29.description: Sorry it has taken me awhile to review Gratitude Heart Garden.  I eloped in July of this year.  I had decided to get a bouquet for myself and a small wristlet for my maid of honor (my daughter) and 2 boutineers. However, I had no experience with ordering wedding flowers, or bouquets of any sort (eh! Not since my Prom....MANY MANY MANY years ago! LOL)The first couple of places weren't helpful.  One particular shop on Lincoln n Addison was disheartening. I went in there and although they were nice and friendly, they didn't give any suggestions, show me any samples, and basically said I should know what I want before ordering. I felt so stupid and walked out.  I was sad. Heading home, I  happened to drive by GHG in Roscoe Village and just stopped the car to see if maybe someone can give me a suggestion regarding what I'm looking for. I walked in the shop and Siddantha was arranging some loose blooms. He was so warm and kind and spoke with me regarding my idea of what I wanted. He showed me in his cooler the pretty arrangements that could be made on my conservative budget. Siddantha is a great person to work with and so caring about what you are looking for in flowers,choices, and your budget. Not only was the bouquet affordable along with the wristlet and boutineers (2), ......they were absolutely gorgeous. I would recommend him for all your plant and flower needs. He cares about his work and makes sure you get what you envision in your mind.

42.description: They're doing the flowers for my wedding..... They do some really interesting and cool looking stuff.  If you want a traditional bouquet then I say go to Trader Joes's (they got great stuff for the price).If you want something custom built and arranged with a theme or concept in mind, then this is the place for you.  They do some decorating for the big houses in the area (they make some cool flower beds for those rich people who own double lots).Anyways its just all really really cool and interesting to look at.  Its a great spot for custom work.

23.description: Gratitude Heart Garden just did the flowers for my wedding on 7/28/12.  They were amazing!  Siddhanta listened to everything I wanted and made it happen!  The bouquets and center pieces were perfect!  I highly recommend them!

47.description: My fiance and I celebrated Valentine's Day early this year since he has to work the night of.  Last night before we went out to dinner he showed up with flowers from Roscoe Blooms (who is also doing our wedding) and the owner remember who he was and made my bouquet up of all of our wedding flowers, which are obviously my favorite!  Service is remarkable!

8.description: We used Gratitude Heart Garden for our August 1, 2014 wedding.  I have to admit that I chose them because they were convenient...walking distance from our home. and where we had lunch that day.  But they turned out to be awesome.  We didn't have a large order but they didn't try to sell us on more.  We also gave them a lot of leeway (we were likely tired of doing wedding planning at this point) and they exceeded my expectations.   In fact, when we ordered some corsages for our Moms, we thought they might not even wear them (more of an obligation than a need) but they were beautiful and both Moms wore them with pride.  I would check them out.  They seem like a small shop that cares and takes care of their customers.

31.description: Siddhanta is truly an artist and did an AMAZING job for my wedding day!  I got married on July 16th at the Palmer House Hilton, in the Empire Room.  My wedding planner kept taking me to decor companies who were expensive and not impressive.  A girlfriend recommended Roscoe Blooms and I am so glad I found them.  I'm hard to impress and Siddhanta completely exceeded my expectations.  When I first saw what Siddhanta did to my room, I felt like I was on My Fair Wedding with David Tutera.The flowers, candles and decor all managed to look modern yet romantic.  I wanted bright summer flower and beautiful details and Siddhanta delivered.  Everything looked so magical and I feel so thankful that I found Siddhanta.  I recieved so many compliments on my flowers, from random people on the streets when we were taking photos to our guests.  You know it looks good when you have men taking pictures of your centerpieces. ;)  Ladies, if you need beautiful flowers for your wedding day, look no further.  I promise you will be happy!

34.description: I was recommended to Siddhanta by Volo as that's where we had our wedding and he is right down the street. We had already decided on a different vendor for our wedding but decided to meet Siddhanta anyways - and we completely changed our minds! I'm so glad we took the time to come in and meet with him, he did such an excellent job on the flowers and decor for our wedding. He spent a lot of time with us on our first meeting - over an hour - and asked very specific questions and showed us pictures to get an idea of what we wanted. He was then able to put in words what we were trying to tell him that we were looking for. The end result for both our church ceremony, reception and bouquets was so perfect. He was able to bring to reality exactly what we had pictured. Siddhanta himself is so personable and kind and easy to work with. Also the cost was extremely reasonable and he was very willing to work within our budget.

16.description: Sorry it has taken me awhile to review Gratitude Heart Garden.  I eloped in July of this year.  I had decided to get a bouquet for myself and a small wristlet for my maid of honor (my daughter) and 2 boutineers. However, I had no experience with ordering wedding flowers, or bouquets of any sort (eh! Not since my Prom....MANY MANY MANY years ago! LOL)The first couple of places weren't helpful.  One particular shop on Lincoln n Addison was disheartening. I went in there and although they were nice and friendly, they didn't give any suggestions, show me any samples, and basically said I should know what I want before ordering. I felt so stupid and walked out.  I was sad. Heading home, I  happened to drive by GHG in Roscoe Village and just stopped the car to see if maybe someone can give me a suggestion regarding what I'm looking for. I walked in the shop and Siddantha was arranging some loose blooms. He was so warm and kind and spoke with me regarding my idea of what I wanted. He showed me in his cooler the pretty arrangements that could be made on my conservative budget. Siddantha is a great person to work with and so caring about what you are looking for in flowers,choices, and your budget. Not only was the bouquet affordable along with the wristlet and boutineers (2), ......they were absolutely gorgeous. I would recommend him for all your plant and flower needs. He cares about his work and makes sure you get what you envision in your mind.

13.description: I stopped I. For the first time today and was delighted! Extremely helpful, beautiful flowers and they stayed within my stated budget. I will definitely be returning in the future!

11.description: This is my very favorite "go-to" store for flowers.  You can buy indivual blooms, have an arrangement made while you wait, or call for a delivery.  The flowers are  fresh and last a long time.  Their arrangements are one-a-kind and beautiful.  I usually tell them the mood I want to convey with the flower arrangement and am always very happy with the results.  This week I bought an arrangement for a family member who was stressed and ill.  The arrangement was muted blue and white hydrangeas with pops of yellow from the other flowers.  The arrangement had a "happy and tranquil" feel to it.  Another thing I like is they do not use a lot of cheap filler like baby breath or leaves which I think just gives a cluttered feel to a floral arrangement.  Their arrangements are full, uncluttered, and clean.The prices and quality is excellent.

39.description: I used Roscoe Blooms for my wedding just a few weeks ago and didn't have a great experience.  Siddhanta seems like a really wonderful guy and he's great to talk to, but there were some HUGE miscommunications that really made my wedding day stressful.  My background is in theatre and production management so I'm good at communicating and I came prepared with pictures and color swatches.  I wanted simple floating orchids in lilly bowls and 2 bouquets - there were only 3 types of flowers involved and 2 colors. Even with all that, what they delivered didn't look like what we agreed upon - it looked like someone else's flowers!  When I called to try to work out a solution, the blame was placed on me, the the delivery guy came and fixed ONE of the 10 items that needed fixed and then left again.  It took multiple phone calls and 3 trips and a lot of drama just to get something presentable for the wedding.  Siddhanta has done some *amazing* arrangements for me before and I really don't know what went wrong for this small, simple order.  I emailed to try to end things on a positive note and thank him for fixing the arrangements and never heard back from him.  All around, not the kind of experience I thought I'd have from my local florist.

37.description: I chose Roscoe Blooms to do the floral for my wedding on 10/2/10 (personals and table arrangements). Siddhanta was about the fourth florist I had met, and I knew right away he was the one I wanted to work with. He spent over an hour with me, drawing out his vision for the table arrangements (literally - drew on paper what he was planning to do!). I loved his ideas and felt that he really cared about doing a good job. (As opposed to another florist I met who listened to nothing I said and only wanted to use orchids) He also brought up things that never would have crossed my mind, like sizing the bouquet to be the right proportion to my height. I had no frame of reference for my $1000 floral budget, i.e. I had no clue whether it was reasonable. We ended up slightly over that amount but Siddhanta always expressed willingness to make choices that would keep the costs in control.When the flowers arrived on the wedding day I could not have been happier! The bouquets & boutonnieres were exactly as promised and beautiful. I was IN LOVE with the table arrangements, they were the perfect complement to our venue and again, were exactly what Siddhanta had drawn out for me way back in June when we first met. My experience with Roscoe Blooms was top-notch, you could not pick a better florist for your event. =)

0.description: I was quite the idiot trying to have flowers delivered. My girlfriend's office literally changed today. After two failed attempts, I got a call from the florist letting me know that they would send someone to the new office location. Everyone I spoke to today was very kind in helping to make sure the flowers got delivered. I know they went above and beyond on my behalf. I absolutely did not mind paying an additional delivery fee since it was my fault in the first place. Thank you!

38.description: I can't say enough good things about this florist! They saved my butt when I found out I had hired a not-so honest florist to do my wedding flowers, and agreed to take on my entire wedding order just three weeks before the big day......  for the same price! Siddhanta is absolutely wonderful to work with and made gorgeous bouquets and bout's for my bridal party. My bridal bouquet was absolutely breathtaking and was beyond anything I could have imagined. I still gawk at pictures of my bouquet today! What really blew us away was that they threw in a few head table centerpieces.... at no extra charge because, " we didn't think about ourselves and a bride deserves flowers at her table." We hadn't ordered head table flowers in an effort to keep costs down, so imagine our surprise when we walked into our reception and found beautiful hydrangea and rose centerpieces at our table! Without a doubt Roscoe Blooms is my new go-to florist. I highly recommend!

27.description: Just picked up some flowers for a friends birthday this morning and they were beautiful.  In addition, I had to go in early (9am, before they open) because I had a last minute  morning meeting.  When I called them with my dilemma time wise they told me it wasn't a problem, they'd just  open early so I could pick them up!  I was so taken aback by the awesome customer service that I almost dropped the phone!

32.description: My hubby (fiance at the time) and I had 3 months to plan a wedding and, based on other Yelpers reviews, called Siddhanta on fairly short notice to prepare flowers for our wedding.  I live in Boston and my fiance/husband lived in Chicago and Siddhanta was more than willing to accommodate my 48 hours of availability while in Chicago to discuss our wedding flower needs/budget.  My hubby and I didn't have a wedding party and I don't love any specific flowers (just like 'em all!), so when Siddhanta suggested that we arrive at the shop with our favorite flowers and weddings colors...I was concerned.  Could he be creative with little direction?!  I showed up at the shop and explained that I didn't have wedding colors picked out and was open to flower suggestions but I did like curly willow arrangements that I'd seen online.  Siddhanta pulled out a book of his previous arrangements/bouquets (so I/my hubby could pick favorites) and also discussed what he thought would be a good options based on my venue.  I knew that it was a risk to not make exact requests for my bouquet or table arrangements, but I wish I had a picture of my/my hubby's face when we walked into the reception ballroom prior to any our guests.  The table arrangements, with hanging votive candles from the curly willows, brought tears to my eyes.  (For the record, I didn't even cry at my wedding ceremony)  :)  Siddhanta and his team did an absolutely amazing job on our arrangements.Roscoe Blooms was the only florist that my husband and I met with and I'm beyond thrilled with our choice!

48.description: This place is great for guys.  The people who run the place are really nice, and they're always willing to help.  I live around the corner, and when I want flowers for my fiancee, this is the first place I stop.  I'll just walk in and tell them what I'm looking to spend, and they always come up with something great.  I agree that you're not going to find rare items, but for good quality, great presentation, and reasonable prices, this is your neighborhood spot.  I also go there to buy greeting cards.  It seems like Hallmark et al. have become so crappy lately that it's worth it to go here for some hand made cards that your gift recipients will really notice and appreciate.  My fiancee loves getting anything from here.As a side note, we once bought flowers there for my aunt in Ohio.  We put them in water and traveled the next day with them in water in the back of the car.  They didn't wilt a bit, and looked great, even after the 5 hour ride.  I'm not sure if that's a credit to the freshness of the flowers or the quality of the packaging, but either way, RB took care of us.

44.description: Though I've never gotten flowers from Roscoe Blooms, I just purchased my third plant here, a rubber tree.  The plants are always in great shape, clearly well cared for, and the selection is on the eclectic side of common.  The staff, always nice/friendly but not pushy, have always been a great resource on watering, light needs, and re-potting.

24.description: Gratitude Heart Garden provided flowers for my wedding a few weeks ago. I could not have been happier with everything they provided - and the prices were lower than anywhere else I was quoted. Weddings are expensive in Chicago. If you're trying to keep wedding costs down without sacrificing quality and customer service, this is the place for you.

7.description: I love this place! Affordable, yet BEAUTIFUL floral arrangements. I've gotten several bouquets from there, and they never cease to amaze and smell absolutely amazing.

49.description: I loved living in Roscoe Village, really just a nice little area, very mixed in families and singles, close to other night life and all, and some really great little bars and shops. This one of them. Not a huge selection, you aren't going to find a rare tropical orchid, but what you will find is a friendly staff, quality flowers, decent prices, well done bouquets and perhaps a cute little dog named Lucy.

40.description: We met with Siddanta of Roscoe Blooms about doing flowers for our wedding after he was recommended by our venue. It was a great meeting and one thing thing that I really appreciated was how much time Siddanta was willing to spend  with us. You can tell that he really cares about his work and is willing to put in the time to get to know your taste.

30.description: AMAZING!! I live in the Roscoe Village neighborhood and wanted to support local businesses as much as possible for my wedding. I made 4 appointments with different florists to explore the different options and this was my first stop. I cancelled the remaining 3 appointments immediately after meeting with Siddhanta. He is professional, talented, has a great sense of humor and most importantly he is patient. My mother and I met with him 3 different times during the planning process and also had numerous phone conversations with him. We both love flowers and kept changing our minds as to the color scheme and look/feel of the arrangements. Siddhanta stayed calm throughout the whole process, listened patiently to our crazy ideas and always offered his professional opinion. I loved the mock-ups that he made for us and didn't think he could get better than that. Let's just say I was blown away by the arrangements on the day of. Some how he made each bouquet and each arrangement better and bigger than I would've ever imagined. They were absolutely stunning! My bridesmaids were so excited about their bouquets which actually doubled as part of the centerpieces. He used all the elements that we asked for but incorporated his own professional style to make sure they looked as beautiful as possible. He is very reasonably priced and an absolute pleasure to work with. I will be going back to his store for my every floral need and would highly recommend him!

46.description: I've been lucky enough to receive flowers from here before, but today was my first opportunity to experience this lovely shop from the other side.  I went in to buy some flowers for a few friends and the gal working there was a huge help.  Once she knew what I was looking for, she asked my budget for the gifts and whipped up some beautiful bouquets that were right on target.  We've all had the experience of picking out everything we like and then finding out it's much pricier than we wanted.  I left with just what I needed for just what I wanted to spend.  Thanks for the help Roscoe Blooms!!  (I'll be back!)

1.description: Sidhatta is great! He is definitely committed to getting you what you want in a beautiful arrangement. GHG is a staple to the Roscoe neighborhood,

9.description: My friend is getting married and we decided to try this place out. The guy explaining the flowers to us were looking at her pictures she brought and saying "imagine what this could look like if.." and gave vocal example..not one...lousy...picture...or physical example to see, he didn't even have a book! "Look the pictures up when you get home" he said. WHAT?! She didn't need to look it up when she got home she had already brought the examples of what she wanted TO him! That is so plainly unprofessional. He was more interested in WHERE she was having her wedding than actually talking about doing his job and filling it with flowers. When she got the estimate from him she noticed there were flowers on the list he created that she NEVER asked for and said no to when he suggested it. Then when she picked another place and emailed him to let him know, he never replied to her. How. rude.So...lets recap...no examples...poor communication...if you go here be prepared to do ALL the work yourself and pay this places overpriced bouquets. But my suggestion is...don't go here. Go somewhere else.

26.description: GHG did the flowers for my small intimate wedding and they were gorgeous and priced right.  They didn't treat me any differently than a bride spending 10 times as much as I did.  I would highly reccommend them!

25.description: Gratitude Heart and Garden did an amazing job on our wedding flowers! Highly recommend them - easy to work with, keeps it within your budget and makes your overall wedding day so easy, calm and seamless. Fabulous place!!!!

12.description: Siddhanta created the MOST beautiful arrangements and bouquets for our recent wedding and I will only get flowers from Gratitude Heart Garden from now on. It was nothing but a pleasure to work with Siddhanta - he was warm, friendly, thorough, easy to work with, organized, responsive, listened to what I wanted, and really took the time and care into  making our flowers the perfect reflection of what we wanted. He is incredibly skilled at what he does and passionate about using flowers to enhance any environment - this was apparent in what was created for us.We did not ask for anything traditional, and Siddhanta mentioned that this was the first time creating wedding arrangements with these types of flowers - I would not have known otherwise since they were so incredibly beautiful. He was also understood and respected the type of budget that I was on and made things work out just perfectly.I would very highly recommend reaching out to Gratitude Heart Garden for any and all floral needs - anything from a bouquet to bring home to multiple arrangements of all shapes and sizes for a big event.

21.description: This is an amazing flower shop!  I called from Los Angeles today to have flowers delivered to a friend in Chicago, and they created the most beautiful arrangement and were so kind.  Thanks, Gratitude Heart Garden!

17.description: Thoughtful owner of flower shop, that carefully decorates and offersand wide range of beautiful creations.  Has an in depth greeting cardselection to match.

10.description: Love love love this adorable little flower shop! The people are always so nice and seem to really enjoy telling you all about the different plants. I love supporting local businesses and this is a great one to go to! Sometimes on a lazy day I will just go inside to browse (and occasionally buy a little succulent) because when you walk in to this place, it just makes you happy!

5.description: I shopped around quite a bit for flowers for my wedding and this place was the most affordable and the best to work with! The shop is really beautiful and the whole staff is really friendly. My flower arrangements were absolutely beautiful and Siddhanta worked with me to find the best flower options for the budget I was trying to stay in. My bridal and maid of honor bouquet was amazing as well. I set up my appointment and went over all the details and on my wedding day I did not have to worry about a thing! I remember arriving to the venue and everything was perfectly set up for me just how I had envisioned it. I definitely recommend this place for all of your flower needs.

3.description: Such a beautiful shop nestled in Roscoe Village! I am guilty of waiting until the last minute to decide on arrangements for my wedding. Kimberly met the challenge of creating centerpiece arrangements and personal pieces (ie, boutonnieres, corsages, bouquets) within my budget and timeline with such expertise! I gave her a few ideas and a color palate and she made my dreams come true. The flowers lasted for well over two weeks beyond my wedding, which is saying a lot considering I got married on a humid, 90+ degree July afternoon. I have an overall new appreciation for the beauty of flowers and loved how everything turned out!

35.description: Siddhanta did the flowers for my wedding and they turned out amazing!   I met with multiple other florists before Siddhanta and they each spent about 15 minutes with me, Siddhanta spent close to an hour and a half the very first visit!  When it comes to flowers, I have no idea, but Siddhanta didn't make me stupid.  He listened to what I had in mind and then brought out books and did drawings to show me exactly what he would do!  It was gorgeous!  I got so many compliments on my centerpieces and for the church, the musicians told us that they had never seen the church look so beautiful! Siddhanta was also very sensitive to the fact that I was on a budget and worked with me.  The alter arrangements for the church were made so that they could also be used for decoration at the reception.   Siddhanta also went above and beyond and added flowers to the cake and did some other decorative flower accents at the reception which he did on his own without extra charge.Finally, the service was terrific!  Siddhanta wanted to make sure that everything was perfect!  He was actually the first person who greeted me upon my arrival at the church the day of the wedding!Siddhanta is amazing!  I would definitely recommend Siddhanta for your wedding, or any other special occasion!

19.description: They're doing the flowers for my wedding..... They do some really interesting and cool looking stuff.  If you want a traditional bouquet then I say go to Trader Joes's (they got great stuff for the price).If you want something custom built and arranged with a theme or concept in mind, then this is the place for you.  They do some decorating for the big houses in the area (they make some cool flower beds for those rich people who own double lots).Anyways its just all really really cool and interesting to look at.  Its a great spot for custom work.

28.description: Fantastic shop with a wide variety of flowers and live plants!

45.description: Not to sound like a high-falutin' flower snob, but I'm not really much of a rose gal. I don't flip for daisies. And I'm positively not a carnation babe. Nope, that brings back too many memories of junior high. When I'm receiving flowers or giving them I love something distinctive and stylish. Think monochromatic bouquets, architectural pieces with height and drama or just a really simple, but unique look with white anthirium, orchids and hydrangea. Trés Chic! There aren't many places I trust with my persnickety tastes and on the rare occasion I branch out from Jayson Home & Garden I'm always let down by scant options paired with babies breath fern and other equally atrocious filler. A quick pit stop to Roscoe Blooms today showed they have the touch of taste... a great array of stunning flowers, vases, small decor items, candles (KoBo - my fav!), gift items and really neat flora table center pieces that grow with just a small dish of water and some rock. They were soooo cool, even my black thumbs won't kill these... I'm definitely going back to pick one out! Two very enthusiastic thumbs up for Roscoe Blooms. With modern arrangements, super sweet help and great odds and ends this place should be on everyones radar - because who doesn't love getting flowers?!

33.description: I met with the owner (Siddhanta) for a consultation for wedding flowers. I had a good idea of what I wanted, and he spent over an hour helping me fill in the details of my vision. He really knows his flowers and was very attentive, even drawing diagrams of the table setup. He also made recommendations on ways to save money. I would highly recommend meeting with him if you're searching for a wedding florist.

43.description: I LOVE this flower shop! They do an excellent job creating bouquets and they seem to last longer than I tend to think they will. I've ordered flowers from here for friends with new babies at the hospital, birthdays, mothers day and they never fail to be beautiful. The colors and the quality of the flowers are outstanding! Having moved out of state I was happy to be able to phone in an order for mothers day and I got excellent service over the phone and I know that the flowers will be perfect.

2.description: I went in here to get flowers for my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary. I walked in, the nice lady asked me what I was looking for and I said I don't really know. I gave her a price I was looking to pay and she went into the flower fridge and came back with a beautiful bouquet of wild flowers. My girlfriend loved them and they stayed around for a long time! I'm definitely going to go back here.

18.description: We hired them for our April wedding and were very pleased! Siddhanta was a pleasure to work with, communicated very well, and worked within our budget. I'd recommend Gratitude Heart Garden, and I'm definitely going to go back for flowers just for my home, just because!

41.description: I love this flower shop! My mom got me a plant for my birthday and ordered it through Roscoe Blooms so I could pick it up. I showed up at the shop about 15 minutes after close because I was rushing home from work and I knocked on the door. The lady working came and opened the door and asked (with a smile) if I was there to pick up my birthday present. It was great and above and beyond what was necessary (as it was my fault I was late). They are great here!

50.description: roscoe blooms is a shop much like roscoe village itself: quaint and tiny but somewhat limited in selection.  what they do have is high quality and the service is excellent.  the sales person who helped me not only gave great advice on my purchase, but offered counsel on plant issues i am having with plants purchased elsewhere.  great place to get a unique gift with all of their tiny decorative pots and precious little plants.  also some unusual candles and home decorative items.  also like the rest of roscoe village, everything is fairly pricey as far as plants go.  don't be fooled by the weird, cheesy website.  this isn't a chain florist and you won't be surrounded by mylar balloons in the store.  just lush green and adorably tiny plants.

4.description: Gratitude is wonderful local floral shop. Their customer service is out of this world and they make sure you receive the arrangement you envisioned.

6.description: These guys get it. Consistently great quality, we've been getting our flowers at Gratitude Heart for at least five years. They focus on what you want, they have wide assortment to choose from, all the time. Their prices are very reasonable as well.

22.description: I really can't say anything more that has already been said, but I HAD to write this review.  I searched extensively for a florist for my wedding.  I met with many who did some nice stuff, but they all basically showed me the same things.  Not a lot of originality.  And I didn't feel like they "got" me.  No click.  Then I met with Siddhanta at Gratitude Heart Garden.  Immediately I knew I found my florist.  Siddhanta is so creative and instinctively has an eye to not only know what will look beautiful, but also to infuse uniqueness into everything he does.  Our wedding was last weekend and I have to say, everything was beyond perfect.  I knew my flowers, the boutonnieres and the centerpieces would all be fabulous.  They exceeded my expectations beyond my wildest dreams.  Everyone raved at the wedding about how pretty everything was and how they never had seen anything like our flowers before.Moreover, Siddhanta is an absolute pleasure to work with.  He is such a warm, funny, dedicated person.  You can see he is passionate about what he does.  He also will not gouge you on cost.  I think he was our only vendor not to do so.  In fact, I am shocked at the amazing pieces we had for what we paid.  He even, without me ever saying a word, went into the bathrooms and sprinkled a TON of rose petals on the vanities.  It looked so pretty.  He really goes above and beyond to make your event special and gorgeous.  I really cannot recommend this place enough.  They have a customer for life in me and if you use them, you will understand why.  Thanks, Siddhanta!  You are the best!

15.description: I first came here last year for a corsage for my daughter's prom last year.  I loved the corsage. The colors went well with her peach dress  and it was just beautiful.  I tried them again this year for my son's prom and I am very pleased with their work.  My son's date was wearing a beautiful gold dress and my son was wearing a very stylish black and gold tux.  The white roses with gold accent corsage and boutineer were just beautifuland looked amazing with their clothes. Not too big but very elegant and pretty.

20.description: We had a fantastic experience with Siddhanta at Gratitude Heart Garden! He did the flowers for our wedding last weekend and we couldn't have been more pleased.Our consultation at their shop - which is lovely, by the way, and also has tons of succulents and candles available for purchase - was exactly the experience we were looking for. We were offered tea, he played with our daughter, and he really listened to what we were looking for and was really creative and inspired right away, which put me at ease. He was also able to work with our budget, which was small, and still give us something special.Wow were they special! My bouquet incorporated lots of blues and soft roses and our centerpieces were astounding. Our reception was at a little Italian restaurant, and Siddhanta filled the centerpieces with roses, kale (!!!), halos of tiny melons on vines, and flowers I have never seen before. He ABSOLUTELY went above and beyond our expectations. If you are looking for something unique, something lovely, something really tailored to your personality and your venue, this is where you need to look. Our experience with Gratitude Heart Garden was 110% satisfying and I will absolutely recommend them to friends in the future.

36.description: This place changed their name, they are now Gratitude Heart Garden...

14.description: Awesome selection, SUPER nice staff, beautiful arrangements! From elegent to funky they have it all! WE LOVE EM!Big Hair family

58.description: Very good selection of beers on tap, usually following some theme. Beer prices are fair. The reason for the so so rating is the food. Recently it has become more upscale which doesn't really match the atmosphere. There isn't much selection now. I'd like to see some of the sandwiches put back on the menu and an improved burger.  Still a good place for a pint or two.

56.description: Great neighborhood bar. The food has gotten when better with their new menu and chef.  Very extensive beer list as well.  If you are in Roscoe Village area its a must go.

29.description: I went to the Village Tap last night for a friend's birthday party. We were seated inside the beer garden, which felt like a scene from a Tolkien novel.  Our group ordered appetizers, which tasted very good, especially the roasted chickpeas. The food options consisted of typical pub food, albeit more "upscale."  Ultimately, it was the beer selection that won me and our group over. Among the three beers I tried, the chocolate, peanut butter stout was my favorite.The waiting staff was attentive and genial, answering several questions about their beer. Overall, I had a good time.

42.description: Love everything about this place. The service for one is always super friendly. The drinks are perfectly made and are a generous size. The new menu is fun, creative, fresh and quite tasty. My favorites are the jerk chicken and blistered shashito peppers. I also love the steak nachos and hummus plate. If I'm looking for a fun, casual place to hang with friends or to watch a game on tv Village Tap is always my top choice.

23.description: We came here last night with a friend for a low key, casual dinner. My friend and I each got the burger with a sunny side up egg on top. The burger was HUGE. And delicious!!! And I have to say, this whole egg on a burger thing is right up my alley. I don't know why, but it's delicious! MY hubby got the "stew" which was really soup and wasn't quite filling enough. It was more of an appetizer (a large appetizer, but not enough for dinner). So once he saw our burgers come out, he ordered one for himself as well. We all loved that burger. The only downside was the service was just so-so. Our waitress was super nice and sweet but also kind of hard to find/not totally on the ball. I think she might have been taking care of the entire place though, so it's likely not her fault!Anyway, I would def return as they food was quite good and the menu had some other tasty looking things just waiting for me!

47.description: Village Tap is (actually, was) my favorite bar to hang out at. I watched a lot of Hawks games here over the years, and there's usually a table open, even for the games. The staff is super friendly, it has a great beer selection, the place is just the right size, the outdoor patio is awesome and the ambiance and crowd are great. The ONLY thing I hate is the new menu. This is why I'm not giving them 5 stars and why they are no longer my favorite bar. They tried to upgrade and get a real chef apparently, but it just doesn't work with this type of casual neighborhood bar at all. I loved the menu before. It was the best bar food in the area, in my opinion, and it was always my first choice when I was in the mood for bar food and a beer. Now I almost never go here anymore. Their deviled eggs are absolutely disgusting (they're green) and the only thing that is bar-ish are the quesadillas (which are decent, but greasy) and the wings. My boyfriend thinks the wings are too spicy, though. Also ,I ordered a pork chop, and I had to send it back b/c it was so spicy I couldn't eat it (it had Thai chilis on it). Sorry Village Tap, but the menu just doesn't work. Please go back to regular bar food.

8.description: The aptly named Village Tap is about as neighborhoody as it gets. I was hungry one evening after getting my car out of the shop, and this was one of the suggested places. A pretty good suggestion it was. We started off with the cheese curds, and it was a promising start. Definitely the softest and flakiness I've ever had. It doesn't hurt they give you a hefty portion. Well it may hurt your arteries, but whatever. We decided to share the burger and an order of fish & chips. The burger was on point. Thick, juicy and well flavored, and the bacon and egg complimented it well. The fish and chips had potential to be some of the best I've ever had, except it was way under salted. It's a shame because everything else about it was fantastic. Another point is deducted for the funky beer. We noticed some of the beers we ordered tasted off. It might behoove them to clean their tap lines. That being said, I'm not in any rush to go back, but a decent place to grab a bite.

31.description: Great neighborhood feel. Interesting menu, fresh ingredients, plenty of variety, attention to detail = delicious food.  Cozy, fun environment.  Can get loud, so we headed outside; there's a cute HEATED beer garden in the rear---we ate our there in JANUARY.  Loved it.   Can't wait to come back in the summer.  Grass fed beef made  an incredible burger and meatloaf. Good beer selection.  Excellent, attentive service. Only one dessert: a combo of cake the size of a half a piece of bread and chocolate mousse in a shot glass.   Miniscule and they gave it to us with several spoons so we could share!  HUH?

34.description: I used to love this place and came here even when I did not live nearby. I moved back to Roscoe Village recently. This place now sucks. I have gone there twice in the past 3 months-both times were disasters. The kitchen, which is partly opened, was disgusting. Food spilled all over the floor, the counters--terribly unappetizing. The food, several years ago, used to be fantastic-particularly the burrito and burgers. They have now gone, I guess, more upscale. It is not working. I had fish and chips-some of the worst I have ever had. A fried chickpeas app was appalling salty-it was inedible and I told the waitress. On both of my visits, they were out of several beers on the menu and some of the beer did not taste fresh. What has happened to this place? I am shocked at the decline. Roscoe Village is lacking in bars and restaurants that are not complete dumps so I guess that is how they stay open. Manager/Owner---Please do something to get this place back to what it once was and I would happily be a regular.

16.description: Favorite bar in Chicago, hands down. I come in and feel like family. Edgar is an absolute sweetheart and wonderful bartender, Mike makes for an undoubtedly fun Saturday night, Meg is quick witted and quick with a drink, Carolyn caters to your every need, Juan is as skilled as he is hilarious, MJ and Miguel are kind hearted and attentive, and the owner Mike Green has made it a point to make everyone here feel at home. I know everyone's names because they make a point of it. Wonderful sweet people. Never felt better drinking and eating my life away. A+ 20,000 Stars 11/10 I'll be here forever.

13.description: Couldn't wait to try this place out. From the minute I walked in Emily was super helpful. Not only does she look good but she was super helpful on what was the best local beer. Then I met top Chef Julia, she was fantastic! She guided me to try the white cheddar curd! Yum! If I had time I would of tried the while menu. Thanks to the whole crew! The Village Tap is a must!!

11.description: Village Tap consistently has a great tap list, something you can always count on. I was glad when they updated their menu a couple of years ago, because I used to avoid eating here. Pretty good appetizers and a variety of burgers and entrees now, though I haven't tried one yet.Atmosphere is relaxed, bar service has been good, same on the patio. It gets crowded on the weekends so I avoid it then, the crowd usually skews pretty yuppie but not always. The back bar is a nice antique, and they rotate the work of local artists on the walls. A big plus is that they do small pours of all the drafts so you can try a lot of different beers.

39.description: When my friend suggested the Village Tap for a burger - I was very hesitant.  I've lived down the street for 8 years from the Tap and thought it to be very mediocre food - but good to go for a beer.   I reluctantly went - ordered a burger and WOW - WAS I SURPRISED! Chef Julia has been there for just under a year (came from Nashville)  and what a difference she has made! Farm to table - Slagel Farms provide the meats - (the burger has a beautiful organic egg as a topping)  even the potatoes are sourced.  She creates a very thoughtful menu - and is creating a new one for fall so I encourage you to visit Village Tap.  I just hope the owner appreciates what a gem he has running his kitchen!

37.description: This place is amazing! The owner is so nice-he stopped to talk to us two nights in a row. The waitress we had was also amazing! We will definitely be back here! Oh, and the food is also delicious. The grilled cheese was so good and light.

0.description: What a win! I recently moved to Roscoe Village and I was desperate to experience the restaurants and nightlife. We weren't particularly set on any place, but wanted to grab a beer before dinner. Passing the neighborhood bars, Village Tap looked welcoming and lively. It took a few minutes to find seats at the bar for two, but an off duty employee gave up her's for me. Who does that as a paying customer? That's just awesome customer service that's cultural. Speaking of customer service, our bartender Mike wrote the book. He has impeccable timing - a hello and enough time to actually review a drink list before asking. It was their "Stout Spectacular" so I needed a lot of time to examine the listing. The Stone chai stood out and I loved it. Picking another to follow the strong flavors though was tough for me. Luckily mike was there to decode my preferences - what do I like, did you like the chai, why don't you try this first... I took his recommendation and ordered the Pollyanna Nitro vanilla bean... So good, I ordered it twice. Good thing we had crispy, creamy Wisconsin cheese curds to shove down our gullets. They stood up to the stout and were amazing. I only recently became a fan of deviled eggs, and I couldn't say no to Village Tap's version with feta and kalamata olives. Holy hell, they came out looking like brains in cut open scalps, but they were good. Like tiny,creamy Mediterranean salads. My boyfriend and I were supposed to go to dinner later that night (9pm reservations elsewhere) but after hanging out with Mike and enjoying the apps, it was an easy decision to stay. We split the bacon and egg burger - so glad they have a potato bun instead of the tired pretzel. Yes, pretzel buns are delicious, but they're so ubiquitous I'm not impressed anymore. I had a great time at Village Tap and I'm looking forward to many more here in my new neighborhood!

38.description: Probably the best fish and chips in the city. The whole new menu is fantastic and fresh. Shannon and Nick are the best bartenders always super friendly.

51.description: Great music, staff & beer garden! Great selection of beers! They even carry Staropramen!!! That in its own is worth going for!!!

27.description: Great food, great service, and great atmosphere.  I love grabbing a drink here.  How this place has 3.5 stars is beyond me.  The Good: Farm to table food.  Burger is a 5.  The pork tenderloin is amazing as well, 5.5/5.  The wings are in a sauce not typical, but are really really good.  The taco's are good.  Mike the bartender and the two sisters always take great care of my g/f and I when we're in there.The Bad: Being a guy from northern WI I have a pretty high standard for Friday Fish Fry.  The batter is excellent, but the fish didn't hold up and was mushy.  I think it was swimming too long in the milk bath prior to cooking.

32.description: Pretty shocked that this place doesn't have a better rating. Village Tap is your classic neighborhood bar, with really good food. When it's nice out, the back patio is probably the best place to drink beer outside in Chicago. As I mentioned earlier, the food here is just awesome. Every single time my wife and I go, we get the stout braised shortrib nachos and the cheese curds. I know what you guys are thinking, "Nachos and Cheese curds? That sounds like standard pub fare to me!" BUT IT'S NOT. It's so much more. These nachos descended from heaven on the 7th day of Genesis when God proclaimed a day of rest, but quickly realized one can't properly rest with out Nachos. And all was good, Amen. The cheese curds are just bomb. Not traditional style Wisconsin battered curds, they're almost tempura style or something? I don't know, but I'm certainly okay with it. Aside from that, good beer, good service and nice people. 5 stars, duh!

54.description: This is a great neighborhood bar with a big, beautiful patio. It boasts an extensive beer list, with 26 brews on tap, including many local craft beers. And the menu, which  was recently overhauled, is terrific. Most of the food is from local farms and the menu changes everyday. Plus, the prices are reasonable. And they have a $3 photobooth!

48.description: So I like it here.  On the surface, it's a neighborhood bar with a decent beer list and some outdoor space.However, look a little closer and you'll see that they have a slammin' outdoor space (retractable roof, smoking area, Christmas lights and vegetation) and a more interesting food menu than I would expect.Yay!I FULLY recommend the fish and chips with one of the sours on tap.  Absolutely fab choice for Roscoe Village dining.Fair warning: Village Tap gets crazy busy on a weekend evening.  And it's no surprise as to why: Factor in a nice beer list, reasonable prices, great menu and stellar beer garden and you've got a recipe for success that brings the Roscoe Village peeps in droves.I like it.  Keep it up.

44.description: Awful.  Just bloody awful.  A once reliable spot for burgers and bar food tries to go all upscale and trendy with a gastropub/small plates menu and the results are an abomination.  The concept has been done many times with far more success in any of a number of nearby neighborhoods.  Try Logan Square if you want better examples.  Or -- if the owners think the new concept is so great -- change the name and decor.  It's about time to ditch the picnic tables in the beer garden that so many people seem to like.  I am not sure what they were thinking, but it isn't often that I could not think of a single thing to order this past Tuesday.  Thank God there are new places opening on my street.

24.description: Living in Roscoe Village for 20 years, I have always been a fan of the tap.  Great beer selection, awesome outdoor space, great vibe.  Now that their menu is farm to table we find ourselves going there or picking up food to go WAY more often!  Burger is EXCELLENT.  And I love the short rib tacos.  The cheese curds are really good, but really filling!  The service is great.  Not a bad thing to say.  Check it out if you are in the neighborhood!

7.description: Very decent beer selection, the bathrooms were actually clean for a bar, and the back patio area(which is enclosed in winter) looked really nice, when the staff allowed me to walk back there for a brief look. I'd like to try the food here, one of these days. Bartending staff was very nice, from what I recall.Negative though(and why I rounded down to 3, from 3.5), is I've had to default to nearby Four Moon at least twice, due to random early closing times here on slow nights. If they always consistently closed at the same posted time, I would've rounded up instead of down. Maybe I'll finally get a chance to revisit here(and perhaps to try the food and/or patio), one of these days?

49.description: I won't recommend the food, but the place is a ton of fun. The servers are friendly and attentive. The beer garden is perfect. The music is always fantastic, not too loud. The photo booth is a nice touch too.

40.description: I was a big fan of this place until I ordered a side salad for $5 which was just a bowl full of rotten bagged mixed greens, with nothing added but dressing. If your going to do the farm fresh food thing, don't serve me a rotten bagged salad. And  $10 for a boca burger? C'mon.

53.description: As an old favorite local hangout we've tried to give the "new" Tapper a few chances.  The new menu is still kinda silly for a grungy, local tap with sticky floors and picnic tables out back!  But we did find a couple things this time around that rocked.  The jones bacon & egg sandwich was incredible, and the slagel farms burger with bacon & egg was pretty tasty as well.  I noticed they also added the Cajun veggie burger back to the menu - a great call as that was one of my favorites.  Overall they need to keep working on the menu but we were pleasantly surprised with our food this time.  They were not packed on a Saturday night which should be telling them something, but the current menu updates earned them another chance in our eyes!

30.description: If you like shitty beer and deep fried frozen food as your meal, don't come here!!! This bar is LEGIT and has some of the best pub food in Roscoe Village! The beers here are great, but I do wish they had a few more cider options. The one on tap currently is not my flavor, but I happily found a new chocolate covered strawberry beer as a substitute and WHOA! It was dark but not heavy, and at over 7% alcohol, I was happy with the price. The beer garden is always packed, no matter if it's winter or summer, so plan on sharing a picnic table and making new friends.

46.description: Have a friend in the area and a group of us walked over to The Village Tap for dinner, drinks and to catch up. We liked their beer garden and the service was polite. The food was good quality, but I don't think anyone was blown away. If I lived in the area I would like coming here. Yep.

1.description: I live in the area and have been here a few times.  I enjoy their unique menu.  It's not just plain old bar food. I also like their multi season patio in back.  I have a few items off the menu, the nachos were pretty tasty with pulled pork on them, the humus was so so, I even had a tandoori dish once which was impressively tasty.  They have a large beer selection, which is nice too.  Service has always been pretty good.

55.description: I really have wanted to like this place, but no way!  Last night's experience, was our last time of trying to like this place.  I know some other friends and neighbors who like this place, so my girlfriend and I have continued to try this place, hoping for a better experience.  We stopped in to have a few beers, dinner and to watch the Blackhawks game.  We went to the beer garden area, as there were a few open tables.  We sat ourself, then were immediately told by our waitress, that we will have to share our table, which was fine.  The way she said, not so fine!  I can honestly say, this is worst waitress experience I have ever had in my life!  It was an older woman with black hair and a horrible attitude.  If you don't like your job, please do us all a favor and quit!  I ordered a beer, my girlfriend ordered a soda that was totally flat and stale.  The second we ordered the soda, the waitress seemed like she didn't want to have anything to do with us.  I guess she was hoping for us both to be heavier drinkers, so we were just written off.  We finally got her attention, to get my girl a cocktail instead.  She ordered a cider beer, which was horrible.  We drink a lot of cider beers, something was wrong with it.  I'm not lying, we seriously question if they waitress tampered with her drink?  It tasted like foul play, not good!  We will not ever go back, unless we know 100% that this woman no longer works here.  She is hurting your business!  Btw, I was in with a friend a month prior.  The same waitress, with another bad service experience.  The food is okay, not great, but okay for a dive bar...

9.description: Great neighborhood pub that's been in operation for 25 years!  I always remember this place as having a GREAT beer list even 15 years ago before the beer boom.  I mean like stuff nobody gets from 3 Floyd's & Surly/ they have a ton of draft selections.. I think 18 taps and also a bunch of bottles & cans.  The food used to be just standard pub grub but NOW... they have an amazing chef & menu with mainly locally sourced ingredients!  The chicken quesadilla is the best I've ever had/ I know it's just a quesadilla but try it and see.  Burger is also amazing.  Inside, it's a mix of locals and neighborhood folks.. weekends draw a pretty large younger crowd so be prepared to stand!  Megan the bartender usually takes care of us and does an exceptional job.  PS- Great Beer Garden!

26.description: Great beer selection.  The old menu was a little better, but they're coming around.  The beer garden is great year round.

25.description: Every time I find myself in Roscoe Village and happen upon this gem of a place, I have an amazing time. During my last adventure here we sat down and waited for a while for service that didn't come. That might sound horrible, but it really wasn't. It was crowded and to be expected. What wasn't expected was the treatment from the bartender when we ordered. Free drinks for the not really inconvenient wait time and a smile to boot. Surprise! Humans still exist at bars on Saturday nights. Great service from a great staff. Love this place.

12.description: I attended a reserved event in the back room beer garden last night. While the village tap does accommodate the space for large groups, the restaurant does lack a bit in the finer points of a community watering hole. First, their beer menu is diverse, but over sells what is on it. I don't know of many places that charge 8 50 for a glass of ipa, but if you spend 4 sentences of your menu describing it, it must be worth it. Second, the wait staff was not as inviting as you would like. I came in and started a conversation with the bar tender. They were clearly there just to take my order.  Third, it seems as though the management double booked the back room as there was a birthday party occupying the same space as our event. Things got out of hand when an organizer asked the table to be quiet while announcements were taking place, and then the environment got a little hostile. Certainly it was a miss understanding, but as a public service announcement, make sure you are firm with management if you need to reserve space. Ultimately, not my scene, there is a cute little comfort food place down the way called John's Place which I much rather prefer.

59.description: The new menu is the most pretentious and ridiculous display since REM recorded "Shiny, Happy People."  Please put something on the menu that I can eat without my pinky fingers extended.

21.description: Great atmosphere, great beer selection, great beer garden and a great staff. Everyone is so welcoming, especially the owner Mike.

17.description: The drinks are well poured, great selection.  Love the free and tasty water self pour tap at the bar.  Food is way above average for bar food, the fish and chips are incredible! The staff are very friendly, good vibes.

10.description: Bad service. Waiter forgot our food, unfortunate experience. I don't think I will be back.

5.description: My boyfriend lives a couple of blocks from Village Tap so we find ourselves here every once in awhile. While this is an OK spot I recommend skipping the food and sticking to the beer at Village Tap. I'm not quite sure what they're trying to do with their menu but the upscale options do not quite fit the divey atmosphere at Village Tap. On my most recent visit my boyfriend and I opted to share the Fish + Chips from the "large" section of their menu. The portion size was definitely not what I would deem "large" as we were only given two pieces of fish. The meal was fine but not enough for us to share and I would've appreciated a regular tartar sauce instead of the bland tarragon remoulade that comes with this dish. Where Village Tap does shine is their carefully selected tap list which has a ton of different options and is well organized for those who are not beer experts. Every time we come in here I end up trying a new beer that I really enjoy. My boyfriend also loves that they typically carry Aquanaut beers, brewed by a small local brewery owned by a friend of his. This review was a tough one to write... I love The Village Tap as a divey type bar with good beer choices; however, their food selection drags it down just for me.

3.description: Hey kids, this place is a gem.  We stumbled upon this place and I honestly thought it would be predictable and typical pub food.  Not so.  The menu is exceptional!  Unique and artisan creative small, medium and large plates.  It's an interesting combination with the menu choices and the casual ambiance for a foodie like me who also appreciates a chill environment.We tried the white cheddar tempura cheese curds (good flavor, soft and creamy, the tempura gives it a nice flavor without being too greasy), crispy chickpeas (very unique with guajillo, chipotle, ancho, cinnamon, flake salt but flavors taste a bit bland and milder than I expected).the slagel farm burger (this is well executed with the egg) and the fish 'n chips (decent).  Really nice patio beer garden.  Lovely space.  They have a photo booth inside too -- super fun.

35.description: There's a good selection of beers and the patio section is a really lovely place to relax, even in the winter, when it's heated and shielded from the wind. If you like grilled cheese, try the one here. It was REALLY good...gooey, buttery, cheesy, creamy and crispy. But don't get the cassoulet, unless you want to pay $12 for a small serving of beans with a smathering of dried out sausages.

19.description: Great food, great service, and great atmosphere.  I love grabbing a drink here.  How this place has 3.5 stars is beyond me.  The Good: Farm to table food.  Burger is a 5.  The pork tenderloin is amazing as well, 5.5/5.  The wings are in a sauce not typical, but are really really good.  The taco's are good.  Mike the bartender and the two sisters always take great care of my g/f and I when we're in there.The Bad: Being a guy from northern WI I have a pretty high standard for Friday Fish Fry.  The batter is excellent, but the fish didn't hold up and was mushy.  I think it was swimming too long in the milk bath prior to cooking.

28.description: I love Village Tap. I used to go infrequently before I moved into the neighborhood and their burgers were always good. After I moved into the neighborhood and came back, I saw they changed their menu. At first I was dubious, but this has become a standard that I go to at least once a week. Their menu changes with the availability of their ingredients, and while they've ditched the cornucopia of burgers, they have amazing other choices like hong kong brisket, or thuringer with sauerkraut and stone ground mustard.The bartenders and wait staff are always super friendly and very helpful. They not only have great food, but their beer selection is top notch and they have a respectable whiskey collection as well!Oh, and they have an awesome beergarden in back that has a retractable roof for the nice weather.

45.description: My wife's and friends had a birthday gathering here. We just reserved some back tables and we were pleasantly surprised with not only a nice , full outdoor space, but just a nice place to sit and talk with friends and family. Some music but nothing too loud so you can invite your parents if you want to talk. The bartenders were all really nice, had some great recommendations on beer too. The menu was great! Some really unique brews to choose. After enjoying the beer and hanging out, we also discovered some pretty solid food too. So don't be afraid to order something to eat here too.On the way to the washroom from outside...we discovered an updated Galaga machine as well, so bring some quarters or ask the bartender for some change. This place is a great bar to hang out with friends, and try some good beer. Definitely coming back, and I anticipate bumping to 5 stars when I do.

33.description: Their beer selection was always admirable but now they have amazing food to boot. Best cheese curds this side of the border and killer pork shoulder quesadillas.  Oh and always friendly staff too!

43.description: This review is solely for Kevin, the bouncer. He is kind and sweet and also follows all the rules. Kevin is great.

2.description: I am so glad the Village Tap is just a few blocks away from where I live. The beer garden in the summer? Incredible! The tented and heated beer garden in the winter? Warm and cozy! The Village Tap has a great beer list and what about the food? While it's not Michelin quality, it's really good and filling comfort food! This is definitely a great neighborhood spot!

18.description: So I like it here.  On the surface, it's a neighborhood bar with a decent beer list and some outdoor space.However, look a little closer and you'll see that they have a slammin' outdoor space (retractable roof, smoking area, Christmas lights and vegetation) and a more interesting food menu than I would expect.Yay!I FULLY recommend the fish and chips with one of the sours on tap.  Absolutely fab choice for Roscoe Village dining.Fair warning: Village Tap gets crazy busy on a weekend evening.  And it's no surprise as to why: Factor in a nice beer list, reasonable prices, great menu and stellar beer garden and you've got a recipe for success that brings the Roscoe Village peeps in droves.I like it.  Keep it up.

41.description: I've taken a star away from my previous review, but still don't hesitate in recommending Village Tap.  Their menu is still excellent, however I have to admit that at times I'm looking for something simple and feel like I just cant find it here.  My wife and I are here about once every few weeks and stay for a beer and dinner.  The Menu changes frequently which is usually a good thing, but wish I had at least a few simple and reliable menu items that I could turn to when we are just in the mood to relax and have a comfortable meal.

52.description: A solid bar with a great beer list and an even better beer garden.  In the cooler months I can't say it's anything special, but if it's warm out this is a great place to grab a tasty beer.173/365

50.description: Beer garden is cool,  but the food is bland and tasteless the waitress could have also been more attentive with filling drinks. The bus boy was very helpful.

4.description: Amazing spot in the city. Great beer selection and food is delicious!!! Customer service: A+Dominick & Juan could not be any better!!!! Very personable and excellent recommendations in their beer selection :-)

6.description: The bar is a decent size and has a nice garden area out back. They also have a nice selection of beers for a reasonable price.I came here recently for an event, and the guy at the door directed me to the back where everyone was gathered. We had a few people who tried to speak to our group, but apparently a separate birthday party was booked in the same room. This lead to everyone shouting over each other and both events being disasters.

22.description: Went here for a few drinks. I personally like certain Weiss and English ales. Village Tap has ZERO Weiss or authentic English ales. I was disappointed to find most if not all the beer served here were micro brews with odd bitter or fruit like tastes. Expect to pay $6 a beer not great not terribly priced, though $6 for a poor beer is not worth it.Pass.

15.description: We came here last night with a friend for a low key, casual dinner. My friend and I each got the burger with a sunny side up egg on top. The burger was HUGE. And delicious!!! And I have to say, this whole egg on a burger thing is right up my alley. I don't know why, but it's delicious! MY hubby got the "stew" which was really soup and wasn't quite filling enough. It was more of an appetizer (a large appetizer, but not enough for dinner). So once he saw our burgers come out, he ordered one for himself as well. We all loved that burger. The only downside was the service was just so-so. Our waitress was super nice and sweet but also kind of hard to find/not totally on the ball. I think she might have been taking care of the entire place though, so it's likely not her fault!Anyway, I would def return as they food was quite good and the menu had some other tasty looking things just waiting for me!

57.description: Love the beer selection at the Tap. Would give that 5 stars easily. They are always rotating the selections and the staff is very knowledgeable about the beers on draft. 3 stars is mainly for their new food menu. The old menu wasn't great but at least it had more variety. We tried the breakfast burger last time and it was so disappointing. It was one of the worst burgers I've ever had. Also had the quesadilla which tasted exactly like the one they used to make even down to the salsa they served. Only difference was the bigger price tag. I want to like the new menu but would prefer more sandwich choices. Perhaps some upscale/inventive sandwiches like Lush or Owen and Engine,etc.

20.description: Very odd food menu. I heard the chef changed about a year ago and the food is very strange for a bar. While I'm drinking beer I definitely don't want British food that I would have at a tea party. Cool patio in the back, great location and friendly service.

36.description: Great beer selections, comfortable environment, friendly staff. But the ambitious food menu was poorly executed. The sauce on the wings was great, but the wings themselves were undercooked and fatty/flobbery. Cassoulet had nice flavor but was overcooked and dried out. Meatloaf was a small portion and just OK. The chefs need better training to pull off this menu.

14.description: My favorite place in Chicago. Food, service and beer are great. The cheese curds are particularly awesome. Highly recommend!

0.description: Haute Hideout is an adorable little boutique in Roscoe Village. Stop by and say hello to Tracy if you get a chance! She has amazing taste.

3.description: First time at this location.  Came in around lunch time, no wait time (used mobile app), everyone was very friendly.  Got the haircut as I instructed and still had time to grab a bite next door (very convenient location with plenty of restaurants.)

1.description: Don't go. Went in at 10am with a high res photo of myself EXACTLY how I want it. A few people waiting, but not for long (we were done in 5 minutes)Said I NEED a trim and she buzzes right through without hesitation. What's worse? She left a huge chunk uneven. I'm not a picky man, but it looks like I did this to myself in the dark. NEVER had I had a haircut THIS bad before NEVER again. I went in because I needed a basic trim and didn't think it was worth 60 bucks to do something so simple... I guess I was wrong.

2.description: John Kulka is the best stylist/cosmetologist/barber in Chicago. No, in Illinois.No one will know how your your head and hair should be styled like John.

5.description: Very impressed!  Chris was friendly and gave me the exact cut I asked him to!  I was very pleased !

6.description: Great service, reasonable prices, and very kind staff.  Very impressive.

7.description: personally, i have followed chris around to various shops for 3 years.  he has never ever given me a bad haircut.  not only that but it took one time for him to remember what i want.  i want my cut, shampoo, conditioner and my eyebrows cut.  he has never failed in the quality of service.

0.description: I go to Beatrice. She is amazing and knows exactly how I like my hair cut. She is great with scissors and is very detail orientated. She takes the time to determine the pattern of your hair to style accordingly. I've gone to other stylists in other supercuts. No offense to the others but I will only go to Beatrice!!!!

4.description: You know it's bad when your stylist tells you there are some things he doesn't know how to do (cut layers).   He then proceeded to cut a hunk of hair out of the side of my head.  Enter stylist  #2 to clean up the mess stylist #1 made.You know it's worse when stylist #2 says, "I need to tell you, something looks very bad," (the side of my head) "and I didn't do it!"You know it's so awful its almost comical when stylist #2 tells another stylist how awful my hair looks, points out the problems, and emphasizes again that she didn't do it.If you don't know how to do something, don't accept that client.    It's that simple.

12.description: Great stuff and easy to sort through.  The owners have an eye and don't overwhelm you with items.  Well put together and always find something I can use.

7.description: This is a great store. So many items you are sure to find a treasure(s). The Lazy Dog features an excellent variety of antiques, friendly staff, fair prices, and new inventory almost every day! it honestly doesn't get much better! Also, be sure to check out the basement for even more deals!!

20.description: This store is great! I have seen a wide array of antiques and collectibles that they offer, and there is honestly something there for everyone.A matter of fact, the war hammer in my possession is from this store.Very friendly, and very informed (border line genius)Anytime your in the neighborhood, look it up and stop in !

19.description: Great antique store!  I've bought a few furniture pieces here and have been very pleased.  Wonderful store and will be going back.

1.description: I have to say...this store is awesome!  Owners and help are super friendly and willing to help you no matter what they are doing. There is such a diversity from Oriental to mid century to Art Deco two fifties and sixties and so on. My favorite happens to be the great selection of hats and clothing and the jewelry is just beautiful. They also have some great sales I would highly recommend the store.

2.description: Absolutely amazing. Very welcoming and friendly with great pieces. Polaroid cameras, small keep sakes, and beautiful antique furniture. The goods are not yard sale grade, but beautifully kept wonders. I could walk through this place for hours.

9.description: What a fabulous place!  Rudy and Lisa are fun and knowledgeable.  Had such a great time on Saturday, we went back on Sunday.  Well laid out space is chock full of great things without feeling cluttered.  We will visit again soon.

6.description: This place always has the coolest stuff.  The owners are very friendly too.

18.description: This store is great! I have seen a wide array of antiques and collectibles that they offer, and there is honestly something there for everyone.A matter of fact, the war hammer in my possession is from this store.Very friendly, and very informed (border line genius)Anytime your in the neighborhood, look it up and stop in !

10.description: Wonderful experience at the Lazy Dog.  A dream shop full of antiques, amazing furniture and a vintage jewelry selection like I have never seen.  Place was exceptionally clean and organized.  Bought a chair the minute I walked in and came back to buy nesting tables that I couldn't be without.  Owners were friendly and helpful, was able to browse without any pressure and prices were very reasonable.  I will definitely be back!

13.description: This is a great antique store. Maybe one of the best in the city.  And I've been to tons of antique stores and believe me there's a lot of junk out there with hardly no turnover, but not this one.  They have lots of unique items with prices that are appropriately priced and justified and there's always something new to look at when go in.  They have a lot of diverse items spanning generations.  If you like antiques this a must-visit for the city.

16.description: I just visited this shop for the very first time this weekend.....what a FABULOUS Antique Shop....as anyone who frequents antique shops, you know there's alot of crap out there!   This is a first rate store....they have a really nice diverse selection, and some of the most beautiful pieces of furniture I have ever seen.  They have a European Art Deco bedroom set right now that is absolutely spectacular.  GO!  You won't be disappointed.

17.description: So I saw that they had a 48-star flag on display in their window. When I went in to check it  out and see how much it was, I was told "a dollar per star." In other words, they wanted $48 not including tax for a silk screened flag. I have a linen stitched flag  (it's massive too) 48 star, WWII era flag in great shape for $20 from a nearby antique store a year back. When I asked why only $20, I was told by the owner that such flags are "a dime a dozen." When I mentioned that to the woman at Lazy Dog, she just gave me a dumb look and said, "that's all I can do." Months later, the same flag was still hanging in their window. I was still up $25 (which is what I offered them), and they were still out $25. Certain folks shouldn't be in the antique business... those who undervalue products, and those who overvalue products. They fall into the latter category.

15.description: Last Thursday I poked into Lazy Dog Antiques on Belmont with a girlfriend of mine.  We strolled around, opening up map drawers, stared at sparkly jewelry, awed over a killer display of alarm clocks en masse and I even bought a wooden display cabinet for a more $38 bucks!  I will be back on Belmont to satisfy my vintage taste and I surely will be stopping into Lazy Dog Antiques again!

0.description: I always enjoy perusing items at antique shops, and have been to quite a few in the Midwest. What I really enjoy about The Lazy Dog is the variety of items and the bonus basement area to explore. The owner was very friendly and helpful. When I told her the item I was purchasing was a gift, she went the extra mile and found a small gift box that she placed my gift in. I appreciated that very much. I enjoyed my whole experience antique shopping at The Lazy Dog. I will certainly be coming back.

5.description: Wonderful store.  Very nice ladies run the shop.  Amy was great the first time I went in to browse. No pressure.  She has a lovely attitude.  I returned and met the very nice and personable owner, Lisa.  I enjoyed seeing all that they had for sale.  Some gorgeous vintage jewelry and impressive antiques and collectibles that were quite eye-catching.  Unique store and I was made to feel very comfortable when there.  Also, had a nice conversation with Lisa.  It is such a good feeling to be able to browse without pressure.  Even if I could not buy something then, I may very well buy something the next time, and as you can see, I'm writing a Yelp review.  This is a cool place to stop and shop for quality antiques and collectibles.  I will be back.  Please Note:  If you would like to meet with the owner to sell something, then be sure to call ahead for an appointment, otherwise no appointment needed.

11.description: I was as happy here with the quality and uniqueness of the stuff as I was with the boss's willingness to deal. First class.I was not so happy with the place not opening at Noon, as advertised. It was raining, and there were no signs of life.  I only noticed a light flipping on perhaps a half hour or so later, as I was heading back to my hood on the bus. So, I got off and returned.But I guess it lives up to its name.

8.description: This place is like an Ebay wet dream! Get the best deal with out the bid time and shipping costs.Yes friends and neighbors, step right up andrub the belly of the Lazy Dog where yesteryear's treasures await to appear before you for at a reasonable price. For instance, the two 1920's brass desk top lamps with beautiful tulip shaped frosted glass shades that encase the light bulbs that provides a ghostly glow of the early 20th century( on my antique desk) purchased last fall. And my 1930's LC Smith metal 30 pound type writer that I purchased this spring.

3.description: Bring money and incredible taste, you'll need both. Everything is extraordinary in here. You won't be sorry to stop in and make an impulse buy.

14.description: Fabulous store with tons of great items.  It is a very clean upscale antique store that has some amazing pieces and great prices.  I only wish there were more stores like this in the area.

4.description: Christine, owner Lisa's sister was so helpful and knowledgeable. Love the store with beautiful choices. Highly recommended.

12.description: Placed an order over the phone for balloons.  The girl on the phone was a little inexperienced but worked with me.  The bouquets were great and ready on time.  A little on the pricey side, but I will order from them again.

7.description: This is a pretty well run Party City.Nice employees.  Clean.  Organized shelves.  Knowledgeable service.  Cheap prices.They have everything for all of your needs, from birthday parties to wedding showers to baby showers.  Kids stuff, adult stuff and TONS of piniatas for reasonable prices (as low as $10).  Free parking lot and conveniently located near Jewel.

3.description: Great store for getting your party goods, costumes and celebratory stuff.  Balloons galore, theme and seasonal merchandise, and a one-stop shop for just about any occasion.
