Or, it could turn out just fine and you have a lovely lasagna and wine. So if you aren't too picky or you're too lazy to go get decent Italian food, Piazza Bella may be worth the risks.

13.description: I decided to try out this nice decorated italian restaurant for my birthday and loved it! I tried a bite of everyone's dish, and they all tasted great but mine was the best. Order the Cod, it was sweet and super delicious! The staff was great and I was able to make a reservation for 10 earlier in the day. The atmosphere was relaxing, with dim lights, and nice decor. Can't wait for my next visit!

11.description: I am adding a star back.  They seem to have improved the food.  Service good.  Come back time Piazza Bellla.

39.description: Dined here recently and I would say it was just okay. Service and atmosphere were great, food was unimpressive. Had the chicken parm, it was pretty charred and dried. The sauce was good but not put on heavy enough. My guest had spaghetti and ziti. They both stated average in terms of taste.

37.description: The food was tremendous; we tried the Squid Ink Linguini cause it sounded different and was recommended by our server and let me tell you, it did not disappoint. A perfect portion sized dish with plenty of fresh seafood. However this was my first and only time visiting so I can not speak of any other menu items.The service was on par with most restaurants and given that we dined on Valentine's Day (Friday as well), I thought it was above average.However the only complaint/issue I have with this restaurant is the menu size and simple, limited options. Be sure to find the most recent menu located on the official restaurant website, not what I saw here on Yelp, because the menu was changed/reduced drastically. Our server informed us they recently had a change in chef(s) and also a significant change in the menu. The entree options are just too limited, mostly pasta dishes only and very few fresh seafood or meat based dinners.I would recommend this restaurant, but only to those who closely view the menu ahead of time and determine there's something they would like to try. Do not go hoping for many options/choices, including traditional Italian dishes.

0.description: Piazza catered our wedding, which is not something they typically do. However, we love their food and they did us a HUGE favor!! The service was excellent to say the least! Our venue did not make it easy for the owner Chris. Piazza had to supply liquor licenses, add on fees you name it. However, Chris did everything he could to make the process as seamless as possible! Lupe, Cuco, and Dave all were so helpful as well as the rest of the Piazza staff that took time out of their busy Saturday's to make our wedding the best! We are so thankful for Piazza, and I would highly recommend them to anyone for gourmet Italian!!

38.description: used to eat at this place all the time.. at least once a week. they changed the menu and now there really isnt a reason to go back. all the good stuff is gone. risotto.. gone. steak.. gone. bruschetta.. gone. the pastas are even all different. the menu is very limited. i asked about the specials (they used to have them every night) and the waiter pointed to the menu. ummm.. there is nothing special on that menu anymore. i ended up having soup and a beet "salad" for dinner. it was blah. i wont be back. i have been a customer for 8 years, and now i wont be back. what a waste of a good location!

51.description: I ordered 3 entrees and an appetizer to go. When I got home, I noticed that the 3rd entree was not what I ordered, but rather someone's left-overs. Gross! When we took it back to the restaurant, they couldn't have cared less. We asked to speak to a manager and he didn't care or do anything about it.Also - the prices listed online are $2-$3 off. They will charge you more. I wish I would have listened to other yelpers. Stay away from this place.

27.description: I take everything back I said in my last review.  This place has undergone a significant update and transformation and I really like what they have done!  The menu has an entire new look -- slimmed down and more interesting pasta options.  Agnolotti stuffed with short ribs -- amazing. Ravioli with sausage and fennel -- amazing.  Spaghetti carbonara -- a really nice update to an older dish.  Yes they got rid of a few items that you would expect at an Italian restaurant, but those were some of the exact items that were becoming so predictable and boring.  Love the fact that if they have the ingredients on hand you can even go off menu for a custom dish.  Staff is as attentive and friendly as ever.  Interior is painted a moody dark blue which may not seem Italian but it creates a great atmosphere.  They gave up the lounge next door -- smart move on their part.   So happy to see the changes and will definitely frequent this place more often.

32.description: With the neighborhood location, ambiance, and great food, this used to be our favorite destination for Italian food.  Not anymore.  The changes in the menu. which seems to have eliminated upwards of half the entree choices, in particular two of the chicken entrees, several of the best pastas, and the risotto, not to mention (as other reviewers have), no more nightly specials.  Yet with less choice, the prices inched up and the quality inched down.  Only the fine service remains, but that is not enough to bring us back after many wonderful meals there in the past couple of years.  Bye-bye, Bella.

54.description: Piazza Bella was okay. Nothing to special or fancy. Pizza was alright -- there are better in Chicago.

48.description: I might come back to try again but wasn't overly impressed the first time around.  The place looks super cute and menu looks great.The bread basket was fab!  Got the roasted veggies as an ap - somehow our plate was removed before we finished eating.  Then had pizza - the crust was thin but super dense - kind of reminded me of a frozen trader joes pizza.  Just didnt love the pizza (why walk here when I could eat at Frasca!!).  I will come back and give the pasta a try and enjoy the bread basket.

44.description: Phenomenal Brunch deal and it's delicious! Salad bar, breakfast buffet, BYO omelette, pick 2 entrees AND 2 mimosas for $15! We stumbled upon this deal walking somewhere else for brunch and had to give it a shot. Weren't many others taking advantage but we will definitely be back. They even put 2 different NFL games on the tv for us. Who knew this was such a gem for Brunch!

24.description: Easy to grab a table inside or out when the weather is nice. Great service, willing to alter most dishes and great wine:)

7.description: I wanted my 300th review to be special and I couldn't haveasked for a better place/restaurant to review.Piazza Bella is a class act all the way, from the moment you enterand see the stunning romantic interior, a beautiful wooden bar, andtables lit with candlelight..I was a little taken aback at first because I thought this place mightbe too upscale for me, but that feeling went away very quickly becausewe were welcomed by the nicest of servers and treated so well!There is not one negative thing I can say about this place becauseeverything they do here is solid, and they do it with style!And as if all that's not enough then they bring you this great breadbasket to the table with olive oil and freshly grated parmesan cheese..Absolutely delicious!And Piazza Bella has a great menu with many choices but I would adviseyou to order a thin crust pizza from them because truly, it was one of the best I have ever had in my entire life!I am so impressed with Piazza Bella, and.. I just have a feelingthis will be one of my favorite new spots.And.. they also have a great wine list,or various beers if that's whatyou would prefer.Honestly, one of the nicest places I've been to all year..Thank You Piazza Bella,It was a great dining experience, one that I will be repeating soon..

49.description: Who are they tryin to kid! I think they stole my $. I truly feel ripped off. Chicken was plain, sauce was salt, potatoes were FRIED! What Italian restaurant (that considers themselves fancy) fries their potatoes?

40.description: I feel my three star review is actually quite generous given how hit or miss Piazza Bella can be. I was excited that there was a neighborhood Italian place since I moved away from my beloved Caro Mio, but Piazza Bella does not even compare. I've dined at Piazza Bella for brunch and dinner. Their brunch service is decent, it is a buffet. No major issues with the food or service, and the price is pretty good. Also, you usually don't have to wait to have brunch unlike the other popular brunch establishments in the neighborhood. Dinner however, is a completely different story. The dishes range from "not bad" to "wtf is this?". On my most recent visit, a pasta dish was ordered that you could add shrimp to for an additional $6. We waited almost 45 minutes for the food to arrive, and when it did the pasta dish had three shrimp on it. That's $2 dollars a shrimp folks! Insane. The pizza I had was fine...this time. A later visit I was given pizza with dough that was not completely cooked. Some dinner pluses include the lasagna. My mom ordered it when visiting me and she loved it. I tried it and it was pretty good. So you see, by eating at Piazza Bella, you take a risk. A risk of having to wait ages for food, being disappointed in the food, and paying too much for the food. Or, it could turn out just fine and you have a lovely lasagna and wine. So if you aren't too picky or you're too lazy to go get decent Italian food, Piazza Bella may be worth the risks.

53.description: Service was terrible and the food was mediocre at best.  To many other restaurants in the neighborhood that offer much better food and service.  Don't waste your time or money!

30.description: Great food!   Superior service!  An evening to be remembered.  The thin crust pizza was the best I have ever had.   Lupe was incredibly gracious.  Will go back again.  Tony from Louisville.

46.description: I've been to this place a few times and have been happy with it in the past, but boy were we disappointed last Wednesday night.  Started off good, I asked the waiter about the wine and was very happy with what he brought me.  Great.  But after that, it all fell apart.  We ordered the goat cheese appetizer which was good, but they were a little stingy with the crustinis, so we asked for more.  Never got them and never saw the waiter again until we finally told the hostess that we were ready to order, could she advise our waiter.  When he came over, we mentioned the crustinis again -he had  no concern about the fact that we had already asked for them.  By the time we finally got them, the app was cold.  Oh well.My friend loves marinara and asked for a liberal portion of it on his rigatoni.  Well, evidently the meat sauce is just meat, no real 'sauce' to speak of (maybe that's authentic Italian, but if you want marina, the rigatoni is not your dish).  So all of that is annoying but here's the worst part.  The lasagna tasted like something was wrong with it - spoiled cheese or something.  I wanted to send it back but my friend was tired of waiting and didn't want to wait for them to make another entrée - he gave me his meal and didn't eat.  Not that it would have even been easy to send it back because nobody ever came by to ask how the food was. Later, our waiter inquired whether I would like another glass of wine - but still no worries about whether we liked the food, even though the lasagna sat barely touched.  When he asked if we wanted a dessert menu, we advised that something was not right with the lasagna and he took it off the bill.  Oh and no, no dessert menu necessary.When I started this review, I clicked three stars because past experiences were better, but based on this outing, I just can't give more than two.

1.description: Gave it nearly two years since my last visit and I can still say without a doubt that the food here is not good.  However I will say the service is wonderful, which is unfortunate for the FOH staff here.Tonight we had the filet with barolo glaze, asparagus and potatoes, and the potato gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce.  Both dishes were boring boring boring.The filet was overcooked by two temps, waiter recommended med-rare hubby asked for rare it came out medium.  The filet wasn't seasoned in the slightest and was bland. The supposed glaze on the steak didn't come through at all.  It also had a few big fatty tendons running through it.  The asparagus and potatoes that came with it were severely disappointing, just boiled, unseasoned cut up baby red potatoes and chopped up miniscule pieces of asparagus thrown together.  I made this concoction at home better last week with some leftover porkchops.  $28The gnocchi wasn't much better--- an overly rich cream sauce with pieces of gnocchi. Nothing to this dish at all.  Even a sprinkling of parsley would have went a long way but there was nothing colorful or overwhelming here.  $16I feel like this establishment is ran by people who just woke up one day and thought, "I think I'll open an Italian restaurant today."  The food is simply not good and is severely overpriced for the quality. I won't be back- I'd rather take a $15 cab ride to a much better Italian restaurant.

55.description: This is one of our favorite restaurants. The pizza is really fabulous-as close to Italy as it gets. My favorite dish is the pasta with peas and sausage in their heavenly tomato cream sauce. I have it with gluten-free pasta and it is amazing. I always take 1/2 home as it is so rich. The caesar salad is great, too, and big enough to split. My guilty pleasure is the little garlic roll to start. Oh my! This is a great neighborhood restaurant, with interestingly enough, an adult side (no kids) and a family side!

9.description: Cute small local place with pretty good service.  Came here for my birthday and I guess my boyfriend told them it was my b-day when he called for reservations but they didn't do anything.  Food was decent.

26.description: I can't believe these bozos. The food is ok. Dependable. Not wow but good. Tonite I went over just by myself to get some wine and pasta. Tables open outside. It's 820p. Way past prime hour. Wouldn't let me sit outside as one person. Their policy. Bye. Forget being a semi-regular. Never again.

25.description: An original, long time patron of this Roscoe Village restaurant has me scratching my head after our dining experience this evening.   The menu has been pared down substantially, and they've given up the old/original half of their space to a new (odd, chinese/taco) joint for which they share their kitchen... The waitstaff is no longer charming and knowledgable about the chef or the kitchen, even though the menu clearly states, "if you don't see your favorite pasta, please let us know and we can make whatever you like....."  -- For whatever reason, they got rid of my favorite dish, the fusilli alla mama with melanzane and ricotta salata.  The waiter cut me off when I just got the word fusilli out, saying they don't have it, can't make it, and they couldn't get the ricotta salata any longer.  (WHY ?, it's readily available).  Anyhow, the place looks like it's trying to be a bar, not a restaurant.   Almost all the pasta dishes now have meat, but there is no fish.  Is this place really still Italian ?  I'm wondering.It's sad to see a place that was once a true gem turn into just another sports (big screen TVs flanking the bar and spilling into the dining space) bar.   I've been dining here for 14 years, but this was the last time.We won't be back.  Arrivederci Piazza Bella.

12.description: This is a local fav.  They get five stars for service.  In reading the reviews, hint, don't go here during one of our hoods famous street fairs and expect a romantic time.  These folks LOVE the street fairs and prepare to be what they need to be during them, a place to get better drinks than the beer and lousy sangria served in the street.  On a weekday, sit outside, have a beer and some pizza, meet the locals.  Only thing I wish they would do is bring back the risotto!

59.description: This is a great neighborhood restaurant in Roscoe Village. The food is always good and the evening specials are really good! The Lounge (Trattoria) was remodeled and looks very modern with big screen TV's for sporting events. The staff is nice and friendly and I have always had good service here. The pricing on some items and the specials is a bit high for a neighborhood restaurant which is the only real negative. The Star of this place is the Manager Lupe and he is the life and personality of this place that makes it such a gem. Have brought many friends & family and had several big parties here as well. I will continue to be a loyal patron as I have never had a bad experience here!

21.description: Don't go here and expect to get any service.  I don't know why people go into the service industry with customers if they are going to REFUSE to provide, well, service to customers.  I went here on the Saturday of Retro on Roscoe and decided to go to the bar to order drinks.  BIG MISTAKE.  Apparently, only the male bartender was capable of operating the cash register and running credit cards, and the female bartender was only interested in waiting on male customers.  What did Julia Roberts say in "Pretty Woman?" BIG MISTAKE.  I usually tip half of my bill, and I'm fairly certain the average Joes the bartender was waiting on, who weren't even standing at the bar while I was waiting for 15 minutes, were not tipping at that level.  I made eye contact with her, tried to flag her down, she actually took time to clean the bar off and continued to ignore me - intentionally. I finally had to flag down the male bartender, who motioned to the female bartender and said she would wait on me.  I informed him that that was not going to happen because I did not have the right, er, anatomy.  Once I got my drinks, a young black guy standing next to me asked "what it took to get a drink in this place." When I responded, "you have a penis, she should wait on you," she ran and told the bouncer she is schtupping to throw me and my friend out.  This was pretty hilarious because we couldn't wait to get out of this dump and were planning on leaving as soon as we got our drinks.  Obviously, I'll never go back to this place.  Way to attract new customers at Retro on Roscoe Piazza Bella!

17.description: Came here for my brothers birthday, beautiful interior, white tablecloths, great food!  Fried calamari appetizer was so good and the chef's special cod was the best cod I've had; the sauce was this amazing sweet sauce that complimented the fish perfectly.  Will definitely be back!

10.description: What a great dinner we had here with the kids. Fresh and had great flavors from the appetizer to the entrees. Always great to see a chef think out of the box and this restaurant does it well! I will def be back (Squid Ink Pasta was awesome!) and will recommend others as well! It just so happened the weather was awesome and the outdoor seating made it even better.

5.description: What happened to you, Piazza Bella?? I've not been coming recently, so I may have missed an ownership change or something, but the empty restaurant perhaps should have alerted me.The service was good, but the food was completely boring in every way. Meh soup, meh salad, boring overcooked salmon, with no discernible flavor, and my 10 year old's friend said the ravioli was dry!!! lolol. It would've been funny, except that I spent $100 for a disappointing dinner for one adult and two 10 year olds:-(

3.description: Everything we requested was promised but ignored. Place wasn't even that busy. Good came out hot and was good. But the time we had to wait to order, drink refills and ignored requests killed it. The waiters think they're doing everything right but two of the waiters who were wearing glasses have the memory of a goldfish.

35.description: Came for the first time in a while and was so disappointed!  New menu...all our favorites are gone.   I ordered the pasta carbonara , which was good but tiny.  Served on a triangle small plate , which barely could hold the pasta!  The menu mentioned a "poached egg" on top, but there was not egg to be found... Assuming it was already mixed in the pasta.?Service was fine, but food so so disappointing !

19.description: Don't go here and expect to get any service.  I don't know why people go into the service industry with customers if they are going to REFUSE to provide, well, service to customers.  I went here on the Saturday of Retro on Roscoe and decided to go to the bar to order drinks.  BIG MISTAKE.  Apparently, only the male bartender was capable of operating the cash register and running credit cards, and the female bartender was only interested in waiting on male customers.  What did Julia Roberts say in "Pretty Woman?" BIG MISTAKE.  I usually tip half of my bill, and I'm fairly certain the average Joes the bartender was waiting on, who weren't even standing at the bar while I was waiting for 15 minutes, were not tipping at that level.  I made eye contact with her, tried to flag her down, she actually took time to clean the bar off and continued to ignore me - intentionally. I finally had to flag down the male bartender, who motioned to the female bartender and said she would wait on me.  I informed him that that was not going to happen because I did not have the right, er, anatomy.  Once I got my drinks, a young black guy standing next to me asked "what it took to get a drink in this place." When I responded, "you have a penis, she should wait on you," she ran and told the bouncer she is schtupping to throw me and my friend out.  This was pretty hilarious because we couldn't wait to get out of this dump and were planning on leaving as soon as we got our drinks.  Obviously, I'll never go back to this place.  Way to attract new customers at Retro on Roscoe Piazza Bella!

28.description: Piazza Bella has awesome Italian food in Roscoe Village... the waiter (Jeff) was awesome and super chatty! We even had a shot of limoncello as our dessert with him!Food was good and they are very accommodating whether you want to change something on the entrée. Overall it was a great experience and when I am in the area I will stop by again for more goodness!

45.description: This has been our neighborhood mainstay for the last two years.  We have gotten to know the waiters and bartenders over that time and it's great to get that acknowledgement that we are regulars.  We think the food is great.  Last night, I had one of the specials, a pumpkin gnocchi with a butter walnut sauce.  I think I like the four cheese gnocchi better but the gnocchi itself was the most pillowy melt in your mouth gnocchi I have ever had.  Their salads are always generous and the menu is quite large, always supplemented with up to three entree specials.  If you come here, you have to understand this is a family-friendly neighborhood so there are inevitably kids there if you go before 7:30 but even then, they opened up the extension to the west side of the original restaurant which usually accommodates those that want an atmosphere with a higher average age.My only real complaint is that they have removed the lasagna from then menu recently!  We loved the lasagna and think it is such a necessary item on an Italian menu.  This is a baked dish of cheesy, saucy goodness.  Last year when we had family in for the holidays, we sought out the lasagna at Piazza Bella.  Hopefully they will bring it back as this is a hole in their menu.

33.description: This place is a nice little neighborhood spot.  Its very cute inside, the food is ok.  We had the calamari for an appetizer and I had the ravioli as my main meal.  For delicious Italian food I'd probably go elsewhere, but for the charm and very kind and attentive waitstaff this place works.  Also, the portions are large so I was able to have a nice lunch the next day.

43.description: I wasn't really sure how to rate this one...A guy I work with said this place was great if you were planning on enjoying a lot of time out. He wasn't kidding. I took a friend of mine and we ordered beer and bruschetta - which was very very tasty. It did take our waiter a pretty good chunk of time to come back for our order though. We were both pretty boring and ordered capalleni pomodoro that came  out, you know, eventually. But both of us were kind of "meh" about the entire dish. I'm sort of a snob about Italian food so I wanted to be softer on my review but...it was just bland. The pasta was cooked a little bit too long because it came out gloopy and it was just under seasoned. Three less minutes boiling and more basil and tomato and it would have been fantastic. I loved the atmosphere. The bar looked fantastic. I think next time this will be the place that I go before dinner or a night out for drinks and apps.

2.description: What a great place! First time here. We had the chicken parm and ravioli. Homemade pasta and homemade sauce, they were excellent. Also tried the asparagus with fried egg and red sauce, outstanding flavors. Great service and affordable wine list. We'll be back!

18.description: The service was good, but the food was bland. They also didn't put pepperoni on half of one pizza like we asked. We didn't leave upset we ate there, but we also agreed we'd never go back. It was literally just "okay nothing special." Not authentic Italian.

41.description: Checked out this place. Didn't like how it was in 2 different buildings, that was confusing as only 1 one was the correct one to enter I guess. Had lasagna which was a little cold in the center. All else was good.

52.description: I wanted my 300th review to be special and I couldn't haveasked for a better place/restaurant to review.Piazza Bella is a class act all the way, from the moment you enterand see the stunning romantic interior, a beautiful wooden bar, andtables lit with candlelight..I was a little taken aback at first because I thought this place mightbe too upscale for me, but that feeling went away very quickly becausewe were welcomed by the nicest of servers and treated so well!There is not one negative thing I can say about this place becauseeverything they do here is solid, and they do it with style!And as if all that's not enough then they bring you this great breadbasket to the table with olive oil and freshly grated parmesan cheese..Absolutely delicious!And Piazza Bella has a great menu with many choices but I would adviseyou to order a thin crust pizza from them because truly, it was one of the best I have ever had in my entire life!I am so impressed with Piazza Bella, and.. I just have a feelingthis will be one of my favorite new spots.And.. they also have a great wine list,or various beers if that's whatyou would prefer.Honestly, one of the nicest places I've been to all year..Thank You Piazza Bella,It was a great dining experience, one that I will be repeating soon..

50.description: I wanted to love it. It's one of my neighborhood pizza/Italian restaurants. I just couldn't get on board w/ the pizza. I make better homemade pizza, I have to say. It was just underwhelming and meh okay. A little greasy for my liking as well. The crust was soggy in the middle - cheese had no flavor and I even ordered additional fresh mozzarella. The wine was nothing to write home about. Seemed as if it has been opened and re-corked a day or two ago.I also tried the desert - the cannoli. I was surprised to see that it came on a plate covered in what seemed to be melted vanilla and chocolate gelato on top to make it look pretty. It tasted okay, so I ordered another one plain. The waiter was very accommodating, but seemed a bit confused about me wanting a plain cannoli. I ordered a cannoli, not a cannoli plus :) The cannoli was outstanding actually - so 5 stars for that! If I need a cannoli, I will definitely be back for take out, but other than that I think I will stick to my normal pizza from Pizzeria Serio (just can't be beat!).Service was okay for 5:30PM on Sat., as it should be w/ only a few tables seated.

4.description: Taking a star off because now that I've been to Sapori, I can't justify giving this place the full five. Four solid stars though, and if you're in the area, I recommend it.

6.description: What a terrible experience. We were looking for a nice family dinner and instead were greeted with mediocre food and the most obnoxious patrons I have ever experienced outside of a sports bar on St. Patrick's Day. I could barely even hear my husband over the loud table behind us, and it just seemed to get louder as the meal wore on. It's sad when one table's dining experience trumps another, and it was impossible to even converse, much less just eat in peace with the noise from the other guests. I had a pounding headache by the end. For the price point, we would have been so much happier at Mia Francesca's instead -- much better food and atmosphere/clientele. This wasn't our first time at Piazza Bella, but it was most certainly our last.

22.description: Visited again this past week and one of my favorite pastas - tagliatelle - was no longer on the menu. Neither of the two beers I wanted were available, and they were out of the gluten free pasta my wife always orders.At this point 3 of my favorite pastas have disappeared from the menu, and now my wife no longer has any confidence she'll be able to get something to eat here.I'm keeping three stars because the lasagna is still very good, but I don't think I can fairly give them 4 stars anymore.

15.description: A gem not hidden, but right out in the open. Consecutively great food, service, and atmosphere.Went to this place night for a birthday dinner and left completely satisfied. Our waiter, Solomon, started us with two fresh bread baskets (complimentary), a crisp green salad tossed in balsamic vinaigrette. She ordered a custom vodka angel hair and chicken pasta dish (there's an option to make your own), and I ordered the 10 oz. ribeye that came with a grilled red onion and bell peppers sautéed in a light tomato sauce. Fantastic.Definitely recommended time after time.

57.description: The service was excellent, I have that much to say. Ambiance was very nice as well, but the food was not anything special. Certainly not worth what you're paying. My lasagna was super salty, my sister's fusilli had an almost taco seasoning flavor to it, and my boyfriend's gnocchi was bland. No thanks.

20.description: Well what more can I say about the place its near to my house very affordable great pizza and great people fast delivery and I love the pizza the pepperoni is awesome the sausage is great I recommend this place everybody should try it

36.description: Updating my review because they took the Tortellini dish off the menu. However there is a really good Potato gnocci dish on the menu now. However I have to dock a star for taking my favorite item off the menu.

14.description: We have been going here for 8 years however, since the change over portions are smaller, prices higher, selection limited and has a very weird energy. The staff used to be happy and it seems like there is a cloud over what was a sunny place. Huge loss to Roscoe St.

3.description: I generally only go to get spa services done if I have a Groupon, which in this case is exactly how I found this place. I bought a groupon for one microdermabration to remove some of the winter dryness and it was also my first time getting that treatment.I called to set the appointment and the book was pretty full due to the recent deal that had gone out. No problem because I wasn't in a rush, but I mentioned interest in coming in early if something opened up. I did get a call in the meantime with an opening that came available but it didn't work for me.The location is very clean and professional. Paulina has her own room in the back of a salon called "The Cutting Room."  We were the last ones there on a Friday evening and it was very relaxing. I got in right on time and we got started on time.As we talked about the treatment, I was very relaxed. She pointed out that my skin was extremely dry and I've always treated myself for oily skin! She also taught me that lotions expire which I had no idea! The conversation was very informative and understandable. Paulina made a suggestion of a few things I could do at home or look into to help the condition of my skin.I got a mask at the end that completely cleared up the redness so I didn't walk out with visible signs. I also got my eyebrows waxed (which we avoided that area with miroderm). She knew I had plans that night so we discussed what was safe as far as makeup and sun exposure over the next few days.I just love Paulina. She was the exact person I would want doing a service for me without begging you to buy product or schedule next appointment. I value that and I value her expertise. I will be back without a Groupon and I wish her the best as she continues expanding her education and services offered.

1.description: I bought a groupon and scheduled it around 45 days away. A month earlier into my appt on the same date Paulina calls me and asks why am I not showing up. Of course, I open up my calendar to confirm and it is a month away. We clear it up and it's ok.The day before my appt I received a txt message asking to reschedule. Valid excuse, family situation. Of course, I understand. The next week I had to txt twice to ask when and how to reschedule as the groupon was expiring. Getting a confirmation about the final appt.Day of the appt - I arrive there 15 min earlier and am confused. There seem to me multiple businesses in one location, which is not an issue, but unclear as to who is doing what and what their function is. I am asked whether I have any compaints or concerns with my skin. Some open pores on my nose and that's about it.Paulina agrees and starts the facial. Some steam and then microdermobrasion. After that she starts looking along my pores and determines she cannot proceed with the facial because I need a deep European facial with extractions and I have to be back. So, without even asking me, she proceeds to put a clay mask. Paulina puts the clay mask and leaves the room. No neck massage. No hand massage while the mask dries.10 minutes later she comes back. Clay mask is not dried, but she moves on to the final hydrating mask.This is not my first facial, but will be my last at Paulina's. Even though the place is VERY clean and everyone seems to be nice, there are soo many things that went wrong that this review is not even covering them all...

2.description: How great! I wanted to try some extreme skincare, so boom! Microdermabrasion Groupon! Everything about my visit was fantastic. The salon: Spotless, uncluttered. Everything was very neat and clean. Paulina has her own little empire inside the Sabe Salon, so this review is for her operation only. Microdermabrasion! I'm a convert! A couple days later now, I have no redness issues, and my skin feels gorgeous, soft n' smooth. Even a few hours after on that day, I went to a party and I felt like my skin looked great. Other stuff: music level was good, not too loud, relaxing. Not too much chatting, which is nice. Room temperature: perfect.The service itself - fantastic. Microdermabrasion feels a little weird, like a tiny lamprey raking your skin, but is not unpleasant. Also, a few pore extractions which is always a good thing. Spotless skin, for the win! Paulina was incredibly precise, and I feel like she covered every square centimeter of my skin. The little crystals did not get in my eyes, no discomfort whatsoever. On the contrary, I found it very relaxing. The microdermabrasion included face, neck and decollette as well - gotta keep all areas fresh and fine!After microdermabrasion, was a wonderful skin, neck and decollette massage with a blissful coconut/avocado oil. After THAT was a facial with a wonderful masque that smelled like apples and felt GREAT on my skin. While I was relaxing with that on - foot rub with the coconut/avocado massage oil! I was so glad my feet were clean!Prices - forget the Groupon - are really reasonable. Best recommendation, go see this friendly, knowledgeable girl in Logan Square and walk out with beautiful skin!

5.description: I bought the microdermabrasion groupon - it took a while to get an appointment in because I work 8 - 6.  Paulina takes her own appointments on her cell phone, so obviously doesn't answer when she is with a client so there could be some phone tag involved.  The salon was very nice, the service was fantastic.  The whole experience lasted about an hour.  It was my first microderm and very relaxing - (other than the hot steam that blows in your face for about 5 minutes to open up your pores - I felt like I couldnt breathe!).  I would def be back if I ever needed a skin treatment!

0.description: Went to see Paulina last week, for a dermoabrasion. I discovered her through Groupon, I coudn't be more happier with the service!!She was super professional and her hands were so soft, moving around my face like an angel. I felt pampered and taking care of after my facial.My skin looks radiant and smooth, days after.I'm glad I find Paulina, and will continue to go. Even without a Groupon, her prices are very competitive.

4.description: She is really great and knows what to do with your skin and takes her time to make you feel relaxed and comfortable! The Groupon was such a great investment!

3.description: Those ladies are amazing! They only use natural organic products which is the main reason I use their products. The body scrubs are great quality and my skin responds very well to them given that I have very sensitive skin.The oils are great too and I am planning on getting a facial soon which I look forward to. I referred my daughters to their etsy store which they loved!

1.description: Walked in to check out their products on a Sunday and met Maureen, one of the co-owners. Ended up getting the sea kelp mask with carrot juice and honey to moisturize and brighten in this cold Chicago winter! Not only was it amazing and affordable but chatting Maureen was like chatting with an old girlfriend. Ended up buying the morning face oil with 10%off products after a service! Love buying all natural and supporting local :)

2.description: My Aunt had booked a service for me, at first i wasn't sure but WOW. LOVE IT! These ladies are wonderful people. We spent 2 hours there just enjoying getting pampered and talking with these amazing owners. They are so knowledge and truly care about there business. The amount of time they take to examples things and walk you through selecting a perfect mask is wonderful.Worth your time for sure! Stop on in and see the shop.

5.description: I found out about Scratch Goods when shopping one day at Wolfbait in Logan Square. I bought their soap and loved it! It made my skin feel soft and it came in a cute package. What can I say, I'm a sucker for presentation!When I found out they were opening a store I was ecstatic. The atmosphere of the store is very modern and chic. It is located in a nice area as well. I can't wait to try some more of their products, but I know I will fall in love with them. I highly recommend this place if you want nice Chicago made, quality products.

6.description: So in LOVE with Scratch Goods! I've heard about their products from a friend a year ago and couldn't commit to trying their products. Talk about a bad choice! I visited their adorable store and received their Signature Experience and I can't stop raving about it.  My mask was specifically tailored for me and my skin. I could feel the difference right away and even after attending a street fest on a hot day could still feel it that night. The owners are super cool and helped me pick a scrub to help my acne troubled face. what a difference it has made. Love that their products are made by the owners with locally made ingredients. Prices are just an added bonus. Give them a shot you won't regret it!

7.description: Love this little gem!!! Amazing all natural skin care products, the masks are wonderful and I definitely recommend you get the foot soak and scrub while there!!! Run by 2 local gals that are super friendly and know what they are doing!! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I definitely recommend you check them out!!

0.description: Stop what you're doing, and book yourself a Signature Experience. STAT. I'm serious. I've never been one for pampering or facials, but this experience is like none other. You get to choose from a variety of fresh, preservative-and-other-poison-free scrubs, masks and oils, and sit back for the most relaxing, rejuvenation experience of your life. I'm talking foot soak and scrub, hand and arm scrub and massage, face massage and mask, cucumbers on the eyes, EVERYTHING! AND my fiancé loves it just as much as me! I think that says something. He and I use their soap at home, exclusively. Their body oils, butters, and scrubs are to die for, too. And they collaborate with tons of other Chicago makers, too, which is really cool. I'm sold. I think you will be, too.

4.description: What a wonderful surprise in Roscoe village! I've seen this business on Etsy so was excited to see all the products in person! The store owners are local and the makers of all products which means they know exactly how it's made and every organic ingredient included. I was excited to hear about the facials offered, alas the aesthetician was out so I'll have to return for some R&R.  Picked up some charcoal & honey soap-can't wait to use :-) bonus: parking is really easy to find on the street (on a Saturday Cubs day no less).

58.description: I always have great service, nice people and a fantastic mani/pedi.  And they give these mini back massages with warm towels!! Its great!!!  You do get a punch card that you can get a free pedicure after so many visits.   I am a solid costomer!!!

56.description: This place is wonderful! I'm not an expert on mani/pedi services, but of all the places I've been in Chicago, this one is my favorite. It is very clean & serene. The prices are very reasonable and they do a fabulous job. All of the employees are very friendly but they don't talk so much where you can't keep to yourself. Cell phones don't work in here which is a great plus because you don't have to listen to people gabbing away; you can actually relax! The soothing yellow walls and simple decor are very refreshing.

29.description: First trip in today (saturday) so take that for what it's worth. Bo gave me a mani/pedi and did a great job. What really impressed me is that she suggested that I try an ever so slightly different shade than I had chosen because she thought it would work better with the undertone in my skin. She was right and I love it. The place is clean and there are plenty of colors to choose from. One added touch is they offered me a dish for my rings. I also had my brows waxed and the job was ok. I'll go back.Appointment not needed but I am glad I called ahead (got a space within 15 mins) because a few walk-ins waited for about 10-15mins.

42.description: I really like this place.  They have a large selection of colors and are quite clean. Mondays-Wednesdays they do a deal on mani pedis

23.description: Got a great pedicure and eyebrow wax. Very thorough with the pedi-paraffin, massage, scrub, paint, everything. Very nice and clean salon, fair prices. This will be my go-to when I'm in Chicago.

47.description: I've been here several times and it is my favorite place to get my nails done.  Very clean and the staff is very friendly.  The neck massage with a hot towel is also a bonus.  I went in once and my neck was so tight....my technician spent much longer than normal massaging it. Much appreciated!I also really like them here b/c I've picked out colors before and they will paint it on one finger and then recommend one that is very similar but always looks better with my skin tone. Love that!They do have a mani/pedi deal Mon - Wed for $35.  Great price but they do rush more than if you go Thurs - Sun and pay full price.

8.description: I had to waste some time while my boyfriend was getting his hair cut at the barber so I decided to get my nails done.... And I'm so glad I have never had better service or a better experience at any nail shop ever! I highly recommend this place you wont be disappointed and they gave me a discount for being a first time customer and I didn't even have to ask for it!

31.description: I am so disappointed. I went for the mani/pedi special for $35 on a Monday. She said she'd do the manicure first, but she never painted my nails. Then, she moved me over to the pedicure spot where she did a full pedicure. Several times I asked if she was going to paint my fingers. She continued to nod. I kept waiting for my nails to be painted! Eventually she said, "special price." Evidently, special price doesn't include fingernail polish! Maybe I'd be ok with that if my toenails weren't cut too short and there wasn't polish on my skin. I'm so upset. A complete waste of money.

34.description: Great service!  Just moved to the area and went here for a mani/pedi - only $35 Monday-Wednesday!  Very friendly staff, organized and wide arrangement of polishes by Esse and OPI, clean building....couldn't be more happy!

16.description: I am a little surprised by all of the good reviews. The workers seemed rushed and that adds to me feeling rushed so something that is supposed to be relaxing is not. They do not like to do no chip. Also, if you have or want acrylics this is not the place for you. They have no idea how to do acrylics. The female owner is very controlling and spends most of her time telling the workers what to do. I think a timer was even set. There are a lot of places to select from so I would have expected much better service.

13.description: My go-to place for my pedicures. I think they do a great job and are very friendly. There is an attention to detail and they don't rush through the pedi, so it gives me time to relax. I can't comment on the mani as I am a nail biter. They have organic options as well here.

11.description: I would give it 5 because the place and service was outstanding for just walking in, the reason for four is because the person who did my pedicure was really rough while doing it. She over cut my nails and actually cut one so short it broke skin...my manicure was amazing I never been to a place that not only gives you a hand massage but also a back massage as well....I will come back hoping that my pedicure next time isn't too torturous.

39.description: I've been to this nail salon twice and it's a great place. They are very attentive. They spend more time and do not rush. It's clean and organized. The staff are very pleasant. And I also noticed they don't shout across the room in another language like at some other nail salons. I brought my friend there for her birthday and they gave her a little gift. I also went a couple days before Christmas and was given a little gift bag. Just nice little unexpected touches that make this salon stand apart from the rest.

37.description: For awhile, Twinkle Toes was my go to nail salon.  It was nearby, clean, and their work was precise.  The past couple of times I've visited, it had been close to an hour before closing time which I considered plenty of time to work on twenty digits.  But on two of those occasions I was made to have my mani/pedi done at once.  Now I'm all about efficiency but I consider part of my pampering the intimate time I get to spend with US Weekly and People.  How else will I know what's going on with Beibs and/or all 53 of the Jolie/Pitt family.  So when my fingers and toes are both being occupied this leaves me with little to do but stare endlessly at nail equipment and bubbling water.  Not to mention it feels like I'm in the "ugly duckling make over" scene of a romcom.  It was because of those visits that I had neglected to review their salon.  I wanted to give them another chance to prove that my experience was important to them - or at least more important than ensuring they got out at 8pm on the button (which I believe they would have anyway).So when my sister and mom were in town recently for a baby shower, we decided to take a girl's trip over to Twinkle Toes.  I have to admit....we stopped into Divine Nails first but they were booked up so as a second option we headed down the block to TT.  They got us in right away and we were able to all get our nails done at once.  That I appreciated, especially with the short notice/no appointment.  Unfortunately, the precision of the manicures was less than satisfactory for two out of three.  My nail technician kept knicking my nails accidentally and would have to remove the polish and start over.  This left a few nails drying at different times and also resulted in my finishing ten minutes later than my mom and sister (read: less drying time).  It didn't help that we were on a schedule.  I also had paint that needed cleaned up around my nails that was missed.  Two hours later at the shower, a large piece of my nail polish chipped off of my index finger.My sister's manicure came out better, though her nails were filed crooked (according to her, because the gal seemed to be in a rush).  While having her cuticles cleaned up she was injured to the point of bleeding.  Nobody wants that.  My mom had the best experience and her nails looked the best but with my sister and I having less than satisfactory experiences, I do not believe I will return even with the assurance that I could have my nails done by that specific nail tech that got it right with madre.  In fairness though, I would probably give these guys 2.5 if I could.  The salon is clean, and they are super friendly.  I just think they need to slow down.  There is a fine line between doing thing efficiently and making your customers feel rushed.

0.description: I recently had the pleasure of going to Twinkle Toes right before a special occasion and was incredibly wowed and impressed by the service I received there. I can say, hands down, that this was the best manicure/pedicure experience I've ever received! I genuinely felt like I was royalty while I was there- they treat you like a princess!You could tell the employees here take great care of their customers. When I got my pedicure, I received a hot stone massage with it as well where they used a great lotion and scrub on my legs/feet to exfoliate all the dead skin away. The hot stone massage felt great since they really concentrated on the areas where I was feeling pain. On top of all that, I also had someone give me an arm massage while I was in the pedicure chair-- never had that done before anywhere else!! So pampered!!Adding on to the excellent pedicure, my manicure was equally as fabulous. I was offered hot tea by the owner and you can really tell they want you to feel absolutely at home while in their care. There was excellent detail to my nails and cuticles (which is a huge plus in my book as many nail salons barely focus on cuticle or just do a horrendous fast job of cutting cuticles) and also lots of friendly conversation that was had during the manicure. I had trouble initially picking out a color and the owner was very encouraging and helpful in picking out colors-- also urging me to try their newer holiday nail polish. While I waited for my nail polish to dry, I got to try their new massage chair out and i was in HEAVEN! An employee worked wonders on my back. I am telling you guys - Twinkle Toes will make you feel like royalty. Definitely will be coming back and telling all my friends about this place. Thank you for the excellent service Luke and Martha!!!!

38.description: What's not to love about warm cloths wrapped around your hands and a neck/back massage while your nails dry? The staff is also super friendly and very attentive. I had a great conversation with the person who did my nails and the girl who gave me a massage while my nails dried. I really appreciated the warm and friendly service. Can't wait to go back for their Monday - Wednesday mani and pedi special for $35!

51.description: Grreat, long-lasting manis & pedis.  $35 mani/pedi M-W.Super-clean, quite, calm atmosphere.  Great massage chairs, huge selection of OPI & Essie colors.  WONDERFUL massage with hot towel while your nails are drying.  I drive out of may way to go here.

27.description: Great nail salon in Roscoe Village:- best massage chairs I've used (generally not a fan)- excellent color selection- never had to wait- free parking on Belmont during non-rush hour times- quality dryers and magazines- friendly, knowledgeable staff-  punch card club (love a deal!)-  no TVs with annoying music playing-  cute atmosphere-- super clean and relaxing -  standard M-W specialI am a Ballet Slippers Essie on the hands girl all the way, and have been for year.  The nail technician even (gently) suggested a better color for my skin tone.  Love that kind of service and professionalism.  Wish the massages were a bit longer, but I am greedy that way.

32.description: Excellent work - my pedicure lasts and lasts!  I really like the staff and the room and chairs are very comfortable.  Have been twice and would go again.

54.description: This salon is a step above the rest.. ALL THE WAY! It is by far THE BEST nail place in town...There is no skimping on details or cost.. they have REAL soap (not the watered-down shit), they don't have TVs, so it's a nice tranquil atmosphere, and all their pedi-machines and potions ROCK... this salon recognizes great taste... The only complaint i have is that they don't serve wine, but then again... ok.. i get it... :/$40 - which is a typical price, but the service is AWESOME.they give you a hand, arm, leg, foot and NECK massage while you're getting a mani/pedi.. i've been here a dozen times and they take their time with you.. they don't make you feel like you're an inconvenience..Sunny took the time to scrub the shit out of my feet to the point where i think i started to see BONE.. that's fine :) at other places they half-ass the exfoliation process... NOT HERE. love it! :)Everything in this place is top/notch.. no tackiness.. no shit-talking about you amongst the employees while you're sitting there.. in fact, they don't talk at ALL unless they're talking to their own client. (Sorry, but most places I go to I KNOW they're talking about me so whatever..)100% personal and professional..Who's ready for a mani/pedi?!!?!?!? LET'S GO!

48.description: This is the only nail salon that I'll go to.  It's super quiet and clean.  I've always felt like I got a lot for my  money and I've never felt rushed.  One time, I chose a really light color for my pedicure and I ended up not liking the color.  I went back the next day to have it changed and they only charged me half price for the color change.  I figured it was my fault for picking the color so I paid them the full amount anyway, plus tip.  But isn't that nice?  It's that kind of customer service that keeps small businesses going!

44.description: During my manicure, the nail tech nipped my cuticle with her clippers, and it started to bleed. She then applied something to my bloody cuticle with a dropper, and actually touched the dropper against my skin and blood. She then put the dropper back in the bottle without sanitizing it. The massage during the manicure was unexpected, awkward and painful. Please don't pound on me or give me hepatitis, I just want to get my nails done!

24.description: I stopped in for a Saturday afternoon mani pedi. $40, very pleased with the overall experience. I'll be a repeat customer when I need nail services in the area. All the other satisfactory reviews pretty much say it all!

7.description: They really go above and beyond to make your visit as relaxing as possible. I didn't feel rushed, I got a complimentary  massage,  the staff is super nice, and they don't have Maury blaring on the TV. Did I mention wine? Loved my experience and I'll definitely be coming back.

49.description: Every visit I have had to Twinkle Toes has been outstanding.  They are always welcoming and professional.  They keep the salon clean.  I never feel rushed.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  Another plus is that there is usually parking right in front during the week!

40.description: I have been to soooo many Mani Pedi places and what I find is for the most part they get the job done.  Started a new job in the neighborhood and saw a sign that said Mani Pedi $35 Mon-Wed also saw a few other spots in the same neighborhood with the same sign give or take on the price.  I asked a friend's opinion and she said she loved Twinkle Toes.  I gave it a try and fell in love too! Very clean, comfy chairs, exfoliating foot scrub used, hot towels used, after they moisturize your feet they wrap your heels to lock in the moisture.  While your getting your mani your toes are drying under individual UV fans.  Once your mani is done they give you a quick but great back rub.  Oh and best part is they take their time!!!!!  They turned people away because all the chairs were full...most places just work faster to get you out and the next client in.

53.description: I went for a mani/pedi yesterday and have to say this place is pretty nice. They give you a nice foot and hand massage and also rub your back. They have great attention to detail, and my nails look perfect. The only reason I can't give them 4 stars is because i think $40 is a tad steep. They do $35 certain days of the week, so maybe I'll go back during the special times from now on.

30.description: This place is as good as it gets in the city. I've tried out many a nail places and i will drive to get to this place because of;  - awesome massage chairs  -I've never needed an apt  - very nice, professional staff  - drying your nails on a dining room table :) Fancy.  - extremely reasonable price for the service  -THE BEST color choices all in the proper OCD's rainbow order.   -Manicures are short lived on my nails and these always stays the longest.Extra note: I've gone their before around mine or a friends Birthday and they give us a small gift. So sweet. Make the effort to try this place out. It's worth it.

46.description: Gotta give it up to my Lasses of Yelp for suggesting this place!Went here yesterday with my fellow nail addict for some pampering. Highlights:Awesome ChairsSuper hot waterExtra scrub in a special cup, amazingHeel Wrap!!!!My tech's name was Becky and she was perfect! Plus it's $35, M-W.I think my nail chair whoring days are over!

1.description: I am always impressed with my experience here. It is seriously my favorite place because they go above and beyond in their care for you. I had a mani/pedi done today and felt amazingly pampered. If you go mon, tues, or wed, they have a $35 special for mani/pedi. For the quality of care and service here, I think it's impossible to beat a price like that. As soon as you pick your colors and sink into a massage chair, they start by offering you complimentary coffee, tea, wine, etc to relax with. I picked green tea and they brought out quality japanese matcha in a fancy ceramic cup. None of that generic green tea in a lipton bag. Goes to show that they put quality even into the small details! As I am getting my pedicure and enjoying the massage chair, someone also comes by to also give me a hand/arm massage. I felt so pampered. I need to comment on how awesome the pedicures are. My heels tend to be awfully calloused, especially during the winter. They treated my heels with a sequence of organic solutions. I've come back multiple times and have seen that they use top quality products. It's always a good sign when the owners are proud of the products they use and are so knowledgable about them. By the time they were through with my feet, my heels were baby skin soft. They finished off with a hot-stone leg/foot massage... and they used a rich organic lotion (thick as peanut butter) that left my feet amazingly smooth.  My manicure was also great. I love their selection of nail polish. I picked up an OPI but they directed me to try a new line of polish that chips less and lasts longer. So friendly and helpful with their suggestions. The massages didn't stop even as I was getting my manicure. Someone came over and gave me the most wonderful neck/shoulder massage while I was getting my manicure. Every time I go back, they remember me and I can tell they really care. They ask about my heels and deliver personalized care. Great place to go with friends too. I brought my friend and we were gawking for weeks at how much we loved our nails :)

55.description: I went for the first time on Friday and thought it was a fantastic spot!  $40 for mani-pedi on a Friday afternoon I thought was a pretty good deal.  The place is very clean, their staff is uber-friendly, their products seem top be of pretty good quality, and a few days later, my nails are still looking great!

9.description: Way to redeemed themselves!!!I work in the area, so this place is very convenient as it is walking distance from my office. I never had an issue until this past Saturday, I walked in, was greeted and taken care immediately. However; I feel the nail technician was hurrying through the mani. She even filed my nails crooked which were fix after I told her. I was not happy with how my nails turned out, but too embarrass to keep pointing out the mistakes. We all have those bad days, so I figure I give the girl a break. Then, I noticed that my manicure had chipped by the next day. I was very disappointed, I was seriously contemplating not using them ever again. My coworkers convinced me to contact them which I did I spoke to Luke who was very apologetic and offered to redo my mani. I went back, he took the time and my nails look great. He didn't charge me a penny!!

26.description: I tried Twinkle Toes recently for a pedicure only and was very happy with the experience. I found close parking easily. I paid up front and left a generous tip before receiving my service, which made me a little nervous. I'm so glad I did though! I don't know if it was because I left a good tip, I'm pregnant (and they took pity) or they just are normally that good but the massage was very luxurious! The chair was nice as others mentioned, but the people giving the leg and arm massages were very thorough; I would definitely say the best massage I've received for a pedicure. I will certainly be back.

25.description: I work down the street from here and cheated on my regular place (2 x 10) to grab a quick mani on my lunch break before a date that night.  I have never in my life been so rushed through a manicure in my life.  The lady was rude, way too quick and wasn't pleased when I asked for an extra coat of the white polish.  The worst part is that they had NO ONE else in there.  Talk about trying to not get repeat customers.  I refused to pay until after she finished bc I wanted the tip to reflect my dissatisfaction.

12.description: Great service! They do a very thorough job and are considerate of nail health. Free street parking! I found parking pretty quickly on a residential road a few paces east of the shop. There is free parking on Belmont (north side) also!Came in for a walk-in. Got immediate service since I went in at around 11 on a weekday. (I would call ahead to be safe)Especially since it's winter time, my hands and cuticles get very dry. My cuticles often flake off. I came in for a simple mani-pedi but I got the absolute complete treatment. I was indecisive on a color and Bora helped me choose dark taupe OPI holiday seasonal. I loved how all their colors all came from OPI, China Glaze, and Essie. The massage chairs are divine. On top of that, I was given a firm leg massage while my feet were in the foot bath. I melted. Sunny started me on a paraffin wax for my dry and destroyed cuticles - the best part is that it's free until 1pm! We talked about what the cause of my excessive peeling cuticles and we concluded that it could be coming from the dry weather and the many dishes I have to wash (I work in a food lab that requires a lot of dish washing). She gave me many tips on resolving the problem at home such as warning me not to pick at them or use harsh tools on them and how to properly lotion them at night. She went on investing much more time caring for my cuticles by adding cuticle oil on them and repeatedly removing them and shaping them gently. She usually goes through the process once or twice for most, but she did it 5 or 6 times for me! My nails came out beautifully. I give my nails minimal attention on a normal basis. This was definitely one of the most beneficial mani-pedi I have ever received. It's been 2 weeks since I got my nails done and the paint still has not chipped. I've been taking care of my cuticles as they have directed and they're keeping up much better than prior. It only cost me $35. I'll definitely be coming back again.

59.description: Affordable, quick, quality, clean.  I got my pre-wedding  mani/pedi there and it held up for weeks.  Don't have much else to say, but it's a good place to go get your nails done when need be.

21.description: I'm in love with this place. Came here on a Saturday night for a manicure and pedicure. Customer service is impeccable, color selection is amazing, and it is so clean inside! They serve wine and other beverages as well, and have really great massage chairs. I'm dumping my current nail salon and coming here!

17.description: Great pedicure, wonderful staff and they even gave me a coupon at the end!  Great for pedicures in a flash with no wait.  Go here!

10.description: I recently moved to the area and have been searching for a go-to nail salon! This place is amazing. The staff is super friendly and they do a great job! Absolutely blown away by their customer service... Staff goes out of their way to get to know you. I will be back!

5.description: I came here for the first time on NYE. From the moment I got there, one of the employees took my jacket and hung it up. As I sat down to get my no-chip, I was surprised by a mini shoulder massage and a bottle of lotion as I paid. Overall, the experience was great and the lady did a great job. I was so pleased with my experience and nails, I had my sister come in the same day. I got a back massage as I waited for her to get her nails done. We both decided to get a pedicure and got a little "menu" with refreshments such as wine, tea, or soda. All in all, a great little place with excellent service.

3.description: If I could give Twinkle Toes ten stars I would. This spot is an absolute gem in the sea of Chicago nail salons. They definitely go the extra mile. It is always a very clean and inviting atmosphere. The pedicure chairs are so comfortable and the technicians massage your legs and feet with hot stones and then bring out hot towels and wrap your legs in ultimate heaven. The manicure includes a neck, back and arm massage which is such a wonderful touch. This is just the basic mani-pedi too! The people who work here are all so friendly and kind. I highly recommend making an appointment in advance as because of all of these awesome touches, it can get busy. With an appointment you won't have to wait. Twinkle Toes is a little paradise in our big city!

35.description: Been here three or four times before. But today, my pediure was exactly twenty minutes - totally rushed and careless. Another girl sat next to me at same time and wasnt even done getting buffed by the time my polish was done. My one toenail is cut too short and crooked. This place is good if they're not in a rush. If they are, yikes. Not coming back.

19.description: I'm in love with this place. Came here on a Saturday night for a manicure and pedicure. Customer service is impeccable, color selection is amazing, and it is so clean inside! They serve wine and other beverages as well, and have really great massage chairs. I'm dumping my current nail salon and coming here!

28.description: I'm giving them two stars and not one because the lady that started off my pedicure gave me a great massage! But sadly I can't say the same for my no chip manicure (chipped the second day). The manicurist kept going back and forth between another client and me. Total disappointment!

45.description: Pros: no annoying chit chat-they are pretty quick-they get you in when you want-easy parking-great selection of colors, OPI etc as other reviewers have stated-massaging chairs-no razor thingies that also gross me out big-time-scrub scrub scrub your heels like crazy-$35 for mani/pedi during the week-you get a neck/back massage-very nice employeesCons: not the most posh place in the world but that's no biggie.Great, quick mani/pedi joint!

33.description: Just wanted to let everyone know that I still love this place and have gone back often. I've gone in numerous times for their M-W $35 deal for a manicure and pedicure - it's hard to beat!

43.description: I was in need of a manicure pronto and wanted to check out twinkle toes. Based off of the reviews, I was drawn in. Unfortunately, I will not recommend twinkle toes if you are looking for a long-lasting no chip manicure. When I left the salon, my nails were EXTREMELY sticky which I thought would go away after washing them but it didn't. My nails were pulling fibers off of everything! After putting up with sticky nails for a day or so, I called them. They were able to accommodate me to try and fix them but when I left...same thing. 4 days later, my nails were peeling off. Totally disappointed. Great & friendly staff. Not so great no-chip manis.

2.description: I have tried a great many different nail salons all over the city. However, I always end up coming back here. Manicures are great, I always get regular ones and they last me an entire week. Their nail polish selection is big and always being updated with the latest OPI & Essie collection. As far as pedicures go, they are the best in the city for your money if you ask me. I always nearly fall asleep getting them. Their regular mani/pedi that's $35 Monday-Wednesday is better than any of the others in the area, I've tried the other and they pay the most attention to detail here versus other salons that can seem to be in a rush to get done with you. If you're in the areas and having a hard time picking, go here! You won't regret it!

18.description: The best nail salon.Here is friendly clean,helpful owners customer service....My nails always look perfect.They have a great selection of regular polish and no chip polish

41.description: Nice massage and great price but my toes do look better than my hands so I can't give it a perfect rating. The young girl working there was super nice and I don't care for chit chat so I tipped extra cause I didn't feel forces to make conversation. I would recommended this place and will return next trip to Chicago. Skip French manicure and just do polish and you will be happiest!

52.description: This place is AMAZING! I have been getting my nails done all over this city for 10 years. I even was "that girl" with nail art, swirls and 2 inch claws popping out of my hands. Gross I know. Now that I realized how tacky I looked I really appreciate a good manicure.Here is the difference of what 5 extra dollars will get you Mon-Wed at Twinkle Toes (and to me, I would pay 40 bucks for these services)1.  REALLY comfortable nice chairs with large armpads to rest on2.  Quiet. Like pin drop quiet. No side chatter, no tv, just radio with good music3.  They wrap your heels in saran wrap after they exfoliate the hell out of your entire leg and lotion you up.4.  No razor's that I've seen. Those things are SO DISGUSTING I hate even being next to someone getting the dead skin ripped off their feet. Gross gross blech blech.5.  A little hand bench for your wrist to rest on while they give you your manicure6.  Hot towels, one on each hand (folded and left on-not just to wipe down lotion for 1.3 seconds7.  Hot towel on my freaking shoulders and neck, plus a rub down/massage of that area and percussive massage of entire back while hot towels are on your hands.8.  The OPI colors are all color coordinated by season, counter is clean and they have full bottles of nearly every color imaginable even if it's out of season 9.  Really nice hand/feet dryers with fan, heat and uv light.  No need to wait a year to dry up because you have a shitty fan lightly blowing dusty acrylic air on you.10. The bathroom is clean and smells delightful. So many nail salons have gross bathroomsI am addicted to this place. Remember the parking rules on Belmont so you don't get a ticket. They take credit cards and have a punch card too! Great place, best in the city.

50.description: This is a really great place. I have gone to a lot of different salons and this is by far the best. Especially for the cost. The manicure and pedicure last awhile and they take their time. They are very clean and considerate. They always have the new OPI and Essie colors. They make sure the polish doesn't smear when you are leaving. I would totally recommend going here.

4.description: If you want to sit in a freezing cold room with your feet in luke warm water then this place is for you. And, to top it off, they are very rough on your feet. And a side note, they took off the end of my eye brow when waxing them.

6.description: This is the second time that I go to this place and I loved it so far. The service is great and the personal is so nice.

22.description: Great service! They do a very thorough job and are considerate of nail health. Free street parking! I found parking pretty quickly on a residential road a few paces east of the shop. There is free parking on Belmont (north side) also!Came in for a walk-in. Got immediate service since I went in at around 11 on a weekday. (I would call ahead to be safe)Especially since it's winter time, my hands and cuticles get very dry. My cuticles often flake off. I came in for a simple mani-pedi but I got the absolute complete treatment. I was indecisive on a color and Bora helped me choose dark taupe OPI holiday seasonal. I loved how all their colors all came from OPI, China Glaze, and Essie. The massage chairs are divine. On top of that, I was given a firm leg massage while my feet were in the foot bath. I melted. Sunny started me on a paraffin wax for my dry and destroyed cuticles - the best part is that it's free until 1pm! We talked about what the cause of my excessive peeling cuticles and we concluded that it could be coming from the dry weather and the many dishes I have to wash (I work in a food lab that requires a lot of dish washing). She gave me many tips on resolving the problem at home such as warning me not to pick at them or use harsh tools on them and how to properly lotion them at night. She went on investing much more time caring for my cuticles by adding cuticle oil on them and repeatedly removing them and shaping them gently. She usually goes through the process once or twice for most, but she did it 5 or 6 times for me! My nails came out beautifully. I give my nails minimal attention on a normal basis. This was definitely one of the most beneficial mani-pedi I have ever received. It's been 2 weeks since I got my nails done and the paint still has not chipped. I've been taking care of my cuticles as they have directed and they're keeping up much better than prior. It only cost me $35. I'll definitely be coming back again.

15.description: I highly recommend this place. Nice staff. Good prices. The hot stones are amazing.  The owners are very nice and professional. Stop by and see them.

57.description: I'm weird about mani/pedis. I'm new to them, really, and only get them for special occasions.That said, I really like this place! They made me like pedicures! I was afraid of them forever, but it's pretty nice! They use this exfoliating scrub on your feet and calves and the calf massage is nice. Who would've thought it-- a calf massage, right?Anyway, I'm a fan, and the french mani they did for my wedding didn't get weird cracks in it. I mean it cracked after awhile as they all do, but not in some weird way.I'll be back if I need another french mani or a pedi, even though it's not in my current neighborhood (it's my old hood. *sniff* miss you, roscoe) and there are a gozillion nail salons near me. Hey what can I say? I'm loyal to what I like.

20.description: Love this place!! Such great service, very friendly, very helpful. Never had a bad experience here :) They are currently celebrating their 10th Anniversary so a regular Mani-Pedi Is $32 as opposed to $40 any day of the week (20% discount) and 10% off any other service with a coupon you can ask for. Awesome place, the only one I go to!

36.description: I've been dropped into a sea of nail shops...!I had no idea Roscoe Village and surrounding was home to so many nail places, and I couldn't be happier. Let the games begin! After a bummer of a 'cure at Elytis (Clybourn), a ONE HOUR job at Nail Tyme (Clybourn)...well, I was looking for someone to do a bang up job in a jiffy to make my fingers look pretty. This is exactly what I got at Twinkle Toes. Of note: *$35 manicure/pedicure special Monday-Wednesday *EXCELLENT color selection. All the new Essie and OPI. Candystore!*My nails are now a peachy/pink (essie), willing spring to happen. *credit cards happily accepted. *watch out for rush hour parking, north side of Belmont 4pm-6pm weekdays. I'll certainly add this to my rotation, a solid choice of the many on Belmont!

14.description: Love this place! They do a fantastic job! Super friendly, great no chip manis and great pedis. They have a punch card and offer discounts Mon-Wed. Super clean too!!

3.description: Everything is a bit more expensive than it needs to be.  And the counter service can be slow.  They card everyone for everything.  And they have a lot of annoying Lotto customers.Almost every sandwich Ive had has been decent.  And they have a lot of "stuff."  By stuff, I mean promotional items that they are trying to sell.  Been in the store, but never the bar.  It is a pretty dumpy looking bar full of old drunks and bad intentions.Very decent liquor selection and a good amount of beers.  A lot of 40's/22's in case you are a wino on yelp.  Now, if you'll excuse me, I am gonna daydream about winos on yelp.

1.description: I live a few houses down from this place and I visit just about every night. I'm not a big drinker but they have a nice size selection of beverages. The reason why I'm giving this place a 5 star rating is for the customer  service.  They are ALWAYS so kind and down to earth.

2.description: Does anyone know why this place has been closed for weeks now? I'm getting nervous. Especially for the deli meat. Their attached bar is still as packed as ever with the local whiskey tango set; I'm sure they know the story on the store but I'm too afraid to step foot inside since I haven't had a tetanus shot in some time. I've thrice set off to Miska's on foot to grab some beer, wine and a bacon club for the road only to find them closed during business hours with no type of signage indicating why or when they'll reopen. I hate walking home empty handed. How do you run a business this way? Thumbs Down.
