5.description: I used to live across the street from this place, which was pretty nice.  The employees are very friendly, maybe because I was a regular.  My favorite place about this was their wide selection of international beer & liquor.  Nothing better than coming home & having easy access to a nice bottle of Le fin du monde & it was especially convenient when I needed some last minute ice & coolers for the bbq I had.  It's polish owned & they have a deli, but I never tried that....& also a bar, unfortunately I never went there either but it seems to have neighborhood regulars.

6.description: Yeah, so the rumor on the street is they took out the dart board. Nice knowing you, Miska's.

0.description: We had a chance to hangout with friends from Chicago at the bar behind the store. We had the chance to meet the owner and it was good experience after all. Reasonable prices and delish frosty beverages. Relaxed and inviting atmosphere. Recommended!

4.description: After reading a great review on this place I decided last nite was the nite to try it out. And I can't help but to agree with my fellow yelper. This place was pretty cool. Its a grocery/convenient store with a deli and a bar in the back. Never seen a setup quite like this one, but I wish I lived closer to it because its definitely a one-stop shop! I ordered the turkey bacon club for my boyfriend because I read that they made it really big and he always has a huge appetite. It was monstrous. So big in fact, that he was only able to eat half! I never thought I'd see the day when MY boyfriend couldnt finish a sandwich. I ordered the corned beef melt which was of average size but still really tasty. I really just wish that it had sauerkraut on it.  .They had a really great selection of wines and other alcoholic beverages which is always a plus. And there were tons of snacks and other grocery items. Other yelpers said that the staff was less than pleasant when they visited, but my experience was the opposite. Everyone said hello and thank you, and the girl that made my sandwich even smiled when I told a corny joke. The only thing I didnt like was that my corned beef melt wasnt bigger and that the prices were a little higher than i expected. My fellow yelpers said I'd pay between 4 and 5 bucks for a sandwich and I paid more like close to 6 and 7. All in all, I say this place is worth checking out!

58.description: Thai linda, to me, is exactly what roscoe village is about. The second I walked in, it just felt comfortable and had a neighboorhood vibe too it. I had called ahead for take out, so I can't say anything about what its like to sit there. I ordered up a bunch of stuff to have over a couple of days. I got the spicy duck, pad thai, and lemongrass chicken along with a couple of appetizers. They even threw in some potstickers automatically because I had ordered over $20 worth of food. I'm used to outright asking when it comes to the deals, and I didn't know about it. The appetizers were very good. I had gotten some thai dumplings and theses hit the spot. They were nice and hot when I got them. The chicken satay was okay, it was just normal chicken satay, so while that was fine, I wanted a bit more. The potstickers they threw in were very good and made up for the chicken satay. They weren't over fried which can happen all too often.As far as the entrees go, they were really good. The pad thai was pretty standard. It wasn't great, but it was far from being bad either. For me, the key to pad thai is always the noodles, and these noodles were good, but they really paled in comparison to the other two dishes. The spicy duck, however, was awesome. It had heat to it, but it wasn't too much for me at all (granted I have no problem with things being very spicy). The duck itself was really good and done very well. The lemongrass chicken was also very good and was a nice contrast to the spicy duck.I ordered up some of the more expensive items on the menu, but all of that lasted me a few days. There's a lot left on the menu and i'm in the area a good amount, so stopping in again is bound to happen

56.description: I'm debating between 3 and 4 stars on this one. I'll go ahead and go with 4 because the price is right and its BYOB. The overall Yelp 3.5 rating has this one pegged perfectly.        If you like the homey mom and pop feel this is defiantly your place.  Our server (who I suspect is the owner) was very friendly and attentive. Lunch for two was about $20 (with Tip) and its BYOB on top of that. My Chicken Pad Tai was excellent. However, my wife's dish  (I can't recall the name) was a little over done and lacked flavor. I don't know what type of sauce they put on the egg rolls, but it was on of the better egg rolls I have ever eaten.         Overall, this is a great option for an affordable Thai lunch in the Roscoe Village area.

29.description: I was a bit wary to try Thai Linda Café after so many bad reviews and my parents saying they did not like their food, but I liked it here!Thai Linda Café is actually quite good, but I need to do some more empirical testing to completely rave about them . I came here with the sig o at the time for Wednesday night dinner at 7 pm and we received PROMPT service. As soon as we sat down, our waitress brought us waters and menus, within five minutes came back to take our order, and within a reasonable amount of time the chef brought out our appetizer, and our entrée was ready as soon as we finished our appetizer. All of this was done while Thai Linda's staff handled several carry out orders.We ordered the crab rangoon and chicken pad woonsen. We received six crab rangoons that were nice little pouches of fried wontons with savory cream cheese. Thai Linda's crab rangoons are distinctive in that they put chives in them. The crab rangoons had thin sweet and sour sauce for dipping, and the sauce had more of a light and sweet flavor. The chicken pad woonsen was pan-fried bean thread noodles with egg, white onions, tomatoes, green onions, peapods, carrots and corn in a light brown sauce. We really liked this dish! The bean noodles were flavorful and we liked that the dish came with a lot of vegetables, including a side garnish of thinly sliced carrots and a red root. The portion was reasonable for the price of $8 without tax.Thai Linda's ambiance is conducive for a date. The lighting was dim, the décor was tasteful with Thai art, bamboo placemats, and rattan chairs. They also have an outdoor patio.I plan to be back to try other offerings I have not seen at other restaurants, such as their lime chicken. I would also like to try their bubble tea and fruit freezes.

42.description: We also took advantage of the $20 groupon for $10.  Nice location on the cusp of Lincoln Park. We parked on the street and walked about 2 blocks to the restaurant where we were greeted by a very friendly young man.We ordered the full appetizer plate and it was very good, we enjoyed everything and I particularly like the shumai. We also had the beef pad see ewe and green curry with beef. Now - everything was wonderful and tasty except for the portions which is half the size of what you would normally get elsewhere. So, if you are looking to lose weight or if you weigh 90 lbs, the serving size would be fine for you. The taste is 5 stars. If budget is not an issue, order two of everything and you'll be satisfied.

23.description: Another disappointing, over priced and low quality Roscoe Village restaurant.  Would someone please come and open a good restaurant in the neighborhood?  My girlfriend and I eat Thai food at least once a week, as we are big fans.  We tried this place for the first time about a month ago, and we were very disappointed.  The good is pretty bland, the portions are small and the quality of the ingredients are poor.  We had there pad Thai, chicken satay,  their spicy basil chicken.  I really can't tell you much more, except that none of the dishes would make me go back.  We did notice, it was a Friday night, and their was only one other table in tjebwhle place, enough said...

47.description: Went here for dinner last night and utilized a Groupon Now. Note: I've noticed this place frequently has Groupon Now deals.I ordered the lemon grass chicken; my bf ordered the peapods with beef. His looked good, mine was good. Chicken was perhaps a little dry.Tip: Awesome beer to enjoy with your food at this byob is called Siamese Twin from Uncommon Brewers (it is brewed with thai spices).We also got the vegetable pot stickers which were tasty; I enjoyed the black bean sauce.Staff was very friendly and the place was very chill, not at all crowded. Cute place for a date.

8.description: Their online ordering system is an absolute joke.  Order placed at 6:10 with their stated "ASAP" availability.  I show up 25 min later, they never started my order and I stand here waiting.  Skip this place if you are one of those rare creatures who realize their time is the most valuable asset.

31.description: I decided to give this place a try since it had mix reviews. Oh boy was it bad! I decided to order there and do take out. The food was not good at all. I never had bad Thai food, and never thought it could be made bad. We ordered crab Rangoon which tasted funny, and my pad Thai had no flavor. Even the thin noodles was bad.  My husband had fried rice which he said was okay. This place is nothing special just save money and go somewhere else.

34.description: There's some really mixed reviews for good old Linda here.  I didn't think she fell into an extreme category - I thought it was a perfectly good, casual spot to grab dinner.  On a Friday night me and the man were hungry.  I was craving Thai, so we walked down to pay a visit to Linda.  There were several other full tables, and a lot of take-out orders on the front counter waiting to be picked up.  We were seated, immediately served water and we place our orders for some apps - crab rangoon (my usual) and a beef-wrapped asparagus.  The apps came out pretty quick - and they were good; not great.  Entrees - we split the chx pad se eew and the lard nar.  The lard nar was served in a deep bowl and was the most soupy I've ever seen it.  I prefer that dish more on the dry side because I don't enjoy eating spoonfuls of gravy - but it did taste good...  The pad se eew was our preferred dish - that had much better texture and flavor.  By the time we got our bill, we were the only table in the restaurant.  Still, the take-outs and deliveries were steady.  Bonus: they served a delightful little fortune cookie roll - I've never seen that kind, but it was way tastier than a regular fortune cookie. Was this the best Thai ever?  No.  But it certainly wasn't terrible (or even bad).  We had a nice dinner, the space was calm and quiet - I would come back again for another low-key meal anytime.

16.description: Myself and one other went Sunday afternoon on a whim and we were not disappointed.  The menu was much larger than I had anticipated which was a pleasant surprise.We tried their chicken satay as an app, and a thing of Pad Thai and a bowl of chicken massaman curry for the mains.  Although the satay was not chunky, it was still good.  The dishes could have been a bit more spicy, but our noses still ran a bit and the overall taste did not suffer.One thing that is worth noting was their Thai Tea which was delicious.

13.description: I saw the review for the Beef Almond & called to order it, but she acted as if she had no idea what I was talking about. To be fair, the menus in Yelp aren't always consistent with the restaurants'.So I ordered my stand-by, Lime Chicken - which is outstanding at Thai Linda!Never had a problem with their meals & delivery has always been timely.Asparagus Rolls are very tasty, too!!

11.description: I stopped by Thai Linda Cafe last night with my roommate. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone craving Thai. This is a great place to order take-out from on a Friday night. It was definitely easy to get a last minute reservation. From our experience it was clearly not the happening place to be on a Friday night in Roscoe. It was us and one other couple in the restaurant that night. Service was just fine, I think there was only really one person working that night. I should also note that this place is BYOB. They'll give you a bottle opener and some glasses, but that's really as far as their BYOB service goes. We ordered the Aloha Fried Rice, Kung Pao, Crab Rangoon and Pad Thai. -The Pad Thai wasn't very different from any other Pad Thai. -Aloha Fried Rice was good, it's your typical pineapple fried rice with raisins.-I usually substitute meat for tofu, I think the Kung Pao could have used a little more vegetables a little less tofu.-Crab Rangoons were good, not your typical chinese food restaurant ones. These almost tasted homemade. 10% discount if you pay with cash!

39.description: I think I have figured out what is wrong with this place after having eaten here 3 times.  They have good recipes, but do not know how to cook properly.  The first time I ordered, our beef was overcooked, almost burnt.The second time, the noodles were mushy and again the meat was burnt.  But the flavors were still good and so I wanted to give them one last try to see if they'd worked out their kinks.The third and last time...my shrimp was almost completely raw, like see through, and they were not de-veined.  Disgusting.  There was a very young person waiting on us and I felt bad hassling him.  So I just pushed the shrimp to the side and ate my rice and veggies.  The sauce was amazing, but how can I get past raw shrimp that still has it's poop in it?!  Mortifying.  I will not be back.  The sauces for all of their dishes are very tasty so I wish they just knew how to cook food.  Very sad.

37.description: First time at Thai Linda cafe - and I must say the chicken pad Thai was delicious! Ordered for a pickup and it was ready on time and very friendly people.

0.description: Thought the food here was really good; they have an unbelievably diverse menu, so not sure how some of the other pan-Asian items are b/c everyone in our party of 4 chose thai staples (pad thai, pad see eiw but w/ crispy noodles, red curry, basil fried rice).  All great w/ no complaints, and the service was very friendly.  The place was pretty empty on a Saturday around 7pm, but there was a fest outside that was probably hurting normal foot traffic.  Also had the green tea boba, which was a little too icy but really good once melted a little.  Definitely have placed this on my top 3 chicago Thai lists (along w/ Thai Aree House and Yes, Thai).I do wish however, that they would fix the listed name on Yelp!  So many ppl call this Thai Linda, which just doesn't pull up :-/

38.description: After getting delivery over the past 3 years, I finally had the opportunity to go to the actual place. Not too big, not too small as it was a nice space. It was virtually empty when we walked in. We started out with the thai dumplings which were very good. For my entree, I got the Spicy Fried Rice with Vegetable and it was definitely spicy! Their delicious thai iced tea definitely helped keep my mouth cool. I love that I finally showed up as the staff was pretty nice and its a nice joint...will return more often as this is one of my favorite thai places in the city...Also this joint is BYOB!

51.description: I order from thai Linda on a bi-weekly basis.  Very good food and delivery usually takes 30 to 40 minutes.  Good value.

27.description: I ordered food for delivery tonight via GrubHub from Thai Linda. I specifically requested a beef appetizer (Tiger Cry) be cooked Med Rare or Medium at the most. It was beyond well done, it was burnt to a crisp and they refused to issue a refund. The chicken satay was also well done; it was very hard to eat. The restaurant requires that I bring back the steak (Tiger Cry) to prove that it was overcooked. The delivery time was prompt and friendly, but the food wasn't something I would even give to my dog! Stay away from this restaurant, it is disgusting. GrubHub helped intervene and they directly gave me a $10 coupon to spend to make up for the experience.Do NOT eat here, I am trying to save you the same frustration that I experienced.

32.description: yuk! In an area of delicious Thai food...Thai Linda does not stand up! The pad thai was lacking all flavor. I usually order that from a new thai place since its so basic and is normally good. It was very greasy and really bland. I would not order from here again. Head up the road to Thai Oscar, Opart Thai House or even Spoon.

54.description: Amazing little neighborhood gem. The food is delicious and not overpriced. The server was attentive, but not overly so. And it's a BYOB.So to summarize:Great food.Attentive staff.BYOB.P.S. The spicy duck is to die for!

48.description: Another Roscoe Village gem! Thai Linda is reasonably priced and has great good. I go here frequently and the food never disappoints. Even on busy nights it's easy to get a table and not too noisy. The wait staff is really nice and brings the food out fast. Get the outdoor seating if you can, the neighborhood is adorable.

44.description: Got sick from the food, and the waiter didn't speak ANY English.

24.description: Always in the mood for thai, I ordered delivery from Thai Linda Cafe. I sure wish I hadn't. Being only 6 blocks from the restaurant and on a Wednesday I was hoping the 30 minutes the person on the phone said it would take.. would only be 20 minutes. It took a little over an hour. Okay.. no big deal, things happen. Upon opening my chicken pad Thai noodle I was impressed by the amount of food I had.. which made me forget about the time it took to arrive. Yummy this is fairly good.. the noodles weren't too greasy and the flavor was good. So why one star? After a big bite.. I looked down and saw something black. Burnt rice chunk? No.. it was a dead fly. Upon calling and complaining about this tragedy.. I was told I could only get restaurant credit. I continued to say I wanted my money back because I refused to eat there again. After 10 minutes of back and forth I lost my temper which finally convinced the lady on the phone to reimburse me. So in conclusion.. slow delivery, dead fly and horrible customer service netted them a one star rating.

7.description: My husband and I ordered from Thai Linda on a rainy night.  Parts of my experience were very off-putting and others were positive.  We tried to order online, but there was a problem with the website.  Not sure what, but we ended up having to order over the phone- not a big deal. I went to go pick up the food.  I walk in the restaurant and no one is anywhere to be seen.  There is one girl who is doing homework in the corner- I'm guessing the owner's daughter.  But other than that, there's no one.  I waited FOREVER for someone to appear.  At one point, a man from the kitchen emerged.  He saw me and made no acknowledgement of my existence.  It didn't even look like he told anyone that I was waiting.  Finally, a woman emerged and I paid and left.  But I was probably waiting for a good 5-7 minutes. The food was good. We ordered the crab rangoon. One complaint with that is the container of sweet and sour was much too small to dip the rangoon into.  They should get bigger containers.  I ordered the veggie fried rice and it was great.  We got the Tom Kha Soup and omg it was delicious!! It was tart, but sweet. Oy- amazing!  Overall, the food was good.  But having to wait that long for someone to provide any service was very off-putting.

49.description: Oh Thai Linda.  It has been the best thai food I've had in Chicago.  But it's very hit or miss.We ordered pad thai, red curry chicken (2 star spicy), and 2 crab rangoon tonight. The red curry chicken wasn't spicy at all (they left it plain, I've had it spicy so I know the difference).  They only gave us 1 order of crab rangoon but they brought the other order out 1 1/2 hours later.  The pad thai was great as always.  I love the fat noodles.I'd normally give them 5 stars because the food is that good when it's on.  But sometimes it is off :-(  Just make sure you double check your order before accepting it.

40.description: Horrible service.  To cure a hangover, we decided to find some cheap and quick Thai food, and searched Groupon Now.  Thai Linda was chosen over the 5 others nearby that came up because the Fine Print did not specify "Dine in Only", and we preferred carry-out.   We ordered on the website which was really easy, then I went to pick it up after 25min.  The person up front, who also appeared to be the waiter was about 16 and spoke little English...this is why I ordered online.  My total was $28, and I pulled up my $20 Groupon Now and a $10 bill.  I was then told something about how the Groupon is for Dine in. "But it does not say that in the fine print," I responded.  "Sorry, you need to pay $28." "No, I bought this over 5 other places because I wanted carry out."  He then went to the back to discuss with his hire-ups, then came back and told me "Sorry, dine in for Groupons, it is $28."  I showed him the $10 bill, and said, "All I have is $10 to cover the extra not covered by the Groupon, so I cannot pay for this."  Obviously, I had credit cards with me, but I wasn't about to spend $28.  The boy ran to the back again, had a short conversation, then came back out and told me I owed to total of $28.  So I left with no food.I could understand if they made a mistake when signing up for the Groupon, since the English was very broken, but the conditions on my Groupon were clear.  I have used Groupon Nows for carry out at similar places several time before with no issues about having to "dine in".  The fact is, that no manager ever even bothered to discuss it with me, and just used a 16yr old to deny its use.  I ordered $28 worth of food, so they were still making money off me, and it seemed like there was no clear reason not to let it go, realizing their mistake in the Groupon.  I never got to have the likely overly oily food and I will never be back .

53.description: The food is quite good for the price and the service is always exceptional at Thai Linda.  Their patio over the summer was great for people watching over a yummy meal.  I usually get the chicken pad thai and would definitely recommend it - I've tried a few appetizers as well (don't recall which ones!) and was pleased.

30.description: We located from Wicker Park/East Village and had a hankering for Thai food. I'm not embarrassed to say what Penny's on Damen devotees we are. We ordered the chicken pad thai - a gloppy mess. The summer roll was totally devoid of the promised shrimp. My husband said the miso soup was fine; how can you screw that up? Overall, totally disappointing. We'll be running to the Penny's location on Sheffield.

46.description: Something has changed here, and in a good way.I saw a groupon deal for this place and bought it. $10 for $20, and the place is practically in my backyard. I decided it was worth another try.We went on a nice night, so we could sit outside on the patio. We started with the thai dumplings. You only got 6 small-ish dumplings, but they were really good.I ordered the same dish I tried out last time - chicken pad thai, and my husband had spicy mint. I wonder what was updated, but both dishes were very tasty. The chicken had a ton of flavor and the noodles were cooked well, not too heavy or greasy. The spicy mint had subtle hints of mint, and was the perfect amount of spice.I really enjoyed our waiter too. He was young, very friendly, and very helpful.And the place is BYOB with no corkage fee. We stopped by Lush on the way over and picked up a great $10 bottle of wine to complete the meal.I will certainly be back again!

1.description: Service is not great so people may have a better experience by getting their food to go. We ordered Thai spring rolls and neither my friend nor I liked them. They were wrapped in a starchy, thick, rice paper that wasn't good. We both tried it, didnt like it, and told our server when she brought our food. We weren't sure how they would handle it but at least hoped they'd clear it from the table. It became a bit of an awkward inquisition on what we didnt like about it. We didnt ask for a refund but our server went to the manager and the consensus was that we could only get a half credit bc we both tried it. It was just awkward.I ordered the basil entree with chicken. Heads up, the chicken is ground chicken not chicken breast. Other than the protein, the flavor was good. My friend ordered the yellow curry--the peas were under-cooked, a little crunchy. The thai tea was very good but heads up, my friend was charged 4 instead of the 2.50 on the menu. At that point we just didnt want to complain any more.

55.description: My husband and I consider Thai Linda one of 'our' places. We went there on one of our first dates when he lived in the neighbourhood and we love to go there a few times a year. I don't think we've ever seen more than one other table occupied, but don't let the emptiness fool you in to thinking it's not popular! The food is delightful and the service is the perfect amount of attentiveness.

9.description: They give you a discount if you pay cash.  BYOB and they have a patio.  I don't know what went wrong but I ordered pad thai and it smelled and tasted awful.  Since I've personally worked in many a restaurant, I don't EVER, and I mean EVER send food back.  I either choke it down or I don't eat it.  And if the server or management is smart, they'll ask "was there something wrong with your dish?" at which point I would tell them how gross it was and so on and so forth.  The pad thai was very odd.  The menu is huge here, maybe they need to consolidate to focus on areas that need to be improved.

26.description: First time here for carry out.  Cute ambiance and space but disappointed with my order.  $5 for bubble tea?  Go somewhere else of you can...the tea was good but there were barely any bubbles.  Not worth it.  My Tom yum soup was extremely disappointing.  Oil droplets were floating on top.  No flavor, kinda stale chicken and definitely old lemongrass...not at all fragrant.  Service was cold and unfriendly.  Won't be back here.

25.description: Delivery thru Grub HubFirst timer- ordered on Thanksgiving. Ordered simply Thai offerings: crab Rangoon, side salad( ginger dressing on side) spring rolls, small tom yum soup w tofu dressing on side. Review: I was really impressed with the whole process. Food was on time. Delivery driver was nice! :-) Every selection tasted super fresh and was prepared perfectly. Food was hot!!!!! I ate everything!!!!!Crab Rangoon: perfect sizes very delicate and melted in my mouth. Usually, these appetizers are way too big and over stuffed with too much cream cheese.Spring rolls: were larger than I am use to here, but I liked it since cabbage, carrots are raw w tofu it good cause I could really taste the freshnessSoup: Amazing- asked for it to be medium and it actually was. W large pieces of tofu :-) they did not skimp on that.Side salad: they have the ginger dressing that I love. Simply greens with shredded beets and carrots I drizzled done olive oil on top w dressing and was yummy. Only thing is wish I would of received a fortune cookie

12.description: Got the sesame chicken, it was ok nothing special  if this place wasn't in walking distance I wouldn't go back

59.description: Great food. Great service. Great price.

21.description: Had pad kee mao. Loved it. Could use a bit less oil though.

17.description: Easily the worst food I've had in Chicago. Ordered the Panang steak, and it was actually inedible. Go anywhere else. Overpriced, poor delivery (wrong address, wrong time), and the food when/if it arrives is really bad.

10.description: Another triumph! I know how cliché it is to order Pad Thai at a Thai restaurant but, wow, was it worth it! The balance of flavors was incredible and the shrimp were perfectly prepared. If you appreciate good Thai cuisine, run, don't walk, to the Thai Linda Café on Roscoe Street!

5.description: Ordered through Grubhub last night and was disappointed. Our bubble teas were probably the only good thing out of our whole order. We ordered pho and let's just say.. It was not pho. It's as if they weren't expecting a pho delivery order at 8pm on a Tuesday because it was horrible. The broth was very dark almost black, the noddles weren't even noddles just some crammed up mushy stuff in a container we had to add to the pho ourselves.. It had absolutely no flavor and the beef were just chunks thick THICK meat not nicely thin... Won't be ordering again...

3.description: I really enjoyed my meal at Thai Linda, and would give it 3.5 stars. The decor was pleasant, I like that it's BYO, and the wait staff were attentive and efficient. We ordered simple dishes - pad see yew, pad kee mao (sorry, I'm sure I'm spelling those wrong) and the massaman curry. All three were delicious, in my opinion. The crab ran goons were the best I've had for awhile! I wasn't a huge fan of the Thai spring rolls, as I was expecting a hot/fried dish (these were cold, probably how they're meant to be but I didn't realize). All in all, I recommend this place - and it's definitely really great value for money with a really large menu!

35.description: Love this place. My wife and I love to grab some beer and wine and enjoy the BYOB. We love the Pad Thai

19.description: After getting delivery over the past 3 years, I finally had the opportunity to go to the actual place. Not too big, not too small as it was a nice space. It was virtually empty when we walked in. We started out with the thai dumplings which were very good. For my entree, I got the Spicy Fried Rice with Vegetable and it was definitely spicy! Their delicious thai iced tea definitely helped keep my mouth cool. I love that I finally showed up as the staff was pretty nice and its a nice joint...will return more often as this is one of my favorite thai places in the city...Also this joint is BYOB!

28.description: Skip it. Go elsewhere unless you want to have one of the weirdest restaurant experiences of your life, as I did:My family has been going to Thai Linda since before they changed management, so no hesitation to go back even under new ones. Sat down with my friend and decided to try their spin on a new kind of Pad Thai, one that had Wontons in it. We started with crispy crab and fish rolls ,which were pretty good but had a spongy quality that I wasn't expecting. Still fairly tasty.When the pad thai arrived, I discovered after one bite that this dish had NO noodles in it whatsoever. It was pad thai sauce dumped on wonton crackers and shrimp. Not at all what I wanted- who orders pad thai and says "Hold the noodles, please"??  So I called our waitress over and explained that I'd like to have regular pad thai instead, since this new dish did not meet my expectations.  The waitress, who clearly spoke very little English, informed me that since I had ordered this, this is what I get to eat.  I figured she must be misunderstanding- perhaps she thought I was saying I hadn't ordered this in the first place.  So, I explained again that I just didn't care for this, and I wanted to send it back and order something different.  Again, she looked baffled- and then said "Let me ask my manager."  At this point I'm thinking- I don't need a manager's permission not to like this dish. Waitress comes back and tells me that the manager says I have to pay for this since I ordered it but I can also get something else, at which point I got angry. I told her to tell her manager that I would NOT be paying for food I don't like or eat, and then asked her to just tell the manager to come and speak to me directly.She comes back AGAIN and says "My manager will give you half off this dish. But you cannot change."  Now there's steam shooting out of my ears. I stood up, walked into the restaurant with the plate of (now soggy) wonton crackers and sauce, thunked it down on the counter, and said loudly, "Tell your manager to come out of the kitchen and speak to me, please." And then I stood at the counter and waited. Waitress tells me she's on the phone. I still stand there. Waitress comes out for the FOURTH time and now says, "OK, we will take this off and you want regular pad thai?"  I say yes and go back outside. Quite possibly the oddest thing that's ever happened to me- I actually had to pick up my plate and practically threaten to walk it back into the kitchen myself to stress the point that I would not be forced into eating a crappy dish or paying for it.  So don't bother going to Thai Linda, unless you are absolutely sure you are going to love whatever the hell they put down in front of you.

45.description: The food and service here was great. Our waiter was amusing and attentive. I ordered pineapple curry and it was perfect! I couldn't think of any way to make it better.  The portions were on the smaller side for Thai food but still enough for left overs.

33.description: I would love to support a local restaurant but our experience was so bad that not only do I  not want to return, I think that other folks should think twice about going.We went there on Christmas night -- it was the only place on the Roscoe strip that was open.  And I totally get that it may not be perfect, or even close to perfect, on Christmas night.  But it was just terrible.  We and everyone else there waited over an hour for our entrees to come out, and the food quality was significantly worse than it was under previous management -- from a significantly fattier beef dish to a much less flavorful noodle dish.  What really made me angry about the whole situation though is that neither of the two folks working the front of the house came up to anyone and said anything as little as:  Hey, it's Christmas, and we're doing our best but it's slow.  We get it.  But they wouldn't even make eye contact with anyone, much less apologize for it.  It took us getting up to talk to them to actually make them address it, which they basically declined to do even then.  Without any discussion, they did knock 15% off our bill.  Again, no fronting of the situation, no words at all.  Can't imagine returning.

43.description: Disappointed.  We ordered in from Thai Linda not long ago and enjoyed it, so when I saw they had a Groupon Now, we thought we'd head over and dine on the patio.  The whole experience was completely riddled with screw-ups, based in no small part on the fact that our waiter looked to be about 16 and spoke almost no English.When we sat down, he asked if we were using the Groupon.  I thought this was weird, as in all my years (?) of Grouponing, no establishment has asked about it before we'd been given the check.  We said yes.  He flipped the menu over and showed us the section we could not order from.  Already a bad sign, since restaurants are allowed to add their own "fine print" to the Groupons and nowhere on the Groupon did it say "not applicable on House Specials".We ordered spring rolls and two cups of tom kha.  Then I ordered the Thai salad and he ordered curry.  I thought it was really weird that my salad came out before anything else, since it has egg, tofu and peanut sauce, and I remembered being a size more suited to an entree, and also it was the only thing I ordered that was not an appetizer.  I placed it to the side and stared at it for a bit.  We ate our soup (not great) and the spring rolls (completely standard).  My salad sat alone.  And sat.  And sat.Our waiter appeared after a time and asked for the Groupon.  I pulled it up on my phone, and he disappeared with the bar code.  I figured he was killing time until the curry showed up.  Then he came back with the check and said, "Thank you!"Uhh.  I informed him we were still waiting on food.  He looked perplexed.  The curry, I reminded him.  OH RIGHT, THE CURRY.  He came back almost immediately with the curry, which had been sitting God knows how long, waiting to be delivered to us.Finally, I got to eat my salad!  I really like this salad, but I thought it seemed much... more petite than I remembered.  Definitely much, much smaller.  And Boyfriend's curry as well, was extremely petite.  It was not a shareable portion.  In fact, with all the rice that was brought out, and all the curry in the dish, it only filled a salad plate.  I have never seen such a small portion at a Thai place.  There is a photo attached.  That's it, folks.  We had zero leftovers, despite ordering quite a bit of food.  I'm starting to wonder if we actually received less food due to using the Groupon.  They did know about it in advance (which automatically makes me anxious.)After all that, our bill was calculated wrong and I'm still not sure how or what happened, since the waiter lacked the language skills to explain it.  Won't be back.  Glad we didn't pay full price.

2.description: Went to Linda's one night with a few friends ... the staff was extremely sweet! The food came out at different times and our appetizers were not hot, they were slightly cold. When the food did come out though it tasted great. It is a BYOB with no corking fee and extremely accommodating with whatever is needed. Our friends and us had an great time!

18.description: There's some really mixed reviews for good old Linda here.  I didn't think she fell into an extreme category - I thought it was a perfectly good, casual spot to grab dinner.  On a Friday night me and the man were hungry.  I was craving Thai, so we walked down to pay a visit to Linda.  There were several other full tables, and a lot of take-out orders on the front counter waiting to be picked up.  We were seated, immediately served water and we place our orders for some apps - crab rangoon (my usual) and a beef-wrapped asparagus.  The apps came out pretty quick - and they were good; not great.  Entrees - we split the chx pad se eew and the lard nar.  The lard nar was served in a deep bowl and was the most soupy I've ever seen it.  I prefer that dish more on the dry side because I don't enjoy eating spoonfuls of gravy - but it did taste good...  The pad se eew was our preferred dish - that had much better texture and flavor.  By the time we got our bill, we were the only table in the restaurant.  Still, the take-outs and deliveries were steady.  Bonus: they served a delightful little fortune cookie roll - I've never seen that kind, but it was way tastier than a regular fortune cookie. Was this the best Thai ever?  No.  But it certainly wasn't terrible (or even bad).  We had a nice dinner, the space was calm and quiet - I would come back again for another low-key meal anytime.

41.description: Good Thai food, good service, nice atmosphere AND BYO-we will definitely be back!

52.description: Having not had Thai in some time, I was excited to try some, what I had been told to be, great authentic Thai food. Thai Linda Cafe is located in a pretty suburban feeling part of Logan Square, across from a Starbucks.Excited that it was byob, me and a few buddies set out with a few beers to give it a shot. I cant say I was disappointed, or overly enthusiastic about it. The patio was nice, though the service was so-so. I ordered a pepper steak dish, which was good, but pretty run of the mill. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their dishes as well. I wouldn't mind going back, as the menu was pretty good. Maybe it's my fault for ordering something simple, but I wasn't "wowed" by my first experience.

50.description: Wish I didn't have to write this review but...  I ordered the chicken pad see ew lunch special.  First thing I noticed is that their egg rolls are now about 1/2 the size than they used to be and they do not taste nearly as good as they used to.  My entree also was not nearly as good as it used to be.  The chicken was dry and bland and the noodles were not very flavorful.  THEN I found multiple hairs in my dish.  Clearly this is gross and unacceptable!

4.description: Not the worst but def. not the best.  We ordered take out from here because it is one of the closest Thai restaurants by our apartment.  I got my usual pad se eew as well as gyoza.  I was pretty disappointed because the pad se eew that I am used to has a lot of sauce.  This one lacked sauce, in fact it had none.  We also asked if the gyoza was pan fried or fried, and we were told it was on a pan but when I got the order, it was fried which causes it to lose flavor.  Overall, although the food wasn't great it was cheap but I don't think we will be ordering from here again.

6.description: Their online ordering system is an absolute joke, completely incompetent service provided. It was terrible!My boyfriend and I placed an online order at 6:05PM. We waited 1 hour and 15 minutes before we decided to call and check on the order. We were told that it will arrive in a few minutes. So, we waited for an additional 35 minutes. We called again, stating that it's been close to 2 hours and if the order does not arrive in 5 minutes, we don't want it anymore. Whoever answered offered no reason as to why it took 2 hours to get our food. The food arrived within 3 minutes of that call, however, both appetizers were cold. It wasn't cooked thoroughly. It was bland and unseasoned. All the side sauces tasted old - the peanut sauce had a thick layer of oil on top, almost as it they just scooped the top layer of separated sauce into a sauce container. In addition, they forgot our drinks. The driver offered no apology or reason as to why it took so long. He took our money and walked off. We called again to report the issue and was told that they will call us back when the drinks arrive. An hour later, and the drinks have not arrived. We called again and they said they can only offer store credit. That's ridiculous! It's a terrible establishment. I'm absolutely appalled they continue to run this business with such terrible service.

22.description: I honestly don't get all of the so-so reviews. In my opinion, Thai Linda is WAY better than the Thai place that's one minute away. The Panang Curry is awesome. The Basi Fried rice is delicious. The Hawaiian Fried Rice is delightful. The Sesame Chicken was just okay. The service is great.

15.description: Another disappointing, over priced and low quality Roscoe Village restaurant.  Would someone please come and open a good restaurant in the neighborhood?  My girlfriend and I eat Thai food at least once a week, as we are big fans.  We tried this place for the first time about a month ago, and we were very disappointed.  The good is pretty bland, the portions are small and the quality of the ingredients are poor.  We had there pad Thai, chicken satay,  their spicy basil chicken.  I really can't tell you much more, except that none of the dishes would make me go back.  We did notice, it was a Friday night, and their was only one other table in tjebwhle place, enough said...

57.description: As I was strolling down through Roscoe Village I came upon this place & checked out the Yelp reviews. I've ordered from there 3 or 4 times now & I think they're great! Ginger chicken, crab rangoon & garlic noodles are fantastic, but beware of their Spicy rice! Two of my friends couldn't handle it.

20.description: It was just ok.  And for the price I paid I would expect more.  I got the pad thai beef.  there was an up-charge for the beef.  fine.  but the amount of meat wasn't a lot. Also, the noodles are thinner than I expected.  they did add a lot of crushed up peanuts, so that was nice.  I also got the tom kha soup.  it was a little too oily for my taste.  my bf got their chicken rice soup and he said it was good.  it also took 20 minutes to prepare and I was the only person in the place and their delivery drivers were sitting there.  don't forget to asl about the free app for orders of $20 or more for take out and delivery.  obviously they don't mention them to you.  in a pinch it will do.

36.description: This place used to be decent... but the last three times I've gone have been terrible. Extremely long waits for food (over an hour), terrible service, and on two separate occasions- burnt AND cold food. One time our bill was twice the amount it should have been. Avoid this place.

14.description: I honestly don't get all of the so-so reviews. In my opinion, Thai Linda is WAY better than the Thai place that's one minute away. The Panang Curry is awesome. The Basi Fried rice is delicious. The Hawaiian Fried Rice is delightful. The Sesame Chicken was just okay. The service is great.

3.description: Since I'm new to the area, I just picked a pharmacy that was close. Pharmacy staff was very helpful! My prescriptions were still being run in the state that I used to live in, so my insurance was denying coverage. The pharmacist took the time to call the pharmacy in Kansas and clear up the situation. I will continue to use this Walgreens for any Rx's and a candy bar if I'm in need of a chocolate fix!

1.description: Well organized, clean, and fully stocked. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Everyone greeted me, and Vicki talked to me in one of the aisles. She's outstanding with her customer service!

2.description: Pretty standard. I mean, it's a Walgreens so...it's a Walgreens. It's always been organized when I've been in and the staff is...a Walgreens staff. Not fancy, not overly helpful, but polite and I'm always in and out quickly. The pharmacy has always been great for me. I have no complaints about them at all. That's uh...that's all I got.

5.description: Its a walgreens, just like any other Walgreen.  However every time I've needed to buy more deoderant, this place has had either Old Spice, Degree, or Right Guard on clearance.I'm not sure whats going on, but I like the fact that for the past 2 years my deoderant costs $0.99 a stick.

6.description: Organized....Helpful staff....Great items always on clearance....Convienient...

7.description: Useless!! Worst pharmacy I've ever dealt with. Pharmacy techs are bad. Pharmacists are worse. Save yourself a headache and go across the street to Jewel, much nicer, much more knowledgeable. Worth it. Don't go here!!

0.description: Writing a review about a Walgreens, not something I ever thought I'd do necessarily.  However, this is a special case.  The manager (Peter) of this particular Walgreens really went above and beyond and deserves recognition.  I had ordered some photos that were to be part of an x-mas gift.  Unfortunately, the photos I was given were someone else's and not the ones I had ordered.  I was frustrated and called the store to voice that frustration.  Peter got on the phone and was apologetic.  He offered to re-print and I informed him that I wouldn't be able to get back to the store before x-mas.  The store was unable to refund the amount to my credit card over the phone so he offered to mail me a gift card for the balance.  This wasn't ideal but I understood it was the best they could do under circumstances, or so I thought.  As I told Peter my address, he mentioned that this was close enough to the store that he'd be happy to drive over and personally deliver re-printed photos and that is just what he did.  I was pleasantly surprised at what Peter was willing to do to rectify an innocent mistake on an $8 photo order.  He really did go the extra mile (lame pun, I know) to deliver superior customer service.

4.description: Stopped in because I needed a chase ATM which they had. The store was clean. Everything seemed organized and the staff was friendly.

12.description: If I could give this store 10 stars, I would.  A friend of mine and I went there yesterday looking for corsets.  We had previously been shopping at a larger, more well-known store on Belmont (that will remain nameless....) where the girl working there had scoffed at even pulling a corset down from a high-up rack so that she and I could try it on.  We got no help, snotty attitude and the feeling that we were putting this girl out by even walking into the store.  So on our way out I asked her if she knew of any other shops that sold corsets nearby.  She said "no" flatly, but then handed me the hot pink card for Skyscraper Heels...... and thank GOD she did.My friend and I walked into the shop to find three ladies trying on shoes and howling with laugher.  The store is quite small, so we felt a bit intimidated going in with five people already in the small space.  But we braved the close quarters and couldn't tear our eyes away from the beautiful corsets on forms above the register.  These were AMAZING compared to the crap we'd seen over at the other shop and we asked if we could try some on.  The shop owner was nothing short of incredible, tying us into corset after corset as we shopped and weighed the merits of one style over another.  He saw that I was having a really hard time choosing between two styles and actually went into his stockroom to dig around for a corset that blended the two styles perfectly and which ended up being the perfect garment for me.  Gary will order you a corset according to your size, style, color and fabric specifications.  And let me tell you ladies, these are SERIOUS corsets.  They have steel boning, paneled construction with hook-and-eye closures in the front and lace-up backs.  Gary is an expert getting you into and out of the garments and even taught me how to properly handle it to be sure that I'm not bending the metal or tying myself in knots. I was happy to pay whatever markup there may have been on the garment for the amazing service we got at this store, but when I got home and I found my corset online I found that (with the euro to dollar conversion) the price was almost exactly the same.  DO NOT BUY A CORSET ONLINE. Go to this shop, talk to Gary, and get yourself acquainted with the garment before you buy.  Support this local business and have an amazing time in the process!

7.description: Ladies (and gents who like to dress up like ladies!) I beseech you, I implore you, I beg you, please patronize and support Skyscraper Heels! It's an amazing small business and from what the owner's told me when I was there last month, the economy has hit them pretty hard. First and foremost, the owners are the nicest people I have ever met.  They love to talk to their customers, to find out who they are and what they need. And they certainly love all different types of people with all different sorts of lifestyles (I heard, like another reviewer did, about Greg's alter- ego Amanda). They want you to find the best shoes for you and will help you find one that you can walk in at least semi comfortably.Another reason you should go here: I'd say between 80-90% of their shoes are made in the good ole US of A, hand crafted in California. This allows them to make custom shoes: half sizes, large sizes, custom colors, etc. This is also why their shoes are a bit more expensive than ones you'll find at Sunny's or another cheap stripper shoe store; most of those shoes are made in China. So you can count on getting sweatshop free shoes! Ethics are always a plus!They also sell custom corsets. You only live once and life is too short to not splurge on a well made corset that will make you look HOT!This place is too wonderful to go out of business and let's face it, we ALL need at least one corset and at least one pair of stripper shoes (it's a fact and it's really not up for discussion). So go here and spend a little more money. Here's just a bit of incentive to do good: If you pay cash, they don't charge sales tax! So please, skip the cheapo stripper stores and go to Skyscraper Heels before it's too late!

3.description: This store is AMAZING! I needed a black corset for my show and had heard this was the place to go. Gary is an expert in corsets! He knew exactly what I needed and what would look best on me. It was the best personal fitting session I've ever had. I will be back for sure!!

1.description: Best selection on heels in Chicago! It's pretty damn expensive but if you want amazing shoes then come here!

2.description: I found heaven!   It is located at 2202 W Belmont!!I have worked in the bridal business for years and always send my brides to Gary, the man knows corsets!!

9.description: This place rocks.  When I went in drag to a NYE party in 1999, they were the place to go. (I gots me some big feet!!) And I wasn't even living in Chicago at the time!Go forth and shop....

18.description: This store has shoes that when yo see you buy with out questioning if you can pay you rent?

10.description: Looking for that size 15C plexi-glass purple pump for an upcoming special occasion?  Or how about thigh-high stilletto boots for some real street walkin'?Skyscraper Heels is THE place to shop for not only a crazy array of high heel shoes, platforms and boots, but also corsets and stockings to compliment your stunning outfit!skyscraperheels.comOwner Gary Page is the High Priest of high-heels and sells oodles of custom-made shoes from some of the last shoe manufacturers still located in the US.  You can also bring in fabric of your own and Gary will have the shoes made to order.At Gary's prompting and because I couldn't say 'no' to such a nice fella', I tried on a pair of 3 3/4" open-toed mules, and I must say they were pretty darned comfortable!  And that's coming from a gal who lives in sneakers, flip-flops, and Danskos!  Apartenly it's all in the engineering!

13.description: My name is Kristin and I am a stripper heels addict. This place is my downfall, my drug of choice. I bought a pair of custom made, Chicago cubs heels that I have received about a bazillion compliments and questions on. They're made with Cubs fabric, and have a clear heel w/ the same fabric stuffed in them. I'm not kidding, every time I wear them during the summer, people of all creeds stop me on the street begging to know where I purchased them. If you love high heels, then Gary is the man to see.

16.description: I was depressed this summer. It's so hard to get out of a funk.... but, FUNKY SHOES help better than any meds I know !!!  Platform MaryJanes, super high Boots, and of course Fetish shoes are a must.  This store is well stocked with  good quality items. PLEASE LADIES AND GENTS, poor quality Fetish shoes= a trip to the hospital.  Invest in your Fetish!!!  Plus, for all beginner corset people, please learn the proper way to lace one up. Here they teach, go and have fun !!!  Next stop....THE DUNGEON !!!

17.description: This place was worth every bit of the hype surrounding it. My friend and I showed up on a Monday and it was closed but the owner was inside and opened up for us. He took his time with us and tried on many different sizes and styles until the perfect one was chosen. Perfect is the right word too. They are to die for!!! I love love love this place!

15.description: I feel a little funny about writing a review for this place, but was in there not too long ago with a young lady looking for a particular style of shoe. She was taken care of like a princess and the information the owner provided was amazing. The gentleman working there was like the encyclopedia/master of stripper heels.  He knows everything about them and has suppliers who'll make almost anything for you custom. Worth a visit.  And guys, take a girl there for a fun trip.  If you can stand being in a women's (and tv/ts) shoe store for a half hour or more, your lady will thank you for it. They sell corsets and stockings there too, guys, so the punishment is not too bad.

0.description: Why haven't I written a review sooner?! I bought a gorgeous corset from them that I wore to my Junior Prom, so...i've been a customer for about 13 years! My mother is addicted to their shoes and the addiction got stuck on me too. The selection is unique, the service has always been incredible (my mother tries on like 10 shoes and I value their patience throughout), and the shoes are top quality. Even though they are the highest of heels they are the most comfortable and durable shoes I have ever purchased. It is hard to buy heels from anywhere else now. Other shoes pinch here and there or wear out in no time. I bought a lovely pair that I wore everywhere for four straight years and never ran into another soul with anything like them. Not only that, but they withstood a lot of abuse! Compare that to the shoes that snap down your first flight of stairs. Even though it may seem pricey in comparison to whatever you might spend elsewhere (well, to those of us on a limited shoe budget at least!)- there is no comparison. They are beautiful, they last, and the customer service has always been impeccable. Isn't that what you should expect from your shoe shopping experience?Skyscraper Heels, you are my favorite store in the world and you have my deepest respects for being a business that still deals in that rare commodity that is quality.

5.description: Need some custom shoes? Ones that sport your love for the Cubs or the White Sox? Dancing shoes? Street-walking shoes? Rainbow platforms? A corset fitted to you? Marabou slippers? Rhinestoned heels? Glittery, leopard platforms? Stripper heels? Ridiculous heels that are high as...dare-I-say...SKYSCRAPERS? You have found the place.I stopped in here once, just to look around. I met Gary, who was VERY helpful. I was pleased to hear his "alter-ego" is the same name as me - Amanda!They have tons of shoes in stock and can custom-make some heels for you. If you're an exotic dancer, this place is a MUST when you are in need of some new shoes. They carry a few popular brands, like Pleaser.When I need some new heels (And what girl doesn't?!) I will make a trip on over here.

11.description: I love this store.  If you have a shoe fetish.....DO NOT SHOP HERE!  You will have a major shoe attack and leave broke.  Your feet and wallet will never be the same.  Shoes come in every color, every fabric, and every height!  If you can't find what you are looking for...guess what...they'll have them custom made for you!!!  Ugh!  Black heels, clear heels, wedges...the options are endless!  I'm not going to even get into the boots!  They have everything from size 4 1/2 up to size 16!!!  Every time that I visit...I am made to feel at home...Gary is sweet, honest, and also a major shoe fanatic like myself.  This is the place to buy super sexy drop dead gorgeous "F*ck me" shoes!P.S.  If you're looking for the original black seamed silk stockings...this is the place to buy them!

8.description: Went in today for a corset fitting. This is a real treat for myself and I love it. Wore it home cause I dont want to take it off, my waist and hips look too good! : )Diane was very helpful, we tried on several sizes. She educated me on how to put it on, take it off, and just how tight to get it so its snug but I dont pass out.  Also bought a white feather boa.  They have tons of gorgeous shoes.Corset fitting is by appointment only but really worth it.

4.description: I cannot say enough awesome things about this place - both the products and the owners.  I first came here in the mid 90s, a tomboy completely new to the world of heels.  "Just wear your shoes while you do housework, and you'll get used to them in no time!" was their advice to me.  It worked, and I've been coming back to get a pair or two of shoes every year since.  (Usually I go to the store with one specific shoe in mind, and bring enough money for a splurge purchase, because I know I cannot resist the call of the heels....  There's always some new design that catches my eye!)Almost every pair of shoes I've bought has been custom made for my narrow feet.  I love that the owners completely understand that stilettos are uncomfortable enough as it is -- no reason to wear ill-fitting shoes and risk injury.  It feels like a luxury to have custom made shoes, and the PRICE!  So inexpensive!I also appreciate that their main manufacturer is located in the USA, and the owners are committed to sourcing as many products as possible from the US.I was all set to write a 5-star review, and then something happened to make me wish I could rate this place 6 stars!  The manufacturer recently messed something up in my order, and because I had procrastinated, there wasn't time enough to get a new pair made in time for Halloween.  Without going into all the details, let me just say that Gary went above and beyond to deliver wearable shoes for my favorite holiday of the year.  It is no joke that they take care of their customers.  I absolutely love this place!

14.description: I love shoes, and I have always wanted to live out a stripper fantasy, but finding boots and thigh hi-s that fit my calves are hard.  They have everything here and are willing to give you some time to look.You can find everything wild to a similiar pair from Pretty Woman - you know those white ones.

6.description: Skyscraper Heels specializes in custom made women's shoes and boots!  They create custom designed shoes to the specific taste and request of the buyers.  They say they can create from just about any material, heel shape and height.  Heels range from 3" to 8" and from sizes 5-17 (W and WW).  They also carry ankle, knee and thigh high boots. I actually went here for a different reason.  I needed a corset and I heard this was the place to go.  Diane, the owner (I think), explained about corset training and was very helpful.  I had a fitting and ended up buying a pair of black patent leather stilettos too.  Note that corset fitting are by appointment only.They also carry a verity of full fashioned '50s style back seam hosiery, Cuban heel hosiery, garter belts, girdles, and waist cinchers.  I was happy with my purchase and my husband had a very difficult time walking out of the store.So, stop by or call (866) SKY-HEELS or (773) 477-8495.  Either Diane or Gary will be happy to discuss your needs and make sure you walk out looking like a million bucks.  They are open Monday from 11:00am - 5:00pm, Tuesday - Saturday from 11:00am - 8:00pm but closed on Sundays.

58.description: Great pizza!!! You can tell that the chef (the waitress said his name was Chris) really has a passion for what he's preparing. Cool atmosphere, good beer list, nice specials... We had a great time. Thank you.

56.description: I stopped by the bar for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing beer selection. The guy behind the bar was very knowledgeable and made some great recommendations.  In addition to the vast beer selection was a large choice of different styles of grilled cheese, yum! Everything was very good. Highly recommended!

29.description: Extensive beer list and awesome Wednesday night trivia. The place itself is a bit run down but who cares when the servers are fun and you get a beer for five bucks?The friendly service, fair beer prices and frequent specials on local beers make this one of my favorite local neighborhood bars. Definitely worth a try if you're in Roscoe Village. No snootiness or overpriced signature drinks here- this is a great place to go for a few beers with friends.

42.description: My boyfriend and I came here yesterday because Commonwealth Tavern was too full. We both ordered the "gourmet" grilled cheeses. I've probably never been more disappointed. They came out cold, with a slice of cheese that wasn't even melted. However, the staff was nice when we sent them back and asked that they be heated longer. Service was slow.. When we initially walked in, it took more than 10 minutes for a server to greet us. Honestly, not a great experience when Commonwealth across the street is so much better. One other plus is that they did turn on the Cowboys game when we asked.

23.description: This is a great neighborhood bar in Roscoe Village to grab a few beers with friends or to get some really good bar food!I've been here several times just for drinks and they have a great beer selection that is always changing. Prices are pretty standard for craft beers in Chicago. The bar tenders are good people and can offer some great suggestions if you ask.The food is really outstanding compared to most bars/taverns. I've only had the pizza but it was really good! Their menu has a nice selection of entrees and appetizers and there definitely is something for everybody.If you're ever in the area and are looking for a place to chill and have some good grub and a couple beers this is the place!

47.description: Meh, didnt love it. The Jalapeno popper grilled cheese was good, however, everything else is just okay. Nothing mind blowing. A bit more pricey than the average "bar food" places with a similar quality. The atmosphere in the place was neither friendly or unfriendly, and there was no real vibe to be had. Overall, just really blah.

8.description: The food here has gone WAY downhill. I've recommended this place to a few friends and wish I could take it back. Food has habitually come out cold. They revamped the brunch menu a few years ago and have since scaled it back. Disappointing all around. One would think they would capitalize on the overflow from Kitch'n and Orange. Not a good option. Go here for a beer and watch "the game", nothing more.

31.description: Having lived right down the street for nearly 4 years, this used to be our go-to neighborhood bar - quick/close with good food and drinks. Sadly we'll be taking a break until they can get it together. Service has definitely gone down hill during our last few visits. Arrived tonight with party of 7 adults +1 toddler and was told they only had one menu available (restaurant was not crowded at all). Shared the one menu for about 20 minutes until more became available. An extra glass of wine was accidentally brought out with the first round of drinks (which took another 10+ minutes) and when we pointed out the error it was taken away but still appeared on our bill. Appetizer order of pretzels took another 20+ minutes and arrived completely cold/soggy. Had to flag a different waiter (ours had disappeared) to send it back. Took nearly an hour from the time we were seated for our meals to arrive, and the most simple meal of the group, a house salad, was never delivered. Had to walk around the restaurant and hunt down our waitress to let her know we were missing something. Again - had to get up and walk around the restaurant to find our waitress to bring the check, then find her (again) to remove the extra wine charge. All in all we spent an hour and a half there and had to go find someone every time we wanted anything - not acceptable for a place serving easy/basic bar food that was not even remotely crowded.

34.description: Food's amazing. I love the beer list. The service has always been great!!! I go all the time and have not been let down once. NICE JOB GUYS!!!!

16.description: Overall, a meh experience. It's a typical neighborhood bar, with prices a bit higher than what can be had elsewhere. Not a place that stands out in my mind, just a mediocre place to grab a bite and a beer.Service has been OK when I've gone, though a bartender insisted I had one more drink than I had, which was fun because she straight up said nope, you're lying, you're paying for what I say. I don't usually fight about a $6 drink unless I'm right, which I was. But since she was a B****, and $6 isn't the end of the world, I didn't let it get to me too much.

13.description: This is our local go to place for lunch or drinks...or both.  They have some really good grilled cheese's, the jalepeno popper is awesome.  The service is always good, the beer selection is consistently great.  The pizza is really good, and so are the burgers.

11.description: Environment: 3/5. Pub, dart board, outside seatingWaitress Hotness: 3/5 very cute waitressService: 5/5 very nice bartender & quick service Beer Selection: Ok. Not as great as they made it sound.Overall: it's hard to judge overall since I didn't try the food however I will update my review upon trying more. Beer selection...could be better.

39.description: My friends and I went here today and 6 of us waited for over and hour for our food which was then Cold when it came out of the kitchen. Did they cook it and then let it sit for a half hour? Nobody knows BC the waitress was terrible and would go "check" on our food and then never come back and report to us. To top it off 2 of us had to wait an hour and a half to receive our food bc they forgot and never bothered to ask us if we needed anything else.. Like maybe the meal we ordered. ALL THE FOOD WAS COLD and even if it was warm it still would have been mediocre. I'd say don't bother going here bc it sucks.

37.description: Overall, a meh experience. It's a typical neighborhood bar, with prices a bit higher than what can be had elsewhere. Not a place that stands out in my mind, just a mediocre place to grab a bite and a beer.Service has been OK when I've gone, though a bartender insisted I had one more drink than I had, which was fun because she straight up said nope, you're lying, you're paying for what I say. I don't usually fight about a $6 drink unless I'm right, which I was. But since she was a B****, and $6 isn't the end of the world, I didn't let it get to me too much.

0.description: The best and the worst. . . I had the BEST pizza of my entire life here yesterday!!! Smokehouse pizza with three different kinds of bbq'ed meat!!!  To Die For!!!   The service was also great (thanks for your attentiveness, Maddie!) everything was great except the waffles in my wife's chicken and waffles.  The chicken was cooked perfectly- hot, plump, fried just right, and flavorful!  The waffle , however, was inedible.  No kidding- it was as hard as the table- as demonstrated when we tapped the table with it.This would have easily been 5+ stars except for the waffle. We'll be back though- for sure!

38.description: My wife and I stopped in here for the first time to watch the final minutes of the Cotton Bowl to see MSU come from behind and defeat Baylor (excellent game!). We both ordered burgers (I had the Kobe Beef) and she had a bacon cheddar burger. Both were excellent, as were the fries. That's all that I can say about it as we didn't stay very long or order any drinks.

51.description: I really like this place, I was here to watch a couple of the Blackhawks games, since they have a lot of TV's and a great bar feel.  My girl and I had drinks appetizers and sandwiches.  We shared the mussels, not so good.  They were fresh, just not PEI mussels; yes, a big difference guys!  If you charge 11.99 for mussels, please serve a better quality, mussels aren't that expensive.  Sorry, this was the only negative, as everything else was very good.  I had the Waygu burger, they call it Kobe, but we all know you can't buy Kobe in the US, period.  Anyways, it was very good, surprisingly good actually.  I had it with swiss cheese and grilled onions, yummy!  I would go back, just for the burger.  I also had some sweet potato tater tots, which were different and tasty.  This is a good place to visit for any ball game, as it's a true sports bar.  I will be back to watch the up and coming world cup matches.  Save me a seat!

27.description: Waitress came to take our order and then didn't come back for 30 min. Cook and staff were obviously drinking on the job instead of attending patrons. Things were forgotten from our order, and the cook came out and yelled at me for mentioning what was forgotten "WELL, DO YOU WANT IT OR NOT!" Not a fan!

32.description: I went here for a college football game back in the fall and I was impressed by the place. Of course that impression is based upon the world of pubs in Chicago, where there are a dime a dozen and typically they serve average to below average food. Riverview Tavern was not the case. I was happily impressed with their nacho appetizer and with their grilled cheese sandwich. Obviously those items are trailblazing and are standard fare at restaurants, especially pubs, but I have those dishes before in pubs across the city and they've been unmemorable or memorably bad. Not as Riverview. I could tell there was a little extra effort there and I appreciated it and it didn't make me feel remorseful that I had to settle with eating at a bar. In addition to the above average food they have a great beer selection on draft and solid service. A win-win in book, and I'd happily go back to grab a drink and a bite to eat.

54.description: I've been here several times with friend and still not impressed.  The pricey food is meh and the service is not good.  It's seems to appear the waitresses don't want to be of much service(perhaps on purpose).  It took forever for someone to come to our table. Whereas we moved to the bar, negative! There's no friendly atmosphere in there, no vibe, no thanks.

48.description: As last time out I had only had drinks here, I wanted to come back and try the food. Wife and I ordered some burgers and they were quite tasty. I had the black and blue burger with cracked black pepper crust, melted blue cheese and mushrooms and wife had the hickory bacon cheddar burger. As was the case last time, service was friendly and attentive. The waitress really knew the beer menu which I appreciated and was helpful when it came to pointing out suggestions for us to try. Also a number of specials such as half off glasses of wine, $1 off Chicago beers and $4 pints Sierra's doesn't hurt either!Food came out super fast and was cooked as ordered. Wife likes her burgers medium with some pink and I like medium well with no pink but not overcooked. Both were exactly on the spot. Not a lot of places get this right. You ask for medium well and you get a bloody mess that's totally undercooked.Burgers came with these Parmesan parsley fries which were also quite tasty. Fried crispy, perfectly done. Winner. There was also a nice sidewalk seating area along Damen that looked inviting (although we sat inside)Overall, nice place. Definitely would come back and highly recommend it if you're looking for a good burger and a beer.

44.description: Great beer selection, delicious apps (especially the cheese curds!), and awesome service!!

24.description: Not a fan. My beer tasted flat. The place overall seemed dingy. Floor was sticky. Bathroom was disgusting. Bartender aloof and unfriendly.

7.description: This is a great neighborhood bar in Roscoe Village to grab a few beers with friends or to get some really good bar food!I've been here several times just for drinks and they have a great beer selection that is always changing. Prices are pretty standard for craft beers in Chicago. The bar tenders are good people and can offer some great suggestions if you ask.The food is really outstanding compared to most bars/taverns. I've only had the pizza but it was really good! Their menu has a nice selection of entrees and appetizers and there definitely is something for everybody.If you're ever in the area and are looking for a place to chill and have some good grub and a couple beers this is the place!

49.description: Fantastic service and bar food. The place is never empty, but not so crowded that you can't find a table with a television view--even during a Hawks playoff game!

40.description: This place is absolutely terrible. Overall look is great. Plenty of TV's to watch sports and a cool "pub" feel. BUT, it stops there. Ordered a "Hail Mary" drink and they ran out of skewers so not only did they bring me a bloody but it was a plain bloody with no garnish at all. We ordered food during the 1st period of the Blackhawks game and it is now the 3rd period and the food has yet to arrive. The server has compensated two rounds of drinks to try and make up for it. Place isn't full and the food wait is still over an hour. DON'T GO HERE. AWFUL

53.description: I was really pleased when my burger was served. Large, pretzel bun, pickles on the side, generous with the crispy fries. The only problem(at least in my opinion) was that the burger was salty. I admit it, I've become the salt 'police'. If I want salt on my food, I salt it myself. I like to start with a plain, unseasoned burger.. I did have mushrooms on the burger, but there were not a huge amount of them, if they were salted, as well, to explain why every bit of burger was so salty.     Otherwise, this is a comfortable spot to have a drink or a bite to eat. Lots of TVs to watch.  The wait staff was great.  Next time I go(or go anywhere for that matter, as salty food seems to be the norm these days) I will be ask in advance if seasoning/salt is used and ask that they omit it entirely.

30.description: We are so happy Riverview Tavern is our local and go to place. They are 100% consistent in their food quality and customer service. We always ask for Don. . . who goes above and beyond to make sure we're taken care of and makes you feel special everytime along the way.We live in a challenging area during the winter months and they do everything possible to deliver your order.Thanks, Riverview.

46.description: Well I thought 3rd time would be a charm. Nope. My hubby and I had date night and wanted something close and easy to grab dinner and some drinks. Our server sat us at a filthy table and disappeared for 10 mins. I asked her to wipe the table off and after she took our drink order. Came back and too it food order, then we sat for 20 mins. She came to is and said just checked on your food and it'll be right up....15 mins later it came out cold. See, she was busy talking to he fellow servers and checking herself out in the mirror. Never checked back on us til after we were done eating, ordered another round and then we sat. 25 minutes later I finally flagged her down for our check. I was overcharged for one of my drinks. Won't be back.

1.description: I'm not sure if this was an average experience because of the things that happened or because of the bar itself...We came here after some friends' brunch wedding expecting a bar hop--the group stayed here all night. And it was just a lot of people fighting off the hangover from the brunch booze and trying to keep the drunk rolling. There were multiple fights (mostly girl drama) and some girl (I don't know if she was a regular patron or part of the wedding party) kept picking "fights" (and by "fights" I mean flirting) with my husband all night. She moved on from him to me when she thought I was moving in on her target...lolz awkward.Anyways, I just don't know if I'd choose to come back here because of the poor associations or just because it wasn't the most exciting place otherwise. Atmosphere seemed lacking and service was gruff.

55.description: My wife and I keep coming back to this place, and in our time in Chicago it's become our local. Why? It's solid and reliable. We really like the food. They have a well varied menu but the burgers are particularly good - large and generous and very tasty. I also particularly like the Cuban sandwich.Really good and really large beer selection. Usually have some sort of nitro stout on tap and plenty of IPAs. Yay.Friendly service, we can bring all our friends here and it's not pricey at all.

9.description: I went here for a college football game back in the fall and I was impressed by the place. Of course that impression is based upon the world of pubs in Chicago, where there are a dime a dozen and typically they serve average to below average food. Riverview Tavern was not the case. I was happily impressed with their nacho appetizer and with their grilled cheese sandwich. Obviously those items are trailblazing and are standard fare at restaurants, especially pubs, but I have those dishes before in pubs across the city and they've been unmemorable or memorably bad.
