Not as Riverview. I could tell there was a little extra effort there and I appreciated it and it didn't make me feel remorseful that I had to settle with eating at a bar. In addition to the above average food they have a great beer selection on draft and solid service. A win-win in book, and I'd happily go back to grab a drink and a bite to eat.

26.description: Can here last night with a group of about 10 people, knowing it would be slammed because of the Hawks game. Knowing this, we all had our beer orders ready and when the drinks came we were prepared to order our food. Beers came out as expected, a few at a time as they were poured. I was stoked that they had some Three Floyd's selections. Food, on the other hand, came as 1-2 dishes at a time and were delivered as a server screamed out what they were. Two times different runners came out with multiple meals that were supposed to go to another table. My meal was never delivered. Within 45 minutes everyone had either finished or just received their meal. I told our waitress that it hadn't been delivered and that she could just take it off the bill and her response was, "That's weird. I wonder where it went." Needless to say we won't be coming back.

25.description: I went here for the women of craft beer event on thurs may 21 as part of chicago craft beer week, i loved all the beers i had, and they were all reasonably priced, (tho idk if the festival or the bar priced them) the hawks were playing that night, so it got pretty packed, but i was still able to order at the bar without much trouble, we had seats which was clutch. I dont have any complaints, though i just dont know how much was thanks to the festival or the bar, either way i was satisfied

12.description: Came here today for a casual brunch. Restaurant is very average. Our waitress was friendly but the restaurant is understaffed. Service was exceptionally slow. Drinks and meals came out at all different times, and a turkey club meal was forgotten. Meal was brought out after they realized the mistake and was taken off our bill. Enjoyed my Riverview Bloody Mary but my Classic Eggs Benedict was underwhelming and lukewarm.

59.description: A terrible let down from walking in...this place is trying to save money by turning the heat down.  Kids meals are $6, tiny slider burger with a few fries...no wonder why it's free monday thur Thursday!   I ordered a burger done medium and it came out bloody...there was even blood saturating the bun!  Disgusting..no thank you! After I sent it back and asked for something else I was told "oh we won't charge you for the buger"...gee thanks!  No offee for anything else and barely an apology!  I had taken my family there one other time and it wasn't great then...I should have learned!  I should have also taken a hint that it wasn't a great place when only a few tables were taken on a Sat night!

21.description: This place absolutely sucks but because most of the restaurants in this neighborhood are subpar it gets by.The food has always been mediocre but it's an option to go to out of the 4 edible establishments in the vicinity.  Today we ate on the patio and from the moment we walked in to leaving both food and service were a huge miss.I stood in the entryway as a mousy server passed me multiple times without acknowledging my presence. Finally the bartender asked "can I help you?" I told him we needed a table outside then mousy server told us to sit wherever and she'd bring us menus.  We ordered iced tea and pepsi to drink, neither were refilled throughout the meals.  We had to go get our own silverware because we weren't given any.  The sweet potato tots (which are a $2.00 upgrade) were burnt to shit, looked to have exploded in the fryer and were happily served on both plates.  It's alarming the morons in the kitchen found it appropriate to even plate them and send them out.  I'm not a cheapass who looks for freebies but we really should not have even been charged for this crap.  Food sucked and service sucked.Won't be back.

17.description: We moved to Roscoe Village in October, and we've already eaten at Riverview three times.  I'm sold! First, the brunch is great, especially if you've had a rough night.  Excellent Bloody Mary with fun and tasty garnishes to hold you over until your breakfast arrives.  Both times we've been in for dinner were tasty; lots of good happy hour/weeknight specials, especially Tuesday nights, when the first 16 beers(!) on the draft list are $5 each.  Standouts include the Thai Crunch salad, the buffalo chicken sandwich, and the bacon n Brie burger.  Service can be a little slow, but the booths are comfy, it's dark and not too noisy for conversation, so settle in for dinner and a few beers.

10.description: this place was cool solely on the fact that I surprised my brother who I haven't seen in a good bit (over a year) for his bachelor party. He was confused, he cried, he punched me, he hugged me and then.. bought me drinks! Every beer that I had was on point - can't list them here for you as I dont remember but it was not disappointing. Also got some grub, a pizza and a wrap of some sort and both of those were good. I'd go back for sure! Cool vibe, has a back bar/ seating area as well as the main dining area - which i did not explore too much.

5.description: Would give it 0 stars if I could. Slow service, the restaurant wasn't even busy, our server never refilled our drinks. Won't be coming back.

3.description: This place absolutely sucks but because most of the restaurants in this neighborhood are subpar it gets by.The food has always been mediocre but it's an option to go to out of the 4 edible establishments in the vicinity.  Today we ate on the patio and from the moment we walked in to leaving both food and service were a huge miss.I stood in the entryway as a mousy server passed me multiple times without acknowledging my presence. Finally the bartender asked "can I help you?" I told him we needed a table outside then mousy server told us to sit wherever and she'd bring us menus.  We ordered iced tea and pepsi to drink, neither were refilled throughout the meals.  We had to go get our own silverware because we weren't given any.  The sweet potato tots (which are a $2.00 upgrade) were burnt to shit, looked to have exploded in the fryer and were happily served on both plates.  It's alarming the morons in the kitchen found it appropriate to even plate them and send them out.  I'm not a cheapass who looks for freebies but we really should not have even been charged for this crap.  Food sucked and service sucked.Won't be back.

35.description: I'll be honest, we've lived in Roscoe Village for years and didn't like Riverview.  HOWEVER, the food has gotten way better in the last year.  Their burgers and grill cheese are top notch.  At this point, I'd say they have the best food of the big four bars at the Damen/Roscoe intersection area.

19.description: I went here for the women of craft beer event on thurs may 21 as part of chicago craft beer week, i loved all the beers i had, and they were all reasonably priced, (tho idk if the festival or the bar priced them) the hawks were playing that night, so it got pretty packed, but i was still able to order at the bar without much trouble, we had seats which was clutch. I dont have any complaints, though i just dont know how much was thanks to the festival or the bar, either way i was satisfied

28.description: Awesome atmosphere - kid friendly. I had the jalapeño popper grilled cheese with sweet potato tater tots and a Two Brothers Pale Ale. Both were delicious!  Our server was knowledgeable and attentive.  We will definitely be back!

45.description: Food was decent, not too overpriced. However, service was horrible and based on the friend I'm staying with who eats here frequently, this is a common thing. We sat down and it took 10 minutes to get asked if we would like something to drink. Every time we asked for anything the waitress seemed extremely put out by the request.

33.description: Decent space deserves better.  Good beer list, just OK service.  Too dirty to consider going back and not a chance I'd order food in a place so desperate for a broom and mop.  Three words of advice: spring cleaning mandatory.

43.description: I've been here several times and have never had a bad meal. I love their grilled cheese, tots and bloody marys. I also really enjoy the old bar atmosphere. The one negative is that their service does suck, but it's in my neighborhood and I like the food, so keep coming back.

2.description: So I decided to stop in here for lunch before going to a later Cubs game. Had the Mac n cheese, salad, blantons, and some beers. My fellow Cubs fan had the grilled cheese. Food was amazing. Very good. Bartender was greatly helpful, chatty, personable, and seemed to have a great knowledge of what's going on in general. The only disappointing part... We left, hell bent on coming back after the game for mini corn dogs. The place was closed before midnight, while listing hours until 2. Loved the place, enjoyed the fresh food (most things, even ketchup are made in house) but wish I could have tried the damn mini corn dogs.

18.description: Great bar food. Love the Tatar tots and their burgers. We usually order pick up, and our items are always ready in just a few minutes. Efficient and delicious

41.description: We visited the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon. The atmosphere was nice but we walked in and waited five minutes before we even saw someone who worked here. After we were seated it took another ten minutes before we saw our waitress and after she took our order she didn't return for the entire meal. I had the Thai chicken tacos and they were good but needed more sauce (and I had to flag down the waitress to get some). My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and they were awful. The chicken was pressed thin and over breaded in some weirdly spicy coating and the waffles were nothing special. We were never offered water or drink refills and we were never asked how our food was. I have no desire to return here for overpriced food and bad service.

52.description: Been to Riverview a few times for dinner and drinks as well as early 11am brunches. Both seem to satisfy me! I've never had the opportunity to sit at the bar, however I've continuously enjoyed my time spent here. In my opinion, they have great food-I'm not usually picky when it comes to bar food anyway and the drinks were good too. The prices are average, the service is fine and the location is nice. Riverview's been my go-to for casual nights and late mornings!

50.description: Much improved over recent years. The draft selection is really great now, descent prices. You will not see miller lite or summer shandy on the draft list thank goodness. The burgers are a definitely better than the standard bar burger, best in roscoe village. Good atmosphere and friendly service.

4.description: Food is original and beer selection is good! Usually pretty low key so there is room for groups and a good view of tvs. They have darts!

6.description: It's old news that there are new owners and it's a different menu, so i am just going to update my review.  They offer a pretty wide beer selection.  Their burgers are quite tasty, especially the mini burgers.  On Wed, the mini burgers are $2 each and I had the black and blue and the Merkle's cheddar burger.  Since then I had the bacon brie burger and it was tasty too!  Their pizzas are so good.  I LOVE THE BALBOA PIZZA. I think it is one of the best thin crust pizzas I have ever had.  The bbq chicken pizza was good and I really liked the buffalo chicken pizza. The hummus is decent but comes with large pieces of red onion.  Do people really dip raw red onion in hummus and eat it?  I would rather more cucumber, tomato or pita bread than red onion.  They don't offer hummus in the "winter," but they still didn't have it when I went in June.  The grilled cheeses are really tasty too, and I think they do a special on Thursday nights. The tempura green beans are tasteless, no salt or any type of seasoning which was disappointing.  I would suggest staying away.  But pretty much everything else is really tasty.  I am rarely disappointed and we come here a lot.The trivia on Wednesday has much improved and we love the trivia host.  Love the outdoor seating as well.

22.description: It's old news that there are new owners and it's a different menu, so i am just going to update my review.  They offer a pretty wide beer selection.  Their burgers are quite tasty, especially the mini burgers.  On Wed, the mini burgers are $2 each and I had the black and blue and the Merkle's cheddar burger.  Since then I had the bacon brie burger and it was tasty too!  Their pizzas are so good.  I LOVE THE BALBOA PIZZA. I think it is one of the best thin crust pizzas I have ever had.  The bbq chicken pizza was good and I really liked the buffalo chicken pizza. The hummus is decent but comes with large pieces of red onion.  Do people really dip raw red onion in hummus and eat it?  I would rather more cucumber, tomato or pita bread than red onion.  They don't offer hummus in the "winter," but they still didn't have it when I went in June.  The grilled cheeses are really tasty too, and I think they do a special on Thursday nights. The tempura green beans are tasteless, no salt or any type of seasoning which was disappointing.  I would suggest staying away.  But pretty much everything else is really tasty.  I am rarely disappointed and we come here a lot.The trivia on Wednesday has much improved and we love the trivia host.  Love the outdoor seating as well.

15.description: Cocktails are nice. Service is spotty. The waitress was not knowledgable on the menu and specials, so I witnessed the bar manager talking down to her when she made mistakes. I would not recommend this place, although the patio seating is awesome!

57.description: Meh--relatively bare, it's service was almost deliberately bad. And, seating at the middle tables is prohibited unless you have 8 people, and all present (what is this, kindergarten?).

20.description: Cocktails are nice. Service is spotty. The waitress was not knowledgable on the menu and specials, so I witnessed the bar manager talking down to her when she made mistakes. I would not recommend this place, although the patio seating is awesome!

36.description: This place was awesome. I went there after the big blizzard of 2015, so everyone in there was kind of frazzled. The waitress was really nice though, and we were able to get a table for lunch right away. Anyways. My friends and I started with fried cheese curds with a spicy aioli sauce. That was super yummy. We were fighting over them by the end. There's also a section of gourmet grilled cheeses on their menu that was out of this world. For our main dish we ordered a spicy chicken wrap, the "yummy" grilled cheese (it comes with tomatoes and avocado but I went sans avocado) and the "savory" grilled cheese which included goat cheese and spices, among other things. The sides were tots and fries and we were all seriously pleased with the food. I'd order my meal again, hands down. Since this is only a few blocks away from my friend's apartment I'll probably be coming back again.

14.description: This place was awesome. I went there after the big blizzard of 2015, so everyone in there was kind of frazzled. The waitress was really nice though, and we were able to get a table for lunch right away. Anyways. My friends and I started with fried cheese curds with a spicy aioli sauce. That was super yummy. We were fighting over them by the end. There's also a section of gourmet grilled cheeses on their menu that was out of this world. For our main dish we ordered a spicy chicken wrap, the "yummy" grilled cheese (it comes with tomatoes and avocado but I went sans avocado) and the "savory" grilled cheese which included goat cheese and spices, among other things. The sides were tots and fries and we were all seriously pleased with the food. I'd order my meal again, hands down. Since this is only a few blocks away from my friend's apartment I'll probably be coming back again.

3.description: Overall a great Starbucks with friendly employees. Drinks have always been made correctly when I order. There is a nice quaint sitting area, but the area is fairly small.  There can be a long line at times, which moves slowly.  Love the ambiance of this Starbucks. Definitely a neighborhood favorite of mine.

1.description: They run a skeleton crew on a Monday morning, who does that?Today I witnessed two gentlemen running around doing all the work while one female with zero sense of urgency moved about the store at a glacial pace. They were completely out of napkins and I asked for them to be replenished and this just didn't happen. No one helped me or gave me a napkin with my breakfast sandwich and coffee that was spilled all over the side of my cup.  I just stood there waiting for over 4 minutes like a moron waiting for napkins that would never come.I even went to the bathroom to look for a napkin or two, none were in there either.The slow female worker came out at a glacial pace to assess the coffee bar situation and it's missing items and couldn't have cared less.  Lazy lazy lazy.Another patron brought me some napkins while I was waiting at the bus stop, what a nice woman.

0.description: Before work my hubby and I always or most of the time we stop by and get ourselves come coffee, great location, great attitude. Very nice baristas and stuff members! Even when the store was under construction everyone was so nice!

2.description: starbucks is starbucks ! but this one is a really cool looking one ! It feels like a unique coffee shop rather than a starbucks  . There are plenty of tables to study at , with outlets close by . There is a little red phone booth , that's very much like the kind they have in the UK . It lost one star due to the lighting , it's a little dark in there for studying . Their lighting seems to be showcasing the artwork and not much lighting going  towards the tables .

5.description: This location was pretty average.  I got what I wanted and they were very fast in providing my delicous drink right away.  The location was a lot smaller than most that i have been to in the past.  As long as they carry my coffee!  :)

6.description: Worst Starbucks Ive ever been to. To be fair it was a bit busy, 1-2 customers at a time. The guy taking drink orders was not only slow, he was rude. I waited patienly in line, ordered my drink and inquired about a to go mug that had no price. The gentleman made a face said he would need to look into it, sat it down and said next. I assumed when he finished with the customers he would look into it so I sat down and tried to enjoy my drink, which was handed to me messy--Im talking dripping down the side messy and the guy didnt even care. So I sat down and waited, waited, and waited. He finished with customers then proceeded to ignore me so I asked if he could get that price. He just said were out of iced coffee and walked into the back. Needless to say I sat there for nearly 30 minutes and I cant buy the travel mug I wanted. He still hasnt looked back in my direction. I like to think im understanding but I can honestly say I will never be back to this starbucks.

7.description: I love this Starbucks! It's like Cheers without the beer. They always know exactly what I want the minute I walk in the door. I wish it was a bit bigger. Sometimes hard to find a good seat. Oh and the bathroom is ALWAYS spotless. LOVE IT.

8.description: This is my go to spot after getting off the bus headed to work.  Friendly staff always offer a good morning or hello.  My morning stop consists of saying hi, they ask if I am having my regular, I say yes and then we chit chat smile while I pay and then move down to get my drink.Very enjoyable place even with the double wide strollers but they seem to steer clear of the working types in serious need of caffeine.For the most part when I am there it appears to be regulars cause they seem to know every ones' name and it is very lively  there during the morning rush.

9.description: Love love love the staff. I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could. I just wish it was a touch bigger. They always have the new stuff so that's great.

10.description: the starbucks on 5300 clark is way better

4.description: I'm in this starbucks about every other day. The guys that work there are really friendly. I get frustrated sometimes with the drink time when I'm trying to catch the bus but I am aware it's my fault trying to squeeze in my beverage when I really should have just walked in the door 5 minutes earlier to allow ample time. Always clean and I've never had any problems as far as not getting what I ordered.

29.description: stevo's is kind of my go-to place when i want late night delivery. their food isn't spectacular or anything (the fries are always soggy; learned that lesson), but their veggie wrap and greek salad make me feel not so guilty about late night indulgences. plus, delivery is always quick, which is a plus.

42.description: The service was great and fast.  The wings were okay...sauce isnt on the wings, but on the side.  The gyro was good, but a little on the dry side and I didnt experience the same piles of gyro meat like other reviewers.  Also, they skimped on the tzatziki sauce, i thought.  Overall, it was pretty much exactly what you would expect from a place like this.

23.description: I've never gotten delivery here, so I can't speak to the problems other seem to be having with their service.  I've been here a couple of times...sometimes sober, sometimes not, and it's pretty delicious in either state.  I've had the gyro, falafel, and onion rings, but haven't really branched out beyond that.  The gyro is no joke, the meat is flavorful and abundant, the pita is soft, and the sauce is full on creamy greek yogurty goodness.  The falafel was just a tick above average if I recall, but came with a really nice creamy sauce that was distinct from the gyro sauce.  When I walked in and saw the guy had flour all over the front of him I thought to myself "Girl, you better order onion rings."  Good call, because they definitely make them there and they are stellar.  Stevo's is pretty cheap too, so that adds to the appeal.  So it's not incredible, but it's solidly good late night people food.  Yup.

47.description: Slow delivery, so all my food was stale. Fries were overly salted, ice on my drink was completely melted. At least the burger was good, hence, the second star.

8.description: So we just ordered from here because it was close, we've ordered before, and they were decent. Ordered the gyros dinner,  well-done, to share since the menu said it came with fries and rice, mozzarella sticks, drinks, and a few other items. The gyro meat was barely browned (I ended up putting it in the toaster oven but it just tasted terrible) fries were soaked in grease, no rice, mozzarella sticks were almost inedible incredibly greasy and the cheese wasn't even melty it's like they took string cheese covered in batter and hoped for the best,  soda was flat and came without ice. I know it's a grease joint but this is over the top. Complete waste of money and the delivery driver didn't give me a receipt and he added his own dollar amount to the delivery fee so I'm not even sure if he charged correctly. Only "good" thing was the pita dipped in the tzaziki sauce.

31.description: Salad in general? I'll pay extra for romaine or mixed greens. Delivery time was average, food was great. I want to leave more stars but I can't. Maybe I'm spoiled by the option to eat more than iceberg. Other than that, awesome.

34.description: The gyros have little to no dressing and the meat is a little too crispy/crunchy for my liking. The amount of fries with the specials are pathetic. Straight facts.

16.description: Ordered from Grub Hub around 7:20 and was given an ETA of 8:35. I had not received my delivery by 8:45 so i called and got a new delivery time of 9:07. Food arrived at 9:27. Horrible timing for a couple of hot dogs and a gyro.  I will never order from them again!

13.description: I'm a very big fan of this place, it's my go to for that "I just got home after a long night of (a) drinking (b) working" hunger. I did expect the place to be a bit sketchy and kind of gross the first time I drunkenly Grubhub'ed it, but I was beyond surprised at how awesome it actually was. The wraps are on point, every side I've ever ordered is just what I want it to be. And the delivery drivers are really chill. I would recommend this place to anyone who really needs food at 2am or 2pm for that matter. I love you Stevo's Grill, I love you.

11.description: I've never gotten delivery here, so I can't speak to the problems other seem to be having with their service.  I've been here a couple of times...sometimes sober, sometimes not, and it's pretty delicious in either state.  I've had the gyro, falafel, and onion rings, but haven't really branched out beyond that.  The gyro is no joke, the meat is flavorful and abundant, the pita is soft, and the sauce is full on creamy greek yogurty goodness.  The falafel was just a tick above average if I recall, but came with a really nice creamy sauce that was distinct from the gyro sauce.  When I walked in and saw the guy had flour all over the front of him I thought to myself "Girl, you better order onion rings."  Good call, because they definitely make them there and they are stellar.  Stevo's is pretty cheap too, so that adds to the appeal.  So it's not incredible, but it's solidly good late night people food.  Yup.

39.description: This is a small hole in the wall, so don't expect a fancy setting.  but the food is awesome.  I was told by the owners, most of everythig, the Shawerma, pizza, is truely home made.  meaning they marinate the stuff and prepare it at home.  other things like hot dogs and french fries are bought from high quality resturant suppliers.When you taste the food, you can tell the quality through the taste.  I tasted a coupld of things, like the chicken Shawerma and falafel, and they are really amazing.  I didn't bother with the store purchased items, I wasn't looking for that.  I can get that stuff anywhere else.I highly recommend it.

37.description: Gyros are awesome!  They make it crispy, and give you piles of meat. -1star for the fries, not crispy.

0.description: Based on reviews, I tried it twice and spaced visits over the course of many months.  I tend to drink in the area and like to soak up in local food after some great beers.  Regarding their fast food, I don't get quite get where their high marks come from.  It's fast food which isn't rocket science and I found it pretty average.

38.description: I took a chance on this place and ordered delivery online.The food itself was pretty mediocre.  The service was terrible.  I ordered mozzarella sticks, garlic bread, and a slice of cheese pizza -- nothing that takes very long to prepare, right?  My house is only about 2-3 miles from Stevo's; far enough that I don't want to walk, but only about a 10-15 minute drive.  I waited two and a half hours for delivery.  After the first hour and a half, I called, and the woman who answered the phone told me the delivery guy had grabbed the wrong order and had come back to get mine.  According to her, he was heading out the door as we spoke.  It still took another hour for him to get to my place.  I rarely complain about delivery guys taking too long and often tune out reviews that complain about late deliveries, but that's pretty ridiculous.The food itself was pretty mediocre.  It may have been better had it not arrived rather cold and soggy.  After popping it all in the microwave, the mozzarella sticks were decent.  The pizza and garlic bread were so-so at best.  I wasn't expecting anything great, since the food was cheap.  The whole order cost $5.58, although after tax, delivery fee, and tip (which I left online, not knowing I'd be waiting for two and a half hours), it was about twice that much.Overall:  this is mediocre food at a good price (which, to me, is not necessarily a bad thing).  Unfortunately, the delivery service sucks (although one can hope that my experience was an aberration).

27.description: Just... don't go here. Tony's Burrito Mex and Man-Jo-Vin's are three blocks away and they are much better.Ordered a slice of pizza from here and, in plain view, the cashier picked something off of it with her fingernail and handed the slice to me. I'm not uptight, but come on now.

32.description: This was the first time I ordered from Stevo's, and I would say overall it's a good option for a quick and affordable bite to eat. The delivery arrived in under 20 minutes (I do live around the corner, but still- that's quick service!) and it arrived warm. I ordered fries and a falafal wrap. The fries were really crispy and delicious, and the falafal wrap was good, but not great. The guy that delivered my order was also very kind- a nice bonus.

48.description: Amazing place wether I walk-in and order, or order through grubhub and have it deliverd or pick up, I always receive the best quality food. I have tried their Sausage pizza, their burgers, fries, and even chicken Kabob and they are always top Notch. I love it. It's about a 5 min walk from my house. The place always looks clean. I have met the Owner/Manager there and she is very nice person. I feel you should give it a shot believe me you won't regret it!

44.description: i recently stumbled upon stevo's grill while walking down belmont i had'nt had a decent gyro for awhile and decided to give this place a shot.i was more than happy i could'nt beleive the amount of gyro meat they put on the sandwich everything was fresh it was absolutly delicious.about 3 days later i was sitting at home and you guessed it i needed a stevo's grill fix i decided to try their chicken shawarma i had seen it next to the gyro spit wow was it good i also got a oreo shake and slice of sausage pizza im still licking my fingers.btw the delivery driver was super fast and one of the nicest i've had for awhile would defintly recommend delivery.next im going to try the falafal sandwich and chicken taco's.this is my new favorite place i cant wait to go through the menu and try everything.if your looking for good chicago style food done right at a reasonable price you cant beat stevo's grill.YUMMERS :)

24.description: Not a coincidence that there are multiple complaints about the delivery process that this place uses as the wait time is ridiculous considering the minimum amount of prep work required but also I've had issues with them not sending my entire order, then when calling them to tell them they say they will send it out in less than 10 minutes.  45 minutes later (I live 10 minutes away) and still nothing, so instead I have to call and tell them to forget it and eat the cost of the food I paid for that they didn't deliver.  Goes to show that just because you know how to out together some decent food doesn't mean you have enough business sense to put together a functioning establishment.  It's an easy fix but something tells me it's not going to change.  So if time is no issue and you don't care if you get everything you order, by all means this is your place!

7.description: Not sure why there's so many negative reviews about this place but I've eaten here twice and have found the food to be good, the prices affordable, and the restaurant to be very clean compared to similar establishments. I've tried the chicken gyros and hot dog and found both to be quite good, fries also hit the spot.

40.description: Delivery was about twenty minutes late. I was ready to write a bad review, but then I ate my crispy chicken sandwich and cheese fries. The chicken was crispy and still hot, with plenty of fresh lettuce and a decent slice of fresh tomato. The fries weren't as skinny as McDonald's, but did taste similarly. They weren't really crispy but had great flavor. The food is good and worth the price. Good service too. Someone from the kitchen actually called to let me know they were running late.

30.description: A few nights ago, I used GrubHub to order some food from here.  Because my buzzer is broken, I included my number and asked to be called when my food arrived.  About an hour later, the delivery driver called to tell me he was waiting outside.  I headed out to see a car with three men in it (including the delivery driver) waiting outside my apartment.  I didn't think it was a big deal, so I paid for my food and went back inside.  About a minute later, I got a text from the same number that had called me to tell me my food was there.  I won't include what the text message said, but it could definitely be filed under sexual harassment.  I immediately called the restaurant and asked to speak with a manager.  I was not given a manager and only talked to the woman who answered the phone, who said that the number didn't belong to any of the drivers and I must be mistaken.  Except the SAME number that called me to tell me my food had arrived was the one that later texted me.  If it didn't belong to the delivery driver, it belonged to one of the other men in the car, meaning he gave my number out.  Since the woman I spoke to refused to do anything, I had my boyfriend call again the next day.  This time he did speak to a manager, who ALSO refused to do anything about the situation.  I wasn't even offered something as little as a refund or a free meal.  I was basically told that they were sorry, but it wasn't their problem.The food was mediocre, but I can't even begin to fathom re-ordering from a restaurant that allows their drivers to give out private cell phone numbers to sexually harass customers.

46.description: Though I live in east Lincoln Park about 2.5 miles away from this restaurant, I never hesitate to place an order or drive for 10 minutes to get the best Falafel in this area.  Food is always great. The Gyros, and Shawerma are excellent.  And they have great Pizza too.  The owners are super nice and friendly.  Their prices are also very reasonable!  I really wish it were closer, because I would eat there everyday!  Would definitely recommend this place!

1.description: It took this place an hour and a half to make chicken fingers that were obviously just frozen tenders thrown in a deep fryer. But at least when I called and complained, the guy gave me a free piece of cake.

9.description: If I could give this place zero stars ,  totally would !!!I placed a order exactly at 2:09. Ok, I'll wait a hour that's fine. Still no food at 3:10. I call them 315 cause my food has yet to be here.Then he tells me the driver is on his way. Cool.I can't go on break past 330, I explained this to the guy. He says will get there. It is 330, the guy calls me saying he's just now leaving the restaurant.  Thanks to him, I cannot eat on my break nor at all til I get out at 510. Nice customer service..Instead of being apologetic,  he just says ok.I will never be ordering from this place ever again.

26.description: The food was super delicious and the staff was really nice! It was also really clean which I was pleasantly surprised by. Prices are really good. And the fact that they're open til 5am on Friday and Saturday is a HUGE plus. I'll definitely be going back again.

25.description: Not sure how the two things (under $6) that I got delivered ended up being $13 and took over an hour to be delivered--yelp says I am .6 miles away. I called twice to make sure I still had it coming (one time 5 minutes before they closed) and both times they told be my order was ready and just waiting on the driver.  Thank you for letting me know my food has been sitting for at least 20 minutes. Super excited for my late night food. Next time my desperation for substance might make me just settle for a mystery leftover in my freezer.

12.description: I ordered delivery for the first time here. I got cheesesteak sandwich, fries and strawberry shake. All were quite good. No mayo on sandwich which would have made it better. Fries were not greasy at all which is important to me. Strawberry shake was also quite tasty. Delivery took 75 minutes.

21.description: Good food. Great prices. Timely delivery. What more can you ask for? I love their burger specials and pizza. I highly recommend. I order all the time.

17.description: This was my first and only time trying out this place, and let me just say, I'm not impressed in any way. I ordered for delivery through Grub Hub. The chicken in the chicken strips were good, but burnt, as though they left them in the fryer for too long. The bacon on the burger was soggy, and the bread fell apart in my hands too easily. Finally, they forgot to put the side of cheese for my cheese fries. I tried the fries before even calling and they just had no flavor. Maybe not enough spices, if any. I called Grub Hub to let them know I was missing the cheese, and they called back saying that when they advised the restaurant about it, the owner said he had bagged it up himself and he knows he put the side of cheese in there. Grub Hub very kindly offered me free grub, but when I hung up, I got to thinking, that it most likely wasn't the Grub Hub driver's fault. The bag was large enough to have all the food fit comfortably in there, and there was more than enough room for a side of cheese. Also, the bag was stapled shut when I received it. I decide to call the restaurant, and I spoke with a man named Jose, who stated he was the cook. I proceeded to tell him about the situation, and he 'kindly' interrupts me and says he doesn't know what happened, because he bagged it himself and he KNOWS he put the cheese in there, but that he can send someone to deliver the cheese to me. I explained to him the fries have already been thrown away so there would be no point in getting the cheese at this point, and he says he'll send me over the fries as well. At this point I'm not as starving as I was before I got the food, and I simply wanted a refund for the cheese fries. He said something along the lines of, "Call Grub Hub for a refund. We can't do anything about it, except send you some more fries." Being in the restaurant industry myself, this is already something I would personally be highly upset about if one of my employees had responded to a customer in this way. I remembered the Grub Hub representative telling me that she had spoken with the 'owner' and that the 'owner' had bagged up my order himself, so I asked Jose if he was the owner, and he said no, he was simply the cook. So I immediately asked to speak with a supervisor or someone above him, and he said no one was there except him and no one would be there until 10pm. That explains why this restaurant may not be doing so well. I left my information and asked him to have them contact me as son as they could. I'm more than positive I'm not getting a phone call from them, and if I do, they'll most likely have the same response I got from this cook, Jose. Honestly, it wasn't the worst food ever, but in hindsight, I should've just gone to McDonald's to avoid all this disappointing mess. Mediocre food, plus awful customer service, doesn't belong in Chicago. I would give this place a second chance, but I feel like they're already set in their ways. Try at your own risk, but I know I'll keep my distance from this place.

10.description: If I could give less stars I definitely would. This place was the worst. I waited for my delivery for almost 2 hrs, and when the food finally got here it was cold. I would strongly suggest another Mediterranean place over this spot any day of the week.

5.description: It was OK. Pretty good hot dog though the bun definitely tasted microwaved. I ordered cheese fries but received no cheese. And the soda seems a bit watered down even with no ice. Basically, make sure you're black out drunk if you order from here so you don't know what was left out or how odd some things may taste. Sober people, you're better off elsewhere.

3.description: I used grub hub and ordered a gyro plate and 2 hot dogs. I was given a time of 7:45 delivery. About An hour. Perfect! Right?? NOT I get a call at 8:20- not to tell me that he is downstairs but to tell me he is just leaving the restaurant... I completely understand if they are swamped, short staffed- whatever the case is. I'd be very understanding if they called me maybe 20 minutes after having my order? Not 35 minutes AFTER my food should have been delivered. It's just bad business. Call customers ASAP and let them know of a delay. Maybe delivery isn't their thing? Who knows.. The food wasn't even bad. Which is the most annoying part. I'd love to order from them all the time but after this first order. I'm just super turned off.

35.description: Me and a coworker ordered from here some weeks ago and by my standards it was pretty good! I had the grilled chicken sandwich and he had a philly cheesesteak...the grilled chicken was pretty good...came with everything I wanted and the only draw back might be the salt on the fries. If you're concerned aout blood pressure and bed sweat then these are for you. Other than that it was pretty good.....oh...the delivery time is horrid though. Better off with a Flintstone vehicle.

19.description: Fuck this place, the food is shitty and I made about $4 an hour working there. Just bad people.

28.description: wicked fast delivery, everything in the large order was correct, nothing was forgotton and the food is totally acceptable after a long night of partying. Im in river north and the food was HOT on delivery. Delish.

45.description: Who ever didn't try out Stevo's Grill is sure missing out! ITS PERFECTION! I usually order the gyro and wow it just melts in your mouth! So GOOD! I also tried the chicken gyro as well! Amazing service with great food = a place worth trying and believe me you will get hooked! Did I mention great food? mmm! Also great prices! Going back for more!

33.description: I got some late night delivery.  The chili dog was really tasty, definitely a cut above your average diner fare.  The food arrived hot and ahead of schedule, and the driver was courteous.  Will definitely come here again to satisfy my craving for a dog.

43.description: This place is a couple blocks away from where I work. I've ordered from them a couple times. The good: Italian beef sandwich on garlic bread with mozarella and hot peppers was on point! Food got here nice and hot. Fries were good and thin like McDonald fries too! My pop was nice and crisp with easy Ice--Job well done Stevo's!! The Bad- I ordered a hot dog today. It wasn't that great (the fries made up for it. ) I'll definitely order from this place again But NOTE TO SELF AND FELLOW REVIEWERS: The Hot Dog's are not worth ordering! (Fail.) All in all I guess you get what you pay for with this place. They are decent.

2.description: From the Gyros to the Cheese Fries I am happy every time. Brings me back to the 90s. It's cheap and you'll never be hungry afterwards!!!

18.description: Not sure how the two things (under $6) that I got delivered ended up being $13 and took over an hour to be delivered--yelp says I am .6 miles away. I called twice to make sure I still had it coming (one time 5 minutes before they closed) and both times they told be my order was ready and just waiting on the driver.  Thank you for letting me know my food has been sitting for at least 20 minutes. Super excited for my late night food. Next time my desperation for substance might make me just settle for a mystery leftover in my freezer.

41.description: Wow, this usually doesn't happen. From 5 stars to 2 stars? What happened? Well, I ordered the exact same pizza as last time. Here's what happened:The pizza was not good. I'm not sure, but our conclusion was that the cheese tasted old. This still would have been a 3-star pizza if the next thing didn't happen:They forgot the pepperoni. How do you forget the pepperoni!?!?! I have the Grubhub order, I double-checked after I received the pie. It's not the end of the world, but it is disappointing to order a peperoni pizza and not get what you order.

4.description: DO NOT EAT HERE! I have gotten sick (vomiting and diarrhea) the last two times I ordered from this place. It's dirty, always smells like old mop water and takes way too long to make a simple cheeseburger (that still didn't have the correct toppings on it). STAY AWAY!

6.description: Now, to be fair, my husband and I usually order delivery from here after a couple adult beverages.  However, I am always pleased with the food.  It is quality fast/fried food from my experience.  I love their pizza puffs, they are perfectly golden and delicious (yes, some places can actually screw up a pizza puff)  I also thoroughly enjoy their mozzarella sticks.  Everything else we have ordered has been good too!  The only weird thing is that they only accept online orders through grub hub for delivery. I find this weird because don't they have to compensate Grub Hub?  You would think they would appreciate the direct call...they d not. I am not looking for gourmet when I order, I am looking for solid food delivered in a timely manner and Steve-o's provides that.  I just think they should consider the benefits of accepting phone orders.

22.description: Awful. Never ordering from here again. It took well over an hour to arrive. The order arrived incomplete and soggy. The delivery driver was rude and would not come to the door. I called asking where the rest of my order was.... I'm still here waiting 45 minutes later! On top of everything the food tasted like trash, how do u mess up fried shrimp and French fries?

15.description: My roommate and I order from Stevo's constantly. The delivery is usually pretty slow, but we don't really mind. The driver tends to be a sweet older man.  The food is exactly what you expect. If you're ordering a hot dog and fries, you're going to get a hot dog and fries. Not a gourmet meal. I don't think this place pretends to be a fancy 5 star, so why hold it to those standards? We like the convenience, the prices, and the food.

20.description: My roommate and I order from Stevo's constantly. The delivery is usually pretty slow, but we don't really mind. The driver tends to be a sweet older man.  The food is exactly what you expect. If you're ordering a hot dog and fries, you're going to get a hot dog and fries. Not a gourmet meal. I don't think this place pretends to be a fancy 5 star, so why hold it to those standards? We like the convenience, the prices, and the food.

36.description: It's a typical hamburger/hot dog/gyro joint, but I've found their price-to-quality ratio pretty good for the area.  I've only ever eaten in, so I can't comment on the delivery quality.  The inside is pretty clean for a place like this, though there's only enough seating for maybe ~20 people?  On the other hand, it's usually not that busy dining in, at least during lunch.

14.description: If you want late night delivery that's solid enough and gets there neck-breakingly quick, Stevos. Stevos every time. Every god damn time

58.description: Fair at best. John's Place offers cheapo specials here during the week- like $3 tacos. At $3 they're a bargain at 1/2 the price. Where's the protein?  Nothing tastes homemade here. More like it's off the Sysco food service truck. The do have a dent veggie burger. But if I want a veggie burger, I'll go down the street to Victory's Banner.  I've wound up here when the wait at Piazza Bella is too long. I've always regretted eating here.

56.description: A serious stable. Chop salad was amazing, so was the shrimp and quinoa salad, and soups. Seriously, what isn't good here? The burger was solid. It's nothing too fancy, just good food and comfortable and tasty interior.

29.description: Loved.  Get out there before summer ends to enjoy the outdoor deck. Then order a $5 beer on  tap and get the guac with chips to start. Get the cowboy burger, shrimp & crab roll, lamb frat bread with taziki sauce, or cowboy burger. All very good. Pick from a choice of reg or sweet potato fries. Very good. Would come here again. We all loved our food, drinks, service, and atmosphere here here.

42.description: Cute neighborhood spot! It was brunch-o'clock on a Sunday, and it was busy, but no wait! Definitely a lot of breeders - babies/toddlers galore, but it was still comfortable. I had a craving for a turkey burger, but didn't want to go to a pub this particular day and John's Place satisfied my craving! The turkey burger was juicy and well spiced. The sweet potato fries were really good too. My hubby got a regular burger and said it was really good, better than he expected. Only thing that could have made the burgers better - pretzel buns! The bread was okay but not pretzel bun good :) I would happily come back here for brunch or lunch. Nice relaxed atmosphere with a neighborhood feel. Delivers with good food and service too.

23.description: YAWN..... bland as hell. My stomach was in a huge knot and it ached after I ate the breakfast burrito. Carry a bottle of hot sauce if you plan to go in and dine on dry, bland kibble. What is the big deal about this place? The staff was nice, though.

47.description: Great service. Freindly and clean.  Presentation of the food was not awesome.  But what really got me was the price.  15 dollar fish tacos? 12 dollar salads with iceberg lettuce.  Thanks but no thanks.

8.description: John's is my neighborhood brunch spot. I've never been here on anything other than a Saturday or Sunday morning to sit outside with the pooch and a friend or two and watch the day go by. All my meals have been very substantial and very delicious.

31.description: Enjoyed my first time here . My friend had the Johns Scramble and really enjoyed it. French toast with cinnamon was also good, but the butter had a layer to it so the separation was just a bit unappetizing. I think I had the cowboy and thought it was a good burger - not the best, but a good burger. Overall, it met my expectations, and I did like the challah french toast. It didn't blow me away, but it was decent. A bit pricey for burgers and salad though in my opinion.

34.description: Ate a late lunch here with some friends. We sat outside and was seated right away. I ordered challa French toast and Johns Scrambled. The French Toast was delicious with just a hint of cinnamon. Although the butter wasn't as fresh. The JS was very tasty. The potatoes were a bit dry but still good. Service was fine. John the owner came by to say hello. I will be back!

16.description: Johns place has been my favorite restaurant in this neighborhood.  I'm in it for the easygoing, American, comfort food.  They have good outdoor seating and are doggy friendly.  John, who must own the place always seems to be around too.  It's a good spot.

13.description: Loved the bread pudding French toast... Highly recommend for everyone to try it. Our server Paul was very friendly!

11.description: Friday night city excursion...Our waiter deserves a trophy after serving my grouchy hungry kids and two parents who were at their wits end just wanting to get them fed. We fought hard and were determined to stop at a cool city restaurant in our old hood, when the truth is my kids were obsessed with getting a calzone from Pockets. Okay... no. Not never, just not tonight.I remembered John's Place on Webster being super family-friendly, and so I was hoping the vibe would be the same here. I figured as much, being in Roscoe Village and all, but I called ahead to see if they had a kids menu. Yep! Score! We made the stop in, two tired hungry kids who were ready to kill each other at this point, and thankfully we found an open table. It was refreshing to walk past other families dining. We grabbed the kids menu and got to ordering right away. I was impressed with the options (see menu picture), but it's hard with growing eight-year old boys who require basically adult-sized portions, but not quite. Once the half-cup of water came out for them, we knew we were in trouble and decided to order a bunch of things off the kids menu for variety. Our waiter was super helpful to guide us with the perfect sides that they could split and mix up to make their experience fun. We ordered sliders for each of them and then a side of fries and mac n' cheese. Perfect! Of course we had to be careful to separate everything equally and not mix any spit (their request), but we managed with the request of an extra plate. I must say, the mac n' cheese rocks! It's well-seasoned and super gourmet. We ordered fried cheese curds for the table, and I want one right now as I'm writing this! Lightly fried in a batter mixed with onions to make the flavor supreme. I ordered a turkey burger with fresh greens, Merkt's cheddar, mushrooms and avocado. Sadly, the burger wasn't for my taste buds. Just too rich and garlicky, but I tried. Hubby got the veggie wrap, and it was a ginormous portion with hummus and all sorts of veggies inside. John's Place was the first place I had ever tried a sweet potato fry in my life (many years ago), so of course I ordered those up as my side. Still soft and basic so you can really taste the potato. Overall, our experience was lovely. But it was time to go after my son took my lemon and put it in his mouth like a boxer's mouth guard and pretended to start boxing. I don't have obnoxious kids, I really don't, but at this point we were just done. Still love you John's Place. We will be back!

39.description: Might be unfair to review a place based on 1 dish but the Drunken Chicken looked so good on the menu and was a definite miss. It was not very flavorful OR juicy. Needed to use hot sauce to flavor it up...never a good sign. I love goat cheese and love mashed potatoes, but the goat cheese mashed potatoes were also not too great. I might be back to try something else. Service was very good.

37.description: I used to eat at the John's in Lincoln Park and always had a wonderful experience. Not so here. You're immediately presented with a sign that forbids you to enter with a drink, presumably coffee, from another establishment. So, they would prefer I go somewhere else? Rather than be pleased that I've chosen to eat here after picking up my favorite drink, they're just going to piss me off. So I ignored it, and the hostess was really rude about. Accept the fact that people like other coffee and welcome that. It's an offensive, off putting sign sign to read the minute you walk in. Talk about negative vibes. Then the next sign you said informs you that kids aren't allowed to run around. What are they going to complain about next? Our looks? Our clothes? You see where I'm going.

0.description: It was a dark and stormy night (no really,  it was!) and I was killing time before meeting some friends so I stopped by this corner restaurant looking for some conversation and to get out of the rain. Even though I didn't have any of the kitchen's faire, I can tell I want to come back to this place next week. The hostess and bar tender were two of the nicest, genuine people you will meet in hospitality, and certainly the most welcoming when you come out of the rain for some delicious comfort food. I'll update next week when I get dinner, but they already have in 5 stars for being a safe harbor and a warm light in Roscoe Village.

38.description: Outstanding brunch spot. Have been here many times and will continue to go back. Friendly staff, good seating, kid friendly, excellent menu. The omelets are outstanding.

51.description: We were in town for my brother's bachelor party and stopped in here for brunch before heading out of town. As for the breakfast menu, they had some great options with creativity and your usual "eggs and bacon". I believe the concept is farm fresh food here. I am sure there is a difference but its probably more in your head. I can never tell in the taste department. The food was good- came out timely even with a new waitress and a large group. Portions are about right, not too much and just enough. Coffee was good- I am sure dirt water with caffeine in it would have been acceptable this day though. Overall, solid food. Nothing too exceptional.

27.description: I really want to love this place. However, it's not my favorite in the neighborhood. I think John's has a lot of potential however the atmospher, and food is lacking. I will give major kudos for the chili, it has to be the best in the city and I'll give it three stars for it.

32.description: I am a fan of John's Place.  They serve a solid burger and a good brunch.  I have even done their taco night and thought that was pretty good.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and the artwork is cool.  The staff is terrific - they are always very pleasant and smiling which I imagine must be hard at times since the place is so kid friendly!  My kids love going here too.  If the fried cheese curds are on the menu they are a must try, as is the blondie sundae!

54.description: This place is wonderful. we were from out of town and picked it based on a yelp review. We were not disappointed.

48.description: Finally had an opportunity to try items on new weekend brunch menu -- although they introduced it a few months ago.  Breakfast sandwich is awesome!!! Might actually replace the breakfast burrito as my favorite.  Holy Grayle (sp?  I know they gave it some funky spelling) was a nice adult beverage to get me through a late Saturday morning.  I had to have two!!  I know everyone gripes about all the little kids at this place during certain times of the day.  Not John's fault -- parents should teach better manners and realize this is not their personal playground or day care.  The staff here is beyond professional and friendly -- they really add to the experience and another reason I keep coming back.  This is one of my all-time favorite casual spots in Chicago.  Keep up the quality, friendliness and great work!!

44.description: Stopped by for brunch and had a pleasant experience. My fiancé and I had plans originally to have brunch elsewhere but John's Place didn't have any wait which is nice for a Sunday and at the same token kind of odd. We shared a fried egg sandwich which was ok. The sandwich wasn't good or bad it was a regular sandwich nothing spectacular. We also shared the s'mores French toast and we're really happy with that. It was a huge portion so if you're gonna eat it alone you'll have left overs. The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the service. Our waitress wasn't very attentive and my fiancé had to get up and actually hunt her down to ask for napkins.

24.description: Friday night city excursion...Our waiter deserves a trophy after serving my grouchy hungry kids and two parents who were at their wits end just wanting to get them fed. We fought hard and were determined to stop at a cool city restaurant in our old hood, when the truth is my kids were obsessed with getting a calzone from Pockets. Okay... no. Not never, just not tonight.I remembered John's Place on Webster being super family-friendly, and so I was hoping the vibe would be the same here. I figured as much, being in Roscoe Village and all, but I called ahead to see if they had a kids menu. Yep! Score! Once the half-cup of water came out for them, we knew we were in trouble and decided to order a bunch of things off the kids menu for variety. We ordered sliders for each of them and then a side of fries and mac n' cheese. Perfect! It's well-seasoned and super gourmet. We ordered fried cheese curds for the table, and I want one right now as I'm writing this! Lightly fried in a batter mixed with onions to make the flavor supreme. I ordered a turkey burger with fresh greens, Merkt's cheddar, mushrooms and avocado. Sadly, the burger wasn't for my taste buds. Just too rich and garlicky, but I tried. Hubby got the veggie wrap, and it was a ginormous portion with hummus and all sorts of veggies inside. John's Place was the first place I had ever tried a sweet potato fry in my life (many years ago), so of course I ordered those up as my side. Still soft and basic so you can really taste the potato. Overall, our experience was lovely. But it was time to go after my son took my lemon and put it in his mouth like a boxer's mouth guard and pretended to start boxing. I don't have obnoxious kids, I really don't, but at this point we were just done. Still love you John's Place. We will be back!

7.description: This is my favorite brunch place in Roscoe, maybe even in Chicago. The prices are reasonable, the service is always excellent, as is the food. I always get the Huevos Rancheros, and It is consistently great. I bring all my friends here when they come in from out of town, and they all have enjoyed it. Outdoor seating during the summer is awesome!

49.description: We've been going to John's since moving to the neighborhood about 5 years ago.  It was a solid, neighborhood go-to joint with great service and good food at a decent price.  But as the menu has changed we've noticed food quality and quantity steadily going down while prices rose drastically.  Average burger/sandwich is now $12-$14 which is pricey for a great burger, and just plain silly for a mediocre one.But one thing that always go to us...  At one point we were in there several times a week, sometimes twice in one day when I didn't feel like cooking!  The staff knew us by name, and John saw us there regularly.  Yet he never ONCE comped a single thing or so much as offered us a drink on the house.  Seriously?  I'm no expert but I would think a free drink every 5 years or so might be worth keeping some business :)  We go back maybe once a month now and all it does is remind of us why we don't go any more.  Doesn't seem so busy these days either.  Hopefully John will get the hint and make some changes.

40.description: Above average burger! But more importantly the water was fresh, refilled often and well iced.

53.description: Another brunch place tested out and I give it four stars.After driving by this place countless times I figured it was about time to check it out. Overall I was really happy with the experience. The brunch menu is not as extensive as some other "brunch" places, but there were a nice variety of options that would please most palates. My friend and I got the Mexican hash, which was tasty. Two eggs, chicken, diced potatoes, chihuahua cheese and some other spices (I think). It was filling without making me feel like I could blow up. Always appreciated.Given that I have a ton of places to check off my brunch places list I probably won't be back soon, but if you're looking for a decent place, without a super long wait, that has ample outdoor seating, this is a good option.

30.description: My boyfriend and I were looking for a good place to have a burger a couple weeks ago on a Monday evening around 4:30pm. When we were seated, there was one other couple seated towards the front with their toddler. We ordered our drinks and placed a food order for A Cowboy burger with chips, and a Roscoe burger with sweet potato fries. Shortly after that, another coupe sits down at the booth next to us, and puts a food order for 2 burgers in right away. The server gets another table seated up front, and a food runner brings our order out- to the couple in the booth next to us. Our server goes to check on how their food is, and they inform him that it isn't what they ordered. The server looks slightly panicked and then looks at us (and yes we can clearly hear this exchange of events). He asks the couple if they had touched the plates, they say yes and they're sorry..... He proceeds to pick up the plates and then set them down in front of us while promising that the other couple "NEVER touched the plates"..... I'm pregnant, and I was hungry enough to eat my own arm off, so we didn't say anything to our waiter about the mix up right then and there, but in retrospect, we should have. I used to wait tables, and understand that mistakes happen- but his bold face lie about the fact that the other couple had never touched the plates when we could clearly hear that they had was not only a sanitation issue, but completely unprofessional as well. I would've rather waited for a plate that hadn't been touched on by others. The food was decent, but his plate was served to us with regular french fries instead of chips, and the burgers were both ordered medium, and cooked well. They were both so charred on the outside that it kind of interfered with tasting any of the other flavors on the food. We probably would give this place another shot, if it weren't for the complete lack of service. Left a bad taste in our mouths for sure.

46.description: A friend and I went to John's Place during Oysterfest ready to chow down on some oysters. We ordered a dozen and 2 glasses of Sangria.The Sangria was delicious, but the oysters were awful. They came stacked on top of eachother, at room temperature, and were super gritty. To top it off, more than one was green. We ate 8 (4 each) before uncovering the really horrible looking ones that were conveniently buried at the bottom.The waiter finally came by to give us a bill (this is the second time we saw him that afternoon). We showed him the remaining oysters which he called "natural" and he delivered the bill charging us in full for everything. $50 for 2 small (but yummy) glasses of Sangria, 8 edible oysters, 4 "natural" oysters, and sub-par service.

1.description: Roscoe Village village has plenty of options for a nice weekend brunch, but John's Place with one of my favorites when I lived in the neighborhood.  The service is always friendly, and the food was always good. Roscoe Village is a very family friendly area so there may be a lot of kids there when you visit. If lots of strollers don't bother you then John's place is a lovely place to have lunch. I would highly recommend the crab and shrimp roll!

55.description: This morning I pulled up the online menu for John's Placeand after being on Special K Breakfasts for awhile I thoughttoday was the day I would spoil myself with a great breakfast.Alas, when myself and my friend Linda arrived we were handeda very limited lunch menu, so I asked about breakfast..No Breakfast/Brunch until the weekends.. Now why I thoughtthat breakfast/brunch menus would be available throughout the whole week,God only knows!Maybe because I read all these delicious breakfast/brunch menuoptions on their online menu..Okay.. so.. I will admit this irritated me because I had truly wantedbreakfast but obviously this was not meant to be.So.. we had "lunch" which consisted of a Bacon Cheeseburger for methat was a tad overcooked and a B-Bque Sandwich for my friend Linda.My burger was edible, but.. not totally enjoyable.Decent hand cut fries.Pretty good service.But.. for the record.. would I make another trip out here for lunch?No..Still want to try menu items off the brunch menu though..I  will just have to remember.. only on the weekends..

9.description: Our waitress was excellent and prices are reasonable. My margarita tasted like orange juice only. Food seemed frozen/ pre cooked but there was a nice atmosphere.

26.description: After an evening of beer drinking and jousting at the Oyster Fest, I wandered into John's Place with some friends since they were one of the last locations that had oysters left. The place was packed as well as the outdoor seating areas, but it was a great atmosphere. I had a great waitress who quickly ushered us out an order of a half dozen oysters and she even tolerated my annoying Brother, whose jokes can be funny but slightly offensive/creepish! I didnt like that they didnt have melted butter for the oysters, but, oh well!I love them though because I actually ended up leaving my tablet here by mistake (well, my Brother did) and John actually took it and kept it for us! I was terrified initially since I had no idea where we couldve put it down at or who couldve picked it up! Needless to say, it is safe and sound back in my possession.I just saw that they have Saturday and Sunday brunch as well; Ill be checking that out soon!

25.description: Crab and Shrimp Roll. That's all I need to say. Better than any lobster roll I have ever had. Big chunks of crab and fresh quality tender shrimp in a tasty but not overpowering dressing on a perfect, buttered toasted roll. I want one right now! Amazing slaw as well and great pickles (asked for more and were happy to oblige). Lovely to sit outside and great, friendly service. Had a great time with the best food item in recent memory!

12.description: After an evening of beer drinking and jousting at the Oyster Fest, I wandered into John's Place with some friends since they were one of the last locations that had oysters left. The place was packed as well as the outdoor seating areas, but it was a great atmosphere. I had a great waitress who quickly ushered us out an order of a half dozen oysters and she even tolerated my annoying Brother, whose jokes can be funny but slightly offensive/creepish! I didnt like that they didnt have melted butter for the oysters, but, oh well!I love them though because I actually ended up leaving my tablet here by mistake (well, my Brother did) and John actually took it and kept it for us! I was terrified initially since I had no idea where we couldve put it down at or who couldve picked it up! Needless to say, it is safe and sound back in my possession.I just saw that they have Saturday and Sunday brunch as well; Ill be checking that out soon!

59.description: Great restaurant with very friendly staff.  Very friendly to kids in the restaurant as well.  The turkey buger is one of the best in the city.

21.description: Finally got a chance to try John's Place after moving to the neighborhood over 2 years ago.  We were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated promptly in one of the big booths in the back.  Hubby and I split a Southwest Salad and a Roscoe Burger, which was more than enough for the two of us.  The salad had a great kick with the spice grilled chicken.  I loved the pimento, bacon cheese, and onion rings on the burger, but the jalepeno marmalade was a little too spicy for me.  The burger itself had a nice charred taste to it.  For dessert, we split the salted caramel gelato, which was amazing!  I also wanted to try the Blondie Bar, but didn't have room :(Great neighborhood joint that is definitely kid friendly (there were a stack of high chairs stored in the back) and fits right in Roscoe Village.

17.description: One of my favorites in Roscoe Village. The Roscoe burger is top notch.  Extremely kid friendly, inside the diner and at the outside eating areas, even on the Roscoe Village scale of kid friendly spots.

10.description: Finally got a chance to try John's Place after moving to the neighborhood over 2 years ago.  We were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated promptly in one of the big booths in the back.  Hubby and I split a Southwest Salad and a Roscoe Burger, which was more than enough for the two of us.  The salad had a great kick with the spice grilled chicken.  I loved the pimento, bacon cheese, and onion rings on the burger, but the jalepeno marmalade was a little too spicy for me.  The burger itself had a nice charred taste to it.  For dessert, we split the salted caramel gelato, which was amazing!  I also wanted to try the Blondie Bar, but didn't have room :(Great neighborhood joint that is definitely kid friendly (there were a stack of high chairs stored in the back) and fits right in Roscoe Village.

5.description: I am so glad my mom and I went for dinner last night. She and I have always enjoyed they're brunch on weekends. But ever since my husband and I moved here a couple years ago, dinners had been hit or miss. The menu is different and they no longer have the hostess I complained about a couple years ago. Both servers are very nice that we have had. We always have our fave guy when we come for brunch...I'll get his name next time. Ok, onto the food: everything we have had for brunch, whether sweet or savory, has been delicious.  They had Elvis pancakes once on special and they were amazing.  For dinner last night we had Thai chicken soup, my mom and I both loved it. We also got burgers, which were very tasty. Mine was overlooked and my mom's was perfect.  (We both ordered medium). But I prefer over to under so I was fine. Fries were good too. I love that we were able to sit outside and have our dinner before it got too chilly. I'm excited to put John's on my brunch AND dinner list now.

3.description: I went with a friend on Thanksgiving Eve. Service was excellent and relatively quick. I had The Cowboy Burger medium rare. The sauce is what made the burger (bbq chipotle sauce). Fries were pretty good. The price is a little bit higher than I'd feel comfortable with, but overall experience was surely positive.

35.description: My girl and I were here for brunch yesterday.  We were excited to have their Shrimp and Grits, since I really liked them the last visit.  We both ordered the same thing, but we've err very disappointed.  I don't get it?  The shrimp were still good sized, but the quality was different, definitely a change for the worst.  The grits were lumpy and lacked flavor and the eggs had a strong vinegar taste, from being pouched.  There also was no sauce, but last time the sauce was really good?  It was a big disappointment from what I had eaten on the last visit.  Bummer!

19.description: Love this place.  We come here all the time.  Everything I have ordered has been good. The menu is straight forward and the food is very consistent.  The ingredients are always fresh and the service is always friendly and quick.  AND.... it is very kid friendly. Con: they close between dinner and lunch - We eat dinner early and always forget.

28.description: I've come here several times for breakfast on the weekends since moving to the neighborhood, and have always had great service and a great meal. But this morning I was really disappointed!I went this morning with a friend and we were promptly seated. Oyster Fest was today, and the restaurant was slow in terms of customers, but the staff seems busy in preparation for it. We quickly placed our order with our server, and then we didn't see her again for the next 25 to 30 minutes. After we realized how long we had waited for our food, we flagged down a manager, and he went to go check on our order. Our server came back, instead of the manager, and said that our ticket had been lost and the kitchen was working on it now. We weren't very happy and decided to walk over to Kitsch'n instead.Having been a server before, I feel like our server should have known that our ticket has been lost well before we inquired about our meal, because she should have been wondering what was taking so long as well. Seems like our server forgot about us!

45.description: This place is so gross, not sure why it has so many positive reviews.Service is fine and the atmosphere is nice ( very kid friendly). The food is just OK and overpriced. I understand it is convenient for those living in Roscoe Village, but every time my family and I eat here we regret it. Not worth a drive if you don't live down the street, and if you do live nearby i would advise walk ing a few blocks down and eating at Pizza Bella, Victory's Banner, or Kitsch'n instead.

33.description: Food is great, service is excellent. Everyone has always been warm and kind (we love Ashley!!!) and it's a great place to bring kids if you don't feel like cooking but want something quick, cheap and tasty. My only complaint is that every time we visit, the portion on the kids' mac & cheese shrinks yet the price remains the same.

43.description: Moving Day to Roscoe Village! In a sea of boxes the only thing louder than my pops' grumbling at putting together a TV stand was the rumbling of my stomach. I Yelped the closest place with burgers and drinks so I could treat my helpers. We took the quick two block walk to John's and sat right away. Service was friendly and attentive which I appreciated since I wanted to run back with hopes that someone finished unpacking for me. Side note: no one didA few of my helpers started out with a Spicy Bloody Mary. I am not a BM fan but it got they enjoyed it and looked pretty fun. I went with the Roscoe Burger based solely on the fact it had a jalapeno marmalade. The toppings were flavorful (marmalade, bacon-pimento cheese, and onion rings) and it was a decent size. I thought the meat lacked some flavor but maybe was overwhelmed by the toppings. Dad got the Cowboy Burger (which the waitress said is their best seller) which looked just as appetizing after a hard day's work. Others got salads, french toast, and then my one friend who just had another BM - all non-noteworthy stuff. Overall my verdict is that I would come back for a quick bite and the food was tasty. I am happy to have it close but the prices don't match the quality. $12 for a burger either has to be Kobe or come with some awesome sides. Fries, chips, or coleslaw don't cut it.  But 3 stars isn't too shabby!

2.description: Went to visit my friends who live in Roscoe village and they wanted to go to John's place. The restaurant looked really nice but a little small and narrow. The service was good and they had a decent alcohol selection. That night was tacos for $3, but I chose to order the John's Chopped salad and some sweet potato fries as others on Yelp have recommended. Overall a good meal and a pleasant experience.

18.description: This morning I pulled up the online menu for John's Placeand after being on Special K Breakfasts for awhile I thoughttoday was the day I would spoil myself with a great breakfast.Alas, when myself and my friend Linda arrived we were handeda very limited lunch menu, so I asked about breakfast..No Breakfast/Brunch until the weekends.. Now why I thoughtthat breakfast/brunch menus would be available throughout the whole week,God only knows!Maybe because I read all these delicious breakfast/brunch menuoptions on their online menu..Okay.. so.. I will admit this irritated me because I had truly wantedbreakfast but obviously this was not meant to be.So.. we had "lunch" which consisted of a Bacon Cheeseburger for methat was a tad overcooked and a B-Bque Sandwich for my friend Linda.My burger was edible, but.. not totally enjoyable.Decent hand cut fries.Pretty good service.But.. for the record.. would I make another trip out here for lunch?No..Still want to try menu items off the brunch menu though..I  will just have to remember.. only on the weekends..

41.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 3 years and prior to that, I was a big fan of the Lincoln Park location. However, methinks John is in a rut. The menu hasn't changed in over a year, and although I dig the kid-friendly atmosphere and love taco night, I think there's a huge opportunity here to mix things up and add some new and different menu items. Like a tuna melt. If the restaurant weren't right around the corner, we wouldn't go as often as we do.
