52.description: As a family, we have been going to John's Place on Roscoe since it opened, years ago.  It was a nice, family friendly place, with decent food.  I just came back from a dinner with my son and was very, very disappointing.  Prices have gone up considerably but the quality of food and service has gone down.  Here are couple of things that made the experience not so great:*The restaurant was full of smoke from the kitchen.*My $15 Baja Tacos were 3 Tacos and a cup of Instant Spanish Rice.  Taco's could have been good if the cabbage inside did not taste like soap. I still have a soapy aftertaste in my mouth.    Even my son commented that his food (plain pasta) tasted funny. Hope we don't get sick.*They usually offer bread basket with butter, but tonight somehow they forgot (although the restaurant was not full.)So for me, "So Long John's Place".  We will not be coming back anytime soon.

50.description: This place is great; a couple girlfriends and I were in the neighborhood and decided to try John's. They have a decent beverage list and an excellent menu; it is a smaller menu, but very well thought out; all of the choices looked excellent.Unfortunately they were out of veg burgers, so my veg friends had to choose among the other items, which was not a problem. Jonathan was our server and he seemed knowledgable about the beverage selection. He was quite friendly and attentive.I would like to go here again when I am in the area!

4.description: One of my favorite places in Roscoe Village. Always delicious food and friendly service (Paul is the best!). Love the weekend brunch options and Bloody Mary's. My favorite is the chilaquiles with pulled pork and guacamole; also the pumpkin pie pancakes. They have great salads, burgers, and rice bowls at lunch/dinner. Cute patio in the summer and cozy dining room year round.

6.description: Loved.  Get out there before summer ends to enjoy the outdoor deck. Then order a $5 beer on  tap and get the guac with chips to start. Get the cowboy burger, shrimp & crab roll, lamb frat bread with taziki sauce, or cowboy burger. All very good. Pick from a choice of reg or sweet potato fries. Very good. Would come here again. We all loved our food, drinks, service, and atmosphere here here.

22.description: (Brunch) Not that impressed.  The menu appears "farm fresh" with good ingredients, but the taste was pretty bland.  Pricing is a little high, for what you get. Service wasn't that good either.  The waitress forgot our bacon and brought it out after we already asked for the check.  Unfortunately, there wasn't an excuse because the place only had a few customers..that should have been the first sign.  I'd go somewhere else if you're looking for a more than ordinary brunch.

15.description: I've been here several times and the food here is always good! They have a great kids menu, dinner/lunch/breakfast menu, and their drinks are always delicious. However based on my visits here your experience will seriously be based on which server you have. If you get the blonde girl that takes 15 minutes to bring water just get up and leave. If you get the brunette one who's a bit older (sorry forgot your name!) go ahead and stay. You can be confident you will get great recommendations and great service. Again, if you get the young-ish blonde lady she will ask you to hurry up and pay your bill (because eating lunch with your niece and sister for 30 minutes is just too long) because she has to make her rehearsal.. You understand.

57.description: If you like tuna tartare, then you're not an idiot, and you have to try the Tuna Poke.All their burgers are legit. The John's Chopped Salad with the Tahini-sesame dressing is unreal.AND are server made a great Moscow Mule.Good food. Good service.

20.description: We've only gone here for brunch, but we really like it. Generally not too long a waitlist and its a good place to bring kids. Food is really good and they are very efficient about getting to food out. Nice tables outside for summer time. I find the inside a little on the small side. They do have booths but they aren't always the most practical with small children.

36.description: my girlfriend susan and i had lunch here on saturday and sat al fresco since the weather was perfect. their john's chopped salad is really delicious and refreshing on a saturday afternoon brunch. susie had eggs on toast and french toast that she really liked. service was pretty good. i'd definitely go back if i'm ever in the roscoe village area.

14.description: John's is still pretty good food however I think it's incredibly overpriced for what you get.  For example, the Roscoe omelette, which is spinach, tomato, green onion and mushrooms with a goat cheese fondue across the top is $11. If you want this made with only egg whites it's $13.  This comes with a small serving of potatoes and toast. This is in line with pricing at restaurants on the Mag mile or Bib Gourmand appointed establishments and because it's up in a quiet neighborhood it doesn't warrant these price points.

58.description: Need to come here for the bottomless mimosas on Sunday! They have a build your own mimosa bar with different juices you can add to you drinks. The food is good, not great, but good normal upscale bar food.

56.description: Good drinks, good prices. Cowboys game on. Burger cooked to order, just the way I wanted it. No questions asked. Great bar. Raffle at halftime. I'll be back soon.

29.description: I think I've walked by this bar ten times in the past 3 days, finally we decided to stop by and to say it was delicious is an understatement. The wide open windows are inviting and the beer menu is huge, and well titos is used in mixed drinks and I totally approve. But the best thing is the food. The pork sandwhich is the best pork sandwich thats ever graced my mouth. This is no run of the mill pulled pork sandwich, this beauty is deep fried with the perfect crust lathered in a tasty sauce that complements the expertly cripsed pork, that makes me think I could eat this sandwich forever. The burger was was cooked fantastically to order, the french fries were perfectly seasoned and cooked to a crisp. The county ribs were also excellent but I think I was yhe real winner with the pork sandwich.

42.description: After hearing that Commonwealth is Shocker Friendly, I had to try it out for myself.  Mike is a Wichita State fan, and told me about his plans to have drink specials for the MVC & NCAA tournaments.  He even had the Shocker flag waving proudly outside for our arrival.

23.description: We have very few choices in Roscoe Village to go to an adult sports bar, and by adult I do not mean ADULT, I mean, no flocks of kids and babies.  Okay, here's the thing... The ambiance is great, great draft beers and IPA's, cute sidewalk patio (thank you for re-doing the concrete!), attentive staff, and lots of TVs. We would give Commonwealth more stars if this was a place we could also come to eat. If that was the case we would be here weekly. There is just a small selection of food, when I am drinking beer and watching football I want delicious bar food to go with it, not curried cauliflower and gnocchi. Know what I mean? We are often forced to go across to the Riverview so we can get burgers, wraps, etc. PLEASE GO BACK TO THE BASICS.Also, this seems to be a great spot for taking dates. As for now, we come to Commonwealth for the convenience and a beer, but I am hard pressed to call this a sports bar.

47.description: I just hosted a baby shower @ Commonwealth on January 24th and could not have been happier with the entire process!  I reached out to book an event a few months back, and received an email from owner/management who were more than helpful! I worked with the chef  on the menu ahead of time, and both he and the management team made sure I got the best possible options and more importantly remained on budget!  The day of the event the entire staff was very helpful, and allowed us to re-arrange and dominate the back portion of the restaurant.  (we arrived early to their smiling faces greeting us!)  They went the extra mile, serving guests champagne, cutting the cake, borrowing us scissors/tape for decor, the whole 9 yards!  Our event went off without a hitch, and we got several compliments on the venue, food, and ambiance provided to us by everyone @ Commonwealth.  I would definitely book another event here, and I will definitely be eating brunch there more often! (the new brunch menu is to DIE for!!) Cheers :)

8.description: This was one of the closest establishments to myself while staying in Chicago recently, so naturally I made it here a few times. I ate off of each menu (brunch/evening) and while both were good, I have to give the breakfast sandwich I had the nod. Brisket and bacon, egg... I'm forgetting a few ingredients but they are rendered unnecessary given the first three IMO. It also helped that it was Saturday so I had the Irish game day specials for drinks. Bartenders and employees were all chatty, helpful, and fun. As were the patrons. Doesn't do anything for me, but this is also a Cowboys bar. Some neat sports memorabilia on the walls. They also have a nice beer selection. Yes.

31.description: Skip the BLT!  I expected more than 2 pieces of cut bacon smacked on the sandwich. I actually laughed when I removed the bun. The fried green tomato was good but it didn't save the sandwich.  Commomwealth either add more bacon or call this a fried green tomato sandwich.Drinks are good though...

34.description: Roscoe Village needed a new sports bar with decent food and a good beer list like this. This place had a chance to become my neighborhood sports bar (I live a few blocks away). Then they hung a Dallas Cowboys flag outside. Now I may never go back again. (Disclaimer: I'm a Philadelphia Eagles fan). I'll try to give an impartial review though:4 stars for fun sports bar atmosphere3 stars for food...it's okay, not great3 stars for their uncomfortable seating and odd table arrangement2 stars for their lack of decorations and creativity with the space (pretty sparse...hire a decorator, yo!)0 stars for their affinity for the Dallas CowboysOverall, not bad if you need a place to watch the game, but nothing special. Go Eagles.

16.description: Garbage service, terrible food, poor management. Avoid at all costs. Got a table with some friends and were complete ignored by all service staff. The ice had melted in our drinks by the time they arrived at the table. When I asked to speak with a manager, the server shrugged and said they were busy and not able to talk.

13.description: I have loved Commonwealth, in the past. I am an absolute Die Hard Cowboys fan from the tiny little town of Alvarado, Tx. Prime Cowboys country. I grew up watching the triplets win super bowls, and literally every person you see wears the Star. Its almost a religion. On 9/20/2015 I attempted to get a party of 5 Cowboys/ 2 Eagles/ 1 bears fan to hang out in my favorite place to watch the Cowboys in Chicago. Friends in rivalry right? Wrong. When we arrived one of our Cowboys friends already had a table going for us and came up and was hugging one of our Eagles friends and coworkers, who just moved here, and know nothing about Chicago. No sooner did that happen than the organizer, who I'm not sure even owns the bar, came off his high horse for a minute to accost our friends. Immediate disrespectful pointing to get out, cursing, name calling, threw a 20 at our friend, which got ripped up and rightfully so. We don't need your money we make plenty. Im confused though. I have seen Bears fans inside before, and while this was going on a Steelers fan and a REdskins fan were inside the bar. Any cowboys fans know those are our biggest rivals. After my initial feelings on the situation and leaving for another bar I was just going to let it go. But the group "Dallas Cowboys Fans in Chicago" has not. Even Today, 8 days later.  Continues to press about the situation publicly, posting photos and bragging about how Douche bag eagles are. When I let him in on maybe some things he didn't know, he bans me from his page so he doesn't dig a deeper hole and removes all the pictures and trash talk because I quote "it was getting ugly for him" All I did was let him know what he did. The negative feedback on his screenshot of Duane A.'s yelp review with his added thoughts to the post, caused him to take it down. This bar. Good food. Bad organizer, unbelievably bad sportsmanship. He claims that the Eagles fans would start a fight. Nah, these two would have shaken your hand on the way out if they had been treated like people and allowed to stay with their friends who invited them and wanted them to know what it feels like to be in a sea of Cowboys...The Noise, the passion we bring. Unfortunately Commonwealth failed really hard this time. Its hospitality not war. You are a bar, with food and drink. Usually a place friends can be just that. Not today. There are some great Cowboys fans in Chicago but this organizer doesn't deserve to call himself one. He certainly did not act like one. He is not one of us. A real Texan and Cowboys fan would not have pulled what he did and caused the scene that was caused over opening a door and walking in.

11.description: The place is the worst of the area. The owners and managers are clueless. Hey waitress, When I'm sitting down I don't need you to come up from behind me and put your hand on my shoulder or touch me at all. The beer selection isn't great but not bad. The cocktails on the other hand are horrendous, this is a place where its a persons first bartending job for sure.The service is not attentive at all. Being in the industry I don't need to sit with my empty drink for almost 10 minutes while you sit on your phone. This place needs to close and re-concept. The outside looks like crap, you look like a barn.

39.description: I have been to Commonwealth about 10 times.  In the beginning it was great - farm to table, everyone knew their stuff.  Then the head chef left.  It has been a downhill battle ever since.  The salads have way too much dressing, staff is not attentive, and the pours from the bar are weak.  The worst was when we went for brunch, and waited 30 minutes for eggs THAT WERE COLD.  No apologies.  The owner or manager was on his laptop and overheard us talking.  Did he come over?  No.  Did we pay for it?  Yes.  And, unfortunately for him, we have taken our business elsewhere.  Don't waste your time unless you just want a drink at the bar.

37.description: Anyone a fan of the Happy Days series and remember the Malaci Crunch episodes? Walking into this bar was similar in that it included a bunch of has been college attitudes crossed with douche-bag drunks.  Literally bounced off of multiple people on the way in and couldn't get out fast enough.  Oh!... and the smell....terrible!

0.description: Commonwealth has a great atmosphere and good drink selection. The reason I took a star away is after a few visits I decided to order desert. It was $9 for an ice cream sandwich. It was described to be extravagant and for that price large enough to share. It was disappointing to say the least.So, great place for before or after dinner drinks won't be ordering food again.

38.description: Every year my family has a big St Patrick's day party. This year we decided to host it at Commonwealth, and I can say we will be coming back for years to come. The owner and managers went out of their way to help us set up to the point they made a welcome banner for us.The wait staff was awesome. Not only were they very helpful, but had patience when it came to dealing with some of our "special" guests.Drinks were on point and so was the food. I recommend this place for any type of gathering.

51.description: Went here today for the New Year's Day brunch and it was great! I called ahead to see if it was crowded and if my friends and I would be able to get a table. There was no one in there around 10:15 am, so we headed over and there was tons of room! We got the Bloody Mary bar and the brunch buffet (i believe this was special to today only). Both were good!

27.description: Returned last night after our first bad experience over a year ago...looks like the changes they made really made a difference. We had a great time and our experience was so much better! The bartender was very sweet and the drinks were good. Will be back again!

32.description: Stopped in for a beer or two.They had a great selection of draught.  Had the pork rinds c which were very good not greasy at all.Nice ambiance good service nice place overall.

54.description: I really like Commonwealth. It's a solid choice for good food and drinks. My favorite thing on their menu is their burger and their fries. Those fries are perfectly fried. Each individual fry is crispy and they also use both salt and pepper to season. Their queso fundido is a close second. As for the booze, they have a crazy extensive beer list and some fun cocktails. Their margarita on the cocktail list has some serious spice and their Moscow Mules are pretty tasty as well.

48.description: So the owner got in touch with me. I was actually shocked about this. He wanted to apologize, which I sincerely felt he meant. Though he said the bar back was doing some kind of joke/improv, it didn't feel like it. But still, I accept his apology, and kinda feel relieved that the bar back was reprimanded. It actually means a lot to me that the owner actually called and apologized. This place will get a second chance from me, because everyone deserves a second chance. Plus the drinks are bomb. And you can never go wrong with that.

44.description: Been here 4 times, pork chop at dinner was really good. Brunch with home made Bloody Mary mix - nice!

24.description: An update to my earlier review. Stopped in last night and ordered dishes I had and loved and dreamt about before: nachos and beet humous-they were mediocre at best. I was so disappointed! I don't know if the chef is on vacation or what happened but I hope this isn't the beginning of a slide downward for the food. On the plus side-the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive.

7.description: I was pumped this place was opening, but was super disappointed when we tried it.  Kind of pretentious staff, left us waiting for 25 minutes, but would not let us use a booth while we waited for a table...which was reserved for an 8pm reservation.  It was 7pm.  Someone we went with got a sandwich and the bread was rock hard, but otherwise good.  Next time we tried it, hoping for a better experience  he asked the server if the bread is supposed to be hard.  She assured him no, must have been an anomaly.  Sandwich comes, rock hard again.  We never went back after the back to back bad experiences, which sucks because it would have been nice to have another option in the neighborhood.

49.description: Had a lovely time today at Commonwealth. Meant to check it out for ages and am so happy I did. The Spinach Falafel bar snack was great! I ordered the wings and couldn't complain about them. Both dishes were presented very nicely, and the service was great. Vinny plays some sweet tunes.

40.description: I really like this bar. Nice food, great service, clean and friendly. Have gone for brunch and dinner/drinks. Has a nice welcoming atmosphere and easy to get parking nearby. The falafel pitta is my favorite! I find the fries too salty.....though maybe that means you by more beer!! A great addition to Roscoe Village, I'll be coming back!

53.description: Went for brunch. That is now my preferred time to go here. Everyone was really happy with what they ordered. Be warned though, they do change the menu. I had brunch schnitzel which was delicious and came with the tastiest potatoes. My friends ordered the falafel frittata which is not authentic falafel but they really liked it. My other friend ordered the papusa, which was good but the schnitzel and frittata were our favorites. We have been back again and I learned this...Do not, I repeat, do not order the bacon. It is only 1slice cut into small pieces!  And it barely has any flavor. Servers are really nice and helpful. They also do $12 bottomless mimosas which are good, they have different flavored juices, yay!

30.description: Great space, cool interior.  Had the smoked potatoes and burger ...both were great.  The staff is helpful and great place to watch a game.

46.description: Very sophisticated food which brings quality to familiar "bar food" items and to innovative entrees/snacks/sharable plates.  BLT with house cured bacon.  Celery Root Risotto that was truly delicious.  Very approachable staff.  Not too crowded.  You're able to linger.  Recommend for the first or second date - you can be there thirty minutes or a couple hours according to how it's going.

1.description: Very decent find in an unassuming part of town!  Hidden gem is a good category for it!I ordered an off-menu item, the brisket/bacon burger.  I'm told it's 70% ground brisket and 30% ground bacon.  I can tell you this much; it was juicy, succulent, and had a delightful smoky flavor that was far from overpowering.  The sauce and pickles (made in house) that came with it were heavenly, and they really cut through the richness of the burger.  I got it with a salad instead of the fries, so I can't speak to the sides (salad was basic, but fresh).We had several apps to start (there was a large group of us there), and the hands-down table favorite was the nachos.  Oh man, those nachos... In-house made chips, slow roasted pork, lots of cheese, fresh sauces... solid.  Their wings are very good, too.  Buffalo sauce is piquant without being overly spicy or boring.  Asian BBQ were equally well made.  The drink selection was pretty darn good, too.  They had a few ciders, great mixed drink suggestions, and a pretty good sampling of beers across the spectrum.  I'd definitely be a regular if I lived nearby.  This place was well worth the visit, and I hope the next time I'm in town to stop by again!

55.description: Do you like lots of Cowboys fans, guys especially? This is the place for you! Dudes with tucked in Aikman jerseys and Timberlands is the standard uniform.

9.description: Came here during Retro on Roscoe for some drinks and wanted to get a snack to tide us over from lunch until dinner.  But... absolutely nothing on the menu appealed to any of us.  You know how sometimes menus are written with your exact preferences in mind?  This place wasn't that x3.  We did have drinks which became a few drinks which became quite a few drinks.  The beer list was great but they didn't have three of the wines I tried to order and I'm still not sure what I actually ended up getting.Big ups for the outlets places strategically by the booth benches.This is a Notre Dame bar, by the way.  Go Randy Moss!  (Minnesota, girl.  Sorry, it's the best i could do...)

26.description: Good Food and Big Beer Menu!

25.description: Came here during Retro on Roscoe for some drinks and wanted to get a snack to tide us over from lunch until dinner.  But... absolutely nothing on the menu appealed to any of us.  You know how sometimes menus are written with your exact preferences in mind?  This place wasn't that x3.  We did have drinks which became a few drinks which became quite a few drinks.  The beer list was great but they didn't have three of the wines I tried to order and I'm still not sure what I actually ended up getting.Big ups for the outlets places strategically by the booth benches.This is a Notre Dame bar, by the way.  Go Randy Moss!  (Minnesota, girl.  Sorry, it's the best i could do...)

12.description: This bar... What to say? Well, anybody has the right to watch any game at any place they like, regardless of what sports team they are cheering for. The treatment of my friends at this bar was absolutely disgusting, and being a big industry girl, I am telling other industry people and people in general not to step foot in this bar. I'm a NY giants fan and I have actually been to this bar before to watch a NY/ Dallas game, about five years ago. Not a problem from a single person there, it's all in good fun. Whoever is managing this place should read a book about customer service and learn something from it. Or, better yet, put your personal feelings aside at work and do what your supposed to do, which is to make customers happy and not discriminate!

59.description: My boss took us for a goodbye lunch because one of our team members was moving to California. It was FREEZING out and this place had the heat all the way turned up. I am always cold and this is the first bar/restaurant i been to where the heat was really nice and cozy! It was about 1pm so there wasn't anybody really in there. They have an extensive beer selection (i don't drink beer so i really didn't give a shit) and i didn't want to order a drink because i didn't want my boss to think "yes she got a problem". LOL so i stuck with water. I would have loved a DRINK LOL. Our server came right away and was talking way to fast for my liking and i didn't understand what the burger of the day was. I opted for the chicken sandwich, fries and a side of MAYO! Now they didn't have any regular mayo so i was i was a bit turned off with that fact. Also my boss wanted his sandwich a certain way but BECAUSE IT SOME TYPE OF SIGNATURE SANDWICH, WHOEVER PREPARES IT DOES NOT CHANGE IT FOR ANYBODY! i mean seriously, it was basically you order it the way it comes or you can order a different sandwich. BIG TURN OFF! Our sandwiches came out at a decent time. Everybody enjoyed theirs and i was so so impressed with my chicken sandwich. I was in love with this special mayo they have and the yummy home made fries. I honestly will only come back to try their drink and stuff my face with their great fries and DELICIOUS MAYO!!!

21.description: I'm giving this place 4 stars for being the ONLY official UCLA bar in Chicago. As a Bruin, I really appreciate this bar's commitment to UCLA and it having a dedicated UCLA game viewing room with large TVs and a few UCLA decors. This is the only place in Chicago where you can actually watch a UCLA game with a large amount of bruins. They also have special UCLA game day deals which is nice. The drinks here are all reasonably priced but I have to say the food is just okay but most people don't really come here to eat. I'm holding back one star because I think a few improvements could be made to make this "THE" UCLA spot.  Please put up more UCLA decal and have better UCLA game day deals. Although I appreciate the $5 game day deals, it'll be nice to have a special deal for every time UCLA scores. For example, a $1 shot for every goal. You'll have people ordering a lot more and it'll greatly increase the atmosphere of game day and the reputation of the commonwealth as a UCLA bar.

17.description: My family and I had a recent very poor experience while in town. We made the mistake of trying to have something to eat at the commonwealth. While waiting to order my children and I watched several, I'm assuming frequent patrons, become almost physically violent with other customers. I watch how the staff not only allowed but looked to support this. I was visible upset by this poor treatment of folks who did nothing from what I could see to deserve any of the harassment. As a family we left shortly later.    It's easy to say this is not a family friendly location.  And unless your part of the local crowd you may be physically assaulted. I warn anyone keep your distance. Until this goes under new management.

10.description: Update 12/30/14.. with the end of the year comes the end of my love of the commonwealth. We used to go in at least once a week for either dinner or brunch. They have changed the menu soo much, there is literally nothing left on the menu that my husband and I eat other than the burger. Soo many delicious things are gone... the delicious soft pretzel, the mouth watering denver steak, the grits... its completely different. Its not really a dinner destination in the village anymore. I really did love this place. Although their bloody mary bar during brunch was awesome, we wont be back unless they make their menu more appealing. Sorry Commonwealth, it was great while it lasted. Im leaving you with 2 stars, one for the burger and one for the fact you stock Stella Cidre. Let us know if you decide to turn your menu around!

5.description: You get two stars for being the designated Dallas Cowboys bar. Otherwise, shame on you and your less than professional customer service. To associate yourself with my hometown is appalling. The saying, "don't mess with Texas" is true. Texans don't treat people in this manner. Arrived at 11 for a 3pm game and was told I couldn't sit at an open table because the table was reserved for the day but, "you can't make reservations." On what damn planet does that make sense? You can't reserve a table but someone reserved the table. A simple  rephrasing to say "reservations are for brunch only" would be more than sufficient and understandable. When I brought this to the manager's attention his attitude was of unconcern and apathy as he informed us that the table I wanted was permanently reserved for their VIP guests.

3.description: Both of my visits to Commonwealth have been impromptu but both have been great experiences! I popped in on Memorial Day for a couple of beers with my boyfriend and we posted up at the bar and really enjoyed ourselves. They have a great draft beer selection and the fact that they have Weihenstephaner on tap was enough to keep me coming back. Our most recent trip was today when we stopped in for a pint and a light dinner. On Mondays they have 1/2 price wings until 8 and we took advantage ordering the Buffalo Wings as well as a side of the Smoked Potatoes. The wings were perfectly cooked and amped up by the picked celery and carrots they were served with. We also both loved the smoked potatoes but would've appreciated a larger portion. You can really tell Commonwealth uses quality ingredients and their menu demonstrates that they strive to do what they do well. Something I appreciate at a time when so many bars have enormous menus and when they could be focusing on perfecting a few menu items and promoting those. The decor here is also spot on. As much as I am a fan of the dive bar you can't beat the airy, upscale feel that Commonwealth has mastered. I'm sure I'll be back again soon and can't wait to try the brunch especially...

35.description: Meh. Positives: service was nice and prompt. Bathrooms and bar were clean and tidy. Negatives: terrible (food & drink) quality to price ratio. Food was very average. My husbands exact words about his pork sandwich: "this tastes like a fried pork big mac." He was pretty disturbed about the Kraft single perched on top. Kraft singles just don't belong on "upscale bar food".

19.description: After seeing reviews on Commonwealth and viewing the menu, i was super excited on the delicious menu. So me and some friends have stopped in a few times over the past few months or so. Everything was fine overall but nothing above the rest. the food is easily forgotten and i expected nothing more than average bar food after finding out it's more of a sports bar in which the menu comes off as it's above bar food. If you can handle the sports and all the grown adults acting like teenagers, you'll do fine here however finding sunday brunch somewhere else may be best.

28.description: Both of my visits to Commonwealth have been impromptu but both have been great experiences! I popped in on Memorial Day for a couple of beers with my boyfriend and we posted up at the bar and really enjoyed ourselves. They have a great draft beer selection and the fact that they have Weihenstephaner on tap was enough to keep me coming back. Our most recent trip was today when we stopped in for a pint and a light dinner. On Mondays they have 1/2 price wings until 8 and we took advantage ordering the Buffalo Wings as well as a side of the Smoked Potatoes. The wings were perfectly cooked and amped up by the picked celery and carrots they were served with. We also both loved the smoked potatoes but would've appreciated a larger portion. You can really tell Commonwealth uses quality ingredients and their menu demonstrates that they strive to do what they do well. Something I appreciate at a time when so many bars have enormous menus and when they could be focusing on perfecting a few menu items and promoting those. The decor here is also spot on. As much as I am a fan of the dive bar you can't beat the airy, upscale feel that Commonwealth has mastered. I'm sure I'll be back again soon and can't wait to try the brunch especially...

45.description: Been here twice and the food is surprisingly good. Friendly staff too. They have a nice brunch menu and an awesome Bloody Mary bar (this was on Sat AM). Nice clean place with TVs all over. Frequent this place!  It's good for the neighborhood.By the way - the have the BEST nachos with pulled pork.

33.description: My favorite kind of food is here at Commonwealth, elevated pub food. I love how their beer list is categorized by type of beer- makes it very easy to figure out which one to try because if you like one pale ale, you'll probably like another in the same beer family.We've gone here several times and the service can be a bit slow during busy times but overall it's worth it. I would call Commonwealth a classier than normal sports bar, they're a great spot to catch a game with friends while enjoying genuinely delightful pub food.

43.description: Great staff and good food.  The drinks are normal i.e. the beer is cold with a good selection.  They've improved since opening so stop back by if they weren't great in the first few months of being open.

2.description: Last night was my first visit to Commonwealth, we'll just say a few things jumped out at me that will result in no return visit.I am an industry person, I am a former Barback and Restaurant Manager.  Presently I am a Kitchen Manager, on top of that I am a Cicerone.  I know a few things about bars/restaurants, and especially about beer.Let's start briefly with the good:Love the build-out, fantastic decor and setup.  How clean/organized you keep your establishment is very important and this was pretty spot on.Menu: Loved the food variety on the menu, lots of very good looking food combinations.  From what I did observe coming out of the kitchen it was well plated.  Unfortunately I had eaten earlier that night and was not hungry, so I can not give points for food taste/quality.Drinks Menu: Fairly solid craft beer line up, good prices.My initial reaction: this looks like a good place.So why the two star review?Service.First off, it is not appropriate for a server to touch EVERY male patron.  Working for tips is one thing, making a point to get inside people's personal space is not acceptable, ever.  Second, give the girl a waist apron so she can carry her pad and a pen around.  It took multiple attempts to get our order in before she managed to get it written down.  Those apron's come in very helpful in a bar setting, especially when you rely on one server to take care of all of your tables.  Get the girl organized.Third, serving drinks 101:ALWAYS serve every drink with a cocktail napkin.  My friend had to request napkins, and we got just regular dinner napkins.  This seems like a small pet peeve, but it's an important one.  Show some class.Always bring a glass to the table with craft beers, and POUR the drink into the glass.  We had to request glasses for our drinks, and when we got them..they were hot.  Now, I'm not a chilled glass person I prefer room temperature, but you expect me to pour my cold beer (myself) into a hot glass fresh out of the washer? This was a combination of server and bartender issues, because that server was not the one to get the glass.  Either you need more glassware behind the bar so you aren't running out (which I hope is the excuse), or you need to train your staff that serving piping hot glasses for cold beverages is not acceptable.TLDR: TRAIN YOUR STAFF.  These are basic problems with one simple solution: train people.  If you don't know how to run a restaurant, find yourself a manager who does and have them teach your people the basics.

18.description: Went for brunch. That is now my preferred time to go here. Everyone was really happy with what they ordered. Be warned though, they do change the menu. I had brunch schnitzel which was delicious and came with the tastiest potatoes. My friends ordered the falafel frittata which is not authentic falafel but they really liked it. My other friend ordered the papusa, which was good but the schnitzel and frittata were our favorites. We have been back again and I learned this...Do not, I repeat, do not order the bacon. It is only 1slice cut into small pieces!  And it barely has any flavor. Servers are really nice and helpful. They also do $12 bottomless mimosas which are good, they have different flavored juices, yay!

41.description: The food is perfection! I've been to dozens and dozens of restaurants and have never had such a great experience from start to finish. Highly recommend this place. I can't wait to go back for brunch!

52.description: Update 12/30/14.. with the end of the year comes the end of my love of the commonwealth. We used to go in at least once a week for either dinner or brunch. They have changed the menu soo much, there is literally nothing left on the menu that my husband and I eat other than the burger. Soo many delicious things are gone... the delicious soft pretzel, the mouth watering denver steak, the grits... its completely different. Its not really a dinner destination in the village anymore. I really did love this place. Although their bloody mary bar during brunch was awesome, we wont be back unless they make their menu more appealing. Sorry Commonwealth, it was great while it lasted. Im leaving you with 2 stars, one for the burger and one for the fact you stock Stella Cidre. Let us know if you decide to turn your menu around!

50.description: Delicious!!! Didn't know if I was in the mood for breakfast or lunch, talked to the bartender. Very nice, personable, asked me what I was in the mood for. Suggested the BLT that wasn't on the menu, but made it for me anyways. Fried green tomato, fried egg, bacon on sourdough bread. Exactly what I wanted, highly suggest it. It is not on the menu so make sure to ask for it. Oh, and bottomless mimosa bar.

4.description: I'm not quite sure about the validity of the recent negative reviews of this place.  Someone mentioned they "were at this bar 5 years ago..."  I bet. It wasn't even open 5 years ago so I'm not sure what bar you were at but it wasn't this one.  Just my two cents.Now onto the food and drink. The menu here has drastically improved over the last year or so. Tonight we had the nachos, filet sliders and gnocchi.  All of it was great. Sometimes it's just nice to have higher end bar food when getting your drink on and Commonwealth hits the spot. Service was great, place was warm and welcoming. No complaints, will definitely be back.

6.description: I've tried this place twice now, and I must say neither time was I that impressed. Walking past the other day I did see that they revamped their menu, so I might go back a third time to try it out. Both times I was there the menu was just not good. At a sports bar you expect certain things....buffalo chicken wraps, burgers and truffle fries. Am I right?! The food they did have all seemed like they were trying to be "too foodie" for a sports bar. One of the times I went was for brunch, and I will say they have a decent all you can drink Bloody Mary bar deal. The only problem was that it took forever for our server to get to us out on the patio! By the time she got our orders and we went to check out the bloodie bar, it was completely scavenged. We left very disappointed.

22.description: I struggled to find a Dallas Cowboys sports bar via good and yelp for the first 2 years in Chicago. I stumbled upon this bar at the end of the 2014 season only to watch my Cowboys lose to the Packers in a playoff game. BUT I did win in finding this hidden treasure. This bar is a DALLAS COWBOYS fan's dream come true!!! SO much love for the 'Boys. EVERYONE comes decked out in gear, super friendly, everyone wants to have and share in a good time. Plus the bar owner is a blast. He passed out DC calendars, coozies, t-shirts, and other fun items. The venue is really nice. Kinda industrial chic. I believe they have Angry Orchard (Yay!) and the bar food was tasty. Even though I'm in the South Loop, I'll be driving up here on Sunday's for my game!

15.description: We were excited to have walked in during a happy hour. The sign outside clearly stated that specialty cocktails were offered at a cheaper price. So, we were surprised when we got charged full price for the drinks. Turns out, we ordered the 2 drinks off he specialty cocktail menu that were the exception. My problem wasn't so much with the money we spent, it was that the waiter didn't mention the exceptions! In short, service could have been better

57.description: Commonwealth is back on top for best brunch destination in Roscoe village!!1. Bottomless mimosas are $12 -- best deal around. So glad they dropped from $15!!2. Free wifi: great for checking fantasy and ESPN during the games!3. Menu: Yum!!!!Love this place!!

20.description: If I could give no stars I would. What an absolutely terrible place. I get that it's a Cowboy bar, but having my friends from Philly and I bullied out of the bar from some guy that organized it to be a Cowboy bar. He had no affiliation with the bar other than the fact he ran the Cowboy/Commonwealth Facebook page. Told us we had to leave because we were ruining their experience. Seriously, we live in Chicago. And the owner basically said we could stay, but he'd have to put us in the front corner so we wouldn't desturb anyone. We politely left with a standing ovation from the entire bar. I thought I couldn't hate the Cowboys and their fans anymore than I do, but apparently everything is possible. A classless organization along with a classless establishment will ensure I, or the hundreds of industry friends and coworkers will never recommend or go back to that poor excuse for a restaurant.

36.description: Everything about this place is great.  Drinks, people, layout, outstanding food and just a great overall vibe.And stickers AND crayons for the kids during brunch!

14.description: You can't discriminate against people who are willing to spend their money, and just want to have a good time. I was in the group of people that got turned away a couple sundays ago, it's annoying because I AM a cowboys fan..? I don't get it. Whatever, I don't need to spend my money there anymore then.. Also we were all industry people, and are not type to cause issues.

58.description: We stumbled upon this place while visiting the neighborhood fest Retro on Roscoe. It's an interesting space, with a wide open front window. Very clean & inviting. It was loud but I think part of that was due to the festival going on outside. The service was fantastic! Our server was passionate about their food and fairly attentive. We had the surf n turf so we were able to sample a variety. The steak was delicious albeit slightly over seasoned IMO. The red snapper, which isn't my favorite fish, was perfect and the mango cilantro salsa was a fresh compliment. The scallops, which are easy to over cook, were like butter. The shrimp & prawns were okay. We didn't get any chimichurri or dipping sauce, which I didn't know was part of the dish until I looked at the menu online. But the biggest surprise was the bill. I wasn't wearing my reading glasses while ordering but grabbed the check when it came. The surf n turf for 2 was $70. My hubby thought the menu said $36. I think the price point belongs somewhere in the middle, but closer to the latter. With tax & tip we dropped $100 with no alcohol. That's a lot for a neighborhood joint and would definitely discourage me from being a regular. There are just too many great options in a city like Chicago.

56.description: My bf is obsessed with Cuban food so when this gem opened up within walking distance of our place, we had to try it. The place is very laid back and we were surprised that pretty much every table was taken.  The staff was young but friendly and opened up our bottle of wine since it's a BYOB restaurant. First we tried the croquettes. They were like mozzarella sticks but filled with ham and cheese. I had the Cubano and my bf had the vieja ropa. The bread they used was really crispy but soft on the inside and I appreciated that they didn't over pile the sandwich with meat.  The ropa vieja beef was really flavorful and well seasoned, with a hint of spicy.  Both dishes came with white rice and black beans that had a garlic taste.  We finished out dinner with steaming hot espresso, it was REALLY delicious and sweet.  Overall, it was a positive experience. My only negative would be that the portions were a little smaller than what I would expect for the price.

29.description: Great sandwich shop, I got the pork belly jibarito  and yes it is as delicious as it sounds. The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and combinations. I would recommend the daily special if it is available

42.description: Amazing, authentic, and just all around awesome!  We will be back!  The steak is so juicy and delicious, the seafood super fresh and tasty, the yucca on point.  I can go on and on.  The dessert was the icing on the cake.

23.description: Food and service was fantastic!Favorites were the chimichurri sauce, the Media Noche sandwich, and the mashed potatoes.Remember it's BYOB!

47.description: Delicious and great service. Totally catered to our young kids too. Definitely recommend this new spot. Everything we ordered was delish. Recommend the scallop and pork belly app. So good!

8.description: I order the Salmon, Pescado of the day and the Jibarito because I was hungry and my eyes were bigger than my stomach! haha It was ALL SO GOOD. Of course I ate half of both. But I have no regrets. IT WAS DELICIOUS. The fish was perfectly cooked. Just flat out flavorful. I don't even know what they put on top but that was great too. It's byob, which is always a plus. The service is really great! Nothing tops off amazing food, like great service! On a busy night also, sheesh what a dream! We didn't get forgotten about, didn't have to wait a long time for food... or even wait for more water. It was all perfect. Will be back, and bringing all my friends. And going to order way more food than I can eat again :D

31.description: A cute place, especially for summer dining. The menu is inspired Cuban- not traditional. Lots of hug sandwiches are on the menu.

34.description: I really enjoyed my experience here. I had the ropa vieja-great flavor. Yuca fries were awesome. My husband had the pork chop and said it was the best chop he had ever had. Note: chop was served medium-restaurant may want to note this to diners as some people prefer more well done (like me). My husband prefers medium so it was fine for him. We brought a bottle of wine-it is BYOB. Our waiter, I believe his name was Felipe, was outstanding. Friendly, great energy, attentive, etc. I liked the Cuban music playing. It was a fun atmosphere.  Entrees were appropriately sized. We had plenty of food to eat. As for prices, I thought they were fine and appropriate given that BYOB cuts the bill down and all of the food was excellent quality. I would say that if they get a liquor license and end BYOB, then they may need to consider knocking a few dollars off some of the dishes to stay competitive.  Bathroom and entire place was very clean. We will absolutely return.  A wonderful, and much needed, addition to the dining scene in Roscoe Village.  Walkable from the Paulina or Addison brown line stops.

16.description: The food was marvelous! I love Cuban food and I usually go to 90 miles (both locations) to get my fix.I took one star off due to the service, the food took a long time and we came here right before the dinner rush (5ish). And our server rarely checked on us. Maybe the service would get better the next time we come back. I would definitely give it another try.I recommend the empanadas, churassco, and the smoothies.

13.description: Great food great service!Finally tried this place out in our neighborhood. Had to wait a bit for a table on a Friday night, but it was well worth it. Good was great and we had a great time!

11.description: The food was amazing and the service was good as well ... The live music took me back like if I was at home ... Definitely coming back for more of that amazing food

39.description: Yummmmmmm. Really great food, cool atmosphere. Owner came out and asked how food tasted, which showed she genuinely cares about her food. So glad this is in my hood!

37.description: Decent food but so ridiculously overpriced it leaves a bad taste in your mouth. For 1/3rd of the price, you can drive just a few minutes away and eat better tasting food served in larger portions. C'mon guys we all know how much a jibarito costs! Service was good but the food took more than 45 minutes to come out. I love supporting businesses in my roscoe village neighborhood but probably will not return to this one.

0.description: Been there last weeknd and OMG i was blown away!!!For starters we had the shipwreck, a sweet plantain boat with scallops and shrimp. My date had the Cura, a new orleans inspired paella, i had the hanger steak. The flavor was spot on and the steak was tender and juicy!!The server made a tableside sangria with lots of fresh fruit. Both service and food where exeptional!!

38.description: DELICIOUS!!!! Let me tell you first that my husband is from Cuba and we are constantly are searching for good Cuban food in the area. It is a very modern restaurant and we actually spoke with the owner for a while and he is a really nice guy. The owner also owns Taste of Cuba in Lincolnwood for a more traditional feel. The Ropa Vieja is my absolute favorite Cuban meal of all time. When it was served I originally thought, "That's it?" I ended up having to take some home because it was so filling! The service is great as is the location. Will definitely come back!!!

51.description: So, i'm a first generation cuban-american; if I want authentic cuban food, i just hop into my mami's kitchen.  I had very high food expectations and hopes. Unfortunately, Cuba 312 failed them miserably. The food was okay, the service though, it killed the deal.  We went this evening and arrived at about 515 pm. It was me, my partner, and her parents. Immediately i asked for the empanada, the croquetas, and the yucca appetizers. The server informed me that they were out of croquetas. Strike 1.  The other two appetizers came out and they were--okay.  When we ordered, someone at the table ordered the Lechon. Again, not ready yet. GRRRRRR, don't open for service if your not prepped. Next,  I don't know if you know this, but it's rude to start eating if everyone doesn't have their food in front of them. Well, 2 of us got our food, the other two--their food came out about 4-6 minutes after.Strike 2. That was awkward. The server did apologize but it didn't make it any less weird. Not only did our entree's come out staggered, but the Ropa Vieja came out COLD. We aren't the type to send food back, but that was strike 3. Lastly, as much as I support family business, it was very hard to build ambience when it seemed like the owners family was sitting in the back corner chit-chatting with the wait staff. For a Saturday evening in Roscoe Village, that's not going to cut it. Not if you are trying to establish your business in an upper socio-economic neighborhood. Cuba 312 got two stars because some of the food was good. I enjoyed my pork chuleta and the yucca mash that came with it. The black beans that I saw my family members eating looked dry and my platanos maduros were too thickly sliced for my liking--but that just may be family preference. Cuba 312 you have a world of improvement to do before I choose you over senor pan, 90 miles, or Syboney.

27.description: I was searching for somewhere that would have paleo options on the menu and found this awesome restaurant. There were many menu options available for anyone who eats grain and dairy free.  We started with the Ceviche of the day which was red snapper and shrimp and delicious.  It was served with freshly made plantain chips.  They make fresh juices daily that are unique and refreshing.  We both had a Jibarito (sandwiches on the equivalent of giant tostones/pressed and fried plantain in lieu of bread).  One was shrimp and avocado and one was steak and egg.  Both were very tasty and a generous portion.  I was able to sub grilled vegetables in lieu of rice and beans.  The only part of the meal that was not 'paleo' was the oil used to fry the plantain.  I'll take it.  The service was great, the restaurant (including the bathrooms) was very clean and well decorated.  The owners were there and were very nice people.  We can't wait to go back.  This restaurant is also byob and street parking was easy.

32.description: Loved the food and atmosphere. Great music playing,  they even have speakers on the outside of the restaurant.  My appetizer was delicious,  it was a plátano maduro topped with scallops and shrimp, can't remember the name of it.  Presentation and taste were great.  For dinner we had the ropa vieja which came with white rice,  black beans and tostones.  Very,  very good, though I felt the beans might have been missing a pinch of salt. Price was a little over priced compared to other Cuban restaurants,  but not so overly priced either where you wouldn't come back.

54.description: I order the Salmon, Pescado of the day and the Jibarito because I was hungry and my eyes were bigger than my stomach! haha It was ALL SO GOOD. Of course I ate half of both. But I have no regrets. IT WAS DELICIOUS. The fish was perfectly cooked. Just flat out flavorful. I don't even know what they put on top but that was great too. It's byob, which is always a plus. The service is really great! Nothing tops off amazing food, like great service! On a busy night also, sheesh what a dream! We didn't get forgotten about, didn't have to wait a long time for food... or even wait for more water. It was all perfect. Will be back, and bringing all my friends. And going to order way more food than I can eat again :D

48.description: If you are looking for an amazing meal, in a casual & vibrant space, Cuba312 is your spot.  As a neighbor of Roscoe Village you always want to support your local businesses. However, we were a little unfamiliar with Cuban cuisine but the friendly and welcoming the staff educated us right away.  Creative dishes that really wow on the taste and spices. Unique combinations of ingredients and flavors. It was very nice to be greeted by the owners Jamie and her husband Billy.  And as we left after this great meal, they both dropped what they were doing to say Thank You !  Very impressive !!! We HIGHLY recommend discovering Roscoe Village and this new locale. You'll be pleased you did.

44.description: Everything I ate was amazing! From appetizer to the dinner to the desert. There was a bit of a wait for my dinner but the waiter advised that I ordered a appetizer. So I ordered a empanada of chicken and potato it was delicious especially with the chimi cherry sauce it was served with. Now my dinner platter was served with amazing white rice and black beans the beans literally melted in my mouth the steak was cooked to perfection. The plantain maduros could have been a little sweeter but they were good. As for my desert someone recommended the coconut flan. I have been in a coconut mood so I decided to give it a go. I was very good fresh tasting not too sweet and it had shreds of the coconut in there. MUST TRY

24.description: Yum!  This place serves delicious Jibaritos and lechon. The mango lemonade was homemade and one glass made me want more!  The empanadas had excellent flavor.  Kevin was attentive in serving us and it wasn't crowded on a Wednesday evening. I am coming back!

7.description: I really wanted to like this place...it's right in my neighborhood, has beautiful decor and always seems like a lovely place. Our food just wasn't good. I had the shrimp jibarito and while the presentation was amazing, it fell extremely short on the flavor for me. It was overly greasy, and the plantain lacked any kind of seasoning.I will say that the service was great, so I think we may try this one again in a few months. I'm hoping that I just ordered the wrong thing on the menu....

49.description: A new Roscoe Village restaurant?! YES! A lover of Cuban food we couldn't wait to try it. So today we strolled in. The shop is cute, and well decorated. We went at non-peak time (2pm) so it was not crowded. I am sure when it gets busy (and it does) it gets quite cozy. We followed the waiters recommendation on a seafood chowder and pressed Cuban sandwich's....1. Seafood Chowder served with bread: standard, a little bland.2. Lechon: a marinated pork sandwich served with waffle fries. Excellent sandwich. It could be  a tiny bit more juicy, but then again I declined the mayo. Waffle fries are are an odd side for a Cuban sandwich, a touch disappointed that it didn't come with plantains, or rice/beans. We did order beans as a side and did not get them. Come to find out we didn't need any sides, the sandwich was filling, and delicious, couldn't put it down. We will definitely come back to try more delicious foods. We will also come with beer as this is a BYOB!

40.description: I found this place on accident with my girlfriend last Friday night and was blown away. We were so impressed we went back the next day for lunch and had another great meal. The food is outstanding and very authentic and the atmosphere is energetic and fun. I spoke to the staff as we were leaving as they had recognized us from the night before and they filled us in on a pig roast they were planning for the Bears game. We couldn't make it, but can't wait to get there for a game day pig roast.Service was a little slow, but I attribute that to them being brand new and still working out all the kinks in the kitchen. Glad I no longer live down the street because otherwise I'd be there every day!

53.description: not very authentic. the flavor was just okay. terrible execution- who uses (semi finely) chopped vegetable in a sandwich???

30.description: This would have been a 4, but our reservations were not taken seriously and I had to take a star off for that. Although our group of five had reservations, it took 30 minutes to seat us.  After that, service was good.I ordered the flank steak and enjoyed it.  It was properly cooked to medium rare and well seasoned.  I did not love the plantains served on the side.  My wife ordered a slow cooked beef stew (something roja) that I thought was good although a little tough.  The portion is a little skimpy so order an empanada as well with this dish.  The beans were excellent and came with each of our dishes. There were insufficient beans as compared to the amount of rice available to mix the two. Our party ordered the seafood empanadas which were excellent.  For dessert we ordered a flan flight that was excellent.  It came with three small flan we got to choose from a list of multiple flavors.This is a BYOB restaurant and the staff is helpful in bringing ice and glasses.  I would consider returning, but it a really smallspace and I'm not a huge fan of waiting around for food.

46.description: Very good!  The owner is super friendly and really cares about what he dishes out.  Pun intended!  The empanadas are amazing - a must try!

1.description: We had a really lovely time here tonight.Bf and I came in with a bottle of wine, which was immediately opened and served for us. Our server (Felipe?) was prompt, friendly, helpful, and seemed to really care about whether we had a good time.I started with the chicken potato empanada, which was delicious - probably the best empanada I've had so far in Chicago. Bf had the ceviche, which he said was great. They came on a bed of plantain chips - like 50 chips - and I ate all of them. Go me. Chimichurri sauce was also provided. Tip: put that shit on everything.Then for our mains, we shared the pork chops and the paella (a special). Whoa. What. Both were amazing. The pork was thick, juicy, and sauced perfectly atop a wonderful, smushy bed of yucca mash. The paella was very generously portioned, piled high with giant shrimp, scallops, clams, and prawns. They did not skimp on this dish. We stuffed ourselves and still had a ton to take home.To finish we asked Felipe to choose a flan for us - he brought us the hazelnut, which was a home run. BF is ambivalent about hazelnut usually, but he loved this dessert. There was a lot to love.This place is not cheap, but it's worth it for the hospitality, fun ambiance, stellar service, and top-notch eats.

55.description: The food is really good !  The yucca fries and the empanadas and  the chicken plate was all really good ! And I know rice and beans are rice beans but theirs tasted so delicious ! It's a little pricey for but the quality you taste in  the food, it  makes for up the high price .

9.description: My husband do the early dinner because of our sons bedtime and every time we have come here we have been seated immediately. The food really good and this is a great addition to the neighborhood. We have been here twice and have tried quite a bit on the menu.  My favorite is the special, I think it is called the Last Dinner, that feeds two and has the prawns, steak and fish. It is filling and cooked to perfection.  The only thing I would pass on are the Yuca Fritas, they reminded me of french fries without any flavor.  We enjoyed the dipping sauce way more than the fries. If you like hot sauce ask for a side of their hot sauce, it is so good and I dipped everything in it.The servers make you feel like family and are attentive. Being BYOB is another plus for this little place and I hope that doesn't change!

26.description: Good Caribbean food. Tiny but we'll decorated local. Kind staff and accurate suggestions if you're on your first visit

25.description: My friend brought me here for dinner and it was yummy! And it's byob...doesn't get any better than that. We had the ceviche and it was delicious, made with chip plantains which gave it a crunch. I had the lechon as my entree and it was full of flavor! My friend has the steak which I forgot what is was called but she did say it was also pretty tasty. I must go back and try the rest of their menu!

12.description: I'm in love with this quaint Roscoe jewel. Authentic wonderful creative dishes is only the half of it. Our server Jeanette can describe the dishes and flan in a way that will make you want to have everything on the menu. The churrasco was perfect! It actually was the best I've had in this city. There was an amazing spicy green salsa that I loved. Great white rice and black beans and plátanos maduras. As Jeanette described some of the specialty flan, my mouth watered...Frida Flan, Celia Flan, Salma Flan and Retro on Roscoe Flan. It's BYOB, but they bring lots of fun to the table...literally. They have tableside Sangría and Mojito stations. You can't go wrong here. #cuba312

59.description: Finally tried this place and it was good! The ceviche was a great way to start, light and refreshing. I had the Ropa Vieja and it was delicious (90 miles is still my favorite version) but this one is a close second. The black beans were good but missing something, I'll have to try them again and figure out what is. My friend had the surf and turf and it was good. My one disappointment was that I ordered a side of maduros and they were served to me pretty burnt. Come on chef how can you send out an entire order of burnt sweet plantains? For dessert we went all out and had the flan flight. It was delicious! Each flan was amazing and perfectly creamy. Overall, it was a good dinner and I will be back to try more of the menu at Cuba 312.

21.description: Food is really good, service was excellent (we had a large group).  And loved the sangria they made with our wine!  Will definitely go back.

17.description: Love this place! We live very close so we can grab a bottle of wine and walk over. We've been there three times and it was consistently excellent. The service was great. The atmosphere is fun and it's BYOB! Does it get better than this?

10.description: Great food!! We came here for a pre valentines dinner and our expectations were way exceeded! The ribeye was super tender and delicious. Would definitely recommend it!!

5.description: We had two jibaritos, one veggie and another one with crab meat. Both were good. We also had the veggie empanadas and the yuca with the chimichurri. I asked management, through an email a while ago, to add a seitan jibarito. Other places offer it and it's delicious. This restaurant however is the closest to my house and it would be great if they did offer it. Anyway, what we had was good. For desert we ordered the coconut flan. We didn't think it was good. Maybe we are used to great flan in similar restaurants in Chicago. Customer service was Great. Hope this place stays around. We will be back.

3.description: Outstanding food and service. The Steak Jibarito was amazing. The plantains had the perfect saltiness and the steak was quite flavorful. The Yuca Fries were addicting. We finished it within minutes. Their Cafe Con Leche was piping hot, but so good that I burnt my tongue b/c I couldn't stand waiting for it to cool down. Our waiter was very friendly, attentive, and greatly knowledgeable. Everything he mentioned about the specials and favorites on the menus sounded so good. He even helped us decide what to order.  He even reminded us that it was BYOB and mentioned there was a liquor store across the street in case we wanted to pick something up. It's a pretty small place and with the BYOB, we noticed a lot of tables staying quite a while just drinking after their meals, so I can see there being high wait times during peak times. Highly recommend and definitely come outside of peak times.

35.description: Hooooly buckets this place is good. Awesome vibes right when you walk in. Fantastic coffee menu and the Cuban was awesome. The garlic sauce instead of ketchup with the fries was delish. Our server was very friendly and didn't make fun of my white girl accent while trying to pronounce the Cuban words. Love that it's BYOB. Live down the block and will definitely be back.

19.description: Service fast and personable Food fresh and delicious Atmosphere laid back Decor love the fresh flowers at the table are a great touch.  The steak was simply amazing. Perfection! tender, perfectly  seasoned and cooked. The menu is very well put together and Very moderately priced.The thought and effort put into the execution of this establishment shows. Great job guys

28.description: This place is great! We went for lunch and were pleasantly surprised.  The empanadas were delicious,  the Cuban coffee was great,  and the Cubano sandwich was fantastic.  My wife got the chicken wrap and that was also delicious. The food was fresh and full of flavor.  Highly recommend!

45.description: The food was marvelous! I love Cuban food and I usually go to 90 miles (both locations) to get my fix.I took one star off due to the service, the food took a long time and we came here right before the dinner rush (5ish). And our server rarely checked on us. Maybe the service would get better the next time we come back. I would definitely give it another try.I recommend the empanadas, churassco, and the smoothies.

33.description: This place is great for what it is.... The only thing I don't like is the loud music that gets on your nerves after seating there for a while. Food and service are awesome!

43.description: We went here last night for dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday.  It's a small place with very friendly staff and the food was outstanding!  We ordered two appetizers for the table, the croquetas and the corn based tamale to split and they were great.  We all ordered the same entree which was the Churrasco Cubano.  This skirt steak was so delicious I would have a hard time trying other menu items because I will look forward to this item every time I go.  On top of the skirt steak, the maduros were perfectly cooked and very fresh.  The staff was great and let us stay a little later to finish our wine while they rolled silverware.  We will definitely be back!

2.description: 1. BYOB, no corkage fee2. Amazing food3. Kind owners and waitstaffWhat a gem in Roscoe Village!My husband and I stopped in on a chilly winter evening. The place was warm and inviting.We brought our own wine (from Lush, just up the street) and it was opened for us right away, with wine glasses brought to our table just as quickly. Our waitress was very friendly and came over to let us know the specials after we'd settled in a bit.I ordered my favorite from a Cuban restaurant - the Cubano - which came with rice and beans. I also ordered a side of the maduros. It was all delicious and warmed me right up from the snow outside. My husband ordered the steak dish on special. I was able to get a bite of it, and it was amazing as well.We finished the night with a cafe con leche, which just hit the spot. Oh, and the owners came over to talk with us before our dinner. They were so sweet, and we enjoyed talking to them. Stop in and you won't be disappointed.

18.description: Cuba 312 most certainly is living up to its name, I have to start by saying that one of my FAVORITE servers has now relocated to serving in this super chic and inviting restaurant, which makes it all the merrier. Being Cuban, my standards are quite high when it comes to other Cuban restaurants, so this review will be nothing short of that..I had a media noche sandwhich, **PLZ PLZ PLZ TRY THIS SANDWHICH WITH A SIDE OF GUAVA MARMALADE** (as i melt in my chair rn)That sandwhich left me in sandwhich heaven, the maduros are FRESH! (unlike some other cuban places around town) and the yuca fries are so fresh every bite is to die for, my boyfriend had the ropa vieja which was super tasty, rice portions are a bit small for the amount of food we had, but eh! For dessert, we did the hazelnut flan..................................................................... (yes, i put all of those periods to visually show you the way i feel about the flan they serve)A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!I told Felipe it was nearly comparable to my mothers flan (which, is a HUGE compliment seeing how my mother makes the best flan in the world *ahem*)Texture is one of the biggest factors in Flan, the texture here was so on point. Didn't lack any flavor, didn't lack anything at all. Perfect!Authentic cuban food, in a super cute spot, the cuban paintings on the wall are so flashy, and the bathrooms are coded by gender, (obvi)Males: Abuello smoking a fat cigarFemales: Abuella smoking a fat cigar. Couldn't be more original, they do however, have Jibaritos on the menu for all my puerto rican folks who don't mind a good jibarito which did originate here in Chicago to  begin with. You should also know that the pictures up on the blue wall with the flat screen are all FOR SALE by one of the best servers in Chicago himself (Felipe)!Very happy Chicago finally got some authentic Cuban food, all we need is an authentic Cuban bakery y ya! the owner is super chill also.And don't forget to leave your feedback in the comments card they include in the checkbook for any recommendations, feedback, and more!VIVA CUBA!! ;)

41.description: Delicious food and wonderful atmosphere! Perfect for a girls' night out! The service was on point and everything we ordered was perfection!

52.description: Love the food here.....Very creative with wonderful flavor....Great staff and decor. Ropa vieja the best en chicago!!!...

50.description: Love this place, nice open window in front, staff are very friendly.  We had a seafood plantain appetizer with perfectly cooked shrimp and scallops.  Then for the main course they had a whole red snapper.  I've had worse fish on islands.  By far the best on the city that I have found.  Plus the place is moderately priced and byob!!!!  Can't get much better.

4.description: This would have been a 4, but our reservations were not taken seriously and I had to take a star off for that. Although our group of five had reservations, it took 30 minutes to seat us.  After that, service was good.I ordered the flank steak and enjoyed it.  It was properly cooked to medium rare and well seasoned.  I did not love the plantains served on the side.  My wife ordered a slow cooked beef stew (something roja) that I thought was good although a little tough.  The portion is a little skimpy so order an empanada as well with this dish.  The beans were excellent and came with each of our dishes. There were insufficient beans as compared to the amount of rice available to mix the two. Our party ordered the seafood empanadas which were excellent.  For dessert we ordered a flan flight that was excellent.  It came with three small flan we got to choose from a list of multiple flavors.This is a BYOB restaurant and the staff is helpful in bringing ice and glasses.  I would consider returning, but it a really smallspace and I'm not a huge fan of waiting around for food.

6.description: Everything I ate was amazing! From appetizer to the dinner to the desert. There was a bit of a wait for my dinner but the waiter advised that I ordered a appetizer. So I ordered a empanada of chicken and potato it was delicious especially with the chimi cherry sauce it was served with. Now my dinner platter was served with amazing white rice and black beans the beans literally melted in my mouth the steak was cooked to perfection. The plantain maduros could have been a little sweeter but they were good. As for my desert someone recommended the coconut flan. I have been in a coconut mood so I decided to give it a go. I was very good fresh tasting not too sweet and it had shreds of the coconut in there. MUST TRY

22.description: Food is good but definitely not worth the prices i understand the area is nice and your catering to people with more money but you can easily go to la unica on devon and grab plates just as good or better bigger portions for half the price

15.description: Food and service was fantastic!Favorites were the chimichurri sauce, the Media Noche sandwich, and the mashed potatoes.Remember it's BYOB!

57.description: Went for lunch.  Small but God was wonderful and our server was top notch.  I will be back

20.description: My husband do the early dinner because of our sons bedtime and every time we have come here we have been seated immediately. The food really good and this is a great addition to the neighborhood. We have been here twice and have tried quite a bit on the menu.  My favorite is the special, I think it is called the Last Dinner, that feeds two and has the prawns, steak and fish. It is filling and cooked to perfection.  The only thing I would pass on are the Yuca Fritas, they reminded me of french fries without any flavor.  We enjoyed the dipping sauce way more than the fries. If you like hot sauce ask for a side of their hot sauce, it is so good and I dipped everything in it.The servers make you feel like family and are attentive. Being BYOB is another plus for this little place and I hope that doesn't change!

36.description: Cuba 312 does not disappoint! We ordered the avocado salad with like vinaigrette and croquettes for an appetizer. Both were extremely flavorful and the salad was fresh. We decided to order the Last Dinner platter which has scallops, steak, prawns, potatoes, and the catch of the day. SO GOOD!!! My boyfriend will drool for days thinking about the steak, he said it was perfect! Another plus is this place is BYOB! Great for date night, girls night, or a family dinner! Check it out!!

14.description: Cuba 312 does not disappoint! We ordered the avocado salad with like vinaigrette and croquettes for an appetizer. Both were extremely flavorful and the salad was fresh. We decided to order the Last Dinner platter which has scallops, steak, prawns, potatoes, and the catch of the day. SO GOOD!!! My boyfriend will drool for days thinking about the steak, he said it was perfect! Another plus is this place is BYOB! Great for date night, girls night, or a family dinner! Check it out!!

58.description: I love love love my local Costellos.  The food is scrumptious and on top of that, the customer service is the best!  I was having a total "unable to make a decision" moment and the guy behind the counter (cute, wears black square framed glasses) literally gave me a ton of options until he could get something I wanted.  Very flexible and quite helpful!

56.description: Have been eating at Costello for 7 years. Great for a quick lunch and food is always very good. Also found quality is very consistent across locations.

29.description: One of my favorite sandwich spots in the city!

42.description: I don't know why it took me so long to write a review for Costello's on Roscoe.  I've never had a bad experience and I really dig what they're up to over there lately.  My favorite sandwich is the Subcopolypse which is a smorgasbord of meats, piled high and assembled with care.  I also recommend the Spicy Roscoe and the Southwest Chick Wrap (it's made with chipotle tortilla).  Aside from their diverse menu of sandwiches, their sides are pretty dank (I'm bringing that word back) too.  I don't get too many of these but it is hard to say no to chili-mac.  Actually, if you say not to chili-mac, well, I'd just prefer not to know.  What has really done it for me though is the opportunity to create your own sandwich and have it be on special for a week at the restaurant.  Sandwich is my favorite food and having the space to express my creativity through my palette is just exciting to me.  They have an impressive list of items to chose from so you can really go deep.  Oh, and you can provide instructions on how to prepare your ultimate sammi.  If you're ever in Costello's and grab "The Wolfman's Cheddar" you can thank me for granting all of your tummy's wishes.

23.description: Super small but delicious!  I have the hot Turk and potato salad and they were both flavorful and tasted like they were made fresh. We had kids with us and it was a little tight with the strollers but definitely worth squeezing in!  They deliver which is awesome!

47.description: The pinnacle of a great sandwich is the combination of fresh bread, plenty of delicious meat accompanied by the right amount of condiment to compliment the main ingredient. My coworkers and I just finished a large order that included 5 horseradish roast beef sandwiches. Verdict? There was maybe enough meat to make one decent sandwich spread amongst all of them and enough lettuce and onion on each to make 5 sandwiches. Each sandwich literally had two paper thin slices of meat on them and everyone's meal ended with a leaf pile sized mound of lettuce and onion in front of them. Also, the "muffuletta style" bread rolls they were served on were nice and stale, which was ironically complemented by the abundance of vegetable condiment.
