The sides however, while not remarkable, we're fairly decent and everyone agreed that the red mashed potatoes and chipotle Mac n' cheese were the best part of the meal. All in all, if you're in the mood for a good deli sandwich I suggest try any other establishment.

8.description: Pretty good local joint.  I wish I couldGive halfStars, but I always round up if it is good!I'm not a big meat eater, and they always do a custom veggie wrap for me.  The best part is, everyone that works there makes me feel like they're happy to accommodate.  They do it all with a smile to boot, so kudos Costello's employees!Also, if they have it, get a side of the tuna pasta salad with pineapple; it sounds like an odd combination, but trust me when I say it is delicious!

31.description: Never been here, ordered through grub hub. Amazing food. Definitely worth your buck. Decent portions, amazing sandwhiches, macaroni and potatoes.

34.description: Sandwiches & salads are ok. I tried Garden Salad and I like the dressing and also All Veggies Sandwich and it was ok! Just ok :)

16.description: This place has been out of their fountain drinks for weeks. Now they are out of a lot of their sandwich ingredients.  Looks like a restaurant that's going out of business.

13.description: Costello's was the grandfather of baked sandwiches before the other kids came around.  I have been going to Costello's since 1998.  Always delicious and consistant.  Went in today and right away noticed it looked different.  Soda machine was gone and the sides were gone and it just looked different.  I ordered and watched them make the sandwich.  Noticed right away the lettuce wasn't shreaded, instead it was a lettuce leaf?  I then realized this is not "my Costello's"  - there must be new owners.  I gave it a try and was extrmely disappointed.  Bread is now chewy instead of crunchy and it just tasted average.  I'm so upset.  I hate it when people mess with a good thing.  If you are going to change it up - at least change the name so you can warn the regulars.

11.description: Ordered delivery off Grubhub. I'm a vegetarian so I got a Village Veggie Deluxe meal. I requested in my order that they add some pickles or banana peppers to my sandwich and they did, which was a huge plus for me. The sandwich was a little small but very good and the potato salad was delicious. They also have a deal where if you spend more than $20 on Grubhub you get a free cookie so that was appreciated as well. And the delivery was quick and the driver was super friendly!

39.description: I've eaten here 6 times in The last few months, and every sandwich I've had had been great. I'm eating the Mess right now, with provolone, coleslaw and French fries. Amazing

37.description: The sandwiches are very bready and somewhat dry, unless you spend $8 on the subpocalypse, which is overpriced for what you get in return.  Think Potbelly with thicker bread.  The sides are better than the sandwiches.  The place is large, clean and often has live music.  The service is a little slow but friendly.  I've tried twice and this doesn't compare to any of my favorite Chicago sandwich shops...pretty average overall.

0.description: So tasty! Just ordered lunch delivered and it showed up in 20 minutes! We orders the mess and roast turkey sandwich - both are super fresh. I even asked them to add pesto on turkey and they did, no charge!My only complaint is they sent me chips instead of apples, but not a big deal at all :)UPDATE - this is our go to sandwich shop for sure! Our orders usually come in less than a half hour after ordering. The only problem is trying to figure out what sandwich to order because they're all so good! My favorite is the Rueben.

38.description: Costello's is a consistent and reliable place to have in the neighborhood. They have an extremely extensive menu for a sandwich shop, and everything we've tried has been really good. The sides are especially great - I haven't tried them all yet but the chipotle mac and cheese is one of my favorites! The place is a little pricey for lunch, but I do think their quality sets them apart from the typical Potbellys, etc. I wouldn't have it every day or anything, but it's a good choice for a casual lunch every once and again.

51.description: Sandwiches... nothing special. Skip

27.description: I can't believe I paid ~$10 for a tiny sandwich. I was looking forward to a Veggie Pizza, but when I got it - shocker. I had to take a double look as I was surprised on how tiny the thing was. Normally I get hungry a few hours after, but after my lunch today I had to do a repeat back home. Food tasted fine, but for the price, I'd rather get filled up somewhere else.

32.description: I live pretty close to this place, so I come here pretty frequently. I usually get the Mess, because it's filling and doesn't make me feel like I'm overpaying for a mediocre sandwich. The problem is that they frequently (nearly every time) mess up special orders. I ordered a mess today with no coleslaw, and got home to find that not only did they not fulfill the request, the coleslaw had leaked all over the sandwich rendering the bread entirely inedible. I called to complain and the guy was pretty nice about it, but I'm done giving Costello's chances. The food is expensive, the service is slow, and in the end the product is just okay.

54.description: First time at Costellos, overall great experience. Great sandwhich, great service, and reasonable prices. Would definitely visit again.

48.description: I'm sorry to say this place offers... mediocre food.Neither the flavors nor the portions inspire cravings for more. I can't even remember what I had the few times I've been here.That being said, the staff is very friendly and patient.

44.description: This was the worst lunch I have ever ordered. Got a chicken Caesar salad and when I received it, it looked like the chicken had been pre-chewed, it came with black olives and whole chunks of soggy tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, and no cheese/croutons, anything else.  The dressing was on the side and tasted terrible. I ate two bites and threw it away. Disgusting and I will not return.  Costello's, you should seriously rethink your salad offerings.  I have heard from many people that the sandwiches are good, though.

24.description: I wish they had better hours. Just came from there. Don't open until 11 and close at 8. The time before I came as they were closing. Sandwiches are good, but I can never get one when I'm in the area. You're missing money with the crappy hours...

7.description: Great food and amazing customer service! The staff here is so nice and I love their sandwiches. I couldn't decide which one I wanted, so the guy working suggested the chipotle chicken sub and it was delicious.I highly recommend this place and will be back very soon!

49.description: Been going here for years for lunch.  Great sandwiches.

40.description: This place is great! Their food is solid. I live in the neighborhood and their food is some of the most consistently good food I've had. As a vegetarian, I recommend the veggie pizza pie

53.description: The kid at the counter last week was super. However, he was there with only one other person and wait time was rediculous for the lunch time rush. Management has to make sure there are enough people there. Why wasnt a manager there? Given the above average pricing for a sandwhich these days, I didnt appreciate having to wolf it all down to be on time for an appointment I had. I have lived in the neighborhood for over five years, I ate here twice. That should say something. This will be the last time I eat here.

30.description: Being from Pittsburgh, I can really appreciate a delicious hoagie. Costello's has some great ones! I especially liked the sub named "The Mess". It has French fries and cole slaw in the sub just like in my hometown. Biting into a good sub takes me back and reminds me of simpler times.

46.description: Fav sandwiches: Southern Rueben, Subpocalypse, Roast Turkey on Focaccia.Get a Costello's card and go on Tuesday. It's double punch day!

1.description: New management has essentially ruined this restaurant.  Quality has gone way down to the point where you can get a better tasting sandwich at Jimmy John's down the street.  Requesting an alteration on a sandwich is just asking for your order to be wrong.  The interior feels like a hallowed out shell of what it used to be with the previous management.On top of that, they don't accept finished loyalty cards anymore.  I could understand phasing them out and not punching them anymore, but seems a bit cold to turn away consistent customers over a single sandwich.

55.description: Great location....yummy sandwich...fair price....good service.  5 star first impression!  Oliver and the crew are really friendly and the music rocks!!

9.description: prices went up, quality and menu went down.  I used to love Costello's sandwiches, now YUCK.  They've changed all that was good: ingredients, punch cards, fountain drinks, and the list could go on.  Maybe the Lincoln Square location stayed the same?  even though roscoe is the "original" it's no good anymore.

26.description: Sandwiches are good. I had a turkey and provolone and im a fan. The soup was basically noodles and water. Definitely room for improvement there. Staff is friendly and the prices are good. Lunch spot id go to again.

25.description: This place is a good standby for us when we just want a casual sandwich meal. When I was pregnant, I can't even count the number of times I'd send my husband out for a costello's club sandwich (still my favorite.) my husband always gets some type of grinder and our little guy will always eat the hummus or mashed potatoes.

12.description: Went in yesterday to grab lunch and  was disappointed to see an entirely new staff. It didn't end there. My sandwich was made incorrectly. The meat was gross. Tasted like something out of a lunchable. And they were out of sun chips. But had other crappy chips. I'm sad to see this place go down hill. It has always been one of my favorites.

59.description: Yummy had a nice selection of sandwiches and wraps It is a basic sandwich shop with great taste. My wrap wasn't smothered with cheese which I am happy about.

21.description: This place has been out of their fountain drinks for weeks. Now they are out of a lot of their sandwich ingredients.  Looks like a restaurant that's going out of business.

17.description: Right next to Starbucks , a small little sandwich spot . They have delicious sandwiches ! Very light and fresh . I got a turkey grinder and it was on a soft yet crunchy bread and the turkey was very fresh .The sandwiches come with a bag of potato chips but no drink . The total for a sandwich and chips and drink is 9.41 . Highly recommended !!

10.description: Not impressed with this Costello's, which is a dreary version of it's Lincoln Square location. Food was good and what I was expecting, but the dining room was more than disappointing. While the Lincoln Square location is bright and full of families, this location is hot, dark and extremely dirty. My son and I had to settle for the least dirty table when we were there because every single one was not clean, probably should have just taken it to go and had a much better experience! Will not be coming to this location again!

5.description: We came here for lunch on a Saturday and the place was packed!  I felt like the wait was very long despite there being plenty of workers behind the counter.  I ordered the ham&swiss on foccacia and my bf got an Italian sub.  The sandwiches are good quality and the bread is excellent, but for the price, I think the sandwiches are very small and I was still hungry after eating mine and chips.

3.description: Great local sandwich shop on the Roscoe strip. The shining star for me here is the side dishes. Their chipotle(or pesto) macs are delicious! The chili is also really great. They have all types of sandwiches, anything you can imagine really. My favorite are the focaccia options.

35.description: Okay so I ordered the mess, with the chipotle Mac and cheese. The mess was kind of bland but it was stuffed full of toppings and filled me up pretty fast.I was enjoying my Mac and cheese until I found a hair which just totally turned me off of it.It was pricey and delivery took forever so I don't know if I would order again.

19.description: Super small but delicious!  I have the hot Turk and potato salad and they were both flavorful and tasted like they were made fresh. We had kids with us and it was a little tight with the strollers but definitely worth squeezing in!  They deliver which is awesome!

28.description: My favorite lunch spot for soup and a sandwich!

45.description: The food is OKAY.  If you are walking by its a nice spot to walk in, but the delivery charge is steep and winds up being close to $20 for a sandwich,chips, and side.Reminds me of potbelly's a lot.  The chipotle mac and cheese is normal mac and cheese and they put a glob of chipotle on top - nothing special.The sandwich was also small and did not contain much meat - I was still starving.Other sandwich places offer larger portions at cheaper prices.  Pass on Costellos.

33.description: I have dreams about their chicken pesto sandwich. It's the best I've ever had. The shop is clean with quick service. They play fun old-school music for you as you dine. I highly recommend this place.

43.description: I've walked past costellos a few times before and it looks like it'll be a cheap greasy sandwich place. Tried it today and was pleasantly surprised to be wrong! I had the subpocalypse which was delightful and tasty.I would say that the food is a bit better than a potbellies at a few dollars more expensive. I would definitely go back.

2.description: I know we only see each other a few times a year, but...Costello's...I think we need to break up. And it's not me, it's you. What have you done to the Beefsteak?! It's dry! The bread is all wrong! And the meat is just no good! I loved having that sandwich in the dead of winter. I know you are thinking, "Well surly we don't have to break up, you can just order something else, didn't you like the veggie options?"Oh, Costello's, if only it were that simple. You are forgetting the straw that broke the came's back, NO MORE SUN CHIPS!Relationship over.

18.description: A cut above your run of the mill sandwich shops. Amazing food and really fast delivery.

41.description: My favorite sandwich place in Roscoe Village!  Everything is very fresh, tasty and the price is reasonable.  Always my go to spot when I want a quick lunch or dinner.

52.description: A couple of years ago I would have given Costello's 4 stars. The service is great and the sandwiches aren't bad (they are a step up from Potbelly's) but they changed their chipotle mac and cheese. Before, it was a spicy cheese blend that had a kick to it. I guess it was a bit much for some because now this side is just regular mac and cheese with a squirt of chipotle sauce on top. Parking can be difficult and for some reason, my chicken sandwich is always cold by the time I get back to my office (about 1 mile away). I'll go back but I won't be getting the mac and cheese.

50.description: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! I plan on going here again for sure. It's a little small as far as seating goes, but that's the only thing close to negative. You get a LOT for your money. $10 get you a delicious sandwich big enough to make into two meals, chips, drink, and a cookie! They are laid back and casual. Did I mention delicious? Some of the menu options are pretty similar, but the creativity of their menu overall sets them apart from sandwich chains. There is no reason not to go... So do it.

4.description: Stopped by Costello's on a Saturday afternoon. I was impressed with the number of sandwich and side options they had on their menu. Decided on the Subpocalypse, which had several meats, cheeses and peppers/onions on a ciabatta bun. Also ordered a side of the chipotle mac n cheese. Sandwiches come with chips and you get a free drink if you order a side. $12 for all of it which wasn't bad.Sandwich was really good! Bread was fresh and the chipotle ranch kept the sandwich moist. Mac n cheese had a little extra zip because of the chipotle sauce and was nice and hot. Honestly, I'm shocked by all the 1 star reviews on yelp. My food tasted great, the restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly. I even overheard the manager helping a customer put together a custom order of larger sized subs. Maybe Roscoe Village has become a bit too yuppie for a no-frills sandwich shop like this. It's a hell of a lot better than Subway and has WAY more options than Potbelly. I'll be back!

6.description: What happened to my favorite sandwich place in Chicago? :(I couldn't figure out what happened as my last two visits my regular go to sandwich just tasted off/different. Same one I have ordered for the last five plus years. I figured it out, the Pico de Gallo is now replaced by diced tomatoes and red onions. I explained to the new guy working there that this isn't the same thing but he seemed to think it is the same. My girlfriend was with me and she noticed the chicken really tasted different.I thought the new guy was a manager, but learned today he is the new owner. UGH! New owner!!!Sometimes changes can be good, not here.Fountain drinks with free refills are gone, now it is $2 for a can of Coke. Sun Chips gone for cheap chips. A cookie with a long list of ingredients, $3! One might jump to the conclusion that this store is only looking for higher profits over customer satisfaction and quality.He also said he wouldn't take the punch loyalty card anyone. Nice customer service! I went to the Lincoln Square restaurant today and to my complete happiness, they are still owned by the original owners. My sandwich was SOOOO GOOD!!! Real Pico!!!!Roscoe Village I won't be visiting you any more. I'll be trekking twice the distance to Lincoln Square. By the way, I used my punch card today at LS - my new sandwich home!

22.description: Incredibly disappointed.  I used to live in Chicago and would get Costello's often. I LOVED the chipotle chicken sandwich with a side of pineapple tuna salad and a Nantucket Nectar drink. Visiting Chicago today, so I came in for my old "usual" order... Tuna salad was not available, nor was the chili. So I got the pesto mac n cheese- not bad, but not terrific, either. The soda fountain was almost all "out of order" and they didn't have bottled drinks! The Chipotle chicken sandwich was very disappointing... The chicken was tough, the sauce was scarce,  and there were no peppers! The peppers are the best part, very upsetting! Overall, incredibly underwhelmed with my experience today and will not be back. Heavy-hearted, since I used to love this place.

15.description: Sandwiches & salads are ok. I tried Garden Salad and I like the dressing and also All Veggies Sandwich and it was ok! Just ok :)

57.description: Nothing great, nothing terrible, nothing that knocked my socks off.I ordered the Spicy Roscoe. It was loaded with mayo (I did not heed the warning of others that the sandwich would be doused with it), lacked a fair amount of turkey, and wasn't really spicy. The size of the sandwich was decent, but I didn't think it was anywhere near the best I've had. I did get the mashed potatoes as a side and they were warm and tasted fresh. We ordered online, walked over to pick it up, and had no problems with the order. No waiting at the restaurant and the order was correct.I'll probably order from here again, as it's close by and convenient, but I won't be expecting too much.

20.description: Went in yesterday to grab lunch and  was disappointed to see an entirely new staff. It didn't end there. My sandwich was made incorrectly. The meat was gross. Tasted like something out of a lunchable. And they were out of sun chips. But had other crappy chips. I'm sad to see this place go down hill. It has always been one of my favorites.

36.description: Would have been 5 stars but I didn't care for the Mac n cheese. Turkey grinder was great. Delivery took 1.5 hrs though- not great.

14.description: I have always loved Costello's which is why I had 10 punches on my sandwich card. I was excited to go in for my free sandwich when I encountered the douchebag of a new owner. Not only would he not accept my punch card but he had an attitude and snarky remarks to go with it. Accepting defeat I handed him my credit card to which he disappeared into the back room for a couple minutes. When he returned he announced the internet was down and started fumbling on the computer. I had to get to work so I told him to forget it. Mr. Not Customer savvy snatched the sandwich from the counter and said, "Fine." Needless to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment due to the unfortunate new owner who is unappreciative of loyal customers and incapable of properly running a business.

1.description: Cheap, large portions, tasty food.The crab rangoon does have more onions than normal but I like onions so I personally don't mind. And very fast delivery! Here in under 1/2 hour and freshly made. Ordered from here twice in the last week.

9.description: Found this place on Seamless and wasn't sure what to expect, but it honestly has been some of the best Chinese food I have ever had.  The prices are amazing and the taste, temperature and look of the food you get is excellent.  They had the food ready when they said they would, the staff was extremely friendly, I suggest anyone in the Irving Park, Avondale, Roscoe Village neighborhoods to check this place out!

23.description: I can't wait for #1 Chop Suey to reopen, The dog even hesitated !!!

12.description: I don't usually post reviews, good or bad, but our experience was pretty terrible. We order two meals and a soup for delivery at around 7pm and it didn't get delivered until 10. One order was wrong and the chicken in the other meal had a jello texture. The soup didn't have much flavor either. I don't recommend ordering from here.

21.description: Great, quick, good value.  This is our go-to Chinese--  HUGE PORTIONS.

16.description: crab rangoon here is excellent!  This place is pretty decent Chinese food, but the only thing is it comes in two portion sizes:  Regular and Large.  The large is seriously 2-3 portions which is just huge.  I ordered 2 large entrees for 2 people and had leftovers for days.  Order the regular!

17.description: This place has wonderful noodles and the best sweet and sour chicken I've had in years! Delivery is quick too!

10.description: I don't normally do bad reviews but this place totally dropped the ball! I ordered lo mein and it had this super wack, slimy, weirdly sweet sauce on it. Totally inedible. Also, the delivery was really late... thankfully grub hub gave me  $5 credit for the wait, so I only wasted $20 instead of $25. Basically I threw a bunch of money down the toilet and I'm still hungry. I would have been happier eating my couch cushion.

5.description: This place is so good, and so cheap. I've ordered from here twice, and I've gotten crab rangoons, puerto rican fried rice, and bubble tea. All have been amazing...especially the bubble tea. Soooooo good. The fried rice is great, and the crab rangoons are probably the best I've had in the city so far. Not too gooey, but not too crunchy either. It's also probably the fastest delivery I've had, always under 40 minutes. And the best part - they're on grubhub, so I can order right from my phone.

11.description: Just ordered delivery for first time.  Service was prompt. They came well before the hour it told me.  Food was ok, about what you expect from a Chinese delivery but nothing that blows you away.  Two stars because my beef and broccoli had a staple in it.  Literally.  Good thing I noticed it on my plate before eating it.

22.description: This is my first one star review. My order is half uneaten on the kitchen table right now. I got two orders, one orange chicken and one mongolian beef; $15, so not too bad. But it was! I should have known when I saw the chef cooking a ton of battered chicken, and putting right into the fridge once it was done. That might explain why the bread and chicken did not stick together as I put my fork through it. It was literally square pieces of chicken inside a big blob of breaded orange goop. The beef was a little bit better, but too rubber-like, and the onions tasted old. I miss Tasty House!!! Besides chicken from jewel and big boys, tasty house was a staple for lunch in high school. You future generations of Lane Tech kids will never know the pleasures of Tasty House...or BeBoBa.

0.description: Orange Chicken and Fried Rice is A1 every time. For $7 they'll give you enough food to feed four!

20.description: I thought this was a great cheap and fast place to get food. I got the cashew chicken and it was pretty darn good. The portion size is ridiculous and I love it. Several meals will come out of one order!

19.description: Though this place is new, I've already ordered from them twice. I have mixed feelings about it, but it's cheap and it's close, so I'll probably continue ordering from them.I really like that their "dinners" come with a ton of food - soup, main dish, fried rice, and an egg roll, all for less than $7. It's easily 2 meals for me.The dishes themselves are not the best I've had. So far, I've had the orange chicken and the kung pao chicken. The orange chicken was just OK, and the kung pao chicken seriously lacked some spice. The fried rice wasn't too flavorful either. I had to add soy sauce just to make it taste like something.The soups are really good though. My favorite is the simple egg drop, but my husband has had both the sweet and sour soup and the wonton soup and said both were food too. The egg rolls are cooked well, not too soggy or anything, and not too greasy.I'd go back for the large portions and great value, but only on nights when I'm feeling extra lazy and don't want to go too far for food.

2.description: DO NOT ORDER! I ordered New China 2's Chow Fun Noodles and a Mango smoothie for delivery. First of all it took 2 hours for the food to be delivered even though I live in the neighborhood. It was fine going down. However, soon after eating I threw up 3 times and no matter what I did I couldn't stop. I eventually stopped after I could only throw up water. I'm feeling a little better a day later, but I can hardly keep anything down. I highly recommend NOT trying their food.

18.description: Absolutely not. I ordered a yellow curry and it wasn't even yellow... The color looked so  unattractive and didn't even look delicious. I knew that when I saw it from the clear top container  that this review will be done. Potstickers were big, greasy, like a big ill meatball inside... Grossed me out. There's better, sorry but no thanks.

13.description: Never post reviews, but our experience with this place was horrible. Did not want to sound like a typical angry reviewer, but my husband and I could not let this go without notice of caution to other consumers. Here are the facts.Ordered at 8:11, estimated time of arrival was 9:12. GrubHub indicated the order was out for delivery at 8:52 (great!) and we did not receive it until close to 9:40 (what?!). That's food and smoothies in the car for over 40 minutes! That may have arrived even later if we did not call twice about the delay and concerns that our food will be cold and smoothies would melt after being in the delivery car for that long. When the food arrived, all of our suspicions above were true. We called asking for a refund and advised they can pick up the food because it was not acceptable. We were promised a refund. The driver was back at our door within a few minutes. He asked what was wrong with the food in a confrontational tone. We let him know that the food was cold, smoothies melted and spilled in the bag. When we asked about the refund, he told us to take it up with the restaurant. Interestingly, he was affiliated with the restaurant when confronting us about the order upon pick up and not when it came to the refund. We called the restaurant to confirm the refund after the driver picked up the food. They did not answer our calls. We had to contact GrubHub to dispute the charges and they confirmed that the restaurant did not initiate any refund. Thankfully, GrubHub was willing to process the refund. We have never experienced such terrible customer service and quality from a delivery. The way this was handled by the restaurant was very disingenuous and unprofessional. With the amount of competition out there, this deserves no stars. Beware.

4.description: New China 2 Mandarin Restaurant is located in a busy strip mallacross the street from Lane Tech, and since I was visiting Chasenext door I thought I would give them a try and honestly, I havebeen craving Chinese Food for quite a while now.This is a pretty small place, there are about 6 small tables inside forthose who choose to dine in, but basically I think it's more a take outoperation.So, I ordered Beef fried Rice, An order of Cantonese Fried Shrimp, Egg Rolls,and a Banana Smoothie.The very sweet young woman working behind the counter brought me mybanana smoothie and yes, I liked this a lot because I love bananas and the additional tapioca was pretty tasty.The Beef Fried Rice was very good, however, the egg rolls tasted reallybland even with the sweet and sour sauce added on.And, I will admit that I love shrimp, but, my major complaint with fried shrimpis that sometimes there is so much breading, this was definitely the case today,and these were really bland too.Now, the plusses are these..The food portion sizes are pretty big, They have daily lunch specials until4pm daily, Their menu prices are more than reasonable, actually I foundthem to be less expensive than other restaurants.So, there are some good things going on in here.I'll just say that I wanted to love this place, the best I can do is like it.And, I liked the my fortune inside my fortune cookie, it read..You stand in your own light, make it shine!Normally I don't agree with what these fortune cookies tell me butthis one I can learn to work with..So, in ending this was a 1 time visit, but don't think I'll be in a hurryto return..Something has to truly stand out before I will return and unfortunatelyNew China 2 Mandarin Restaurant didn't do that for me..Nothing left to say...

24.description: Though this place is new, I've already ordered from them twice. I have mixed feelings about it, but it's cheap and it's close, so I'll probably continue ordering from them.I really like that their "dinners" come with a ton of food - soup, main dish, fried rice, and an egg roll, all for less than $7. It's easily 2 meals for me.The dishes themselves are not the best I've had. So far, I've had the orange chicken and the kung pao chicken. The orange chicken was just OK, and the kung pao chicken seriously lacked some spice. The fried rice wasn't too flavorful either. I had to add soy sauce just to make it taste like something.The soups are really good though. My favorite is the simple egg drop, but my husband has had both the sweet and sour soup and the wonton soup and said both were food too. The egg rolls are cooked well, not too soggy or anything, and not too greasy.I'd go back for the large portions and great value, but only on nights when I'm feeling extra lazy and don't want to go too far for food.

6.description: Waste of $30!!! I ordered 2 entrees and a side for dinner at 630 and it didn't come till 750pm. Having to wait an hour and half made me hopeful that this better be good. I was surprised at the size of their dinner boxes, I mean they are Huge for $9, so big you have to carry with two hands bc the weight of the food was breaking the Styrofoam. Other then the size to price ratio everything else was gross!! I'm serious. ...the eggroll had a funky taste in it and the orange chicken didn't have much flavor, the chicken was a grey color in the side and just mushy. The crab ragoon were okay, it was the only thing I eat. We now have to huge boxes of food in our garbage and had to cook dinner bc this was so gross.

15.description: This is by far the worst lunch I have ever had in Chicago.  I ordered something off the menu and asked for it with a different sauce.   The order came the way I did not want it sent it back.  I watched them literally wash the chicken with water and then dump a new sauce over it.   It took a total of 30 seconds to make a new order?????   This place is a joke and will get you sick.  Eat at your own risk.

7.description: Good hole in the wall Chinese. You get what you expect and it tastes GOOD :-)Friendly new owner remembers me and I don't go that often. Good people making tasty food.

8.description: New China 2 is a pretty mediocre Chinese restaurant. I actually think I'm being somewhat generous. I generally try to keep my reviews very even keel but this place will receive a pretty harsh review. We ordered lo mein with pork, general tso chicken, and fried chicken wings. With the chicken we also received some fried rice. The fried rice, I think, was reheated and tasted vaguely of freezer burn. The lo mein had a hoisin-like sauce on it. It made the noodles little slimy and way too strong of a flavor. The chicken wings were bad; they were heavily fried and so crunchy that it was just hard to eat. I just can't really recommend this place. I've had some really great Chinese food in Chicago but this place just doesn't meet the standard.

3.description: Cheap + Pretty darned good.  We got some of their wings, Spicy Thai Basil Beef, and Empress chicken.  I put them in order of deliciousness.  The wings were very unique.  I don't know what they coat them with before they throw them in the fryer, but the coating is incredibly crunchy, so much so that I reheated them (in the microwave no less) and they were still pretty crunchy...wings generally get all grossy mushy in microwave.  The sauce on the wings was very sweet/sticky and tasted very much like traditional Chinese BBQ flavors.  The Spicy Thai Basil was a good dish, but I honestly didn't taste that much basil flavor...I dunno what I was expecting though ordering "Thai" from a tiny Chinese takeout place.  Nonetheless, it was tasty.  The Empress Chicken was the most "meh" of the dishes.  The chicken was breaded pretty thickly and of course the breading got mushy because of the sauce.  I will say all of the sauces were pretty sweet, so if you're not into that, maybe order something else?  All in all, a good value for quick Pan-Asian takeout.

14.description: It's no Tasty House, but it's a step up from the previous owner. Menu a bit limited, but haven't had a bad meal yet. Especially enjoy the new style Mongolian chicken. Even my four year old loves this place!

58.description: The problem with any 4am bar is, if you're in a position to suggest a 4 am bar, you've already too much to drink as it already 2 am! On a school night.The problem with Blue Light is it is walking (stumbling) distance to my home. Bad, bad, and bad. This summer I got to know most of the bartenders, Amy is super cool.I recently saw a group of girls dancing on the bar. The soon-to-be bf appreciated it.

56.description: had a great time with wild friends. what a local joint def a place to bring a pack of wolves too. The place doesn't get crowded until 1 or so .. But does have  a good selectioin of music and booze.

29.description: I wasn't a fan.  I didn't have a terrible time, but it's a dive bar with not exactly dive drink prices.  I liked that it was open until 5 am, the bouncers were nice, and I had a decent time.  It was fun observing and meeting a few characters I'd never talk to again.    I think there are many better dive bars, and maybe if they're not open 'til 5, 4 will just have to be the end of my night =)

42.description: The song with this title by Bloc Party is a real crowd pleaser.  Whenever the band breaks this one out, it's a really amazing performance with Kele Okereke bathed in the eponymous stage lighting and the crowd clapping along like they're at Reading or something.  Simply a wonderful love song.  Too bad the bar with the same title sucks so badly (and that Bloc Party can't sue for defamation of character).  The bar Blue Light,  full of douchebags and douchebagettes, would never be able to appreciate either the song "Blue Light" or the irony of it being played here while they try to hook up late night.Arriving just past 2:00 a.m., the modus operandi of Blue Light was very apparent.  The DJ was spinning nothing but R&B hook-up music and it was a swirl of hair gel and cheap American beer.  And that was just the chiller back room (which I shouldn't even mention since that might be the bar's only saving grace).  The front room was a madhouse of people who seemingly couldn't make the pickup at the 2:00 a.m. Roscoe Village bars.There's apparently a better beer selection up front, but the back bar doesn't even serve Guinness (or even PBR, just Miller Lite and such).  Drinking my Budweiser and listening to Ne-Yo, I couldn't even believe this place was on Western and was saddened that it seemed to be packed and wouldn't be closing down soon.Word on the street (from a former employee of this bar before its remodel into a giant douche) says this chad bar used to be better (though apparently still awful).  They might have even played "Blue Light" at Blue Light at one point.

23.description: A few weeks ago I was out and randomly and met this guy from LA.  It was his first time in Chicago and he had been here for 4 days and had only been exposed to the touristy bars and pubs in the city.  He seemed a bit disappointed.  After several drinks and a 2am closing at the location where we met, he asked if there were 4 am bars here in Chicago.  I said hell yeah, let's go.  Of course then I have to put my money where my mouth was-and think real hard about where the closest 4am bar is to my place...first one that came to mind: Blue Light.  For months I have driven past this place, dying to know what it is all about. I've just been so curious and promised myself someday I would make it there.We arrived around 2:30am, we were dressed pretty trendy-I had on my favorite Zara Skinny Jean, with a large cuff, black fitted jacket and these amazing, leopard print heals.  He of course, being from LA, looked amazing!  He had on this great button down, with a real casual cord blazer, a great pair of jeans and a really cool scarf.  So we walk in, and immediately look at each other and laughed.  Not only were we the tallest folks in the bar (he is 6'2" & with heals I was 5'10") we were the whitest.  This can be a little intimidating at times, but we had already been drinking and could have cared less.  We headed to the bar, got our bourbons and just took the atmosphere in.  Then we noticed the backroom.  Once we got back there and realized it was a dance floor and they were playing awesome rap, we were geeked.  We spent the next 1.5 just chilling to the music and in our own little world.  We were feeling it that night.  Lots of PDA going on around us, so we felt very comfortable being together--like I said, in our own little world! The patrons of the bar seemed like a tough crowd, nobody I would want to start shit with, but on the other hand there were no fights and didn't seem to be any issues while we were there.  As much as we stuck out like sore thumbs, nobody cared.  The bartenders were prompt, friendly and seemed cool.I will definitely be returning to Blue Light, but probably only with a male chaperone or a group with girls and guys (wishing my LA date would return to go back with me!).  It doesn't seem like somewhere a group of girls should go alone late at night.

47.description: Wow a 4am bar that I have visited many occasions. I mean what can be better than to people watch drunks!Chads,, hipsters, thugs all unite in a friendly setting of overpriced booze!Everyone one on a mission to get hammered and to plan where they are gonna eat afterwards!Yes many drunks from all parts of the city.............Lovely!Shake & Bake Seal of approval!

8.description: I'll start off by saying that I have been to blue light before a few times with friends and for it being probably one of the few bars open late it's been pretty fun, until this past Saturday. My cousin's in from Cali so I went with him and another cousin. We were by the bar and my cousin was trying to order some drinks, but for some reason couldn't place the order, he handed me his card and said "here you order, this guy's not going to take my order." He was speaking about the bartender, which I believe his name was Julio. Long story short I think he might have bothered Julio, not sure maybe if my cousin wasn't ready with his order or didn't know how to order, since it was Saturday, maybe the bartender thought my cousin was wasting his time. My cousin has a distinct personality so maybe he rubbed the bartender the wrong way, regardless now I was going to try to order. I saw the bartender was busy, but did try to let him know I wanted to order. He clearly saw me, but once again I was aware he was making drinks already, so I figured I'd wait, while I'm waiting he knocks down a cup filled with those cocktail mixers and crushers with what I'm assuming was water mixed with residue of drinks. Luckily I was paying attention and stepped back but some did manage to spill on my shirt. Julio the bartender proceeds to keep mixing the drink and doesn't bother giving me a rag, napkins or even picking up the cup. I grab my own napkins put some on the counter to stop the leakage off the counter and to dry my shirt. My cousin then goes to pick up the cup which was still just laying on the counter and then the bartender reaches for the cup and napkins, my cousin then tells him, "you know you knocked this down and it spilled on my cousin", the bartender glances at me and answers back "Ok and? What do you want me to do?" My cousin then says "well you could at least start by apologizing" the bartender then looks at me unapologetically and gives me the most fake apology of my life. That was probably the worst service I've ever had at a bar. Needless to say we didn't order anything from him. I probably won't be going back to blue light anytime soon. I really didn't appreciate the service or actually lack thereof. I think this bartender needs to learn how to be patient with his customers or at least be considerate and apologetic, when something's clearly his fault.

31.description: Blue Light, oh Blue Light, crazy, crazy, Blue Light.Oh what trip to Underbar is complete without taking a step into the wild side into Blue Light? While my friends were smoking, I peeped cross the parking lot and saw a stack of dudes outside Blue Light smoking while a girl in a white cocktail dress came out of Blue Light looking like she got out of Studio 54 or some jazz. A bit more motivated, we marched in to Blue Light and met great opposition when we got inside as this bar was loud blasting B96 tracks with the peacoat mafia shuffling in and out and rubbing up on everyone. At one booth featured a girl giving a guy a lapdance while pregnant girls were abound hopefully NOT imbibing alcoholic beverages. Ethnicities of all kind were represented and Blue Light had a tinge of the UN all over it with a chance of international incidents.Despite the chaos and pandemonium, the bartender was quick to ask for drinks and I made note even though I am on drinking hiatus until April 2nd. We got our drinks and speared ahead forward into the vice locked line to push to the back room and the dance floor. It was even tighter there as one guy was humping his less than attractive date using freakdancing moves in the confined space.We pushed and continued to the very back where we found seats and room to breathe. Eventually the monkey show started to abate and there was actually room to dance. Unfortunately, no one in this bar was going to dance as it was a total sausage fest with an estimated 12 guys for every girl. Good for the ladies, bad for An Unstoppable!! In the corner where some people dancing in their seats, too lazy to get off their ass while someone left a giant, giant stein filled with margarita.When the lights came on and the bouncer started yelling for everyone to get out it was as if someone had unleashed a torrent of cockroaches out who all were scurrying to get away. The music was off, the lights were on and it was everyone's last chance to take off their beer goggles before making the wrong decisions that define drinking as dangerous. While waiting outside ugly dudes were hopping into cabs with ugly girls looking as if they had won the lottery. I couldn't help but wonder what the morning would bring them!

34.description: This place has essentailly two things going for it.  1. It is open till 4am 2. They have this huge, blue, awesome pineapple drink with huge straws sticking out of it (it reminded me of the drink that Garth chokes on in Wayne's World)  Aside from those two positives, this place scares the shit out of me.  If  the producers of "Gangland" on the History Channel decided to start a theme bar, this place would suffice.  That being said, I have never had any problems personally here, its just an overall vibe I get, and I guess beggars can't be choosers after 2 am.

16.description: For some reason Yelp won't allow me to reply to your message so I'll write it on an "update":  Jesse,I must say that taking on a bar like the Blue Light is going to be one of the toughest projects you've ever encountered.  I hope you're up to the task.  The bar needs a COMPLETE overhaul in staff, clientele, security, and environment.  There's a saying, "The fish starts rotting at the head".  I hope that you, being at the head, won't allow your fish to rot.  In my opinion all of your problems would be solved by just tearing the place down and starting fresh but I understand that can be costly, I just hope that you do a better job than your predecessors.  Maybe I'll bring my friends over the summer to see if you've kept to your word and the place has drastically improved but as it stands I find it hard to want to return.  Good luck.

13.description: Blue light is a OK bar. Parking in their lot was 5 bucks, which I'm fine with. There was no cover or nothing . (Saturday). If you really want a bar seat , get there early. Because it does packed in the after 2. I had no problem with security. There was the "Ghetto" crowd there. However, they didn't bother anyone. The bartender "Adam" was awesome. Don't order drinks from the bartenders assistant or whatever they are, because they'll Puck your drink up. Music sucks at times.

11.description: If you have to open up your review by warning people not to bump into someone, you might be in the wrong place.  Shootings and stabbings have occurred within the vicinity of Bluelight over the past couple months as people leave the bar.  So if you want to get drunk, wander outside and get shot, by all means, Bluelight bar it is!  A bar packed with ghetto thugs is not a recipe for a fun night.Why do you think everyone is salty at this place and ready to fight?  Because there are 15 creepy dudes for every 1 girl wearing heels in the backroom.  Enjoy at your own misery...

39.description: I don't want to go back to this place.

37.description: Scary place full of scary aggressive drunks.  I love dive bars, but I won't go here again because I don't want to get beat up.

0.description: The Blue Light it is under a new management and has a new and better look .The  bar it is clean and the bartender was friendly. The  drinks are  high quality and the cocktails are made with fresh fruit and are delicious. We will be back for another drink.

38.description: Admittedly, I am one of those who used to frequent Blue Light when it was a cheap, seedy joint, with nice bartenders and that charming, rickety old back room.  We were all told that 'it wouldn't change' with the new ownership.  So I'm biased.I tried to give this place a chance, really I did.  Rather than an update of the old cheap-and-friendly country vibe, the 'new' Blue Light is anything but: think of any 'club' cliche and it's here: shitty, trendy hip-hop music, guys with too much cologne and hair product, slutty women, check.  Glitzy, over-the-top space, pricey drinks, ridiculous, immigrant-yet-racist bouncers-to-crowd ratio, yep. Oh, and a (inconsistent) dress code (baggy jeans OK if you're white, not if you're...not)?  Dude, we're on Western, under a bridge, across from a cop station and a Dominick's.  This isn't Trump Tower, get over it.Maybe I'm just too old or too jaded or just that I liked the old place, but if I need a drink at 3 a.m. around here, I'll slither in to Underbar.

51.description: I realize this is a 4 am bar, so my review, which is for a visit from about 8 to 10 on a weeknight, is probably totally unrepresentative of the late night weekend Blue Light.  However, I really liked this place.  After we fled the 60's go-go music at Underbar we landed here.  Blue Light was playing punk, which was much more acceptable.  The place was fairly empty but the people that were there were really nice.  One girl and I bonded over owning the same Banana Republic shirt.  A nice guy in a blonde wig offered to pick up tacos for us on his taco run.  Drinks were cheap.  Overall, a win.

27.description: Blue Light is what it is....a 4am bar for all the drunks to congregate too when their 2am bars close!!!The clientle is mixed...some shady characters @ times.  The Manager and bouncer are buddies of mine, so i feel as though they are always on the alert of the 'problems' when they enter, but @ that time of night, it can be a constant.Drinks are a little pricey and place can get PACKED on weekends for sure.  Good music and a lot of good times there for sure...just not someone to go if ur stone cold sober.

32.description: I am floored by all the bad reviews on here. After being totally tired of my neighborhood late night bar the girls and I (about 8 of us) decided to venture to Belmont and Western and see what BlueLight was all about. This place was a blast!! When we got there around 2am the place was not really that busy. If I had to say there was maybe 30 people or so in there, We stayed til the lights came on and it was still PACKED!!If you are looking for a nice quiet place to relax before home this is definitely not the place..If you are someone that loves good music and fun people this is definitely for you!!I met so many characters!! Loved it loved it!!The only stinker was the parking.. if you cant get in the lot it sucksHave fun yelpers!!

54.description: Superlatenight bar with a big emphasis on shots. Since I have my diehard "no shots" rule, there's not a lot of reason to come here. This place features the standard offerings of a late night joint - supah drunk people, leering drunk guys, possibility of vomit in bathrooms, and  . . . shots. And the music was not good, which sorta tears it for me.

48.description: There is absolutely no way I can hate this place. No matter how many weird foreigners, balding men or bros hit on me when I am here. Usually at 2:30am on a Saturday morning, slugging down PBR and trying to keep my head up.I always end up at Blue Light when I am shitfaced drunk and should have been taken home, probably hours before I came in the door.We came here for my birthday after we closed the Bob Inn. Me and about 10 of my friends proceeded to have them open the back so we could take that bitch over. We stayed in the back corner 'till they literally turned the lights on and herded us out the front door. In that time, I saw two of my friends get friendly, two of my friends argue loudly, and me and my friend almost fight some douchebag who tried to grab my other friends ass. And I did this all while constatly holding full whisky shots in each hand. Man, it was a kick ass time.Now all my friends say they'll go out, "as long as we don't end up at Blue Light."And I know that's a good thing.

44.description: I think bartenders can either make or break a bar. In this case, he definitely made it! It is nice to get generous liquid laughter from a hip mixologist-aka Nick the bartender. This place has a sinful vibe, pretty hip interior, good tunes, and a diverse clientele. It is also nice to wander freeeeee from the armpit of Clark street by just heading west. Sooooo head WeEsssttt....You might find yourself under a Blue Light to spice up your night.

24.description: Dive wouldn't properly describe Blue Light, it's more like a 'cleaned' up crack den... Super sketch but a lot of fun, I mean what do you expect with a 4 am close!?!?

7.description: I really had a good time here. The bartenders were super friendly and talkative. They invited us to come out a few days later for an event they were having. They were super generous with shots and drinks and everyone around us seemed to be having just as much fun. Looking forward to checking it out again.

49.description: Um....creepy as hell. Bad location...Need I say more??

40.description: Cockroach crawling on the bar, over the [used-to-be] clean pint glasses, on the shaker... Kill beers, leave, never come back.

53.description: Ok, lasted all of about five minutes in this place...I was after 2AM when I got here, but damn.  Just not my cup of tea.  I suppose I wasn't thinking straight at that point of the night.  Hell, I can't think now, but anyway, too many drunks, too many punks, bad loud music.  Either I'm too old for this shit or it's just a bad scene.  I'm going with bad scene.

30.description: This is a bar that works for the late night (4am/ 5am) crowds.  All the late night people care about is their next drink and who they are going home with.  That being said, it has a ton of great people watching starting around 1am.  (And people picking up.)  I don't hate the bar, I just think of other places to go to that are better.

46.description: Blue Light is pretty decent for a late night bar. With limited options after 2am, I always head here. Casual wood front, more of a club feel in the back. Drinks are pretty expensive, but don't worry, because by the time you make it to Blue Light... you won't even care.

1.description: Came on a Tuesday for Tequila N Chill, super relaxed and the drinks were delicious try Daddy Issues you won't be disappointed.

55.description: Racist doorguy.  That's all I have to say.I walked up with my friend, who was dressed in a pair of blue jeans, a striped polo shit, and black shoes.  My friend, I should also mention, is black.We approached around 1:30 on a weekday night, I'd just gotten off work at another bar nearby, and the college musclehead lookin' doorman informed my friend that there were already enough people "dressed like him" in the bar and that I could come in, but not him.We went to Underbar next door instead.Big ol' FU to this place.

9.description: I'm the duke! for right now anyway.  I wonder if this means some caliente mamacita in 4" heels and a skin tight mini might entertain the notion of a drink with me(?).  Probably not, but bring your A game and you could dance the night away in the back with a nice one.  Just don't bump any of the thugs.  I say this tongue in cheek.  I've never seen anything go down here, though most that dislike it would think otherwise.  If you bump someone don't be a dick about it, just say sorry and keep it moving.  Most people are cool.  It can be sweltering at times.  The dance floor err meat viewing room is in the rear.  So typical; people come out and onto it and then graze and gawk for too damn long.  What to do when it's late night and your on the prowl.  Right ?Great people watching.  My favorite perch is a table which is opposite of the ladies room.  Although as the night moves on, the chorizos are alert to it and then line up the hallway blocking view. WTF.  Weekends are often filled with ladies in scantily clad outfits and legs for days.  I said great people watching right? You will see the best and worst lines thrown at ladies.  The best yet:  Guy: Where you goin' girl? Gal: Home(The space between them now halved)Guy: Can I come?Gal thrusts her arm out and grabs his undershirt through an opened button.  She tugs the shirt and him out the door.DAyum!  : His boys in disbelief.   The lights go dim when the night lingers onwards so make sure your beer goggles are clean and working.  I've seen some potential hookups end at the doorway.  There is a bright light out there for the door man to check IDs.  Plus, the entrance is right on the street, so one could spill out onto oncoming traffic.  Try not to drink too heavily.  There are a couple awesome bartenders which will give you a gracious pour for your cocktail.  This spot is on my to do list when the night is late and I can do for one more drank.  (That was on purpose) The weekend DJ is nutty bumpkins, son.  That means the mix he's throwing out is off the chain.  Usually something you could get out of your seat to move to or bob your head to.It alarms me a bit when some bars get a shitty record on Yelp.  Like is it really that bad of a place or is it something else.  Let's recap, heavy pours, decent prices, peoples of all colors which is not the typical Chicago bar crowd, whatever that is.  What makes it more crappy than some of the other bars of different hoods which should be deemed douchebag bars?  Ah fuck it, like it or don't.  It's a 4 am bar, so hit it or go home solo.

26.description: Real cunty bartender from Michigan had me kicked out after I made a joke about the Detroit Red Wings. Yes it was filthy but we're IN CHICAGO AND WE HATE THE RED WINGS. Overpriced and kinda trendy. I'd seek out another 4AM bar, in fact, there is one right down the street from them...

25.description: I'm the duke! for right now anyway.  I wonder if this means some caliente mamacita in 4" heels and a skin tight mini might entertain the notion of a drink with me(?).  Probably not, but bring your A game and you could dance the night away in the back with a nice one.  Just don't bump any of the thugs.  I say this tongue in cheek.  I've never seen anything go down here, though most that dislike it would think otherwise.  If you bump someone don't be a dick about it, just say sorry and keep it moving.  Most people are cool.  It can be sweltering at times.  The dance floor err meat viewing room is in the rear.  So typical; people come out and onto it and then graze and gawk for too damn long.  What to do when it's late night and your on the prowl.  Right ?Great people watching.  My favorite perch is a table which is opposite of the ladies room.  Although as the night moves on, the chorizos are alert to it and then line up the hallway blocking view. WTF.  Weekends are often filled with ladies in scantily clad outfits and legs for days.  I said great people watching right? You will see the best and worst lines thrown at ladies.  The best yet:  Guy: Where you goin' girl? Gal: Home(The space between them now halved)Guy: Can I come?Gal thrusts her arm out and grabs his undershirt through an opened button.  She tugs the shirt and him out the door.DAyum!  : His boys in disbelief.   The lights go dim when the night lingers onwards so make sure your beer goggles are clean and working.  I've seen some potential hookups end at the doorway.  There is a bright light out there for the door man to check IDs.  Plus, the entrance is right on the street, so one could spill out onto oncoming traffic.  Try not to drink too heavily.  There are a couple awesome bartenders which will give you a gracious pour for your cocktail.  This spot is on my to do list when the night is late and I can do for one more drank.  (That was on purpose) The weekend DJ is nutty bumpkins, son.  That means the mix he's throwing out is off the chain.  Usually something you could get out of your seat to move to or bob your head to.It alarms me a bit when some bars get a shitty record on Yelp.  Like is it really that bad of a place or is it something else.  Let's recap, heavy pours, decent prices, peoples of all colors which is not the typical Chicago bar crowd, whatever that is.  What makes it more crappy than some of the other bars of different hoods which should be deemed douchebag bars?  Ah fuck it, like it or don't.  It's a 4 am bar, so hit it or go home solo.

12.description: So my ex used to go to this bar with coworkers (amongst other people I DIDN'T like), so he soured my taste for the place, but the new owners are awesome!  The bartenders make my drinks just the way I like them. Most of the old locals were SUPER friendly, so I hope they stay and bring more of the same there.  Despite their intimidating size (& glad of it 'cuz they keep the peace), the security guys are teddy bears!  The new crowd is not much to my liking right now, but I'm hoping that's only temporary.  Once a bar has an established name, it is infamous for it so I hope in their case it isn't known as the TROUBLE bar.

59.description: WORST. BAR. EVER.I miss the dive!  It was always a great time, a great mix of people, and the busted darts were the greatest.  I remember the carpet-covered stage in the back, and for some reason, I remember them having hula hoops on a few occassions.  And a real glass???  Ppppsssshhh, no way!  Plastic or nothing.AND NOW???  A place that's trying waaaay too hard to be something that it just isn't capable of being, EVER.  Some of the bartenders are nice, but there is one absolute *sshole that was working the front bar a couple of months ago.  He was rude and somehow managed to pour the WORST patron shots.  How do you f*ck up straight patron???  Well, he managed to do so.  And he also got p.o.'d when I called him out on pouring me the wrong cocktail.  I'm never speding another dime in that dump.  Free booze may be a lure to get me back there, but that's doubtful.  And for me to feel that way about anyone offering up stiff libations is pretty bad.

21.description: I've seen this place's cool sign from the Western overpass for years. I decided to stop in Tuesday night yesterday after leaving another bar. Me and my buddy were going there for the first time to check it out.   I waited at the bar to place a drink order but the bartenders were too busy on their phones or chatting up their buddies to notice. Place was not that busy either.   After a few minutes of waiting I just wanted to order a water, take a piss and go somewhere with better service, but I noticed it had been another 10 minutes and neither of the skank bartenders had asked what I wanted to drink yet...fail bar.  First time was my last time.

17.description: I've seen this place's cool sign from the Western overpass for years. I decided to stop in Tuesday night yesterday after leaving another bar. Me and my buddy were going there for the first time to check it out.   I waited at the bar to place a drink order but the bartenders were too busy on their phones or chatting up their buddies to notice. Place was not that busy either.   After a few minutes of waiting I just wanted to order a water, take a piss and go somewhere with better service, but I noticed it had been another 10 minutes and neither of the skank bartenders had asked what I wanted to drink yet...fail bar.  First time was my last time.

10.description: Meh.  It's a late nigh hookup bar/dance club.  If that's your sort of thing, then it probably merits four stars.  I came in here looking for a drink after a long night of work, and wasn't really impressed by the place.I can attest to the fights here that another reviewer mentioned though.  Last time I drove by here late at night the cops were breaking up some major stuff from the bar.  If you're looking for a more blue collar vibe, wander on down to Liberty Lounge.  If you're looking for a more hipster scene nearby walk on down to underbar.

5.description: Bluelight has change through the years. Bluelight is the spot to go if you want to go to a not so crowded bar from 9pm to 12pm . Bluelight is the spot to go if you want to have some fun drinking and dancing after 12 pm.Keep in mind one of the few bars in the city that closes till 5am on saturdays.They have a great selection of beers... my favorite MILKSTOUT.if you go to bluelight you got to try there famous PEPINO DRINKS... DELICIOUS.   There raspberry and strawberry mojitos on point. Everyone is very kind and even the owner is out there helping out on drinks and taking care of people. Bluelight is not ghetto anymore how its use too. Check it out...

3.description: This is a fun place Don't be there early, unless you want to sit down and chill in nicely light quite bar. If you are there for the party then be there around 11-12 on Friday nights. Pepino drinks are good. Good music hip-hop and other trendy music.  Girl.to guy ratio is 50/50 that's always good. But there always seems to be a couple of idiots in the crowd.  With my luck I always bump into them.

35.description: I'm giving a solid 3 stars based on my only experience here. I came with a bunch of girlfriends after a holiday party. We got there at about 2 a.m. and the place was busy, but not packed, can't get up to the bar busy (ahem Continental & Carols - you can suck like that sometimes). So that gets one star and the other two are for the back bartender & the bouncers. The guy workin the back bar was great and made sure my gf's and I were taken care of. We'd been drinkin since like 9 and were a little rowdy at that point, but he was sweet and took it all in stride. So cheers to you back bartender dude! And the bouncers were really friendly and made convo with my lonely self when I was outside smokin. Nothin sucks like havin to step outside to smoke at 3 a.m. and having no one to talk too.As for the negative reviews on the clientele - yes, there were definitely some skeezy dudes in the place. But, I contend that you get that at just about any 4-5 a.m. bar. I just avoid the skeezes and have fun with the people I came with....and I definitely had a fun night here.

19.description: HOLY MAKEOVER! So I guess this place has new ownership or management or something awesome, but I walked in and didn't even recognize it! They took down whatever was behind the bar and also expanded the space between the front and back bar by the restrooms; taking down the awning like doorway that was in front of the mens bathroom. Great idea, because trying to get to the back bar before was such an issue where as now its open and easy to walk from bar to bar.  Also, the MUSIC!! Holy wow.  I have met two of their newer DJs one was DJ Mr West and the other Flo-zilla.  I mean, they both know how to get the party started and their range of music is amazing! I felt like I was listening to music I knew and then there would be a track I had never heard before but still was awesome and then back to my favorite jams.  Awesome!Also I have to say I am a fan of the back bar on the weekends and they have a bartender Ozzy back there.  I dont know how he does it! It is so packed on Friday and Saturday nights but somehow he whips up everyone's drinks and keeps everyone happy.  He has great service and most importantly speed when it comes to bartending.  Lastly, I have been going to this place for YEARS! I have seen my fair share of fights in this bar which is pretty typical for a four am bar, it just happens.  However, and this is big, but I have not seen one fight or even disgruntled argument in the past three months.  I dont know if there is new security with the new ownership or something but this makes me feel safer and want to go there more oftenAll around this place has gotten a hug face lift and I am not only happy to go there but happy to bring friends there.  From the bartenders to the music to the fun atmosphere this place is changing and definitely for the better!!

28.description: Be jealous.Review #600 right here.And what better establishment to cap off this milestone?  That's right, Blue Light.Blue Light and I have the quintessential love/hate relationship.  Every time someone suggests heading here, I groan, scoff, make a face - you name it.  Yet, despite all my whining, I still end up going.  And, you know what?  It's never THAT bad.  To be honest, it's almost always quite amusing.  (Well, I should disclaim that you MUST be somewhat inebriated to enjoy this place.  Anyone completely sober should just avoid this place completely.) The people that you encounter here provide great material for stories for generations to come.  In the past, we've met Joakim Noah look-a-likes, people who claim their name is Joe DiMaggio, men who apparently leave their cell phones in their cars, cops who bring their weapon into the bar and the best Cali Swag impersonators who happily taught my friend how to do the dougie.  Also, if my friends and I are ever feelin' like undergoing an impromptu high school reunion, we're sure to run into a billion people we went to school with here.  (Bengals, what?)See?  Top-notch entertainment right here.  And.....the music is always good.  Shout-out to the best bartender, Meg, and best doorman, Vinnie, for being friendly faces to our usually hot mess selves.

45.description: My review of Pooh Light.I got high in the bathroom and some skanky chick accused me of stealing from her. I found that entertaining. BESIDES THAT THIS PLACE BLOWS DICK! This place is worse than taking a sharp turd. TRUST ME!  dont even know why i am writing this review or how i arrived there one evening. I need to stop drinking heavily.

33.description: oh, blue light. i totally get why everyone loves to hate on you, but i think the early morning debauchery and hilarious people watching are part of your skanky charm.i've been here many a time, and there's always a slightly different vibe. most times, that vibe is 4am pick up bar/ B96 jams/ jager shots/ drunken dancing. not my favorite, but if you can't beat em, join em!earlier in the night, i've seen this place be more of a chill hangout bar. there is one bartender who is super friendly, and a group of us that visited on christmas had a great time just hangin out. also that night, some random chick comes in dressed in a barely-there "santa" getup that a stripper might have been embarassed to wear and starts dancing on the bar. anything goes at bluelight!i was also here this weekend for a bday party. their open bar package for parties was $30 for 3 hours of drinks (including call drinks and champagne), and they were poured Strong! great service, you can bring your own decorations and food for the back room, and they will even play your videos on the screen (was that a vampire-themed porno?!)!love it or hate it, you know you'll be back.

43.description: I've been to Underbar countless times, but last night we decided to change it up a little and check out Blue Light.  It's a fairly average late night bar - the service was pretty quick, and it's not like you can mess up a beer.  The crowd seemed ok, but my friend and I had tucked ourselves into a booth, so we weren't really mingling.There did seem to be quite a few bouncers...  Like, a lot more than I would have expected.  Made me wonder if things tend to get rowdy here.

2.description: Pepino drink is on point there.  Good place to end the night...

18.description: Came in for a drink and a shot and I was charged $16 and this dump...Wtf?...it was a draft and a shot...Not a club in downtown...then my buddy orders the same except he was charged $18...Don't count on their music. Comes from an Ipod!

41.description: i went after work. me and my friend were the only one in there, but we liked that we had FINALLY gone in after just driving by it for so many years.it immediately reminded me of waterhouse (d-bag central) and was disappointed when i found they were owned by the same people. after a shot of whiskey and a stella, i realized the music was really bad. still like it, but i wonder what it's like at 3am.

52.description: This place sucks, but what do you expect when you get 800 drunk idiots in one room.  The only time I've been here I went with two of my buddies and it led to one of the craziest night of my life after we walked out of this place, but that's a story for another time.. We got a spot at the bar and the bartendar was pretty attentive and fast, but of course the drinks were way overpriced.    Next to us some drunk guy kinda leeched in on our little party because he had been ditched by the girl he came to the bar with.  If I was hammered(which I was) this guy was forking torched.   That's the problem with this place everyone is super ripped.  Puke in the bathroom, tough guys everywhere you turn and 6 dollar miller lights no thanks.  Go to oakwood instead much tamer.

50.description: I'm a sucker for this place.  ALWAYS end up here on a Saturday night.  They're open til 5am that could b why.  I see many ppl arent to crazy about it because there is nothing but drunks at this after spot but hey I always have fun when I go with my groups of friends. They're not punks or hard asses trying to start fights thats just the ignorant ppl. I'm usually not attracted to those kinda places but I think I just mind my business here and it always turns out to b a great night! Someone help me find another 5am spot please =)

4.description: This is a message to the owner jesse. c, please train your security/doorman staff to be friendlier and more hospitable to the good paying customers in this establishment. A few friends and I walked in and chose your bar over many others we could've attended. Spent some money and weren't aloud to finish our drinks at the end of the night. The doorman walked up to us and asked us to finish our drink and leave. with we agreed to and started to finish them, he then walked up to us a second time a few minutes later and asked, my colleague hadn't finished his yet was a few minutes away from finishing his beverage. i asked the doorman why don't you ask any of the other 20 patrons in the bar to finish there drinks why us he then told me they where all with the DJ. he began to say i was arguing and shoved me out of the door. mind you i am a doorman myself for a high end rooftop lounge at a hotel in river north. Your doorman had no right to put his hands on me and shove me out of the door the way he did that has never happened to me. I would like to attend your venue and say great things about it but the service I received from him was uncalled for. check your security cameras on 09/182015 @3:50am and you can see for yourself. I would never put my hands on a customer unless it was absolutely necessary and yes i did challenge his request by asking him why he didn't ask any of the other patrons to leave except for us, but nonetheless he dint have to respond with aggression and put his hands on me and shove me out the door it was uncalled for. I hope you read this and please contact me directly as i have never been treated this way anywhere in the city.

6.description: Are you a lady that needs a confidence boost?  Come here, if you don't value yourself whatsoever.  However, it's best experienced wasted.  That's what I've observed, anyhow.My favorite time here was the last time I was here.  My friend isn't the friendliest.  I don't know why she let some drunk white girl sit down with us, let alone talked to her, but she did.  (For the record, I'm the only drunk halfie she likes, and even that's debatable.)  I was just sitting there quietly enjoying my beer when she pointed at me and started crying, because I didn't like her.  Our conversation went something like this.(Looks at my friend and points at me)  "She doesn't like me.""...uh, I didn't say anything to you.""YOU DON'T LIKE ME!!""...alright then."Somehow, I ended up the shoulder she cried on when the guy who was getting her wasted and grinding on her left her for another girl.  "BUT HE TOLD ME I WAS PRETTY!!!"  Seriously, I don't know why my friend let her sit down with us.I may have inadvertently started a couple fights here.  My bad?  As long as you leave fast enough while guys are fighting, you're good to go.  Other than that, Blue Light isn't completely awful.  Sure, the beer is somewhat overpriced and the shots, forget it, but at least they have craft beer.  They clearly attract a certain clientele, I just come for the entertainment, and because it's not my choice if I'm not driving.

22.description: Came in for a drink and a shot and I was charged $16 and this dump...Wtf?...it was a draft and a shot...Not a club in downtown...then my buddy orders the same except he was charged $18...Don't count on their music. Comes from an Ipod!

15.description: Blue Light, oh Blue Light, crazy, crazy, Blue Light.Oh what trip to Underbar is complete without taking a step into the wild side into Blue Light? While my friends were smoking, I peeped cross the parking lot and saw a stack of dudes outside Blue Light smoking while a girl in a white cocktail dress came out of Blue Light looking like she got out of Studio 54 or some jazz. A bit more motivated, we marched in to Blue Light and met great opposition when we got inside as this bar was loud blasting B96 tracks with the peacoat mafia shuffling in and out and rubbing up on everyone. At one booth featured a girl giving a guy a lapdance while pregnant girls were abound hopefully NOT imbibing alcoholic beverages. Ethnicities of all kind were represented and Blue Light had a tinge of the UN all over it with a chance of international incidents.Despite the chaos and pandemonium, the bartender was quick to ask for drinks and I made note even though I am on drinking hiatus until April 2nd. We got our drinks and speared ahead forward into the vice locked line to push to the back room and the dance floor. It was even tighter there as one guy was humping his less than attractive date using freakdancing moves in the confined space.We pushed and continued to the very back where we found seats and room to breathe. Eventually the monkey show started to abate and there was actually room to dance. Unfortunately, no one in this bar was going to dance as it was a total sausage fest with an estimated 12 guys for every girl. Good for the ladies, bad for An Unstoppable!! In the corner where some people dancing in their seats, too lazy to get off their ass while someone left a giant, giant stein filled with margarita.When the lights came on and the bouncer started yelling for everyone to get out it was as if someone had unleashed a torrent of cockroaches out who all were scurrying to get away. The music was off, the lights were on and it was everyone's last chance to take off their beer goggles before making the wrong decisions that define drinking as dangerous. While waiting outside ugly dudes were hopping into cabs with ugly girls looking as if they had won the lottery. I couldn't help but wonder what the morning would bring them!

57.description: It's a late night bar so be ready to have drunks bump into you, have alcoholic drinks spilt on you, and lastly drunks hit on you.  I don't know how this place is on a regular basis, as I went on Black Wednesday, but it was beyond packed.  The bartenders are speedy about getting drinks.  I actually ordered from female bartenders here cause they were faster....Yeah, I don't believe it either.  They were also very friendly.  The bouncers are slight jerks.  My friend left her hat inside and they wouldn't even open the door for her to get it quickly, nor would they even go look for it.  Mind you there were still people inside, so one more wouldn't have made a difference.  But, oh well.

20.description: G-h-e-t-t-o!!
