36.description: I will never come to this establishment ever again.I was looking forward to this "nice 4AM bar" that one of my co-workers has been talking up for the last few years.  She and a few of my other co-workers called me up and had me drag my lazy butt to work at closing time so that we could go to this amazing Blue Light bar where the service is always great and the male bartender in the back always knows their orders.  We all pile into cars and convince a couple other friends of ours who were already out to come meet up with us.  Now, my coworkers are wearing tennis shoes and their work tops.  I am wearing nice shoes and a nice top, but, hey, I wasn't the one serving beers all night.We meet up with our guy friends and us ladies get through the door, no problem.  However, our male friends (who are Hispanic) are stopped at the door and told they can't enter.  We ask why not and this huge European guy informs us that they are wearing tennis shoes.  Seriously?  The girls I was with were wearing tennis shoes too!  We point this out, and then the big bouncer tells us that he doesn't like our male friends attitude.  Those guys had maybe said two sentences asking why they couldn't come in.  Hmm... me thinks this tis a race issue? My friend that comes there often asks the female bartender if she recognizes them b/c she and the guys had come there so many times before.  The female bartender, about 5'5"-5'7" with brown hair then yells at her, "WHAT?  I DON'T KNOW YOU!  YOU LIAR!!"This was my first experience and I thought it would be awesome, but they lost all of our service that night.  Not only that, but I always have friends coming into town and I will specifically tell them to avoid this late night spot.The only good thing to come out of that visit was the guy outside telling us where to park.  He was really nice and he doesn't deserve to be standing outside in the freezing cold - send the fatass who doesn't like "attitude" out there, and maybe that jerk of a bartender who needs to learn some manners.  Most bartenders would get fired if they ever spoke to anyone like that.

14.description: Be jealous.Review #600 right here.And what better establishment to cap off this milestone?  That's right, Blue Light.Blue Light and I have the quintessential love/hate relationship.  Every time someone suggests heading here, I groan, scoff, make a face - you name it.  Yet, despite all my whining, I still end up going.  And, you know what?  It's never THAT bad.  To be honest, it's almost always quite amusing.  (Well, I should disclaim that you MUST be somewhat inebriated to enjoy this place.  Anyone completely sober should just avoid this place completely.) The people that you encounter here provide great material for stories for generations to come.  In the past, we've met Joakim Noah look-a-likes, people who claim their name is Joe DiMaggio, men who apparently leave their cell phones in their cars, cops who bring their weapon into the bar and the best Cali Swag impersonators who happily taught my friend how to do the dougie.  Also, if my friends and I are ever feelin' like undergoing an impromptu high school reunion, we're sure to run into a billion people we went to school with here.  (Bengals, what?)See?  Top-notch entertainment right here.  And.....the music is always good.  Shout-out to the best bartender, Meg, and best doorman, Vinnie, for being friendly faces to our usually hot mess selves.

58.description: I got my first no-chip manicure and it's PERFECT! My manicurist and I talked a little, which was nice. Also, they play really good music. How I Met Your Mother was playing on tv because they have Netflix hooked up to the tv! My only suggestion is that if you want full gel sets, call ahead because only one or two people do full sets at the salon (only one person was there doing the full sets and he was booked all day). Amazing atmosphere and very nice manicurists!! I 100% recommend this place!

56.description: Best nail place that I've tried in Chicago. First, it's super clean, no toxic polish odors and everything is spotless. Second, they did an amazing job on my nails, I got a regular mani and a spa pedi. Third, the staff are really friendly and professional. Finally, they play great music and the atmosphere is very relaxing. This is about a 20 minute drive for me but I will definitely make it my go to nail place from now on!

29.description: In from out of town visiting my sister,  and I'm thinking traveling back every few weeks might be the best idea.   The very best gel manicure I've ever had.   They do an exceptional job,  very clean place.  The people working there were just great. Absolutely great experience for my sister and I both!

42.description: This is the best nail salon ever! Avka does my nails and they are always perfect and last me 3 weeks for a no chip mani. The salon is very stylish, comfortable and everyone is kind.  It is one of my favorite places to be!

23.description: Story time!I had acrylics for a while. By a while I mean I had the same set for about 5 months. I had kind of come to terms with the fact that my nails were trashed and there would never be any hope for them. It was worth it to me because I love long, pointy, scary witch nails. Enter Avka.After reading so many amazing reviews of this place I decided I'd finally make the switch. The nail techs soaked my nails off - no scraping as I've had done in the past. It was very time consuming but they were patient. I was shocked when I realized Avka was not going to cut my nails and put extensions on. What I currently have is 100% my nails with gel on top. I couldn't be happier! Of course my nails are not unscathed, they are a bit weaker and kinda ugly but yeah that's life after 5 months of acrylics.I have to include that the staff here is fantastic. Avka himself is a wizard and on top of that is also super nice and funny. It's actually just a really friendly atmosphere. I can't say why but I felt comfortable talking to the people being serviced next to me which isn't something I've done at any other salon. Let it be known that I am, wholly and completely, a nail junkie. I love nails. I've been to dozens of salons. This is the best. It's called Nail Junkie for a reason. Love yourself and go here!

47.description: Best pedicure I've EVER received. I went to two different places and both places shut me down cause I didn't have an appointment on a Friday afternoon. I called into Nail Junkie just to make sure I didn't waste anymore of my time and Avka was awesome. Set up my appointment and came in 15 minutes later. Very easy to talk to. Took his time. Just A+ service all around. I'm so glad those other places didn't accept me lol! Congrats on this gem. Wish you guys all the luck with your business. You guys are keepers

8.description: Best no chip mani/pedi ever....and they offered me wine which is totally a plus! Great job AVKA!

31.description: No wonder this place has all 5-star reviews. Hands down the best manicure place I've ever been to. And saying that in Chicago's mani/pedi saturated market is SOMETHING!Avka did my REGULAR mani-pedi, not the gel ones, and it was amazing. What a quality!!!! I Especially the pedicure! My pedi survived through salty ocean and sand for 10 days straight, and then 2 more weeks in 'normal conditions'. Got it done on July 2 and finally removed the polish yesterday on July 7/29. AKA the pedi lasted 1 day short of FOUR WEEKS. Amazing! This is my new go-to spot. GO AVKA!!!

34.description: Today was my first time at nail junkie and all I can say is I will be bringing all my friends here!

16.description: I love coming here! The staff are very friendly! The owner is very sweet and accommodating. They do an excellent job on the no-chip! I would recommend this place to anyone!

13.description: So happy to have found my new nail spot. We recently moved from Streeterville where I went to the same place for 5 years. This is by far the best. The service, cleanliness and skill far exceeds other nail salons in the city. Keep it up Nail Junkie!!!

11.description: Story time!I had acrylics for a while. By a while I mean I had the same set for about 5 months. I had kind of come to terms with the fact that my nails were trashed and there would never be any hope for them. It was worth it to me because I love long, pointy, scary witch nails. Enter Avka.After reading so many amazing reviews of this place I decided I'd finally make the switch. The nail techs soaked my nails off - no scraping as I've had done in the past. It was very time consuming but they were patient. I was shocked when I realized Avka was not going to cut my nails and put extensions on. What I currently have is 100% my nails with gel on top. I couldn't be happier! Of course my nails are not unscathed, they are a bit weaker and kinda ugly but yeah that's life after 5 months of acrylics.I have to include that the staff here is fantastic. Avka himself is a wizard and on top of that is also super nice and funny. It's actually just a really friendly atmosphere. I can't say why but I felt comfortable talking to the people being serviced next to me which isn't something I've done at any other salon. Let it be known that I am, wholly and completely, a nail junkie. I love nails. I've been to dozens of salons. This is the best. It's called Nail Junkie for a reason. Love yourself and go here!

39.description: I made an appointment and the best part is unlike most places I did NOT have to wait past my appointment time. Place was super busy, day before Mother's Day but they still managed to take me at the exact appointment time. I really love a place that respects my time. Nail tech was friendly and made pleasant conversation. Wine was offered which was a pleasant surprise. Tools are sealed and new for each person. Loved it!!!! Found my new place. I travel 30-40 minutes from my home to come here.

37.description: First time at Nail Junkie and I love my nails. The service was great. I came in with powdered gel nails and had them removed and replaced with liquid gel nails. My nails look so natural.

0.description: One of the best nail salon in Chicago!!! They are very nice and the way they take care of you and your nails is high quality!!! Very nice people!! *you can drink wine while they take care of you!

38.description: Hands down the best nail salon in Chicago. Sarah did my pedicure which was fabulous, not to mention the most comfortable massage chairs I've experienced yet. Avka then did the best No Chip manicure I've ever had in any city. He's as meticulous with his work as the salon is clean. Each set of tools came out of a sealed package which guaranteed cleanliness. Avka and the team at Nail Junkie are amazing.

51.description: Great work on mani and pedi! Friendly staff and cute, modern decor. And a plus were the awesome tunes being played!!

27.description: I didn't have the experience so many other raved about at Nail Junkie. My friend and I went for mani / pedis. She had a great experience. I had the worst technician. First, I waited 15 minutes after my appointment time to start. Then, she nearly burned me with the hot paraffin. She had to redo my nails when she decided to put on my flip flops after doing the nails vs before. With my manicure, she didn't even asked how I wanted my nails and just proceeded to shape them square. Same issues with having to redo the color several times. Lastly, she quoted me the wrong price and then came back and said I owed more. I didn't mind but what irritates me is that she said she would give me a 10% discount because of the change. But they give 10% to any new client -- so not sure how that solved her being bad a nails. I'm not sure I would go again. But like I said, my friend had a great experience and loved her nails.

32.description: Avka's work is consistently flawless. The best manicure I've ever had.

54.description: My friend took me here for a birthday treat and I loved it! She told me that Avka was really good but didn't get to see him this time, but the lovely lady who did my regular mani was really sweet and did a great job! My sister in law who joined us got a gel manicure and she loved it! My friend's gel pedicure was spectacular--they seem accommodating to requests but we were told "we don't get many requests for designs", surprisingly. They were all so friendly and nice but the only thing was that though it didnt' seem quite as busy, my friend's gel mani/pedi took 3x longer (3pm appointment, we left at 5:45pm)--its fine though because they did a great job. It is somewhat far from my place but if you want a clean and friendly place that serves Starbucks coffee and tea while you wait with plenty of magazines and Netflix streaming, this is your place. Avka had jokes and was so friendly too! =)

48.description: I decided to have a treat myself day, and after walking in and out of a dingy nail place on Western and Roscoe,  I came here. It was great. Nice selection of nail polish, super friendly staff. 10% off for first time customers too! I found my new nail place.

44.description: Best manicure pedicure specialist extraordinaire !  Avka is an artist. My no chips last 3 weeks. The best.

24.description: There's a reason this nail salon has nearly all 5 star reviews. Love this place!I walked in on a whim, without an appointment, wanting to pamper myself after a long overnight shift. The owner moved around some appointments and I was seen within 10 minutes even though they were pretty busy. My manicurist was really friendly; I told her what length and shape I wanted and she did exactly what I wanted. She took the time to file and tame my unruly cuticles. I think her name was Carrie?I got a no chip in a deep purple color (which Carrie helped me pick out). I don't think I saw the whole selection of no chip colors; but that's probably for the best, since I can be really indecisive. My mani lasted about an hour - she took her time, paying attention to details and making sure everything looked just right. My nails look PERFECT! I'm so happy :)Someone mentioned this before, but they sterilize their equipment and open a new package for each person. I appreciate that. Tip: make an appointment! They were super busy all morning. You might get lucky to be seen as a walk-in; they seem to be really accommodating. But if you're in a hurry, an appointment might be best. Overall: A+++!! This place is a must :)

7.description: Came here with a few girlfriends for some much needed r&r. I got a mani and a pedi and my mani lasted almost 2 weeks! They had a 10% off special for new customers and were able to accommodate 3 of us on a somewhat short notice. Will be back!

49.description: Second experience here was just as amazing as the first! My nails look great and my arms are like butter after the incredible massage! I highly recommend Nail Junkie!

40.description: Love love love this place! I'm extremely picky when it comes to my nails and have never found anyone that could do my nails exact how I like them. That is until it Avka. He is a pro at gel nails and really cared about the health of your nails as well. Trust I know I got in trouble for filing my nails wrong. Hehe. All in all he is amazing, great personality and great customer service and I love that he never forgets a name.

53.description: This place is awesome! They are friendly have a super clean place and my nails always look AMAZING!!!!Love it here!

30.description: By far the best nail salon I've been to in Chicago. I searched far and wide for a nail spot to give me quality sculpted nails ( UV gels). You can get them as an overlay over your actual nail length or you can get them a little longer. The salon also does regular manicures, gel manicures, pedicures, spa pedicures. First, the place is beautiful. I am not easily scared off- sometimes those hole in the wall spots give you the best manicure- but the salon's décor is on point and I had to take note. It's spacious and has enough seating. They use quality polishes like OPI and Essie and have a great color range.Now for the best part- there is only one person who does the sculpted nails and he is amazing. This means you cant just walk in for sculpted nails but he surprisingly squeezes you in for last minute appointments. You know how nails grow out and there is the bump between your nail bed and the gel? Avka's technique is so flat at the base of the nail that they grow out without any bumps. That means you can rock these for so much longer without them looking terrible. You can change the polish and cover the base of your nail that has grown out. I should also mention that these gels are crystal clear. Like glass. A lot of places tell you you're getting UV gel and the color of them is clear but with a faint white tint. It's usually inferior product or even mixed with some acrylic. The gel used here is the clearest I've ever seen. So much so that you could rock these nails with just clear polish if you wanted to.When I first walked in and Avka told me my nails would last at least 3 weeks I politely smiled and thought to myself, ummm nah, not happening. He was absolutely right. I'd say they last around 4 weeks but probably best to come in at around week 3.And the price is on point. I think $65 for a new set (and new customers get a discount) and $35 ish for fill-ins. I HIGHLY recommend Nail Junkie!

46.description: My first time here and I wasn't even able to go through the door. I got there at their scheduled open time at 10AM and there was no one in there, the door is locked. I see there a couple people waiting in their cars outside (workers), one of them saw me and was very nice and told me "he" was on his way. That "he" would be there very soon. It is now 20 minutes later and still nothing. Girl comes out again and changes the story. It went from, "he's on his way" to, "You know what, he isn't coming, maybe something happened?"  I understand things happen. However, don't these co-workers communicate with each other? How is it she didn't know what was going on? Neither of the ladies knew what was going on. My point is, they clearly lied to me when they told me "he" was coming. They had no idea. I'm not going to bother coming back. I went out of my way come because of the great reviews. Now, it's 30 minutes in and still "he's" a no show. I shouldn't have bothered. What a wasted trip. I'll just go somewhere else from now on.

1.description: This place is awesome. I was able to get in with a last minute appointment and glad I finally stopped by. I scheduled for a no chip manicure. Extremely patient and helpful when deciding a color. Also, my nail technician put 3 coats without the need to request. She was so nice and paid close attention to my nails. They were buffed, filed, shaped and conditioned perfectly. I definitely will be returning to this place in 2 weeks! Not to brag but they also had tickets they gave out for a movie for tomorrow night! Can't wait to see more no chip manicures from here. Thanks Nail Junkie for bringing these nails back to life!

55.description: I have a horrible habit of biting my nails and to try to stop I got acrylic nails put on at a shady place in the loop. They were lumpy and fake looking. Avka did an absolutely amazing job and recommended I get a set of gels because they are lighter and more natural looking. My nails look beautiful and natural! I finally have the pretty nails I have wanted my whole life. You would never know they were not my natural nails. So totally impressed with this salon and Avka's work. Make sure to make an appointment if you want a gel set. He is the only one there that does them and his schedule seems pretty booked.

9.description: There's a reason this nail salon has nearly all 5 star reviews. Love this place!I walked in on a whim, without an appointment, wanting to pamper myself after a long overnight shift. The owner moved around some appointments and I was seen within 10 minutes even though they were pretty busy. My manicurist was really friendly; I told her what length and shape I wanted and she did exactly what I wanted. She took the time to file and tame my unruly cuticles. I think her name was Carrie?I got a no chip in a deep purple color (which Carrie helped me pick out). I don't think I saw the whole selection of no chip colors; but that's probably for the best, since I can be really indecisive. My mani lasted about an hour - she took her time, paying attention to details and making sure everything looked just right. My nails look PERFECT! I'm so happy :)Someone mentioned this before, but they sterilize their equipment and open a new package for each person. I appreciate that. Tip: make an appointment! They were super busy all morning. You might get lucky to be seen as a walk-in; they seem to be really accommodating. But if you're in a hurry, an appointment might be best. Overall: A+++!! This place is a must :)

26.description: Angie did my nails. And it was the best service I've ever had so far. I'm definitely coming back. Thank you

25.description: Nails look great, free wine, decently priced, nice employees and got an appointment within 45 minutes. I'll be back.

12.description: I am a Nail Junkie !  I been a client for over a year and I've never been disappointed

59.description: I really love this place! I'm so happy they are open on Mondays since it's my only day off. My appointment was the day after a really big snow storm and I was very pleased that they stayed open!I had a pedicure and no chip manicure. It was wayyyyyy over due but those ladies worked their magic on me! It's been over a week and not one sign of chipping! If you're a new client they give you 10% off! Gotta love that!

21.description: Came here with a few girlfriends for some much needed r&r. I got a mani and a pedi and my mani lasted almost 2 weeks! They had a 10% off special for new customers and were able to accommodate 3 of us on a somewhat short notice. Will be back!

17.description: I have now come in twice and can say with certainty that I won't stop. I've only had gel nails and gel fills applied, but can honestly say I've never had a better manicure anywhere. Avka is the only gel artist there, so definitely plan on making an appointment ahead of time if you choose to get gel nails done. That said, he is the most meticulous, detailed, and attentive manicurist I've ever had. I had an idea in mind for the shape I wanted (casket), and he ensures each nail is proportionate by carefully matching each finger on one hand to the corresponding finger on the other. He's quiet but friendly, occasionally engaging you in conversation but mostly lets you relax, which I appreciate a ton.Though it's not the most convenient location for me to get to, I will continue coming here because it's by far the best in the city and Avka is awesome!

10.description: I love this place! I've been going to Avka for like 5 years and he is just the best and also I had tried everybody for my pedi, everybody is great. Best nail salon in Chicago !

5.description: Great no chip. Extremely clean and beautiful salon. Owner is super nice and accommodating. Soko did a great job with my no chip manicure. The best nail salon in the neighborhood.

3.description: Amazing mani/pedi! Everyone is so friendly, the atmosphere is so chill and it's beautifully decorated. Also I was able to watch hgtv as I got my nails painted :) I highly recommend Nail Junkie!!

35.description: I have never had a regular manicure last a full week before coming here, so now I am fully committed to Nail Junkie. If you can make polish stick to this dry nail beds, you've got a dedicated customer. The place is always clean and comfortable and the prices are fair. In the winter, they know how to send you on your way without your toenails smudging inside your boots. They staff is super polite too and parking is easy to find on the weekends so I don't mind that it's not in my neighborhood. 5 stars!

19.description: Nails look great, free wine, decently priced, nice employees and got an appointment within 45 minutes. I'll be back.

28.description: I've been coming here for the past number of months after moving into the area.  I have been to multiple nail salons and this is by far my favorite.  I've had many if not all of the technicians do my nails and they all do a consistently good job.  I also had the gel nails for a while and they looked amazing.  Very natural without that thick artificial nail look.

45.description: Love this place!  For starters it is very clean and the space is pretty so it's the perfect setting for pampering yourself.  They really take the time to do a quality job and my nails have never looked better.  The staff is friendly and they talk to you not just each other.  My no chip and my pedi look great and the last!

33.description: it's been over a month and my no-Chip still hasn't chipped (I know, I'm lazy). This place seriously rocks.

43.description: This is an extremely nice and clean nail salon. It feels high-end without the pretentious staff. The color selection is extensive as are the services offered. Everyone here was friendly and professional. I was even offered a glass of wine!!!! Oh, and that massage chair is actually REALLY GOOD! I didn't want to get out of it!! My mani/pedi = $40. Plus 10% off for being a new customer!!! Worth the drive from the South LoopTip: Call ahead or make an appt.

2.description: I'm a first timer here. Although I was pleased with the overall experience, my nail tech was quite rough with my cuticles. The proper way to trim a cuticle is to gently clip it, yet she yanked and tore each nail and after a few days all of my cuticles began to split and tear. Many of them are swollen and painful. Update Totally 5 starsThe problem was resolved after I submitted my first review and this is now my only nail shop!

18.description: I am visiting from New Jersey and needed to have a gel fill. I decided to schedule an appointment after reading all the positive reviews. I am not one to post reviews but I felt I should since I was so pleased ! They were so attentive to details and did all the steps by hand rather than machines to do my gel overlay without damaging my nails underneath. I am tempted to fly in every few weeks for nail maintainance..... They were that good!!!Unexpected but wonderful experience!!!

41.description: Avka and Talman are awesome! My no chip manicures last more than 3 weeks, however I like my cuticles cut so I go every two. The décor, music and overall ambiance is very comfortable and clean. Parking can be a little tricky, but it's worth driving around for. I moved to the area recently and discovered this amazing spot! I would highly recommend making appointments as Avka is always in high demand. **if you like pink, get #113 no chip, I'm obsessed.

52.description: I AM A NAIL JUNKIE!   I can't say enough about this place!  They have what seems like 100 colors of no chip, and the price for a no chip removal and new no chip is so much less expensive than the places I have been in the past.  The best part is that everyone gets new tools that have been sanitized in an autoclave so they are completely sterile!!! No germs here!  That is very important to me, and why I go every 3 weeks religiously for my no chip.  They also have really nice, new pedicure chairs (only have had one pedicure there) and serve all kinds of coffee and tea.  Love Nail Junkie!

50.description: I really enjoyed the spa pedicure I got here. The staff was friendly and the salon was very clean. My nail technician was gentle and the experience was very relaxing. Parking on Belmont was free and easy to find on a Sunday afternoon. I will definitely be back.

4.description: I love this place & will make it my permitted place. Very welcome warming. My nail tech took her time even thought it was starting to get busy. I choice a very difficult color and she worked magic with it. Love this place!!!!!

6.description: Overall I liked this place. I was a first time customer. I wasn't offered 10% off like some of the other reviewers mentioned, but whatever. I got a no-chip from one of the ladies there. I got them done on a friday night and at first glance they looked fine. As I inspected them today, though, I noticed all the imperfections. I was very disappointed in the lack of neatness around a few of my cuticles. I compared my nails with the pics here on yelp and mine were just not up to par. I couldn't live with them, so I called the next day and asked if they could fix them. I drove all the way back and Avka immediately went to work cleaning up and correcting my nails. They look awesome now. I can appreciate the customer service I received in that way and will, most likely, make another appointment with Avka in the future.

22.description: This has to be one of the BEST nail salons i have been to. I took my mom today to get pampered for her birthday. We arrived about a half an hour early but they seated us right away. The decor is to die for. It is very modern and chic. We were offered beverages once we sat down. Telman did my no chip manicure and pedicure. There was a woman with black hair who did my moms. They are so cool. We laughed so much. This place is a tad bit pricey but i mean come on you get what you pay for. QUALITY work!! My mom and i will be back again!!! Really guys GO! :)

15.description: Nail Junkie is my new favorite and regular place for my nail necessities. The salon is very nice and presentable, everyone is very welcoming, and they have a great selection of OPI and ESSIE polishes. My appointment was with Avka, the owner. He was running a bit late but it was totally worth the wait I'm obsessed with my nails and have been getting soooo many compliments. They also give a 10% discount for first time customers. I love this place!

57.description: This place was great! Nice, modern atmosphere, and the staff is all very friendly and seem genuinely interested in chatting.

20.description: I love this place! They only do gel full sets, no acrylic! But the owner does all the gels, so make sure you make an appointment! He does an amazing job!!!! If your nail are long he will sculpt the gel on your nails for length instead of putting the plastic tips, if you do have really short nails he will use the plastic tips. I love my nails, I haven't had the time to get my fill in but even after the two week time frame my nails still look good. This salon is a little bit more pricier compared to other nail salons using gel; such as Vietnamese salons in the area, but the attention to detail and the precision they put into every nail is well worth it, plus they have a really pretty selection of nice nail polishes to choose from. Love everything about this place, name, the salon, the work, the skill! Highly recommend!

36.description: So, after I posted my first review, shortly after I got a call from a number that I didn't recognize; it was Nail Junkie. Avka said he had read my review and wanted to apologize that my no chip manicure didn't last at least two weeks. He had said that the girl who worked on me had come from a different salon and was still getting used to everything (which is more than understandable because we've all been there, and even if it's the same type of work it takes a while to get used to a different environment and setting). He insisted I come back in so he could re-do them for free.Naturally, I felt bad because I know with certain places people can maybe just have an off day and it wasn't my intention to get anything free out of it. But, he insisted and booked me for an appointment earlier today. I'm so happy with how they turned out! Everyone was, again, so nice and friendly there. He was so thorough and really wanted to make sure that nothing would go wrong with my manicure. Their customer service is beyond amazing. When I tried to tip him, he didn't want to accept it, but of course I had to give him something! He did such an amazing job! And re-did my nails for free. This will be my new go-to nail salon :)Seriously, go here!

14.description: I enjoy being pampered and Nail Junkie just does it right every time. Last week I scheduled an appointment for my daughter my sister and I to get a simple manicure and the ladies here were just fantastic as always. They are polite, clean, respectful and friendly. I'm very happy to have found this place and don't even mind having to travel across the city to come here. This is a place where you go to relax and be treated with much respect. Everyone keeps to themselves, no gossip, no drama and complimentary wine. What more can you ask for? I love me some Nail Junkie!!!

29.description: wonderful. There is so much to choose from without feeling like you are getting ripped off. The prices  are very reasonable, and many of the pieces are hand washed by the owner, so it doesn't have that horrid stench like the typical used clothing store.  The owner who I met was very friendly as well.

42.description: I bought a one of a kind, vintage shift dress that seems to be made of burlap. Don't laugh. The print and coloring are glorious- a rich, bright, glowing teal printed on a n olive green background. It has pockets and fits like a dream, as though professionally tailored. Every single person who has seen me wearing it is raving! And it was $16.00. I adore vintage sheath dresses... this store could become my new mecca. I like it so much I might marry it. If that union would be legally recognized by the state of Illinois. Sigh. At least I will be well-dressed for my dreams.

23.description: Welcome to your own private Shangri-La (to be read in the voice of Robin Leech from Life Styles of the Rich and Famous).  Well, you don't have to be rich and famous to shop this funky vintage store!  I love the owners Debbie and Jim, they are super friendly and have that cool cat vibe.  They have filled their vintage shop with a bit of everything...fedoras, wigs, boots from the 70s, psychedelic shirts, large beaded necklaces from the 60's, 50's rhinestone pins, alligator clutches, stretchy woven belts, pretty silk slips, graphic scarves, vintage print fabrics, men's button down shirts, aprons, and so much more.  The thing I really love about this store is that everything is really affordable.  I have been to other vintage stores, and their prices are twice as much as Shangri-La.  My greatest find was a 40s dark navy dress with satin trim with a very flattering fit.  I always leave the store with some great piece to add to my wardrobe or jewelry box.  So, you too can experience Shangri-La and discover all the treasures to be had!

47.description: I need need need NEED this place!  Like the reviewer posted below, I've NEVER left Shangri-La empty handed, always find amazing wears at seriously unbelievable prices.  The well-kept quality of these garments is both mind-boggling and gorgeous!  I've amassed sweet little slips to layer as sexy dresses, belts to hold it all together, a ridiculous hand-strung rattlesnake vertebrae necklace, a pristine eel-skin clutch.  Most recently, a sleek  black satin cowgirl shirt with fabulous embroidered lace detail and a hot summery baby-blue disco dress... I have to find a way to winterize it! The woman who owns this place is totally hilarious!  She knows how to buy-to-sell and check out please check out the belt buckles and bracelets and other treasures hidden amongst that jewelry display case.  One stop vintage shipping.  Don't be fooled:  It's a tiny place.  Give yourself time to try on everything! You'll find plenty to play with .

8.description: I needed a vintage 1950's outfit for work (lucky me), and after calling places near the theatre the owners at Shangri-La mentioned they had a few (and even a few at home that had just been washed they could bring in!).  I went by that day and tried on the one in store and it was perfect.  The store is small, but they know their inventory and there are always lots of fun pieces on display.    It's a good thing I don't live in the neighborhood because I have a feeling my pocketbook would be a lot lighter. The owners are nice and the prices are great.  I got my skirt for under $30. Win. WIn.  I love supporting local businesses - especially local businesses that realize I'm not made of money.I'll definitely be back.

31.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Great vintage at great prices- what could be better?  I've been in here quite a few times and am always blown away by their selection.  Not only great clothes but great bags, jewelry, and shoes OH MY!The owner is really nice and has done a great job of having a ton of items (very organized) in a tight spot.I really enjoy the Roscoe Village neighborhood and am so glad they have such a wonderful vintage shop.

34.description: I was looking for a very special item for an audition and found it here! When I called them, they were so helpful (over the phone!) and were able to find something that they thought would be what I was looking for.  It was PERFECT and I have to say contributed heavily to my absolutely fabulous audition!  (I won't hear back until January, though :( The selection of men & women's clothing and accessories is amazing and very moderately priced.  I will definitely be back!

16.description: Ah. ShangriLa Vintage, literally invokes a sigh of content and relief. I visited this place two to three years ago on one of my solo Halloween escapades. This place is true vintage. I use this store as a reminder of what quality vintage clothes should look like. I bought a lovely tapestry styled floral top that is holding up very well and a black lace overcoat. Upon returning home, I realized that the black lace overcoat was missing a button, and  I am still trying to find practical things to do with it since it was an impulsive purchase on my part.The store owner was very nice to me and we ended up having a light conversation. She offered me some candy, as it was Halloween. I've been busy, but I am planning to go back to the store to look around for clothes or anything that strikes my fancy. The place is swell and you should definitely give it a go.

13.description: First time there last Thursday (December 9, 2010) and it vas a vonderful experience! The voman behind the counter vho I believe must be the owner vas very helpful! I vas able to find my prize vinning ugly sveater there for the Yelp Elite Ugly Holiday Sweater Soiree at Nick's Pizza and Pub in Elgin! Countess even found a terror-ific sveater for herself! I should of visited this fine vintage clothing establishment a long time ago for costumes! Vell, I now know to go look there for future costume ideas vhen ve film for upcoming shows!

11.description: Such a lovely store and the man who owns it is the nicest most wonderful person in the whole world.

39.description: Well.... I am not even sure where to begin.  I don't think I've felt so bad about myself after leaving a clothing store in a while.  Not because the clothes didn't fit, actually all of the ones I tried either fit or were damn close. No, it was because of the owner who acted like I was too fat for the dresses I was picking.  Yes, I am a size 12 and I know that's in a modern size and with vintage I am going to need something a little bigger but I am 27 years old and I know when something is going to fit pretty much immediately.  I don't like feeling like I am being followed around (maybe its just me).  If I rip something trying to stuff my fat ass in it-I will buy it!   She really offended me, at first she was just up our ass about everything and I thought she was just overly helpful, then I realized what she was doing. She actually picked a dress for me (without me asking) that was so big I could have taken it in about 8 inches everywhere! Not even kidding either. It was pretty ridiculous and I left feeling horrible.  I can be sensitive but I am also pretty confident and I think I look good but she really hurt my feelings. THE PLUS SIDE was that I found a beautiful dress that looked great on me and a pretty necklace.  I spent $44 dollars even though I could barely look at her at this point.  Maybe the skinny costumers don't have this problem with her and I totally understand her being nervous about things being ripped but I did not deserve to be treated like that. My sister works at a vintage store so I get it but I am a costumer and it was out of line for her to act the way she did.  She could have simply said that she checks the pieces after every person try's one on just to make sure they are in the same condition, I would have been completely understanding of that.  I will never go back and it's too bad.UPDATE: Her post/response isn't even accurate... I was handed the Gigantic dress BEFORE I even went into the dressing room so clearly it was assumed that I wouldn't fit into the ones I had which she never actually saw me in and has no clue how they fit-just cause I didn't buy them doesn't mean they were too small. But thanks for the back handed apology... I am officially done with this!

37.description: Great stuff. Owners are really nice. Always something interesting to find.

0.description: This place is small, but jam packed with awesome stuff!  If you're a fan of 50s-60s-70s styles, you'll have a hard time putting things down.  Highly suggest checking it out.

38.description: ooooo, la la... Shangri-La!G-E-M. Every vintage piece is hand-selected or purchased for inventory, then dry cleaned and arranged by era, then by size. Amazing. It's a smaller version of Knee Deep Vintage in Pilsen...but the quality is just as high. You can easily zip through the racks, as they are so well presented...The owner is knowledgeable, and has been open for 17 years...before Roscoe Village was hip, hip, hip and home to the stroller set. Been in biz that long selling second hand? Must know some tricks of the trade. Yeah, awesome vintage stuff + not overpriced. We have a winner!Prices: VERY reasonable. Dresses range from about $18-$35. In pristine condition...ain't no mothballs up in here! Everything is clearly marked with pricing, sizing, measurements, era. I got a hair clip for $1, necklace/earrings set for $12 and a really cute scarf/tie for $4. I mean, really...those are downright Brown Elephant prices, but you don't have to wade through piles of Forever 21 rejects. Accessories: SCORE! Sunglasses galore, hair stuff, hats, gloves, tights, shoes...you name it. Parking to the east of Damen on Roscoe is non-metered, non-permit...so park yourself, and enjoy...(hehe, ps...their mannequins had breathing masks on a la swine flu. some of the best window decor in the city!)

27.description: I LOVE this store! I'm from the suburbs and I go into the city every few months or so to get my hair done at Big Hair and I always stop by Shangri-La! The last time in I found two really adorable necklaces and a vintage 1950s dress that fit me perfectly which was surprising considering I'm rather curvy! The owner is really nice (I've only ever met the male one) and I asked him if he had any vintage White Sox stuff. (I know, try finding that on the north side...) he pulled out some old charicutres of the 72 team and told me that they used to be sold in a set of 7. Since he didn't have the full set and recognized my mom and I as returning costumers, he gave them to me free of charge! My dad loved them as a father's day gift and framed them right away! Overall great products, great varieties, great prices, and great owners! Can't wait to go back tomorrow for my birthday!

32.description: In recent years, vintage clothing seems to have gotten "hip." At least, much "hipper" than it used to be. That means many vintage stores have raised their prices. AND many "vintage" stores have taken to carrying old Gap or Old Navy shirts, marketing them as "vintage," and slapping a $10 price tag on what may have been $10 new. No thanks.Shangri-La is truly vintage AND surprisingly affordable. It's a small store, so I don't always find what I'm looking for, but their inventory rotates enough that I make sure to stop in every month or so. It's also very well organized, and I appreciate the informative notes on the price tags (regarding era, size, etc.).Also, the owners are very friendly and helpful. I went in on Halloween last year, desperately seeking a costume, and the owner suggested I go as "Joan" from "Mad Men." She even grabbed a '60s dress from the back that fit me to a tee!

48.description: Oh, Shangri-La, I've always wanted to thank you for that psychedelic muu-muu I bought thirteen years ago.  Purchased for a very special occasion--Valentine's Day, freshman year of high school with my first "real" boyfriend--it's garish colors were meant to dazzle and stun the boy, making him mine forever.  I think he was definitely stunned and even though we didn't last forever, that was a very memorable and enjoyable V-Day, celebrated in technicolor polyester/rayon blend.When I was in high school, Shangri-La also provided me with a $1 pair of bowling shoes that I absolutely loved, in addition to all sorts of other fun vintage items that have held up remarkably well, considering they were at least 20 years old when I bought them and have been going strong since then.Still love Shangri-La.  I think I've moved on from the over-obvious psycho muu-muus (well, really--muu-muus in general), but it's still great fun to search through the racks at Shangri-La... even if it does smell sort of BOish.  Eh, just means the stuff's been well-loved, right?  Right??

44.description: Very adorable thrift store and the owner is super helpful.  However, the general downfall of any thrift store is that if they don't have it in your size they aren't going to have it in the back.  The organization of this store is impeccable and I couldn't have been more pleased.  I wish every store could be this organized.  If I ever need something from another generation I'll definitely be hitting up this store.

24.description: Really nice selection of vintage clothing. I have went to this place and found really great items, other times I find nothing I like.One of my favorite sweaters is from this place and a few shirts. Reasonably priced and knowledgeable owners.Definitely worth checking out!

7.description: They don't make 'em like they used to, and if you already know that, well, you already know where to go to get the stuff they used to make.  This is hands down my favorite vintage store that I have ever been to.  The owners are two of the coolest and nicest cats you could hope to meet.  The store is small but the collection is always terrific (no "filler" to sort through), the prices are great, and there is always a lot of turnover so I advise you to go, and to go frequently.When I lived in Chicago I would frequent this place.  Whenever I return to Chicago I make it a point to return to this store.  It is impossible to leave without finding at least one thing, and if you can't, you just aren't looking hard enough.

40.description: In theory, I like vintage. In execution, I only find the weird, ugly, or just plain broken/torn/stained stuff. I came looking for some accessories for my friend's "retro wedding", and did manage to come away with a pair of earrings which were perfect after some polishing. The owners were friendly and tried to suggest as many items as they could from their admittedly small selection.I meandered about the rest of the store for another half hour desperately trying to find something else to like, but only found the weird, ugly, or otherwise unsuitable stuff as mentioned above. I stand in awe of you who build your wardrobe from vintage goods (especially from here).

30.description: This is a very fun place! Extremely friendly and conversational owner, very clean clothes, great prices. Heavy on 60s-80s stuff. A specific, well curated collection of clothes. Labels are very helpful, listing waist size and s/m/l, as well as honestly noting any flaws. I appreciate that it's also noted when something is not vintage, although I only saw a couple items like this. As a rough guide, most dresses seemed to be $12-30, purses and jewelry mostly $6-12, also some cool fabric and small home furnishings. And a few more expensive things mixed in.  A lot of bright prints, cute shift dresses and bowling/western shirts. Good selection of guy's stuff. This would also be a great place to get costumes for a play or just costumes in general. It's probably pretty tough to sell clothes to this place because it's a small store focusing on a very specific aesthetic. Although I prefer older vintage clothes, this is still a great place and I hope to stop in periodically to see what's new and chat with the owner! If you're in the neighborhood, I'd recommend combining this with a trip to Night and Day vintage down on Belmont (though careful for the very limited hours on the latter one.)

46.description: I love love love shangri-la!its always so full of treasures. I will never forgive my self for passing up the motley crue painters hat! Always a pleasure to shop. Clothing is clean and well organized. If you are looking for something specific just let them know more than a few times they have pulled things out for me that hadnt made it to the sales floor yet.only bad thing is i missed the used book section. remember that???? oh cheap used books i miss you!

1.description: LOVE this shop! Though it's small, the shop owner is dedicated to quality. The organization is by decade, style and color and she even puts the measurements on the tag! Also! She has all her garments cleaned beforehand. She's really dedicated to quality! I've visited vintage shops in just about every city but I will always come back to this little gem. If you love vintage, don't miss this one! I think this shop is way higher quality than anything in Pilsen.

9.description: ooooo, la la... Shangri-La!G-E-M. Every vintage piece is hand-selected or purchased for inventory, then dry cleaned and arranged by era, then by size. Amazing. It's a smaller version of Knee Deep Vintage in Pilsen...but the quality is just as high. You can easily zip through the racks, as they are so well presented...The owner is knowledgeable, and has been open for 17 years...before Roscoe Village was hip, hip, hip and home to the stroller set. Been in biz that long selling second hand? Must know some tricks of the trade. Yeah, awesome vintage stuff + not overpriced. We have a winner!Prices: VERY reasonable. Dresses range from about $18-$35. In pristine condition...ain't no mothballs up in here! Everything is clearly marked with pricing, sizing, measurements, era. I got a hair clip for $1, necklace/earrings set for $12 and a really cute scarf/tie for $4. I mean, really...those are downright Brown Elephant prices, but you don't have to wade through piles of Forever 21 rejects. Accessories: SCORE! Sunglasses galore, hair stuff, hats, gloves, tights, shoes...you name it. Parking to the east of Damen on Roscoe is non-metered, non-permit...so park yourself, and enjoy...(hehe, ps...their mannequins had breathing masks on a la swine flu. some of the best window decor in the city!)

26.description: There is nothing I can say that has not already been said about how fabulous this store is!!!  It seems as though the owner spends a great deal of time handpicking each item he sells in the store.  I have gone here a few times and have never been disappointed or spent a ton of money.  I feel like what Im purchasing is clean, solid, and reasonably priced.This is more than a thrift store, this a vintage clothing store that sells amazing pieces.  If you are looking to pop in here and spend $5.00 on 20 things this is not the place for you.  If you are looking for really amazing pieces of clothing that are truly vintage and/or original then I totally recommend this place to you.

25.description: Shangri-La is too cool. We went in search of sweaters, but the owners didn't really have much out since they're in that transitional period of trying to sell of their Halloween appropriate things and summer clothes before pulling out their cool weather items. Even so, everything was well organized roughly by period and size, and the woman (Debbie?) working there was friendly and helpful.Items were marked with bust and waist sizes instead of just a generic size (but with that info as well, as a guideline), prices were really reasonable, and there was a ton in "average people" sizes in the 14-16 range. My girlfriend found a nautical inspired tunic and a really cute plaid top for under $15 plus tax. There were lots of other cool finds: a green high waisted skirt, a blue and purple lace shift dress, a sequined batwing jacket, cozy sweaters, etc. that we too big or too small or just not quite what we were looking for but totally awesome for the right person.It's worth checking out for anyone interested in super cute, well priced vintage items from the 40s to 90s or so. It's a small shop, but almost everything there is cool and right for someone.

12.description: Shangri-La is exactly what I wish my closet looked like. Animal print, sequins, grandpa sweaters, spandex, lace, funky accessories, and polka dots everywhere. Oh, and a friendly bearded guy behind a desk asking if I need help finding anything.This tiny shop sits on a corner of Roscoe, past most of the shops, bars and restaurants, but it is one of the most interesting places to visit in the area. The clothes and accessories aren't for everyone, but definitely a go-to place for me when I'm looking for something funky, without a funky price tag. I love just visiting to see and touch all the crazy pieces they have.Vintage to Shangri-La means vintage, unlike some "vintage" shops I've been to, where they might have a bunch of contemporary clothing mixed in with the vintage pieces at insane prices. The racks and shelves and well-organized and the staff has always been a pleasure to interact with, so I say browse away! And tell me what you got, afterward.

21.description: The best vintage store in Chicago. The clothes are usually in pristine condition, like they're fresh off the rack from the era they made in. There are hundreds of signs posted around the store advising and warning you to handle the merch in a particular way. For example, please don't try on clothes if you have excessive perfumes or deoderant on, don't pull on clothes when perusing racks, but this is just evidence of how much care the owner has put into keeping these clothes in good condition.The prices here are great. It's a refreshing vintage store to shop in after tyring so many "vintage" clothes stores in Chicago that are filled with tired old clothes pulled from thrift store racks with holes, stains, and smells and ridiculous prices to boot. There's a differance between "old" and "vintage" that many vintage stores don't get...but Shangri-La keeps it classy with their eye for quality.

17.description: Really nice selection of vintage clothing. I have went to this place and found really great items, other times I find nothing I like.One of my favorite sweaters is from this place and a few shirts. Reasonably priced and knowledgeable owners.Definitely worth checking out!

10.description: Ahhh!!  I am TOTALLY obsessed with this store now!  Shangri-La, you have now ruined me.I have to confess that I am a sucker for the bigger shops, as I am a very small size and can usually never find things that fit.  But despite the fact that Shangri-La is about the square footage of a New York apartment, their stuff is all quality and not very expensive.  They are helpfully organized by time period and size, and on top of that the owners provide bust, waist and hip measurements as well (really, why don't more shops do that?).  I very quickly found exactly what I'm looking for -- 50s and 60s dresses with a 24-25 waist, and at the last minute my eye fell on a great white leather belt that would look great over summer dresses.The owner was the perfect mixture of helpful and hands-off -- I hate it when people hover like you're going to spill wine over their clothing or something.  Can't wait to be back!

5.description: I love this store. I can't help it but I have an affinity for old stuff and Shangri-La has cool vintage finds at way affordable prices. I love the jewelry and have bought many pieces to mix in with my current wardrobe. This place has less "junk" in it than a Hollywood Mirror, but it's not necessarily modern fashion as you might find at some of the other vintage shops near by. The owner is super nice too and knowledgeable about the different eras. Definitely worth stopping by to find a hidden treasure!

3.description: Great little vintage shop, nestled in Roscoe Village. She carries a great selection of both men's and women's wear as well as accessories (belts, purses, hats, jewelry, etc) You also find a pattern or sewing bits if need be. Or even a vintage glass or Pyrex every now and again. Prices are reasonable. There is a dressing room (it's not glamorous but it works!), for trying items. Lovely shop. Helpful owner. Highly recommend stopping in this shop.

35.description: What... a... goldmine!Picked up- an actually vintage- DKNY red leather bomber... 40 bones.What? Excuse me? You'll knock off a few bucks for a rip that I didn't even notice? OKAY!The prices aren't jacked up because they are vintage, either. There was nothing there that I looked at where I was shocked at the price. Honestly!You may not be able to find everything you want, but if you are just looking to expand your wardrobe (by a few decades), Shangri-La Vintage is the perfect place if you're in the area.And please chat with the owners. They were super friendly to everyone who walked in the store!

19.description: What... a... goldmine!Picked up- an actually vintage- DKNY red leather bomber... 40 bones.What? Excuse me? You'll knock off a few bucks for a rip that I didn't even notice? OKAY!The prices aren't jacked up because they are vintage, either. There was nothing there that I looked at where I was shocked at the price. Honestly!You may not be able to find everything you want, but if you are just looking to expand your wardrobe (by a few decades), Shangri-La Vintage is the perfect place if you're in the area.And please chat with the owners. They were super friendly to everyone who walked in the store!

28.description: Oh my goodness! I just moved to Roscoe Village 2 months ago. I walk by Shangri-La every single day and I never went in until this weekend. I would usually classify my style as ho-hum- I tend to throw on flared jeans and a bright, yet plain tee shirt. I really like the idea of older, classic clothing, specifically 50's swing dress all the way to loose hippie clothing. I digress. I went in this store Sunday with my mind on a swing dress or a pin up style. I was in the store maybe 5 minutes and the lady in there (I presume owner) said, "here try this!" It was like she read my mind and pulled out this very, adorable dress. I tried it on- fit PERFECT. The shoulders were a tad worn out (in terms of the black color) but it was barely noticeable. For that reason though the dress was only $5. She recommended throwing in a red belt which was $4 and definitely made the dress. I walked out of there with a cute outfit for $9 and some change! And for the record,  I am 5 ft 9 and wear an L/XL and teeter between size 13-15. Women were smaller many decades ago, but still, it's not impossible to find an outfit for those of us who are curvy.She was so nice, so helpful, and so friendly. The store is small, yes, but it's much better than walking into a big thrift store and having to find gems yourself while searching through messy clothes piles and the dirty stench you sometimes encounter at Village Discount. I will definitely be stopping by every few weeks to see what I can get my little paws on!

45.description: A friend and I came here on the recommendation of the other yelp reviews...man, we were not disappointed at all! I found three wonderful dresses in great condition, and my friend found two gorgeous necklaces. He gave her a discount on one of the necklaces after he had rung me up and felt bad he hadn't given me a deal, so let me pick out a pair of earrings! How nice is that?It is small, but what a selection. I also really appreciate when shop owners make an effort to find vintage/retro dresses over a size small/extra-small. There are some funk-tastic (in a good way...they do clean everything before putting it out, a REALLY great thing to do) selections for a size medium to large busty gal such as myself. I walked away with a fabulous black 70's number. Sweet.

33.description: Okay, I love this place. The owner is so friendly and she has a good eye. I got an black acid wash denim jacket, an acid wash purse/bag, and a vintage 40s velvet belt all for under $40. Not too shabby.Shangri-La is one of my staples. Too bad it's so far away from where I live!

43.description: We just happened upon this place as we were strolling along Roscoe trying to digest our very filling dinner.  It seemed like we had come in very close to closing time, but the fellow working the counter was incredibly nice and cool and did not try to shoo us out at all.  So because I didn't want him to be there any longer than necessary, I only took the briefest glance at the clothes, which seemed to me to be very well maintained with some very surprising prices! I was expecting stuff to be marked at least double for this neighborhood.The accessories were totally bangin - I have my heart set on this cute little 1950's style wicker purse that I just decided I must go back and get, as well as really sweet jewelry & shoes.  I ended up buying a vintage magazine and some 1970's baseball prints for BF which were in pristine condition but cost virtually nothing.  This is one place you are totally going to get addicted to if you are a fan of vintage goods!

2.description: As far as vintage shops go, Shangri-la is the tops. I used to live behind it, and there were many times when it was handy to be so close. The owners are knowledgable and been in business forever -side note, they had an article on Huffington Post where they took an awkward family photo with a sloth- seriously. Their selection is good, but my favorite is their selection of sunglasses. It's very cute and vintagey and I think everyone can find something they like. Also, it's very well priced!

18.description: I've always been kind of afraid to shop establishments like this becos 1) they are kinda expensive, and 2) they are full of snooty artsy people.  But upon arrival to Shangri-La Vintage I found neither of those things.  The shop was small but very well organized and the lady at the counter (the owner?) was very sweet and helpful.  Prices are reasonable too (for Roscoe Village, that is).We had actually come in to find some *ahem* ugly holiday sweaters for the Yelp Chicago Burbs Ugly Holiday Sweater Soiree and we were not disappointed.  The lady actually had gone in back to bring out a sweater so horrific, so tacky you needed sunglasses just to view this thing!  HAHA!  I even found a sweater that I thought was tacky but everyone else seemed to disagree, but oh well :).  They also had some Mr.Hankey the Xmas Poo earrings for sale but I decided just to go with the sweater.I will definately go back here anytime I need a vintage pieceP.S. Count Gregula WON first prize at the Ugly Sweater party!  Thanks Shangri-La!!!!!

41.description: I love vintage - but I am not as diehard a fan as some.This shop is cute and unlike most "vintage" stores - this place means vintage.... They owner had a great selection of 60's and 70's fabrics tucked in the back - and I may just need to go back to grab some.

4.description: I LOVE Shangri La. Firstly, for a small store, they offer a great selection of REAL vintage goods, from formal and casual clothing and shoes to weird knick knacks, fabric and magazines. I have a few great beaded sweaters and dresses from Shangri La and I always gravitate toward their jewelry section, which is wonderfully displayed, showcasing long chained charm necklaces, classic brooches, chunky Greek style necklaces, bracelets and earrings, ect. Jim and Debbie, the shop owners, are really cool people and make the shopping experiance all the better. Shangri La is definetely a front runner in the best of Chicago vintage shopsGo for an easy to find location, great customer service and a fantastic selection of vintage wares.ps, they're always playing music I like: post punk, psych and goth tunes that keep a good shopping beat. If they served food and drinks I'd be there all day.

6.description: By far the best vintage shopping in the city! Incredibel selection of stuff that you have always wanted but couldn't find anywhere! Funky, fun, great for guys and gals, awesome jewelry, AND THEY HAVE OLD PLAYBOYS! Everytime i visit Jim and Debbie (owners, who are AWESOME) I never leave without buying something! Quite a jem in Roscoe Village!

22.description: Every time I go to this place I walk out with something cool.  They have a pretty good selection of vintage sunglasses , flannel and skirts for women.  I got a pair of 60's beatle boots for wicked cheap one time.  Around Christmas they always put out a good selection of ugly Christmas sweaters so if your attending a party make this your destination of choice.  The place is ran by a woman and a man who are really friendly.  They play pretty good music over the speakers and let you shop without bothering you which is awesome.

15.description: Oh my goodness! I just moved to Roscoe Village 2 months ago. I walk by Shangri-La every single day and I never went in until this weekend. I would usually classify my style as ho-hum- I tend to throw on flared jeans and a bright, yet plain tee shirt. I really like the idea of older, classic clothing, specifically 50's swing dress all the way to loose hippie clothing. I digress. I went in this store Sunday with my mind on a swing dress or a pin up style. I was in the store maybe 5 minutes and the lady in there (I presume owner) said, "here try this!" It was like she read my mind and pulled out this very, adorable dress. I tried it on- fit PERFECT. The shoulders were a tad worn out (in terms of the black color) but it was barely noticeable. For that reason though the dress was only $5. She recommended throwing in a red belt which was $4 and definitely made the dress. I walked out of there with a cute outfit for $9 and some change! And for the record,  I am 5 ft 9 and wear an L/XL and teeter between size 13-15. Women were smaller many decades ago, but still, it's not impossible to find an outfit for those of us who are curvy.She was so nice, so helpful, and so friendly. The store is small, yes, but it's much better than walking into a big thrift store and having to find gems yourself while searching through messy clothes piles and the dirty stench you sometimes encounter at Village Discount. I will definitely be stopping by every few weeks to see what I can get my little paws on!

20.description: I cannot possibly recommend this store highly enough. I went with a friend, and even though their selection was much smaller than usual due to the Halloween rush a week before, we both managed to find some very nice things.I have never encountered such a well-stocked vintage store with such low prices. The clothes are marked with bust and waist sizes with a approximate contemporary size as a guideline, so it's good to know your measurements before you go. As long as you do though, the measurements of the clothes help a lot with the modern-to-vintage size gap, and if you're an experienced thrifter like me, you can probably tell if something will fit just by looking at it.The woman who was working was EXTREMELY nice and helpful, and even produced a gorgeous 1940s navy blue dress from the back room when I lamented their lack of clothing from that period. Since it had not yet been rehabilitated, she sold it to me for a mere $18. I replaced the shoulder pads, went over a few seams, and it's now my favorite dress of all time.I did expect a much larger store, but they certainly manage to cram an awful lot of clothing into a very, very small space. It's all loosely organized by period and style, and the shop owner is happy to help if you're havng trouble finding anything.I am definitely going back here as often as I possibly can.

36.description: Shangri-La is a great little vintage store that really focuses on the quality of its clothes.  Everything is dry cleaned before it hits the racks and a lot of the pieces even have the tags still on.  You'd be hard pressed to find anything torn or stained or raggedy.  They even have signs up reminding you to be extra gentle with the clothes.  The shop is small but they manage to fit a lot of items in there without it feeling too cramped.  Granted, I was the only person in there, so I imagine it would get claustrophobic with more than 4 or 5 shoppers at a time.  Prices were really reasonable, too: I walked out with a beaded clutch in near-perfect condition for $6.

14.description: I usually have bad experiences with vintage stores: either they're pricey, people are so protective of the clothes that they're theoretically handing off to you that you can't even unzip them without being terrified that they're going to turn into dust in your hands and then you may be arrested for committing art crimes, or they just have nothing for people like me, eg, average-sized.Shangri-La, is, well, sort of a nice little paradise after places like that. We went in last fall and I was pleased to see they not only listed size but frequently average bust and waist measurements, which are really useful on vintage clothing, particularly because trends shift so much and sizes change. Sometimes 10s are cut big and sometimes 18s are for people with wasp-waists...it's a gamble. I found a couple of great pieces that are now some of my favorite clothes, a nautical tunic that I have worn as both a costume piece and just a really freaking cute shirt/minidress (blue and red go with everything, let's be real) and a great hip-length plaid top that goes great with skinny jeans and boots.  There were a TON of things that I would have loved to walk out with, from a sequined jacket I would have been unsurprised to see on a rockstar to an adorable highwaisted skirt. I also LOVE their accessories collection and I WILL be back for their amazingly inexpensive brooches and military pins. Basically, a great place.

58.description: Wonderful restaurant that has been sleeping under my nose for years.  The best Fillet Steak I have had in years.  When they asked how I wanted the steak cooked, I replied "cook it the way the chef would eat it:.  was not disappointed.  Highly recommend it.

56.description: I hate that I feel the need to give Turquoise such a low rating considering how excellent the food and table-side service were. Truly, our server was warm and knowledgable and made our experience wonderful. The food was excellent, especially the rack of lamb, carrot dip and desserts (try the baklava!).The reason I'm giving such a low rating is the treatment my two friends and I received as we were finishing up our dessert and wine by someone I can only guess is the hostess. After some curt treatment about the bill because we did not have our credit cards ready for her to run, she repeatedly pushed another table closer and closer to ours every time she walked by. Like, I get it -- the restaurant is busy but that is straight-up rude, especially because we were still finishing up and had spent a considerable amount of money; it's not like we were just wasting time chatting over empty glasses. I was willing to let it slide until she pushed the other table directly into ours, hard enough to shake our table and make a statement that she was ready for us to leave (turning our 4-top into a 6-top, presumably to make room for the next reservation). That, to me, is simply unacceptable and the unfortunate reason for such a low mark. I'm not sure I'll be back...I loved the food and our server, but I certainly did not appreciate the side of aggression.

29.description: Food is good but service is awful.  They never have enough waiters and if you call in an order that they say will take 15 minutes, count on it being 45-60 minutes.  And even then when you get there they may not even recall takin your order over the phone.

42.description: In all honest I was expecting much more. Our reservations weren't held so we had to wait even though we arrived on time. The door kept blowing open and customers, myself included, had to keep getting up to close it on their own. The dishes we had weren't anything special and while I understand that they are trying to do something different than the regular Turkish cuisine you see everywhere in the U.S., it wasn't anything special and a bit of a let down.

23.description: Cool restaurant for an evening of mingling. The decor and style is midway between contemporary and a communal/family style restaurant - with it swaying more towards the later, but in a good, cozy kinda way. Food portions are considerably large, waiting staff is very young and pleasant. We meandered for a friend's birthday dinner, in an effort to try new cuisines; turkish being one I personally hadn't tried yet. Was pleasantly surprised and left feeling like it was a good experience. Hard to go wrong. Will definitely go back someday.

47.description: We decided to go for a walk since it was one of the first, beautiful days of the year in Chicago. We were specifically targeting a place that had outdoor seating and we stumbled upon this quaint, Turkish delight. We started with the mussels and were very impressed, especially by the size of them. The mussels were about double in size compared to most restaurants. The sauce they were bathing in is delicious. I highly recommend soaking the free bread in it for some extra goodness. The Ossobuco short rib with cheesy polenta is amazing. I can't wait to have it again. My girlfriend had the chicken lemo and loved that as well.The outside seating area, food, and service was fabulous. Check it out.

8.description: Hours are listed as 11 AM to 11 PM but they turn you down at 9:45 management in Turkish style. They don't even say sorry for that. Food is usually good but staff's attitude is not so professional.

31.description: Pretty good Turkish food. They put an upscale spin on a type of food I don't typically associated with upscale. The food is the same menu you expect from a standard Turkish place but with a nicer plates. The food is good, but presented as better than it truly is. So you don't need to pay these prices for this quality. I guess if you want to dress it up with wine and nicer table cloths this is what you get, but the food is not worth the price, though it is good quality.

34.description: went here for dinner the other night ! and it was great ! they serve bread and it's so good . I had soup and the cup is enough for two people to share . We also ordered the hummus , it was super good . I had the chicken kabbob and my brother had the mixed grill . Both dishes came with a lot of rice that seemed like it was old or not cooked well .It tasted a little off . other than that rice everything else was great ! would go back !

16.description: I've been here twice now and the food has overall been great. The baklava in particular is fantastic, ditto the flan. The second time I went, my server was Aysulu, and she was very attentive, helpful, and nice - one of the better waiters I've had in quite a while. I will definitely be going back to Turquoise!

13.description: How is it that it took a friend visiting from Minneapolis who was desperate for good ethnic food to find this place? Even more embarrassing was that she found it on yelp! I've never heard of it in the 8 years I've lived in Lakeview. Yikes, I clearly have a pretty myopic focus on certain types of cuisine.We went to Turquoise on a Saturday evening recently and had a wonderful meal.The meal started with a delicious loaf of bread that came with the most delightful and delicious carrot salad. I will be spending my afternoon trying to find a recipe to replicate this salad, it was that good. Mmmmmm.We definitely over-ordered, but lucky for me that meant dinner the next night after my friend left! Everything was delicious... we started (and shared) a feta salad with a nice greek style dressing and the caprese which had a burrata centerpiece (mmmm). For our dinner we shared the Iskender, which is doner (picture gyro meat) over toasted bread, yogurt, tomato puree. It was soooo good. We also shared stuffed mini-eggplants - the stuffing was a mix of veggies. It was so tender and flavorful. We were too stuffed for desert, which was a shame.Service and atmosphere are fine. It would be a cute spot for a date night. The service was not especially attentive, it reminded me more of service you would find outside of the US. A little slow and not overly friendly but definitely adequate. I tend not to expect American norms for service when I'm at an ethnic restaurant (unless it's fancy and expensive), so I was not disappointed.The key takeaway from the reviews for me is to stick to the mediterranean dishes unless you've been dragged there against your will and you'd rather eat "American" style food. There is an entire section of the menu for more American type dishes, but I wouldn't order from it at a great Turkish place.

11.description: Pretty good Turkish food. They put an upscale spin on a type of food I don't typically associated with upscale. The food is the same menu you expect from a standard Turkish place but with a nicer plates. The food is good, but presented as better than it truly is. So you don't need to pay these prices for this quality. I guess if you want to dress it up with wine and nicer table cloths this is what you get, but the food is not worth the price, though it is good quality.

39.description: First time I came here was for my cousin's graduation dinner on a Friday night. I loved the food so much, I came the next day with my other cousin. We loved it so much that we reserved a table for the next day, which happened to be Mother's Day. I think in a three day span I almost tried everything on the menu. Overall: great place, great food and great atmosphere! I sat downstairs in their party room, inside and outside and everywhere was nice. Must try if you are in the mood for good Turkish food!

37.description: i went there as they were closing as i reserved online, they told me that they were closing and i told them how come ?! i made a reservation and u accepted ! so they let me in knowing its their fault.. i eat, the food was good honestly, then when i came home i had the worst stomach ache and diarrhea ... i don't know if they did something to the food but i sure think so !
