0.description: We recently enjoyed a celebratory dinner (for various birthdays and work anniversaries) at Turquoise.  This was my second time at the restaurant, and I dare say I enjoyed the food even more this time around.  I think I realized that the menu features many dishes with lamb or eggplant, or both, and fortunately I like lamb and eggplant a lot.  We split an order of the terrific lahmacun appetizer, and also enjoyed the complimentary bread basket.  My dinner was the Patlicanli Islim Sarmasi, with chunks of lamb meat elegantly wrapped in eggplant, and a side of white rice.  The order is served in two spheres, so it is convenient to eat half of the order and save the rest for leftovers (to save room for dessert).  Other entrees enjoyed by our group included a risotto dish with seafood, a pasta dish (thick strands of pappardelle) with smoked salmon, and the Turkish Delight which is actually a vegetarian dish with hummus (and not the gummy candy-like sweet of the same name).  Although I was not the one with a birthday or anniversary, my dessert was probably the most flamboyant.  The almond parfait is a wedge of hard ice cream, and our wonderful server lit a container of chocolate and Bacardi sauce and then poured it onto the ice cream for theatrical effect.  Looks cool and tastes good!  This was a great meal at Turquoise.

38.description: So, we just tried brunch here for the first time and OH MY GOSH. It is both insane and incredible. 17.95 a person gets you like 10 different courses. Not kidding. They brought out fresh bread first and hot tea, then you get some kind of egg and feta omelette, cheese plate, hashbrowns, feta pie, kofta, crepes, sucuk, fruit platter....I'm sure there are a couple things I'm forgetting (see picture). The only thing I found confusing is that I guess you have to choose between champagne, tea or coffee. I don't know. It was never really explained to us. On the menu it says "start with champagne" and finish with coffee or tea, but they never offered us champagne and we got charged for the coffee, so who knows. Maybe drinks aren't included. I would just make sure to ask them to clarify if you're wanting more than one thing to drink. Regardless, everything was delicious and I can't wait to go back!

51.description: I come here a lot, and I understand the comments about the service. It's not bad It just seems like the place is still run like a small mom & pop restaurant that has limited clientelle. That can irk people expecting a certain atmosphere, but I don't come here for a night out, I come here for some of the best food in Chicago.  Their bread is fresh, warm and delicious. Every entree I've tried is on point and the food is clean and fresh. I catered from there and I went to the kitchen to pick up the food, the kitchen was spotless. I usually get the yogurt kebab, I've been to Istanbul multiple times and I'll put their kebab up against any I've had in Turkey.They also have a brunch every sunday, prefix menu of different types of eggs, potatoes, cheeses, and more. It's something you should try atleast once.

27.description: It was my first meal in Chicago. And unfortunately, I have to say this isn't comparable to food truck in NY. I tried the lamb rice and the lamb wasn't cooked thoroughly and the seasoning was not enough. Even worse, you can see the vegetables had been stored for a long time and was not fresh!

32.description: Everything is great about this place. Their food, ambience and portions! They have a nice variety on the menu which covers everything from American to Turkish and I've tried many different dishes and they all rock!

54.description: Went in with my Dad, make sure to try the bread made in house with the carrot purée spread. The yogurt in the dishes was very good, and didn't overpower the food. The sampler gave a bunch of tasty examples of why this is the best food in Roscoe Village.

48.description: This is a great spot in Roscoe Village. I love the fresh bread and dips that they start you out with. I've tried many of their vegetarian appetizers and entrees and all are good. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is servers are overly friendly, but not rude either. Sometimes have to flag them down for another drink, extra sauce, etc., but overall not bad and would not stop me from going back. Portions are large and prices are fair for what you get.

44.description: From start to finish, excellent.  Seated quickly, menus brought quickly, bread and spread (both out of this world) brought quickly, order taken quickly, appetizers excellent (lentil soup, eggplant pancakes and sauce) and timely, and main courses excellent (osso buco, mussels appetizer, onion kebab - phenomenal).  Be prepared to eat - be hungry - we had to take a lot home as servings were generous.

24.description: A Roscoe Village gem and personally my favorite restaurant. We always start with the hummus and the feta salad which leaves not much more room for an entree but I always order and have leftovers #winwin. I would recommend the chicken kabob (my go-to), the short rib, chicken lemo and the salmon. You cannot go wrong at this place!

7.description: Still one of my favorite restaurants to go to. It's even better during the summer, because they open up the front patio and you can sit outside. Everything I have had from Turquoise has been excellent! My most recent experience was two weekends ago. I actually decided to try the lentil soup for the first time, and OMG it was so delicious! I will definitely be ordering it again. Recently, my favorite main dish has been the Imam Bayildi - which is two pan roasted baby eggplants, stuffed with vegetables. It's a light and tasty meal! Turquoise is a great place to check out for lunch of dinner!

49.description: We were looking for something a little different for our Easter brunch this year...and having enjoyed wonderful dinners at Turquoise and after  reading the positive Yelp brunch reviews, thought this might be worth a try.  It sure was!  The menu and price was a little different than posted on the website and champagne is no longer included (our mimosa 's were only $5 each though....and they gave us a 2nd round for free...so no complaints there.). We really enjoyed the different food and choices...from crepes to  lamb meatballs to different egg dishes...plus a cheese plate and fruit plate.  Each of us had our favorites but there were no complaints.  We all left full and very content and certainly would recommend it to others.   Thank you, Turqoise for a wonderful Easter experience!

40.description: The food here is excellent!  I had the Braised Colorado Lamb Shank and it was the best lamb I've had.  I've also had the Chicken and Beef Kebap.  The appetizers are also excellent!I'm not a fan of their cocktails though and they skimp pouring wine, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. Stick with beer here.I'd definitely go back.

53.description: Osso Buco--get it. 'Nuff said about dinner.As for Sunday brunch, much more to be said. For $18 per person, you get a family style-served brunch with at least 12 different plates of food. Cheese and olive plate, two types of omelette, potatoes, meatballs, some type of delicious beef roll, an egg and sausage dish, fruit plate and more. Orange nice and tea or coffee includes. Too much food, but all tasty.

30.description: Modern Turkish food with some twist. The chicken Lemo has an amazing butter sauce and the meats are always tender and juicy. This place is not great for lunch as they take forever to prep the food. Perhaps order ahead.

46.description: Amazing place to have breakfast in. For 40 bucks you and another person will be beyond full! You must get their brunch special. It's like a 6/7 course meal that will have you returning for more. Plus the bread they bring out is the best I've ever tried.

1.description: I had lunch with a friend at Turquoise recently, and we both enjoyed our food. They start you with a complimentary carrot dip and fresh bread, both heavenly, and it was hard to not fill up before our order came out. I had the lentil soup and we split the Mujver (zucchini panackes). The ingredients were fresh and the food was rich with flavor! We were less impressed with our main courses (the reason for 4 stars instead of 5). I had the caprese salad, admittedly, this might not be their best dish since it isn't a Turkish dish. The tomatoes had a strange spice to them and the sundried tomato past on it didn't fit the flavors or textures well at all. I thought I might not be enjoying it because I had filled up on the other delicious food and bread already, but when I tried to eat the leftovers later I ended up just throwing it away. My friend had the chicken lemo. She liked the chicken but wasn't overly impressed with dish. The service was friendly and casual- they didn't hover but we didn't have to wait too long either. We would definitely return and try other entrees, that is assuming we can save enough room after we start on that carrot dish. I was quite stuffed!

55.description: This place is absolutely amazing! I don't understand how it is not a solid 5 star... Since we moved to the area I've been here about 5 times and I wish I could eat here everyday! Everything I've tried is delicious, especially the Baklava... So fresh and consistently tasty! By far the best I've tried. The ambiance is great, people are nice, everything in the menu is good, the price is good... What more can you ask for?100% recommended!!!

9.description: So, we just tried brunch here for the first time and OH MY GOSH. It is both insane and incredible. 17.95 a person gets you like 10 different courses. Not kidding. They brought out fresh bread first and hot tea, then you get some kind of egg and feta omelette, cheese plate, hashbrowns, feta pie, kofta, crepes, sucuk, fruit platter....I'm sure there are a couple things I'm forgetting (see picture). The only thing I found confusing is that I guess you have to choose between champagne, tea or coffee. I don't know. It was never really explained to us. On the menu it says "start with champagne" and finish with coffee or tea, but they never offered us champagne and we got charged for the coffee, so who knows. Maybe drinks aren't included. I would just make sure to ask them to clarify if you're wanting more than one thing to drink. Regardless, everything was delicious and I can't wait to go back!

26.description: Went here for brunch with our 4 year old daughter.   First mistake, No kids menu.  Second mistake, they provide you a menu and then just take it back and say it's only a Prix Fixe menu but "you'll like it all."  The food wasn't great but wasn't bad. So so. They definitely need to consider a kids menu of more traditional brunch (chicken, plain eggs, turkey, etc). A lot of food, so the value is there for the $18/person. Just not a good family option for brunch. This place is definitely a sit around and take your time brunch spot for adults to meet up and enjoy a 90 minute lunch. If you have any kids, go to John's Place across the street or Orange two blocks east.

25.description: I absolutely love the food. BUT the service is the WORST I've ever experienced. Every time I come here it's a nightmare. Save yourself 3 hours, get take out.

12.description: First time I came here was for my cousin's graduation dinner on a Friday night. I loved the food so much, I came the next day with my other cousin. We loved it so much that we reserved a table for the next day, which happened to be Mother's Day. I think in a three day span I almost tried everything on the menu. Overall: great place, great food and great atmosphere! I sat downstairs in their party room, inside and outside and everywhere was nice. Must try if you are in the mood for good Turkish food!

59.description: Food is always fresh.  Service is great.  Lively crowd.  I recommend it!

21.description: The food here was absolutely fantastic.  We stumbled upon this place by accident.  Not wanting to wait an hour for Korean food, we instead just yelped this place on the fly and we were pleasantly surprised.   The humus was so fresh and rich and the beef was so tender that it just melted in your mouth.  The gnoccoi was to die for- well, not literally but it had such a rich after flavor.  You know good food when after the first bite, the flavors just marinate and become richer in your mouth as you chew it. And that's how we felt about everything here (except the creme burlee- it was missing an humph)Everything here was fantastic.  I still dream of the food here and would definitely go back.

17.description: Modern Turkish food with some twist. The chicken Lemo has an amazing butter sauce and the meats are always tender and juicy. This place is not great for lunch as they take forever to prep the food. Perhaps order ahead.

10.description: Heading: This is Chicago and not a town in Europe.Wait the other heading is: how to spoil a romantic dinner. Come here trust me both will happenI am very well traveled throughout Europe where one get accustomed to waiting for a non existing waitress however it's done differently here in the US and we pay for a good service.We came here on recommendations for a romantic dinner that has long over due. I wish I can reverse the decision but sadly can'tThe food was ok but the service was horrible not sure if I can find other nice word. We had appetizer and main meal and my 1 drink was done by the time our appetizer s were delivered and I never saw our waitress againI even flagged her down but she was the only waitress working and NOBODY helps her not even the managers roaming around God alone knows what they were on

5.description: Great spot when you're in the mood for some good Mediterranean!  Their menu is pretty large and varied with plenty of seafood, vegetarian, and of course the standard dishes you'd expect from a Med place.  They have a lot of more upscale dishes than a standard Med place, with steak, lamb, duck, oxtail, etc. When you sit down, they give you this really good dip with pita bread to start on the house.  We also opted for the hummus, which was delicious, along with their homemade pita bread.  For dinner, I opted for the chicken kebap...meat was super flavorful and tender, not dry at all.  The yogurt sauce it was served with was awesome as well, I usually don't like yogurt sauce and this was so fresh tasting, I loved it!  The serving sizes are really big as well, I had enough to bring home for lunch the next and then some.The decor inside is a little old school, looks like they haven't had an update in quite some time, so not a super trendy spot if that's what you're looking for.  Service is also a little spotty, just a little slow, but they are really nice.  So I'd say you are mostly coming here for the good food!

3.description: Pretty tasty.  I live a few blocks away and had only been here once for dinner.  I booked a large table downstairs for NYE.  I was very pleased with the food and drinks even though service was a little slow.  I know they were busy that night.  Our server was very nice and helpful though.We started with some apps and they serve bread and their yogurt/carrot with it (I can't remember what it was called).  Their bread is very good.  We ordered hummus and Su Boreji for apps.  The hummus was really good and I liked the Su Boregi (it's like spanikopita but with what appeared to be raw dough). We ordered some beers and martinis for drinks, I liked the martinis, but wish they would explain what is in them on the menu.  The poor server had to recite the ingredients on nearly half the martinis because there is no explanation.Everyone was pretty happy with their main dishes.  I had the rigatonni w/ mushrooms and sausage, it was delicious.  My husband had beef kabob, also delicious.  My friend had the chicken kabob, but it was way too salty, I think the salt maybe just got away from them on that specific dish because everything else was tasty.  I really like their rice, next time I'm getting a rice dish.  On our previous visit here, we got the ossobuco and it was really tasty.  Oh and now I know they have a downstairs area which could be good for small parties.

35.description: Coming here feels like you're going over to a friends home for dinner. The atmosphere is cozy, warm, and comfortable, even if a bit loud when it's busy. Eats all the delicious warm bread and dip is incredibly tempting, but try to stop yourself because the food is amazing. The diver's scallops and grilled calamari are perfection. My only, small complaint is that 3 scallops are served, which is kind of awkward when most parties are 2 or 4. Every time I want to try something new, but the ahi tuna (with avocado creme and a kind of ceviche) is so amazing that I order it almost every time. You should absolutely finish your meal with coffee or tea with mint.

19.description: Someone please explain how this place has four stars on Yelp. It is a disgrace to food in Chicago. I ordered delivery via Grubhub. Not only was the food an hour late, it was disgusting. I called when the order was 30 min late - terrible customer service. Another 30 min goes by and turns out their driver never showed up today. They assured me the order was freshly made - it was cold and soggy.The seafood salad contained - 1 scallop complete with piece of shell of something, 2 small shrimp, a quarter of a squid and a ton of lettuce, ridic at $14.95Icing on the free rice pudding? A gray hair. Fyi I don't have any gray strands. Gross. So much for my healthy seafood salad and organic veggies. Going to go throw up now....

28.description: What a gem! A friend recommended this restaurant and I cannot wait to go back. The service was wonderful, I had the Patlicanli Islim Sarmasi which was delicious. Combined with outdoor seating made it a great night.

45.description: I went here for my birthday dinner with a good group of friends and this place was great.  The hummus was outstanding, and I really enjoyed the sogurme.  The bread for the table was particularly incredible.  For my entree I chose the yogurt kebap, which was great because I was able to enjoy the lamb and the pide,  We shared a few desserts for the table, the creme brulee, the kazandibi, and the rice pudding.  I really loved the kazandibi, which was a type of flan.  The place itself was warm and welcoming.  I don't have a ton of experience with Turkish food, but this set the bar pretty high.

33.description: Still one of my favorite restaurants to go to. It's even better during the summer, because they open up the front patio and you can sit outside. Everything I have had from Turquoise has been excellent! My most recent experience was two weekends ago. I actually decided to try the lentil soup for the first time, and OMG it was so delicious! I will definitely be ordering it again. Recently, my favorite main dish has been the Imam Bayildi - which is two pan roasted baby eggplants, stuffed with vegetables. It's a light and tasty meal! Turquoise is a great place to check out for lunch of dinner!

43.description: Wait why is this a Turkish restaurant there is like 5 turkish dishes on the menu. My mom got food poisoning here. Fun.

2.description: Was great to eat home made breads and the food was just as good as you can imagine. We were on business trip and glad that we booked in advance! The place is a bit small and was pretty much full even on a Wednesday. We had a Turkish-Canadian citizen and she confirmed that the food was as authentic as back home. We all loved the food we ordered. WIll definitely visit again if in town.Best part was getting the free desert on the HOUSE :) I think they recognized that we were visiting the town and was first time in there. Very NICE@

18.description: Nice neighborhood spot!  Food is excellent.  Authentic and a good variety.  Good service too.  A little formal atmosphere but still kid friendly.

41.description: How is it that it took a friend visiting from Minneapolis who was desperate for good ethnic food to find this place? Even more embarrassing was that she found it on yelp! I've never heard of it in the 8 years I've lived in Lakeview. Yikes, I clearly have a pretty myopic focus on certain types of cuisine.We went to Turquoise on a Saturday evening recently and had a wonderful meal.The meal started with a delicious loaf of bread that came with the most delightful and delicious carrot salad. I will be spending my afternoon trying to find a recipe to replicate this salad, it was that good. Mmmmmm.We definitely over-ordered, but lucky for me that meant dinner the next night after my friend left! Everything was delicious... we started (and shared) a feta salad with a nice greek style dressing and the caprese which had a burrata centerpiece (mmmm). For our dinner we shared the Iskender, which is doner (picture gyro meat) over toasted bread, yogurt, tomato puree. It was soooo good. We also shared stuffed mini-eggplants - the stuffing was a mix of veggies. It was so tender and flavorful. We were too stuffed for desert, which was a shame.Service and atmosphere are fine. It would be a cute spot for a date night. The service was not especially attentive, it reminded me more of service you would find outside of the US. A little slow and not overly friendly but definitely adequate. I tend not to expect American norms for service when I'm at an ethnic restaurant (unless it's fancy and expensive), so I was not disappointed.The key takeaway from the reviews for me is to stick to the mediterranean dishes unless you've been dragged there against your will and you'd rather eat "American" style food. There is an entire section of the menu for more American type dishes, but I wouldn't order from it at a great Turkish place.

52.description: I've been here three times now and I have to say it is incredible every time. It is in my top three Chicago restaurants. This is a small place so reservations are a must. Turquoise has a great neighborhood feel with a mix of young and old seated throughout the restaurant. I love their homemade warm bread and olive oil to start. This last time they provided a free carrot dip which I thought had great flavor. Their menu has a lot of unique options and their wine's pair well with everything. We ordered the Caprese Lingurian Pesto to start which was enough to share among three people. The mozzarella was incredibly creamy and light. For the main course, I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a substantial amount of food. Everything was perfectly seasoned so I can't even say which cut of meat/fish was my favorite. I sampled the Lamb Kabap and Ossobucco, both of which i would order next time. My only complaint is that they didn't have the chocolate souffle this time around for some reason. Last time we waited half an hour for that souffle after finishing out meal because they made it from scratch and it was devoured in approximately thirty seconds. Rarely, do I love deserts that much. Hopefully, they have it next time.

50.description: I'm sorry but every dish was GROSS. Delivery over an hour on a Wednesday,  the"pounded chicken" with gorgonzola was nothing more than fried chicken filets FLOATING in a sauce that gave it a sloppy breading with a pudding like texture. The appetizers and entrees alike went in the trash. YUCKOver $70 completely wasted.

4.description: We decided to try something new in the neighborhood and came here on a chilly December night.  The place is pretty small and you can hear the family upstairs thumping around their apartment.  I was pretty surprised but the place was half way packed.  Our waitress was very pleasant and knowledgeable of all the dishes.  I ordered the onion soup and gnocchi dish.  The gnocchi were like little soft pillow, stuffed with cheese and spinach.  My bf got the mussels and braised lamb shoulder.  He loves the sauce that the mussels were in and the braised lamb was super smokey.  Also, their bread is amazing and everything is well priced.  This place is worth a try, they have a huge menu, welcoming staff, and even a bar.

6.description: Went here on. Saturday night with a group of friends. I tried the roasted pepper apps which was delicious did have a bit of a kick though. They brought out bread which was delicious. We also ordered Lamachoun to share which is bread with ground beef and hint of cheese it was very satisfying for my main entree had the Pide which was another beef entree and was delicious when it comes to Turkish food in the past I have stuck with Tried and tested Adna or Doner Kabab decided to try something different so had the PIDe which was delicious. Service here is great and the food top notch.

22.description: Just tired of mediocre lunches. Got a bone in my Chicken Lemo today. Over the years they just stopped caring.

15.description: Went here for brunch with our 4 year old daughter.   First mistake, No kids menu.  Second mistake, they provide you a menu and then just take it back and say it's only a Prix Fixe menu but "you'll like it all."  The food wasn't great but wasn't bad. So so. They definitely need to consider a kids menu of more traditional brunch (chicken, plain eggs, turkey, etc). A lot of food, so the value is there for the $18/person. Just not a good family option for brunch. This place is definitely a sit around and take your time brunch spot for adults to meet up and enjoy a 90 minute lunch. If you have any kids, go to John's Place across the street or Orange two blocks east.

57.description: Had the Beef Kabobs.  One of the best meals I have ever had.  Can not wait to go back!

20.description: This place seated 5 people without a reservation. We had a superb meal above our already high expectations. The service  was exceptional. We were seated outside on a warm evening and finished our meal when is started to drizzle instead of wrapping and leaving which was our expectation they invited us in for complimentary desert. Very well priced and classy. Best food. The lamb was the most the most tender succulent piece of lamb chop I have ever had.

36.description: The food is amazing.  The del presidente and the beef kabob were both genuinely unique dishes you don't get other places and very good.  The del presidente has seafood mixed in with risotto and a white wine sauce.  The kabob is marinated is some middle eastern way but isn't too heavy where it would take away from the flavor.  We'll be back.

14.description: Hubby had a restaurant.com deal and I had some cute new jeans I wanted to sport, so Turquoise was the spot for our fri night date. Luckily, we found free parking 1 block west on roscoe but there were a few metered spots in front. I had made a reso and still had to wait 20 min. Sorry, that automatically knocks off a star. We were seated by the aisle and usually this bugs me, but servers were very observant to not nudge or bump into me. Although our server looked like my former evil boss, I tried to not hold it against her as she was really prompt and helpful when we had questions. We order 2 glasses of Pinot noir and while they were decent, they required breathing to be drinkable. Maybe they just opened this bottle? Idk. They were very tangy at first. Decent but drinkable later. We received the complimentary bread which was definitely the best freaking bread I've had in a while. Took all my strength to not eat a whole loaf. We ordered mujver since yelp told me to and it was exquisite. Not too heavily breaded to overstuff you, and the sauce was the boss. I had the salmon that came with gnocchi. Salmon was just ok, same taste as store bought. So much gnocchi in this dish, I had to box it up for another day. Gnocchi was also standard. He had the yogurt kabap which was the same sauce as the mujver but with lamb. He loved it. From the looks of the menu and reviews, this is definitely more of a lamb-driven spot. It seems the most popular dishes are lamb and that's all good. It's just not the spot I'm really gonna enjoy most. Oh well, at least everyone saw my new, cute jeans.

1.description: What a disappointment, $8.75 for two slices of pizza soaked through a plate due to how greasy they were. If you order more than one slice make sure you ask for separate containers as all they do is toss one paper plate on top of another hot melted slice and toss it in a styrofoam container. The bottom of the first plate was glued to the second slice. I fully believe the guy behind the register was using full sarcasm when he said, "this is good pizza right here." Save yourself the trouble and money and head over to bartolis for their slices. $3.25-$3.75 a slice and they have the decency to place it in a box that's is geometrically shaped for a slice of pizza. The only thing riverview brick oven has going for them is the fact that the pizza is served hot, something any standard microwave can achieve. See pictures I posted for my justification of this review.

9.description: Sadly this place isn't run as good as it was when it was Robey Pizza which is a real shame. They used to do an awesome job here.The pizza's here are more expensive than they used to be by $4-5, and the flavors aren't as good as they were previously. Our most recent pizza seemed fairly undercooked (not much browning on the crust) and it was very soggy. The lead time they gave for pickup was really long and the pizza by that point was not the warmest.Next.

23.description: The reviews for this place are far too harsh.  I must admit that I have yet to have the pizza so I may revise upon doing so.  I have had both the sandwiches and salads on from the new menu since the change and they are a DEFINITE upgrade.  The chicken parm is really good and the pollo fuego is unique, delicious and certainly spicy.  The homemade chips are a big step up from the small bags of chips Robey had.  The lunch specials are the same as before which I was glad to see and are a great deal at $6 for a sandwich or salad.  The addition of a couple tap beers is a nice option as well.  More of a pick up or delivery spot but it would be nice to have a draft if you decide to eat in.  As I said, still need to try the pizza but I definitely recommend the place since they switched over.

12.description: I actually haven't had pizza here. I always order one of the sandwiches and they're excellent. The crispy hand-cut chips are really tasty too.

21.description: Just got put on hold for 5 min... Hmmmm.  I hung up and called another place..

16.description: Good brick oven pizza. Nothing fancy, more of a take out place then sit down.

17.description: Order the "Lip stinger" and it was awesome - loved it! I also saw a Taco Pizza with Doritos on their website which I can not lie, peaked my interest for my next order. You'll hear from me soon!

10.description: Let's be honest here, the pizza isn't the best but certainly not the worst.  RBOP needs to work their execution a little and they are sitting on a gem.  Roscoe Village has clearly shown an interest in artisan brick oven pizzas, one needs not look further than Frasca's sidewalk in the summer.  It's easy to imagine this would be a successful delivery concept in the winter.  I live right around the corner so I was rooting for this place, I'm still rooting for it, but it needs some work.  The pizza is way to greasy. Not sure why, nothing on my pie could have produced this much grease, I can only suspect the dough was doused with too much olive oil prior to the toppings.  I enjoyed the toppings, I had the balboa, it was rather spicy but flavorful.  The only problem was the toppings slid off the crust due to the grease which left me with a nice piece of toppingless crust.  The now naked crust had a wonderful crispy bottom and edge but the topside resembled something more like a wet noodle.  And thin wet noodley crust is not an ideal vessel for transporting tasty toppings into ones mouth. Fix the grease and you fix your pizza.

5.description: This place really pales in comparison to Robey Pizza that used to be in this space. We gave them two tries before giving up, finding much better pizza elsewhere (Frasca, Spacca Napoli, Ciao Bella, etc.). Prices are double what Robeys charged, and both times the faux-Neopolitan pizza was soggy in the center with grease. This was after ordering carryout and walking it a block away, so time wasn't the issue, it was just consistently underdone. Also gone were the great past ingredients like marinated tomatoes, goat cheese, red peppers, homemade sausage.Sadly all the funky eclectic decor from Robeys was stripped off the walls, leaving a bare, sterile impression now. There's a crappy sun-faded banner over the hand-carved wooden Robey sign that sort of resembles the lack of effort put into this business. Robeys was good while it lasted, but we won't be back here. C'est la vie.

11.description: This place is really terrible. My bf had a pepperoni pizza which was so greasy it was soggy. I ordered a margarita pizza and am pretty sure the cardboard box would have tasted better. Terrible crust,sauce from a can, and customer service not the best. Get a business in that space that knows what they are doing with that amazing wood burning pizza oven.  What a waste!!!

22.description: Order the "Lip stinger" and it was awesome - loved it! I also saw a Taco Pizza with Doritos on their website which I can not lie, peaked my interest for my next order. You'll hear from me soon!

0.description: My wife and I moved to Roscoe Village in May and nearly did not go to this pizza place due to poor yelp reviews. Fortunately we decided to give it a shot and ignore the reviews. Some quick points:1. We have a pizza here every two weeks and I would easily say the majority have been great2. We have never had a greasy pizza as some people noted3. Flavors and crust are great4. Pick it up if you can - the driver is outsourced and slow5. We never write reviews but thought the reviews on Riverview are so wrong based on our experience that we need to make our point.

20.description: Not good pizza.  I agree with Kevin's review, it was probably one of the worst pizzas I've ever had in Chicago.  It's too doughy, the sauce has no flavor, Kind of reminds me of the pizza in South Florida.

19.description: Just got put on hold for 5 min... Hmmmm.  I hung up and called another place..

2.description: This is our favorite pizza place!! The atmosphere is relaxed and they are always friendly. We've tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed! The balboa and fungi pizzas are awesome. Definitely a place to try!!

18.description: The Club Italiano sandwich is awesome. Big fan of the natural chips. Was there right after Thanksgiving.

13.description: This is some of the worst pizza I've had in Chicago.  Tastes like they use cheap, standard tomato sauce and the greasiest toppings.  I'd rather have had a frozen pizza.  Service was also pretty terrible.  Nobody was at the register for about 5 minutes at lunch, with the restaurant completely empty.EDIT: As an alternative, go to Bartoli's up the street!

4.description: Really nice guy made me a great BBQ pizza! Pizza was well made, also cooked and made right in front of me. I was the only customer at the time, was around 7:30 and the chef was really easy to talk to. Described what was good and what I should try. So he recommended me the BBQ Pizza and also was able to cut it into squares for me. Would recommend!

24.description: This is some of the worst pizza I've had in Chicago.  Tastes like they use cheap, standard tomato sauce and the greasiest toppings.  I'd rather have had a frozen pizza.  Service was also pretty terrible.  Nobody was at the register for about 5 minutes at lunch, with the restaurant completely empty.EDIT: As an alternative, go to Bartoli's up the street!

6.description: I don't know why the bad reviews... They have good pizza, they seem to use ok to fresh ingredients and the dough is really nice. Two downsides: 1.We ordered delivery and we live 3 minutes drive from that place. The pizza took 1 hour and 5 minutes to get here... 2. Pricey. We also had pizza and Italian "fries" once on site. Italian fries never again, just tooo much cheese and dough but pizza is real good. Not too thin not too thick. I am confused about the bad reviews...

15.description: Went there right before heading to Chicago airport. It was highly recommended by a Chicagoist. Used to be very good, much better than other famous pizza places. Changed the name and it doesn't taste as good now.

7.description: I'm surprised by the bad reviews here.  I just moved to Chicago from New York City and after spending 3 months in Lincoln Park thinking I'd never taste a good bite of NY-style pizza again, I moved to Roscoe Village and found this gem.  It's not perfect, but they have created a beautiful crust, and the toppings and sauce have been fresh, a bit spicy (which I love) and consistent after several orders.  This will be my go-to pizza spot.  And my husband loves that he can have a beer in the tavern while he waits for carry out.

8.description: RBOP has been criticized way too harshly in these reviews. I come here occasionally during lunch, often with my friends or parents, and I even catered with them for a party. I have never felt anything less than pleased with their food and service. It's a nice change of pace when I go from deep dish to thin crust / Neapolitan style / New York style, or whatever you wanna call it. Riverview is a good option when that inspiration strikes. The pizza options on the menu are well-crafted, with lots of unique flavor combinations. But even still, I usually stay simple and boring with my toppings. I think the texture of their pizza is great. The crust is neither too crunchy or chewy. Anyone who complains about it being "soggy" or "oily" is just ignorant to the style. It won't blow you hair back, but the pizza is very tasty. I would often split a pizza and sandwich with a friend so we can get some of both, which is what I recommend. The Turkey Spin Club, Chicken Parm, and Tony Montana are all really flavorful and come with home-made chips. Riverview also has a lunch special for a slice and a beer, which is great when just relaxing with a friend or on a date.

3.description: It didn't even have proper change to give me. I let it slide, but after eating half of a slice I was ready to ask for a full refund. The second half of the slice was undercooked. Only reason I didn't was because my girlfriend didn't want me to cause a scene. This was my third try at the place, and definitely my last.Damn I miss Robeys.

14.description: Not very impressed with the pizza. It was very greasy! It seemed over priced for the quality of food. It did the job and made us full, that's about it.

1.description: Food is good but service is usually a let down. The only tables open still had garbage on them and we're not wiped down. We sat at a dirty table. It stayed dirty for the remainder of our stay. All while the cashiers stood at the register chit chatting.

2.description: Delicious food, fast service, great prices! This is a new location, but the quality and  customer service is up to par. We were greeted at the door and taken care of quickly. Recommend this location

0.description: This is my first time eating at Noodles N Company. The food was good, service was good. But our table was dirty and we had to ask someone to clean it and the chairs were filthy. We ordered the garlic cheese bread which was borderline burnt. The marinara was good though. I ordered the Thai Hot Pot, which was not spicy at all besides the peppers in it, and there was too much spinach and mushrooms for my liking. My fiance ordered the Japanese Pan Noodle with shrimp, it was great no complaints there. Overall good food and location, staff can smile more but they were friendly. Definitely needs work on cleanliness.

3.description: I have gone to many different hair stylist and Amber is by far the best I have ever been to! She really takes the time to listen to what you want, what you dont want and always has great advice on what she thinks will look good! I love that she gives her honest opinion on how she thinks a different color or style will look. I just went from having brownish/blonde hair to a brownish red and LOVE IT! I never would have felt taking the leap if it want Amber doing it. She is very easy to talk to and offers a great service at a very reasonable price! I would recommend Amber to anyone, man, woman or child!

1.description: Amber is the best for color (I'm blonde) and cut!  I was at a loss when my former stylist moved to LA...lucky for me I was referred to Amber and I couldn't be happier.  Not only does she do a fantastic job on my hair (truly an artist) but she has become a great friend!  I always have so much fun when I go to her.  I would 100% recommend her to anyone looking for a stylist and colorist they can trust!!

2.description: I adore Amber. She is the best stylist I've ever had. She completely understands my thin, blonde hair. She's taken me through every hair mood from dark and short to long and blonde. She knows exactly what to do even if I can't put words to it. Most recently, she's brought me into the world of balayage. I'll never go to another stylist again.

5.description: Amber is SOOOOOOOOOO creative and truly gives the BEST cuts & colors! I wouldn't trust my lovely locks with anyone else!

6.description: Amber is, without a doubt, the best stylist I've ever had.  I had gone through a bunch -- my hair is generally really low-maintenance, and it typically takes a REALLY BAD haircut for it to be an issue...  so I always thought that any stylist would do.But then I met AMBER.  She has helped me try all sorts of new things (I tried coloring my hair for the first time with her, and now I love it!), but she also keeps me from doing anything that I might regret (like when I thought it would be a good idea to go from my natural darkdark brown to BLONDE -- she said, "well, let's start with highlights").  I cannot tell you how many compliments I get on my hair style and color -- even when I go weeks and weeks without a touch-up!Not only did I follow Amber from another salon, but I moved from Chicago to Boston almost TWO YEARS ago, and I STILL insist that no one else does my hair.She's enormously talented, and a ton of fun.  She's the best!  (If you ask me, I say she doesn't charge nearly enough.)

7.description: Amber is the bomb-diggity. I've followed her from another salon and will continue to. She is great about working with your schedule to fit you in and is amazing about working with your hair to get it how you want it. Fun personality to boot!

0.description: I have been going to Amber for about 10 years now. Amber is without a doubt the best stylist I have ever had. I drive states and hours to have my hair done by her and only her. Amber is great because she listens to her clients for what they want. She adds suggestions and strives for excellence every single time. Amber is always on time and sticks to her schedule. I wouldn't trust my hair to anyone but Amber! I have recommended many friends and family members to Amber and they all love her!

4.description: LOVE Amber!  She's the absolute best!  She knows I like variety, and has done my hair in blonde, brown, red, and even super-blonde!  She is a miracle colorist, and her cuts are amazing as well.  She is really good about fitting me in after work since that's when it's convenient for me to come - which is really nice of her.  I get compliments on my hair every time I get it done (and I do different colors all of the time).  People say "this one's my favorite" just about every time.  She also did my hair for a wedding I took part in, and it was PICTURE PERFECT.

3.description: This was a pretty good show. DONT get the nachos, I was very disappointed. However the acts were good.

1.description: My Friends and I went to The Sidebar Show's opening night a few weeks ago and I just wanted to say It was the best stand up show I've seen so far. Every comic was great, the venue was perfect and we can't wait to come back. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good laugh. The best part of it all it was only $5 and the bar, Riverview Tavern, had some awesome specials that night, so it was easy on my pocket as well!DO IT GUYS!!!

2.description: All of the comics were great and hilarious. I went last night with 4 friends and they loved it as well, we had a lot of fun! Each comic was unique in their own way, which kept the show interesting, and they were only allowed a certain amount of time which was a good thing in terms of getting variety. It was a great show and we will definitely be back!*Drinks and food were very fast, as well!

5.description: It is an awesome show for a great price! Definitely now a go to on Tuesday nights. They accommodate groups very well. Splendid beer selection, and they don't break the bank!! I tried their Turkey club when I went and Bells Best Brown. Excellent fries! I highly recommend!

0.description: I went to the Sidebar show last night, and they were fantastic. The event is driven by passion. The three guys running The Sidebar Show are all comedians, and each seems intimately invested. At the end of the evening, the three went around thanking us for attending, making sure they met each of us, and gave off a fantastic vibe.The comedians invited were fantastic, and we were lucky enough to see five different performances. Finally, the event itself is well organized. The seat count was perfect, wait staff was easily accessible, and I was entirely comfortable

4.description: Such a fun show! The hosts were great, the groupon deal was great, and I can't wait to perform at this venue in the future. So many "showcases" around the city are just glorified open mics and the performers are not fully prepared but everyone that went up was wonderful

3.description: Just had my first massage at Lily Spa. I initially selected it because 1) it is open on Sunday, and 2) it's very close to my house. I'm a fan, and will most certainly be back.The price is more than reasonable. $60 for an hour massage (for new clients) is a steal as far as I'm concerned. The quality of the massage I received was five stars. It was thorough and exactly as I'd asked. The only thing that made this a four star experience as opposed to a five star experience was the lack of a blanket on the table. I was covered with a towel instead, and (perhaps it's personal preference) I would have enjoyed my experience one more star with a blanket.I will certainly return to Lily Spa!

1.description: ABSOLUTELY AWFUL EXPERIENCE!I'll attempt to summarize as much as I can, but there was a lot wrong with my deep tissue massage. First of all, they had me pay $85 for a one hour deep tissue massage BEFORE my service even started. That was the first red flag. I've been receiving massages for years. I've heard of putting a card number down to hold a reservation, but to completely pay for the massage before is happens is unreasonable, but whatever. Then the lady at the front desk asked me how much I'd like to tip...? Tip? Before she even starts the service? I told her I would be tipping after the service was complete.The lady at the front desk then leads me back to my room and tells me to undress and lay down. I needed to use the bathroom so she told me to undress, put a towel on, and she would show me to the bathroom. Weird, I thought, so I'm just gonna walk shirtless in a towel to the bathroom I guess.She leads me to the bathroom and says "you take steam shower" I was like, "aahh...ok?" she then set up a towel on the bench in the shower and turned the steam on. Ok, this is a nice amenity I thought. But she just left after that. No instruction. How long do I stay in here? 5 mins? 20? Is this cutting into my hour massage time? I stayed for 5 mins then sheepishly tip toed in my towel back to my room.I met my massage therapist and tried to have a consultation with her about my bad lower back and how I'd like her to spend extra time on it. She cut me short and said just lay down and well talk after that, so I did. But we didn't talk after that. She just started massaging me-and not a deep tissue massage, but a swedish massage. I asked her if she could 'find the knots' and 'apply more pressure' as that is what a deep tissue massage therapist would normally do. Her reply was that a deep tissue massage was the same as a swedish, just harder...what?! That's completely false! Any trained professional would tell you that. They are completely different techniques. Google it for goodness sakes! Then the phone range at the front desk. She stopped massaging immediately and said "sorry!" as she was leaving the room to go answer the phone. This is when I got up, got dressed, walked to the front and demanded a refund. She had been 'massaging' me for a total of 10 mins so she said she would only charge me $20. I told her no, I paid for a service and I did not receive that service so I would like a full refund. Her counter offer was to only charge me $10. I just said screw it, received a partial refund, and left with a still aching lower back. I know I've written a lot here, but honestly this is a fraction of the confusion and awful service I received at this place. Please, give your time and money to a company that will take care of you i.e. not Lily Spa

2.description: I attempted to surprise my husband with a last minute massage on Valentine' Day.  I told them several times that he was coming in but I would pay for it.  When I called, they said they couldn't take my card over the phone, so I would have to come in.  I said I would be in in a few hours, but then they charged my husband before they would do the massage!  It was so annoying.  I won't be back.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is that my husband said the massage was okay...not great.

9.description: Atmosphere is definitely a plus, and the hours are nice.   I do find quality of the work not bad, but perhaps a tad sporadic.  I prefer the older, more experienced people who have made this more of a profession as opposed to a temporary job.

10.description: I went here with my boyfriend recently and we both enjoyed our massages.  They made sure to ask how the pressure was and it was a relaxing environment. They were very nice aand the massages were great and affordable. They even give a discount the first time you go. I highly recommend Lily Spa.

4.description: I stopped by today after searching the internet for a great place for a foot massage and I found it!  This new spa is extremely clean and modern.  After the foot massage, I also asked for a hand massage and she was happy to!  All for $30! They gave me a tour of the facility after and I was impressed!A simple little gem in the Lakeview/Roscoe area!  I will return!! You can't beat the price! Don't let the price fool you either. I'm a clean freak and couldn't fiind a flaw with the place!  They have only been open for 3 months so be sure to come out and support them!

6.description: Just happened to pass by and stopped in to check it out... So glad I did! The place is clean, with a nice décor and has an awesome steam/shower.  The rooms are very clean with fresh towels, soft lighting and music.  Jessica was very personable and gave an excellent massage.  I returned a week later and had Yunna whom is deceptively strong for her size and gave an incredible deep tissue massage.  Yunna's back walking skills are amazing.  For wonderful, skilled massages I highly recommend!

12.description: I found this spa supremely relaxing, clean and nicely appointed. And the massage was excellent. Yunna was powerful for such a small person and responsive when the pressure was too light or too strong. Plus a half hour massage is $40 for first-time customers, so it's a great value too! I'll be back...

5.description: Really nice place, the hours are great, and its relaxing!!! The massage was nice.

13.description: I love this place and recommend it to anyone.  I tried this place on the recommendation of my friend who enjoyed the foot massage she got here and I'm really glad I found it.  I've been here about five times for the foot massage, chair massage, and deep tissue massage. The prices can't be beat,  I think the chair massage (15 minutes for $10)  is a particularly good value.  They are very professional, the facilities are pristine, and they do a great job.

11.description: This is the kind of place you drop into at the spare of the moment when you're walking by with extra money in your pocket.  It is NOT a dependable luxury spa where you go to unwind and be pampered for your money.  I booked a facial & massage a week in advance, only to drive across the city, park and walk up to find the place CLOSED!  When I called the owner they didn't even remember I had an appointment @ 11:00 a.m. (they "Open" at 10:30).  Needless to say I got back into my car and called my usual salon.  Yes, it cost more...but I was greeted @ the door.  They hung up my coat, fixed me a cappucino and showed me to my personal locker & steam.  All of this before 2 professionals provided great service.  What good is saving a few bucks when people don't even care enough to show up?

8.description: The spa is cute and clean; unfortunately that is where the good review ends. We went in for a relaxing couple massage - but that proved impossible with the women who chatted with each other the entire time. Our massages were worse then one from my 12 year old sister; instead of a professional massage, it felt more like a purposeless rubdown by untrained amateurs. We will not return.

0.description: After reading previous reviews.. I feel like lots of lies.  I have been coming here for a couple of years.  Always first class.  Amazing massages.  I've never been asked for a tip and massages were always great.Highly Recommend.

7.description: I came in one day for a facial & massage and it was mediocre at best. I really, really wanted to like this place because the prices, they're open late and was able to get me in that day. Although the space looked nice they lacked detail of what makes a spa. When I called in there was a HUGE language barrier and I wasn't able to really get any questions answered about their services other their hours. I wasn't asked any questions about my treatment preferences for my massage.  The massage pressure was sporadic and the masseuse didn't ease the pressure even after my request. The facial didn't even seem like one. No hot towel was used in any part of the treatment- for 20ish minutes was just a series of watery masks to be wiped off with a napkin that I swear re-rinsing and re-wiping on my face. After that, a thick mask applied and I was then left in the dark for about 20 minutes for it to dry.  In all, it was a big dissapointment and I wouldn't recommend going.

1.description: I have mad respect for Kevin and his skills and appreciation for his craft. Recent transplant from LA and have wanting a bike since my move. Finally decided to buy one. Not wanting to spend massive amounts to money, I turned to Yelp in hopes to find used bikes. I called Kevin to try to set something up. He just asked for my height and we met soon after. He had an enormous amount of variety of bikes to choose from. I am by no means a bike expert and I felt that Kevin was very knowledgable in educating me about the different options. Honestly though because I was so impatient, I wanted a bike that was ready to ride off the lot that day. If not, Kevin could have put together a bike for me of my choosing and have had it ready for me by the end of the week. I was so happy with the service I just referred my roommate, who has also been wanting a bike, to him. She chose out a frame that she liked and fitted and Kevin literally had it done the next day for us to pick up. All in all an awesome guy and amazing service he provides!

9.description: Really nice guy with hundreds of bikes to choose from. Not all of them are "completed" but if you are looking for something special and vintage, you will find it here! Myself, boyfriend, and friend all came and left very happy with new bikes - at great prices. We are all pretty short so it was great to have multiple small bikes to choose from. Come here first before going anywhere else to get a used, vintage bike! Thanks Kevin.

23.description: Thank you sir! Fast & friendly service.  Has an awesome selection of bikes to choose from. Will definitely continue to use in future. 100% support local businesses.

25.description: Typically a Craiglist bike seller, Kevin Thornton spends most of his time revamping vintage bikes. I visited his garage yesterday in hopes of finding a single speed vintage cruiser for someone short (i'm only 5'2"). Small bikes are incredibly hard to find. Luckily Kevin had at least 8-10 different bikes for me to choose from, all vintage, all beautiful. He doesn't sell a bike unless it is in great, rideable condition. His prices are completely reasonable. They start at $55, most of the really attractive bikes seemed to be $100-$175.Not only was he incredibly friendly, his family was very welcoming and genuinely had my best interest at heart. They found me the perfect bike! I told Kevin that I dreamed of having a double basket on the back of the bike someday. Magically, he pulled one out and put it on the bicycle for me. This is truly a one stop shop! Some weekends, Kevin will open his garage to sell to you. Otherwise he is appointment only. Give him a call.Please shop with Kevin and give business to a genuine person who loves his work! You won't regret it!

12.description: Kevin is such a great guy!  A joy to buy a bike from!  There are so many to choose from, all in great mechanical condition and at very fair prices.  Kevin really takes pride in what he does, my bike got a flat tire, and he fixed it and gave me two new intertubes for only 5 bucks!  Also my husband did not like the bike that I picked for him, so Kevin let him exchange it.  There are lots of unique bikes, I got a German Bismark from the 1940s!  My husband got a nice green Swchwinn cruiser.

21.description: My bike had gotten stolen on Monday so I was in search for used bikes- I didn't want to buy a new one considering the fact that it may be stolen again.  I looked here on Yelp to help me find a good place to buy it and came upon Kevin Thornton Bikes and I'm so blessed I did. I had called him while I was in his area and he took the time to allow me to take a look at his bikes with short notice.  He asked me what it was I was looking for and had picked out the perfect bike.  Because the price was so reasonable- 75 for a diamondback mountain bike, i decided to buy a road bike while there too.  He took the time to show me a few that were within my budget and I was able to get one I fell in love with.  He is so knowledgeable and just an overall nice, good guy.  You can tell he is really passionate about what he does and is not trying to rip anybody off.  I highly recommend him to anyone looking for a bike.  He also does tune-ups/fix ups for a very decent price as well. So if you have a bike that needs some work done- he's he man to take it too.  Overall, very, very impressed.  Thanks Kevin!

16.description: If you are looking for a bike on a budget this is your place. I bought a mountain bike in really good shape for only $50. Kevin is great. He wants to make sure that you'll leave his garage with exactly wath you are looking for.

17.description: My daughter and I went to get a bike on Saturday. Keven was extremely knowledgeable and kind. He took time to describe the different kinds of bikes to us to help my daughter in knowing what kind of bike to get. He was extremely helpful. Could not recommend him more highly.

10.description: This was the easiest process ever. We called and he told us when to come over. We stopped by and he showed us many different option to fit exactly what we were looking for.He's super nice and great to work with. Plus he knows everything about his bikes and has more than you'll believe. His price is cheaper than everything else we saw on Craigslist.I wouldn't even waste my time looking anywhere else.

5.description: It's guys like Kevin that can make a big city seem like a small town.Kevin has more vintage bikes that I would care to count and he restores them with lots of TLC. We just bought a 60's era Austrian-made Sears 3 speed and couldn't be happier with the price, the bike, and the fact that we got to do business with such a cool guy.

11.description: Kevin found me a 1973 Schwinn Breeze that perfectly suited my needs as a first time bike owner. Seeing the hundreds of bikes in the garage was also a treat--since the bikes represent such a varied collection of countries, sizes, colors, ages, etc. Each used bike seems to have a story, and Kevin knows what he is doing.

22.description: Kevin is such a great guy!  A joy to buy a bike from!  There are so many to choose from, all in great mechanical condition and at very fair prices.  Kevin really takes pride in what he does, my bike got a flat tire, and he fixed it and gave me two new intertubes for only 5 bucks!  Also my husband did not like the bike that I picked for him, so Kevin let him exchange it.  There are lots of unique bikes, I got a German Bismark from the 1940s!  My husband got a nice green Swchwinn cruiser.

0.description: I called Kevin while out on a bike ride today, and after having stopped at the worst bike shop ever in the city that just seemed to not want my business.  My bike seat post was toast, so I looked him up while literally riding down Damen.  He practically stopped what he was doing on a beautiful Sunday to help me out.  So when I arrived, he came out and said I needed a new bike post.  He found me one in his stash of parts, fixed it in no time, and I was back on my way with functional parts.  Really friendly guy and I recommend his repair services.

20.description: My wife and I were looking for sturdy, comfortable used bikes that we could use to cruise around the city. Kevin was extremely helpful and guided us through his very large inventory to the two perfect city bikes. I would recommend Kevin Thornton Bikes to anybody looking for a VERY fair deal on a used bike from a knowledgeable bike expert.

19.description: Kevin is the man. Quoted $120-$200+ everywhere. Here? Walked out the door for $45. Looking for a bike? Come here first, then do your shopping around to make sure you sleep at night, but I wouldn't even bother. Thanks again for the hook up.

2.description: Kevin is an awesome dude! I got a sweet bike, completely restored, at a great price! I'm a bike novice and didn't really know what I wanted, but Kevin was able to give me enough info about the different styles and functions of the bikes, that by the time I left I felt like a bonafide expert! Overall excellent service/quality at an excellent price. I'll definitely go to him for all my future bicycle needs!

18.description: Typically a Craiglist bike seller, Kevin Thornton spends most of his time revamping vintage bikes. I visited his garage yesterday in hopes of finding a single speed vintage cruiser for someone short (i'm only 5'2"). Small bikes are incredibly hard to find. Luckily Kevin had at least 8-10 different bikes for me to choose from, all vintage, all beautiful. He doesn't sell a bike unless it is in great, rideable condition. His prices are completely reasonable. They start at $55, most of the really attractive bikes seemed to be $100-$175.Not only was he incredibly friendly, his family was very welcoming and genuinely had my best interest at heart. They found me the perfect bike! I told Kevin that I dreamed of having a double basket on the back of the bike someday. Magically, he pulled one out and put it on the bicycle for me. This is truly a one stop shop! Some weekends, Kevin will open his garage to sell to you. Otherwise he is appointment only. Give him a call.Please shop with Kevin and give business to a genuine person who loves his work! You won't regret it!

13.description: Kevin was amazing. He was very laid back, and helpful and we joked the entire time that I was there. It took maybe 15 minutes to find a bike that was perfect! I'm 5'1", and it's hard to find a bike my size. But he did it! It was a great price, had a rack in the back and had a water bottle holder. Everything was perfect and amazing about this experience. I highly suggest going to him if you're looking to get a fantastic deal on a bike.

4.description: I've bought two bikes from Kevin in the last year (one was stolen) and I am have been crazy happy with both. He does excellent work and his bikes are so much better and more well-made than some of the ones you can buy at the store. Call before showing up, but if you're looking for a great used bike that you won't have to do extra work on later, this should without a doubt be your first stop

24.description: If you're looking for a cheap used bike, something vintage, road bike, 3 speed, single speed, fixed gear, cruiser, whatever... Kevin probably has it and for what you would probably hope to pay on Craigslist.Kevin fixes up bikes and resells them out of his garage. He has A LOT in his inventory. You can find anything from $50 to $250. I bought an 80s Raleigh road bike all fixed up and ready to ride for $250 and that was one of his most expensive bikes. If you're looking for something reasonably priced and vintage, give him a call to see what he has, and then you can go over to his place and look at everything.He knows bikes and did I mention he has  a lot.

6.description: Went to buy bikes today with a friend. Kevin was AMAZINGLY helpful! When we called, he asked for our heights and had several bikes in mind as soon as we arrived. There were many cute bikes to choose from, all between $130-200, but I ended up going with the very first bike that Kevin picked out for me, a Chicago-made Schwinn Suburban from the '70s. My friend got an awesome Dutch road bike, and each was under $200.After we left, we went down the street to Roscoe Bikes for helmets and locks. The whole experience could not have been easier or more fun!!!!TIP: Call ahead! Kevin is pretty flexible with hours, but it's nice to know he'll be home and ready to help you get your perfect bike.

15.description: If you're looking for a cheap used bike, something vintage, road bike, 3 speed, single speed, fixed gear, cruiser, whatever... Kevin probably has it and for what you would probably hope to pay on Craigslist.Kevin fixes up bikes and resells them out of his garage. He has A LOT in his inventory. You can find anything from $50 to $250. I bought an 80s Raleigh road bike all fixed up and ready to ride for $250 and that was one of his most expensive bikes. If you're looking for something reasonably priced and vintage, give him a call to see what he has, and then you can go over to his place and look at everything.He knows bikes and did I mention he has  a lot.

7.description: This gentleman is an amazing and kind hearted person. I wanted to surprise my hub by repairing his vintage Schwinn bike handed down by his father. When I brought it over to him, he knew exactly what year it was made and was very honest about what needed to be repaired, no "extras" or "hidden tweaks" to get your money. I went in knowing what needed to be repaired and he was dead on. In most places, they were wanting to charge me triple of what he charged me and plus he was able to fix it in short notice! I was so thankful that he was able to fix it so perfectly in time for my hub's birthday. We are now loyal customers and only suggest Mr. Thornton to any bike needs and buys!Thank you so much Kevin!

8.description: My wife and I had been wanting to get her a bike for quite a while and found Kevin while searching online. He was ridiculously helpful, using his passion for bikes to find us the perfect cruiser. It is a rare, 1970s Raleigh that is really amazing (Kevin collects Raleigh cruisers and had never seen one). Best of all, The price was unbelievable. He even had locks!This is hands down, the best place I have seen to get a decent bike at a great price while supporting a local, grassroots entrepreneur.

3.description: My boyfriend and I were looking to gets bikes, nothing crazy, just to get around, get to work, etc. We called, gave our heights, and Kevin had a few bikes to show us, two of which we purchased at a great price for the two of them, which were also very different but both awesome. Can't say enough nice things about Kevin, he was a great guy, with obvious knowledge of bikes that neither of us have, but you can tell he's being genuine and not just using bike terminology to feel cool.Two thumbs up to this guy!

14.description: I found exactly what I wanted and the bike was tuned perfectly. You can tell he loves bikes because he has a million. Bring one in or pick one out one of his and he will make it run smooth.

3.description: The 1901 is a small alternative gallery that features burlesque shows, art exhibits, craft fairs, and I'm probably missing something.  The craft fairs are held on a monthly basis (or so) and are a great place to purchase some really unique things.  Track their website for the  next fair!  Mother's day is coming up :-)

1.description: You gotta love the 1901!  An excellent resource for performers and artists.  It is clear that the people who run the space really care about their space and have really made the most of it!

2.description: I first came to the 1901 for a figure drawing class, which they hold at the end of each month. It's a small, intimate setting in which I could brush up on my drawing skills without feeling pressured to make anything spectacular. There are usually only a handful of artists, ranging from students to professionals. There's a casual attitude and the models joke around with the artists.I've been to a few of the craft fairs and gallery receptions as well. It's the place to find unique dark and macabre paintings, photographs, jewelry and sculptures. There is a wide range of prices depending on the artist and the piece, but there are definitely many affordable items.While it may not be to everyone's taste, the 1901 fills a niche here in the city for gothic and alternative art. The donation they ask for any of the events is next to nothing, so there isn't a reason to not at least check it out. They generally have snacks and coffee available at the larger events, but it's BYOB.The entrance is a bit hidden. Look for the light strings just south of Belmont on Wolcott.

5.description: This gallery is truly hidden and it is a gem in the gothic/alternative community.  It exhibits various forms of art from the local gothic community including photography, paintings, mixed media, crafts, etc.  It also hosts some creative burlesque shows, bands, etc.  Drinks are served up and include goodies baked at home like brownies while you enjoy the art and performances.  If you want to know where people like DJ Scary Lady hang out when in Chicago, or where the gothic artist community hangs, come check out this hidden gem.

0.description: Oh, The 1901 does grow on you!! I am a regular here,both as a performer(stand up comedy,folks...you would pay me to keep my goodies covered!) and as a spectator. This space is fun and funky and has a great vibe! Come check out Please-O-Matic,first Saturday of the month or The Let It All Hang Out Comedy Show,last Saturday of the month. Both fun shows and as always,BYOB!

4.description: Holy shit! The 1901 Gallery is an amazing place. They host unique burlesque and comedy events, craft fairs, and art receptions. I've been there on multiple occasions and have been turned onto some interesting underground art and music. If you have never been, you should plan a trip soon and see for yourself. Shit yeah!

28.description: I love this store and I love Jen! I got my wedding invitations through Jen and actually had her do my Wedding Ceremony programs. She prints in her shop as well, which just adds more great options when selecting what you want. She has an amazing assortment of products to sift through, it was overwhelming! But Jen was patient and extremely helpful when I was making decisions. Store is adorable!

1.description: I am a huge greeting cards collector, and I stumbled upon this while I was roaming around Roscoe Village.  The original store was a few doors down, and they moved to a bigger space within the last year.  Either way, the owner, Jen Pramenko, the owner, is the sweetest person you'll ever know.  I bought a card earlier this year (around February or so), and when I came home, I noticed that it was ripped and taped up.  This store only accepts exchanges for store credit or for another merchandise; I emailed her and asked if I can come in to exchange for another product; she totally was embarrassed and so shocked about the situation, and assured me time and time again that she would never sell 'used' products.  She said she would be more than happy to give me a full refund.  I came and she gave me a refund, apologized a few more thousand times, asked me I could pick out another item in the store on her as well as keep the original card if I chose to do so (for my collection).  This is the service I expect, and the fact that it's coming from a cute stationery/greeting cards store makes it all so much better.  I think this place is cute, has a great collection of cute cards (can be quiet expensive), sometimes has a sales bin in the front of the store at 25% off, and holds little cocktail parties while you shop at discounted prices sometime in the evenings.  You can usually find parking on the street, metered.  Love it, love it, love it.+wonderful stationery and cards collection

9.description: Our experience was perfection from start to finish! I found With Grace on yelp from all of the other reviews on here. My Fella and I made an appointment with Zoe and she was the bomb! We had a super tight deadline, invites that needed to be sent and returned form the UK like yesterday and NO IDEA what we wanted or what we were doing.Zoe walked us through the process like a complete pro. She gave tough love where needed, guided us through our indecisiveness and keep us laughing along the way..."Above and beyond!" was our experience with Zoe. Our invites turned out 100x better than we could've dreamed, Zoe even met us on a Sunday to personally deliver the invites so we could get them in the mail ASAP.Highly reccommended to anyone wanting a happy, fun, stressfree experience with wedding invites. Oh, and the little wine/beer store "Lush" next door is convienent if your groom gets a little antsy/edgy/etc.Enjoy!

29.description: Jen and her team are amazing.  My fiancé and I stopped in there on Saturday to look at wedding invitations and we had an amazing experience.  We tried going to a few other shops and looking online but none of them even asked us anything about our wedding or what we wanted.  They just threw those highly overwhelming, large bound generic wedding invite books at us and told us to pick one.  So I was expecting more of the same when we went in to with Grace.  I could not have been more wrong.  From the minute we walked in to with Grace Jen had read my fiancé and I like a book.  She asked us all kinds of questions about our wedding and she helped us create the perfect invitations, reply cards, and thank you stationary.  She walked through each and every step with us including wording - what's modern v traditional, hotel v church ceremony, etc.  These are things that normal every day people just don't know.  She really knows her stuff.  And to top it all off she was really reasonable on the price!Sometimes you meet or work with someone who just gets what it means to give amazing customer service and we both felt that Jen and her team at with Grace did that for us. We were concerned that our vision would not be able to be realized but she was able to do that for us today, as her shop names says, "with grace" and talent.

23.description: This place is great! I worked in a paper store before and wanted to do my own invitations, but specifically wanted Envelopments for the enclosures.  I've sat down with both the owner and Emily multiple times.  They were open with recommendations, but not pushy.  They cut my invites (which I purchased elsewhere) for free, and let me borrow a tape gun to do it myself at home (for $5 cost per tape roll).  I DEFINITELY recommend this place if you want to go with a small company that will give you professional and personal attention.  4 stars only because the owner was a bit eccentric, though very nice!

5.description: I didn't know it until I read the other reviews, but this place does wedding invitations? I wish I would have known that about a year ago!I passed this place numerous times while walking my dog on Roscoe, but never popped in. I found myself in need of a greeting card one day, so I headed in, hoping to find something. What I found was tons of the cutest items you can imagine. And the employee was as nice as they come. She asked me what kind of card I was looking for, and directed me to the correct place. All the cards are just adorable. I didn't have a lot of time to linger (which was probably best for me and my pocketbook since I would have wanted everything in the store), so I purchased my card and left.I am excited to have found such a charming little card store nearby. I'll definitely become a regular customer.

31.description: Can't say enough about With Grace!  Jen is so knowledgeable about her products and always makes fantastic recommendations for gifts.  I come in the store for everything!  Love all of their stationary and the store is darling!

25.description: I didn't know it until I read the other reviews, but this place does wedding invitations? I wish I would have known that about a year ago!I passed this place numerous times while walking my dog on Roscoe, but never popped in. I found myself in need of a greeting card one day, so I headed in, hoping to find something. What I found was tons of the cutest items you can imagine. And the employee was as nice as they come. She asked me what kind of card I was looking for, and directed me to the correct place. All the cards are just adorable. I didn't have a lot of time to linger (which was probably best for me and my pocketbook since I would have wanted everything in the store), so I purchased my card and left.I am excited to have found such a charming little card store nearby. I'll definitely become a regular customer.

12.description: We arrived without an appointment on a Saturday and Jen stayed late to meet with us.  She went through a million wedding invitations with us.  We had to go, and we schedule another appointment for a few days later.  She again went through tons of invitations.  We had one very specific style in mind, there were many close ones, but we couldn't find the exact one we wanted.  Jen went online and helped us find the exact invitation we wanted from another company!  She even helped us with the wording!  All we ended up buying was a great birthday card that you can't find anywhere else.  Jen went above and beyond, we got the exact invitations we wanted, and couldn't be happier or more surprised by the extreme level of service.  FYI, the price online was essentially the same as with Grace's.

37.description: My daughter and I can barely pass the windows each time we walk by.  This store has the most adorable things, and the selection of invites and stationery is so well edited.  I find almost too many things but I am always able to convince myself that I need them all.  With grace is with good taste, if I may say so.
