21.description: We got our wedding invitations are so happy with the result. Jen, the owner is super sweet and really takes care of you. I have also gotten thank you cards here and I always get compliments for sending cute cards :) The store also has a ton of adorable  gifts and I will for sure go here for my next gift shopping trip.

16.description: Jen,the owner is absolutely fantastic! She helped me and my fiancee in the selection of cards that fitted our budget for our wedding. She really knows her business,craft,gives great advice on design,detail layout..etc! I would give her a 10 stars if i could. We went to her store after reading the reviews on yelp! And you,reviewers were absolutely right!With Grace is absolutely the best place to get your wedding cards or any printing! Excellent!

17.description: I recently read a children's book (to a child, thank you!) called Fancy Nancy. Fancy Nancy wants to make everything a little more fancy. Well, I'm on board with Fancy Nancy--having a party? Why not send an invitation? You could even bedazzle it if you want to!I'm pretty sure if I walked into With Grace to find bedazzled invitations, I'd find them. With Grace is a lovely little shop in Roscoe Village specializing in paper needs, but invitations in particular--weddings, bridal showers, bachelorette parties, birthdays, holiday parties, you name it. I even saw some invites in the shape of beer steins! Next time I have an alcohol-fueled fun fest, I'll be sending you an invitation...If I were doing a personalized holiday card, I'd also come here--it seems as though they have a much bigger selection for greeting cards if you order them. I initially came in here to check out the selection of cards I could just sign and send, but they don't have much of a selection. 'Tis early in the season, maybe I'll check back in.Besides invites and holiday cards, they do have a selection of personal planners and thank you cards, little bachelorette-type goodies like keychains, wine plugs, and nail kits, and a selection of Our Name is Mud products (I personally own a handpainted oversized coffee mug that says "Oy Vey!") to make every day a little bit more fancy.

10.description: Fantastic! I bought my wedding invites and shower invites here. Not only are they gorgeous but they came in under budget! I loved working with Jen and Emily. They were so helpful and really know their business. They even emailed me an etiquette template to help me address the envelopes.

11.description: This place is great! I worked in a paper store before and wanted to do my own invitations, but specifically wanted Envelopments for the enclosures.  I've sat down with both the owner and Emily multiple times.  They were open with recommendations, but not pushy.  They cut my invites (which I purchased elsewhere) for free, and let me borrow a tape gun to do it myself at home (for $5 cost per tape roll).  I DEFINITELY recommend this place if you want to go with a small company that will give you professional and personal attention.  4 stars only because the owner was a bit eccentric, though very nice!

26.description: This is my first review!  I joined yelp for the purpose of letting everyone know how wonderful my fiancé and I think 'with Grace' is!  We found 'with Grace' through a wedding invitation website.  We first met with Emily (super sweet and really knows her stuff).  When we showed her the invitations that we wanted, she immediately told us she can find them cheaper from a comparable company.  That was wonderful to hear.  In case some of you don't know invitations are expensive!  We got a great deal and love what we ordered!Next, we then met with Jen to go over the details.  She was a lot of fun!  Super high energy and like Emily, she knows her stuff!  Jen pointed things out to us that we would have never thought about.  She was also really honest with us about her ideas.  We loved most of what she suggested.  There was zero weirdness when we didn't take an idea she gave us.  No hard sell!This was an all around great experience!  I would encourage anyone shopping for invitations, of any kind, to visit 'with Grace.' Jen we hope you had a great time with your kids at Pizza Hut!Carly and Joe

27.description: Jen did an amazing job on my Christmas cards. She is very sweet and professional. The store is so beautiful, I found great gifts for some friends. I will be back soon for moving announcements!!

35.description: Got our wedding invitations here.  We were running behind on timeline and she notified us when we picked the invites that they might be running behind.  She then jumped in and said "but I'll push them."  Not only did they take longer than quoted (which happens) I was always the one calling only to find out the timeline had changed.  They were obviously very good at letting her know the timeline had changed because by the time I tracked her down each time she seemed to know right away.  The invitations were gorgeous but that was Spilled Ink (who I would totally recommend) but what we paid her forn was to be the go-between.  I wish we had just gone directly to the artist.  We had 3 couples decline because they RSVPed to another wedding before ours.

8.description: Would not recommend working with this women she obviously has too many customers to give anyone any sort of customer service. Receiving a phone call back takes hours and when you voice a concern about it she is very rude.

0.description: So I am definitely a little, maybe a lot, late with this review. But I had to come back because that's how good the service was at With Grace! I got married in 2010 and was looking at pricing for wedding invites. Any bride planning a wedding knows that it is a big chunk out of your budget and that it is the first thing that will set the tone of your wedding. I came in on a weekend (by appointment only) to discuss my options with Jen, the owner. I will admit, I wanted campaign taste with beer prices. I had to do two sets of wedding invites. One in English and one in Spanish. The total number of invites added up to about 200! She gave us a discount as long as we let her use the Spanish wording for future customers since we were the first customers she would be doing Spanish invites for (works great for both parties) Well, I immediately told Jen what my budget was and what I was envisioning. She put stuff together for me and really helped me out in terms of sticking to my budget. She even offered to let me borrow her tape gun so that I could put the invites together my self and save a couple hundred dollars. It's the personal touches that Jen puts into her work that I absolutely appreciate. Rest assure that I will continue going to With Grace for my invite needs. Her willingness to try to help out her customers in anyway she can and the fact that she is an active owner in her business will keep me coming to her!

38.description: I was thoroughly impressed by this shop the first time I walked in it.  The selection of items that you cannot find in any other store in the Chicagoland area is very impressive!  The customer service is amazing.  They always try to make sure you are completely satisfied with your purchase no matter how small or large the dollar amount.  I recommend this store to anyone who wants unique gifts for just about any occasion.

20.description: Our letterpress save the dates are classic and refined. We are receiving compliments from all the corners of the world on how gorgeous they are! The designer even added a touch of Spanish moss to the live oak trees for our order.

19.description: I adore Jen and her talented staff.  Four years ago, Jen helped us pick out amazing invites that had the perfect amount of "us" in them.  People still use our invites as examples for their events.  The one thing you need with a vendor is someone who will tell it to you straight.  With Grace helps you with timeline development and adds an extra level of service that you cannot get with online vendors or other cookie cutter resources.  I am planning a wedding for two of my favorite people now, and With Grace was hands down my go-to source for their invitations.  Amazing as it is, they got two incredibly picky people to find the perfect invite suite!Always feeling the love, and I would entrust With Grace with any of my wedding invite needs. I am looking forward to receiving the invites!

33.description: Amazing service, great quality and pricing.  Jen the owner went above and beyond for my wedding invitations, programs, favors and rehearsal inviations.  We used a personal image that she was able to scan and print and the turnaround was quick.  Her staff, expertise and personal touch and adorable store will be one I will frequent and praise to everyone!   I couldn't of done it without them~

2.description: These ladies are awesome! My fiance and I couldn't decide on an invite, so... getting closer and closer to our date, we decided to come to "with Grace". I'm not sure if it was Emily or Jen who we saw (I think Jen) but she was kind and didn't rush us, and stayed concious of our budget. We ended up going over budget (our decision-- she didn't push AT ALL) so she helped us figure out other ways to save $. She also knew a lot about rules of the language, pointed out font differences... and made this overwhelming experience very managable.When I went to pick up the invites, they were able to leave them at the wine bar next door so I could go late to avoid traffic (tho note, they thought they closed @ midnight, but it was actually 10pm-- so check). Also, there were ink blotches on some of our invites, and my email was answered kindly and quickly, and the replacements were express shipped to my house! Yay, 1 less headache for a busy bride!

34.description: I recently read a children's book (to a child, thank you!) called Fancy Nancy. Fancy Nancy wants to make everything a little more fancy. Well, I'm on board with Fancy Nancy--having a party? Why not send an invitation? You could even bedazzle it if you want to!I'm pretty sure if I walked into With Grace to find bedazzled invitations, I'd find them. With Grace is a lovely little shop in Roscoe Village specializing in paper needs, but invitations in particular--weddings, bridal showers, bachelorette parties, birthdays, holiday parties, you name it. I even saw some invites in the shape of beer steins! Next time I have an alcohol-fueled fun fest, I'll be sending you an invitation...If I were doing a personalized holiday card, I'd also come here--it seems as though they have a much bigger selection for greeting cards if you order them. I initially came in here to check out the selection of cards I could just sign and send, but they don't have much of a selection. 'Tis early in the season, maybe I'll check back in.Besides invites and holiday cards, they do have a selection of personal planners and thank you cards, little bachelorette-type goodies like keychains, wine plugs, and nail kits, and a selection of Our Name is Mud products (I personally own a handpainted oversized coffee mug that says "Oy Vey!") to make every day a little bit more fancy.

32.description: Been in twice, got my wonderful Mommy a card here and then came back to get the girls piggy thank you cards for their birthday notes. The girl could not find what I saw previously but she did fulfill the need with a pad of paper that had a cute pig on it that I could not pass up. It was like $8 compared to what I would have spent quadruple times 2 on for boxed cards and she gave me like 20 free envelopes for the notes in addition to giving my little dolly, Grace who was home sick with me, a pad of paper to take because they share the same name. Darling, love the roses in the windows.

18.description: Can't say enough about With Grace!  Jen is so knowledgeable about her products and always makes fantastic recommendations for gifts.  I come in the store for everything!  Love all of their stationary and the store is darling!

13.description: My fiance and I worked with Jen at her new office at her home. She is amazing. I was very picky, and she showed me a zillion different invitations and ideas until we found one that me and my fiance loved. She took the time to go through the wording of the invitations and discuss everything possible. We exchanged numerous emails during the process and she always got back to us promptly. She also let us make changes numerous times. I just picked up our invitations today and am so impressed. I also feel that working with Jen was affordable. She offers something for all price ranges, it really depends on what you are looking for. She was the least expensive option I was able to find and could not be happier! I highly recommend using Jen and her company with Grace for all of your wedding needs!

4.description: The last two weeks before my wedding were a bit hectic. The last thing that I wanted to deal with were the seating cards, but I had to get them done. After an exhaustive search and purchases via the web and Joann Fabrics, I realized that what I purchased was not what I wanted at all. Enter with Grace. I called about the place cards and explained that I wanted to printed them myself (the costs were adding up). The owner was super helpful first on the phone and then in the store. When I got to the store, she explained how to print on the cards and then sold me the cards. They ended up being less than what I was going to spend via the web and I was able to shop local. Now I plan on using them if I ever need stationery, invitations, etc.

24.description: I went in wanting unique wedding invitations but not wanting to spend a lot on them.  We worked with Emily.  Let me just say she was fantastic!  She never pressured us to go with more expensive invitations, in fact, she provided many suggestions for how to get the invitation we wanted for less.  We ended up liking a particular invitation but made several changes to suit our style.  Emily took all of our changes, had a proof made, and then made a few suggestions to make them look even better.  Everything came out as expected.  The whole process was easy and we are very pleased with the results.  Quite a feat when dealing with the wedding industry.

6.description: My fiance and I just got our wedding invitation in the mail.  They are breathtaking.  I don't really have the words to explain how creative, fun, available, patient, detail-oriented, passionate, and amazing Jen is.  I would use her again and again for our invitation needs.  Literally, she is the best.

22.description: I was going to try to do invitations on my own through tinyprints or some such website and I am SO GLAD I went with Grace instead!  Jen and Emily were both incredibly patient (I always had my 5 month old baby with me!) and helpful in guiding me quickly through the options to come up with an invitation that I love!  I thought I didn't care that much and just wanted something done nicely, but once we started working, I realized I had a lot of personal preferences.  They helped me create an invitation that reflects our style and is perfect for our beach wedding.  I spent more than I expected, but it was totally worth it.  I never could have gotten such great results if I had tried to do this on my own!  OH - AND THEY ADDRESS YOUR ENVELOPES!  Best money I ever spent.  They look amazing.

15.description: IF YOU ARE A BRIDE AND ARE DEBATING ON WHO TO USE FOR YOUR WEDDING INVITATIONS YOU ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO COME HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Too much enthusiasm?  Sorry.  But as a girl who was clueless when it came to wedding invitations and who was dreading the thought of having to pick them out and design them, With Grace literally turned what could have been an overwhelming, anxiety-ridden, boring experience into an awesome, relaxing, and FUN (yes, it was fun) experience.  Jen is the best.  Maybe it's because she's also normal, hilarious, and has a sarcastic sense of humor much like myself, but she really was phenomenal when it came to guiding me and my fiance through the process.  She listened to what we told her our style was, she made thoughtful suggestions, she was very informative regarding certain etiquette, etc., and she was conscious of our budget.  Planning a wedding is stressful enough on its own, so it's nice to encounter a helpful, friendly face along the way that turns what can be a stressful situation into a fun one.  Do yourself a favor and come here, you will not be disappointed.  Oh, and if you are disappointed (*angry bride who wrote a negative review) then you seriously must be smoking something if you think Jen is unpleasant to work with.  :)

7.description: Great gifts, great cards, great people.I sent my friend here for her wedding invites and all positive reviews from her.I have to buy something every time I come here, I love this store!

36.description: Although everything I have to say has already been written--I thought I'd add my 5 star review.  Jen (the owner) was amazingly helpful during my wedding process--from invitations to thank yous to helping my new husband pick out a very sweet card for me.  Go.  Shop.  Enjoy!

30.description: I would like to give her 5 stars for my wedding invitation experience as the result itself was excellent. HOWEVER..Jen is not the sweet lovely shop owner that you first meet. If you don't agree with what she recommends she gets a bit testy and I could tell she was holding back her annoyance. After the second experience like this I let her know how uncomfortable that made me. I then requested assistance in thank you notes via her e-mail and she would not respond. Obviously she was refusing to work with us which forced us to get non-matching thank you notes. How unprofessional is that? Due to this lack of professionalism I can not recommend this store as she does not always act "with Grace" !

3.description: Jen is absolutely amazing! We couldn't be happier with our wedding invitations. She was very easy to work with, had great ideas and suggestions, and extremely responsive. Her prices are also very reasonable and she has so many options to choose from. I would only consider using Jen in the future for any invitation, announcement, etc.

14.description: This is my first review!  I joined yelp for the purpose of letting everyone know how wonderful my fiancé and I think 'with Grace' is!  We found 'with Grace' through a wedding invitation website.  We first met with Emily (super sweet and really knows her stuff).  When we showed her the invitations that we wanted, she immediately told us she can find them cheaper from a comparable company.  That was wonderful to hear.  In case some of you don't know invitations are expensive!  We got a great deal and love what we ordered!Next, we then met with Jen to go over the details.  She was a lot of fun!  Super high energy and like Emily, she knows her stuff!  Jen pointed things out to us that we would have never thought about.  She was also really honest with us about her ideas.  We loved most of what she suggested.  There was zero weirdness when we didn't take an idea she gave us.  No hard sell!This was an all around great experience!  I would encourage anyone shopping for invitations, of any kind, to visit 'with Grace.' Jen we hope you had a great time with your kids at Pizza Hut!Carly and Joe

58.description: One of my favorite places.  It's fusion, so it's not necessarily "authentic" anything.  It is just fresh and not overly greasy food in a restaurant with a nice ambiance.  All of the servers are really nice.  My b/f and I order take-out and dine in both pretty often.  Our favorite hot dish is the XO Beef Satay special.  It's not on the online order menu, so you have to call in your order if you want it for take out or delivery.  It is not like chicken satay on the app menu, it is instead really tasty fried beef over white rice.  I don't know, we just love it.  Another regular dish that we get is the General Tao Chicken, sweet and spicy and delicious.  The bbq pork fried rice is also very good, it is light and delicious, not disgustingly greasy like Chinese takeout places.  We have also had the beef chow fun, which was also great.  For sushi, I have liked pretty much every roll I have ordered.  I usually stick to the small maki rolls so I can have some of the b/f's hot dish as well.  The gyoza appetizer, which is like a pot sticker, is also good.  I believe it is both steamed and fried.  A perfect mix :) They have a decent wine selection as well.  And I love their after dinner candies, a sort of pear (I can't remember what the name of the actual fruit is) hard candy and then green apple tootsie rolls.  How can I not be happy when I leave?!

56.description: This place has been open down the block from my work for some time now and I just got around to ordering some lunch from here. Since I just started eating Veggie Sushi, I called and ordered 1 asparagus tempura roll and one sweet potato tempura roll. At about $5 per roll it was a good price for lunch. The wasabi was super strong. Over all if I have an Asian lunch craving this place will be a good option. It is by no means gourmet or amazing, but good for quick easy lunch.

29.description: As far as sushi goes, this place is decent.  It's definitely not the worst that I've had but not the best, either.  I love that it's in our hood of Roscoe Village and offers alcohol, as so many sushi joints are BYOB.  They do have a fabulous crab Rangoon and a good selection of signature rolls.  I've been for lunch and dinner and I love that they have lunch specials.  We've ordered delivery from here a few times and the food was just as good delivered as it was in the restaurant...I don't know what exactly happens to sushi on the delivery drive but it's never quite as good as when it's served at a table.  Or is that just me?

42.description: So, my friend and I have consistently loved this place UNTIL today.  We ordered our sushi, which did not look right (the rolls were small and kind of pathetic looking), but based on our past experiences we went ahead and finished our meal.  We got a roll to go for a co-worker, which we immediately took back to the office (less than 1.5 miles away).  Our co-worker went to eat her sushi and found a maggot crawling out of one of the rolls.  She immediately went to Hot Woks (since it's so close) and the same women who is always waitressing blamed us for putting maggots in the sushi before we brought it to our co-worker. Of course this was not true, who would do this and everything was packaged and stapled just like it was before we left.  The woman proceeded to say that it was our fault, but reluctantly and eventually refunded our co-worker. Either way....terrible, terrible customer service and DON'T ever go there, unless you want maggots in your food!

23.description: We have been here many times since we moved to Roscoe Village in the spring. They are always friendly and the food is always good. The crab rangoons are terrific. We usually order the cashew chix and yakisoba, never disappointed. We haven't tried the sushi yet, but friends dining with us have with no complaints. We should step out and experiment with their other dishes...after tonight, I swear!

47.description: My fiancé and I went here on the 3rd of July. The staff was really friendly. The food was delicious, and it came out quickly. We shared the untraditional egg rolls, some sashimi, a couple of rolls and pad thai, which really hit the spot. This is rare for us, but we left without room to try dessert. It's a great Roscoe Village restaurant; we will be back.

8.description: Really cute small place.  Came here for dinner on a weekday.  For appetizers we got the gyoza and untraditional spring rolls.  Both super good with flavorful dipping sauces.  As an entree, we got the chardonnay garlic chicken and the chicken lo mein.  These were good but kind of bland.  I would come back to this place to try their sushi next time.

31.description: Was in from St Louis visiting the grandkids and stopped for carryout.  Rush, the manager(owner?) helped me decide on what to get since they don't have a few favorites that we would normally get in STL.  The order was fast and the staff was really nice while I waited offering me a drink numerous times.  Luckily the hockey game was on the tube and Rush let me sit at a table to watch the game whiole food was prepared.  Took the sushi over to daughter's place  and everyone raved about it.We even came back the next night for a late dinner to eat in the restaurant.  Ordered General Tsao Chicken which was great also. Can't say enough about Rush and the rest of the staff.  Only downside is that he said the Blackhawk players tend to eat here also.  Bummer being a Blues fan.  Hopefully Bicks will bring the Cup by for all on Roscoe Street to see

34.description: I've lived in Roscoe Village for a year and a half and hadn't visited the restaurant due to mediocre reviews.  We decided to give it a shot on a crummy rainy evening in December.  This place was really terrible.  The fish was lukewarm in the sushi and the flavors in the rolls weren't great either.  The rice was undercooked and crunchy.  The edamame was overcooked and over-salted.  All in all, a pretty disgusting meal.  There were a few tables of really shouty drunk people which didn't help the atmosphere (which is sort of lame to begin with).  It also didn't help that I was sick to my stomach about 45 minutes after leaving the place.  Maybe this is the sort of place that caters to people who don't actually like sushi, but since there are many, many superior sushi restaurants to this one in the area, so I won't be going back.

16.description: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago.  I have never had a bad sushi roll from this restaurant.  I have eaten there and ordered take-out and delivery.  The sushi is always fresh and very flavorful.  I used to live close enough that I could walk here when I ordered take-out and the people that work there were always extremely friendly and got to know me by name (maybe I went in too much, lol).  Whenever I order delivery I usually get my meal before the estimated 1 hour and 15 min delivery time.  This restaurant is not BYOB which is the only thing I think that could make it even better.  Some of my favorite rolls include the Alaskan, Rainbow, Spicy Salmon, Salmon Avocado, and the Akira.  Akira is really where it's at if you want an amazing sushi roll!  Every time I order I also get the cucumber salad which has an amazingly sweet dressing on it.  The crab rangoon appetizer is also amazing!  I ordered Pad Thai once while I was here and it was just OK.  I would definitely recommend getting the sushi when you go here.Hot Woks has a great variety of sushi rolls and it isn't insanely overpriced.  The service is good and the food is always fresh!

13.description: We love the food here and the folks that work there are amond the nicest people around.  Great atmosphere only topped by the tasty food.  Well worth the stop for eating in or delivery!

11.description: I love this place. My husband and I go at least once a month. Great prices, fresh sushi and service with a smile. The owner (manager?) often stops at each customers' table to see how the food is and I've seen him sweeping and taking out the trash. I appreciate a restaurant run by someone who isn't afraid to get his hands dirty who treats his employees well and genuinely cares about the whole customer experience.We're moving out of the area soon but will be hard pressed to find a similarly priced and impressively run sushi chain that feels like a family restaurant.

39.description: I adore this place and the staff. I live a block away which is pretty dangerous. At this point the staff knows my name and order when I call in for pickup which is embarrassing for me but also sweet.The food is very good quality and it's consistent.

37.description: Hot Woks Cool Sushi is my go to sushi place when I can't be bothered to travel too far. Sometimes even when I'm motivated to venture more than a mile outside of my immediate area, I still chose Hot Woks Cool Sushi. I like Hot Woks Cool Sushi for many reasons. I like that the sushi is fresh, fast, and not absurdly expensive. I also enjoy many of their hot menu items and appetizers . I'm a fan of the Bento Boxes and I love their seaweed salad. If in Roscoe Village and craving sushi, I would recommend Hot Woks Cool Sushi. The service is friendly and prompt, they serve alcohol, and the food is good. You can't go wrong!

0.description: I just moved to the neighborhood, and let me just say I love this place.  Really, what's not to love!?!!The only bad thing was my chicken could have used just a little more flavor.  However, with a little salt and soy sauce, all was fixed and good once again.  The chow mein was good, with a good amount of vegetables and fresh noodles.  Good flavor as I said, just needed a little extra to send it over the edge.  The chop stick spring rolls were great too.  Smaller than normal but just as flavorful and good, with a nice sweet and sour dipping sauce.  Prices are good and worth what you get for the price.  Also the owner is super friendly.  She was chatty and kind and cared about the diners.  As I was new and she didn't recognize me, she took time to get to know me and was great.

38.description: I order from here regularly. The food is consistently top notch. I love the mega vega! The employees are friendly and don't seem to judge the frequency by which we order from there. The only reason I gave it 4/5 is because while it's great, it's just missing a little something to make it stand out from the other sushi places

51.description: The decor is nice, the sushi is good, the service is acceptable, and the prices are reasonable.

27.description: This will be quick, but just wanted to say their specialty drinks were not very good.  Ordered their version of an old fashion and it was basically a Manhattan.  My friend ordered a drink that was missing amaretto, can't remember the name.  Plus she was waiting 15 mins for me to arrive and when I get there no one had even asked if she wanted a drink.  The servers were walking over each other once they started serving us.Well the warm saki was very good, and the Mt Fiji roll was awesome.  Great looking place.  Pork Fried Rice was very good as well.So the food gets the 4 stars, but the service and drinks, that are advertised on their menu could use some help.Go for the food and order a bottle of wine, you will be good to go.

32.description: Had a 7:15 reservation on Valentines Day. Seated promptly, waited 15 minutes before we were greeted. Another 10 before we got our cocktails, which arrived separately.  Everything took way too long and our entrees were delivered 10+ minutes apart. No explanation, no apology.  Food quality was pretty decent, but not enough to make up for the inexcusable service.  Lots of employees running about, the place was chaotic and uncoordinated all around. There are so many other Asian-fusion style restaurants within a 10 minute drive, there's no reason to go back.

54.description: My girlfriend and I love this place. Have tried the Irving Park, Roscoe Village and Millennium Park locations, and this Roscoe one's probably the best. Their Panang Curry is some of the best I've had in Chicago -- a nice blend of peanut flavor and spiciness and thickness, the three individual factors that are hard to mix properly. Other places have spicier panang, or more peanuty, or thicker, but I think Hot Woks has the most balanced. Also, get an order of the Mega Vega roll, you won't regret it -- best vegetarian roll I've ever had.

48.description: HORRENDOUS service and mediocre sushi!  My friend and I were one of 4 tables the entire night and I still cannot get over how horrible the service was.  We both  worked in the service industry for 5+ years,  so we both are very understanding when it comes to slow service when a restaurant is packed. However, even if the place had a line around the block, it would not have been an excuse for these servers.  There were more servers on the floor than tables, and we still had to wait a ridiculous amount of time for each course...as well as our wine and water.  We weren't even offered dessert, and when we asked for it, our server checked her watch -- right in front of us, despite the fact that it was still 30 minutes before closing time.  Even if the sushi was perfect, I would not go back to this place...and perfect, it is not...it's not bad, it's just not great. I have definitely had fresher sashimi at other restaurants.   At least they didn't screw up the edamame.

44.description: I'm a big fan of hot woks cool sushi. In fact, I love their Michigan ave. location and Pulaski location too, but roscoe village is my favorite location. I love the atmosphere, service and the food. Can't wait to eat here again soon.

24.description: Based on reviews of the food among the four locations, this seemed like the perfect place for a birthday dinner. From the get-go, making the reservations and getting questions answered by the manager, everything was perfect. We had a party of six and chose this place because some love sushi, some dont, and their menu was great for us. To start, we ordered the untraditional egg rolls, crab rangoon, and edamame. My husband, who was anti-sushi, got some helpful tips and advice from the manager. He went with the fukudome which was terrific! Their shrimp pad thai was excellent. The noodles tasted so right - not crazy weird sweet and not blah; just perfect. The shrimp were so good - not rubbery feeling like some places. The roast pork fried rice was definitely a favorite among us. The roast pork was bbq pork ("moo-dang" in Thai) and the plate was super tastey! We also ordered the pad kee mao (drunken noodles) and the sauce and noodles were prepared and cooked soooo deliciously. We are excited about going back to try other things.

7.description: I love going here for lunch with coworkers! We get the three maki special all the time. My fave is the Alaskan roll and the unagi roll. Comes with yummy miso too! The crab Rangoon is a great appetizer, tempura could use some seasoning.

49.description: Favorite sushi in the area. Quick delivery, always fresh!

40.description: Since i wrote this review and sent it to management, they promptly responded and rectified the problem. I can appreciate a business that takes customer issues seriously! Hot Woks is A-OK with me. Hi Donisha,By now you should have received an apologetic call from our Manager Rush at the Hot Woks Cool Sushi location, but I also want to follow up with you to apologize once again for such an incident.  This definitely is not something you should expect from Hot Woks Cool Sushi and I am incredibly thankful that you brought it to our attention.  We have actually used your note to identify what not to do in similar situations at all our locations.  Rush is following up with Seamless Web to reverse your charge with Seamless Web.  Please let us know if there is any other issues.  I realize this may not totally rectify your evening.  Granted, we are not always 100% correct but we definitely try our best to improve the quality and service you expect.  I just want you to know though that we appreciate your patronage and support.  We built this business a little over five years ago and we're pushing hard to make sure we can make it through another five years at least.  Thanks in advance for your understanding.  Regards,Lois

53.description: Excellent! This place is great! Really nice decor/ atmosphere. The waitstaff is always very friendly and the food is great. Best sushi I've ever had!

30.description: I would give this place 1 star, but I don't think it was the delivery person's fault. Therefore, 2 stars for a quick delivery. I had crab Rangoon and shrimp pad Thai delivered. The crab Rangoon was soggy. The noodles were warm, almost cold.I had to microwave my entire meal, which didn't help the taste much. Everything tasted as if it was sitting out all day and they simply warmed it up and stuck it in a to go container. Needless to say, I will not be ordering take out from here again.

46.description: Good, reliable sushi. Never had the "hot woks" menu items but the decor is clean and bright, they have a nice patio, though it's not BYOB, which might be good or bad depending on your POV.

1.description: My friend and I came here on a Saturday night. It was mostly full but there wasn't a wait. Also there's a ton of free street parking so that's always great. The meals, prices and service were all great. I got the chow fun noodles and sweet potato maki. My friend got the miso soup, caterpillar rolls and some type of cherry lychee drink. Everything was delicious. Our waitress was great and made sure we were taken care of with our water and meals. The prices were also very affordable. Definitely will recommend this place to anyone! Give it a try! Lots of selection for anyone!

55.description: Good neighborhood sushi and kids love eating here.

9.description: This will be quick, but just wanted to say their specialty drinks were not very good.  Ordered their version of an old fashion and it was basically a Manhattan.  My friend ordered a drink that was missing amaretto, can't remember the name.  Plus she was waiting 15 mins for me to arrive and when I get there no one had even asked if she wanted a drink.  The servers were walking over each other once they started serving us.Well the warm saki was very good, and the Mt Fiji roll was awesome.  Great looking place.  Pork Fried Rice was very good as well.So the food gets the 4 stars, but the service and drinks, that are advertised on their menu could use some help.Go for the food and order a bottle of wine, you will be good to go.

26.description: We order delivery from this place once a week and it's always consistently good, on time, and fresh. Their sweet potato roll and specialty rolls are fabulous- and their crab rangoon is some of the best I've ever had!

25.description: I have been to this location and two other Chicago locations - and their food is always consistent. This review is specifically about the horrible service we received on a not-very-busy Friday evening. We were seated promptly, the server came over to take our drink order - my boyfriend ordered a beer and I just wanted a glass of water. The beer came right away, but I didn't get any water. 10 minutes later, the server came to take our food order, and when I placed my food order, I again asked for a glass of water. When 10 more minutes went by and I still hadn't received the water, my boyfriend went inside to find her and again asked her for it. She finally came out with the water said that they were out of clean glasses, that's why it took so long. Our food came out about 30 minutes after we ordered - way longer than it normally takes. We had ordered some appetizers - but everything came out at once - except for one item we ordered that never came. There was no soy sauce on the table - I waited a few minutes but the server was not to be found. So I went over to an empty table that had not been cleaned up and got their soy sauce. When we were done eating, our server was still MIA so we asked another server for our check. The check came - and the appetizer we never received was on the bill. We asked her to take it off, which she did. Then our regular server took 15 minutes to run our credit card. I walked by her when I was coming back from the rest room, and she was standing at the CC machine with my card in her hand. I asked if everything was OK and she said yes, and handed me the card and receipt to sign. She seemed very nervous and confused, and every part of her job seemed to be a challenge for her. The group sitting right by us was also receiving horrible service - as we all commented to each other how slow/bad it was. As we left, we stopped by and told the host/manager about our experience. His response "I am sorry but are very busy tonight." First of all, the restaurant was half full, second of all, what kind of apology is that?"

12.description: I wish they were more consistent with the cooking of their food. I've ordered about 4 times now from them and sometimes it can be delicious and other times just not that good. Their general chicken usually when it's good is crispy and crunchy. Sometimes it can be soggy and flavorless. I would love to know anytime I wanted Chinese I could order here but I think next time I will look elsewhere first.

59.description: So my girlfriend and I found ourselves in Roscoe Village for dinner. It was a last minute thing and we were starving. We originally stopped by the Kitschn and I had no idea that they closed at 3. Next stop, Costello's, Nah didn't feel like a cold sandwhich. We then spotted Hot woks Cool Sushi. Looked at the menu and felt that would be a good decision. Boy were we right. I got a huge chicken teriyaki bento box that was filled with everything I could ever want! An awesome peanuty coleslaw, tempura, rice, miso soup, california rolls, and my chicken teriyaki? Geez. When I was done (and I finished mostly everything) I stated that I ate a whole family's worth of food. And all for $11.95?!?!?! This is where it gets better! My girlfriend is vegan. She's been vegan for a year so she's pretty much switched over to the dark side. She orders the tempura Udon soup. Asks if it's vegetarian and was told it was. When we get her soup, it's beef based (very delicious btw). We ask our waitress and she appologizes. She comes back and offers to have the chef make veggie based broth from scratch!!!!! It's not something they normally do, but they made a wrong totally right! A manager even came by and apologized. I am ever so thankful that they made our night a happy and comforting one. It was dreary and rainy outside, but the decor (candles and low light) made everything feel so relaxed. We will definitely be back. They certainly take care of their clientel. Everything tastes so good too!

21.description: I am a frequent diner at the Hot Woks on Adams St. I have always been impressed with that location as a lunch spot and therefore didn't hesitate to bring my husband for dinner at the one near our home. We shared a sushi roll to start which was fairly basic but relatively fresh. We each had Panang Curry for our main course. While not bad, it was not the best or most authentic curry either of us have had. One big plus was that we came on half price wine night. For the amount of food and drink, it was quite the bargain! Overall, I would recommend this spot for a good, basic dinner but not much more.

17.description: Not only is their bento box excellent (as is the panang curry and everything else on the menu!), their customer service is absolutely superb. I inadvertently placed an order twice -- once thru a third party app, which I thought I cancelled because it didn't confirm the order -- and once by calling the restaurant directly after the cancellation. Upon learning my initial order hadn't actually cancelled, I basically received the same order twice. Not only did HWCS literally take the second order back, but they refunded me the cost. They didn't have to do that. HWCS has great food and absolutely fantastic customer service.

10.description: Love this place. We order take out all the time and it's always delicious and fresh! The tuna avocado salad is my favorite!

5.description: Had the worst experience here, to the point where I didn't leave a tip for the waitress GASP. That is something that I never do! First time for everything I guess.My aunt, friend and I walked in at 1130 am (when they open). Sat down and looked over the menus. Our waitress came by and put out waters. Two of the glasses were dirty. I asked for a Thai Iced Tea, she brings me a Thai Iced Coffee. Off to a rocky start but whatever.So were ready to order from the lunch menu (1130-3 menu) and were told that no sushi from the menu was available. O.K. My aunt comes specifically for the sushi... major let down, but fine. My friend orders her food, asks if she can have beef with pea pods and not broccoli. The waitress claims they don't have that (which is interesting because she's had it there several times). Fine, she ordered her beef and broccoli.My aunt orders the beef teriyaki bento box. We then ask what they are planning to substitute the california rolls since there is no sushi. She says you can order a vegetable one instead, so we ask for the sweet potato. She says any substation costs $2. So we ask how can you charge us extra for something when the original item isn't available? She said yes I told you you can have vegetable. OK. So we want sweet potato. OK but I have to charge you extra. I draw a blank. She claims that this is the rule and that she cannot substitute it. Fine. I then order my pad thai and we sit kind of confused as to what is up with this woman.Our appetizers come out, my aunt (bento box) doesn't get her miso soup. We figure the lady must have forgot. Then the entrees are brought out, guess what? No bento box for my aunt. Waitress claims we cancelled that. Not once did we say that we didn't want the bento box. My aunt then says please just bring me beef and broccoli, it comes with an appetizer right? Waitress says no (mind you ordering from the lunch menu), so my aunt just says beef and broccoli is fine. She brings out a supposed "dinner portion" of the beef and broccoli which is the same size as the one served for lunch, no one asked for the entree portion, we noticed it on the bill. When she brought the bill we asked and she claimed thats what we wanted. My aunt told her that she didn't understand us from the beginning. This experience is absolutely ridiculous and although their food is great, I cannot get past the horrible service. I will not return. I will go back to the Irving Location and pray that all goes well there.I have visited this location many times and usually have an ok experience, but this was just ridiculous. The three of us were so irritated we hardly touched our lunch and of course didn't leave her a cent of a tip. Feel we wasted $30 on a terrible lunch experience! The receipt says "YUWA" on it, so maybe that the servers name. Management, PLEASE, train your staff in customer service and to LISTEN to their guests. This place I really like became so sour to me!

3.description: Service at this location is just fine. Servers are nice. Food is mediocre. Sushi is average, bento boxes are pretty below overage. Salad is wilted. Personell practices at this chain of restaurants is terrible. Avoid this location and this chain. They hire and will "train" servers to fill schedule gaps, and suddenly day there is no space available for them. Ridiculous and stupid.

35.description: Great place. Sushi and maki are very fresh and served in large portions. Bentox boxes are a nice combination of different small specialties if you want to go for variety at affordable price. The staff is adorable. They love their customers and you can feel it an every moment. Highly recommended!

19.description: Just moved to Roscoe Village and was stoked to have a sushi place just a short walk from my house. My husband and I tried it on a Saturday night, we were seated right away. We started with the Chopstick Rolls which were piping hot and crispy. I ordered the Spicy Tuna and Ebi Maki, my husband ordered pad Thai. The maki was super fresh and delicious. My husband loved the pad Thai. Prices are reasonable and the crowd is anything from couples to families. All around a great place with a variety of Asian cuisine, we will definitely be coming back!

28.description: One of my favorite places for solid sushi, gyoza, crab rangoon, etc. I go here pretty often and I almost always like everything I order. Nice outdoor space, but nothing terribly special about it. Great that they have beer/wine options, unlike their sister Hot Woks on Pulaski. But if you prefer BYOB, that's the place to go.

45.description: Solid Thai place, but we didn't try the sushi.  We started with the dumplings and crab rangoon, which were both very good.  The crab rangoon had lots of filling and were wrapped up like cute little purses instead of the normal triangular shape.  For dinner I had the beef chow fun, which was served with wide noodles (the Chinese version I've had is usually a thinner noodle), but it was still very good.  I think we all pretty much cleared our plates!  One of my friends had the chardonnay chicken, which was really nice and lite, other friends had something with chicken, shrimp, noodles and veggies, which was also very tasty.  Service was good and they have a good sized outdoor patio.  Prices were also very reasonable.

33.description: My friend lives a block away...we almost have food delivered on a nice night. God I feel so lazy sometimes. We bucked up and opted for pickup instead. Untratitional Egg Rolls: (Asian spices, peanut sauce, Italian sausage, cabbage, carrots and caramelized onions.) They tasted like normal egg rolls to my friend and I. I do like egg rolls though so I wasn't dissapointed. I was hoping for something a bit more though. Pepper Steak: (A hearty dish made with flank steak sauteed with bell peppers, baby corn and onions in a rich black bean garlic sauce.) This was really good and a dish I have not had in a while. Panang Curry: (Tender chicken breast stewed in a rich Panang curry and coconut gravy with carrots, bell peppers, basil leaves, and peanuts). Normally a go to of mine. I like it...my only problem was that it was VERY soupy. They waver between 3.5 and 4 stars in my book...

43.description: This is probably my favorite go-to/kinda inexpensive/holy crap I'ma eat all that myself sushi spot. I get carry out and delivery pretty often, and haven't been disappointed. Not a very colorful review and I can't drop the names of everything I've ever had, but I definitely keep returning and I feel like that's a pretty good endorsement. Crunchy spicy tuna is a must-try though, as is the Akira and Harajuku rolls. Always friendly counter staff.

2.description: A neighborhood place that never let's me down. The food is always consistent and the prices are right inline with places which charge much more! Sushi Gold is a favorite along with the Spicy Tuna and Spicy Salmon Maki. Great Miso and any number of any other options from the Curry dishes to many, many Maki rolls!

18.description: My friend lives a block away...we almost have food delivered on a nice night. God I feel so lazy sometimes. We bucked up and opted for pickup instead. Untratitional Egg Rolls: (Asian spices, peanut sauce, Italian sausage, cabbage, carrots and caramelized onions.) They tasted like normal egg rolls to my friend and I. I do like egg rolls though so I wasn't dissapointed. I was hoping for something a bit more though. Pepper Steak: (A hearty dish made with flank steak sauteed with bell peppers, baby corn and onions in a rich black bean garlic sauce.) This was really good and a dish I have not had in a while. Panang Curry: (Tender chicken breast stewed in a rich Panang curry and coconut gravy with carrots, bell peppers, basil leaves, and peanuts). Normally a go to of mine. I like it...my only problem was that it was VERY soupy. They waver between 3.5 and 4 stars in my book...

41.description: As an FYI, I am just rating this on their sushi as that is all we had. We had three rolls, and I can honestly say I did not enjoy one.  We had 3 signature rolls, which I would hope would reprint them well. For the dragon, The shrimp tempura in one of our rolls was so soggy and had no crunch. I had never experienced a shrimp tempura like this before.  The rainbow was ok but very bland and Akira, which was marked spicy, had no spice and was not good.  Also, each roll was poorly rolled and they all were falling apart on the plate.  We went on a Friday night and there were 5 chefs working, so maybe we just had a bad chef.  Overall, this was some of the worst sushi I have had in chicago, as we did not even finish half of each roll. This is the first time I have gone to sushi and not finished the rolls.  On a brighter note, they have a great patio area where you can sit outside.  It is also byob. We also had the crab ran goons for an app, which although we're heavy celery flavor, are always good. I was surprised with all the good ratings, and while I hope we just had a bad sushi chef that night, I will never return here as there are too many sushi options in the city to eat bad sushi that falls apart and has no crunch to the tempura.

52.description: Let's put it this way... I could have lost my paycheck here.  I had crab rangoons and edamame - very good, but not to die for good.  The sashimi platter made me wanna just camp out and empty out all the oceans.  It hit a certain spot in my brain that will make everything else in my life just a series of diminishing returns.Now I'm sad...

50.description: I have a few favorite sushi spots and I am somewhat picky about my sushi (shouldn't everyone be?)...  However, hungry and not wanting bar food one night, I went here.  I thought that the lights didn't need to be quite so bright...but the food was pretty good.  I'm not sure if I'm totally sold on this spot for sushi, but in the area, it's a decent option.  However, while the sushi was ok, I didn't think it was stellar.  Service was also pretty slow.So, I might be back, but I wouldn't seek this spot out purposely for sushi - but in the area, it's a good option for a quick meal.

4.description: They have really good Thai iced tea but the sushi was ok . By ok , I mean that it was pleasant enough but not anything amazing that left my taste buds dancing . the service was really amazing , very fast and friendly .

6.description: I am not a fan. Neither my husband nor I enjoyed our dishes. We did not like the chicken and that is a pretty basic item. Some odd thing was in my husband's dish; it tasted bad.  Service was also lacking. For example, we ate less than 1/5 of our food and abruptly asked for our bill simply to get out of there, yet staff said nothing and did not ask us if the food was ok. We will never return. We only live a few blocks away so it's a big bummer that we did not enjoy it.

22.description: Hot Woks best foods:  Crab Rangoon - amazing, Pannung Curray - amazing, very flavorful but not too heavy, Sushi - the sushi is fresh and flavorful.  HWCS has fast pick up service, friendly on the phone, and a discount program if you are a repeat customer.  I am a huge fan!

15.description: Great drinks, sushi, crab rangoon, service  and more! This has easily become one of my favorite places to order from in Chicago.

57.description: Slow service and the food is good - but nothing to sing Hallelujah too. not a bad choice if you want asian and don't have time to look for something better.

20.description: Nice girlie dinner Saturday night. Split the Gyoza and Crab Rangoon. Both were yummy.  Gyoza was steamy and fried, with a nice amount of pork filling.  The Rangoon had just the right amount of crab and cream cheese. We also split the beef chow fun. The noodles and sauce were really good, but a couple of pieces of beef were a little chewy. Mai tais were great - just the right amount of alcohol.  Raspberry cheesecake was meh - wouldn't get it again.  Cute atmosphere, friendly service, and reasonable prices.  Will definitely go back and order take out.

36.description: Maybe it was the Purple Haze I ordered (hot sake + Chambord)... but this sushi was excellent!  It wasn't just the Purple Haze.  The food was just really fresh and delicious tasting. We split three rolls to start: spicy tuna, the confusion (really light and different with an orange glaze on top), and the akira.  I would order all of those again, and I might be able to eat them all myself. We also split an order of general tao chicken that we both didn't really need at that point, but we devoured nonetheless.  This sauce was a tad too sweet for my liking, but the chicken was crisp and good, and there were no "bad pieces" (the mystery / chewy pieces that are always a bad surprise).  The staff here was so friendly too - it was a bustling place the night we dined, and we got smiles and thank yous from everyone we encountered.

14.description: In the times I've been here, I've never had a single problem. The food was delicious, my girlfriend's plate was decorated beautifully, and for being a sushi place, they have a lot of other options than just sushi to try. The general tao's chicken is amazing, crispy/crunchy with a good flavor. Staff has always been super friendly. Food has never come out wrong, Overall just a wonderful place. And their mochi dessert is always tasty and beautifully done. Just a great place! And it's always been clean.

28.description: There simply is no better place. I have been going to Vera for more years than I want to admit---she is the best. And I agree with all the nice things people say about Tip.It doesn't get any better than this place.

1.description: I just had Vera cut my hair this past Saturday. I had a wonderful experience at the salon. Vera had me fill out a short survey to learn more about how I currently handle my hair and what I was looking for to make sure she took care of all my needs. She used the best products and made my hair look gorgeous! I highly recommend you see Vera for any of your hair styling needs!

9.description: Friendly neighborhood feel, great haircut at a really cheap price. I only get my haircut every couple months but I would definitely go back here

29.description: I used to frequent the cheap chains, but those days are now over.I found a REAL salon with an incredible staff , and you better believe I will be going back!Southport Hair Studio is as good as it gets. Everyone is incredibly friendly and helpful as can be. I was able to be seen the day I called, and received the best treatment from everyone there. I suggest making an appointment with Tip. He is a magician!  I cannot believe how wonderful he made my hair look. Not only did he seem to read my mind, but he did this all so efficiently . I thought SURELY with my massive head of long, curly, coarse, downright impossible hair that I'd be there forever. Nope! He's a master. He had it washed, cut, and blown-out in 30 min, and it looked like a completely different head of hair when he was through. I was pretty floored, and very, very pleased! He's amazing, and I am stayin' put with this salon!

23.description: Tip is incredible. He works with your hair type and will tell you if something won't work with your hair type...he'll also give you suggestions on things that would work without making you feel like you're being pressured to do anything. You make the decision; Tip just helps to make you look your best. He's personable, very funny and quite talented. I went to him with hair to the middle of my back and gave him free reign to chop it off...this was about a year ago. And I have loved each and every haircut that he has given me. He even saves pictures of haircuts that he thinks I might like. The prices are great here too. What I haven't tried is color...I have seen the good work that Tip does with color on a couple of my friends; however, I refuse to color my hair until I start to get gray hair. That will happen one of these days, I'm sure. I'm surprised I don't have gray already.

5.description: I switched from stylist I had been going to for 5+ years to Vera at Southport Hair Studio more than a year and a half ago and I am always exceptionally pleased.  I have curly/wavy/unruly hair and Vera cuts it in a way that it always looks great (curly hair is hard to cut).  I also love the color that she does--it looks natural and doesn't fade.  I have a difficult schedule and Regan is always so helpful to accommodate me, often at the last minute.  I've referred several friends/clients to Vera and they are always pleased.  Friendly, professional, terrific service, and reasonable prices.   Thanks Vera and Regan!

31.description: Southport Hair Studio is a great salon, offering everything from cut and color [including color correction] to waxing and nail services. Friendly, knowledgeable staff.

25.description: If you truly love your hair.Do not have it cut here.These are nice folks but they'd better serve the world as DMV employees--think how enjoyable it would be to be waited on by a kind, competent person who wants to do well. But as stylists, this team lacks the talent to give a man a great hair cut.  I reckon they do better at coloring, and other women stuff, which is why they've garnered 5 star reviews. Maybe I just got the worst of the lot. Still, I firmly believe in consistency of quality, among all that a business does and by all measures, such as cleanliness and order of the establishment. Peek into this salon and you'll see drab, unkempt furnishing / counter with random boxes / objects laying around. Since the store collects and stores basic personal data of its patrons, I imagine management could cross-reference this review with my 'file.' So be it. I don't mean them any harm. I just wish my hair hadn't been harmed. The prices are good, but hec, if you want to look great, you have to spend some bucks. Next time, I won't fall for a low-priced option. Next time can't come soon enough!

12.description: I've been going to Vera for several months now. She does a great job and the price is right. I currently have bangs and she taught me how to do maintenance trims so I don't have to run back to her every week, although she would be happy to do them for me in between cuts if I was so inclined. I don't drive and the location is an easy walk from the Paulina Brown Line or the Belmont bus will get you to her front door.

21.description: Love, love, love Vera and her staff. I get my hair colored and cut, some counseling, quite a few laughs and I look and feel a 100% better when I leave. Vera stocks the best hair care products and Listens to your needs and wants.

16.description: I've been going to Vera for almost two years now and she really does a fantastic job. I live in the West Loop and have tried places that are closer to my house but they just don't compare. It is worth the drive and I get a great haircut every time!

17.description: Tip is incredible. He works with your hair type and will tell you if something won't work with your hair type...he'll also give you suggestions on things that would work without making you feel like you're being pressured to do anything. You make the decision; Tip just helps to make you look your best. He's personable, very funny and quite talented. I went to him with hair to the middle of my back and gave him free reign to chop it off...this was about a year ago. And I have loved each and every haircut that he has given me. He even saves pictures of haircuts that he thinks I might like. The prices are great here too. What I haven't tried is color...I have seen the good work that Tip does with color on a couple of my friends; however, I refuse to color my hair until I start to get gray hair. That will happen one of these days, I'm sure. I'm surprised I don't have gray already.

10.description: I walked in here today after calling another hair salon very close by who said my men's cut, nothing added, would begin at $68 without tip.  I called Southport and spoke with the super friendly receptionist (Reagan?) who not only said they would get me in, but that I could come in 15 minutes before they opened to begin my cut.  I was done in about 25 minutes thanks to Jimmy and his craftiness.  I got a great wash, cut and style before a work interview around the block and would recommend Jimmy's services to anyone.  Southport was clean, friendly, and above all, affordable.  I highly recommend based on my one experience here.

11.description: I just started going here late last winter, but have so far had wonderful experiences with hair color, cut and a keratin treatment. Tip is now my "go-to" guy when it comes to hair services. I have been on a long journey to find someone who understands how to work with my hair and yay, I found him! I have tough hair (curly, thick, kind of kinky ethnic hair) to work with but Tip seemingly has magic fingers in managing to make it look good. :) Bonus is that the salon is within walking distance from my apartment.

26.description: I went to this salon because they are super close to me and don't charge a ridiculous amount for waxing.  I now refuse to go any where else.  It may not look like the poshest place in and their little side room could do with a revamp but at the end of the day quality and service is what is important and this place fits the bill.

27.description: Vera is the best! I have curly/wavy hair that never does what I want it to. Vera gave me a great cut that gave my crazy mane a nice shape and helped the curl to lay much better than other cuts I've had from the cheaper chain salons. Nice atmosphere as well - clean design (if you're sort of sensitive to that kind of thing) and great people. I usually hate talking to the hair stylists at chain places like Supercuts or something...those people all seem to hate their jobs), but Vera was great to chat with while she beautified my crazy head of hair. She also taught me how to use specific products to help keep my hair looking good. It's hard to find a stylist that "gets" curly hair, but Vera knows what's up. She also specializes in color...I didn't have mine done the last time I went, but I wouldn't think twice about it if I needed it done. I'm sure it's great...everything else was.Love this place! I live outside of IL now, but would definitely go back if I'm ever in Chicago and need a haircut.

0.description: No idea why I waited so long to write this review. I've been going to Tip for 7-8 years, originally referred by a male friend.Here's the deal. I have a dense, thick, unruly, long mess of curly/wavy hair. When handled with care and wooed into submission it can be envy-inspring. When mistreated, it can send young children screaming (no, seriously, this has happened). Additionally, most hair stylists run screming when I walk in the door. But not Tip.I still remember my very first visit. I walked in sheepishly, assuming I'd be faced yet again with the "what did I do to deserve this?" look from the stylist. Tip greeted me with a smile, sat me right down and explained to me that he grew up fixing his sister's hair, whose is just like mine. He too has curly locks and he GETS IT.Since then, he's trimmed, thinned, colored and chopped off almost all my hair (Locks of Love), always with a great result. Friends and strangers alike often ask me what products I use, who cuts my hair, etc... And I attribute this to Tip's handiwork. Without the right cut, all the product in the world would do nothing for my 'fro.Beyond his supernatural ability to deal with my mane, he's honest. When I've come to him with an idea based on something I saw on some girl on the street, he hasn't just said ok and started chopping... He's consulted me on what he thinks *my* hair will do with that cut and been honest when he didn't think it would work for me.If you have hair that doesn't require any special skill to keep looking good, maybe it isn't worth the dinero to come to a salon like this. If, like me, you have hair that requires a special understanding and some TLC, do yourself a favor and see Tip. He is the thick curly hair whisperer.

20.description: Vera gives a darling cut.I was not thrilled at first. I didn't like her styling but when I got home and moved the cut around a little, I just fell in love. I'll forgive her for the styling. I can work with her on that. I have curly hair that falls flat when I'm running around and working like crazy. With Vera's cut my curls are still bouncy. She's talented and the prices are right.

19.description: I used to frequent the cheap chains, but those days are now over.I found a REAL salon with an incredible staff , and you better believe I will be going back!Southport Hair Studio is as good as it gets. Everyone is incredibly friendly and helpful as can be. I was able to be seen the day I called, and received the best treatment from everyone there. I suggest making an appointment with Tip. He is a magician!  I cannot believe how wonderful he made my hair look. Not only did he seem to read my mind, but he did this all so efficiently . I thought SURELY with my massive head of long, curly, coarse, downright impossible hair that I'd be there forever. Nope! He's a master. He had it washed, cut, and blown-out in 30 min, and it looked like a completely different head of hair when he was through. I was pretty floored, and very, very pleased! He's amazing, and I am stayin' put with this salon!

2.description: Nice neighborhood salon!

32.description: I enjoyed my first visit with Tip very much; after my dire need for a haircut was taken to heart by a sympathetic friend.  On a Saturday afternoon, she said, let me call and see if they can fit you in today.  On a Saturday afternoon!  I thought no way.  Not only did I get an appointment, but I wasn't treated as a last minute appointment; I felt like I'd been getting my hair cut there for a long time.  Tip listened to what I wanted and I got a great haircut.  Since my hair is curly, it can make getting a good haircut difficult, but I left happy with my hair and without a significant dent in my wallet.

18.description: Vera is the best! I have curly/wavy hair that never does what I want it to. Vera gave me a great cut that gave my crazy mane a nice shape and helped the curl to lay much better than other cuts I've had from the cheaper chain salons. Nice atmosphere as well - clean design (if you're sort of sensitive to that kind of thing) and great people. I usually hate talking to the hair stylists at chain places like Supercuts or something...those people all seem to hate their jobs), but Vera was great to chat with while she beautified my crazy head of hair. She also taught me how to use specific products to help keep my hair looking good. It's hard to find a stylist that "gets" curly hair, but Vera knows what's up. She also specializes in color...I didn't have mine done the last time I went, but I wouldn't think twice about it if I needed it done. I'm sure it's great...everything else was.Love this place! I live outside of IL now, but would definitely go back if I'm ever in Chicago and need a haircut.

13.description: I was in Chicago Saturday, January 25th, for my daughter's Wedding Reception and desperately needed my hair cut for the event.  My other daughter recommended I try her Hairdresser, Tip.  He had a cancellation and was able to get me in.  He was fantastic!  Tip listened to me about the challenges I experience with my hair, and provided an excellent cut for a reasonable price.  He was personable, and talented.  The shop was clean, and the staff was very courteous.  I would definitely recommend Tip and this facility!  Thank-you Tip!  Judy Sievert

4.description: My hair had hit the point of no return, after my previous stylist retired, I bounced around and my poor hair had fallen into the wrong hands. After some ill advised "ombre" ends, and an awful scraggly cut, I turned to Yelp...and found Vera!! (Cue angels singing)She was so kind, and complimentary (I know,  it was BAD) and whipped me into shape in no time. I left with bouncy, shiny, healthy or healthier hair.The whole staff was so friendly,  and kind, I immediately felt like a regular!Do yourself a favor,  and try them out!!

24.description: Unfortunately I didn't have the same experience as the other reviewers.  I went to Vera because someone called her the color queen, and I was looking for a salon in Chicago, instead of trekking out to my old salon in the burbs.  I specifically said (at least 4 times) in the consultation that I wanted a dark brown color instead of the washed out blond highlights that I hadn't been keeping up with.  At the end of the color, her comment was "I am really pleased with the way the blond turned out.  I decided because of your eye color, you could support the blond color."  I was so dumbfounded by that comment, but I thought oh well, the color's not terrible, it's just the polar opposite of what I wanted and explicitly asked for.  Also, I asked for a bob with an angle and nice layers to give my fine hair volume and body.  She said she could see my last hair cut was done really well and was flattering (I loved it too), so she was just going to follow that and take it up to a shorter length - exactly what I wanted!  Again, much to my dismay, I had a completely blunt cut.  Literally, no layers at all, no angle, straight cut that I could have gotten at a $10 barber shop.  When I asked about it, she said she thought the angles would drag my face down.  Again, I was dumbfounded and so sad that I just got ripped off . . . and color is not cheap anywhere!!  It was like we had spoken two totally different languages but I was SO clear about what I wanted.  She even told me my grown out cut and style was so flattering, so I don't know why she decided to mess it up so badly.  Had I not been in such shock, I wouldn't have left a tip at all.  I had to go to another stylist to tone my hair as much as possible and COMPLETELY recut.  I don't want to recolor it for awhile so as not to damage it.  Speaking hairwise, this was my worst and most expensive mistake.  I really wish I could get my money back, since I had to pay for a new cut, toner, and soon new color.  I do NOT recommend this place at all.  (The staff is very nice, like the other reivewers say, but that only gets you so far).

6.description: Great haircut Vera!  Thanks a lot.  You also had my hair jelly at a good price too.  Our three year old daughter has not gotten her hair cut yet but when we decide to cut  it I coming to you:)

22.description: I've been to a lot of stylists through the years but I will definitely be visiting Vera again.  I have long, naturally curly hair that I typically wear straight.  Most stylists do not believe how curly my hair is until they try to blow it out straight.  So, I really appreciate a stylist who listens to me while I describe my hair and what I want.  Vera did exactly that.  I never felt rushed and quite honestly, I've never felt more comfortable.  We had great conversation and she gave me an amazing cut.  The price is beyond affordable which makes a visit here only more pleasant.

15.description: I have been a faithful client of Jimmy's for over 4 years. He is fantastic and will be very honest about what will look good, just ask! He is amazing with your hair and always takes his time to make it look perfect. When I first visited at Southport I felt very welcomed to the salon. I have continued going there and they are always very friendly! They do an amazing job on nails too. I went this weekend for a "no chip" manicure and they took great care of me. After trying different salons for no chip and seeing how much space they leave I have finally found the perfect one. She got close to my cuticle and it looked looks wonderful! I am only going there from now on!

7.description: I have been coming to southport hair studio since I was a little kid! Everyone there is professional, talented and creative! I love it!

8.description: I had a great experience at Southport Hair Studio.  Friendly, courteous service from the moment I walked in.  I got a great looking cut from Vera, and she also recommended a product which helped with my dried hair.  A++ service. I will certainly return.

30.description: Nice cut, slightly pricey. Apparently the owner does really awesome color. (I couldn't test her out as she also takes a long time doing color...which my appointment did not alllow,) I got my brows waxes here, too-- totally happy with every service I received and will be going back in a month or two!

3.description: After reading all the reviews I made an appt with Vera. I received a voicemail confirmation for my appt with Vera a few days before.  I showed up today for my appointment with Vera and some other guy was scheduled to cut my hair?  I don't do well with unexpected changes and was a little annoyed because I scheduled this appointment weeks ago and rushed home from work to make sure I was there on time.  This could have been avoided with a considerate phone call.  Poor customer service.  Not a fan.

14.description: Vera gives a darling cut.I was not thrilled at first. I didn't like her styling but when I got home and moved the cut around a little, I just fell in love. I'll forgive her for the styling. I can work with her on that. I have curly hair that falls flat when I'm running around and working like crazy. With Vera's cut my curls are still bouncy. She's talented and the prices are right.

0.description: Great barbershop! Came here for a fade and a lining and I walked out a changed man! Lol what I'm trying to say is you have to go here for your next cut, blowout or taper. These guys know what they are doing! Great prices and great waiting area with lots of TVs! Da Bears!

29.description: I would not suggest going to this salon due to the environment and unprofessional customer service. The salon environment seems disorganized and dirty. The makeup looks old and dirty. The rooms have random old cups of coffee, soda, etc all over. Just doesn't feel clean and hence didn't feel like a pampering experience. Most of all, I have to comment on the customer service which is not the strong suit of the owner, Olivia.  She yells at her employees during your service. ugh. She overshares, which is completely inappropriate and awkward to hear about her personal romantic history as well as body procedures she has had done.  I seriously thought I was being punked at some point because I was in such disbelief that she was acting this way. She may be talented at lashes but it's not worth going through the unprofessional treatment and icky salon.

42.description: I bought a Gilt City certificate for $150 that included "100% real mink lash extensions, an eyebrow wax and eyebrow shaping." Seeing as a full set of mink lashes can go into the $300-$400 range, I thought this was a great deal at one of Chicago's best lash extension places. Unfortunately, it has been about a week since I went in to redeem the certificate, and I can say that I am overall disappointed with the entire experience. I think sometimes, when you buy deals to places, they treat you as if you're not a full-paying customer, which is really not good business sense.Day-of: The lash lounge is small and looks rather unprofessional, but this is only a minor complaint. Anna (not the owner, Olivia) did my extensions. She did an okay job. I think I may have been a challenging client because my lashes are naturally not long, thick or curly (but that's the point of wanting extensions, right?). After an hour or so of lying on the table/dozing off, I was excited to open my eyes and see my new luxurious lashes. I wasn't astounded with the result. The extensions looked relatively natural and subtle, but also unruly and not the transformation I expected. It just looked like some of my lashes were randomly a bit longer. So, they looked nice, but I would not pay upwards of $300 to get them done again. Then, it was time for my eyebrow wax, which I had to keep reminding them the certificate included. Olivia did this for me, but it was very - for lack of a better word - half-assed. She did some basic, non-detailed waxing and finished with a few tweezer plucks.
