I expressed some annoyance with one of my brows that always refuses to cooperate, and she was like, "oh let me show you this," as if she was going to perform some sort of magic. She just brought out an eyebrow shaping makeup kit that I already use everyday. And it didn't really make much of a difference. In fact, with her broad strokes, she made one of my brows look a little trannylicious. Also to be honest, Olivia's lashes and makeup job looked kinda messy. Not a good thing to notice about the owner. Anyway, I left decently satisfied, but a little put off by the owner's attitude and the overall vibe in the lounge.Aftercare: I was told my eyes couldn't come in contact with liquid for 24 hours. This is extremely difficult in sweaty summertime, but I won't whine too much about it. Even after this liquid ban, the extensions take a while to get used to. They get in the way when you wash your face, and are pretty annoying to deal with because you don't want to mess them up. Also, they just started to look increasingly unruly. I noticed a few lashes that were stuck together and some that were crazy long. To get the look I want, I still have to wear eyeliner, and I want to wear mascara, which kind of defeats the purpose. Furthermore, they really do not last very long. It's been about a week, and I probably have about 15% of the original lashes left. To sum up, maybe I'm just not meant to have long, thick lashes. At the same time, I thought Chicago Lash Lounge would be the kind of place that strives to change that belief. Instead, I realize that they are just a small, boutique place offering (overpriced) luxury services in a subpar space/atmosphere.

23.description: I bought a Gilt City deal for natural lashes on a whim - without checking the ratings for the business on Yelp first, which I usually do.  After reading through the reviews, I panicked but the Gilt City voucher was pretty clear about no refunds.So, I made an appointment for the service, and was actually very pleasantly surprised by the experience.  Parking was easy, the store itself didn't look that untidy or dirty, and there was a receptionist who was friendly and helpful.  Isabelle was the technician who did my lashes - she is AMAZING.  The lashes turn out looking really natural and fabulous (much better than at Lashe Spot), and she is super sweet. Olivia herself came out to check on my lashes, and through my brief interaction with her, she was friendly.  Yes, I did hear her talking to her customers the whole time I was getting my lashes done, but they seemed to be engaged and enjoying the conversation as well.Overall, I had a good experience and I'm definitely planning to go back and get my lashes filled by Isabelle!

47.description: I just had my lashes done by Mimi and she did a great job. I was nervous because I had only had extensions applied once before but Mimi does great work. She was very nice and patient with all my questions . Thank you Mimi you are a true professional and I would reccomend anyone who wants to try lash extensions to go to Mimi!

8.description: After debating whether or not I should get eyelash extensions for about a year, I finally found the courage to make an appointment at Liv Lash Boutique. I googled this place and saw that CBS voted them as one of the best places in Chicago to get eyelash extensions so that's what drew me in. Since I only ever used the glue on strip lashes, I was ready for a change and wanted to experience what the eyelash extension craze was all about for myself! When I called to book an appointment, I was fortunate enough to speak to Olivia (Liv) the owner of the salon. Immediately, I expressed my concerns about getting eyelash extensions for the first time, but Liv reassured me that I was in good hands. Liv explained how she has been doing this for several years and I was impressed to learn she trained in Hollywood with celebrity artists on how to do eyelash extensions. On the day of my appointment, it was easy to find the salon's location and there was so much free parking on the street. I arrived a few minutes early, so Liv politely informed me she was finishing up with a client and would be with me shortly. As I sat and waited, I couldn't help but admire the design and layout of this salon! All of the furniture, artwork, and wall designs that decorate this place are so fashionable and chic! The salon really nailed it when setting the perfect ambiance for something as glamourous as getting eyelash extensions. The pink walls are awesome!Soon, Liv was ready to see me and directed me to the private room where eyelash extensions are applied. There, I felt more of the same modern vibes as the rest of the salon and as I settled onto the comfortable chair, I noticed the room was very neat and clean. Liv then proceeded to ask me what type of eyelashes I was looking to get, and this being my first eyelash experience, she made sure to hear me out, ask me all the right questions, and really understand what I wanted before she started. I even showed her pictures from my phone that were examples of how I wanted my lashes to look, and she was so patient and understanding! Once she knew I was comfortable and confident with what I chose for myself, Liv started applying my eyelash extensions one strand at a time.Liv worked diligently and thoroughly for two hours, but time flew by so fast. Liv is exactly the type of person you would want to have if you could not move during a 2 hour process of getting eyelash extensions. She is so friendly and makes sure you are very comfortable the whole time. Not only does Liv answer every question under the sun that you could possibly think of about eyelash extensions, how to maintain them, what kind of mascara to use on them, which makeup removers are safe etc., but she also takes the time to explain to you what she is doing as she goes along. We ended up talking about anything and everything, and she made me feel so at ease.I was amazed and so happy when I saw my eyelashes! I always wanted thick, long eyelashes and Liv was able to make that happen while making my eyelashes look so natural. It's amazing what a difference fuller eyelashes make in beautifying your eyes! Plus, with the eyelash strips from drugstores you can usually see the glue and feel the lashes on your eyes the whole time, but not with Liv's eyelash extensions. You cannot see the glue at all and it doesn't even feel like you have extensions on.The day after getting my eyelash extensions, I flew out to Asia for vacation and despite the humidity, my eyelashes remained intact for a month without falling out or budging. Having these extensions cut my makeup time in half since I didn't have to apply so many coats of mascara every day. I am so satisfied with my decision to go to Liv Lash Boutique for my first ever eyelash extensions and will definitely be going back to Liv in the future. Trust me, take advantage of the 50% off mascara set for new clients, you will fall in love with this little pink palace and not regret it!

31.description: Saturday I had my 5th appt with the Olivia to give me a new full set of lashes. I was excited, I wanted to look great on Christmas and new years eve! Her prices r excellent! I got a full set of eye lashes w 2 free refills. She explained that will b almost 3 months worth of lashes! I was really happy! I'm a single mom so this is a real treat for me! I got there at 2:00, & was greeted by her receptionist. She's really sweet! Olivia came right out and brought me back to her private room. my appt was right on time. That's something I really appreciate! her room is very relaxing, & I really like her! I feel like she's my friend too! We always have such great conversation, and she always remembers all of our conversations! I love that! It makes me feel special! It goes so fast, cuz we talk and when she was finished my lashes looked beautiful! She does such a great job I don't know what I would do without her! She brought me back to her receptionist  who offered me a free mini makeover with their new holiday colors. So I said ok. She made me feel special, she remembered me too. She made me look great and she was in no hurry to get me out of there. U see I'm terrible with eye makeup! She taught me how to apply it and sold me the new holiday eye shadow. I'm really gonna feel pretty for the holidays! I appreciate all there time w me! Thank u Chicago lash lounge! Happy holidays!

34.description: This review if for the groupon for 100% mink eyelash extension. Anna was the wonderful person who put my eyelashes on. It did take 2 hours and I was getting this done the day of my reception, so it was on the longer side. Anna was patient with my million phone calls I was getting since it was a busy day in my life and a very important day. She did a GREAT job. I had the extensions for about a month. I still have a few long lashes here and there, but they are almost all gone. They are hard to get used to, and may seem to be in the way, but they looked amazing on me. I would do it again for a special occasion (and another groupon....there is no way I would spend $300 for this). The other half was Olivia. I mean....I have never met such an unprofessional person in my entire life. First of all, there was no receptionist, so she was rude to paying customers and kept complaining that the receptionist was on "vacation" and it was hard to do two things at once. Come on lady....your the one who owns the business...hire another person! Second of all, she was on the fricken phone and talking soo loud it was hard to bear it for TWO hours! Thirdly, when it came time to do my eyebrow wax, she made them look hideous! I had to ask her how long she has been doing eyebrows for, and she told me she has been doing them for 10 years or some number where she SHOULD know how to fricken wax eyebrows. If it was not for Anna I would have given this place a 0 star (if that was possible). I skipped the mini makeup application since I was running behind and I was going to see my makeup artist after this anyways for the wedding reception makeup. Thank god for my makeup artist who had to save my eyebrows later on.

16.description: Olivia is a fabulous lash artist! I have been going to her for a year and not once have I been disappointed. Her place is adorable and I love her girly little dog. I have been to many lash extension shops and Olivia does the best work by far.

13.description: Seriously, I wouldn't recommend going here ever.  You're better off being pale.  If you don't mind having orange streaks all over your hands and feet and fake eyelashes done by somebody who is in training, then go for it.I read the customer reviews regarding the customer service and I experienced much of the same; dirty salon, the owner was not dressed appropriately, and I don't really think you should have a dog running around shedding, in a place where you're gluing fake eyelashes onto people, but that's just my opinion. However, a good airbrush tan is hard to come by, so I was willing to give it a shot.First of all, I got here on time and they weren't open.  In there defense, it was only about a 2 minute wait until the owner came and let me in.  I felt pretty confident that the the owner was doing my spray tan, and she told me all about (over and over) how she used to do spray tan's for Vegas Showgirls, and there is just no room for error, so I was in good hands.The spray tan was the worst I've ever seen.  She was all over the place with the barrier cream and I was left with white splotches on my hands and feet.  When I asked her to fix it, she said that she couldn't and that it's "just how spray tans work."  Then she said, "I guess I could put some Jergens on it or something."  No thanks.  Also, she didn't warn me about wearing deodorant, so the whole area around my armpits turned green from a reaction with the aluminum.  Awesome look for my strapless dress that night.She had somebody new working there, and they decided to use me as her training mannequin  for my false eyelashes.  These lashes were seriously 1.5 inches long and spaced so far apart, I looked ridiculous.  I had to trim them myself.  Will not be going back.

11.description: Ok so I went back on a lifebooker deal for Mink Eyelashes.  lifebooker.com/referral/…Anna no longer works here so I was a little scared based on all of the reviews of the other people.Here is the skinny.  The lashes were GREAT!  So I just got them put on by Olivia, the owner on Thursday.  They look amazing.  I have never had lashes before so I have nothing to compare it to, but I think they look like 5 STARS.  So lashes=5 STARS.  This lady seems like she knows what she is doing.  Read below for my interpretation of Olivia.Everything else was 2-3 stars.  The cleanliness of the salon could definitely need some work.  Its a cute place, but seems dirty.  This is the main reason I didnt give it 4 stars.  Its really like a 3.5 but yelp doesnt like halfs.There was no receptionist so the phone kept going off, which is totally fine with me.Olivia herself.  A lot of people have attacked her on here.  This is how I would describe her...she's a gay man in a female's body.  Women dont react well to that.  If she were an actual gay man, everyone would love him (ie her).  But she's not.  People dont like her disarrayed appearance because she looks messy.  They dont like her loud, sometimes obnoxious voice and inappropriate conversations.  They dont like her talking about herself.  You know what, I didnt mind.  She was very nice to me and definitely asked me about myself.  Of course, her own life experiences made their way into the conversation, but it wasnt overpowering.  Maybe I caught her on a good day.  The last time I came, I was definitely taken aback by her demeanor.  This time, I liked her.  I honestly think that she takes pride in her work...she may not be the most professional of people, but I liked her.I thought it was great for the price I paid.  The lashes look good (we will see about staying power).  The salon needs some well deserved cleaning/painting love.  Olivia is crazy, but nice.  Oh, one last thing...she has a little cutesy dog.  If you are allergic or whatever, this is NOT the place for you.

39.description: I, like many of the reviews on here, bought the Gilt City coupon for 150 dollars that included the mink "natural" lash extensions and an eyebrow wax. I was completely unimpressed with the eyebrow wax, but lets be honest, that's not really what I went there for.I thought Olivia did a really nice job on the lashes. She talked me through the whole thing and it went very smoothly. I was happy with how they turned out. She asked what I was looking for and suggested I go for a more natural length, just adding a bit of length to my natural lashes and making them fuller. This was a good suggestion for my first time. They really did look great. I did not enjoy how they tried to sell me a ton of extra products...my lashes lasted in total about 3 weeks. I'd say after a week and a half, my lashes were at about 50% of what they were the day I got them done. I had a good experience at Lash Lounge, but I guess I can't afford to keep going or even get a new set put on. It's TOO pricey without the coupons. I liked the job they did, I just wish it was more affordable to keep up with!

37.description: I had such a horrible experience with this salon.  Went for my first spray tan and the color streaked.  The owner of the salon is a real pill too.  DO NOT GO HERE!

0.description: Hours before my apt I decided to read reviews on yelp. I must admit some of them made me question going in. However, as soon as I arrived Liv informed me she was getting the room ready. I love how cute the salon is! Yes the door was locked and i had to stand there for 3 seconds but as Liv later explained; She locks the door because she is at the salon alone. Totally understandable wanting to be safe. I waited for no more than 5 mins but in the meantime my friend and I were able to spend time with her wonderful little dog. He is the cutest most well behaved little dog ever!! Before going to my apt I read about the salon needing to be clean, not true the salon was clean. I didn't see any dog hair either. Mr. Bubs (her dog) is not allowed in the treatment room, so no need to be concerned about his hair. Liv is such an awesome person! The two hours I was there getting my eyelash extensions flew by! Liv told my friend and I all her stories, it felt like I've known her here whole life. I would rather take this fun bubbly personality than a robotic 100% professional one. Liv was very attentive to my friend as well. Offered her to sit in the massage chair, showed her where the bathroom was, and got her some water.My extensions came out exactly how I wanted them to look like. They are perfection!! Liv knows what she's doing, I will definitely be back and will recommend her 100%

38.description: I would like to preface this review by indicating that I HAVE NOT received services here. I have, however, had a negative experience that I wish to share primarily for the benefit of the store owner. If you are going to engage in a client-facing business, take the time to hire the proper employees (friendly, informative, etc)! I walked into the Lash Lounge on a lazy afternoon without an appointment (gasp!). I knew there was probably only a slight chance that I would be able to get the false eyelashes that day, however, it looked like there was some makeup and other fun stuff to check out so I walked in the store. There were no customers sitting in the waiting area and there were two employees standing and talking near the entrance. Basically, I was looking to waste some time and spend some money. The two women, who appeared to be appalled that i was a walk-in, informed me that there were no appointments available (good sign), handed me a pamphlet and practically shooed me out the door. I wanted to check out the other services, browse the products they had for sale, or maybe see a book of "before and afters" - yet the women told me to look over the pamphlet and call later to make an appointment.  The store looked SO CUTE! I love anything girly and this place just drew me in! I am an eyelash junky (and have since returned to my previous vendor- which is further away and a bigger hassle to get to) however, I want to be treated like a valuable customer/potential customer. If the employees were friendly/helpful/talkative or showed any interest in me in general (besides removing me from the premises so they could continue their private conversation) I would have made an appointment and probably bought some makeup on the spot.

27.description: I went to CLL by recommendation of a friend who had her lashes done there earlier this year.  I wanted a more 'romantic' look for my wedding.  Olivia is very talented with lash extensions.  I never had lash extensions before so I was worried that I'd be the small percentage who would be allergic to the adhesive or have some issue.  I was very pleased.  Fast forward over a month and I'd say about a 1/3 of them are still on.  After the wedding I was much more careless about rubbing/washing my eyes and using products.  I sprayed my face with sunblock, dived into ocean and pools, wore oil-based lotions, etc.  Technically, I shouldn't have any left on but I do.  Even though I have a lot less lashes on than before, I still don't bother with mascara cuz I don't need it.  Love that.Olivia was very outgoing, talkative, extremely informative about lashes and her own professional history, and casual.  She put me at ease.  She also adjusted her schedule so I could come in after hours to get my lashes done in time for the wedding.   One thing I noticed on Yelp is that CLL has over 30 filtered reviews...because I don't post reviews much I'll probably be in the filtered list.  I noticed this gives CLL a skewed rating.  Make sure you read all the reviews, including filtered, before you decide.

32.description: I actually created a yelp account so I could write a review about this place. The lashes were nice but the service was HORRIBLE!!! The owner is completely rude! Did not dicuss any details about the package I bought and when I called to make my 2nd lash appointment she made up her own "RULES" about my appointment. I thought getting my lashes done was suppose to be relaxing and fun but the whole time the owner complained about a girl she just fired and how grateful I should be that she is doing my lashes for cheap. Ummm lasted I checked $400 is not cheap.DO NOT GO HERE!!! Unless you like rude and stuck up service.

48.description: I've been going to Olivia's since this summer. It had started off with lash extensions for a special occasion (as well as a recommendation from a friend), but as soon as I got my first set, I was hooked!Olivia really listens to what your needs are and make the recommendations that are best suited for your eyelashes (as not each person can support the same weighted lashes). I never knew there was so much expertise that goes into something like this. Olivia really knows what she's talking about as she also teaches other people how to do eyelash extensions. It is a very tedious task as each lash extension is glued onto each of your own lashes. (Be aware, if you have been going elsewhere and they are gluing the lashes to your eyelids, this is WRONG! Fortunately, Olivia will be able to correct that for you.)She recently opened her very cute store on Belmont with private lash rooms. I feel that getting lash extension is a very intimate process and I would hate to be in an open room where everyone can hear your conversation and see you get your lashes done at the same time. The best part about her location is FREE parking! Yes, that's right - there are NO METERS!!! I highly recommend Olivia and the Chicago Lash Lounge to anyone looking for an EXPERT in eyelash extensions and truly cares about her clients.

44.description: The same way when someone mentions basketball, Michael Jordan comes to mind, whenever you think of, or hear the word  'lashes' mentioned, the ONLY name that should come to mind is Olivia! YES, She is just that good!! This is coming from a woman who has visited her fair share of lash artists, and none of them can compare! I became so frustrated with past artisits, that I went on a 2 year hiatis from lash extensions. But once I did extensive research, found Olivia online, and visited her for the first time over a year ago, I KNEW the lash God's had answered my prayers!!OMG!!! I have never seen such gorgeous, realistic lash extensions before, and I was lucky enough to call them my own! Over a year later, I still cannot stop staring at my lashes in the mirror in amazement! Olivia's work is so wonderfully and meticulously done, sometimes I forget myself these lases did not grow out of my eyelids!! I have received tons of compliments on my lashes, and I get so excited about passing along Olivia's contact information, and singing her praises whenever I have the chance. And mostly because I want so many of fellow lash loving ladies out there to allow themselves such an experience! Ladies, please stop abusing and damaging your natural lashes with the heavy, poor quality lashes and adhesive being applied to your lashes either in the 'one stop shops' for cheap, or the overly priced, less than qualified technicians in the uppity shops. I know that you are either losing your own lashes, or leaving these shops broke, and less than fully satisfied. And believe me, I know, because I have been in both of these situations on more occasions than I wsh to recall, before finding Olivia! Olivia takes many things into consideration before applying your lashes. The weight that your natural lashes can hold, the shape of your eyes, so that she can apply the lashes in a way to best compliment your eyes, the price range your are looking to stay within, the duration of time you are looking to keep your lashes for, your comfort level while having the lashes applied, and how to work with the characteristics of different ethnicities' lashes, as I am an African American woman, and our lashes tend to be extremely curly, bushy, and like to criss cross with each other, but her expertise allows this not to be an issue during application and the wearing of the   extensions! Olivia has opened up an ADORABLE lash lounge in a great location, with easy free parking, and a great staff. She not only provides a wonderful service here, but offers a full maintence product line for your lashes, along with other fabulous services! Please visit Olivia at the Lash Lounge, and allow her to make your lashes live up to their fullest potential, and tell her Nikki sent you!!  ;-)

24.description: Ok so I went back on a lifebooker deal for Mink Eyelashes.  lifebooker.com/referral/…Anna no longer works here so I was a little scared based on all of the reviews of the other people.Here is the skinny.  The lashes were GREAT!  So I just got them put on by Olivia, the owner on Thursday.  They look amazing.  I have never had lashes before so I have nothing to compare it to, but I think they look like 5 STARS.  So lashes=5 STARS.  This lady seems like she knows what she is doing.  Read below for my interpretation of Olivia.Everything else was 2-3 stars.  The cleanliness of the salon could definitely need some work.  Its a cute place, but seems dirty.  This is the main reason I didnt give it 4 stars.  Its really like a 3.5 but yelp doesnt like halfs.There was no receptionist so the phone kept going off, which is totally fine with me.Olivia herself.  A lot of people have attacked her on here.  This is how I would describe her...she's a gay man in a female's body.  Women dont react well to that.  If she were an actual gay man, everyone would love him (ie her).  But she's not.  People dont like her disarrayed appearance because she looks messy.  They dont like her loud, sometimes obnoxious voice and inappropriate conversations.  They dont like her talking about herself.  You know what, I didnt mind.  She was very nice to me and definitely asked me about myself.  Of course, her own life experiences made their way into the conversation, but it wasnt overpowering.  Maybe I caught her on a good day.  The last time I came, I was definitely taken aback by her demeanor.  This time, I liked her.  I honestly think that she takes pride in her work...she may not be the most professional of people, but I liked her.I thought it was great for the price I paid.  The lashes look good (we will see about staying power).  The salon needs some well deserved cleaning/painting love.  Olivia is crazy, but nice.  Oh, one last thing...she has a little cutesy dog.  If you are allergic or whatever, this is NOT the place for you.

7.description: I had a very enjoyable experience with Olivia! Yes, there is a dog in the salon. No, it was not dirty or unprofessional. I felt very comfortable and the work was excellent. I rate this place a 4.5 but Yelp doesn't allow half stars. A little tlc will go far for this business and turn it easily into a 5 star.

49.description: After living in Manhattan for 8 years, I recently moved to Chicago and feared not being able to find beauty services as good as my NYC faves... but, Olivia is better than any I've had in NYC!  Olivia is an expert in eyes and eyelashes, passionate about her work, and doesn't settle for anything less than perfection.  She genuinely cares about and listens to her clients needs.  She is accomodating, professional, and possesses high integrity... a rare find!  I am definetly going to wear her lashes for my wedding next year =)  I highly recommend Olivia to anyone who is looking to try lash extensions for the first time, or anyone who has been getting them for a while.  You'll love her too =)

40.description: I absolutely love my eye lash extensions from Chicago Lash Lounge. I currently get the mink ones and it is worth every penny. I get compliments all the time and its so nice not to have to worry about putting on mascara or curling my eye lashes before going out because they always look done up. The salon is absolutely adorable too. Olivia and her staff  make you feel like one of the girls. Its such a fun girlie environment.I read a few of the reviews below regarding the lack of pedicure space and I laughed. The salon is a Lash Lounge, specializing in eye lashes. They do nails because its an added little service for your convenience. Either way I love my mink eye lash extensions and so does everyone I know. I highly recommend checking this place out if your looking to feel pretty everyday!

30.description: Ive never been here but I called asking about a service. The girl that answered put me on hold which basically was setting the phone down on the counter.  It was a good 3 minutes and all I could hear was someone complaining about groupons and just being totally negative and whiny.  This was about six months ago but since I was reviewing another location I thought I would add this one too. Basically I will never go here because of the piss poor customer service. The girl on the phone was nice but she seemed like she was afraid of the women complaining. I think it was the owner or the manager however it works over there. When the front desk person came back on I think the lady was still complaining.  Ewwwwww!

46.description: I have been to Chicago Lash Lounge three times and everytime I go it's always a great time and my lashes come out awesome!!!I have small eyelashes and Noemi (Mimi) made me look like i had the fullest set of eyelashes. It feels great to walk into a room and someone say to you "You have such beautiful eyelashes...are they really yours?" I'm not gonna lie..they look soooooooo real, I claim ownership!! Noemi works great, fast and is so personable!! She always keeps you comfortable and makes you look fabulous!! She is attentive and I will continue to get my lashed done by her!! Thanks Noemi!!! I'll be coming in for a set real soon!!!

1.description: I wanted to like this place - I really did. I visited the Liv Lash Boutique on three occasions: November, 2015, December, 2015, and February, 2016. Let me first say that Liv knows what she's doing. She has a steady hand and good technique. The lashes on all three occasions turned out great. It was everything else that prompted me to write this review and probably not return (which is a shame). I worked at a cosmetology school for three years. Part of what I was around were theory classes and state board prep classes for the students. Sanitation 101 is that you don't reuse things on multiple people. The covering on the headrest, the blankets and the pillows are all reused from client to client. For example, I went into the room directly after another girl left and put my head and body on the same stuff she had been laying on. Ew. The tools are the same. The tools are set out in a cute fashion - all in cute little holders. However, again, the instruments I had used on me seemed to have been laying there from the last client. It's a really cute concept and I really wanted to spend my money at a local business but it needs some work. I hate to be a negative person; it's not who I am and I think spreading negativity hurts everyone in the end. After that disclaimer - the owner is larger than life - which is great if she's your girlfriend and you need someone to go clubbing or get over an ex, but not if you're looking for a nice, professional, spa-like experience. She constantly talks about herself - like she has to fill the silence - and will interrupt you 100% of the time if you start to say something, even if you're asking her about her other services or packages. Her conversation topics are what everyone else mentioned on YELP and half of them are totally inappropriate.  I think she said the word "titties" at least 12 times when I was last there. The first time I was there, she trash-talked her competition, who I guess tried to sue her over trademark or copyright infringement or something and she was forced to change her name. Talking about stuff like that is not appropriate and makes someone seem bitter and unprofessional. She bad-mouthed other clients in front of me and another client saying that they had some nerve to try and get in with 24-hr notice (this is a good problem to have, Liv) and stated that it was rude and pushy and they should know she was busy. And then she threw her cell phone on the counter.While working on me, I had a little twitch - you know - like a cold shiver. Her reaction was "Great. You just made me loose five lashes. I love what I do but sometimes my clients make me want to throw my tweezers across the room." I was stunned and wanted to cry at that point. So rude - and she said this while there was another client in the waiting area. I was definitely embarrassed. Overview: great lashes, very poor customer service.

9.description: I was a sceptic....Now I'm a believer. My husband said I, "look like a doll," and more importantly that I look younger!!! I got my lashes in December 27th and here it is January 17th and they still look awesome. I have also not worn a stitch of eye makeup during that time, saving me tons of valuable time in the morning getting ready. If time is money for you then the cost of the service balances out in the free time you'll get not having to layer on the eyeliner and mascara when your getting ready for work. Totally worth it.

26.description: Oh my goodness! I was so worried about writing a review before, because it was that scary! When I went, I was given a 15 minute lecture on why she was the best. I timed it! And then during the whole application, I got a while life story. Seriously, I learned about her husband was in the hospital, her in-laws are "nuts", her sister pulls her hair out. It was too much. It was disruptive, obnoxious and not the relaxing experience I was looking for. I think this was also the cause of some of my lashes not put on very well. I was told at the end of my appointment that she was going to allow me to come back for a free touch-up of the lashes. When I came back, another girl did my lashes and we were the only ones in the place. Then she went on about how much she hated working there and what a horrible job Olivia did on my lashes. She even said she was going to remove some of them and re-apply it for me for no extra charge because she felt bad about how bad it was. While this was happening, the phone rings and the answering machine picks it up because she was working on my lashes. It was the owner yelling at her to "pick up the phone!" and "how rude of her not to pick up the phone," It was so awkward. She then offered a free service for me at her place because she wanted me to know how lashes are supposed to be done! So weird!This girl was also supposedly the best esthetician, but let me tell you, she made my under arms raw and unfinished, and I had to get my eyebrows re waxed by someone else. So I leave thinking, okay... this was a very crazy experience, but at least she fixed my lashes for my wedding... Come to find the day OF my wedding, the owner calls me to tell me that she thought I'd only come in for a quick touch up, that's why she wasn't charging me. But she said and I quote, "Well, you had to get a lot of your lashes fixed, probably because you weren't taking care of them, so Im going to have to charge you $75" So the other girl sold me out. Luckily for her I didn't say what I was thinking, which was, "I didn't ask her to do it, she insisted that she fix YOUR mistake."Guys, I couldn't make this up. It is seriously crazy! It would be nice if people were more professional and discreet, but it seems like they don't like each other and it shows! I don't know if this girl is there anymore, so I don't know if things have changed, but I will not go back! Too crazy for me!

25.description: I've been hesitating on whether or not to write a review for this place because I will really only write a non-flattering review if the customer service was horrible.I went here earlier this year and while she did a Great job on my lashes - unfortunately the environment and customer service is what has kept me from ever going back here. The reviews below are true.Yelling at your employees is not acceptable-especially when you have clients in the store.Talking bad about other client's - doesn't matter if I know them or not- is not professional.Blaming your employees/ late clients to a new client is not professional.Blaming employees for your bad behavior- says more about you than them.Again, in this economy you want to try to bring new clients in and retain the ones you have- doesn't matter if you consider yourself as the best- there is always someone else out there doing an equally great job while providing great customer service.

12.description: I've never been to this place but whoever is in charge of their phones is very rude and unprofessional. So now I never plan on visiting. Get it together.

21.description: I came here last week for a spray tan before a trip to Miami and I was pretty disappointed. While she is very friendly, it seems like she does not have a lot of experience or I just had her on an off day. My hands and feet looked like they belonged on a monster. They were blotchy and just very strange looking. She made a fuss about not spraying hands or feet because they tend to look orange and so I'm not sure what exactly happened but I would have rather had them all one solid orange  color than the creepy spots that appeared. The rest of my body looked good, but the hands and feet just ruined it for me!

17.description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I usually use Yelp to look up reviews, rather than write them.  I have to say how shocked I am reading some of the reviews for Chicago Lash Lounge.  I have been coming here regularly for over 3 years and have always had the best service.  I go pretty far out of my way to visit Olivia for her services.  Always worth it.  She does a fantastic job on my lashes and I regularly get compliments on how amazing they look.  Her passion for what she does is incredible and every single time I see her she expresses her appreciation to me.  EVERY TIME.  I'm sorry, but I can't believe most of these reviews for a split second.  I have been going to her every few weeks for years and would have had some kind of bad experience by now if there were any truth to the negative comments.  I highly recommend Chicago Lash Lounge to everyone who asks for a referral.  It is the ONLY place I will go.  And I am very picky.

10.description: I had a similar experience to another reviewer. I walked in around 2:30 in the afternoon today looking for information because I've never had false eyelashes professionally before. Professional is not the word for this place. The two women sitting inside didn't greet me, and instead asked what I needed, then when I told them I was looking for information on false lashes they handed me a service menu, a business card, and a coupon, and said people normally watch the videos online and "It's just that we're having a meeting". I was appalled. No wonder the place is empty. I won't be trying this business for my first time with lash extensions.

5.description: I did my homework online to find the very best in Chicago for lashes and I nailed it! I'm from the West coast where there are many more choices and infinite lash salons. The owner trained in Hollywood and is an extreme perfectionist. She knows what she's doing! I just had a full set the week before at another salon and was unhappy with them but had already given the girl 3 attempts. Lash Lounge removed the whole set and put on a new set that I could be proud of. I'm back to getting compliments on my lashes again! They gave me a "new customer" discount on the first set and I'll definitely be back for my fills there. I got the synthetic mink which is medium priced but looks beautiful!Since there was only the owner working there during my visit I can see how it's hard to balance "walk ins" and still do the work so the complainers who commented here need to realize this. It's a tedious job and lash designers need to focus on what they're doing which is a tiring labor of precision when they're very good at what they do. I wouldn't want them to get up and go consult with someone while they're doing my lashes and if the complainers think this is rude then they don't know the business at all. Lash Lounge rocks! Keep up the great workUPDATE:The initial lash set, and one fill was the only experience. Yes, she does great work but wouldn't respond to further attempts for a fill appointment over two months. Think about this before booking a series of fills. She does good work but complained about her other clients to me while dong my lashes, judging each one who would be privileged enough to get an appointment. #not-classy #unprofessional

3.description: I cannot say enough good things about my experience coming to Liv's Lash Lounge (formerly Chicago Lash Lounge). I have been a customer here for the last three years, after going to several other lash boutiques in the city. I feel like a VIP every time I come here. The service is great, and most importantly my lashes look amazing and last forever. My natural lashes are almost blond and I have always been insecure about them, but when I leave the Lounge I look and feel like a celebrity!  Liv (owner) takes her time, always has my favorite coffee and the time just zooms by. The packages and specials make getting 100% mink lashes affordable and Liv always takes care of her customers. I plan on having Liv do my sisters entire wedding party in the fall! The salon is clean, comfortable and cute!! Thanks, Liv!

35.description: Olivia (owner) did my makeup for my wedding a few weeks ago, including temporary false lashes, and I looked fabulous.  The make-up (powder, because I didn't like airbrush) stayed on the entire night and the lashes actually lasted about a week. Olivia also did my mother with airbrush and the results were great.  So many people complemented her on how youthful she looked.I actually had two trials because I felt like airbrush was too heavy for me, but each job made me look great.The employees aren't the most customer-service oriented and sometimes they are a little awkward, but the bottom line is the work done by Olivia is great.

19.description: I would like to preface this review by indicating that I HAVE NOT received services here. I have, however, had a negative experience that I wish to share primarily for the benefit of the store owner. If you are going to engage in a client-facing business, take the time to hire the proper employees (friendly, informative, etc)! I walked into the Lash Lounge on a lazy afternoon without an appointment (gasp!). I knew there was probably only a slight chance that I would be able to get the false eyelashes that day, however, it looked like there was some makeup and other fun stuff to check out so I walked in the store. There were no customers sitting in the waiting area and there were two employees standing and talking near the entrance. Basically, I was looking to waste some time and spend some money. The two women, who appeared to be appalled that i was a walk-in, informed me that there were no appointments available (good sign), handed me a pamphlet and practically shooed me out the door. I wanted to check out the other services, browse the products they had for sale, or maybe see a book of "before and afters" - yet the women told me to look over the pamphlet and call later to make an appointment.  The store looked SO CUTE! I love anything girly and this place just drew me in! I am an eyelash junky (and have since returned to my previous vendor- which is further away and a bigger hassle to get to) however, I want to be treated like a valuable customer/potential customer. If the employees were friendly/helpful/talkative or showed any interest in me in general (besides removing me from the premises so they could continue their private conversation) I would have made an appointment and probably bought some makeup on the spot.

28.description: While I can't comment on the lashes (yet), I had my first appointment at Chicago Lash Lounge for a quick eyebrow wax. Jade did my eyebrows, and they look amazing! I haven't been happy with the shape of my brows for a long time after a bad experience with threading, but Jade not only helped fix the shape, but told me where/how to pluck between waxing to keep improving my natural brow arch.I'm not typically a girly girl, but the shop is adorable, and super clean. I'll definitely be back for more brow waxing, and hopefully lashes sometime soon!

45.description: I had been so used to buying the traditional strip eyelashes. The kind you apply with glue, and hope no moisture comes anywhere near you. While driving by, I saw Chicago Lash Lounge, and it caught my curiosity. What the heck was a lash lounge? I came home and looked them up on line, and realized this would be a new obsession. Here they do lash extensions, which is an individual hair bonded to your own eyelash. Not like the ones you can buy that are clumps of two or three hairs and applied with glue. This is exactly what I needed! No more eyelash strips folding up, or glue getting in my eye when it rains!I did my due diligence to make sure I found the best place.  I was shocked at how much lower the prices are here.  At Flutter lash studio, a full set of mascara look lashes will run you about $500 if not more.  I read that the up keep for lash extensions is pretty simple, but you need to get them refilled, because they shed out with your natural lashes.  So, I have to pay $500, only for one service, and then try to find some more money to get them refilled every 3 or so weeks? Ouch. At Chicago lash lounge, I got a full set of mascara style lashes (they are thick and tinted black so I never have to wear mascara!!) and two refill sessions for well under $300! I couldn't believe the difference in price.  My experience was wonderful. The shop is so cute! And they carry high end cosmetics and everything can be applied and won't affect your lashes.  The process was great.  Olivia was so friendly and personable, I was immediately comfortable with her.  You go into your own private room, and lay down on a comfy massage style bed.  She applies a cooling pad under both your eyes, and all you do is lay and relax, and Olivia does the rest.  She told me all about her training and how she got to where she is now. What an incredible person, with probably the most impressive resume I have ever heard.  I asked her why she charges so much less that the other lash boutiques, and she said that she could never charge that much.  She wants this to be affordable for people, and something they can really maintain.  Thank god for that! Otherwise this would be a one time thing.  After she was finished, I couldn't believe my eyes.  The lashes looked so real, and I couldn't even feel them! Every single one was perfectly in place, and now I can leave the house without any makeup, and my eyes look great.  I'm so glad I found this gem, and I can't wait to go back for my refill in 3 weeks! If you want eyelash extensions, this is the only place to go!

33.description: Its interesting.   My great friend Auntie Fabulous went to the Chicago Lash Lounge and came back with the sexiest,  most natural thick long, Jessica Rabbit style lashes EVER.  She looked so hot she sizzled ... so of course being a good friend I had to copy her.  First I read the Yelp reviews to make sure everyone else had fared as well as the lovely Auntie Fab.  What I read was not negative about the lash service so much as the customer service in general.  Knowing that there are always two sides to every story,  I made an appointment and off I went.  The "lounge"  is adorable,  but the over all vibe was a tad harried.  I tried not to be put off when my waxing services were performed with me sitting up on a chair - but most of all I tried not to notice the owner.  Who by the way did not even greet me when I entered the place.  She was very busy having a fit about the fact that a receptionist had lost her price list for a certain product.  She literally was flapping around like her hair was on fire.  I finally  understand that she had a leak somewhere ( in the building - not on her)  Even so as a business owner one should know the meaning of the word decorum.  I was ushered back to the lash room where a serene Betina ( I think that was her name) asked me a series of questions and then went to work on my short, pathetic lashes.  About an hour later,  I was sporting some truly gorgeous  long fluttery lashes.  Sure,  I admit it, I'm a little more Doris Day than Jessica Rabbit - but the still looked good. So my review is a 3 not because of the excellent work done by the technician,  but because it was stressful to be there listening to all the private business that was being discussed during the time that I was with the quiet and professional Betina.  Also not sure that I will go back to CLL as they no longer offer the semi permanent lashes that I received today.  But it is a fun look and I will enjoy it while it lasts!

43.description: This is a review for mani-pedi and general customer service.  Not lashes. I also would like to previous the review with the makeup application was flawless and not reflected in the review either. I had bought a Gilt cert for a mani/pedi/makeup application.  The reason for the one star, and I would give it 0 if possible, is the mani/pedi.  When I arrived there were two of us.  There was only one person to do the mani/pedi and I was told "this is not a nail salon" and that they did not have numerous people to do the mani/pedi.  It should be noted as well this was out second attempt at our appointment and this appointment was not even on the books.  We were told there had been a receptionist and she had been fired for messing up the books.  I get that, but not having an appointment on the books, for the second time in less than two weeks is poor management.....there was no apology either. The manicure was bad.  Just bad.  I have shorter nails and had to ask for the nails to be straightened out as they were filed REALLY crooked.  There were few polish option, almost all were old or really tacky colors. Additionally, there was NO cleaning of the nail tools in between use of two different people.  Gross.  The pedicure chair is in the back. I use the term pedicure chair loosely.  The chair is nothing but....a chair, not a pedicure chair and amazingly uncomfortable.  The foot soak is nothing better than a plastic bucket.  I was forced to hold up my legs/feet at an odd angle so that the chick could do my feet.  I am taller, but not crazy tall.  Good thing I had not had a workout that morning!  The application of the polish lasted 3 days...I have had pedicures last a month before.  Even if I do my own toes they last significantly longer.Overall: If you are not a mani/pedi place and do not have the facilities to offer mani/pedis do not offer them! I will stay with Pinkys thank you very much.  The place is somewhat shabby and looks like it needs to be redecorated, cleaned, touched up. As a final note, I did see someone getting an eyebrow wax and it looked great, as did the lashes of the women who did my makeup. I will never go back here, nor recommend it to anyone.  Although the lashes  and make up application looked good (maybe they should stick with what they appear to be good at), the customer service and general rundown feel of the place is off putting.  There are hundreds of nail places around and dozens of similar boutique style salons within 2 miles.  They need to clean up their act and learn some customer service!

2.description: Recently had my wedding and Liv was great to work with.  She did my makeup for both my engagement photo sessions and onsite for my wedding.  Liv and Raeganne went above and beyond my expectations with regards to the bridal party's hair and makeup. Liv even helped out my friend Dave (our groomsmen) with a pimple crisis that day and covered up his zit!  See pics below. Overall she made me look glamorous and made me feel special on my wedding day.  Her storefront is super cute, pink and girlie and wait till you meet her dog!  Looking forward to doing my lashes with her for my honeymoon.

18.description: I bought a Gilt City deal for natural lashes on a whim - without checking the ratings for the business on Yelp first, which I usually do.  After reading through the reviews, I panicked but the Gilt City voucher was pretty clear about no refunds.So, I made an appointment for the service, and was actually very pleasantly surprised by the experience.  Parking was easy, the store itself didn't look that untidy or dirty, and there was a receptionist who was friendly and helpful.  Isabelle was the technician who did my lashes - she is AMAZING.  The lashes turn out looking really natural and fabulous (much better than at Lashe Spot), and she is super sweet. Olivia herself came out to check on my lashes, and through my brief interaction with her, she was friendly.  Yes, I did hear her talking to her customers the whole time I was getting my lashes done, but they seemed to be engaged and enjoying the conversation as well.Overall, I had a good experience and I'm definitely planning to go back and get my lashes filled by Isabelle!

41.description: Beware of writing an honest review of this place. You will probably get a call from the owner herself wanting to make false accusations and make you feel bad for wanting to let other customers know of your real experiences. Unfortunately, some business owners cry wolf to the Yelp team trying to say that competition is writing the bad reviews. Nope, just disgruntled customers. Every word of this is true, including the rude phone call I just got from the owner herself attempting to justify each and every thing that went wrong with my experience. I was rightful in wanting a refund, and even more right to write an honest review. This is borderline harassment.....I am much happier getting a brand new set of lashes at another lounge than spending one more dime in this dump.

4.description: I purchased my mom a gift from here for her Birthday and she always had bad luck with most Eyelash places, She told me that this was the best present she ever received. I want to say Thanks to Olivia for making my mom feel pretty again :)

6.description: Love this place! The service was excellent, the lashes look awesome. I was going to the other Chicago lash place however I am so glad I tried out somewhere new! I have received so many compliments. My lashes do not look fake either.

22.description: I'd have to say I agree with all the negative comments on this yelp page.  I've had a number of bad experiences there but because I actually really liked my lashes the first time I had decided to try them again.  A few things that I encountered...1) The very first time I went there, Olivia did not have my or my friends appointment in the books.  She had told me via email to arrive an hour before the salon opened because she was double booked but nobody showed as we sat outside and waited for a full hour.  When she finally got there, she first blamed the receptionist saying she didn't write it down, then when I said the emails I had regarding the appointment had been with her, she changed her tune and said she thought we meant the following Saturday.  The email clearly states a number of times the date and time of the appointment.  She then added in that she had been in the hospital all morning due to a car accident of a family member.  I'd typically believe this but after hearing the hundreds of stories Olivia tells her clients about her family and friends, it's really hard to believe anything that comes out of her mouth.  She also called the other two clients who were supposed to come in next and told them she'd have to reschedule, like it was nothing for them to just change things around and come in at a different time.2)  As others mention, Olivia has a very sloppy appearance and her fake eyelashes always look horrible.  All she does throughout the entire session is complain and talk about herself.  She seems to think every person in her ex husbands family is psychotic and the stories she told about them just seem too insane to be true.  She also talks crap about her clients as well as her staff.  She ALWAYS has an excuse for everything and seems to love to act as if everything is never her fault.  As the owner of a company, nobody wants to hear whose fault it is, they just want you to fix whatever problem comes about.  3) After my first experience (Olivia being late and telling insane stories the entire time), I did decide to return because I had fun with the fake lashes and thought they turned out pretty great (beside being a pain in the ass to maintain).  She did tone it down a bit on the story telling and family bashing in my second visit but still she talked WAY to much, the phone continued to ring at an insanely loud volume with a rude receptionist who would answer the phone.  With that said, again, the product turned out fine and they mentioned a special where I could pay $50 more to come in for two additional fills.  I decided to purchase the package, although I think I should have known better....4) I made my first appointment for my fill but was unable to come in due to being ill.  With the number of times Olivia changes peoples appointments, I wouldn't think it would be the end of the world if I called the day before to cancel.  I left a message saying I wouldn't be able to come in.  Because things at work got busy I didn't make it back in for my fills.  I recently called back in (yes it's maybe been 6 months or so since my last appointment) and asked about the last package I had purchased.  She claims that the package expires after 7 weeks if it's not used.  I asked if they'd be able to offer anything seeing I had prepaid for this.  Easy solutions that come to my mind...let me come in and pay for a full set and come back in later for 2 fills, give me a credit for the fills I didn't use, etc...nope, all Olivia offered was for me to buy a new package at $400.  Really?...no thanks.  It's an unpleasant atmosphere and I really only wanted to go back to use the rest of my package I had already paid for.  I really hope for Olivia that Tabitha from the Style Network (or is it Bravo?) can come in and change that salon around.  Olivia has the talent to be successful but she needs someone to teach her how to run a business!  Your clients aren't your therapist, we don't want to hear about your drama.  You also need to explain your packages a little better and it would have been nice to have this 7 week rule in writing.  I completely get that you'd have to put a new set on but to not offer me anything for the money I already paid just doesn't seem like a way to get a client to come back. Also, clean your salon, hire some competent employees and stop blaming everyone else for your mistakes in your business.

15.description: Well, I can only hope that I am reviewing the right place... I had a VERY different experience many of the others who wrote.We had the Chicago Lash Lounge work an off-site event for us.  They saw 40+ clients over the course of 6 hours.  They showed up on time, came prepared with plenty of material and ran an organized service.  Both of the women were professional and personable.  They kept track of who was waiting and kept the rotation moving.  I was thrilled with the results and so were all of our clients.  They did a great job making everyone feel glamorous and special.  I will definitely use them again for an event!(Thank you so much ladies.)

20.description: Well, I can only hope that I am reviewing the right place... I had a VERY different experience many of the others who wrote.We had the Chicago Lash Lounge work an off-site event for us.  They saw 40+ clients over the course of 6 hours.  They showed up on time, came prepared with plenty of material and ran an organized service.  Both of the women were professional and personable.  They kept track of who was waiting and kept the rotation moving.  I was thrilled with the results and so were all of our clients.  They did a great job making everyone feel glamorous and special.  I will definitely use them again for an event!(Thank you so much ladies.)

36.description: I went to Olivia for an initial consultation and fill. She has amazing carisma. I told her I had spent a ton of money trying to find the right lash tech. She was on a time schedule and managed to at least correct the horrible lashes from my last lash tech. I was dissapointed it wasn't what I had in mind, but she was very honest and fair with me, not charging full price. They def look better than what I had!Her former Jr Lash Tech named "Joni" was my private lash tech. Ironically Olivia and I both know her. Joni is at Salon Lashe now. When Olivia saw her work she couldn't believe how poor it was and how unprofessional Joni is (due to theft and lying). Joni gave me very poor service and horrible consultations, every time charging me full price. Unlike Olivia at Chicago Lashe Lounge.It's a small world in the Lash Industry so please research your lash techs and salons!!

14.description: I had Mandy do my lashes and I just love her! :) This is a very relaxed, chill salon that made me feel really comfortable asking questions (this was the first time I had eyelash extensions).  I called first (as you should) and got an appointment for a 1/2 hour later! When I came in, it was a relaxed atmosphere.  The people that are mad that they didn't get more attentive in your face service should probably go to Salon 1800 or somewhere with more of that vibe. For me, I really enjoyed my experience here and have had numerous compliments on my lashes (without even telling people I had it done)! I would def recomend :)  It is a long process, but Mandy is super fun to talk to and what do you expect? If you want lash by lash extensions, you have to be patient :)

58.description: Crazy place with a cultish vibe. Sri is an inspiration to the entirety of this place. Great food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

56.description: Let me start off by saying I am not a vegetarian. This place was great! I loved the food and it is the first vegetarian place that I can honest say that about. I had the southwest burger and the flavors were great. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

29.description: One of my fav vegetarian restaurants in the city, but you certainly don't need to be veg to enjoy. Love the French toast with peach butter for breakfast and southwest burger for lunch. Neatloaf sandwich and dinner are also fab choices. Coffee is great, atmosphere is even better. A truly zen Expirience, I highly recommend!

42.description: It doesn't get any better for breakfast than VB.  We love this place and the vegan sausage tastes better than "real" sausage.  French toast, omelets, just amazing.

23.description: came here randomly while walking through the neighborhood.  I am not a vegetarian so was a bit skeptical, but menu actually had plenty of veg/non-veg options. Overall the place is clean and pretty quiet, even though most seats were taken. We had no wait on Sunday morning around 1045. staff was friendly and food came out in less than 10 minutes. I got the smoked Gouda and sausage omelette, which was decent but doesn't sub for real sausage if that is what you prefer.

47.description: Cute place. Had the pesto egg scramble and a chai. Chai was awesome as were the eggs but meal could have been hotter (some of my potatoes were actually cold). Whole group liked their meal and it was reasonable prices/nice people so we'll be back :)

8.description: Vegan french toast?  Yes please!I came here with my mom and a friend on an early Saturday morning, and was very happy with the vegan selections (be sure to ask for the separate vegan menu if that's something you are into). Vegan french toast is something that is not often done well, but here it was absolutely exceptional. I also appreciated the real maple syrup on the table, not as an expensive extra or something you have to ask for separately from the fake stuff. The coffee was also strong and delicious, which is a key component to a good breakfast. Service was friendly and prompt.My mom got some kind of tofu scramble that looked really good, but alas I was too busy shoving french toast into my gaping maw to event think about trying it.

31.description: Fantastic place!  No better way to rejuvenate and refresh after a night out than to have brunch here.  The food is incredible, light yet filling, without leaving you stuffed.  The environment is soothing, clean, and very enjoyable.

34.description: I can't begin to even describe how much I love this place!  Let me bring it back about 15 years ago, when being vegetarian wasn't cool, it was damn hard to find a restaurant that had a decent selection of food, other than the lame "vegetarian-friendly salad".  Victory's Banner always had an extensive, EXTENSIVE menu of vegetarian and vegan-friendly options.  They have scrambles made with either egg or tofu, fresh house-made chai, veggie sausage or bacon, the list goes on.  Not only are their egg/tofu dishes delicious, their pancakes and french toasts are to die for.  Let me list the freaking delicious things I've gorged upon at this place: carrot pancakes, almond french toast, satisfaction promise (tofu pesto scramble, OMG), curry omelet, Steverino omelet, broccoli cheddar omelet, Greek omelet, soy sausage and Gouda omelet, pesto goat cheese omelet. The service is always wonderful and friendly, and you can even buy some of their homemade chai mix to take home with you!  Get there early, because this place gets busy.  We've even taken a few meat-loving carnivores here, and they have also fallen in love with it.  EAT HERE NOW!

16.description: One of the best, no-frills breakfast spots in the city. All vegetarian/vegan. To drink, make sure you try the homemade chai, it's incredible. I don't drink coffee and have had more than my share of chai and this is may be the best I've ever had. My favorite entree is the french toast, which is light and fluffy and amazing. I like the combo with a slice of french toast and two eggs. The egg scrambles are also popular and delicious. The place isn't too big but it's comfortable and they usually move people in and out quickly. The servers are friendly and laid back, they all are students of meditation and the philosophy permeates the environment of the restaurant, perfect for a relaxing morning brunch! Fair prices too...just go!

13.description: Breakfast at a little healthier level. Many healthy options to choose from. Loved their pesto eggs and french toast with peach butter. They have real syrup and their coffee is strong and good which was a really nice surprise for me to find here. The quantity of kids pancakes might be a bit little for a 6 year old pancakes lover. He was still hungry. But overall I found their "namaste" vibe different and so their cute decor.

11.description: Oh man, the brunch here is just out of this world. Whether you go savory or sweet you won't be disappointed. I usually go for the french toast, whatever the special is, because it's humongous. Usually it involves some concoction of granola and fruit and it's always amazing. The last time, my friend got their omelette special with had brie, apples, and some kind of chutney. I definitely snuck a few bites of that in. Their fresh squeezed juice is delicious. The staff is really nice and speaks quietly as a matter or principle, which I enjoy. It's within walking distance of my apartment so I can roll myself home after stuffing my face. I just generally say YES to Victory's Banner.

39.description: Went there before work on Sunday morning trying to find something to eat. It was Mother's Day Sunday and we were seating fairly quickly on their outdoor patio (which by the way has it's permit, for all you Chicago inspectors!) I have to admit, I was thrown off by the bio with it's stance of No Meat. I like meat. A lot. But the food was so flavorful that I did not miss meat. I ordered the The Steverino which came with caramelized onions, grilled red peppers and goat cheese and a side of potatoes (that weren't heavily salted, bonus). There was a bit too much goat cheese but overall it was really delicious. My boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito which came with a side of rice and salsa. The burrito was just oozing with a saucy goodness. He only had half of it because he didn't want to immediately pass out in a coma. It is a heavy breakfast entree. He was so happy with the food and definitely wants to come back.I'm curious about all the reviews of the chai tea. I'm going to try that and the some pancakes next time!

37.description: Victory's Banner is consistently good and inexpensive. My wife is vegan, and their options for her are excellent.

0.description: Great vegetarian/vegan brunch spot. Had the french toast, Mexican scrambled eggs, coffee and the veggie omelet with added goat cheese. Great size portions for every dish!Really enjoyed all the flavor profiles - they had great taste and spice on everything - not even the side of beans was bland!The french toast was battered lighter than I have usually have had but great since we were both very full from the rest of food. I wish the peach butter was a little peachier, but it was nice to try. Cute location and seems to be run by an Indian, so there were some little things like the upama and chai on the menu and the waitresses wearing saris that made me chuckle.Definitely want to try the chai next time around.

38.description: I'm a big meat eater, so I had my reservations. I was wrong. I got the veg bacon cheeseburger and it was awesome.

51.description: Hit or miss @ this place! Service sucks, except for the male server. The girls look tired..fed up all the time! Dunno!  The food varies depending on who is cooking! It sucks because i wanted to like this place! I'll go back but just because Orange has nothing good and kitschen or whatever is terrible!

27.description: After years of living in Chicago this really is my favorite.  Don't expect super fast service; the wait staff is all friendly but the feel of the whole place is laid back.  You can't help but be in a good mood while there.  All that aside, the food is great!  Raspberry french toast is one of my faves if you are looking for very fresh and fun.  On the healthier side, I like the eggless wonder.  Filled with veggies and pesto.  Mmm.  Every soup I've had has been a delight.  Just wish they were open more days and hours!

32.description: Dined late June 2014, 3 visitsVictory's Banner...Go. You will eat healthy foods, organic foods, and whole foods full of flavor. I was in the area for 5 days and ate here 3 times and got food to go. Yes, I am a fan. I wish Victory's Banner was here in DC area.The staff is kind and attentive. The restaurant is smallish but they accommodated my party of 10 no problem. Victory Banner always has plenty of patrons seated inside and outside, each of the 3 times I visited I was seated quickly. The foods I ordered and ate:Lemon lentil soup - divine, aromatic, delicious. So good I got it to go on another visit.Pancakes with yogurt, fresh raspberry, and homemade granola - perfect pancakes--light, tasty; a good, hearty breakfast. Loved the granola.Omelet: I made my own with spinach and mushrooms. Good omelet. Fabulous breakfast potatoes! Dense & hearty bread served as side; it was good. The same bread also came with the lentil soup.What I tasted and looooved:Breakfast Burrito: A tortilla stuffed with 2 scrambled eggs, mushroom, red onion, red peppers, gouda, black beans and sour cream. Organic salsa & brown rice on the side.I needed more days in Chicago because on my next visit I was going to order my very own Breakfast Burrito. I had tasted it on one occasion, then shared about 1/3 of one on another visit. They are big and delicious...not salty, you can taste the individual ingredients.Good eatin'Chow!food chick~~:~~Eat, drink, be merry and validate for parking (TM)

54.description: I was reluctant to go due to the vegetarian tag on their yelp listing but I'm really glad I went.  Scrambled eggs + Pesto + sun dried tomatoes = amazing.  I am stealing this idea/recipe and making it at home.

48.description: I was excited to check out Victory's Banner as I live in the neighborhood and heard it was delicious. My party of 3 walked in on a Saturday morning. They were busy but there were one or two small open tables and a party in front of us waiting to be seated. No one took our name or even said hello. The party in front of us asked one of the waitstaff a questions and she replied (not sure what the question was) and then walked past me complaining about the customer to me and rolling her eyes. After that party was seated no one came back to acknowledge me or inquire about how many were in my party etc. even though there was a 3 waitresses working right behind the front counter refilling water jugs! I kept making eye contact with one of them and she was just ignoring me. Finally someone came to say there was only a small table next to the wall but a bigger table was just about to leave and if we wanted to wait we could have that table. So we waited another 15 mins (we have now been there over 25 mins) and just as the table we were waiting for was being cleaned off another party of 3 walked in and the hostess seated them at our table! I told the hostess/waitress/water jug re-filler we were leaving and walked out. We wasted nearly 30 minutes in total! We walked over to John's Place instead and had a very lovely brunch.

44.description: Try the Pesto and Goat cheese Omelette. You will not be disappointed. Its sooo good.

24.description: One of the best, no-frills breakfast spots in the city. All vegetarian/vegan. To drink, make sure you try the homemade chai, it's incredible. I don't drink coffee and have had more than my share of chai and this is may be the best I've ever had. My favorite entree is the french toast, which is light and fluffy and amazing. I like the combo with a slice of french toast and two eggs. The egg scrambles are also popular and delicious. The place isn't too big but it's comfortable and they usually move people in and out quickly. The servers are friendly and laid back, they all are students of meditation and the philosophy permeates the environment of the restaurant, perfect for a relaxing morning brunch! Fair prices too...just go!

7.description: Not so victorious here.  Service is a bit lacking (although made up later) and the food was very much hit or mis. The trip started with the host telling me that the wait was 15-20 min. He left and came back to ask if I was still staying - as if he had expected me to leave. How inviting...It's not like I haven't waited that long before dude.  If I was in a bad mood, I would of left. I gave them a chance anyway and was punished by having to wait nearly 1/2 hour. Bummer. We then ordered and it was taken by 2 diff people. Each not knowing what the other has already asked...and my order came back wrong on top of it. Another bummer. Finally, we were seated in an area that was hit by cold air and when we asked to have to vents turned down...nothing came of. Ok...enough. Food was ok overall with kudos to the veggie burger (which my 8 yr old orders without being promoted to do so and then actually liked) and the French toast with peach butter. The other food was just plain and ok. I expected more flavor from a place that prides themselves on vegan, veggie cuisine. The rating would have been lower if the order mistake wasn't taken off my bill...which I appreciated. But not enough to make the overall trip enjoyable.

49.description: French toast was amazing! No joke. Bacon (vegan) not really my thing but I cannot say enough good things about the french toast.... literally my mouth is watering thinking about it! I wish they were open late for breakfast for dinner. :) My only complaint. Service was nice and wait was reasonable.

40.description: Really great, fresh vegetarian food.  Everything is delicious but I always order the upma (South Indian hot cereal).  The service is really friendly and the patio is a bonus.

53.description: tried this place for the first time today on a friend's recommendation. we were absolutely not sorry. she also urged us to try their homemade chai ... another resounding success! the menu is expansive and diverse. they have an amazing selection of wraps, veggie-focused burgers, as well as breakfast options and quesadillas! i went with the coconut curry tofu wrap - not overpowering, good balance of spices and flavors ... perfectly cooked tofu (an art that oddly not every veggie restaurant has perfected...)

30.description: Oh man, the brunch here is just out of this world. Whether you go savory or sweet you won't be disappointed. I usually go for the french toast, whatever the special is, because it's humongous. Usually it involves some concoction of granola and fruit and it's always amazing. The last time, my friend got their omelette special with had brie, apples, and some kind of chutney. I definitely snuck a few bites of that in. Their fresh squeezed juice is delicious. The staff is really nice and speaks quietly as a matter or principle, which I enjoy. It's within walking distance of my apartment so I can roll myself home after stuffing my face. I just generally say YES to Victory's Banner.

46.description: Victory Banner has quite a reputation to live up to! Google best brunches in Chicago and VB will absolutely pop up on some of the lists. I think what I liked most about brunching here is the atmosphere. So calm, relaxing, zen like. I didn't feel rushed, there's no pressure to do a mimosa or bloody, just enjoy a mature Sunday meal with friends. The inside is pretty small but a table for two was only a 20 minute wait or so. It looks like they have outdoor seating if Mother Nature ever blesses us with sun again. The menu is pretty long, almost overwhelming, but also humorous how they will have things with bacon and sausage even though its all soy products. Side note: ordered the soy bacon and was pleasantly surprised! How do they make it taste like bacon? Is there some sort of bacon seasoning I don't know about. I had their staple "Satisfaction-Promise". It was relatively hearty, served with toast and hash browns. The eggs looked like baby food but tasted really great - the pesto and feta stood out as the champion ingredients. I didn't care for the hash browns at first but they grew on me and I am going to guess seasoned with Old Bay? Victory Banner serves up satisfying meals, fresh and organic ingredients that are going to leave you feeling victorious!

1.description: An awesome brunch location. Arrived Sunday around noon, wasn't too busy about a 20min wait. Had the brahma burrito. It was delicious, the smoked Gouda in the burrito tasted good. And the brown rice next to it was a healthy choice. The organic salsa was devoured immediately too. Service was excellent and the theme of the restaurant provided a great insight and educational resource.

55.description: Food was great service was awesome and staff was very professional.The rest of this review is out of guilt for being a jerk. I thought I lost my phone there and was a little too mean to the staff, but they were professional, confident and nice... then I found my phone at home. They were nice to even me, the rude customer. I'm very sorry, thanks for being wonderful.
