9.description: The Neatloaf Dinner is to die for. It's my favorite here. Customer service is great. I don't like their omelettes or wraps; in both cases they just have bad taste to me, not sure why. I only tried ea. once and wasn't my taste at all. Their burgers are good as well as there vegan soups.  I have never tried the pancakes or any sweet stuff. I always want to order a hot cocoa or chocolate buy they don't carry rice or almond milk, so can't have it. Soy milk i guess they have it. I always wonder how a place like this doesn't offer other choices of milk but isn't a big deal. It's worth trying the place.

26.description: What's not to love about this spot? It is always bathed in sunlight, the food is original and delicious, the cult members that work here are wonderfully pleasant and they never mention their cult like activity, they are open early, there is always an open table, and there is an abundance of free street parking. And, did I mention that the food is damn tasty? Order the Satisfaction Promise!

25.description: My go-to Roscoe Village brunch spot (unless they're packed, which is sometimes the case!). They're so accommodating, whether you're vegetarian, vegan, dairy-free, etc. and the food is DELICIOUS. My favorite is the Steverino omelette with caramelized onions, roasted red peppers and goat cheese. The potatoes and bread that come with are divine. I love this place. LOVE.

12.description: I can't begin to even describe how much I love this place!  Let me bring it back about 15 years ago, when being vegetarian wasn't cool, it was damn hard to find a restaurant that had a decent selection of food, other than the lame "vegetarian-friendly salad".  Victory's Banner always had an extensive, EXTENSIVE menu of vegetarian and vegan-friendly options.  They have scrambles made with either egg or tofu, fresh house-made chai, veggie sausage or bacon, the list goes on.  Not only are their egg/tofu dishes delicious, their pancakes and french toasts are to die for.  Let me list the freaking delicious things I've gorged upon at this place: carrot pancakes, almond french toast, satisfaction promise (tofu pesto scramble, OMG), curry omelet, Steverino omelet, broccoli cheddar omelet, Greek omelet, soy sausage and Gouda omelet, pesto goat cheese omelet. The service is always wonderful and friendly, and you can even buy some of their homemade chai mix to take home with you!  Get there early, because this place gets busy.  We've even taken a few meat-loving carnivores here, and they have also fallen in love with it.  EAT HERE NOW!

59.description: Let me just say that the wait for this place is killer, and it takes a bit of time to get someone's attention. It's the only reason I'm subtracting one star, because otherwise, I really did love this place. ALSO: You MUST have your whole party here with you in order to sit down. They will not seat you unless your whole party is here. A+ for the bottomless chai. YAAAAS. I can't even finish all of it, but it's delicious and it's only a dollar more for bottomless! I had three or four cups, so that should tell you how much I liked it. (Especially on a cold winter day!) I'm pretty sure it's all vegan? I mean, I probably shouldn't have ordered the side of fake bacon-- as it looked like dog treats. But that was my own fault. I ate it all up anyway because I love fake meat products. Sue me. I got the curry omelette, which was pretty interesting. It was pretty good, though the curry was pretty sweet. I liked it enough though to eat the entire thing. The side potatoes are great, and pretty flavorful. My friend had the french toast and I really liked it. I liked the orange butter that comes with it, and the maple syrup. I wish I had gotten that, but I was in the mood for something a little more savory. Her boyfriend got the cinnamon bun french toast or something like that? It was sort of like a french toast cinnabun and it was very good. I would definitely eat here again, were it not for the wait.As for the stuff that addresses the "spiritual enlightenment" blahblahblah, it is definitely a huge theme here-- but I never felt like they pushed me to buy anything other than the food. I really like it here-- just wish it was easier to get to!

21.description: I love Victory's Banner. Sure it's moderately culty but still delicious.

17.description: Totally delicious! The pesto and goat cheese omelet did not disappoint. The bread served with breakfast tasted like it was fresh from the bakery this morning. I will definitely be back here:)

10.description: Love this place, they have great fake bacon for omelettes/scrambles and the employees are all so nice.  I do wish they offered a tempah option thought.

5.description: My good friend just moved here recently and I came down to visit him on a Saturday morning to check out his place and get some breakfast. Of course, when I asked him where we were going he had no clue as we are walking down Roscoe. Boom, Victory's Banner.Not knowing a thing about the place, we come to find its vegetarian, which for two 6 3", 220 lb dudes like us, this would normally be an issue. But it's good to cleanse the body of the meat sweats every once in a while, and Victory's Banner does not disappoint when it comes to quality products used. I also agree with old Yelper pal, Colleen C.'s review about this place having a holistic vibe to it. I had the breakfast burrito. The gouda used really made this veggie burrito taste great. That and the organic salsa. Everything from the fresh veggies used to the brown rice on the side speaks that the food is made with love and a health conscious effort. The coffee was uniquely tasting, very strong and I didn't see the bottom of my cup while drinking perhaps 4-5 cups. Service was excellent, although it wasn't all that busy while we were there either. I will definitely be back, great place.

3.description: Still my favorite !  Victory's Banner is my go to breakfast, brunch, lunch spot in Chicago.  The only issue I have is that they're not open for dinner!  Absolutely love the menu choices, the service, the atmosphere, and hands down, the best chai I've ever had anywhere.  I've been coming here since 1998 and it has remained my favorite, without fail.   The owner Pradhan is a pretty awesome guy too - stop in and try the raspberry french toast and the smoked gouda and faux sausage omelette (I always add spinach).  Great for groups, or first dates. :-)   If you want a healthy and fulfilling dining experience, this is your place!

35.description: Spot On. Great service, bright peaceful space, flavorful thoughtful food. I'm sold. Sad to have only first come here a month before moving to Japan, but there are still 30 days left for eating in the US.Southwest Veggie burger, chilaquiles, Satisfaction Eggs, and homemade chai...all so well done. Took family from small towns here and it was incredibly approachable vegetarian, even for them from the land of cows and pigs.

19.description: This review is for the horrid service we experienced a few weeks ago when we went to Victory's Banner for breakfast on a weekday. The food was honestly forgettable, I can't even remember what I had. My husband had some sort of scramble which he said was okay.Perhaps our server was having an "off" day (as a former server, I know that these days can happen and sometimes you take it out on your tables) but she was nothing but flat-out rude from the get-go. My husband had a few substitutions he wanted for his dish, and as he was explaining this to the server she held her finger up in his face and said brusquely "uh, can you GIVE me a minute?" and scribbled on her pad. These were not complicated subs. It was one ingredient substitution and one ingredient he didn't want. This was nothing out of the ordinary, and nowhere on the menu do they say "no substitutions."So, we place our order but I was just completely soured on this woman. For a place that's trying to send across a peaceful, Zen-like vibe, this woman was whatever the opposite of that vibe is. She then proceeded to disappear for about 20 minutes, during which our food was sitting up on the counter under the heat lamps. We were this close to getting up and just getting the damn food ourselves instead of waiting for this woman to reappear.Reappear she did, eventually, reeking of cigarettes, and dropped our food off. No apologies, no asking if we needed anything else, just dropped the food at the table and walked away. I try to make it a practice to give each server I encounter the benefit of the doubt, particularly if it's clearly slammed in the restaurant, if the place seems understaffed, or if we have a large party or complicated orders. All these factors tend to rub servers the wrong way or put them in a bad mood. I can even accept neglectful service as long as the server recognizes it eventually, or even gives an explanation. None of these factors were in play, and this woman just ruined what could have been a pleasant experience.

28.description: I come to Chicago at least once a year to visit family and Victory's Banner!  Bright, cheerful atmosphere, friendly service and vegetarian food that is amazing!  I am not a vegetarian but could become one if the cook at Victory's Banner could live in my house!  Everything I have tried there is so flavorful and prepared with care and tastes like very high quality ingredients are used.My family has told me they have tried the "other" breakfast joints on Roscoe St. when there was too long a wait at Victory's Banner and none compared to their quality.  So go here if you want to give your senses and taste buds a real treat! It's the best there is and worth any wait time indeed!

45.description: Who'd have thought that 'buckwheat waffle' is something that I would (1) try at all (2) go back again and again for it. Fantastic stuff is it!Their other veggie/vegan options are pretty darn good.Do not try their uppama or whatever they call it. Chefs at Victory's Banner, take these from a South Indian who KNOWS how to make upma (it is a South Indian dish after all) 1. Dry roast the rava (cream of wheat) before cooking it2. Do not bring the upma to a porridge consistency, it has to be of a consistency that allows it to be moulded (look up how it is served on google)3. Please add salt, a little more salt will not kill the dish. Please stop making it like it's something you'd serve to someone who doesn't care about how it looks, tastes and feels. I say this to you so frankly because I do love your restaurant, you all do a great job! Big thumbs up on the sarees!

33.description: We had the award winning French toast with that amazing peach butter and one of the omelette specials, which I can't remember specifically...I do remember that it was crazy delicious!

43.description: This is one of my all time favorite brunch spots. I love the hippie, peaceful vibe and the vegetarian food is satisfying and fresh tasting. My favorites are the peach butter French toast and the satisfaction promise omelette. The French toast has to be the lightest fluffiest bread I've ever tasted with a light sweetness from the peach butter that just melts in your mouth. The omelette is really delicious and fresh and comes with perfectly cooked potatoes and delicious whole grain bread. Definitely satisfied every time!

2.description: Good brunch option with indoor and outdoor seating options.  They have a signature french toast which was pretty simple with peach butter, but it was well executed and good.  They have real maple syrup on the table.I had their egg scramble with pesto, sundried tomatoes, potatoes on the side, and Red Hen bakery toast that had an awesome crust.  Enjoyed the dish and will be back.

18.description: Need to get their front of house together. Waited 20 minutes without being told how long the wait, but a table is paying & then we would be seated. They seated someone else & no table for 4 in sight. We had kids & live in the neighborhood. Pissed. We left & went to sbux.

41.description: I'm bias because this place is like my cheers. I love the staff they make it worth coming. The food is fresh and tasty. They grow a great deal of their own food. They have fresh flowers on the table from their flower shop next door.

52.description: I was looking for a place for our last breakfast in Chicago before heading home and was more than intrigued by the reviews on Victory's Banner. I am by no means a vegetarian, but the idea of having breakfast listening to a sitar served by a waitress in a sari sounded indeed like a great idea.As I'm following the GPS' directions, I kept wondering if I had the right address because it looked like we were in a residential area but as we got to the address, we saw the blue awning and the yellow cursive-written name on it. We found a free parking space which was flabbergasting considering the previous parking adventures. It was still quite early and this might have explained that. We were warmly greeted by a young woman wearing a sari. There were just a couple of tables were occupied so we were able to choose one of our liking.While waiting for someone to take our order, a young man came and dropped a book and a couple of toys next to my son. He introduced himself as Bobby and was really friendly and interested by our family's origins. (My wife is from Trinidad and from Indian descent). The menu was pretty varied but I went for a sausage and Gouda omelet. My son went for the pancakes and a side order of sausage, my daughter for the chocolate chip waffle but my wife went for the Uppama. According to the menu, it's "a savory hot cereal with peas, tomatoes and onions, served with coconut chutney and yogurt." The kids and I got our food pretty quickly but the Uppama was taking time and it so happened that with Bobby's interest in our family, he forgot to put in the order. When he realized what had happened, he came to apologize and said it would be on the house to make up for his mistake. It was finally served and it was most interesting but the chutney was absolutely delicious. My son did not like his sausage and we found out afterwards that it wasn't meat but a veggie-based sausage (of course!) . The place filled up pretty quickly a sign that the place was worthy of its reputation and there was a line already building up at the door. As we were getting ready to leave, Bobby came with a bag and apologized for being busy and for not having the time to come and wish me a proper happy birthday so he put a muffin and a candle in a bag. It was a nice and unexpected gesture.Although they said the Uppama would not be charged to our bill, it was. I guess the information was not properly relayed but we didn't ask for it in the first place so we were fine with the omission.The staff was really top notch, prices under $10/person and great food. What is there not to like from this place?

50.description: If you're a french toast fan this is the place to be.  Absolutely outstanding!  Make sure to order it well done - the bread is so wonderfully thick it sometimes comes out mushy in the middle.  Larger menu.  Pancakes are excellent as well, along with their many fabulous egg dishes.  I'm partial to the Steverino with Caramelized onions, grilled red peppers and goat cheese.  Yum!  Solid organic coffee and fresh juices.  Just make note this is a vegetarian establishment - so you'll have to BYOB (bring your own bacon!)Overall 5 stars for food - but 4 stars for inconsistent service.  Sometimes fabulous, sometimes you kinda feel like you're bothering them...

4.description: I really enjoy their food, especially their side of potatoes.  Sometimes, the service is a bit slow, but I think it's worth the wait.  The owner is very friendly and always stops by to make sure you are satisfied.  Be sure to check with them, because they do close for retreats and have recently changed some of their hours.

6.description: Very nice brunch spot in Roscoe Village. This is a vegetarian place that also offers many vegan options. I enjoyed the pumpkin cheesecake French toast with a side of scrambled eggs, and it was delicious. All of my friends were happy with their food as well. Service was very friendly, though the food took a while coming out and it took about 10 minutes before everyone received their dishes. I never set foot in the restaurant because we sat on the nice outdoor patio. All in all, it was a very good experience and I will definitely return.

22.description: Victory's Banner is INCREDIBLE! I salivate even writing this review. Their Raspberry French Toast is to die for. I never order French Toast but this is amazing. Everything is homemade here. The Satisfaction Promise is another favorite. Order whatever you want here. You won't be disappointed!

15.description: I'm bias because this place is like my cheers. I love the staff they make it worth coming. The food is fresh and tasty. They grow a great deal of their own food. They have fresh flowers on the table from their flower shop next door.

57.description: This is my favorite brunch place in all of Chicago. Everything gets an A+, from the excellent veggie omelettes (try the pesto & goat cheese, to die for!) to the award-winning French toast. They also serve bottomless cups of the best housemade chai I've ever tasted. The lunch menu is great too (I love their Bliss Burger) and during the summertime, the patio is perfect for soaking up sun and people-watching on Roscoe. As a vegetarian and a brunch lover, I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

20.description: The Neatloaf Dinner is to die for. It's my favorite here. Customer service is great. I don't like their omelettes or wraps; in both cases they just have bad taste to me, not sure why. I only tried ea. once and wasn't my taste at all. Their burgers are good as well as there vegan soups.  I have never tried the pancakes or any sweet stuff. I always want to order a hot cocoa or chocolate buy they don't carry rice or almond milk, so can't have it. Soy milk i guess they have it. I always wonder how a place like this doesn't offer other choices of milk but isn't a big deal. It's worth trying the place.

36.description: One of my favorite brunch places in the city!  Really peaceful energy, cozy little cafe, delish peach butter and challah french toast, yum!

14.description: Dined late June 2014, 3 visitsVictory's Banner...Go. You will eat healthy foods, organic foods, and whole foods full of flavor. I was in the area for 5 days and ate here 3 times and got food to go. Yes, I am a fan. I wish Victory's Banner was here in DC area.The staff is kind and attentive. The restaurant is smallish but they accommodated my party of 10 no problem. Victory Banner always has plenty of patrons seated inside and outside, each of the 3 times I visited I was seated quickly. The foods I ordered and ate:Lemon lentil soup - divine, aromatic, delicious. So good I got it to go on another visit.Pancakes with yogurt, fresh raspberry, and homemade granola - perfect pancakes--light, tasty; a good, hearty breakfast. Loved the granola.Omelet: I made my own with spinach and mushrooms. Good omelet. Fabulous breakfast potatoes! Dense & hearty bread served as side; it was good. The same bread also came with the lentil soup.What I tasted and looooved:Breakfast Burrito: A tortilla stuffed with 2 scrambled eggs, mushroom, red onion, red peppers, gouda, black beans and sour cream. Organic salsa & brown rice on the side.I needed more days in Chicago because on my next visit I was going to order my very own Breakfast Burrito. I had tasted it on one occasion, then shared about 1/3 of one on another visit. They are big and delicious...not salty, you can taste the individual ingredients.Good eatin'Chow!food chick~~:~~Eat, drink, be merry and validate for parking (TM)

12.description: Frankie & Johnnie are the best!  I went here for my wedding invites and Frankie was so helpful in finding eco-friendly/swanky invites. They are *beautiful*.  The process was really simple and they are so easy to work with.  There's tons of other gifts and paper-goods in the shop.  Highly recommended for any of your papery-needs.

7.description: We have worked with Frankie and Johnny for so many years!  they always do a stupendous job.  My wife and I had our wedding invitations done, and they really walked us through the whole process and spent the time she needed with her to make a  decision, for me it was whatever she wanted ;-)Great place for all you custom invitations and small gift needs

3.description: Frankie and Johnnie helped us with our wedding invitations and I cannot say enough good things about them. The idea of picking an invitation out of the hundreds of choices overwhelmed me but Frankie listened and pulled out what she thought would be my top 3 books. I found ones I liked then within 15 minutes. She also was great about eloquently wording everything, another thing that overwhelmed me a bit. Then once they came in both Frankie & Johnnie sat with me and made an envelope addressing train. We addressed all 100 envelopes the day we got them and within a couple hours. Plus, they helped me figure out how to send invitations over seas, which was super helpful. Our invitations were gorgeous and we got a lot of compliments. But they were also great as a resource in general with the wedding. They had great feedback about venues, people and details that I wouldn't have thought about but really made a big difference. PS - We also got stationary from them with our new name. Really nice quality and great design for a good price.

1.description: I was very excited to work with Village Paperie and Gifts after seeing their work and reading the great reviews. However, my experience with them has not lived up to the reviews I read! I emailed the business on Jan 11th, 18th and 26th about purchasing custom items. After each email, I get a prompt reply (within a day or two) but no information to help me place an order. I keep getting a message about how they are waiting on pricing information from a vendor. Yes, but in the meantime you could get all other pertinent information or something?!? It is now Feb 11th and the last contact I had with the business was over two weeks ago. I am so disappointed in the service that I joined Yelp to voice my displeasure. I was really looked forward to the product. But it seems that will have to go with someone else.Buyers beware. It seems like they are great if you can get their attention.

2.description: Frankie and Johnny are the best!!! They offer so much more than just invitations. They helped us with welcome bags, escort cards, programs, save-the-dates, thanks you cards, custom table number cards and even personalized bathroom napkins!! On top of that they are easy to work with, but know exactly when to step in and give some direction. These sister's will make sure that your event has special touches that make it feel like you. We will be using them for any invitations, announcements or cards going forward!!

9.description: Best go to neighborhood storefront for unique, memorable gifts.  Customer service is over the top and owners are in tune with recommending great gift ideas for births, baptisms, birthdays, etc.  Fun place to stop in for not the norm birthday cards and gifts no matter what age.  Everything purchased from Village Paperie & Gifts has been very well received by recipients.

10.description: We had save the date cards made here a few years ago. They came out gorgeous! We worked with Frankie.on them. She was so kind and friendly. Great shop. I buy a lot of hair accessories and hats there for my 6 month old:)

13.description: We were excited to use Village Paperie for our wedding Save-the-Dates, invitations, and such, but it did not turn out so great.  We had to proofread our Save-the-Dates several times as there were many errors.  Also, the turn around time for the proofs took a lot longer than we were told.  Once we received our Save-the-Dates, there was still an error.  After our frustration with this place we decided to go Papyrus when we realized that the exact same product was marked up at Village Paperie.  Although the store has cute products to purchase, I would not use them or recommend them for wedding invitations and such.

16.description: Village Paperie was a life saver for our wedding!  We live around the corner so we really wanted to patronize local businesses on Roscoe.  I am so glad we did as Frankie and Johnnie went above and beyond in helping us with invitations, place cards and programs!  They directed us to an awesome invite that was in our price range.  Frankie knows those invite books!  We received so many compliments on the invites.  It was the place cards and programs though that was a life saver.  We tried the DIY place cards and after spending an entire day trying to do them myself, called the ladies.  Do not try to do place cards yourself!  You will regret it.  VP was able to print them out in 48 hours on beautiful paper that was reminscent of our invites.  They also did a lovely job on the programs and turned them around asap.  They also have all those little things you don't know you need until you are getting married--an endless supply of thank you notes for one!  Give them a try and you'll know why everyone loves Roscoe Village.

17.description: I never write Yelp reviews, but wanted to take a moment to write this one because Village Paperie and Gifts absolutely deserves it. In an attempt to not have to order personalized napkins on line, I called Village Paperie to find out about pricing, their ideas, etc. Frankie was extremely helpful, personable and professional on the phone. So as not to not waste my time, she gave me the prices for the various types of napkins. Low and behold when I did all of my price comparisons, they came in right in line with the lowest priced napkin that I found online. If I had to choose between ordering on line and ordering from a local Chicago business, I choose order from a local Chicago business, especially when the price is totally comparable. Not to mention that I get to work with the knowledgeable and kind Frankie. Frankie was patient and had great ideas. She followed up with me later on that day because she did some more digging and was able to match up the fonts on the guest towels and cocktail napkins, I appreciated that!! Though I have yet to receive the napkins, my experience with Frankie and Village Paperie thus far has truly been top notch.  I am also going to order the table place cards from Village Paperie as well. They have so many cute samples to look at and I found one that I loved! Thank you Frankie! You made me feel at ease and not like I was being ripped off and I know our napkins and place cards will turn out great. I will be referring you to my sis and friends for help with their invitations and other wedding needs!

15.description: Frankie is awesome.  We ordered our wedding invitations from her.  She is absolutely a true professional and a pleasure to work with.  She even helped us stuff our envelopes!

0.description: Big Fan of Frankie! This is a great neighborhood store that carries all kinds of unique gifts!Frankie helped me out with all my Christmas gifts since I don't like going into the shopping malls.  She suggested a monogram money clip for my husband, and I got a few hand made headbands for my daughter that are a hit! I picking a few appetizer platter for my Secret Santa party, who doesn't need cute appetizer patter!  I was so happy that Frankie wrapped the gifts and I was ready for the Christmas Parties!   My husband and I have gone back to order Monogram gifts and can't wait to see them.  So if your in Roscoe Village I recommend you go see her.

5.description: We stopped in on a whim and saw some samples and ended up buying our first personalized stationary (a set for each of us and a set for both).  They turned out beautiful and I'm sure we will be using their services again.  Very helpful, and a LOT of samples to look at.

11.description: Frankie & Johnnie are the best. They are so helpful. They go above and beyond what you would expect when you are making personalized Christmas cards, invitations, personalized gifts, etc.  They are wonderful to work with. We are very lucky to have them in Roscoe Village. They contribute so much to our little community here in the village within the city. They have Elmo, Rudolph, the Easter bunny and many functions for holidays at their store. I know I always can find a gift and great cards at their store.

8.description: If I could give this place 6 stars I would. We are working with Frankie and Johnny to create our wedding invitations. They are friendly, flexible, funny as hell and very informative. If you have any invitation needs, I highly recommend them.

4.description: I never write yelp reviews, but I am so frustrated with this place.  If you are a busy bride and don't want people wasting your time then don't go here.My fiancé, mom and I went in to look at wedding invitations. I so wanted to get my invitations from this place, the store was close to my house and my fiancé even agreed to look at invitations.We picked out some different invitations and Frankie told  is she would get back to us in a few days with a quote.  I never heard from her again, I could email her but why? If she doesn't have the descency to get back to me then she obviously doesn't need my business.

14.description: Frankie and Johnny are the best! I ordered a customized sign for a holiday gift - it was a hit!  They were so prompt, the prices are always fair and the product is always perfect. Perfect place for a hostess gift, baby gift, teacher gifts, and the funniest cards ever!

6.description: I did a terrible job when planning for invitations.  I wasn't worried about it, and was convinced I was going to just 'buy them online'.  Advice: that's a terrible idea - you need a real person for invitations.  The time and energy they saved me would be worth it alone.  In the end, I had a much better invitation, and learned a lot from Frankie and Johnnie - not just about invitations - they know a lot about weddings.I was so panicked before I met with them.  They calmed me down, but were realistic.  They made it work for me so my invitations still went out in time, and I loved them!  I felt that many vendors are great with you until you sign a contract or agree to pay them.  Frankie and Johnnie are with me until the end, and I love them for it.  I plan to go to them for all my paper and custom gifts needs, and I encourage you to as well - you won't regret it!

0.description: It would be very hard to get excited about Kwik Mart, but yet I find myself going in there often enough to appreciate its existence. Pretty much all they offer is a small booze selection, an inexpensive and random assortment of snacks, and then of course the obligatory few items of food or whatever that happened to fall off a truck and get put up on the shelves to fill the space. Pick up a few things for 25 or 50 cents each and then get out kwikly.

12.description: My daughter is getting ready for prom, started tanning 2 weeks ago, 4 spray-ons later, she's still as pale as the day she walked in. So I decide to call and speak to the facility manager, find out what the problem may be?Imagine my surprise when I can barely get the receptionist to give me the manager's first name. I ask when the manager will be in next, "will she be in today," and again met with resistance of the receptionist. I ask the owner's name and she says Don, "when is Don going to be in?", her response, Never, he doesn't come in...,you will have to call the corporate office. "oh, so this is a corporate owned store?" well then can you tell me who is the district manager and how i can contact him?" ....and ms. receptionist can't give me that info either, referring me to a corporate phone number.So i call corporate now it's 11:15 a.m., you would expect someone to answer the phone at some extension? NOPE! Every extension is meet with voicemail, including customer service! I call back 10 minutes later, same thing. I call back a 3rd time, only to be met with recorded phone messages to leave a name and number and someone will call back. What kind of company has no corporate employees? This is the worst customer service oriented company that i have come a cross in a long time.  If you decide to go there and have a problem, be sure that you will not get satisfaction, because it appears that this particular company only has face people, who are inexperienced themselves in resolving customer issues.Believe me when i say, walk away and walk fast!!

7.description: I don't know where to start.  I don't feel 1 star does my experience justice.  There should be no stars associated with what I just went through.  I truly hope by reading this I am saving people.So, I went to Ultimate Exposure Tanning on Western Ave.  I just wanted to get in and out and do a quick 10 minutes in the stand-up as we are leaving soon to go to Mexico and they are right next to my house.  I should have figured things would go bad when I saw people standing and waiting very impatiently when I arrived.  I looked past it and decided to join this disgruntled crowd.  I stood in line and waiting for about 20 minutes as Adriana (lady at the counter) was attempting very unsuccessfully to help ONE customer.  She kept saying over and over, "I am so sorry; my manager said I can't call her on her day off."  She also indicated this was the first time that she had the whole store to herself.  Well, as you can imagine the line just got longer and longer.  She continued to help the same one customer for a very long time while others kept waiting.This was starting to get very painful to watch Adriana struggle.  I mean PAINFUL!  Finally she gave in and tried to call her manager.  Guess what? No answer!  That's the best way to run a store???  Have one of your employees who is new and has never done this on her own be by herself, and tell her not to call you no matter what because it is your day off.  Then when she does call, ignore it.  Wow!  What a great manager!So Adriana continued to struggle helping the one customer while people kept walking in.  I can't physically describe how painful this was to watch her struggle.  I would maybe compare it to being a Carlos Marmol fan, or watching the Bulls give up a 12 point lead to the Heat with 3 minutes left in Game 5 of the Western Conference Finals.  I just kept my head down and crossed my fingers for her.  Then about 25 minutes in she finally fixed the problem. "Hallelujah!"  Our prayers were answered.  Now we can get everyone through this line, right?So finally I got to the front and asked her for 10 minutes in the stand-up.  Adriana asked me to fill out the new customer form and get out my ID.  So, I of course tried to get this done as quickly as possible.  Unfortunately while I was in the middle of filling out the form, another customer had an issue.  Wow!Here we go again.  Now she had another problem.  The pain started again.  It was awful!  So once again the line started to build up and she tried to help one person unsuccessfully over and over.  We also heard the same story.  " I am so sorry!"  This is my first time by myself and my manager said not to bother her on her day off.  I was stunned.  I really thought at this point I was on candid camera or something.  I honestly looked around for cameras, or Ashton to pop out and say it was all a joke.It was about 40 minutes into my lovely visit.  I was waiting with my filled out form just to do 10 minutes in the stand up.  In the 40 minutes that I had been there Adriana helped like 4 people.  I finally just walked out.  I know I was next and I know I had my form ready.  When asked where I was going, I said don't worry I won't be back.  Everyone chuckled; surprised I didn't have many followers.I am sorry to write such a bad review especially because I feel it was not Adriana's fault, but the fault of a bad manager.  I felt everyone had to know how bad my experience was.  The only way I would ever consider going back is if I received a written notice that the manager was fired and this would never happen again.  Until then, I won't be back and neither will anyone I know that tans.

3.description: Bar None the WORST customer service I have dealt with in years!!!I have been a customer of Ultimate Exposure for over 10 years.  I pay a very steep rate of $34.99/month which is charged on the 1st of each month.  On November 1st, 2014, I visited the Roscoe Village location (surprised it was open as they never honor their posted store hours - see other reviews too) and attempted to update my credit card information with the new expiration date at which time I was informed a $10 declination fee would be charged because when they attempted to run the credit card thru at 5 am that same day, it was rejected due to the expiration date of 10/2014.  After informing "Gulisio", I refuse to pay the fee and would like to speak to a manager.  I was informed there was no manager on site at which time I asked for the telephone number to the Ultimate Exposure corporate office.  "Gulisio" informed me she was not authorized to give out the number to the corporate office and asked for my name and number and that someone from corporate would have to contact me.  I was very suspicious of this protocol and for good reason, because after 10 days, no one contacted me.  On November 10th, I re-contacted the salon and spoke with "Katy" who insured me the district manager would immediately be notified and that she would contact me that afternoon/evening.  Again, that NEVER happened.  I, once again, re-contacted the salon on November 13th and spoke with "Kelsy" who was as nice and apologetic as can be.  "Kelsy" gave me the number to the corporate office which is located in Melrose Park and informed me the point of contact was Gina, who serves as the district manager.  I contacted Gina at the number provided and after apprizing her of everything that has transpired over the past two weeks and how I have been a customer for over 10 years, Gina informed me there was nothing she would do for me.  Gina stated this happens all the time and she was not willing to waive the $10 charge.  I then asked Gina who above her I could speak with about the matter at which time she informed me I was out of luck as she is the highest level supervisor that would address this matter.  I then asked Gina what about the 675 points I still have and Gina told me I was out of luck and there would be no refund issued.  The way this has been handled has been a complete nightmare.  The staff as a whole are completely incompetent and ignorant (with the exception of Kelsy)I will make sure I let all my family members and friends know how this was handled with complete lack of professionalism, primarily with that of Gina.  She is a disgrace to this company and her not willing to waive a $10 service fee (the salon's error by the way - as i came in on the 1st) will cost them hundreds, if not thousands, of dollars in the long run.STAY AWAY from this place!  I wish I could give it ZERO or NEGATIVE stars!

1.description: Nice facility and free parking @ this strip mall. It's never been too crowded & love that they're always having promotions. I got 3 months of free tanning for 3 months of membership.

2.description: In March of 2013, I had bought a month of tanning full price at Ultimate Exposure in Berwyn. Fast forward to this March and I went to Roscoe to use the groupon I bought. I got in, no big deal, and tanned there a few times. Today I went back again and the guy told me that my account is on hold for $32 from the Berwyn location - and I accrued this charge LAST YEAR!here's my problem: How come it wasn't on hold when I came in to tan on my groupon a few weeks ago? How come Berwyn never billed me for this or communicated it to me in some way? How come Roscoe didn't tell me I owed money when I began my groupon?This is bad communication, bad policies, and bad business. I will never be back to Ultimate Exposure and I hope they get their $h!t together and figure out their billing for the next customers who come in. But...after seeing all the reviews on this place, I'm not so sure this will happen. Apparently they don't really care about customer satisfaction!

9.description: Ive yet to have a super bad experience, everyone's always very nice, friendly, and knowledgeable

10.description: About two years ago I was in a bed at the Ultimate Exposure on Irving Park in the Norridge area when behind the face panel part of  my bed started on fire--yes FIRE! After jumping up, unplugging the bed, running out and the next day calling HQ  I was given free tans--like a fool I took them and never used that bed again.Well just recently I was at the one on Western and not only is it a Friday night, it's also nice out and people are getting spring fever and getting their tan on. I walk in and there is one 18 year old(IF she's that old) behind the desk very obviously completely overwhelmed by all the people in there.  I just went about paying for my 12minute Monster Bronzer and about 5 minutes into my tanning session I hear a loud BOOM! I open my eyes to see that the panel that protects you from the bulbs has popped out of its track and is about to fall on me. I jump up, get dressed and when I walk out of the room there are 10 people standing in line.  I apologize for cutting explain to the girl what just happened and SHE completely panics and it on the verge of tears--it's NOT her store, she doesn't know the managers #, she is all a flutter and I find myself consoleing her.I leave... call HQ AGAIN! They call me back and offer me FREE TANS! I explain to the girl I probably won't be tanning anytime soon and she still gave me the points and offered me the suggestion to try spray tanning and cut me a check for what I had spent for the tan I didn't get to finish.I also explained to her that this VERY young, inexperienced girl should not have been left alone in a tanning salon on Friday night when it wasn't even the usual store she works in to begin with. In general from what I have seen Ultimate Exposure is one cluster*mess* after another. teenagers with no proper training left alone on busy nights who don't even know how to handle an "issue" let alone god for bid an emergency. It's all very disappointing and ridiculous. They really need to re-evaluate their training process.oh and here's a two for:the nail place connected to it is THE WORST nail salon EVER--do NOT get your nails done there!

13.description: I'm admittedly not much of a fake baker, but I have a wedding to go to this weekend and haven't had time during the sunny hours of the day to lay out.  I chose to go here since they had a 7 day free offer, which was the best of the offers I saw from tanning salons in the area.  I was pleased to find staff members not sitting around texting, as LA Tan tends to be known for, but definitely didn't appreciate the upsell. Honesty in advertising is really important to me, so I wasn't too pleased about paying $17 for the 7 days, and not being allowed to use the excellerator I always use.  I understand they have their company policies....it just made for a less than idea experience.  That said, the beds have really good cool air circulation, so I give it 2 stars :)

16.description: I dont even want to give this place 1 star, in fact I want to give them negative stars. Let me start by saying if you hold more then one account here, make sure you get rid of the one you don't use or they you run the risk of the company charging your old account (like if you were under 18 and under your parents had to sign you up). I decided to sign up again, being 22 under my account. The location copied my credit card and I thought everything was great, but boy was I wrong. Somehow, this location got ahold of my parents checking account, which I think they took from my old tanning account, which would be called FRAUD, and began taking money out to pay my sunless tanning fee. When we confronted them and asked how the heck they got my parents checking account number,  they said I went in and verbally provided them with my parents checking account (without a check and without their names) to pay for it, yet they also copied down MY credit card to MY account. First of all, obviously a tanning company does not accept payment via check, and secondly, verbally?! I think not. When we talked to the company manager she was very short, acted like I was stupid, and constantly put me on hold. In the end, they refunded my parents and put the money onto my account, giving me 2 months to pay it off. No apologies for embarrassing me in front of my family and bank that my parents had gone into to talk about suspicious activity. She also made sure to point out that this case had to be settled once she refunded my parents. Sound suspicious, yeah I think so! To make a long story short, DO NOT GO TO ULTIMATE EXPOSURE, the people are rude, and they obviously do not know how to control their finances.

17.description: I know tanning is so bad for you, but we all need a little color in the winter. I've been to this Ultimate Exposure before and like it- the beds are clean which is most important!

15.description: I like the place, staff is nice. But not happy that I joined unlimited tanning for 25.00 per month.They are the crappy beds and stand up ones. Then 2 weeks later they raised the price to 29.99. Whatever I paid it and didn't complain about the 5 dollar increase. But they just raised it again another 3 dollars. I've only been going there for 4 months. So it looks like they raise the price every 2 months. And this time they didn't even tell me. Cancelling my membership today.

0.description: The beds are just fine, but that's where the good experience ends.  The staff is incompetent at best.  My favorite line?  "These beds don't have burning rays, they only have tanning rays."  Really?! Then why did I end up with a minor burn... um, because its a tanning bed.  They all burn you.  They are fake sun rays.  You can get burned from them.  I actually had 3 different employees tell me that as I progressed to the stronger beds. STOP TELLING PEOPLE YOUR MOST EXPENSIVE BEDS WON'T OR CAN'T BURN! IT'S FALSE, MISLEADING AND JUST MAKES YOUR EMPLOYEES SOUND DUMB!Also, I ordered a monthlong plan and was informed (apparently on the 31st day) that it expired.  (Would have been nice information to have when I went for my last session, so I could make other plans)  I was tanning in prep for my wedding, so I only needed 7 more days of tanning, or 3 sessions.  They offered me the "deal" of $25 per session or I could just  purchase another month. When I told them my honeymoon meant I would only be able to use 2 weeks of that month, she suggested "well, it would still be cheaper than paying $75 for three sessions."  Um, yeah - 'ya think?  I informed her that $25 a session was OUTRAGEOUS, asked if she had lost her mind, walked out and promptly went to a non-chain tanning company, which I've given five stars.

5.description: This place really sucks!  The employees have all been very nice, but this place sucks.  I bought a Groupon for 10 gold-level tans.  Yah, I had read the reviews of multiple locations of UE and knew it wasn't going to be the greatest experience ever, but figured for $30, I'd give it a whirl.  Well, the reviews were right.  I have never tanned in a worse level-one tanning bed EVER.  I think it was probably the first bed ever made...EVER!  The 1980s called and they want their tanning bed back.  It rattles and clunks every time I use it.  It's horrid and besides that, I barely get tan.  So yah, not great.  And to add insult to injury, today I wanted to tan so I rearranged my normal Saturday morning routine and did my grocery shopping later than usual.  The plan was to get my groceries at Mariano's, which is in the same shopping center as UE, and then go over and tan real quick.  I pulled up to UE at 8:55 am.  I waited until 9:10 am and the place never opened.  I know the place is supposed to open at 9 am on Saturdays.  I tanned at 9 am last Saturday, the sign on the door says 9 am and the website says 9 am.  WTF?  Two other girls were waiting with me.  After 10 minutes of waiting, I had had enough.  I wasn't about to waste another second of my Saturday morning waiting for the schmucks who work there to open the damn doors so I left.  I hope someone finally showed up to do their job today!  What a joke.  LA Tan is so much better.  I still have tans to use so I'm sure I'll be back...ugh!  I'm already dreading it, but I'll be damned if I'm not going to squeeze every last cent out of that Groupon I bought.  Blech...find another place to tan.  This place is crap.

11.description: I'd never been tanning before and had some questions, the girl behind the counter was absolutely wonderful.  She answered all my questions and put me at ease about tanning for the first time.  So much so I signed up for a membership.  Been going ever since and the whole staff there are always super friendly and inviting.  They are always there to greet their members with a smile.  Great service!

8.description: worst customer service ever! time and time again i am told by know-it-all employees here that their lotion is hypoallergenic and all natural.  so after trying an "all natural" lotion i find that it contains 4 artificial colors, which my skin is allergic to.  so my next visit comes and i am again harassed about not using lotions.  this time i am offered an "organic" lotion, whose ingredients revealed 2 artificial colors and stated 95% organic. (whats the other 5%?)  when i bring this to the attention of the employee i get an eye roll and an "ok whatever."  i understand that it is their job to sell lotions but i would be weary of taking the claims made by these "tanning experts" seriously.  did i mention i have been placed in the oldest bed in the salon every time? don't make them mad or else they'll put you in the ancient creaky bed from 1985.

4.description: i would give this 0 stars but the review does not allow. All the machines are terrible, and always have a problem. I would not go here but since I bought a groupon I am forced to go to this place since it is close to my house. I thought it would get better the more times I go, but it keeps getting worse. The tanning beds are old and unattended too. Every time I sit for 5 minutes the machine shuts down when I pay for 10 minutes. When I ask them that my minutes are gone before I used them all they give me this excuse about we can not restart the machines. I ask for the manager and they get confused and start panicking. When the manager comes he can add minutes to the machine. It feels forced to buy lotion every single time I walk in because its LOTION, LOTION, LOTION. Its the only thing they say to you when you walk in the door since the managers force them to sell like machines. Once my groupon deal is done I will never go back to this place.

14.description: I'm going on vacation (Dominican Republic, yay me!) in a week and a half  and I am way too white.  (No really, I think I may glow in the dark.)  Anyway, I started coming here last week to get some sort of a tan.  I haven't had a problem with this place at all.  I've never had to wait for a bed, it's clean and the staff are nice.  The best part?  Since it's in a strip mall, there is plenty of parking.  Works for me!

6.description: Walked in last Tuesday, bought a tan and received a 2nd tan free - as long as it's used within 7 days.Walked in this Tuesday, the free tan apparently expired yesterday.If the free tan is good for 7 days and you can't tan more than once a day, then wouldn't the 7 day count start on Wednesday and end the next Tuesday?Never going back here. Also, their prices are outrageous (compared to L.A. Tan, XSport, etc.).

28.description: This is the closest bar to my house. It's another of Chicago's divey neighborhood bars, with its share of locals and townies. They have karaoke on the weekends, but I have not experienced it. Sometimes they have free food for Bears games. People bring stuff and grill out back; great snausages, pork chops, guac and more. Jess, the bartender on Sundays, is a real hoot.

1.description: RVP has new owners and classed the joint up a bit, which is nice.  It is still our favorite neighborhood bar and our favorite bartender is Jamie.  Virginia is great too, we just don't see her very often.  Who am I kidding, they're all great people.  The drinks are reasonably priced, the atmosphere is pretty chill and they now have some decent wines.  They have a jukebox and no longer have that clunky, ugly karaoke station.   My only complaint is that the only "food" they offer is pretzels.  I am just the kind of girl that needs food while she drinks.  They will let you order food to the bar though, so I use that option pretty often.

9.description: Great neighborhood bar, nice bartenders, good crowd.  We frequent it anytime we want to walk to the corner for a drink.

29.description: Nothing too remarkable about the bar besides the fact that they have Metal Karaoke (though somehow the likes of Backstreet Boys and the Beatles sneak in there) and really cheap beer specials.It's a nice neighborhood bar to visit if you are looking for some ridiculous drunken karaoke and cold beverages.  Just dont let the bartender chick make you her special orange juice concoction - it's a killer.  In a bad way.

23.description: First and foremost, this friendly establishment is cash only. For me, that is very important because I have fallen victim to the plastic generation and never have cash on me. The ATM machine was also out of order the night I went...so...be prepared.Continuing n, I'm with Rob L on this one, there aren't many things I dislike more than karaoke. I hate it. I will not sing it no matter what is at stake. I went here the other night, a Friday to be exact, to catch the end of the Hawks game to find a white binder on our table. Which only meant one thing, karaoke night.Kudos to those that do karaoke and are actally good. Kudos to those that aren't good and think they are but are having fun. I'm all for having fun, it just doesn't include singing.I really liked this place, cozy little atmosphere with a friendly and attentive bartender. Nothing high class about the place and that's the way I like it.I also like the conversation hearts decorating the mirror of the bar...I wonder what Kansas City Tom is all about?I'll be back! Just not on karaoke night..

5.description: Ok, this is a dive of the highest order....but I love it.  Where else can you get cheap beer and drinks AND karaoke on a weekend without a huge crowd?  You can definitely get all of the above here.  The bartender that I've seen there most often is friendly and serves up drinks fast with a smile.  The other patrons can range from wild bachelorette parties to small groups of friends, but it's definitely great for people watching.  No food here, but I think you can bring it in and drinks are cheap and good.Worth a visit if you want a low key night without any stress of the Lincoln Park or downtown bars.

31.description: Your pool table is mine, Roscoe Village Pub.Even after a completely unnecessary number of $2 Coors Light 22oz. beers in plastic cups, on top of the bellyful of beer I was already barely functioning with, and despite the 45 year old mill operator looking guy doing Korn karaoke (pretty well, frighteningly enough), I own that pool table.You are a good bar.  Not good like "a place I would recommend to others" but good like "I wreck shop on your pool table during sad, weird, please-make-it-stop karaoke."  You know what, though?  I'm okay with that.  Your man-tender laughed at my jokes, the neighborhooders graciously shook hands and smiled when they lost their pool table, the beer was DIRT CHEAP and the absolutely physics-defying gut hanging off your long haired karaoke man(?) was more apropos than hideous.  I had a five star night at your two star bar.  Thank you, RVP.  Thank you.  You are pretty swell.Let's do it again, eh?

25.description: Gotta have love for a place that serves beer in plastic cups.And has a very passionate crew of regulars who live and die by karaoke.Fun neighborhood place.

12.description: Don't get me wrong, I looooove me a dive bar. Just not this one.  Went with a group of friends for a coworker's going away party to have some cheap beers and sing some bad karaoke... boy, did I under-estimate how bad the karaoke would actually be... due to the guy running it.  He pretty much sang every other song himself... even though there was a waiting list for actual bar patrons to sing their songs.  On top of that, the bartender... one.... on a Saturday night... was extremely rude and lazy.  Save yourself the headache... go elsewhere :)

21.description: I'm not sure what to make of a bar that's completely dead at 10:00 p.m. on a Friday night.  If it's a downtown happy hour place, it's alright because you closed at 9:00.  If it's a late night place, it's alright because no one's showing up for another two hours.  And I guess if it's a neighborhood joint, as RV Pub supposedly is, you assume that all the regulars have passed out on their own sauce at home, because why else would a bar be completely empty at 10:00 on a Friday night?  RV Pub will be worth a second visit, because I've driven or been driven by it a million times, and I'm sure there's more to the story.  There has to be.

16.description: The RVP is awesome for what it is - a neighborhod karaoke bar. Yes, there is going to be karaoke here on nearly a nightly basis. Yes, it will not be packed each night with groupon-toting kids looking for a beer or food special. Yes, they will have the grill hot during the warm months and let you bring your own meat to throw on there and cook. Yes, you will get to know the bartenders and the karaoke masters Will & Marz after just two visits. And yes, it is cash only and almost certainly you will get a 'beer on the house' each visit. If you're looking for something else, this is not your place!

17.description: A typical neighborhood pub. This place has video poker, a pool table and few patrons during the week. fits into my favorite type of place

10.description: Cheap beer, never crowded, friendly staff. This place could have more potential but it's the perfect dive bar.

11.description: This place certainly can grow on you.  It grew on me after a few visits.  The regulars, once you get to know them, are pretty nice.  There's one pool table inside and it's free on Sunday's.  They also have a few board games available (monopoly, pictionary, etc.) but I've never seen anyone play.

26.description: There are many ways to get my heart racing. My blood pumping. My nerves rattled. My throat to tighten and for me to "freak out" just a little. Okay, really, it may be just one thing. I'll admit to it. Nothing gets to me more than karaoke. Nothing. I hate it. I don't hate those who can belt out a tune. No, they are the lucky ones. They can rise above the eyes and sing. Or those who can go balls to the wall and let it all hang out while singing "Walk Like an Egyptian". Nah, no hating, I just hate doing it. I was here one weekend a little while ago for a friend's birthday party. Very much your typical neighborhood bar. Friendly bartender, cheap beer specials, small and intimate dive bar setting. My friend was craving some karaoke to sing out her to her inner idol. The place has what might be a regular attraction of karaoke on Friday nights. Oh joy. Well, I am glad the place was packed and I could simply pass the buck, celebrate my friends birthday have a drink or three and take a quick cab ride home to fall asleep. Aside from the karaoke, nothing seemed too happening or note worthy. However its not a bad little dive bar, not a bad one indeed.

27.description: I went here for a private party last year. It's a-ok. Small - but cozy. I like the secret smoking area out back - it made me feel like a bad-ass. I was a dive bar bad-ass for the night. Rock-on.

0.description: Great neighborhood bar, everyone is friendly, nice selection of beers on tap. Solid place to meet friends, play shuffle board, drink beer and watch a game.

20.description: My friends and I frequent the RVP and have come to know the staff very well.  The bartenders are really nice and often have time to talk and hang out.  The downside is that there is no food aside from bags of chips available, but there is a binder of take out.  There's also a grill in back and we often bbq with staff and/or other regulars/patrons. Sometimes it gets a little quiet, but there is a pa for cds and an old school cd jukebox.  The tvs need an update, but they are still visible from all angles of the bar.

19.description: My friends and I frequented this place quite a bit in the past.  We went there recently and it had completely changed.  The karaoke DJ was rude.  And if you don't want spilled drinks on the pool table....perhaps put a tarp on it.  Won't be going back again - ever.

33.description: the perfect place for getting day-drunk on warm weekend afternoons.  they allegedly have $2.50 pints of fat tire when the cubs play at home; everytime i ask, they're out of it.

2.description: Under new owners and they really turned the place around. Good classic Chicago bar. T.V's drink specials, bar games, friendly bar tenders...what more could you ask for?

34.description: An unpretentious corner bar located at Leavitt and Addison (important to know, so you don't get it mixed up with the similarly named Village Tap on Roscoe Ave -- oh the hilarity that has caused in the past!). There's usually a lot of activity here during Cubs games, and its location from Wrigley Field (stumbling distance, literally) brings in the post-game crowd. But, it doesn't get terribly crowded, and there are $6 pitchers of Bud; a decent jukebox; and a pool table (Sunday nights are free). Depending on your tolerance of off-key, drunk singing, be warned there's karaoke on Thursday and Saturday nights  (w/ a fairly deep catalog, tho). In all, it's a nice bar to get a cheap beer and maybe sing some Dolly Parton.

32.description: A bar that falls somewhere between corner tavern and Wrigleyville drunk shack, good times are usually had at this bar.  Despite the prices on their premium taps and mixed drinks, I find the staff to be friendly and inviting for a good story or two.  If you get along with them well enough you might wind up at a 4am bar to hear them vent about their job.  Good times.Thursday/Saturday Karaoke nights tend to be a good time and only one or two groups will dominate the procession on any given night; but I warn that the song book quality varies with the host for the night.

18.description: First and foremost, this friendly establishment is cash only. For me, that is very important because I have fallen victim to the plastic generation and never have cash on me. The ATM machine was also out of order the night I went...so...be prepared.Continuing n, I'm with Rob L on this one, there aren't many things I dislike more than karaoke. I hate it. I will not sing it no matter what is at stake. I went here the other night, a Friday to be exact, to catch the end of the Hawks game to find a white binder on our table. Which only meant one thing, karaoke night.Kudos to those that do karaoke and are actally good. Kudos to those that aren't good and think they are but are having fun. I'm all for having fun, it just doesn't include singing.I really liked this place, cozy little atmosphere with a friendly and attentive bartender. Nothing high class about the place and that's the way I like it.I also like the conversation hearts decorating the mirror of the bar...I wonder what Kansas City Tom is all about?I'll be back! Just not on karaoke night..

13.description: My friends always get excited whenever they head to this place. I never understood why. . . .until I went with them. All I can conclude from this experience is that I really need to find some new friends. It was karaoke night when I went, and from what I can gather, it's karaoke night a lot at this place. While I hate any unnecessary noise in a bar or pub, I really can't stand it when that noise is being made by a human modulating his vocal cords in either impersonating a raptor, or the less desirable singing of rock and roll music.Of course I know karaoke can be somewhat amusing. But it wasn't the tongue-in-cheek fun karaoke like a 70 something year old man singing "Do Ya Think I'm Sexy?" Instead it was fat, scruffy, middle aged men delivering energetic renditions of "Master of Puppets" fully convinced that they were, in fact, James Hetfield. But that all didn't matter once I saw the draft beer selection. For a seedy looking joint that would probably consider pouring a can of Old Style into a Dixie cup as elegant, they had a good selection on tap. I ordered a Bass and paid only $5 which is impressive for this area. Everything was looking okay until I tasted how watered-down it was. Just to be fair, I ordered a pint of Fat Tire next and got the same thing. That was a deal breaker for me, and that's why I gave this place one star. I can look past these mid-forties burnouts and their wives dressed in leopard-print everything, but when you start fucking with my beer, we have a problem. I'd rather pay a $7 for a beer that was drinkable than $5 for a pint that was, at a minimum, 20% water. I speak not only for myself but for all beer aficionados, you might be able to fool the lager boys with that kind of chicanery, but you're not going to get us.

4.description: I love RVP! We had our wedding reception there and it was a fabulous space with great staff that made out night unforgettable.  They host great special events and it's also a wonderful place to relax, grab a great beer and catch the cubs/bears game with friends.

24.description: This is a great little corner neighborhood bar.  One of my good friends lives on Addison and Claremont and we stopped here after a beer run to the place across the street (yes, we stopped to get a beer on our way back from getting beer).  Like many of the other reviewers have stated, the place is really cozy.  I liked the smoking area out back that looks more like someones backyard than the back of a bar.  They broke out the glasses for us, I guess they knew we were high rollers.  Old  Family guy episodes on a tube TV and Fat Tire on tap beats 30 plasmas and extreme fajitas anyday.   Good times.

6.description: We recently attended a wedding reception at roscoe village pub and it was great! The staff was friendly and super organized. A great venue for an event!

22.description: This a real bare bones "Dive".. Has some cool aspects such as exposed brick walls and really old wood floors plus a Smoking Patio out back... Staff is friendly and the Clientele varies widely from locals to younger and alot of patrons that look like they just got off the clock from the graveyard shift!!

15.description: This is a totally low key dump. If you don't want to battle the bros and hos of Wrigleyville, this is a suitable alternative to drown yr sorrows in relative peace.

7.description: Great Neighborhood Bar!  The new owners have really improved the place!  I was in this bar a year ago, and it's really a night and day difference from what it was like before!  Very comfortable, warm environment, with a friendly staff.  Great Chicago pub!

8.description: DO NOT GO HERE FOR KARAOKE. The employee controling the karaoke is a jerk and allows the employees more turns to sing than patrons. The Jack Black bar back, who loves to scream metal music, is mildly entertaining in a 'I feel so sorry for this place' kind of way. Hey, it's their bar and they can do what they want.  And that's exactly what they do.

30.description: This place is by far NOT amazing.  BUT I'm giving it four stars for their cheap drinks, fairly good service, and most of all their Saturday night Karaoke.  So much fun as it's never that crowded...making it a lot less embarrassing to belt out your favorite toon.  Plus the patrons of the bar are supportive regardless!  Overall the perfect equation for a fun evening.

3.description: We enjoyed our visit to this bar. Bartender was friendly, beer was fresh, and everything was clean. Nice big televisions. Pretty good beer list and a healthy selection of local beers. I see some Yelpers refer to it as a dive bar. It appears recently renovated and I would consider it more of a neighborhood bar not a dive bar. It is actually nicer than many of its competitors in the area. We will return for sure.

14.description: I'm not sure what to make of a bar that's completely dead at 10:00 p.m. on a Friday night.  If it's a downtown happy hour place, it's alright because you closed at 9:00.  If it's a late night place, it's alright because no one's showing up for another two hours.  And I guess if it's a neighborhood joint, as RV Pub supposedly is, you assume that all the regulars have passed out on their own sauce at home, because why else would a bar be completely empty at 10:00 on a Friday night?  RV Pub will be worth a second visit, because I've driven or been driven by it a million times, and I'm sure there's more to the story.  There has to be.

1.description: This was almost two stars for me, but the very friendly service bumped it to a 3.  I ordered the Chicken Panang and ordered it extra spicey.  It was very bland compared to most Thai food I've had.  The high point though, was that it only cost like $6.95.The presentation was pretty nice, and the waitress was very friendly.  The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything special.

0.description: I had met up with one of my co-workers here for a quick pick me up meal and this place delivered on our expectations.Walking in at 5pm on a drizzly Tuesday, we chose our own seat since there was no one in the front- no patrons or staff. We were helped out immediately. I had ordered the Pad Thai with tofu with mild sauce, since my Polish stomach can't handle spices all that well. The waitress had returned within five minutes with our meals and said enjoy. The food was absolutely delicious. To top it off we were given a cucumber salad that was very colorful and very tastey.Repeat- Super sweet owner who knows his stuff in regards to the food and wants you to return for the amazing food.

28.description: I've been with Karen for years -- all the way back from Film Clips on Lincoln. I am always very welcomed in the shop by everyone who works there and most recently, Karen gave me the best haircut & color EVER! Not to mention, she cuts my 19 month-old son's hair (and has since he was about 9 months-old) without a peep or tear out of either of them :)

1.description: I bought a Groupon for a facial from here, simply because it was easy to get to (Belmont L stop, then 77 bus takes you right there) and I am SO glad I did. Kasia was wonderful! Not only did she get right back to me about another opening if I wanted to get in sooner, she was extremely friendly and I left with my skin glowing! I have been bouncing around different places getting facials, but I will definitely be back here. Kasia was professional, friendly, and did a fantastic job. Seriously -- I had no idea my skin could look this amazing!

9.description: Was easy to get an appointment and the staff member on the phone was very pleasant.  Interior was nice and plenty of street parking.Got a no-chip manicure as my service and have mixed feelings about the results.  I've had about a dozen of these in the past and it's become clear that there's the quick way to give a no chip and then there's the right way.  The right way takes about an hour with multiple applications.  This way took about 30 minutes and started chipping the next day.  If you want a good no chip manicure, go up to the no chip boutique in Lincoln Square.  It's their specialty and they last two weeks.

29.description: I love Eleanor! She listens to and understands what I want, and will sit down and find ideas with me if I don't know what I want. She is a great down to earth person, and fun to talk with too. The location is easy, and the hours are accomodating. The decor is great, and everyone is friendly. The haircuts are pricey ($55), but worth it.

23.description: I've also been going to Village Cutting Room when it was still Southport Cutting Room.  Wendy does an awesome job and has been the only one who has figured out how to tame down some of the crazy crap that goes on at the front of my hair.  The park across the street is great entertainment for my kids and I dig the artwork that's up for sale on the walls.  If I ever move out to the suburbs I'll probably still continue to go here.

5.description: Haircuts by Dottie are my favorite thing. The vibe here is a lot more relaxed. The stylists don't seem like they are racing against a clock to get in as many customers in a day. What that means to me is that she is going to give me her full attention and time to give me the best color and cut there is. I'm a fan of the KMS products available for sale. And to seal the deal, plenty of free street parking nearby.

31.description: I've been going to this place to get my hair cut since it was the Southport Cutting Room on Diversey and Southport.  Yikes, that would be almost 10 years! I have been going to the same woman, Kelly, all this time.  She is awesome, as are the rest of the people there who mostly have been there as long. Everyone is in their mid to upper thirties, laid back, not at all pretentious, and they just do a really good job. I've sent several girls there as well and all rave about it and have continued to go back for cuts, coloring, whatever. Prices are beginning to get a bit steep but are still way less than what I assume you would pay downtown.

25.description: I'm a guy who's had his haircut by the neighborhood barber for years.  After one such recent haircut my girlfriend could not shut up about how awful it was, and suggested I go to her hair salon, enter The Village Cutting room.   I called and setup and appointment easily, and upon my arrival was treated like a King!  My stylist Wendy shampooed and rinsed my hair and then got down to the business of fixing my awful haircut.  She was so friendly and talkative, she made me feel welcome, and the end result of her hard work was a haircut my girlfriend can't shut up about, not to mention other women.  I've been called handsome and sexy more times this week than I have in the past year put together!  This haircut changed my life, Thanks Wendy!

12.description: I have been going to VCR for a few months now for waxing services, massages, and nail services.  I just love this place.  All of the professionals are just that - professional.  Pleasant, welcoming, and excellent at their jobs.  I highly recommend.

21.description: This place is amazing! I purchased a deal on living social for a lumifacial. I had no idea what to expect, but I was truly impressed and pleasantly surprised. Kasia was extremely professional and helpful; she even opened the salon early for me! I was taken in back room, which was nicely decorated, and she played relaxing music throughout the entire hour and a half I was there. She tailored the facial to my skin needs, which was not expected due to having a coupon. It turned out to be much for than a lumifacial-I received different masks, massages, and ended up getting an eyebrow waxing (which turned out great!). Kasia was just so helpful and kind; I highly recommend this place! I will definitely be going back for another facial, and maybe to get my hair cut (which I also hear great things about).

16.description: I've been a loyal customer of The Village Cutting Room since it was The Southport Cutting Room way back when....that said, WARNING*WARNING*WARNING...the current Village Cutting Room is under new ownership. Virtually ALL of the wonderfully gifted & awesome hair stylists (Kelly, Karen, Wendy, & Lynn) who have worked there for years and years have left the building, taking their talents elsewhere (hint: check out Flip Salon on Lincoln Avenue--review coming soon). The new owner seems to be taking the Village CUTTING Room into an odd, European Spa-like, direction. Seems a name change would be in order!

17.description: I have been seeing Kasia for eyebrow waxes and facials since I moved into the neighborhood about 3 years ago. I can't say enough great things about her, or the service you will receive here. Everyone has always been beyond accommodating and friendly. They have recently renovated and the space is very inviting. I have received a prenatal massage from Jacklyn and WOW! This is definitely not a full service spa (no locker rooms, amenities, etc) but it is by far one of the best massages I have received and her pricing is reasonable. I would recommend the spa services here to anyone. Unfortunately I cannot speak to the hair services as I have not used them, but the customers that I see coming and going seem pleased!

10.description: Making an appointment was easy enough. Location is appealing to the eye.The no-chip I received along with my two friends was left to be desired. The tech was trying to hard to be too fast. I've had no-chip done several times at other locations and it definitely took a couple of weeks to chip where as this particular one started to chip the next day.  Like I mentioned before, I had two other friends get them as I gifted them the no chip and they had a bad first experience.

11.description: First of all, my review is based solely on the Brazilian Blowout. I had bought a discount coupon for a blowout for $100 ($300 value) or I'd have never gone to this salon. For hair cuts, etc they might be good, but my procedure wasn't great. I've gotten a Brazilian blowout before and while it was the same solution, the process my first time was different and much more effective. It's only been a few weeks and my hair is already starting to get frizzy. I would definitely not go back for another blowout, and I'd choose a salon closer to me for cut and color.Also when I first called to make my appointment, despite the fact that I'd bought a legitimate coupon for a specific service offered by this salon, they told me they didn't have anyone there that could do the Brazilian blowout. The next day someone called and told me they could accommodate me, which gives me the sneaking suspicion that's why I'm not thrilled with the result; that it's not her specialty, she just stepped in in a pinch.

26.description: You know how you have certain things that you love about yourself (and a lot that maybe you don't?)  Well, I love my hair and that's the reason I totally trust Eleanor.  She has always given me a great haircut and color, because she is passionate about what she does and loves it.  She is also awesome to be with, because good hair takes time, and it is so refreshing spending time with someone who loves what they do.  I know I'm vain about my hair, so if I ever can detach, I know exactly who I'm going to get to cut it all off.  Eleanor!
