27.description: Highly recommended!  Kelly has been doing my hair for 10+ years, starting at Southport Cutting Room.  I love the vibe of this place - it's laid back and welcoming, so I don't feel like a heel showing up in my workout stuff.  Kelly is creative and thoughtful and comes up with great ideas for how to style my hair.  For years my hair was very short, and I constantly received compliments on the style - Kelly is great with short hair.  She's done highlights for me, and now that my hair is longer she keeps it trimmed and styled just as nicely!  She's great.  I won't go anywhere else in Chicago to get my hair cut.

0.description: Linh is my favorite mani/pedi girl on the Northside. I've been seeing for her two years at VCR Spa and I won't go anywhere else now. Her mani/pedis are top notch and I love the privacy of the her little corner in the back of the spa. She doesn't use one of those vibrating chairs that poke my back in odd places. She has this completely relaxing ambiance and everything is hyper-clean. She is fastidious about the hygiene of her materials -- and I notice.Additionally, Linh gives the BEST quality mani/pedis and her prices are reasonable. When she has a special ($30 mani/pedi & $25 no-chip mani), you will not find a better deal, and you certainly will not find better service. She's super quick to respond to my texts about scheduling appointments, and I like how she takes her time when she does my nails. I always know I'll have a fab mani/pedi when I leave the Village Cutting Room!

20.description: "Quick Tip - $20 pedicures this month!" ... is what I would say if I knew how to work my phone and post Yelp check-ins to Facebook.I took my first trip to The Village Cutting Room yesterday and was very impressed.  I got a Bloomspot deal for waxing and Kasia was amazing.  The place was buzzing with hair and mani/pedi clients, but the waxing room was discreet and as pleasant as possible.  Since my Bloomspot coupon covers three bikini waxes, I already made my April and June appointments, but I definitely plan on becoming a long-term client of Kasia's.  Great place for waxing in Roscoe Village.

19.description: I'm a guy who's had his haircut by the neighborhood barber for years.  After one such recent haircut my girlfriend could not shut up about how awful it was, and suggested I go to her hair salon, enter The Village Cutting room.   I called and setup and appointment easily, and upon my arrival was treated like a King!  My stylist Wendy shampooed and rinsed my hair and then got down to the business of fixing my awful haircut.  She was so friendly and talkative, she made me feel welcome, and the end result of her hard work was a haircut my girlfriend can't shut up about, not to mention other women.  I've been called handsome and sexy more times this week than I have in the past year put together!  This haircut changed my life, Thanks Wendy!

2.description: Shawn is here now from Lather on Roscoe...he is awesome-and the atmosphere here is nice!

18.description: I've also been going to Village Cutting Room when it was still Southport Cutting Room.  Wendy does an awesome job and has been the only one who has figured out how to tame down some of the crazy crap that goes on at the front of my hair.  The park across the street is great entertainment for my kids and I dig the artwork that's up for sale on the walls.  If I ever move out to the suburbs I'll probably still continue to go here.

13.description: Linh's manicures rock!  She is affordable and does a great job!My manicures usually chip the next day but Linh's manicures last almost a week without chipping.  She is also very hygenic which is a big deal for a germophobe like me.  They have easy FREE street parking as well!

4.description: Employees are super cute, kind, and friendly. They have this relaxing ambiance it feels like home and everything is very clean. I like the Polish lady who arranged me an appointment with Linh and Linh is my fav mani/pedi girl in Roscoe Village.  Besides they have different promotions every month, better to check website before having an appointment.I will definitely go back.

24.description: I was fairly happy when I walked out of here. But after I got home and re-styled my hair, I saw that exactly what I did not want to happen did happen.I specifically asked Karen not to cut layers that separate in clumps. But that's what she did. I pointed out what the previous stylist did that I didn't like. She agreed and then proceeded to pretty much do the same thing. I told her texturizing generally doesn't work well on my hair. She told me that it would help keep the layers from separating. Sometimes the client knows her own hair pretty well. Texturizing doesn't work on my hair. I should have insisted against it, but an experienced stylist should have recognized this.I wish stylists everywhere would learn how to use different cutting techniques on different hair textures instead of taking the cookie cutter approach. To all the stylists who may be reading this--you need to adapt the basic style and your cutting approach to the client's individual hair. That used to go without saying among good stylists. Not anymore. It's too bad--Karen seems like a pleasant person who genuinely wants the client to be happy. But if a client says that a specific technique generally doesn't work, please listen.My experience here was just one more chapter in the ongoing saga of misadventures in Chicago hair salons.

6.description: Nails by Lingh - She does a fantastic job! I got a no chip done there with a YouSwoop deal. I am glad she was featured because I would have never known about this place. I drive by there all the time. She has  a variety of colors and a new no chip formula with bright spring colors. I have had many no chips not last on me and this one lasted 3 weeks! She also has the original opi formula that last forever too. She was very fast and very friendly! I will definitely be back!

22.description: I love everyone here and have been going for years. Wendy has always done an amazing job on my curly locks. I love Karen and all the girls they all really make you feel like family as soon as you walk in the door

15.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  I receive waxing services from Kasia (also the owner) and I have been going here for years.  At least eight years now.  I recently moved out of state.  Every time I am back in Chicago, I make sure to stop by to say hello even if I don't need an appointment.  The last time I was in Chicago, Kasia made time for me and came in on her day off. Now that is customer service!  The prices are very reasonable and less expensive than other places in Chicago, the suburbs and even in my current city of residence- Baltimore, Maryland.  Kasia listens to what I need and does not push any other services.  She is very respectable, professional and kind.  The spa is always in tip top shape and has a pleasant and soothing feel about it.  I definitely recommend this place.

7.description: I've had 2 pedicures(both excellent) and a manicure and no chip manicure done here with Linh. No complaints about the manicure, and their no chip manicure is only $25 so I suppose I got what I paid for- chipping the next day. She fixed it but again, it was chipping withing 2 days. I'm going back for my second no chip tonight, so we'll see...I also had my hair done by Christine this week. I corresponded with her weeks before the appointment to give her a good idea of what I wanted, and she was very prompt about replying. I brought pictures and spoke with her for about 10-15 minutes about what I wanted before we started. She asked questions and seemed genuinely interested in meeting my needs.I was there a total of 2.5 hours. While we did not achieve my desired look(she explained to me that it wouldn't be possible to bleach my dyed brunette locks without major damage), I am 110% happy with the results. I love the cut and color. She painted individual pieces of my hair using the Balayage method, and she put in a lot of work. She was pleasant to talk with over the course of the appointment and I felt she really understood and heard what I said. Perhaps my only complaint is that I felt my back was wet during the rinsing and shampooing, and later discovered my cheap, cotton Old Navy cardigan had bleach spots on it. She still deserves 5 stars though, and I will be back for touch ups and will most likely follow her to her new salon come August.

8.description: "Quick Tip - $20 pedicures this month!" ... is what I would say if I knew how to work my phone and post Yelp check-ins to Facebook.I took my first trip to The Village Cutting Room yesterday and was very impressed.  I got a Bloomspot deal for waxing and Kasia was amazing.  The place was buzzing with hair and mani/pedi clients, but the waxing room was discreet and as pleasant as possible.  Since my Bloomspot coupon covers three bikini waxes, I already made my April and June appointments, but I definitely plan on becoming a long-term client of Kasia's.  Great place for waxing in Roscoe Village.

30.description: Kelly is a terrific stylist and I have heard that the other stylists are great too.  I have been a client since 2003 (went once or twice to the original location on Southport) and have been loyal ever since.  Very cool artwork and vibe inside, but not at all pretentious or snobby.  Kelly is fantastic with my hair - color and cut - she has done gorgeous work with some baby-fine, mousy hair!  Also, Kasia did great work on my brows and gave me a lovely facial.  I highly recommend this place!

3.description: Very pleased with my facial (groupon) from Kasia. She was very informative (but not pushy) about suggesting products for my skin type. Already made an appointment to go back!

14.description: I was really surprised to see the reviews about the no chip manis chipping. I've had no chip done many times from other salons and the one I got from Linh was the same, if not better in quality. I had no chipping whatsoever. Linh is meticulous and has a great selection of colors for no chip. I go w a friend on weekday afternoons and we bring our daughters and they are totally sweet about letting our daughters play while we take turns getting our nails done. This place was such a find!

36.description: I'm a big fan of Rudy's bakery, especially of the danishes and little cookies. I had a cupcake once that wasn't too great, but I'm ultimately pleased.I'm an even bigger fan of the prices. Danishes are less than a buck and a small cup of coffee is, too.

29.description: A true to form NW side bakery from the taste of the pastries to the frankness of the interior setup. I am a *very* picky person in the bakery department and this place has just the right taste. The Taste: Northwest Side of Chicago has a Bakery Style...Really!Reminiscent of the Thompson's bakery in Park Ridge, these cookies sweet rolls, coffee cakes and donuts have extraordinary flavor that only butter or lard can deliver. I noticed another review that would contradict that statement, but I'm a butter girl and feel pretty strongly that you need to try for yourself on these pastries! If you like Old World bakery of Lake Zurich, Thomspons (long closed) of Park Ridge, and have a tendency to prefer french/german/english style baked goodies, this is the bakery for you. Specifically, they have chocolate covered cake donuts, sticky buns, raspberry & apricot sweet rolls that are done with absolute perfection. They also have these deliciously sweet and cute coffee cake PIZZAs! It's a circular coffee cake with pepperoni-circles of different jams/cheese (raspberry, lemon curd, apricot, cheese). They also have a variety of breads to choose from, but honestly I mostly hit the sweets, so I can't attest to their prowess in the bread department :)What ForOn the way to a friends house for brunch, holiday parties, the in laws for easter, birthday parties and holidays, this bakery was always a stop for us to pick up 'a little something sweet'. It's also a perfect Saturday morning walk for anyone living in Roscoe Village. It's right across the Village Thrift parking lot...fuel up before the dig!The PlaceNo frills place with a booth or two off to the side in case you want to eat your danish & have some coffee pronto. This is a classic bakery, as many other reviewers quipped as "old school" - all work being done in the back with all the benefits of incredibly low priced and daily baked fresh goods in the front. The propriertor is a sweet guy, and staff is quiet and kind, quick and attentive.No matter where you live, visit your local bakery today and keep this wonderful neighborhood tradition alive!

42.description: I feel like this place totally doesn't get enough credit.  At all.Rudy's is often overshadowed by Dinkel's, which is just a few blocks away.  Don't get me wrong, Dinkel's is great.  But when you're in the mood for some excellent, small-batch, tastes-like-your-grandma-made-it-with-love treats, take the four-block trek down Roscoe to Rudy's.  It definitely looks like a family-owned place, and everything I've tried there has been cheap, fresh, and delicious.  The pastries are very generous in size and dirt cheap.  The pies are also especially awesome - try the pecan when in season - a whole pie for $6.  The winners, however, are the giant coconut macaroons, which are by far the best I've ever had.

23.description: I live near this bakery and walk past it regularly but had never stopped in. Today I was walking down the street and decided I could use a cup of coffee.  I debated a minute about going into Rudy's or crossing the street and going to Starbucks.  I like to support small business where I can and decided to go to Rudy's, and I am so glad that I did!I ordered a small, individual sized cake and a small coffee.  The cake was delicious!  It alternated between yellow and chocolate cakes and was not dry at all.  The coffee was also delicious, and I really appreciated that the man working behind the counter was willing to root around in the fridge and dig some skim milk out of the very back for me.Altogether, my coffee and cake only came to $2.25 which I really thought was a fantastic deal.  I will definitely revisit Rudy's.  The baked goods (or at least the little cake I had) and the coffee served here are very good, and the people working here are really kind.  I feel like I got much more than I paid for, which is not something I ever feel leaving Starbucks.

31.description: Definitely one of the least trafficked bakeries I've ever seen... never busy, not even on weekends. No really, never has another soul even shared the space with me the few times I've stopped in and perused the cases of old school butter cookies, pastries and cakes. I'm pretty sure this bakery has been here forever. If not, it certainly looks like it has... it has a bit of a shabby, burned out vibe on the outside and the inside doesn't do much to pump up the volume either. Also weary and worn-down it certainly does nothing to make the sweets any more attractive; it's true, if you stare at them long enough, even they too look spent. Adornment and decorating of the cakes is, dare I say, amateurish... maybe compared to the likes of Vanille, Sweet Mandy B's and Bittersweet anything would look undesirable, but I feel like Rudy's is still sitting on the starting line instead of running in the race. They do make a good butter cookie (and for only a buck a piece), but everything else just looks inadmissible to my palate. Isn't the point of going to a bakery to torture every fiber of your being with the hardest decision known to man... which 2 things am I allowed to take home and shove down my esophagus?? Not here, my friend, not here. Time will tell for this Ma & Pa shop, but what I'd really like to do is wipe 'em off Roscoe in favor of a Berry Chill. Now there's a sweet treat that never goes bad!

34.description: So easy, so cheap, SO GOOD! I love the little mom and pop nature of Rudy's, and they always have donuts ready to go in the morning. I recommend trying the gooey butter danish square thingy... I don't know what it is, but it melts in your mouth. Maybe it's better that I don't know many calories they actually are. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm.

16.description: I have been to Rudy's 4 times to grab treats for my coworkers. Every single time, they were blown away by the awesomeness. From breads to donuts to specialty pastries. Its all delicious! I almost forgot to mention how inexpensive this place is too. Its a no-brainer.

11.description: This bakery will bring back memories of your grandmother.  The baked goods are very traditional and delicious.  The butter cookies melt in your mouth.  I have gone to this bakery for about 18 years.  I spoke to Rudy and he told me that he gets up at around 3 am everyday to prepare for the day.  Rudy's Bakery is a traditional bakery in every sense.

39.description: Great, affordable pastries and sweets!We've popped into this neighborhood gem a few mornings now to grab some really cheap danishs and cinnamon rolls. YUM! I'm really happy to have such a great place in my neighborhood!

37.description: I stop into Rudy's when I can. They have funny hours, even for a bakery, and seem to be closed a lot of the time. They have some nice cookies, and some pastries, but their donuts are lacking, and their cupcakes just aren't as awesome as they should be. I agree with other posters that the price is right at this bakery, but I will walk the extra half mile to the other places in the neighborhood that I like better.

0.description: I love Rudy! He is so sweet. He preps everything over night, each night, so it's always fresh.  The cheese danish is unreal good, and it's $1.39!  The butter cookies are delicious too.  Great to pick up for a party or just for a treat.  Best part for a quick snack: they sell individual pieces of cake with sprinkles on all sides! WHO DOES THAT?  Rudy. He's the best!

38.description: Sometimes when the need for cake overpowers me, I must give in.  One morning I stopped into Rudy's for a slice of cake.  I decided on a coconut cake with raspberry filling and took it home so I could eat the cake in the dark to hide my shame.  The cake, even though it had been individually wrapped, was dried out.  It really did not satisfy my cake cravings at all.  I was terribly disappointed because I liked the bakery and I love to support small businesses, but this cake did not do anything for me.  So sad.

27.description: I grew up in Roscoe Village, and back in the '60's and '70's, there was a fantastic bakery on this site named "Heck's Bakery", run by the Heck family. When they closed up shop, at least one other bakery occupied this storefront. They were not as good. Then came Rudy. I believe he bought some of the Heck family recipes, as there are items at Rudy's which I remember from the Heck days. The most decadent of which is the "Heck's Special", a 3-inch thick, wonderfully dense coffee cake with a custard filling and topped with icing and nuts. The chocolate chip coffee cake, and the "cheese pizza" coffee cakes are also winners, as are the assorted sweet rolls. Also recommended are the fruit slices. As has been stated in some of the other reviews, the small cookies no longer seem to use the same amount of butter as in the old days, but they're still quite good, especially the yellow ones with delicious dollop of fudge on top. The big decorated cookies are the ones to go for. There's always an interesting assortment of those, decorated for whatever holiday might be upon us, or frosted to look like smily faces or baseballs. I cannot comment on the layer cakes as I have not tried those. Rudy and the rest of the staff have always been very friendly. The prices are great.

32.description: LOVE IT!! OMG the croissants and butter cookies are delicious!  Rudy is so nice!  It's a kid-safe business, too. I really like this little place & hope it stays around for a loooooooong time.  You can walk over on a Sat or Sun morning for some fresh, tasty pasties.  They serve coffee, too but I have not tried it.

13.description: I live near this bakery and walk past it regularly but had never stopped in. Today I was walking down the street and decided I could use a cup of coffee.  I debated a minute about going into Rudy's or crossing the street and going to Starbucks.  I like to support small business where I can and decided to go to Rudy's, and I am so glad that I did!I ordered a small, individual sized cake and a small coffee.  The cake was delicious!  It alternated between yellow and chocolate cakes and was not dry at all.  The coffee was also delicious, and I really appreciated that the man working behind the counter was willing to root around in the fridge and dig some skim milk out of the very back for me.Altogether, my coffee and cake only came to $2.25 which I really thought was a fantastic deal.  I will definitely revisit Rudy's.  The baked goods (or at least the little cake I had) and the coffee served here are very good, and the people working here are really kind.  I feel like I got much more than I paid for, which is not something I ever feel leaving Starbucks.

24.description: Ru-dy's Ru-dy's Ru-dy's!! No, this place is not at all associated with Sean Astin or Notre Dame Football but I still feel like it warrants three cheers. No-frills bakery with great pastries and donuts, great cheap coffee, great seasonal and holiday-themed cookies, and a super great staff! Seriously the nicest staff in the neighborhood. Easily missed as the place is a bit non-descript and located across the street from Starbucks, but definitely worth your time and money.

7.description: Stopped in here today because I had a craving for something not so healthy for breakfast this morning. All I have to say is this place is definitely 100x better than their comeptitors in the neighborhood. Its a little bakery in the heart of roscoe village that looks like it got stuck in the 60's but oh man the food is absolutely on point. Got Packazi for Fat Tuesday.... better than Dinkels and Dinkels is top rated by timeout magazine. Go here you wont be disappointed.

40.description: This place is great. We got my birthday cake here and it was the best!  I've had lots of baked goods from the other more famous neighborhood bakery, but this is way better- and more affordable.

30.description: They make a mean challah. Also it's nice that it's a medley of pastries based on American, Eastern European and Latino cultures.I loved the display at easter. It was out of control. Lamb cakes with frosting curly furs, candy studded. The staff is nice too.VERY affordable baked goods. Considering that now days a crappy croissant can cost $3-4 at chain cafes.

1.description: Rudy's is now OPEN again; though sporadically!!! The owner/baker is so nice! We got 4 donuts from him this afternoon. He let us know he only makes so many a day! So happy he's back open!! 5 STARS

9.description: As I near the end of my time in Roscoe Village *tear* I finally visited Rudy's. Charming family-run bakery. A hole-in-the wall if you will, not necessarily the most aesthetically pleasing bakery but run by a very heart-warming family. I had to try the coffee cake as so many Yelpers suggested. I was excited when I found out that they have multiple coffee cake flavors! Chocolate...prune...pecan...lemon....WHAT TO CHOOSE? WHAT TO CHOOSE?!!! As a pecan roll lover, I went with the pecan.. And got even more excited when I found out it was only $1.28! HUH? WHAT? Even with Chicago's uncannily high taxes?!!! YAYYYYYYYYY. I left quite pleased with my purchase, sat at the Starbucks across the street (JUDGE AS YOU MAY) and delighted in my buttery, flaky, coffee cake! I've returned twice since my first visit. And the kind man who runs it remembered me---always a good sign =]

26.description: It was errand Saturday.  The errands started around 9:00 in the morning out in the Joliet area with my youngest daughter.  Who is still an hour and twenty minutes short of her magic 50 hours of driving to get her license.  Then I will have three behind the wheel.Errand Saturday ended that night back home around 8:00 pm, with my wife and oldest son.  What a day!!  Along the way one of our stops was at Rudy's Bakery in Roscoe Village.  We have never been to Rudy's so it was nice to try.  The older gentleman behind the counter was quiet but friendly.  We ordered a one pound box of assorted butter cookies and a tasty looking eclair for my oldest daughter.I didn't get to try the eclair, I will have to ask my daughter about it, but the cookies were good.  We had probably about 8 to 10 different varieties of butter cookies.  They were all moist and tasty.  None of them were bad but nothing truly to write home about.  Our total bill was around $11 dollars.  But I was shorted a dollar when I got my change back.  That will teach me to count it in the store and not just put it in my pocket to count later.So if you are in the Roscoe Village area and looking for a nice little bakery stop by Rudy's.  Of course I would recommend you count your change before you leave.

25.description: rudis bakery they  have the best  coffee cake,cheese bread cookies and cakes ......mr rudy is nice & friendly

12.description: I would probably never have stopped in this little hole-in-the-wall if it hadn't been for Yelp saying, hey, there's a good bakery nearby!  And I always trust yelp with important decisions like where to buy donuts.  I got two chocolate frosted cake donuts and one bearclaw and they were total less than 4 dollars.  Also they were huge.  And delicious.  Thanks again, Yelp!

21.description: Love this place. Great cookies and great prices. No credit cards though. :(

17.description: It was errand Saturday.  The errands started around 9:00 in the morning out in the Joliet area with my youngest daughter.  Who is still an hour and twenty minutes short of her magic 50 hours of driving to get her license.  Then I will have three behind the wheel.Errand Saturday ended that night back home around 8:00 pm, with my wife and oldest son.  What a day!!  Along the way one of our stops was at Rudy's Bakery in Roscoe Village.  We have never been to Rudy's so it was nice to try.  The older gentleman behind the counter was quiet but friendly.  We ordered a one pound box of assorted butter cookies and a tasty looking eclair for my oldest daughter.I didn't get to try the eclair, I will have to ask my daughter about it, but the cookies were good.  We had probably about 8 to 10 different varieties of butter cookies.  They were all moist and tasty.  None of them were bad but nothing truly to write home about.  Our total bill was around $11 dollars.  But I was shorted a dollar when I got my change back.  That will teach me to count it in the store and not just put it in my pocket to count later.So if you are in the Roscoe Village area and looking for a nice little bakery stop by Rudy's.  Of course I would recommend you count your change before you leave.

10.description: Amidst a forest of highly- priced establishments it was refreshing to find an old-school neighborhood bakery. Not only that,  but the cherry/pineapple coffee cake rectangular roll I had was huge-AND only $1.25 AND delicious beyond belief. The gentleman working there was really nice.

5.description: Tried this place for the first time this morning. Smelled great as you walked in. I got the chocolate donuts. They were fantastic. Not too sweet and were the big, thick cake version. Reasonably priced too. I think we'll be making this our Saturday morning tradition.

35.description: I love Rudy's doughnuts and other breakfast pastries. They are fresh, tasty, and so cheap. I might get my coffee across the street at Starbucks, but I get my pastry at Rudy's.

19.description: This is an adorable place to go to with the kids!  I love to stop by with my son and daughter after an outing in Roscoe village and have cookie and coffee with them.  The staff is friendly and it is really a great local place.  The cookies are all great and reasonably priced.

28.description: Nobody knows but the coffee is to die for......and CHEAP compared to the crappy Starbucks across the street.  Also.....excellent pastries and two of the nicest, sweetest people in the history of the world work there.  Cheap, good food.

3.description: We stumbled along this place as we were checking out Roscoe Village's Oyster Fest.  I spotted the Pecan Roll from the window and for $1.55, it was a deal!  We picked one up.  The pastries here a fairly priced. And this establishment seems to be family run.  The man that helped us out was quite nice.  The Pecan Roll was just okay.  It was a little dense/dry and could have been a little softer/fluffier texture wise.  I would have probably picked up some other pastry items but there were little flies or nats flying in the display cases, so I opted not to.  I like how this is a mom and pop joint with fair prices.

33.description: My kind of bakery: old-school, great selection of no-frills pastries, and low prices!When I say old-school, I mean it. Remember those smiley-face cookies from your youth? They have 'em. Better yet, they have frowny face cookies as well, which were hard for me to resist for their hilarity factor. Their brownies are also quite wonderful. I came in an hour before they closed and everything was still very fresh.But be aware that Rudy's is also cash only! Not like you will need much, since the prices were very reasonable (I paid 2.35 for two items).

43.description: I love this bakery because its very old school and not trying to be anything more than what it is - a bakery. They have everything from special order cakes, cupcakes, eclairs, brownies, donuts (wish they had a larger selection though),  coffee cakes, sweet rolls (the best!), danish, breads, and my favorite, the good old-fashion smiley face cookie with that distinct yellowing icing and chocolate frosting eyes and smile. Sometimes they even have sad face cookies, hahahaha.They have been hit and miss depending on the day, but the owner is such a nice man and the prices are dirt cheap, like under $1 for most single items (rolls, cookies, danish, etc.) I often get nervous because I wonder how these small mom and pop shops can survive the growing neighborhoods where I'm sure rents can get pretty steep. I hope that Rudy's never gets pushed out!

2.description: If you are looking for some classy, expensive, gorgeously decorated, over priced, snobby customers, music blaring type of bakery, go to Julius Meinl.Well, although this place looks sketchy from your carview window, it really is a cutest little shop inside. It has that feel that it's been around forever, a classic bakery feel if you will. Not to say the inside is beautiful, but it's ok. I liked that.I got a large coffee and two pastries for under 5 bucks! 5 BUCKS! Take THAT Starbucks (directly across the street from it with a usual line out the door and around the block).Their coffee is delicious. It's a Colombian blend and very little cream and sugar are needed. You can really taste the beans roasted!The gentlemen who took my order is a very friendly man. Quiet, mysterious, but very nice.The pastries were delicious! I got a danish and something else similar to that with nuts on top. Both very good! Rich in flavor and the bread was great.I try to swing by here as much as I can before work. It's not a crazy busy bakery with lines out the door. You're in and out which I love.And as I was exiting the shop, I heard a little boy calling out "Grandpa, look at this!" Made me realize why I support these great mom and pop shops to begin with. He's probably teaching his grandson how to roll dough :)

18.description: Definitely one of the least trafficked bakeries I've ever seen... never busy, not even on weekends. No really, never has another soul even shared the space with me the few times I've stopped in and perused the cases of old school butter cookies, pastries and cakes. I'm pretty sure this bakery has been here forever. If not, it certainly looks like it has... it has a bit of a shabby, burned out vibe on the outside and the inside doesn't do much to pump up the volume either. Also weary and worn-down it certainly does nothing to make the sweets any more attractive; it's true, if you stare at them long enough, even they too look spent. Adornment and decorating of the cakes is, dare I say, amateurish... maybe compared to the likes of Vanille, Sweet Mandy B's and Bittersweet anything would look undesirable, but I feel like Rudy's is still sitting on the starting line instead of running in the race. They do make a good butter cookie (and for only a buck a piece), but everything else just looks inadmissible to my palate. Isn't the point of going to a bakery to torture every fiber of your being with the hardest decision known to man... which 2 things am I allowed to take home and shove down my esophagus?? Not here, my friend, not here. Time will tell for this Ma & Pa shop, but what I'd really like to do is wipe 'em off Roscoe in favor of a Berry Chill. Now there's a sweet treat that never goes bad!

41.description: Have to agree, great bakery.  They close one day per week.  I always seem to be there on that day.  Cookies and danish are great.  Look to the cookie.

4.description: First time visit today. Took home two stale, inedible cookies and mediocre banana bread. Baked goods really need to be fresh, not just inexpensive.

6.description: Rudy's is a great bakery with affordable prices and lots of classic pastries to offer. Their fun window displays of seasonal and holiday cakes remind you of being a kid again. This isn't the place for gourmet cupcakes, cronuts, or whatever the latest pastry fad of the week is. Our all-time favorites are the homemade turnovers, coffee cake, ham & cheese croissants, challah bread (great for french toast), raspberry squares, and of course the paczki on paczki day. Lots of fun special cookie designs for kids. Much cheaper and fresher than what Starbucks offers across the street. They remodeled in the past year and added some more seating and new flooring. It's a modest little place with lots of heart. Support a great local business and check out Rudy's.

22.description: Oh Rudy's, I want to love you SO BAD. You're a shabby little bakery in a perfect little location. I walked by you all the time and peered at the window quizzically to see awkward little baked goods sparsely populating the display.I have a really soft, squishy spot in my heart for local bakeries, though, so I finally went in recently with an open mind, open eyes and an empty stomach, looking for something to satisfy my insatiable sweet tooth. Inside looks pretty much how you would expect it would look, lots of shades of yellow/off-white, like the building has just gone a long time without love. But it's ok with me if the paint is dingy, as long as the food isn't. Some of the treats looked promising, like the cookies and breakfast pastries, and some of them looked kind of depressed. I went with a brownie and a peanut butter cookie. The man behind the counter was very sweet, and the prices were great. Unfortunately, the treats were just so-so. So saddings. I had such high hopes. The PB cookie and brownie were on the dry side - still tasty - but didn't taste freshly baked and definitely nothing to get too excited about.So I went in again today. Maybe I didn't get the right stuff last time. I thought the danishes looked the best the last time I came and they still looked pretty good today so I went with an apple danish. It was just ok. I liken the taste to those danishes you buy in bulk at Costco. Whyyyy Rudy's whyyyy?I dunno dude. I've given this bakery two tries to amaze me. Both times it hasn't. Both times it hasn't repulsed me, either. It was just ok. I enjoy the staff and the prices don't make me feel like I'm totally throwing money away so maybe I'll try again at a later point in time. I feel like a parent getting upset with their child for getting a B on their math test. C'mon Rudy's, you can do better!

15.description: Came here on a Saturday morning after an appointment in the area and was greeted by a real nice man working the store.  He was patient while I took forever with my order.  Everything looked delicious!  I finally settled on a cheese danish which was excellent.  Too bad I don't live in the area, otherwise, I would come here more.

20.description: Sugar cookie was inedible... I threw it away.  Butter cookies with sprinkles were just okay.  This bakery is so cute, I just wish the food was good :-(

8.description: This is a seriously overlooked little bakery. It's definitely old school and, I have to be honest, I kind of appreciate that. In a world of places that are trying to do it bigger and better and weirder, just for the novelty, it's kind of nice to walk into a place where it feels like time has stopped.The one down side to this place is that they're cash only, which I really do hate. Consequently, I wasn't able to get the cross section of stuff I would normally buy when I visit a bakery for the first time. I did have a big chocolate chip cookie and a horseshoe chocolate sandwich cookie, which were both seriously killer. That was a few weeks ago and I'm still thinking about those cookies. I also had an apple strudel, which was lovely. So flaky and buttery- a classic, and beautifully done. I want to try the cheese strudel now.Don't let the slightly dated exterior put you off- there are secret treasures inside. Just bring enough cash to pay for them.

14.description: GREAT coffee cake, Challah bread! VERY FRESH!! baked that morning!

1.description: The Cornelia Arts Building has provided incubator space to local and international artists and artisans for the past 25 years. Established in 1986, the informal community of the Cornelia Arts Building now hosts over 40 local artists whose work spans disciplines including painting and drawing, sculpture, photography, print-making, jewelry design and performance.

0.description: Great building filled with resident artists and artisans! Four annual Open House events are free and open to the public - include guest artists, plus fun features like live music and food truck! Wonderful chance to meet artists in their working studios and even buy their artwork! CorneliaArtsBuilding.com

12.description: Holy crap, I had forgotten how good Popeye's Chicken was!I don't usually get to eat any fried chicken because the mister is watching what he eats and he is helping me to watch what I eat too. However, last night I got to be in control of the dinner choice (picking up food) so before I went over to Wendy's to get his Mandarin Chicken salad I thought to myself, "Self, you want some nasty greasy fried chicken, right?" and I was all like "hells yeah" so I snuck into Popeye's for a 2 pc combo with cajun rice (aka dirty rice in Loosiana y'all).I had to wait a bit longer than I wanted as the place seemed to be understaffed, but hey I was in a good mood and I REALLY wanted that chicken.  The chicken was juicy, the rice was tasty and the biscuit was flaky and butteryish.  I thought I had died because I was in chicken heaven!Minus one star because it is really bad for me and minus another star because someone swiped my drink when I went to the ladies room to wash the grease off my hands :p.

7.description: I rarely eat fast food, but sometimes that fried chicken craving just hits you! The drive through menu is misleading. It shows that a bucket of chicken + 1 large side comes together for one price, but we were told they were separate. The cashier used a coupon though so we saved a few bucks anyway. I would give this place three stars, but they keep forgetting to give me ranch! We won't get into how I ended up dipping my chicken fingers in a tub of sour cream....

3.description: I'm giving half a star for customer service, and another half star for portion size. I usually avoid this location because they are really stingy. I have had some meals that were downright insulting; I'm a human being, not a bird.If I go in and order a dish that has a specific number of pieces such as 8 puny shrimp, that's on me and I don't complain, but there is no excuse for giving out 12 Cajun fries, half-filled containers of sides, and a handful of crumbs whenever they have bite-size items on the menu. This location ALWAYS gives me the skimpiest servings possible.My problem today was mainly customer service. I came in with a coupon that I got for doing a feedback survey, if you ever look at the back of your receipt, you will see the coupon code space, you get the code after you complete the survey.Anyway, I came in with the code. I'm supposed to buy a large drink and get two pieces of chicken and a biscuit free. I've been using these coupons for over 5 years after rating each visit online or over the telephone, at various locations including this one.The only two workers out front did not know what the coupon was, and they looked at me like I was crazy. They kept gawking at it and then whispering to each other. Finally they said these numbers don't match. I'm like, huh?The one worker said it again, these numbers don't match. I said don't match what? They don't match. I am super confused at this point, what doesn't it match? The sky? My foot? There is nothing to match. The cashier is supposed to take the coupon, hit some key on the register, and then enter the coupon code...that's it, there is nothing to match. They never even attempted to ring anything up to see if the code worked because they obviously did not know how to do that, they clearly have never looked at the back of their own receipts before.I didn't put up a fuss, just said forget it. I hate when people simply don't know what they are doing, and try to act like you're the problem and not their lack of knowledge.  It bugs me that in the end they think they are right and you are wrong, when it is not so.Oh yeah, and after all that, they didn't even have the Lemonade Icebox pie. Thanks a bunch Popeyes on Addison.

1.description: I never thought messing up fried chicken would be possible but coming to this Popeyes put that theory to work...although Im generally not a fan of greasy food..sometimes a girl needs her fried chicken. Especially if its spicy.I've been to a few locations and as with any franchises-some will be better than others..but this location by far the WORST..horrible customer service..you can tell everyone there hates their job..they were not very pleased when I would ask questions about the prices then they mixed up my order...(regular instead of spicy) I knew right away it was regular beacuse it was completely lacking in any taste whatsoever. Sadly, however, when I got the spicy one it was also just as flavorless..but boy was it greasy...there was absolutely nothing redeeming about itThe mac and cheese..was overcooked and mushy.My husband and I couldnt come to finishing even a quarter of the food we had ordered.If you want Popeyes fried chicken, avoid this place at all costs..this does not come close to the reputation Popeyes is known for.I literally feel I threw $20 away because thats what I had to do with the food we ordered.

2.description: As far as the fried chicken chains are concerned, Popeye's is normally my spot on fav, hands down. The Colonel just can't hang in my book. With that being said, this location in particular is a huge disappointment to the otherwise stellar reputation of the brand. I was leaving Wrigley after a game and heading back to hop on 90 to head back to the burbs when I saw the sign and just had to stop. I just wanted to grab something quick to go, but quick did not turn out to be a word in the employees of this location's vocabulary. It was a solid  20 min wait from the time I ordered until I finally got my box. Even if they had to bread it on the spot and throw it in the fryer, it should not have taken nearly so long. I think the clerk might have been pissed off at me since I stopped in relatively close to closing time for the dining room, as he was giving me some pretty serious attitude. I have an aversion to any drive-thru. OK, dude, I get it. You obviously hate your job, and you hate me because I am forcing you to do it. Perhaps a line of work that does not involve customer service is more your speed. How about being a guinea pig for some pharmaceutical company? Needless to say, I was relieved when I finally got my box so I could leave. I polished off my 2 piece spicy with cajun fries and a biscuit while speeding down I-90 at 85 MPH. This is not an easy feat to pull off, but I am somewhat of a professional. As for the food?Chicken: Extremely greasy. Eating it made me feel like I had just been making out with Miss Piggy. Also poorly breaded and prepared. Pretty much the entire skin fell off after the first bite. Part of the cool factor of Popeye's (and fried chicken in general) is that nice crunch to contrast with the succulent nature of the meat. The skin here would only be useful if I was trying to pull off a "Hello Clarice" impersonation.  I ate it because I was extremely hungry, but even that was a mistake. Fries: About like trying to eat seasoned cardboard. I could not finish them. They were WAY over-seasoned and hard as a rock. I dumped them out the window. I hope the person behind me on the highway did not have their windshield damaged from a projectile fry. Biscuit: The one and only redeeming quality. It was actually really good, which shocked the hell out of me since everything else was so awful. If you are going to royally F up somebody's food, why not go for the gusto and epic fail at everything? Popeye's franchises normally have fairly decent chicken on my visits, but this location sucks.

9.description: 1 star for the remarkably clean interior.  1 star for the occasional deal posted on the window that actually makes eating at Popeye's a possibility.I'm not the type to eat this type of food.  "This type of food," Eric?  What does that mean?  I'm glad you asked.  I meeean... fried food that can be and frequently is tastier grilled (chicken), super SUPER expensive side dishes that are SO mediocre, and the type of food that attracts swarms of 17 year olds wearing straight billed fi'ty-nine fi'ty hats.Ok, that last one isn't Popeye's fault.  Or is it?I went here yesterday with my lovely girlfriend to get a bucket of 10 pc mixed chicken for 9.99.  {---   "1  star for the occasional deal posted on the window that actually makes eating at Popeye's a possibility."But, we get home with a huge bucket of chicken and nothing else.I don't eat the fried chicken skin.  I peel it off.  I'm in it for the meat, baby. (ha.)So, I have a huge ass plate of chicken meat, a bucket of fried chicken skins, and no fucking side dishes.THIS IS WHY YOU GET TWO STARS POPEYE.LOOK WHAT YOU'VE REDUCED ME TO!!!*ahem*  Sorry, that shan't happen again.Cheeers.

18.description: When my family makes me eat fried chicken this place is not bad. You might rot in the drive through but at least they have always gotten my order right.

10.description: Please. Slow. Down.Seriously.The chick behind the register asked me something about apple and sweet potatos.  I can only assume pie, but I couldn't tell clearly enough.  So I had a craving.  Sue me.  I haven't had Popeye's since I left Texas three years ago.  And now I sadly don't think I ever will again.  I don't recall the gravy on the mashed potatos being so gross.  The chicken so greasy.  More so than expected.  Extra star though, the biscuit is exactly what I wanted!  There are rules posted everywhere.  Again, seriously.No loitering.No outside food.No eating in for longer than 30 minutes.No refills.No sharing.No using the restroom without someone buzzing you in and then trusting they recall that you're in there before they buzz someone else in.I get it.  Lane Tech is across the street.  But it's Saturday and you have one other family in here.  Chill.Or don't because I learned my lesson.  It's getting to be a sad time in my life where I realize that I'm not only done with chains, I'm also done with fast food.  *sob*

13.description: The dippin chicken promo says double the serving, but i only got 9 pcs of the chicken. How many pieces would a single serving have have? 5? Because it's not worth $4.99 for 5 small pieces of chicken.

16.description: As I've said before I do not love fast food, however they're everywhere taunting me with their cheap & greasy eats. Popeye's is the worst, you think you're taking the high road by getting chicken, right, fried chicken. I love their sides, fries, red beans w/rice and the Cajun rice. The staff here is not mean, or rude, just unfriendly.  They never smile, maybe they don't have teeth.

17.description: It's a relatively new franchise, so I've been watching this place grow like a greasy sprout from a smelly flour bed.  At first it seemed that the staff had no clue how to operate the facility because they were new to the fried chicken racket.  After a few years of being open, they've hit an obvious ceiling presumably due to the revolving door management.  That being said, the chicken and sides are what you'd expect from a Popeye's location; but I've had better chicken from other locations in the city.  The wildcard is the fact that I wind up sick from the food more often than not.  Is the great taste worth the price of digestive malaise?  Sometimes it is....

15.description: Damn, Popeye's is some good drunk eats.  Mashed taters with cajun gravy, mac and cheese, biscuits, and of course, the specialty, fried chicken.  The service here sucks, but what do you expect from a drive-thru at 1:30 am, Disney-esque smiles and cheer?  Hardly.  You'd be surly too if you were working the deep frier well past midnight.Sometimes they close earlier than stated.  Trust me, there is nothing more disappointing than showing up with five minutes to spare just to find out the stoned employees have closed the joint already.  So we'll call the complaint line, and they'll send us some free coupons.  Small solace.

0.description: I'm a huge Popeyes fan, so I just want to get that out of the way first. With that said, this restaurant is a disappointment. I'm giving it 3-stars because it's a Popeyes, and if the name Popeyes is on your restaurant and it serves fried chicken and warm biscuits, then you automatically get 3-stars. This place is slow, uninterested, and slow. Did I say they're slow? They're slow. When I walk in and I'm craving Popeyes, my excitement level is generally a 9/10. I'm like a kid on Christmas, but this time I just want to open my box of chicken and biscuits and then sit there and hate myself after. Is that so much to ask for? It shouldn't take 20 minutes before, that just gives me time to think about how bad I'm going to feel after. Clean it up Popeyes of Irving and Ashland.

5.description: Disclaimer: Fried Chicken is my favorite food.I went here 3 times over the past 5 months - every time the chicken was exceptional. I have been to other locations in the city, and have often gotten stale chicken or fires - not here though. This is my go to popeyes now.

11.description: Drive though. Always a bonus in the city. I stopped by here, famished after a CPR class about a mile down the road at CPR Now. I knew there wouldn't be anything along the way on my hike back up to the northern suburbs, so this was the closest place. Since I normally avoid fast food, I was pleasantly surprised.  I forgot how good popeyes could be. I ordered the wrap filled with spicy chicken, red beans and rice. OHHHH so good, smoky, salty, spicy, and convenient to eat in the car...perfect. Not a place a would frequent unless I want to be the reciepient rather than the administrator of the CPR I just learned though.  Nice for a once in a while treat, and this location was clean and efficient.

8.description: the chicken wings was a bit dried, but their sides are seriously good, i prefer their mash and gravy over KFC anytime!

4.description: I usually like Popeye's. However, this one managed to make bland mac and cheese. And the tables were dirtier than other locations I've been to (except the one at Lawrence and Kimball). They have a drive thru and parking lot. The employees were nice. But I'll go to another location next time - I just wish the one on Harlem weren't so far away!

14.description: There is less light in the day and the holiday cheer has passed. My household is resuming normalcy, but as I have stated there is less light to energize my cold, tired body. I had a guest over one afternoon a couple of days before leaving to visit my family for the holiday and had a pantry cleaning party. We whipped up a Top Serlion marinated in wine, butter, shallots and a dash of HP sauce. We created a delectable cauliflower casserole with bits of  cheese, gruyere and an ancient block of reggiano that would surely not make it past my impending trip to visit my family back on the farm. We topped the casserole with panko flakes browned in butter, threw it into the oven and baked at 375 until it was Just Right. With reckless abandon and a bit of dry white Bordeaux we tore through our meal and hoped that the rest of our holiday fare would be even half as good.The day before I was to leave to go back to the farm, hunger stepped back onto my doorstep. The grocery? The prospect of heading down to the grocery gave me as much excitement as shopping at Macy's on Christmas Eve. I've already had Sticky Rice this week. Italian take out, the depth of misery -- over priced and under satisfying -- I'd rather gnaw on my cat's tail. A sleeping pill? There had to be something out there that would cure the emptiness in my stomach...but what?Popeye's Famous Fried Chicken."Spicy" fried chicken, flaky biscuits (do they still make them with lard?!), so-called, "mashed potatoes," with (even sillier), "Cajun Gravy(tm)", rice and beans, and gelatinous, "Mac-n-Cheese."I've been back from the farm for four days and rediscovered the box of chicken. 'Twas just as delish and crispy as the evening I bought it. Joy to the miracle of modern fry techniques!Happy New Year, Yelp :)

6.description: Can they be any more slower! Omg. It's 4:24 pm on Saturday and there are barely any people here and they are so slow. Imagine if it was busy. Service is horrible but the food is okay. If you are in a hurry do not come in here.  And I ordered a sweet tea and she had the cup on the counter but she never gave it to me I had to ask for it like 10 minutes later.

3.description: it should be known that i have been a client of kauser's first salon, great cuts on devon, for fourteen years now. i'm so particular when it comes to who touches my skin, especially with something as important as my eyebrows. one wrong gesture and you can look surprised ALL the time. or your brows can be uneven in thickness. trust me, i've seen it all, and i've made the mistake of putting my brows in a stranger's hands out of desperation before. it rarely works out. enter kauser's new(er) salon. sure, it's much closer to me than traveling out to devon, but i also know that kauser only works at this location on mondays, and i'm usually working. therefore, i congratulated her on the new location but planned on still making my monthly hajj to her on devon. well, cue birthday week and very little free time to get much-needed errands, including threading, done in time. i decided that if i couldn't make it out to devon (and i really couldn't), i should at least continue to support kauser. so i apprehensively stepped foot into this location. farrah works nearly every day. she's gorgeous, intelligent, and confident. i didn't scare her with my brow spiel. instead, i told her i wanted to keep them thick and i just needed a little cleanup. as she began, she told me my brows look great. i told her it's because kauser has done then for years. she giggled. not only did farrah do the minimal cleanup i asked for, she also managed to shape them beautifully. i was, quite frankly, in awe. even my mother commented on the fact that it looked like she had penciled in my brows! only after this did i tell farrah how seriously i take my brows. she told me she's glad i didn't tell her beforehand because she would've gotten nervous!i'm happy to report that i'll be returning to see farrah whenever she's in and whenever i don't have the ability to go down to devon. it's so nice to have another *person*. also, for what it's worth, my mother got a full face wax with farrah and enjoyed her thorough job with that as well.

1.description: My eyebrows were getting completely out of hand, and I kept putting off going to them waxed. Finally, when I looked in the mirror and saw two Tom Selleck 'staches where my brows once were, I knew it was time to fix my face. I went in on a Saturday and had my brows threaded for $7. It was quick, easy, and my brows were on point. Like BAM! So, don't be Dallas. Fix your hairy face.

2.description: I've been here twice. I was pleased both times. I just wish western was not such a cluster at 5pm!!!!! I'll rough it and come back. Good threading is hard to find. $7! Can't beat it!

9.description: Great place! I came here with a Groupon and I know this will be my new go to place for eyebrows and stuff! Farrah was great! She's informative and very friendly. She got me a nice discount for visiting for the first time. I will be recommending this place to my friends for sure. Try it out if you're looking for a great salon!! :-)

10.description: DO NOT GO HERE! This place is a potential health code violation! I am shocked that as many people have said they had a good experience when they clearly double dip here. Yes, that is right. I went here for a Brazilian and she used the same stick over and over again. Re-dipping in the same wax creates a breeding ground for bacteria. What if someone else had an open sore (hello, STDs) on their vajajay and then she double dipped on them and then on to me?! The worst part - I called her out on it, asking her not to do that and she said "no, I only use a fresh stick for each client." WHAT? You are supposed to use a fresh stick with every application of wax!  You are NOT supposed to reuse any  stick. I tried to explain again and she didn't seem to understand due to a language barrier (supposedly). I even told her that I was pregnant and that I didn't want her to use the same stick but she kept doing it anyway. I was halfway through and didn't know what to do. I should have walked out in the middle.  The IL Dept of Health's site is down today so I couldn't check if what they were doing was against code or not, but I would NEVER go here again. They clearly don't care about their client's health (those stick are not that expensive). On top of it all, I walked out with blue wax all over my inner lady parts (why would I have it on my inner parts?!) and she smeared some sort of lotion over the entire area that was never rubbed in. And she didn't even get all of the hair off?! I get waxed every 30 days and have never had to shower after due to wax and lotion being all over. Not only a terrible wax job, but unsanitary to boot!!!

4.description: Good for small area waxing and threading. I like all the women working there and the prices are very convenient.

6.description: I've been going here for over a year now and would not choose anywhere else to get my eyebrows done! Riffat is the best! She does awesome with not only eyebrows but her facials too! She takes her time and makes everything look fabulous! I highly recommend this place! Really clean and a friendly environment!

11.description: Bad place. I tried this place as it was close to home and I needed to get my eyebrows done. I just didn't have time to travel to Devon where I usually get my threading done. First I felt I was not even welcomed into the salon . Second all through the threading procedure the lady was talking to another lady sitting in the parlor . Talk about customer service. The worst part the lady cut all my skin around my eyes leaving me cuts and scars . My eyebrows were unevenly done as well.  I would definitely take the pains to go to my regular threading place in Devon next time.

5.description: I honestly don't understand why this place has such bad reviews...well I'm just basing this on the eyebrow threading I had done with the sweet older lady who works there. I was going to do wax, but she told me that threading would be better since it lasts longer and gives a more natural shape to your brows (plus mine are a little thinner) so  I thought why not. I am sooooo glad she did it. My eyebrows came out looking goooood AND they were EVEN. EVEEEEEN. So many places do a good job with grooming my eyebrows but for some damn reason one is always thinner than the other, and that drives me crazy! But not here man. This here is legit.

7.description: I've been here once before and although I found the woman here to be extremely pushy, I was pleased with my brows so I decided to return. They take walk-ins almost exclusively so that's what I did and when I arrived there was a woman in the chair and a man waiting to be serviced. About 10 minutes after I came in another woman walked in and asked if she could get her eyebrows waxed. The owner(?) finished with the woman and moved on to the man while telling me repeatedly to sit in one of the salon chairs so I'd be more comfortable (I'm 9 months pregnant) although I assured her that I felt fine.  I go to the restroom and upon my return she again told me to sit in the chair and I figured that I was next so OK. She finished with the man then turned to the woman who came in AFTER me and said "you're next". The woman looked baffled as did I. She knew that I existed because she wouldn't leave me alone about the damn chair. Then she said "oh she called ahead"The fuck she did. I told the woman that she in fact did not and that I was CLEARLY next. She tried to make up some bullshit about it only taking a few minutes but the point was she had decided for whatever reason that she valued this woman's money more than mine, so I took me and my dollars out the door. What topped it off was that I was so pissed I went the wrong way and got stuck in Pride parade traffic.I'll never go back.

8.description: I went in to this salon/spa thinking it was that...it really wasn't!!!! I asked for wax and thread for my eyebrows but was disappointed with the lack of service...no towel over my forehead...no wiping off my eye makeup....the lady was walking across the room for the wax after each application....really??? No...definitely stay away!!!

0.description: This salon is in a little strip mall across the street from Lane Tech. I've been here a few times for eyebrow threading and each time I walked in without an appointment and was seated immediately. This is my favorite place to go because she takes her time (which is still only a couple of minutes), it doesn't hurt, and I don't walk out of there with a super red face like I do everywhere else that I have tried. The parking lot is very small and is shared with a few other businesses, including a Chase Bank and a Dunkin Donuts.

58.description: I think this place is incredibly charming!  Came here with a group of 5 for some wine (we didn't order food) and really enjoyed our experience.  We were seated outside in one of the corner sections and loved it.  The atmosphere is really elegant and there is a good diversity of people.  The service was 10/10:  our server was incredibly knowledgeable about wine and was extremely helpful in describing the taste so that we knew exactly what we were getting.  She was even more helpful in my experience than a couple of the winery servers in Sonoma that I had when I was in California.  She came by enough times to make sure that we liked everything but not enough that it felt intrusive.The wine itself was amazing.  They have options to create your own flights with both red and white wine.   For the flights, you get 3 different wines to try with about a half glass portion which is pretty generous.  I also had a glass of red wine by itself which had a great finish.  If you can appreciate a good glass of wine, or just enjoy trying new things this place is a must.   The prices are not too outrageous for the quality experience and wine that you get.   This is great for a date spot or for a group.  Tip:  Sit outside if you can, the inside section isn't nearly as fun.  Also I believe they can rent out the space for an event, this venue is perfect for one.

56.description: Cool atmosphere outside. Food was average for the price-hence the low stars. Wait staff was pleasant and attentive. I've had better Tapas.

29.description: Stopped in for some vino after a hellish week and some steak tartare.  I will say the tartare was very good and the wine prices were on point. The bartender was awesome, super nice guy.  Will definitely be back!

42.description: Great romantic spot with good wine and superb service. "Small, expensive plates" In fact, the plates are so small, it borders on being a rip-off. They need to change this.

23.description: Closed to the public on a Saturday night because of a "private event"?! Boo. Way to service your neighborhood. Not coming back, that's for sure.

47.description: Had a reservation for an early NYE dinner here with my wife and another couple. Unfortunately it was one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. Food and service both were shockingly bad. Details below...Upon arrival for our 8:15 reservation, we were taken by a seemingly flustered hostess to a tent-like enclosed patio. Not exactly what we expected given the sub-zero windchills last night. This proved problematic as the restaurant's attempts to heat the tent caused quite a bit of condensation which, unbeknownst to us at the time, soaked our personal belongings over the course of our meal.We all four ordered a three course prix fixe special NYE offering. Two of us added pairings, while the other two ordered drinks a la carte. We received our first wines without food, which would become a common theme on the night. It was a good 20 minutes until the first course actually arrived, effectively nullifying the idea of pairings since I had already finished my wine by this point.My strangely giant portion of mushroom soup finally arrived, lukewarm at best. Despite the huge serving, the soup was served with a small teaspoon. If I had tried to finish it, I would probably still be eating it. While powering through this course, my second wine showed up with no explanation.We sat for another 30 minutes waiting for the second course to arrive. It eventually did - my pork belly was edible but nothing to write home about. Two people ordered the rack of lamb. One was served barely rare, while the other came out beyond well-done. Around this time the waitress noticed that my wife's second drink, ordered about 20 minutes ago, had not yet been delivered. Rather than apologizing or saying she would check on it, she simply walked off after saying "Well, it's been ordered." This was a fairly common theme on the night...I'm not sure if the waitress was embarrassed at the fact that the restaurant was so clearly in the weeds (I didn't see a happy face in the entire place - staff or diner), but she seemed to avoid our table at all costs.Up next was the longest wait of the night as we waited about 40 minutes for dessert. As expected, the dessert wine came about halfway through this wait and I polished it off well before dessert actually showed up. We had been pretty patient all night but finally one of asked if the desserts were on their way. The waitress replied with "yes, everything is backed up tonight." No apology at all.Dessert finally showed up, and it was the worst course of the night. My profiteroles tasted like sawdust - I took one bite and was finished. We sat staring at our food for another 15 minutes or so until I got up and asked the waitress to kindly bring us our check. She dropped it off a few minutes later with a simple thank you, and no acknowledgement of the fact that we all knew it had been an absolutely horrible experience. Ironically, when the reservation was made we were told there was a hard 2 hour cap on our reservation and we would be kicked out promptly at 10:15. By no fault of our own we left at 10:45.$350 later we left the restaurant feeling ripped off and still hungry. Honestly if they had made some effort to at least apologize, acknowledge the situation, or thrown us a bone in the form of a free round of drinks or something, I could write this off as a place not prepared to handle a NYE situation and give them another shot. Unfortunately, the entire experience was unbelievably bad across the board and no effort was taken to make us whole for that fact.In summary:Food: 0/5Service: 0/5Value: 0/5

8.description: The oysters were good, but the service sucked! The bouncer was on a power trip and enforced "regulations" (during oyster festival) per 5-10 minutes. Oh and the waitress was rude! I honestly don't write bad reviews unless I am completely dissatisfied, and I could not wait to leave. I would not recommend this to my best friend.

31.description: My husband and I had our wedding reception at Volo on May 2, 2015 and it was perfect. We rented out the outdoor garden area and had about 60 guests. The venue was very intimate and we received multiple compliments from our guests. Many wondered how we had found the place. More than the venue the service at Volo was amazing. From the moment we first emailed, April was very responsive and never took more than 24 hours to respond to our requests. She coordinates all the events at Volo and did a fantastic job making sure all of our details were taken care of. The staff also immediately made us feel at home. It felt like we were a part of the Volo family. Now, the food. It is something that cannot be ignored. The chef, Steven, has such a passion for blending unique flavors. It is not your traditional wedding food, which was exactly what we wanted. Everything is served buffet style with small plates instead of a large entree type meal. Another big plus is the drink options, we got the beer and wine package and they were great about accommodating our request for local IPA brews at no additional charge. Overall, we could not have been happier with Volo. If you are thinking about having a small intimate wedding in the city at least check this place out. It was beautiful and made our wedding day one to remember. We look forward to going back to Volo again and again to celebrate our anniversary.

34.description: This place is pretty fantastic and just what the husband and I needed on a Friday night after a long week. We were able to make a reservation a few days in advance and were sat in their cute covered patio out back. Our server was extremely friendly and attentive and he was incredibly knowledgable about their wine list. I love that you are able to get half pours of wine so that you can try more and they have a nice variety of flights. Their wine list is very diverse but not overwhelming. The food was also excellent offering a lot of small plates and delicious entrees. We had a cheese plate, pickled veggies and olives, bread with 3 types of spreads, pork belly skewers and shared the fried chicken entree. I kid you not, the fried chicken was one of the best dishes I've eaten! We will be back soon. I'd recommend this place for a date night or a night out with the girls :)

16.description: Top place. Came her for the oyster happy hour and went to town. Drank lots of great white wine, and we ate some amazing pork belly. Loved the food happy hour and the service was excellent. Our server at the bar (we sat at the bar) was super nice. She let us try some wine before the pour, and even when we spilled a glass by mistake she topped it off for us. Just a cool place. The interior is modern and the back room has a very cool booth option for date night.

13.description: One of my favorite places for wine and tasty little plates to share.  It helps that it is within walking distance of my apartment.They have a nice but not overwhelming wine list.  They also have really good food.  I love getting an array of cheeses, some oysters, and other little plates of deliciousness.I wish they were open on Sundays.  That's usually the only night my husband and I both have off and want to go relax with a glass of wine and light bites.  So i don't get to come as often as I would like, but I am sure their employees appreciate the day off.

11.description: Cabana-ingGot really giddy when I found a groupon for wine and cheese at Volo during barely warm weather last spring. The weather gods were on my side because we were able to sit in one of their cute outdoor cabanas. So cute, it'd make Barry Manilo bust out his tune.We had a choice of one wine flight each and a cheese plate to share. We picked piedmonte and pinot noir flights and a bunch of cheeses that came with jam, candied walnuts and some bread. Perfect little romantic spot for after a light dinner or a small bite if you're both anorexic. For reg folks, it is a great pre or post-dinner idea.Service was good especially since it was a busy night. For me the main draw is the back patio so I'm not sure if I'd go back just to sit inside. Yeah, the wines are great, I just like to sit in a cute setting while sippin. The inside just looks like any other bar.I will definitely be back before Chiberia season!

39.description: We visited this restaurant on Saturday.  And we were pleased with the food and service.  The portions are sharable.  We ordered the BMG flatbread.  And despite that the crust was a little overdone, it was delish!  And we also shared the Black & Blu steak.  Another must-have.  Very flavorful too!  If you were hungry, then another dish would be necessary since the portions are smaller.  The ambiance is simple -- chalk written walls.  It was a little cold being seated by the door.  They have a floor heater, but I wasn't able to feel the difference.

37.description: Nice cozy patio, good for groups of 2-4. Came for $1 oysters and they were decent. Took off a star for the service taking forever, it wasn't busy either.....maybe just understaffed on a nice day. Took the 2nd star off after waiting for 30 minutes to get the check, then another 30 for the waiter to come back and run our cards.

0.description: If you have ever told someone to have a "sweet new year" or even if you refer to your friends or people you have come into contact with as "sweetie" that could be because you just came from this place. It has a awesome selection of sweet wines and I had one just this ;ast Saturday from South Africa. I would remember what the wine was but i had many vowels in it. Just to make sure my pallet was right I topped it off with some white sangria. If they add some goat cheese I will come here a lot more even though I will probably come here more often.  I only regret that I dont live in the same building so i can sleepwalk my way in here, drink sweet wine and pretend I dont have any problems :)

38.description: Great porkbelly, cheap decent oysters freshly shucked. Very nice back patio. Interesting decor. Fresh orchids in the bathroom. Decent beer list. Didn't get entre. Try it.

51.description: This place is very cute and we loved the outdoor patio. Wine selections were very interesting and the service was spot on, much better than one would think for a small place. Great price for dishes.loved the chilled oysters, beet and goat cheese salad, duck confit melts in your mouth! If you are up in that area of Chicago check it out!

27.description: Local neighborhood jem. Great staff who want to know you by name. As I'm writing this review dano the owner tops off my glass of champagne just cuZ he knows I've had a long day.   Food good and not too large. My favorite is the duck confit. Great wine list.  Will come again!!

32.description: Excellent Food and Wines.  Definitely top notch, hands-down.  Extremely reasonably priced.This is a wonderful spot in a great neighborhood.  It's a perfect place for a date, especially the patio with its private cabanas.  The service was outstanding, and the chef is super knowledgeable and talented as he came by to make sure everything we had ordered was as good as we had hoped, and took time to chat with us.If you've not been to this place, you must give it a try.  You can't go wrong here.

54.description: Cabana-ingGot really giddy when I found a groupon for wine and cheese at Volo during barely warm weather last spring. The weather gods were on my side because we were able to sit in one of their cute outdoor cabanas. So cute, it'd make Barry Manilo bust out his tune.We had a choice of one wine flight each and a cheese plate to share. We picked piedmonte and pinot noir flights and a bunch of cheeses that came with jam, candied walnuts and some bread. Perfect little romantic spot for after a light dinner or a small bite if you're both anorexic. For reg folks, it is a great pre or post-dinner idea.Service was good especially since it was a busy night. For me the main draw is the back patio so I'm not sure if I'd go back just to sit inside. Yeah, the wines are great, I just like to sit in a cute setting while sippin. The inside just looks like any other bar.I will definitely be back before Chiberia season!

48.description: Very sad to write this review...Wife and I chose this place for the NYE meal; our first in Chicago! And we were a little disappointed.We were the first to arrive around 5:45pm and were seated in an enclosed/heated patio area. It was -3F outside and so were little nervous being seated here. Two minutes later, my wife was being "rained" upon; as in the condensation from the tent/canapé ceiling was dripping down. Can't blame the venue for this of course and they were happy to seat us at the adjacent table. Sadly, despite being next to the large heat generator, we were still a bit chilly.Our waitress was excellent. She guided us though the wine flights and helped us chose the right wines based on our preferences. Great choices too! However, the food, while tasty was far from generous in portion size. We ordered three different plates (the Salmon, Duck and Pork Belly) and we were still pretty hungry afterwards. We went on to order two different desserts; both of which again were tiny in size. So here's my advice for this place. If you're looking for a quaint and cozy WINE BAR EXPERIENCE with fancy nibbles, this is the place. However, if you are looking for a restaurant, I would go elsewhere.

44.description: Decor isn't much, but the service is very good and their wine is excellent. My main gripe is that it is very over-priced, especially for the way the place looks.

24.description: My wife and I used Volo for our wedding and reception this past July. It was a perfect venue; the space and especially the service were incomparable. Special thanks to Chef John for the fabulous food, to Danno for keeping our drinks fresh and his many kindnesses, and finally, to April, who was incredible in every way to make our day truly special.

7.description: I've been here twice, once during the week and once on a weekend. Both times it wasn't packed and service was great. Ive tried the oyster special and that was just ok. The oysters arent served on ice and the condiments were a bit bland. I also tried the bone marrow and it was good but very oily, but worth the try. And both times I had the duck confit which would have me coming back again and again. It falls of the bone and has amazing flavor. In fact, I plan on going back this week!
