Oh and their back area is adorable and they have it sealed off with heaters when its cold. I have added Volo to my rotation.

49.description: Great place...and Perfect Wedding!In addition to being a frequent customer as we live in the neighborhood, my husband and I had our wedding here on May 17 of this year.  April, Dano, Stephen, and the entire team were all great to work with. They were very flexible, allowing us to customize our food and wine selections in our package to make it perfect for our day.   They even added a couple extra food items (things we enjoyed at the tasting, but ultimately decided not to include) in addition to perfectly preparing everything what we ordered.  The food never stopped coming.  All our guests ate like kings.It was a chilly spring and we had freezing rain the day before.  Therefore the beautiful patio garden got a little battered.  The gardener come in and cut some of the flowers from the side area and placed them in the fountain to add a little bit of color for us.We chose not to have a DJ.  I was planning on having my niece cue up our music groupings (we had a processional song, recessional song, a cocktail hour list, and an after ceremony list).  April offered to do it for us instead.  How nice is that!Overall, you will get attention here that you simply will not find at a banquet hall or a hotel ballroom.  I cannot say enough great things about Volo.

40.description: Can't speak for the food but this place was a great stop for a glass (...or 3) of wine!  Wine was reasonably priced and the food menu looked very reasonable as well.

53.description: Had a great evening here last Friday! We were seated in one of the "cabanas" in the patio and really enjoyed the experience. I started off with a bubbly flight, my husband had the pinots; both were good. Later in the evening we ordered a carafe of the sauvignon and I don't see why anyone would get just a glass when for a few dollars more you end up with approximately 2.5 glasses of wine. Our server was fantastic: friendly, helpful and when a larger group was seated, he made sure to take our order first so as not to be stuck in the kitchen queue behind them. We really liked the small plates/tapas style menu. Started off with a cheese plate and then moved on to the lamb tacos, eggplant mozzarella, oysters, and fried chicken. All but the latter were great. Next time we'll definitely get something else instead of the fried chicken. While I loved the back patio, the inside of Volo was great as well. Very intimate atmosphere--a great date spot. All in all it was a lovely evening and I'm looking forward to returning again!

30.description: The first time I came here I had a great experience, I have been back since and was looking forward to many more visits, as I live down the street.  They have a beautiful outdoor patio in the back.  However, recently I visited and due to their limited menu as well as being lactose intolerant and allergic to wheat, I really can't eat much of what they offer.  I had ordered food to go and when I got to Volo I had asked the hostess if it was ok to eat on the front patio and order a wine flight.  After I had setup my food, a gentleman told me I needed to leave and couldn't eat here.  I started to explain that I just ordered wine and he rudely interrupted me and told me to leave.  I'm pretty disappointed with how the situation was handled.  I'm not sure I'll come back or recommend this place to my friends.

46.description: We've lived in the neighborhood for 5 years and have always wanted to try this place so were very excited to go here for a NYE dinner with another couple.  Unfortunately, after our experience, I don't think any 4 of us will ever go back. We were seated on their outside patio, which was heated and had a cute ambience.  However, it was so freezing outside that condensation was building up on the tent and dripped on both us and our personal belongings.  However, we were feeling optimistic and excited to celebrate the evening so we overlooked the seating choice.  We both chose to do the prixe-fixe option with two of us choosing the wine pairing and the others ordering drinks a la carte. We were served our drinks in a timely manner, however it was odd because both of the boys who did the wine pairing then spent 20 minutes waiting for the first course with the wine meant to be paired with it....okay, we were starting to get a bit annoyed and it just went downhill from there.  I won't go into details about the rest of the meal because another member of the group already reviewed in details.   However, to sum it up...the worst part of the evening was the attitude of the staff.  Our waitress essentially ignored us because I'm sure she knew we were starting to get annoyed with the service and just wanted to avoid us.  The food runner dropped our dishes off in a hurry without any explanation.  Looking around, it was obvious the kitchen and staff were overwhelmed as there were a lot of unhappy faces.  However, just a simple acknowlegement from any of the staff, a manager, etc. would have gone a long way.  Instead we got a curt attitude from our waitress and were told "oh you didn't get your drink yet? well I ordered it" "Yeah everything is backed up" without any empathy or apologies.  If I'm spending over 80$/person on a meal on NYE, I expect better than that.  I'm surprised if there was a manager on site that night, that someone did not take the time to visit all the tables and apologize for the delays or offer a complimentary cocktail, anything to salvage the evening.Very disappointing as the patio looked like it would be amazing in the summer and we all live in the neighborhood, but very confident that we won't be returning and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

1.description: Okay, so it's Saturday night at around 7:30pm and guess who walks in for a 6-top reservation? My husband, young son, friends, their two young kids, and moi. Yes, we realized it was a wine bar when we made the last-minute reservation on OpenTable, but we really needed some wine after a fun-packed evening at a school concert (note sarcasm here).Did the waiters and hostesses scoff at this unlikely and probably-unwelcome scene? Nope. They welcomed all of us with smiles and a really nice table too! The waiter was super nice and helpful (smart, because we were ordering up the place). We ordered pretty much everything on the menu to share. Note that the portions are tapas style and each plate has varied serving sizes, etc.The waiter was so nice and told us how many were in each portion as we ordered (e.g. we had to order two of the tacos because they come in three). They have an extensive wine list and everything we had was outstanding. The kids had cold cuts and cheeses and we pretty much had everything else. The tartar with egg -- outstanding!!! I also loved the oysters. For dessert, we had gelato and we loved everything. Thank you Volo for understanding Chicago and we will definitely come back (most likely without kids)!!

55.description: Pea Flatbread was bad. Eggplant mozzarella stack was not goo. The vegetable crudite were sport peppers and cornishones. Server with hat was just goofy. It was late but no pride.

9.description: Went here tonight with a friend. It was a good setting, relaxed, yet classy service, drinks, & food. Our server, Bradford(?), was awesome. He was able to give recommendations that we each loved for our separate wine flights, and our shared plates. He was also super friendly, well informed, and easy going. We really enjoyed all of the plates we tried. Look forward to coming to enjoy the patio in the summer!

26.description: Elly was a very attentive and kind server. The food was excellent and the atmosphere on the back patio was perfect.

25.description: I attended a wedding here recently. The space is lovely - very intimate, and a nice setup for a small wedding. Everyone who was working at the wedding from Volo were very nice and helpful. Also the food was, hands-down, the best I've ever had at a wedding. No bland over-cooked chicken breasts here (if they offer you a lamb chop, take it. Don't ask, just accept it and eat you. Your mouth with thank you.)

12.description: Wine and service were good. I would skip the food if I ever return.  Prices are on the high end and not consistent with the food offered in my opinion.  The staff are very nice so it's unfortunate that other areas are lacking.

59.description: Im in love!  The service is fantastic, the wine is amazing.  We did order food the first time we went.  It was ok, but I would just visit for the wine.Service:Fantastic.  I have had the same server.  A middle aged man with glasses and fun spikey hair.  He is very knowledgeable, helpful and constantly on his toes.  Sit in his section if you can.  He seems to always be there.Atmosphere:Great for a first date, regular date, or time out with the ladies.  Sit in the patio if its nice out.  The atmosphere is so relaxing and makes you want to cozy up and drink glass after glass with your guests.  When I went with my boyfriend we stayed till it closed and sat inside which had a nice warm feeling too.  When I went with a friend of mine we sat outside and enjoyed their covered back patio for two hours.  Its easy to get lost in the time there.Wine:If you can not tell from the five stars its great.  The winner is the fact that you can order  a taste, a half glass, a whole glass, or more.  I appreciate the portion sizes because I like to try several and create my own flight.  Though their menu does have flight options.  I prefer red wine and they have some great options for boldy, juicy, spicy wines with a nice long finish.  They will also sell you the bottle.  We made sure to take one home with us.Food:It was ok.  We had the muscles and one of their spreads.  It was ok. Nothing to rave about. Id go to Hop Leaf for either of those items first.  The wine won me over so much, that it really wasn't a deterrent to the evening.Price:Im a penny pincher and this is cost effective. 4.50 - 8 for a delicious half a glass of wine each.  Yes and Yes.  Sign me up!So if you need a night for wine, go to VOLO!

21.description: We hosted our son's rehearsal dinner in the beautiful garden setting in the back of VOLO Restaurant Wine Bar. It was AMAZING! April was so incredibly easy to work with and made sure everything was perfect for us! The food was plentiful and delicious and we were even able to choose our favorite wines. We brought in small mason jars with flowers which, along with the candles they provided and the lovely lighting, made us feel like we were in a magical place. The service was exceptional, too. I cannot say enough wonderful things as April and her staff made my son's rehearsal dinner a night we will never forget!!!

17.description: Perfect place to go with a girlfriend or romantic date. The ambiance is very cozy and intimate. Oyster happy hour was good (the oysters themselves didn't blow my mind, but what do you want for a dollar?) The real shining star here is the service. . . Dano the bartender escalated my casual snack with a friend to the best kickoff celebration to my birthday week. Charming and funny without being intrusive --- and nobody hates a birthday mousse! Can't wait to come back

10.description: I went here on a Wednesday night for a romantic mid-week night out (because why not!) and we were happy with our dinner. Service was pleasant --- our server was knowledgeable and friendly --- and the food tasty: we had a cheese plate with honey and jam-like accompaniments, mussels in a classic garlic sauce, duck confit, steak with blue cheese potatotaes and gelato. I liked everything and portions were quite reasonable, like prices. Furthermore, Volo has an extensive (and affordable!) selection of wines by the glass --- it was fun choosing and tasting different ones! I definitely recommend for a relaxed dinner with friends or your significant others: it's a quaint, familiar place where you will feel at home!

5.description: This place has a nice selection of wines (of course) and the flights are always fun. The garden area out back is nice too during any season.The hours here are kind of weird though. They shut down really early the last time I came here on a Friday night.

3.description: An excellent dining experience. This review is a tad late as my wife and I went Valentines Day weekend. The place was packed and noisy but we were OK with that. The food is exceptional, much more than you would expect for a neighborhood place.Service was over the top friendly and knew their menu well. The front can be a bit drafty when the door blows open but the total package made up for it. Wines are unusual, different and well priced. This restaurant is on our "good find" list.

35.description: Comfortable little place with lots of wine.  Good spot to go for groups 2-4 and have drinks and small plates.

19.description: OBSESSED! I now have a new favorite Chicago go-to. The happy hour special $1 oysters and $2 pork belly was phenomenal. The wine was superb. Service was excellent. The outdoor patio was incredibly beautiful and perfect for a date or girl's night. The cheese plate was so delicious. I can't wait to come back and try more off the menu. My only regret is that I hadn't been coming here sooner!

28.description: OBSESSED! I now have a new favorite Chicago go-to. The happy hour special $1 oysters and $2 pork belly was phenomenal. The wine was superb. Service was excellent. The outdoor patio was incredibly beautiful and perfect for a date or girl's night. The cheese plate was so delicious. I can't wait to come back and try more off the menu. My only regret is that I hadn't been coming here sooner!

45.description: Chose the prix fixe menu, with wine pairings. Food was okay. First course of fried oyster salad was by far my favorite dish. Rack of lamb was a little cold by the time I got it, which was disappointing. Wine was fantastic, and the outdoor patio, even on the chilliest night of the year in the dead of December was comfortable.

33.description: We just moved to Roscoe and all my co workers told me I had to try this place. We sat inside not in the outside cabanas, and it was awesome. The sweet pea flat bread literally had us in awe, and our server was just amazing. So friendly, gave us a complimentary dessert, and suggested without being pushy. Ambiance was cute as well. Don't pass this place up!

43.description: Top place. Came her for the oyster happy hour and went to town. Drank lots of great white wine, and we ate some amazing pork belly. Loved the food happy hour and the service was excellent. Our server at the bar (we sat at the bar) was super nice. She let us try some wine before the pour, and even when we spilled a glass by mistake she topped it off for us. Just a cool place. The interior is modern and the back room has a very cool booth option for date night.

2.description: I would give Volo a 3.4 after my first visit for a friends birthday. I probably would have scored it at least a '4-stars' had I gone with just one or two other people as opposed to 8. Large groups, while the restaurant can most certainly handle, just don't seem to fit right in this intimate and romantic setting.Pros - The appetizers were interesting and the vast majority were very good (though I'd stay away from the bone marrow. It wasn't my cup of tea).  Volo has an impressive wine list and interesting (read: unique and fresh) specialty cocktail list. The decor was very cozy and would be better suited for a date or double date than for a large group of friends.Cons - Specialty cocktail drink prices were ridiculously high for what the quantity served.Would I go again? I'd definitely like to try it out, maybe with just a close friend or two next time.

18.description: I attended a wedding here recently. The space is lovely - very intimate, and a nice setup for a small wedding. Everyone who was working at the wedding from Volo were very nice and helpful. Also the food was, hands-down, the best I've ever had at a wedding. No bland over-cooked chicken breasts here (if they offer you a lamb chop, take it. Don't ask, just accept it and eat you. Your mouth with thank you.)

41.description: Please note we came to your restaurant last night (Monday) as it showed open on yelp. It was closed. Please update days and hours so to not inconvenience other patrons.

52.description: Great Romantic spot fitting for any serious date.  Servers know their wine well and are happy to make suggestions.  Superior service even to other wine bars and establishments that pride themselves on good service.  Food menu focuses on shared plates adding further to the romantic vibe.  Solid combination of atmosphere, good wine, good food, great option for your next date

50.description: Great place for a date or just with friends. The outdoor patio is one of the best kept secrets in the city. Small, private cabanas line the open courtyard, lit only by string lights. Great ambiance, good menu and wonderful wine list. I hate to call any respectable business adorable, so let's just say this one shouldn't be missed.

4.description: We had our wedding at Volo and cannot sing its praises enough! All of our guests commented on how beautiful and unique the garden was and raved about the endless delicious food options. In fact, several people mentioned that they were still thinking about the food weeks later.April was very responsive throughout the planning process and made sure everything ran smoothly on the day of the event. Anything I thought I had to remember or take care of was already done. Our wedding at Volo exceeded our expectations and left us floating with happiness for weeks. We can't wait to go back!

6.description: Volo is a really cute and intimate wine bar. The highlight of the place is their tucked away back patio with cabanas.  This is an awesome place to go on a first date or for a happy hour. Although it is a little pricey, as most tapas places are, the food is pretty good.  I really loved their crispy bacon on a stick and my bf though the oysters were high quality.  The menu is small and might not appeal that much to a picky eater like me but I would come back again for the ambiance.

22.description: Nothing special here, customers are packed in like sardines and it is difficult to talk over the loudness of the place.  food is decent, but there are better wine bars in Chicago, this may be a good place if you live nearby.  I would not come back.

15.description: This summer, I keep going back to the charming patio at Volo. I've enjoyed the sparkling wine flight twice now, and it's a lot of fun to spend an evening relaxing outside and sharing small plates. I like the cheese plate, and adding the honey, nuts, and fig jam to complete it.The waitstaff was incredibly helpful with recommendations, and just downright friendly. I went solo once while on a work trip and they made me feel extra special, which made up for the lack of conversation.It was such a brutal winter in the city that I can't get enough of this al fresco experience.

57.description: So I went here Friday night with my BF and another couple. Overall we had a really nice time. We sat out on the back patio and it was very beautiful and romantic with the lamps and candles. We all ordered wine/wine flights and then a bunch of stuff off the menu. Pros* The food was overall extremely delicious, and we loved nearly everything. The duck confit was spectacular, as well as the bacon, mushroom and goat cheese flatbread (yum!). We tried cheese plates and other items. Fried chicken was very good. Our service was also on point. And the chocolate pot de crème dessert with shortbread cookies was seriously my favorite part.Cons* The patio tables/chairs suck. They just do. This is a nice place. Maybe at least put cushions on the iron chairs? That would be nice. Or better yet, totally replace the table and chairs with comfortable, more roomy items. And we ordered the filet plate and yeah, I have never had to chew a piece of "filet" that many times in my life. That was a total letdown. Finally, the biggest issue I had here is the price. It's just too expensive for what you get. The plates are generally quite small with portions, but quite pricey. To actually fill up on food, you drop big. For the 4 of us, it was over $250. That's a lot, esp. for a wine bar/small plates place. Overall we had a lovely time here, but honestly I don't see us coming back. And the only reason being is it's just too expensive. But if you have plenty of moolah, then check it out. Very yummy/nice.

20.description: Funny host. Great decore.  Window seat.  People watching. Flight of wine. Cheeses! Ceviche, mini tacos, more wine, fried chicken w coconut milk rice. Bradford adds a free drink. Glowing happy and full.

36.description: One of my favorite places for wine and tasty little plates to share.  It helps that it is within walking distance of my apartment.They have a nice but not overwhelming wine list.  They also have really good food.  I love getting an array of cheeses, some oysters, and other little plates of deliciousness.I wish they were open on Sundays.  That's usually the only night my husband and I both have off and want to go relax with a glass of wine and light bites.  So i don't get to come as often as I would like, but I am sure their employees appreciate the day off.

14.description: Stopped in for some vino after a hellish week and some steak tartare.  I will say the tartare was very good and the wine prices were on point. The bartender was awesome, super nice guy.  Will definitely be back!

1.description: Horrible! They butchered my boyfriends neck he left with so many cuts. The only guy that was there his name was Sal. He never listened to what my boyfriend wanted for his hair and did what ever he wanted to do. He left very fuckin upset and hated it.

9.description: "A Bloody Experience (In Two Parts)"Part One.When I first moved to the neighborhood, I was in dire need of a shave and a haircut.  I waffle between the hairy mountain-man look and the (only slightly) more respectable urban professional chic look, and I happened to be coming out of one of my mountain-man phases.I thought I'd give SAL'S a try.The barber's name was Joe (like me, hey neat-o, let's be friends!) and the haircut was not awful.  It wasn't going to land me on the cover of GQ, which I'd been counting on until the moment I saw his handy work.  But then, Joe started in on the hot lather shave.Blood.  No, carnage.  Every stroke of the straight razor flayed my skin.  Joe chastised me for having sensitive skin.  Yes, evidently it's my fault that I am bleeding profusely from the neck.Blood, and pain.  Joe started blotting the cuts frenetically with his barbershop towel.  It was a disaster, and he charged me for the shave anyway.  He was nice enough to apply some balm so that my cuts would heal faster.Part Two.Well, Joe didn't seem like such a bad guy, really.  Mild goring notwithstanding.  I didn't want to get a haircut there again, and so when my mane had grown back in and I was ready to be shorn again, I decided to be equitable and split my dollars between a haircut at BIG HAIR (review forthcoming) and a beard trim (not shave) at Sal's.I went to Big Hair first, got my hair cut, and crossed the street.Joe didn't seem so friendly this time.  Maybe he remembered how I had bled all over his barber's chair.  Or maybe. . . maybe he saw me emerging from his competition across the street!  Maybe he could still smell the baby powder on my neck. . .I timidly asked if he could trim my tangled mess of a mountain-man beard.  He muttered a response through his clenched teeth.No straight razor this time.  Just clippers.  He seemed to be taking a long time with it.  Maybe he wanted to impress me with his handywork, and make up for the time he almost beheaded me with his straight razor..I didn't realize what had happened until I got home.  I guess I wasn't paying attention when he showed me his handiwork in the mirror.  But my old pal Joe had completely clowned me.  Literally.  My beard had been reduced to a rough shadow, and shaped into a hoboclown/guido hybrid.  He had taken off the top half of my moustache and cut the beard line too low.I was mortified.  I shaved off the bead, but left the pencil thin moustache for a couple days because it made for a great lead-in to my story of how I lost my mountain-man beard.

23.description: Walked in without an appointment on a Thursday morning.  Great plus, as the next nearest shop couldn't take me within an hour and a half.  This is an old-style barber shop that's been there for over 30 years, which gives it a certain charm.Got a very quick and clean haircut from Joe, who was friendly and polite.  Cut my hair a bit shorter than I hoped for,(the only reason for 4 stars and not 5) but it still looks good and professional.  Hot foam shave on the neck and sideburns is another touch that sets it apart from the franchise salons.I'll be coming back.

25.description: This is a strait up old school barber shop, no joke.

12.description: Apparently Sal has retired but the guy that works there now is top notch.  The other reviews claim that this place is "old school" and that's no joke.  You'll get a shave with a straight razor, a hot towel, the works.  You'll listen to the rat pack, old jazz, you get the picture.  This guy is the real deal, he loves cutting hair and shooting the shit.  And on Friday, they might even offer you a beer.  You know this ain't the kind of place that will cheap out on you, either.  We're talking Heineken.Also they keep Playboys in the magazine rack.

21.description: Solid, and old school. Catch up on whats going on in the neighborhood. Started going there when I lived around the corner and still drive back over now that we've moved. Always leave feeling refreshed. Thanks Joe!

16.description: I'm super-picky when it comes to haircuts and I've tried a few of the old-school shops (Gabby's, Belmont Barbershop, etc).  Usually, Sal wins my $20 for the following reasons: he got my haircut right the first time (most barbers take a couple of shots), you can normally be seen within 15 minutes without an appointment, they do full hot lather shaves, and they give you a beer with your haircut.  Honestly, what else could you ask for?  Love it.

17.description: I've been here twice.  Why would I pay twenty bucks for a sub-par haircut?  Then tip on top of that?  People say they were in and out quick, but that was not my experience.  It doesn't take that long for a high and tight with no shave.  But he somehow managed to take forever.  And it was not because we were talkingI'm not much of a talker, but don't mind a discussion about sports or business.  I had heard the barber talking White Sox with the guy before me.  Yet when I tried he shirked. If the cut was more affordable, this would be a decent place.  But unfortunately he's over-priced his services.

10.description: This is the only place I will get the "mane tamed" any longer.I will recco friends. Why? First of all, I said "trim" and the guy knew what I was talking about. Not a mullet, not a meterosexual do, a trim! Amazing! Hadn't a trim gone extinct with the Jolt brand? Then, he has pics of his Puerto Rican boy and my Pittsburgh boy Roberto Clemente. I asked him about it, and he is one sincere dude. Some eyes shut and shaking while talking about his death. Him too.Onto the haircut. Superb. Old School. No bull shit. AM radio in the background. An offer of beer. I was out of work for the day, what more could I want - besides the news segment on Bush being muted, over which he had no control?At the end of the haircut he pulled out this massager that was fucking dynomite. This thing demolished my shoulder blades, in a good way.Good work Sal.

5.description: When I was a much younger man, I went to a barber named Fred way north on Damen for about 10 years.  Every haircut and shave was perfect.  Unfortunately, Fred closed up shop due to old age and I had searched for 5 years trying to find the right spot. Little did I know the right spot was right under my nose.  Sal's is an authentic barber shop.  It's clean, cool, and the fresh aroma of Pinaud Clubman aftershave lotion permeates throughout.  Oh yeah, and Joe offered me a beer while I wait.  A+.There is always current reading material in the form of magazines (GQ, automotive, PopMech, etc.) and today's paper.  The music is so befitting of the joint, I feel like I'm in the 1950's.  I've never waited longer than 5 minutes and that's even going on a Saturday morning.  Every haircut has been spot on, exactly what I was looking for.  After the haircut is a straight razor shave with warm shave cream and a generous treatment of aftershave lotion.  Price is reasonable, especially considering the personal and authentic treatment.  I've never looked forward to haircuts until going to Sal's!

11.description: Excellent haircut.  Fast friendly service without an appointment.

22.description: I don't get my haircut regularly from Sal's. The few times that I have been in there have been great. What's better than having a beer while you wait to get your haircut. I'd go back there more often if I lived close by.Joe is great!! Will try to get back there soon.

0.description: (review from my husband)sal's barber shop is great.  sal is actually retired in florida, so the gentleman who cuts your hair is named Joe.  this is an old school place.  you walk in, see the classic stools.  a combination of jazz and frank sinatra flow through the speakers.  old baseball hereos are on the wall.  great spot.  you can even get a cold brewski, read a playboy, and get a back massage.  and of course you get the straight razor as well as the precision of a military barber. if you're looking for a great cut and some old school vibe, check out Sal's.

20.description: Apparently Sal has retired but the guy that works there now is top notch.  The other reviews claim that this place is "old school" and that's no joke.  You'll get a shave with a straight razor, a hot towel, the works.  You'll listen to the rat pack, old jazz, you get the picture.  This guy is the real deal, he loves cutting hair and shooting the shit.  And on Friday, they might even offer you a beer.  You know this ain't the kind of place that will cheap out on you, either.  We're talking Heineken.Also they keep Playboys in the magazine rack.

19.description: Walked in without an appointment on a Thursday morning.  Great plus, as the next nearest shop couldn't take me within an hour and a half.  This is an old-style barber shop that's been there for over 30 years, which gives it a certain charm.Got a very quick and clean haircut from Joe, who was friendly and polite.  Cut my hair a bit shorter than I hoped for,(the only reason for 4 stars and not 5) but it still looks good and professional.  Hot foam shave on the neck and sideburns is another touch that sets it apart from the franchise salons.I'll be coming back.

2.description: Nice guy and cool atmosphere but he took forever and actually cut my face during a shave.

18.description: I love the simplicity of a good barber shop.  Sit down, talk (or not) get a trim and get out.  Sal's has all that, plus unlike most of the strip mall salons you aren't getting pressured into a hair wash and buying a bunch of hair products.Quick service and a classy place.  Its comfort food... for your hair!

13.description: Walked in for a haircut.  Place was clean and empty.  The guy did great work.  He worked quickly but took time to check his work and make sure that my taper was even all over.  I wasn't expecting the back and neck massager, but it was appreciated.  He used a straight razor and hot lather to clean up the sideburns, ears and neck.  He topped it off with balm and understated smell-um for my neck and scalp.  It was a few bucks more than I expected at $20, but I'm planning to go back for another solid haircut :-)

4.description: The only thing this man is capable of is a buzz cut.  Took my curly haired 5 year old for a medium scissor cut.  Instead of telling me he did not know how to do that, he took out the buzzers and shaved his head.  My son looked in the mirror and was crying.  The barber then blamed his crying on me.  He kept begging me to let him finish the hair cut.  There was nothing left to cut.  I have seen better cuts come out of PETCO.

24.description: you wanna see me almost cry... guaranteed?  come with me when i take my son for his haircuts at sal's.  it's so effing cute i can hardly contain myself.we parked in front of sal's one day and were just about to leave to get ready for our boy's one-year birthday party when the gentleman who cuts hair here [i think his name is joe] came out to give my son a bright yellow helium balloon.  he DID need a haircut, my husband and i reasoned.  we took the key out of the ignition and went in.joe is wonderful with our baby.  he doesn't just tolerate my son like most stylists who don't specialize in kids cuts; he really enjoys cutting his hair, talking to him and chucking him under the chin every so often.  "you are my very good friend!  i love you!" he says to my son, and my little guy just beams at him.  it probably doesn't hurt that my son is extremely well-mannered in the chair, but my little boy seems to really enjoy the experience in return, and he doesn't want to hop off the booster seat board when the cut is finished.  joe does a great job with his hair, especially with clippers, and always gives him a lollipop when he's finished.  it's so cute to watch him and joe that my husband and i always find ourselves with lumps in our throats, watching our little man getting a big-boy haircut in a big-boy barber shop.

6.description: Joe is the man.  if you are looking for a good barber that is friendly and makes you feel comfortable, Sal's Barber Shop is the spot.  cuts are $20, but include straight razor on the neck and sideburns.  also eyebrow trimming.  support this local business.  its been around for a long time and Joe is a really good guy who knows how to cut hair.

15.description: I don't get my haircut regularly from Sal's. The few times that I have been in there have been great. What's better than having a beer while you wait to get your haircut. I'd go back there more often if I lived close by.Joe is great!! Will try to get back there soon.

7.description: I've been here several times.  He always cut my hair too short.  Always!  Not a little too short.  A lot too short!  I don't know how to explain to this guy how to cut my hair.  I think its because he doesn't listen.  The hair cuts are well done with nice clean lines and the free beers are nice, but what's the point if he won't cut it the way I ask him to?

8.description: I used to live in Roscoe Village, and Sal's was right down the street. Awesome. Sal is a great barber - in addition to the quick, as-simple-as-you-want haircut, he's very adept at recognizing if you are the kind of guy who likes to chat. There's always some nice jazz music playing in the background too. I also appreciate that he trims my eyebrows (they can be a little unruly) and does a quick hot-lather shave around the edges.I since moved out near the lake, and I still bike out to Sal's when it's time for a trim. Minus one star since there's one guy who's a little less attentive to the small details (like the eyebrows).

3.description: Wow, I just got the worst haircut of my life!  Joe, he was friendly, but doesn't know how to cut hair. Truly, this guy is butcher!  I am spoiled, as I have a great girl that normally cuts my hair.  This is Golden Scissors in a Wheaton, Olivia is my stylist, this is for a different review.  All I can say is, don't go here!  I'm not that picky with my hair, but this is bad.

14.description: Went here two consecutive months.  2nd time I came back the owner said.. same cut as last time?  I said yeah.....a 3 on the sides but a little shorter on the side.  He said last time was a 3.5 on the sides....so I said that's fine.  Anyways.....after he shaved both sides of my head, I look up and my hair was shorter than it was the day I was born!  I said...that's not a 3.5 or a 3.  He said...it's 3.5.....then showed me the razor and said......see?  The razor had a big fat "2" on it.  Anyways...he said the haircut is fixable, which it wasn't .  I now have a buzzcut that I paid 20 bucks for but could have used my shaving razor for for nothin.  He still took my money and muttered a pathetic apology.  I am NOT going back there again.

56.description: This place is great! Emmitt did my color and cut. He really knew his stuff. I told him what I wanted and from there he went over the many different options I had and explained how each color would effect my hair a couple weeks later. I really liked this b/c I like to know about up keep. Great to chat with and overall a very good experience!!

29.description: I booked via a Groupon since I was in the market for a new stylist.  I was not disappointed with Stephanie.  She changed me from a bright blonde to a dark brunette and talked me through the whole process.  My hair doesn't hold color very well but it's been 2 weeks and it's still going strong.  When I first meet people they can't believe I'm a natural blonde because of the time Stephanie took to really listen to what I wanted and helped match the best color to my skin tone.I felt very comfortable the entire time I was at the salon and will definitely be going back.Only pitfall, make sure you bring cash or check for tips.  They can't take it on the credit card.

42.description: Emmett is the only person I'll let cut my hair anymore. Completely worth $50 + a hefty tip. He's talked me through every new haircut idea I've ever proposed, was very open-minded and willing to go in any direction I wanted, but also explained to me the potential downsides of the cuts I was interested in. I've learned so much from him about hair, products, styling equipment, and techniques. He's always coaching me to advocate for myself with other stylists who may try to cut my hair using an incorrect technique or convince me of one thing or another that isn't true about my hair. He's been my sole hair stylist over the past two years, and has given me the very best haircuts of my life. Really personable, interesting, and sweet as well. I highly, highly recommend him.

23.description: LOVE Salon de Vive...although I'd probably love anywhere salon if they had Stefanie. I originally found her through a Groupon deal for partial highlights and cut. I'm so glad I tried it out because I knew right then I had found my hair gal. She is so sweet, full of energy, and definitely knows how to give you exactly what you want for your hair. She takes time at the beginning to really hear you out and listen to your concerns and desires. Then, she gracefully provides her opinion with a take it or leave it attitude, which I love. The second time I went I decided I wanted to go dark for fall. That was not the best decision I have ever made, but it was only because I didn't like it, nothing due to what Stefanie did. It did look really good, and she did exactly what I asked her to do...I just couldn't get used to my hair that dark. She gave me her cell phone number and had me text her all week to tell her how I was feeling about it. She was more than willing to have me come back in to do something different, but by the end of the week I was used to it and the richness of the dye wasn't as powerful as it was right away. Just knowing she was more than willing to go above and beyond to make sure I was happy after the fact was awesome.The Salon is in Roscoe and super cute. Very open, airy, trendy feel without being stuck up. Prices are about average but with Stefanie you definitely get the biggest bank for your buck.

47.description: I have been following Steven around town for almost a decade! He is definitely worth the travel and time. He's great with advice on what fits for me and what would be ridiculous. He just made my hair a magical red that matches EXACTLY what I wanted. People everywhere have been asking me where I had my hair done and I love to recommend him because aside from being a great stylist, he's a great person.

8.description: I have been coming to Salon de Vive for a few years now. And Vi the owner does an amazing job! She is very personable, pays attention to detail, and I can usually get an appointment within 1 to 2 weeks without fail. Her rates are very affordable. And parking is free! I would highly recommend anyone to switch to her as you will not be disappointed. A few of my friends have switched stylists. And they all sing her praises. I constantly get compliments from strangers on my cut whenever I am out.

31.description: I love the Salon because it is so close to my house - easy to park in the area and really beautiful inside but the best reason is Stefanie!  After years of getting the same highlights and basically the same hair style - a dear friend recommended Stefanie and she totally changed my look.  I now get all over color and low lights which more effectively covers my gray (so unfortunate to have gray!) but adds so much more dimension to my color- She also does a great blow out and cut- Go and Stefanie and you will have a new amazing look- and great company while she is getting it done-

34.description: I visited Cristina for a wax, and she was fantastic! She was professional and informative, and she helped me feel very comfortable during the whole experience. I plan in becoming a regular.

16.description: So sad we moved to NC!!  Vi has done my cuts and color for 5-6 years now.  I have SUPER thick and tangled hair. BLONDE.  We've gone from short and sassy to long and sexy then everything in between.  I do base bumps on top of highlights and she gets it right every time.  I've also gotten keratin treatments from her before and I find her prices to be very reasonable for the work she performs.  Plus, she's just so darn cute and fun to chat with.  I don't I've ever seen her without 3" heels on.......Love and miss you Vi.

13.description: I called in very last minute asking if they could fit me in for highlights and a cut on the same day. They were able to  accommodate and did an absolutely fantastic job. I have extremely curly hair and very picky about salons, but I had let my color go for so long it was just time. Emmett fit me in later for the afternoon and walked me through what his thoughts were for a "fresh" look. I appreciated that they didn't try to up-sell me for services or products and I ended up spending more because of that. They had a special on the website for first time customers but it was just an added bonus because of how happy I was with my service. HIGHLY recommend and with absolutely be back.

11.description: LOVE Salon de Vive...although I'd probably love anywhere salon if they had Stefanie. I originally found her through a Groupon deal for partial highlights and cut. I'm so glad I tried it out because I knew right then I had found my hair gal. She is so sweet, full of energy, and definitely knows how to give you exactly what you want for your hair. She takes time at the beginning to really hear you out and listen to your concerns and desires. Then, she gracefully provides her opinion with a take it or leave it attitude, which I love. The second time I went I decided I wanted to go dark for fall. That was not the best decision I have ever made, but it was only because I didn't like it, nothing due to what Stefanie did. It did look really good, and she did exactly what I asked her to do...I just couldn't get used to my hair that dark. She gave me her cell phone number and had me text her all week to tell her how I was feeling about it. She was more than willing to have me come back in to do something different, but by the end of the week I was used to it and the richness of the dye wasn't as powerful as it was right away. Just knowing she was more than willing to go above and beyond to make sure I was happy after the fact was awesome.The Salon is in Roscoe and super cute. Very open, airy, trendy feel without being stuck up. Prices are about average but with Stefanie you definitely get the biggest bank for your buck.

39.description: I can't say whether the service is any good here because though I showed up for my apt 15 minutes early and waited almost 15 minutes past my apt time, no one bothered to come out. I hoped to get in early, but expected that I'd wait the 15 minutes. Instead i waited for than 1/2 hour and left without anything to show for it. That's not even the worst part. To add insult to injury, the girl who arrived 15 minutes after me went in ahead of me. I had my back to the salon in the waiting area, the other client was facing the salon, and before I knew it, she bounced up from her chair and went in. There was no one else at the salon, just a receptionist on the phone chatting away without a care in the world. Totally unprofessional and disrespectful of clients. Don't waste your time or money here.

37.description: I think I found my spot. I booked a Keratin Treatment (priced per Groupon) with Stefanie. I called to make sure I was getting the right product/procedure that is supposed to smoothen and relax my thick curly hair and frizz ( I actually want to make sure there was some formaldhyde)....Since I wasted my money at a different salon in Gold Coast claiming to do the same. (yelp.com/biz/danyel-nico…)There was a slight mix-up with appointments but it was fine it the end. Stefanie was thorough and fast...YAAY! The place has a nice ambiance and the street parking was free. They are not pushy about buying their products either. I'd certainly recommend this place.

0.description: Always enjoy getting a hair cut from Vi. Friendly good service and can count on a great cut.  The salon is clean, the people are nice and I'm in and out during my scheduled appointment. All at a reasonable price. Couldn't ask for more.

38.description: I bought a groupon for a Keratin treatment and got booked right away with Emmit.I was not treated any differently than other regular paying customers which is really nice becuase it tends to happen. My hair is amazing!!! He took his time to domy hair and explained everything he did. Gave me tips for my hair and what products to use. Will definitely be coming back!!!

51.description: I started going to Salon de Vive two years ago when I moved to the neighborhood.  By chance, I made an appointment with Stephanie and have been so happy with her styling ever since!I have long hair, so I don't go in that often.  However, every time I visit, Stephanie makes me feel like a valued client.  She takes her time and gives me an awesome cut.  I almost feel bad going back more often, but my hair always looks great, even when its going out.The place is great.  Its really clean, its never hectic and loud.  Street parking is available.  Overall, a great experience and I would never go anywhere else!Be sure to ask for Stephanie!

27.description: I tried this place for the first time a few days ago and had the best experience ever! I got my hair cut and colored. Not only did Stephanie do exactly what i wanted with my hair, she was super nice also. She made me feel comfortable and like she really wanted me to be happy with her work. The salon is so cute and cozy, great atmosphere.The chairs were even more comfortable than any other salon I've been to. They have definitely gained a new loyal client! I have been looking for a place for a while now and the search is over! :)

32.description: Emmett is the absolute best if you are looking for a fabulous cut or color. He not only has done my hair for years, but he is so phenomenal I bring all my friends. I highly recommend Emmett.

54.description: I really like Salon de Vive and the people who work there.  It is a calm relaxed place with fair prices, and the people their know what they are talking about and actually listen to their clients.  Stephanie cuts my hair and has always done an excellent job.  I am rather picky and bounced around from place to place.  I have had success at other places in Chicago, but this is the place I will get my hair cut from now on.

48.description: Good haircut, good price.  I also liked my hair stylist and the atmosphere!

44.description: Emmit is great, been going there for years.

24.description: I found a Groupon for wax service; Christina is very professional and welcoming.  I felt comfortable the whole time.. I was in and out in less than 30min.  She uses good quality wax for sensitive skin; which I have always had an issue with. Totally worth the drive and very reasonably priced.

7.description: I was searching for a new salon and saw all the positive reviews for Stefanie, so I listened to  Yelp and I'm so glad I did. I have never loved a hair cut so much. She really listened to what I wanted, and went over the plan before she started cutting away. Nice atmosphere, overall great salon. I have 0 complaints, and again her work is flawless. To think I almost spent over $100 downtown somewhere! **TIPS ARE CASH ONLY!** so come prepared. Don't hesitate, book here you will not regret it.

49.description: From looking at the other clients, this appears to be a great salon.  I have incredibly thin hair that's hard to style, and while my hair dresser was really nice, I'm not sure it was anywhere near worth the $50 I spent for a trim.  He put a lot of light hairspray in it and curled it a bit to give it more "body," but that all disappeared after about an hour and ultimately my hair looks pretty much the same as it did $50 ago (plus the coarse hairspray feel).  Like I said, it seems like a good enough salon that I would recommend it to other people, but in my particular case I'd say it was a waste of money.

40.description: Stefanie is AMAZING!!! She is very accommodating and I always walk out feeling like a brand new person after she colors/highlights and cuts my hair!! I would follow her wherever she goes!!

53.description: I found out about this place on salonapprentice.com where one of their new stylists had a $20 special going on to build a clientele base. Called at 4:30pm, was in her chair by 5pm. Wonderful! She was so sweet...great to chat with, outgoing, funny, feels like your BFF is cutting your hair.However, my micromanaging side reared it's ugly head when we had to recut my hair 3 times. I asked for a stacked bob...didn't think that it was that difficult or needed more explanation. Yes, she just graduated from Aveda so sure I'll cut her a little slack. In the end: we got a perfect bob.I got a really funny feeling about the owner though. Every time he would pass by; he was really condescending to her right in front of me...is it because she's new? Is it because she is cutting my hair for $20 instead of $60? At one point he snottily asked her "Is that a client?" (referring to me)...really?!  Save demeaning questions for the back room, buddy.

30.description: I am fortunate to have Emmett as a dedicated stylist that always listens. I may have these ideas of color and Emmett takes the time to discuss color, choice and maintenance.  Always happy when I leave. His previous ratings are on Emmett Hodge on Yelp and Citysearch. Go ahead look him up. You won't be given false information. He also applies make up for special occasions or girls night out.

46.description: My pores are gone. Seriously, Cristina and her magical facial stole my pores.  I bought  a groupon for a facial, thinking the same thing everyone thinks when they purchase a service through groupon... It wont be horrible, but I'm sure it wont be great either. Boy was I wrong.  A very stylish salon, the moment I walked in I was welcomed by a friendly associate cutting hair.  My wait, less than 4 minutes was soon ended by a smiling Cristina welcoming me by name.  She showed me to my room where I changed and the magic began.Cristina was super friendly, chatty (but not too chatty- after all it is a facial, a time to relax and refresh).  She explained each step of the process.  I love she uses the Hydro Peptide products. You can actually feel them working. Exfolliating, masks, steam, finger preassure and best of all a mini massage.  I could feel the stress and anxierty leaving my body as her magic fingers worked out every feeling of doubt, anxiety and stress from my body.  Little did I know what a hour later after the facial was over my skin was robbed as well! Gone were my large pores, dead skin, and rough exterior. I was left with soft, plump, glowly poreless skin.  Seriously, all kidding aside, Cristina is awesome. This was an amazing facial (and I've had many). I booked my next appointment on the spot.

1.description: I've been seeing Stefanie for a few years now. She rescued my hair from years of damage and harsh products. She always gets the color to exactly what I'm looking for and the cut is always perfect no matter the request. I've also done two keratin treatments with her with great results! She recently changed her process with the keratin treatment and my hair seems softer and straighter than last time. She works so hard and efficiently and is very reasonably priced! An all around great experience every time.

55.description: At last, they are listed on yelp I added my review on citysearch, salon de vive was formerly Accent salon on fullerton & clybourn. Always ask for Emmett, he's the best. He's honest and does a fab job on hair, color, I've used him for makeup as well. A true artist he is.

9.description: I am so exceedingly unhappy with my experience that it has compelled me to write my very first review.  I brought the obligatory inspiration pictures to show my stylist during the consult, the cut was not faintly attempted or even considered.  What I walked out of there with was a 1st year in beauty school basic trim, at best.  My color-where do I even begin.  Let me pause here and say the moral of the story is to trust your instincts.  I live around the corner, which prompted the out of character happenstance appointment with this unknown salon, and there were so many red flags that I should have known better.  An establishment that has been in the neighborhood for 20 years with only 46 reviews (all positive of course), that also boasts a moniker of recognition from 2007 in a trophy case?  *Insert side eye roll here.  I don't want to be presumptuous, but drawing the conclusion that this salon caters to a clientele that is not accustomed to, or rather doesn't even know what Yelp is, would be fair; 60+ I would assume.  Clients who are perfectly content with a color touch up and the same trim every 6 weeks...or you know, a curler set in-between perms.  I think I'm more disappointed in myself for not walking out.  But I digress.  Back to the color..."Chocolate brown" he says...wth is chocolate brown?  At least give me some perspective here; are we talking milk chocolate or dark chocolate?  Ha, I can laugh now because a week has passed but if I know a level 4 is way too dark, and you don't understand what I'm saying when I talk in terms of color level and then you turn your swatch over and say, "oh look, I turned it over and it says level 4".  No.  Just no.And now I have no recourse because he used permanent color on me even though I pleaded for semi or demi color.  I will say this, the owner offered to have another stylist "fix" it which I emphatically declined because even I know I would completely lose any integrity that is left in my hair trying to lift this (almost black) color any lighter.My stylist was nice enough and this is not a reflection of him as a person, but that is the only positive thing I have to say about my experience with him.Essentially the SAME experience as Anna B. from 7/25/2013.  He doesn't listen to what you want, and after seeing his technique I would venture to guess its because he simply can't.  Needs addition training/schooling for sure.Good luck.

26.description: When I arrived at my appointment my stylist sat me down in the chair and told me he was in a rush. He didn't even bother to introduce himself nor discuss what I wanted done to my hair.He took one look at my locks, asked me if I had gotten a shag haircut. I said "No, I have layers." And he told me not to get layers in my hair "Because it makes me look like I have no hair at all" (Really!? Thanks for that.) He then yanked my hair into a few careless clips and went to start mixing dye for highlights. At this point, I was already leaning forward in my chair ready to take off my smock, leave and, forget about the whole thing.Well, he returned and started painting up my hair saying "you already have highlights, so I'm just going to do the touch-ups on you" (I had a prepaid groupon for a cut and full highlights, not simply touch ups) had he discussed or even asked me why I'm here, he would have found out that I actually wanted to go lighter also.I'm an easy going person, so I nodded and kind of agreed with him. Two minutes later when I actually noticed that he was only painting my roots, I tried to clarify what I still hadn't gotten to say about my own hair in the first place.He got really flustered and told me "NOT to upset him because, HE was the one doing my hair" (Is that a threat... or something?) When I asked him what exactly I said that had bothered him, he had to walk away and stormed off to the back.I already had a few foils in, I walk to the nearest semi-available hair dresser and ask her to help me wash them out because I wanted to leave. Her name was Vi, and she brought me into the back to see what was the matter. She assessed the situation, talked to me, my stylist, and then the two of us together. What a saint! I was 4 minutes late to my appointment and I'm sorry for that. But there is no reason or excuse to treat anybody like that, especially a customer!!Ultimately we put our differences aside, shook hands, and he worked on my hair. It was still probably the most uncomfortable hair appointment I've ever experienced. When the foils were done he rinsed my hair like a maniac, and styled my hair in what I consider a passive-aggressive fashion (Aiming the blow dryer right at my face).------------------------------------------------------The place was cute and trendy, comfortable not overly vogue. I actually ended up staying for the services. And would return to this salon perhaps with a different stylist.One star added for cleanliness atmosphere and the female staff,Second star because despite everything, EMMET still gave me some solid highlights and didn't shave my head or dye my hair green even though he seemed to be taking his bad day out on me otherwise.

25.description: I love this salon! Very far from my home, but will travel to get my hair done here! Stephanie is beyond words! She is the sweetest and nicest person, plus she leaves my hair great every time! I get so many compliments on my hair every time I get it done here! Stephanie is the girl to book with!

12.description: I've been having my hair cut, colored. And keratined by Stefanie for a year now and I couldn't be happier with the results.  She's very attentive, listens, gives great advice, and works efficiently.  She also is a super sweet person.  I adore her.  I highly recommend the salon.

21.description: I just love Emmett! I have long highlighted hair and I used to spend HOURS getting it cut and highlighted. Emmett does a great job with my cut and color, is reasonably priced and lets me get on with my Saturday. He is friendly but also respects your privacy if you want to read or just relax during the visit. Couldn't be happier with this place :)

17.description: I think I found my spot. I booked a Keratin Treatment (priced per Groupon) with Stefanie. I called to make sure I was getting the right product/procedure that is supposed to smoothen and relax my thick curly hair and frizz ( I actually want to make sure there was some formaldhyde)....Since I wasted my money at a different salon in Gold Coast claiming to do the same. (yelp.com/biz/danyel-nico…)There was a slight mix-up with appointments but it was fine it the end. Stefanie was thorough and fast...YAAY! The place has a nice ambiance and the street parking was free. They are not pushy about buying their products either. I'd certainly recommend this place.

10.description: I've been a client of Natalie for over a year now for highlights and hair cuts. Now my neighborhood go-to spot for great and reliable service. I first came to Natalie with too short layers and she's been awesome with helping to keep me stylish while we've worked on getting my hair to a happier place. Natalie is great professionally and is a pleasure to be around personally. So nice to have a hair stylist that listens and that I trust.  I look forward to seeing her on a regular basis and knowing that I'm going to leave a little happier and more glamorous!

5.description: I've been seeing Vi for about 15 years and cannot imagine letting anyone else color, cut or style my hair.  I've run the gamit from long to short, dark to highlighted hair and Vi just knows what I'm looking for.  Love the place and highly recommend it for men, women and kids.

3.description: I love this place .. Emmit my stylist really takes his time to give me the hair extensions of my dreams.  He really explains how to take care of them .The salon is super friendly and everyone makes me feel welcomed ..Just wish I cam here years ago . Since, there 2 blocks from my house.Thanks Salon De Vive ..

35.description: I went in for a full color and haircut and came out thoroughly disappointed.  Emitt was the stylist that worked on my hair and he said he had over 20 yrs of experience but after seeing what he did with my hair, I would have never guessed. Hair coloring:I went in with around 1.5" of exposed  dark brown/black roots and dark golden highlights.  I did not want to bleach my hair again but wanted to keep it as light as I can w/full color and no bleach.  I knew my hair would end up being a little darker but I was able to go medium brown w/out bleach with a previous stylist.  Emitt ended up coloring my hair back to my natural hair color.  And did not get my roots.  Haircut:I asked for long layers. My haircut looked like a 10 year old cut it.  The layers were not blended at all.  I had an obvious short straight layer going around my head.  My longer hair underneath looked like it was extensions, that's how obvious the layers looked.  Stylist: He was nice, but came off a little fake.  Like...he was trying to hard to be liked.  That 's understandable in his industry.  Overall: I'm not happy whatsoever.  Complete waste of money.  A week later (today) I went and got my haircut fixed at J. Gordon Designs w/Chloe.  She also pointed out my roots were not colored and that my haircut was not blended and uneven.  She fixed the cut.  It looks amazing now.

19.description: I had been bouncing from salon to salon until a friend referred me to Stefanie. Stefanie is a true professional and from day one I have walked out of the salon loving my cut and highlights. Plus the price is reasonable. And though I haven't known Stephanie quite a year now, I feel like going in for my appointment is more like catching up with an old friend - we chat the whole time and she's a lot of fun. I've definitely found my go-to salon and highly recommend Stefanie!

28.description: Purchased Groupon for full highlights and cut. Horrible experience! Do not recommend to anyone nor will I ever go back!  Not sure where to start on this but it was not good!  Natalie was the stylist, and was nice but did NOT listen to me about my hair or what I wanted!!!  She foiled my hair. I told her I wanted golden highlights and that I process quickly!! I didn't realize that they foil/color more than one client at a time. SO NOT GOOD!! She told me to have a seat in the sofa area and that she would check me in a few minutes. FOURTY FIVE minutes later I approached cause I knew I was WAY OVER PROCESSED!!  She had the nerve to tell me I still needed a few minutes and sent me away. I have had my hair highlighted my whole life and I know it doesn't take this long EVER!  When she finished foiling her next client she called me over and said I needed to go under the dryer for a few minutes. I was like r u sure???  She looked again and said nope your done. I knew I was done LONG AGO.....MY HAIR WAS WHITE, totally over processed and platinum! Stripped of any color.  I was so upset and disappointed!!  I tried so hard to be nice about it cause I didn't want her to feel bad. I tipped her $20 and left hoping I was being overly sensitive!  I went home and my kids and husband told me I looked horrid and like a super Grandma old lady!  I was crushed and called the salon.  I should have stayed then and told her to fix it but my son had an event so I had to leave with this yucky hair color.I wanted to go first thing the next day for some help. They said NO Natalie has to fix it and wont be in til next Tuesday.  I stayed IN doors as to not be seen as 20+ years older than I actually am.  My hair looked like ashy charcoal.  It was awful.  Today, Tuesday I went in with a PICTURE of how my hair normally looks. Golden highlights which she even complimented me on when she first met me.So she added a toner and it turned out much better! The finale on my writing this review was that she told me I had to style my own hair afterwards. She said her next client was waiting. She just washed my hair and asked if I wanted to sit under the dryer or a hair dryer to blow dry it myself!  I was shocked at how poorly treated I was and she added INSULT to INJURY by not properly drying my hair which would've taken 5 maybe 10 minutes.  My hair is very fine and dries quickly.Horrible customer service, two horrible experiences and horrible initial hair. She did NOT listen to anything I said.  I KNOW MY HAIR and advised her accordingly.  The whole situation was handled horribly!!!  While my hair is better now the whole experience I endured was unnecessary.

45.description: I have been going to Stefanie for years now and have always been thrilled with my cut and color. She always does a fantastic job! Stefanie even did my makeup for my wedding. And considering I got no sleep the night before, she worked wonders!! I even "cheated" recently by seeing another stylist and lived to regret it. The other cut ruined my hair!! (insane split ends, to the point of breakage) But Stefanie has worked with me to repair the damage and months later, my hair is (almost) back to normal. I swear I'll never stray again!

33.description: Go visit Natalie...After going from salon to salon and trying numerous stylists, I finally found Natalie (originally working at a different salon). She has been doing my cut/color for a couple years now and is fantastic. Natalie knows exactly what I want... I'm really picky about my highlights/low lights and she gets it perfect every time. You can imagine my panic when she was no longer at her previous salon but luckily I found her again at Salon de Vive!Salon de Vive is great. Convenient location in RV, easy street parking, clean/good vibe inside, and I've never had to wait for my appointment.

43.description: Christina is great! I bought a groupon for my 1st Brazilian. I know it sounds crazy but Christina talked me through everything, making me feel very comfortable. I'll definitely go back to her.

2.description: Absolutely love Salon de Vive. I have been seeing Vi for longer than I can remember. She is wonderful!!! Color and cut is always perfect. People often compliment me on color--actually surprised it's not my "natural" color....wish it was this beautiful naturally!!! In addition to Vi, everyone at the salon is very welcoming. The salon itself is beautiful and an extremely comfortable place to be. Without question I would recommend Vi and Salon de Vive to everyone.

18.description: Natalie has been cutting/styling my hair for probably a solid 7-8 years now.  She is one of those gems that once you find, you cherish and never want to let go! I am a fair-skinned natural blonde who, for the greater part of my life, could get away with my natural color from day to day.  However, after hitting my 40's, these ashy gray-ish blonde strands started taking over so I decided it was time to even things out.  Let's just say I was a pretty terrified grown woman who had never colored her hair before. Yikes!In her usual style, Natalie was completely professional with her consultation and we decided to take it slow with some highlights (softer at first visit, then brighter). I walked out of the salon yesterday after receiving my first full on highlights I feel like a new girl!!! The color blend is just perfect, I only wish I would have done it sooner. Just fantastic. Thank you thank you THANK YOU!For the GENTLEMEN:  Natalie has also been cutting my husbands hair for many, many years and he (like me), would not even THINK of going elsewhere!The salon itself is laid back and comfortable without any pretentiousness. While under the dryer, I often find myself hearing interesting music streaming from the speakers and then Shazam'ing & downloading them to my iPhone on the spot...(I had no idea I was such a fan of Passion Pit!)In short, Natalie is great, make your appointment today!

41.description: I don't normally take the time to write reviews, but since I'm new to Chicago and have been looking for a good waxing location, I wanted to give this place a shout out. I believe my search for my go to salon is over.I purchased a Groupon for a brazilian wax with Skin by Cristina and I'm completely satisfied. Salon de Vive itself is really beautiful. Warm colors and rich fabrics, all while maintaining a young and fresh atmosphere. The waxing room was clean and had nice lighting. I met with Cristina and immediately she made me feel at home. I've had several waxes before, so the whole process was nothing new for me, but even still, Cristina guided me through very comfortably. Some waxers talk talk talk, but Cristina had the perfect balance of conversation without running your ear off. Once the wax was over, Cristina mentioned that she offers her customers $35 dollar brazilians, which is cheaper than I've ever found in both Chicago and Los Angeles. I couldn't believe it would cost so little! I will definitely be coming back.Lastly, I was in and out in a total of 20 minutes, which included a little wait at the beginning because I was early for my appointment.I recommend getting waxed with Cristina to anyone and everyone.

52.description: i have been getting my hair cut at Salon de Vive for over eight years and have been with Stephanie for the last five. I would never consider going anywhere else.The room is open and sunny and as invitingly warm as each member of the staff.  From the moment I walk in to the shampoo to sitting in the chair, I am treated like the only person there.  Stephanie is so attentive to every need and hair on my head I never have a moment's doubt that I will look my best when I walk out.I'm just a dude so I can't speak for the much more intensive women's services, but if I'm paying $37 for a haircut and raving about it, you know it's good.

50.description: After having the same hair stylist for years, she moved out of town and I was at a complete loss. Tho I got recommendations from many others, no one person or salon got me very excited. I went over a year without a haircut before I finally came across reviews on City search for Salon de Vive. There were so many good reviews, and something in my gut said to take a chance. So I booked with the owner Vi. She is now my new stylist for life! I have now been having my hair done with Vi for over 4 years now. I actually had never had such time taken with me on the first visit to determine what I really wanted, how I lived, my lifestyle, etc. The first cut was amazing! and it grew out so beautifully that I was able to go a longer time between cuts! I do keep my hair longer, so that helps, but each and every time my cut is perfection! Color is SO good too, she actually got it to almost exactly as my natural color, so too, I can go longer between color jobs as you can barely tell as it grows out! Vi is always a pleasure too, makes you feel so welcome and comfortable, almost like visiting family. I cannot tell you how elated I am to have Vi as my hair stylest. It doesn't get any better. Vi is simply the Best there is! And, her prices are very affordable and most fair for the quality of the cut and color you get. I have paid far more for far less. I am completely satisfied with Vi and Salon de Vive!

4.description: I am really picky when it comes to my hair. I've never colored it or dyed it, save for a few fun highlights when I was a teen. But this time I did my homework and saw that along with great reviews for Salon de Vive, my sister raved about the place too. I booked an appointment with Stefanie for a cut and color; I knew I needed to try out some subtle color at one point (even though I love my dark hair), so I showed her some pics I liked of highlights and I asked her advice. She was super helpful and creative, and could tell I was really nervous so she made me feel comfortable. We decided on some caramel highlights to accentuate my dark color and they came out fabulous! Stefanie did an amazing job and was so professional and kind the whole time. I am so glad I decided to check this place out because of the exemplary services provided by Stefanie.

6.description: Stef is the BEST!!  Whoever is doing your hair now is no where near as good as Stef!!  Quit that person and make an appointment with Stef at Salon De Vive.  I've been going to Stef for about 5 years. I've never had a bad cut or color.  I change my style quite frequently.  I walk in, kind of explain what I want, maybe show a picture or two, then boom!  She does exactly what I was explaining, but better!  She knows what works for each different hair type, facial features and personal style.  I can't say enough good things about Stef!  Call her now!Salon De Vive is professional yet fun and relaxed.  Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend Salon De Vive!  As long as I live in Chicago, I won't be going anywhere else.

22.description: Natalie has been cutting/styling my hair for probably a solid 7-8 years now.  She is one of those gems that once you find, you cherish and never want to let go! I am a fair-skinned natural blonde who, for the greater part of my life, could get away with my natural color from day to day.  However, after hitting my 40's, these ashy gray-ish blonde strands started taking over so I decided it was time to even things out.  Let's just say I was a pretty terrified grown woman who had never colored her hair before. Yikes!In her usual style, Natalie was completely professional with her consultation and we decided to take it slow with some highlights (softer at first visit, then brighter). I walked out of the salon yesterday after receiving my first full on highlights I feel like a new girl!!! The color blend is just perfect, I only wish I would have done it sooner. Just fantastic. Thank you thank you THANK YOU!For the GENTLEMEN:  Natalie has also been cutting my husbands hair for many, many years and he (like me), would not even THINK of going elsewhere!The salon itself is laid back and comfortable without any pretentiousness. While under the dryer, I often find myself hearing interesting music streaming from the speakers and then Shazam'ing & downloading them to my iPhone on the spot...(I had no idea I was such a fan of Passion Pit!)In short, Natalie is great, make your appointment today!

15.description: Saved the day!I went in after I thought it would be fun to have my mom dye my hair like we used to do back in the day. As fun as that sounds, it really wasn't. My hair basically turned into a very bad impression of fire. I went to see these guys and they completely saved the day. Great job on color. Definitely sticking with them.

57.description: I love this salon! The stylists are so friendly -  not even a hint of hipper-than-thou vibes here.  Stefanie has been my stylist  for a couple of years and she always does a wonderful job. She really takes in your ideas and offers her own based on your hair type and lifestyle. Aside from being really easygoing and fun to talk to, she's also great with color and styling. Viva Salon de Vive!

20.description: Saved the day!I went in after I thought it would be fun to have my mom dye my hair like we used to do back in the day. As fun as that sounds, it really wasn't. My hair basically turned into a very bad impression of fire. I went to see these guys and they completely saved the day. Great job on color. Definitely sticking with them.

36.description: Stephanie is the BEST!  Seriously, I may just be THE pickiest person when it comes to my hair and Stephanie never disappoints.  I have this giant head of Diana Ross frizz that Steph handles with care but also whips into shape. We've colored it, corrected it, highlighted, keratin--the works, and it always comes out exactly the way I want it but never fried. Recently i brought her a pic of Eva Mendez and said 'Are you a magician because I want this hair!"  Well, she is one after all.  An all over root touch up, highlights, and a glaze transformed my 3 shades of brassy locks into soft brown and golden perfection.  She also does one hell of a blow out.  In the past I would always have to go home and touch up with a flat iron but with Steph I'm ready to hit the road with my bouncy, silky new do.  In the past I would always read reviews of stylists and hope to find my match and after living in Chicago for 5 years I finally found her. Besides doing an awesome job on your hair you'll find a new friend.  Steph is one of the nicest women I've had the pleasure of meeting.   Easy street parking and a Starbucks on the corner make the trip complete.

14.description: I love Salon de Vive, Vi, Emmett, Stephanie and all the staff.  Everyone is extra friendly and the vibe is great.  Which is probably why all the stylists have been there so long.  Vi has done my hair expertly and consistently for 20 years.  I don't have to explain what I want- she knows and does it to perfection every time.  This place is a godsend for your hair... you/your hair will love it, too!

3.description: I love this place! I stopped by on my walk home from work a month ago and had a lovely chat with the woman working that afternoon.  I've stopped by since and bought some unique blue seashell earrings. They have nice, cheap earrings (most are $15) and, of course, tons of pearls. Their pearls range from freshwater pearl bracelets for $8 (!) to luxurious strands of all colors. A great place for gifts!
