1.description: I'm strolling down Roscoe on a beautiful, sunny April Saturday when I see the sign for Pearls and Cake.  Not sure if they sell jewelry or baked goods, but how can I go wrong either way?  I like pearls.  I like cake.  In I go.This store sells the widest variety of pearls and pearl jewelry I've seen this side of India.  Necklaces, rings, bracelets, earrings - chunky, seed, delicate - all the colors and styles you could hope for.  The walls are covered with pictures of famous women in pearls - Michelle Obama, Audrey Hepburn - anyone you'd hope to emulate in your jewelry selections.  Prices ranged from too-cheap-to-pass-up ($5 bracelet!) to more "special occasion" (gorgeous creations mixing pearls with other precious and semi-precious stones).  At the register, I was about to say that I didn't need a bag for my purchase (I'm green chic!), but then I saw the bags...  So cute - totally reusable as a gift bag.  I took one (and promise to reuse it!).Another plus was the guy behind the counter.  I'm pretty sure if I worked at a jewelry store I'd cringe when any child entered my domain.  In the short time I was there, two of the romper-room set came and went, and Mr. Pearls and Cake scarcely batted an eyelash.  Kudos to you, sir!

2.description: I love their jewelry and the girls are so much fun.  I just acquired a beautiful multistrand pearl bracelet and I can't wait to wear it.  It's a great place for beautiful jewelry, the holidays are coming so start shopping for your friends.  MEN: if you want nice stuff, you can shop here for your special women.

5.description: I live on Roscoe and had never been in here til' this weekend.  My dad spotted a necklace in here after eating at john's place that he wanted to buy my mom. He assumed it was a few hundred dollars, when we went in to check it out, it was $25.  unreal. they have some really pretty pieces and nice selection.  I am not big on costume jewelry (i like the real mccoy) but for gifts and weddings etc, they had a great selection and even better pricing!

6.description: This is my new favorite store in Chicago!! I could hours in here. It is a true hidden treasure - the prices are fantastic, the stuff is soooo cute and the latest styles from all over the world. My 5 year old son loves to come with me too! Love Love Love Love Love it!!

0.description: I live nearby this shop and finally stopped by to check out what this place was like.  I found tons of great, unique jewelry items from around the world (owners are stewardesses and bring items back with them), small purses, and other random finds.  I picked up a few Christmas presents while there and will definitely keep Pearls and Cake in mind for future gifts for girlfriends, weddings, or the occasional 'just because' gift.  Not only do they have quality items to offer but also at reasonable prices.  Whether you are looking for something on a tight budget or a more extravagant item you're sure to find it here.  Very pleased with my shopping experience!!

4.description: I stumbled across this place purely by accident and was so thrilled I did! I bought a beautiful earring and necklace set as a gift for my Mom and of course something for myself too :) The prices are amazing even for costume jewelry (which I loooove) and a lot of it looks A LOT more expensive than it really is. That's the mark of a good product. I dare you to walk in here and not buy something.

58.description: I had an interview in 2 days and had to get a haircut in the area soon!  Great barbershop, not one of those new salons.  $19 for a haircut and I was very impressed.  I got my hair cut by Peter and my hair looked great.

56.description: Great barbershop! I have been going to Greg for quite some time- he does a great job and doesn't take too long. Some barbers take reservations, others do not. Definitely check this place out, much better than a chain place.

29.description: Great place.

42.description: I've been going to Greg at Belmont Barbershop for well over a year now. He gives the best haircuts I've had anywhere, and I wouldn't want to go anywhere else or to anyone else.  I leave my hair in his hands ever time. I walk out and always come out looking great! Great atmosphere too!--walk-ins can take a while especially on Saturdays so I recommend making an appointment.

23.description: After a disastrous experience at a Hair Cuttery, I made it my mission to find a new place for my fiancé to get a haircut. I found the Belmont Barbershop and quickly made the first available appointment with Peter.My fiancé asked for the Julian Edelman/undercut and Peter executed it perfectly. It was honestly the best haircut he had ever gotten in our 8+ years together and I couldn't stop staring at him (he looked even more ridiculously handsome then usual.)He has now seen Peter 3 times and each time he comes home with perfectly cut and styled hair. I don't think he will ever let anyone else touch his hair again. As a bonus, whatever products Peter uses in his hair always smell amazing.

47.description: Just got my hair cut by Derrick who I must say was very informative about style and maintenance. He gave me the exact hair cut I asked for. I have been shopping around for different barbershops, but after having Derrick cut my hair I will be sticking exclusively with The Belmont Barbershop.

8.description: Been looking for a barbershop since I moved to Chicago and stumbled upon The Belmont Barbershop. I walked in and didn't have an appointment (I found out they are by appt only). Peter had an opening and was kind enough to give me fresh haircut. After a few questions Peter knew exactly what I was going for and absolutely nailed it! Stoked on my haircut and will definitely be coming back to The Belmont Barbershop! Great customer service and affordable rates. Thanks Peter for dapping me up!

31.description: Great experience! This is a very professional place. I booked my appointment online. I was a little late and the barber was very understanding. They stay true to keeping your appointment to 20 minutes. Great price for a great service. I traveled from the south side to see how this place was. Needless to say I will be making the trip more often. This place is definitely worth it!

34.description: Came here from downtown last minute hoping to get a quick haircut. They were able to give me a cut in no time and were very accommodate. The service and atmosphere are top notch. Special thanks  to Peter who hooked me up with a great cut.

16.description: This is a great barbershop. The guys running the place are super cool. I always feel at home when I'm here. Peter is a master of is craft!

13.description: This place is a TV in the waiting area away from being 5 stars!  Best, most-consistent cut I've ever received- hands down. **UPDATE** - went from 4 TO 5 stars with the edition of flat screens.  Highly recommended!

11.description: After a disastrous experience at a Hair Cuttery, I made it my mission to find a new place for my fiancé to get a haircut. I found the Belmont Barbershop and quickly made the first available appointment with Peter.My fiancé asked for the Julian Edelman/undercut and Peter executed it perfectly. It was honestly the best haircut he had ever gotten in our 8+ years together and I couldn't stop staring at him (he looked even more ridiculously handsome then usual.)He has now seen Peter 3 times and each time he comes home with perfectly cut and styled hair. I don't think he will ever let anyone else touch his hair again. As a bonus, whatever products Peter uses in his hair always smell amazing.

39.description: This place is awesome! Best barbershop in the city!! Definitely recommend making appointments. I was coming here for 6 months as a walk in and I would see Jose. He is a great barber and does well. I had to start making appointments because wait time is up to 3 hours sometimes. I make appts with Isaac now and have never been let down. He is probably the best barber I have ever been to as well as in Belmont Barbershop.

37.description: There's nothing like an old-fashioned barbershop. Belmont Barbershop is 100% honest. You won't find any of that fake "Ye olde barbershoppe" garbage, or it's accompanying price hike here, just friendly, skilled barbers giving great haircuts. I've been going to Travis for about a year and he has never let me down yet.Highly recommended.

0.description: This place is awesome. Worth the drive from Evanston. Colin gave me one of my best cuts - especially impressive given that my previous cut (from another shop) was not good. Definitely my new regular spot.

38.description: This review is long overdue.  All of there barbers here are great, but Isaac is the motherf'ing man.  There's a reason he's booked two weeks out.  I always leave this barbershop feeling amazing.  There's nothing like a clean cut...Thanks, y'all!

51.description: Hands down, Best barbershop in Chicago, for me midwest!Atmosphere, energy, and talent lined up at this great Chicago barber. They know hair, and they know man. It's a must go to for a superberb cut that's modern but still classy as ever. cheap in my mind for the quality. $19 before tip, CASH ONLY.

27.description: I went with Josh Cooley, the owner and I could not be happier. He gave me the best haircut I have ever had in my life. Highly recommended. Its seriously worth it to work around his hectic schedule

32.description: I walked in off the Street for a Straight Razor Shave at 1:30pm on a Saturday, fully expecting to get turned away - couldn't believe they took me. It was my first time here and found this based upon a recommendation via the CBS Local WebsiteJose took care of me. Its be a long time since I had a Straight Razor Shave but it was amazing and better than I remember. Definitely will be going back.

54.description: I will never go to another barbershop. I tried the cheap chains. Even tried SportClips cause it is guyish and has hot towels. Belmont Barbershop blows it away. Sure it is more expensive than a 12 SuperCut, but they don't screw up your hair. Great service, but book ahead. Wait is long sometimes, and the waiting area isn't comfy or with WIFI.PS...Don't bring a CC. Cash only.

48.description: I had a work crush on this quiet nerdy guy with a bad haircut who sits near me. He was such a sweetheart, keeping to himself, fumbling over his words, hands shaking and barely being able to look me in the eyes when I ask for the daily financial reports. I could tell all he needed was a little confidence.Well last week he struts in with his new do from The Belmont Barbershop and let me tell you, he seems like a whole new person, wait no, he IS a whole new person.Now he has a classic Don Draper look along with the swaggering machismo of a young Burt Reynolds.He even smells like campfire and gunpowder.I''ve become the one breaking eye contact and nervously sweating whenever he steps in my cubicle to make small talk.Yesterday I accidentally grazed his body walking past him and felt a shockwave of paralyzing orgasmic pleasure encompass my body. Now I'm pregnant with his child and haven't even had my morning mimosa.It's crazy what a good haircut can do for a man.

44.description: Greg the barber is great. He's gives an expert cut...Every time. Handles clippers like a master. And he's help correct a few cuts when I tried to do it myself or went elsewhere.

24.description: Loved this place because Isaac gives great haircuts. Sadly I was informed today that he no longer works there. If anyone knows what shop he went to, please let me know. I gave it a 3 because of the recent price hike. Not a big deal but if you were going to do that then you should have added a credit card pay option. Big annoyance to customers. Update: I found Isaac at his new shop Handcrafted Barbershop on grand.

7.description: First cut here and Collin hit it right on the money! Super friendly professional staff that takes reservations so you don't have to sit around all day. Highly recommend.

49.description: This place is awesome..  they have added on new barbers but it's a pretty smooth operation... as long as you show up on-time for your appointment.  If you are late, just forget it..  sign up on the walk-in sheet because you are more or less out of luck.  I had to learn that the hard way early on.. but given the demand at this place, it's fair that people need to show up on-time.I'm low maintenance when it comes to hairstyles..  I just want it to look good.  Best part is that I can come here and say, "Whatever looks good - go for it" and they will make you look awesome.  FYI, looks like Jesse has left Belmont Barbershop and started his own gig on Irving Park by Milwaukee Ave.  Had to do some searching around online to find it.  Thank you Google!  The $19 haircut price means I usually stop by the convenience store a few doors down and get some change for the tip.. just buy a few lottery tickets.

40.description: Still going strong. I rated it 5 stars years ago and pledged my allegiance then, and I've never been let down. Now that I'm moving out of town, I'm sad that Josh won't my be go-to guy anymore. I wish the Belmont Barbershop all the luck in the world!

53.description: This was a great experience! Everything from making my appointment to sitting down on the chair and getting a great quality haircut. You can't beat it. I made an appointment online with Peter, which by the way is an awesome guy! He cut my hair EXACTLY how I wanted it and he's such a nice and friendly person I highly recommend him, Peter, again, thank you brother! The only thing I was sort of concerned about was the parking in the area, but believe it or not, I found plenty of parking right in front of the place (on a Saterday afternoon mind you) so even that worked out well. I'll be coming back to The Belmont Barbershop for sure.

30.description: This place is top notch. Great atmosphere, barbers and music. Isaac was excellent. He gave me one of the best haircuts I have ever received for my upcoming wedding. I used to go to walk in places like super cuts or hair cuttery, never again.

46.description: This is the best barbershop around. Everyone in the shop is very talented, Hands down the best haircut I have ever gotten.

1.description: Visited four times so far. I highly recommend Josh. His cut looks good even without applying pomade.

55.description: I absolutely love going to the Belmont Barbershop to get my haircut. All the barbers there are great. Jesse has cut my hair for almost 2 years now. He's an all around great guy and is great at what he does. I've never been disappointed with his work. Jesse, you're my hero!

9.description: Great shop, great bunch of barbers, felt like I was back in L.A..  with the big glass doors open to the gorgeous Saturday weather and Mickey O'Rourke on the wall.I'm torn with the on-line booking, in/ out, great cut..greatalthough I did miss the male cohesion that you get when going to a barber shop.  Shooting the sh** with all those waiting their turn. Great product - LayRite!, with a very reasonable priceSatya

26.description: First of all I must say it is a great place to retreat every month to talk to your barber and a have a great cut. When I was told about The Belmont Barbershop I was a bit skeptic because I was still loyal to my hair stylist in Boystown. When I made an appointment online with Issac I couldn't wait. When I walked into the Belmont Barbershop I was taken by then setting sending me back to the 1990s and I was reminded of the times when my grandfather would take me to get our flattops. I was called by Issac. I sat and he gave one hell of a haircut!!! Great styling! Issac certainly has a sense of humor. I had good conversation about neighborhoods and micro-breweries. Gentlemen of Chicago. I highly recommend the The Belmont Barbershop if you want that classic hairstyle whether you want to look like a Don Draper, have period piece from the 1920s, or a hairstyle that is suited for our time this is place for you. I recommend Issac for he has keen attention for detail and he is a down to earth guy.

25.description: What a great barber shop. Reminds me of going to the barber as a child with my father. Walked in yesterday for a haircut. Put my name on the list and within an hour I was sitting in Jose's chair waiting to get cut. The guy knows what he's doing!! Showed him an image of what I wanted and he delivered. Definitely will be back!

12.description: I finally made it over to Belmont  and I could not be happier. Walking in they are blasting Iron Man and have coffee and donuts waiting for the customers which was a nice touch.I had Chris cut my hair and he did a really really good job. Also he was helpful with picking some products for my unmanageable hair.I live in Streeterville and it is not easy to get to, but I am coming back no question.Thanks guys for making my Saturday!

59.description: This place is definitely different from all the barbershops and beauty salons i've ever been to for one they greet which says a lot about how they view their customers.  Although the majority of the barbers are always booked its for a good reason they all do their job well.  My personal fav Jose which is usually walk ins but man he knows exactly how to cut my hair again might just be my biased but observing the other barbers in there and the clients hair styles assures me all the barbers there are great.

21.description: Fantastic shop I have been going to the shop for 10 years I love the shop very much and is dear to my heart the best barbershop in Chicago hands-down

17.description: This place is awesome! I went to a barbershop in Louisville throughout my four years at college and I was worried I wasn't going to find a place that did as good of a job once I moved. Well, I found my replacement. I first walked in without an appointment, and they still sat me down right away for a cut (although it's super easy to make an appointment online on their website). The cut was great, fast, and not expensive. The barbers were friendly, and we had a great conversation. Glad I found my new barbershop in my new neighborhood!

10.description: Walked in without an appointment and I think I got "the new guy" who didn't have a wait. Wasn't a great cut at all. I think there are some good barbers here so make an appointment in advance and ask for someone by name.

5.description: Use to go to a salon but missed the barbershop feel. Came across this shop and I have to say I got exactly what I was looking for way better price then salons. Great barbers and feel as you sit and get cut. Everyone here has major talent so it really doesn't matter who you get.

3.description: Have been going here for 3+ years and am always pleased with the results.  I always go with Josh, so can't speak for anyone else.  Still, I can't imagine any of the barbers here not being top notch.One person commented that they raised the price without warning.  I don't know about you, but the last time I was in they told me personally that the price was changing.  On top of this, it's clearly stated on their site when you go to make a reservation.  Kind of hard to miss.

35.description: Guys, do yourself a favor - spend $20 on the best haircut you will get.  This was my first time there.  I went on line and made an appointment with Peter (walk-ins may take awhile) and left very very happy.  Great atmosphere.  Well worth it!

19.description: Starting in March '15 Belmont Barbershop transitioned to Appointment Only, which in my opinion is much better as Jose (my barber) was walk-in only. Try to book 2 days in advance for any time selections as this location stays busy.

28.description: I've been working as a Barber at another successful shop in the city for the last two years, and the word is that Belmont barbershop is hands-down the best in the city.            After, experiencing the shop, I couldn't agree more.  They have a buzzing, energetic and friendly atmosphere and the haircut that I got was about damn perfect. I have an extremely high standard when it comes to the quality of a cut and these guys are at that or above.        Issac gave me the perfect mid-fade, skin up. He listened and completely delivered. All that AND I had good time, with good company. I almost never leave reviews,  but for this place it was warranted. Go there.

45.description: My boyfriend got a haircut by Josh and when he came home I was in love even more haha. Josh styled his hair so good and the product was so great. He uses it everyday and his hair looks amazing! Thanks Josh :)

33.description: I love this place. Great vibe in there on a Saturday morning.The last time I was in there I think they're playing the theme from Laverne and Shirley on the radio for kicks.All nice guys. No reason to be intimidated.Make a an appointment on their site. They stick to the time very well.Peter is a great barber, and a really nice guy. Been cut by Jose, too. Also good barber.Classic barber shop with a modern vibe.

43.description: Loved my haircut, possibly the best I have ever had! It came out so aesthetically pleasing!Definitely reserve Isaac, he's one of the best barbers there, I was told to reserve him and was not disappointed. Do not do walk ins, I saw the two guys who did walk ins leave the people with really bad hair. I'm assuming they're amateurs. Make a reservation online and you're going set!

2.description: Looks like Belmont Barbershop with little warning just raised prices another 13%. This makes the two year jump in price 30%. Meanwhile I've gotten a single digit raise. Not sure who's making these decisions, but its clear they're not for the common gentleman, just the rich gentleman. I still rate my barber excellent, but I will start looking around again for a new barbershop. Some of their barbers left about a year ago and started their own shop which I'll now take a look at.

18.description: I walked in off the Street for a Straight Razor Shave at 1:30pm on a Saturday, fully expecting to get turned away - couldn't believe they took me. It was my first time here and found this based upon a recommendation via the CBS Local WebsiteJose took care of me. Its be a long time since I had a Straight Razor Shave but it was amazing and better than I remember. Definitely will be going back.

41.description: I have been going to The Belmont Barber Shop for at least 5 years now. I always get a great cut, never have to wait, and it never takes too long. The guys are all amazing barbers and the shop talk is entertaining and fresh. There is always tasteful music playing and the decor is classic. I always walk out of that place looking and smelling like I can take on the world.

52.description: I've been to each of the walk in gents, and they are both top notch. Clean cuts, good vibes, and the walk in wait on a Friday afternoon filled with hustle & bustle was still only a half hour. The undercut was perfectly executed, and paying attention to the details (trimming down where my newly hairless sideburns met the beard) was very appreciated. The star deduction is really a personal bias, because I'm a man with medium length curly hair. It's a rare combo, and difficult to execute perfectly.

50.description: Best barbershop in Chicago.  I drive from downtown to get my haircut here, it's worth the drive.  Peter does a great job.

4.description: I'm truly impressed with the entire experience, the owner Josh, who I'm proud to call my barber is the best I've ever dealt with and somehow understands how to fill in the space between the picture on your phone to reality and carry it out with no mistake. The prices are by far the most reasonable I've encountered (for what you get). Best of all, you know you're not walking into some gimmicky chain barbershop or salon that charges an insane amount of money for a mediocre cut but rather supporting a small business that delivers in a personalized/professional manner. So far my faded and beard trim have turned out wonderful. At Belmont Barbershop they keep it simple and clean, cash only and very punctual. Keep up the good work guys you gained a customer for life!!

6.description: The best barbershop in Chicago! Professional and easy going barbers. The best haircuts I have gotten in my 20 some odd years in this city. These guys are professionals, if you don't like to pay $ for a great haircut then go to a nearby Supercuts or unlicensed barber in your neighborhood.  All good barbers but Josh Cooley is the go to!

22.description: The first time I went to Belmont Barber Shop was the day before Thanksgiving because my hair person from Halo on Diversey left and Belmont was right down the street. Waited for some time- clearly because I had not made an appt. and it was he day before Thanksgiving- but still got a great cut and got out of there with a new do.  The next time I went IMade an appt. w/Travis because he cut my friend's hair- and he was cool and did an awesome job. I thought- this is my new guy here. Next time I went to book- no more Travis. I guess they had a huge change and some of their people left and went elsewhere to work.  And here I was yesterday. I know where Travis works- kind of far- and figure- this place is right down the street, convenient, and they certainly have some good barbers there. I made an appt. w/ Peter and showed up on time and he did an excellent job with my melon. He wasn't much of a talker at first- but he warmed up a bit as my haircut went on. Even recommended me a great Italian eatery by Taylor Street. This place is everything you need if you are a guy that wants to hop online, make an easy appointment, get your hair cut in 15 minutes, have a couple good convos, and get outta there. It's a cool spot and he guys that work there seem like they are on top of their game and have some good experience at the art of whipping butter. I am going to continue to go to Peter and would send my friends there for a cut any day.

15.description: First of all I must say it is a great place to retreat every month to talk to your barber and a have a great cut. When I was told about The Belmont Barbershop I was a bit skeptic because I was still loyal to my hair stylist in Boystown. When I made an appointment online with Issac I couldn't wait. When I walked into the Belmont Barbershop I was taken by then setting sending me back to the 1990s and I was reminded of the times when my grandfather would take me to get our flattops. I was called by Issac. I sat and he gave one hell of a haircut!!! Great styling! Issac certainly has a sense of humor. I had good conversation about neighborhoods and micro-breweries. Gentlemen of Chicago. I highly recommend the The Belmont Barbershop if you want that classic hairstyle whether you want to look like a Don Draper, have period piece from the 1920s, or a hairstyle that is suited for our time this is place for you. I recommend Issac for he has keen attention for detail and he is a down to earth guy.

57.description: Cool place, decent haircut, but the shave was bad. $55 total price before tip for both. I left thinking all was good, but then noticed blood on my face while shopping right after I left the place. I get home look in the bathroom mirror, and I've got dried blood all over my face. Worst part, I discovered that hair was still left on my face. Visible hair, not to mention the sandpaper under my chin. I don't splurge on something like a shave that often, so I was very disappointed with the outcome. Maybe I have a rough beard, but $36 for a shave that was not close and left me bleeding? Should have used the money to buy more replacement razor blade heads instead. Big pass for anyone looking for a shave. Haircut was standard issue.

20.description: The best barbershop in Chicago, hands down.  I got a cut from Peter and Josh and both were flawless.  Every guy I've seen walk out the door looks great.  Cool guys, unique atmosphere, fantastic business culture...this shop has a customer for life.

36.description: This is the best spot in the city! I've been going to Jose for a little over a year and he gets my cut right every time. Sometimes the wait is a little long because he is a WALK IN only barber but it's worth the wait! Classic style barbershop, cool people, highly recommend this spot.

14.description: I probably had the worst experience ever in this place. To make sure the barber understands what I want, I usually bring with me a photo of what I want. For the most part, it worked so far. But not here. I got a haircut with the barber Peter and after explaining him that what I wanted is what he could see in the photo, he started to cut. It didn't passed even a minute when he started to cut extremely short in the sides, the total opposite to what it was in the photo. I told him, but he kept going. In the end I end up with a hear cut that it was, at  best, very different. Around 5 times shorter in the sides and with a strange look of mushroom.Considering that sometimes it is just a matter of return to home and play around with the hair, I tipped him well and I got my place. But it didn't have any "aesthetic" solution. So I returned to the barbershop and, after arguing with him because he took it as a personal thing, he accepted to correct the haircut, but 4 days after. Unfortunately I have to show up in some places before that, and not with this mess over my head.

28.description: Quick and cheap. There's rarely a wait and they do a good job. What more could you want?!

1.description: I use to come here a lot. Especially when they had their no chip mani/pedi deal. The last time I came in (about a month ago) they no longer had the deal. They did give me $5 off because I asked about it, so that was nice. Each time I would go in I'd get the no chip mani. I've noticed that it seems to last only about a week or two before peeling at the bottom edges. I've gone to other places before and this typically does not happen. I've had no chips last up until a month. I don't think I will come back because the mani/pedi deal is gone and the manicures are subpar.

39.description: The service was good enough at this place but it felt quite cramped and, as another reviewer stated, they have absolute terrible ventilation.  All you smell is fumes, which after a while, you do get used to but I'm sure somewhere in your body is paying for it.  The chairs are comfy and mani/pedis for $30 is right up my alley.  Color selection is fair enough and the workers can be chatty but pleasant.  It's just the fumes are too much and it's not a good place for those that are claustrophobic.

9.description: After delivering mail today I wanted to treat myself to a Mani and pedi....I decided this location , bad choice.... The nail tech was super rough with my aching feet...she became hostile after I told her my heel were still rough and asked her was she new!!!! She stated she asked me did she want me to use this certain sand blaster machine looking thing and I told her no, I said you never asked me anything " no I held it up and by the look of your face it was telling me no".... My face may have been looking weird because I was uncomfortable!!! So I asked for someone else , finally another lady comes and tell me I'll see what I can do , it may not be much.... Okay you rude assholes I said to myself. I paid $15 for that weak pedi and as I was leaving out the other transgender nail tech was laughing at me...HaHa I saved money , you all lost money, I would have sent a lot of my co workers to this shop.... And that one star is because they had free WiFi !!!!

29.description: It was pretty busy when I arrived. I had to wait awhile but I couldn't pass up a deal. $25 is pretty unheard of. The owner took care me and did an ok job. I guess you get what you pay for.

23.description: The results are without a doubt 5-star. However, the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired. That and the constant chatting of the nail techs, keep me away from this shop. Currently, it's $25 for mani/pedi and $10 for mani only. You can't beat that. But that also means it doesn't always get the best element of customer. My major gripes are the owners school age children, when not in school,  they run around the shop and make noise. So not a tranquil environment. Another frustration is that the workers eat at their stations & have food sitting around. The smell really turns me off. Also why have on a tv, if  the picture is all static? And please turn off that darn radio.   Again these contribute to a less than desirable environment. They have a good selection of OPI polish. The parking lot is a plus.

5.description: Most bizarre experience ever.  The told me the wait would be 15 minutes -- not biggie.  After about 10 minutes they took me over to the foot bath to soak.  Assuming it would be another 5 minutes, I was cool with that.   I kept asking how long it would be and they kept saying just a few minutes.    It was actually another 15 minutes.more later just staring the review

31.description: Very disappointed! My best friend and I were out shopping and decided to stop in this place that we have passed several times for a pedicure. This is something we do often, shopping and pedicures....we have had good and bad pedicures from all over Chicago. This by far had to be the worst! They kept us waiting for a quite a while before we were able to get in the chairs...this should have been my first clue, but hey, they were busy, it happens. But there are 4 chairs in the back and only one person getting a pedicure at the time. So we finally get into the water. A lady comes and starts working on my friends feet. Im waiting..... waiting..... waiting.... getting pruned..... waiting..... waiting. A good 20 minutes at least ( Im being generous ) FINALLY somebody comes for me. My friend was getting her toes polished before mine even began. Then to top it off, she cuts my nails, scrubs the bottom of my feet and POOF we are done! No trimming of the cuticles. She slapped some lotion on and painted my toes very sloppy and that was it. $20. Beware, you get what you pay for. My friend said hers was OK, but she absolutely agrees, we will not go back there.

25.description: I love this place! I've been coming here for years! When I was a student at Lane Tech I would come with my friends and get ridiculously long and obnoxious gel nails. They have airbrush stencils and varied tips (even print tips) for fun designs. I also noticed they just started carrying Gellish and no-chip mani products, but I do mine at home now! Let the guy who does artificial nails do some crazy design on your hand. Thank me later! $25 for a spa manicure and pedicure is an excellent deal. I usually opt for the extra $5 for french pedi and they always do a consistently good job. I stopped in the rivaling place across Addison and they gave me a jagged cut & were quite rude both times I went.. this is really the place to go!I'd recommend getting here before or after Lane gets out of school because traffic off Addison and Western gets hectic. This place can get busy, but there is rarely a long wait.

12.description: TERRIBLE. I have given this nail salon three chances now. The first time I came in 45 minutes before close only to be seated for 35 minutes while all the employees rushed to clean. They started doing my acrylic full set 10 min before close only to do a terrible job because they were rushing. Second time I went to go get acrylic full set and the woman made me get a french tip when I did not want to. I argued with her for a good 10 minutes saying I want the whole nail painted but she refused because she said a french tip would look nicer. I was so in shock that she refused to do it my way, I did not argue due to the fact that is not how I handle my anger. Third time I made an appointment for my friends and I. I set the appointment at 6:30 pm on a Saturday night, knowing they close at 8 I thought this was enough time. The girls and I walked in around 10 min late due to traffic. What do I see when I walk in? I see 5 employees glaring at me while quickly cleaning. I said i had an appointment at 6:30 and they refused to take me because they were closing an hour early at 7. I understand that coming in 10 minutes late was not acceptable but when I made an appointment earlier that day for 6:30 they should have asked me to schedule a little earlier since they were closing early that day! Overall, not the best nail salon. Their prices are cheap but I would much rather pay that extra few bucks to be treated with respect.

37.description: Our feet do need help during the winter, I went in and had a pedicure done, the lady was nice asking me how I like my  nails cut. And some other questions, I think she realized that I was trying to escape from the world and give myself an hour of quiet time and wasn't in a mood for being chatty that day. Did a great job on the feet! Will be back as they have parking, bank is in the same strip mall so I was prepared if they wouldn't take my debit card.

21.description: I'm all for a no-frills place to get a reasonably priced mani/pedi, but two things will keep me away from here in the future: First, the place smells like a moldy basement. It turned my stomach. And second, while my toenails look good, the nail tech (who was as sweet as can be) did a horrible job at exfoliating my heels and toes. There's still dead skin on the soles of my feet. I can do a better job in the shower with my own exfoliator.

16.description: $25 for a mani-pedi is such a steal in any major city. I've been to Pro Nails twice now and have learned that you are receiving exactly what you paid for: a run of the mill, outdate salon whose cliental includes a bunch of high school students. On the weekends the salon is very crowded and it will usually take a while to be waited on. I've gone on a weeknight to find that it is dead (even with school in session). I've only received the mani-pedi here and both times were different. The first time, my nails began to chip after a day. This was the weekend service and I believe the nail techs were in a hurry. They even rushed me out of the dry station, telling me my nails were dry. When I got home I had noticed all the chips and dents in the polish from it not drying thoroughly. To top it off, I had boots (it was December) and even with the cuticle oil and plastic baggies, the whole big toe had come off. After that I began to frequent Nails 'R Us, but unfortunately there was a huge disaster with them (see their review) and I decided to try Pro Nails again.The second time was much better. The manicure lasted so long that it was difficult to remove with regular store bought remover. The pedi lasted about a month without chipping and this included surviving a trip to Africa. The nail tech was friendly and kind, but it was really hard to understand her. I went at about 5:30pm on a weeknight and it was dead inside. I think this time the nail tech actually had the time to do a good job and I was actually able to dry for as long as I wanted.All in all, I wouldn't come here if I was really looking to relax. If you want to just throw some paint on them nails, this place is for you. They use dish soap for scrubbing your feet and the massage lasts about 20 seconds.

17.description: Just moved to the area and wanted to find a nice, clean place within walking distance that I could drop in. Based on various reviews on Yelp I walked over. Managers Special $25 mani/pedi-great deal. Even better that I got Ann, who was excellent, very precise and did a great job! I got her hours so I can go back and see her. For this price, the technician (Ann), cleanliness, and so close to me - it rates high.

10.description: Worse customer experience I've ever encountered. Waited  about 30 min for service then was sent off because they we're closing soon .

11.description: I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with Pro Nails. The location is not great, because the strip mall parking lot is tiny. After reading other reviews, I was worried about the cleanliness of the interior, but it's actually a clean and cute place! The staff seems to be related to one another and they are very cordial and friendly. I saw Jo, who did a great job on my nails, and also chit-chatted with me (but not too much). I'm glad I found a new neighborhood spot with great prices! ($45 for a pedicure AND a no-chip manicure)

26.description: I got a pedicure a week ago at pro nails and it was my first time there. I had a great experience...its quiet and the employees speak very clear english, thats what i loved about it. Also because i didnt have to hear them speak in their language the whole time they talk in english mostly. I live in roscoe village down the street and never went there but now that i have i think its my new spot from now on!

27.description: This is my new place.  $25 for a mani/pedi -- are you SERIOUS?  For that price, I had certain expectations... broken massage chair?  Lethargic technician?  Bleeding cuticles?  I didn't care; I was so desperate for my paws to look good again after the disaster of a manicure I'd gotten the week before.I was totally blown away!  The boyfriend and I walked in (yeah, I said it, so what?) on a Saturday and we only had to wait a couple minutes.  The color selection is good, as is the magazine selection (yay, RealSimple!)  Everyone at the salon was incredibly friendly and funny.  Also, I appreciate the right balance of chatting and silent reflection when I'm gettin' mah nails did, and Pro Nails has it.I also appreciate that everyone there speaks perfect English.  I have no problem with immigrants, but I've had one too many experiences at cheap salons where any directive: "Can you make them more square?" "That kind of hurts," "I cut my toe yesterday, please be careful" is met with a nod and a smile of complete incomprehension.  Haven't we all?When we left, our nails looked totes fab, even the boyfriend's (his technician scolded him for going so long without a manicure, because boy hands take a lot of punishment, apparently.)  But it gets BETTER.  My first chip appeared almost a week after the manicure (Saturday to Friday), and still looked fine until Sunday, when I started thinking it was time to repaint.  And not with no-chip or gel... just with OPI, top coat, and apparently a heaping sprinkle of fairy magic.  I don't think I've EVER had a manicure last a full week, still lookin' fine.  My new place, for serious.  Get in line, ladies.

35.description: OPI Polish-$25 Mani-Pedis!My new nail salon.

8.description: So rarely am I happy with my nails when my usual person isn't the tech ~ but I was desperate for a manicure, so I turned to my reliable source "Yelp".  Once again, I got the perfect reco!  Lynn with Pro Nails did a fab job and my nails are exactly the way I desired.  Not to mention, they're downright cheap!   $17 for a refill?!  Who does that anymore?!

0.description: 5 stars for MiMi! Fast service,  was greeted immediately, given nice cold water, she started massage chair which was nice because Lord knows, I don't know how to program that! Mani & pedi $33 not bad at all. Quick, fast service! I'll be back.

38.description: Sigh, yes...I realize I am a total addict. However, the last place that did my nails made them round. This does not work for me as I am a clacker tapper. This means, I sit on my computer all day tapping away at my perfectly manicure nails. Consequently, they need to be short and square...So, back I went for some repairs. Pro Nails has a parking lot. Score. They are also next to BeBoBa Bubble Tea House and a good lookin' gyro place...The nail tech was very sweet and only gave me minimal backlash for pulling at my cuticles. (six of one, half dozen of another...I used to be a nailbiter). My only peeve is with the credit card policy. The manicures are cheap(ish) at $10, but the minimum on a credit card is $15. This makes no sense...or maybe it makes perfect sense to them, as I ended up dishing out a 50 percent tip. Sigh...Decent place to stop, just keep in mind it's a no frills shop with a pretty seedy bathroom (not recommended) a parking lot...and a $15 min charge. I suggest getting some bubble tea whilst you wait...Pretty in pink.

20.description: $25 for a mani-pedi is such a steal in any major city. I've been to Pro Nails twice now and have learned that you are receiving exactly what you paid for: a run of the mill, outdate salon whose cliental includes a bunch of high school students. On the weekends the salon is very crowded and it will usually take a while to be waited on. I've gone on a weeknight to find that it is dead (even with school in session). I've only received the mani-pedi here and both times were different. The first time, my nails began to chip after a day. This was the weekend service and I believe the nail techs were in a hurry. They even rushed me out of the dry station, telling me my nails were dry. When I got home I had noticed all the chips and dents in the polish from it not drying thoroughly. To top it off, I had boots (it was December) and even with the cuticle oil and plastic baggies, the whole big toe had come off. After that I began to frequent Nails 'R Us, but unfortunately there was a huge disaster with them (see their review) and I decided to try Pro Nails again.The second time was much better. The manicure lasted so long that it was difficult to remove with regular store bought remover. The pedi lasted about a month without chipping and this included surviving a trip to Africa. The nail tech was friendly and kind, but it was really hard to understand her. I went at about 5:30pm on a weeknight and it was dead inside. I think this time the nail tech actually had the time to do a good job and I was actually able to dry for as long as I wanted.All in all, I wouldn't come here if I was really looking to relax. If you want to just throw some paint on them nails, this place is for you. They use dish soap for scrubbing your feet and the massage lasts about 20 seconds.

19.description: Fantastic place! Everyone was so nice and the prices are amazing! I went in for a gel fill in and walked out with perfect nails. Cheap, fast, friendly, and great work. I will defiantly be returning. :)

33.description: I have acrylic nails that I am extremely picky about.  I tried 5 different salons before going Pro Nails on a whim.  They are the best, by far! They shaped my nails how I wanted them (round, without balking at not wanting square), made sure the fill was perfectly smooth, took off a broken nail gently with clippers, and finished in the fastest time possible.  Cost was only $16 for a fill and 1 break.  I recommend asking for Ken!  Only reason I didn't give the salon 5 stars is because it isn't so posh looking.

2.description: I am giving 3 stars for cleanliness. The place is rather worn looking, but based upon the fact that they are located directly across the street from a high school means their clientele is likely a younger, less discriminating age. Their prices mani/pedi no chip $43 is the cheapest I've seen yet. I got squeezed in for a polish change as their books were full for the evening. At those prices I am sure!!!! They use some automatic callus remover that looks like a clarsonic brush. At the end of the day, the nail tech didn't do any better at painting then I could have done. Ummmm, I could have saved my $8 and bought myself a martini somewhere. The quest for the perfect nail tech continues.

34.description: I love this place! It's $25 for a Spa Pedi/Mani. They are professional.  My nail polish lasts a long time.  It is an in-between type place - Not too fancy but well taken care of.  Love the massage chairs and they even have a great local rap song by Kid Sister named after them!  It doesn't get better than that!

32.description: I think Pro Nails needs an upgrade.$25 for a mani/pedi is an absolute steal.  If you're looking for a cheap, quick fix, Pro Nails is the place.The folks working at Pro Nails are ridiculously nice, too.  The gal who did my pedi was a peach and the guy who did my nails was told tall tales of his last Britney Spears concert.  I mean, seriously... good conversation and pretty nails at rock bottom prices?  I'm in.

18.description: I think Pro Nails needs an upgrade.$25 for a mani/pedi is an absolute steal.  If you're looking for a cheap, quick fix, Pro Nails is the place.The folks working at Pro Nails are ridiculously nice, too.  The gal who did my pedi was a peach and the guy who did my nails was told tall tales of his last Britney Spears concert.  I mean, seriously... good conversation and pretty nails at rock bottom prices?  I'm in.

41.description: Always clean, professional and so inexpensive that you can easily get a pedicure every 2 weeks in the summer and not even feel guilty about it. Great service and no appointment needed!Be advised, around lunch hour it gets crazy in that area with Lane students on lunch so if you go then, allow more time. Fill-Ins only $13 for acrylics!

13.description: They used to have the 25 dollar mani/pedi special every day of the week, but now it's only Monday, Tuesday and Wednesdays, but 30 bucks isn't bad either.I like this place and I like it even better now that they have remodeled it. Plenty of chairs and it's bright and airy.All the people who work there are very friendly.If you want something fancy.....go spend your money and go there. I don't want to see your frowned up face sitting next to me in the pedicure chair acting like you are so grossed out with your surroundings.This place is reasonably priced and fast service.

4.description: ZERO STARS! I booked 3 appointments and they were not very accommodating when asking questions about new colors yelling, "SEE ON THE WALL!"  No customer service and I will never go again and never recommend anyone to go there. Who is the owner??

24.description: This is the only nail salon I will go willingly to in Chicago! The staff is super friendly and well-skilled. Large selection of colors and services. They even do waxing! And they're prices are reasonable. Mani/pedi for $25 + tip! That's awesome! Love this place!

6.description: Guess where I am right now?I'm in a massage chair, waiting for my pedicure. It's 4:30 on a Tuesday and it's quite busy!Their prices are reasonable to begin with, but on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, Pro Nails has a special for mani/pedis -- $25! You can't beat it.Pro Nails is your basic no-frills nail place. Don't come here expecting luxury. (There are places you can go for that, but you'll pay at least double.) The technicians are nice and the work is solid. Pedicures from here last a month.I have tried to edit this place on Yelp a few times since hours are not listed. Their hours are:Monday-Saturday 10am-8pmSunday 11am-5pm

22.description: I only gave one star because you have to give at least one. Got the $25 pedi/mani last week. I totally should have known you get what you pay for. This week I am treating an infected toe.  My technician cut me and then tried to say I had an ingrown nail.... ummmm no you cut me.  I watched her place the equipment she used on me back with all of the other equipment. Disgusting. I am praying I don't have to go to the doctor. My toe is seriously red/purple, swollen, and with a blister along the side of the nail that is pussing yellow/green.Wanted to add that I called the salon to let them know what had happened. Their only response was "Okay we'll find out who it was."  I said "That's it?" to which he confirmed that was all he would do.

15.description: Pro Nails is my bi-weekly spot. Great service by all, in addition to being affordable. Mimi, Anna, and all treat us like family. They make sure we do not leave unless we are happy. Highly recommend them to all.

40.description: PROS: Very friendly staff; fast, great service; easy parking; $30 for pedicure/manicure (massaging chairs a bonus!); hot towels.  CONS: Decor is a little shabby; poor ventilation (strong smell during another customer's acrylic nails and, for some reason, the smell of incense).

7.description: I don't know what happened to this place. I was here a couple months ago, and the workers did my nails decent (for the cheap price of $25 for a mani/pedi during the special mon-wed). NOW, I come in today with my mom (who is not a complainer) and we both get a mani/pedi. First off, the $25 deal is gone! So the price for a mani/pedi was $33. Second, I did not recognize any of the workers, except for like 1 (seems to be all new workers). So they sit me and my mom together on the pedicure chairs. Not only was the pedicure so fast, they were barely cutting any cuticles. Oh, and not to mention, they're painting was horrible? I already knew that my mani was going to be just as bad. Indeed, it was. Once again, they barely even cut our cuticles or cleaned it at all! The paint on our nails were just horrendous. I literally paint way better than that. When I got home, I had to cut my own cuticles AGAIN! I normally don't write reviews or anything because I like to give people the benefit of the doubt, but like I said earlier, my mom who is NOT a complainer was pissed! Her nails turned out worse than mine. At least now we know we are NEVER coming back to this nail salon.

36.description: Quick, Good, Inexpensive....that is what I am looking for in a mani/pedicure....and Pro Nails always delivers.They do a great job, without the bells and whistles and I love that I am in and out so fast. I don't have time for long, luxurious session, nor do I want to chitchat or pay a lot, so this place is perfect for me. They give good advice too for foot, hand and nail care, when I am in the mood to talk.

30.description: Can't beat their special for manis & pedis here. This place is pretty awesome and the staff is very knowledgeable and super friendly. It's nothing fancy but they do a great job.

3.description: Third time here, kept trying to give them the benefit of the doubt. "Sit", don't touch", "go", only words spoken to me. When I asked for a clear coat, she said" I don't know".This is the first time in my life I did not tip someone! Came out feeling stressed!Manicure not bad, toe nails cut too short after I asked that they not be cut short.Definitely will NOT be going back!

14.description: This is my first Yelp review ever... And I'm sad that it has to be a negative one. I have been an avid customer for the last few months. I loved the no chip manicure and have gotten one every time--no complaints. I went in Thursday evening after work to get a no chip manicure before the Easter holiday. By Saturday morning, one nail had chipped. I called and spoke with 'Mimi', and explained the situation.. I was informed they would be closed Sunday for the holiday. By 830p Sat. night 5 nails had chipped! I had every intention of making it in after school Monday, but was too late as they had closed when I arrived. Went in this evening after work and was informed that I had said it was just one nail.. I should have come back sooner.. Blablabla.. I explained that yes, at that time it was just one but several more chipped after I simply showered. I asked for my money back as I did not have time to wait till she was done with all her clients.. She told me "because you've been coming for a long time, I'll do it again, and you just pay $15." Umm no.. I did not just pay $45 on THURSDAY of last week to pay another $15 today for a job poorly done to begin with. It really bothered me that she basically implied I sat at home picking off the polish myself. I mean come on.. I'm a very unhappy long-time customer. Even though this place is right around the corner from my house, I don't think I could ever go back.

58.description: So, the last couple of years I had been smitten by the frozen yogurt bug, but I think the infatuation lingered mostly due to the vast selection of flavors & toppings available, and coz it was healthier than eating regular ice cream. But this past week, I decided to end my relationship with all Fro Yo bars, since I discovered Paciugo.Although, I happened to have come across this location by chance, I was informed by the the owner that this was his 3rd & most recent store in Chicago with the other 2 in Lakeview and Lincoln Square. This relatively new franchised 'gelateria' is very inviting and playful with different colors, trendy furniture and fixtures & a very clean washroom. Other than gelato, they also have coffee and shakes on their menu which I didn't try on this visit. Did you know that gelato is smoother in texture and richer in taste than ice cream, but with almost 70% less fat? I know, I didn't but when I found out, I tried not one but three different flavors :) and they were all phenomenal with my favourite being the Salted Caramel & Chocolate Hazlenut. They make their gelato fresh onsite and use only natural ingredients. I was told, that at any given time, they have over 25 flavors from a selection of over 300 and keep rotating them regularly. It would take me 100 visits to try them all out!The staff at the store were great and not only did they recommend some of their favourite flavors but I also got to sample a few. And for less than the price of a starbucks latte, I got the small size with 3 flavors. They also offer party packs starting at $10 to take home larger containers of your favourite flavors.   I am sure i'll be frequenting this gelateria and its other locations as the temperature soars this summer.

56.description: My niece and I stopped Paciugo on the of their grand opening! And let me tell you, I instantly became addicted to the the lemon/mango gelato!! It's a little pricey, but definitely worth it!

29.description: Yummy! I love several things about this place. 1. You can sample every flavor if you'd like. 2. You can get 3 flavors in the small. 3. WEDDING CAKE FLAVOR! Delicious! I only gave 4 stars due to the price. It is a little expensive...but every now and then, it's worth it. Especially for the wedding cake flavor, yum!

42.description: I come here ALL the time. I havent tried all their flavors yet but ALL of them are very good. Personal favorites: Lavender vanilla Sea SaltTriple Vanilla This place is smaller than the other Paciugo places, so I think they have less choices. But it's a great place to go with a friend or two. I can eat a five flavor cup all by myself. They are amazing. :D

23.description: "12 Star Service"There are those places that get just get it -- customer service and Paciugo exceeded all expectations. I was trying to track down grape ice cream (yes, different, but I was still looking). I emailed and called a ton of places to no avail. I happened across Paciugo and I sent an email back in July about ice cream. Someone followed-up with me via email and said they do carry it from time to time but they do not have it.Low and behold late-September, someone follows up with me to tell me they had grape sorbet in. I told them I would not be able to make it until the following day. What did they say?! I'll put some away from you and here are our hours. OMG! Who does that anymore.. AWESOME!I arrive and give my name and yep.. they made a batch with me in mind and held it aside. The manager was super friendly. Told me about the options in which I could take it and how to prepare it before eating it. Such a grade A experience! I'll definitely be back and refer others. Worth every penny.

47.description: This is the most amazing Gelato I've had outside of Rome! First off I love that you can choose three different flavors for their "small size" which is a good amount for one person. I got the Hazelnut, the Amaretto, and the wildberry. Honestly the Hazelnut was my least favorite, BUT still amazing. The Amaretto and wildberry were exceptional! Open late at night and the flavors are abundant! YES YES YES if you're in Roscoe Village or in the area!

8.description: Came in here for dessert and it was awesome. The staff were so friendly and funny, and the gelato was delicious. Well priced too. You can choose up to five flavors in the large so it's a great variety. Pumpkin spice, Pistachio, and Birthday cake were my favorites.

31.description: Awesome staff. Mind blowing gelato!  Sea salt  carmel is AMAZING!  Also  try  their shakes, you won't be disappointed.

34.description: We had dinner on Armitage, so we went to local ice cream shop in Lincoln Park.  On the way home, my hubby asked me what was wrong... before I could answer, he said, "You wish we would have gotten gelato in Roscoe Village don't you?!"  YES!  So, we pulled over, I threw my ice cream in the trash and went to Paciugo!!  Seriously, if you're gonna do it, you just have to do the BEST.

16.description: A pretty solid place for gelato. We headed in around 8 or so on a Saturday, and there were only a couple people ahead of us. Not a long wait.I will say that they are very quick to offer generous samples. I ended up with 3 choices in a small cup for a little over $5. Flavor choices: Lemon, cake batter, and salted caramel.I would definitely head back, but maybe more of a treat instead of a regular occurrence.

13.description: Hooray for another Paciugo!I've always loved Paciugo. Their gelato is probably the best I've come across, and I really appreciate their unique and creative ingredients and combinations. Flavors are rotated on a daily basis, and include more basic options like French vanilla and dark chocolate and fruit sorbets, but also fun varieties like bananas flambé, chocolate jalapeño and blueberry lavender. It's all really good--and rich; a "piccolo" size (up to three flavors) is plenty enough to satisfy.The hardest part is trying to decide which flavors to get because they're all so compelling, but they let you try a sample to help you decide (or in my case, make it that much more difficult).The staff is super friendly and efficient and does their best to keep the line moving; not easy on a busy evening when the place is overrun with little ones and everyone's tripping over each other trying to get a gander at the favor selections.Parking in RV can be hit or miss, but that's also the case with their other city locations, so it's just a roll of the dice.I'm glad to see the Paciugo chain expanding, and I'd be one happy camper if they added a location in my 'hood.

11.description: I used to go to Paciugo pretty regularly...until a couple months ago.They started refusing to serve me a kids size (which is actually a normal portion and $3.50) and I had been eating the kids size pretty regularly for over a year.  Even when I explained I wanted the kids size but I'd pay the small size price (which is gigantic and $4.50) - the lady tried to insist I needed a small. I just don't understand why places do this - so instead of having me stop by 2x per week and pay $3.50 for a kids size you'd rather not have me come...oh well, it is healthier for me not to come at all.

39.description: The gelato here is not that good. I'm not comparing it to what's in Italy, but against non-chain "gelaterie" in the Chicago area.Paciugo is a nation-wide chain. You're eating manufactured bases with a lot of preservatives and artificial flavoring at these.I have been to this location (on a date, mind you. The girl wanted to go here...), and a tiny cup of just a few ounces of what Paciugo calls gelato puts you out of almost $5 after taxes. There are quite a few of independent gelato retailers in the Chicago area that are far more deserving of your patronage. Your taste buds will thank you.And don't let your kids play with the sticky Brio train set, either.

37.description: I've been here a couple of times now and can definitely say that I'm hooked!  Sad story though as I'm on a hiatus of eating the things I like.  Good news is that this isnt gonna be forever Paciugo, so don't you worry.The prices are good, the staff is very helpful and the product is delish!Don't be scared to ask for a sample of something if you aren't sure or are just curious.  I was able to try one that had black pepper and who knows what else and boy was I glad I only got the sample!  I'm sure it pleases someones tastes buds though but not this gals.

0.description: Every flavor I've ever gotten here has been amazing. They have a wedding cake flavor that makes me drool thinking about it. They have labels to show you which options have dairy and which are dairy-free.

38.description: Was it the best Gelato I've ever had? Was it as light and airy as I've come to expect from great gelato? No and no. But, that doesn't take away from the product they serve. The customer service was excellent, some of the best I've ever had, and the quality of the gelato was pretay pretay good...Enjoy Suckas'!!!

51.description: OK....let me start off by saying that I love gelato.  I was very excited to learn that Paciugo was moving in to the 'hood.  Hubby and I and our baby went right after it opened...and we have been going consistently ever since.  Tons of great flavors -- both of the fruit variety and the chocolate variety.  Lots of great combinations to be had.  I love that even in a small, you can get 3 flavors which makes for lots of fun new tastes.  As a chocolate lover, I have tried all of the varieties of chocolate -- including the extra dark chocolate (my personal fave), the chocolate cookies and milk (also delicious).  The salted caramel is really good and the s'mores flavor is out of this world.  The special flavors -- including those mixed with lavender and rose offer a terrific and refreshing alternative if you are looking for something that tastes a bit lighter.  The flavors are in somewhat of a rotation (although the stand-bys always seem to be available) which makes each new trip a new opportunity to experience a different flavor combination of gelato. The space is relatively small which sometimes makes it hard to get a table.  And I think my only gripe is that the service can be a little slow.  It's not the fault of the servers -- each gelato just takes a little longer to make and because they give samples out, it often takes people a long time to make up their minds.  Paciugo typically only has 1 or 2 people working behind the counter, so the lines can be a bit long.

27.description: I've been to three and I like this one the best -- don't know why but the gelato here tastes better even though the other two locations are closer to where I live.  I know they are all made fresh in the store and have the same recipes but the gelato at this one taste better.  Can't go wrong with the chocolate.

32.description: Overall I have mixed feelings about my experience at Paciugo. The gelato is definitely delicious. It ranks below Black Dog, but not too far behind. The negative I have is the service, which I wasn't expecting would be an issue. The atmosphere inside is clean and modern.I arrived here with my girlfriend and was greeted by the manager who served us. While we were trying to decide which flavors to order the manager rudely asked us to order soon. We weren't ready so we stepped back even though no one else was in line to order. Once we decided what to order the manager was unhappy since a line had formed just as we were ready. She said something under her breath along the lines of this is why I wanted you to order sooner. This type of service is not something that I would expect from this establishment, let alone the manager. I won't be returning here since this rude service left a sour taste in my mouth that overrode the tasty gelato.

54.description: Yum! I am a fan of this place. Paciugo has a number of great gelato flavors. Better yet, the servers had no problem letting us have as many tastes as we wanted (although I do wish the patrons in front of me noticed the line behind them and cut down to 5 vs 10!)  And even better yet, there is one soy flavor each day! So all you nondairy ice cream-loving eaters who are sick of fruity sorbets, this place is for you. On my visit, the soy flavor of the day was chocolate banana. YUM! Good thing this place is far away from me. Otherwise, I'd definitely be fat off of soy gelato.

48.description: Ran into this place while dining across the street. Had the berry mix and it was great.

44.description: You can't imagine how excited I was to find out that Chicago has three locations now! My first time at a Paciugo was at their Mall of America location. I asked if they had any other locations and I got an answer I did not like, "We're only located in Minnesota". Poop! Where else was I going to get my Gelato and blood orage sorbet fix? Well, that's all taken care of. My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this location after dinner down the street. It was close to closing time so it was dead. Chris was working and he was very nice and made us feel at ease when it came to asking for samples. He suggested I try the salted carmel gelato and I chose the red velvet. Let me tell you, there was a party in my mouth and tummy. It's kind of dangerous because all the paciugo locations are right by my favorite restuarants. How can I not stop by if I'm in the neighborhood?

24.description: What's there not to like? It's gelato. Great flavors. The staff is sweet and patient.

7.description: Paciugo is the best.  I would like to see this outfit take over every neighborhood in the city.  Or at least, every neighborhood on the north side in which I spend time.Chocolate hazelnut, cinnamon dulce de leche, toasted coconut, and triple vanilla...ah, superb.  The last few bites of melty agglomeration in the bottom of the cup was a little taste of heaven.Bonus:  if you visit during a 20-degree snowstorm, you will have the place to yourself and can take as much time to taste and decide as you like.

49.description: I may be biased because I make my own gelato at work, but this "gelato" they have all tastes like garbage.They have some alcohol based flavorings (tiramisu, rum raisin, etc) and you can tell because even their cookie dough tastes like alcohol.I tasted 5 flavors, and ended up with "classics": chocolate, coffee and cookie dough.chocolate was bittersweet and heavy, coffee tasted like it was made from burnt coffee, and cookie dough tasted like it was a rum soaked cookie.Real gelato should be creamy, and not overly sweet. This was icy.I walked from Damen (where the store is) and by Hamilton (a mere 2 blocks away), I had to throw it out because I couldn't stand the flavor anymore.Sorry, I've had real gelato, and this is far from it.

40.description: This place is crazy good. They are really nice about letting you try as many flavors as you want, and they will recommend their favorites if you look like a deer in the headlights like I did, unable to focus on anything because every single flavor was just calling my name. So I tried about 6 :).  The sea salt caramel was mind-blowing. I mean, I've had this flavor in many forms, be it as a caramel itself, a fancy hot chocolate, etc, but this was over the top. I actually ended up getting an Affogato, which is two scoops of gelato (I did panna cotta and one of their dark chocolates), with italian espresso poured over the top. You end up with a cooled down espresso and still fairly solid gelato to mix around in it. A perfect pick me up and indulgence at the same time!  I will definitely be back!!

53.description: YES!! This is a great addition to the neighborhood.  I love it!The selection of flavors is immense.  The prices are reasonable.  The taste is excellent!Go here.A small size gets you 3 flavors.  I thought it was the perfect size.  They are known for their salted caramel and it was delicious.  I also had the toasted coconut (a MUST for coconut lovers) and the mint.  GREAT for any time of day!

30.description: I have been in this location several times mainly for two reasons, one I live close by and I think their product is awesome. However the service I received recently was unacceptable. First, I thought sampling two maybe three flavors is OK but the girl last was not having it. Upon my third request to sample she let out a big exhale and said "sir if your going to keep sampling will you please keep your spoon? We don't recycle!" This caught the attention of the other customers and was completely awkward. The jar on the counter says "put here after sampling" it says nothing about recycle rules or limit of sampling flavors. So if I kept the spoon from the first sample how do I get another sample without receiving a new spoon? I think I will just stick with Black Dog from now on. Has a more family feel when it comes to service and the product is more than comparable.

46.description: Love.  Wish they had opened up a little earlier in the summer, but you can't have everything.  It's walking distance from my apartment and open til 10pm during the week.  It's essentially begging me to go there all the time.  They have some milk free options which is great.  I have thoroughly enjoyed most of the flavors I have tried.  Frutti Tutti and Irish Coffee being my two favorites.  However, I made the mistake of putting them in the same container.  Oopsy! The servers are super nice and the b/f and I love walking over there on a random week nights.  Thanks for coming to the Roscoe hood, we have been waiting for a place like this!   Oh, just a warning, it is hard to notice this place from the street as the trees are directly in front of the sign, but it's there nestled in between Kitcsh'n and Orange.

1.description: DELICIOUS, the 3 flavors size is enough unless you're binging.  The only downfall is no where to sit.  There's a really old toy bench with broken toys that smaller kids would be interested by for a few minutes - but if it's going to take up half of the small seating area, then lets get non-broken toys.

55.description: What? Where are all the glowing reviews for this place? First off, the people behind this chain are natives of Italy. So, needless to say- things are done the right way. A lot of the time, "gelato" done stateside is hardly gelato- it's plain ol' ice cream, nothing more.  This is gelato. FINALLY. There are lots of great flavor options here, from standard vanilla/chocolate/mint/strawberry to the more exotic : rose, banana rum raisin, and so much more. The good news is that you can try it all fairly easily. Just like in  gelaterias in Italy, you can order multiple flavors to go in one cup (up to 3 for the small, 4 for medium, and 5 for large). Yay! Yes, this does cost more than your standard ice cream fare, but you get what you pay for . So thrilled this place opened up nearby. Much needed. I'll definitely be back. A million times..for the panna cotta flavor alone!

9.description: Creamy and super delicious gelato. A good amount of flavors to choose from. They are on the pricer side, but it seems like gelato is expensive everywhere. I always pick this place over all of the ice cream shops in the area.

26.description: This place has very good gelato.  Service was friendly and tastes were offered with a smile.  Was it best gelato ever?  No.  However, most of their gelatos are made with whole milk and not cream so there is 70% less fat.  A 4 oz serving is 150 cal and 4.5 gm fat compared to Haagen-Dazs which has 274 cal and 17 gm fat (this info from Paciugo website).Tasty and not too bad for you.  Can't do much better than that.

25.description: A pretty solid place for gelato. We headed in around 8 or so on a Saturday, and there were only a couple people ahead of us. Not a long wait.I will say that they are very quick to offer generous samples. I ended up with 3 choices in a small cup for a little over $5. Flavor choices: Lemon, cake batter, and salted caramel.I would definitely head back, but maybe more of a treat instead of a regular occurrence.

12.description: We come here because my favorite gelato place is a bit further away.  It's ok- I like the amarona cherry but that's about all.  The flavors here just taste....generic.  As in they all taste the same somehow without that artisan flavor that many gelatos have.  I also think it's a little pricey.

21.description: Paciugo is the best.  I would like to see this outfit take over every neighborhood in the city.  Or at least, every neighborhood on the north side in which I spend time.Chocolate hazelnut, cinnamon dulce de leche, toasted coconut, and triple vanilla...ah, superb.  The last few bites of melty agglomeration in the bottom of the cup was a little taste of heaven.Bonus:  if you visit during a 20-degree snowstorm, you will have the place to yourself and can take as much time to taste and decide as you like.

17.description: Great gelato! And a small area for kids. It's a winner. Salted caramel, wild berry and mango passion fruit were all spot on. A small will be around $4.25 with tax but you get 3 flavors. I'm definitely coming back.Parking tip: free parking on Wolcott. It's residential but you shouldn't need a permit.

10.description: Stopped by Paciugo for dessert after having dinner across the street at Volo. My husband and I split a cup of pana cotta and vanilla. Both were pretty good. Service was friendly. We were the only ones there, so no wait. Would definitely recommend if you are in the area, but not somewhere you'd make a special trip.

5.description: The gelato here is good but nothing out of the extraordinary and for the same price I could get 3-4 scoops at Mariano's which comes out to way more. I got the salted caramel (my favorite one), strawberry kiwi (least favorite), and the black cherry swirl. Yes, it's a bit lighter compared to other gelato places but that doesn't mean too much since if I'm already going to eat dessert, who cares about the calories/fat content anyway.  Other noticeable points: they didn't seem to have that many interesting flavors on the day I went and a lot of the gelato bins seemed pretty empty and on the verge of running out which of course gave the impression that I was eating a bin that had been there for days. Also, the girl serving us definitely had her "don't give a F " face on.

3.description: While in Paciugo I asked my friend if gelato was more healthy than regular ice cream. Yes, that happened. He just shook his head. I meannnn...according to their website it does have less calories than ice cream! So there!Paciugo has a ton of cool flavors and from them I picked Cookies n Cream, Peppermint Chocolate Chip and Milk Chocolate. All were very creamy and delicious - loved them all. For a three flavor cup, it ran me $4.26. The shop was very clean, service was courteous and it was completely empty on a weeknight. The gelato is great so I'd definitely go back anytime I'm in the Roscoe Village hood.

35.description: Waffle cone with up to four different flavors of beautiful gelato?  Yes please!  I'll take two!  (Seriously, I could eat two.)We checked this place out on a warm sunny day after a chocolate craving struck me earlier in the day.  I was thinking chocolate from the moment the craving struck to the time of ordering and I must say, the cone was everything and more that I needed. I tried the bacio (chocolate with hazelnut), creme brulee, and the german chocolate (with coconut).  Awesome combo / cone / everything.  Looking forward to returning and trying more!  Cute little place too.

19.description: Waffle cone with up to four different flavors of beautiful gelato?  Yes please!  I'll take two!  (Seriously, I could eat two.)We checked this place out on a warm sunny day after a chocolate craving struck me earlier in the day.  I was thinking chocolate from the moment the craving struck to the time of ordering and I must say, the cone was everything and more that I needed. I tried the bacio (chocolate with hazelnut), creme brulee, and the german chocolate (with coconut).  Awesome combo / cone / everything.  Looking forward to returning and trying more!  Cute little place too.
