28.description: I LOVE this place. Every flavor of gelato I have tried is delicious. The fact that you can select multiple flavors is wonderful. I have been here several times now and have always experienced friendly service. The place itself is very clean and modern. My child loves playing with the train table they have set up. Yes on the pricey side, but this is Chicago, not Nowhereville, IL. You get what you pay for and I find it worth it. Awesome place!

45.description: Wasn't horrible - but I didn't finish a single scoop and probably won't be back.  It was like it was too warm and melty - and the flavor wasn't there.  I had great hopes and even brought some friends in from out of town, but we all left disappointed.  I thought Black Dog down the street was way better.

33.description: Hooray for another Paciugo!I've always loved Paciugo. Their gelato is probably the best I've come across, and I really appreciate their unique and creative ingredients and combinations. Flavors are rotated on a daily basis, and include more basic options like French vanilla and dark chocolate and fruit sorbets, but also fun varieties like bananas flambé, chocolate jalapeño and blueberry lavender. It's all really good--and rich; a "piccolo" size (up to three flavors) is plenty enough to satisfy.The hardest part is trying to decide which flavors to get because they're all so compelling, but they let you try a sample to help you decide (or in my case, make it that much more difficult).The staff is super friendly and efficient and does their best to keep the line moving; not easy on a busy evening when the place is overrun with little ones and everyone's tripping over each other trying to get a gander at the favor selections.Parking in RV can be hit or miss, but that's also the case with their other city locations, so it's just a roll of the dice.I'm glad to see the Paciugo chain expanding, and I'd be one happy camper if they added a location in my 'hood.

43.description: This place was GREAT! The ambiance was fun, the servers were very nice and the Gelato was Exceptional! I was stationed in Italy for 4 years when I served in the Navy and I hadn't tasted any Gelato since I left. I was afraid some how, some way it would taste commercialized.....you know, Iike Olive Garden. But, I went out on a limb and gave it a shot and I must say I was very impressed and will definitely be going back. :)

2.description: Yum yum yum. You can't go wrong with gelatos at any hour. Even if its -10 degrees, ain't nothing stopping me.

18.description: Went here on Sunday, first feel of spring in the air so off we went for some gelato! I love their ice cream. Reminds me of the real stuff in Italy!! My wife took a photo of hers and said it was like heaven in a cup! Pic says it all

41.description: Best gelato ever! Kinda a pricey though.

52.description: Skeptical about portion sizes & mixing 3 flavored together but paciugo rocks! They're mascot kind of reminds of the pink panther movies...

50.description: I love how you can choose 3 different flavors in their "small" size. It helps when you are indecisive about your choices.  You are probably indecisive because everything sounds and looks so yummy!  They do offer sample tastes, but I don't want to be the one that holds up the line because I'm tasting 20 different Gelato flavors (because they all looks so good and they're all made on site)  So best to go with a pal (or in my case, the hubs) so you can sample some of their flavors and not get any impatient glares. For me: Pistachio Almond and Salted Caramel. Creamy, cool and delicious. The Salted caramel was my fave--salty and sweet is always a winning combination.  I also got to try the Black Pepper (oddly refreshing with just a hint of pepper, I was pleasantly surprised that I liked it).  The Coffee was delicious, just like drinking a nice cuppa joe.  The Hazelnut was also really good.  Clean digs, friendly and upbeat service.  Nice spot.

4.description: It's rare I get gelato outside of Capogiro's in Philadelphia (I know I sound like a snob, but it WAS rated best gelato in the country by...somebody) because it never compares. But this... This is really good gelato. I got a medium so I could try 4 different flavors: Mango, Caramel Apple, Amaretto Creme Brulee, and Pistachio. All were delicious, especially the caramel apple. I couldn't stop eating it if I tried. Highly recommended.

6.description: This place offers super delicious gelato in a pretty cool place in Roscoe. The many flavors astonish me, and seemingly rotate often. I would suggest trying an affogato, which is like vanilla (or your choice) of gelato with expresso. It really hits the spot!I'm also a sucker for fruit gelatos, and along with Black Dog, Paciugo really hits the spot every time.I'll whine about the prices, but I can survive them, it just means I treat myself less!

22.description: Delish gelato, creative flavors that *work*, friendly, knowledgable staff, plenty of seating indoors and out.

15.description: "12 Star Service"There are those places that get just get it -- customer service and Paciugo exceeded all expectations. I was trying to track down grape ice cream (yes, different, but I was still looking). I emailed and called a ton of places to no avail. I happened across Paciugo and I sent an email back in July about ice cream. Someone followed-up with me via email and said they do carry it from time to time but they do not have it.Low and behold late-September, someone follows up with me to tell me they had grape sorbet in. I told them I would not be able to make it until the following day. What did they say?! I'll put some away from you and here are our hours. OMG! Who does that anymore.. AWESOME!I arrive and give my name and yep.. they made a batch with me in mind and held it aside. The manager was super friendly. Told me about the options in which I could take it and how to prepare it before eating it. Such a grade A experience! I'll definitely be back and refer others. Worth every penny.

57.description: My name is Mark, and I have a terrible Gelato addiction. Ever since my sister introduced me to the idea of Gelato as a "healthy dessert", I've been on a never-ending quest to find the perfect cup. With the recent opening of Paciugo in my neighborhood, I continued on my journey. Walked right in and the girl behind the counter greeted me nicely and asked me if there were any flavors that I would like to try.Some of the flavors that I saw were pretty basic, but included: Limoncello, Strawberry, Double Chocolate, and Orange Sorbet. Ended up getting a medium cup with four flavors: Sea Salt & Carmel, Chocolate Cookies & Milk, Roasted Banana and Baileys. Two of the flavors were on her recommendation and were very well received by me. Final verdict: Two enthusiastic thumbs up. The good thing about this place? It's steps away from my house. The bad thing? It's steps away from my house. This place will taunt me forever. Sigh.

20.description: I'm sorry in advance if this sounds snobby. I lived in Italy for a semester in college. So I've had my fair share of awesome gelato. Pacuigo can totally compete with some of the best gelato places in Italy. My favorite thing? How pacuigo tastes so fresh- especially the fruit gelatos. The staff are always nice and friendly and very helpful. But honestly and I can't believe I'm saying this, I think if the staff were not super friendly,I  would still go all the time. The gelato is that good!

36.description: With about 9 pounds worth of sushi in my stomach, my friends and I ventured over to Paciugo to make it an even 10 pounds with some creamy light-as-air gelato. The interior of the store is bright and open with a wide selection of different gelatos. Customer service was great - staff was friendly and gave us great suggestions because we were so overwhelmed with the flavors. I sampled a handful of the flavors before making my decision, but some of the standouts were:1. Pannacotta (wedding cake)2. Dulce de leche3. Pistachio  almond (my favorite)4. Pumpkin cheesecake5. Chocolate hazelnut (just like Nutella)You can get your gelato in a cup (3 sizes) or cone, but instead of choosing just one flavor, you can get up to three different kinds. I ended up choosing pannacotta, pistachio almond and pumpkin cheesecake. Each one was delicious and I was able to polish off my cone in a matter of minutes. This place isn't exactly cheap - my cone set me back about 5 bucks, but I believe the quality of the product justifies the price. I could really taste the ingredients in each flavor and it didn't reek of artificial flavorings. There's ample street parking in the area along with residential parking as well. Overall, it's worth a try at least once!

14.description: With about 9 pounds worth of sushi in my stomach, my friends and I ventured over to Paciugo to make it an even 10 pounds with some creamy light-as-air gelato. The interior of the store is bright and open with a wide selection of different gelatos. Customer service was great - staff was friendly and gave us great suggestions because we were so overwhelmed with the flavors. I sampled a handful of the flavors before making my decision, but some of the standouts were:1. Pannacotta (wedding cake)2. Dulce de leche3. Pistachio  almond (my favorite)4. Pumpkin cheesecake5. Chocolate hazelnut (just like Nutella)You can get your gelato in a cup (3 sizes) or cone, but instead of choosing just one flavor, you can get up to three different kinds. I ended up choosing pannacotta, pistachio almond and pumpkin cheesecake. Each one was delicious and I was able to polish off my cone in a matter of minutes. This place isn't exactly cheap - my cone set me back about 5 bucks, but I believe the quality of the product justifies the price. I could really taste the ingredients in each flavor and it didn't reek of artificial flavorings. There's ample street parking in the area along with residential parking as well. Overall, it's worth a try at least once!

58.description: Attention to detail. Just picked up my bike after a tune-up and it rides like new. First time I had work done there and will be a regular now. First time writing a review too - felt like these guys earned it.

56.description: It feels a little superfluous to add yet one more five star review for RVB, but I can't help myself. This is what all bike repair shops should be. I've been to the shop a few times to pick up tubes and other small accessories, and a few days I brought my beat-up, ridden-every-day-in-every-kind-of-weather trusty commuter in for a long overdue tune up. On every occasion they've had the accessory or part I've needed, and the guys behind the counter have been uniformly friendly, approachable, knowledgeable, and efficient.  Oh, and the prices? Fantastic. I was used to paying between $9 and $11 for a tube (yeah, I know) in DC. Here, tubes are a measly $6. Now, for the tune up. I brought my bike in two days ago with a substantial and unsettling wobble in the back wheel, frequent flats on the back tire, scraping brakes, messy, loud shifting, and a litany of other problems  that frankly, I hadn't thought about until they were no longer there. I braced myself, expecting to be told I needed a new wheel, or a $250 tune up (DC prices again...) that would take two weeks, so when they told me a tune up was $75 and I could have my baby back in TWO days, I was ecstatic. Sure enough, two days later I come back and find them just finishing up work on my bike.  Turns out I needed a new tire. They had two choices in stock - both reasonably priced and much nicer than what I had installed.I was thrilled, but not surprised, to learn that the bike techs are just as great as the people who've rung me up in the past. Absolutely not even a hint of snobbery or surliness from these lovely gentlemen.  While they were finishing up work, I asked them if it were possible to install a chain guard on my bike, should I ever get tired of wearing ripped up pants like a messy child. (Backstory - every other bike shop I've been to and a few internet forums have told me that since my bike as a front derailleur, I'm out of luck on this count.) The guys here said sure - they might have to order a part, but they could make something work. Wow. So to recap - I've got my bike back (riding like brand new) two days after I dropped it off. Total cost? $140 for a shockingly thorough tune-up, new tire, new brake pads, a few spare tubes, and an actual solution should I want to install a chain guard at some point.  Can't recommend these guys highly enough.

29.description: Anytime there is a problem with my bike this is the place I go! They always are so helpful and very knowledgeable about bikes! Everyone here is friendly and doesn't make me feel silly about knowing zilch about bikes! It's the best! I wouldn't go anywhere else!

42.description: Had a good experience getting a tube changed here today. I'm a new rider and hadn't had a flat before. They changed it up for me, explained what happened, and then told me everything I needed to know in order to install a new tube myself when this happens again. I felt like the $10 labor charge was a liiiittle much for a 4 minute service, but I didn't know how to do it myself and it was worth the money just for the education. Great experience, will be back again.

23.description: I am not  a biker but I wanted to get a pair of warm bike gloves for my boyfriend. I found what I wanted online and asked around bike shops in town. I was hoping to see different sizes to give a best guess at which fits him most, but no shop had it in stock. Alex at Roscoe Village Bikes was by far the best at responding and helping me out of all people I contacted. He ordered 3 different sizes just for me, and opened the door for me when I was a little too late to arrive before the closing time (thanks to CTA), and provided advice by trying them on to see which would fit him best. Great customer service, I will definitely come back next time I need bike gears.

47.description: Roscoe Village Bikes Rocks!  I live in Edgewater, but my office recently opened on Belmont and Damen, and Roscoe Village is now my go to shop. Knowledgeable staff abound at bike shops, but personable staff do not- and Roscoe Village has that in spades. I took my bike in for a tune up and it is basically working just like new! It is my main form of transport, and I was zooming around and couldn't wait to get to lake shore drive to let out the clutch. Go, and go often!

8.description: Super friendly bike shop, and helpful staff.  I was relocating from San Francisco to Chicago and decided to let Yelp lead me to the right shop to ship my bike to. I called a week before sending my delivery to confirm they were ready to receive, promising they would call the moment the bike arrived and when to have it ready for pickup. It was a 2-day turnaround from delivery date to pickup, and were really sweet to give me a map of Chicago bike routes, along with some pointers of scenic routes to check out on my free time. Thanks you guys for taking care of my baby!!!

31.description: To Roscoe Village Bike, my congratulations. You have achieved a perfect 5-star review in my book. If I really like a place, I give it 4 stars. Giving a 5 stars out is like saying, "If there is even 1% chance that I can go to this business, even if I must wade through alligator infested swamps and hike freezing tundras, I will go here."After being hit by a car, my bicycle was almost totaled. I took it to two other local shops for repair estimates before bringing it here. John was very helpful and gave me an inventoried and detailed estimate for the insurance. After conversing with the insurance, I brought it in for repairs. They were booked for two solid weeks! While some might see this as inconvenient, I think it's a testament to their awesome work!Exactly two weeks after I dropped my bike off, they called and said it was done. They even cut $45 off of my estimate!! Wow, thank you!! Everything looks fantastic and they gave me a 30 day guarantee if anything broke. Customer service: 5 starsBike knowledge: 5 starsPrices: 5 starsAttitude, ease of service, communication, etc: 5 starsHaving a dog in the shop: 6 stars

34.description: This place is awesome. The staff helped me with my first bike and accessories. I knew nothing about bikes and they took their time to break everything down for me. They sincerely like to help people. Their prices are competitive and the service is remarkable. This is definitely my go to place for Bike maintenance and fun. Feel free to drop in and just ask questions- no pressure to purchase or make unsure decisions.

16.description: We brought our bikes here for tune ups last year.  My wife and I have had our mountain bikes since high school and that's probably the last time they were ever tuned up (if ever?).  We got them back a few days later and they were much smoother and better to ride.  The service was really friendly and they let us know that we could bring them back if anything didn't feel right or something needed adjustment. We will definitely use Roscoe Village Bikes again and we'll check them out when we are ready for new bikes.

13.description: I came here after reading the reviews here on Yelp. I came looked inside the store due to the fact that they carry a helmet called Nutcase, also that I went on there site , and they have this section of the dealers (nutcasehelmets.com/helme… ). So some of the Nutcase Helmet's are sold here too. I came in to try on a Multi-Sport helmet I had a design in mind but I was told by the clerk that it didn't come in my size. I tried on a Large and Medium I also picked out the two designs . I paid for the multi sport bike helmet and waited for the one I ordered in the Medium size it came in. I was able to try it on again and the other one they had and made my choice. I was going to buy from Amazon but It's a wee bit higher. So I decided to order from Roscoe's.

11.description: Both of my tires were flat so I went in to fill them up & make sure there wasn't something wrong with them because they become flat pretty often. Paul helped me fill them up and reassured me that they were fine. He then went on to reposition my seat, tighten a few things that had loosened, and lubed the gears so that already my bike feels better. I was in and out within 5 minutes, didn't pay anything, and my bike is good as new. Great customer service & I will definitely be going back here when it's time for a tune up.

39.description: Very educated and super helpful staff! Great selection of bikes, bike accessories, clothing, bags, and much more! If Kyle is in, he's awesome!

37.description: Came here to purchase a new road bike. Was treated with respect and honesty by Paul, Jody, and Austin (Sorry if I misspelled your names, guys!). They answered my questions, made me feel comfortable, never talked down to me, and never pressured me. They did upsell me on a bike above my price range, but that was MY issue, because I started jonesing for the nicer bike once they let me try it - can't blame them for showing it to me. Highly recommend this shop to those who may be intimidated by hipster bike snobs.

0.description: Top notch! I have had tires installed, fenders installed, other repairs and tune ups, and have bought accessories such as lights. Highly recommend!

38.description: Great bike shop! Came in today with my new-used bike (from Kevin Thornton, a guy in the neighborhood with a great home-based used bike shop) for a lock and a helmet. The guys were incredibly helpful and kind, and even installed the kriptonite lock base on my bike for no extra charge. A great place for accessories and service!

51.description: For years I was an avid bike tourer and I serviced my own bike(s). Due to limited free time I've "outsourced" bike maintenance. Generally, I've had bad experiences with Chicago repair shops - most notably with On the Route Bikes on Lawrence which provided me with a belligerent staffer (bikes and bile!) and a sloppy maintenance job. I am giving RVB a 5-star rating after getting a deluxe tune-up on an older Trek 610. It was pricey at $120 but they delivered fully on their promise of a very thorough servicing. They kept to the same day deadline and let me know in advance that I'd be paying over $4 more for a new cable. The store has a great vibe (friendly, clean, orderly) as they are also open to answering any questions you may have about bikes. As mentioned in other reviews, this is a small store with a limited selection of new bikes with reliance on Jamis and BMC for road bikes.

27.description: Fantastic! That's all that needs to be said about Roscoe Village Bikes.I haven't had any repairs done on bike since I purchased it in 2012, however my bike was showing signs of wear from the numerous miles put into the bike. My chain was rusty, my handlebars were loose, and my brakes were faulty. So I bought it in, I mentioned the problems, and the gentlemen immediately repaired my chain and derailer at no cost! So then he had my brakes repaired (took a day) and tighten up all the loose screws around the bike (and I didn't even mention them!).My bike is running even better then the day I bought it! I'm now making it to places 5 times faster then the buses ever could.Great job! Will be back!

32.description: Wanted to add mine to all the 5-star reviews. AWEsome bike shop. Great service -everyone was really nice and helpful. They made my bike feel like new and fixed it up in the same day I brought it in! After I was so happy that I brought my partner's bike in and they made it run smooth and replaced the handle grips without charging me for any labor. Really impressed with this place. Best bike shop I've been to in Chicago. Prices were really reasonable. Labor on my bike was only $15. Thank you!!

54.description: Great customer service. I am an avid cyclist & I have shopped several bike shoppes. Roscoe Village Bikes is by far the best place to shop,  & not just for bikes. Dan G.

48.description: I bought a women's BMC race bike from Roscoes a little while ago. After riding it for a few days, I was feeling really uncomfortable. I thought maybe I had ordered the wrong size. I took it back in and the awesome guys at roscoes worked with me on getting the fit similar to my old bike. Best customer service bike shop I have ever dealt with! If you need a new bike, this is the place to go.

44.description: They practice the dark arts at this place.  That is the only explanation for how awesome it is.  I recently took my old, ironic hipster bike in for a tune up.  On a previous visit (for a new seat) they told me that I probably needed a tune up.  I promptly dismissed this as hooey. Like how the guy at the oil change place always tries to upsell you, to convince you that its time for a $800 belt job.  Well, then I tried the seat.  And found that having a decent (albeit more expensive) seat on my old, ironic hipster bike made a huge difference.  So that is what sold me on getting it in for a tune up.  The thing runs like silk, that is how smooth my bike is.  Turns out that when your bike is properly tuned up, you can actually move pretty easily on it.  LOVE THIS PLACE!  Highly recommend.  I have stopped trying to DIY stuff to my bike.  Honestly, they are so fast and so good, the money you spend to have them do something is a drop in the bucket to how much time I would have spent messing around with it.

24.description: Went here on a whim to see if they could fix my stroller that broke. Did not expect that not only did they take a look at it right away, they fixed it on the spot! Love the friendly staff and the FANTASTIC service.

7.description: Went there just for break adjustment and turns out I left with a new seat, hand bar and new break pads. The service is excellent, very honest and good quality. Nice atmosphere, you feel that you're in good hands and that they know what to do to fix a bike. Totally recommend it.

49.description: I brought my bike here for some fixing because the shop I usually take it to is closed on Wednesdays but I really needed my bike fixed since I use it to commute. Although it's not as close distance to me as the other one, I would most definitely bring my bike for repairs to Roscoe Village from now on. Really nice people, repaired my bike problem same day, only charged me for one thing and yet I noticed they fixed three other things and did not charge me for it, was quoted $22.50 on my ticket (I was actually ready to pay close to $100 because I thought the repair was going to be expensive), and when I came to pick up my bike after they called me to let me know it was ready, the girl at the register just said $20. When I saw my bike it looked like a brand new bike. I think they even cleaned it too. Once I started paddling it felt like I was riding a new bike. I am a very happy customer and will be back for any future bike repairs. This bike shop really knows how to take care of their customers!

40.description: I recently brought my daily commuter bike in for its pre-winter tune-up and could not be happier. Having just moved to the neighborhood, I had heard nice things about this shop but had no idea. Not only did the guys in the shop talk to me like an equal (something other bike shops should take note of) but they took the time to ask me about the bike, what sort of riding I'm doing, and how I'm planning on riding.When I got my bike back the next day I couldn't believe the difference. The bike is over 20 years old and feels like it's brand new. With no additional costs, they fixed a my rear rack and adjusted plenty of things that were not included in the price with no second thought.So pleased. Would recommend this shop to anyone and everyone.Thanks guys!

53.description: I just have to echo all the comments here.  I hadn't been in this great bike shop before...but a flat tire landed me in front of their shop last weekend.  i was late to an appointment - long story short, this fantastic staff had me up and running again in 15 minutes and I was on my way.  I'll definitely be back there soon.  Great shop!

30.description: If you love your bike as much as I do, you know it can be really difficult to find a good bike shop in Chicago. Sure, that may sound crazy for a big city... but do you know how many rip-offs are out there?! You've got to be careful! Roscoe Village Bikes is officially my go to spot for any repairs to my baby. For good reason: they're skilled, knowledgable, entertaining, quick, and inexpensive.To be honest with you, I had never been as pleased as I was then when I had visited RVB. It was one of the first weekends of warm weather and POP - I ran over glass that an idiot threw in the bike lane on Lincoln and desperately needed a new tube to make it home. I called up a few shops and was quoted anything from 17-25 for a new tube including labor and because it was so late my bike would most likely have to sit overnight (really though?). Well, after being cooped up during such a crappy winter, I had some riding to do on such a beautiful day. Siitting overnight was not an option and the CTA was not a very appealing alternative. RVB had the best price and was the closest to my unfortunate tire problem so I headed over with no expectations. When I arrived, I was promptly greeted by two guys at the front counter. They were extremely inviting and although the place was closing in about 30 mins or so and obviously busy, they took my bike in without any problem. In fact, they seemed happy I had chosen them. That was refreshing!Anyway, long story short they fixed my bike and even helped me pick out some cool lights for my bike. We had a really great conversation in the ten or so minutes it took for them to fix her up, too. Here's the best part: I was so excited my bike was back in action, I couldn't wait to take it outside for a test ride. Before I hopped on, I saw that their mechanic had tightened up a few bolts that were loose and went out of his way to even tighten up my lock-holder. WHOA. I was really surprised that someone took time out of their day to do something like that...for no reason.I know it probably didn't take him long or mean much to him, but that gesture meant a lot to me. That kind of genuine customer service is hard to come by these days and as long as I'm in Chicago, I'll find it very difficult to go anywhere else for my biking needs. Thanks Roscoe Village Bikes!

46.description: Very friendly shop!  I don't think their tune ups are inexpensive, but they did do a lovely job fixing my bike up like new (and cleaning it - yay!).  I was also thrilled to finally have caps on my air valves again.  Super friendly and my bike was done early!  Also, a really cute little shop (free air, too!).

1.description: Great little place in the heart of Roscoe Village. Reasonable, great service!Satya

55.description: Great customer service, quality bikes, reasonable prices & overall great shop.  I just bought my girlfriend a bike from Roscoe Village Bikes.  I visited 4 other shops prior to my purchase & was dissatisfied with each of them.

9.description: Took my bike for an annual tune up.  At first I was afraid I would over pay.  Not the case these guys do a solid job and provide real value.The replaced a bent fork. New wheels and tires all for a reasonable price.Great place to get your bike fixed.

26.description: We brought our bikes here for tune ups last year.  My wife and I have had our mountain bikes since high school and that's probably the last time they were ever tuned up (if ever?).  We got them back a few days later and they were much smoother and better to ride.  The service was really friendly and they let us know that we could bring them back if anything didn't feel right or something needed adjustment. We will definitely use Roscoe Village Bikes again and we'll check them out when we are ready for new bikes.

25.description: This place is nothing but the best.  So helpful and fast! I had a bunch of stuff stolen off my bike and they helped me pick out all the new stuff I needed without trying to sell me only the expensive options.  They informed me on stuff too like filling my tires up once a week is a good idea- i just waited until they were visually low to fill them up.  They are very knowledgable and when my bike was making a weird noise they checked it out, oiled her up and sent me on my way free of charge which was just nice because they could've made something up and charged me but were just genuinely happy to help another biker. Cool people there too and I've met some fun other customers while there.  I love roscoe village. GO TO THIS BIKE SHOP ALWAYS.

12.description: This place is super :) the people are friendly, nice, and knowledgable!! They fixed my stuck chain within 30 min of walking in and suggested some improvements to make the bike better :) not pushy or forceful at all. Love them!

59.description: RVB rocks! They do great quality work and the turnaround is fast. They are super friendly, and their prices are reasonable. Recently they salvaged a frame of mine with a very bent dropout, which seemed like a tricky job. They also built a wheel for me that has about 500 miles on it so far without ever needing a true.They are a great shop, and I am one damn picky customer when it comes to bike shops. I woud trust them with any job.

21.description: This is an awesome store for any level of cycling.  My wife and I got our BMC road bikes here and are thrilled with them.   The post purchase tune-ups were key.  New cyclist or people looking for something to spin around town are always in there and the staff has always treated everyone great.

17.description: If you love your bike as much as I do, you know it can be really difficult to find a good bike shop in Chicago. Sure, that may sound crazy for a big city... but do you know how many rip-offs are out there?! You've got to be careful! Roscoe Village Bikes is officially my go to spot for any repairs to my baby. For good reason: they're skilled, knowledgable, entertaining, quick, and inexpensive.To be honest with you, I had never been as pleased as I was then when I had visited RVB. It was one of the first weekends of warm weather and POP - I ran over glass that an idiot threw in the bike lane on Lincoln and desperately needed a new tube to make it home. I called up a few shops and was quoted anything from 17-25 for a new tube including labor and because it was so late my bike would most likely have to sit overnight (really though?). Well, after being cooped up during such a crappy winter, I had some riding to do on such a beautiful day. Siitting overnight was not an option and the CTA was not a very appealing alternative. RVB had the best price and was the closest to my unfortunate tire problem so I headed over with no expectations. When I arrived, I was promptly greeted by two guys at the front counter. They were extremely inviting and although the place was closing in about 30 mins or so and obviously busy, they took my bike in without any problem. In fact, they seemed happy I had chosen them. That was refreshing!Anyway, long story short they fixed my bike and even helped me pick out some cool lights for my bike. We had a really great conversation in the ten or so minutes it took for them to fix her up, too. Here's the best part: I was so excited my bike was back in action, I couldn't wait to take it outside for a test ride. Before I hopped on, I saw that their mechanic had tightened up a few bolts that were loose and went out of his way to even tighten up my lock-holder. WHOA. I was really surprised that someone took time out of their day to do something like that...for no reason.I know it probably didn't take him long or mean much to him, but that gesture meant a lot to me. That kind of genuine customer service is hard to come by these days and as long as I'm in Chicago, I'll find it very difficult to go anywhere else for my biking needs. Thanks Roscoe Village Bikes!

10.description: I. Love. This. Shop. I love to shop around and this was no different in April when I needed to find a new bike for a long ride I'm doing this summer of 2013. The staff was extremely knowledgable, friendly and non pressuring. They really stand out from the other shops I went to and they have won me over as a customer for the rest of my time in Chicago.

5.description: Best bike shop in the city! Great service, great prices & extremely friendly service.

3.description: After almost 30 years with the same saddle it was time to upgrade. Oh boy, I should have not waited as long as I did. Popped in to Roscoe Village Bike Shop on the recommendation of a friend, what a great shop. Place was hopping on a nice weekend day but the staff had it all under control. I knew what I wanted so I cannot speak to the depth of their inventory but they carried what we needed and got us out in no time at all.

35.description: Great Customer Service!

19.description: To Roscoe Village Bike, my congratulations. You have achieved a perfect 5-star review in my book. If I really like a place, I give it 4 stars. Giving a 5 stars out is like saying, "If there is even 1% chance that I can go to this business, even if I must wade through alligator infested swamps and hike freezing tundras, I will go here."After being hit by a car, my bicycle was almost totaled. I took it to two other local shops for repair estimates before bringing it here. John was very helpful and gave me an inventoried and detailed estimate for the insurance. After conversing with the insurance, I brought it in for repairs. They were booked for two solid weeks! While some might see this as inconvenient, I think it's a testament to their awesome work!Exactly two weeks after I dropped my bike off, they called and said it was done. They even cut $45 off of my estimate!! Wow, thank you!! Everything looks fantastic and they gave me a 30 day guarantee if anything broke. Customer service: 5 starsBike knowledge: 5 starsPrices: 5 starsAttitude, ease of service, communication, etc: 5 starsHaving a dog in the shop: 6 stars

28.description: Great service and always really fast.  Everyone working here is very knowledgeable and friendly.  I purchased a great bike from them, and have had a lot of work done to my old bike, and every experience has been pleasant.  As long as I'm working or living anywhere near them, I will go to them for all of my bike needs.

45.description: As most other reviews mentioned these guys were really friendly and honest.  They didn't try to sell me anything I didn't need.  They fixed a flat in under 15 minutes.  I will definitely bring my bike back if I have any issues.  They even fixed my basket that I attempted to put on by myself.  Thanks guys!

33.description: I can't say enough good things about Roscoe Village Bikes. I bought my bike here 6 years ago and have received great care ever since. I took my bike in today because the gears were clicking and it turned out that my son had managed to bend both the derailleur and the derailleur hanger when he borrowed it. No worries, though, as RVB fixed it in less than an hour for only $15. These guys are fantastic.

43.description: I love this place to teeny tiny pieces.  I've brought my bike in twice -- once because it had blown a tire, and once because the seat and seat post got stolen off of it from my building's bike room.  Not only have the staff always been friendly, knowledgeable, and professional, but also they expressed sympathy for my plight in the latter case both when I called  to ask what to do and when I subsequently brought the bike in (read: they are all genuinely nice people).  They quoted me the price over the phone ahead of time as well as again, before starting the work, and they also don't try to foist unnecessary work or products upon their customers -- which I greatly appreciate as a non-expert in cycling who might easily be convinced she needs fun new bike toys.  They already had seat posts of various sizes in stock, so they just put one on ($20) and installed the seat I selected from inside the store ($35).  What's more, they filled my tires, greased the gear chain, and cut down the post to the right size at no extra cost -- everything was done in 20 minutes.  All in all a consistently great experience and I can't recommend it highly enough.  Also, Buddy (pup mascot and official greeter) is adorable.

2.description: I'm new to biking, and they were very thorough when helping me find a bike and the equipment to go with it.  I have stopped by there several times with questions about the bike and equipment and they have always been very patient with me.  I've been happy with my service.

18.description: I've gone back for two tune-ups since: one to screw my seat into place, and another to do a safety check after a car hit me. Both were free of charge and happily and quickly executed. Couldn't be happier that I chose this as my bike shop.

41.description: Couldn't be happier with the service! Very knowledgable staff, and when I had an awkward return situation their immediate response was "No matter what, we'll make it work." Can't ask for more than that!

52.description: This is probably the best place to get your bicycle fixed in the city.  They've always been very friendly, honest and quick.  They also have been very forthcoming when answering questions.  I've had so many flats last year that I got tired of doing it myself (the tire is so hard to get off the rim), so I had them do it for me.  They ended up putting kelver between the tube and tire, to prevent some of the flats that might occur going through Chicago streets.

50.description: I was a total bicycle amateur last summer when I bought a new bike at RVB. They were super friendly, answered my (probably dumb) questions with no condescension or attitude, and helped me find the perfect bike. The price seemed great for what I got, based on some web research and compared to other shops. A huge selling point is that they offer a free maintenance package on new bikes: a 100-mile check over, a 250-mile check over, and then two fall tuneups. Four for free! When I took it in for the 100-mile check over last fall, they finished in an hour and even showed me a few things about the bike computer I'd added.It's a year later, and I still love the bike (it's a KHS Urban Xpress). It's perfect for cruising around the city or the Lakefront Bike Path, or even all 30 miles of Bike the Drive! I've gone back a few times with other questions about my bike, and both because they recognize the bike as one purchased from them, and because they're always super friendly and willing to help, they always make time to answer.Also, free air!

4.description: I seriously can't say enough great things about the staff. I was very intimidated upon entering, but everyone was so friendly and really helped me with my needs. Nothing was pushed on me and I never once felt as if I was being taken for a ride (pun intended).   I got to test ride a Jamis commuter 2.0 and ended up going with that. I highly recommend them for cycling needs.

6.description: 5 stars for friendly staff and service.  Though they have a really small inventory and couldn't get the bike I wanted in the store in a timely manner I still appreciate the good service and accessories selection.  I will continue to bring my bike here for service needs in the future.

22.description: Super helpful and didn't make fun of me too much when I asked them where the kickstand was on my newly purchased Jamis.  Popped in a few times with questions, and they were promptly and kindly addressed.

15.description: Got a flat tire on the way to the Cubs game on Tuesday near Roscoe Village Bikes, called them asked them if they had a guy available at the moment and they did. Fixed it real fast and I still made it to the game before the first pitch of game 4. Thanks again guys, definitely recommend this shop.

57.description: Great place. Helpful and knowledgeable staff, and they don't try to push anything on you that you don't need or want. Tune-up are very thorough and although they can get REALLY busy in the spring, they keep they're promised appointment dates for them and will usually have your bike back to you before the estimated time. Fair prices for a stand-alone neighborhood business. The store is a little cramped but the charm it has makes up for it.

20.description: I get my bike tuned up here about once a year.  The service is always awesome and the staff is always friendly and helpful.  I have bought many accessories and parts for my bike here and if I were in the market for a new bike, this would be the first and only place I would shop.  Best bike shop in the city.  Period.  Thanks for all of your help and for helping me take such good care of my bike!

36.description: I have a bike that is over 10 years old. I decided it was time to replace the old bicycle and started researching several bike shops in the heart of the city. I ventured from the south side to the north side and explored several bike shops. The assortment of bikes here was awe-inspiring, and the colors, price-point and brands were (are) spectacular. I asked lots of questions, and received intelligent answers from the employees at the Roscoe Village bike shop. I was impressed with their knowledge/expertise. One of the issues that I was struggling with was finding the right bike for my height. I am only 5 ft 1 in, so finding a bike that fits my height was very, very challenging. I had a budget of what I wanted to spend (under $200 but over $130). I appreciated that they allowed me to 'test' ride the bike before making my final purchase. With Summer around the corner, I wanted to get back into riding a bike on a regular basis. I figured I run five or six days a week -- I am not a fitness fanatic, but I do like staying healthy. I thought why not continue to do so by riding a bike regularly. Instead of getting into my car, I am now planning to ride my bike around the city. I'm looking forward to using my car less during the summer months. However, I purchased my bike here, not because of all of these things, but it was their customer service that clinched it for me and made me "close" the deal. I'm happy with my bike, and I am even happier that I was able to stay within my budget (:  Sweet!  I highly recommend them for anyone who may be seeking to buy a bike. The employees are very smart, knowledgeable, helpful and will answer all of your questions. They never made me feel like I was asking a dumb question. I felt respected. I never felt pressured to buy my bike here. My husband has a vintage bike that is 30 years old. He gets his bike tuned up every year and it is in fantastic condition. I keep telling him to replace his bike. When he decides to part with his "vintage" bike this will be the place that we will go to for sure! If you are in the market for a new bike this is a place you should consider.

14.description: These guys are great. Very knowledgeable and really helped me find the best bike for me.  Most bikes are too tall for me since I'm really short, but they knew immediately how to address my needs.  Now I have a bicycle I truly love.  This is definitely a go-to place for finding a bicycle.

1.description: Maybe he was just having a bad day?Refer to my Yelp review about Emmet @ Salon de Vive

2.description: I have never felt so comfortable with a hair stylest.  I know he will veto any bad decision I may make and the whole experience is relaxing.

0.description: Go no where else for new hair color, hair style and eyebrows. My hair has been touched only by Emmett for several years and I am very satisfied. Also, has done my makeup a few times. He's honest with you and if the color doesn't look good or you don't feel good call him and he'll fix it. Ask for a free consultation, he's located inside Salon de Vive

3.description: I like Great Clips.  They're your average, run-of-the-mill haircut go-to when you don't want to spend $70 on a trim at a salon.  They accept Bellycard, which, upon checking in, makes the $15 cut even cheaper!  Score.The cuts aren't bad.  They've cut my hair a few times, and knew what to do with my layers.  (I have finicky hair.)  They cut my fiance's hair regularly, and he always looks good.  No complaints.  No waiting. No fuss.  I like it!

1.description: I go here to get pampered.  They do a real nice job and even listen.  They are the place to go if you have male pattern baldness like me or always get a one on the side and a two on top.  Nice people dumb strip mall.

2.description: Quickest, most hassle free and pleasant hair cut ever. Busy mom can't beat this, plus $15 is a deal. Online checkin told me there was no wait. Very clean shop as well. Thanks GC!

0.description: Very good place to get a haircut with friendly staff. Unfortunately this place is now closed because it had a small parking lot in the strip mall and didn't get a ton of business

4.description: Yep they did it again. I went to see Jene and Toi. Jene did my hair while Toi worked on my daughter Isabella's hair. I love this location, I swear this place is awesome. These ladies are so precise and courteous. Isabella had 3 inches cut off and Toi put 2 beautiful french braids in her hair after she was done. To all my parents out there, this is an awesome place to take the kids for a cut. Its inexpensive and they do a wonderful job! I highly recommend both this location as well as the 2 stylists!

3.description: I am giving them five stars based on my one treatment; my guess is they'd be great across all of them.  I did the sola sauna.  You lay on a massage table and they put a tunnel-like device over you.  They describe it as infrared wavelengths that warm you up.  You definitely get warm in the 'tunnel'.  It feels different than just being in a dry sauna (like the wood rooms).  I recommend drinking a good amount of water the day leading up to your treatment.  About half way through the 40 minute session, the wonderful aestatician Monica gave a wonderfully relaxing facial.  They have a beautiful shower to use after your treatment (because you sweat).  This is great now, but I can already picture some sessions in the winter!

1.description: DeLuxe MedSpa is new to the Roscoe Village neighborhood and what a great addition. I have had two amazing facials so far including their Pumpkin Facial that is on special through November -- I thought it was a great value. My skin has never looked better! Their decor is lovely and Monika is incredibly knowledgeable! I also love their Lira product line. I will definitely go back!

2.description: Had a great first visit last week. Monika is super sweet and nice to talk with. I tried the Sola sauna which was really relaxing, and Monika gave an awesome face massage the entire time. Will definitely be going back to try other services!

0.description: Very nice interior design, stuff is helpful and professional - Monica helped me with choosing my first package for hair removal. Already had 2 procedures and I can see huuuuuge difference. I tried before some other place and after 6 procedures I still have hair regrown. After first treatment at Deluxe my hair started growing back after 2months!!!!!!!! Just had second one - we will see how it goes now. They are using brand new laser machine which is great. I can highly recommend this place - i will be coming back here.

28.description: I had a torta.I've had better.The meat is really fatty

1.description: I really like when a place says they close at 1 am but push you out the door at 12:35. I even called before we came to eat! And the employee kept STARING at us too till we left. Not to mention I ordered two burrito DINNERS and he decided to only make the burritos, no rice or beans. This place appears to have gone downhill since apparently they got new owners. I'm just so disappointed because I love Mexican food and this place is so close to my house! :(One star cos the food is good. And even then the chips are way salty. I'll take the bus to Arturo's down the street on Western if I want Mexican from now on.

39.description: I like the tacos!

9.description: My boyfriend and I went here last week and ended up getting food poisoning. I had a steak torta sandwich,which had no flavor or seasoning. My boyfriend had a chicken burrito which he did not like either. We both were very sick the next few days. Also there was two younger males working, who were not very friendly. The only plus side about this place is their rice water.

29.description: It was a beautiful Sunday morning. I was driving home, while sporting a Bourbon hangover and I was hankering for some Mexican food. I spotted what I was looking for in a small strip mall near Lane Tech High School. I thought to myself, "What a better way to enjoy my Sunday football Activities than with some Carne Asada and Chorizo. The Famous Taco and Burrito is just what you would expect for a Mexican eatery located in a Strip mall. It's a total hole in the wall. This is a no frills Eatery that's all about the food. I left the Famous Taco, Burrito with my bag of delight and headed home to watch some football. My timing could not have been better. I got home just in time for the start of Fox NFL Sunday. I sat down with my bag of Mexican Goodies and watched Howie, Terry and Jimmy Johnson breakdown Sunday's Grid Iron battles. As I opened the bag the smells from my Steak Burrito and a Chorizo Taco filled my nose with delight. The Steak was beautifully marinated and delicious. My only complaint about the Burrito is that they put way too much sour cream in it. Other than that, it was top notch. The Chorizo taco was delicious. The greasy sausage was just what I needed to neutralize the Bourbon in my system from the night before. My impromptu Mexican lunch was awesome. Not even the sight of Jimmy Johnson's, Steroid hair could ruin it for me. The food even stayed in my stomach after the Bears played like a one legged man in an ass kicking contest against the Cardinals. The bottom line is that the Famous Taco and Burrito sated my hunger at a time where I desperately needed it. It's great food and a tasty price. I will definitely be back.

23.description: OF COURSE YOU'VE HAD BETTER MEXICAN FOOD.  This placed is called The Famous Taco Burrito NUMBER TWO.   They are at most the second best burrito joint.  I eat here on what I think of as a regular basis (maybe once every 24 days)  That was an arbitrary number.  Hmmm, let me put it another way, the take-outtie restaurants near me are: Subway, Big Boy Gyros, Popeyes, Hero's Sandwich Shop, Tasty House, and Jimmy Johns.I eat at TFTB#2 the most.  I know I know, you're thinking about how I could pass up so many sub joints.  The truth is that I spread out my sub-scarfing over 4 or 32 places, so that means that my sub-ingesting-per-restaurant rate is much lower than my burrito-ingesting-per-restaurant rate.Also, I just had Tasty House for the first time.  I'll go there more often.Okay, back on track...The tacos are DELICIOUS.  Get the carne asada or ground beef or the slightly healthier and subsequently more bland chicken tacos, always (ALWAYS MF'ER!) say "yes, please sir. One or two or ten extra won't hurt, sir." when they ask if you want hot sauce on the side.  They add a lot of sour cream and cheese on everything I've had.  Like I said, once every 24 days.I get the taco salad quite a bit.  I know, it's a delusional thing to get at a place like this.  If they say ignorance is bliss, what is it when you aren't ignorant and still in bliss?They put nacho cheese on the taco salad.  Bad.  Tell them, "Hey ese, I no want none of that processed shit on my pile of meat and rice sparsely populated with iceberg lettuce."  And when they look at you funny, you can tell them that Eric said it's okay to call them "ese".CHEEERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRS!

5.description: Wanted to like this place as I pass it all the time. Good food. Employees are bad. Don't waste your time. Go to taco burrito palace number 2 on halsted.

31.description: I live in NYC now, but I lived in Chicago for awhile and still come back to Chicago on a regular basis.  Two things always get me when I arrive in Chicago - people are generally bigger here and it's hard to find a restaurant open at 11 pm during the week (well at least in the Lincoln Square/Ravenswood area).  Yeah, diners and stuff like that are open, but no late night Thai and the such.  So this gives you some background as to why I'm eating here.I ordered a beef burrito and my GF had some chicken tacos.  My carne asada was really salty and the salsa didn't really add much to it.  However, the "king size" is quite large and it filled my empty stomach.  My GF's chicken tacos were incredibly bland - it was almost a vacuum of taste.  I'm sure they have some good things on the menu, but the chicken taco and the carne asada burrito were not it.

25.description: This is the type of place you want to like, hole in the wall, no one speaks English and sells coke by the can (not to mention the pleasant aroma of mexican food being cooked on an open grill). Unfortunately this place disappoints, not that its really that bad; just very very mediocre. The meat has very little flavor, and falls very flat. The rice is also pretty flavorless. Overall this place was pretty disappointing, though I did have this drunk one time because it was almost the only thing open and shocking it tasted much better. However, my other experiences haven't been very good. On a good note the portions are huge and prices are cheap. The staff has always been extremely friendly. I'd avoid this place unless like me this is the only thing open within walking distance after you've had a few.

12.description: Looking for late night eats to soak up some of that alcohol you've been guzzling?  Enchiladas, rice, and beans should help!  I ate my leftovers the next morning and even thought they were pretty good then, great guacamole and yummy Horchata too!

37.description: Good eats, for cheap prices, I can't  say that this is not the best place to eat mexican food but for the price it isn't bad. There is sacrifice of some quality and that's probably one reason you won't see me here on a regular basis.  two people can eat her for well under 10 bucks a person. Downer is that you have to pay for refills. Not much 25cents, for pop and 50cents for tamarind/horchata. More then likely due to the fact that Lane Tech is right by and they probably get a lot kids coming in.

21.description: once upon a time i thought i loved this place. but now i see it must have been due to being both drunk and starving each time i ate from here. i mean, everything is good, but nothing is great. i think some items are a bit overpriced for the quality, and you can't trust the menu above the counter- according to this my chicken quesadilla should have been $4, but it rang up $6.95. i often judge a mexican place by their salsa. if i love the salsa, i'll love the place. the salsa here is like ketchup. :(

16.description: I had a torta.I've had better.The meat is really fatty

17.description: OF COURSE YOU'VE HAD BETTER MEXICAN FOOD.  This placed is called The Famous Taco Burrito NUMBER TWO.   They are at most the second best burrito joint.  I eat here on what I think of as a regular basis (maybe once every 24 days)  That was an arbitrary number.  Hmmm, let me put it another way, the take-outtie restaurants near me are: Subway, Big Boy Gyros, Popeyes, Hero's Sandwich Shop, Tasty House, and Jimmy Johns.I eat at TFTB#2 the most.  I know I know, you're thinking about how I could pass up so many sub joints.  The truth is that I spread out my sub-scarfing over 4 or 32 places, so that means that my sub-ingesting-per-restaurant rate is much lower than my burrito-ingesting-per-restaurant rate.Also, I just had Tasty House for the first time.  I'll go there more often.Okay, back on track...The tacos are DELICIOUS.  Get the carne asada or ground beef or the slightly healthier and subsequently more bland chicken tacos, always (ALWAYS MF'ER!) say "yes, please sir. One or two or ten extra won't hurt, sir." when they ask if you want hot sauce on the side.  They add a lot of sour cream and cheese on everything I've had.  Like I said, once every 24 days.I get the taco salad quite a bit.  I know, it's a delusional thing to get at a place like this.  If they say ignorance is bliss, what is it when you aren't ignorant and still in bliss?They put nacho cheese on the taco salad.  Bad.  Tell them, "Hey ese, I no want none of that processed shit on my pile of meat and rice sparsely populated with iceberg lettuce."  And when they look at you funny, you can tell them that Eric said it's okay to call them "ese".CHEEERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRS!

10.description: I don't understand why some places insist on grilling their burritos until the tortilla tastes like char coal. Unfortunately, this place is one of them. Fillings were bland. The carne asada has no flavor, and is fatty and gristly. Pass on the guacamole too, go with a sack of pork tacos.

11.description: Not only the worse Mexican food I've ever had, it was the worse food I've ever had anyway in 35 years.  They should be embarrassed.  I am.

26.description: I have yet to venture into the world of "internet dating", but if I did, my profile would read something like this..."Short brunette seeking independent and kind hearted guy...to share torta with."These tortas (I choose avocado or pork) are humongous! While I am unfortunately perfectly capable of finishing an entire sandwich on my own, it would be much better for my health and figure if I only ate half of it. The huge portion of fries are just o.k. and of course much better covered in orange cheese product.  All of this and a can of Squirt (AWESOME) for around seven bucks!

27.description: AHHH!! Thank you for being so awesome, you Mexican Taco Kings!!! I used to live about 100ft away from this place and I'm pretty bummed that I'm a little further than I like to walk in the cold now. :( I used to come in all the time and get a veggie burrito and have them add the extra veggies, but a few visits ago the really nice guy behind the counter suggested I start ordering the California burrito, vegetarian style and cut out a little of the extra hassle in ordering my extra veggies. Awesome!! The burritos already come with rice in them, so I don't need to order a side and the best part is:THEY ARE MASTER BURRITO WRAPPERS!!! Nothing is ever falling out, or coming loose and they never get soggy and gross and they are HUGE!! I mean, like the size of bricks. I usually take some to go and can get 3 meals from one burrito. And the prices, for the amount of food you get, are AWESOME!! I love this place!

35.description: i think this is one of the best taco places around! - it's fast, cheap, and of course it's open very late! a great go-to place when you have that mexican-food craving!

8.description: A good, no frills and very fast Mexican restaurant in Roscoe Village! Succulent and flavorful Al Pastor pork complements tender seasoned rice and slow simmered beans in their Tacos Al Pastor Platter. Delicious whether it is at 2pm or even at 2am. Want quick and good Mexican? Then swing by Famous Taco Burrito Kings, but then again they are already "famous" so you probably already know all of this...

0.description: Great value!Food was good for a snack and way better than stopping at Taco BellTortillas out of a pre made pack but again great for the price for a late night snackBring cash if you expect to spend less than $10The king size pork burrito was plenty for my wife and I to split and included orchata for $7.50

38.description: Yes, it takes awhile to communicate with the waitress, and yes, it was strange that she went to vacuum out her car after taking our order, but let's focus on what's important: you get an ass ton of good food for a very little amount of money. And if you're in the mood to rape your internal system with all that is greasy and good, get the chorizo burrito. Your taste buds will thank you when the toasted tortilla filled with fresh cold lettuce and pipping hot greasy ground up sausage passes through your hungry mouth.Two extra bonuses for your dining pleasure:1. A lot of guacamole for your order.2. Lovely "paintings" of big busted women in compromising situations on the walls.

20.description: Im from southern California, so I was skeptical about mexican fast food in Chicago, It was awesome! took me by surprise for sure.. great spot, and open 24hrs

19.description: I got steak quesadillas and a chicken quesadilla here. Both completely lacked any semblance of flavor and both felt like I was chewing rubber. It may be a hole-in-the-wall restaurant and I'm not expecting 4-star food or anything. I just want something with flavor.There's a place on Addison and Lincoln with much better food for basically the same price. I wish I knew the name of the place, cause I would easily suggest going there over this place, any day.

33.description: Went toay and it was pretty good.  I'll say this, it's cheap and the portions are plentiful.  Steak taco was tasty but over-sour creamed.  Meat was okay, not great.  Chicken taco was okay, but my complaint here is that the chiken was shredded and very underseasoned.  Not a bad call for quick Mexican but there are much better places.  And yes, the smell of cleansing solution permeates the place, whih makes dining in somewhat unpleasant.

2.description: Dry tamales, watery horchata and  smelly - fatty steak tostadas. We left more than half of our food on the table and ended up eating  at the subway next door. Fountain soda machine all  dispensers out of service plus the front guy has a unpleasant attitude.

34.description: So I like burritos with rice in them.  Big deal, want to fight about it?  A vegetarian burrito from this place has rice in it and is rather inexpensive ($3ish).  Thumbs up.

32.description: Good cheap eats...The Veggie Burrito and Cheese Quesadilla dinners are solid citizens.  The guacamole is Yummy and a great bargain.  The green sauce is great.  The guys working at the Western/Addison location serve it up super fast and with a smile.

18.description: I just posted a review for El Burrito Mexicano on W Addison, and since we ate at these places on back-to-back days (Yes, we've  had a mighty burrito fix lately), I'll compare.I'd probably go to The Famous Taco Burrito over El Burrito Mexicano, just because the menu seemed bigger, the place seemed a bit cheerier, and because the guys working at The Famous Taco Burrito made something not on the menu that my wife wanted: cheese enchiladas. Not to say that the guys at the other place wouldn't have--we didn't ask--but I think the food is slightly better at TFTB, too. Slightly. This is another solid place to get authentic grilled Mexican food that will fill you up. Everything we got was good and I'm sure we'll go back (free parking right out front!).

13.description: This place rocks.  Arturo and the staff are always friendly.  Food is served super fadt and it is always excellent.   Just a great place to eat!

4.description: Good steak tacos. Very slow service we only a couple are in front of you.Over all not bad

24.description: Perfect place for I don't know what i want but I want Mexican food fast, good and reasonably priced and I haven't shaved (lol).Great selection on the menu and love the authentic people there. Food is better than fast food, and in a pinch, stop in for my favorite shrimp tacos (don't let them tell you it's not offered, have to negotiate off the menu to get what  you want!)

6.description: Nasty people! We ordered red tamales but they gave us green ones which are too spicy for the kid. We called and asked them to rectify the problem and they just hung up on us... twice!

22.description: I got steak quesadillas and a chicken quesadilla here. Both completely lacked any semblance of flavor and both felt like I was chewing rubber. It may be a hole-in-the-wall restaurant and I'm not expecting 4-star food or anything. I just want something with flavor.There's a place on Addison and Lincoln with much better food for basically the same price. I wish I knew the name of the place, cause I would easily suggest going there over this place, any day.

15.description: Great little place with a very helpful staff. They let me add and subtract a few items that I didn't want. Good price, good amount of food and great tasting burritos.

7.description: I wish this place was good.  I moved to the area recently.  I have tried this place multi-times, I just don't like it.  The prices are fair, the guys working there are nice, the good just isn't good.  I love, hole in the wall, Mexican good.  Burritos, tacos, tortas, etc., I love it all.  I think this place uses cheap ingredients and their recipes are very bland.  Tony's is much better; over on Belmont & Damen.

36.description: I only come here when I'm tanked, and pretty much anything tastes good when you are wasted. The meat is not high quality and pretty fatty, but with those low prices and large portions who is to complain. They have a picture of nachos topped with guacamole by the wall menu, but who know guac is extra for nachos? The adventurous may want to try the tripe tacos (request extra crunchy). They mop the place pretty regularly, but the smell of cleaning solution kills the dine-in experience.

30.description: I LOVE this place! Simple ingredients; perfect!

3.description: We came here tonight it was either Popeye's Chicken or The Famous Taco Burrito's. Well I saw in their window a manger's special I tried their 3 enchiladas suizas dinner which comes with refried beans, Mexican rice= orange Rice & Peas  small salad which was so,so,so filling my sister had the  3 Taco dinner made from Al pastor style, refried beans, Mexican orange rice & peas. Also we choose for drinks called Horchata. I thought I would have some leftovers to have tomorrow for lunch or breakfast. But I was so,so hungry and this is my clean plate moment. We were there tonight @ 10:10 PM We will come back for more. They hours Sunday-Thursday 9:00 AM -1:00 AM/ Friday- Saturday 9:00 AM- 4:00 AM

14.description: This place is everything you could ask for in a mexican quick serve style restaurant. I initially only wanted to go there because I thought the name of the place was rather whimsical and actually kind of hilarious. At the location I live next to the "King" part of the sign has fallen off so it just looks like its called "The Famous Taco Burrito". When I ate here I discovered that it is in fact a great little place. The tortillas taste fresh, the meat doesn't seem like it has been sitting around for hours and they have a huge variety of things you can try. Not to mention, its open very late. The price is beyond reasonable, you get a lot of food for not a lot of money. This is a simple restaurant in a very good way.

28.description: Back story:  I had two major issues going on with my hair...First one was an allergic reaction to a medication that made a good 60% of my hair fall out.  Second was a HORRID color and cut from Ulta that made me look as if I had even less hair.  It was shocking how bad my hair looked and felt...After being robbed of over $300 at Ulta, I was a bit cash poor and definitely wary of hair stylists...until Margarita.  She really looked at my scalp and hair and told me what I could do to make my hair more healthy and look fuller...she made sure during the entire cutting process to let me know what was going on and make sure I was ok with what was being done.  The result?  AMAZING.  I am serious, I didnt think anything but a short Dorothy Hamill bob was possible, but she did it.  Not only does my hair look adorable to me, but I have gotten compliments out in the wild from perfect strangers!  That is a 100% turn around...all for only 35 dollars!  Thank you Margarita!

1.description: Great cuts at reasonable prices! Great home feeling in the middle of the neighborhood.

9.description: I just moved to Chicago, and live pretty close to this place, so I decided to try it out.  When I got there, they were ready for me, which is always nice.  The girl who was working as the receptionist was the same girl who did my shampoo.  She was sweet, but a bit rough.  I'm not tender headed at all--I am a camp counselor and am used to having 8 year old girls try to "do my hair" for fun.  She was fun to talk to, but I felt like she wasn't really paying too much attention to my head.So now we come to the haircut.  Margarita cut my hair, and she was sweet.  The hair cut I ended up with was ok, nothing too amazing.  I sort of felt like there was a little language barrier, as if she was having trouble understanding what I wanted, but she tried very hard, so I really appreciated that.It was decent, but I probably won't return.

29.description: Wow, I had a great experience here today!  Being Italian my eyebrows can go from looking okay to bordering dangerously on a unibrow quickly --today was one of those days.  I called to see how fast they could get me in for a wax and I was told right away.  They made me feel welcome from the second I walked in the door.  It was raining and when I almost slipped on the floor the owner himself came over to put out a floor mat and make sure I had a place to hang up my umbrella.  Angie did my brows and she was great.  I have been getting my eyebrows waxed for 11 years and this was my most painless wax ever.  She also showed me exactly the shape she was going to make and explained to me every step of the process.  I think this would be nice for someone who was getting their brows done for the first time.On the way out I decided that I also needed to get my bangs cut and they sat me right down and did them perfectly.  I actually didn't get the name of the girl who cut my bangs but she was very friendly and professional as well.The best part was the price.  Brows were only $15 and my bang trim was $5!  I am looking forward to going back and trying the rest of their services.

23.description: Yay, finally found a salon that I like and that doesn't charge a ton for a haircut. I was able to make an evening appointment with one day notice. I came in with a picture and Margarita took extra time to make sure she was giving me the exact cut I wanted. I'm getting so many compliments on my hair today!I was a fan of some *other* place in Roscoe Village but at Conexion, I pay the same price for a haircut, get my hair washed and don't feel rushed.

5.description: I've been to Conexion Salon a few times now and I've had a wonderful experience each time.   MY go to hair stylist has been Angie and she's always taken great care in finding out what I want and also has great suggestions on hair styles and colors!   I definitely recommend this Roscoe Village Salon!

31.description: Margarita washed, cut, and styled my hair. She was very thorough, cautious, and did a good job. At $30, I got a much better cut than I paid for.

25.description: This place was so great, it made me finally sign up for a Yelp account so I could review it.I called about an hour ago to schedule an appointment for an eyebrow wax, and since I just live down the street, I was able to come in immediately and get it over with.I walked in and was greeted by name upon entering-- total plus for politeness.  They even offered a cup of water.The eyebrow shape and attention to detail that I got with the wax was top notch and better than what other salons charge twice as much for.  It was $15!They were installing new pedicure chairs while I was there, so I'm excited to come back and give those a try.

12.description: Angie was great.  I needed a quick bang trim and found anywhere that could fit me in close to my house.  I wil be repeat customer now - I lucked out big time with the quality of service she provided!

21.description: My long, straight, one length hair needed a trim badly, so I took to yelp to find a place in the Roscoe Village area where I could get a cut without paying $50 plus dollars for someone to trim off my ends.The place was empty when I got there, which was a little concerning, but on the plus side, I got in right away. During my "consultation" (AKA, me telling them to cut off as little as possible) my stylist asked me if I wanted my hair washed, which seemed odd. This isn't Supercuts....I thought it was an given that a hair cut comes with a wash. (Strange moment #1) While I'm getting my hair washed the stylist asked me if I want him to use conditioner......Do people actually just use shampoo? And if so, isn't it a job of a professional stylist to teach them better than that? (Strange moment #2)So after he gave me a trim (only about 1 inch, good work!) my stylist starts to blow dry my hair. About halfway through he stops to take a break because he is hot and tired....I mean I know I have thick hair but come on! So after drying it to about 75% he asks me if that is fine, he is sure the rest will dry on its own. (Strange moment #3) After all of the strangeness that has happened so far (asking to wash my hair, asking about conditioner, not fulling drying my hair) I'm ready to go. I say it is fine and pull it back in a pony tail and head out in the the January weather. Sure I usually restyle my hair when I get home from an appointment, but I at least what they stylist to make an attempt, and not send me out in the cold to freeze my brain off.So I left feeling unsatisfied, yeah it was only $35, but for that price I expect some conditioner, without having to ask for it, and a full blow dry.On the plus side, when I got home and restyled my hair, the cut actually looks nice and he stood by his word and only took off the ends.I won't be back, but I did the haircut I desperately needed.

16.description: Yay, finally found a salon that I like and that doesn't charge a ton for a haircut. I was able to make an evening appointment with one day notice. I came in with a picture and Margarita took extra time to make sure she was giving me the exact cut I wanted. I'm getting so many compliments on my hair today!I was a fan of some *other* place in Roscoe Village but at Conexion, I pay the same price for a haircut, get my hair washed and don't feel rushed.

17.description: I just moved to Roscoe Village and needed to find a waxing location. After reading many reviews on YELP I chose Conexion- big mistake. It was not clean and I was in pain- for many days after. Stay away!

10.description: Just got my eyebrows waxed here (really, like 45 minutes ago) by Angie, and they turned out so beautifully!  It was one of the most perfect brow waxes I've ever had.  She took her time doing it, explained each step of the process, and the final result was flawless and stylish.  I'm so happy!  I think $15 is a very reasonable price for what you get here.  I'm certain to go back the next time I need my brows waxed!

11.description: Angie is the best! $15 men's cut on Tuesday is the best deal in the city....reccomend for anyone looking for a great affortable men's cut

26.description: I wanted to update my rating of Conexion because I was contacted by the owner of the store and she issued an apology for my experience.  It really impressed me and I like to see businesses who take the extra step to keep their customers happy.  I really feel as though I may have just gone on a off day-and everyone has those.  I will definitely go back to this place and give it a second chance.

27.description: I am in love with this place. I was a little weary at first because no one was in, which... come to think of it was great. I was seated immediately. Angie cut my hair and styled it. OH man I was in love! My hair looked great and it didn't have that stiff look. It was great. I'm definitely going back! You can't beat a haircut under 40 dollars too. I was actually expecting more.

0.description: Honestly, it takes a lot for me to go to a salon and take care of my long hair. That's why when my wedding day was approaching I was in trouble! I called different places... most charged as much for just a preview of a look as my little dress had cost me :l  Thankfully Conexion Salon was recommended to me by my husband.At the salon, Angie took care of me first by listening to my likes in hair style, then looking through some choices, and finally doing a sample of both a hairstyle and makeup.My experience at the salon was great- the entire staff is very friendly and professional. The day of my wedding Angie was there earlier than opening time. I was late but she still had time to do an outstanding job, and we even changed the style! She did my makeup and I was ready to go :) looking great for my special day! The pricing is very reasonable and overall I was more than satisfied- thank you Angie!I saw how many services they offer here- from waxing to relaxing massages and all hair services... I can't wait to go back and do something to my hair =D

20.description: Went here for a haircut in December because it had good reviews and was reasonably priced. Margarita is great! I got the last appt of the day and they didn't rush me out even though i was there for about 15 minutes past close while she was finishing blow drying my hair. I showed her a picture of what I wanted and she wanted to clarify and see some more views so she actually looked up the celebrity on her computer and we looked at some other pictures. She then proceeded to do exactly what I asked for! It was great! I would recommend to anyone and it doesn't take a long time to get an evening appt!
