19.description: So everyone here is really nice and they make every effort to accommodate your needs, but I don't feel like they have a whole lot of experience.On the plus side they are VERY meticulous with your hair and take the time to talk to you about it and explain everything.  The girl who cut my hair was incredibly sweet and my hair turned out fine. It's not stuffy and super trendy at all and you will definitely feel comfortable here.  I tried this place because it's walking distance to my house but I probably wouldn't go back unless I desperately needed an inexpensive haircut.The eyebrow wax was also fine but I've had better for the same price.  Bonus points for the lady because she acted like she really cared about my brows and how I took care of them.If you're looking for a reasonably priced, nice, clean salon with an inviting atmosphere and really nice employees, then go here.

2.description: This has become my go-to salon ever since I moved to the neighborhood.  The prices are reasonable, the service is great, which goes to show you don't have to pay $50 for a haircut to be treated well!

18.description: For me, this is the type of salon where you feel uncomfortable from the get-go. I have been here twice and both times were unfavorable. I received a gift card for my birthday and originally went in for a mani/pedi which took about 3.5 hours! It was a good mani/pedi but who has that much time to spend in a salon making idle chit chat and hoping your nails are instantaneously dry so you could leave immediately following the last brush stroke! I still had money left on the gift card so I "HAD" to go back for something so I needed a pedi and once again was thoroughly disappointed.  This time, a different nail tech, performed my pedicure but it was done too hastily. It was like she didn't know how to do a pedicure or just didn't want to do the hard stuff. That's why I pay for pedis - so someone else could scrub off the dead skin off my heels!  She seriously used the wrong side of the foot scrubber thing. She cut my nails but did not file or shape them! I could have done the same thing but better at home with my pedi egg. I get home and look at my toes closer and notice there is polish outside of my nails and on my skin! Ugh... Not to mention, it was $30!  Way too overpriced for a pedicure of that quality. If I pay $30 for a pedi, I at least expect a massage chair and a thorough scrub!  The chair was pretty uncomfortable btw. Then when I checked out it was like the 2 ladies at the counter were zombies and not understanding anything i said!  Needless to say, I will not return to Conexion or recommend it.

13.description: My cousin and myself went here for a prewedding manicure. My cousin made an appointment for the two of us. We show up, only 1 manicurist. It took 2.5 hours for both of us to get a manicure/pedicure, because there was only one manicurist and she had to do both of us individually. Had we been walk ins, obviously they wouldn't have known 2 of us would have been coming in and it would have been fine. However, they DID know, didn't do anything about it and it took an extremely long time.The job the manicurist did was fine enough, but I'm not sure I would go back.

4.description: Just got my four year old daughter's hair cut here.  They did a great job, were very thorough and sweet to her.  And it was $15!  I felt it was a much more stylish and professional cut than you get at the kid's hair salons.

24.description: I'm driving around lakeview looking for someplace that will be quick, clean, reasonably priced, with nearby parking for a last minute lip waxing. Conexion was all these things.I walked in, asked for a wax, filled out a form, and was in the back in under 2 minutes. This was the first place I've been that asks about your skin before a waxing. They really care about you and obviously don't want you to have a bad reaction.They had me lay on a table in the back and propped me up with pillows. She used a pre-wax cleaning thing, quickly yanked off my mustache, used a gel to remove the extra wax, aloe to sooth the skin, and a cold light-bulb thingy (though I'm sure that's not what it was) to calm the skin.I'm sure I was in and out in less than 10minutes. You can pay with cards, but tips must be cash. The place was really nice and the people are friendly. I'm giving it 4 stars, not 5 because I don't know what their hair cutting is like.

6.description: If you are looking for a reasonable priced, friendly environment this is it.  I've gone to places that charge twice as much for half of the customer service and a crappy job.  Josephine does an excellent job on my eyebrows ( a little more than other places but it's totally worth it $15) and my hair.  At my first visit I was looking for a change and my hair had been damaged (by the salon across the street) and she helped me fix it right up by giving me a cut that would hide some of the damage.  I've texted her the day before I need an appointment and she always squeezes me in.  She's even shown up to work early for me so that I can see her when I need to.  I also love that they are so nice to the elderly.  Every time I go there, there are elderly women and men getting their hair done.  Not super fancy, but who needs that?  Minus one start because I wish the esthetician was there more often.

22.description: So everyone here is really nice and they make every effort to accommodate your needs, but I don't feel like they have a whole lot of experience.On the plus side they are VERY meticulous with your hair and take the time to talk to you about it and explain everything.  The girl who cut my hair was incredibly sweet and my hair turned out fine. It's not stuffy and super trendy at all and you will definitely feel comfortable here.  I tried this place because it's walking distance to my house but I probably wouldn't go back unless I desperately needed an inexpensive haircut.The eyebrow wax was also fine but I've had better for the same price.  Bonus points for the lady because she acted like she really cared about my brows and how I took care of them.If you're looking for a reasonably priced, nice, clean salon with an inviting atmosphere and really nice employees, then go here.

15.description: This place was so great, it made me finally sign up for a Yelp account so I could review it.I called about an hour ago to schedule an appointment for an eyebrow wax, and since I just live down the street, I was able to come in immediately and get it over with.I walked in and was greeted by name upon entering-- total plus for politeness.  They even offered a cup of water.The eyebrow shape and attention to detail that I got with the wax was top notch and better than what other salons charge twice as much for.  It was $15!They were installing new pedicure chairs while I was there, so I'm excited to come back and give those a try.

7.description: FANTASTIC!! It honestly doesn't get better than this I would give them more stars if I could. The staff is very friendly, attentive and proffesional. I've been going to Margarita for years now and everytime I visit I leave very satisfied. I've gotten hair cut, color, waxing, and facials at Conexion and each experience was phenomenal!!! Thanks Conexion Keep up the great work!

8.description: This place is awesome! Margarita, Josie, and Angie do a great job with my hair and eyebrows. The place is a very comfy family owned salon that knows a lot when it comes down to your hair. I always walk out of there very  satisfied. I always go there and am glad to have a stylist who knows what she is doing. I have never had a bad experience there. They are gentle and do condition your hair. They make sure you don't walk out of their salon with your hair wet. I love it here! I've gone there for a waxing too. And they are were clean about the entire process. Despite what people say, Angie and Josie are very clean and caring. They let you know exactly what they are going to do and care about   the pain you feel and try to make the waxing less painful. The wax was great and I was fine after with no pain. And I have a low tolerance for pain, so it's nice to have them making sure I'm not hurting through it all. Both my sister and boyfriend go here to and they love it! I would recommend it to anyone who's looking for a Paul Mitchell salon. Conexion doesn't try and rip you off and leave you feeling like you over payed for a haircut. Their entire staff is super friendly and enjoy talking with you while you are there and even have complimentary coffee, tea, cookies, and fruit. This place is amazing and I will recommend it to everyone!

30.description: I've found my new salon. I was fully expecting to try a few places and then settle on one, but I hit the jackpot on the first try. I walked into Conexion a frizzy brunette with split ends, and walked out a sleek redhead.Ana did my cut/color/style, and she did a perfectly brilliant job. She cut off only the half inch or so of split ends - such a relief not to lose 4 inches of hair when I just wanted a trim! - and fixed my growing-out bangs. I initially wanted a brighter orange-y red, but she pointed out a darker shade that worked much better with my skin tone and looked less cartoon-y than the other shade would have. She also managed to turn my usually frizzy hair perfectly flat without using an iron. The entire walk home, I was That Girl who stops in front of every window to check out her hair. I will ABSOLUTELY be back.

3.description: This is a wonderful salon. If you can, ask for Angie. She really takes that extra step to make your experience perfect. The prices are great too and they are very knowledgable.  Angie is the only person I trust with my hair. I get it colored and cut and she does a great job every time.  They also do massages, waxing and mani/pedi. If you havent gone here and are looking for a new place, its a MUST try.

14.description: I'm driving around lakeview looking for someplace that will be quick, clean, reasonably priced, with nearby parking for a last minute lip waxing. Conexion was all these things.I walked in, asked for a wax, filled out a form, and was in the back in under 2 minutes. This was the first place I've been that asks about your skin before a waxing. They really care about you and obviously don't want you to have a bad reaction.They had me lay on a table in the back and propped me up with pillows. She used a pre-wax cleaning thing, quickly yanked off my mustache, used a gel to remove the extra wax, aloe to sooth the skin, and a cold light-bulb thingy (though I'm sure that's not what it was) to calm the skin.I'm sure I was in and out in less than 10minutes. You can pay with cards, but tips must be cash. The place was really nice and the people are friendly. I'm giving it 4 stars, not 5 because I don't know what their hair cutting is like.

3.description: We just had my daughter's 8th birthday party at Crush.  The girls had an amazing time and so did I! The candy bar, just dance on the wii, and the custom tees kept the girls oh so happy.  I didn't have to worry about a thing.  Even the two sixth grade girls who helped me out thought it was the coolest party ever.  I highly recommend Crush for tween and early teen birthday parties as well as for their fashion. They styled my daughter in the coolest outfit for her party.

1.description: What to do when your tween daughter finally realizes that the neon glitz of Justice is just toooo much?  When Target/Old Navy/Gap seem to think that 10 year olds still want to wear lots of glitter, lace and ruffles?  In other words, when she finally starts trying to have style of her own but there is no style available at mass market stores?  Take her to Crush.  My daughter just loved the personalized shopping experience and array of things that fit her newly developing style sensibility.  Plan to spend an afternoon - a fashion show at Crush, rolling over to John's place next door for a snack and then over to Cinnamon (a great grown up boutique just down the street) for a little something for mom.  Go crazy and maybe even spring for a mani/pedi at the place on Roscoe as well.  A great mother/daughter experience.  Lush is a boutique and prices are boutiquey, but that's okay with me.  As long as my daughter has a few cool outfits she can wear - and mix and match, we are golden.  I'd rather that than 10 ugly t-shirts from Justice with matching neon leggings.

2.description: great close and great people, they are so helpful and nice. they have great close, accessories, gifts, and shoes for young girls and even for adults.

5.description: I love everything Crush has to offer: clothing + accessories. I've been to the store a few times and every time I stop in, there's always something new. Jodi, the owner, is super helpful and very friendly. The dressing room is nice and comfy. Heart rug: how cute! Right now, I am obsessed with their extensive collection of vests and cashmere leggings. Chicago winter: I am ready for you.

6.description: I took my daughter there when she had a day off from school. The selection was just right, not too overwhelming. My daughter enjoyed the attention she received to find what she was looking for. I wish she did not like as many things, since it was hard to decide what to take home with us. We will be back again soon!

7.description: Really cute clothes and accessories at reasonable prices. Some "Made in the USA" brands, which I really appreciate. A lot of colors, textures, and prints. Nice atmosphere, and the owner always has a smile on her face.

0.description: Such a clean fun upscale store that still appeals to tweens and teens.  And this aunt likes finding some things for herself there too!  Easy price points for such a boutique feel.  The manager is always so friendly and the owner too.  Always a hit when I get clothing as presents there for my 10 and 15 year old nieces.

4.description: Cute store with great gifts. I love their selection of necklaces and earrings - great for teens as well as adults! Love the interior and the owner is so sweet. My son fell outside the store and she rushed out and asked if I needed help and could not have been more helpful. So glad this store is in our neighborhood!

0.description: I've been going to T.G. for seven years -- almost as long as I've lived in Chicago.  Before I found him, I had a string of overpriced experiences with overprocessing.  T.G. gives a great haircut, but he's especially talented with color.  T.G. is the whole shop.  He takes your appointment, rings you up, washes your hair (with really great products), and then does the color, cut, and style.  His salon is very inviting with a lot of natural light and beautiful pottery, artwork, and a lot of greenery and flowers.  The nicest thing is the experience is very personal, and yet still entirely professional.  He will spend a lot of time with you figuring out what you want and then balancing it with what you need. Going to T.G. is like visiting a friend, but you don't have to worry about a bad hair day because he'll fix it before you leave.

3.description: I found Calm Skin care 2 years ago through a friend . I am very picky about natural cosmetics and was a bit skeptical about using a new product....Surprise! Best eye serum i have ever used! The company lists all ingredients of their products and  they provide a valuable education for newbies. It so easy for me to order since the company is local. Recently they launched an eco-friendly mineral make up line-I love the highlighter and the bronzer!Now that is a 1 stop skincare shopping spot for me. No more browsing and researching different sites!Amazing products!

1.description: This is a great, no-nonsense skin care line.  I personally use the cocoa butter body bar during the winter months to keep my knuckles from bleeding (ouch!).  My wife is addicted to the shimmer lip balm and likes using the body oil for moisturizing her legs, it's pretty easy to get efficient coverage.  She also like the clay masks, they're convenient for travel since they are in powder form.  She's planning to checkout the make-up line, will update.

0.description: As a passionate environmentalist who is always looking for ways to reduce my waste, I love how CALM has refills of their make up and skin care line. One of my pet peeves are all those little, plastic make up containers that can't be recycled. Kudos to Jyl for giving us a solution! Now I can take care of my skin and the planet. It's a win-win for all. I would highly recommend CALM to anyone who wants a feel-good experience for their skin. :)

2.description: I worked with Jyl and Daniella for an eco-friendly wedding show and they were amazing! The makeup on the brides was flawless and they were able to handle all the makeup for all the girls in a very fast and professional manner. I would recommend them to my clients for their wedding day. And these ladies even come onsite to you. Eco-friendly, convenient, and beautiful. It doesn't get much better!

5.description: I started using CALM Skin care products a little over 6 months ago and I have already noticed a huge difference in my skin's complexion. Since switching to CALM, my skin looks much brighter and more alive. I also feel really good about putting natural ingredients on my skin.  I never thought much before about the ingredients I was putting on my skin but after seeing the difference in my skin I would never go back to using the harsh products I was using before. I have sensitive skin and always thought that it was just normal for my skin to get red and irritated at times.  However, I haven't noticed any redness or irritation since switching to CALM.  Plus, my skin never dries out like it used to (the moisture mask is miraculous) so it looks much healthier as well. I am obsessed with the toner, cleanser, moisture mask, and lip balm.  I also recently purchased the Eucalyptus Sage Bath Salts which is extremely relaxing. One of my favorite things about CALM is that every time I try a new product I am never disappointed.  It really is a product line that you can trust across the board!!

6.description: Jyl has created an incredible line of all-organic skincare products and make-up. WOW! She's passionate about skincare, her clients and the Earth, and has developed great products that work, that are good for you, and that are environmentally and economically sustainable. I had the pleasure to get a facial and make-up application yesterday from Danielle. So relaxing to know that the products she were using were gentle on my skin and didn't contain any toxins and byproducts. Danielle is an expert make-up artist and I highly recommend her to anyone looking for a holiday party, wedding or special occasion make-over. Last winter, I used tre jojoba hand salve for my dry, cracking fingers. Wonderful product and it smells so good, too. If your fingers crack like mine when the temps get below freezing, you need to check it out. I'm definitely stocking up for this winter and getting  for friends with the same dry skin issues. CALM's make-up line is great, too. It's available in a variety of palettes to please any skin tones (even covered my dark circles) -- foundations, blush, eye colors, liners, concealer, lip tints and more. I really like the fact that Jyl has put so much thought and research into not just the product, but the packaging as well. She is a local business who uses the most environmentally friendly packaging available, and has also made sure the packaging is suited to the product (mineral-based powders need to be packaged to keep out moisture, for example). Containers are refillable, eye shadows can be mixed and matched in a compact that holds at least six shades. Jyl has really done her homework in developing CALM and you won't be disappointed.You can order the products and refills online, and they are available at selected local places, including Healing Foundations at 2112 Belmont in Chicago.Thank you Jyl and Danielle!

7.description: I worked with Jyl at the Edgewater Art Fair/Fashion Show as one of the Makeup artist/Hair stylist for Calm Skin Care. The show was amazing, the models were outstanding, the designers were awesome, and Calm Skin Care products were great to use. I'm thankful for Jyl giving me the opportunity to be apart of the show, Jyl is a down-to-earth person yet professional at the same time, I look forward to working with her again.

8.description: I started using CALM products a year a half ago after meeting Jyl at a networking event. I was blown away with the products. I used to have mild acne and spent a lot of money on high end organic products but now that I've been using CALM regularly I feel like my skin is not as temperamental and I'm saving a lot of money! Big fan. Highly recommend!

9.description: Recently I had the pleasure of working with Jyl in a fall fashion show where all of the models wore CALM makeup.  I helped apply foundation to a few of the girls- it went on so lightly and smooth unlike department store makeup that often feels thick and oily.  The makeup made every models skin look flawless and beautiful.  I would recommend CALM to everyone!  I love that it is all natural and good for the environment as well.  I was introduced to the skincare products at the fashion as well.  I have very dry skin and was excited to hear about all the moisturizers and facial cleansers.  I tried some of the aloe facial moisturizer and it left my skin feeling so soft.  I can't wait to purchase some of my own!

10.description: I'm a big fan of Calm Skin Care.  I have sensitive skin, so these products have been wonderful for me.  In the past, I've used Lancome, Estee Lauder, etc. and found those products to be too harsh and overly fragrant.  The cheaper drugstore brands I've tried have caused serious rashes and break-outs.  I use CALM facial cleanser, tonifier and eye/neck serum on a daily basis and my skin feels great!  It's all natural  and makes my face so happy!I started with the spa sampler ($16), which is a 1"x6" plastic tube with a 10-day sample of the facial cleanser, 3 different facial masks, the eye/neck serum and facial moisturizer.  It was a great way for me to test everything out and decide what I liked.  Also, the sampler is a cute gift for friends/family, and it's a great size for travel (especially if you're obsessed like me to have the most efficiently packed carry-on suitcase).  I've also tried the salt scrubs, which leaves your skin velvety smooth and smells so good, and this past winter, my husband & I could not live without the jojoba hand salve.  It is the best!  We have a baby, so we're constantly washing our hands, and this product has been a miracle worker!  I highly recommend Calm.  You won't be disappointed!

4.description: I recently had the opportunity to work on a fashion show with Jyl from CALM and she is such a darling and pleasure to work with! The makeup on the models looked beautifu! She also gave me a brief description on what CALM is all about Care, Art, Love, Maintain. I love what her products stand for but the true test is actually trying out the products and she gave me a sample of the Soy Milk and Rose Hips facial scrub cleanser to take home and I am hooked! It left my skin so super soft!! I definitely will be purchasing most of my facial products from her line! Plus with all the major brands putting chemicals in their products it's nice to know that there is a skincare line that explains what is in the product and it's so much better for your skin and health.

3.description: I'm knocking this place down two stars because I feel like their are cheating the Diet Mountain Dew addicts. They no longer sell 44 ounce cups, only 32. But the prices are the same. And according to corporate, they are supposed to have the bigger cups. I hate it when businesses cheat their customers out of 12 ounces of soda and future diabetes. Color me annoyed.

1.description: I have been coming to this gas station for over 10 years. They got rid of all of the sweet employees from the early 2000s, And they replaced them with employees who are VERY rude and lazy. I asked for a sandwich one time and they claimed they were out. So I took it upon myself and glanced in the cooler and saw multiple boxes of sandwiches. I once spoke to the district manager, lets call him  Bryan Yeast and he was a totally useless. *my opinion*  DO NOT SHOP HERE. There is another gas station literally down the street from this crap hole. It is a Marathon Gas Station Belmont and Western. They also serve grill items and sandwiches. Better priced too! Those employees are more friendlier. Especially the Night time gal. You cant find graveyard people who are as sweet as her. *names not really because i was threaten....true story*

2.description: No check cashing... isn't this the company where i got my Net Spend card that says I can cash checks? Why no check machine? Maybe a sales rep could apologize after I walked a mile to cash a check? Ah forget about it!  Just don't go there to cash a check.

9.description: The staff is pretty rediculous at times.  I've heard them get down right bitchy with customers and with each other.  However, they usually run a special on 2 liters of coke or pepsi...2 for $3! which is amazing.  Since I live close its usually my go to spot.  They also have a cool rewards program (doesn't everyone nowadays?) that lets you earn points towards future items.

10.description: The best thing about this Speedway is that their gas prices are among the lowest in the neighborhood. The worst thing about this Speedway is location, location, location. For some unholy reason they built a gas station on a postage stamp sized corner where all the cars can barely fit next to the pumps, not to mention that every time I go here to gas up there is some jerk parked who is blocking the way into the station because he/she just NEEDS to run inside to purchase that all-important bag of pork rinds.Top tip: Join Speedway's Speedy Rewards program! You get points on your card towards discounts on gas and store purchases. I have been fed for free using my Speedy Rewards points :D!

4.description: Gas prices are cheap especially for being in the city. (Plus my car take premium gas). They have pretty decent food on thier roller grill.just make sure you have your speedway card so you can rack up those points.

6.description: I often wake up in the cold dead of night from ghastly dreams consisting of a world where fountain soda doesn't exist.I then get up, put on some clothes (that's right, nude sleeper, baby) and slippers and crawl, run, walk, somersault, rollerblade, moped, car-jack, hang glide, or web swing over to Speedway.Thus am I satiated..69 cents for any size fountain soda.  You can try for different combinations (patent pending), such as:The Conscientious Snowboarder: Diet Mt. Dew with just a splash of lemonade or Sierra Mist/Sprite and a splash of orange soda.The Law-Abiding Citizen: Coke Zero topped off with a splash of Coke Classic or Cherry CokeThe Repeat Offender: Coke Zero with a splash of Pepsi or Wild Cherry Pepsi.The Unfulfilled Med Student: Diet Dr. Pepper with a splash of Regular Dr. Pepper and Wild Cherry Pepsi.Or, lastly, for now:The Status Quo: Coke Classic with Coke Oh, they also have gas.Oh, the speedy rewards card allows me to get a free soda for every 5 I purchase ( I think it's 5).Lastly,  the parking fucking sucks at this gas station.   The parking lot is like a scalene triangle with 6 or 8 pumps running from angle A to side b.Cheeers.

12.description: Negatives-Can't think of anyPostives-Friendly people-Almost never a waiting

5.description: I had two papers saying that I had a 25 dollar gift card to macy's, but what I did not know is that you need to redeem it for a plastic card at the gas station.  I went in today and they were very nice and told me to call speedway to redeposit the points since they were out of macy's gift cards.  The manager was awesome - he called for me and 2 minutes I was on my way with outback gift cards.  Great customer service!

13.description: when you live in roscoe village and tony's burrito mex is already closed there is only one option. speedway. with a nice variety of drinks and snacks you just can't lose. I'd suggest visiting speedway during the 10pm-6am shift when "hey buddy" works. He can't tell you your total in english so you should try to mentally figure out your total before you step up to the plate.

11.description: People that work there are rude, Rude, RUDE. I went there, the clerk made an error on my credit card, when I pointed it out to him, he asked me to leave the store and never to come back. Since my error involved them owing money, I called the police. They got it worked out, and had he just handled it differently none of the melodrama would have been necessary. I wont be back... I have been a loyal Speedway customer for years as I am from NW Indiana.

8.description: I am a loyal Speedway customer. Not particularly of this location but of Speedway in general. I use my Speedy Rewards Card religiously. However I detest going to this location even though it is really close to me. I understand that space is at a premium on the north side of the city. i am not expecting a sprawling Speedway like you will find off of an interstate, but this has to be the smallest lot occupied by a gas station in the Midwest. They have six pumps and if three of them are filled, then you are most likely waiting in line. There also always seems to be a big ass truck blocking things up too. Regardless of the less than perfect location, the gas is still somewhat cheaper than most of the other stations around and the employees are always pleasant and they give me my due Speedy Rewards. I guess I will just quit my bitching and appreciate the positive things.

0.description: Good deals if you go in the convenience store, and definitely some of the best gas prices in the neighborhood. Sometimes the air isn't working, but when it does work, it takes credit card! (How many air machines take cards?! This is awesome).Make note, this station doesn't sell beer or liquor. If you're out late at night, there's a party store just south on Damen that offers beer and liquor.Also, this station has awesome beverage deals, mix and match! I can get two 20oz Gatorades (for those hung over nights) for $2! Or 20oz bottled pop is 2 for $2.50. Pretty great deals!

7.description: Cheap gas prices!!! Wouldn't want to get stuck in the middle of the lane but the cheap prices draw me to this location. I have been lucky to pull up to the front pump, fill up and get out. Perk?? - They have a rewards system! Who knew???

28.description: I chose Holly for my wedding hair and makeup and absolutely loved her work! Finding a hair and makeup artist for my wedding day was one of my biggest fears, because I had visions of some awful prom hairdo and looking way overdone. Holly eased my fears with her fantastic ability to make my makeup look natural and my hair light and effortless, but wonderfully styled. I wanted a classic, old-Hollywood look, and that I got. Everything turned out beautiful! And I loved the airbrushed makeup. It lasted all day long!I also had a large wedding party and Holly was able to accommodate for that by bringing along assistants. All of the girls absolutely loved their hair and makeup. We received compliments all night long! If you're looking for someone with good taste, talent and a calming presence, Holly is your answer!

1.description: I tried to book Holly or her associated artists for my wedding later this year, but as soon as I inquired about the possibility of negotiating on prices, she was extremely dismissive of us. I wish I had had the chance to be a customer of hers, but she never responded to several inquiries about whether or not they would be available on my wedding day, merely reinforced multiple times that their prices are non-negotiable, which is fine... But just asking the question meant that she wasn't interested in us as a customer.Clearly she's only interested in a certain kind of client, and we're just not in the right tax bracket.EDIT: As to the claim that these prices are comparable to others in Chicago:Holly's bridal hair: $275Livia Carporale: $225Bridal hair at Pin Me Up: $100Holly's bridal makeup: $275Flawless Beauty: $175Bridal makeup at Pin Me Up: $100Numbers speak louder than words.

9.description: I am usually not a last minute person, but oh boy was I last minute to book Holly for my wedding reception makeup and hair! I called Holly the night before the event (probably all frantic because I still had no one doing my hair and makeup) and had made like 5 phone calls and Holly was the only one that called me right back that same day! I was so glad when Holly was able to get me in the next afternoon for the makeup and hair. She told me exactly what to buy so I can do a little touch up during the reception so I don't get oily (which I do have a big problem with) and where to park when I arrived at her place (free parking in the city...score!) Holly did both the make up and hair for me in about 2-2.5 hours. She did airbrush make up and OMG I looked amazing! I didn't even have a trial run with her and she nailed it! I showed Holly a picture of the hair that I wanted done and she pretty much was exact to the point! I cannot believe how great she was. I really cannot say enough about this person. I am so glad that I went with yelp and booked her and she was able to fit me in! My reception was on Sep 9 and it was phenomenal! Pretty could not stop raving about the hair and make up. I mean my hair is about 20 inches long....thats a LOT of hair to work with and she did it. Overall, Holly is awesome! If you want someone you can trust with your makeup and hair, it's her!

29.description: Holly hooked me up with a fantastic regional stylist, Kathie, for my August 2010 wedding. I'm from out of town, so she accommodated my schedule by doing a trial run at her apartment the day before the wedding--which worked out great for my rehearsal dinner. She listened to my suggestions and got ideas from pictures of hairstyles that I sent her. Kathie was extremely FLEXIBLE and didn't make me feel rushed in any way. She took the time to get my hair exactly the way I wanted it and was relaxed and easy to work with. On the day of the wedding, Kathie showed up early and was able to work around people dressing me and putting on my make-up. It was a wonderful experience, and I loved how my hair looked for my wedding! The style lasted all day, even with the humidity. I would choose Kathie for my stylist again without any hesitation! Thanks, Kathie!!

23.description: I got married in October and Holly came to my apartment to do hair for me and my five bridesmaids. We had SUCH a great time! Everyone looked and felt fabulous. Highly recommend!

5.description: Holly Kasprisin is an absolute professional that you will not only enjoy working with, but can be confident in her abilities to transform you to your "best self".  I had both a hair and makeup trial with Holly a few months before my wedding on July 16th 2011, as well as hair and makeup done for our Engagement Photo Shoot. Both times I was thrilled with the outcome.On the wedding day, Holly and one of her assistants showed up at the Union League Club 15 minutes before they were expected to get there to get everything set up for us.  She was in charge of my hair and airbrush makeup, my mothers hair and makeup, hair for 5 bridesmaids, and fake eyelashes for all of them.Holly has extreme attention to detail and I was floored by her ability to manage the craziness that was going on around her - flowers showing up, lunch getting set up, the photographer everywhere, unannounced family members stopping by, etc.  All the while, she was calm and focused on what she was doing.My makeup when I was finished was exactly what I wanted - simple, elegant, and understated.  I literally didn't feel as though I had any on.  And even when tears came later in the day, nothing on my face was ruined.  I just carried tinted lip gloss for touch ups.Then there was my hair.  WOW!  I am attaching pictures, and you will truly see Holly's array of talent.  I had shown her a few photos in magazines, but didn't expect to get the look of intricacy that I did.  It was BEAUTIFUL.  Our wedding was featured on StyleMePretty and got TONS of comments on my hair.  You can see it here stylemepretty.com/2011/0… I think the best thing about Holly is not only her wonderful, friendly, laid back personailty, but her ability to hone in on what her client is asking for.  She isn't one of those "pick from one of 10 hairstyles" kind of artists.  She never does the same hair or makeup twice because everyone is unique and she showcases their beauty in a way few other artists I have ever seen emulate.  Holly is a bit pricier than many, but her perfectionist outcomes and 20 years of experience completely justify the extra money.  I promise, you will not be disappointed!Thank you Holly for being such a huge part of our wedding day, for making me, my mom and my girls feel absolutely beautiful, and mostly for your friendship and well wishes!

31.description: I had a trial with Holly and she did took the ideas I sent her and created a pretty half up/half down wedding look.  Unfortunately, I didn't end up booking with her, as she had another client interested in my wedding date and I took too long deciding if I was okay just having her for my bridal party (and then some) or to go to a salon where we would have a bunch of stylists handle all of us at the same time.  I would highly recommend her.  She's super sweet and a great listener!  I will definitely use her for any future hair needs!

25.description: Holly was so amazing! She is so pleasant and kind, she worked with me and all my last minute details!  I felt so beautiful on my wedding day, and it lasted all night!I went to her for my Feb wedding, we did the trial in mid Jan.  Makeup was something that I didn't really think of until last minute, and was very happy that she was available!  I read her reviews on Yelp and her website, and decided I couldn't go wrong, and I was right! :)Holly is very professional, she was on time, and she worked with me on pricing.

12.description: I was recently married and Holly did an AMAZING job on both my hair and makeup.  She and her assistant Chris did hair for my bridal party as well.  We had a blast just chatting with them while they did our hair and everyone's hair looked fantastic.  Afterwards a couple of my bridesmaids confessed they wished that they had gotten their makeup done too because they thought mine looked so good.  I have honestly never felt so pretty in my life and I have Holly to thank for that!  I was really afraid that I would end up looking like a clown if I had my makeup done professionally, but Holly and the airbrush make made me look very classy and was not overdone at all. Holly will come to your location and put you at ease before your wedding or special event.  She kept us all on schedule so that we left on time and my hair and makeup lasted through a windy blizzard and several hours of sweaty dancing.  Hire her- you won't regret it!

21.description: Ok, look no further, trust this woman with your face, your hair, your firstborn child!! She has the innate talent to change you into a beautiful Hollywood a-lister!! Yes, even YOU. You will be beautiful yet comfortable..you but better..cannot recommend more!! Reliable, loves what she does and it shows!! Seriously, there is no other!

16.description: Holly was so amazing! She is so pleasant and kind, she worked with me and all my last minute details!  I felt so beautiful on my wedding day, and it lasted all night!I went to her for my Feb wedding, we did the trial in mid Jan.  Makeup was something that I didn't really think of until last minute, and was very happy that she was available!  I read her reviews on Yelp and her website, and decided I couldn't go wrong, and I was right! :)Holly is very professional, she was on time, and she worked with me on pricing.

17.description: I found Holly while researching hair/makeup artists for my October wedding. I had asked several friends for recommendations, read several reviews, etc...but was so excited to talk with Holly because her work looked beautiful everywhere I saw it (her site, blogs, etc.). Holly has been so wonderful to work with! She's extremely responsive, flexible and most of all, cares about your happiness.I had my wedding makeup trial the day that I got my engagement photos taken, and she was so great about taking my feedback into consideration and making adjustments throughout the afternoon. She would offer her recommendations and worked closely with me to create a beautiful look. Holly even touched up my hair so it was fresh and full of body for the photos. The pictures turned out great, and I've received SO many compliments about my hair/makeup.For the wedding, Holly and I did a trial together where she listened to what I wanted and we tweaked the hair style along the way. We were really excited about the overall look and I was thrilled with it on wedding day, too! My friends were in awe of how textured my typical stick straight Asian hair was on wedding day! Holly did a fabulous job of giving me an updo that wasn't updo-y at all!I would highly recommend contacting Holly if you're considering a hair/makeup artist for any occasion.

10.description: I found Holly on Yelp and boy...am I glad I did!  Holly did my hair and make up for my wedding this past weekend.  She also did make up for 3 other girls.  Everyone was extremely happy with Holly's magical talent in transforming all of us to our best selves.  Her technique is excellent.  We all looked beautiful yet natural which is not an easy thing.Holly was exactly on time when she arrived.  She is lovely and her easy going style puts everyone at ease.  She is extremely talented with both hair and make up and I can't say enough about what an incredible job she did.  I would love to work with Holly again for special events in the future.  Thank you Holly!!!!!

11.description: Holly did a last-minute hair and makeup job for me for a photoshoot, and what a great job she did!  I had a basic idea in mind...I wanted something with a bit of 1960s influence without looking too costume-y, and she nailed it!  She uses airbrush makeup which, in my opinion, is the only way to go.  It gives good coverage without looking fake, and it looked great on camera.  The hair was perfect, too.  I've gotten so many compliments on that style.As a bonus, Holly is super sweet and fun to spend time with - I wouldn't hesitate to recommend her!

26.description: Holly did a last-minute hair and makeup job for me for a photoshoot, and what a great job she did!  I had a basic idea in mind...I wanted something with a bit of 1960s influence without looking too costume-y, and she nailed it!  She uses airbrush makeup which, in my opinion, is the only way to go.  It gives good coverage without looking fake, and it looked great on camera.  The hair was perfect, too.  I've gotten so many compliments on that style.As a bonus, Holly is super sweet and fun to spend time with - I wouldn't hesitate to recommend her!

27.description: I found Holly while researching hair/makeup artists for my October wedding. I had asked several friends for recommendations, read several reviews, etc...but was so excited to talk with Holly because her work looked beautiful everywhere I saw it (her site, blogs, etc.). Holly has been so wonderful to work with! She's extremely responsive, flexible and most of all, cares about your happiness.I had my wedding makeup trial the day that I got my engagement photos taken, and she was so great about taking my feedback into consideration and making adjustments throughout the afternoon. She would offer her recommendations and worked closely with me to create a beautiful look. Holly even touched up my hair so it was fresh and full of body for the photos. The pictures turned out great, and I've received SO many compliments about my hair/makeup.For the wedding, Holly and I did a trial together where she listened to what I wanted and we tweaked the hair style along the way. We were really excited about the overall look and I was thrilled with it on wedding day, too! My friends were in awe of how textured my typical stick straight Asian hair was on wedding day! Holly did a fabulous job of giving me an updo that wasn't updo-y at all!I would highly recommend contacting Holly if you're considering a hair/makeup artist for any occasion.

35.description: I was recently married in December, and Holly helped make my wedding day so incredibly special due to her creativity and knowledge.  She did my hair and make up, as well as many of my bridesmaids, and I felt so beautiful on my big day because of her work.  Also, throughout the day, I never even had to touch up (just lip gloss) because of the airbrush technique that she used, and my curls stayed until the very end.  We noticed an evident difference between the bridesmaids who had their make up done by her and the ones who did it themselves.  In the limo, the girls with the airbrush make up looked flawless still, while the others were touching up.Holly works with each person and truly wants an end result that one is not just simply satisfied with.  She wants you to feel like you always dreamed of, and that was evident from the moment of my trial with hair and make up.  I gave her photos at the trial, and she matched what I wanted with such expertise and ease because of her experience.  With a wedding, one has so much to worry about, and my hair and make up was the one part that I did not have a concern about.I highly recommend Holly because she goes above and beyond to ensure your happiness.  She makes you feel comfortable from the second you meet her, and she truly helped make my wedding day a dream come true.

8.description: I loved Holly. I found her from Yelp and with less than a few days remaining before my wedding she took me in as a client, learned what I liked and did the most amazing airbrush make-up job for me. She's very sweet and knowledgeable. I got so many compliments on my make-up that day. Even with all my tears that day my face held up. :-) I highly recommend her. Also I'm African American and she had shades for my skin tone.Melody J (Formerly known as Melody P)

0.description: Holly was absolutely amazing! It was about 1 week until the wedding I had still not booked my wedding hair and makeup! l found Holly on Yelp and saw all her great reviews and decided to give her a call.  She luckily had my day open so I booked her right away! My sister was worried for me since I did not have time for a trial and was leaving it all up for that day.  In the end, I have to say booking Holly was one of the best decisions I made in planning for the wedding.  My makeup was flawless and lasted the ENTIRE night.  She gave my very fine hair extreme volume with a beautiful up-do that I never thought would be possible with my hair! She was also so nice and easy to talk to! Super professional! Holly thank you so much! I loved the way I looked on my wedding day! =)

20.description: Just had a trial with Holly - she is awesome!!!I sent her a few pictures of styles I liked, and she pretty much nailed it.  I was comparing the pictures we took to the original photos I showed her, and the hair and makeup was just like what I envisioned!  She also was great about consulting me every step of the way, asking how I typically do my makeup so the resulting makeup would be better, but not too far off from how I usually look.  Even more than that, she is such a relaxed and fun person.  Exactly the type of person I want on my wedding day - not only will I know that my makeup and hair will be taken care of, but I'll also have such a nice person around to calm my nerves a bit!

19.description: When I got married April 12, 2009 in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, I was lucky enough to have one of my very good friends in attendance who just so happens to be a professional hair stylist and makeup artist. The weather in Mexico was tough...some days it was hot and humid and others it was less humid but very windy. Holly and I had worked together before heading out to Mexico to come up with a few hairstyles that would work in the given climate on my big day. I was very indecisive about what I wanted and Holly was uber-patient with me while she tried various hairstyles. When the big day was upon us, we found that the weather was super hot AND super windy. Knowing how very picky I am about everything, I was a bit nervous that day that I wouldn't love my hair. I had every confidence in Holly that she would do a great job, but again, I'm super picky and know that sometimes pleasing me is a never ending and thankless job! :) I soon found out that I had no reason to be nervous! I loved, loved, loved my hair on my wedding day and Holly's skills far exceeded my expectations! She wasted no time give me a wonderfully modern up-do as she knows I am not a big fan of up-do's. After she finished my hair and makeup, she worked fast and feverishly on the hair and makeup of my bridesmaids. We were being rushed out the door to get to the ceremony and Holly was still finishing her own hair and makeup that she chose to do last...which I thought was very selfless of her. The entire evening she would pop up with lip gloss and powder and bobby pins as everyone was snapping pictures all night long. After the cake cutting ceremony I was left with frosting all over my face and as soon as I turned around, Holly was there with makeup and napkins in hand! I felt quite pampered as Holly was my personal hair & makeup army for my entire wedding day even though she was also a guest at my wedding, too! I would highly recommend Holly Kasprisin for any and all of your beauty needs!!

33.description: I heard about Holly thru a co-worker and looking back on it - was one of the best calls I made.  I got engaged in June and was married in October, so it was fast and furious and Holly and I went thru 3 pre-appts to find the look we liked and she was absolutely wonderful and very talented.  Holly will give you her real opinions (which are right on!) and will also go out of her way to be accomodating for clients.  The day of my wedding, Holly ended up doing way more than was originally booked - she helped with make up, my family and was just an awesome resource for last minute fixes that you're more then likely to have.  Holly is truly professional and reliable and I would recommend her to everyone who wants to cross the "hair and makeup" off their lists - no worries with Holly - she'll be there for you.

2.description: Long overdue review. Worked with Holly for our wedding back in 2011. I have gotten my makeupdone in the past by multiple people and have never been truly happy with the outcome...until Holly.  She did a wonderful job of enhancing my face and personal makeup style while still allowing me to feel like me. Super nice and easy to work with. She has a great team of makeup artists that did an equally wonderful job on my mom and sisters. Highly recommend.

34.description: I was married in Michigan in August 2008. I was running out of time to find a hairstylist for my wedding... I found out that I was a bit picky when it came to hair (I had gone on a trial with someone else and ended up with crunchy ringlets. yikes). Holly was finally recommended to me by a trusted source. I could not have been more thrilled with her creativity, professionalism and unbelievable talent. Any original hair concerns quickly evaporated at our "trial-run" a month or so before our wedding. Holly took the time to look through pictures, ask questions and work her magic....even in the trial. Even when I wanted to change a thing here or there, Holly was SUPER accommodating and never acted frustrated. She took her time to be absolutely certain that everything was perfect on the wedding day. She also did a few of our bridesmaid's hair. Everyone was thrilled. In fact, I was so impressed with Holly, that I recently recommended her for my best friends wedding - and as a bridesmaid, she was just as accommodating and fantastic. I will no doubt be recommending her for my sister's upcoming wedding in the winter. I'm not normally they type of person to write reviews, but she's honestly the best and wanted to share with all those nervous bride-to-bes out there :)

32.description: Hi Holly-Just wanted to thank you for doing my hair and makeup for the wedding on May 8th, 2010.  It was such a pleasure to meet you and your work was beyond belief.  You did a spectacular job of interpreting the style for hair and makeup from the pictures I sent to make it work for my taste.   I did not have to retouch anything all night except a little lip gloss, and we were out till 3 AM.  There is no way to list all the complements I received, but here are a few; "You look like a movie star", "I have never seen you look better", "You look like yourself, only better", "It was the perfect blend of new and old Hollywood."   Our photographers are using the pics for their website-check them out when you get the time.  matthaasphotography.comMy mom's makeup and niece's makeup and hair turned out spectacular as well. It was a great experience getting to hang out in the hotel room and getting ready with everyone.  I would not have changed a thing and it worked out better than I could have imagined! Thanks again.Tricia Sanders Lehman

18.description: I used Holly for my wedding day hair and makeup in June 2011. She was amazing to work with!! The trial was included in my bridal price for the day-of. I told her what I was looking for and she really made me look exactly how I wanted.The girls she brought with her the day of our wedding were great and super talented. All my bridesmaids and my mom and mother-in-law were very happy with the way they looked. Holly and the girls were on time - even at 630AM! They got everyone ready in time and Holly even stayed to ensure I knew how to put my veil in and take it out for the reception. She was still there cleaning up her tools when we left for the ceremony!She does great work and is well worth her price!! I highly recommend her!

13.description: I have booked Holly for the Hair & Makeup for my wedding in November. She was very patient with me and listen to exactly how I wanted to look for my wedding. She is super sweet with a calming presence. This is exactly the type of person I want to be doing my hair and Makeup on my wedding day. I can tell she will help me stay calm too! I added a couple pictures from our engagement photo shoot (Heather Parker Photography) that was done the same day as my hair & Makeup with Holly.

4.description: I cannot say enough about Holly. I contacted her with less than four weeks to go before my wedding and she got to work right away helping me figure everything else. I sent her a picture of the hair style I wanted and not only was she able to translate it, she made it infinitely better. When I sent photos of the hair trial to my family, they asked me if I had hair extensions put in. For someone who has incredibly thin hair, that's about the highest compliment I can get. The hair the day of the wedding, looked even better than the trial. She is a true professional and will not leave until the hair looks perfect! Holly is incredibly easy to talk to, friendly, and all around a lovely person. Everyone in the bridal party loved their hair. I could not have been happier on the day of my wedding. Thank you Holly.

24.description: I was recently married and Holly did an AMAZING job on both my hair and makeup.  She and her assistant Chris did hair for my bridal party as well.  We had a blast just chatting with them while they did our hair and everyone's hair looked fantastic.  Afterwards a couple of my bridesmaids confessed they wished that they had gotten their makeup done too because they thought mine looked so good.  I have honestly never felt so pretty in my life and I have Holly to thank for that!  I was really afraid that I would end up looking like a clown if I had my makeup done professionally, but Holly and the airbrush make made me look very classy and was not overdone at all. Holly will come to your location and put you at ease before your wedding or special event.  She kept us all on schedule so that we left on time and my hair and makeup lasted through a windy blizzard and several hours of sweaty dancing.  Hire her- you won't regret it!

6.description: Holly did my hair and makeup for my wedding.  She is AMAZING!  I didn't want to look like anyone but myself, and she did a great job making me look my best.  I think choosing her is one of the best decisions a bride could make.  You spend so much time getting ready, Holly is definitely the person you want to have with you, keeping you calm.  Her attitude really just makes you enjoy your day even more!  I felt like I looked as amazing in my pictures as I did the wedding day.  She really thinks like an artist - even how the camera will see your makeup.  Her assistants were also great to work with.I could not recommend Holly more!!

22.description: Holly has all five-star reviews for a reason! She's as good as it gets!Holly did my hair and makeup for my wedding, and also worked her magic on my mom and maid of honor. I'm not someone who likes to wear a lot of makeup, and hate it when brides look like their face is painted on. Holly's airbrush technique is incredible. It looks and feels like you have no foundation on -- just perfect skin. When she was done, I looked like myself -- only beautiful and glamorous. And it looked even better in the photos!She also did a fantastic job on my mom and sister, again making them look like more glamorous versions of themselves. And the makeup didn't budge all night. Fantastic all around!

15.description: Just had a trial with Holly - she is awesome!!!I sent her a few pictures of styles I liked, and she pretty much nailed it.  I was comparing the pictures we took to the original photos I showed her, and the hair and makeup was just like what I envisioned!  She also was great about consulting me every step of the way, asking how I typically do my makeup so the resulting makeup would be better, but not too far off from how I usually look.  Even more than that, she is such a relaxed and fun person.  Exactly the type of person I want on my wedding day - not only will I know that my makeup and hair will be taken care of, but I'll also have such a nice person around to calm my nerves a bit!

7.description: I did not end up using holly for my wedding due to her prices. She is an amazing artist just did not fit my budget.

36.description: When I got married April 12, 2009 in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, I was lucky enough to have one of my very good friends in attendance who just so happens to be a professional hair stylist and makeup artist. The weather in Mexico was tough...some days it was hot and humid and others it was less humid but very windy. Holly and I had worked together before heading out to Mexico to come up with a few hairstyles that would work in the given climate on my big day. I was very indecisive about what I wanted and Holly was uber-patient with me while she tried various hairstyles. When the big day was upon us, we found that the weather was super hot AND super windy. Knowing how very picky I am about everything, I was a bit nervous that day that I wouldn't love my hair. I had every confidence in Holly that she would do a great job, but again, I'm super picky and know that sometimes pleasing me is a never ending and thankless job! :) I soon found out that I had no reason to be nervous! I loved, loved, loved my hair on my wedding day and Holly's skills far exceeded my expectations! She wasted no time give me a wonderfully modern up-do as she knows I am not a big fan of up-do's. After she finished my hair and makeup, she worked fast and feverishly on the hair and makeup of my bridesmaids. We were being rushed out the door to get to the ceremony and Holly was still finishing her own hair and makeup that she chose to do last...which I thought was very selfless of her. The entire evening she would pop up with lip gloss and powder and bobby pins as everyone was snapping pictures all night long. After the cake cutting ceremony I was left with frosting all over my face and as soon as I turned around, Holly was there with makeup and napkins in hand! I felt quite pampered as Holly was my personal hair & makeup army for my entire wedding day even though she was also a guest at my wedding, too! I would highly recommend Holly Kasprisin for any and all of your beauty needs!!

30.description: I have booked Holly for the Hair & Makeup for my wedding in November. She was very patient with me and listen to exactly how I wanted to look for my wedding. She is super sweet with a calming presence. This is exactly the type of person I want to be doing my hair and Makeup on my wedding day. I can tell she will help me stay calm too! I added a couple pictures from our engagement photo shoot (Heather Parker Photography) that was done the same day as my hair & Makeup with Holly.

3.description: The whole process was easy and wonderful. I thought it was a disaster when my makeup artist was supposed to stay the whole day but got sick left before the ceremony. Holly stepped in and took over my touch ups. She is absolutely amazing. I would definitely recommend.

14.description: What a great experience! I was marriend July 30th and with Holly, Chris and Stephanie's help it was a beautiful experience. My reception venue was a conservatory with no air conditioning. Holly really worked hard to make sure both my hair and make up held up in Chicago humidity. Holly was wonderful coordinating with Chris and Stephanie to assist with my mom and bridesmaids. I could not be happier with my experience. I have recommended her to all of my girlfriends because of her work, personality and organization. Basically, she's awesome! Thanks Holly!

58.description: The thing about Praha is this: nothing is too clean or too dirty. Everything here has a well-worn quality that's a necessary and endearing trait to thrift-shop and flea-market aficionados. You may not find that pristine turn-of-the-century antique piece here, but you will find a carefully curated vintage collection at prices that are comparable to the aforementioned Salvation Army, if not cheaper.What also sets this place apart from the myriad of antique shops on Lincoln is that--unlike the reviewer below--the owners get the whole bohemian-thrifter-small apartment vibe. They stock and sell pieces that most of us will actually use (not just prop in some corner to impress nobody we care about) at prices most of us can afford, and are totally in line with the small-scale, mercurial nature of the urban vintage collector. Let's face it, collecting vintage and antique items may be an investment, but most of us are decorating crappy Chicago apartments and will be turning these pieces over to some other lucky person within a few years. Their stock turnover reflects this practical sensibility. It changes frequently, so it's always worth it to stop by at least once a month to check out the newest acquisitions. As for customer service: Fuhgetabout the one (one!) unhappy-camper reviewer and his nasty, pointedly personal review below and pay attention to the other five-star ratings on here specifically noting the excellent customer service and the kindness with which they greet customers.

56.description: I just popped in here one day and am so glad I did. How CUTE is this store?! They have tons of pieces big and small at great prices. There's vintage mixed in with new, refashioned pieces, even a selection of brand new gifty things. All totally affordable! My favorite piece was a super cool lamp with a mini top hat as a lampshade for $30! There was a beautiful cut glass vase for $14! The owners were sweet too. It's the kind of shop that you feel good about spending money in.

29.description: Todd is a complete joy!  I popped in to look for a gift for a friend and left with my thoughts on a dining room table!  They will be going on a buying trip and I was able to learn more about the items they pick up and when to check out the store when they come back!If you love to travel, be sure to chat with Todd!  I can't wait to go back in!!!

42.description: Praha makes me squeal with excitement.Squeal.Audibly.On every visit I find something I MUST. HAVE. NOW.  Like wrap-it-up-I'll-carry-it-home-on-my-back-like-a-Sherpa-it-must-come-home-with-me-to-live-forever-or-I-will-die!!!!  This is beyond mere "wanting".What has me so lusty?Todd and David, the fantastic, wonderful owners (more on them later), take trips around the world - predominantly Europe, "Praha" is "Prague" in Czech - and bring back fabulous pieces: chairs, art, street signs, accent tables, vintage knick-knacks, lamps, books, and other pieces of wonder.  Ohhhh my.  Each piece is unique, each piece would look lovely in my home.  Wandering through the store is an ever-changing adventure.Back to Todd and David.  Have you ever had a conversation with a store-owner and then wanted to take them out to coffee and be best friends forevermore?  Todd and David could meet me for coffee daily.  They are gems.  Todd and I discussed travel (both for work and for fun) and I learned about his history with selecting and importing from near and far.  This guy knows his stuff.  Best part?  I'll be outfitting my home in Todd-and-David treasures without ending up in the red.  Prices = Very reasonable.

23.description: Love this store, love everything inside of it and I love the owner!  When I go to a store I want good service whether I'm spending $20 or $2,000!!!  And that's what you get at Praha, this will be my first stop whenever I'm on the hunt for a new piece!

47.description: Hello 1940's amazing paintings of Roosters!  Yes, you're coming home with me and will live on my kitchen wall.I LOVE this store - its a trek for me but totally worth it.  Its surprisingly affordable for lots of fun new and vintage stuff, and the customer service is simply wonderful!

8.description: Vintage/antique/junk* stores are like candy malt kitten shoppes to me, and I fell in love with Praha several years ago when they were located near Trader Joes (I purchased a bookcase, and (I believe it was David?) delivered it to me for a measly $10). Just recently visited their new location, and they are still one of the very best places to buy unique, quirky items full of character, and at a bizarrely reasonable cost. This is the kind of store where you fall in love with several items, and then you fall in love with the owners - who have no compunctions with pulling up a chair and chatting with you for a good hour about everything from the Quad Cities (where both Todd and my husband are from) to key lime pie martinis. In fact, I think the boys should open up a bar adjacent to the store so discerning shoppers can enjoy a Pims cup or a Tom Collins after making their final purchases.If I weren't moving across the country, I would have bought a gorgeous dark wood dresser for $300, or that kitsch kitchen table with the metal counter, or that rustic coffee table in the front window, or...you know. All of it.Check out the photograph of the lovely kitchen scale I bought - something that won't disrupt the natural order of packed belongings, as I promise I'm trying to get rid of things rather than accumulate them, really.Ahem. So go here, bring your wallet - but no need to stop at the bank, or fill out a second mortgage - and make sure you allocate a little time for shooting the breeze with the owners while you're there.*Difficult to categorise this place, really - more like a beautifully preserved nuclear family time capsule with an abundance of charm and taste than anything else.

31.description: I Love Praha!Great shop for unique, beautiful, cool antique & antique-looking finds - at reasonable prices (**THAT's the key!).  Nice, friendly owners/staff too - chatty and friendly with no sales pressure. I've purchased some amazing bookends here that I adore (bronze lions and golden dogs) - lions for myself, dogs as gifts for others.  They have lots of other nice large and small furniture pieces (dresses, hutches, mirrors, etc. to little trinkets, decor, cards & candles) and many other home items that I would love to buy.

34.description: If you are looking for stylish, used and/or new, very cool vintage, reasonably priced furniture and other home decorating/furnishings, you will not find a better place.  My husband and I are new to Chicago from out-of-state; for the past 1.5 months, we have hit at least 15 antique/salvage/refurbished/vintage furniture stores (all in the West and North/West neighborhodds) looking for exactly what Praha provided.  All of these other places we have come across definitely have beautiful, cool, trendy furniture that I would love to have....if we made twice the amount of our current income, which is totally ridiculous.   The best part about Praha are the owners, who are amazingly nice, down-to-earth, and truly "get" the average person who appreciates great finds.  I wish I could become their bestie for the sole reason that they are hilarious and super easy to talk to.  I am looking forward to heading back there very soon.  I love helping out the small business owner and this has been my fave place to do that so far in Chicago.

16.description: Unlike a majority of antique or thrift furniture stores, Praha was remarkably well organized. It was well curated and had a wide range of items to buy at a very reasonable prices. A majority of the items are in very good condition and there's something interesting for everyone there.

13.description: Took Yelp's advice and ventured to Praha's new location on the first day they were open there (thanks for the quick address update!!). I immediately fell in love with the eclectic merchandise and truly enjoy taking the time to look at everything in the store. After a second visit I purchased an awesome media cabinet that I have just loved! I really appreciated the owners 1) helping me carry the piece to my car and 2) giving me a background on the item I was buying! Also, if you're a fan of this place, you should like them on Facebook. They post pictures of new items they get in (and when the items have sold and I can stop lusting). Great for checking out the store online in between visits!

11.description: I Love Praha!Great shop for unique, beautiful, cool antique & antique-looking finds - at reasonable prices (**THAT's the key!).  Nice, friendly owners/staff too - chatty and friendly with no sales pressure. I've purchased some amazing bookends here that I adore (bronze lions and golden dogs) - lions for myself, dogs as gifts for others.  They have lots of other nice large and small furniture pieces (dresses, hutches, mirrors, etc. to little trinkets, decor, cards & candles) and many other home items that I would love to buy.

39.description: Love this place! i went in yesterday and they have a ton of great stuff. I ended up getting a trunk that I am using as an end table for $60 bucks. The prices are extremelly reasonable and quality is fantastic. I cant wait to come back and pick up some lamps and a couple other things to spruce up the apt. oooh and they have a flat $10 delivery fee, so you have no excuse not to buy as much as possible :)

37.description: Wow.I had been by this place a few times but had no clue what it was until I moved into my new place last summer. Moving from an apartment to a house kind of sucks, because you are burdened with a cavernous empty space and nothing but bachelor-pad accoutrements to attempt to fill it. My co-worker suggested praha for a man of my tastes and I was BLOWN AWAY.the unassuming storefront hides a delicious morass of crazy stuff, mostly  in the vein of shabby/retro/vintage/whatever-you-want-to-call it; in other words, right up my alley. Super eclectic mix of farmhousey-looking stuff, euro-type retro-modern pieces, and super-quirky weirdo furniture, all of it unique and timeless (or let's face it, it wouldn't be there). I scored some cool pieces, including a light fixture that EVERYONE who enters my house immediately wants to buy off me. Additionally, there is pretty interesting selection of vintage knick-knacks, curios, and other assorted paraphernalia to stick on the mantelpiece/end table/whatever of your choosing.The thing I love about this place is that nothing  you get there will ever be a "me-too" piece, ie the same target dresser that all my friends have (a distinctive advantage when trying to sophistication on a 20-something's budget). The owners & staff have an incredible eye for picking out cool stuff so you can save the hair-tearing out at the flea market or thrift store.If only I had unlimited disposable income...fortunately, even my limited income goes a long way at this joint. And now I have a new hobby of bringing my friends here and watching jaws hit the floor.

0.description: Love Todd & David - and I love the store. It's such a charming, homey space. They have so much cute, unique, old stuff at reasonable prices. I bought a lovely side table and some other odds and ends that really brightened my home up. They also stock some delicious local candles. And my favorite is the recycled paint they sell. It's well priced and really easy to paint furniture with. I did a hutch in the "storm cloud" color. I'll update and post a pic when I can.Thank you guys! Will be back when I get the itch for something new and cute.

38.description: This review is very delayed but I first visited Praha over the summer with friends on a day spent antiquing around the area. Praha was our last stop and it was the most successful. Everything in here is my style: shabby chic, french country, refurbished pieces that are trendy now. I need to help back again because as the owner told us the inventory changes often. That was another treat of the visit, the owner was so friendly and helpful and chatted with us for a while making it the best experience of the day.

51.description: We walked by here months and months ago, went in to check it out, and I ended up getting some dining room chairs from here. And then we went back and got a table. And then a buffet...Praha has outfitted our dining room, and if I didn't already have enough furniture for the rest of our place, I'd go here to get it. The owners are helpful, friendly, prices are very good, and they have super-reasonable delivery rates.

27.description: Cool store among the strip of other antique vintage remade-stuff shops in the area.  Bought a few things from this store and the guys working here are cool friendly guys.  We talked with them awhile about random things and liked the shop very much.  If you are looking for unique gift, Praha probably has something for everyone.  Saw some vintage Xmas ornaments in the window, will be buying some this weekend!

32.description: Praha is such a find!  Todd and David have a fantastic eye and their store is packed with reasonable items to add to your home.  Some are vintage finds and some are new cool items, but they will tell you which is which without having to ask.  I stop by here constantly to check on the new arrivals and it never disappoints.  :)

54.description: Could this store be any cuter?!? No, it could not. I want to move into Praha and make myself at home, because that's how you feel the moment you walk through the door.  First off, the name hooked me.  I went to Prague last year and fell madly in love with it.  Anything that reminds me of it will get my attention.  This place is full (as in it's hard to walk around there is so much stuff) with every kind of home decor you can think of, and then some.  I'm not sure if everything is vintage, but it certainly feels like it.  There are large pieces furniture like a red armour I'm dying to own, framed pictures, lanterns, lamps, trays, baskets, and on and on. They also had lots of great random little things like gourmet marinades/sauces, hand soaps, and mixes for dips and soups.  This is the perfect place to come if you are looking for something unique for your apartment (aka non-IKEA).  In addition to the lovely inventory, the staff was super nice.  They were helpful to each customer in the store.  You could tell that they were there if you needed them, but they weren't going to follow you around pretending to know "just what you need!"  The prices vary depending on the item, for example a wooden chair was $125, and then stained glass candle holders were around $8 a piece.  I will definitely be hitting this place up for housewarming gifts, there are so many original items that I can't wait to go back and shop.

48.description: Do you love vintage mixed with new?  Then this place is for you!  This little shop is absolutely adorable and perfect for scoring unique and vintage home decor.  (From furniture to knick-knacks.) The price range at this store is fantastic.  My favorite purchases?  An old-school banker's chair, brass mail holder/sorter, and a tripod Directoire Table (among many other awesome finds).  If I had an endless bank account, I would go nuts in there.  Though some may say the store can be somewhat difficult to walk around in...it is because it is brimming with neat stuff.

44.description: This place is probably my favorite store in the city. I have bought  gifts, furniture, decorations, etc etc here. The guys who own it are fantastic and I love their style aesthetic. It is like a cooler, more indie anthropologie! But buy stuff when you find it -- things don't always stay unsold!

24.description: My favorite antique store in Chicago. Period. A friend recommended it for unique, affordable house goods, but in addition to this the store has the best customer service on the planet. By the time I was on my way out, Todd & David felt like my new best friends. I can't wait for my new media stand to arrive tomorrow!

7.description: I get pretty amped up about little vintage finds in general, so to have a store packed full of things I love is fantastic. Who needs milk and eggs when I can spend all my money on furniture and art?Besides feeling like I'm seconds away from breaking the entire store (I'm clumsy on my own, but it's a pretty tight squeeze in there) it's wonderful. Everything from kitchen goodies like a diner style napkin holder to aprons, furniture and mirrors, to their kid's section is just well put together. I've left there spending anywhere from $7.00-$300 so be really careful or you'll get too excited and end up purchasing a full 1954 living room set. Such a great find.

49.description: I loved this place! I have been searching for a wonderful, interesting gift for my aunt. The store is very small, but packed with surprises! Everything is for sale from the furniture to the customizable "vintage" signs on the wall. The owners were so nice, and let me put my bags behind the register. I ended up buying a great gift for my aunt, just in time for Christmas. I will be coming back for many gifts in the future. Great for gifts, and small furniture pieces.

40.description: Friendly folks selling cheap vintagey furniture, furniture, and bric a brac with a consistent aesthetic. I'd find lots to buy if I lived in the area.
