53.description: I was looking for furniture places.  This one had good reviews, so I put it in my tour schedule. Its more bric-a-brac than furniture.  Lots of soaps and jams and stuff.It's fine for what it is, just not what I'm looking for.  Staff was very nice though.

30.description: They have a cool array of random pieces. Good pricing on furniture and bigger pieces. I liked a lot of the accent pieces they have but thought they were a little over priced for a thrift store.

46.description: I love Praha - there's always something new to check out.  My go-to store for gifts and home accessories - great mid-c furniture too!  The recent haul from the shopping trip to Prague is fantastic - loads of great enameled signs.  Todd & David are the consummate shopkeepers - always handy for a suggestion and a great story.

1.description: These guys are great. We love our new prints!  Thanks again

55.description: New furniture is so expensive! If I could completely furnish my apartment with hand-me-down furniture from my family I would. I love furniture with a history and the pieces I've acquired from my mother are wonderful. But the hand-me-down furniture has run out! That's where Praha comes in. Unique and affordable furniture and accessories that can fit into a number of different styles. The store is thoughtfully arranged with an abundance of merchandise. I purchased a sofa table (which I will use as a desk) last weekend. I plan to be back for future furniture needs. I can also see this a great place to find unique gifts.

9.description: One of my favorite stores, hands down. The owners are truly delightful and I just had a conversation with one of them about our mutual love for lamps. Every time I go in there, I get lustful about one of their lamps, or bookcase, or knickknack. It's a bit of a problem. But the pieces are so unique and the prices are so good -- definitely a fair price for even some of their largest pieces. I highly recommend Praha to anyone looking for a unique item for you or for a gift.(FYI: They move into their new store on Belmont & Leavitt at the end of March.)

26.description: Praha always has good finds and is the easiest antique store to navigate. So much planning goes into the layout of the floor, which makes shopping an incredibly enjoyable experience. Todd and David (the owners) are the absolute best. Not only are they more than willing to help you find what you need, but their knowledge of furniture/decor is incredible. The prices are affordable and the quality unmatched. I will definitely be returning for any future furniture needs.

25.description: i really really love this store. not only does it have absolutely fabulous things you both need and never knew you needed, but the owners todd and david are just fabulous. i'd seriously have them over for dinner. they're always super friendly and helpful and i could quite frankly listen to them talk all day. they have mostly mid century modern items, but their store is definitely not limited to that only. they also have cards, soaps, crates, lighting and nicknacks. they are more than willing to take down dimensions for you and have very reasonable prices. their delivery fees are ridiculously inexpensive--ranging from $10-30 per load, not per item.

12.description: Absolutely love this place. Great antique furniture and home decorations. It is a bargain hunt (some items are way beyond my price range) but it's so worth it when you find THE chair for a deal! CUSTOMER SERVICE here is AWESOME. Todd and David are SO nice and will engage you in a 20 minute conversation--not to coerce you into buying furniture, but because they genuinely want to! I'm a huge fan of this place, and would recommend it to anyone, hands down. =D Oh and they offer shipping services which is nice. Their curbside drop off is only $10 which is VERY reasonable compared to shipping a generic Ikea desk which everyone and their mom's mom has for $100. :)

59.description: So, I'd bought a table in here a few days ago, but had to leave to get later since hubby and I were on our way to get groceries at Trader Joes and were walking the 2.5 miles back to our apartment. Anywho, we came back to Praha today to pick it up and, of course, to browse more. I spotted a gorgeous chair, very reasonably priced, that I had to get (and did).On top of the amazing merchandise, I have to say that the customer service here is unbeatable! Todd and David are both so personable and helpful. They saw that we'd walked over and offered to give us a ride back to our apartment so we wouldn't have to take a cab (which we gladly accepted). Great experience. Great prices. I'll definitely be back.

21.description: i happened to discover praha when i first moved to chicago 5 years ago. i immediately fell in love with these antique tin coffee and tea holders and struck up a conversation about them with one of the owners, todd. 30 minutes later of chatting and finally feeling like chicago was the right place for me, i walked out of praha with the first of many many purchases. Their prices are incredibly reasonable!!! If you like flea markets and vintage home goods, this is the place for you. Todd and David bring in new stuff constantly, so you have to check back all the time - which i do at least once a month.  i bring friends and everyone i know ends up having to have something. i recently purchased a rug and these amazing wire baskets for storage. my friend got this beautiful art deco-ish coat hanger. it's a really fantastic place, do check it out.

17.description: Hello 1940's amazing paintings of Roosters!  Yes, you're coming home with me and will live on my kitchen wall.I LOVE this store - its a trek for me but totally worth it.  Its surprisingly affordable for lots of fun new and vintage stuff, and the customer service is simply wonderful!

10.description: This is one of my favorite stores ever. They always have interesting and unique pieces in here and the prices are a lot more affordable than you would think for a store of this quality. It's a great mix of vintage and new items and the fact that the owners are also completely awesome is a nice perk. It's probably dangerous that this place is right on my corner- I tend to go in when I shouldn't. Their Xmas stuff is going to bankrupt me!

5.description: Great stuff here.  Always worth stopping in to see what's new, or more accurately, what great old things the two owners have found for their shop. There's lots of things to decorate your home or hovel. High quality, rare but never too pricey -- the selection will get your imagination going. This review wouldn't be complete without mentioning the two guys that are Praha.  They're knowledgeable, and fun. Stop in and see for yourself.

3.description: Lots of cool, old shit.  Love this place.  This is true.  I have never gone in here and not walked out with a fabulous find (well I don't walk out without paying for it)!  I have bought gifts for my friends and sisters here.  I've brought stuff for our homes and everything I've brought I've received compliments about how cool, unusual, or funky it is.  Great store.  It's always changing.

35.description: i've been in a few more times since my last review, and i needed to update. i'm growing more and more fond of this place each time i visit, and the owners truly do seem to care about about their customers, neighborhood and community. the store is always so clean, which is always appreciated when trying to treasure hunt. well done guys, keep up what you're doing :)

19.description: Praha makes me squeal with excitement.Squeal.Audibly.On every visit I find something I MUST. HAVE. NOW.  Like wrap-it-up-I'll-carry-it-home-on-my-back-like-a-Sherpa-it-must-come-home-with-me-to-live-forever-or-I-will-die!!!!  This is beyond mere "wanting".What has me so lusty?Todd and David, the fantastic, wonderful owners (more on them later), take trips around the world - predominantly Europe, "Praha" is "Prague" in Czech - and bring back fabulous pieces: chairs, art, street signs, accent tables, vintage knick-knacks, lamps, books, and other pieces of wonder.  Ohhhh my.  Each piece is unique, each piece would look lovely in my home.  Wandering through the store is an ever-changing adventure.Back to Todd and David.  Have you ever had a conversation with a store-owner and then wanted to take them out to coffee and be best friends forevermore?  Todd and David could meet me for coffee daily.  They are gems.  Todd and I discussed travel (both for work and for fun) and I learned about his history with selecting and importing from near and far.  This guy knows his stuff.  Best part?  I'll be outfitting my home in Todd-and-David treasures without ending up in the red.  Prices = Very reasonable.

28.description: Absolutely love this place. Great antique furniture and home decorations. It is a bargain hunt (some items are way beyond my price range) but it's so worth it when you find THE chair for a deal! CUSTOMER SERVICE here is AWESOME. Todd and David are SO nice and will engage you in a 20 minute conversation--not to coerce you into buying furniture, but because they genuinely want to! I'm a huge fan of this place, and would recommend it to anyone, hands down. =D Oh and they offer shipping services which is nice. Their curbside drop off is only $10 which is VERY reasonable compared to shipping a generic Ikea desk which everyone and their mom's mom has for $100. :)

45.description: My new favorite store! I loved almost everything! Truly unique pieces galore and affordable compared to other antique shops.

33.description: I almost don't want to yelp this, since it's a little off the beaten path of Andersonville, making it seem like a hidden gem, but I just love David and Todd, and wish them years of success with their business.  These guys know what looks good and their store is just full of awesome finds at the best prices in the whole city maybe.  The furniture is all spot on, and I love all their candles, art, and new items.

43.description: I fell in love with Praha yesterday! I never stepped in, because to be honest, the storefront never intrigued me. But yesterday my friend and I went for a hunt for some antique finds. Praha has the perfect eclectic mix of different styles from different places and decades. There are some truly great things to find for very reasonable prices. I could have stayed there for hours. Before going to Anthropologie and finding home decor that is mass produced, unoriginal, and overpriced, please check here first. Oh, and the shop-owner was super friendly too. what to look for: -architectural layouts/blueprints that are large scale and really original -all sorts of antique/ aged crates, wood and wire-cute gifts and even some nice new items mixed in like soap and candles- old, sturdy furniture pieces

2.description: This place is fantastic and the owner is such a fun and witty guy to chat with.  I can always find so many cool, one of a kind items here for my home and all at reasonable prices.It's nice not to have generic pottery barn or CB items like all the Joneses do.Over the last few years I've been able to find cute knick-knacks for the house, tables, and an antique Eastlake piece that I'm using as a bar.  This place is a gem and everyone should visit.  Places like this are why I prefer to shop local.

18.description: I was looking for furniture places.  This one had good reviews, so I put it in my tour schedule. Its more bric-a-brac than furniture.  Lots of soaps and jams and stuff.It's fine for what it is, just not what I'm looking for.  Staff was very nice though.

41.description: love love love this place. (and the owners)if you are new t chicago check it out for those personal touches you need in your new apt...otherwise you just need to go there! hours are odd, but who wants to go furniture shopping in the morning. i actually appreciate them being open later! go an explore the amazing finds in furniture, candles, and decorations!

52.description: Praha is a fantastic neighborhood store with wonderful finds at a reasonable price. In addition, Todd and David offer AMAZING customer service. We have owned a Hoosier Cabinet for two years (yes, two years!) and we needed to move it upstairs to make room for another piece of furniture and we needed to move it asap. We live near the store and on whim I thought that they might have a suggestion. Not only did they help but Todd and David came over to our house, disassembled the piece and carried it upstairs to its new location, reassembled it and did this on a moment's notice. We were so amazed and blown away about their wonderfulness, I just had to let all of you know too. Thanks to David and Todd and Praha!

50.description: My apartment is filled with various items from Praha.  Chairs, bookcase, end tables, console table, baskets, clocks, magnets - you want it? they have it or will try and hunt something down for you.  David and Todd are one of my favorite things about this neighborhood.  They take genuine interest in what your looking for and pride in each of their unique items.  Chat withTodd for 20 minutues and you'll feel like you've known him forever!  Absolutely delightful - I'll be in soon, I need a few lamps!

4.description: I just finished reviewing one of the most expensive vintage stores in America that's located in Des Moines.... giving it 2 stars for it's ridiculousness... and I immediately remembered that I needed to review the complete opposite.This place is extravagant.  It's like walking into an incredible showroom of antiques that you start to question are antiques because of how great of a condition they are in and the incredibly reasonable price range that they are at.It's almost like the owners here know they are making a killing with decent prices in a great space so they don't feel the need to hose their customers.A great example of how reasonable pricing was was a really cool vintage globe that they had for sale for $95.  Right down the street, there was the same globe in no where near the same condition at another vintage store for $200.  Praha almost forgets that it could charge a higher premium for things because they are in a trendy neighborhood in Chicago... but that's ok.  Good karma will bless them for their pricing.The woman who was working here when I visited was super nice and loved her job... just a great person who was bright and cheery and great to speak with...And if anyone of you reading this is a regular vintage/thrift shopper... you'll note that Praha doesn't have "THAT SMELL" that every other store has...Vintage stores around the country should wish to be more like Praha... they've perfected the genre.

6.description: I've been shopping at Praha since their last location on Lincoln ave. Now that they have moved onto Belmont ave. (my hood') I couldn't be happier. Many vintage/antique/up-cycle/home furnishing stores are really pricey. That makes their items sit for a LOOOOONG time and it gets "stale". NOT these boys. I'm there at least 2-3 times a month and every week there are always new and gorgeous furnishings. Needless to say they are not helping my hoarding tenancies, but If your going to collect, it might as well be awesome stuff! The prices are also extremely reasonable. A true gem here in Roscoe Village.

22.description: Never been here, but it gets 5 stars nonetheless.  Because I just got off the phone with Todd and he was awesome.  Didn't have what I wanted in stock, but described a piece that is similar of which he will email a picture.  And he described a buying trip they are making in the next week or so to increase inventory.  Isn't good customer service easy?  Well done.

15.description: If you like antique furniture and accessories from around the globe Praha is the place to be.One big advantage is you might never find any thing similar so you definitely know that it's a unique piece.

57.description: Six month later - our apartment is almost fully furnished. Most of of our furniture came from Praha and I am so happy with it! I get compliments on our interior all the time!We bought everything from dining room chairs to sidetables and even our liquor cabinet in this store.For me Praha is still the best place to go for affordable antiques and vintage furniture!

20.description: I visited Praha for the first time yesterday and I will definitely be back!  I've been on an antique/vintage furniture shopping binge for the past two weeks and Praha is one of the best places I've been to!  They have a wide variety and every product has charm to it.  It's not just old junk like some antique places.  One of the owners (I forgot to ask his name - rude of me!) was not only helpful in regards to questions about their inventory, but he was telling me a lot about the new 'hood I'll be moving to.  I will return soon purchase bigger furniture items as well as smaller pieces to decorate.  I was happy to hear that they offer cheap delivery or drop-off service and they will hold some pieces for me for no extra charge!  Overall, a great find!

36.description: This place is great!! They have a bunch of random stuff and you could easily spend an hour in this store. The best part is the customer service! The owners are sooo nice. I bought a desk from them last year, they even helped me move it into my car (err actually moved it for me). When I got home I changed my mind, and they happily let me return it!!! I was shocked. Definitely check this place out.

14.description: This was a really sweet place.I head to boutiques, antique shops, thrift stores, craft fairs.... I'm a fan of finding unique something or others to add a touch to my home or for sake of giving a really unique gift.This is certainly a place to check out :)  Often with many shops I find myself walking in, walking in a big semi-circle and within a few minutes I'm right back out the store.  Some places are just like big garage sales happening in a store, which is the kind of place I very rarely find anything special or of great quality.I spent a good hour here with a friend picking up all sorts of items to see what they do (really cool desk calendar that you spin the numbers and months, a mother of pearl handle magnifying glass, and an old candy machine in really good shape as examples.As well, mixed in with the old was a fraction of new items still keeping in touch with the antique/vintage motif (like some soaps and some paper weights).  I wound up purchasing this really crazy little story book that I recited out loud to my friend in the store.  Upon checking out the gentleman that rung us up talked to us about the author and how his wife published the rest of his books after he died, etc...  Point is the shop keeper was informed, friendly and exactly what you would want from an antique visit.  I will definitely be heading back here from time to time as the inventory changes, it's a sweet little spot for sure.

28.description: This morning, I wanted to celebrate my friends birthday with an impromptu Mani/pedi. After arriving at 10:30, the receptionist informed us that another customer had called, was on her way and that there was only enough staff left to assist one of us. I requested that my friend and I would like to go together, and asked if it was possible since we had arrived first. A flurry of activity ensued to call this other woman and ask how far away she was...taking about 15 minutes. Minutes that could have gotten both of us halfway through the desired service.Then there was in store deliberation (in front of us and other customers) about whether we could or could not stay.The end result was that we were asked to leave. It may have been because I happened to have a gift certificate, and it didn't merit the attention, but I would like to point out that there were two of us...and I like to support local business, so additional services would have been a fun thing to splurge on.My feelings were hurt that an apology for the time inconvenience or inability to stay were not issued.I have always been under the impression that "Walk-in" clientele are not only  welcome, but also the primary mode of operation. I'm also really glad that the nail service industry is doing so well that they can turn people away.I do intend to go back, and I hope that the nail salon will make it right upon our return.I hope to change this to a five star review.

1.description: I will likely never go here again, and if I do, I'll bring cash. When they ran my debit card both my name and ENTIRE card number showed up on a screen in front of other customers.

39.description: I love this new spot! The place is very bright with brand new massage chairs. The kind of chairs I've only seen before in Vegas ( they massage but it's more than just a vibrating sensation, it's like one of those shiatsu machines). The ladies working there are very nice and spent a good amount of time on my pedicure. They also give a neck massage while your polish is drying which some people might find weird but I thought it was good. The price of my pedi was $12 less than on the posted sign which was nice. I also forgot cash and they let me put the tip on the card.

9.description: I had one of the worst mani/pedis of my life here last weekend. I've been going to this 2x10 location for almost 4 years and have continued to do so despite their higher prices, because it is so closely located to my house... Never again. I was assigned to a young man whose behavior was smug, rude, and completely unprofessional. He was so heavy-handed and was actually hurting me as he clipped, filed, and scraped at my cuticles. I asked him to please be more gentle and he rolled his eyes and then started speaking under his breath to the man seated next to him. Then he barely pumiced my feet, barely exfoliated my legs, and massaged the shit outta my calves. The whole experience was SO uncomfortable. As I was transitioning to my manicure, I accidentally smudged one of my toes. I asked him to please fix it and he huffed and puffed. He then had me awkwardly suspend my foot in mid-air while he crouched down and re-touched my nail, all the while making tsk tsk noises and complaining that his back hurt. He even paused to stand up and crack his back. What? How weird!  For a $45 service, this is definitely NOT a luxury experience. After being a regular customer at this 2x10 location for almost 4 years, I will NEVER be returning. Next time, I'll check out the new nail salon down the street.

29.description: Not a fun experience. I got a gift card to here from the cinnamon boutique down the street. Love that place... But if my manicure had not been free courtesy of cinnamon I would not have been pleased at all. The nail technician was not paying attention to my nails instead she was eves dropping on the womans convo two seats over. She was filing the tips of my fingers so much that it hurt and filed my nails down to nothing. Which saddened me because I had spent a long time trying to grow them. She was just not paying attention... Sooo much so that she sprayed her the germicide on her face instead of on my nails. She cut my cuticles and I bled. When she gave me the shoulder massage she pulled on my hair and that was not fun either. Not to mention my color wasn't dark enough and she told me they only do two coats... Most nail salons offer to change it if you hate it.. Right? At least in my experience...So glad I didn't have to pay for this.

23.description: They have a good deal on Mondays.  And they give good massages once they are done withe your treatment. Only think I do not like is that the people are not receptive to conversation. :(

5.description: Bad pedicures and it's not clean. They are inexperienced. Once I talked a friend into going and they cut his foot. Save yourself the headache and don't go here

31.description: I come here every week.  I feel comfortable with every single nail technician, knowing that they will do a phenomenal job.  I recommend this spot to all of my friends and I regularly bring out-of-town guests in as a treat!

25.description: I like this place a lot.  Clean, moderately priced and they give GREAT massages during and after each pedicure.  I will be going back!

12.description: I'm pretty shocked at all the 4-5 star ratings. I don't get my nails done very often, and when I do I go in with the expectation I am not going to be rushed or feel stressed by the reception or nail technician. I was asked to pay before I even picked out a nail color, which was really awkward. The guy at reception watched me struggle with my bag and coat and I ended just throwing them on the empty chair next to me. The pedicure itself was boring. I didn't pay $30 for a color change. I was rushed out the door when it was over. It was just a very stressful situation that I really did not appreciate. Also, I'm not sure if there are nail technician apprentices or something, but there were a handful of girls wearing white shirts and black jumpsuits that did not match anyone else. When I was trying to pick out my color they were hovering over the polishes; it took about 2 minutes before I could actually get my color.

37.description: Saaawweeeeet!! Finally a nice nail spot has materialized for all of the lovely ladies in the Roscoe Village 'hood... took long enough, didn't it gals?I was super excited to see something useful, fabulous and hopefully here for the long haul pop up on my favorite little fun stretch of Roscoe. I've been fervently praying for a Berry Chill, but hey, a clean and modern pretty polish spot still tickles my pickle - uh - and toes just the same!2(x)10 Nails has the goods: a fantastic selection of colors, tranquil massage chairs, super reasonable prices, ridiculously easy street parking, completely clean everything and even downright lovely staff with enthusiastic little fingers to massage your back and neck while you're drying. Ooooh! Ahhhh! Right there! Yeah!  The only thing missing? The inclusion of the now famous 'no chip' manicure... Get on board that train two-by (ok, the name sucks) and you'll give us babes a one way ticket to cloud nine!

21.description: Perfectly acceptable nail salon in my hood. We called to make appointments, and they were very friendly and accommodating. We came in at just the perfect time, right before the Sunday rush.I like my pedicure place to be extremely clean. It makes me feel more assured that everything is sterile. The inside felt kind of dirty; I want them to give their floors a little bit of love. Just sweep 'em up, throw a little pine sol in a bucket and really scrub em.The massage chairs were OK, as was the pedicure. I wish she had spent more time scrubbing my feet with the pumice. Isn't the point of the pedicure to get your feet nice and soft? How can they be soft is she spends a total of 20 seconds scrubbing my heels? They can't be. The massage was good, and they give you a little shoulder massage after you've sat under their dryers. They also had many a color from which to choose, and I believe they have recently gotten their new no-chip OPI nail polish, for those of you in need of the no-chip manicure. Also, they don't let you put tip on your credit card. This gets under my skin, but I try to understand it from their perspective.All in all, an OK experience. I would go back because it is so convenient, and you do get a pretty decent pedicure. It cost $30, which I think is expensive, but that's pretty much a competitive price for Chicago.

16.description: Per other Yelper's reviews who recommended calling in advance, I decided to so that I could avoid any confusion or difficulty even though I always come as a walk-in. Calling never even crosses my mind! They were able to fit me in no problem for a manicure. I am no manicure connoisseur, however, I was satisfied with the service performed. A few other people were getting a no chip manicure, and it looked beautiful! The only strange part of the experience was how quiet the salon is and that both the tv's were playing children's shows when there were no children present in the salon. The quietness combined with the clean decor proved to be more relaxing for me. A manicure is $15. Some other places that I've been to have charged $13-15 for a manicure. In my experience, $15 is the better manicure and worth the extra $2, including here.

17.description: How long does your manicure last? For me, a typical manicure buys me 2 days. I will inevitably chip it, bang my nails on something and/or not be patient enough to wait until my nails dry before I leave and smooth the polish on my keys or my body. So when I looked down at my nails 7 days after my manicure and it was still in tact, I made a note that this was Yelp-worthy. This place is close to my BF's place and I've been here now twice. Both times I have not had a wait, they end up waiting for me to pick my nail color! I'm not much of a talker at these places and that's fine for the staff, they left me alone to the stack of trashy magazines. The pedicure is long lasting - the last one I had lasted over a month - way longer than I should have worn it.

10.description: Great selection of colors. Friendly staff. Always perfectly polished fingers and toes. I really love this place. For me, the shoulder/back rub post mani is a plus. I've seen some people complaining about it, but I consider it an extra perk. Walking in here always decreases my stress level. Highly recommend this place for anyone wanting a great mani/pedi outside of the more expensive salons.

11.description: Perfectly acceptable nail salon in my hood. We called to make appointments, and they were very friendly and accommodating. We came in at just the perfect time, right before the Sunday rush.I like my pedicure place to be extremely clean. It makes me feel more assured that everything is sterile. The inside felt kind of dirty; I want them to give their floors a little bit of love. Just sweep 'em up, throw a little pine sol in a bucket and really scrub em.The massage chairs were OK, as was the pedicure. I wish she had spent more time scrubbing my feet with the pumice. Isn't the point of the pedicure to get your feet nice and soft? How can they be soft is she spends a total of 20 seconds scrubbing my heels? They can't be. The massage was good, and they give you a little shoulder massage after you've sat under their dryers. They also had many a color from which to choose, and I believe they have recently gotten their new no-chip OPI nail polish, for those of you in need of the no-chip manicure. Also, they don't let you put tip on your credit card. This gets under my skin, but I try to understand it from their perspective.All in all, an OK experience. I would go back because it is so convenient, and you do get a pretty decent pedicure. It cost $30, which I think is expensive, but that's pretty much a competitive price for Chicago.

26.description: Oh my first bad review....and I kept trying and trying to like this place. I have only ever continued to go here because it is so close.  After my recent experiences I will spend the extra 10 minutes to go somewhere else.  Not only do they cost $2-$5 more for every service, they don't give extra quality.  In fact, my manicures have always been worse here than cheaper places.  All of my manicures I have gotten here chipped the NEXT DAY if not THAT NIGHT!I decided to try the no-chip and got it twice and it was very nice......THEN on my third time it chipped 3 days later.  No big deal, I understand that it can sometimes happen.  They told me they would redo it for no charge, by the time I went in the next day almost all of my nails had chipped.  (no-chip is supposed to last 2-3 WEEKS and it had been 4 days) They re-did them and the girl who had previously been nice to me seemed very displeased about it and rushed.  I still tipped 20% on the actual cost, cause hey she still had to do all the work and she was not the girl who had done it last time.  Then 5 DAYS later almost all my nails were chipped AGAIN!  I decided to forget about spending the extra $25 on no-chip and just get a regular mani when I went to get a pedicure.  They told me that it would cost to get the no-chip taken off!  After they had done it twice in a week and a half and it still did not meet the guarantee time of the original?!  No way!  They ended up taking it off for free......but then....my manicure chipped THAT NIGHT!!!  I decided to just forget about even going back and asking them to redo it....to much time and hassle.

27.description: Per other Yelper's reviews who recommended calling in advance, I decided to so that I could avoid any confusion or difficulty even though I always come as a walk-in. Calling never even crosses my mind! They were able to fit me in no problem for a manicure. I am no manicure connoisseur, however, I was satisfied with the service performed. A few other people were getting a no chip manicure, and it looked beautiful! The only strange part of the experience was how quiet the salon is and that both the tv's were playing children's shows when there were no children present in the salon. The quietness combined with the clean decor proved to be more relaxing for me. A manicure is $15. Some other places that I've been to have charged $13-15 for a manicure. In my experience, $15 is the better manicure and worth the extra $2, including here.

35.description: The first time I went I only got a manicure and I felt it was rushed and not worth the price. That was also the first week(s) they were open.Went last week for the second time because it was convenient and thought I would give them a try again. MUCH better experience. Ask for Jenny if you like to go solo to relax and just read your magazines and watch whatever is on the TV because you just want to relax and not chit chat. The only I would have wanted more of is stronger more thorough massaging of the calves and feet; although you can pay an additional $10 (or something like that) for ten minutes of just that. I'd definitely go back again! (Plus after you're done with your mani pedi mini massage ... cross the street and finish up with a beer at the Village Tap!) Roscoe's a great neighborhood!

8.description: I get pedicures very regularly, and this was easily one of the worst I've had. To start, they asked me to pay as soon as I arrived. Why would I pay for a service before it is complete? After declining and confirming payment upon completion of my pedicure, I received nothing but attitude from the poorly-coifed man at the reception counter.No one offered to take my coat, and I had to ask to hang it up before it was taken from me. When I sat down, the nail technician tried to roll up my pants. Slow down, we just met. The pedicure itself was meager. The technician paid more attention to my leg massage than my actual pedicure. I went in because the bottom of my feet needed some winter love. She spent approximately 15 seconds on the pumice scrub and she forgot to prune the cuticles on one of my feet. My painted toes look fine. It's nothing to write home about but it's better than if I had a toddler paint my toes. The post-pedi back rub was probably my least favorite part. I realize there are people who probably enjoy that aspect, but I'll pass. My friend wasn't even offered a back rub. My favorite receptionist rudely told us (not asked) to pay because they were closing. Calm down, sassy. Needless to say, I will not be returning and I urge you all to stay away.

0.description: 2 x 10 is my weekly God-send.  The minute I walk in I can feel the stress coming off and now I'm going to walk out feeling refreshed.  Depending on how I feel each week I alternate between the no-chip and regular manis and always get a pedi.  I play soccer every week, and the pedicure lasts for weeks -- in tact.  The personal service here is also impeccable.  Within weeks of switching from my old nail place of choice to this one, the staff already knew my name.  They also let you BYO.  This is great for Friday's after work when you want to unwind with a glass of Pinot with your girl friends.I also want to note, that I don't live in Roscoe village, but downtown.  I happily make the treck up there becaues this place is just worth it.

38.description: ok, they seriously almost had to kick me out of the chair when i popped in for a pedicure last weekend.  This place was great and such a great addition to the neighborhood. I no longer have to trek over to southport for manis and pedis :) YEAH!!!really clean, nice employees, great color selection, tons of mags and of course really great pedicure chairs!

20.description: I would like to give 2 x 10 a better rating, but I simply can't. Got a mani/pedi with one of my besties today. She opted for the 2 week gel nails, and I went for the regular. The experience itself was lovely, comfortable, and the foot, hand and shoulder massage were above the norm. However, I do a pretty good job on my nails myself so my standards are a bit high for the actual end product: well appointed nails. I can't say I got them this trip. Here's why: Some of my nails are filed more roundly than others (I usually go for the squoval - flat top, rounded on the ends) and the polish job is not great. In addition, the tech was very aggressive with my cuticles, and I got nipped. She was sincere in her apology, and took cure of it right away. But this happens far too often to me personally. I'm starting to think I need to request "no cutting." But I digress.I may be too forgiving, but I will give them another shot. I bet if you find a particularly decent tech here, and keep coming back for the same person (or same few people) that would be your best bet. Simply love the 'hood, too. That helps.

19.description: Your average nail spa but with the nail technicians having good hands as they massaged the legs and shoulders. I felt pampered.I did like there selection on colors and may have annoyed them a bit as I couldn't narrow my choice then your normal woman which spots one within minutes. Overall I would go again, I was seated promptly, no correction on nails and they really cleaned under nails. Now, for those ladies who keep writing it's a nail salon bad touch.Here's my advice to ya: At night polish your nail tips with clear polish. I can get away with a color on my hand nails for two weeks. Yup, that's right two weeks it's never failed do it the 2nd night of your manicure. Enjoy!

33.description: Great color selection, amazing pedicures and friendly nail techs.  Will definitely be back.

2.description: Don't go here, they have no idea how to give a pedicure. I finished my service here and went to another nail salon 3 days later to get a REAL pedicure. Thanks but I'll stick to Nail Loft which is 2 blocks past your location.

34.description: How long does your manicure last? For me, a typical manicure buys me 2 days. I will inevitably chip it, bang my nails on something and/or not be patient enough to wait until my nails dry before I leave and smooth the polish on my keys or my body. So when I looked down at my nails 7 days after my manicure and it was still in tact, I made a note that this was Yelp-worthy. This place is close to my BF's place and I've been here now twice. Both times I have not had a wait, they end up waiting for me to pick my nail color! I'm not much of a talker at these places and that's fine for the staff, they left me alone to the stack of trashy magazines. The pedicure is long lasting - the last one I had lasted over a month - way longer than I should have worn it.

32.description: I heart this place! I have been going to 2X10 in Roscoe Village since they opened. I recently got married and got my mani/pedi there. Some girl friends of mine got me a gift certificate for my wedding mani/pedi, which I used; however, I added the French mani and was not charged the upgrade which was a pleasant surprise I attribute to being a loyal costumer. The staff is always so friendly. Paul knew I was getting married so he made sure that my girlfriends and I all sat together for our services. And I had the BEST French manicure of my life. I last 7 days before it showed any signs of cracking and about 10 days before any chipping occured. WOW! Love this place. Great neck and should massage included with any mani or pedi, you don't have to get a mani/pedi to get the massage  :)

18.description: Saaawweeeeet!! Finally a nice nail spot has materialized for all of the lovely ladies in the Roscoe Village 'hood... took long enough, didn't it gals?I was super excited to see something useful, fabulous and hopefully here for the long haul pop up on my favorite little fun stretch of Roscoe. I've been fervently praying for a Berry Chill, but hey, a clean and modern pretty polish spot still tickles my pickle - uh - and toes just the same!2(x)10 Nails has the goods: a fantastic selection of colors, tranquil massage chairs, super reasonable prices, ridiculously easy street parking, completely clean everything and even downright lovely staff with enthusiastic little fingers to massage your back and neck while you're drying. Ooooh! Ahhhh! Right there! Yeah!  The only thing missing? The inclusion of the now famous 'no chip' manicure... Get on board that train two-by (ok, the name sucks) and you'll give us babes a one way ticket to cloud nine!

13.description: Despite negative reviews and mediocre service, I continued to go to 2x10 nails for its convenient location. I finally paid the price!  After a $55 mani/pedi (incl tip) Friday morning I woke in the middle of the night in pain, BOTH of my big toes red and infected.  I went back on Sat to show them and they were clearly annoyed I was bothering them, their only concern getting me out before customers saw what they did to me. I asked for my money back - and was offered a discount on my next visit.  Next visit??? 3 days later I am still sore and putting shoes on is incredibly painful.  And to literally add insult to injury...the manicure barely lasted one day!  Obviously I will not be going back and I would advise anybody to go elsewhere.

4.description: I think they are starting to cut corners.  I've been coming for 3 years and the quality has become very unreliable.  The last pedicure I got was extremely poor.  The lady rushed through the job even though it was the middle of the afternoon and not busy at all.  She cut the cuticles too short and left the nails too long.  Also the nails had rough corners that snagged on my sheets.  At first the water temperature was too cold and when I asked very nicely if she could warm it a little, she turned the hot water right on my foot and scalded it.  Everything she did she did only barely -- filing, trimming, exfoliating, etc.2x10 is more expensive than other places but it was justified by the mini-back rub that they give you while your nails dried, but this time it wasn't worth it.  I would say it was more of a micro-rub -- it lasted at most 15 to 20 seconds.I'm taking my business elsewhere.

24.description: I have been going here for a year because there really isn't anywhere else in the heart of RV. I think I have finally decided that convenience isnt' worth the bad service. Not to be agist, but I have noticed that the older ladies pay a lot more attention and are less rushed than the younger girls. My cuticles are hardly ever cut down enough, the mani hardly ever lasts and I don't like feeling that I am inconveniencing them when I do a walk in. The last time I did a walk in, it was at 7pm for a mani. They close at 8pm. My nails are super short. They rushed me through the mani, totally skipped the massage and were cleaning everything out from under me and under my feet by 7:45pm. I was really irritated that I never got the massage. I was going to say something but everyone was too busy cleaning to even come near me. The manis/pedis are just ok here and the customer service just isnt that good. I don't recommend as there are a lot of places in the area within a 10-14 minute drive.

6.description: not worth any of the money I spent. Absolutely could have done better myself!First of all, they make you pay upfront and have no where to tip when paying credit. Really?!?, you cant just charge me more so I can tip?...so they send you to an atm down the street that charges $3. I got a pedicure first. One of the main reasons I get a pedicure is to get my heels pumiced. The woman barely rubbed them and the are still in rough shape. Im VERY irritated about that!!next, my manicure. I sat and waited till my nails were dry and sprayed them with quick dry. Lines are all through the polish and two are already chipped!!!! I literally just drove home! what is with nail places lately? they are all so lazy and crappy service. I give up! Every reason I would have gone to salon over doing them myself is non-existent anymore!Do not go here!!!

22.description: Your average nail spa but with the nail technicians having good hands as they massaged the legs and shoulders. I felt pampered.I did like there selection on colors and may have annoyed them a bit as I couldn't narrow my choice then your normal woman which spots one within minutes. Overall I would go again, I was seated promptly, no correction on nails and they really cleaned under nails. Now, for those ladies who keep writing it's a nail salon bad touch.Here's my advice to ya: At night polish your nail tips with clear polish. I can get away with a color on my hand nails for two weeks. Yup, that's right two weeks it's never failed do it the 2nd night of your manicure. Enjoy!

15.description: I have been to this salon a few times in the past, but this afternoon the nail technician did not clean the nail tools between customers!I saw her bring over my cuticle trimmers and start right on the lady's feet beside me!I am absolutely disgusted! There are germicide containers and high heat germ killers right on the counter behind me but she choose not to use them.Her mistake, I will not be coming back here again.

40.description: The Ladies that work here are very nice, and it's great to have a nail salon on Roscoe Street (why didn't someone think of this sooner??)Also I like that they make a box of nail tools, file and buffer, to be used only on you, its a nice touch.

7.description: I've fallen victim to a few issues here on multiple occasions: 1. Overbooking 2. 40-something-year-old women throwing temper tantrums -- Relax and please realize adding services onto your pedicure pushes other people's appointments back. Also, remember that the men and women providing you with a service have lives too and maybe want to go home. (I witnessed a woman complaining until she got her manicure even though they were booked through the night. Then, she brought a friend back with her at 10 minutes until close.) Roscoe Village's first world problems combined with an awkward massage make it pretty hard to relax here.

36.description: I have been there 4 times and every time I kick myself in the butt for going again. The pedicure was too rough, again. I asked her not to be too rough and I am not sure she understood. She cut my toenails WAY to short which made the filing very uncomfortable (this was the second time that happened to me there). I asked for a French Manicure and was disappointed. I asked her to use one color but she insisted on the other which I ended up not liking. I suppose I could have been more stern but by this time I thought.... who cares, never again. It is pretty much the same pricing as the Nail Bar and I never have a bad experience there. I guess somethings are worth another few blocks for.

30.description: I have been to this salon a few times in the past, but this afternoon the nail technician did not clean the nail tools between customers!I saw her bring over my cuticle trimmers and start right on the lady's feet beside me!I am absolutely disgusted! There are germicide containers and high heat germ killers right on the counter behind me but she choose not to use them.Her mistake, I will not be coming back here again.

3.description: I got here weekly for a manicure and monthly for a pedicure and always have a great experience! Always on time and relaxing. Great place to stop at before brunch on roscoe.

14.description: I would like to give 2 x 10 a better rating, but I simply can't. Got a mani/pedi with one of my besties today. She opted for the 2 week gel nails, and I went for the regular. The experience itself was lovely, comfortable, and the foot, hand and shoulder massage were above the norm. However, I do a pretty good job on my nails myself so my standards are a bit high for the actual end product: well appointed nails. I can't say I got them this trip. Here's why: Some of my nails are filed more roundly than others (I usually go for the squoval - flat top, rounded on the ends) and the polish job is not great. In addition, the tech was very aggressive with my cuticles, and I got nipped. She was sincere in her apology, and took cure of it right away. But this happens far too often to me personally. I'm starting to think I need to request "no cutting." But I digress.I may be too forgiving, but I will give them another shot. I bet if you find a particularly decent tech here, and keep coming back for the same person (or same few people) that would be your best bet. Simply love the 'hood, too. That helps.

0.description: I love this place. I never walk out empty handed. Maria and Emily are super sweet. The selection is a little bit of everything - unique, dressy, casual, vintage-y, all of the above. Prices are fabulous.  You can find really designer things for a steal.The store houses other merchandise also, which is nice. And, location is super convenient and near lots of other things. Make a day of it!

58.description: For anyone who does not know what good Mexican food should taste like than this is your place. It is beyond bland and overpriced. I went with my fiancée last night and we laughed after about how bad it was. Her margarita however seemed to do the job but did not discard the fact that the food was terrible. Have you ever heard of seasoning the food, i mean even a little salt would have been nice. Dont waste your time here, we heard from several friends that it was terrible but we like to form our own opinion and now wish we would have listened. So please listen to me cause i wish i listened to them. DONT GO HERE!!

56.description: Boy there are some not so good reviews..not sure why. This place has always delivered on a good meal. The enchilades mole and shrimp fajitas are delicious!I think the service is great too, we always have the same two waitors and they are very attentive.Margaritas are ok, a little watery.Outdoor patio is great on a summer night with the flowers and rope lights, great vibe.

29.description: So so mexican food.  Margaritas were not very good.

42.description: The first time I went here, the food was amazing. I was so excited to move in about 3 houses away.Then I went there twice with other friends.  Very bland and mediocre. I hate to write this because I really want to love this place - especially based on proximity.Margs are good - I always get the Cadillac. If only that would help me appreciate the food more. I usually get empanadas, a mix of enchiladas (I prefer spicy) and queso.  It's fine food and definitely edible - you just have to keep your expectations in line. I do enjoy the patio when it's available.

23.description: The Worst Imitation Overpriced Mexican food on Earth.  The horchata was from a dry mix (with water) they poured into a glass, which separated as soon as it settled.  Food was bland and tasteless.  I have been eating Mexican food for 40 years and it was not ony horrible, but overpriced for the bland crap they slap onto your plate.  They should be ashamed to pass this off as Mexican food.  You know something is wrong, when you don't see any actual Mexican People eating in a Mexican restaurant.  The only way this food would be good is:  a) if you are already drunk, or b) you just don't know good Mexican food,  DON'T EAT HERE - The drinks aren't that good either.

47.description: Can't forget the Frida painting on the wall and the glass doors that lead to the outdoor eating area.  My parents and I have picked this place a lot.  And it is no wonder with the cute bar set up and the fast service.I ordered the garlic eggplant chilled dip.  And they ordered different tortilla cooked entrees with cheeses and red meats.  Simple bottles of cervesas and margaritas for drinks and just a nice little neighborhood place were kids are commonly present.  Lots of tortilla chips and salsa for starters here.  Its fast service and not expensive.

8.description: Ambience is very nice, open, airy, lots of windows, outdoor seating.It's near my home and really had high hopes for it.Unfortunately, the food is awful. Oozing bad tasting oil, meat and enchiladas and all,Otherwise, no taste, just oily goo. Too gross to eat.Prices sky high for Mexican food-35 per person without any drinks, tax or tip.Tried twice, both times bad, so not a fluke.

31.description: If you love authentic Mexican cuisine, this is not the place.  The refried beans and rice appeared to be packaged.  The taco shells were from a box.  In a city where we have more Tortillarias than Mexico city, they choose to use store bought tortillas for the quesadillas.    The prices were high and the overall quality was unacceptable.  The $9 margaritas came in a wine glass-wow!  We will not be back.

34.description: I want to like this place. I love supporting the Roscoe strip restaurants, and the outdoor seating is great. But the food is bland, bland, bland.

16.description: Oh goodness - reading the reviews below - YIKERS.Went to QR last evening on a whim - I don't live in the neighborhood and after 14 years in Chicago - maybe my second cruise down Roscoe Street - my friend picked the place because she wanted to sit outside.There were only 3 tables of diners in such a huge place - but they all looked like they were having fun....so why not!The service was lovely and we ended up CLOSING QR on a Monday night lol - so much fun they were very nice - never asked us to leave etc.The food was super fresh - surprisingly fresh and TASTY - we ordered everything off the vegetarian menu and it was super tasty.Ooooh the margaritas are LARGE and in charge and pack a wallop - I actually had to sip my margarita LOL...ooo weee - can you imagine lol.And spicy - I love spicy and the standard chip-and-salsa salsa was spicy! YUMM! was a good start.So maybe go with a sense of just wanting to hang not expecting a whole lot of attentive service because you just want to sit and chill out and enjoy the quiet neighborhood, eh?I hope QR sticks around because I want to go back!

13.description: Umm .. Don't go here. Can't really put it in words .. It's just bad all the way round. My advice , pick another place.

11.description: They value their own profit over your experience and good food. Overpriced decent food in a nice atmosphere. Also, no free refills on soda - whoops! I paid $6 for a coke :/   Which is fine, except I wish the waitress would have told me she was charging me another $2 every time she brought me a refill. Because I would have said NO! We went here on a Saturday night and found the place mostly empty. This was not a good sign but we were there, so... Chips and salsa when you sit down is great. But beyond that... meh. The waitress was rather terse and I think she wanted to go home. One word answers, not rude, but not friendly. Didn't have the courtesy to explain anything. Just give me your money and go...Food was ok. Everything was about 1.5x as expensive as comparable Mexican restaurants. In sum, this place is just trying to make money off the wealthy Roscoe Village clientele.I won't ever go back.

39.description: After 4 years of living in the neighborhood and being scared away by bad reviews, we were pulled into Que Rico by the sunny weather and ideas of drinking margaritas outside. The service was nice, but slow since it was so nice outside and there were lots of thirsty patrons. The margaritas were just okay, and we even upgraded to the premium ones. The food was just bland as many others have said. Not the worst thing I've ever tasted, but I really like spicy, flavorful Mexican, so if you do too, this might not be the place for you. Prices are also a bit high for what you get, but they do have a decent patio.  We probably won't be back since it wasn't my favorite and was a bit pricy, but the location's great and service was good.

37.description: Margaritas are awesome.  food and service was very enjoyable. Would def go back.

0.description: I went to my brother's birthday dinner at Que Rico. I live right around the corner and have been meaning to give the place a try for awhile now.I can honestly say that there was nothing standout about the meal. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything to write home about. We got two pitchers of margaritas (meh) for the evening. We had chips, salsa, and guac as the appetizer. Seriously, the salsa was the highlight of the night - foodwise that is. The chips were good and the guac was so-so.For dinner, I had the Combo for dinner. The Combo is unlisted on the menu, but you get steak, an enchilada, and mole. Why did Que Rico get three stars when it probably deserves one or two at most? I had a great time with family and the servers were very nice and prompt.

38.description: This place is lovely looking, but the food is another thing. The cook made the food as if he was just trying to rush and send out anything. For over 10 dollars for any dish (Mexican) I was expecting polished extra fresh food, instead it actually looked worse than a local mex. Restaurant basically food was over priced, and the Waiter had to get flagged like a dog just for service. If you have high standards, this place is not for you.

51.description: Very nice atmosphere, very reasonably priced and the food is good.  To be very critical I would say, the food, while good, just lacked serious flavor, something Mexican cuisine is well known for.

27.description: 5 stars all around.  Food, service, atmosphere and decor are all 5 stars.

32.description: Gist of this review: pretty good margarita's and pretty bad food.I don't like to bash on a place until I have been there a few times.  I have now been to Que Rico 4 times and every time I was disappointed.  I ordered shrimp over rice the first time there and ti was extremely fishy, aka old shrimp.  Other times I have been there we had greasy meat and cheese dip and flavorless tacos.  They really need to step up their flavor and quality of food, especially for what they charge there.  Next time I'll just go to the late-night taco shop nearby!  Only redeeming point is their margaritas.

54.description: Come here for the margaritas! I live in the neighborhood and have tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt on too many occasions.  I've come to the realization that their food just plain stinks.  But on the bright side their margaritas are some of the best I've ever had.  STRONG! On a weekend where I feel like letting loose this is where I start my night.  I usually get two pitchers of regular margaritas on the rocks and the bill comes to ~$50 w/o tip.  Me and two or three of my friends are good to go after that.  Outdoor seating is great as well.  And Francisco (one of the waiters) is SUPER nice! We didn't realize they close at 10pm on Fridays (or was it a Saturday?) and we came and sat down at 9:45pm.  When I realized they were closing the kitchen I apologized profusely for making them stay late but they were SO friendly (maybe because we were only there to drink).  Francisco came out with shots on the house and told us all about his kids.  Great man, great margaritas.

48.description: Que Rico can best be summed up as $16 meal that should probably cost around $8.95. If you're going to charge more than $10 or $12 for Mexican (especially lunch) you need to do a little better than mediocre.       Like most of the Rico reviewers I live in the neighborhood (just moved) and was excited to have a Mexican restaurant less than a block from my home. My wife and I went for lunch I had the Arroz Con Pollo  (Mexican Chicken and Rice) . The Chicken tasted pretty good, but the rice tasted like it was from a box. My wife ordered and enchilada which I tasted, not bad, but nothing to write home about.      The atmosphere was is homey bordering on upscale and the service was good, although we were the only ones there.  They have some sort of roof top bar that looks like it might be fun to try in the summer. Don't get me wrong the food wasn't awful, just a bit overpriced ($42 for two people); maybe lunch special would be a good idea.

44.description: We live in the 'hood and have been here several times.  The joint is nearly empty these days and it's SUCH A SHAME!   The food is REALLY TOO MUCH MONEY.  We have had food here that's good, but lately it's just not.  A bowl of soup that should be about $4 was $8 (no chicken in it, very salty).  I really hope that the owners just fix it, it's very convenient and has a nice sidewalk space in summer. It seems like the upstairs should be an amazing outdoor spot-never seen it open The empty restaurant in a busy Roscoe Village area should inspire a second look at what's keeping patrons away.  The food has to be better for us to go back, and no wonder the service is mediocre, has to be tough for waitstaff to make any money when it's not busy.   Dear owners, please don't leave, open the upstairs and give us better food for our money.

24.description: Que Rico may have the best margaritas in the city - also the prices are reasonable and the food is delicious.

7.description: Okay Que Rio........deep breath5stars for margs (Don Julio is a must) 0 (can I say negative?!?!) for food. We have eaten here one time. NEVER. AGAIN. As previous reviews have noted, the food is disgusting. My wife got steak tacos, bland, sub par, and expensive for what it was. I got the veggie burrito.....DEEP BREATH.......it was filled with a frozen vegetable mix, no lie, no exaggeration....peas, carrots, little broccoli, and if that is totally unbelievable get this.....it was covered is what tasted like marinara sauce. I AM NOT LYING. It was so shockingly disgusting I couldn't believe it. Obviously, I made my wife try it to confirm I wasn't having a stroke or something, she spat it out. Flour tortilla....microwave a bag of mixed veggies, dump into tortilla and smother in marinara. WHAT ON EARTH. I have never been to a restaurant where I could literally not eat something for being so gross. My waiter didn't even ask if I had an issue with my uneaten meal. I just wanted to get out of there. Have been back for the margs.

49.description: DONT GO HERE! The food is "so-so" and SUPER EXPENSIVE.Ive been to Que Rico several times and have lways left thinking "well.. ok.. Im not hungry anymore.. but it wasnt great."  Last week was the LAST STRAW. We live on the block so we decided to walk down the street. We walked in and there were a few tables open so we figured the wait woudlnt be that long. WRONG. It took almost 15 minutes to even get a menu!  Once we finally got our food it was about an hour later. We dont drink so we drank diet coke. What they failed to tell us is that they changed their soda policy. 6 diet cokes later.. and after we got the bill.. we found out that each fill up of the diet coke was $2! WTF?  So basically.. for 2 people to have diet coke, veggie enchaladas, and steak fajitas (not even enough steak for the 4 tortillas they give you), OUR BILL WAS $76!!!!!!!   QUE RICO, I WANT MY MONEY BACK! Ill never be back.. and I live in the neighborhood and Ill be telling my neighbors.

40.description: I wouldn't go back. The place seems like it would be nice, but nothing about my experience was better than mediocre. I had a Margarita (whatever the basic house version) and it was awful. Strong, but awful. The must have used the cheapest tequila made, because it was super harsh and bitter. Basically undrinkable. I ordered the steak tacos. They were a bit too chewy (mystery meat?), and they were really bland. Not much flavor at all. For $13 I expect some flavor. The waiter wasn't attentive at all (though he seemed to be pretty busy with outside tables), and I don't expect much.  And one other thing that bugged me. They have these double doors that the staff uses to serve the customers sitting in the outdoor area. If not latched, one of these doors swings all the way open. Over half of the time we were at the restaurant, this door was wide open. Heats the inside, wastes energy. None of the staff seemed to be concerned about it. Maybe their energy bill is why they charge so much for not-quite-mediocre tacos. Everything about this place is lacking. I won't go back.

53.description: Was very disappointed in Que Rico.  The dishes were okay, but I could have gotten similar (or better) for less cost.  They were far too expensive for the caliber of food that was delivered.

30.description: Oh goodness - reading the reviews below - YIKERS.Went to QR last evening on a whim - I don't live in the neighborhood and after 14 years in Chicago - maybe my second cruise down Roscoe Street - my friend picked the place because she wanted to sit outside.There were only 3 tables of diners in such a huge place - but they all looked like they were having fun....so why not!The service was lovely and we ended up CLOSING QR on a Monday night lol - so much fun they were very nice - never asked us to leave etc.The food was super fresh - surprisingly fresh and TASTY - we ordered everything off the vegetarian menu and it was super tasty.Ooooh the margaritas are LARGE and in charge and pack a wallop - I actually had to sip my margarita LOL...ooo weee - can you imagine lol.And spicy - I love spicy and the standard chip-and-salsa salsa was spicy! YUMM! was a good start.So maybe go with a sense of just wanting to hang not expecting a whole lot of attentive service because you just want to sit and chill out and enjoy the quiet neighborhood, eh?I hope QR sticks around because I want to go back!

46.description: The food was excellent! The service was excellent! The drinks were awesome! I can't wait to go back and bring more friends with me to spread the word about this great place!

1.description: This place is right down the street from my house and I've been meaning to stop in for a while now. We came in for an earlier dinner, around 6:30, and I was shocked that the place was empty. There was one other couple leaving, but that was it! I  was really craving a michelada, and was pretty bummed when the server said they weren't able to make me one...what kind of a Mexican restaurant can't make a michelada?! Anyways. I got over it pretty quickly and ordered the chicken enchiladas Suizas which was pretty good. It came out piping hot, and the meat was nice and tender. My boyfriend ordered the chimichanga meal and was not as pleased. He thought his meal lacked flavor and was just overall bland. With so many other Mexican gems in the city, I probably won't be seeking out to try this place again.

55.description: Meh. No bueno. The food is boring and the service wasn't impressive, either. Too bad! Such a good looking place, but it sucks. I'd rather make the jaunt over to El Tapatio any day. Now, that place is good!!!

9.description: Bad bad bad, I can't say enough. No love has gone into this food and the wait staff is terrible. Everything we ordered tasted bad.

26.description: I truly hate to write a bad review, but I have to be honest: It is a mystery to me how this place stays open.I live in the neighborhood and have been there twice.  The food is incredibly bland, to the point of no taste at all.  This is fine for certain cuisine, but not Mexican.The service is awful.  Granted the last time I was there was during Retro on Roscoe, so I understand that it's busy.  However, there was ONE server for the entire restaurant; it's not like it's a surprise when a major festival is going to be on Roscoe, so they needed to consider their guests and staff more people.  We personally witnessed two tables get up and leave because no one even greeted them, and we sat forever waiting for a check.  Part of me wants to give them the benefit of the doubt and go back, but then whenever I drive by, they're either empty or closed, which does not make me want to go in.  With some many other excellent options in the city for Mexican food, this place is not worth it.

25.description: The guacamole was really, really bad.  I think it was pureed; the texture was moussey and it was puce colored.  It kind of tasted like Trader Joe's guacamole, but less flavorful.That said, the enchiladas were good.

12.description: Sometimes following the crowd, you miss the hidden gems. Roscoe Street in Roscoe Village has a fair share of eateries towards Damen. But there is one eating establishment closer to Western. Que Rico! Que Rico! is neither a corner taqueria nor a Latin American style Charlie Trotter's equivalent. It may be the quantity of other restaurants on Roscoe Village closer to Damen that pulls potential customers away from wandering too far west down Roscoe Street.Tortilla soup. Camarones al ajo.The tortilla soup reminded me of the same that I have had in Mexico City. The camarones al ajo was a very appetizing plate of plump shrimp, Spanish rice, frijoles, and salad. I gobbled all of it. And then indulged a slice of cake under caramelized pineapples, a caramel glaze, and a fist size scoop of vanilla ice cream.Que Rico! How nice! How delicious.

59.description: Went here again, due it being really cold and convienient. Had the mole chicken enchiladas and they were reasonably tasty and the margarita was nice and strong. I think the level of spicyness at Que Rico is quite conservative - and those of you who may want their food a little on the hotter side may want to ask for it.Upgrading from 2 to 3 stars, as it was enjoyable. Also this place seems very family friendly which can be convienient for a lot of people also.

21.description: I went with a co-worker one day after work to enjoy the beautiful weather and get some thoughts together for an upcoming meeting.  Great idea, but when the drinks are as strong as they are at Que Rico, don't expect anything productive from that dinner date.The food was mediocre at best, but I learned you come here for the margaritas.  They are as strong as any I have ever had.  It seems like all that's in them is tequila and a little bit of lime.  (I'm glad we walked over from work instead of driving, because we stumbled back.)

17.description: I went with a co-worker one day after work to enjoy the beautiful weather and get some thoughts together for an upcoming meeting.  Great idea, but when the drinks are as strong as they are at Que Rico, don't expect anything productive from that dinner date.The food was mediocre at best, but I learned you come here for the margaritas.  They are as strong as any I have ever had.  It seems like all that's in them is tequila and a little bit of lime.  (I'm glad we walked over from work instead of driving, because we stumbled back.)

10.description: Very basic. I wasn't impressed by anything besides the tortilla soup. Service was alright. Everything about the experience was just okay.

5.description: 2 stars for their quesadilla and it's close to my girlfriends house... yes, that counts because she has a baby and we tried going somewhere walking distance.Anyway, the service was slow, it's overpriced, the menu selection was mehhh, and our waiter wasn't attentive.  The whole time we were there, we never got a refill on water.  Their chips and salsa wasn't good so it made the wait felt even longer.I will not return.

3.description: So my husband and I have lived a half block from Que Rico for almost 2 years and finally decided to give it a try.  The reviews were pretty bad, but I finally convinced my husband that at least we could sit outside and enjoy the weather.  So the busboy was great, he brought us water and chips and salsa and then more chips and salsa as we waited over 20 minutes for a server to even greet us.  When a server was 3 feet away taking the order from the table near us, I said "Can we be waited on please?" no response, i flailed my arms...still nothing.  Ok, weird.  I caught sight of another server, waived my arms to her to try and get her attention...nothing.  Finally the second server came to drop off the food to the table near us and I waived my arms and said loudly, "are you our server?"  It took 23 minutes to be recognized by a server, and we were only served because I was sort of obnoxious.  Makes me sad.  The food was ok.  Nothing to write home about.  I certainly won't come back for really bad service and only ok food.  Maybe I would come back for margaritas in their outdoor space?  If we were ever served, which is not guaranteed.

35.description: I keep hoping that something will happen and this place will get better one day. Such a great spot, but no personality. The food is bland and boring, expensive for run of the mill Mexican, I would actually prefer to have the food from Burrito House.... Please someone help this place, it could be soooo good!!

19.description: I love this place. There is nothing artificial. The sauces are terrific, the guacamole tasty, the margaritas yummy. It's nestled in a quiet part of the city, making it very neighborhoody and great for kids. The staff are very patient and cool. My favorite thing to get are the enchiladas verdes. But the mole is very good too. This is a nice, reliable family restaurant that doesn't disappoint.

28.description: Sometimes following the crowd, you miss the hidden gems. Roscoe Street in Roscoe Village has a fair share of eateries towards Damen. But there is one eating establishment closer to Western. Que Rico! Que Rico! is neither a corner taqueria nor a Latin American style Charlie Trotter's equivalent. It may be the quantity of other restaurants on Roscoe Village closer to Damen that pulls potential customers away from wandering too far west down Roscoe Street.Tortilla soup. Camarones al ajo.The tortilla soup reminded me of the same that I have had in Mexico City. The camarones al ajo was a very appetizing plate of plump shrimp, Spanish rice, frijoles, and salad. I gobbled all of it. And then indulged a slice of cake under caramelized pineapples, a caramel glaze, and a fist size scoop of vanilla ice cream.Que Rico! How nice! How delicious.

45.description: I've eaten here a few times and have generally enjoyed it.  The food is pretty solid--it's authentic.  The salsa is nice and spicy and the margaritas and sangria are both good.  This past Sat. night we were planning to go to El Tapatio with friends, but didn't feel like waiting an hour and 15 minutes so we opted for Que Rico instead--no wait.  I enjoyed my enchiladas verdes although a few bites were cold, which was annoying.  My husband had the enchiladas suizas and found them to be a little bland.  It's better Mexican food than what's available in our neighborhood, but isn't the best out there.

33.description: Que Rico = Que No NoVery cute restaurant - warm orange walls, nice lighting, outdoor patio area - the atmosphere was better than the food.  Came here for a Friday night dinner date after passing by the place many times and wanting to try it.  We sat outside in the enclosed patio area, which was nice, and started with a pitcher of margaritas - a little too sweet, with a lot too much ice in the pitcher.  Food: I ordered the chx chimichanga, the man ordered some kind of exotic sounding spiced chicken / rice dish.  My plate had three small changas with tiny dollops of guac + sour cream, served with mini portions of bland beans, rice, and shredded lettuce.  This was priced and listed as an entree, but really should be considered an appetizer, because that was its equivalent. The man's exotic sounding chx dish turned out to be something on par with what we could easily make at home: cook some rice, add a can of tomatoes + chx.  Voila. With some TLC [ a menu overhaul complete with spices / flavor, fixing of the deteriorating outdoor signs, more on-spot service ] this place could be really nice. Until then, adiós Rico...

43.description: The service is friendly, the atmosphere is superb, but the food is so-so.  Every time I eat here, I keep my fingers crossed that there is a new cook in the kitchen.  The food is bland and over-priced.  However, I would recommend enjoying a summer's evening on Que Rico's patio with drinks and appetizers.

2.description: Absolutely love, love this place!  Have been a regular customer for years, and this is always the go-to Mexican restaurant for me and my friends.  It is an all-around great experience for us every time.  It's also a family-owned place where the family is directly involved, welcoming guests and making sure everything is top-notch.  The atmosphere is a cut-above most other Mexican restaurants, with table cloths and soft lighting.  Very relaxing at the end of a busy day - or week.  The Margaritas are probably the best I have had. Whenever I visit any other Mexican restaurant, I always measure the drinks against the ones served here, and these are usually the best hands down. They are very tasty as they use fresh citrus (not the mix) and are generous on the tequila.  The visit is worth it for the Margaritas alone.  But, the food is also great, from the very fresh and tasty salsa which arrives immediately at the table with warm chips, to anything else my friends and I have ordered from the menu.  We all have high expectations, and none of us have ever been disappointed with a meal here.  Also, don't miss the warm pineapple cake with ice cream for dessert - it is fabulous!When the weather gets warmer, they also have a lovely outside patio which is a great place to unwind and enjoy the evening.  The dining room also has open-air patio doors, so it provides an indoor-seating option in the summer, as well. All in all, if you are looking for a great relaxing evening with good food and drinks, this is the place!

18.description: A nice neighborhood place.  I'm surprised at the poor reviews.  True, you can find more authentic places in the city, but the food here is good, the atmosphere is great, as is the  service.  It's a great place to meet up with friends and have a couple of drinks, appetizers and maybe dinner.I went there again a couple of days ago.  Still good.  Look at the dates of the bad reviews.  I think they have gotten better over the years.

41.description: My friends and I had the urge for some Mexican food. This place looked nice and seemed to have a good atmosphere. That was all it had. The special was a cheese quesadilla for $10. Don't know how you can pass that deal up but I did and ordered tacos. Seemed easy and safe at a 'reasonable' price of $13. The ground beef was red, very undercooked. Unfortunately I didn't notice this right away. One person at the table ordered a Coke; the other two of us drank water. Never was a refill offered for the Coke and we had to ask for more water. The 'waiter' never asked us once how anything was. Not once! All three of us were disgusted and left knowing we will never go back. In short, if you want to overpay for ambience and lousy food, go here. Oh yeah, the music was loud, then turned off, then skipped and wrapped up with a Mexican version of Achy Breaky Heart. No joke. What a poison pit!

52.description: The food isn't excellent - everything seems to have a lot of cheese. It gets 4 stars for the beautiful decor and atmosphere and even better magaritas.
