I have a thing for vintage pyrex bowls, and I've seen quite a few pieces here.I love browsing here once a month or so to find new treasures. I always leave with a stack of books. It's a cheap way to keep my reading habit going.Oh, and my husband was able to put together a Prince William costume last Halloween from stuff purchased here for only $8. Red coat and all!If you hate digging, you'll hate this place. But, if you have some time to kill or want to indulge your book-collecting habit, this is where you should go.

41.description: I read some of the other reviews on this page. Yes it's a little dirty inside, but come on people!  Get serious! Of course it will be a little dirty, they sell sweaters for 75 Cents.  What do you expect?   If you want a nice clean stores to buy used clothes, go to one of those crappy "thrift stores" that sells what I guess should be considered a cool shirt for $20. There are a bunch of em' in wicker park as well as people who can teach you how to be cool. So anyway, Village Discount is great. I have found quite a few amazing items for myself and for my friends. I really like searching threw a tone of stuff to find one great item and this is the place to do that. I've never left without finding at least one great find, usually its more like 5-10 items. Its a cute neighborhood too! I don't have too much experience with the staff. The thing is though, who really goes to a thrift store and expects fantastic customer service.  This isn't some over priced store on Michigan Avenue.  Its a thrift store and I think they do a great job.  I do remember one guy ringing up my stuff and a sweatshirt I bought did not have a tag. Some thrift stores won't let you buy it if that is the case, they put it in the back to be repriced, he just picked a price, asked if I was OK with it, and that was that. This place is not really located in an area that is easy for me to get to, but I still go cause its THAT great. Way to go Village Discount!

52.description: all i got was a $2.50 hoodie after an hour of scour.  an Abba vinyl cover (minus the vinyl) was the next best thing.  rabid selection, needing a redux.  and don't yell at me if i refuse your plastic bag.  it's really not necessary.

50.description: I always forgive this Village more than I should because it's so conveniently located in Roscoe Village.  But I can't think of much I've ever found here that I couldn't get at another, better thrift store.  This Village is totally disorganized, especially the basement (a graveyard of busted suitcases and Cabbage Patch Big Wheels), and the racks are so overstuffed it's hard to browse without your biceps starting to ache.  My suggestion: find the "Better Garments" section and stick to that, quickly browse the housewares and don't go downstairs.  One last hot tip: they DO have a parking lot half a block down the street on Roscoe.

4.description: This is my favorite Village Discount location. I've had better luck here finding good quality work clothes in my size (I'm not exactly small) than I have at other locations (I mostly end up at the Milwaukee location since I'm in the area more often, but I prefer coming here). One weekend not long ago I managed to catch a half-off sale and I think I walked out with 10 clothing items for less than $15.  The basement section is my favorite though and I never leave that area empty-handed.Yeah, the place definitely has that thrift store smell as others here have mentioned, certainly not any worse than anywhere else I've been to, but I've been thrifting for well over 15 years so I barely even notice anymore. YMMV. One thing I must say about this location though, is the employees here are always SO MUCH NICER than other locations, and my trip there tonight is what prompted me to finally write a review. I bought a few delicate & glass items from the basement area, and the woman who was at the register carefully wrapped and bagged them all for me so they wouldn't be damaged in-transit. Everyone has always been pleasant if I've asked for help. Definitely one of my top places to shop.

6.description: (This review is based on a comparison with the Milwaukee location) I saw the reviews for this VDO location and thought "People are just being picky/uppity." I really hate giving mediocre/bad reviews. However, there is a huge disparity between this VDO location and the Milwaukee location. I was excited to find this one near my house because I needed to get some affordable dresses for work. The store had a total of 10 wearable dresses, and they were mostly 80s/90s prom dresses or saris. There is seemingly no coherent organization at times. They do have a solid jacket/coat selection for women. That's about it.I am used to thrifting and the idea of wearing used clothes (and the stains and smells that come with them). HOWEVER, THE BASEMENT SMELLS DANK AS HELL. It reminds me of if a pipe burst in an old woman's closet with dirty socks on the floor.I hope they get a better selection and better smell.

22.description: This place is great! It's in a really convenient location and isn't creepy to go in (which I find is a problem with som thrift stores). It was really well cleaned and I liked how it was set up/organized.My favorite part was the books section since all books are less than $2 each, including my own great finds like best sellers that some one tossed aside. You really have to dig to find any good scores though.

15.description: A little stinky and employees were cranky, but I've found some real gems here (regardless of how bizarre the item I'm looking for may be).

57.description: This place apparently makes more money booting parking violators than it does selling anything.

20.description: I've lived in this neighborhood for years, and somehow never came to Village Discount.  I love shopping but hate spending money, so after brunch last weekend my friend (an expert thrifter) convinced me to go in and shop around.I'm gonna pop some taaaaaags, only got twenty dollars in my pocket....  And for that $20, I got two sweater dresses ($8 each) and a cardigan ($3).  What a deal!  I'm wearing a sweater dress today and already got compliments on it.This place is kind of a hot mess though.  It's pretty disorganized, signage looks like it hasn't changed in 15 years, confusing nomenclature (cardigans called "open sweaters," dress section seemingly not containing dresses?)  Tons of stuff is hideous, I mean hilariously hideous.  You could have a ball here just scanning the racks for oh-my-god-i-can't-believe-somebody-bought-that sweaters.  Very generally speaking, within a section items are color coded, though this isn't super well-maintained.  I mean obviously the shoppers just toss stuff wherever but I'm not sure if anybody is picking up after them.You can find some amazing deals here.  Nothing high-end (not a consignment store, duh), but some really nice like-new clothes for dirt cheap.  I'm seriously starting to wonder why I'd shop anywhere else, ever.  I mean, the aisles are crowded, and there's the heartbreak of finding something adorable and it doesn't fit.  But oh my gosh, if you get a good deal, it will be a GOOD deal.I only looked in women's clothing, noticed they had bras and swimsuits - so I don't know how I feel about that.  I saw lots of kids jammies and bedspreads too.  For a low-income family or just somebody trying to save cash who needs to get some new clothes for their kids, this would be great.  And this would be a great place to get "ironic" t shirts from somebody else's high school!I did see stuff from Aeropostale, Abercrombie, and New York and Co.  Nothing more high end than that.  But I'm already planning my return!!  What  a great place to revamp your wardrobe for pennies.

36.description: Thanks for being the core of my wardrobe for so many years. If you don't mind going through tons of racks in a lot of very smelly aisles then you will be sure to find some gems. Who can complain about 50 cent shirts? I go in with 5 bucks and walk out with a garbage bag of clothes. Sweeeeeet.

14.description: This shop is disorganized and ultra crowded in the clothing department. However, it has a lot of good buys if you have the patience to sort through the stuff.Have furniture too, and you can find good buys. Though I only gave it 3 stars, I think the crowdedness is not a problem to some shoppers.

58.description: Dude, what kind of name is Man-Jo-Vins?? It sounds like a Chinese restaurant with crappy Kung Pao Chicken. Well regardless, it's not Chinese... it's a newly opened hot dog stand type place with a few booths and some counter seating. There may be no fortune cookie for you, but what you can get is a corn dog, cheeseburger, italian beef, italian sausage, grilled cheese sandwich, gravy bread (still haven't figured out what that even is), cheese fries, soft-serve ice cream, and on and on as long as you're maintaining a 'junk food diner' type of mentality.It's good greasy fare and pretty much all we have to offer in the way of encased meats now that Hot Doug has moved West. A small caveat though... their 'Chicago Hot Dog' doesn't boast the typical neon relish that usually scares my intestines to tears anyway. That shit just ain't natural (like a hot dog is?). But it does come with celery salt, sport peppers, dull green relish, tomatoes, onions, mustard and a pickle - oh yeah and a small serving of the fresh cut fries. Not bad for hosting a hangover even if I don't get a fortune cookie.

56.description: Rode past this place for the last couple of months on the bus and never saw it.  I was just walking around the neighborhood today for lunch and wanted something from some place different as there are not a ton of lunch places that are walkable.I went in and was greeted by 2 pleasant women.  So I ordered a Hot Dog and a large chili to go.  The service was very quick, I walked down to the corner and back and my food was ready.The hot dog was plump and covered in the requested mustard and onions.  Their fries seem to be hand cut and were fresh and hot.The chili came in a large bowl and was also very good...your typical diner type chili.With my limited options I will be back but not because of convenience but also because the people were friendly and the food was good.

29.description: Went back here, and it was just as amazing as before.  This place is awesome.  Perfect Chicago hot dogs, and one hell of a pizza puff.

42.description: This place is not very good.  They seem to try to be a Johnny Rockets, but end up being comparable to the Target food court (with higher prices).  The chilli was very ordinary, and the patty in the burger was dry.  At least the place was clean.

23.description: This place has a great story going all the way back to the 50s, but honestly....I'm focused on the present when it comes to the food.$4.99 daily special for a hot dog & soup.  For the quality, its a total bargain.  Tasty hot dog (loaded), incredible fries & decent chicken noodle soup. Coffee was a bit watered down, but maybe I got a bum pot...no biggie.Next time, the home made shakes....

47.description: Great Chicago-style hot dogs and polish sausages, outstanding pineapple shakes, and some of the best fries around!Service can be slow sometimes, but it's definitely worth the wait.  Seating can be tight during normal meal times, but outdoor seating is available during the warm months.

8.description: I was hoping this place would be better. My girlfriend and I went tonight. We ordered a hamburger, chicken tenders, and fries. The burger was pretty soggy, both sides of the buns were falling apart. The chicken tenders were okay (they were the frozen kind which I expected). The fries were the best part--freshly fried with the skin on. The person working was nice, but there were a lot of fruit flies, not very appetizing.

31.description: Yesterday was Super Bowl Sunday, and I found myself headed down Damen Avenue to catch a bus on Belmont to watch the game at a friends home. I suddenly got a terrific urge to get a pre-Super Bowl hot dog with everything on it. I looked around and say a place called Man-Jo-Vin which I have walked past for the past decade without ever going in. I went in, asked the cheerful lady behind the counter for a hot dog to go with everything on it. I got it in a nice paper bag, headed to the Belmont & Damen bus stop, opened the bag, pulled our and unwrapped what looked like a hot dog from an advertising photo; it looked absolutely PERFECT. I started thinking that there was no way it could taste as good as it looks, but I was oh, so, very wrong. After 64 years of earthly existence here in the Windy City, I have finally chomped down into the greatest hot dog I have ever eaten! The bun was perfect, the hot dog was perfect, the condiments were perfect ( no ketchup of course ). I couldn't believe my taste buds. You just have to go in and get one of these hot dogs to believe it. I know I am going back next week to try another hot dog PLUS the Jumbo Beef and Sausage Combo. I have no idea what the Beef and Sausage sandwich will look like or taste like, but if it is even half as good as that hot dog I had on Sunday, they have a customer forever. I think now I can forget about all my youthful UIC sandwich haunts on and around Taylor Street and the Halsted and Maxwell Dog and Pork Chop stands. Next time I visit ( it will be soon ) I am going to take a seat and really savor my next Hot Dog or whatever I buy at Man-Jo-Vin's. How could I have not gone in over a 10+ year span...am I stupid or what.  The best damn hot dog ever...in my opinion. I'll post a review of their Sausage and Beef sandwich next week.

34.description: All around better than average. Nothing here is going to WOW you, but you'll be satisfied and you'll enjoy that you didn't spend $20 on a burger and fries. Clean and with what seems to be employees that were well socialized growing up and have manners. The menu is basic but full of options and the prices aren't outlandish, just typical for Chicago. The beef can be a little on the dry side at times, and the sausage a little over cooked (via the beef-sausage heart clog combo), the fries are awesome. Hand cut and cooked perfectly. I didn't even think about it until now, but like one other reviewer said, veggie-folk, be wary. I'm pretty sure there's nothing there for you other than a crappy salad and sody-pop.

16.description: The food here is pretty good, when you get it.  The service is so amazingly slow.  I've seen paint dry faster than these people can put a chicago style hot dog together.Put a little pep in your step - oh and a smile wouldn't hurt either.i'd give them a 2.5 star overall...

13.description: If you're looking for an authentic beef sandwich, hotdog or burger with crispy yummy fries... This is your place. We love the shakes too.

11.description: My wife and I went to Man-Jo-Vin with our daughter after playing the park nearby last month. We ordered ice cream for our daughter and some fries for us. Instead of cooking us up a fresh batch of fries, the woman behind the counter took some already cooked fries and put them back in the oil to cook again. The fries were disgusting -- the grease just oozed out of them. I have eaten at this place a few times and consider them to be decent hot dog place. The fries this time were terrible and I had to write about it. I could have asked for a fresh batch of fries but did not want to waste my time -- I just won't come back to this place.

39.description: While the food here is delicious, I feel like I need to warn my fellow vegetarians that pretty much nothing here is vegetarian friendly because they use an animal/vegetable fat blend to fry everything in. :(The shakes are super tasty though!! Try a caramel-banana!!! Seriously!

37.description: The f***in Shiznit! Tastiest burger in 3 counties. Jumbo Vienna dogs and fresh cut fries! AND PIZZA PUFFS! Oh yea! Man-jo-vins is super rad and cheap!  MMMMMMMMMM!

0.description: This is one of our favorite neighborhood stops for hot dogs and ice cream after playing in the park. My daughter loves the cheese fries and ice cream, while I am partial to the maxwell or beef. I especially like it when the staff surprises you with a mini soft serve or sample hot cocoa, which was really good.

38.description: Been to this joint a couple times and the food is consisttently good, however the customer service is extremely poor.  I went in last night and the woman at the counter didn't even offer me a hello or how are you, she simply said, "do you know what you want?"  I thought that was weird and I noticed that everything look really clean, so I checked my watch, it was 7:57, and I asked if they were closing.  The girl said yes, they were just about too and then asked if I could come back another time.  I thought that this was incredible rude.  I came into the establishment while the lights were on and the doors were unlocked, and the staff did not want to serve me.  Not a great practice during this economy.  I will not return to this establishment, which is ashame because the fries are top notch.

51.description: The fries are without a doubt their specialty here. They're done "old school", with some of the skins still on. Mmmm. They're perfect!I had the veggie burger, which I found to be very tasty. Reasonable prices, friendly mom n' pop atmosphere.

27.description: Hot dog was solid, fries tasty. Atmosphere a little cluttered inside.

32.description: I came here a couple weeks ago for the first time even though I've passed by often.  I'm glad I made the stop because everything was delicious.  I had to grab the 2 dog special and although I'm not a big fan of french fries, these were too good to pass up.  My brother had the italian beef which is true to form and also great.  Since that time, I went two days in a row!

54.description: Not your average diner...Especially since the name doesn't end in diner like the rest--nor anything easy to pronounce.  Man-Jo-Vin, no clue!  Well that was until I read the Yelp rival's Centerstage bio.  It only goes wayyy back to its 1953 origins when the brothers Manny (Man), Joe (Jo) and Vince (Vin) started it up.  Now it has been completely remodeled and the only dineresque flares are in the tables, chairs, exposed aluminum and clock.  I was just looking for a quick/cheaper place to eat and almost passed MJVs up.  The minute I bit into their hand-cut french fries, I was soooo glad I didn't keep driving.  The fries come right out of the grease causing a crispy outside yet soft a potato-y interior.  I finished them on my way home before I could even take a mouthful of my burger.  My bill at the register also surprised me with a 1/2 pound burger (which looks like a full pound on a bun) with the works, plus the delicious fries for only $5.50!  That's a steal!!!  My new favorite place; especially during Halloween time when the workers dress up with face paint and all.

48.description: Went to Man-Jo-Vins for my second time today. I ordered a chili dog and bought my boyfriend a gatorade out of the cooler. It was quite as cheap as other reviewers have said. It was $6 for just those two items. To my surprise, the cashier decided to give me a small basket of fries for free.My chili dog was tasty and sloppy as it should be. The fries were crisp and not too greasy. I want to go back to try a chocolate malt!

44.description: A solid neighborhood beef/hot dog spot.  The only real complaint I have is very small, and it's that the giardeniera is not too hot (pun totally intended): it's neither too tasty or hot.  However, the beef is good, the hot dogs are good, and the fries are excellent.

24.description: Really nice, high-quality fast food. Hand-cut fries, fresh burgers, and good shakes. They also have some interesting things on the menu like a tamale in a hot dog bun with grilled onions...For fast food, very good! Priced accordingly (higher than normal fast food but not unreasonable).

7.description: Their fries alone would give them four or five stars, but overall, a three will suffice. I've come here twice since my college bff lives so close. The first time I got their Italian beef, which was pretty good! But the price point is quite high, especially since the second time I visited the place I got a cheeseburger which was so obviously from a frozen packet it was a bit off-putting to pay $8 for a meal. I'd probably visit again, just not for their burgers.

49.description: This review is from my 6 year old son.  "I love this place.  It is so good.  I ate there yesterday.  And I love it because it's so close to my home.  And the hot dogs are delicious.  And the apple juice!"Enough said.

40.description: This place is alright, even if it was a little dirty when I visited.  Check it out if you're in the neighborhood and you want a dog.  Not worth a special trip to the area.

53.description: Sometimes you just need your grease! My man and I were pretty bummed when the original closed down and was knocked down. We used to live across the street and the smell of the place would make us drool. We moved away from there maybe 2 years ago and every time we drove by we'd check the space. We were delighted when they finally reopened! Best fries in the city! The rest of the menu is too. I think the prices may be a teeny bit higher than other beef joint in the city but such is the way of Roscoe Village. We don't go there nearly as often as we used to but like I said, sometimes you just need grease!

30.description: The food was mediocre. Shared an Italian beef, pizza puff, and cheese fry none of which were noteworthy...

46.description: We stopped here yesterday for lunch while out Geocaching. The burgers and fries we had were excellent. The fries were nice and hot, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The burgers were tasty and hot! This is not a typical hot dog / burger stand. It is clean and well lit. The bathrooms are so nice you could think you were in a much more upscale place. The prices are not upscale though, so it was really a nice experience. I was at the old Man-Jo-Vin many years ago. It had more of the type of atmosphere I like (typical hot dog joint), but this place blends in very well with the surrounding neighborhood and suits the clientele.

1.description: I would love to give this 3.5 but can't do it..yet.  So I will give it 3.  Went here one evening for dinner after work, as I live in the neighborhood, and it was about a half hour before closing.  I ordered chicken strips and fries (as I was feeling like a kid..at age 27) and paid about $11.  The food was so salty.  That is the biggest thing about it.  Usually fries can be a little salty or even non-salted, but these tasted really strongly of salt.  I like salt, but not quite that much.  The fries though were good, hot and crispy.  The chicken strips were good, hot, a d had a little spice to them.  They were a little crisp on the outside and good on the inside.  Ambiance was nice and the staff were friendly.  Has a very 50's style diner feel to it with the booths, small restaurant, and fun music.  I will go back though and give it another chance, see if maybe it was just an off night.

55.description: I have been there twice.  The prices were too high, the cooks move slower than molasses, and the fries were excessively greasy.I figured for a hamburger joint, they would be fairly fast on a take-out order. No.  They moved like molasses, bumbling leisurely around the grill.  I waited 20 (literally) minutes for a veggie burger and fries once.  I watched them serve other people who got there after me, before they even started on my order.  I figured I should phone it in next time, so I asked for a menu, but they don't even have one.  As far as atmosphere- When I walked up, the outside of the place is stroller city.  The inside was packed with children.  I am sorry to be a hater, but I HATE screaming children running amok.  If your baby starts violently wailing, do you ignore him and  just sit there and finish your hot dog?  Apparently so.  I finally got my overpriced food, and darted out the door.

9.description: Man-Jo-Vin!? Man-Jo-GEM! So, Sunday we were hurting a bit. A tad (VERY) hungover on a rainy Sunday with no groceries in our house...I decided it was time to make our debut at neighborhood mainstay, Man-Jo-Vin. I'd walked by many times, but never quite understood the place...but now I do. NOW I DO. It's localized "fast food" in all its glory. Chicago style hot dogs, chili dogs, tamales (a Tamale boat is a tamale in a hot dog bun, what!?), fries, shakes, pizza puffs...you are craving American junk food? They've probably got it. I tried to be relatively good and ordered the jumbo chicken sandwich. Besides the mayo, it was probably a pretty safe choice. Marinated and cooked fresh, topped with lightly grilled onions, tomato and lettuce and placed atop a lightly toasted bun. We both opted for massive Diet Cokes. Bill rang in at just about $8. Not too shabby! My guy tried to say he didn't want anything, but then proceeded to eat half of my sandwich. He also commented that it was surprisingly good for the somewhat bland nature of a grilled chicken sandwich. What would I come back for? A chocolate shake. A tamale boat. The Chicago style dog combo (TWO!) for under $5. Other things. Whenever I'm hungover again. The place has history (check the pictures on the walls) and a sense of humor (see also: pictures on the walls). The staff was courteous and though not jumping to help me, were certainly adequate. The space is clean with 4 or so booths/tables to sit and enjoy your food and we were joined by a group of little leaguers with their dad (rainout!) and a pair of older gentleman. Everyone wins and Man-Jo-Vin! *Not open late. *Does accept credit cards. *Easy street parking surrounding (watch for rush hour limits) *Fairly cheap for the 'hood! I'm surprised at how much I liked it...in this part of town a good lunch option can actually be a bit tough, but this place has its program on lock down. Now someone please send me a tamale boat on the double!

26.description: Ok....Nanny talking here. So, I took my little ones to this quaint little "mom and pop" stop on our way hme from our "let the kids go crazy and wear themselves out" session at the park today, for lunch. And, all I can say is  these fries were PHENOMENAL!!! Real homemade fries with the very healthy skin still intact...fried to perfection! Burgers! Need I mention the burgers!!!!???  My two little ones gobbled them up do fast my head spun! Strawberry shake was delish! I will be coming back for the recommended chicken sandwich! I can't wait!

25.description: 5-star milkshake! Easily one of the best I've ever had.

12.description: The place is very tidy and the staff is really nice.  I especially like the star wars characters neatly displayed by the counter.  The prices are a little high for a meal so I just ordered a hot dog w/ a San Pelligrino.  It was actually pretty good.  I can't really say much about the food since that is all I tried.  I will go back again and finish this review.

59.description: I stopped in Man-Jo-Vins today, a newer addition to my neighborhood, for a quick and tasty mid-afternoon lunch. The space is small, but mostly clean and cute (think simple retro chairs and booths) and the staff is friendly and fun. I ordered the Chicago style jumbo 1/4 lb. hot dog which came with a small order of hand-cut fries. The dog was juicy and flavorful, and the fries were fantastic. I love fries that aren't so crispy or greasy that they lose their potato-ness, and these fries tasted like seasoned strips of potato. Fries like these are to find, so I'm grateful that they exist in my neighborhood. Or maybe I shouldn't be...too many fries equals too much belly...Anyway, I'll definitely be back to Man-Jo-Vins for their soft serve ice cream, to try out their Polish sausage, and maybe even sample their Italian beef. Except I'll have to go early--they're never open later than 8pm, which in my opinion, isn't late enough--especially since the food they serve would be the BEST drunken antidote on a late Saturday night.Welcome to the neighborhood!

21.description: This is my go-to place for Italian Beef and hand-cut fries.FYI, they are closed on Monday.

17.description: MA-R-VIN at Man-Jo-Vin's. Childhood memories in this place. Kenneth, Kim, Jerry, Susan, Tiffany, Larry, Tony, Michael, etc. All the usual suspects from Audubon elementary school. I felt like Madonna singing, "This used to be my playground"Located on Damen and Melrose Man-jo's has been here since 1953. The team members working here today were here working 20 years ago. Amazing!The place is squeaky clean. Not what it was before. I remember it being bigger as well. Or maybe I am just getting bigger now.It's a much nicer place and my mom and I were impressed with how clean the restrooms were. This whole area had changed from when I grew up here. Now, LET'S TALK FOOD!!!Chicago Style Hot Dogs. This was mom's order.Jumbo Italian Beef with hot peppers. This was my order. We got one To Go for Pops.Great food. Customer service is good. It was nice to reminisce about the good old days. I hadn't eaten here for over 18 years. It was nice to be back.

10.description: I really can't figure out why this place has maintained such good reviews. I've been here three times: italian beef, chicago dog, italian sausage. Each time it was pretty disappointing. Even a mediocre italian beef is worth a couple stars, but I can't give it more than that.

5.description: Still waiting on my food, but wanted to wrote this before I forget.  No one said Hello at all.  It is the most unwelcomed I have ever felt at a burger spot.  It's my first time here and I expected at least a little friendliness.  I'm a server and would never treat my guests like this. The one star is just based on service alone.

3.description: My friend is Chicago born and bred knows and loves a proper Italian Beef. He gives the Italian Beef with sweet peppers 5 out of 5 stars.The service is friendly, the place very clean.I will come back for hand-cut fries. They look good.Three hours later went back for fries--so fresh and tasty and addictive.

35.description: Hungry and headed to a dart bar that had no food, I was looking for a good burger without having to spend $15. Out in the wilderness of Roscoe VIllage, I knew my choices were limited. When I saw the neon light signaling Vienna Beef Hot Dogs, it was like seeing a magical pool of water in the proverbial desert materialize, only this time it was real!The furniture was new, the booths were without slash marks or graffiti that mark more uncivilized parts of the city. I perused the menu and there were hot dogs, italian beefs, burgers, shakes, and all sorts of goodies including corn dog and pizza puff. I decided on a double cheeseburger combo for $7.25 and tax which made it about $8. I sat and waited and there were some kids playing in the background and some other people who ordered too. Food came in short order and I took my food to go. Once I settled into the bar up the street, I unraveled a pretty delicious cheeseburger with grilled onion, which was a pleasant surprise. The cheese seemed like the kind used with cheese fries but I was down for it. There was no ketchup with my friends, but I didn't much care.  Overall good value for what I got, nothing otherworldly but very convenient.

19.description: We stopped here yesterday for lunch while out Geocaching. The burgers and fries we had were excellent. The fries were nice and hot, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The burgers were tasty and hot! This is not a typical hot dog / burger stand. It is clean and well lit. The bathrooms are so nice you could think you were in a much more upscale place. The prices are not upscale though, so it was really a nice experience. I was at the old Man-Jo-Vin many years ago. It had more of the type of atmosphere I like (typical hot dog joint), but this place blends in very well with the surrounding neighborhood and suits the clientele.

28.description: I really wish I didn't like this place. Its a family run place. I can only imagine what its like at their family reunions. Dull and lifeless is the only way I can describe these people. The are absolutely the void of any personality. You would think after a over year of frequenting a small establishment  week after week that they may actually acknowledge us? Nope. Would it kill you to smile or be the slightest bit personable?         Well as much as I despise visiting this freak show of sandwich making zombies,  they do have really good food. Just like their sign says "Just good food" They really mean it. That is ALL that it is.      I have searched high and low for a better Italian beef sandwich and I could not find one. I wanted to, really I did.     So, if you are looking for a good burger or Italian beef, this is the place but may I suggest take out....***UPDATE***I just want to say that 4 years and many burgers and italian beef sandwiches later, they are still the best. We don't go as often as we used to so I no longer expect to be recognized and I have noticed that when we do go in,  they seem a lot more personable. So, that said..... I am upping this to 5 stars. They deserve it. Seriously, best darn sam'ich ever!

45.description: To the reviewer below who asked "Dude, what kind of name is Man-Jo-Vins??" I thought you might want to know the background...Three brothers- Manny, Joe, and Vince, opened the restaurant originally in 1953.  They couldn't decide who to name it after so they went with all three (Man...Jo...Vin!)  Vince was my grandfather.  My family still makes these dishes at our oversized family reunions. farm2.static.flickr.com/…This new version is run by someone who worked in the original.  I happened to come across it a few months ago after brunch in Roscoe Village and was ecstatic because I didn't even know it still existed in any form.  This place is a true Chicago classic- I may be biased of course but if you want authentic Chicago taste with a lot of history- check out the pictures in the back near the restroom- and a friendly atmosphere, I'd really recommend it.Here's what my aunt, Vince's daughter, had to say about it if you want to hear more about the history:"Built in 1953, with all used equipment and no experience by my Dad, Vince and his two brothers Manny and Joe, hence the name Man Jo Vin's. With little money and a dream, Man Jo Vins was born. It started as a hot dog stand where food was served through a window to loyal customers, winters as cold as ice and hot summers. The films of the grand opening of the Damen Ave. store and the little know Laramie store are in the family archives. All the uncles worked at MJV, including Uncle Frank Nuccio who recently passed away. He is loved and sorely missed. Lots of memories for me and my cousins at MJV. My first car was given to me in the parking lot (1961 Chevy, red and white). I am now 60 years old, but always stopped in when i was in Chicago. It made our families and that of the Porter, Nunzio Micelli, very comfortable financially. My Dad sold his share in 1968 shortly after my wedding, and moved to Florida. The only day it closed was for funerals of my Grandmother and Grandfather and my wedding with my name on the marquis announcing the big day. What a thrill!!!! I still remember the pans of beef, the hot dogs steaming, the tamales. We now have family reunions and eat the same food now and it is just as delicious. Thanks for keeping MJV alive!!! And the memories for me...."

33.description: What's there not to love about this corner burger-and-shake shop in Roscoe Village? The food is great, the service is wonderful, and it has such a small-neighborhood feel that you forget you're in the middle of a city. A very popular place for families with small children, but I like it because it is a great hangover cure. This place is an institution!

43.description: My husband and I ate here recently and while it was tasty and clean, it seemed a bit pricey for a burger joint.  No complaints on the service or food though!

2.description: When it's actually open, this place is great! It's family run and though the food takes a little while, it is worth the wait. This place is a throwback to 1950 and offers service with a smile while offering good ole fashioned American comfort food in the form of hot dogs and fries. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

18.description: This place has a great story going all the way back to the 50s, but honestly....I'm focused on the present when it comes to the food.$4.99 daily special for a hot dog & soup.  For the quality, its a total bargain.  Tasty hot dog (loaded), incredible fries & decent chicken noodle soup. Coffee was a bit watered down, but maybe I got a bum pot...no biggie.Next time, the home made shakes....

41.description: So, the customer service is definitely lacking, but everything else about this place rocks.  From the hand-cut fries, to the delicious jumbo vienna beef dogs.  I'll definitely be bringing out of towners here for the best Chicago-style hot dog in the city!

52.description: Just had a perfect polish and fries! The polish was beautifully grilled with the perfect amount of relish, mustard and sport peppers. The fries were delicious, perfectly fried and lightly salted. All this for $3.50! I added a large soda, and including tax, I paid $5.79 for a yummy meal.

50.description: i have loved this place since I was a little girl & we lived across the street! I always get a double cheese burger & fries and love it every time. We make a point to go there every couple of weeks. The only bad thing is all the "nannies" & strollers that are there during lunch as it has become quite a hot spot for the toddlers! If you are in the area definitely stop by & don't forget to order the fries!!

4.description: this review is specifically only for the Italian Beef. ordered my regular prep: dipped w/ hot peppers. the sandwich overall on the dry side w/ both bread & beef too dry. the dip oily which can be ok w/ me but the beef seems not to be soaking in advance of being served here which detracts from taste of beef, bread & sandwich. on the positive side i like the inclusion of the sport pepper in the mix.

6.description: A group of grade school friends and I visited the "old neighborhood" and a trip to Man-Jo-Vin's was a must.  Although it's looks are not the same as back in the 60's the food was every bit as great as we remembered it!  Great Italian beefs.  So glad we added it to the walk thru the area!

22.description: I had heard really good reviews of this place, so I popped in to give it a whirl.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff seems very catatonic, not able to display even the slightest sign of emotion whatsoever.  You won't get small talk, a friendly greeting and even a hint of a smile.  To me, this is somewhat off-putting and makes me wonder what the back story on this place is and why these drones are staffing the front counter as if they are in mourning.  Beyond this, the food is very delicious.  French fries are out of this world.  The Italian beef sandwiches are just as good as many others you'll find across the city.  Burgers and dogs are also done very professionally for a grill joint.  I just wish the workers were a bit more personable and friendly.  It would make things much less awkward and much more enjoyable.

15.description: I had heard really good reviews of this place, so I popped in to give it a whirl.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff seems very catatonic, not able to display even the slightest sign of emotion whatsoever.  You won't get small talk, a friendly greeting and even a hint of a smile.  To me, this is somewhat off-putting and makes me wonder what the back story on this place is and why these drones are staffing the front counter as if they are in mourning.  Beyond this, the food is very delicious.  French fries are out of this world.  The Italian beef sandwiches are just as good as many others you'll find across the city.  Burgers and dogs are also done very professionally for a grill joint.  I just wish the workers were a bit more personable and friendly.  It would make things much less awkward and much more enjoyable.

57.description: If any of you think this is a "newer" addition to the neighborhood, then you must have not lived in the neighborhood that long. This place has been around for ages, it just that the original was torn down a few years back, and rebuilt and reopened recently.  Really shows how long some of you folks have really been around.  ANYWAY... great greasy fast food. I love the hand-cut fries and the burger w/ everything (ask for mayo & relish too) is fantastic. Sure, it's not a Kuma's burger, but who's comparing.

20.description: Man-Jo-Vin!? Man-Jo-GEM! So, Sunday we were hurting a bit. A tad (VERY) hungover on a rainy Sunday with no groceries in our house...I decided it was time to make our debut at neighborhood mainstay, Man-Jo-Vin. I'd walked by many times, but never quite understood the place...but now I do. NOW I DO. It's localized "fast food" in all its glory. Chicago style hot dogs, chili dogs, tamales (a Tamale boat is a tamale in a hot dog bun, what!?), fries, shakes, pizza puffs...you are craving American junk food? They've probably got it. I tried to be relatively good and ordered the jumbo chicken sandwich. Besides the mayo, it was probably a pretty safe choice. Marinated and cooked fresh, topped with lightly grilled onions, tomato and lettuce and placed atop a lightly toasted bun. We both opted for massive Diet Cokes. Bill rang in at just about $8. Not too shabby! My guy tried to say he didn't want anything, but then proceeded to eat half of my sandwich. He also commented that it was surprisingly good for the somewhat bland nature of a grilled chicken sandwich. What would I come back for? A chocolate shake. A tamale boat. The Chicago style dog combo (TWO!) for under $5. Other things. Whenever I'm hungover again. The place has history (check the pictures on the walls) and a sense of humor (see also: pictures on the walls). The staff was courteous and though not jumping to help me, were certainly adequate. The space is clean with 4 or so booths/tables to sit and enjoy your food and we were joined by a group of little leaguers with their dad (rainout!) and a pair of older gentleman. Everyone wins and Man-Jo-Vin! *Not open late. *Does accept credit cards. *Easy street parking surrounding (watch for rush hour limits) *Fairly cheap for the 'hood! I'm surprised at how much I liked it...in this part of town a good lunch option can actually be a bit tough, but this place has its program on lock down. Now someone please send me a tamale boat on the double!

36.description: I realize that this is primarily a hot dog joint, and I owe them a return visit for that much, but the burgers aren't anything beyond a basic fast food experience.  My double cheese was absolutely slathered in ketchup, mustard, and long cooked onions.  It's difficult to eat a burger in a dignified manner, but especially so when you've got onions hanging way out of your mouth.  My preference, tastewise, is chopped raw onions, but that's also a much simpler option for not wanting to look like you're wolfing down a zebra on the Serengeti, too.  The fries were excellent.  Crispy and full.  I'll be back for the dog.

14.description: I had the Italian Beef and it was pretty fantastic, better than most of the Italian Beef I've had in Chicago. Their milkshakes and fries also looked really good, I'm excited to give those a try sometime. The employees are friendly, the place is clean. Overall, it's a very solid restaurant.

3.description: Great intimate venue. You can come here just for the bar area and not see a show if you want. The place is intimate which I vastly prefer over a larger crowd. Cash only. Huge bar. Saw a pop up Amy Schumer show here and it was hilarious and a unique experience that only 200 of us coolest Chicagoans got to see.

1.description: Came here for the first time to see a friend's band play. I don't recall seeing a sign on the outside of the establishment which caused me to waltz past it(my friend had to come outside and flag me down). But let me say, this place is a hidden gem! As soon as I walked in I was really impressed by the overall vibe of the place. They have a good amount of seating in the bar area; bathroom wasn't a nightmare. Thumbs up to the water cooler located right by the entrance. It definitely is a chill place to get a drink with a friend or two. On this particular night after a 2 mile walk, all I wanted was a coke($4). The performance room is amazing. Very spacious and they have theater esq seating! Provides good viewing of the stage area no matter where you plant your booty. All the bands performances sounded great; high five to the sound guy. I can't wait to come here again for another fun filled night of good tunes.

2.description: After months of stalled attempts I finally made the journey: not the quickest journey on public transportation from downtown, but not too far.  A lot of the shows I want to see are on Sunday nights later, which also cramps my efforts.  The old Viaduct space transformed into a music venue like no other in Chicago, with a focus on Jazz, Contemporary Art/Classical, and other innovative/improvisational ensembles.  Following the New Music scene in Chicago, it is a major player in innovative programming, including the creative Spektral Quartet that I heard tonight.  Bar and ability to bring drinks in the open, casual space makes this so much a better venue that more formal halls.  If I only lived next door I would be there all the time.

9.description: Wonderful spot and the the new cornerstone of Chicago's vibrant jazz, avant-classical and contemporary dance scene. Get a drink and see some of the coolest new shit.

10.description: you know nothing.. your corrupted in your own ego.. and you will be set free here.. thought provoking and deeper talent than most will understand the -place is un pretentions and says come ion and be free to not understand what's going on..someday you will ...pure awesomeness by talent scouts/ booking agents.. soooo GOOD!  trust them with your FURTER experience

4.description: great place and great bar--not a lot to add--find parking west of Western

6.description: Great new performance space with a major emphasis on jazz.  There is a picture of Fred Anderson hanging above the bar.  Nice separation of the bar from the listening rooms, as in the Hideout.  There is a selection of different chairs, some of which might be construed as being more comfortable than those at the Showcase...The smaller of the two listening rooms is very intimate, has great acoustics and the feeling is one of the musicians playing in your living room.  Great for all that subtle audience interaction.The cover charge is very reasonable and outstanding programming; musicianship.

11.description: This is the best new venue in Chicago. It has small crowds, an intimate feel, carefully curated acts that are sometimes intellectually and emotionally challenging, other times so much fun that you could almost burst. The owner is one of the programmers of pitchfork, and this place basically gets the acts that are too cool for pitchfork. Obviously, not the place to go to if you're looking for a sports bar and are willing to settle on a concert venue: this is a place for people who are interested in exploring the frontiers of modern culture and seeing how contemporary compositional techniques can reflect our current social/political/moral position in the world.

5.description: Besides being an out-of-left-field performance space, I really have to tip my hat to its dual identity as a speak-easy, with that funky little bar and its esoteric menu of cocktails, all attended to by a skilled bar keep. We went there last night and just did the drinks since we arrived way too late for the show. The shadowy off-ramp street, the scruffy exterior with its mysterious signage ... this is a great place to escape the razzle-dazzle of the City; a new hide out. Drinks are priced economically as well.

7.description: Great bands!

8.description: A great venue to see bands, and interesting bookings.  I went there for a benefit show, so that indicates the owners are philanthropic minded, as well as hip. Love the movie theater style seats.

0.description: THANKS for existing and your contribution to Chicago and music lovers.Great venue.Great musicians.We are lucky to have it in Chicago.How does it compare to the likes of The BimHuis of Amsterdam or Shinjuku Pit Inn of Tokyo, the old Knitting Factory of New York, or Painted Bride of Philly in terms of sound, acoustics, etc.?  It does not -- but the types of people who play here, that alone, warrant giving it a five star.Tonight I was lucky to see Muhal Richard Abrams and Roscoe Mitchell.  For those into Kenny G. , these folks are on the opposite end of the spectrum, and thank the heavens for that....A few months ago they had Peter Brotzman play (whom I have seen perform in a few countries and is one of a kind).These are just a few names of talented performers Constellation brings to Chicago.Highly recommended. Keep up the good work.

58.description: I can't believe that I snoozed on this spot for years and years. One of the best Gyros I've had in my life. Years ago I lived in Greek Town for sometime and this place tops any Greek Town gyro spot. The meat is cooked perfect. if you want it a tad bit crispy--just ask. The pita is always on point!Hands down best Gyro in the Cook Co.

56.description: I miss coming here during lunch.  Hands down the best fries I ever had.  The owner Jimmy still is same always fun to talk to.  All the pictures of the kids at all over the wall. This places hasn't changed much except they delivery now!!

29.description: Big and meaty ! That's for sure Wishin I were there on western !Go cubs

42.description: I used to live very close to this place and frequented them for their gyro platter. Their tzatziki was the best I've had in the city yet. And I love their simple side salad that comes with the plate. I've since moved a few miles away but felt the craving for a gyro so drove, in traffic, back to Big Boys... I was sorely, sorely disappointed to find half filled containers of watery (milky?) tzatziki. So sad. Please don't change your sauce, or better yet, change it back to the thick, garlicky tzatziki I knew and loved. Other than this last time, I've never been disappointed and the staff is very friendly. Ok - one more thing - don't bother with the boiled, non - Vienna or Red Hot hot dogs.

23.description: I just moved to the neighborhood, and I'm glad to have a good Gyros place close.  Jimmy seems like a nice guy who cares about his business.  I have only visited a couple times, but it's good, for what it is.  It's a solid gyros with a good sauce and generous portion of meat.  I also tried a cheeseburger here, it was okay. It's very basic, but still ran me $4 and some change.  I will go back and continue to look for a couple more new items.

47.description: First off, everything on the menu is exceptional from the philly cheese steaks to the gyros. The food taste fresh, juicy, and finger licking good!!!  The service staff is courteous, fast, and  delightful. Jimmy the owner and his son, take great passion in making great food. Hands down this is THE BEST GYROS IN CHICAGO!! This isn't my first time eating at Big Boy's and it will never be my last.

8.description: Absolutely love this place. Locally owned, with the owners usually behind the counter. Super friendly staff. The Chicken Kebab plate is great. Rice and salad are perfect complements.Wife gets the gyro and always says its super good.

31.description: Hands down the best gyro I have ever had here in Chicago. The meat was so juicy and tender it was like butter in my mouth. Paired with fresh onion and tomatoes it was truly a jubilee of flavor.You would be doing your body a disservice if you did not take the opportunity to dine at Big Boy Gyros.

34.description: I love Big Boy Gyros. I started going here while in high school, Lane Tech of course! They have the friendliest staff. Food is served fast. Best Chicago style food, almost anywhere, in the city. Plus the fries are amazing and require no ketchup.  And all of its very reasonably priced. Only advice, avoid during lunch hours during the school year. It gets packed and loud really fast.

16.description: This was the first place in our new neighborhood that we ordered from to eat our first meal in our new home.  The gyros are so tasty and overflowing with meat!  We finally ate there for the first time recently.  It's a family owned place.  Lots of photos of the Lane Tech high school teams decorate the walls.  The wife took our orders and the husband was busing the tables.  We didn't even realize he was there because he was sitting and chatting with another customer for a long time.  They seem to know many of the customers ordering.The Philly cheesesteak was good, but the best were the fresh, perfectly seasoned fries.  The gyros are still the stars of the menu!  Prices are reasonable.

13.description: Big Boy's is awesome! I was in the mood for burgers and stopped at Big Boy's for some burgers and a kebob for my fiancée. She does not eat red meat and when the order came out as gyros by mistake (it happens), the guys made it right immediately. Additionally, the guys were kind and friendly! Big Boy's is now my first choice burger and gyro joint! Thank you!

11.description: Been going here since my years at Lane. Jimmy and his family always provide excellent service, and the cooks always deliver. They know how to keep their customers happy. Faves will always be the gyro (duh!) and cheeseburger combos. Yummy!

39.description: I use to work down the street and came here often. The owner is the nicest person ever!!! The food is good, beef, Steak or chicken sandwich, polish, gyro, seasoned fries are all very good. They always give my kids free ice cream after a meal. Give them a shot and you won't be dissappointed.

37.description: Will never ever go back here again. Would rather go hungry. Ok so I was excited to see a grill type fast ish food restaurant nearby. Went I. To check it out with my bf.   Initially was Barely greeted by the monotone angry about life man upon arrival should have been a red flag. The man / owner I believe stood impatiently as I pondered ( mind you we were literally the only patrons). Ill take a grilled chicken sandwich with jalepenos (extra like dollar charge for the peppers, really? ... Fine. I digress) . I don't remember how much total but remember thinking for what it was, it was overpriced. I realized there was no cheese after he put it on the grill and I had already paid. Asked for cheese he said it'll be a dollar something. Ok fine, a charge for cheese i can understand use the only dollar n change I had to pay. puts the sandwich  on grill. Meanwhile i ask for a cup of water. " we dont give water we have bottles" ummm like 2.50 when i only wanted a few sips to prevent death and dehydration AND i just paid over 2 bucks for a jardinera sprinkle and cheese yeah right at this point id rather lose a finger than give him any more money. He gives sandwich to me still no smile no symbol of giving a **** whatsoever. I ask for some bbq sauce he says that's a dollar. Wowww I chuckle in shock and go " are you joking ? This is now ridiculous" get my sandwich and leave. Mind you all the fees I could probably dismiss and not hold a grudge, just never return, if the guy had not had the ugliest demeanor I've encountered in a while.  Just impolite and seemed angry. I am a new customer. Why would I return if you had zero hospitality ????? That on top of the stupid charges. I will never support this place again. Demeanor

0.description: I love the lady owner from Greece  I feel like I'm in an authentic greek food  location!

38.description: Of all the fast food joints I walked into...Jimmy the owner has it on lock.  He's a quintessential Chicagoan that will talk about sports and politics with a many colorful metaphor then ask you what you want to order.  Love the guy.  He also gives to local non-profits and has a great repoire with the students at Lane, donating prizes and food to their activities.  He's not rude to the ones that do well in school and are respectful.  He's also a stickler on how his food comes out.  He watches the grillmen like a hawk.  Everything here is hot and fresh.  Highlights are the Grecian chicken; plump, juicy and grilled to perfection with that right balance of oregano and lemon.  GREAT gyros.  Always consistent.  This is where real Chicago neighborhood folks go; the kind that don't care about flights of kimchi fries and stuffed french toast pub burgers.  If you come here and don't like it, then run back out to your mommy's arms to cry about it or the closest snitty brunch place, whichever is closest.Yo JIMMY!

51.description: Only come here if you are in the mood for delicious (somewhat greasy) burger, fries, gyro, dogs, and several other GOODIES!

27.description: Had gyro today with a side of rice.Good portion of meat and hot(bonus) but too greasy!Rice just ok! Gave the owner my money and hands me back change,without telling me how much! I think Tom & Jerry's gyros are much better and can taste the fresher meat.....

32.description: Jim is the best. Fantastic chicken Philly and Gyros. The Italian beef is excellent. Ask for it on garlic bread. The fries are always fresh and they use season salt on them. Been going there for about 15 years.

54.description: I have been going to Big Boy's since I was a freshman in highschool. I went to Lane tech and this place is right across the street. It is packed from 11 - 3 but if you are not a student, you have a separate line. Jimmy, the owner, is like family to me and mine. I met him while I was on the football team and he has always been nice to the students. Sure he doesn't take nonsense during lunch but who the hell wants to deal with 1,000 teenagers. Teenagers are assholes. He gets upset at the idiots. The ones who sit around taking table space and don't order a damn thing. I'd be pissed off too. Anyways, the food is amazing. Gyros, burgers, beef and chicken are amazing but the fries are the golden goose here. I have never had fries like these before. Something in the seasoning is amazing. Get the cheese fries and you will be in heaven! I have taken my little brother and sister here and they love Jimmy. He always gives kids free ice cream after their meal and he is super nice to them. He will chit chat with his customers and always remembers you even after years of not seeing you. His place is the best. Definitely a staple in that community.

48.description: It was really good. The food was more than I expected as far as flavor goes. The atmosphere was definitely mom and pop, but I liked it. I will definitely return when I am craving a gyro and have about 1500 calories to spare.

44.description: Love this place! Great food! Great owner!

24.description: Tasty gyro, big portions, fair prices, friendly service, plus a parking lot.  I'll be back for sure.

7.description: Love the new breakfast menu! Nice price, good supporter of Lane Tech and Roscoe Village. Jimmy is a nice guy always positive - " What's up Guys?"

49.description: Got two gyro plate specials, a tamale and an order of fried mushrooms for my husband and I. Maybe it's because we came in before closing or I don't know, but the tamale was extremely dry like it had been sitting out for hours and they nuked it and most importantly NO CUCUMBER SAUCE for our gyros. How the heck do you serve gyros without the sauce?! The only thing that saved this from a 1 or 2 star rating is the Greek salad that came with our gyro plates was really good and the mushrooms were also good. Not that it's really hard to mess up either, but seriously, no sauce with a gyro is a sin! :/ won't be going back anytime soon. Especially not before closing.

40.description: Was at the chase bank decided to try it after reading reviews. I didnt think the fries were that great.  Philly steak was really good, but lacking meat. :( i will still come back to try the chicken philly

53.description: This place is a RIPP-OFF!! I went here because I was working in the Roscoe Village area and I needed a quick bite before my appointment. That's exactly what I got, a bite. Maybe the smallest gyros sandwich of all time. Usually when you get a gyros, you are challenged in finishing the entire thing because of the pile of gyros meat. Not here! The sandwich was really small!! It tasted okay, but the smallness of the sandwich for $6 plus is ridiculous. The final straw, was that they charged me half a buck for a cup of water. Are you serious?!!!

30.description: The gyros is great...it's perfect in terms of being crispy and cut thin but not too thin.  The chicken sandwich is also really well seasoned & juicy & big.  I went here randomly because I was in the area & hungry.   I can't believe I almost went to Wendy's around the corner!  It wouldn't have even been that much cheaper & definitely would not have been as good.

46.description: This is my favorite Gyro place in Chicago.  I love the gyros and I also love their chicken dishes.  The fries are good, nice and seasoned.  But the gyro by itself is enough for me.  The staff is super friendly and know their customers.  I really love this place, simple, quick, and delicious!

1.description: Big Boy Gyros is located in a small strip mall across the streetfrom Lane Tech High School.And, upon entering, I found it to be a small place, there is a smallcounter with stools for seating and 8 tables.. yes, I counted!I was surprised because they really have a pretty great menu, not onlydo they serve some pretty great gyros and other assorted sandwichesbut they have breakfast too!And, props to Big Boy for not putting onions on my gyros like I asked!However, this place seems to be pretty popular with those Lane TechMunchkins and it fills up fast, be warned!Honestly, I took my gyros to go and it went all the way back to Rogers Parkwith me and it still was warm and the meat was tender and the pita softand fluffy..No complaints from me!So, if you are in the area of Addison and Western and want a great gyrosjust head over to Big Boy Gyros..A pretty great little spot in an unassuming little strip mall..Nice guy at the counter too!A nice little find if I do say so myself...

55.description: Their food is really good, and the owners still remember my face four years after I last was seen there. The food is expensive though, and not that big. So you dont get alot of bang for your buck. It is usually very crowded on weekdays during lunch hour because of the local high school.

9.description: They weren't bad, but the pita was pretty small and they did not put any sauce on the meat so it was dry. They threw in a tiny little sauce on the side, which was not enough for me.The staff was super friendly though, so I would probably try them again and just ask for an extra pita and more sauce!

26.description: Some of the best gyros near the north side ! :))) and the fries are freaking addicting ! Tried their home made beef and it was decent. DEFF THE GYRO AND SEASONED FRIES & mozzarella sticks

25.description: This was the first place in our new neighborhood that we ordered from to eat our first meal in our new home.  The gyros are so tasty and overflowing with meat!  We finally ate there for the first time recently.  It's a family owned place.  Lots of photos of the Lane Tech high school teams decorate the walls.  The wife took our orders and the husband was busing the tables.  We didn't even realize he was there because he was sitting and chatting with another customer for a long time.  They seem to know many of the customers ordering.The Philly cheesesteak was good, but the best were the fresh, perfectly seasoned fries.  The gyros are still the stars of the menu!  Prices are reasonable.

12.description: I love coming here, always go for the polish sausage. Jimmy is so nice and always gives my kid some ice-cream! I went to LANE and so I avoid going during the week during peek lunch hours. I have no complaints and will continue coming here as long as they are in business, they are my favorite place for hot dogs and fries ! And let me not forget their shakes too!

59.description: Great food and memorable service.

21.description: Great place! Fast, good, clean, and courteous... Everything you can ask for in a gyro joint. My sandwich was sufficiently overflowing with meat like a good gyro should, with the appropriate amount of onion and tomato thrown in the mix. The tzatziki was good... I do wish it was a bigger container that came with, but I will just order extra next time. Overall, it took care of my gyro craving I had today, in a delicious way.

17.description: The gyros are good, the staff was friendly.   I had a carry-out.  Definitely order another side of sauce with the gyros because they are pretty big.

10.description: I always see big boy and often get tickets by the speed camera right out side their location go 20MPH on school days or suffer the consequences.  It was my first time eating at this establishment so I decided to try their signature dish THE GYROS PLATTER. I got take away per usual. Gyro was excellent. He had both long pieces and short fattys. The tiziki was spot on however I tend to stay away from dairy. Unfortunately by the time I got home the bag was completely wet and fell apart. The fries we soggy and not crispy like I prefer better luck next time I guess. I also had the pleasure of trying the steak sandwich let's just say it was the MVP of my meal the onions were perfectly grilled to where they didn't carmelize so the sandwich was not soggy.Perfectly grilled to medium well. Needless to say I will be back for the steak. This traditional Greek fare has done alright by me...

5.description: Always good food and the restaurant is CLEAN. The owner takes pride in his business and always appreciates regulars. Lunch time during school days is busy since Lane Tech is right across the street, but this place handles it and it's fast. Frequent this place regularly as it is an asset to the neighborhood.

3.description: My business partner & I have been going to Big Boy Gyros at least once a week for the past 6 months. When we were there last week, we topped off our drinks on the way out (they were 1/2 full) and the lady behind the counter said something about a refill. When we went back there today, she charged my partner an extra $1.00 in advance and we laughed and asked what that's all about. She was extremely RUDE and said "I charged you for a refill" and my partner said "in advance? What if I don't want a refill". I said, "seriously, let go somewhere else" and she responded "go ahead". She gave him back his money and said "Go". Turns out she is the owner. Extremely rude. She just lost 2 loyal customers over 5 cents worth of Coke. We will NEVER go back there.

35.description: It's a four star place if you are 17.  The older you get it just goes down hill from there.  It is what it is, grease and fried food.  The city has a million places like this so I don't know if a person would go here voluntarily as a "destination."  It's also kind of pricey...four dollar hotdogs seem extreme.  Nyet...

19.description: The food has always been consistently wonderful with outstanding service! Such a great find.

28.description: Had business on the North side, and had a taste for a gyro.... So I did what this site was created for, and simply Yelped .Found myself about 2 miles from what folks are calling 'the best gyro in Chicago'... So hell yeah!! Off I go!Got the gyro with fries and diet Coke, as a take out order. There was one young man cooking, another man (later I figured was Jimmy the owner) who was carrying on an in-depth conversation with other customers (2 other sets in the restaurant when I arrived at approx. 215pm). I ordered it with the meat 'well done', as I always do with my gyros.Fast forward, there is not a ton more I can say that remains unsaid. Gyro meat very tasty, however I do not feel 'the best in Chicago'. Sauce served on the side, which is actually a great addition.  Fries are good, plentiful and hot.The one lasting memory I take from BBG 's is the owner made it a point to say 'thank you very much, sir' to me as I departed... Even in the midst of his conversation with his guests. He never waited on me/handled my order, so that was a very nice gesture on his part.I recommend BBG, and I'll return for other items when in the area.

45.description: When it comes to this menu and type of food, they are by far the best in Chicago.

33.description: I work down the street and have always been curious about Big Boy's, so I thought I'd give it a try and got the gyro dinner with greek salad, pita and fries for around $9.  Everything was made fresh to order, even the fries were straight from the bin to my box (to-go) ; excellent, crunchy and seasoned just right, by the way.   Good meal, friendly staff and not too expensive.  If you're not into gyros they have a wide selection of Chicago-style eats and burgers, which I'm sure are good, but the gyros were tasty enough to bring me back for more.

43.description: Great old style hotdog/beef place right off of Western.  Been around forever because the serve EXCELLENT food (the gyros are one of the best anywhere).  The owner is great and never forgets you were there before (feel like walking into Cheers!).Love the place!!

2.description: Don't come here for the Chicago Style hot dog, because it's far from that. I received a hot dog with a tiny bit of mustard, a pile of relish, a dusting of onions, 1 pickle slice (not a spear), 1 tiny tomato wedge and one of the smallest sport peppers I have ever seen. This was the first Chicago Style hot dog I have ever eaten where I didn't loose one thing out of the bun to give you an idea of how skimpy the toppings were. Ordered cheese fries, but upon returning home was disappointed to find no cheese on my fries. Only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is because the fries were at least good. Might try going again, but definitely won't be ordering the Chicago dog.

18.description: Classic Chicago fare, with a surprisingly delicious Gyro. They don't skip on the proteins and the service was ultra friendly. Not much more to say say here folks. It's good!

41.description: Great deal on the gyro platter, gyro meat, pita, veggies, fries and greek salad all for under $9, cant beat it!

52.description: def a solid place. went there for the 1st time.a) SUPER CLEANb) Great, and friendly servicec) The gyros is def good stuff. Nice and crispyd) The fries are outstandingBy far, one of the better "fast food" places in the roscoe village/bucktown areas. Thumbs up my friends!

50.description: Great food.  Great service.  Love this place!

4.description: Not too bad. I like this little shop. They have cheap breakfast deals. They aren't that great tasting, but still a better option than the Dunkin Donuts next door. It made my belly full and made me less hangry the morning that I came in, so it serves it's purpose.

6.description: Very rude and insulted my mother because she needed a restroom and they don't have one the food was mediocre at best.

22.description: Been coming here since I started high school at Lane the first year they replaced Paradise Grill in 97-98.  While I don't go here as often as I'd like, the food has always been incredible and Jimmy is on top of making his customers feel welcome.  My thanks for being awesome, man.  You'll always have a customer here, even though I am somewhat infrequent.

15.description: I just moved to the neighborhood, and I'm glad to have a good Gyros place close.  Jimmy seems like a nice guy who cares about his business.  I have only visited a couple times, but it's good, for what it is.  It's a solid gyros with a good sauce and generous portion of meat.  I also tried a cheeseburger here, it was okay. It's very basic, but still ran me $4 and some change.  I will go back and continue to look for a couple more new items.

57.description: No thrills Gyro spot. Can't say I've tried anything else, but why would you if you're going to "Big Boys GYROS?"The owner is super nice and friendly...a true Chicagoan is the only way to describe him. I like that he cooks the gyro meat a little longer so it gets that nice glistening glossy crisp. He has the best tziki sauce around this neighborhood. There's a competitor down the street that offers a gyro special on the weekends but we prefer going to Big Boys because it's so much better.The only thing I don't particularly care for is their Greek Salad. I'll stick to the Gyro and fries here.Hint: Beware during the weekdays during lunch time. All of Lane Tech is in there.

20.description: Real tasty food with more of a homemade style. They put a lot of care and quality into everything, very friendly and would return

36.description: I love Big Boy Gyros.  The co-workers and I get lunch from here all the time!The food is delicious.  The gyros are some of the best anywhere!  I always get a grilled chicken salad, and they put extra chicken on mine "cause' I'm nice and don't mind waiting."  So what?  There's a ton of Lane Tech kids there during lunch hours.  That tells you two things.  The food is good and it's not expensive!What really impresses me is the owner, Jimmy.  He never forgets a customer's face, which is impressive.  He can talk to you about anything!  Really, really nice guy.  I feel good supporting a business run by good people.  Everyone who works there is nice.I'll be back tomorrow...

14.description: Best fast gyros sandwich this side of the city. And the staff is always wonderfully friendly! I always ask for extra seasoning on my fries, and extra tzatziki....because you can never have enough!

58.description: Look, I know these guys already have 66 reviews and they're all five-star reviews.  So I'm being redundant.  Big deal.  They totally deserve it!I went in tonight and got my first tattoo ever, ever, ever.  I've been wanting this tattoo for 14 years (no joke) but never worked up the courage until now.  In fact, I'd probably have found an excuse not to go this time, too, except that three of my best girlfriends decided that today was "it's Kelz' birthday and we're going to spoil her rotten" day.  One of the gifts I received was............a trip to Family Tattoo for my first inking.Enter Matt W.  I wishy-washily explained my long-standing idea to Matt.  Our conversation went like this:Me:  "uh... you know.. I kinda thought this one thing but... I don't know... maybe kind of like that...oh I don't know... uhm :::holds up thumb::: about this size? ish?"Matt:  *skritchskritchskritchonpaper*  "how about something like this?"Me:  "Oh!  Oh!  omg, that's perfect!"Less than an hour later, I walked out with the most gorgeously drawn, perfectly shaded dragonfly and shamrocks on my hip.  I feel totally bad-ass...........cause yeah, I'm inked, baby, and damn, it looks good!If you've never had a tattoo done before but want one, if you're new to the area and looking for a place to get yours done, you have GOT to go see these guys.  Take my word for it - take the words of the other 66 five-star reviews... just go see these guys.  They're quick, creative, helpful and their prices are *incredibly* reasonable.  If you choose Family Tattoo for your work, you will NOT regret it.

56.description: This place is awesome! Friendly, professional, and clean staff! They aren't cocky like most shops. John John does amazing work. I'd highly recommend this tattoo shop and I have been to many different shops.

29.description: This is a place worth getting tattoos at - even while I was waiting for my artist to draw something up for me, I witnessed another artist patiently explain the process to a couple of first timers and answered all their questions politely.I was able to walk in without an appointment and Kevin Leary accommodated all of my requests and offered helpful suggestions. He was friendly, professional, and patient (including when I passed out! I'm a wuss). The tattoo looks beautiful and the aftercare instructions I was given are thorough.Family Tattoo done won me over.

42.description: It has become a cliche to leave a five star review for this place, but I feel obliged to share what a positive experience I had.I spent several months scouring the portfolios of Chicago-based tattoo artists and eventually found Caroline A. Moody.  I am so glad that I did.  As soon as I saw her portfolio, I knew she was the one to do my tattoo and e-mailed her instantly.I've had my tattoo for a few days now and STILL feel compelled to cry when I look at it.  Honestly, it blows my mind every time I look at it that it's going to be a part of my body forever.  It's absolutely breathtaking.  People can't believe how realistic and beautiful it is when they see it, I've even had people who previously said they would never get a tattoo say that they are considering getting one based SOLELY on how beautiful my thigh is now.  Any compliment I have received on it should be directed toward Ms. Moody, who really is an amazing talent.My healing process has been really easy-going thus far and I'm not sure if that is good fortune on my part, or yet another shining example of Ms. Moody's professionalism.  Oh, and, when she told me how much she was charging my jaw nearly hit the fucking floor.  I was literally prepared to spend twice the amount she charged me, especially considering both the size and quality of the final product.  I got a relatively big, and extremely beautiful tattoo for a miniscule price. Go to Family Tattoo and ask for Caroline A. Moody.  It'll be the best decision you've ever made.  Do it right now.  Don't be a fucking idiot.

23.description: I had a great experience at Family Tattoo. After some Yelp research and a quick Google of health code violations (I knew majoring in journalism was good for something!), I decided on Family Tattoo because of the great reviews and impeccable record of cleanliness. I went in to make an appointment on a Friday afternoon for the following Tuesday, and I was scheduled immediately at a time that worked for me. I showed Kevin Leary, one of the artists, what I wanted (a simple sentence in my dad's handwriting) and he assured me that he could do it. When I returned on Tuesday and Kevin was perfectly on time. He photocopied the script, applied it to my shoulder and reapplied it when I asked him to move it a few inches. It was a very quick process - I was in and out in 30 minutes. Best of all, he didn't make me feel foolish for asking for a small tattoo. It's my second one, but some artists can be super snobby about not creating huge works of colorful art. He was very pleasant, the place was extremely clean, and the price was very fair. I'd definitely come back again, and I'lll recommend Kevin Leary to anyone!
