47.description: I had been planning my tattoo for quite some time and decided on Family Tattoo based on the wonderful reviews I read.  I chose Caroline because I liked her art the best.  My design was very simple (Hindi script on arm).  I brought in my design and by the 2nd draft she had drawn it perfectly.  She was super sweet, patient, and a total professional from start to finish.  It was my first tattoo so I didn't know what to expect, and she said that I chose one of the more painful places for my first tattoo (inside of upper arm).  Not sure if it was my high tolerance for pain (!) or her gentle hand, but she made me feel very comfortable and was finished in 15 minutes.  She did an excellent job and I am thrilled with my results.  The price also seemed very reasonable.  If I ever have the need to get inked again, I will certainly go to Caroline.

8.description: While family tattoo is a great shop- not pretentious whatsoever like some Chicago shops, very professional, and clean- my review is geared toward Rich Marafioti, who has done great work on my arm. Super easy to discuss your vision with and he takes the idea and runs with it. He free handed a tattoo that takes up most of my forearm and it's turning out amazing (still not finished). His Asian inspired and American traditional work is amazing. He's done all of my boyfriend's sleeves and every time he gets a new tattoo, I'm jealous. Highly recommend Rich with whatever tattoo company he's with!

31.description: Heard good things about this place. Sat in on a friend's session with Caroline and it's a winner for sure. Caroline paid a lot of attention to detail and spend a good amount of time making sure the art was exactly what my friend wanted and didn't make her feel uncomfortable asking to make changes.

34.description: Unfortunately I can't comment on the art work as I never ended up getting a tattoo here. When I came in for a  consultation, they were extremely rude, despite the fact that they were open for another hour with no clients, with a big "walk ins welcome" sign. The girl who spoke to me became especially rude when I said this would be my first tattoo, as if I'm some prissy straightedge and they're too good for me. Sorry to bother you, I'll take my money where it'll be appreciated.

16.description: Unfortunately I don't remember my artist's name but I believe it was...John.  He was very cool.  The tattoo he gave me gets compliments all the time.  Even the music that was playing was cool.  The price he charged me was even lower than the price he quoted me on.  Plus he had no problem taking a break whenever I needed a moment from the pain (I'm a giant wuss.)Great place, check them out.

13.description: I came to Family Tattoo with my friend to have some simple tattoos done. It was my fifth tattoo, first at Family Tattoo. We walked in around 1:00 and were instantly taken care of. Our artist was Kevin. He did an amazing job on both of our tattoos and was extremely personable. I have never had a tattoo artist who seemed as genuinely excited about my tattoo as I was. It made for a very relaxed environment. Price was also very reasonable for the size of the tattoo. I will definitely be coming back here.

11.description: Kevin took my raw ideas and refined them into a tattoo that gets "wow!" from my friends (who have a lot of ink themselves). The shop was very clean and professional,  I was treated like a valued customer as was every person that came in. I will be going back here again for more work without any hesitation.

39.description: Caroline provided a fantastic experience. If you're looking for an artist who will listen to you as well as provide great ideas, she's your lady.  I got great traditional work of her own design and she talked me through a rough chest piece.  She's a real class act and a professional through and through. Cool, cleanly, and worth every penny. An all around great experience.

37.description: Gilly has done a handful of my tattoos and im effing in love with every single one. He's professional, hilarious, and a perfectionist. He makes the time pass by quickly which is awesome when you're getting the bigger pieces. The owner lee is super friendly and helpful. If your looking for a shop to call home this is it.

0.description: This place is great! I went 2 weeks ago to get my first tattoo after I had to put my 10 year old French Bulldog to sleep. Bob Haas did an AMAZING job making sure it looked like her and with minimal discomfort. It is super clean and every is really nice. Bob is super talented.

38.description: What a positive, happy experience.  Caroline rules.  From the moment we walked in until the moment we left, we felt welcome.  What a sweetie Caroline is! Can't wait for my next one, because she is my girl. Told me, "honey, this part is gonna hurt the worst." I appreciate that! Everyone loves you, so this might not mean much.  But my new tattoo means the world to me! xoxo

51.description: I realize that the five star review is a bit trite, but I couldn't not commend the wonderful work Kevin did this past Monday afternoon. A girlfriend and I swung in with some idea of what we wanted, but nothing concrete. Kevin was patient, offered suggestions and we left delighted with the work. Thank you for a great afternoon, man!

27.description: 12 years ago I got my first tattoo- a fairy on my lower back. (How cliche, I know). For the last 12 years I have regretted it. In hindsight, the tattoo artist was just a drunk, half-arse idiot. Over this last decade I have went into many a tattoo shop interested in a cover up. Every single shop refused. The tattoo had too thick of a black outline. Anything on top of it would look like a black blob. Well, all y'all were wrong. Last week I walked into Family Tattoo which is conveniently a block away and was immediately greeted by James Aguila. I showed him the tattoo, told him what I wanted, and he said, "no problem." I set my appointment for a week later. Yesterday I came in and James showed me exactly what i had envisioned. I sat there for 3 hours and the end result was nothing short of AMAZING. James is super skilled, kind, and talented. I cannot see any trace of that darn fairy. The pricing was way less than i had expected. I was once told by one cover-up artist that whatever he covered it with would take several sessions and cost around $500. What a joke. Family tattoo was more than fair, and I feel as though I should go back and give James more of a tip. (They are cash only.)I am referring all my friends and all you yelpers to Family Tattoo. I will go there for ALL my future tattoos. This is the best tattoo I have!

32.description: Simply said, The girl in the front who first spoke to me was very polite at first but became very irritated with me when I asked her for a quote on a second tattoo. Then when she forwarded the question to another artists he rushed through the basics as if he was busy at that moment (I was the only person in there). I definitely would not recommend this place no matter how good their work is, first impressions are everything.

54.description: Went in a few months ago to inquire about a large custom piece. They totally blew me off and gave me the feeling like I should impress them rather than the other way around. They had no customers in the place at the time yet behaved as if they were terribly busy and had no time to talk to me. They gave me their card and I walked out. I hung on to the card for a while but finally threw it out when I became serious about the tattoo. I found another place much less pretentious and I am very happy with the work. Family tattoo lost out on a $1,000 tattoo and it will wind up being much more than that in the long run as I intend to extend it. Sorry guys. There is alot to be said for just making people feel welcome. Maybe you are great tattoo artists but I will never know.

48.description: Coming from out of town, I did some research before coming to Family Tattoo and after my experience, I have to confirm all the 5 star reviews. I can see why this place comes so highly recommended! Things were great from start to finish. They were able to take me as a walk in shortly after opening and from the minute I entered, the laid back atmosphere immediately put me at ease. Caroline Moody was excellent--very professional and made the entire experience comfortable.  I left extremely pleased and would definitely come back to see her again next time I'm in Chicago. This ranks as my best tattoo experience thus far.

44.description: Caroline Moody is AMAZING!  I cannot say enough good things about her, or my experience at Family.So when I was 18 and stupid, I decided to drive out to boo foo Indiana with a friend and get tattooed (the legal age in IN was 18 at the time, and it was 21 in IL).  So not only was this tattoo shop shady (the piercer gave me Vicodin and told me I would need it for the pain.  No really, that happened), the artist pressed too hard on my back and gave me scar tissue there along with a REALLY stupid tribal tramp stamp.  Yes, I know, I know, tribal is terrible, but once again- I was 18 and stupid.Flash forward ten years.  The older, wiser me decides to cover up the stupid tramp stamp.  By now I have three other tattoos by two different artists, and both of them told me that I have scar tissue there which might make a cover up difficult.  I was on the fence about just lasering the damn thing off, but decided to try to find another opinion.  Enter Family, and Caroline Moody specifically.  I had never been to Family, but a friend of mine had work done there and loved the place, and clearly Yelpers love it too.  I was really impressed with Caroline's art, so I emailed her with a picture of my crappy tattoo and asked her opinion about covering it up.  She emailed back and said she agreed there was scar tissue but that she thought it could be done, and suggested I come in for a consult.  When I did and she saw it in person, she said it for sure could be done, which was a huge relief for me.  I didn't really have a solid plan for the tat, but had a photo of an art piece I had always liked that I thought might be cool.  When I showed it to Caroline, she said she thought it was a great idea.  She asked if she could work with the picture a bit, and I said absolutely.  I set my appt up and a week later, she showed me the stencil.  It was beautiful!  I was blown away by how awesome it looked.  She is a VERY talented artist!  We did the outline that day, and the shading two weeks later.  I am SO much happier with my lower back now!  (I posted some pictures for anyone who wants to check it out)  Caroline also wrapped my back with a burn bandage that I wore for the first two days after the shading session, and it kept my bed/clothes clean, which was awesome.  The price was very fair too, especially for the quality of the work.So in conclusion, Caroline is awesome, and now my back is a little more awesome thanks to her.  :)  I am positive she will be tattooing me again sometime in the near future.  I would highly recommend this shop if you are looking to get tattooed!1/17/13:  I liked my initial tattoo so much, I ended up having Caroline turn it into a full back piece.  Which I LOVE.  I can't say enough good things about Caroline or this shop.  And trust me, many people have asked me about my back, and I have been telling them all about Caroline/Family.  So hurry up and go, people!

24.description: I have a long story involved with this, but I'll fast-forward to about late February of this year.I decided that this was the year I would get my first tattoo and waffled between a few Chicago artists and parlors before choosing Caroline Moody at Family Tattoo. A friend of mine had been tattooed by Caroline about two and a half years beforehand, and I loved Caroline's portfolio, so I knew she would be the one for me if I ever had the courage to go get it done. I had also read through reviews here that she was very skilled and very fast but thorough.Caroline was amazing and helpful, made setting up an appointment easily, gave me her advice as an artist on what would and would not work with the design I brought to her, and was extremely professional and to-the-point without making me feel like a complete idiot. When it came to the actual tattooing time, she worked quickly and with a light hand and checked in on me a lot to make sure I was holding up--it was a fairly big piece on my side that included some intense work on my ribs, and as mentioned, it was my first tattoo. I went back for my touchup two days ago and it's even more beautiful than it was.The place itself is very well-lit, with custom artwork on the walls and work areas for each artist. While I was getting tattooed, I looked around as much as I could and saw some of Caroline's previous work, as well as some of Gilly's, who also seems very talented. I felt immediately comfortable and not like I was taking a risk by walking into someplace sketchy and the prices are relatively low ($60 minimum, and my rather large and detailed tattoo was only $240).The only reason this place gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because I have nothing to compare it to. I will definitely be back, though!

7.description: My review is a little bit for the shop in general, but mostly is for Caroline Moody.  My piece is only about halfway done, but I love it and thought it was about time to leave a review.Walking in the shop for each of my appointments, I've found everyone inside the shop welcoming and friendly. I'm always a little anxious walking into places where people are way cooler than me (bike shop, coffee shop, tattoo parlor), but everyone working at Family Tattoo has a good attitude and doesn't give guff. The place is very clean, brightly lit, open, and comfortable.Caroline is exceptionally friendly, professional, and talented. After showing her some reference images during my consultation, she understood what I was looking for and got to work. The piece she showed me for my first actual sitting was perfect, and exactly what I was looking for. I am working on a pretty large piece, which has taken multiple sessions and will take a few more. Caroline is good about checking in with me if it seems like I'm zonking out, offers me stretch breaks when I forget that a stretch might be a good idea, and is a pleasure to joke around with.Caroline is easy to correspond with over email, and has accommodated a few reschedules for me, which I greatly appreciate.My half-sleeve is about 50% done. Each time Caroline works on a new section I'm excited to see what she's going to do, and I'm always happy with how the work turns out.In conclusion: Family Tattoo: welcoming, comfortable, and attitude-free.Caroline Moody: talented, professional, super-cool.

49.description: I was looking to add to my arm. A coworker recommended Family Tattoo. Weird name, out of the way shop, but totally worth it. Matt Wes took my idea and came up with an awesome design. Not his usual style but I'm psyched with the result. 9 months later and the colors are still super vibrant (while the one I got a year ago now looks like shit.). no fading at all. Matt was fast, awesome to talk to, and really, really talented. The price point was very fair. I really wish I hadn't left Chicago because I'd definitely go back for all my work in the future.

40.description: Came in and got a bird by Bill Smiles. I had been drinking the night before and despite all the bleeding, my tattoo still came out amazing. It's my favorite tattoo to date, and I've remained loyal to Family Tattoo ever since. The only negative thing I will say is that they try and persuade you to get your tattoo bigger than you want by telling you it will look terrible/smear if you get it small.

53.description: Lee is the man. Best shop in Chicago. Will be heading in for work soon!

30.description: Great and friendly tattoo place! We came for a small tattoo and the results are great! Our tattoo artist made sure that the location is perfect and re-did the layout per my request. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because we had to wait quite a while for our tattoo caused by casual chats, eating, and socializing. But we were not in the rush.

46.description: Emailed family tat w an idea i had & they quickly responded for me to come in.  John John was able to take my vision & draw it out perfectly! I got a good size tattoo in the middle of my back, & it truly wasn't painful, he had a very light hand. It looks amazing and I can't wait for the warm weather to show my new tat off! Thanks John & Family Tattoo!!

1.description: Awesome shop overall. It's very welcoming and so are the artists. They don't try to intimidate you or act like elitist douche lords like some other shops. I've receive two tattoos from the shop. My boyfriend has his whole sleeve done here. It's gorgeous. They have the best colors. They are so bright and do not fade! Dan Tipton did my second one. I love it! He's really honest. If something will look cool he will tell you. If something will look stupid or won't work he will let you know as well. They find out what you want and give you their creative feedback. On a comfort level; the shop is clean. There are rooms and stations. The stations all have half walls and curtains if you request for privacy. I will definitely get more work done here. Just wanted to praise their good work!

55.description: Bill was awesome! I can't wait to come back and get some more work done.

9.description: Came here to get my second tattoo, first at a Chicago shop. I was a little nervous choosing a place because there are so many options in Chicago, but I am so happy I came here.  Dan did my tattoo and he was really professional and did an amazing job! He really listened to my ideas and was open to make changes to make it exactly what I wanted. The tattoo turned out great and if I ever get another one I would definitely come back!

26.description: I wanted a simple tattoo after my wedding shower and that's what I got.  I was in and out in 15 minutes, no worries, no fuss, no one trying to intimidate us like we were newbies.  Caroline did a great with what I wanted, wasn't at all pushy, and charged me very reasonably.  She'll definitely be seeing me again soon for my next tattoo.

25.description: Love Family Tattoo got a cover-up tattoo for my husband and it look like it was never there go to Kevin Leary he is the best at what he do my husband tattoo look awesome I will definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a good tattoo location

12.description: Gilly did a great cover up tattoo on my wrist for me. He is very nice, and was very patient with me while going over design ideas. When I showed up for the appointment, which was made the night before, he had several ideas already drawn up for me, and I could tell he understood what I wanted.The only reason I am giving 4 instead of 5 stars, is because the guy who greeted me at the front desk was rude.

59.description: My first tattoo was a doozy - a large, intricate script piece on my left side, vertically over my ribs. Not only did John do an absolutely beautiful job, but he was very patient with my sensitivity to pain, need to take breaks, and all my other neuroses. I highly, highly recommend Family Tattoo in general, and John in particular.

21.description: My sister and I went to Family Tattoo based on a recommendation from a friend and the reviews here on Yelp.  We were getting our first tattoo (matching) and we couldn't be more happy with how it all worked out. The place is a typical tattoo shop, quaint, simple and clean! Very clean!Our expectations were high and they were met exactly.  We talked to Caroline to set up the appointment and she couldn't have been nicer.  She was very understanding of our nerves, our crazy attention to detail on a small script tattoo and was very honest with the whole process.  Since we already had the artwork, it was pretty easy, so we found a date that worked and made the appointment with her.  We paid $20 to hold the reservation and then came back in a week.Knowing we were nervous Caroline took great care of us, she was patient and extremely kind.  She gave us the full run down of what to expect, how to clean it, what to do after, what not to do after....etc.  We watched her sanitize the whole area, she showed us the sanitation seal on the needle, she made us feel extremely comfortable.  Once we found the right location on our ribs for the tattoo she completed it on my sister first and then me and we were done in 45 minutes.  During the tattoo she kept telling us how great we were doing, told us to keep breathing and always calmly talked to us to make sure we were OK.  In a million years I would have never thought I could actually go through with it, even though my sister and I have been wanting these matching script tattoos for years but it was because of Caroline that I was able to do it. I would recommend her to anyone, not just for script because she does much much more than that and is an amazing artist in her own right.  The best thing about her, was that she wasn't above doing this 4inch script tattoo on each of our right ribs and it was perfectly and beautifully done, both times. Thanks Caroline! If we ever decide to get another one, we are coming back to you.

17.description: Kevin Leary is A+Great artist and a good dude.  I haven't had any work done by other artists at Family tattoo, but they seem to be a friendly bunch.

10.description: Family Tattoo is the place and Kevin Leary is the man. They've got a welcoming, friendly environment down on west Belmont. The two times I've been in have been nothing but a positive experience. This time around I worked with Kevin on an idea I was dreaming up. He offered suggestions and honest advice to land in a good place that he and I were both happy with. This, paired with relaxed conversation about any and all things, made for an excellent session. And if you're a fan of HBO's The Wire or need convincing to start the unparalleled series, he's the guy to talk to.So to quote Slim Charles from The Wire, "The game's the same, just got more fierce."

5.description: Great place to get a good tattoo. I've had all my tattoos done by Rich M. and have always had a great experience. He is not shy about telling you the truth and giving you his opinion, which I appreciate. I usually try to give him creative freedom with my designs seeing as he is the artist. I trust his judgement and I know the end result is always good! I recommend this place to anyone looking to get a great tattoo in the city.

3.description: Best Tattoo parlor in the city!!! Our artist Heath was very friendly and professional. My sisters and I went in for matching tattoos and he made our whole experience so enjoyable! We highly recommend Family Tattoo.

35.description: I decided to get my first tattoo, and after lots of research and reading tons of reviews, I emailed Caroline Moody. She took my idea and brought it to life. She was completely willing to tweak the size and gave great advice regarding size, color, and placement. She was quick, and the pain was minimal. Caroline made me feel comfortable, totally understood my anxiety, and is truly an artist. The shop is very clean. They do not try to sell you expensive aftercare lotions (which I discovered at many other places I checked out). And the prices are INCREDIBLE. Why spend more, when you can get a true piece of art at a great shop?! :)

19.description: My sister and I went to Family Tattoo based on a recommendation from a friend and the reviews here on Yelp.  We were getting our first tattoo (matching) and we couldn't be more happy with how it all worked out. The place is a typical tattoo shop, quaint, simple and clean! Very clean!Our expectations were high and they were met exactly.  We talked to Caroline to set up the appointment and she couldn't have been nicer.  She was very understanding of our nerves, our crazy attention to detail on a small script tattoo and was very honest with the whole process.  Since we already had the artwork, it was pretty easy, so we found a date that worked and made the appointment with her.  We paid $20 to hold the reservation and then came back in a week.Knowing we were nervous Caroline took great care of us, she was patient and extremely kind.  She gave us the full run down of what to expect, how to clean it, what to do after, what not to do after....etc.  We watched her sanitize the whole area, she showed us the sanitation seal on the needle, she made us feel extremely comfortable.  Once we found the right location on our ribs for the tattoo she completed it on my sister first and then me and we were done in 45 minutes.  During the tattoo she kept telling us how great we were doing, told us to keep breathing and always calmly talked to us to make sure we were OK.  In a million years I would have never thought I could actually go through with it, even though my sister and I have been wanting these matching script tattoos for years but it was because of Caroline that I was able to do it. I would recommend her to anyone, not just for script because she does much much more than that and is an amazing artist in her own right.  The best thing about her, was that she wasn't above doing this 4inch script tattoo on each of our right ribs and it was perfectly and beautifully done, both times. Thanks Caroline! If we ever decide to get another one, we are coming back to you.

28.description: BF just had amazing work done by Caroline-- a cover-up metamorphosis and a bunch of other lovely stuff. This is the beginning of a cult (if there isn't one already.) It is absolutely gorgeous!

45.description: I got tattooed by Bill as a walk-in.  He was professional and did an awesome job with a sketch I had done.  He's a really cool guy to talk to and I got to nerd-out about art for several hours which was incredible.  To say that I'm in love with what he did to my arm would be an understatement.  I can't recommend this place enough, so in an effort to be concise: best experience ever.

33.description: Family tattoo is awesome. Especially for first time tattoo-getters. Getting a tattoo for the first time is always a little overwhelming. Even more so when you enter a place where tattoo-covered workers are unfriendly and you get nervous just looking at the wide open space behind the counter where tattoos are being done in open view. That was the place my friend and I went to before finding Family Tattoo. The workers at Family Tattoo give off good friendly vibes and they're very understanding towards ridiculous tattoo questions. I forget the name of the guy who did mine (sorry!) but He was awesome..! I told him what I wanted and he designed it on the spot for me and made changes to the design that I wanted. All for the price of $60.. Unlike the previous place which charged $100. Family Tattoo has individual rooms separated by curtains where you get your tattoos done, which I prefer much better than the previous place. I like the privacy. If i do get a 2nd, I would fly all the way back to Chicago to Family Tattoo to get it!

43.description: I got my first tattoo from Caroline. She was very kind and professional. Highly recommended, thank you!

2.description: As this was my first tattoo, I had a difficult decision on where to go. Dan came highly recommended by a friend who has beautiful ink, and he was able to fit me in with only a few days notice. He was patient in explaining the process, drew a sketch based on the picture we emailed and then created the tattoo I've been procrastinating getting for the last 14 years, even better than I imagined. I came with a friend, and Dan let us sit with each other and provided good conversation. I highly recommend him to anyone considering a quality tattoo at a lovely, clean shop!

18.description: 12 years ago I got my first tattoo- a fairy on my lower back. (How cliche, I know). For the last 12 years I have regretted it. In hindsight, the tattoo artist was just a drunk, half-arse idiot. Over this last decade I have went into many a tattoo shop interested in a cover up. Every single shop refused. The tattoo had too thick of a black outline. Anything on top of it would look like a black blob. Well, all y'all were wrong. Last week I walked into Family Tattoo which is conveniently a block away and was immediately greeted by James Aguila. I showed him the tattoo, told him what I wanted, and he said, "no problem." I set my appointment for a week later. Yesterday I came in and James showed me exactly what i had envisioned. I sat there for 3 hours and the end result was nothing short of AMAZING. James is super skilled, kind, and talented. I cannot see any trace of that darn fairy. The pricing was way less than i had expected. I was once told by one cover-up artist that whatever he covered it with would take several sessions and cost around $500. What a joke. Family tattoo was more than fair, and I feel as though I should go back and give James more of a tip. (They are cash only.)I am referring all my friends and all you yelpers to Family Tattoo. I will go there for ALL my future tattoos. This is the best tattoo I have!

41.description: No better place in Chicago to get tattooed.  Fun and honest people, fair prices and amazing work.  Why go anywhere else?

52.description: 6 out of the 8 tattoos I have, I have gotten from either Frank or Lee. They do such amazing work! They're clean! My husband has been coming to these guys for I wanna say 10+ years. I've been going to them for about 5 years and will continue till my skin gets wrinkley.

50.description: I went to Family for my first time on Monday and ended up going back again on Wednesday.  John did my first piece and then Gilly did my second one.Everyone is very cool and laid back which added to having a good experience.  I've been getting ink for the last 16 years and I think I've finally found a home base here in Chicago. John was cool, did a great job and I'd get more ink from him.  Gilly was awesome as well, gives good tattoo advice (a friend was on the fence about one and he suggested to not do it), and he did a great job on my leg.Excellent place, and I highly recommend Family.

4.description: I recently had my first tattoo ever done by Caroline at Family Tattoo. I'm pleased to say that I am blown away by the design she did for me and I've had dozens of compliments on her work in just the one week since I had my tattoo done. When I first met with Caroline I had just an idea, and then when I came in for my appointment and she showed me the drawing she came up with I was blown away. She was very easy going about making any changes or adjusting the placement for me and was very conscientious of any hesitations I had. She helped me through some of the pain, making me feel a little less obnoxious than I thought I was being and the end result was more than I had imagined. Loved it. The only challenge I had was that I had initially hoped to see the drawing before the day of and had reached out via email a few times, but I later learned there was an issue with the email so I don't hold her responsible! I would recommend her any day and if I ever have the courage to get another one done she'd be the one I go to.

6.description: The shop is spotless and the artists are great. Dan Tipton has been my artist for two years so far and I couldn't be happier with his work. I refer anyone who asks me about my tattoos to Family Tattoo.

22.description: Great Experience!  Friendly staff!  I'm no tattoo shop expert by any means (this was my third and my wife's second tattoos) but this is the cleanest, most professional looking place I'd ever seen.We just got small work done but we were treated great, and the pricing was very reasonable.At the rate we get work done we may not be back for a few years, but when we need another one we'll go back to Family Tattoo!

15.description: Caroline is top-notch. I went to her based on a recommendation from a friend and it was a really incredible decision. I had an idea and some reference material for a tattoo I wanted on my left forearm and, upon our initial consultation, she thoroughly explained the ins and outs of what this tattoo would entail. I was incredibly excited to see what she would come up with. When I went to the shop to have the actual piece done, I was blown away by what Caroline had recreated. She listened to every word I said and incorporated it seamlessly into her artwork. I didn't have to change a thing, as her drawing was 10 times more incredible than I had hoped it'd be. During the actual tattoo process, which was extremely time intensive, Caroline was the absolute picture of professionalism and fun. She consistently let me know what she was doing next and was extremely accommodating... Making sure I was feeling ok and asking if I needed a break. Getting a tattoo can be an uncomfortable experience... Sitting for 3 - 4 hours right next to someone you don't know well, not knowing if you should talk or not talk, not knowing if the artist is even interested in the work he/she is doing on you. I didn't have any of these weird experiences with Caroline. The entire thing was very comfortable... We talked when we wanted to, I let her concentrate when she needed to. And, above all, I feel like she had a genuine desire and need to do the absolute best job she could do on my piece. She took her time, paid an insane amount of attention to detail and I really felt like she was doing this piece as much for herself, her creativity and her reputation as she was doing it for me. All of which is very, very much appreciated. Caroline's experience and talent in the fine arts makes her not only an incredibly interesting person, but also an absolutely unbelievable tattoo artist with her own voice, point of view and high, high standards for herself. I will be seeing much, much more of her in the future and you all should too!

57.description: So in the past month I've gotten two tattoos from rich at family. Both times I had made an appointment and both times he was super prompt. All I can say is how happy I am. He was super awesome and incredibly reasonable. After getting tattooed for almost 4 hours the last time, I almost choked when he told me what I owed him (really, really reasonable!!!) Anyways, I will definitely be returning for future work.

20.description: Caroline is top-notch. I went to her based on a recommendation from a friend and it was a really incredible decision. I had an idea and some reference material for a tattoo I wanted on my left forearm and, upon our initial consultation, she thoroughly explained the ins and outs of what this tattoo would entail. I was incredibly excited to see what she would come up with. When I went to the shop to have the actual piece done, I was blown away by what Caroline had recreated. She listened to every word I said and incorporated it seamlessly into her artwork. I didn't have to change a thing, as her drawing was 10 times more incredible than I had hoped it'd be. During the actual tattoo process, which was extremely time intensive, Caroline was the absolute picture of professionalism and fun. She consistently let me know what she was doing next and was extremely accommodating... Making sure I was feeling ok and asking if I needed a break. Getting a tattoo can be an uncomfortable experience... Sitting for 3 - 4 hours right next to someone you don't know well, not knowing if you should talk or not talk, not knowing if the artist is even interested in the work he/she is doing on you. I didn't have any of these weird experiences with Caroline. The entire thing was very comfortable... We talked when we wanted to, I let her concentrate when she needed to. And, above all, I feel like she had a genuine desire and need to do the absolute best job she could do on my piece. She took her time, paid an insane amount of attention to detail and I really felt like she was doing this piece as much for herself, her creativity and her reputation as she was doing it for me. All of which is very, very much appreciated. Caroline's experience and talent in the fine arts makes her not only an incredibly interesting person, but also an absolutely unbelievable tattoo artist with her own voice, point of view and high, high standards for herself. I will be seeing much, much more of her in the future and you all should too!

36.description: This place is absolutely wonderful. We walked in late one night to get a quote after visiting another popular Tattoo spot. Not only the quote was less, but they offered to do it on the spot, since ours were on the smaller size, and we both had the designs we wanted. I am chicken when it comes to pain. I still tear up when I get paper cut, and I was freaking out before getting mine. The artist, John, was very calm, easy going, and professional. He asked just the right amount of questions and  had the right answers to my silly questions to calm me down. I thought it would hurt like hell, but it didn't at all. Strangely, I felt really chilled and the whole experience was very relaxing. Since the tattoo was on my back, I didn't look at it at all, but instead tensed myself waiting for the pain to hit, but from the beginning to the end nothing hurt. The tattoo came out beautifully and I could have not asked for a better and smoother first time.I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone. They are clean, friendly, professional, and talented. I'm planning my second visit as I write!

14.description: One of my friend's recommended this parlor to me as this was my first tattoo and I wanted to choose a place I would feel comfortable with. Daniel greeted me and asked what I wanted. He quickly drafted my idea and we made a collaborative decision on the final design. He was very nice and friendly throughout the session. The place was also clean and overall good customer service which is hard to find in Chicago. Although no tattoo is going to be painless he talked to me throughout so I could relax and before I knew it he was done. I am very happy with the tattoo and the price was very reasonable. I highly recommend this place for any newcomers if you have anxiety about getting a tattoo. I would be inclined to come back here in the future.

1.description: The Cornelia Arts Center...is a visual art venue that houses mutliple disciplines and hosts regular open house events.  This space is an edgy warehouse converted into private artist lofts.I attended an open house last night and was surprised that I never heard about this place before.  Just off Lincoln Ave, I was able to view many types of art...from Jewerly makers to paintings and even a sculpturer that was making a huge steel structure right in front of my eyes.  Some of the artist I found interesting were: James Parenti (painter) and Bahar Partow(photographer) just to name a few....I've always been fascinated by the gritty side of arts...painters and sculptures...their worlds wet, dirty, and dusty from toils on an existing body of work.  As a fine art photographer, we never get that sexy aspect from our art, but Cornelia Art Center provides that to visitors.  Artists are engaging and of course provide the complimentary wine & cheese, though one painters loft I visited while walking around was talking to some folks looking at her work and said she had really expected a lower brow crowd that night so she purchased cheap beer and apologized she didn't have more wine......lets just say I felt like turning to her and telling her to kiss my girts (hey...I'm from the south...), but I refrained and realized that she HAD to be  talking about some other folks and not me *grin*.These types of spaces are what I call the "pulse" of art in cities because they house such a high concentration of artists of so many different types of art, it is really a great way too see and do a lot in a little space.  So you should check this out next time you want to get your Art on.

0.description: I love this area of town, and yet I feel like I never have an excuse to go there.  Some of my friends hosted a fun karaokee event, and I got to check it out.  It's a nice location, really quite perfect for this kind of event.They get the extra star for hosting a bad-to-the-bone (b-b-b-b-bad) karaoke event there.

58.description: I was a fan on Exsalonce until today. I'll admit that I am a sucker for good customer service and the single star rating is based on the poor service that I received today. First, if you're not familiar, from their website, under a section called Etiquette:CancellationsIn consideration of other guests and our service providers please give as much notice as possible when canceling an appointment. Less than 24 hours notice will result in a 25 percent charge to the client for the total service time.PunctualityTo receive the full Exsalonce experience, please arrive 20 minutes prior to the start of your service. If you arrive after the scheduled start of your service, we may not be able to offer an extension of time on the scheduled services.I arrived 5 minutes early for my appointment this afternoon. I saw that my stylist was still with a client, so I asked if anyone was available for a brow shaping. Great, she got me in. 15 minutes later, I was done. My stylist was still with another client. I patiently sat down and flipped through a magazine. A few minutes later, I checked in with the receptionist - my appointment was at 3pm right? Yep. No apologies for keeping me waiting, etc. It was now 3:15. 3:20....I ask how long its going to be, the two people in front dawdle a bit (one was clearly new) and they finally ask the stylist (who is in the middle of a head full of highlights) and he says um, 5-10 minutes. At that point, I decide that I'm not waiting 30 minutes PAST my appointment time and pay for my brows and leave.I might have been more patient had anyone made any kind of acknowledgement that I was waiting for so long. And, their "punctuality" policy is just salt in the wound. So long exsalonce.

56.description: Talk about a full service salon! I was scheduled for an updo and a makeup session for a wedding I was attending. Tony did a beautiful job on my hair, and Alexis paid a lot of attention to detail, I was greatful she didn't rush and send me on my way, I was very happy the way it turned out.About an hour later after I got home, my hairdo wasn't as perky as it was when I left (thanks to Chicago's wonderful weather), but they said to come on in and they would fix it, and sure enough, it stayed the whole night. Not to mention they tie ties! Who knew that everybody in the house didn't know how to tie a tie, so I brought it with me on the return trip and sure enough, Tony came to the rescue...Again.  Throughout the night, I was getting so many compliments that I looked like a movie star with my red lips and sexy side swept hair. Thank you!!

29.description: This salon is Awesome!! Maria gave the finest  haircut and  style that  I have had in Chicago in 10 years!  She is skilled, knowledgeable, friendly, and gorgeous!  An all around fantastic  experience. I will certainly be back .

42.description: An update to my previous review and response to Tony.  The price for extensions is not displayed on your website.  Would you like to publicly share how much you charge for extensions?   Further, thanks for sending me out into a sub-zero winter day with soaking wet hair.

23.description: I always leave Exsalonce happy with my new cut and color from Jess. Jess listens to what I want for my hair and always delivers a great look. She is easy to talk to and work with and I enjoy my appointments with her. I highly recommend Jess for your next service.

47.description: I decided that I would step up my game for the new year and move away from the barber shop.  It was hard for me, as I grew up in an era where men went to the barber and women spent a half-day at the "beauty shop."Exsalonce and Tony did not disappoint me in the least.  I arrived early and was accommodated early.  Tony asked me what I was looking for, and was able to take my stammering reply of "Uh, something that will look good and be easy to do in the morning" and create a style that works for me.  Best of all, wife approved.  I will be back.

8.description: Tony and his staff are awesome! If you want a day of pampering, you must go to  Exsalonce! The atmosphere is so relaxing, so welcoming, calming and fun. You just  have to experience this for yourself! The staff is so friendly and professional. The products are top of the line. I just can't say enough about the experience you will have here! Take advantage of all they have to offer, you will not be disappointed!! Don't put off another day, go and visit Exsalonce Spa and Salon today!

31.description: I have been going to Exsalonce for almost 2 years.  Even though this is a very busy salon, their customer service is always phenomenal and I never feel rushed (something I've experienced at many other salons of this caliber). The space is gorgeous and they always have cookies and good coffee. :)What I enjoy most about going here is that I feel comfortable seeing any of the stylists.  I currently recommend Jess for color, Maria for cuts, Mallory for updos and Tony for extensions! I've had 4 sets of extensions since my first visit.  All have lasted at least four months.  Always a treat to visit Exsalonce! Highly recommend it!

34.description: Overall I was really happy with my experience at Exsalonce.I bought a Gilt.com deal and had also heard good things about it from my co-worker, so I was excited for my first time at Exsalonce. The salon looked very nice and clean, and I was offered a refreshment upon my arrival. Mallory took me to get my hair shampooed and my head massaged, and did a great job with my very long and thick hair. She gave me the long layers and face framing long bangs that I wanted, and the blowout looked great as well. The whole process only took about 45 minutes, which was great considering that I am used to hour-plus long haircuts since my hair is so long and thick typically.I am really happy with the new cut that I have and would definitely consider returning!

16.description: Went in on a Friday afternoon and got a haircut for $20 from a new artist named Zachary. I absolutely love my new hair and Zach could not have been more lovely, 5 stars for sure.

13.description: DISASTER AVERTED!!!  Tony is an angel!  I had a stylist turn my auburn hair into a chestnut brown.  It happened late on Saturday afternoon and as most salons are closed Sunday and Monday I couldn't get in to see Tony until Tuesday. Needless to say tears were shed.  I figured my hair was ruined and it would take a few attempts to get my hair back to my natural color.  He explained that he studied color correction at Loreal and that he could do this in his sleep.  It took him 30 short minutes to fix my hair.  I have never been happier with my hair.  I've finally found a new home and stylist for my hair.  He new exactly what I needed.  THANK YOU!!!!

11.description: Zach is amazing!!! I have naturally curly red hair and don't trust just anyone cutting my curly hair but Zach did a great job! He gave me a beautiful trim with long layers. I would highly recommend Zach to do your next haircut!

39.description: Donna is fantastic! She did a superb job on my Royal Keratin and haircut. I am going to see her again for extensions! She gave me great advice on how to care for my hair after Keratin and recommended products to maintain the Keratin so that it last as long as possible. She also recommended products to help with my hair issues - helpful suggestions without being pushy or "salesy". She is super friendly, sweet, easy to talk to and bubbly. She is very knowledgeable about coloring, different hair processing treatments, product, and improving hair health. Her cut was EXACTLY what I wanted without really having to explain it - I just told her I trust her and she gave me a phenomenal cut. I love it. I must have asked a zillion questions about extensions and she answered them all easily and with confidence - this woman knows her stuff! I highly recommend her and will absolutely be going back. Tony Odisho is a big name in the haircare, salon and now extension industry and Donna represents his brand and reputation for excellence perfectly. My impression of Tony and his salon can be summed up in 6 words: relentless pursuit of excellence and quality. He seems to accept and expect nothing but the best from his staff, regarding his product lines and from himself. This impression led me to his salon and to fully trust that the stylists he hires are the best of the best - so I was confident in telling Donna "Do whatever you think is best I trust you!" Every expectation I had was exceeded and I'm thrilled. The reception staff was warm, friendly, helpful and professional. They invited me to the launch party of Tonys new keratin tape extension line and went out of their way to charge my phone and show me pictures of other clients who had their extensions done at Exsalonce. Overall my experience was amazing and I can't recommend them enough!

37.description: Had my first haircut at this salon this week.  Mallory did a fantastic job! When I arrived I was greeted very pleasantly by the receptionist and offered some tea or coffee and there were also cute pastries available in the interior waiting area.  Prior to the cut I received a very short, but lovely scalp and shoulder massage by the stylist. What a great surprise!  The stylist Mallory then cut my hair perfectly!!!  It was a wreck when I arrived and I have exactly what I wanted now!  I would definitely recommend this salon for  haircuts and Mallory as a stylist  especially!

0.description: I love this place. Jess colors my hair and does a great job with my pixie cut. She even taught me how to blow dry my hair so it always looks as good as when she does it. I also love this place because their product line is great. But even better, there is no hard sell!!!Did you know they have a spa with massage, sauana, steam and rain shower combos with really nice robes?? We renovated our bathroom this summer (we only have one) and my husband and I bought a package so we could get away (and get clean). It was divine. With the holidays upon us (and all the drama that goes with it) we booked massages with Niki about a week ago. I worked at a suburban spa for three years, and it was better than any massage I received there. A few years ago my husband had a series of 10 massages at Urban Oasis, and he said that Niki was better than anyone there. Today was an incredibly stressful day, and I received a 90 minute massage from Niki that put me back in a sane perspective and more. The ladies at reception are always incredibly nice. None of that stuffy attitude you get at other salons/spas. If you are looking for a place that cares about you and what you want your hair to look like, as well as about you as a person and your general wellness GO HERE.

38.description: I had to stop coming here after I began working 80 hours a week - Roscoe Village is not on my way to anything now ... BUT while I was coming here, Joan did amazing things for my hair. I truly recommend her and Exsalonce for anyone who has big hair. Joan knows what she is about with thick, coarse, curly hair - she will make you look like a million bucks.

51.description: I love Exsalonce! My first visit, a couple years ago, was for a massage. It ended up being one of the best massages I have ever had. I enjoyed it so much, I bought a gift certificate for my bf at the time so he could experience the same awesome massage I did. Unfortunately (for him), from the time I went and the time he was going to go, their female massage therapist was no longer working with them and my bf was not comfortable seeing their male massage therapist. Fortunately (for me) shortly after I purchased the gift certificate I was considering making a big change to my hair, but I was nervous about doing so. I called Exsalonce and explained my situation and reservations, and the receptionist set me up for a free consultation with Tony. Tony set my mind at ease and I decided to schedule an appointment with him shortly thereafter. They even let me use the gift cert I had purchased for a massage towards my hair which I thought was awesome...although having to use the gift cert on myself for a massage would not have been the worse thing either! My first appointment with Tony was great. He took the time to listen to me and what I wanted before he started doing his thing. One of the best things about Tony is that he is super fast...he colored, cut and did a blow out for me in about 90 minutes. I think my jaw dropped when I realized how quickly I was in and out on my first visit. Now Tony is the only stylist I will let touch my hair. I have gotten so many compliments on my hair, especially on my color, I have sent at least a half a dozen friends and coworkers to see Tony at Exsalonce and each time I get a call or text thanking me for my recommendation. Tony also acknowledges and rewards my referral ever time I go back. If you are looking for a neighborhood salon and spa with awesome customer service, stylists and massages, you will not be disappointed at Exsalonce.

27.description: The atmosphere and staff are great. Today was my first time there, and I will definitely be going there to see Maria from now on. She also give the best head massage on top of giving a great haircut!

32.description: I have lived in Chicago for 8 years now, and for almost 7.5 of those years I have tried many different salons and stylists. I am so glad I finally found Jess and Exsalonce! She is incredible...fun to talk to, focused, gives me what I am looking for, gives expert advice, is always on time, never leaves me with those weird hair stains on my forehead, and never gets chop happy with the scissors. This salon is clean, smells delicious, everyone is soooo friendly, and they are reasonably priced. My search is over thanks to Jess!!!

54.description: I highly recommend Exsalonce. My stylist was Talor and although I had been with my previous stylist for 10 years she made me feel comfortable and at ease. As any curly girl knows we get very attached to the person who does our hair. I was happy to find her and make a good transition to someone new. She really listed to what I wanted in a cut and gave me helpful recommendations.

48.description: After shelling out a large sum at Exsalonce for extensions for my wedding, I was promised they would last at least three months.  So, needless to say I was very disappointed when they started falling out after less than a month.  I scheduled an appointment and I couldn't believe how patronizing Tony was towards me.  Despite the fact that I spent $100+ on products to care for my extensions and I had taken notes to be sure to follow their instructions to the T, he claimed that it was my fault that they were coming out and that I hadn't been treating them with care.  I'm not a business owner but I don't think that being rude to customers who spend 4 figures on your products is the best strategy.  Buyer beware!

44.description: I love the hair extensions Tony Odisho put in.  They look amazing! I had received a terrible haircut from another salon, and Tony quickly and effortlessly put in about 15 strands to even out the terrible layers I had.  Everyone is amazed how natural the extensions look.  Thanks Tony!

24.description: Zach gave me a wonderful haircut and blow out! He was so sweet and made me feel comfortable with his skills before we even started. I'll for sure be going back to him next time I need a trim.

7.description: I now have a new regular salon for all of my hair and waxing needs. Zach did a great job with my hair, which was epically long, and now it looks healthy and the layers are great. He's also just super fun and friendly, and not intimidating at all! Megan did a great job with my brows and really paid attention to detail. I could totally see us being friends! The owner, Tony, also has his own product line which I think is a really neat and unique quality to have. I highly recommend checking this place out, you will not be disappointed!

49.description: Miracle workers! I received a horrible hair cut from ANOTHER salon. Leaving my hair in short lengths in places and long in others. Tomas added extensions to my hair and made it look absolutely perfect. The hair blends well and no one even knows it isn't my hair. Now I can't imagine not having them! Tony and Tomas are professionals and well educated. I highly recommend them to anyone!

40.description: Can't say enough good things about Exsalonce.  I came here with a wedding party on New Years Eve and EVERYONE left feeling glamorous. I had Tony for makeup and Joan for my updo and they worked wonders- as did all the other staff (Natalie, Tomas, a few others names I can't remember) who worked with us. They didn't rush us at all and hanging out in the new space was comfortable as it was GORGEOUS and they had a cute little kitchen/bar area. With staff so friendly and accommodating and the price being right, I will definitely be spreading the word to the billion other brides I know. Thanks Exsalonce!

53.description: Love, love, love Exsalonce!  The front desk staff are welcoming, friendly and helpful.  Natalie has been cutting and coloring (shhh) my hair for years and she is fantastic.  They have an aesthetician on site (Dermalogica products) and I'm going to try a facial soon.  The Exsalonce newsletter has fun tips and specials.  The Roscoe Village location also makes for great shopping or dinner & drinks before/after your appointment, and it's a quick walk from the Paulina brown line stop.  All in all, Exsalonce is a five!

30.description: I really wanted this place to be my new hair home, but alas, I am again on the search. I had been going here for about a year and a half, possibly longer and was always happy enough with my hair and visit. The front desk staff could not be nicer - always welcoming, gracious, and happy! Such a pleasure when you set your first step in the door. Somehow the timing always worked that the owner was up front checking in or finishing with a client too. He always greeted me right when I walked in, took my coat and offered me a beverage. Really nice, unexpected gestures from an owner. The problem has been more with my stylist. Overall I liked her and have been happy with my hair and experience. She doesn't have the most outgoing personality, but was definitely nice. After going to her without complaint for the last year and a half, I had a problem with my most recent cut. Instead of the long layers that I requested (which has been my standard since I've started going to her), I received more of an unflattering bob. I called to come in and have it fixed and honestly, didn't think anything of it because I've had a standing relationship with her and I assume it's normal for clients to want minor changes/fixes. However, the reception I received from my stylist was cold at best and she blatantly was annoyed that I wasn't happy with my cut. The first thing she said to me was an abrasive "So, what's up?" - no hello, no how have you been, no apology that I wasn't happy with the cut. When I explained what I didn't like she told me that since I went with a little bit of a shorter length than I have in the past, she would have had to re-cut all of the layers. Um, ok, then isn't that what you should have done in the first place since I was requesting long layers? She literally spent five minutes, if that, quickly dry cutting chunks out of my hair and then was done. That's it. Then walked me out, told me to schedule my next appointment and that was it. The cut was fine and I was definitely happier than I had been. However, I was so disappointed at the way I was treated and how she responded to my minor complaint that I just can't go back. I would still recommend this salon, but maybe request a more experienced stylist.

46.description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Exsalonce yet. This has been my salon for over 5 years now, and I absolutely adore each and every person that works there. I have had my hair done by Joan; who is beyond amazing, Tomas, who is absolutely wonderful, and Natalie, who is also a true artist.. Every single time I leave this salon I feel beautiful, and believe me my hair presents a challenge when I walk in....I love the comraderie amongst the staff, you feel like everybody loves each other and loves to work together (they even go on vacations together), and I feel like part of the family. My schedule is very erratic, so I often have to make an appointment the day before - but I know that no matter which stylist I will see; I will be made to feel comfortable and I know my hair result will be as it always is 100% of the time: perfect!

1.description: I got a groupon for a massage at this place. Setting up an appt was easy and they sent a reminder a day ahead to confirm the date/time.When you walk in, you'll see the salon first. The spa is to the back, where they can offer a bit more quiet to guests. The woman walked me to a washroom, where they had lockers and a steam shower. She told me I could change and use the sauna and shower.I've never been to a sauna, so I really didn't know what to do or what to expect. I wasn't really given any instruction either, just left to explore for myself. I didn't really see staff around to ask for help.The sauna is nice for one person, maybe two if you're OK being close to someone else. You're able to rest and stretch out while enjoying the heat. The steam shower is a nice space once you figure out how to work the shower. It took me longer than it should have to get the actual shower on. I couldn't understand why the water wasn't warming up until I added steam. A little instruction would have helped.The massage itself was nice. I had Nikki. She went over my sensitivities and what I wanted from the experience. She helped me choose a scent before starting. I was disappointed that the massage didn't last the full 60 minutes (the session started late even though I was there thirty minutes early). After the massage, Nikki face instruction on after care and I was able to enjoy the sauna again.I noticed while I was relaxing after that a lot of staff was passing through (for laundry I guess). They were rather loud, slamming doors behind them and walking back and forth a lot. It kind of took me out of my mood and I decided to head out.Overall, I'd go back again.

55.description: Excellent! is what it should be called.  Talara took care of my husband's and my hair.  I had a wash and style and it was beautiful.  My husband had a haircut and could not stop commenting on how well she cut his hair, but also how she did not do any small talk.  He hates going to a salon and female stylists ask all kinds of ridiculous questions.  He wants his hair cut not a convo.   Talara is awesome.

9.description: I've been to this salon a few times, but yesterday I went to Zach to fix a box dye gone wrong! He did a wonderful job not only fixing my color but also giving me pointers and just making my day. I left the salon feeling beautiful and with my next appointment booked. I would highly recommend going and asking for Zach!

26.description: I had such an excellent experience with Tony and his team at Exsalonce. I had partial tape extensions put in my hair for my wedding because though I had the length, I wanted a full beautiful look and my hair is on the finer side. I was nervous, but went for it. First in the consultation, instead of 15 minutes Tony spent almost 30 with me. First discussing my extensions, which type I should get, care for them etc, but then after he took the time to consulate on my up do for my wedding in Northern WI. He was not even doing my hair but spent some time just playing around and giving ideas. Such wonderful customer service. My actual appointment took about an hour. The extensions themselves looked so real and beautiful. They matched my hair perfectly and no one could tell that I had them, except for the fact that everyone kept telling me how awesome my hair looked. Last but not least, On the day that he put my extensions in, I got a trim as well and then he curled my hair exactly how I wanted it for my wedding. He did not have to do that, but he went the extra mile, because he knew I was nervous about my up do. My hair had never looked so beautiful. On the day of my wedding - my hair was long and full and I have loved every moment of having them in. Thank you, Tony. You were so awesome and generous with your time and I have been recommending you to everyone!!!

25.description: I came in and had a cut and blow out from Zach and it was wonderful! He is a very skilled stylist and is so fun to talk to. I will definitely be coming back!

12.description: Every time I interact with the staff at Exsalonce, everyone is so friendly and accommodating.  I usually have a crazy schedule, so I very much appreciate the scheduling flexibility.  Whenever I arrive, I'm offered a beverage, and haven't had to wait very long ever.  There is a relaxing spa-like feeling here and it is decorated beautifully.Maria is my hair expert!  I've been extremely happy with my haircuts.  I have long hair and have had bangs, then grew them out into long layers, and she has worked with me on transitioning my style and get through that awkward stage.   Today I finally took the plunge and let her do her magic with coloring my hair and It turned out so beautiful! She painted in highlights so it was a more natural looking ombré style.  I am blown away with her knowledge and expertise.  I know who to go to for all my style advice.5 stars!

59.description: I really like going to this salon. I started going to Exsolance from a referall several years ago and Tony did my hair and he was awesome! He also did my hair for my wedding were I had gorgeous extensions and my hair was perfectly died and colored. I had to move to Oak Park at one point and due to the treck, I tried to find a salon closer. I tried like 5 places and none were nearly as good. I finally decided it was worth the commute! Now I actually go to Thomas and he is also phenomenal! I just got my hair done this past weekend and the blonde highlights are amazing!

21.description: I've lived in the city for 10 years and spent the first three looking for a good salon - I finally found that in Exsalonce. I've been going there for about seven years now and they never disappoint. The service is always friendly and I always walk out with exactly what I've asked for. I've been going to Maria for about two years now and I really appreciate that she walks me through all of my options, brings fresh new ideas to our appointments and makes sure that I'm clear on the price for whatever I've chosen to do. I also appreciate that she offers up product recommendations, but it never feels forced - I know that she's looking out for my best interest and wants to keep my hair looking it's best! I am a lifer.

17.description: I had such an excellent experience with Tony and his team at Exsalonce. I had partial tape extensions put in my hair for my wedding because though I had the length, I wanted a full beautiful look and my hair is on the finer side. I was nervous, but went for it. First in the consultation, instead of 15 minutes Tony spent almost 30 with me. First discussing my extensions, which type I should get, care for them etc, but then after he took the time to consulate on my up do for my wedding in Northern WI. He was not even doing my hair but spent some time just playing around and giving ideas. Such wonderful customer service. My actual appointment took about an hour. The extensions themselves looked so real and beautiful. They matched my hair perfectly and no one could tell that I had them, except for the fact that everyone kept telling me how awesome my hair looked. Last but not least, On the day that he put my extensions in, I got a trim as well and then he curled my hair exactly how I wanted it for my wedding. He did not have to do that, but he went the extra mile, because he knew I was nervous about my up do. My hair had never looked so beautiful. On the day of my wedding - my hair was long and full and I have loved every moment of having them in. Thank you, Tony. You were so awesome and generous with your time and I have been recommending you to everyone!!!

10.description: Fabulous job on my balayage, thank you Stina! It is so hard for me to trust someone with my hair, which I'm sure many of you understand, and each time this woman touches my hair it shocks me how much she over succeeded my expectations! So many compliments, love love love it thank you Stina and Exsalonce team for giving me an unforgettable experience! I'll be back soon!!

5.description: My sister bought me a gift card for a facial for my birthday, and I finally redeemed it! So glad I met Megan! She was so friendly yet professional. I learned about my skin needs but wasn't pushed to buy products. The spa was so relaxing! I loved the privacy of the dressing rooms, the robes and slippers were comfy. I was able to sit in the sauna for a few minutes, too. I wasn't rushed to get out after my service. I already made my next appointment.

3.description: Jess is great!  I've been going to her for years and I've never had a bad experience with her.  They do sell products there, but they are not pushy about them.  My hair has a hard time holding a curl, but Jess taught me how to curl it.  I've tried other hair sprays, but the Tony Odisho hair spray is the only one I have found that actually keeps a curl in my hair.  This is by far the best hair salon I've used.

35.description: I've been coming to Exsalonce for years.   When I say years, I mean 9 plus years.  Needless to say I am a big fan.  Tony is an excellent hair stylist and owner.  I always get compliments on my hair and it is all thanks to Tony.  If I want a change, I leave it up to Tony to make suggestions on the latest and greatest and it always turns out fabulous.  Also, he is a magician with color and highlights!I highly recommend Tony.  He is awesome!

19.description: Maria is excellent and I always am satisfied with my hair. I have curly hair and I am particular on how I like it cut and colored and she is very accommodating. She also has cut my fathers hair for years and does a great job. I would highly recommend Maria.

28.description: You should come here!!! Gorgeous salon, my highlights and cut turned out great. Staff was really friendly. The music choice was a little on the clubby side, but not terrible. Plus little snacks left out. I was running errand all day and really appreciated a handful of pretzels. They also had a great groupon and I got an appointment within 24 hours. Really impressed. My stylist was Mallory. I am so over the moon with my highlights. Perfection!

45.description: Just had a great first time experience at Exsalonce in the Salon and I will be returning in the future for sure! I usually go to the Aveda institutue for my color b/c I like Aveda products, but not Aveda prices in salons and the last time I went I had them cut 5 inces off my hair. The cut was ok, but left ALOT to be desired and I needed to get it fixed up.  I went into Exsalonce because they're in the neighborhood and was greated by a lovely receptionist and my stylist Tony who put me in the chair right away, which I love. He talked to me for a minute and then sent me off to get a wonderful shampoo and scalp massage. He gave me exactly what I wanted without me having to go into much detail, which I consider to be the sign of a great stylist. He understood my hair and gave me a FAB new cut! In and out of the hair with a new do freshly cut and styled in 30 minutes...YEP I'm a HUGE fan and I'll be back!

33.description: Jess is amazing.  I've lived in Chicago for ten years and never really found a stylist that I was happy with until now.  She is the first and ONLY person that was able to show me how to get beachy waves out of my straight, fine hair- and it wasn't that difficult!  She listens to what I want and provides suggestions and my hair looks great afterwards.  And friendly and easy to talk to, which is a big plus for me.  I'm glad she's at Exsalonce and I hope she sticks around!  Highly recommend her!

43.description: Went here for a massage with cupping. Jon was wonderful!!! She uses just the right amount of pressure. She was friendly but not overly talkative which is annoying when you want to relax. The current space is a little cramped but they are expanding to larger space next month. If you are a first time visitor, their website advertises 20% off. Their prices are affordable and there is free parking nearby. I'm already rebooked for the grand opening. See you there!!

2.description: I've been going to Megan for my facials for almost a year, I love her! She is extremely knowledgeable about skin care and different products to match your needs. She worked with me to get the right regimen and I am seeing amazing results because of her expertise. The spa facilities are great with a nice private bathroom to change in. I always get there 10 min early so I can enjoy their steam shower and sauna before my facial.

18.description: Tony is amazing!!  He does his magic with your hair that you always leave feeling pampered and stylish every time. His staff is friendly,  courteous, and professional, and Tony expects no less.  He always has great product recommendations to help maintain your hair between visits. I have been going to him for yrs, and do not trust my hair to anyone else.  And since he knows my hair so well,  I can go from shampoo to a style that looks fantastic on me in 30 minutes which is priceless!And even though I don't live in Chicago anymore, every visit includes a trip to Exsalonce, or sometimes,  I even make a special trip to see Tony to make my hair look phenomenal again!

41.description: A friend of mine had an appointment at this salon about 2 weeks ago. Due to our busy work schedule, she had to call to reschedule her appointment. The receptionist told her it is their policy to charge 50% of what she was going to have done, for canceling on the same day. As anyone would, she refused. Later that day she received a missed call, and a voicemail from the manager at the salon. He RUDELY told her (and I quote) "You are not not welcome at Exsalonce ever again, and good luck finding another salon that will take your abuse" REALLY??? How dramatic, and insane. Rude staff, overpriced and always running late. Who wants that? This salon SUCKS. I'd give them a zero if I could.

52.description: I read about Tony Odisho in Yelp about 6 months ago so decided to try Exsalonce. Best men's haircut I've had in a long time. Definitely recommend Tony and Exsalonce. Also the staff and front desk are very friendly and professional.

50.description: I got a massage from Julie she was awesome! I'd def go back!

4.description: So happy to have found such an amazing salon with a great team! Stina is a GODsend and an absolute magician. I have very dark hair and of course want to be a blonde bombshell, she did exactly that! Gave me an amazing head of full blonde gorgeous highlights and then did a base bump of my natural color to take me from dull mousy brown with highlights to golden sun kissed blonde (just what I need in the middle of Chicago winter!) I'm so excited to finally have my new talented stylist and can't wait to see her in 8 weeks for another gab fest and magic show! Make this place your new salon & you will not be disappointed!

6.description: Zack is the best! I went to him recently for a hair cut and he did a wonderful job! He listened to exactly what I wanted and gave me a fresh cut with great layers. My ends looked amazing and he gave me a blowout with some loose waves that lasted days! I liked him so much I sent my boyfriend who agreed Zack did a great job. He gave him a trendy (and super cute) cut that is not the least bit high maintenance and helped him with some products. I would definitely recommend Zack to anyone bc he certainly knows what he's doing with those shears!

22.description: Megan is simply the best.  I have received many compliments on my skin lately which is pretty amazing considering I chase after a 1.5 year old all day and half of the night.  I wish I had started seeing her sooner.  Her facials are quite relaxing and waxing is about as painless as it can be.

15.description: I am so pleased with my experience(s) at Exsalonce. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is lovely. A special shout out to Megan for giving me fantastic facials; my skin feels and looks great. In one word, Megan is marvelous!

57.description: I had a really great experience at Exsalonce, which I went to for the first time last month.  It had been recommended to me by a friend and I am really glad it was.  I was put at ease from the start by the kind girl who set up my appointment and answered many of my questions over the phone (I was planning on getting a wax and wanted to know if I could still schedule a spray tan the next day-she reassured me it was okay).  When I came in, I confided in the girl who was doing my eyebrow/lip wax (Alexa?) that I usually get my waxing services done at the local nail salon and have breakouts afterwards.  She explained that was because they "double dip" the wax and that is definitely not something they do at Exsalonce.  The waxing process was quick, relatively painless, and I really had NO breakouts afterwards.  She kindly put some makeup on me since my sensitive skin turned bright red and it was still daylight hours :)  She also gave me some samples to try out.  The checkout process was easy and fast-they certainly want you to get the best deals possible.  I will definitely be going back!

20.description: Maria is excellent and I always am satisfied with my hair. I have curly hair and I am particular on how I like it cut and colored and she is very accommodating. She also has cut my fathers hair for years and does a great job. I would highly recommend Maria.

36.description: First off Maria is awesome!!!I used to do hair and am really picky on trusting just any one with my locks. I work close to this salon and decided one day to just go and get my bangs trimmed. I was introduced to Maria and had a conversation with her about my trepidations with trusting someone new to cut my hair. She reassured me that she completely understood and would listen to everything I had to say. I booked an appointment and I cannot say enough fabulous things about her! My hair looked amazing afterwards, and I felt fantastic! I would recommend her to anyone I know, and I will definitely be back to see her!

14.description: I have been coming to Exsalonce for the past 2 years and have never been disappointed! I have recently been going to Stina, a talented new artist, and I would highly recommend her to anyone! She listens to what you want and makes you feel comfortable. I have gotten a haircut and bayalage from her and I loved them both!!

29.description: It was a really stressful mani-pedi experience. When I get my nails done, I like to relax, this did not happen. DISCLAIMER: my nails do look fine and it is very clean. They accused me of trying to use my youswoop twice when in fact their records were wrong. I told them if they could prove I'd used the swoop already I'd gladly pay for the mani/pedi.
