When they finally figured out their error, they were not apologetic, they acted as if it was my fault their list was wrong.  (I mean if I'm going to try and rip them off, I wouldn't hand them my youswoop when I first walked in the door). The owner man and one of the nail technicians yelled at me for being late to my appointment, I offered to come back another time but they told me to pick a color anyway. They were not busy- there was not a wait. I didn't understand why it was such a problem for me to be late when I'd at least be bringing in a tip for one for one of the girls. The girl doing my nails barely spoke to me, and when she did I could not understand a word she said.

42.description: I do not recommend going here. The people are rude and they rush through your manicure. The lady wasn't happy with my tip so she insisted I put more on my credit card. I told her no I was okay with the tip I gave and she got mad and did my manicure in 5 minutes (by the way, the tip was more than enough). She then walked over to her coworker and started talking about me in her language, which was obvious and rude. She did a horrible job on my cuticles and kept missing the edges of my nails. When she was done she walked away, turned a mini fan on to dry them, then immediately jumped to someone else. No thank you, or good bye. This place is horrible and I would never go back because of the disrespect and rude service.

23.description: I happened to drive by this place and decided to stop for some pampering. I thought being the only customer in the shop would allow the nail artist to spend time on my nails and really do a thorough job . . . not so. The no chip manicure was done way too far from my cuticles and the whole thing was really rushed and sloppy. A few days later it looked like my nails had been growing for two weeks! Needless to say I will not being going back to this shop.

47.description: So I got a Groupon $20 for $55 worth of services...$55 at this place...uh no! First let me say that I am not sure if they have even finished building this place. There was nothing but some paint and a TV on the walls...nothing else. There were no places to dry your nails or feet...my nails take a while to dry so I thought I could sit under the light longer...but what light...there was not one, or even a place to sit other than the nail station to dry with a little fan... So they advertise a "Spa mani/pedi" all the spa means is a little sea salt rubbed on your legs, I get that with a regular pedi at my normal place. Both services were very rushed. My toe nails were not cut even or filed even. Spa...hmmm, I think someone didn't explain to them what that means... I also did waxing, you would think I had learned my lesson looking at the place, but I wanted to give them a fair chance...NEVER AGAIN!!! It was horrible. I did the $45 Brazilian wax...lots of hair left, was not gentle at all, didn't even blow the hot wax, not once. What I asked for was not even...you couldn't see that... I'm frustrated and not very happy. At least I only paid $20 for the mani/pedi...I would never pay $55. I will not be returning here...I felt like I went to one of the hole in the wall shops in NYC...

8.description: Wonderful place, clean and comfortable. Under new management and they've made some really nice improvements! I drive out of my way to get manis/pedis here. They just got a bunch of new colors in, too.

31.description: I popped in here for a mani on my way home on a Monday night. It wasn't crowded and Tina saw me right away. She was careful and very quick and my nails look great. This is a great spot for a very professional manicure. Can't wait to try out the pedis.

34.description: Came back for another mani/pedi.  Color me MUCH more impressed. I was greeted when I first walked in.  I was able to sit next to my best friend while we got our nails done.  It was quiet, the lights were soft and there was not a tv blasting.  It was very calming and the pedicure was very good.  The massage was good and the addition of using a hot towel was awesome. I am really happy with my manicure as well.  So far, no chipping and hopefully it will last a few days.  They also took their time there-the last time I was there, I was in an hour in like no time at all.  This time was a lot more pampering and I felt relaxed. They are under new management, so maybe that is the difference? It was a much more enjoyable experience. I feel like they also lowered their prices.  Now a mani/pedi was $34...before it was $55?Also my manicure lasted a week! Muy impressed.  Given, I wasn't doing dishes a lot during this time so that was helpful but still..a week is good.

16.description: Dude. What's all the Yelp Angst about. Srsly, this place ain't bad. It's not even half bad. It's actually quite fabulous... especially for the price. Had a wonderful mani/pedi sesh at Classic Nails and fully intend to return soon. Found the salon while driving in the 'hood down Belmont and once inside, was pleasantly surprised that it was actually much nicer than I expected... loved the look here and appreciated the nice, new pedicure chairs, tasteful decor, cleanly everything and sprawling array of current Us Weekly's, People's, In Style's, etc. for our reading pleasure. A girl's gotta get in her gossip somewhere and, of course, I love doing it on somebody else's dime ;-)Polish colors were OPI and Essie exclusive (score!) and the selection was bountiful. Went with a nice shade of milky pink that my tech, Tiffany, expertly applied and then sat back and watched some CNN coverage with me on the nice, large flat screen. Loved it.I found out they also do no chip at only $18/mani so I'll be hitting that up before my vacation for some nice, long-lasting digit attention.No angst here, this place is a Classic!

13.description: Love how my nails look after a relaxing manicure and pedicure . And, it's always easy to get in or make an appointment!

11.description: Walked in on a Saturday morning with my mom, who was visiting from out of town. We are used to having to wait if you don't call ahead and make reservations. Not this place! They were above and beyond accommodating and even asked what channel we would like the TV set too! They do a great gel as well as carrying all Essie colors! For two deluxe pedicures and one gel manicure it cost us about $75 without tip. That's the best price I've seen in a long time. I'm also new to the city and they were very talkative about the neighborhood and where the hotspots are and all about the street fests. Now my mother, an opinionated Texas woman who is impossible to please, was pleased!!!!! A+ in my book

39.description: not sure what all the bad press on this place is about. just got back from a really good experience. first of all, the pedicure chairs-- i wanted to buy one and put it in my apartment. they were so cute and comfy, brand new tan leather with bright red foot-baths, they looked like little ferraris :)the girl i had did a great job painting my nails! they look super shiny and flawless.the massage was short and it wasn't a super luxurious treatment, but overall it was a great place with a warm, clean atmosphere, and i would definitely return and recommend.i used a youswoop, and it was not an issue. there were little signs to guilt trip you into tipping cash, but they didn't say anything to me, like other people mentioned.

37.description: I am pretty easy to please, but The Classic Nails Shop is somewhere I would never go again. Some friends from work and I purchased a YouSwoop to get a "Spa" Manicure and Pedicure for $25.00. Upon entering for our appointment, we were the only three people in the place. Despite this, two of us were getting pedicures while my friend was sitting in her pedicure chair not being serviced (even though there were employees in the back room). So by the time we were done with our pedicures, she was just getting started. For a "Spa" pedicure, it sure was the fastest pedicure I've ever had. The technicians seemed rushed (again, let me point out we were the only ones in there), and my manicure and pedicure combined took less than an hour. The manicure was very strange. They didn't buff the nails, they didn't ask us to wash our hands after they put that "stuff" on it right before they paint your nails, and I had nail polish on my skin that they didn't bother to wipe off. Calling the manicure and pedicure a "Spa mani and pedi" was misleading because it was no different than a regular manicure and pedicure I would get anywhere else. I would hate to see what their regular manicure and pedicure consist of.Additionally, when we were there the air conditioning was not working, so it was very hot, and the noise of the men working on the air conditioner took away from something we hoped would be a relaxing afternoon.  I don't know if the service is typically this bad, or if it was because we had a YouSwoop coupon, but in my opinion, it is their choice to put the coupons out there. If they don't want people paying less for their services, they shouldn't offer discounts. Also, the point of YouSwoop and Groupon is to get people into your business so they come back and refer others. I definitely won't be going back and I definitely won't be referring others, so they really lost out.Luckily, I had good company that day, so we made the most of it!

0.description: Jesse is amazing and is the owner of a fairly new shop. I got a gel fill in with a no chip polish and it came out beautiful. I can't stop looking at my nails. Jesse takes her time on your nails and will not fail you. It was my first time here and it won't be my last. Welcoming atmosphere and very friendly. They also serve wine.

38.description: I bought a Groupon for this place, and  trying to book an appointment was near impossible.  They kept saying they could squeeze me in at 2pm on a weekday afternoon....UMMMM, I'M AT WORK?Anyways, the girl who did my pedicure was very sweet and did a great job. The woman who did my manicure was rude, and I'm not kidding, did my entire manicure in 10 minutes.  It was terrifying.  She cut my cuticles way too fast for comfort.  Also, the entire time I was getting my manicure I could hear children screaming/crying (I'm assuming they were hers because she was the only person still working at this time - it was after 6pm - whom were locked in a back room or closet or something, waiting for her to finish.  It was beyond weird.Anyways, I wondered why they would schedule a 6pm appointment with me and then hurry me out of there with wet nails.  I'm not kidding, the lady was waiting at the door with the 2 children at 6:45 tapping her feet, staring at her watch, and jingling her keys to let me know it was time to go.  I destroyed my nails as I was leaving which was I was not happy about.I will use my remaining Groupon earlier in the day and will not let that woman near me again.

51.description: In mid-January, 2010, I hot a limited-time offer for a $12 mani-pedi (their grand-opening special); sounded too good to be true. It was not.  The shop is brand-new, clean, and spacious, attractive though certainly not luxurious.  My mani-pedi took about only an hour but the technician (Vi, also the owner) was extremely meticulous and both sets turned out great.  They have six spa pedicure chairs and six manicure stations and feature OPI and Essi nail polish.  They do waxing as well, but I cannot speak to that personally.  Vi was very sweet and was happy to let me read my book or to chat with me.  She said they are doing a business-card draw and will give away one free manicure/week and one free pedicure/week.  I would definitely go back and will be interested to see what the going rate is once the opening special is no longer valid (1/20/10 for the M-W deal; 1/23/10 for the Thurs-Sat deal; 20 for mani-pedi).

27.description: I got my gel nails done by Tina and they looked great--she's a pro. She was pleasant, the walls in the shop are a nice cocoa color, overall great ambience. Nice big flatscreen TV, plenty of magazines so I can keep up with the gossip. Tina told me there were new owners when I asked her how long they had been here so obviously things have changed (I've read the earlier reviews).  It was my first time here and I will definitely go back, my nails look beautiful.

32.description: I bought 3 youswoops to this place because it's hard to turn down a $20 mani-pedi blocks from my house. My 3 experiences here were so weird that I guess it can only average out to a 3.1. nice mani-pedi, girl didn't say anything to me. No one acknowledged me except to take my youswoop and accept my tip. 2. pretty normal mani-pedi, once again no one acknowledged me until I told them I didnt' have my youswoop printed out but I could show them on my phone. That's when the owner went crazy. She claims too many people were coming in and reusing their certificates, so I can't use it unless I print it. I pointed out that if she had a list of names, she could just cross one of mine out but she accused me of lying and wanting to cheat her. She told me I needed to go to a kinkos 5 blocks away to print out the certificate. She continued yelling at me until I basically told her "oh hell no you crazy psycho." Finally after she realized I wasn't going to go to kinkos, she waved her hand in my face, grabbed my certificate and told me to "go, go away" HAHAH what!?!?!?!?!3. after waiting a good 3-4 months, I checked on yelp and saw others mentioned they changed owners. I thought maybe this time I could try again and DEFINITELY made super I had my last certificate printed out. Everything went over GREAT! They were nice, acknowledged me, good paint job that lasted over a week! Wow...what a turnaround. So I guess I'm glad I went one last time because now I might actually keep going back knowing that crazy, psycho woman is gone.

48.description: This was the worst manicure/pedicure i have ever experienced.  It was rushed, it chipped that afternoon and the owner spilled nail polish all over mine and my nieces shoes and didn't bother to clean it right away because she was worried about her precious floor instead.  In fact when we left I had to ask her what about our shoes, to which she replied, what?  She knew we had polish all over our shoes, because I asked her twice nicely what about our shoes... then one of the other gals looked at the shoes and tried to get polish off but then put them back down without finishing, why I have no idea.   I understand accidents happen and think I was pretty nice about the whole thing, but if I have to ask you again when we leave, what about our shoes, that is just poor customer service plain and simple.   After the nail polish spill we also received a not so pleasant attitude which I did not appreciate w/ my 4 yr old niece, it was her first mani/pedi, i wish I could look back and have a good memory.   I will not be returning and if I could would give them no stars I would. The place is clean and spacious, that is the only good thing I can say unfortunately.  I really expected better and am completely disappointed. I had this experience in early May, 2010.

44.description: When was the last time your nail experience was so bad you want to leave?When was the last time you look at your fnger nails and thought, I can do a much better job at home?This is my first and last time at this Classic Nail Shop. If you only bought 1 you swoop, I strongly suggest you cut the loss and don't even bother going in there. If you bought more than 1 of these groupon or youswoop, save and giveaway the coupon to someone you hate!I walk in, I was the only person in the place, the nail polish was on the odd side of the wall so you can't really see the true shade of the polish. The pedicure was a meh, water is cold, the girl is nice but she doesn't know what to do. If you looking to get pampering you can forget about that, she barely scrub my feet, about a minute massage. It was an absolute bare minimum pedicure, noted that the certificate is for the "Spa" mani/pedi, there was nothing spa about this.At this point I'm begining to think this had to be a joke, right then and there, as this younger girl is painting my toe nails, this older lady came over and ask me if I need my finger nail cut. What the hell?? What's with the rush? I'm the only person in your place and you are in a rush? So, the younger girl finally finish painting my toe nails, I walk over to start the manicure with this older lady. Now she starting to work on my cuticles, she didn't even start to take my nail polish off!Then she start to ask me about the tip, proceed to point to the sign about how she prefer to get cash, I was going to giver her cash tips anyway, but I just hate the way she ask me. The paint job sucks, after a few minutes, she was done, she turn on this little fan point it at my fingers and walk away. I was not direct to the drying station, it was just that little fan for my fingers, nothing for my toes.I couldn't wait to get out of there, I don't imagine I will ever coming back here.Ladies, there is a reason why nail.com at Belmont and Clark is always busy, and there are many reasons why this Classic Nail Shop is empty.

24.description: Buyer's remorse averted! A year ago I bought two You Swoops for The Classic Nails Shop based on their few, but positive reviews. However, when I looked them up a few months later there was an avalanche of negative reviews that had me ruing my decision to buy even one; it was at that point I began crafting a list of nemeses (nemesi?) to pawn them off on. I'm not sure what made me revisit their Yelp page, but I noticed an uptick in reviews and positive comments about new management; with great trepidation I decided to use my first certificate this past Fall and was pleasantly surprised. The salon isn't fancy or spa-like, but the equipment looks newer; there are approximately 6 manicure tables and 6 pedicure stations with the massage chairs. They also have a nice selection of mindless magazines to get me up-to-speed on important stuff like vases are out, bouquets are in*. Both visits, I was able to get in quickly, even when I used my second certificate a few days before expiration - just like a good little procrastinator should. I found both visits to be consistent and good, even the second time when they were dealing with an endless stream of stragglers. I don't really have any complaints about my manicure experience. Both times the technician who helped me was efficient and proficient. However, the pedicure left a bit to be desired. Both times it seemed like my feet soaked only briefly before they got down to business. I also wish there was more massaging, exfoliating and pumicing of my feet. However, the polish job on my toes was fantastic, I was able to go days without chips.  All in all, I'm glad I decided to use my You Swoops. I can't say this is my new favorite, go-to nail shop, but I think there's something to be said for consistency. 3.5 stars*Take note gentleman

7.description: Thank you for saving my nails! I walked in without an appointment from another nail salon (literally) and the 2 owners were so kind. The technician removed the no-chip half removed by the previous salon and continued with a very professional manicure. I was impressed with her attention to caring for my nail to not further damage them!  The salon is under new ownership and I will definitely be back.

49.description: Chitown deals offered a great deal so I purchased a package of services at this salon.  The salon is fairly new, which is presumably why they offered such a great deal.  The interior is nice and spacious and the pedicure chairs were great.  The staff was friendly and efficient!  The best part was that they did my mani and pedi simultaneously.  Highly recommended.

40.description: Went back a second time, and the paint job on my fingernails was less than stellar.  It was pretty horrible.   I guess they really don't care.  I will not be returning.And I will not be purchasing another nail youswoop/groupon/living social ever again.

30.description: Recommended!Like others, I too bought some Youswoops for a $20 mani-pedi. I approach buying a Youswoop/Groupon, etc. for a mani-pedi with great trepidation as sometimes the places are just plain not good:  your services are rushed or the place isn't clean or you can't even get an appt because they sold too many discount services - you name it.Au contraire with our experience at The Classic Nails Shop. It was near perfect.- Our nails look fabulous and flawless.- The staff was friendly and courteous.- Great selection of  nail polish colors. I counted over 350 choices of OPI and Essie colors. (Yes, I counted and yes, I am a dork.)- The place is spotless (including the bathroom).- We were not rushed in any way and there were no TVs blaring but just a low volume radio. - Free street parking on Belmont.Tina, the new owner, was my manicurist and she was superb. She told me she changed the hours of the shop when she bought it  which was a good move as now they are open on Sundays and during the week they are open until 8 pm.  We went at noon on a cold and snowy Saturday and there was only one other customer in the 2 hours we were there. Maybe it was the weather or maybe the reviews about the former owner have kept people away which is unfortunate as this is a great shop. I must say $37 for a mani-pedi ($34 Mon-Wed) is a bit steep given the plethora of nail shops in this city. I highly recommend they lower the M-W special to $30 and they will get more business.

46.description: I was having a bad day and wanted to make it better. I printed my YouSwoop for The Classic Nails Shop and called to see if they had openings. The lady was very short with me, but communicated that I could come in any time before 3:30. I asked how long the mani/pedi would take and was told an hour... hmm that's not long. I said I would come at 2.When I arrived, I was pleased to find parking easy and the shop clean and new.  It all went downhill from there. Typical Asian nail salon otherwise. No name products other than OPI polish. I told the girl my name and I wasn't in the schedule at all, nor welcomed. The place was totally empty so I imagine this is how a walk-in would be treated. The foot bath was hastily filled and the massage chair turned on (which was quite strong and made it hard to read, but that's fine). Within 20 minutes I was done. The exfoliating scrub was applied and then my feet were promptly put back in the water- no scrubbing. Lotion was rubbed in, not massaged. My feet are still ashy as they were when I went in... the entire reason I went in! Who wants nice look-at-me nails with ashy, dry skin on their feet? So irritating.I then received my manicure. Again, no massage, no exfoliation, no soak. There wasn't even an attempt at it like the pedicure. Before painting they asked me to pay and I gave them my Youswoop. I did not have cash to tip, yes I know this isn't cool. It also isn't cool to be scolded for it though. They ran the tip on my credit card, painted my nails and rushed me out. The edges of half of my nails aren't painted and three have major bubbling. I was put in front of a fan and then it was turned off and I was told I could leave, but "don't touch anything." There was no spray to dry them, no protective oil, nothing. She also did not check my toe nails. 45 minutes, only customer, and I'm being told to leave. Upon examination in the car, my nails were all tacky. I imagine I was treated this way because of the credit card tipping... or just bad service in general. Either way I wouldn't even come back to let them fix it for free. One star for cleanliness, one star for competitive prices M-T-W mani/pedi combo, but beware- you get what you pay for... or less.

1.description: I just finished getting my fill in and gel polish with Jessie! She is absolutely amazing! I've been going to her for several months and she's grown my natural nails out so long. She's the best  and her shop is centrally located for her customers.

9.description: Amazing! Tina completely saved my nails. After having a terrible experience at my last nail place, I decided to try a new one and think I've finally found a place to call my nail home in Chicago! Shape, thickness, and price all perfect! I can be pretty OCD about my nails and pick at them if they aren't perfect. Tina made me feel so comfortable telling her exactly what I wanted and I left happy as a clam. The new shellac colors they have are gorgeous! $30 for an acrylic fill with no chip? Unheard of! I can't wait to go back for a pedi soon!

26.description: Lynn is my new main gal!  That said, I don't know that I'd be going back to anyone else at the Classic Nails Shop.When I called to schedule an appointment, I gave a 2 week window with evenings and weekends available and got some serious attitude. "Sorry, I can't come in during the weekday -- manicures don't grow on trees, ya know."Tina greeted my sister and me when we arrived.  She was extra-friendly, but almost to the point of being pushy.  No issues using two YouSwoops.  Lots of great Essie and OPI colors, though it's April, and I only saw a few of the new spring pastels.  Lynn was friendly and chatty, but at the same time great at her job.  This is probably the most comprehensive manicure I've ever had outside of a high-end spa.  She took her time filing and trimming and just making sure my nails were perfect.  They have a light table now for drying.  As I was about to leave too early, I smudged one of my nails.  A tiny little smudge that was barely noticeable.  Lynn jumped in and tried to fix it, when it still didn't look perfect, she insisted on redoing that one.  My sister's manicure was adequate, but not as great.  Her nail tech did not talk, which was fine by my sister.  Also they have a punch card program and I got a punch even with the YouSwoop coupon.

25.description: When your dearest of friends departs and bestows unto you a youswoop for a mani-pedi with the stern admonition "DO NOT LET IT GO TO WASTE," you use it. Right?So, use it I did. One mental health day meant I was gonna do a little primping. It was very easy for me to make an appointment for a Friday so in I went. The salon is clean, massage chairs in top working order, and the assortment of tabloids was impressive. My chosen colors were springy as an Easter egg (despite the decidedly unspringy temperature we've had as of late) and I was off on my way to pretty fingers and toes. Excellent selection of Essie, my fave.As I watched some Entertainment show with Billy Bush attempt to make Amanda Pete belch on their show (for serious), my toes were painted a raspberry red and my finger tips were the color of lilacs. Twenty minutes at the drying station and I was on my way. Total time? About an hour and twenty minutes. Pretty standard.Aside from mishaps on BOTH of my thumbs, I remained relatively chip free for about a week. IMPRESSIVE!It's not in my 'hood, but if I was looking to get pretty and in the area, I'd definitely return. Stamp THIS youswoop USED.

12.description: This is always my go to location for nails! Tina the owner is so good at painting as is Tiffany! New (probably not how you spell it) is the go to person for the no chips. This location is BYOB they offer water as well. The prices are the fairest in the neighborhood. I bring my daughter along and she will not allow me to go anywhere else. For her nails and toes just to paint, they charge 8 bucks and for a full mani and pedi for her its only $15! She get to sit in the massage chair and get her feet and nails soaked SAME services as us ladies! Mon -Wed they offer a special on Mani and Pedi's I think its only $30 but it may be $35 but for this single mom its the BEST price in town. I really love my ladies here.

21.description: Dude. What's all the Yelp Angst about. Srsly, this place ain't bad. It's not even half bad. It's actually quite fabulous... especially for the price. Had a wonderful mani/pedi sesh at Classic Nails and fully intend to return soon. Found the salon while driving in the 'hood down Belmont and once inside, was pleasantly surprised that it was actually much nicer than I expected... loved the look here and appreciated the nice, new pedicure chairs, tasteful decor, cleanly everything and sprawling array of current Us Weekly's, People's, In Style's, etc. for our reading pleasure. A girl's gotta get in her gossip somewhere and, of course, I love doing it on somebody else's dime ;-)Polish colors were OPI and Essie exclusive (score!) and the selection was bountiful. Went with a nice shade of milky pink that my tech, Tiffany, expertly applied and then sat back and watched some CNN coverage with me on the nice, large flat screen. Loved it.I found out they also do no chip at only $18/mani so I'll be hitting that up before my vacation for some nice, long-lasting digit attention.No angst here, this place is a Classic!

17.description: So I got a Groupon $20 for $55 worth of services...$55 at this place...uh no! First let me say that I am not sure if they have even finished building this place. There was nothing but some paint and a TV on the walls...nothing else. There were no places to dry your nails or feet...my nails take a while to dry so I thought I could sit under the light longer...but what light...there was not one, or even a place to sit other than the nail station to dry with a little fan... So they advertise a "Spa mani/pedi" all the spa means is a little sea salt rubbed on your legs, I get that with a regular pedi at my normal place. Both services were very rushed. My toe nails were not cut even or filed even. Spa...hmmm, I think someone didn't explain to them what that means... I also did waxing, you would think I had learned my lesson looking at the place, but I wanted to give them a fair chance...NEVER AGAIN!!! It was horrible. I did the $45 Brazilian wax...lots of hair left, was not gentle at all, didn't even blow the hot wax, not once. What I asked for was not even...you couldn't see that... I'm frustrated and not very happy. At least I only paid $20 for the mani/pedi...I would never pay $55. I will not be returning here...I felt like I went to one of the hole in the wall shops in NYC...

10.description: I have come back a few times since my first time and loved every visit until today. I came in for a mani/pedi again and I honestly should have walked out before it even began. As I was picking out my colors, my technician went out for a smoke. I'm coming in here to relax, not  I have to smell smoke on someone. I should have walked out then but I stupidly didn't. During the pedicure, I felt like the tech cut my nails far shorter than nothing and I was surprised I wasn't bleeding from her treatment of my cuticles. We start the manicure and it was just awful. While trimming my cuticles, the tech cut too deep on two fingers. She didn't even notice and it took me saying something. She tried to remedy the situation but at that point, I was over her and didn't want her further causing damage to my nails. I asked to pay and be done. She took my card and had her boss, who had seen her trying to stop my bleeding. Not that we discussed not charging me for the manicure but I kind of assumed I wouldn't be charged for it. Wrong. I walked out with a barely halfway done manicure and two bleeding fingers. I'm honestly debating ever coming back here and the only reason they are getting two stars is from the service I received prior. If I do, it will most definitely be after 5p on a Monday or Tuesday since that's when the amazing nail techs work.

5.description: Just got back from classic nails on Belmont.    The new owners are very nice and the service was great!   I got the no chip manicure and regular pedicure and was very satisfied.   They have a large variety of colors and materials to select from.  The nail tech took her time with me and the leg massage was awesome!!  They also offer other services like waxing etc.  so it's a great one stop spot.   I will definitely be coming here for all my nail services and will recommend it to everyone.   You won't be disappointed.  Give the new staff a try.

3.description: Jessie is amazing!!! She knew exactly what I wanted and was a perfectionist which I love!! So wonderful to talk to and listened to how I wanted my nails. The environment is relaxing and warm. Not crazy and loud like some other nail places!!! Highly recommend Classic Nails!

35.description: So like the others I had a youswoop for the Classic Nails and finally I am going to use it. I called and called and called to get no voice mail. After my fifth attempt to get an appointment I had success, but the women was so rushed with me on the phone, I hope my appointment at 2 still stands. I have to say this place is not like your common nail salon because what it lacks it tradition it made up for it with the duration of the finish product. Yes it wasn't the normal nail experience because there was only two ladies there and one kid. I have to say that my experience was not ideal to what I am used to. Since it was only two ladies, they would tag team on the service. My friend and I went and we both waited for the clients ahead of us to be done with their services. I was the first to get my nails done and I was skeptical on the technique because it felt sort of rushed. After she was done with me, she started working on my friends hands. The second nail tech was available so they took both of us to the pedicure stations. I thought this was odd because Lauren's nails weren't even painted yet. The both started to work on our feet. The experience felt rushed to me, but I was happy with the finished product. they worked on painting Lauren's nails after the pedi. I was going to give this place a 2 star review, but my nail color stayed on for 2 weeks. I was shocked because usually I chip in the first few days and that is going to the nail spa boutique type places. I was actually quite impressed on the duration of my nail color.. mind you it is a DARK red nail color. I would go here for a basic manicure, but I wouldn't go here for the experience.

19.description: When your dearest of friends departs and bestows unto you a youswoop for a mani-pedi with the stern admonition "DO NOT LET IT GO TO WASTE," you use it. Right?So, use it I did. One mental health day meant I was gonna do a little primping. It was very easy for me to make an appointment for a Friday so in I went. The salon is clean, massage chairs in top working order, and the assortment of tabloids was impressive. My chosen colors were springy as an Easter egg (despite the decidedly unspringy temperature we've had as of late) and I was off on my way to pretty fingers and toes. Excellent selection of Essie, my fave.As I watched some Entertainment show with Billy Bush attempt to make Amanda Pete belch on their show (for serious), my toes were painted a raspberry red and my finger tips were the color of lilacs. Twenty minutes at the drying station and I was on my way. Total time? About an hour and twenty minutes. Pretty standard.Aside from mishaps on BOTH of my thumbs, I remained relatively chip free for about a week. IMPRESSIVE!It's not in my 'hood, but if I was looking to get pretty and in the area, I'd definitely return. Stamp THIS youswoop USED.

28.description: Ehhh....I won't be going back. Nothing screamed 'WOW' here. I was one of 4 people here on a Saturday and at one point I was the only person. Shop is clean and they have a few TV's, but once again nothing special. Nail techs were friendly and the girl who did my pedicure did a decent job. But they claimed that they had 4 other people coming in right after me so they had to do my manicure at the same time as my pedicure. I was ok with that, but honestly my mani was not that good. I think I will have to get another soon just to clean up the cuticles the nail tech barely touched. Did those 4 other girls show up....nope. Then there was the arguing in front of customers. 2 girls had some type of issue with a coupon, their credit card....something like that. But they were kinda loud and making a scene and that was not really neccessary. And then one of the other nail techs forgot she was doing a girls nails when the owner called her over to look at some paperwork. The customer was like "excuse me! I have to leave soon!" Good luck to them...but I won't be going back.

45.description: I bought a Youswoop coupon for a spa mani and pedi for $22. I think it's normally $47 for both services. This salon is not near where I live but I don't mind the drive, so that's not really a short fall. The  problem with the place was the staff's poor customer service and lack of attention to detail. They seemed more interested in jamming in appointments then doing quality work. My toenails were left uneven, and it seem that they only have two ladies who do manicures so after my pedicure I had to wait 10 minutes to get my manicure started. The manicure was done SO FAST, and again my nails were cut unevenly as well as my cuticles. When V was done with my manicure she asked asked me to sit under the UV lights, as I got up to move I smudged my thumb nail. But V had already started her next manicure in the 20 seconds it took me to do this. So She had some other lady come over and "fox" the smudge, but the nail still looks like garbage. I didn't care enough to complain. In the future I will stick to the awesome nail shop in my hood and stay away from youswoop.com "bargains".

33.description: went in a second time, I had a You Swoop that I needed to use.  I called ahead and they  took me in right away. really clean salon, Tina is one of the owner/operators and she did a really good job.  She asked me if I wanted a no chip manicure, I passed on the offer and she didn't pressure me after that.  Really wished I could have had a deeper massage, but hey, it's physical labor for the technicians so i get it...they're tired too :) Got a Mani that is lasting over a week! yea! if I didn't live so far I woudl come back if I needed a mani in a jiffy

43.description: Ladies, what is all the complaining?!  I just got back from a mani/pedi and had a good experience.  They took there time and did a great job.  The space is very clean and calm, overall enjoyable.  The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because they didn't give me a mini back and neck massage like some other places.  For $20 with a swoop or groupon you really can't beat it.  Go pamper yourself here, you won't regret it!

2.description: I wouldn't go anywhere else, I always go to Jesse and she never fails me!!! She's now the new owner of this shop and I cannot wait to see what she has in store! I get gel nails and gel polish on top, and she does a superb job! I know she won't let anyone walk out with anything less than perfection  Come in and see for yourself!

18.description: I don't get the Yelp! hate for Classic Nails, either. I really really like this place!I strolled in late on a Saturday morning and they saw me right away. Even though they had a big hen party coming in soon after me for both manis and pedis, my nail tech didn't rush AT ALL. She was very thorough and friendly, without being overly chatty. And she did an amazing job with no no-chip mani: it lasted nearly two weeks! And it was a deal,too! It's very clean and spacious inside- looks like it was some generic office space, but it's been nicely converted to something comfortable and open. I also have to give them serious credit for dealing so well with that hen party. Dear Lord- there were MAYBE 6 brain cells between this pack of condescending , aging Trixies...but the Classic Nails staff dealt with them with serious professionalism. Kudos- I sure wouldn't be able to handle it! I'll definitely definitely be back- they have a loyalty program!

41.description: Didn't think this place was all that bad until I came home and got a better look.I ordered a Chi-Town Deal and got a mani/pedi/eye & lip wax (I think I paid $25 for $57 of services). The pedicure? Looking and feeling great. Manicure? Well, my nails weren't filed symmetrically. So glad I chose a nude color so that wouldn't stand out.  Lastly, the waxing was alright, pretty standard as far as I could tell when I was there, but my upper lip is still red! Going to work with a mustache is precisely why I went in in the first place! I can appreciate a woman who has to take care of  her kids, but one of the women just kept on randomly getting up (without a word or apology) to get her kids to stop crying in the back. I would hope that's not a regular occurrence.Overall, I don't know that I would go back there. For the little money I spent on my Deal, it wasn't a bad experience, but I can't see myself paying full price for that.

50.description: Classic Nails was great!  I have been loyal to another nail salon for the 3 years I have been living in Roscoe Village.  Recently I have been disappointed with the service I was receiving so I checked out Classic Nails.  Sarah & Vi were very good.  My sister & I had a great overall experience!  The pedi chairs are super comfy & they have great specials!  I am trying to set up a girls spa day there for a bachelorette party...

4.description: New owner, new lotions, scrubs, colors & offerings.... same (or nearly same) price.  Still good value, still good service (they take their time), good leg & foot massage. Something fun & new:  Princess mani pedis for little girls on Sundays.  Very cute.Atmosphere is comfortable, definitely not trendy or updated.

6.description: love this place its so clean and relaxing. They also give loyalty cards and you just have to visit 6 times then u get a  free mani. also mon-wed mani pedi is only 30$. i usually go there on weekends tho and they also serve wine these days :)

22.description: Love this place!! It's right down the street from me and holy crap are the massage chairs AMAZING. Always have space for a walk-in AND it's a BYOB...doesn't get much better. The ladies who work here are eally nice and friendly always very thankful for the business. I've become a bit of a regular and always bring out of town friends here. Brought 12 girls in for a bachlorette party, which we scheduled a month in advance and it was awesome...they even had a bottle of champagne for the bride to be!! So great!The only reason I didn't give the full 5 starts is : 1) they always have the tv on cnn (not my idea of relaxing) and 2) the massage on the pedicure could be longer, but i'm spoiled b/c I used to practice massage so my standards are pretty high. But all in all, great spot!!

15.description: NEVER AGAIN! I went there once, and they did a great job.. but then the second time, I called them asking how much was acrylic full set they said $20 when I got there, they said it was $30. I said well i was told it was $20, they said sorry we didnt understand you, you have to pay $30. So I was going too, but then they made fun of me because I have short nails, WELL that's why I'm coming to the salon to get acrylics on so they can grow a little. So then I walked out and said bye!I will NEVER go back there again!!!

20.description: I don't get the Yelp! hate for Classic Nails, either. I really really like this place!I strolled in late on a Saturday morning and they saw me right away. Even though they had a big hen party coming in soon after me for both manis and pedis, my nail tech didn't rush AT ALL. She was very thorough and friendly, without being overly chatty. And she did an amazing job with no no-chip mani: it lasted nearly two weeks! And it was a deal,too! It's very clean and spacious inside- looks like it was some generic office space, but it's been nicely converted to something comfortable and open. I also have to give them serious credit for dealing so well with that hen party. Dear Lord- there were MAYBE 6 brain cells between this pack of condescending , aging Trixies...but the Classic Nails staff dealt with them with serious professionalism. Kudos- I sure wouldn't be able to handle it! I'll definitely definitely be back- they have a loyalty program!

36.description: so i went back to use my second youswoop, and I gotta say, it was MUCH MUCH MUCH better. Not sure if it's under new management - a new woman greeted me at the door and was extremely personable - and then the woman who did my mani/pedi did a good job. She didn't rush through it..actually gave the full spa pedi - scrub, massage, etc - and took her time on the pedicure. It looks good. Similarly, with the manicure. No rush job, gave me a nice hand massage, etc. While the manicure could be better (she didn't clean up around the tops as well as she could, so I had a few specs of nail polish at the tips of my fingers, and i can tell the polish will likely be chipping soon), it's not bad.Much improved from my last post, so I'll definitely look forward to using my 3rd Youswoop there. Hope the experience continues on this upward trajectory!

14.description: Buyer's remorse averted! A year ago I bought two You Swoops for The Classic Nails Shop based on their few, but positive reviews. However, when I looked them up a few months later there was an avalanche of negative reviews that had me ruing my decision to buy even one; it was at that point I began crafting a list of nemeses (nemesi?) to pawn them off on. I'm not sure what made me revisit their Yelp page, but I noticed an uptick in reviews and positive comments about new management; with great trepidation I decided to use my first certificate this past Fall and was pleasantly surprised. The salon isn't fancy or spa-like, but the equipment looks newer; there are approximately 6 manicure tables and 6 pedicure stations with the massage chairs. They also have a nice selection of mindless magazines to get me up-to-speed on important stuff like vases are out, bouquets are in*. Both visits, I was able to get in quickly, even when I used my second certificate a few days before expiration - just like a good little procrastinator should. I found both visits to be consistent and good, even the second time when they were dealing with an endless stream of stragglers. I don't really have any complaints about my manicure experience. Both times the technician who helped me was efficient and proficient. However, the pedicure left a bit to be desired. Both times it seemed like my feet soaked only briefly before they got down to business. I also wish there was more massaging, exfoliating and pumicing of my feet. However, the polish job on my toes was fantastic, I was able to go days without chips.  All in all, I'm glad I decided to use my You Swoops. I can't say this is my new favorite, go-to nail shop, but I think there's something to be said for consistency. 3.5 stars*Take note gentleman

0.description: Love the fun and creative merchandise, the very friendly staff and best of all: the costumes! It's my daughter's FAVORITE place in town (and grandma and I are big fans too...).

29.description: This guy.......is nothing short of amazing. I met him when I started working the front desk of State Street Barbers about 6 or 7 years ago. I've been going to him since. He's efficient, communicative, personable/likable and aims to make you happy. Which is everything you want in a barber/stylist. He's also very talented. I've seen him do a variety of cuts and styles for men and women. Great conversationalist. I've referred some family and friends to him and they continue to see him. I could go on, but I wont. You'll just have to find out yourself. Which I hope you do; you won't regret it.

42.description: I have never gotten so many compliments on my hair. Diadro spent about an hour and a half on me, listened to all my concerns and hair dreams and gave me the best haircut I've ever had. I have definitely found a place I can return to with confidence and not worry about my wallet being punched.

23.description: I don't write many reviews--just about businesses that are either outstandingly good or bad.  Diadro Cuts ranks as outstandingly good.   Why?  I'm 41 and am picky.  Had been going to Chicago Buzz for last 8 years (try Trish-she's good) before moving to NW Lakeview.  I tried Diadro based on the Yelp reviews and to my surprise, got the best haircut I've ever had.  It looked better, longer than any previous cut.  And the price was very competitive.  I was really happy.  2nd cut wasn't quite as good (not sure why), but just got out of my 3rd cut and it's even better than the first.  What makes Diadro stand out--he has both barber (started in a barber shop) and high-end salon experience (trained at Mario Trcoci), which makes for a better overall men's cut.  Most stylists don't know how to use a razor, and most barbers overuse the razor.  Diadro meshes both in a way that is like art.  And in my opinion, the diff between a great cut and a good one is attention to detail.  Double and triple checking lengths, blending, etc.  Diadro is a master at this.  Add to that mobile scheduling and I've found the right guy to fit my lifestyle.Downsides: the salon that he works in is kindof feminine, but it's not a huge deal.  Conclusion: I'm sold.  I'll be going to Diadro as long as his location and price make it worthwhile.

47.description: I drive from the far southside to have D cut my hair.  He does my boyfriend's hair as well and he is as pleased as I am with the work.I followed D from Big Hair and he has never done me wrong.

8.description: I'm extremely happy. I have an insane amount of hair and have had bad cut after bad cut. It looks like those days are over. Diadro did an amazing job. I went to him for my last major cut and then made the mistake of having my bangs trimmed elsewhere and they butchered me. He got my hair back in order the other day and I am incredibly happy with my new style. He also did a great dye job. I am naturally a VERY light blonde and he made my hair a really pretty chocolate brown. Can't recommend him enough!

31.description: I went to Diadro a couple months ago and I have meaning to write about my experience because he is that good! I am one of the pickiest people. I have NEVER liked a haircut and I'm new to the city so I was so lucky to have found Diadro. He is real with you and he knows what he is talking about. He tells you how it is but once he is done, you see why he made some choices. If you are looking for someone that will take his time and truly knows what he is talking about, go to him! You won't regret it!

34.description: OMG!!I am very picky about who I let do my hair. Since I never had a male stylist before, I was a little skeptical when my friend recommended him to me. He is amazing! Very chill! Very laid back! And very good at what he does! I've only been to him twice and both times I have left a very satisfied customer. Sitting in his chair is  my way of spoiling myself completely every two months! If he ever moved away, I don't know what I would do!

16.description: True story: before today, I had only had my hair cut by my longtime family stylist in IA.  I was super nervous to go to anyone else - my hair is a big challenge.  I'll cut to the chase, Diadro is AWESOME!  Not only did he give me an amazing cut, but he gave me a style (with a full tutorial) that is easily replicable in my day-to-day life.I am beyond thrilled - I'm taking my husband in for a haircut asap. :)

13.description: I'm very self-conscious about my rectangular face shape, so much so that I saw the same stylist for over 20 years.  What was I thinking?!  I've seen Diadro twice now- once for a quick trim and once for a massive change in style- and have been ecstatic both times.  If you live on the North Side, I don't know why you'd go anywhere else.Diadro communicated with me thoroughly, combining my vision with his expertise.  I was nervous before cutting my hair short, and his words chilled me out.  He also kept reinforcing how FUN this was going to be, and gave me great suggestions for multiple style options for later.In terms of the cut, Diadro is FAST.  The bulk of my hair was gone in minutes, leaving him lots of time for super-precise detailing; my hair's texture and bangs were shaped to perfection.  The styling grows out beautifully, so I don't feel like I have to go back every few weeks for re-shaping.I also appreciate the environment of SDC Cutting Gallery.  It's clean, uncluttered, and bright.  The music playing is modern, and the girls there are sweet; they totally remembered me after just one visit!Finally, you just can't beat the price.  Diadro has raised his female haircut cost- now $40- but still a STEAL in this neighborhood for this level of skill.  I'm going to do my best to convince my suburban mom to drive in.  Her stylist- the one I saw for 20 years- is stuck in the 90s, and it's time she met someone as rad as Diadro.

11.description: I love Diadro's haircuts! He's very talented and listens to me. I trust him 100% and always leave very happy (and I get a lot of compliments, which doesn't hurt).

39.description: I found D thanks to a friend who gets her haircut by him, and am so thankful. I've loved every haircut he's given me and he's such an awesome guy! Def recommend Diadro to anyone looking for an awesome haircut

37.description: Diadro is very talented, very sweet, and very into your hair.He has given me some of the most fantastic haircuts I've ever had (the kind that I don't have to get re-cut every 3-5 weeks because they show obvious signs of wonky outgrowth), and took my dark-ash-brown hair to a fantastic, vibrant cotton-candy pink.He listens to what you want, the cut he gives you always looks better than it did in your head, and he's very pleasant to be around.  I couldn't ask for more!

0.description: Diadro is the only person in Chicago I trust when it comes to doing my hair.Since I moved here in 2010, I have failed in finding a place to get my hair cut.  I'm very picky with my hair styles, and Diadro, I completely and totally trust with my hair.He is super kind, amazingly skilled, and will cut your hair so beautifully!!!

38.description: D is the man!  I met Diadro when he was cutting heads at Twisted Scissors, and knew I had to follow him when he left to go solo.  D is always friendly, cheap, and cuts heads like Ghostface Killah on the mic!  That's why he's got Supreme Clientele!Don't hesitate to give Diadro Cuts a try.  You wont be disappointed.

51.description: Diadro just cut my hair, and after I realized I'd only tipped 25% on what was the best haircut of my life, I created a yelp account solely to recommend him.So, yeah, he's pretty good. Now that I live in Brooklyn I may have to find a way to time haircuts with visits to Chi town...

27.description: This is the first hair cut I have ever had where it looks great without needing a ton of styling products, which is awesome because I'm more of a brush'n'go kind of person.  With that in mind, he is probably one of the best stylists I've had as he gave me a haircut that looks great with the hair I have instead of a haircut that also needs a lot of hair glop to look decent.Unlike other stylists, he didn't try to talk me into buying products or getting my hair colored. Thank goodness. He is very responsive to the customer, and will go out of his way to make the customer happy.

32.description: I went to Diadro on the basis of Yelp reviews and I am so glad I did. He spent a lot of time looking at my hair and understanding my willingness to spend time and effort on maintaining a style (very little). He also asked me general questions about my style, my work, and how I liked to look. He even taught me how to properly operate a hairdryer and fixed the remnants of a messy trim I had given myself a few months before. The online booking also makes it really easy to schedule haircuts. I'm thrilled to have found him and will definitely be going back. It doesn't hurt that Flip is a great looking salon and very conveniently located.

48.description: There are a lot of places to get your haircut in Chicago, but I don't go to those places. I'd rather take a 2 mile journey up to D, and have my hair cut done by a pro. My GF and I followed D from twisted scissors, haven't looked back.Oh and yelp, don't delete my review.

44.description: D is the best.  He always spends time listening to what I want and offers feedback.  I always leave feeling like I just had the best haircut of my life.  He is by far the best at what he does and I wouldn't go anywhere else.

24.description: After moving to the city, I needed to find someone to cut my hair. I did my research and came across this shop. I decided to set up an appointment, which was quite simple seeing as you can book your appointment online. All I can say now is thank you, thank you, thank you. This man knows his stuff. I'll be honest. I'm a male and I have very thin hair, so it's extremely hard to do anything with it, let alone find someone who knows how to handle it. Diadro knew exactly what he was doing. Just in the first appointment, we had already already set-up a plan on how to go about tackling my hair. He gave me amazing tips and tricks I just had never heard before. Even after the first haircut, I was ecstatic. Then the next time I went in, he remembered exactly where he left off at and just built on it from there. I honestly could not say anything bad about this man right here and his establishment.

7.description: I rarely write reviews, but have to post one for Diadro.  I have been his client for four years and am blown away by his skill.  I completely trust him with my hair and walk out of his studio feeling awesome. He knows exactly what to do with my thick, wavy hair and is knowledgeable about all sorts of cuts and styles.  I don't know what I would do without him!And my god, he is super affordable!

49.description: Let me start by saying when I went to Diadro the first time, my hair was absolutely ruined by another stylist.  Diadro quickly consulted me on what he could do for me and actually LISTENED to what I wanted!  After a full hour of cutting my hair I had EXACTLY what I wanted and for 1/3 of the price of any major salon.  Diadro is one of the best stylists in the city and I have reccommended him to all of my friends.I have been getting haircuts from Diadro for about 6 months now.  I am an extremely low maintenance type of girl and I always love the way he styles my hair upon leaving his salon but when I get home I cant seem to do it the same way.  Last time I was in Diadro offered to teach me how to blow dry my hair the correct way and had me come in for classes M-F for a full week as I developed basic blow dry skills.  He was extremely patient with me and my lack of styling skills and figured out a way to simplify my style so that I could do it right every time on my own.Diadro is funny, genuine and an all around good guy.  It also doesnt hurt that you can call him the day before you want a cut and he will find a way to fit you into his busy schedule.  Diadro Cuts is a cut above every other salon in Lakeview.  I highly recommend his service!

40.description: Finally!  A fabulous cut that doesn't break the bank!  I have paid over $75 for a stylist to just trim my hair, and style it in a way I would never take the time to do.  Diadro listened to me, and spent an extra half an hour with me giving me tips on how to style my hair in little time.  I will be going back to him for sure.

30.description: Diadro is AWESOME! He is by far the best hair cut I have ever gotten..... ! I have recommended him to all my friends. I got my second haircut from him today, and I will always go back. There is no need to look any further. Thanks for being so great at your job and more importantly enjoying what you do. You are the best.

46.description: Diadro is amazing!  He is the best stylist I have ever been to.  He takes his time and is an absolute perfectionist. I strongly recommend  him.  He is incredible! you will not be disappointed.

1.description: I've finally found my go-to guy for an exceptional haircut in a laid-back atmosphere. Getting a cut here is akin to the way I feel after getting a massage- I come out renewed, relaxed and feeling fantastic. Major props for the genderqueer haircut option.

9.description: Diadro just cut my hair for the second time and he is amazing. This is the best haircut I have ever had. I have long, straight hair and Diadro gave me a great style with layers for movement while keeping the length.I found out about Diadro through a friend who just raved about him. In both my and my friend's experiences, Diadro really listens to his clients and makes sure that he understands what they want. He also draws from his expertise and makes suggestions, but lets the client decide what will be done.Finally, Diadro's prices are incredible. This is the best haircut I've had and also one of the least expensive.

26.description: TALENTED & ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!  Diadro is extremely talented at what he does and is not the 'average' stylist you may encounter.  His passion, talent and perfection truly shine thru his work (art)!This is the best cut I've ever received, not to mention, very easy to maintain and practical--Double Bonus!  Diadro designed a cut that would best compliment me, yet one that was easy to work with on a daily basis.  I went to see family this weekend & everyone expressed how sharp and detailed my hair looked, in addition, it fitting my features and personality so well.  My mother lives in Iowa and plans on making a day trip up just to have him cut her hair.....what does that tell you?  I adore my new style and would recommend him in a heartbeat!  Upon meeting him, you will know you're in good hands! Give him a try, you won't be disappointed!

25.description: Diadro he's def a talent stylist, with great kindness. I went to nobody but him as long as I have my hair cut in Chicago. He far exceed the "average" level. I mean NEVER go to Diadro if you want a ugly hair style. BTW, he totally know how to match your expectation, and he can always make more of it! If you don't believe his magic, go try it..

12.description: I am very picky about who gets to touch my hair. I moved to Chicago couple of years ago and would never feel like getting a hair cut at any salon with the fear of a massive goof up. Finally I really needed one soon and therefore started an online search (based off friends' suggestions) on several hair cutting salons in and around Chicago.I finally stumbled upon SDC's reviews while looking at other places and I must say: Every single review is perfect. I had the same wonderful experience. Diadro is awesome. He suggested what would suit me and heard me on how i wanted my hair to look and then suggested few options. It is totally worth it !!! The salon is not fancy like other salons, maybe they are still setting it up. But that doesn't matter! I would strongly recommend Diadro's Cut to everyone out there who is looking for something affordable and awesome :).

21.description: Diadro is the hair stylist I've been looking for all my life and I've tried them in some ritzy places! He is so talented and careful and takes the time to get to know your kind of hair. And he is so skilled, he gets the perfect results that I want.  I'm so glad I found him!

17.description: TALENTED & ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!  Diadro is extremely talented at what he does and is not the 'average' stylist you may encounter.  His passion, talent and perfection truly shine thru his work (art)!This is the best cut I've ever received, not to mention, very easy to maintain and practical--Double Bonus!  Diadro designed a cut that would best compliment me, yet one that was easy to work with on a daily basis.  I went to see family this weekend & everyone expressed how sharp and detailed my hair looked, in addition, it fitting my features and personality so well.  My mother lives in Iowa and plans on making a day trip up just to have him cut her hair.....what does that tell you?  I adore my new style and would recommend him in a heartbeat!  Upon meeting him, you will know you're in good hands! Give him a try, you won't be disappointed!

10.description: I have been very reluctant to write a review for Diadro. If he's reading this, I'm sure he remembers our conversation at my last haircut appointment. I started seeing him a few years ago when he was at Bombshell Salon, and was so impressed that I sent my ex to Diadro. (Diadro is quite talented at cutting men's hair.) I stopped seeing Diadro because I moved to the West Loop and he was just too far, but I had two hair appointments this year since moving closer to Flip Salon and needless to say, I am glad to be back. Flip Salon is very convenient, being within one block of the Addison-Brown Line CTA. After the hair appointment, I always go across the street to Trader Joe's for groceries!*Anyway, Diadro is a really thoughtful, talented stylist. I am a "wash and go" kind of girl. I don't like to use much product in my hair except maybe some mousse and hairspray, and I like a classic, yet edgy cut. He takes this all into consideration and provides his input when suggesting styles. He takes his time with me and makes sure that I am pleased with the results. I always leave satisfied with my hair cut! His prices are quite reasonable. You can leave tip on your credit card too, which is super convenient.Of course, Diadro is a really cool, sweet guy.Yeah, if you're not happy with your stylist or you're looking a talented stylist that doesn't charge you an arm and a leg for a 'do, definitely book an appointment with Diadro. * - I started writing this review a few months ago. He is now at SDC Gallery, which is accessible via Damen, Western, and Belmont buses. Paulina CTA is about a 20 minute walk away.

5.description: Diadro is extremely skilled at cutting hair and also ensuring his clients are completely satisfied! Diadro is great at listening and also giving nice styling advice throughout the cut. He encouraged me to come back with feedback and new style ideas. Diadro is all around just a cool guy and phenomenal barber!

3.description: Diadro did a great job shaping my hair, which have been challenging for many of my hairdressers. You could see his passion right away and that's what makes his job outstanding. The haircut was $30 and $7.5 tip, still less but better than the haircut I used to get at Halo for Men ($50 and $10 tip).This is the first place rated five stars I have seen on Yelp.

35.description: I have lived in Chicago for two years and avoid getting my hair cut here at all costs.  I have a loyal stylist back home in Madison who has been fixing me for 10 years and I trust her implicitly, so after a couple mediocre experiences at salons in the city, I gave up.However, recently I did a brief stint as an extra for a tv show, and they cut my hair in order to style it for the 60's.  The cut made me miserable, and I put up with it as long as the show was shooting, but as soon as it concluded, I knew I needed to do something about my terrible haircut.I googled my neighborhood and after scanning yelp reviews, I decided on Diadro.  I scheduled my 9:45am appointment at 1am, and prayed that he would be there for it.Sure enough, he was there and ready to go the next morning, and after a good conversation and a lot of questions about what I wanted, he dry cut my hair, shampooed, and blow dryed.  Then he gave me a few minutes (by myself so I didn't feel any pressure) to play with my hair and see how it felt and if it was doing what I wanted.  He came back and listened when I expressed a desire to change a few things, fixed them, and I left feeling better about my hair than I have in months.  The whole time he was also funny, charismatic, and great at keeping conversation up.  I felt comfortable talking to him about what I was looking for, which is not always the case.  I have to say I had a great experience with Diadro.  I was a little skeptical of all the five star reviews, but after getting exactly what I wanted from both the haircut and the experience, I am on board. Thank you Diadro!  I couldn't be happier :)

19.description: Diadro he's def a talent stylist, with great kindness. I went to nobody but him as long as I have my hair cut in Chicago. He far exceed the "average" level. I mean NEVER go to Diadro if you want a ugly hair style. BTW, he totally know how to match your expectation, and he can always make more of it! If you don't believe his magic, go try it..

28.description: Drove up from Urbana in search of a new stylist and I've found one in Diadro. He formulated and communicated an immediate and long term plan for my hair that fit with my level of Styling bandwidth and product use in a way that had a sort of nonchalant brilliance to it.

45.description: Words can not express how happy I am to have found Diadro.  I spent much of Thursday night calling salons to see if someone could fit me in for an early morning appointment the next day, before I had to go to work at 12pm.  I happened to read some good reviews about Diadro, and called him up. He went out of his way to reschedule his day, and probably came is early, to make sure that he could fit me in, AND take his time with our appointment. When I showed up he spent a lot of time noticing the texture, and movement of my hair, and talking with me about what I wanted. I loved the results of my cut. At the end of our session, I was expecting him to simply blow dry my hair straight. But instead, since I usually let my hair air-dry curly in the morning, he wanted to show me some techniques to help me style my hair myself. It was great! He talked about the kinds of products he would recommend for my hair, but never tried to push me into buying any from him. He is one of the nicest people I've met in Chicago, he's incredibly affordable, and he is a wonderful stylist. I wish I could give Diadro six stars.

33.description: Diadro is the best.  The. best.I cannot stress how anal I am about who I let touch my hair.  It borders a little crazy.I had just moved to Chicago a few months ago from Florida and went here on a referral from a friend.  I was incredibly nervous as I have stupid thick hair that can be difficult to cut.  Plus, it had taken me forever to find a hair stylist I trusted back home.  I had been going to her for five years and never thought I could trust anyone to do such a great job with my hair.I was wrong.Diadro is INCREDIBLE.  He takes his time and really understands what works for your hair.  My first haircut with him he said, "Cutting hair is fucking fun!", and I instantly knew I was in for a great cut.I only had a vague idea of what I wanted and Diadro took it from there.  Every time I leave with a "dang, my hair looks stupid cute" smile on my face.AND, his prices!?  $35 for a female cut.  You can't beat that.Go to him.

43.description: I have two basic requirements for a hair stylist; listen to me when I say I refuse to spend hours on my hair in the morning, and then don't try and sell me expensive styling products I'll never use for the haircut I'll never style.Diadro listened, styled - and now my hair looks awesome. He managed to skillfully shape my mop into an actual 'style' that even my lazy backside can take care of -and- get compliments on!Will absolutely be back!

2.description: I've been coming here for over a year now after being forced to wait 30+ min for a scheduled haircut at another salon. I've never had the same problem here - I don't believe I've waited more than 5 (rarely 10) minutes because you're able to set your own appointments online which is really simple.I've never been dissatisfied with my haircut, I just let him do his work. He's definitely passionate about what he does seeing that he is a perfectionist when it comes to every aspect of your hair. He listens and gives insight on what he thinks would work well.I have a pretty simple haircut, so it always baffled me how someone could possibly mess it up even though I went back to the same person. It's always been consistent and now I feel safe enough to try something new next time.

18.description: Just went and got my 1st haircut here today. I am very particular about how I like my hair and I'm pretty hard to please. That said this was a great cut. I got exactly what I was looking for and I will be back.My only issues was today was a hot day and I came in having just walked about a mile and I was a kind of sweaty. The shop was also pretty warm so I was kind of uncomfortable, but that is a pretty minor inconvenience.

41.description: I found D in 2006 and it was a blessing! He started off by offering to style my hair which I had recently had cut. He styled it and I loved the way I looked when I got out of his chair. After asking him to style my hair a few more times I decided that he was the one that should be cutting my hair. I have been faithful to him since! He now is in charge of helping me keep me "Diva" on! He also cuts a couple of my guys , my mother's hair, and my BFF's hair! He is professional, courteous, and honest. HE IS ALWAYS RELIABLE AND HE IS THE BEST!!

50.description: First off...YELP please don't delete my review!Second and more important...My cuts from Diadro are the best damn hair cuts I have had in Chicago period!  D will give you a cut, some laughs, and you leave feeling like you just ripped him off.  The price is CRAZY.  If D was like so many other stylists he could charge $80 and everyone would still go to him cause he is THAT good.  With D the saying "what you pay for is what you get" holds no ground.  Diadro goes to work cause he loves what he does, not to steal all your money.  D...your the best, see you few weeks.

4.description: I made an appointment to meet diadro on the same day, and was able to book 5:30pm.  Finding parking was as not nearly as an issue for other locations in Chicago; I parked a block down and walked over to the store front.The studio was... Bare.  There were two stations, with one of them only being occupied by diadro at the time.  Decorations were spread around as much as possible to occupy the huge space, but the studio was lacking a real presence.And I liked that.  I walked in, and Diadro instantly sat me down and expressed what he wanted to do.  There is something about getting a haircut with the minimalistic amount of things and people around. You can tell that Diadro really cares about his work; the exact moment you enter, he has already began thinking about what he wants to do to make you look good.Unfortunately, I have a series of interviews in the near future, and I needed a tamer haircut.  However, he was able to give me a formal look that looks approachable when I let my hair down.He did a wonderful job,  I came in with a shaggy head that hadn't been cut in nearly a year (Riding my sport tourer feels better with my locks flowing in the wind) and he turned it around.I'll definitely come around again, without the restrains of appearing to be more responsible than my age.Also, I'm male.  If that means anything.

6.description: Diadro is phenomenal. I'll never go to any other stylist now that I've been to SDC!

22.description: true story - i've known Diadro a long time.  i have crazy and curly hair, both.  in desperation i walked into a fancy salon and they threw me to the guy who cuts the hair they don't want to deal with.  he is an amazing talent and great personality.  we both left the fancy salon and i spent four bad-hair years searching for him.  now i found him and i travel a ways to get to his salon but entirely worth any effort.  we've been through the help-me-age-gracefully haircut and a few experiments and every look works and every experience with him is easy and fun.  i don't say this lightly:  Diadro is an artist and a good soul.

15.description: This review is long overdue. I have been seeing Diadro for over two years now and i love him.I went to many salons in Chicago looking for someone who would understand my hair. It's crazy that for a such a diverse city a lot of salons have no idea of how to deal with hair that is not straight. Mine is curly, thick Puerto Rican hair and it was a nightmare to get it cut. I once went to a salon to get a haircut and ended up asking the girl to just cut the ends because I could feel how nervous she was about cutting my hair. I have had my hair long for many years. When i started seeing Diadro it was on the shorter side but still long enough to cover my neck and my curls where everywhere. I really like my curls and to some extent i thought they defined me somehow. After seeing him for a while i was ready to go pixie and he gave me the cutest haircut ever. I wouldn't change him for anyone. He is hands down the best stylist in the city.

20.description: I hate to sound like a broken record, but I just have to add my 2 cents. Diadro is a master of his craft. I could not be more pleased with him. He gave me the best haircut I have ever had, and I consistently get compliments on it. He seemed to intuit my personality. He asked a few key questions, LISTENED TO MY ANSWERS, and then created a style that is versatile, interesting and unique to me. I have been to him twice already, and I will continue to see him for as long as I am alive and living in Chicago, and if I move, I may even book flights back just to go to him. Not kidding. My hair has never been healthier, which is saying a lot because I have fine hair but lots of it, and after a while, it can get ratty looking. Diadro's cut starts out looking great and never looks bad as it grows out. I am able to reproduce what he did in the salon pretty closely. The best part? Diadro does not believe in using too much product (no product pushing) and showed me how to style my hair so that I don't need to use more than a spritz of hairspray IF I want. That is new territory for me. If you go to see Diadro for a women's haircut, you will walk out with a $200 for $35.

36.description: Diadro is the best at what he does. The. Best. He takes the time to "get to know" your hair.  If you feel like your hair is hard to manage, D will be the one to tame it.  Stop reading this and book an appointment with him already. I'm just about to do the same.

14.description: Besides being a very talented stylist, Diadro is life saver in situations when you must have you hair done for special occasions! I had a formal Gala event to go to  and he was able to flex his schedule at the last minute request. 45 minutes later I walked out with a perfect hair. I got so many compliments  - it was both classy and stylish. Huge thanks to Diadro for his creativity, talent and precision! I have been going to him exclusively for the past year and highly recommend him to everyone.

58.description: Brunch is just brunch here. Nothing extraordinary about the food but the fresh pressed juice is a whole other story. You can pick any combination of fruits or vegetables and they will turn it into a refreshing juice for you. Definitely worth stopping in for that

56.description: I was being selfish because of my cucumber situation. Yelpers- go to Orange, either location, if you want a real Chicago brunch. Do the right thing.

29.description: This place was fun.  The best part was that the servers were undaunted by a stroller during busy Sunday brunch hours and accommodated us well!  Everyone was very nice and the food was great.  Well priced.  Wish I had tried the Frushi!
