42.description: This place is an amazing breakfast/lunch place.  Great food, great service, can get busy most of the time but that's a good thing, it means there's always fresh food coming out of the kitchen.Too bad it closes around 3pm, I wish they stayed open later...Oh, by the way, if you stop by, you gotta get their "Fruit Sushi", it's AMAZING!!!

23.description: Love their pancake flight options and the orange coffee, but I wouldn't wait longer than 10 minutes to eat here.

47.description: This is probably the best breakfast spot in Roscoe Village. I won't give it five stars because I have had better, but keep in mind I am very spoiled when it comes to trendy breakfast spots. However, if you love the food at IHOP this food will blow your mind. I personally hate IHOP. The steak and eggs Benedict is my favorite dish. My son loves the pancake flight. I have never had any problems with seating or service.

8.description: Delicious food! The staff was super helpful and assisted in picking out what we wanted to have for breakfast! We will totally be back!

31.description: Orange is my favorite, go-to breakfast stop!  I am shocked to see I'm reviewing them for the first time!Cucumber jug of water....orange infused pot of coffee...If you're a tea drinker, their chai tea french toast is to die for.  Yes, french toast oven baked in chai tea.  YUM! My mouth is watering just thinking about it, guess I'll have to take another trip soon! OH darn.The wait is never long, as their staff is stacked with bus-boys, waiters, and cooks to help clear the tables and get you in.Come hungry! I always leave with yummy leftovers.

34.description: Delicious and original. Orange coffee is a must try!!!!  Very kid friendly.  Lots of fun decor on the wall and really friendly staff. They have a special pancake flight that changes themes.  There was also a fruit plate called fruishi.

16.description: My fav place for breakfast in Chicago. Only 4 stars bc they have to cappuccino or espresso. Great french toast but they are rich, large portions, so plan on sharing. Definitely get the Tijuana eggs Benedict.   Great fresh juice options too!

13.description: Decent breakfast.  Nothing to write home about.  Frushi is just cut up fruit.. Plus- bow truss coffee.

11.description: I came here for brunch on Saturday and we were seated immediately. The good: Coffee! They serve Bowtruss and it never disappoints. Extra points for bringing me a personal mug. I had the two eggs and a side of pancakes. I usually like to order my eggs over easy because I like to break it on a toast, but unfortunately, the plates only come with 1 piece of toast. Also, the potatoes were more of a mashed and didn't have that much flavor. I was a bit confused by it because I've never had breakfast potatoes that way...but they were decent.The pancakes I ordered came in a stack of two and they were not fluffy pancakes as I had hoped. The pancakes were a bit flat and by the time I ate them, they were sticking to the plate. Also, I ordered fresh strawberries and got like 3 strawberries and charged $1.50 for them, which I thought were overpriced. My boyfriend got the chorizo has with eggs and from the bite I tried, it was good. I would give this place another shot at another time.

39.description: Very disappointed in my first experience at this place.  If you are not willing to order an omellete from their pre-designed menu, they will only do custom orders as a "scramble"  Seriously?  You are a breakfast place.  You obviously have an omelette pan, why can you not make your own.  I get it if everything were on a grill only but I thought it was a joke.Food was extremely, extremely over priced for both the portion size and quality.  Syrup is in Olive Oil bottles and takes about 5 minutes of holding it upside down to get any on your pancakes or waffles.I would not recommend this place, especially when there are several other options in the immediate area.

37.description: Chicago lives for brunch and Orange does brunch right. The service is amazing and they keep the large weekend crowds moving without making you feel rushed in any way.Try the orange coffee and the rustic raspberry egg sandwich- it sounds weird but it's not! So delicious! This is a great place to bring out-of-towners to show them Chicago means business when it comes to brunch!

0.description: Best breakfast/brunch place within walking distance of my apartment. It's a little pricey, but I visit about once a week. The best part? The coffee. The orange coffee is really good, and they also sell Bowtruss. It's a little pricier than I like to spend on coffee, but it's bottom-less and they give you a to-go cup to take the rest of your pot home. Maybe it's to make up for the "no outside beverage rule," but I think that's good service. As for the food, it's good. It's not the best, but it's good. The chai tea french toast and house potatoes are amazing. The service is good; everyone we've had so far has been really sweet and there's never a wait. Overall I highly recommend.

38.description: This is always a must stop when we come to Chicago! I love the French toast ( Orange's French toast) always great. Also enjoyed in my party was the pancake special which is 4 different types of pancakes  3 of each kind. Awesome! And a chorizo Benedict... Also awesome!!! Service is always great. We had a baby with us and the server was so great with him! The food is fresh and always good. High praises!!

51.description: Cute little place that is not a far drive from my house.  Seating is tight, but it is likely because the place is hopping during peak breakfast hours,  I tried the cinnamon role pancake which was delicious, though super rich.  My wife sampled the four fruit pancake special, of which she really only liked one of them, so we would likely pass on that next time.Our waiter was kind and attentive.  While a little out of my way, I could gladly go back.

27.description: The orange in roscoe is much better then wicker park. The look and feel of the restaurant is more urban and boho. It's brightly coloured and really adds to the charmThe service was great, waitress was polite and alertThe orange coffee is different and worth the tryThe food here is pretty great. I ordered the chorizo breakfast, the food tasted delicious, light and fresh. My BF got the steak and eggs- he to liked it a lot except the balsamic dressing over it was over poweringA perfect place for brunches.

32.description: The service is just an addition to the amazing quality of food! The fresh frushi is a must! They have items that anyone will love from sandwiches full of flavor to traditional breakfast favorites.

54.description: Never again. Came here with my boyfriend and some of his family. Cute looking place. Cool art on the walls. Our waiter was kind of obnoxious with the up selling of certain things on the menu. The chai tea french toast was alright, but it was super soggy-not at all the way I like my french toast. The huevos rancheros was pretty gross and soupy. Not a fan of their potatoes either. The omelette was pretty good though. My boyfriend's steak tasted super weird, so all of us tried a piece, and we all agreed something was wrong. So, by that time there wasn't much of the steak left. We brought it to the waiter's attention and he was SUPER RUDE about it, telling us that it shouldn't taste weird and that maybe we shouldn't have eaten so much of it then. This middle aged white guy was probably one of the top 3 rudest waiters I have ever had.

48.description: This place is great! One of the items I ordered was fresh squeezed orange banana juice. It was a little pricey but so yummy! I ordered the pancakes and they were amazing as well as bacon. My fiancé ordered the orange French toast and loved them. I would highly recommend going there.

44.description: This trendy brunch spot is my favorite place to go to in Roscoe Village. I have been to Orange at the very least 30 times. The ambiance is great, very trendy and the music is upbeat. I check in on Instagram each time I go there and people are impressed by the dishes I photograph. (Green eggs and ham, Chai Tea french toast, orange rosemary french toast, pancake flights, fruishi, etc.) Joseph, who runs the Instagram page even gives out free entrees if you hashtag #OrangeChicago each week for one lucky winner. I've won before and am always pleased each time I go back. The service is impeccable and they don't bother you too much either, which is a plus for me. Cucumber water is always filled and the food comes out rather fast which is nice as well. I can't think of any complaints. If I had to pick one... I would say... if you show up during peak hours, you might have to wait to sit down. Very popular, so I completely understand. Other than that, I highly recommend my favorite breakfast/brunch place in the neighborhood. Actually have never had lunch before because the breakfast stuff is so good. Might have to try lunch and add to my report later. Good eating.

24.description: went for breakfast and it was great !! very very strong coffee ! And the only negative thing is about the house potatoes , would not recommend them . But I would highly recommend their waffles !!! so good !

7.description: Fabulous orange coffee!!! This is really delicious and I would love to have this every morning!  This is a new favorite brunch spot to keep in the rotation. I finally found a place in the RV hood that is quiet, adult-like, and doesn't have children running around screaming and crying. Hallelujah!The food is excellent and is done on a higher level that most of the restaurants nearby. Chicken is antibiotic free and egg whites are no charge. The attention to detail here is what I appreciate. I had a fantastic chicken club sandwich and sweet potato fries. Will probably be back on Saturday or Sunday!

49.description: Bradley, Joe, Mario, and the rest of the gang at Orange provide such great service! It makes the good food even better!!

40.description: My girlfriend and I have been to Orange twice now, and each time was great.  The food is fresh, authentic, and the service is on point.  They take care of you and make sure the meal goes well.  I had the chocolate chip pancakes and they were light, fluffy, and comes with real syrup.  Last time I had the corn beef hash and I ate it so fast, my girlfriend didn't even get a chance to try it.  She got the steak sandwich, which is a light, healthier version of most steak sandwiches.  She had the omelet last time with apple sausage in it.  Nothing was heavy, greasy, or bad.  The greyhound, cocktails and juices are worth the visit by themselves.

53.description: Wow!!Fun, inspired menu. Well-executed dishes prepared with fresh ingredients. Service on Monday morning...slow. However, I would DEFINITELY return. There were 3 of us dining, plus a toddler. We ordered 6 breakfasts because everything sounded so delicious. Not one of our meals disappointed us in any way!The Tijuana Eggs Benedict was TO DIE FOR. Not too spicy, perfectly cooked poached eggs, served with potatoes which were delicious, but mostly untouched because portion sizes are substantial. We also ordered an omelette which was perfectly prepared and our "healthy" contribution to the meal.Our carrot cake pancakes were quite tasty- fluffy and not too sweet. The seasonal Pumpkin Ginger cakes were very gingery (which we like, but might be too overwhelming for some). Both pancake dishes were topped with "puddles of goodness", as my dining partner noted- not too sweet concoctions of cream cheese whipped cream or something similar. But- it gets better!- the Rosemary Orange French Toast was magnificent. So, absolutely delicious. The brioche bread was sliced thick and perfectly battered. It wasn't soggy or mushy inside, but moist with a gorgeous, crisp crust outside. The rosemary orange cream and sliced almonds on top made this dish totally over the top!To polish off our meal we also had bacon, which was cooked just right, and a pretty little fruit plate. Again, service was a little slow, but as we were in no rush and seated outdoors on a gorgeous day, we couldn't complain. And the food was totally worth the wait!!Well done, Orange. Well done.

30.description: Warm tomato wedges are not oven-roasted tomato. Something to consider before ordering the Caprese Eggs Benedict. Otherwise, food tends to be good.

46.description: My food was super good, I had an appetizer of Frushi, and than had a bacon, feta and spinach scramble, good but expensive for breakfast.

1.description: I went to Orange this Sunday on Valentine's Day for a friends b-day lunch.  The food here is terrible and I do not understand all these great reviews.  My scrambled eggs were obviously taken from some bulk catering tray in the back and definitely not cooked to order.  I asked for my bacon extra crispy and it came out deep fried!  They are apparently known for their pancakes but you can't try those without ordering the full 6-course flight of pancakes.  They were busy so they were also all over us about clearing plates as the last bite was still en route to my friends mouth in order to hurry us out.Overall, this place is highly over-rated, bad food not made to order, and mediocre service.  I will not be back.

55.description: We went here on a Sunday morning before our flight back to NY. The place is located in roscoe village which is a cool little downtown area with a lot of different restaurants and cool shops. The food at Orange was awesome!  I got the chocolate hazelnut pancakes while my wife got the Pancake flight, and both were delicious. The Orange coffee is a pretty cool alternative to regular coffee, it has a hint of orange flavor that isn't overpowering. It seems that they use really high quality ingredients in everything they make. The artwork on the wall gives this place a great Chicago vibe. We definitely recommend and hope to be back next time we are in the neighborhood.

9.description: Why 4 stars and not 5? I'm a fan of outdoor seating in the summer. I had the rosemary and orange french toast - it was rich yet light and refreshing! My mom had the Green Eggs & Ham (the 'green' being pesto) which to be honest, I preferred. The french toast, while tasty, was a bit too much after plowing through 2 pieces. The Green Eggs & Ham, savory and I couldn't get enough!We tried the Orange-flavored coffee. I wasn't a fan though the server was very nice and offered to swap it with regular coffee if we asked.

26.description: Loved the frushi! Probably the best thing I enjoyed from my meal. I was excited to try the orange coffee, but was disappointed at its taste. Orange and coffee just don't go well together to me. Don't get me wrong, though, others seem to enjoy it so give it a try if you're willing to risk it. I also had high expectations for the pancake flight, but that also wasn't that great. The pancakes seemed a bit dry to me despite the toppings it had. I think when I went the theme was pies. I love the fact that this place switches the theme up every week, though.

25.description: Decent breakfast.  Nothing to write home about.  Frushi is just cut up fruit.. Plus- bow truss coffee.

12.description: Tasty place. Parking was easy. I came on Friday at about 9am. I ordered the pancake flight. I really like that idea because sometimes I don't feel like picking breakfast food... It's hard enough for me to pick between savory and sweet! Great ambiance. The service was a little slow though. We once had to get up and grab a server for more water.

59.description: Like the name suggests, Orange will pretty much pair anything in your meal with an orange flavor. I debated for a hot second if I wanted the orange flavored coffee, but then I remembered the only orange flavored things I like (besides oranges) are Orange flavored Milano cookies. If you're feeling bold, try an orange coffee.I'd call our brunch more of a lunch and not recommend this place if you're looking for a morning pick me up. There's a reason we never have brunch in this area, even though all my friends live in Roscoe village. The food is decent, but don't let the pictures fool you. There's somewhere else for that.

21.description: I had breakfast with my friends here today.  This place has a really nice welcoming interior design. Lots of bright colors. Wait staff was friendly.  You can crest your own juice. I had mango strawberry and it it was delicious. I had the omelette 5 for breakfast. It was very good. It came with some potatoes and I chose five grain toast. My friend got the omelette special and really liked his good. My other friend wasn't feeling breakfast so he ordered a burger and said it was also good. My friends son had the fruity pebbles pancakes. This was a huge portion for a kids menu. Overall we had a great meal.

17.description: Was ok, decent food, bit of a wait for a table, kind of expensive for breakfast.  I'd come again but wouldn't go out of my way to make it happen.

10.description: Delicious pancakes, great service, and great menu options. Came on Valentines Day, really busy but food still came out fast and good. Compliments to the chef.

5.description: I'm not much of a yelper, but what a great surprise this place is. Any kind of fresh juice you want, coffee and the best French toast I've ever had! I think it's called Rosemary orange ... Trust meExcellent service too!

3.description: When a breakfast/brunch place offers complementary cucumber water, it won't have a low rating in my book.  Hubby and I finished shopping at the Village Discount, and we stayed for food nearby.  Orange is located on Roscoe St., the street where hosts the annual RV fest.  It's a vibrant commercial road with lots of local businesses and restaurants.  Orange serves classic western-style breakfast/brunch menu, with a hint of Hispanic twist.  I saw "Tijuana Benedict" on the menu and felt curious.  By the way, many items are vegetarian-friendly, with the letter "V" indicated at the end of the descriptions.  Hubby went with the grilled cheese with rye bread, stuffed with pesto, garlic, broccoli, and avocado (extra $2 for this add-on).  This "Tijuana Benedict" had nothing to do with border control, but had everything to do with the criminally delicious Chipotle hollandaise sauce.  The eggs were impeccably poached; the amount of meshed potatoes wasn't overwhelming.  In other words, the portion was adequate for my late morning appetite.  Hubby's grilled cheese was hearty and I shared some of the fries with him.  Orange offers all-natural ketchup, manufactured here in Chicago.  Although I'm not a fan of ketchup, the spicy ketchup has a sweet and "BBQ" after taste.  Hubby said he used to make ketchup from scratch, and that ketchup definitely tasted home-made!  Brunch for two (2) here cost us $25.25, so it seemed fair considering we were in Roscoe Village, one of Chicago's premier family-friendly neighborhoods.

35.description: Tasty place. Parking was easy. I came on Friday at about 9am. I ordered the pancake flight. I really like that idea because sometimes I don't feel like picking breakfast food... It's hard enough for me to pick between savory and sweet! Great ambiance. The service was a little slow though. We once had to get up and grab a server for more water.

19.description: Really delicious food! Had the oat and berries French toast, tijuana eggs Benedict both were knock out good! Even the food presentation was stellar. Great service comfortable and nicely decorated interior. WiFi strong. Huge and strong awesome tasting bowtruss coffee.

28.description: My first review was in 2008 and we keep coming back.  I moved my review up a star as this place has remained good, great service, good food.

45.description: The frushi and fresh-squeezed juices alone bump the star rating up one.  Other than that, it's just an ordinary brunch joint.  Nice ambiance and good food but nothing so spectacular to make me look forward to their breakfast items.

33.description: I dig this place! I think the Frushi is nasty but everything else on the menu is great. I always get the pancake flight as a starter for brunch. This location is a lot less crowded than the Lincoln Park location and there is tons of parking so its an easy last minute place for a group.

43.description: When I have a morning without my daughter i like to come to orange. My spouse and I like to share so we always get the pancake flight and then something savory.  I love the flight. Each week is a different theme. They make 4 specialty pancakes and then serve silver dollar versions of all of them.  Sometimes the flavor combination are so amazing.  It is a great way to get a variety and I love variety.  They have frushi, I have never tried it but it always looks interesting.  I am not a sushi lover so I am a little apprehensive to try it. You can also create any type of fresh fruit/veggie juice you want. Cons- The seating is a little tight sometimes with a small child I like more room. it can get a little pricey for breakfast but it is worth it for an occasional treat.

2.description: What an awesome brunch! In town for a few days and needed a place to eat that was near the antique shops on Belmont Ave. Glanced at the reviews on Yelp ahead of time, then happened to see it while driving through the neighborhood. We were surprised to walk right in with no wait on a Saturday around 10 AM. That day it was cash only due to register malfunction, so maybe that was why? Anyway, we were in and out of there in less than an hour, so it was pretty amazing! Our server was helpful and friendly, but not overbearing. He even showed us pictures of the specials on his smartphone! How cool.I had a cup of amazing orange flavored coffee - I have never had anything like that before! It had a great flavor without being cloyingly sweet. For my meal I had the omelette 5, which contained spinach, caramelized onions, local chicken sausage, and gruyere cheese. It came with a piece of toast and potatoes. I was pleasantly surprised that the potatoes were more like  mashed redskins instead of fried, and they came in a fancy-looking shape that I can only think to describe as a 'tall hockey puck' (I am not classy). The husband had a vegetarian burrito that came with a side salad, and he seemed to enjoy it. I had a bite, and WOW so much flavor! It was so nice to have a brunch meal that wasn't super greasy and heavy. The menu states that they do fresh squeezed juices, and FRUISHI... aka, sushi made from fruit! The inside was brightly colored and clean, and I really liked the painted tin ceiling. If I lived in Chicago, I would eat here all the time! Definitely worth a visit!

18.description: Chicago lives for brunch and Orange does brunch right. The service is amazing and they keep the large weekend crowds moving without making you feel rushed in any way.Try the orange coffee and the rustic raspberry egg sandwich- it sounds weird but it's not! So delicious! This is a great place to bring out-of-towners to show them Chicago means business when it comes to brunch!

41.description: Fabulous orange coffee!!! This is really delicious and I would love to have this every morning!  This is a new favorite brunch spot to keep in the rotation. I finally found a place in the RV hood that is quiet, adult-like, and doesn't have children running around screaming and crying. Hallelujah!The food is excellent and is done on a higher level that most of the restaurants nearby. Chicken is antibiotic free and egg whites are no charge. The attention to detail here is what I appreciate. I had a fantastic chicken club sandwich and sweet potato fries. Will probably be back on Saturday or Sunday!

52.description: Went here on a Sunday morning for brunch with my best friend. Definitely a good decision! The food was delicious! Our server was also really nice. I decided to try the orange coffee and didn't love it so he brought me regular and didn't charge the one I didn't like. So sweet! Definitely a place I'll be going back to!

50.description: I visited Orange during the early afternoon. I had the pancake flight and my daughter has the chai tea French toast. Everything was absolutely delicious! The pancake flavors were unique. One was lemon vanilla, it was mouth watering! The portions were rather generous too. My daughter loved her French toast too:) Service was quick and courteous. Would definitely visit again.

4.description: Very kid-friendly, the Pancake Flight theme this weekend was "Box of Chocolates", so for a chocolate whore like myself, this was a dream come true (chocolate, chocolate sauce, white chocolate, chocolate-covered fruit, caramel with chocolate...it was perfect).  I was worried that my flight was going to be just four silver dollar pancakes, but actually, it's 12 silver dollar 'cakes for $12 with enough toppings to have me leave full, so that worked well.  The bacon was too crispy to enjoy it, and my Greyhound was only OK, but the pancakes made up for these shortcomings!

6.description: I've been meaning to try Orange for awhile but never did. That was a mistake! Went for brunch on a Sunday and it was great. The place itself is very home-y and cute. My friend and I decided to do the champagne flight which was delicious. Strawberry, pineapple, and pear mimosas; pear was my fave. I ordered the green eggs and ham which was delicious. Eggs, pesto, tomato and ham. What else could you ask for?Orange is great for brunch. I'll definitely be back!

22.description: Why 4 stars and not 5? I'm a fan of outdoor seating in the summer. I had the rosemary and orange french toast - it was rich yet light and refreshing! My mom had the Green Eggs & Ham (the 'green' being pesto) which to be honest, I preferred. The french toast, while tasty, was a bit too much after plowing through 2 pieces. The Green Eggs & Ham, savory and I couldn't get enough!We tried the Orange-flavored coffee. I wasn't a fan though the server was very nice and offered to swap it with regular coffee if we asked.

15.description: Great place in Roscoe and a very good choice for breakfast or weekend brunch. Love the Special that I tried and the orange coffee I haven't tried before. Really tasteful.While there are more places for brunching surrounding this, Orange has something special to offer. I liked the local and decoration too.

57.description: Still one of my favorite brunch spots. Small and quaint, good device and an unexpected menu with local ingredients and interesting dishes. The house brewed orange coffee is amazing- make sure to take a bag home, it smells like heaven. The outdoor seating is lovely and right in the middle of the village. Also, the cucumber water is always something to appreciate :)   if you're feeling exploratory, don't miss the Frushi

20.description: I live in the neighborhood and this is my go to place.   Love the omelette 5 with egg whites.  Orange coffee is meh, but the regular is good enough.  They'll even give you a to go cup if you don't finish what you have.

36.description: Orange on Roscoe is a great place to go for brunch, especially if you want to take your little ones to a "brunch play date".  I've been to all the other Orange locations previously (Lincoln Park, South Loop, etc.). The pancake flight provides a perfect sampling of dessert type pancakes.  However, if you are looking for savory pancakes,  the pancake flight menu item is NOT for you.  One idea is to do a mix and match of sweet & savory pancakes... or add bacon on the side...kidding.  Anyway, this isn't a place to go for breakfast/brunch on the weekends if you don't want to be accompanied by babies and toddlers. Roscoe Village is a family friendly neighborhood after all...

14.description: Stopped in for brunch on a Sunday morning; Roscoe Village is full of great brunch spots, and we were curious to see how Orange would rate. Would definitely recommend -- service was very friendly and quick, the food was tasty and the menu offers good variety. Definitely check out the pancake flight if you're a fan of hot cakes and/or sweet breakfasts. Only downside to this cozy spot is the price -- brunch for two cost us just over $40 with tax and tip. We'll be back, but probably not every week.

29.description: Right up the street, easy to get in and get out.  I love the self check outs.  I crack up at the parking lot monitors when I see them. The only time I don't like going is when it's full of school kiddies. Annoying!!Why do some posters talk to these places we are reviewing?  "Oh Jewel, I love you..."  Anyone undertand this?

42.description: Well, I'll be.  Grocery stores are different around these parts - clean, stocked, and efficient, with the distinct absence of basketball candy fund raisers.However I did notice that 9 out of 10 carts were completely unmanageable.  Seriously.  I grabbed the first one and noticed the bum wheel and didn't realize that I would look exponentially more retarded upon each additional heavy item thrown in the basket.  My forearms are literally (and by "literally," I mean "literally") sore because of my Iditarod this afternoon.

23.description: I've only been here twice during my stay in Chicago with my girlfriend.But I love it, great selection, fresh produce, decent prices. When I was there, they had loads of bargain on alcohol.Oh, and it's a great place to pick up souvenirs, cheaper than most vendors that I've been too.  I wish they had a chain in Cali :)

47.description: I'll tell you now that the main reason I like this Jewel is the convenience that it's open 24 hours (except Sunday). It's also one of the biggest Jewels in the area, so you can find pretty much anything you're looking for. It's also one of the easier navigateable stores I've been to in Chicago.That being said, Jewels in general have some of the worst prices UNLESS it's preferred card, in which case you can find some awesome deals. The self-checkout lanes are often broken and there's one that always "speaks" slower than the rest. Still, if you're a fan of Jewel (and I have to say that I am), this store is one of the better ones you'll find and it's where I do my main grocery shopping.

8.description: An open letter to the Jewel-Osco corporation:To Whom It May Concern,I would like to discuss your corporation's bewildering treatment of a glorious and noble product, Kerrygold Irish butter.  For years, your chain was my household's reliable source for the beloved Kerrygold.  However, recently I have begun to "shop around," and this exercise has opened my eyes to some astonishing facts.First, you sell Kerrygold everywhere--almost.  You carry it at Ashland and Wellington, at Western and Roscoe, in Uptown, North Center, and Andersonville in Chicago; and in SE Evanston, SW Evanston, Wilmette, Skokie, and Niles...but NOT in Glenview, which is one of my two regular Jewel stops.  If you made a map of this, it would look like a desert island of sad butterlessness in a rich sea of Kerrygold foil.Second, your pricing is uniform across all stores--uniformly ridiculous, that is!  I never questioned the $5.99 price tag until I began to compare.  You are being beaten handily by your main local supermarket competition ($4.29 at Dominick's, 28% less) AND by higher-end and niche chains (in some cases less than HALF your price):  Trader Joe's $2.79Treasure Island $3.99Fresh Market $3.99Whole Foods $4.49I am not an economist, a dairy farmer, or a grocery store executive, but this doesn't make any sense to me.  Needless to say, I have bought my last half-pound of Kerrygold at a Jewel store.Good day to you,David R., Kerrygold AficionadoPS.  Thank you for having mangoes on sale on a day when I desperately wanted to make mango smoothies at home.PPS.  The mangoes were several days from being ripe.

31.description: By far this is my favorite Jewel partly because it's so close to my home and also because the staff there go out of their way to help you. Never had that experience shopping at over-priced Dominick's.   Anyway, I went shopping last night since Thanksgiving is two days away and almost hit the $250 mark with my bill before my coupons which saved me $38. Most of the coupons were the ones the register prints out before you finish your transaction to use at your next shopping trip but my wonderful cashier let me use the $8.00 coupon right away.  This is why I love this Jewel!

34.description: Just when I was finally about give up on Jewel, I found the Roscoe Village location.  The Cornielia-Southport location sucked so bad that I was about to become a Dominicks shopper forever.  This location was quite pleasant.  Unlike the Southport Horror Show, this location had fresh produce and fully stocked shelves. And to my amazement , they actually had real, human cashiers working. The self checkout made me want throw a bag of corn nuts at the manager.  I have been trying different grocery stores in the past few months, and this is the best one that I have found so far.  This leads the list of contenders to become my weekly grocery shopping spot.

16.description: Just when I was finally about give up on Jewel, I found the Roscoe Village location.  The Cornielia-Southport location sucked so bad that I was about to become a Dominicks shopper forever.  This location was quite pleasant.  Unlike the Southport Horror Show, this location had fresh produce and fully stocked shelves. And to my amazement , they actually had real, human cashiers working. The self checkout made me want throw a bag of corn nuts at the manager.  I have been trying different grocery stores in the past few months, and this is the best one that I have found so far.  This leads the list of contenders to become my weekly grocery shopping spot.

13.description: The quality of this store is atrocious !! I stopped in there to pick up a few things on this past Sunday night and found an entire cooler of rancid meat. The night crew chief didn't seem the least bit concerned. The Director of the store called me but it did nothing to restore any confidence in this store or their food. The director claimed that he walked through the store 5 hours before I found the entire cooler of spoiled meat but that meat looked like it was spoiled for over 24 hours. Shop here at your own risk !!!!

11.description: Why am I giving a chain food store 4 stars? One big reason - it seems that Jewel has invested a lot of money in employee training. I can hardly walk down an aisle in this store and, if there is a Jewel employee there, I am asked "Are you finding everything you need, ma'am?" On the rare occasion when I say no, the employee moves so fast to help me, I feel like I'm Mayor Daley standing in front of the City Council.I have to tell you, I do not buy meat or fish, so I can't review that. I do like the expanded organics section. I even buy the Jewel organic brand, Wild Harvest, and I like what I get. This store is probably my favoriter Jewel. It seems really clean. It is well laid-out. And it usually has what I want if it's something ordinary. (If I want raspberry vinegar, I go to Whole Foods.) PS: While I will use the self-service lanes when checking out with only a few items, more times than not I have a problem. The machine doesn't like my cash, it apparently doesn't want to weigh my tomatoes, or the moon is in the 7th house. Why knows? I have more problems than good luck with the whole self-check item. I think jewel should give a 10% discount on the self-check registers, since they don't have to pay a cashier to stand at every one. Those things really piss me off sometimes. The produce in this store I find to be better than in other Jewels. It stays fresh longer. I think they must have more turnover here.This Jewel also does a better job of keeping their shelves stocked than other stores in the chain. One of the things that drives me nuts in general about Jewel is, if something goes on sale that I want, it is never in stock. I have to get to the store at about 6:30am to buy the last item. But with the Roscoe Village Jewel, I have had much better luck.

39.description: This is the best Jewel-Osco in the galaxy. I used to live down the street and actually looked forward to shopping at this Jewel-Osco.  You want it?  They got it, ya turkey.  Yes, it is busy but the people working there are the opposite of horrible.  Lines are never as bad as they are at many other grocery stores.No way Jose am I ever going to the Dominick's next door.

37.description: A recent re-visit to this location made me realize that I have to go back....all the time. I think it's the biggest Jewel I've been to, and they literally have EVERYTHING you could ever want. I shop around at other chains and smaller mom and pop shops, but you can't beat my traditional Chicago fave. Jewel rules.

0.description: The was a very nice lady working by herself in the deli on thanksgiving day around 230pm. She displayed great customer service and engaged me with good conversation while preparing my order.

38.description: One of the larger and nicer Jewels I've been to.  Beware that at around 2pm Lane Tech empties out and a million dirty teens crowd up the place with their myspaces and heelies, each buying one piece of candy and a soda.  GET OFF MY LAWN!!!

27.description: Why am I giving a chain food store 4 stars? One big reason - it seems that Jewel has invested a lot of money in employee training. I can hardly walk down an aisle in this store and, if there is a Jewel employee there, I am asked "Are you finding everything you need, ma'am?" On the rare occasion when I say no, the employee moves so fast to help me, I feel like I'm Mayor Daley standing in front of the City Council.I have to tell you, I do not buy meat or fish, so I can't review that. I do like the expanded organics section. I even buy the Jewel organic brand, Wild Harvest, and I like what I get. This store is probably my favoriter Jewel. It seems really clean. It is well laid-out. And it usually has what I want if it's something ordinary. (If I want raspberry vinegar, I go to Whole Foods.) PS: While I will use the self-service lanes when checking out with only a few items, more times than not I have a problem. The machine doesn't like my cash, it apparently doesn't want to weigh my tomatoes, or the moon is in the 7th house. Why knows? I have more problems than good luck with the whole self-check item. I think jewel should give a 10% discount on the self-check registers, since they don't have to pay a cashier to stand at every one. Those things really piss me off sometimes. The produce in this store I find to be better than in other Jewels. It stays fresh longer. I think they must have more turnover here.This Jewel also does a better job of keeping their shelves stocked than other stores in the chain. One of the things that drives me nuts in general about Jewel is, if something goes on sale that I want, it is never in stock. I have to get to the store at about 6:30am to buy the last item. But with the Roscoe Village Jewel, I have had much better luck.

32.description: Hi Jewel on Western.... I like you. I like you because you are much bigger and cleaner than the location by my house (Elston & Kedzie). You also carry the Sambazon Acai drink that my husband loves. I go out of my way to visit you when I can (if you didn't notice already). Stay true Jewel (fist bump).

48.description: Baby, when I used to love yooooou!!  Dear Jewel,Why do you keep taking things away from me?  You stopped carrying the vegetable wash that I loved.  You also stopped doing Shop N' Scan, which was a key instrument in my grocery budgeting.  Ok, ok, not so bad.  Then you were hit or miss with the Roman Meal whole wheat bread.  Sometimes you had it, sometimes you didn't.  Then you took away my 10 oz. can of Hormel Chili.  That's when I started to get mad at you!  Don't you know that a girl needs her processed meat/chili fix and the 10 oz can was the only thing that didn't make her feel like a pig?!?!?!?It's ok, Jewel, I still loved you.  I loved you because the staff was friendly.  They guy at the deli would always ask me how my day was and the butcher offered suggestions on how to cook my meat.  They smiled and made me happy.  I also loved that I could make small talk with the shoppers, because I always need help picking out a good bottle of olive oil.  Yes, Jewel, I still loved you even though you hurt me.But now...now you have gone too far!  You have taken away my favorite salsa and now you are taking away the STARBUCKS!!!!!  Don't you know that I like to roll out of bed and get my groceries and I NEED my coffee to sip on while I go up and down the aisles?!?!?!?!Jewel, I'm afraid that this is the end. It's over.  Don't call me.  Ever.

44.description: All you need to see to understand the difference between what it's like to live in South Loop versus what it's like to live in Roscoe Village is the differences between the two Jewels.South Loop--cranky, nasty, put-upon employees who don't care if you live or die.Roscoe Village--cheerful, jokey, relaxed but alert employees who probably don't care if you live or die either but at least they have a sense of humor about it and don't take it out on the customer.Seriously, my grocery shopping life has improved tenfold since moving not too far away from this Jewel.  The store carries enough of the "extra" stuff needed in life without being a MegaSuperStore, the healthy foods aisle and produce is pretty great as is the deli/prepared foods section, and every employee I've encountered has been great and not in that artificially annoying too-cheery, won't-leave-you-alone way.Even though it's all the same corporation, I feel better spending my money in a place where the staff doesn't appear too tortured.  This Jewel actually seems like a not-horrible place to work, and that alone makes it a wonderful place to shop.

24.description: Even though I have a Jewel that is much closer than this one, I can't bring myself to shop there.  I love this grocery store (as much as one can love a grocery store).  Clean, helpful staff, veggies usually fresh and lots of sales.The bakery sells one of the best carrot cakes in Chicago!

7.description: Mango that I paid $2.00 for was rotting on the inside.Collard greens tasted like pesticides were freshly sprayed on them.  The only two fresh things I went there for... Horrible quality produce!Also, the cashiers are rude.

40.description: Easier to navigate than the Dominicks on Chicago Ave, and very friendly staff. You can get everything you need here, it's a pretty standard gorcery. You'll also be able to get some gourmet things, but not too much. They stick to the basics and that is what they do a great job at.

30.description: Ok, they've increased the number of self-checkout lanes, which is great (and they are now pretty much all open).  So what can I complain about now?  The frustratingly minimal amount of room you have to bag your groceries!  If I have more than a handful of items, I end up going to the regular checkout just to avoid the logic puzzle that bagging my own groceries is here.

46.description: This review is based purely on customer service...Being the designated Beer Baron for my softball team, I ran into this Jewel on my way to Hamlin Park to stock up on carbonated wheat water before our game.Of course I couldn't find my cooler so I needed someone to help me get one of those stupid foam ice chests off of a shelf well out of my reach.A wonderfully pleasant employee who I stopped mid cottage cheese inventory helped me out and was incredibly nice, as were the people at the checkout.Maybe I was just in a good mood, but I was really pleased with my service here!(Minus one star because I didn't buy anything other than beer, ice and that stupid cooler that I broke while still in the parking lot.  So I can't really attest to the quality of their produce, etc.)

1.description: This use to be my favorite Jewel. This evening I was rushed and forgot my reuseable bags. As I was standing in line the cashier was talking to the couple a head of me.  At first I thought it was very nice small talk but then it kept going and going.  She stopped the belt so I couldn't put anymore groceries on it.  I waited and waited as she took her time and continues to small talk for 10 minutes.   She slowly decides to turn the belt on as she said good bye to her new friends.  She looked at me and ask "do you have bags?"   I told her no. I thought she was literally going to explode.  She started taking off her sweater saying she was having a hot flash.  Then she started to Scan my items allowing them to pile up.   I got the sense she was angry I didn't have bags and she didn't have a bagger.  The line behind me was getting longer and longer.  She was so very slow and her attitude had completely changed from the last customer.   I had a feeling she thought I should bag my own groceries!!!  This isn't my favorite Jewel anymore.

9.description: I agree with Paul K's review of this Jewel.Totally remodeled recently, this Jewel is definitely one of the best in the area.  My favorite is still the jewel-Osco at the corner of Cass and Ogden in Westmont, but no Jewel will ever rival the greatness of that location.  Anyway, this Jewel is my new favorite in the city of Chicago for sure.  It's a bit smaller than a few other locations (Roosevelt and Ashland sticks out in my mind) but they have everything you could want and need.  Everything is nice and newly refinished since it was remodeled so the look of the store is very clean and crisp.  The produce is always nicely stocked and they have a really nice selection of seasonal items that changes every few weeks.  Sometimes I can't figure out how they choose to organize the different stands of produce, but you can find everything you need relatively quickly so I try not to question their motives.Deli, bakery and meat counters are always manned and every employee I've ever run into has been ultra-pleasant.  They're always willing to help and - as you know - the Jewel Deli Counter does special orders like nobody's business.  They make specialty cakes and take special orders for catering and holiday meals at pretty decent prices.  Their ready-made chicken is also delicious, FYI.All the products on the shelves area always neatly shelved and in order.  I've almost never run into a product that was completely out on the shelf, so they have a good ordering crew.  They always have nice, neat and relevant endcaps with seasonal or sale products for easy shopping.  I think I really appreciate the management of this store.  As a former employee of a Jewel-Osco, management really makes a difference.  You can tell that certain people run their stores in a very professional way, and that's the impression I get here.  All of the employees are always courteous and they go above and beyond to help if you ask for something.  I really appreciate that in a store because if they don't have something, they'll get it (or try to substitute the closest thing).  I love this Jewel so much that I've made it my weekly shopping stop.

26.description: I love my Jewel - slightly sad I know. Well love is the wrong word. I am not in love with a grocery store and hate going when I'm tired after work with two toddler who want to reek havoc just as much as the next person, but if I have to suffer a grocery store I gladly suffer this Jewel. The staff are mostly helpful and the food is fresh. There's a Dominick's right across the street but I always go to this Jewel

25.description: The store is nice enough for a chain grocery.  I rarely go except to by things I can't get at my local market like veggie burgers & other vegetarian meat substitutes.  However, their bakery has definitely changed my tune about them--and not for the better.  My best friend's husband was throwing her a surprise party.  I was going to get some balloons and other silly decorations at the party store & told him I could pick up a cake if he wanted.  He thought that sounded great & called Jewel to order a cake.  They told him he couldn't order one.  What?  Of course you can!  I've ordered them before and my childhood was full of custom cakes ordered from Jewel.  Yet they told him "no."  Although they DID say he was welcome to come in and pick up a pre-made cake and IF they weren't to busy they could write "Happy Birthday" on it.  ???  So I ran there on the way to the party and found there wasn't ONE single yellow cake.  Everything was chocolate (my preference, but not hers!).  So that's what I got.  And it will be the last thing I ever buy from the bakery there.  Next time I'll go to a real bakery.  The extra cost is worth it.

12.description: The store is nice enough for a chain grocery.  I rarely go except to by things I can't get at my local market like veggie burgers & other vegetarian meat substitutes.  However, their bakery has definitely changed my tune about them--and not for the better.  My best friend's husband was throwing her a surprise party.  I was going to get some balloons and other silly decorations at the party store & told him I could pick up a cake if he wanted.  He thought that sounded great & called Jewel to order a cake.  They told him he couldn't order one.  What?  Of course you can!  I've ordered them before and my childhood was full of custom cakes ordered from Jewel.  Yet they told him "no."  Although they DID say he was welcome to come in and pick up a pre-made cake and IF they weren't to busy they could write "Happy Birthday" on it.  ???  So I ran there on the way to the party and found there wasn't ONE single yellow cake.  Everything was chocolate (my preference, but not hers!).  So that's what I got.  And it will be the last thing I ever buy from the bakery there.  Next time I'll go to a real bakery.  The extra cost is worth it.

21.description: This is a nice little Jewel store.  It has an old neighborhood grocer appeal.  2 warnings tho: don't go when the school kids are there unless you like waiting in line and don't go looking for exotic products, being a small store they don't have a big selection.  Oh, and the cakes are brought in frozen and not so great!

17.description: I like this Jewel.  It is open late, they have pretty much every product I want, the staff is really nice, the prices are reasonable and they always take my coupons. The best thing about this Jewel is that there is always plenty of parking and I almost never have to wait long at check out! I know there are grocery stores that are cheaper but I don't like wading through a lot of junk to get what I want (ahem, Aldi).  With the Preferred Card and coupons, I feel like I get a good deal here.My only complaint is that they do seem to have a stock issue.  Whenever I go, the shelves look pretty bare.  I'm usually able to get what I want but sometimes things are missing.

10.description: Due to the convenience and that it's not a Chad/Trixie Meat Market like the one on Ashland, I frequent this Jewel a lot.  Unfortunately, I end up having to stop somewhere else almost every time to pick up something they didn't have.I went in once to pick up supplies to make homemade salsa.  No jalapenos.  None at all, I asked the produce guy and he said they were out.  Another time I went to get chili ingredients...one large can of kidney beans left on the shelf.  Whaaaa???  Is this not a grocery store?!?Their meat counter is pretty good and I do enjoy the fresh baked yummies at the bakery, but this Jewel is really a last resort if I can't make it to TJ's or S&VT's.

5.description: I shop at this jewel at least once a week and spend hundreds of dollars monthly. My regular experiences are usually good ones. But today, for the 5 time, my interaction with this woman Barb, who's supposed to be the front end manager, was less than pleasant. Every time I go in the express lane, which is rare for what I spend, this woman is at the register. She is rude unfriendly and lacks customer service skills. But, today topped it all. I waited in line watching her bag people's groceries like they were garbage, snatching payment from their hands, while she said absolutely nothing to each of them. When it was my turn I asked her for my $10 cash back as a roll of quarters, because she is usually the one to get them, and she told me I had to wait at the register next to her. I told her ok no problem, thank you. She didn't respond. After waiting an additional 8 minutes at that register, listening to her next to me tell a regular customer how horrible her day was, she finally approached. She snatched my money and went in the drawer to get the quaters. I responded saying thanks so much, and again, no response. I'd think as a manager she would know to at least say thank you, if not have a nice day or something. I've never been treated so rudely in aNY store I've ever been too. And it's not like she was just having a bad day, I could understand that, every encounter with her is the same. After today she made me want to go next door to Marianos next week for my groceries, where people treat you with kindness and respect. Absolutely, inappropriate. If my rating would be solely on her attitude it'd be one star.

3.description: I just walked out of this location and had to write a review. I was in the area because I have been craving lobster rolls and went to Marcianos first to see if they had some fresh lobster that they could see them for me they were out so I went over to the jewel.  I ended up seeing that they had a special on lobster tails and that they would statement as well so I went online and requested the girl behind the seafood counter to do so she gave me an estimated time of them being finished I'm about 12 minutes 30 minutes later I finally got my lobster tails price triple what they should have been.  When I walked out of the store I kept thinking and wondering why my bill was so expensive when I hadn't gotten very much I only had two bags of food but I didn't have time to into the price of the lobster. Getting into my car I took a look at the receipt and found that the lobster was placed three times as much as what it was advertised as and went back in and out with the manager the manager very quickly took care of that for me and refunded my money and for that reason and for his treatment of me alone is why I give this location four stars.

35.description: I usually leave this store empty-handed no matter how bad I needed something when I walked in.Two words: shitty selection and highway f**king robbery!I almost always only come here in the middle of the night because we ran out of soy milk, or veggies for the rabbits. I almost always walk through the produce aisle, gasp alot, make remarks like "how absurd!" and then just roll my eyes and leave.Tonight (since the produce market was closed) my boyfriend and I decided to stop by and see if we could get a decent head of romaine or something for the rabbits. Yeah right. I will not pay $3 for wilted, scraggly, cellophane-wrapped romaine, not tonight, not ever. (Not here anyway!)We did the customary wandering around the store to laugh and point out the ridiculous prices on EVERYTHING, and were suddenly stunned to see a sale on Toffuti Cuties! They actually had 6 different flavors in stock, (but not "Coffee Break", my favorite non-dairy treat in the whole world ever) and they were on sale for only $3 per box! We were so shocked and elated that we promptly bought 4 boxes and left, pinching ourselves all the way home. I still hate Jewel stores, all of them, but am satisfied enough with my score tonight to actually give them this (barely deserved) one-star review!

19.description: We had thought with Marino's moving in next door that Jewel would step up it's game. No such luck. Higher prices for much less selection and service.

28.description: I agree with Paul K's review of this Jewel.Totally remodeled recently, this Jewel is definitely one of the best in the area.  My favorite is still the jewel-Osco at the corner of Cass and Ogden in Westmont, but no Jewel will ever rival the greatness of that location.  Anyway, this Jewel is my new favorite in the city of Chicago for sure.  It's a bit smaller than a few other locations (Roosevelt and Ashland sticks out in my mind) but they have everything you could want and need.  Everything is nice and newly refinished since it was remodeled so the look of the store is very clean and crisp.  The produce is always nicely stocked and they have a really nice selection of seasonal items that changes every few weeks.  Sometimes I can't figure out how they choose to organize the different stands of produce, but you can find everything you need relatively quickly so I try not to question their motives.Deli, bakery and meat counters are always manned and every employee I've ever run into has been ultra-pleasant.  They're always willing to help and - as you know - the Jewel Deli Counter does special orders like nobody's business.  They make specialty cakes and take special orders for catering and holiday meals at pretty decent prices.  Their ready-made chicken is also delicious, FYI.All the products on the shelves area always neatly shelved and in order.  I've almost never run into a product that was completely out on the shelf, so they have a good ordering crew.  They always have nice, neat and relevant endcaps with seasonal or sale products for easy shopping.  I think I really appreciate the management of this store.  As a former employee of a Jewel-Osco, management really makes a difference.  You can tell that certain people run their stores in a very professional way, and that's the impression I get here.  All of the employees are always courteous and they go above and beyond to help if you ask for something.  I really appreciate that in a store because if they don't have something, they'll get it (or try to substitute the closest thing).  I love this Jewel so much that I've made it my weekly shopping stop.

45.description: This Jewel isn't bad... fairly clean, but somewhat tightly packed into the space that it is in... but that is OK - means less walking for me. I do not like how they pushed the liquor section into the back left corner of the store, makes me take longer in retrieving my bourbon. Hehehe. Overall though, this is actually not-too-bad of a Jewel store, for a Jewel store... and they have a TCF in there too... for those of you who are like me and bank, ghetto-style. Fo' shizzle.

33.description: Oh Jewel, how I've missed you.Yeah okay, it's not an amazing store, but for being a Big Chain store, my experience is that this is one of the better ones in the city. It's clean, it's got a pretty decent selection, is organized fairly well, and typically has friendly service.After frequenting only fresh markets and the Jewel in Andersonville for a year, I went back to this Jewel last night just because I just happened to be close.. and boy had I forgotten just how big and clean it is. I like it.

43.description: Before I begin my review I have a request. The store is called Jewel. Stop calling it Jewels. As in "I went to Jewels last night." Unless of course you went to several Jewel stores. Thank you. On to my review.I like this Jewel. It is very convenient as it's only 2.5 blocks away.  The prices are good and WAY less expensive than the Dominicks right next door. The one and ONLY problem I have is the deli counter, the people there don't know math. And they are persecuting single people who grocery shop. I'm single; I'm only buying food for me. It has taken me nearly 6 months to get used to buying for just me. I don't buy a lot at once because it goes to waste before I get a chance to eat it. Deli counter convo:Me: "Can I get a quarter pound of smoked turkey thinly sliced"Slices turkey, hands bag to me and tag reads .33Fine.Me:"Can I get a quarter pound of pepper jack cheese thinly sliced"Slices cheese, hands bag to me and tag reads .35It thoroughly annoys me.Me: "You do know that a quarter pound is .25, and .33 is a third."Mathematically challenged kid: "Ya, a quarter pound."If you're a student at Lane Tech working part time at Jewel and you don't know math, we are all in trouble.

2.description: Seriously, the worst place to get groceries.  15 employees standing around while there are 50 people needing check out and only three lines open.  Also, their Garden Vegetable soup is apparently made with meat now.  Disgusting. Next time I spend the extra money and go across the way to Mariano's.

18.description: I despise this store, yet it's the only thing open near my apartment past 10pm.Boo. We that work past 9pm get such lousy options sometimes...It seems this store is always understocked. Understocked and about to expire. I usually only venture over here for "just the basics" to complete a meal. I like the addition of their natural and organics section, but why is it only a 1/2 isle of the entire place? It also doesn't extend into their produce, unfortunately.Don't bother buying flowers here- ever. They'll be dead in 2 days. The bf bought me a lovely bouquet and it lasted just under 48hrs.I'll return here, begrudgingly, since my favorite places to grocery shop are closed by 9 or 10...

41.description: Honestly, I wouldn't normally write a review on a grocery store, but for this one in particular I must. I have yet to have one problem out of the multiple times I've been in this grocery store. I love it. I can find all that I need here which is usually snack food which I can take on the run. There is a pop machine here that sells pop cans for .25$. There is a deli, bakery, cold food bar, fish bar, and more. But I would be cautious around the cold food bar. Some things dont taste like you would expect them to but for the most part its delicious. There is self checkout lines also and a person manning them at all times to help you with any troubles you are having. I enjoy this "Jewel", not "Jewels" and do come here a lot.

4.description: Nice store, clean and nicely stocked, but not very friendly staff (also lines that showed open with no one manning them...). I increased this from a 2 start to a 3 since they weren't stocked out of what I needed....but I will stick with the stores across the street even though they are busy. PS The pricing on my item rang up incorrectly but the cashier would barely let me talk. Since it was $0.50, I decided I'd skip the hassle of making a stink...

6.description: Horrible.  Out of rosemary, sage, and every other ingredient needed to make a meal.  Produce looks horrible.  Wish Whole Foods would go here instead.

22.description: Due to the convenience and that it's not a Chad/Trixie Meat Market like the one on Ashland, I frequent this Jewel a lot.  Unfortunately, I end up having to stop somewhere else almost every time to pick up something they didn't have.I went in once to pick up supplies to make homemade salsa.  No jalapenos.  None at all, I asked the produce guy and he said they were out.  Another time I went to get chili ingredients...one large can of kidney beans left on the shelf.  Whaaaa???  Is this not a grocery store?!?Their meat counter is pretty good and I do enjoy the fresh baked yummies at the bakery, but this Jewel is really a last resort if I can't make it to TJ's or S&VT's.

15.description: All I can hope for in the world is that Bucktown Strack and Van Til forgives me for cheating on it with its neighbor from up the street.  I think it will, it's a very friendly store.I had no choice.  S&VT doesn't have a Coinstar machine, you see, and the Roscoe Village Jewel does.  Actually this Jewel has pretty much everything.  However, I usually go to the grocery store to get food not to check out a movie, buy circus tickets, or have a medical checkup.  I swear the line for the customer service counter was longer than a check-out line at 2:00 p.m. on a Thursday (filled almost completely with people twice my age).  Were there to have been bingo and an optomotrist, I could have mistaken this location of Jewel for a rural Wal-Mart.Anyway, back to my story.  So I used the Coinstar and was actually able to afford groceries due to the transaction.  Well, I should say I was able to afford groceries at another store due to the transaction.  How they get you (I'm shaking my fist but you can't see it) is that you have to go through a cashier (or wait in the 30 minute customer service line) to get cash for a Coinstar receipt.  So I decided to try and get groceries.  As I wandered the store, I realized that everything was cheaper at S&VT and I would be wasting my hard found money to actually not hold off and buy things elsewhere.I was tempted to buy a few things they had on their current "in this economy" promotion as they had some items that were deeply slashed (some things up to 40% off) but I have no Jewel card.  The cashier will usually magically make one appear but I wasn't willing to take the chance (I know, I know, they're free but I've been spoiled by S&VT not having a card and their deals being for everyone).In short, I walked out with some paper towel, lunch cheese, and a loaf of Wonder Bread (the only items I was desperate for and willing to pay the price).There are some positives about this Jewel, though.  It's right off Western Avenue so I always stop in when I forget things for birthday parties on the north side.  Their deli makes some truly tasty french fries.  And, hey, when you get lost in their nonsensical aisles (seriously, would it be hard to put milk near butter?) you might run into a fun costumed character for the kids.  Yeah, that's about all I've got.  Oh, and the Coinstar machine that started this tirade.  That's nice too.

20.description: Honestly if anyone truly likes coming here, I will gladly resale grocery goods from a nearby grocery store, double the price, and it will still be cheaper than jewel.    On top of the extremely extremely expensive prices, even after "preferred card" their more than double of somewhere else that isn't jewel or dominicks. I mean seriously!!!    And then on top of over the top prices, you can't find anything there, food is ready to expire the next day.    After shopping at the jewel bandit osco, they don't even bag your groceries after the raping you just took.  But that only after waiting 20 minutes to check out.    Why on gods green earth would you choose to pay double for food, and get treated terrible????     Me I'll choose better customer service, and half the price, anywhere else.

36.description: All I can hope for in the world is that Bucktown Strack and Van Til forgives me for cheating on it with its neighbor from up the street.  I think it will, it's a very friendly store.I had no choice.  S&VT doesn't have a Coinstar machine, you see, and the Roscoe Village Jewel does.  Actually this Jewel has pretty much everything.  However, I usually go to the grocery store to get food not to check out a movie, buy circus tickets, or have a medical checkup.  I swear the line for the customer service counter was longer than a check-out line at 2:00 p.m. on a Thursday (filled almost completely with people twice my age).  Were there to have been bingo and an optomotrist, I could have mistaken this location of Jewel for a rural Wal-Mart.Anyway, back to my story.  So I used the Coinstar and was actually able to afford groceries due to the transaction.  Well, I should say I was able to afford groceries at another store due to the transaction.  How they get you (I'm shaking my fist but you can't see it) is that you have to go through a cashier (or wait in the 30 minute customer service line) to get cash for a Coinstar receipt.  So I decided to try and get groceries.  As I wandered the store, I realized that everything was cheaper at S&VT and I would be wasting my hard found money to actually not hold off and buy things elsewhere.I was tempted to buy a few things they had on their current "in this economy" promotion as they had some items that were deeply slashed (some things up to 40% off) but I have no Jewel card.  The cashier will usually magically make one appear but I wasn't willing to take the chance (I know, I know, they're free but I've been spoiled by S&VT not having a card and their deals being for everyone).In short, I walked out with some paper towel, lunch cheese, and a loaf of Wonder Bread (the only items I was desperate for and willing to pay the price).There are some positives about this Jewel, though.  It's right off Western Avenue so I always stop in when I forget things for birthday parties on the north side.  Their deli makes some truly tasty french fries.  And, hey, when you get lost in their nonsensical aisles (seriously, would it be hard to put milk near butter?) you might run into a fun costumed character for the kids.  Yeah, that's about all I've got.  Oh, and the Coinstar machine that started this tirade.  That's nice too.

14.description: Average jewel but watch out in the parking lot my car got hit there..

28.description: Randomly walked in on a Monday morning for a pedicure after seeing their cash specials posted outside.  Overall a relaxing experience and my polish job was exacting.  Ambience is clean and fresh.  Paid $23+tip in cash.  Will definitely come again.

1.description: I normally make appointments for mani/pedi's, but decided to stop in and see if they had an opening. Very glad I did! I've been to Salon Yves before, but it's been a while. I had a descent experience before, but I am going to love this place now! They are under new management and the new manager, Tyler, introduced himself and talked with me for a while. I had my mani/pedi done by Winston and he did an amazing job. It was slow in there, but I also went during the late afternoon on a Wednesday.  Lillian was another worker and came over to talk to me and made sure I was happy with my nails and colors. I will be back to this place! There are discounts if paying in cash, but they do accept cards.

9.description: I am not one to typically run home and write a review immediately about a business. Today is an exception. I got a mani/pedi on a Wednesday at Salon Yves - there were two other women in the salon with me and otherwise very quiet and relaxing. My manicurist was Tiffany, the owner's mother. Tiffany was friendly, professional, and sweet. She did an excellent job on my mani/pedi and I paid in cash for $32. If you use credit cards, mani/pedi is $35. The salon was clean, decor was nice, and they had a great selection of polishes - Essie & OPI. I would recommend coming here during the week when you can as Tiffany shared with me the weekends get packed.Tiffany shared her background with me and I discovered that her family has ties to the Vietnamese store down the street, Bahn Mi & Co. She was kind enough to give me a free combo coupon for Bahn Mi & Co to try out their sandwiches (as I shared with her that my husband and I love Vietnamese food). Never one to turn down an opportunity to support local businesses, I took the coupon and picked up the combo right after my mani.

29.description: I'm not really sure how to review this. I had an eyebrow wax only. My eyebrows look fantastic - really well shaped and perfectly aligned. Among the top 3 I've probably had from that point of view. However the wax really got me. It was fine during the waxing, but afterwards it hurt way more than I've felt before. I had to apply ice to fight the puffiness and pain. It's several hours later and I still have some puffiness but it's getting better. Had I not had the latter part of this experience I'd rate it higher. I will try out the mani/pedi soon and let that be my guide for the next review. I'm torn on whether I will go back for one-they look great, but man it hurt after!

23.description: First time visit and I'm very impressed. Lovely decor, prompt and friendly service and very clean. My technician was super sweet and we had a great conversation during my pedicure. Prices are very competitive and it's a BYOB, which means I'll be having a girls' date here in the future!

5.description: Salon Yves is a good addition to the Roscoe Village neighborhood. Much more chic and cute than other local options... it is the type of place you'd go with a gal pal for a pedi date and to swap some gossip. With their very cute setup and nice, friendly techs, this salon is perfect for a girl who likes basic nail services. I can tell they do a beautiful job at spa pedis and classic square manis, but try to amp up the wow factor and you may find yourself disappointed. For starters, the selection of no-chip colors runs a bit light. I'm a bit of a no-chipaholic and can vouch their array is quite slim compared to most places that do no-chip. They didn't have a signature milky pink or a neon coral (my defaults) in their choices so I settled on a pastel blue and called it a day.The service started out alright until my tech completely abandoned me while my old no-chip mani was soaking off. She left me sitting to start on a gal who had just walked in (with no appt) despite the fact that I had made an appointment and was a bit pressed for time. I sat soaking for 30 minutes before I had to draw attention to the fact that I was a) slightly annoyed at this, b) running out of time and c) wanting to get the straight acetone off my nails. A different tech told me to sit tight and that someone else would be with me shortly. Another 10 minutes later and I was with tech #2 and #3 (they started double teaming at this point, which was nice and showed a sense of urgency). They got my no-chip off, slapped on the new blue color and then botched the shape of my nails. Womp, womp. One tech made them square while the other kept their existing almond shape as I had requested. They clearly struggle here with a more modern, trendy nail look. Glitter disco nails aside, I do wish they would have done better honoring my appointment over the walk in. No-chip shouldn't also mean no-service-until-someone-really-complains-and-then-you-give-them-lots-of-service.

25.description: A cute lil nail and wax salon. The staff is very friendly. Ive been in 3 times sinxe the opened and have been warmly greeted. I have never made an appt and have always been helped within 5 min. Ive had a manicure, pedicure and eyebrow wax. All have been top notch. The pedicure chairs are uber massage chairs.. they are no joke. This is not just a vibrating chair. They also use a sugar scrub on your feet. Its a nice touch that felt awesome and worked well. I dont think any other place in the neighborhood includes that. Good color selection and the price is right. Bring cash.. they accept credit cards but they have cash only deals. Why not save a few bucks if u can. Ill be back.

12.description: I used to be an acrylic nail wearing girl but that all changed today. I went in to salon yves, not wanting my nails to be drilled on anymore, as they were getting pretty thin. The ladies there took their time GENTLY getting the old acrylic off and never once did they hurt my fragile nails. JULIE! You are amazing. She put an extra coat on my fingers since my nails were so fragile. She never tried to rip off the old acrylic and really understood how nervous i was about that. I love this place. I will definitely be back.

21.description: Love this place! This salon is just a few blocks from my school. The staff is extremely friendly and they do a great job at making you feel welcome! I've been here twice, for both no-chip mani and pedicure. My no chip lasted about 3weeks before I needed another one! Both my technicians were super sweet and had a great sense of humor. I will definitely keep coming here!

16.description: Aw man... I'm not one to throw negativity around, but I have to say something. I'm relatively new to the whole waxing thing, but I should have known something was horribly wrong when I went into the room and the sheet on the table hadn't been changed. When I mentioned it, the woman went in and put a hand towel down on it. It only went downhill from there...She only used one stick throughout, and let the wax fly everywhere as she slopped it on--sometimes leaving it to cool as she cut more strips, and it was more painful than any wax I've had in the past. My poor bikini line is raw and bruised on both sides, and my pits are swollen and discolored, too. The experience certainly drove home why you have to be licensed by the state when you're putting hot wax anywhere in spitting distance of somebody's nethers...Bottom line: if you're going here for waxing, make sure your estitician has a posted license before you go in the room. And if the sheet isn't clean, turn around and walk out. :/

17.description: I have been going to this salon since it opened this summer, and I have had a high quality experience every time. The owner is very kind and accommodating, as are the rest of the staff. My gel manicures always last! The salon is very clean and has a high selection of colors and brands. I had been going to Wonder Nails on Western Ave for over a year but I switched over to Salon Yves when it opened and I've been very happy, it is also convenient for me to walk to from my apartment.  This time I got a design manicure, I brought in a photo of a triangle manicure I saw online and they did a perfect job!! Love it (see my photos)! If you haven't tried this place, I suggest you do!!

10.description: Nice pedicure spot.  The lady was thorough and conscientious and did a good job shaping the nail and exfoliating away some calluses.  The chairs are comfy and the place was clean.  The magazine selections aren't the best but certainly enough to get through a treatment.  It's less expensive than the other place down the street but you don't get the mini-back rub either.

11.description: Great place for a mani and pedi!  The inside is decorated really cute. I recommend if you are in the area!

26.description: Aw man... I'm not one to throw negativity around, but I have to say something. I'm relatively new to the whole waxing thing, but I should have known something was horribly wrong when I went into the room and the sheet on the table hadn't been changed. When I mentioned it, the woman went in and put a hand towel down on it. It only went downhill from there...She only used one stick throughout, and let the wax fly everywhere as she slopped it on--sometimes leaving it to cool as she cut more strips, and it was more painful than any wax I've had in the past. My poor bikini line is raw and bruised on both sides, and my pits are swollen and discolored, too. The experience certainly drove home why you have to be licensed by the state when you're putting hot wax anywhere in spitting distance of somebody's nethers...Bottom line: if you're going here for waxing, make sure your estitician has a posted license before you go in the room. And if the sheet isn't clean, turn around and walk out. :/

27.description: I rely on Yelp for just about everything - restaurant recs, salon recs, bakery recs, yoga studio recs - you name it, I Yelp it.  But I rarely write reviews.  I thought I should pay my fellow Yelpers back by letting them know where to get nails and waxing done if they live in Roscoe Village or the surrounding area.  So here it is:I love, love, love this place!
