I've gotten two manicures (and I can't believe how long my regular mani lasted!), a pedicure, and a wax.  I've had three different technicians for my services/visits and felt all of them were extremely good.  Probably the best cuticle trimming I've ever had with a manicure at Salon Yves.  And, it was the most comfortable I've felt during a wax (Donna will make you forget about the waxing - you feel like you are chatting with a friend over coffee).I'm delighted that they are in my neighborhood, and I'm even more delighted by their prices.  $12 for an excellent manicure - that's a deal.  Pedicures are under $25 (I think $23?) and there are some package prices, like a mani/pedi combo that saves a few bucks.  The waxing is also an excellent price.I was always bummed that I had to leave my neighborhood to find good waxing and mani/pedi services - not anymore.  I've finally found my go to spot!

0.description: Just moved here about a year ago and finding my go to nail salon has been rough. I've been going to the same nail spot for 15 years in my old hood so when I find my spot I'm usually a lifer. After a dozen or so misses I've found my hit. I love this spot!! They are super clean, music/decor are calming, great selection of colors and always take me as soon as I walked in. I've had compliments every time I've gotten my nails done. I usually do no chip manis and pedis. I've tried the regular manis with the extended polish (for $3more) which are supposed to last 10 days, but honestly they didn't last longer than the regular polish but they had a better selection of colors in the extended stay so I ended up getting it anyway. I've been here about 6 times and I'm happy to say I've found my spot.

20.description: I've gone twice now and have not been impressed with the service. If you bring cash, you can get a mani/pedi for $32. However, both times I went it felt more like an express service. No massage or maybe it was so quick, I missed it. For me, I would rather pay the extra money to not feel rushed and get a nice foot and leg rub. What also bothered me was the older lady who drained the foot tub, sprayed it down with water, used a few towels to wipe around the tub and then put the blue towel down to use on the next customer. This place is not for me. I hope you have better luck.

19.description: I have been to salon yves a few times and it has always been great. The manis and pedis aren't just painting - there is always good attention paid to cuticles, ingrown nails, etc. unfortunately, there is a new group of technicians and they just don't cut it. I called to ask if they had time for a pedi. They said yes, come right in. When I arrived 5 minutes later, every seat was taken and I had to wait 15 minutes. Strike 1. I specifically asked the tech to give special attention to any ingrowns. I'm a runner and they get bad. He did nothing but file. I asked him to check again and even showed him. This time he tried to use the clippers. Needless to say, my toes still hurt and I will have to deal with it myself. Strike 2. When the tech finally finished pretending to give a pedicure and was about to paint, I asked him to put my flip flops on rather than the foam shoes. He refused and said that it was too hard for him to paint in regular shoes. Strike 3. Too bad this place couldn't maintain it's great service. Just another mediocre place now.

2.description: Great no chip mani today.  The tech took special care and was gentle-  I hate places that jerk your hands around and are rough.  He trimmed my cuticles with perfection.  For me, it's always in the details like this that make or break a nail experience.The salon is newer and clean.  They had a large selection of no chip colors (prob around 100).  I don't do the whole acrylic nail art thing and it doesn't look like they do here from what I could tell.  Classy.I'm not really a fan of pedicures in general, so I doubt I'll ever be able to review this place on those.  But for manicures it's a great spot.  My only complaint would be the horrible music they had playing.  I heard enough Britney Spears. NSync, Backstreet Boys, and Mariah Carey to make my ears bleed.  Maybe this is what little teeny bopper girls like but for the demo of the Roscoe Village neighborhood proper, the SAHM and the Chicago Housewife probably isn't in the mood to listen to this when trying to relax.  Other than that, so far so good.  Will update accordingly if the no chip doesn't hold up.

18.description: One of the best salons in Chicago! I've gone in and received mani/pedi from different technicians and every time I was pleased. Everything is very clean and sanitary. Well organized for a small place. The massage chairs are the best I've ever sat on! The decor is so cute, modern and clean! It is such a cozy atmosphere and the employees are all extremely nice and welcoming. I've also had my eyebrows done on occasion. The shape is always on point and look great! They take you to a back room to do any sort of waxing. It's nice and private so you don't feel uncomfortable. Also price is great! If you pay cash they even give you a discount! I plan on coming to Salon Yves for years to come! It's my go-to salon!

13.description: I've gone twice now and have not been impressed with the service. If you bring cash, you can get a mani/pedi for $32. However, both times I went it felt more like an express service. No massage or maybe it was so quick, I missed it. For me, I would rather pay the extra money to not feel rushed and get a nice foot and leg rub. What also bothered me was the older lady who drained the foot tub, sprayed it down with water, used a few towels to wipe around the tub and then put the blue towel down to use on the next customer. This place is not for me. I hope you have better luck.

4.description: I love this place so much. It's the perfect addition to Roscoe Village. I get my nails done pretty frequently and I definitely like to feel very pampered and comfortable while doing so. I love little cute boutique feel places that are clean and fresh and this is definitely that place.Donna is amazing at nails and even more amazing at eyebrows. I'm a tad bit of a perfectionist when it comes to the brows and I FINALLY found someone that I give an A+++Oh, also this place is BYOB. Who does not like a nice glass of white while reading a book during your pedi?!

24.description: This placed opened up down the street from my workplace so a coworker and I decided to pop in on our lunch break for a quick mani.They had a sign out front with their prices and some cash specials they had going on.  $11 for a mani sounded like a deal so in we go!  The employees were very nice and courteous and they offered a nice selection of OPI and Esse products.  I went with a silver OPI and a glitter since I was getting my nails done for my birthday weekend and wanted to jazz things up a bit.My nails were nicely done and the polish lasted for about a week.  My nails were actually a lot stronger afterwards and grew quickly which is pretty rare for me!Overall I was pleased with the service and look forward to going back!

6.description: This salon is so cute, so clean and most importantly sooooo comfortable.  The ambiance is fantastic, the staff is genuinely happy that you're there and they go above and beyond to make sure you're cozy. I love the iPad payment with the touch of my finger and the latest and greatest nail colors and services.  However, this place isn't just a gold mine mecca for nails, this is also home to the waxing goddess Donna.  I've been going to Donna for as long as I can remember for my waxing and every session is comfortable; yes I said comfortable in relation to the term waxing.  Seriously.  I don't know what her magic fingers do but you go in expecting a certain level of pain/discomfort and you come out looking amazing and feeling like you just had a chat with your long lost bestie from 9th grade....and did I mention you look great. I get compliments on my eyebrows probably once a month (if I've been good and gone to see Donna.)  I will not let ANYONE else touch my brows and I don't think you should either.  Salon Yves makes provides you with a relaxing and aesthetically pleasing location to do all the primping one might desire.

22.description: Just stopped in after I dropped my daughter off at ballet next door. Very cute décor, clean, super friendly, and my technician looked like she belonged in the chair not me! (Had a beautiful gown on, a Yurman bangle, Tory Burch flip flops- the works;) The nail polish selection was huge, and the pedi chairs were top of the line. My mani/pedi took an hour & half but I was in no rush and I'm sure if you were in a hurry they'd accommodate. I later found out the tech was the owners mother (whose birthday it was today) and a sister was working there as well- made me like the whole experience more! The place was made with care and it shows. Definitely will be returning and would recommend!

15.description: I've taken walks to this salon a few times for a no-chip mani. The first thing that turned me on to this salon were their decent prices and location. $12 manicures c'mon! The salon is new and super cute. However, the reasoning behind my three-star rating is the fact that though my manicures turn out nice, the associates are always in a hurry. Because of this I've had bleeding cuticles (on more than one finger) and polish that doesn't quite go on my entire nail. I got my no-chip yesterday afternoon and tonight they're still sore! I did visit at a pretty busy time but that shouldn't be the reason (or excuse) why my no-chip looks like I did it myself.

7.description: I want to give this place a better review, but I just can't. I went for a mani pedi on a Friday. I called and made an appointment in advance and when I got there, I had to  wait an additional 15 minutes. They were very busy and I could tell because of how rough the person was when she was doing the mani pedi. Usually mani pedis take an hour a half and mine was done in less than an hour. It took them 15 minutes to do a pedicure for the woman next to me, which makes me question the quality of service.The ambiance was nothing special and it felt like a factory in there with how quickly all of the services were performed. The polish on one of my nails was smudged before she finished putting on the top coat and when I pointed it out, she took a cuticle clipper and took that part of the polish off and then reapplied it. I expected her to reapply polish to the whole nail but she did not and the polish does not lay flat on that nail in the space that she "remedied" the issue. Good news - I paid cash so it cost me $32. Guess I get what I pay for on this one.

8.description: A cute lil nail and wax salon. The staff is very friendly. Ive been in 3 times sinxe the opened and have been warmly greeted. I have never made an appt and have always been helped within 5 min. Ive had a manicure, pedicure and eyebrow wax. All have been top notch. The pedicure chairs are uber massage chairs.. they are no joke. This is not just a vibrating chair. They also use a sugar scrub on your feet. Its a nice touch that felt awesome and worked well. I dont think any other place in the neighborhood includes that. Good color selection and the price is right. Bring cash.. they accept credit cards but they have cash only deals. Why not save a few bucks if u can. Ill be back.

3.description: Salon Yves really takes the mani-pedi experience to the next level by providing a super chill, clean and cozy atmosphere. They can get pretty busy at times (which is a good thing for them!) but do a lot to make you comfortable while you're waiting. It's also BYOB and occasionally plays guilty pleasure chick flicks to keep people amused while in the chair. Talk about knowing your audience! My loyalty goes to you, Salon Yves!

14.description: This placed opened up down the street from my workplace so a coworker and I decided to pop in on our lunch break for a quick mani.They had a sign out front with their prices and some cash specials they had going on.  $11 for a mani sounded like a deal so in we go!  The employees were very nice and courteous and they offered a nice selection of OPI and Esse products.  I went with a silver OPI and a glitter since I was getting my nails done for my birthday weekend and wanted to jazz things up a bit.My nails were nicely done and the polish lasted for about a week.  My nails were actually a lot stronger afterwards and grew quickly which is pretty rare for me!Overall I was pleased with the service and look forward to going back!

12.description: Talk about a cool store. Fixture is a great go to store for yourself or for gifts! It has a little bit of everything...from handbags to books, baby stuff to picture frames and jewelry to furniture... Patti the owner is also very nice. She also loves to support local talent. So some items can be a little pricey but they are totally worth it b/c they are quality items and you know you are getting something unique and different.If you are in Roscoe Village or even no where close by, it's a definite stop by and check it out location.  Plus parking is usually very easy and there are great restaurants close by too, if you get hungry.

7.description: Love this cute shop! I always am able to find a present for a (female) friend or family member. This store is the cutest, and has sweet Christmas decor.  I purchased some trinkets last year AND went back again this year because I knew they would have a great selection--and they did!

3.description: Great boutique for gift shopping (or for yourself.. of course).  The selection is unique and perfect for a variety of occasions.  The kids rain boots and slickers were the cutest!   Every price point is available. I will be back for a custom frame for sure.

1.description: Cutest little shop ever! And, Henry, the labradoodle makes the shopping experience that much better.I loved shopping here, and will continue to go back.  Yes, it's a little pricey (reason for the 4-star rating), but it's a local shop and I'm always a fan of supporting local businesses.

2.description: I stopped in here on a whim during one of the Roscoe street fests....I was hot and this spot seemed cool and inviting.  In any case, it's a good (and bad) thing that I visited.  First of all, everything is so cute in here - and it has a really unique selection of gifts and fun items - these are definitely things you won't find elsewhere (this is the good part).  Secondly, the stuff is so unique and fun that I wanted to buy everything (this is the bad part)...  I did get a really interesting pair of earrings from a local artist that I adore and that get compliments every time I wear them.The staff was super friendly and I'm only upset that I didn't visit this wonderful local business sooner!

9.description: I love this place! Everything I would put in a store of my own! I seriously want to buy almost everything in the place. The things I wouldn't buy now are because I need a house to put them in instead of my tiny apt. :) Patti is the best! She remembers so many of her customers by name which always makes you feel awesome! Also- Patti has her store pet friendly, so feel free to bring the pooches in too.

10.description: This place is really cute.  If you're ever looking for a random gift for someone and can't think of anything, try here.  They have lots of cute purses and wallets, a section of kid's and baby stuff, and even dogeared jewelry.  You'll also find random things for the home, organizers, political buttons, and books.  I think I could go in here everyday and find something I wanted.  The staff is also always very friendly.

13.description: Fixture is the type of independent business that I feel really good when I support.  Everyone who works here is super nice, and today when I asked the clerk if she knew what cd was playing she went to the trouble of writing down the artists website for me.  This store is a really good place to find one of a kind gifts.  Many of their items (such as onesies and picture frames) can be made to order and personalized--but they are really pricey.  However I often find little things here that even broke little me can afford.  Even on the days that I don't want to buy anything I love to browse in here and remember things to ask for or buy for people later.

16.description: Fixture has MOVED  - they're now in Roscoe Village, right down the street from Victory's Banner Restaurant and Roscoe Blooms.  Weirdly, I can't find their new address anywhere, but rest assured, they haven't disappeared.I love this store.  It's pricey, but the items are interesting and unique.  This is my one-stop shopping for most of people on my list for holiday gifts.  Handmade jewelry, incense, lotions, pet toys, some books, great candles - a big selection of things in a small space.  Be sure to check out the children's selection in back, as I've found some very cool, unusual baby gifts at more reasonable prices than I'd expect from a boutique.  The staff is friendly and personable and really knows a lot about the merchandise, so don't hesitate to do what I do - walk in, say "I'm shopping for this kind of person, got any suggestions?" and let them show you some stuff.  You also might want to give them a price range, if you don't want to fall in love with something you can't afford.When I need a birthday or holiday gift, I go to Fixture, and I know that whatever I purchase will be unusual, personal, and of excellent quality.  Don't miss it, even if you just go to browse.

17.description: As most boutiques are, this one is a bit pricey - but so worth it. They have great gift ideas here, everything's so unique and fun you cannot walk in without buying something. The staff is wonderful, and they're very knowledgeable and helpful if you tell them what you're trying to get and for whom. Great jewelry and home decor, and some one-of-a-kind purses you'll find no where else.

15.description: I strolled into this store, because the smell of the candles enticed me ! This store reminds me a little of The Landmark in Andersonville. Very unique little store, with tons of items that can be personalized. Great housewarming gifts can be made with a theme. I could easily spend a lot of money here ! The lady working there was super friendly, and made some small talk.  I'll be back with more money in hand..

0.description: Fixture is a wonderful treasure trove filled with art, unique giftware, homeware, decorative items, buttery soft leather handbags, artisan crafts, fashion accessories, books, a children's section, and more. It is a fun store to look through. I was in the Roscoe Village neighborhood for five days and visited the shop everyday. Each time I discovered something new, and ended up buying a cool circle scarf once; then a book and a Putamayo CD on other visits. Confession: Yes, I adore Fixture and all of the goodies it has to offer but I visited the store everyday because of "Henry" a 70 pound Golden Doodle who is so full of charm you can't help but be in a great mood after visiting him in his store. I loved my little vacation in Chicago but "Henry" was the highlight. (see photo)

5.description: This place is meant to buy unique and interesting gifts.  The candles are all really good smelling (however they are usually avaliable at places like TJ Maxx or Marshalls for a fraction of the price).  It just comes down to convenience of this place to my apartment.They have some interesting soaps and other stuff.  I'm not really into that, but the wifey is.Overall its a solid place for a unique gift... however lots of items in this store I would not buy for myself.

11.description: Fixture is a really cool store for accessories.  They have a lot of great items to choose from.  Whenever I need a gift for someone, this is the first place I go!

8.description: This is a great place to shop for a gift or just to pick up a little something for yourself. Great candles, baby gifts, hobo bags, and my favorite..putumaya music collection.Staff is great and it always feels so warm and welcoming when your step in the door!

4.description: I love this little shop.  One day I was waiting for a friend who was late for brunch and wandered into some of the shops on Roscoe.  Most had cute stuff but was way too pricey.  This one, Fixture had some unique gifts, reasonably priced as well as expensive splurge items.  I found things I absolutely loved and ended up spending way more than I should have.  The shop owner, who's name I now forget, is super nice.  She will chat with you if you want or just let you browse on your own if you don't want to be bothered.  She does have a very large dog that may be intimidating, but he's very friendly and after checking you out once, will leave you alone.  If you pet him, he'll love you forever!

14.description: My favorite (and first) hobo purse / wallet was purchased here! I love that thing. Anyway the owner of Fixtures is an amazing woman, she is always super friendly and ready to help you find the perfect gift.  This place is on my top five list for unique gift shopping!

6.description: Perfect place to buy unique gifts and gretting cards!The also have modern handbags which make it worth it to be on their email list!  Sometimes they'll even mail you coupons for their handbag sales.

58.description: A few weeks ago I introduced CBS2's Kate Sullivan to Hero's Sandwich Shop.  It remains the best submarine sandwich shop in the city.  Fresh ingredients and prepared the way you want it, this place has been pleasing folks since 1963 (and me since 1970).  Try it once and you'll keep coming back.

56.description: Crappy hard chewy bread skimpy meat slices that they cover w tons of lettuce & oily cheese. No thanks

29.description: Simple, good sandwiches served in a clean environment. Better then anything Subway has.

42.description: Hero's subs taste like my childhood! I grew up eating the Turkey/Ham and the Cold Cuts, and still go often for a trip down memory lane. Cash only.

23.description: Hero's makes very basic sub sandwiches and they take cash only.  They use fresh Turano bread (baked daily) and fresh vegetables prepared daily.I like the turkey and ham with everything but pickle and add mayo.  It's just under $6 for a full sized sub (roughly equivalent to a subway footlong).  I love that it's close enough to my work that I can pick up a sub in a short 10-15 walk whenever I get hungry.The workers are friendly even when they're busy.  There isn't exactly a line and you don't need to stand at the counter except when you pay and pick up your sub.  The waiting system can be a little confusing if you haven't been there during busy times like lunch.

47.description: If I could, I'd give it 2 1/2  Stars,going a little past "Meh" but not quite to "A-ok".  Since it's close to home, I generally go there in the evening when the Lane Tech kids are gone.   Its nowhere near the quality of Bari or J.P. Graziano's, but way, way better than Jimmy John's or Subway or Quiznos.  For the North Side, it's pretty decent.  I'm not keen on the staff; there's a very old, wrinkly lady whom, if I pay with a twenty, holds it to the light and examines it closely.  That irritates the shit out of me, but not enough to stay away if I'm in the mood for a decent sub!  Very good bread; go with the Mixed Cuts.  Pretty reasonably priced..

8.description: Awesome subs, made with premium deli meats, and fresh Turano bread.  Please note: CASH ONLY.

31.description: I've been going here since i grew up in Lakeview. Their ham sandwich has always been one of my favorite sandwiches!I make the stop every once in a while but living a little further away is somewhat a hassle during rush hour. Just writing this review is making me salivate...

34.description: This is a definite place to go if you're craving a submarine sandwich and in the area.  The Turano bread is what keeps me coming back, it's hard to describe good!  I always stop here before a Cubs game.  All their subs are really good, but the submarines that I usually order on my numerous trips there throughout my lifetime are:1) Ham & Turkey Submarine2) The Monster Submarine

16.description: Very overrated.  Had an italian.  Bread was tough to bit through (felt more like ripping through), sandwich was less flavorful than I had hoped.  Much prefer other places

13.description: The best ham sandwich in the USA! ( Tourin crispy Italian bread, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, oil, vinegar, cheese, fresh ham, oregano! )  Crazy people were waiting in line at nearby Hot Doug's for hours. I went to Hero's!  5***** quality! ( Back in October) I've been enjoying their subs for at least 50 years! ( I'm in my 60's now) How many high quality places last that long? There is a reason for their longevity: high quality food, dedication and a clean environment. My favorite sandwich is ham. I get everything on it and add sliced jalapeños. Sometimes I try the turkey sandwiches. The ingredients are top notch. I think they have the best ham sandwich in the USA!

11.description: I just moved up the street and stumbled across Hero's. This is your classic, no frills, sub shop. By no frills I mean, nothing on the walls, no seats in the shop, and a couple windows to watch the suckers who aren't stopping in. No, this place isn't going to knock your socks off with a new sandwich you've never heard of, but it will give you consistent and good subs. The ingredients are fresh, the bread is fresh, and you can't really ask for more from a sandwhich. The Monster can easily be two meals, a meal and a snack, or just a really big sandwich depending on who you are. CASH ONLY!

39.description: One word "love"

37.description: Some of my first memories are from waiting for food in this shop.  I'm 30 years old and the place is nearly the same from my first memories, some pictures have changed.  My parents went here in high school.  This is a Chicago time capsule.Saying all this, I am a food snob.  I hate poor execution, lack of seasoning, up- marketing traditional items, and generally trying to be something you cannot achieve.  Hero's is authentic, it has paid its dues, and they make a great sandwich.  The bread, meats, and seasonings are spot on.  I hope this place lasts another 50 years.

0.description: My favorite sub shop ever always good people are always nice go when I can there's a line but it goes fast worth the wait

38.description: I don't understand why this place is so popular. I have had their ham and roast beef subs. Neither felt like it was anything special. Meh. The end.

51.description: Nothing compares to a cold cut sub w/bologna or mortadella made with fresh crusty Turano/Gonella bread, the basic veggies, and oil and spices. This is a CLASSIC not to be messed with.All these other joints that toast their subs or offer olives, green pepper, secret sauces, on homemade bread is selling BULLSHIT!

27.description: THE best sub sandwiches in Chicagoland.  Always fresh and fast - yes it's a dive, hole in the wall but oh so delicious!  I now live on the south side of the city and whenever I'm remotely near there I stop for a mixed cold cut - my mouth is watering thinking about it.  My dad always got the nachos - a good little appetizer, but it's all about the sandwich and these guys do it right!  If you're in the area do your palate a favor and stop in - you won't regret it!

32.description: This is the best sandwich shop in the city by far!Nice employees, they don't talk much or bother you with unnecessary conversations. You are walking in, telling them what you want, they prepare it, you eat. that's all. Simple and clear. Unlike other places that ask you 1000000 questions that you really do not want to answer, just grab your sandwich and get the hell out. Don't forget to bring cash with you. They do not take plastic.ohhh i was almost forgetting the bonus. Sandwiches are so damn good!

54.description: Inexpensive?  Check.Tasty?  Check.Will sustain me through a double at work?  Check.No frills, but this sub sandwich is exactly what I need.  It serves a simple, tasty, utilitarian purpose and is saving the day for me right now.

48.description: It's okay. Maybe a little better than subway, etc.  The subs taste a lot like Jimmy John with the firmer French bread and the generous portions of meat, but overall I wouldn't go very far out of my way for it.  Two stars because I had hoped for more.

44.description: Good size subs at moderate prices.

24.description: I might have gone on a bad day, but I really didn't like this place. I love subs and I love Turano bread like no one's business. But when I went here I was disappointed. I got the Italian cold cuts sandwich and everything looked good initially. Then I bit into it and the bread was stale. Not rock hard but not pleasant. I didn't taste the toppings really and when I opened up the sandwich the salami and mortadella looked pretty disgusting. Purple in color to a point that I took the meat out to finish it. I'm not a sub snob so it's pretty hard to disappoint me, but this really did. Even though this place has great reviews, I won't go back. The meat creeped me out to a point of no return.

7.description: I have to wonder what kind of other sub sandwiches people have had in their lives to give this place such high praise. I don't understand where it all the comes from; maybe Lane Tech alumni who've never had the chance to try something else because this is conveniently located right across the street?I've given this place many tries thinking that maybe I've been there on an off day, or maybe a dozen off days. Nope, it's consistently mediocre. The Turano bread they like to advertise has never once been fresh, which is a shame because fresh Turano bread is quite good and while some establishments bake Turano products on site daily, Hero's does not. If you think this is fresh bread, you need to get out more. Pretty sure they just get the same kind of sandwich rolls any one of us could buy in a bag at the grocery store.The vegetables lack color and texture, and the meats are Hormel. You know, the near-discount brand you can buy for cheap at your local grocery store. They're so slimy that they slide around on a strange layer of mucous so much that when you bite into one end, the meat and toppings all slide out the back and the sides because even the bread can't hang onto them, probably due to the fact that it's a bit stale as mentioned. It should not be considered a point of pride to advertise that you serve cold cuts that anyone can pick up for peanuts at the local corner store. Same can be said for most of the toppings and condiments. Nothing about these sandwiches stands out and makes them any different than one you could make at home.Do any of the people giving this place glowing reviews know what fresh bread, quality cold cuts and crisp vegetables taste like? Based on what Hero's is serving, I have no reason to believe they aren't just going down the street to Mariano's to buy their ingredients. I get it, they're a small place and they've been there since 19XX and they don't have a website or take credit cards and I guess that's all supposed to be part of the charm. Sure, fine, but I've been at total holes in the wall where they at least took debit cards and provided food that amounted to something they actually made and not something that could be assembled from the exact ingredients anyone can LITERALLY get at a grocery store.There are better sub options around Chicago, and I'm not just talking Jimmy John's, Subway, or Potbelly, although I'd still take any one of those chains over Hero's, which makes no attempt to set itself apart and do something unique or distinctive, much less fresh. Sorry, but two stars is actually being incredibly generous given the other options that are available.

49.description: The ONLY place to get a sub in town...  It is that good...Very limited parking in lot.No seating, just grab and go.

40.description: Hero's Submarines.. how have I missed you all my life?I have wasted my time going to those other Submarine Places..Well.. there will be no more of that..God.. I Love this place!Located right across from Lane Tech it can get very busy,but.. it is/was so worth the wait!The Sandwich List is basic.. Turkey, Ham, Roast Beefand other cold cut options are offered.Chips.. No Fries..And.. a dill pickle that they will cut for you if you'd like.No seating is available but they have a long tabletopacross the Addison Street side windowNo playing around here, the cashiers behind the counterask what you would like and they do this with a great attitudeand a big smile!And.. your sandwich is delivered into your hands very quickly..And.. today I got a foot long turkey sub with all the condimentsand a huge dill pickle for $6.50!So worth every penny..:)Just for the record Hero's is cash only..But.. you wont need to break the bank to eat here!I am so impressed with this little, very ordinary lookingsandwich shop...So.. do yourself a favor and venture on in here..Because whats happening on the inside is anythingbut ordinary..:)

53.description: Very tasty subs!

30.description: I have to admit that it has never occurred to me to enter this sub shop.  It always looked closed though the signs would indicate otherwise.However, today I stopped in for a quick sandwich pick up.  It's very sparse inside...two friendly attendants/sandwich makers and not much else.  My sandwich was made quickly and efficiently with fresh meats and cheeses (and who doesn't like Turano bread).Tasty and for about $6 for a sub and chips, this may be one of the best values in the area!

46.description: I grew up just a couple of blocks away from Hero's, so this is where I've been getting my sandwiches...my entire life. Hero's has the best bread, the best ingredients, and the perfect proportions. The corn chips are always the way to go, and their new lunch deal makes for a perfect bite. Lots of annoying teenagers if you come at the wrong time, but, during the summer, just picking up some Hero's and sitting on the lawn of Lane Tech is one of my most wonderful memories of my preteen years. Hero's gives you no-nonsense, perfect sandwiches. No bells or whistles, just what's right. The ingredients are on point, and the bread is to die for. Do not skip this great sandwich shop.

1.description: Don't waste your time. This place serves up hot garbage for subs. I ordered a turkey sub and the gelatinous faux slimmy white floppy substance they called turkey angered me enough to write this review. Subway serves artisanal turkey by comparison. How this place has stayed in business for so long baffles me given how poor quality of product they sell.  This place makes Arby's seem like a viable alternative.Seeing all the positive reviews, it makes me wonder how much of the population was born without taste buds.

55.description: Great sub shop. Never dissappointed.

9.description: Love the smoked turkey with everything very very delicious. I'm going to have them cater my daughter outdoor birthday party.

26.description: One of my favorites places to get a sandwich. No frills. No nonsense. Hole in the wall place. But their sandwiches are money.

25.description: Had an Italian half with chips and soda it was great sub better then Subway .I knew about this place since 1971 my brother while driving decided to stop off went inside while I waited and brought a couple sandwiches. I was a passenger in his car that day .

12.description: Favorite sandwich place in all of Chicago. Them taking cash only is the only knock against them, but I wont go anywhere else.

59.description: I stopped in after seeing them on the news... Great sandwich joint;  really friendly gr8 customer service

21.description: Best subs ever!! I don't live in Chicago, and every time I come to town, I always get one. It's a family favorite. It's worth the trip, and is a reasonable price!

17.description: I always hear everyone that went to Lane Tech say that this was their place growing up. So luckily I got a ride home from a party and we decided to go here because my cousin who took me said the same thing. I really wasn't thrilled. I ordered the roast beef and to me it tasted like cheap packaged deli meat. I mean it wasn't bad but it is a overhyped place.

10.description: I have to admit that it has never occurred to me to enter this sub shop.  It always looked closed though the signs would indicate otherwise.However, today I stopped in for a quick sandwich pick up.  It's very sparse inside...two friendly attendants/sandwich makers and not much else.  My sandwich was made quickly and efficiently with fresh meats and cheeses (and who doesn't like Turano bread).Tasty and for about $6 for a sub and chips, this may be one of the best values in the area!

5.description: My favorite sub shop in Chicago. Pick your meat, cheese, and get it with everything; hold the pickle, add a little mayo.High school across the street. Good to avoid noon on weekdays. Line does go super fast though. Parking too.

3.description: Awesome sub shop - way better than the standard Subway/Potbellies/Jimmy Johns crap. The bread is what makes it, the rest is kind of standard. I love the finely shredded lettuce on my turkey sub, with the mayo...the bread though, seriously. So chewy and just perfect. Everything about the sandwich was satisfying and fresh.

35.description: Hero's is amazing!  I only discovered this little hole-in-the-wall gem a few years ago, and my life has changed.  I used to go to Those Other Sandwich Places, but never again.Hero's has crunchy Turano bread that is delicious and MAKES the sub what it is.  Add some fresh meat, cheese, veggies, and oil and seasonings, and you've got yourself what I consider to be the best sub in Chicago.  if you haven't gone, go.  Now!  They're open until 9:00...

19.description: I grew up in Rogers Park and used to frequent their shop at Touhy & California which is long gone now, but I still crave the sandwich of my youth and I go back to relive the memory. It is as perfect as the first time I went there.  I always get the same thing, the bologna sub. Where else can you get that? I bought it then because it was all I could afford as a kid in 7th grade. I think it was 89 cents,  but now I am 47 and drove from the far west suburbs in my Cadillac and still love that inexpensive sandwich.  I spend $10 in gas for a sandwich that costs $4 and change. It is perfect in its simplicity,  a great Turano roll, lots of thinly sliced bologna, lettuce, tomato, onion, American cheese, pickles, Italian spices, and Italian dressing.  So simple, yet a unique flavor I can't get anywhere else.I will keep coming back as long as they don't change a thing. A true Chicago original.

28.description: This is my favorite place for subs.  What makes them stand out is their mustard and mayonnaise.   It has a very unique sweet and tangy taste to it.  You MUST get their subs with mustard and mayonnaise. You also HAVE to specifically request mustard and mayo on your sub.  Even if you tell them you want everything on your sub, they won't include the mustard and mayo unless you specifically ask for it. So do yourself a favor and get one of their subs WITH mustard and mayo!

45.description: best subs in chicago.... way better than subway

33.description: I just finished eating a sandwich from here just now.It was pretty good, the bread is what makes the sandwich I think. I got the turkey sub with everything on it, plus mustard mayo and giardenera. I wish they offered vinegar, but I'm not complaining.My supervisor told me not to eat here because they aren't sanitary, but I kept a close eye on when they made my sandwich and it seemed pretty clean to me.I would eat here again if I was in the area, but I wouldn't make it a trip.

43.description: Just a nice fresh simple sup shop can't go wrong!

2.description: I pass this sub shop on the daily, so cliche but so true. So often and for decades even, without ever venturing inside.  Always wondering, until..Wondering whether it could match the great experiences I had shared with my Dad (during childhood) at a submarine shop near Little Italy.  The sub shop by UIC, was old school.  "I-talian" owned and run, They didn't share their ingredients lists or what went into their "special sauce", it was (just) a great submarine sandwich shop with windows busied with colorful writings of all their special sandwiches.  I was talking to the old man about that sub shop recently, he said " those Italians were expert sandwich makers."  So some weeks back, I was caught in the rain on the "606" trail.  A straight hour of inconsistent rains poured down atop of me.  Some hard rain and some soft rain.  I now know how a wet dog feels after rains.  Heavy!  Why am I sharing this?  I dunno, cause I was hungry.  Not hungry but hongry!  I had a long walk, I was thoroughly wet to my core and wanted a good meal to make me "right as rain".  I decided a submarine sandwich would give me that.So I stopped in and ordered a sub.  I was hongry as mentioned earlier and asked if they could double up on the vegetable toppings.  They charged me extra for double veggies and the oddity is that it didn't look like it had extra veggies.  It looked like it was a normal amount of shredded veggies.  I won't bore you with extra details but the sub was pretty average.  I don't think a second go is needed.One and done.

18.description: Hero's makes very basic sub sandwiches and they take cash only.  They use fresh Turano bread (baked daily) and fresh vegetables prepared daily.I like the turkey and ham with everything but pickle and add mayo.  It's just under $6 for a full sized sub (roughly equivalent to a subway footlong).  I love that it's close enough to my work that I can pick up a sub in a short 10-15 walk whenever I get hungry.The workers are friendly even when they're busy.  There isn't exactly a line and you don't need to stand at the counter except when you pay and pick up your sub.  The waiting system can be a little confusing if you haven't been there during busy times like lunch.

41.description: This place reminds me of those family owned deli's in the northeast. Nothing fancy, but they make a mean sub and grinder. It's tiny, it's cash only and there's no place to sit, but get the Monster sub. so so good! I always ask restaurants what is on their Italian sub. If mortadella isn't mentioned, I know they don't get it, so I don;t order it. Hero's does it right. And they customize their toppings to whatever you want. I can't wait to try one of their 3+ foot long subs for a Superbowl party of something. They do one thing at this place, but they do it right. When I go into Subway, I weep a little wishing it was Hero's.

52.description: I have been very excited to try this place ever since I discovered it. It reminded me of the Jersey Giant, an awesome submarine place back in Michigan. So I finally tried today and should say the sub was good, however, the pleasantries stopped there. The two dudes behind the counter had zero interest in assisting us with our order or anyone in the store for that matter. In addition to the simply poor service, there was some person, which I could only assume was the owner was screaming from the back about some football game that was very inappropriate. To add to the overall poor experience, they charge $1.35 for a pop and no free refills, which to me is outrageous, this combined with that fact that it is cash only adds to my dismay. I have a message for the Chicago restaurant owners and cabbies, I am tired of you all complaining about debit cards and credit cards and then have the nerve to put a ATM in your establishment and try to make money on that but you refuse to pay the credit card companies. Hypocrites. We are all aware of there is a fee to use the service but get used to it, this is a plastic world and I am going to boycott cash only places and I invite all of you to join me.

50.description: This place makes a mean turkey sub.  It almost makes you want to go to a Subway and slap someone.  Nothing fancy, just lettuce, tomato and onion with a little oil + vinegar and Italian spices.  But the bread, oh the bread.  I believe they use Turano bread and it brings the whole sandwich together.  Crunchy, chewy tasty all serve as acceptable adjectives for it.Hero's isn't the place you come to get free wifi, Celine Dion playing in the background or a salad.  It's the place you go to get an awesome sub.

4.description: This review is several months overdue.  This is one of those no frills sub shops, but I found the meat to be that slimy weird type of meat. The bread seemed a little stale also. I wouldn't go back.

6.description: I have been going to Hero's for over 20 ears since I was a lane tech student and the sandwiches have never changed. Some who are not from Chicago may not understand the hype but I've always said its a Chicago thing. The combination of the Turano bread, shredded lettuce, oil and oregano, is what makes the sandwich in my opinion. I usually go for the mixed cold cuts or the Italian  as they usually has the most flavor. I'm really into mayonnaise so you have to let them know to add it.  I try to go early in the day as that's when the bread is the freshest. They keep it simple with the side dishes as you can either get a bag of chips or nachos. This place is very small but you can always find counter space to eat your sub. The steady stream of regulars that walk in there is amazing.

22.description: Always awesome! The same sandwich I have been getting for the past 30+ years! Consistant, fresh, delicious.. This is the real crave!

15.description: Let me first say that I have been eating at this place for the last forty years, I used to go to school and work nearby this place.  Now I have not been here for awhile, but I always had a great sandwhich from here.  I used to drive quite a distance to get a sub here.Until today, I ordered a american sub with everything on it.  I don't recall them putting mayo on that particular sub.  But there was so much mayo on the sandwhich that every bite was a Heilman's experience, and it would just squirt out and all you could taste was the mayo.  At the end of the sandwhich there was a huge pile of mayo sitting there on the wrapper.  Must of have went through about a dozen napkins while eating.  Also it seems to be a little more costly to eat there since my last visit.

57.description: Not the cheapest place in town but I would drive an extra 15 minutes to get there. Sandwiches are excellent. My favorite is the Roast Beef/Turkey Combo...delicious. All sandwiches are made to go because there is no seating in this very small store. Employees are very courteous and make sure they are putting the right ingredients on each sandwich. Check out the sports memorabilia on the walls while you are waiting for your order.

20.description: I always hear everyone that went to Lane Tech say that this was their place growing up. So luckily I got a ride home from a party and we decided to go here because my cousin who took me said the same thing. I really wasn't thrilled. I ordered the roast beef and to me it tasted like cheap packaged deli meat. I mean it wasn't bad but it is a overhyped place.

36.description: There's a reason this place is across the street from a high school... it's geared toward kids on a tight budget and the unexperienced palate. Sandwiches seem to have too much mayo/mustard even when asked for 'easy' amounts. Meats also seem kinda cheap/slimy too... but hey, you get what you pay for. They also seemed to have recently switched to the TINY 1 oz bag of chips... big disappointment (very similar to the Costco case of chips used to stock your kid's lunchbox). They're probably trying to cut corners to avoid raising prices, but hey, when you skimp on someone's portions, they're bound to go elsewhere. They're better off charging a few cents more, in my opinion... Never have a customer leave cheated or hungry. They use Turano bread which (I guess) is a plus, but once you've had Bari's on Grand Ave, it's hard to go anywhere else. This place is good in a pinch.

14.description: This is just what I was in the mood to eat for lunch today. I had a turkey and roast beef sub, which included cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickle, oil and oregano. I added mayo and giardiniera, which added a little spice. The veggies looked and tasted fresh. The bread was a little on the hard side. Overall, it was really good. I would go back and would probably order the same exact thing. Also, to note, the sandwiches were made by a lady wearing gloves.

3.description: This Fannie May Store has been open for about a month.It is located in the Roscoe Village Strip Mall, a few doors north ofToys R Us.The Store is visually attractive and new, and now is the timeto stop in and pick up some holiday candy because it is now at 50% off!And they have quite a nice assortment of pre-boxed candies thatare still there this day after Christmas!They have a great store manager working here by the name of Johnand he is so pleasant and welcoming..He is so good with his customers and that means alot!So.. Anyone for Christmas mint meltaways at 50%off?Sounds like a deal to me!I even noticed a freezer with some Fannie May Ice Cream..Good thing I was on my way out..:)So.. welcome Fannie May to Roscoe Village..And to John.. I wish I had you for my boss..:)Very Nice Indeed..:)

1.description: Obviously the chocolates and ice cream brought us into Fannie May, but the customer service will keep us coming back.  Sheila was absolutely fabulous and made sure we left happy, laughing and loving Fannie May even more. She is a perfect example of what good customer service should look like anywhere.  Will definitely be back because of her.

2.description: I've been to a few Fannie May locations and by far this one is the best. A huge selection and great customer service. Sheila was very helpful and friendly. It is great to go to a place as simple as here and get such great friendly customer service. I will definitely be back to this location again. She also made sure to tell me about the sale items and also about an up coming event they are having in the store next month.

5.description: The staff at this location is amazing. The store is really clean. I'm addicted to the Graham cracker ice cream. John and Sheila are super friendly. Every time I walk in and Sheila is there it brightens up my day. She always let's me know what's new and remembers what I like. I no longer but my Fannie may at the grocery store. Love it!

6.description: A family favorite and a special treat for special occassions! Every year I treat my mom to these amazing dark chocolate buttercremes for valentine's day, mother's day, her birthday and of course, Christmas! My grandmother used to send us the chocolate crayons from here every Chrismas as well. The Guttman family LOVES Fannie May!

7.description: Very nice service. Free samples,  Too. Best candy store and half the cost of the fancy brands.

8.description: the manager is a very nice person, but even more important; there pure white chocolate is super yummy. they give you lots of samples and will gift wrap your candy for you. I will definitely be paying a whole pan of white-chocolate one day.

9.description: Very Nice Store and they have Ice Cream also!!! Staff is SUPER friendly. I'm going back tomorrow to get me some Pixie's... YUM!!!

0.description: Amazing choice of chocolates. I was surprised how the store can be so organized. Excellent customer service. Thank you for doing this for us. Definitely will come again with my family to get some sweets for Mother's day.

4.description: Excellent service! Sheila is a great ambassador for Fannie May and her inventory is well-stocked. Thank you for helping us get ready w/our Easter chocolates!

12.description: If you are looking for a show that will make you pee your pants, this is it. I've been to the Tuesday show two weeks in a row and probably will be back for more. The stand up comedians are great and each brings their own flavor to the show. Its great for a first date. Boom!

3.description: a steal at $5!! you pay $25 at other clubs and its not even as funny. I go all the time and its always good. they never let you down. good beers, amazing food. this place is win win win

1.description: Visiting Chicago from Philly, stopped in to check out the third anniversary show for Comedy Secrets. A truly great comedy show from top to bottom. Loved the format, the panel really added to the fun of the dark stories told. Special guest headliner Drew Michael closed out the show with what was honestly one of the tightest and funniest standup sets I've ever seen. So far, this is the best comedy we've seen in Chicago. For real.

2.description: Terrible place. Bouncers assaulted a friend of mine because of his sexuality. Literally dragged him after punching and choking him. Horrible and despicable place. If you want to know more just look at the Chicago Underground's Facebook page. The story shall get out.

9.description: Amazing show and value.  Some of these comedians are really going to make it big if they haven't already.  There are a few here and there that I haven't cared for, but for the most part...I have enjoyed myself and laughed myself silly.  Because of my work schedule, I don't go as much as I like.  However, I have found quite a few comedians there that I have tried to follow at different venues. I usually find out who is playing that night before deciding to struggle the next day at work...overall, awesome!

10.description: I think the Chicago Underground Comedy showcase is incredibly tight.  In some ways it's comparable to The Lincoln Lodge, and it's not uncommon to see the same people performing at both venues.  The experience, though, is completely different.  ChUC is in the back of a bar, up on a rock band stage.  The whole night has the feel of a rock show.  The comedy is loud, the beer flows freely.If you're looking for a hot night of stand-up in Chicago, and want to see comedy that's a little edgier than the fare at Zanies, definitely put this showcase on your calendar.  Five years from now, you'll be watching some famous comedy show, and you'll recognize someone from the set you saw in '08.

13.description: The Chicago Underground comedy showcase is always a different comedy show and almost always a "can't Miss". The show is a little more edgy than the acts you might see at Zanies or the Improv in Shaumburg. It's mostly stand up but they always manage to offer up a wide variety of acts. It's a fun show on what's normally an Off night.There is sometimes a beer special and Beat Kitchen has a pretty great kitchen. More than you'd expect a typical "rock" venue to have.This show is a great Tuesday night date or afterwork excursion.  And you can't beat the price. $5

16.description: If you like comedy, and you don't have a funeral to go to on a Tuesday, you owe it to yourself to come see this show. The best people in town are performing here all the time. Guaranteed to be more engaging and crazy than the lame, suburbanite-oriented comedy clubs you might be used to!

6.description: I highly recommend checking out Chicago Underground Comedy.  You get 5 comedians for 5 bucks.  Most of the acts are different from week to week, and you get some really quality performers who come in.The performances are stand up, which I am highly partial toward.  So kick back relax, grab a beer and get ready to piss yourself laughing.I would suggest getting to the place 30 minutes early so that you can guarantee yourself a place to sit.Also, avoid paying your cover fee in $1 Native American Sacagawea coins, because the tatted up door man might choke you out.Definitely check this place out.

15.description: unlike the other two reviewers here, I am not a Chicago comedian.  ;)however, I will say that for $5, this is the most reliable night of comedy in town.  you can see rising stars as well as more established local comedians put on sets they might not put on as opening acts at places like Zanies or the Lakeshore.

0.description: This show is great. I loved it. We saw Comedy Secrets where comics tell stories that we're not allowed to talk about. If you love gossip this show will literally be torture for you. We took an oath.It was a packed audience, awesome lineup, killer hosts and panel, and the stand up from Drew Michael was incredible. This was the funniest thing I've seen in a while. Also the panel element of the show was a perfect pairing with the personal stories.

5.description: I saw the St. Patrick's Day show last night at the Wilmette Theater.  Note my refusal to call it "The Mette."  I think the fact that I can remember when Lyman's pharmacy was down the street and can produce photographic evidence of my time as a WJHS cheerleader exempt me from using the hipstah slang.    The host was affable and third and fourth comedians (Matty Ryan and Adam Burke) were excellent.  I don't LOL easily (seriously, it's a problem - I'm like the girl Seinfeld dated who just said "That's funny") but they both totally broke through my icy facade and brought out the chucklies.  They were original and very different form each other, but both totally solid.  One teensy note would be the volume of the mics - it seemed too loud by like one hair.     The crowd was diverse in terms of age, but since it was Wilmette, homogenous otherwise.  Still, I give some of the audience members props for gamely laughing at a couple softballs about 1%ers as well as attending an event with a 9:00 start time.  Unfortunately, that probably eliminates my parents, but otherwise I really would force them to check it out sometime.I'll keep CUC on my radar and you should too.

11.description: On a whim, I made the trek out to Roscoe Village for some Tuesday night laughs. The scene is very low-key, but entirely enjoyable. We arrived to Beat Kitchen a bit early, not knowing what to expect for a crowd. Fortunately, there were plenty of tables open in the bar area, so we grabbed a seat and brew while we waited for doors to open.There was only a single waitress working the joint that night, but she did a great job attending to everyone's needs. Once the show area was opened up, we seamless moved to a new table and kept our tab open, and continued to sip on 312 ($3 draft special) and PBR tallboys ($3.50).As for the comics, I was a bit underwhelmed, but for five bucks, it's an incredible value. There were maybe 6 in total, including the emcee and I was impressed with about half of them.All-in-all, Chicago Underground Comedy is a great value. The beers are a bit on the pricey side, but the low cover charge for the comedy helps keep the night a great value.I would definitely recommend to others and return in the future.

8.description: So, to start off I would like to note that I have only been here once, so my ratIng at this point is based off of only one show. However, the show that i saw, for a stand up comedy show, was terrible!! I went out with a couple friends who had been here once before and said it was great. And then there was this show. Things started off promising with the host; he was funny, energetic and the right amount of engaging with the audience. I would say the host was easily the funniest person to come on stage this night. And incase you are wondering, I went Tuesday, June 5th. From the the time the host was done with his act, things went down hill. My friends that had gone before even admitted that the acts were terrible compared to the first time they went (or for any stand up show). The first two acts were two guys who could not remember their own jokes and were completely all over the place in the train of thought it was not even funny. They maybe funny in normal conversations because of how awkward they are, but are not funny in stand up. The 3rd act was a female, who for the most part was semi-entertaining. The next two acts were females who were both anything but funny and who's acts were not at all stand up. One read some script that made no sense and the other seemed like she was trying to be Kristen Wig in an SNL skit, but was not funny. The final act was "eh". That is the ear way I can describe it. His jokes had potential to be funny, and were a little, but he dragged them out waaaay too long. I would be willing to give this another shot, I just hope that there are all new acts and they actually bring funny comedians

4.description: This was such an amazing show! I was surprised by how talented these comics were, and for only $5 it was a steal. The host was great and really funny, as were the following 4 comics, but the headliner guy really killed it and left us in stitches. The show lasted over an hour and was well worth it. This is probably the best value for great comedy you'll find in the area. Do it.

14.description: One of my favorite comedy showcases in Chicago.  I've been many many times.  The reason being is that it's only $5.  Plus, the food and drink at the Beat Kitchen is great.  Oh, right, the comedy.  The stand-up is great.  It's one of the most solid weekly showcases in the city, and definitely the best value.  Get some friends, get some fivers, get drunk, and get laughing.

7.description: Best comics in town and for only $5. With $3 drink specials, you can get a nice buzz to completely hammered and laugh until tears stream down your face. Even though a handful of comics have moved to the coasts for fame and barely any fortune, newer comics take over and the show doesn't lose any quality. Must see local comics: Prescott Tolk, Paul Thomas, Cameron Esposito, Ken Barnard, Adam Burke, etc. Returning comics: Hannibal Burress, Nick Vatterot, TJ MillerAnd you are welcome..

58.description: Best tacos on the north side, FOR REAL.

56.description: Tony's always hits the spot. The only think I do not recommend are the chips and salsa. Maybe it was a bad day but salsa was more like pizza sauce. My taco dinner was exactly as expected and service is always super fast!! The price is right and ingredients are quality. Can't go wrong!

29.description: Affordable and tasty. Clean enough.  Nice staff and quick service.

42.description: Sorry guys, now that I've been in the area a while, I've found some much better options for my taco fix.  I like your food, but it's over priced for the quality of what you put out.  I know four other taco joints locally, that are much higher quality, and less expensive.  I'm writing this, as I have always gotten friendly service, I just stopped coming because of the prices.  Also, I noticed you cut back on your meat portions and yet the prices continue to go up, bummer.  I do understand it's hard to make it now days, as raw material costs continue to rise, but it's hard to raise your menu prices, I get it!  You just have to rethink what you are trying to be; cheap taco joint or high quality tacos at a fair price?  I really hope you can see this, as I wish you all the best!  Again, you seem like good people, I just see less people in your place and I think I get it, I hope you do too.  I'll try back next month, as I don't want to give up on you yet.

23.description: Great spot for a cheap and quick meal. The steak burritos, steak tacos with flour tortillas, and the chicken enchilada suiza are some of our favorites. My kids are picky eaters but they will eat a beef quesadilla from here, so this place is a winner in my book!

47.description: I'm not ashamed to admit how much I love Tony's drunk or sober. Their steak tacos and flautas are my go-to. When I'm feeling really hungry, I put on my big girl pants and order their steak torta.The service is fast, prices are cheap, and they're pretty much always open. They have daily specials (taco dinner, torta, burrito suiza, and flautas). Since we're all friends here, I'll admit that I order a burger there from time to time.Don't fight it--go check out Tony's and ask for some extra red sauce. You won't be disappointed.

8.description: Well i had one of my Taco cravings again and spotted this place. I stopped for lunch just because i wanted a Taco. When i walked in, the two girls behind the counter were so deep in conversation about their "Baby Daddies" that i was ignored for about 30 seconds. One of them wanted to make sure to finish what her "Baby Daddy" did before getting to me. I mean that already pissed me off!! I was just looking at her like "REALLY LADY?!".I placed my order for two steak tacos and they came up pretty fast. As i am sitting there eating my Tacos, i remembered that one of my friends had mentioned this place a year ago. He swore up and down that this place was amazing. Well my taste buds told me "THIS PLACE DOESN'T EXCITE US ONE BIT". The Tacos were mediocre. Nothing to rave about or pass out over.

31.description: My boyfriend and I have been going here for years. The staff is always very friendly. I love their steak burritos! The prices are reasonable. They keep the place clean. I highly recommend it!

34.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Chips and guacamole are magical, a must have. My favorite is the taco dinner, but everything is superb. It is definitely the best Mexican food you can get for your money. The location is great, but parking is tough. Overall, best Mexican food for your dollar.

16.description: It's like if your favortie taco truck decided to set up shop. The food and atmosphere is absolutely authentic, and while there are fancier mexican restaurants in Chicago, Tony's has banging burritos for the right price! I ordered the burrito supreme, and I could feel the other customers instantly become jealous as my food was delivered. I was just simply shocked about how big the sucker was, as well as how quickly and friendly the service was. The burrito was so good that I ate the entire monstrosity in 3 min. The lady next to me told me what I did was a sin. I simply replied it was my guilty pleasure :) 5 stars, this is my new favorite mexican spot in west lakeview.

13.description: Great food, open late night, inexpensive, and right around the corner... I eat at Tony's a few times a week.

11.description: Sorry guys, now that I've been in the area a while, I've found some much better options for my taco fix.  I like your food, but it's over priced for the quality of what you put out.  I know four other taco joints locally, that are much higher quality, and less expensive.  I'm writing this, as I have always gotten friendly service, I just stopped coming because of the prices.  Also, I noticed you cut back on your meat portions and yet the prices continue to go up, bummer.  I do understand it's hard to make it now days, as raw material costs continue to rise, but it's hard to raise your menu prices, I get it!  You just have to rethink what you are trying to be; cheap taco joint or high quality tacos at a fair price?  I really hope you can see this, as I wish you all the best!  Again, you seem like good people, I just see less people in your place and I think I get it, I hope you do too.  I'll try back next month, as I don't want to give up on you yet.

39.description: Tony's has awesome burritos and the people who work there are very nice.  It's a nice local place and it's open super late Friday and Saturday.

37.description: Thought I should write a review since I frequent this place (drunk and sober). While I've tried a couple things, I always go back to the steak tacos. They are heaven. It's always fast, and the staff is great. It also doesn't hurt that I live a hop and a skip away. Tony's is my go to late night, and everyday taco fix.

0.description: I am rarely excited about eating places but after trying a burrito here I can not wait to go back! If this place delivered I don't know that I would get groceries. My wife got a veggie burrito repotted it in high regards. I had the chicken burrito which was "amaze balls". Descriptiveness eludes me other than I throughly enjoyed it and am returning again soon!

38.description: Excellent vegetarian burrito. Friendly service. Clean. Inexpensive. Mexican people come here to eat. What else is there to say?

51.description: Had chicken taco and burrito. Good as heck, quick service, inexpensive. 5 stars will eat again

27.description: Absolutely the best burrito in Chicago and I've had quite a few.  I recommend the steak burrito supreme dinner.

32.description: Good drunk food.  My friends and boyfriend loved it.  Been here twice now, first time I got a chicken burrito.  Second time I got veggie quesadillas.  I wasn't a fan of their chicken and the quesadillas were greasy.

54.description: Tony's is legit mexican food that is fairly cheap for good sized portions. I have only gotten the steak sopes and guac but it was so good I returned for seconds! I love it! Multiple friends of mine enjoy it too-def check it out

48.description: This is our go to place for Mexican food. Luckily for us it is located 1/2 block away. We usually get the beef tacos and beans...very tasty and very filling. Always quick service and friendly staff. Highly recommend this place for authentic Mexican fare.

44.description: Great place to grab quick, yummy Mexican food. The service is great and the staff is friendly.

24.description: Nothing negative to say about this place. It's my go-to jam whether late night or afternoon. Al pastor over everythang. tacoz, enchiladaz suizaz, burritos. Homies make a mean ass cheeseburger as well. They're open mega late. There's a HORCHATA FOUNTAIN...I mean i can't believe they have anything less than 5 stars, kno what i'm sayin?Anywhere you can get good food at low prices with hilarious staff AND soccer on tv is a good place.stop reading this and go. NOW.

7.description: Cheap and cheerful with some top quality Mexican food!You can go here sober, drunk or hungover and it never fails. Personal favourite is the pork tacos dinner but I would be happily order from 90% of the menu.

49.description: Great service. Mine started bad but ended up being a real good experience. Ordered the steak burrito with rice and beans. Ate the rice and beans and took a bite out of the burrito. I immediately spit it out my window. I think it was tongue. Friends like it- im not a fan. I went back and they gave me a steak burrito which was really good. They even refilled the rice and beans which was really nice. Try it if youre in the area.

40.description: Love this taco joint! Have lived in the neighborhood for 15 years & Tony's never disappoints. Very friendly, great quality food, and always fast.

53.description: I have no idea if this restaurant exists before midnight.  Maybe it does, maybe it doesn't.  For all I know this could be some mythical place that only comes into being after midnight to cure your hangover 8 hours before you get said hangover.Yes, you heard me correctly.Tony's cures hangovers before they exist.How so?Well, you get drunk, you get in a cab or you walk to Tony's, you eat a giant (and delicious) burrito, and you don't have a hangover.It's that simple folks.121/365

30.description: Best late night or any night Mexican! I have been coming for years and it's always packed and that's not because it's the only place open at 3am it's because the food is delicious and the ingredients are fresh! Simple but yummy and the staff could not be more courteous and fast!

46.description: Finally tried this place after passing it on my Damen 50 bus commute.  No frills taco joint with fast service.  I tried the carne asada and pastor 2 taco dinner combo.  Definitely Americanized with the lettuce, tomato, and sour cream toppings rather than the traditional tacqueria onions and cilantro.  Rice and beans standard fare.  The tacos will suffice when in a pinch for dinner on my way home or after a late night out.

1.description: Tony's Burrito Mex can best be described as the go to place after a night of drinking. I had the opportunity to check out Tony's when a friend dragged me here for a late night snack after a night of drinking.Walking into Tony's brought me back to my college days of everyone packing into the nearest and cheapest restaurant for a late night snack. Tony's size is better suited for dining-out. There are only two or three tables in the restaurant and a few bar stools to accommodate customers that want to dine-in. The overall energy of Tony's was great! Everyone from the customers to the staff was very friendly and welcoming. The staff are definitely patient because they are used to dealing with intoxicated customers that take forever to order. The food itself is super cheap and very low quality. I unfortunately visited here when I was sober so I could taste how bad the food was. The chicken in the burrito was terribly seasoned which made it taste very bland. I personally was starving so I finished everything but I wouldn't try this restaurant again unless I'm starving or have had a few too many drinks.

55.description: I love this place; been going for years as I live three blocks away! Super friendly service, awesome food, great salsas, and very fast! Plus my son is friends with the owners son, so hopefully that might pay off someday!!!

9.description: What a fuckn MessEnvironment: 1/5 Your diner setting. Grab n go, quick bite type of place.Food: Sucks/5Steak Taco: sour cream, cheese, old lettuce, horrible tomatoes. Meat was cold and soo old and dryTongue Taco: sour cream, cheese, old lettuce, horrible tomatoes. Tongue was disgusting.Overall: Horrible. If your drunk or don't know Mexican food go right ahead. Your a disgrace for calling this food Mexican.

26.description: I remember it being pretty darn good at 3 AM, a bit drunk.

25.description: Great authentic mexican food! Had the flautas they're great! Best I had! Good prices for what you get.

12.description: Good enough for late night tacos! Chicken was pulled, not filled which is annoying but the steak was cool. Tortillas are flour, which is unfortunate but the rice was really good! They have tamales which is unusual for smaller places like this. Tamales were only $1.50! I enjoyed my meal.

59.description: We eat here at least 3 times a month. It's sooooo good!!  Get the SOPES with the pork, it's the best thing ever. You can't go wrong with anything here. Just order anything with pork.

21.description: AMAZING tacos... i don't go anywhere else

17.description: I'm still going to this place after 1 year! When I'm craving tacos, burritos and any other yumminess I head straight to Tony's. Great food and friendly workers

10.description: I could eat chipotle every single day. It's great food at a great price. However, after getting the large pork burrito at Tony's I found my new favorite burrito. For 5.95 I got the best burrito I've ever had. This place is absolutely fantastic. If I lived near roscoe village I would get this multiple times a week. Don't let the fact that the exterior isn't posh fool you - this place rocks!

5.description: If I lived in this neighborhood, I would be at Tony's ALLLLLLLL of the time.  It's cheap!*$7.50 for three items + rice & beans*$5.50 for a huge plate of chips and real guacamole (not that green goo shit)*$8.00 for a tamale plate + rice & beans*$7.25 for an enchilada plate with avocado slices + rice & beansIt's tasty!Sometimes when you get cheap eats, you sacrifice flavor.  Not here!  Especially of note - their carnitas, their guacamole and their salsa verde.It's divey!Yes, the atmosphere is basically a diner.  And I love it.  It's casual, but clean.  That's all that matters.My sister lives blocks from here and came here for the first time when we were in town.  I think this is grounds to disown her.

3.description: The steak tacos are my favorite! I live in the neighborhood and come here all the time. The only thing I have tried and not liked is the tamales.

35.description: Went to this place with a bunch of friends. I lobbied for the group to get Mexican food, and one of them suggested this place. I was just going to get tacos, because many places prepare certain dishes in different manners. I decided to give them a shot on my favorite dish, chilaquiles verdes con carne. I'm certainly glad I did. The torillas were perfectly done, cheese nice & melted, and salsa was on point. The carne was pretty good, although I'm used to it being much fuller/in bigger pieces than Tony's delivered. That was my only real gripe. I'll definitely try to go here again when I'm in the area. My friends all enjoyed the meals they had as well.

19.description: Good drunk food.  My friends and boyfriend loved it.  Been here twice now, first time I got a chicken burrito.  Second time I got veggie quesadillas.  I wasn't a fan of their chicken and the quesadillas were greasy.

28.description: Great place! I order from here occasionally & I must say THEY ARE FAST! Usually they have my order ready for pick-up in about 10 minutes or less! & Sometimes my order is for 3 people & they are still that quick. It's amazing. The food also tastes great. I really like their breakfast burrito. I am not a fan of their enchiladas suiza though. I think the sauce is too spicy & for some reason to me, it tastes like a spicy BBQ sauce. Out of all of the items I have tried, so far that is the only one I am not a fan of. As for other items like: tacos, burritos, flautas, etc. I recommend trying this place if you're in the neighborhood. Prices are great too!

45.description: Well i had one of my Taco cravings again and spotted this place. I stopped for lunch just because i wanted a Taco. When i walked in, the two girls behind the counter were so deep in conversation about their "Baby Daddies" that i was ignored for about 30 seconds. One of them wanted to make sure to finish what her "Baby Daddy" did before getting to me. I mean that already pissed me off!! I was just looking at her like "REALLY LADY?!".I placed my order for two steak tacos and they came up pretty fast. As i am sitting there eating my Tacos, i remembered that one of my friends had mentioned this place a year ago. He swore up and down that this place was amazing. Well my taste buds told me "THIS PLACE DOESN'T EXCITE US ONE BIT". The Tacos were mediocre. Nothing to rave about or pass out over.

33.description: I moved to Chicago from Austin, TX, so my Mexy-food bar is pretty high.  Tony's is by no means high brow dining, but the food is solidly good.  We both ordered Chilaquiles (one order of red, one order of green) and a taco or two.  The chilaquiles were delicious and the red sauce in particular knocked my socks off.  The tacos were solid, with a good amount of filling in them.   I pass this place on my commute to work and I'm not sure that I've ever seen it closed, so that's a plus.

43.description: I love this place.  Always a great choice day or (late) night.  I typically order the steak torta meal.

2.description: Really good taqueria in Hamlin park/roscoe village. Portions are a big large, but can't say I've ever been disappointed with the quality of the food.

18.description: Best quick taco and burrito joint in the city. I lived down the street for 3 years and probably ate there 100 times. night time cooks is better than the day cooks, at least the foods a little better. you know this place is good because the line is always out the door after midnight.

41.description: Tony's has the best "drunk food" in the city. The best thing about it is that it's phenomenal when you're sober too.

52.description: For my first time at Tony's, I thought it was a decent taqueria style mom-and-pop joint. The seating inside is pretty small, but fine.
