You order at the counter and they call out orders. It was pretty quiet when we were there - although they were getting quite a few carry out orders.The food was fine. I liked my taco. It was crispy and the cheese was flavorful. I think overall the beans are kind of bland. Being that was one of the main flavor ingredients for a vegetarian taco, that is probably the basis of the food being good, but not great. The enchilada I had was also so-so. The tortilla was kind of tough and the red sauce was a bit off.If I had to try this place again, I would definitely try the burrito next time.

50.description: The food here is ok. It tastes better the later it gets. Service is quick and friendly-always. The hidden gem in this place in my opinion is the fresh cantaloupe and hibiscus juices they sell daily. SO GOOD.

4.description: I'm not really sure what the 5-star reviews are all about. The only upside is the price, I got a 2-taco dinner and only cost $5+. Other than that, subpar. Also all these people deeming this as "authentic" -- uhm....okay. And the "authentic guac" comment made me laugh! There isn't "fake guac" --how can you substitute avocados (what guac is made off) with anything else??? Steak taco (cilantro and onions): meat/marinade tasted bitter and bland. Tried salting it, but it just made it worse.Language taco (onions and cilantro): this was the lesser of two evils. At least it tasted better when I salted it.If you're drunk or tight on cash I would definitely recommend this place; if you want to satisfy the taste for good tacos...head elsewhere! Tons and TONS of students in here. Someone also mentioned "no hipsters...Spanish speaking signals good" something to that extent... There were literally no Mexicans there when I sat down for an hour -- every other race except Mexican. Hello, Of course they'd be speaking Spanish in the back; most cooks in city (no matter what cuisine/restaurant) are Mexicans; you'd hear them speak Spanish here, at a chinese place... Even at freakin ihop! You "authenticators" are hilarious.

6.description: TCustomer service has changed dramatically. They are so kind and the food is amazing. Thanks!

22.description: Yum, steak fajita burrito was delicious. Tortilla nicely toasted on the outside plus great red and green salsa...

15.description: Nothing negative to say about this place. It's my go-to jam whether late night or afternoon. Al pastor over everythang. tacoz, enchiladaz suizaz, burritos. Homies make a mean ass cheeseburger as well. They're open mega late. There's a HORCHATA FOUNTAIN...I mean i can't believe they have anything less than 5 stars, kno what i'm sayin?Anywhere you can get good food at low prices with hilarious staff AND soccer on tv is a good place.stop reading this and go. NOW.

57.description: I dig the Peppers they have out on the counter... Burritos are tasty too!

20.description: BEST TEX MEX IN CHICAGO! seriously! Born and bread Texan and this is the best place that's actually true to texmex. All they need to do is add queso to the menu and it would be a 5 star and I would be obese, but you can't deprive people of cheesy goodness that's a texmex staple.  TexMex is my favorite cuisine so it's nice to have a little flavor of home. Bonus: open late night!

36.description: Over 10 year i had been looking for a place with their food that would remind me of my root and this is the best one there is and the only one.. I have had tacos, to spicy, not spicy, meat dry, etc. but the tacos in this place are right on the spot

14.description: Affordable and tasty. Clean enough.  Nice staff and quick service.

3.description: BOYCOTT THIS STORE.Over the summer, there was a storm in Chicago and the power went out, unfortunately for these guys, the power was out for like, 4 days.  They remained open even without power and I went in to buy beers from them, they had cold beers in the basement they'd hook me up with.Well, the power came back on and a few days went by, I bought some ice cream bars and they had MELTED and REFROZEN!  They did not do anything with the products they had that'd gone bad, they just tried to trick people into buying them anyway!  I didn't say anything, i didn't want to make a scene in front of customers, a bit later i bought a 6 pack that had been warmed and cooled a few times over and just tasted awful, i had to go back this time.Well, I asked for my money back and the guy inside threw a fit, he wanted me to bring him the can i opened back at my apartment claiming "how am i supposed to sell this now?"  I had to argue with him for 5 minutes over the $5 I deserved back for that bogus spoiled beer I'd just bought and he demanded I never come back.Before that experience, I'd have given this dump 5 stars, it deserves lower than 1.  don't shop at this place, there is plenty of alternatives in and around roscoe village.

1.description: Pretty decent selection of beer and liquor, a little light on the wine selection, but for being a neighborhood corner liquor store, it's not bad. Also, for the food aspect, its more like a 7-Eleven or convenience store, not a huge selection.Prices reflect the nature of the convenience provided, so liquor prices are higher than Binny's or other larger stores. ATM inside as well. Make sure you get a receipt as all I got was my credit card receipt and couldn't see itemized total.

2.description: Great little place! If you need a btl of wine and your in the area stop by and pick up a few bottles.  Oregon pinot noir or malbec. Good selection and price.

5.description: Damen Food & Liquor is our closest local neighborhood corner store... bodega.. if that's what they called them in Chicago, which they don't. The guys there are always nice but always kidding you. Once they asked for my ID to buy beer and when I was getting it out saying "what? I'm 32!" they were like "oh no! no! you're not! put away that fake ID!" Funny guys. Cash only, but there's an ATM by the door.

6.description: While this place is a typically overpriced convenient store, the staff has never been anything but nice to me. They are a couple of very nice guys!!

7.description: I give this place a 5 for character. It is shady and weird and, some might say, an affront to the BBB. BUT, in my neighborhood there's nowhere to get my fix past 10:00.I called them recently to ask them what time they were open until and was told, "Whenever for you. 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, whenever." So I said, "What is the official time?" Answer: "We will be here." What? OK. You win. You guys are aces and probably hiding bodies somewhere.

8.description: Just when you thought a two liter of Coke couldn't be more than two dollars...

9.description: The owner yelled at me for parking in front of his store even though I live across the street. The man is nuts.

0.description: ATTENTION IMPULSE SHOPPERS:The attractively packaged ping pong balls have been moved from the shelf to the counter.  Try to stay focused on your intended purchase and hold on to your $2.49

4.description: Okay, this is the place my friends and I have deemed "the shady liquor store." Each time I go in there, that nickname is confirmed.Last night, I went in with my boyfriend a little after midnight, only to find one of the worker's kids (oh, I don't know, 10 or 11 years old?) behind the register, ready to ring us up. All I wanted to do was ask him, "Isn't it past your bedtime?"But, the reason for anything more than 1 star is the fact that it's super convenient when you've finished that bottle of wine and now you're looking for the next. But obviously no more than 2 because they're cash only. Just because they have an ATM doesn't mean it's all okay now.

3.description: When I bought my condo in Roscoe Village, I had no idea about this absolute gem of a bookstore. I don't know how I got so lucky buying a condo just blocks away from this great neighborhood bookstore but thank god, I hit the jackpot!

1.description: I was surprised a book store was popping up on this stretch of Roscoe, but I love books, so I was perfectly happy to see it.I stopped in finally and it was such a cute store!  Nicely organized, really friendly staff and a very wide selection of books including a very well appointed kids section but also cards and other fun stuff.Definitely worth a stop in!!

2.description: Great little bookstore. Impressive selection for the size, and very well curated. And they have a great story time for kids two days a week.

5.description: This is exactly what Roscoe Village (and every neighborhood in Chicago) needs.Like most independent bookstores, RoscoeBooks is welcomingly quaint and well-staffed with knowledgable and helpful book lovers. But what sets RoscoeBooks apart is the way that they somehow condense the variety of titles that you might find at a big-box bookstore into a jewel-box setting. The result is an extremely accessible, user-friendly neighborhood bookstore. They do such a good job presenting hot/new titles from such a diverse collection of genres that you can't walk 10 feet without grabbing three or four books. This is also the ideal place for gift buying because not only is the inventory incredibly diverse, but they also do a great job highlighting popular titles and providing staff recommendations.RoscoeBooks also focuses heavily on children's books, and the owner is a new mother herself who helped me pick out some gems for my nieces and nephews. Oh, they also have a HUGE selection of greeting cards (holiday, birthday, etc.)--those really hip (read: dirty) cards, not just your run of the mill Hallmark stuff--and it's always handy to have a reliable card resource nearby.Roscoe Village, you are lucky. Here's hoping that this place sticks around for years to come.

6.description: Great locale shop. Exactly what Roscoe Village needed. The staff is always friendly and attentive if you ask for a book. They can order books if they don't have one you want. The selection isn't huge as some local bookshops, but perfect enough to wander in and find something interesting.

7.description: Well organized and nice for browsing. The kids section is well stocked with classics and some fun, newer titles as well. I've had good luck picking up gifts here. Great neighborhood book store, glad to see it open and I wish it all the best - a nice addition to roscoe village.

0.description: For a small store, how did you possibly have a copy of Camus The Stranger in stock?  The Lovers Dictionary?  And how can the manager and owner stop whatever they are doing to listen to me babble about the latest book that broke my heart - and ask me about it again months later?This is the ideal neighborhood book store.

4.description: Stopped in today and enjoyed their selection.  They have a great kids area in the back and it's nice to shop local.  I think this place will find success in the neighborhood and seems to have something for everyone.

3.description: Dr. Olivo has a unique vision and has made her new location a huge success...Your whole family can come for Primary Care, women's care, pediatrics, podiatry, and even address back pain with physical medicine, and end your visit with a Hydrafacial (best skin clearing treatment ever). Dr. Olivo has a brand new Medspa wing complete with injectables, fillers, and a non-cosmetic face lift treatment that is really incredible (results are real, and it helps prevent more lines/wrinkles, while building more collagen and actually lifting and naturally sculpting the face)...plus all of the physicians are really friendly and caring.

1.description: I want to give zero star if I can. Went there on a freezing Sat morning with no meal and got a call 15min before the appointed time - 9am, telling me that the doctor I selected is not available today and we said we were ok with the substitute. But that was only the beginning. We got there at 9. After waiting for 10 min, the front desk lady informed me that their facility actually do NOT cover our insurance and she only found it out now, not when she was booking the appointment?!! Are you kidding?? After all the troubles and our morning drive and you are telling me this?

2.description: After coming here for 5 weeks now I have seen a great center for all ages. If you're an elderly or have a newborn Dr. Olivo and her team are the people for you! I have had a great family medicine experience as well as experiencing first hand how much these ladies care for their patients. Along with Dr. Olivo, Nicole her nurse practitioner, is a great care taker who is very passionate about everyone who comes under her care. I have worked with both of them and they each give their heart and soul to the people they care for. Make them your providers and you will walk away very satisfied!

5.description: If I could give them no stars, I would. This review is for their horrible customer service because I haven't actually been able to have a service there, but maybe if you can get and keep an appointment there, leave a review so everyone else can make an informed decision. I have used yelp for almost ten years, but have never really reviewed anything before because I have never been this motivated by an experience (good or bad) with a business. So here is my (long and frustrating) story:On 5/21/15, I purchased the yelp voucher that is currently being offered for $100 worth of services. I called their office that day (5/21/15) to make an appointment for a facial (specifically, a Hydrafacial, an amazing facial using special machine that isn't very common, which is why I chose this place and bought the yelp voucher) and they told me their esthetician would not be in the office for a few weeks, so I made my appointment for 6/10/15. I received a confirmation call on 6/9/15 for my appointment on 6/10/15, and then when I showed up to my appointment on 6/10/15, the person at the front desk asked my name, went to talk to someone, and then came back and told me the esthetician wasn't in the office (and she wouldn't be in for another few weeks because she had surgery, something they should have known the day before when they called me to confirm?) and that they called and left a message that morning telling me that my appointment was canceled. I did not receive any calls or messages from them that morning and I told them that, so I guess she was lied to by whoever told her that, or she lied to me. So normally I would not continue to try to give a place my business after getting such terrible customer service, but since I had that $100 yelp voucher, I needed to reschedule my appointment. Since the esthetician would again be out for another few weeks, I made an appointment for 7/10/15. Then on 6/29/15 I called to ask if the esthetician would be available on 7/2/15 instead, and was told she would be there that day so I made an appointment for 2:30pm. So I had a confirmed appointment for 7/2/15 at 2:30pm as of 6/29/15, 7/1/15 (when they called and left a message to confirm), and even today 7/2/15 (when I called at 11:35am to confirm my 2:30pm appointment, and then was asked to move it to 4pm because the esthetician wouldn't be there until then - another red flag). I even asked if the esthetician would actually be there at 4pm because she wasn't there last time I showed up for my appointment, and I was assured that the old esthetician was no longer working there and their new esthetician was very good. That being said, I moved my appointment to 4pm today (7/2/15), but because of all this shadiness, I called at 3:40pm today (7/2/15) to re-confirm that the esthetician would be there for the 4pm appointment. The women who answered the phone told me she would check and then I was put on hold for 5 minutes without anyone coming back to the phone. Then I tried calling back and was sent to voicemail twice so I left a message telling them that I would not be there for my 4pm appointment unless I heard back from them. I did not hear back from them until 4:15pm and she gave me the excuse that the esthetician had surgery and they thought she would be in the office, but she's not (even though earlier today I was assured that there was a new esthetician and the other one was no longer there - another lie I guess?) and they wanted me to reschedule. I told them that this was not acceptable, that I've been given the run-around for over a month and that I wanted to cancel my appointment, not reschedule, and that I would be leaving them bad reviews and getting my money back for my yelp voucher (which hopefully yelp comes through and gives me a refund). So long story short, I don't know what is going on over there but buyer seriously beware!

0.description: So I've been hearing a lot lately about this Hydra Facial and I decided to give it a try at Olivo Medical Spa. I used the Mind Body Connect app to book my appointment with Michelina and it was very user friendly and convenient.  I arrived 15 minutes early for my appointment so I was able to check out their beautiful space.  The treatment room I was in was very modern, while comfortable and relaxing.  Michelina was very thorough in her treatment and made sure I had a good understanding of what to expect.  I am loving all of the products that she recommended I use at home.  I will definitely be back for another Hydra Facial and to try other treatments they offer.

4.description: Dr Olivo was a nice choice for a low income situation. She is sweet, knowledgable, and helpful. Her office customer service, however, is LACKING. I called over 6 times last Sat to get an answer and kept getting the same quick response from Stephanie "the doctor will get to it". I wasn't looking for a cold medicine refill, I was looking for an insulin prescription which keeps me alive. I understand if the doctor couldn't fill it for me (I hadn't been in in quite a few months) but Stephanie knew how important it was for me, the least she could have done was call me back and told me they couldn't do it until I came in before CLOSING FOR THE WEEKEND! I am shaking posting this, I do NOT enjoy negativity but this was such an incredibly inconsiderate thing to do to one of your patients.

58.description: Great Food for a great price.  I had the Hawaiian burger and it was excellent!  I had a hard time making up my mind on what to get because it all sounds good.  The fries a just okay.  The place was packed on a Tuesday for lunch because there are a lot of high school kids there getting a bit to eat.  If you don't mind that I highly recommend checking this place out.

56.description: I like this place to take the kids for lunch on the weekends. The folks there are super friendly and are constantly working the room to see if you need anything. Every visit a Mgr stops by to see how everything is. They always seem happy too.Burgerwise, my kids and husband tell me the burgers are great and not too heavy. I go for chicken and the sandwiches are pretty tasty. Great addition to Roscoe Village .

29.description: That was disgusting. So greasy and not much flavor. Fries are decent. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.I should mention that the staff was friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere clean and welcoming.  My only complaint is the burgers...at a burger chain.

42.description: Ordered the ranch burger it was delicious!  Service was fast and staff was super friendly! I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

23.description: Awesome food!! Although this is primarily a burger place they do also have some very delicious juicy chicken sandwiches

47.description: My friend and I were at babies r us buying baby shower gifts and wanted something to eat. I didn't know there was a Meatheads in the same plaza and told my friend we should try it. I've heard very good things about this place. I ordered the Cajun surprise and Cajun seasoned fries. My friend ordered the patty melt. Mine was so delicious, I've always wanted to try a burger with a fried egg, and I liked it. My friend really liked her patty melt. The service was outstanding. They bring the food to your table. You can customize your own burger or choose one from a list. They have like 5 or 6 to choose from. I would go there again and try the Texas burger (forgot the exact name). I highly recommend Meatheads.

8.description: Delicious burgers! The staff was very helpful in suggesting food items! Can't wait to come back and try something different.

31.description: I'm going to write another review and will continue till I'm Blue. Right now I'm so full that I'm barely able to type anything. With that being said, Nicole was on the pos today and knew our order before we even walked in the door. How do you ask, she is usually cooking our food to know our order without even ringing in the order is basically amazing! Steph looking over everything and Anthony rocking out the grill... And those jalapeños! Yum! If you haven't had fried jalapeños you are missing out. Come and Anthony will hook it up! Today after a long day of work, this is exactly what I needed and will miss it when I go on vacation. Thank you for giving me the customer experience as a feeling home! I love this family!

34.description: My review is base on just one visit so I'll need a few more visits to have a more solid review. That's been said and based on my first visit here are the verdict:Customer service: Great. The manager addressed my questions regarding the menu and followed up with me while I was eating.Food: delish and based on their moto and values statement is Angus beef, grass fed Midwestern origin so it have to be good. In fact it was fresh and I can taste the freshness. Simple menu based on fresh unpretentious food, but very good. Sometimes simple is better. Will come back definitively.

16.description: That was disgusting. So greasy and not much flavor. Fries are decent. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.I should mention that the staff was friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere clean and welcoming.  My only complaint is the burgers...at a burger chain.

13.description: Meatheads is the best place to eat in the area where I work.  The burgers are flavorful and always served piping hot.  The chicken is good, if the portions somewhat smaller than I would prefer.  The salad is surprisingly good, and compliments a sandwich quite nicely.Free water is available (a nice option when spending the money on a fountain drink isn't prudent).Other than when it is beset by the local high schoolers, the place is a dream to frequent.

11.description: Well this is one of my uncle's favorite burger joints and he happen to take me there for lunch today. I had their chicken sandwich and a order of french fries. They both tasted very delicious! I haven't had a good chicken sandwich since I left New York City and I think this spot is it. I will be back to try their burgers and maybe a chocolate shake. I will definitely recommend them to my family members when they visit me over the summer.

39.description: I think this is one of my favorite places in Chicago. The food is fresh and the service is amazing. The manager is always walking around or bringing food out and checking on his customers. Being from California, I always hear people complaining about how they miss In-N-Out (which I think is lame, but whatever). I always explain this place as an In-N-Out meets Five Guys. The fries are fresh cut and on the skinny side, and there is a large selection of free toppings that you can add to your burger. I wish it was just a little cheaper, but it normally comes out to about the same as going to a chain sit down restaurant, but MUCH better! SO worth it!

37.description: Disappointing. I had the Californian, it's over priced, bland, and the patties were really thin. With so many good burger places and with the price being 7.50 for JUST the burger I would recommend another burger joint. I won't be back.

0.description: The service here is great. Nicole is the best person at this location. My boss and I come there all the time. We work across the street at Chamberlain college. Scott is very nice as well. But the level of customer service Nicole provide is amazing.Latoya

38.description: My first time in a meatheads, and I am very impressed. Not just by the food, which was quick and exactly to order. But I was extremely happy with the service we relieved. From the cashier helping us through our orders, another member of the staff running our food out and checking up on is 2 times. Removing our trash when we were finished. And the manager coming to check on us which you would only expect from a higher end restaurant. Very impressed that they give back to the community as well. We will be coming back here for sure.

51.description: Wow  I had never had a burger that tasted this good, greasy, and cooked to perfection I mean well-done. For me the French fries in a pie pan also your hamburger comes on a Kraft paper like in a pie pan. How clever now I know what to do with my old pie pans from Baker's Square. Serve lunch in them.   These fries are homecut,fried . The burger  I tried for my first visit was the Texas Ranch- instead of raw onions mine were grilled onion's ,lettuce,tomato,cheddar cheese, ranch dressing. & a pickle. The COOLEST pop machine  that looks like a juke box . I had Vanilla Ginger Ale Pop. How cool is that. I would go back again to try there other burgers & more. We went there on 3-3-14 at 6:00 PM.

27.description: Well let's just say this was amazing . I was sitting in my bathroom thinking hmmm what would make my year. Well It Poped in my HEAD let me get something so mouth watering that it brings a tear to your eyes. I hope on my Flinstones bicycle and put on my jean shorts and my HE -MAN jacket and pedaled right over to this kingdom of goodness ,But I first took a deep breath and said THANK YOU JESUS I am at my Kingdom of food. I walked inside and the staff was so nice they said " How can we help you Buddy I was amazed I made a friend. Well then I put my order in and I said give me Burger so JUICY it will make me write a letter to all my friends. My burger came and WOW did it have the FLAVOR explosion that I have been looking for all these years. I Had to take 2 breaks from eating it cause the food was so OUT OF THIS WORLD YUMMY.

32.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Very clean, incredibly helpful and friendly staff, simple menu, nice layout, easy parking, and the food was very good. It's not the best tasting or most creative burger in the world, but that's not what it's aiming for. It's just all-around really solid food if you're craving a cheeseburger (which is pretty much every other day for me) but you don't want either fast-food or a bar. I also like that it was very family-friendly, there were a lot of kids there. I'll be back.

54.description: On my most recent visit I think this place moves ahead of Smashburger on the strength of the blue cheese sauce.  Just excellent burger and fries.

48.description: My first visit to Meatheads was a pretty good one.  I visited here because I was attemping to visit Hot Doug's at lunchtime (bad plan) and saw the line down the block and around the corner.  Therefore, I had to think fast (my dad was hungry and I had promised him lunch).  I remembered that there was a Meatheads nearby and we headed directly there.  I was happy to see that they had other options besides burgers, but I forgot that they were similar to Five Guys in the fact that they had HUGE double pattie burgers.  Oops!  I ordered a burger and fries for my dad and a grilled chicken sandwich for me.I waited at a small counter for the food and it came relatively quickly.  They also came over with a tray of ketchup, mayo and mustard for me to choose in case I needed more condiments (nice touch) since the food was a to-go order.I have to say that the food was tasty and fresh (though, I will say that the buns got pretty soggy quickly - perhaps since everything was so juicy - but on the chicken??).  The regular order or fries was too much for both of us, but they were nicely cooked with the right amount of soft inside and crunchy outside.  I also had a side of buffalo ranch which was delicious (not sure it's worth an extra 75 cents, but had to try it).All in all, it was a good visit.  I'm not sure it's quite as good as it's counterparts, but it is fast.  Extra points to the t-shirts that say 'girls can be meatheads, too'.  One thing that did slightly annoy me was that the girl ordering ahead of me clearly knew the cashier and they were just chatting while a line formed.  I think they could have taken this off-line so as to help the line move a bit quicker.  I am not one to say that talking isn't allowed, but it was the middle of a busy lunch hour and probably not the best time for that.

44.description: Ordered a cheeseburger with avocado, jalapeño, and giardiniera on it.  Out of all the restaurants that I have ever been to, Meatheads is the most generous with avocado portions.  Meatheads slathered on at least 4 thick slices of avocado- and that made my cheeseburger a 9 out of 10 (one cannot order a hamburger rare at this location.)The french fry portions are large, they have jalapeño-ketchup, and hot sauce.  These additions help the french fries immensely.  Its not that the french fries are bad, but they do need a little nudge in the right direction.  Recommended: cheeseburger with many toppings.

24.description: The food here is so fresh. I order from here quite often and never had a mess up on the order. The customer service is great and you can customize everything. I found my perfect customized burger, but I did concoct a doozy once. I highly recommend the salad and burgers. The 1/3 burger is thin, but perfect for me since I don't need a huge patty.

7.description: Hard to beat for fast good food. Better than gettin E. Coli at the establishment next door. It's clean, the burgers are good for fast food, and they have real fries. They also support local schools, which is one of the main reasons I go here when I'm too tired to cook at home.

49.description: I would give this place 5 stars for the service alone! Everyone who works there is so friendly, and the manager walks around all the time checking on tables. The shop is extremely clean and modern, and the high-tech soda fountain is awesome. There is no blaring metal like at that biker burger bar down the road and the burgers aren't going to cost you $12+, so if quiet conversation is what you're into while you're eating, this is a good place for it. The Californian is a favorite and the Cajun fries are must-haves. Being city-dwellers with no yard for grilling, we love that Meatheads is so close for when we want great burgers any time of the year.

40.description: Double loyalty points on Mondays

53.description: Took my kids there the other night and was upset we had not come before! The fact that they have a coke freestyle machine made my kids love it even more. The fries were a huge order, so I said, good thing we didn't order more than one. The server said, I wouldn't have let you order a second. Love that honesty and the fries were crispy and yummy. The hamburgers were delicious, but the name definitely made us wonder exactly what was on the menu. You can also get a hot dog, chicken and salads, so maybe it should have their tagline, more than just hamburgers! We'll be back.

30.description: Retried the sesoned fries, and they finally got it right! Of course, I could not go for only fries. Up to date, I have tried all their specialty burgers and dream about them every now and then. I am sooooo lucky to be five minutes away, YAYYYYY!

46.description: Meatheads has some of the best chicken fingers/tenders in town. Seriously, I consider myself to be an expert in the chicken finger area. This is very fortunate for me, because when it comes to burgers here, I always panic at all the different options and combinations I could make that I usually end up ordering one of the chef-inspired burger. That, or my brain would probably explode. The chef-inspired burgers are excellent though, and one day I will take an hour before I come here and plan to make my own creation, and it will be gloriously meaty and messy. This girl likes her toppings.And then, wash all of that cow and/or chicken down with some fresh freestylin' Diet Orange Coke from their machine (trust me, it's so bubbly and refreshing and delicious), and treat yourself to a milkshake too. The seasonal banana split I had last week was ridiculous. On top of all this (I know, right?), the staff are usually walking around and checking up to see how you're doing. Everyone has been very courteous and friendly. It's pretty rare to see this kind of attentive service at a quick-serve restaurant. And I kind of dig it - makes me feel like a chicken finger huffing princess.

1.description: It's not just the great food they have here, but the customer service is above excellent! I love great customer service. It just makes your day! And this guy we had today was the nicest ever, and signed us up for points too. Just a small incentive for fries and such, but it's just nice to hear people explain everything and help you to your benefit, not their own. And the eggnog milkshake, OMG. To die for. And of course I asked the guy if it was good and he gave me an honest answer that it was good, but instead he had it made while we were waiting for our food and told me to try it and if I don't like it I could change it!? Wow, that really brings the level of standard much higher for restaurants of any kind! they take their motto very strong, and you can tell its sincere- thoughtful food for caring people :)

55.description: As you may have already ascertained from other reviews, it's kind of its own take on Five Guys. You order as you walk in, take a number and then go have a seat. The burgers are large and you can get just about any topping (within reason) added for no extra charge.        Lets be honest its pretty easy to get a good burger quickly and on the cheap, in this fair city. However, Meatheads (at least at this locations) does a good job paying attention to the details that make a difference in the competitive semi fast food environment.        Firstly, the employees up front are very upbeat which is refreshing. A lot of time when you go to fast food places the employees seem somewhere between indifferent and border line suicidal, not the case with Meatheads. Also, the manager always comes around and checks on you. I've never had any issue, but I get the feeling if I did, he would fix it and not have me fill out a complaint card or something. Lastly, despite the fact that there are a lot of kids here, the room is open enough, that a loud or crying child probably won't drive you crazy. Meathead is an excellent burger option or a good selection for a relatively inexpensive family meal.

9.description: Five Guys on steroids...good  variety of food...milk shakes are delicious...chilli cheese fries were ok not the best but if you have a craving it will do.

26.description: This was my first visit to meatheads and I gotta say, they are way better than 5 guys. They have a similar menu, but a little more to choose from. I got a 1/3 lb burger with American cheese, bacon, mayo and avocado slices. The overall taste of the burger was very delicious. I didn't want it to end! The fries are a million times better than 5 guys too. They aren't soggy or borderline burnt. They are very flavorful and crispy on the outside. I saw that they also have vanilla or chocolate shakes on the menu. I was too full to try that this time, but I would love to try one next time. The kids menu is great. A lot to choose from and the toy that comes with the meal is pretty cool. The cashier made sure other staff had our table ready, clean and with a high chair set up for our toddler.  All of the staff is very friendly and considerate. This is my new go to burger place.

25.description: It's a regional chain; I can see their footprints in the city of Chicago, Chicagoland, some other parts of Illinois, and even northern Indiana.  Rosa J. normally tries to refrain from going to a national or regional chain because she strongly upholds her "dine local, shop local" philosophy everyday of her life.  Nevertheless, she has noticed some great yelp reviews on many Meatheads locations and could not resist herself but to check it out what all that rave was about.  I chose the location that is most convenient to where I work, in terms of public transportation.  Thus, the Roscoe Village location was selected for this study (sorry, don't want sound scientific, but couldn't help it with seven (7) years of science/criminal justice background on my belt).  The service was very friendly, for a fast-food restaurant standard.  I had the Cajun sunrise burger, a regular-order of Cajun fries, and a fountain drink.  Did I mention that they have the Coca-cola free-style pop machines?  Yes, they do!  They seem to have free wifi as well, even though it was a bit slow.  But come on!  You're at a burger place, so please concentrate on eating your burger, children.  The Cajun sunrise burger wasn't disappointing, but it wasn't that amazing like other yelpers have described in their reviews and pictures.  They have a fried egg (my absolute favorite topping in a burger), bacons, tomatoes, lettuce, and jalapeños.  Honestly, the three (3) bold-flavored toppings: fried egg, bacons and jalapeños make the entire burger lose the "focus."  For some reason, I just couldn't taste the uniqueness of a gourmet burger and didn't have a wow-factor.  My only suggestion is that if they fried the egg to be done as "over-easy," it would help to hold the "burger" together instead becoming crumbly after a few bites.  On the other hand, the Cajun fries were quite delicious.  The portion was generously large, and the seasoning was also on point.  There were two (2) special unit CPD officers onsite and having a burger date with me.  I felt safe!  By the way, pay attention to where police officers are going to eat and follow along (DO NOT STALK THEM THOUGH...let them do what they are supposed to do).  They knew the local restaurants, and some are real foodies.  Anyways, I still like this place and try something else next time.

12.description: This was the beginning of "BurgerQuest Chicago 2015" where I try all sorts of burger places from upscale to counter service - but no national chains - and since I'm by here all the time shopping at Mariano's, I made it Stop #1.First off, it's a regional counter service place. Knowing that, I wasn't expecting anything gourmet. The menu states that the meat is "Certified Angus," some of their topping choices were interesting and when I read "Cajun Fries," I was sold on going. I should have eaten someplace else.It's VERY clean in there and they have the absolute coolest fountain drink system, but they seriously abused that poor Angus beef. I ordered mine with grilled mushrooms and Swiss cheese - my "standard." I had to stop eating halfway into it - it was rather bland and the greasiness was SO overwhelming. I like to chew my burger - this was nearly "chewing optional," that's how greasy it was. The fries were decent, but if you go, just get the plain. This is the 3rd place I've been to in Chicago that has "Cajun fries," and I'm starting to think no one knows what Cajun means here. All they seem to do is just sprinkle cayenne pepper on fries. Cajun has a complex medley of flavors, not just one note. When I stood up to leave, I felt it hit my system so hard, I ended up only "renting" my lunch.Overall, it's just too expensive for what it tastes like: a glorified McDonald's. I'd only go back to play with their fountain drink system all... day... long. It's the PlayStation of drink systems!A similar small-chain burger place with the same values of locally sourced, mindful food is Epic Burger - go there instead and for about the same price.

59.description: Decent prices for great burgers. Fries taste fresh and not over seasoned. They have different types of specialty burgers that I have not tried yet but will eventually. I usually get the 1/3 lb burger and choose my own toppings. There's a set list of "included"/free toppings and a list of toppings for $1 each like avocado, fried egg, etc.I would compare this to Five Guys but better and cheaper!

21.description: This was the beginning of "BurgerQuest Chicago 2015" where I try all sorts of burger places from upscale to counter service - but no national chains - and since I'm by here all the time shopping at Mariano's, I made it Stop #1.First off, it's a regional counter service place. Knowing that, I wasn't expecting anything gourmet. The menu states that the meat is "Certified Angus," some of their topping choices were interesting and when I read "Cajun Fries," I was sold on going. I should have eaten someplace else.It's VERY clean in there and they have the absolute coolest fountain drink system, but they seriously abused that poor Angus beef. I ordered mine with grilled mushrooms and Swiss cheese - my "standard." I had to stop eating halfway into it - it was rather bland and the greasiness was SO overwhelming. I like to chew my burger - this was nearly "chewing optional," that's how greasy it was. The fries were decent, but if you go, just get the plain. This is the 3rd place I've been to in Chicago that has "Cajun fries," and I'm starting to think no one knows what Cajun means here. All they seem to do is just sprinkle cayenne pepper on fries. Cajun has a complex medley of flavors, not just one note. When I stood up to leave, I felt it hit my system so hard, I ended up only "renting" my lunch.Overall, it's just too expensive for what it tastes like: a glorified McDonald's. I'd only go back to play with their fountain drink system all... day... long. It's the PlayStation of drink systems!A similar small-chain burger place with the same values of locally sourced, mindful food is Epic Burger - go there instead and for about the same price.

17.description: Wow really expensive for what you get. Should be called Bigbuns instead, not enough meat for me. I can get a better burger at Hardee's Meh.Fries are just okay.

10.description: The restaurant is always clean... Service is fast and friendly. And their burgers are awesomely tasty, and delicious!

5.description: Since I went to Meatheads for the first time about 1.5 months ago, I'm happy to say I've returned several times since.As you may expect, Meatheads does something extremely well:  meat! I've had everything from the beef to the chicken to the hot dog and have rarely been disappointed. The menu at Meatheads is similar to the menu at FiveGuys where you customize what you want on your burger but the difference (to me at least) is the ingredients used are of a higher quality. There isn't much more I can say of the fried chicken sandwich besides that it is my go-to place for a fast casual food. Finally, the "New-England" style hot dog isn't for everyone; while it does taste pretty good, I'm going to stick with my Chicago Style Vienna Beef dogs.Severely underrated are the fries, more specifically the fries with the Cajun seasoning. There are enough in one order to be split between two people and the Cajun seasoning adds a nice kick to what is already a great fry.

3.description: it's a nice burger place . I got the fried chicken burger and fries . They give you a lot of fries ! The  chicken burger was very good and the chicken was real chicken . One of the nicest customer services .

35.description: Went here randomly while in the area - will definitely be back.Burger: A+All the fixins you need, great quality beef, excellent bread, and fresh. Fries: BThe Cajun fries aren't really spicy at all, just seasoned.  Not bad, not amazing.Shake: BAlthough it says hand dipped, the taste reminded me more of McDonalds, and Stake N'Shake puts together a much better milkshake.Kids Meal: CThe $5.50 kids hot dog meal comes with a foot-long dog - great taste but x3 more than my kid could ever eat.  It's also $1 more to get milk instead of pop, so by the end I looked at the bill and my 3-year-olds meal was the same cost as mine.So overall- great burgers and hot dogs.  I'd pass on the shakes, and pricing adds up fast.

19.description: Congratulations to the whole Meathead crew! My family thinks they have the best burger in Chicago!  The fries are freshly made!  They also have 2 cool design your own Coke machines! The place is immaculately clean!! The menus easy to understand and they are also big supporters of local kids sports teams. I applaud the ownership for whatever they're doing for training! They are fast fresh food with great service!  They are also very family friendly! Another tip try the chicken strips!

28.description: Wow really expensive for what you get. Should be called Bigbuns instead, not enough meat for me. I can get a better burger at Hardee's Meh.Fries are just okay.

45.description: I was not impressed with this place. The half pound burger was not one thick juice burger, it was three thinner pieces of meat on one bun. For 2 burgers, 2 fries, and 2 medium cokes it was $25.00. To me it is just an over priced steak and shake. I will say it was clean restaurant and friendly staff, but was disappointed with the burger being 3 pieces.

33.description: I can't believe this is the first time I've reviewed Meatheads.  I love this place.  It is a total trip down memory lane with the 80s and 90s music playing in the background and feels like one of those safe places I used to go to with friends in middle and high school.  The food is really good and fresh - the Cajun fries are addicting and I have no discipline when it comes to them.  Even the hot dog my son orders from the kids menu looks delicious and gives me food envy.  Meatheads is so family friendly - they will even split a shake for my kids!  The actual restaurant is super clean and the staff is always very friendly and welcoming.  Whoever runs this place is awesome and knows how to treat customers and it seems like manages a happy staff.  I also love that Meatheads really does support the community - they do a summer reading challenge for Audubon and I was happy to see them at the Jahn Pumpkin Patch this year.  We are repeat customers many times over and will continue to dine at Meatheads!

43.description: As a student of Lane, this place is a gem and is perfect for those days where you have an activity after school and you need a good meal to hold you over. This place is perfect to grab a bite to eat with friends. It is clean, great service, and great food. I LOVE their fries, very generous servings and good meat. Good prices for what you receive.

2.description: Meathead  service is great, from the attendant at register to food service and excellent service, the shakes are awesomely delicious , burguers and chicken sandwiches are excellent, better than any in the area of Chicago.

18.description: My first visit to Meatheads was a pretty good one.  I visited here because I was attemping to visit Hot Doug's at lunchtime (bad plan) and saw the line down the block and around the corner.  Therefore, I had to think fast (my dad was hungry and I had promised him lunch).  I remembered that there was a Meatheads nearby and we headed directly there.  I was happy to see that they had other options besides burgers, but I forgot that they were similar to Five Guys in the fact that they had HUGE double pattie burgers.  Oops!  I ordered a burger and fries for my dad and a grilled chicken sandwich for me.I waited at a small counter for the food and it came relatively quickly.  They also came over with a tray of ketchup, mayo and mustard for me to choose in case I needed more condiments (nice touch) since the food was a to-go order.I have to say that the food was tasty and fresh (though, I will say that the buns got pretty soggy quickly - perhaps since everything was so juicy - but on the chicken??).  The regular order or fries was too much for both of us, but they were nicely cooked with the right amount of soft inside and crunchy outside.  I also had a side of buffalo ranch which was delicious (not sure it's worth an extra 75 cents, but had to try it).All in all, it was a good visit.  I'm not sure it's quite as good as it's counterparts, but it is fast.  Extra points to the t-shirts that say 'girls can be meatheads, too'.  One thing that did slightly annoy me was that the girl ordering ahead of me clearly knew the cashier and they were just chatting while a line formed.  I think they could have taken this off-line so as to help the line move a bit quicker.  I am not one to say that talking isn't allowed, but it was the middle of a busy lunch hour and probably not the best time for that.

41.description: I love coming here! My order was only messed up once, I was given the wrong to go order. When I called to speak to the manager he apologized and it was veey nice. It was a sunday I understood,  he asked for my address and sent me a giftcard! It was nice and we will keep coming again and again.

52.description: A step up from fast food and an economical place to bring kids. A good value with clean facilities and free re frills on drinks.

50.description: My third visit in 5 days!  This place is fresh and delicious.  The burgers are so good.  The fries, fantastic!   The staff is so friendly and helpful.  Nothing but smiles at this Meatheads.  Thanks again Meatheads for another awesome visit.

4.description: It's a regional chain; I can see their footprints in the city of Chicago, Chicagoland, some other parts of Illinois, and even northern Indiana.  Rosa J. normally tries to refrain from going to a national or regional chain because she strongly upholds her "dine local, shop local" philosophy everyday of her life.  Nevertheless, she has noticed some great yelp reviews on many Meatheads locations and could not resist herself but to check it out what all that rave was about.  I chose the location that is most convenient to where I work, in terms of public transportation.  Thus, the Roscoe Village location was selected for this study (sorry, don't want sound scientific, but couldn't help it with seven (7) years of science/criminal justice background on my belt).  The service was very friendly, for a fast-food restaurant standard.  I had the Cajun sunrise burger, a regular-order of Cajun fries, and a fountain drink.  Did I mention that they have the Coca-cola free-style pop machines?  Yes, they do!  They seem to have free wifi as well, even though it was a bit slow.  But come on!  You're at a burger place, so please concentrate on eating your burger, children.  The Cajun sunrise burger wasn't disappointing, but it wasn't that amazing like other yelpers have described in their reviews and pictures.  They have a fried egg (my absolute favorite topping in a burger), bacons, tomatoes, lettuce, and jalapeños.  Honestly, the three (3) bold-flavored toppings: fried egg, bacons and jalapeños make the entire burger lose the "focus."  For some reason, I just couldn't taste the uniqueness of a gourmet burger and didn't have a wow-factor.  My only suggestion is that if they fried the egg to be done as "over-easy," it would help to hold the "burger" together instead becoming crumbly after a few bites.  On the other hand, the Cajun fries were quite delicious.  The portion was generously large, and the seasoning was also on point.  There were two (2) special unit CPD officers onsite and having a burger date with me.  I felt safe!  By the way, pay attention to where police officers are going to eat and follow along (DO NOT STALK THEM THOUGH...let them do what they are supposed to do).  They knew the local restaurants, and some are real foodies.  Anyways, I still like this place and try something else next time.

6.description: Gave meatheads a second try today- perhaps I ordered the wrong thing the first time. Liked it a lot more today! I had the Cajun burger, and a side of Cajun fries. Definitely more flavor with this! Loved the egg and jalapeño on the burger, and just the right amount of seasoning on the fries. You can tell the meat is good quality here. Service is good too- friendly and quick. Will be back.

22.description: So, for two straight days, I've made the trip to MeatHeads. It's super close to where I'm working this week and it offers me a chance to take a walk at lunch time. Now, the food: Yesterday, I tried the Texas Ranch Burger and the Tenders. Both were pretty good. You can definitely tell that their meat is fresh. The Tenders were also great. Today, I wanted to see about the fish. (Fish Fridays). The fish and chips were really good. The fries were amazing too. There's a guy here. He has this long hair and he's amazingly funny. Seems like he loves his job a lot. I look forward to running into him the next time I'm here. With all that being said, check this place out. Great food.

15.description: Ordered a cheeseburger with avocado, jalapeño, and giardiniera on it.  Out of all the restaurants that I have ever been to, Meatheads is the most generous with avocado portions.  Meatheads slathered on at least 4 thick slices of avocado- and that made my cheeseburger a 9 out of 10 (one cannot order a hamburger rare at this location.)The french fry portions are large, they have jalapeño-ketchup, and hot sauce.  These additions help the french fries immensely.  Its not that the french fries are bad, but they do need a little nudge in the right direction.  Recommended: cheeseburger with many toppings.

57.description: The bun wasn't up to the challenge. Toppings slid out and the bun tasted under done.Really well decorated and great concept. I just found the burger itself to be whatevs.

20.description: Gave meatheads a second try today- perhaps I ordered the wrong thing the first time. Liked it a lot more today! I had the Cajun burger, and a side of Cajun fries. Definitely more flavor with this! Loved the egg and jalapeño on the burger, and just the right amount of seasoning on the fries. You can tell the meat is good quality here. Service is good too- friendly and quick. Will be back.

36.description: The food here is so good, and the prices are very reasonable. The staff here is wonderful and are always so friendly.  Everyone that works here is so attentive and make such a nice atmosphere. I've always had very positive experiences here. I definitely recommend this place!

14.description: Been to this location many times and always have an amazing experience! Nicole always makes our experience fantastic, she's always friendly and accommodating. I'm usually there with kids and she makes it much less hectic by helping out with whatever we may need!

58.description: Hair Party is fantastic! Super cute and super clean! Michelle Tucker (formerly of Salon Bombshell and Robert Jeffrey) and Tiffany (formerly of Robert Jeffrey) work here. Both are fantastic stylists and colorists. Every time I leave my hair looks amazing! Michelle and Tiffany always remember clients names and more importantly they give you what you want. I've never had a color or cut forced on me. You will not be disappointed!

56.description: I've been going to Michele Tucker since the beginning and have had amazing hair for 8 years. I've done pretty much every color/hair style under the sun and Michele make it look awesome every single time. It's so great to pop into her chair (especially in the lovely new space that's all her own!) and give her a tiny notion of an idea and let her do as she pleases. Whatever voodoo she does to my head always gets the best compliments! And the compliments keep coming, even if I haven't gone in awhile. Michele is a master at her craft. Her haircuts look fabulous right after they're done as well as many as 3 months later! She cuts it so they always look good, despite growing out.It's really wonderful to see how Michele & Fanny (Tiffany Foster, formerly of K. Paige salon & Robert Jeffrey) work together. They are perfect partners to collaborate on your head!It's rare to find a place that does both excellent cuts AND gorgeous color. If you want subtle & natural looking OR fire engine red (or Barney purple for that matter!) & funky, this is it. She doesn't normally stock the crazy colors but you can go pick up a bottle of Special Effects from The Alley on Clark and she will give a most masterful application. Whether you want a few chunks of a sassy color or your whole head flaming pink, these are the girls to go to!Really: just go here. It will be the best-looking decision your ever did make.

29.description: Hair Party is definitely the most relaxed salon in the city.  There is no pretention, no upselling, no ridiculous product pitchers, just quality haircuts.  Eleanor has cut my hair for the last 5 years.  She does an absolutely FANTASTIC job.  I have had various things done to my hair from a basic trim to color & highlights to a keratin treatment.  Eleanor has a tremendous amount of talent, and my haircut always looks terrific.  The best part is she cuts hair so it retains its shape for WEEKS.  Literally, I have been busy/ traveling/ etc and gone almost 5 months without a haircut, and it still looked pretty good.  Eleanor is also fantastic to talk to, and she is such a great person. Her terrific personality works great too because she will be honest with me when I want to do something.  She will tell me how it will actually look with my hair type.  I don't end up with some crazy cut that requires a live-in stylist to maintain.  She does all of this in a super tactful and nice way though.  She isn't yelling at you that your hair can't handle that cut, she's just being honest.  I have recently recruited two of my friends to try Eleanor.  They both love her too!  Eleanor and Hair Party will be cutting my hair for YEARS to come.

42.description: Eleanor is a super star: dynamite stylist *and* lovely person.  She listens to what I want, but makes suggestions about what might work better.  She's always right!  At least six girlfriends with really different types of hair (long, short, curly, straight, coarse, etc.) go to Elanor, and they all look terrific.  It's because she really knows what to do with all types of hair.  As for the salon itself?  It's cool, but there's no snotty attitude.  Just good music, current magazines, nice selection of beverages & candy, and as much or as little conversation as you want.

23.description: Have u seen how cute i look today?? Seriously, i do! And as hot as my mom is, it really is because of the awesome cut i received from jade and the fab color from tiffany!! These girls rock at what they do- and for that i am thankful!!!

47.description: I've been going to Michelle for at least 6 years now.  Have followed her from salon to salon.  Was super excited when she decided to open up her own place.  She is absolutely awesome with color and knows how to help you figure out what cut works best with you and how to achieve a look you want.  Michelle's other sytlists, Tiffany, in particular, are also really great!  You can't go wrong picking this salon.

8.description: Love Eleanor.   She is the sweetest person and always styles my hair perfectly.  She has cut my hair for 10 years!!!

31.description: I've been seeing Michele for haircuts and color since 2004. An honestly, I just let her do what she wants with my hair, because she's that good and I trust her that much. In fact, I moved to Los Angeles last year, but I still insist on seeing her for my salon visits. She's great with long, curly hair like mine, as well as short-hair cuts. I hear she does a lot of wedding styles, too. And she's just an all-around great lady to talk to, while she performs her feats of hair prowess. I'm not sure if Michele's taking on new clients, but nab a spot in her schedule if you can get it!

34.description: Indeed as good as it gets. I am a baby boomer, but still a free spirit, fashion foward, and eternally young at heart. Michelle, who is the owner , never tried to give me an old lady hair cut. she understands that being older doesn't mean being ready for the rocking chair. more like ready for rocking. :) and...she is the best hairdresser I've ever had in decades of living. and talk of nice...I love going there. Michelle is a gem: a smart ,savy and very kind business woman. the other sytlists are always nice and welcoming too. I look like a million bucks when I walk out of there--which shows how old I am! a million bucks use to mean something back in the day. again :)cheryl

16.description: I don't usually write yelp reviews, but Stacy did an awesome job on my hair. I had been going to the same place for years and decided to give Stacy a shot based on a friend's recommendation...and also on the fact that I hadn't tried anything new with my hair for over a decade. PS - I have pretty standard brown hair, it gets some big curls/frizz when I let it grow out and is starting to thin a bit, but overall, I think it's normal dude's hair as far as I can tell.Back to the review...I was there a little early and she was ready for me - no wait. Once I got in the chair, we spent some time discussing different directions we could take my hair in and finally I just told her to do whatever she thought would look best...and I'm glad I did.After a relaxing wash (I heart head massage), she gave me a totally new look and everyone, including me, loves it. She obeyed my few rules: must be low maintenance; must be able to go a while without being cut (that is, look good once it starts to grow out so my cheap ass doesn't have to pay for another haircut until I absolutely have to); and must be fun/different.  Her chair-side manner was top notch - very friendly/chill. We spent half the time talking and the other half silent, which is to say, she goes off your lead, which is nice, b/c sometimes I just like to shut up and enjoy my haircut. Anyway, the place itself is clean with good natural light. Definitely function focused though, which is fine, b/c I rather pay for a good haircut than for some expensive fancy-pants crap on a pedestal.Long story short - I'll be back.

13.description: Jennee is amazing! I went in with very long, thick hair, that was bulky and in need of a style. I wanted to keep it long while adding lots of layers and movement. Jennee gave me the perfect cut that I have been looking for!! Stylists always give me a few long layers that disappear and my hair ends up back in a pony tail. Not this time! My hair still has the length but with lots of layers and movement. It feels much lighter and will be perfect for summer! I am in love with my new style! Jennee is also great at up-do's and has done several different styles with my hair. She is great at braids, romantic sweepy up-do's and sleeker styles. She is talented, creative, and attentive! She is highly recommended!!!

11.description: Melissa was awesome.  First, she made sure that I didn't get a parking ticket and waited patiently for me to move my car.  Then, she really took her time to make sure I had the perfect cut.  I've never had anyone cut my bangs so expertly.  Reasonably priced, too.  I will come back again and again!

39.description: I went to see Eleanor for the first time for a cut and color.  The cut is perfect.  I have unfortunately thin hair, but she managed to put in great layers to make it look much fuller than it is.  I chose the color to put in my hair, but the next day I didn't like it at all.  Eleanor insisted that I come back to have her work with it until I was fully satisfied, even though she did exactly what I had asked.  She made a few adjustments to it until I was finally happy.  Even though this was MY mistake, not her's, because I chose the color and then didn't like it, she absolutely refused to let me pay for her extra work (she even came in on her day off to fix it to my liking).  Now I love it!!  Eleanor is so fantastic, she's a great stylist, and she was oh so patient with me and my changes.  Highly recommended!!

37.description: This review is specifically for Jenn, the eyebrow guru who formerly worked for Anastasia in Nordstrom's on Michigan Ave.Let me start by saying I am from Tennessee, and I fly to Chicago ONLY to get my brows don by Jenn. Yes... It's that serious. When she left Nordstroms, I was devastated... But thanks to my Yelp family we have been reunited. I moved to Chicago this week and she was literally my first stop. She takes her time and makes sure you brows are perfect before she sends you back into the real world. She even takes the time to make sure you know how to properly fill in your brows if you ask her. She's amazeballs. I heart Jenn. I will follow her to the ends of the earth.Do yourself a huge favor and visit her... I mean only if you care about having amazing brows. If you enjoy looking like Bert from Sesame Street, then by all means go one with your hairy life.

0.description: Jennee has been cutting and coloring my hair for over 3 years now. She is the absolute BEST! I won't let anyone else touch my hair. She knows my hair better than I do. Everytime Jennee cuts my hair I ask her what she thinks I need done (color, bang trim, full trim, layers) and she just does it. I have never left disappointed. She is GREAT with color. I always have people complimenting my 'cherry cola' colored hair. She is also great with bangs! Besides her AMAZING hair skills, Jennee is a great person to talk to. She is so easy going and cheerful. I always look forward to getting my hair cut so Jennee and I can chit chat for a bit.Seriously, go book your appointment with Jennee... NOW!

38.description: It was a warm, fine day. I was hungover. As I gazed at myself in the mirror and pondered the last nights regret...I realized I needed to jazz up my face. And by face, I mean hair as that seems to be the thing to do these days. I'd never had color... I've always maintained the bohemian roust about look from ages past. Skip to the point in this lengthy novel where I phone a friend and wind up at Hair Party, as that's why I decided to break my yelp cherry.Jennee...stylist...extraordinary. I've been having her do my hair at various unnamed locations for about a year now. Let me also mention, I hate the salon vibe. However this location is quaint and lacks the pretentious nonsense other salons reek of.Again, back to Jennee. My aderol hasn't kicked in yet, apologies. So...each time I entrust her with my long locks she takes the time to really listen to what I'm throwing out there, gives suggestions and I wind up with the best cut I've had in decades. She convinced me to add some color to spice things up and mixed up a hot concoction of auburn delight! She's very sweet and doesn't just chat you up about the weather...but rather gets to know you. It's the best kind of salon experience.I suggest you become a part of her harem...get to the salon, book your appointment...sit back and enjoy. You will not leave dissatisfied.Sidenote: As a result of the bitchin' color she installed...I've been garnering glances from every hot hipster in town. She'll customize your locks to suit you and you'll thank her later, times two.

51.description: Michele Tucker is my idol! Great cut and color every time! I have been going to Michele since her days at Bombshell. I'm so excited she has her very own salon now...she deserves it! She is very accommodating to everyone's schedule (an extra bonus). A very relaxing, stress free space :) Mary and Tiffany are great too! I believe they have extended hours around the holidays...they wouldn't want you going to a Holiday Party with bad hair!

27.description: I hate doing this but I am beyond upset right now. They get 3stars for being nice enough to book me for a same day appointment and being greeted kindly. Stacy gave me a 7:45 pm appointment to which I arrived on time. When I got to the salon she had someone in her chair and let me know she would be a few minutes. Maybe it's just me but when someone tells you a few it should consist of 5 maybe 10 minutes tops. Whatever the case may be, I walked out at 8:16 pm with NO haircut because she still wasn't done. I'm not a stylist but I would think its not a wise move to take someone else in or book your appointments so close together. After all the goal is to give your clients the attention they deserve right? Either that or communicate with your client that you are really behind and it will take you longer than expected.

32.description: I went to Hair Party for a cut and color and it was such a great experien ce. Jennee Miller was my stylist and she really knows what she is doing. It's the best cut I've had in years and the color she used looks great - not flat. I also picked up a shampoo and conditioner they sell and it's incredible. I've finally found the right stuff for my hair! It's full and soft and I love how it feels. I haven't been this happy with a salon experience in years. I highly recommend going. reasonable prices, a fun atmosphere and smart stylists!

54.description: Had my hair cut by Michele yesterday...amazing.  Hair Party has such a cute, intimate atmosphere, and Michele and her coworker, Tiffany, make you feel right at home. I have pretty finely textured, curly hair, so there's really only one right way to cut my hair.  Michele hit it spot on, and then some.  She really listened to my complaints about my hair, and took the time to explain the problem and how she could fix it.Not only did Michele give me a fabulous haircut, but she also gave me some wonderful, easy pointers on how to style my hair, which are always appreciated!Hair Party's website says, "As our client, you're offered the option of booking appointments with your pals, transforming a salon visit into your very own happening." I love the idea of communal haircuts (Michele, can we bring booze?), and I totally want to do this sometime.I'm officially obsessed.  Michele makes me want to get my hair cut more often than I go in for my regular dental cleaning, the standard 6 months, which is my current haircut schedule.

48.description: I have been going to Michelle for about 6 years now and LOVE my hair. I get compliments all the time at how natural the color is and she has cut it both short and let it grow long, and it looks great every time. Fantastic!!!

44.description: I hadn't been to a professional hair salon in over two years, so when I decided that I aesthetically needed an update to wow my boyfriend who had only seen me with one plain jane look, I did research and stumbled upon Hair Party--the only place that received a perfect 5 stars--for very good reasons.I stopped in to book an appointment with Michelle, but she was so booked that she couldn't take any new clients, so she referred me to Tiffany instead. Not only is Tiffany a down to earth, friendly, and smiley stylist, she most importantly did an amazing job on my hair!! I can confidently say that she if the first hair stylist that I didn't feel nervous with.  She colored my dull hair black and gave me the sexiest bangs.  I told her that I was intimidated to get bangs because I didn't want to look like I was getting ready for kindergarten, but I wanted sexy rock star bangs and she executed my request completely. I'm sure that she dreaded doing my waist length hair, but she looked happy doing her job, and that made me less nervous about my new transformation. I love this place. Good vibe, good artists, and good souls. They are very reasonable with their prices as well. Another pro is that street parking is available, so you won't have to worry about feeding your meter while you're enjoying getting your hair did.

24.description: I don't usually write yelp reviews, but Stacy did an awesome job on my hair. I had been going to the same place for years and decided to give Stacy a shot based on a friend's recommendation...and also on the fact that I hadn't tried anything new with my hair for over a decade. PS - I have pretty standard brown hair, it gets some big curls/frizz when I let it grow out and is starting to thin a bit, but overall, I think it's normal dude's hair as far as I can tell.Back to the review...I was there a little early and she was ready for me - no wait. Once I got in the chair, we spent some time discussing different directions we could take my hair in and finally I just told her to do whatever she thought would look best...and I'm glad I did.After a relaxing wash (I heart head massage), she gave me a totally new look and everyone, including me, loves it. She obeyed my few rules: must be low maintenance; must be able to go a while without being cut (that is, look good once it starts to grow out so my cheap ass doesn't have to pay for another haircut until I absolutely have to); and must be fun/different.  Her chair-side manner was top notch - very friendly/chill. We spent half the time talking and the other half silent, which is to say, she goes off your lead, which is nice, b/c sometimes I just like to shut up and enjoy my haircut. Anyway, the place itself is clean with good natural light. Definitely function focused though, which is fine, b/c I rather pay for a good haircut than for some expensive fancy-pants crap on a pedestal.Long story short - I'll be back.

7.description: We stopped in on short notice to get my five year old daughter's haircut. The service was amazing and she could not have been happier.  The art on the walls gave me something to look at during the styling. We will be back again.

49.description: I've been going to see Michele for hair cuts for almost 5 years now. She is a rock star. I have the craziest, curliest, most out-of-control hair ever and previous stylists would look like they wanted to vomit when I walked in. Not Michele. She is always really enthusiastic about cutting my hair, gives me a fabulous cut and style, and then tells me about how she wishes she had curly hair too. (Really, Michele, you don't. Promise.)I live on the south side and drive all the way there every few months because I refuse to let anyone else touch my hair.Recently I have also had the pleasure of having Mary do the a keratin treatment on my hair. That girl has the patience of a saint. The process takes nearly three hours and as I mentioned a moment ago, I have crazy, curly, out of control hair. She wrestles with it for three hours and voila! My hair is straight and shiny and looks like a Pantene commercial. I love this treatment. Even though the curl comes back once you wash it,  it is a kinder, gentler curl than I am used to, sans frizz. Michele and Mary have totally saved my butt. Er, hair. I'll never go anywhere else.Michele has also done great color on my sister and about a million other people I know, so although I haven't had that done personally I can vouch for her color skills.

40.description: I found Hair Party on yelp, and went to it one day after botching a boxed hair color to get it fixed.  Everyone was very friendly and I came out a couple hours later with a normal, great-looking color.  I went back for my next cut, and Jade was great at understanding what I was asking for, explaining what she was doing, and making sure I liked the cut as it progressed.  First time I ever left a salon with a blow-dried style that I was actually happy with and wore out that night.She just did a great color for me last month, and trimmed my bangs to last another couple months until my next cut.  I definitely recommend--it is a great environment and they do great work!

53.description: I moved to Chicago two years ago and finding a stylist in a new city is always stressful.  I was at a bar and saw a girl with hair I really liked and she said she went to Hair Party.  I have been going there ever since.  Every few months I want to do something different with my hair and the stylist at Hair Party make recommendations that are fun, stylish and that I always love.It is a very cute salon right on Belmont with lots of light.  Everyone there is super nice.

30.description: Now I can understand why this salon has a five star rating. I haven't been to a hair salon in over three years, as somebody who hair been trying to grow her hair out, i was tired of stylists that didnt listen and would chop off my length, even though i worked hard to keep it healthy. It was about time that i gave in and let a professional style my hair, so i began search for a salon. I read reviews for months and never found anywhere that made me want to visit until i read about Hair Party. I thought the name was kinda silly but cute, and reading through the reviews i realized the salon was literally next door to my apt. So i called and booked an appt with Jennee. Walking in, i immediately felt comfortable. The salon isnt that big and there was no stuffy clubby vibe that i feel alot of salons have, but at the same time it was modern, clean and professional. There was one other client seated who said she had been following her stylist for 15 years. Jennee was wonderful! she knew exactly what i wanted done and she really knows what she is doing. Not only that but she was great company, and im somebody who usually likes to sit in silence. My hair looks more gorgeous than it has in years, without having to sacrifce my length. Im am officialy no longer afraid of the hair salon anymore, and have already talked my sister into booking her next appt with her.

46.description: RAD!!!!! ladies and gents all you need to know about this place is that it is the best of the best.  The ladies here are awesome!!!! Chill vibe, great hair cuts and even better color.  I see michelle but i have also gone to tiffany. Both of them are great.  It took me close to 10 years to find a hair salon this good.  thank you hair party!

1.description: Jennee's still the best, it's two years past my initial review and I won't let anyone else touch my hair. Jennee just styled my hair for my wedding this past weekend, and she did such an incredible job on me, my bridesmaids, my mom, and my grandmother. Jennee's so calm and wonderful and she's a pleasure to spend time with, both on my wedding day and during regular haircuts. Oh, she's also great at styling a variety of hair types on clients of all ages. I've been seeing Jennee for about as long as I've been seeing my now-husband so, yeah, it's gotten kind of serious. I highly recommend her without reservations!

55.description: As promised...I'm still not sure if this is really my hair. It's downright...cooperative. It blowdries out into a "normal" shape. I actually LIKE it when I view it from the back. It's not too short, not too long, and...omg, I like it!? I think it's Tiffany's fault. Indeed. (eeeee, YAY!)

9.description: Jennee - my hair looks so good!  Thank you Thankyou!!

26.description: I have your basic long-ish brown hair and I am not very picky about how it's cut as long as it's not to layered and it's still long. HOWEVER, after going to Michelle and living with the cut for a couple months now I'm hooked! My hair looked great when I left and it's grown into the cut really well too (it's been a couple months now). It frames my face well, it has more bounce than it has before and it looks really healthy. And Michelle is a delight to be with. She listened and heard what I said and to my concerns about layering and gave me honest feedback and we came to a great result.Thanks Michelle!

25.description: Stacy has been cutting my hair for over two years. My hair isn't the easiest to work with (thick, sometimes frizzy, kind of curly but not...) but she's patient, while still efficient, and takes my vague instructions and runs with them. I've always been happy with the results. I'm psyched she's at Hair Party now - such a cool place!
