12.description: Michelle & Tiffany are two of the best stylists that Chicago is lucky to have! At the salon the music is on point and everyone is very cool and friendly. I'm glad that I can get my hair done super well at such a laid back and awesome salon.

21.description: Jennee Miller is the bomb. (I made this Yelp account solely so I could write a review for her and Hair Party.)Let me begin with some backstory. I'm a long-hair girl. I've never had a short haircut in my life that I liked. I went to another salon (whose name I will not mention here) two days ago, and chopped off my waist-length hair to donate. To put it bluntly, I wasn't satisfied. My hair was about to my collarbones at that point, but it had too much volume around the crown of my head and flipped out at the ends to create a weird helmet soccer-mom-hair shape - exactly what I was trying to avoid.I was considering getting it fixed up, so I trolled Yelp for at least an hour and a half this morning reading reviews. Hair Party looked promising based on all of the glowing testimonials, so I called them around noon to ask about their rates. The person on the phone was very nice and explained to me that all of the stylists book their own schedules, so if I knew which one of them I wanted to cut my hair, she would have that stylist call me back with her availability. I asked for Jennee, and the person on the phone took my name and number and said that Jennee would call me back once she was finished with her client.About an hour later, Jennee called and said that she could fit me in for an 8:15pm appointment. (The salon itself actually closes at 8:00 - she was cool with starting me 15 minutes after that!) I told her that it would be fine and we settled on that appointment.I live in the South Side, so I left quite early for my appointment to get dinner downtown on the way. I ended up not stopping for the meal though, so I was going to be early for the appointment. Lo and behold, Jennee had sent me a text saying that she would be finished with her client before me at 7:45, so she could start with me then if I could make it.I was still about 15 minutes early, so when I walked into the salon, I sat in the waiting area and read some magazines. The overall atmosphere was great, very chill and all of the stylists were chatty and cool. I was in the chair by 7:43pm. Jennee asked me what I wanted to do with my hair, and I had some pretty specific requests - thin out the ends, which were very blunt/square-looking and heavy, reduce some of the volume around the crown of my head, and overall to get my hair to fall straight down instead of flipping out weirdly. Jennee took one look at my hair and agreed immediately with my comment about the ends of my hair, and said that she could easily thin that out a bit. The crown of my head, however, was going to be more of a problem since it was caused by the top layer of my hair being too short, so I would have to wait for that to grow out a bit. As it happens, though, she ended up pretty much eliminating that problem anyway.Throughout the haircut, Jennee was very easy to talk to and kept the ball rolling by asking me questions about myself. We found out that we'd both lived in Tokyo for periods of our lives (how cool is that?). She explained to me what she was doing to my hair as she did it, and followed my requests while adding just enough of her own personal liberties to make my hair look good. I no longer have any of the bulkiness around the ends of my hair and my bangs fall perfectly. I'm generally not the kind of person who has a "regular" hairstylist because I get my hair cut at salons so infrequently, but I think Jennee's my go-to now.I was out the door by 8:12 - less than half an hour! In total, it wasn't cheap, but it was definitely affordable. I am very happy with my haircut and the overall experience, and would recommend Hair Party and Jennee Miller to anyone.

17.description: I have your basic long-ish brown hair and I am not very picky about how it's cut as long as it's not to layered and it's still long. HOWEVER, after going to Michelle and living with the cut for a couple months now I'm hooked! My hair looked great when I left and it's grown into the cut really well too (it's been a couple months now). It frames my face well, it has more bounce than it has before and it looks really healthy. And Michelle is a delight to be with. She listened and heard what I said and to my concerns about layering and gave me honest feedback and we came to a great result.Thanks Michelle!

10.description: I have been coming to Hair Party for over a year now.  Melissa is always attentive and receptive to my needs.  She keeps my hair easy to maintain (and that's usually difficult for red) because that is usually my one request.The atmosphere is great and the girls really want to take care of you.  Recently recommended a friend here and she loved it too. I will keep going back.

5.description: Melissa is fantastic. She provides lively conversation and can always bring a smile to your face. Hair Party walls will also keep you intrigued every time you look around! For me my haircuts are about the stylist. I don't want to tell them how to cut my hair, because I want to trust in them and their artistic talent to do the right cut every time I go in. With Melissa the trust is there!

3.description: I have gone to Jamie for a few cuts and highlight/lowlights so far, and I'm very impressed!  His color is natural and beautiful, and I don't see grow out like I have with other stylists.  And my cut is stylish but easy to maintain.  He's very easy to work with and talk with.  I highly recommend him!

35.description: Alrighty, peeps. Let's start at the beginning: Do NOT let the name of this salon deter you. When my friend first recommended it I was imagining something like Carnival Cuts for adults. It is not that. In fact, it couldn't be further from that.I have been searching for someone to cut my hair in Chicago for 3 years. Seriously, why is it harder than finding a doctor? It's like I don't care who gives me my yearly exam...but I won't go to just ANYONE for a trim....I have tried so many different places (from Mario Tricoci to Buzz to everything in between) but always end up flying back to Michigan to go to my stylist there (and, uh, see my family....)But my search is over. And Tiffany is my girrrrl. Tiffany is GREAT. I walked in to the salon with a grainy picture on my iPhone that was taken after my most recent Michigan haircut. Tiffany played with my hair a little, asked me a few questions, and got to work. And I don't know HOW she did it, but she gave me exactly what I wanted (which I know for a fact I wasn't very good at explaining). She listened to me, she only cut an inch when she said she'd only cut an inch, and she gave me the cutest bangs I've had in a long time.And can we just talk about the blow out? AMAZING. So amazing, in fact, that a stranger stopped me on my bus ride back to Lakeview to ask me where I got my hair done and what their phone number is.The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because there is no receptionist and everyone books their own appointments. So...it can get a little tricky to get a hold of the person you want. BUT, once you go, you'll have Tiffany's personal cell phone number, so booking in the future is a breeze.If you're looking for some ritzy salon, Hair Party is not for you. But if you're looking for someone who does great work, will give you a beer while she does that great work and won't charge you some ridiculous amount for that great work...Get thee to Tiffany. Now.

19.description: I just recently moved back to Chicago and the most stressful part of the relocation was trying to find where to get my hair done. I tried to find my old stylists and was unsuccessful so the search began. I stumbled upon Hair Party and decided to book an appt with Jennee for a cut and color. My husband says the best I've had so far, so that review alone is worth so much. I've since been back for a blow dry because I was going to a black tie fundraiser and yet again I was not disappointed. I highly recommend Jennee and she will take care of you!

28.description: I just recently moved back to Chicago and the most stressful part of the relocation was trying to find where to get my hair done. I tried to find my old stylists and was unsuccessful so the search began. I stumbled upon Hair Party and decided to book an appt with Jennee for a cut and color. My husband says the best I've had so far, so that review alone is worth so much. I've since been back for a blow dry because I was going to a black tie fundraiser and yet again I was not disappointed. I highly recommend Jennee and she will take care of you!

45.description: This place has a great vibe, and I am always, ALWAYS happy with the cut I get from Jade/Jen - I call her Jade, her name from when she styled at Vidal Sassoon downtown, but her real name is Jen. It's a damn good cut. I've followed Jade for the last 8 years because first and foremost because she's simply the best stylist I've had but also as icing on the cake, she is fun personality to yak with and can get me in and out if I'm in a hurry.A true professional with cutting edge skills. (wah, wah). ;)

33.description: First off, what a cute salon! On a sweet little corner across from the Beat Kitchen on Belmont. I grabbed by coffee and went inside.From minute one I had a great experience. Offerings of candies, water or beer. Why yes! I love candy!My stylist is Jennee Miller, who does an amazing job with not only my cut, but color too. I have never been disappointed. I like that she is easy to talk to and works with me on what style fits my life and what styling I'm willing (or not willing) to do.I give Hair Party 5 stars.

43.description: Me and my boyfriend get our hair cut here by Jade.  She just moved to this new salon and I love the decor and all the girls are super friendly.  She is great with curly cuts and my boyfriend has always had a hard time getting a good cut, she always does an amazing job on his funky head.

2.description: Jennee is simply the best!  After years of stumbling around from salon to salon trying to find someone I trusted, I was so thankful to Jennee her 4 years ago.  My hair is fine and hard to style on top of needing color every few weeks - and Jennee always makes me feel like a million bucks when I leave.  Jennee is amazing at coloring my hair and always knows what will look best on me.  She is so calm, kind, and cheerful - I look forward to seeing her each month!  For my wedding, Jennee was the only person I trusted to work with my hair, and the end result was absolutely gorgeous.  It's so easy to make an appointment with her and I really appreciate her flexibility to work with my schedule.  Can't say enough wonderful things about her!

18.description: I came in last week and saw Melissa M. Last week to get some highlights done. She did amazing! I wasn't even exactly sure what I wanted for color, but she did better then I could have imagined. She is a young, newer stylist so she has some great ideas for what is hot right now and modern. I had very dark, almost black hair and wanted something different. I like dying my own hair and experimenting but it was great to have a professsional make it look, well, professional! Melissa put highlights in all over, and added a toner. The result was a pretty, caramel color with a lot of dimension. I've had the same hair color for 2 years so I'm super happy to finally have a change and be feeling spring and summer ready!She has very affordable prices, especially compared to the average price you could end up paying in Chicago.Furthermore, Melissa took great care of me and was wonderful to talk to. I was referred by a few of my coworkers who see her for cut and colors on a regular basis. Now I am happy to have a stylist in Chicago that I can trust, and afford! I can't wait to go back and get even more coloring done!

41.description: I followed Jenn here because she has been doing my brows for almost 2 years now and she is amazing!! I used to see her at Nordstroms and she recently moved here and I love it! The salon is so cute and I like the atmosphere at Hair Party better. Ive said this before and ill say it again, Jenn is the Eyebrow Queen of Chicago :)

52.description: If you go here, you will walk out feeling amazing.  Michelle just knows hair.

50.description: Michele is the best! She is not only one of the sweetest people I know but she gives a DAMN good haircut/color. I have been seeing her for about 5 years now and she is gifted with hair. She is a hair artist. I know it sounds weird, but Mozart had a gift, right, well so does Michele. She is so passionate about hair and she is great. I don't know where her hair-enthusiasm comes from but I don't care because it's making me look good! Not only do her cuts look awesome when she gives them, but they look awesome for months afterwards, and she is really cool about squeezing you in for a bang trim if they are looking a little long before your next full haircut.She did the hair for my sister's wedding as well as another friend's wedding and we were all thrilled for each event.If you can't see Michele, she just hired a new stylist Mary (? I hope that's her name) who blew out my hair last time and did a great job.

4.description: LOVE Melissa Manila! My boyfriend highly recommended her, and I decided to leave my current stylist to give her a try for hair color and never went back. Melissa is very dedicated to her work, and really takes the time to make sure she perfects the color and style you want, not to mention, she is a blowdry queen! I have rather difficult long hair, and Melissa has mastered every aspect of both my color, cut, and style! She is refreshing and I always looked forward to my visits at Hair Party with her not just for a dazzling new 'do, but also for great conversation. The ambiance at Hair Party is stellar, with unique pop culture surrounding you and a very artistic vibe. After a long day at work, come relax and have a beer, and walk out glamorous thanks to Melissa! :)

6.description: I am SO bummed to have to update this review. I gave it five stars before because Melissa did an amazing color on my hair. I was so impressed with her. If she's in that day, I will definitely recommend that you sit in her chair. She did such a great job with turning my crazy blonde hair into a lively, deep brown. But...then I went in to get my bangs trimmed because they were getting sort of long. I basically got sheered. I left so upset. I'm happy they do free bang trims because I couldn't have stomached paying for what I got. It wasn't Melissa who did it, but I'm sorry to say that I can't remember who it was. I said I wanted the littlest bit off just to stay out of my eyes and she cut it so far above my brow that I flinched when she did it. So I'm left with a janky set of bangs that my friends and boyfriend consistently let me know they feel sorry that I'm stuck with.Go for the color, leave for the cut. So bummed to have to dock points.

22.description: One of the tasks I faced after recently moving to Chicago was to locate a competent person to cut my hair.  I wasn't terribly optimistic about my prospects - it took me 3 years to find my former barber.  Thankfully, the travel gods were merciful, and I found Stacy.  Not only does she know what she's doing hair-wise, but she makes the entire process super pleasant.  If you're looking for a great cut and equally great conversation, Stacy's your girl.  Her prices are reasonable and she's very accommodating.  She'll even do touch-ups and "neck" trims in between appointments so you can get the most out of your cut.  I highly recommend checking her out.

15.description: Jennee Miller is the bomb. (I made this Yelp account solely so I could write a review for her and Hair Party.)Let me begin with some backstory. I'm a long-hair girl. I've never had a short haircut in my life that I liked. I went to another salon (whose name I will not mention here) two days ago, and chopped off my waist-length hair to donate. To put it bluntly, I wasn't satisfied. My hair was about to my collarbones at that point, but it had too much volume around the crown of my head and flipped out at the ends to create a weird helmet soccer-mom-hair shape - exactly what I was trying to avoid.I was considering getting it fixed up, so I trolled Yelp for at least an hour and a half this morning reading reviews. Hair Party looked promising based on all of the glowing testimonials, so I called them around noon to ask about their rates. The person on the phone was very nice and explained to me that all of the stylists book their own schedules, so if I knew which one of them I wanted to cut my hair, she would have that stylist call me back with her availability. I asked for Jennee, and the person on the phone took my name and number and said that Jennee would call me back once she was finished with her client.About an hour later, Jennee called and said that she could fit me in for an 8:15pm appointment. (The salon itself actually closes at 8:00 - she was cool with starting me 15 minutes after that!) I told her that it would be fine and we settled on that appointment.I live in the South Side, so I left quite early for my appointment to get dinner downtown on the way. I ended up not stopping for the meal though, so I was going to be early for the appointment. Lo and behold, Jennee had sent me a text saying that she would be finished with her client before me at 7:45, so she could start with me then if I could make it.I was still about 15 minutes early, so when I walked into the salon, I sat in the waiting area and read some magazines. The overall atmosphere was great, very chill and all of the stylists were chatty and cool. I was in the chair by 7:43pm. Jennee asked me what I wanted to do with my hair, and I had some pretty specific requests - thin out the ends, which were very blunt/square-looking and heavy, reduce some of the volume around the crown of my head, and overall to get my hair to fall straight down instead of flipping out weirdly. Jennee took one look at my hair and agreed immediately with my comment about the ends of my hair, and said that she could easily thin that out a bit. The crown of my head, however, was going to be more of a problem since it was caused by the top layer of my hair being too short, so I would have to wait for that to grow out a bit. As it happens, though, she ended up pretty much eliminating that problem anyway.Throughout the haircut, Jennee was very easy to talk to and kept the ball rolling by asking me questions about myself. We found out that we'd both lived in Tokyo for periods of our lives (how cool is that?). She explained to me what she was doing to my hair as she did it, and followed my requests while adding just enough of her own personal liberties to make my hair look good. I no longer have any of the bulkiness around the ends of my hair and my bangs fall perfectly. I'm generally not the kind of person who has a "regular" hairstylist because I get my hair cut at salons so infrequently, but I think Jennee's my go-to now.I was out the door by 8:12 - less than half an hour! In total, it wasn't cheap, but it was definitely affordable. I am very happy with my haircut and the overall experience, and would recommend Hair Party and Jennee Miller to anyone.

57.description: For anyone looking for more than your average hair salon experience "Hair Party" is the spot.  Their new loft setting feels more like a spa experience with hand treated floors, high ceilings, and walls colored to set off an artist's (client) oversized photograph that fully explains their name. It is in fact a party!   Michelle and Tiffany are not only some of the best stylists and colorists I have had the pleasure of trusting (you know what I am talking about!) - but when I last arrived for my monthly favor to myself (thank you) they made a music playlist for me  to listen to on Pandora. This is care on another level!Paula H

20.description: I have been going to hair party for 3 years now. Jade is my stylist and she is the best thing that has happened to my hair since I knew what  style was. I have received many bad haircuts in my day and you all know the awkward stylist shopping you have to do when you move to a new city. Luckily I met Jade and never have to worry about a bad haircut ever again. She has so much knowledge and experience that I felt comfortable from the word Hello. I have recommended plenty of my personal circle to go to Jade and hair party, and they all have said the same great things about the service and cut you receive from Jade personally, and all of the other professionals at hair party. Hair party in general is a great place to get your hair done. It has a great feel and everyone from stylists to their clients are great to be around. Don't ever get a bad hairdo again. Go to hair party and ask for Jade. Trust me!

36.description: As luck would have it my hubby was in search of a stylist who could do some magic with his thinning hair the same week I heard Jennee was now at Hair Party. So the moment he walks in the house I like what I see but the true test is a week later it still looks great!

14.description: Go do yourself a favor and book an eyebrow waxing with Jen. She is the master of her trade. No seriously, she is an absolute rockstar when it comes to eyebrows. She takes her time and loves taking care of her clients. You will not find a better eyebrow wax in the city of Chicago! That much I am sure of!

36.description: When I've made my entire delivery order over the phone, gotten my total, given all my information and THEN you tell me you're not able to take credit cards today, you piss me off. You should have told me that from the very beginning instead of wasting my time. I was really craving a tuna sandwich too.  Oh well, I ordered from Pockets instead.

29.description: This is the worst Jimmy Johns in History!  Everytime I go there, there is a fat Mexican guy behind the counter.  He is so rude the second you walk in.  He will even ask, "is that it".  How can the owners of this place let this continue!  In my attempt to avoid that jerk, I had it delivered and the entire order was wrong, even though there was a receipt with the correct order attached to it.  I will never go back at this point, and will tell everyone in the neighborhood not to go back.

42.description: I really, really, really, really like Jimmy John's. And I really, really like this location. They're fast, and they've never screwed up my order, like, ahem, another location.

23.description: Delivery didn't bring my chips. No refund or chip voucher. :(

31.description: We always order from this Jimmy johns.. It's close to work and they are usually pretty fast delivering.. Haven't had any bad experiences.. And the staff is really friendly.. Will definitely keep ordering for lunch. When you are here at Roscoe village. Just don't park on the village crossing parking lot.. Cause they will tow your car in a matter of less than one minute... Seriously I see people getting towed all the time..

34.description: Stopped in to grab a quick sandwich on my way back to the office- had an appointment nearby.  I've been to plenty of JJ locations never entirely impressed with their product but it's decent and time for lunch.  The people working, however, act like they're doing you a favor at this location.  When my sandwich was ready (though I wasn't told it was, it was just tossed on the counter far from where I was standing at the register) I went to pick it up.  Because I was taking the sandwich to go, I asked "may I please have a bag" to which a lady grabbed on, and tossed it at me.  I don't need you to open the bag and place my sandwich in it for me necessarily, but give me a break.

16.description: Just the worst.  Took an hour and a half to get my order, so my lunch break was spent watching the door.  Half an hour later, the receptionist delivered my lunch to my classroom.  Never again.

11.description: This place isn't too bad. The employees never look too happy to be at work, but it could be worse. Four stars because its in a great location, never crowded, and the sandwiches are pretty good.

39.description: Ya know, I love me a beach club(no mayo- add dijon) and your pickles are the shiznit, but the attitude I get when placing an order has GOT to go. Seriously, every time I call the location on Roscoe in Chicago, I get huffs and puffs like I'm interrupting her day by making her DO HER JOB, no total on my order, and get hung up on. Every time. Today she hung up on me twice. And it's not like they're busy..

37.description: Nothing is more amusing than the truth.  Last week I  saw a Jimmy John's delivery man speed down my street well in excess of the speed limit while texting on his phone.  How did I know it was a Jimmy John's delivery man you might wonder, but it had one of those big huge signs on top of the black Honda Civic that said "Jimmy John's".Knowing full well this is against the law, but more concerned for neighborhood safety with kids running around and all, I did the neighborly thing by walking in the store, introduced myself by name and neighbor, and kindly requested to speak to the manager figuring we could avoid an accident waiting to happen.When I explained the problem to the uninterested young woman behind the counter she said that I could explain the problem to the delivery man himself who is the acting manager - how convenient I thought, but his response was more interesting, "you can go f@ck yourself outside".  Accident happened.For real, wow, now that takes customer service to a new level!  Be warned fellow Yelpers who knows how these folks will react if you dare to complain about a sandwich.

0.description: Super fast and consistent every time. I live a mile away and every time I order for lunch it seems they are at my door by time I hang up the phone.

38.description: oooooookay... lets start at the beginning. I just started working at a new place on Roscoe... probablly abut 2 blocks away. therefore, Jimmy Johns is, or should i say, would be, a great choice for my coworkers and i's daily meal. apparently the 2 times that the employees there have seen me wasnt enough for them to think oh! she works/lives in the area... maybe i shouldnt act like i have better things to be doing then what im PAID to be doing.i will not make the trek down there again. i will not call again. and actually i reccommend finding a different spot for any yelpers... and possibly a huge employee change for the owner. you're losing a TON of business my friend....

27.description: Subs so fast you'll freak!

32.description: Worst franchise ive been to. Go up the street to Costellos

13.description: Sandwiches are great but they have never gotten our order correct. Every time I order, they get something wrong; for example, we ask for the sandwiches cut in half, they forget to cut the sandwich in half, we ask for avocado, they forget the avocado, we ask for no lettuce, they add lettuce, we ask for no tomato, they add tomato, we ask that names be written on the sandwich, they do not, making it difficult to figure out who ordered what. We order the sandwiches online to avoid these kinds of issues. The receipt we get on the bag lists all our requests and is correct. Someone just doesn't double check their work or the order before they send it out. And I am not exaggerating when I say every order I have put in online from this shop has always been wrong in one way or another. And I have never ordered more than 4 subs. I wish there was an other jimmy johns that would deliver to our house.

24.description: This Jimmy Johns has the worst phone customer service! Everyone sounds like they don't want to be there. If you don't like your job then quit! They sound like a bunch of stupid ghetto people that don't know how to act while at a job. Don't work in the service industry if you can't handle it. I'm also complaining to corporate about this franchies and hope they close it down.

7.description: Worst service ever. 45 minutes late when I placed my order online hours before the location opened. When I called, they gave no apology or explanation. The delivery driver was also extremely inconsiderate and offered no resolution or remorse for the delay. Never ordering for this irresponsible, rude jimmy johns ever again.

40.description: The only reason I am giving this joint 2 stars is because the food is pretty much always good. 2 points for consistency! What completely blows at this place is the customer service! Half the time I go in their, the employees are sitting at a table goofing off and begrudgingly get up to place my order. I'm rarely greeted with a smile, a hello, and never a thank you. Not only does the customer service leave something to be desired, but the prices at this location are completely outrageous. Save your money and walk down the street to Costello's, you get much more for your money. And to the owner of this franchise, do yourself a favor and stop by more often at night, your employees are NOT working. They goof off, and steal food. I have seen it on multiple occasions..

30.description: Consistently poor service. Not surprised that it only averages two stars. Today I walked in and no one was at the register. After a few minutes, the manager looked up from his clipboard and saw me, but still didn't acknowledge me. Then he sauntered over and took my order, but still felt like I was an annoyance to whatever else he was working on. I go occasionally because they are just a block from where I work....and I keep hoping to have a better experience, but it never happens.

1.description: Lots of people seem to have beef with this place.  Not sure why.  All of my experiences have been positive.  Maybe because I take it for what it is, a freaky fast sandwich shop.I like the turkey Tom and thinny chips.  I also have used delivery from here and it's super fast.  Only qualm is a JJ complaint in general- on a cold winter day I want a hot Sammy and soup.

9.description: not sure why 2 stars.  Its a Jimmy John, consistent, clean,  yes employees all seem a bit down but no matter.

26.description: This location needs a complete overhaul in the way they handle their customer service.  I called tonight to place an order and when I told the guy on the phone that  it was going to be for delivery he loudly and exageratedly sighed into the phone.  Give me a break, what else are you there for if not to take orders and make sandwhiches?  This was just the beginning of my horrible experience and the rest of the conversation went downhill from there.  He was rude and inattentive (how can you possibly be inattentive on a phone call?!?!) and after three tries of placing my order I told him to forget it and I hung up.  I always wondered why this place wasn't more busy every time I walk by and now I know.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

25.description: While I haven't been to all of them, I really believe this is probably the worst Jimmy Johns franchise in the city.  This place is destined for a corporate take-over.  The bread, which is the heart and soul of Jimmy Johns, is usually overcooked or stale.  The sandwiches are reliably made with very little care.  The prices are higher than other city Jimmy Johns.  The service is rude and slow.I am a huge fan of Jimmy Johns...but this one is just terrible and hurts the Jimmy Johns brand.

12.description: Ordered  a  #12. My daughter and I  shared a 8 " sandwhich. I asked to cut it in half and put the avocado on one side, and they said they can't do that...I had mentioned that, I'm paying for it... and they said no it's there policy! Since when can you NOT order something on the side. Never coming here again!

21.description: Just wanted to update this because I've recently moved back to the hood and myself and my roommate order here pretty frequently - no more problems with stale bread.  This review is still just for delivery w/online ordering though.

17.description: Simply incompetent. We have ordered from this spot about a dozen times and they've gotten it right maybe once. Also very unfriendly when I've been in the store. I don't know if the owner is absent or simply uninterested but the people he has working at this location clearly show he or she couldn't care less about customer satisfaction. Sometime soon I'm sure I'll be in touch with corporate to complain, and I encourage you to do the same.

10.description: I order delivery from them at least once a week. I think they've only messed up mine once, but I don't typically special order things. They may have forgotten mayo packets I requested, and not to put tomatoes on my boyfriend's sandwich once. Never really had a problem with delivery speed.I think the worst Jimmy John's in the city title should belong to the one in Wrigleyville on Clark.

5.description: The cashier was extremely rude. I mean if you don't like your job then quit. I'm never going there again.

35.description: Does everyone remember that Escherichia Coli outbreak that JJ's had over a month ago?  Their sprouts were getting people sick.Well, they don't offer the sprouts anymore (for the time being).  The fucking problem is that they don't bother telling you this.  So, you go to order the #12 (Beach Club, Bitches), and it comes with no sprouts automatically, unbeknownst to the buyer until it's unwrapped and in your mouth.  Hey, JJ's, why don't you spit in my face and run over my cat?  I mean, are a few isolated cases really going to disrupt your national sprout distribution business?!They also added mayo when I very specifically asked *no mayo, but please give me a packet on the side*.  This allows me to control mayo quantities.  I was the only patron and there were two workers.  Mistakes like that are unacceptable.no Cheeers.

19.description: Delivery didn't bring my chips. No refund or chip voucher. :(

28.description: I don't even know where to begin with the amount of bad service I've experience here over the years. The only reason they stay open is because of the Jimmy John's brand.Here are some of my experiences:1. I ordered for delivery I only live .25 miles away. After an hour I call them a couple of times and they tell me the driver must of gotten lost. I canceled my order.2. I went in to this location and ordered a sandwich and some guy came in from outside (not wearing a JJ's uniform), didn't wash his hand and made my sandwich for me. After he was done he went back outside to his car and left.3. I've been here numerous times when an employee is with her screaming baby in the back of the restaurant. I refuse to ever go here again and I'm not that picky. I always go to Costello's down the street. Great customer service and really good sandwiches/sides.

3.description: Our order came an hour late. I had to call them and they told me they were going to call but their delivery driver had car trouble. No apologies, no extras .. nothing. Sandwiches were soggy like they were made an hour ago and nothing was labeled.

33.description: Jimmy John's on Roscoe is a sweet deal.  They have a great product and it's in your hand before you realize it, they are that fast!  Great for a quick bite.

43.description: Personally...I love Jimmy Johns sandwiches! Plus, this location has super friendly people working that are super quick at making your sandwich. And...they deliver!

2.description: Probably the worst customer service Jimmy John's I have ever been too.  They don't ever include napkins with delivery and charge more than any other local Jimmy John's.  When I challenged them on the higher prices they lied and told me higher taxes for roscoe village, lol.  Finally, they can take over 40 mins for delivery when I live .5 miles away and their bread and meats are frequently expired.  Go to the other Jimmy John's whenever possible

18.description: After an hour I called to see where my sandwiches were.    Their response "we only have one driver - do you want to cancel?"  I asked why they never called to tell me " the response was I didn't know when the bike delivery guy was going to get back.  Do you want to cancel?  WORST JIMMY JOHNS EVER!

41.description: What a horrible sandwich. If I want something from prepackaged supply I would go to Subway and get it for cheaper. The selection was boring as was the taste. The counter service was a couple folks who were obviously wanting us out. The prices were flat out ridiculous. They say make it a combo "for almost $2" but when they ring it up it's $2.75, that's closer to 3 (just sayin'). I would recommend you go to Costello's if you want to spend that amount on sandwiches or Subway if you don't.

4.description: Two stars might seem harsh, but given that speed is a core part of the Jimmy John's experience, this location is terrible.I have never had any issues with the sandwiches, but they take forever to deliver. I live 0.5 miles away and it often takes 45 minutes or more for the sandwich.If you are walking past, or doing pick-up, this location is fine, but do not order delivery!

6.description: I order from here on days I work from home. "Freaky Fast" isn't very accurate, as it generally takes 45 minutes. And they constantly mess up my order. I normally just suck it up when it happens, but I called once and the person who made my sandwich basically said I was lying. Thinking of giving Costello's a try instead!

22.description: Sandwiches are great but they have never gotten our order correct. Every time I order, they get something wrong; for example, we ask for the sandwiches cut in half, they forget to cut the sandwich in half, we ask for avocado, they forget the avocado, we ask for no lettuce, they add lettuce, we ask for no tomato, they add tomato, we ask that names be written on the sandwich, they do not, making it difficult to figure out who ordered what. We order the sandwiches online to avoid these kinds of issues. The receipt we get on the bag lists all our requests and is correct. Someone just doesn't double check their work or the order before they send it out. And I am not exaggerating when I say every order I have put in online from this shop has always been wrong in one way or another. And I have never ordered more than 4 subs. I wish there was an other jimmy johns that would deliver to our house.

15.description: While I haven't been to all of them, I really believe this is probably the worst Jimmy Johns franchise in the city.  This place is destined for a corporate take-over.  The bread, which is the heart and soul of Jimmy Johns, is usually overcooked or stale.  The sandwiches are reliably made with very little care.  The prices are higher than other city Jimmy Johns.  The service is rude and slow.I am a huge fan of Jimmy Johns...but this one is just terrible and hurts the Jimmy Johns brand.

20.description: I've ordered from these guys at least once a week for over a year, and maybe once or twice has there been a hiccup. They're good and fast, just like they say.

8.description: I love Jimmy Johns but the service here is not good,  and they were kinda rude...  It took 15 min for them to make 4 sandwiches.

14.description: I love the Jimmy Johns near my work so thought I would try again. 35 minutes after placing my order online and not receiving the order, I called to cancel and was informed that they had already cancelled it. What the h&ll? I wish I could order from a different one but when I try they say they can't take my order. Please close this Jimmy Johns so that we can order from a better one.

58.description: Our favorite neighborhood bar.  My friends and I love Saturdays and Four Treys, which is karaoke night.  The DJ is great and the crowd is the friendliest in the city.  This place is the opposite of pretentious.  You can wear anything, drink anything, sing anything, and still make new friends here.  A terrific place for dancing, since the DJ plays good tunes between karaoke hits.  Saturdays are also $6 pitchers.  Overall drink prices are very cheap here.One memorable Saturday at Four Treys, my friends and I were riveted--yes riveted--by an older man in a uniform who serenaded the crowd with a head-banging, lighter-worthy rendition of Journey's "Separate Ways."  "Someday love will find you..."  The neighborhood bar scene doesn't get any better than this!

56.description: great people hang out at this bar.  I have been coming to the Treys for 5 years.  There is always someone fun to talk to.  Bartenders rock and are all very nice.  You can wear whatever you want and get a good priced drink any day of the week.

29.description: This bar is perfectly laid back. I don't mean that the owner has contrived the atmosphere and decor to seem laid back. In fact- the decor in the place looks like it has been collected over the years and kept because it still works, not because it matches some designer's vision. The overall effect is that you're hanging out at a friend's house, where a little spilled beer isn't a big deal. You'll usually run in to a friendly dog or two here.I like going during the week (Tuesday night Trivia. It almost deserves its own positive review) where you'll probably meet Anna, the bartender who is always nice but never sacchrine sweet (this is a good thing), The prices are also right: $2.50 PBRs during the week. Saturday Karaoke is fun where there is little shame in butchering a song, but a good rendition is always appreciated. The dj whose name I always forget plays a dancable mix that's a little heavy on the Lady Gaga, but otherwise pretty palatable and generally fun. It's usually pretty packed on Saturdays, too.If you're looking for a place that's polished and will serve you drinks with umbrellas or things that end in "tini" while you wear stilletos, I suggest you look elsewhere. If you want to wear jeans and hang out, this is the place to go.

42.description: I spent a Tuesday afternoon at Four Treyswith my friend and his German Shephard/Golden Retriever. As soon as we walked through the door, the nice Polish blond bartender had already come over with a large bowl of water for the dog and some tasty dog treats. We spent over three hours at the bar, during which time the bartender had prepared two bags of popcorn specifically for us. She also permitted us to bring our own food, so my friend ran out for about 10 minutes and came back with a huge taco dinner from the taqueria on the corner of Damon and Belmont. The dog was happy, we were happy, and the crowd was very low key on that Tuesday afternoon. We will be coming back, hopefully with dog and food in tow!

23.description: A really nice neighborhood bar that is bigger than it looks on the outside. That being said if you rside outside of Roscoe village no real reason to come to this bar. This is perhaps the closest bar I have seen that looks like that bar from goodfellas.

47.description: You know the night is being finished off right when Deanna and Amy get up to sing in a crowd of bad singers, everybody sings along without prevail, there's a lot of dancing going on and I almost fall down -- twice.  All in all a good bar that's close to home (thank god!) with inexpensive drinks.  Sort of feels like you're in someone's home, but that's just part of it's charm.

8.description: This is a little local bar.They have a decent amount of televisions.  Round high boy tables with stools for seating.  This bar is set up with a few bar room arcade games and darts.  Very low key local bar for a relaxed night.  We had a pitcher of beer and left.

31.description: I've only been to Four Treys on nights when karaoke is happening. The place is usually packed and it's not laid out for a big crowd. The bar is at the very front but the karaoke is in the back. So everyone heads back there but a pool table takes up about 50% of the space. Still, every time I've gone I've had a good time and the drinks are cheap.

34.description: I'm a  big fan. I recently moved out of the area and this is the #1 thing I miss from Roscoe Village. That and Tony's Burrito Mex. Down to earth regulars & bar tenders, the owner is a sweet heart...its just hard to beat. It's a good home-feeling neighbor bar that you quickly learn to love. Plus, it's dog friendly! The only thing I put into question here is that Yelp says the nearest L track is the Addison Brown, when I believe the Paulina Brown line stop might be more direct, if only a block or 2 longer.

16.description: Four Treys is kind of like your pot bellied middle aged uncle who wears Hawaiian shirts all the time. He isn't going to impress anyone, but he sure knows how to show you a good time.     I'll admit I'm generally a guy who likes the large beer selection, surrounded by trendy hipster-ish art and fancy beer pairings. Honestly, four stars might be a little high but I always have a good time here.       Treys is the kind of place that probably looks like it did ten years ago and will probably look the same ten years from now. It's like your old room back at your parents place . Dusty old football helmets hang from the ceiling, there a large pool table in the middle and a dart board plastered to the back wall. You can buy a pitcher of Bud Light on a Saturday for what it would cost for a single beer at some of the nearby establishments. Moreover, you can sing Karaoke and bring your dog (except no dogs on Saturdays). This is the perfect place for a cold winter night when you and your buddy's just want to down a lot of beer without breaking the bank.        Also, it might not be the first place you think of for large groups, but I attended a great geriatric themed Christmas party that some friends of mine threw here. Overall, if you like dive bars then this is what your looking for.

13.description: I want to be clear: this place is fine.  Nothing awful about it.  Nothing great about it.  Their selection is fair, the prices are average, the atmosphere's okay, the bartender's a decent guy.I like what a previous reviewer had to offer about Four Trey's:"Being at Four Treys is like partying in someone's basement."Now, I LOVE a good dive bar, but here are the reasons I don't go back to Treys anymore:- There's no air conditioning (Which, last summer, for example, was equivalent to murder.)- The 2nd stall of the Ladies Room remained "out of order" for at least several months (Who knows how long it was broken before I started going there.  Is it still?)- They only take cash (Yes, there's an ATM, but let's join the modern world, Treys.)- They charge for soft drinks ($2.50!?  Ugh, that's a pain in the ass.)- They charge for refills of soft drinks (Come on Treys, get over yourself.)

11.description: Four Treys is ridiculous in the best way possible.First and foremost DO NOT come here sober.  Especially on a Saturday night after 11pm.  Being at Four Treys is like partying in someone's basement.  There's carpet, which always kind of scares me, wood paneled walls, tiled ceilings and decor consisting of light-up beer signs and Christmas lights.  It's totally freaking awesome.Best discovery for sure was karaoke.  I was in on a Saturday night, so I'm not sure what happens other nights of the week, but karaoke for sure on Saturdays.  Nothing says "Summer Rules" like wailing Welcome to the Jungle at 1am to a room full of your newly closest drinking friends.Beer prices aren't staggeringly cheap, but certainly not offensive.  Plan on shelling out about $4 for domestic bottles.  Service behind the bar was friendly and speedy.Finally, it's hotter than hell in this place.  A ponytail and a tank top are your friends.Four Treys is easily one of my new fave dive bars.

39.description: Witnessed:A dog sitting on a bar stool with his head on the bar. Knocked over his owner's drink with his paw. Cut that dog off, yo, he is crunk.A baby stroller. More than one baby stroller, actually.The bartender poured an extra shot into my bloody mary. Kudos to that.I would write more but I was as crunk as that dog.

37.description: Our little group came in on Superbowl Sunday (of all days)!  It wasn't too crowded so we brought our Golden Retrievers with us and had a blast.   (We work for golden rescue and did an adoption event in the neighborhood earlier in the day.)  The Bloody Marys were great, Colleen is a hoot and we'd come back any day with our pups in tow.  It reminds me of my uncle's bar in Bucktown many years ago (before it got hip, overpriced and therefore..ruined).   Hey - for those who think the dog thing is obnoxious - they have a sign right in the window saying it's a dog friendly bar.  Go somewhere else and complain.   We loved it and we shall return.   Maybe with more dogs to annoy Colin.

0.description: The diviest of dives, man. Cash only.  Dog friendly. No food except for a bag or two of potato chips hanging from the ceiling. Carpet that looks like it has lived 19 lifetimes. Dinginess everywhere.  Karaoke binders that carry a pungent sickly sweet swell of dozens of spilled beers. Basically, it's like a better-lit fraternity basement party, with slightly better drink selections.  And less PDA.   The front of the bar is where you'll do your ordering (I recommend sticking to hard liquor or bottled beers, as I've had taste issues with the draft sometimes), but head back to play pool or darts or claim a table for karaoke.  This is one of those bars that will be dead as a doornail at 10 p.m. and suddenly breaking the fire code 45 minutes later. It gets a good crowd, from 20 somethings all the way up through the occasional grandparent, and everyone is typically in a good mood (probably because you can feel comfortable rolling into this place in jeans, a hoodie, and Chucks, even on a Saturday night).  Drink prices are good, the guy selling tamales tends to show up right when you need him, and the bathrooms are clean enough to get the job done, which is of some comfort considering how divey the place really is. It gets hot in the summer, as the A/C struggles to keep up, so dress accordingly, or avoid it on the hottest of weekend nights.

38.description: A bar full of quirky neighbors, fireman and randoms, fine by me.  A bar that looks pretty much like a '70's suburban basement?  No problem.  Cheap drinks and relatively friendly service, certainly pluses.Low ceilings, too bright florescent lighting and kind of a stale beer stench in the backroom keep this from being a world class dive bar.

51.description: Wow, these reviews are hysterical!  I especially enjoy Corey S. who was complaining about $2 cokes.  To quote Back to the Future Part 3: "Water? If you want water, you go dunk your head in the trough out there. This is what we pour [pours a glass of whiskey]."  There's a Speedway across the street if you want a coke.  If you want a sterile bar that plays Coldplay, Riverview Tavern is just up the street.  This bar functions best for people who go to a bar to drink (what a concept!).  $2 PBRs everyday.  Friendly, funny staff & patrons.  Great place to play shitty Aerosmith songs on the jukebox & be silly drunk with friends.  Not the best place to take your parents or straight edge friends looking for a California turkey sub.

27.description: This is not a bad spot for a local neighborhood dive bar.  The atmosphere here is comfortable, friendly, and the prices are reasonable.  If you want good night of fun, and laughs, check out their Saturday Karaoke Night.  Cheers!

32.description: This place only gets 5 stars because they allow dogs to sit inside!  We watched a Cards-Cubs game here and were the only people there.  They don't sell food but do have a massive binder with menues from the area.  Found a local pizza joint that delivered to us bar-side.  Would have been fun if our pooch could have socialized with other dogs, but worth a trip back just so he can sit at the bar with us.

54.description: I wholeheartedly agree with the girl who said it's like going to the basement of someone you were never really friends with to begin with.  This place is lit so bright, it makes you feel awkward.  Simple mixed drinks are not even halfway decent.  The only good thing (?) is dogs are allowed to come in with you during the summer, when they keep the large door-sized windows open as well.  But even that isn't enough to keep me here.  I mean, it's not as if my dog would enjoy it any more than I would.

48.description: Seeing Deanna sing a Ruth Brown was the highlight of the night, and even though Four Treys was filled with a lot of loud bad singers, it was a great place to be with a bunch of yelpers.  Amy H.'s version of Bobby McGee was even better at Four Treys than it was at Brando's... twice in one week?  I'm a lucky girl. Cheap beers, good crowd.

44.description: reasons to go here:1 - $5 pitchers 2 - Kareoke3 - You can bring your dog before 7 pmreasons not to go here:It smells like a bar with $5 pitchers that you can bring your dog toThe jukebox was strangely expensive and was broken/turned off and ate my money

24.description: All the comforts of your parents basement, without the curfew!  Saturday nights at Four Treys are pretty much a guaranteed good time if you're into karaoke and pitchers of bud light.  The karaoke is well done with no dead spots - not missing a beat, the dj usually plays Top 40 dance music while you're waiting for the next stumbling American Idol to take the mic.  The crowd is friendly and you'll often see the same faces as it's a neighborhood place.  Drinks are reasonable and with $8 pitchers of bud light on Saturdays it's pretty easy to know what to order.  The only Saturday I would NOT recommend going here is during the Retro on Roscoe street fest.  Then they open up this back garage part (which normally is never open) and charge big bucks for cans of bud light (no pitchers during the street fest, wah wah wah).  BOTTOM LINE: All in all, on a Saturday night it probably has the highest energy in the Roscoe Village area, making it a good spot to wrap up an evening with some sing-a-longs.

7.description: Four Treys is a perfect neighborhood bar.  It's comfortable, friendly and cheap.  Can't beat that!

49.description: Corey S. wrote: "Townie bar with a rude staff and even more terrible customer base. 2 beers on tap (1 works), $2 dollar cokes, 3 jerks in cubs hats and sweatpants who continually refer to one another as faggot throughout their drunken attempt at pool, 1 shitty pool table, and a bunch of bent ass steel tip darts."Yes, it is all true. But 2 stars worth? No. Yes, it's a locals bar that puts local in locals. Neighborhood imbibers and drunkards call this no-frills bar home. With $2 PBRs and daily drink specials you would call it home too. I went twice and enjoyed it for what it was an not what I wanted it to be.

40.description: Look, I don't dislike the Four Treys.  It's an okay bar.What I do dislike it their garage.  You see, the Four Treys has a garage space in the back that they use occasionally for special or private events.As the Roscoe Village Street festival occurred this weekend, the Four Treys opened their garage to accommodate extra patrons.Here are my knocks against the space:1.  It was crowded.  It's a small place, and very cramped.2.  There were alot of jerks around, especially one dude in a Frank Thomas jersey who tried to grind with my friend while she was doing karaoke.3.  They only had cans of PBR and Bud Light, and they were charging 4 dollars a can.4 dollars a can!  For PBR!  What do they think they are?  Wrigley Field?

53.description: This bar is fantastic.  All of the bartenders rock, it's laid back and they have great specials.  Love the jukebox. It's a great place for day drinking.  Or night drinking.

30.description: I'm about to use a phrase that upon hearing it makes me turn and run away in terror because people who use this phrase are usually putting up a facade of toughness and taking pride in dumbing themselves down, neither of which describes this place, but I have to use this phrase because it's the best quick way of describing Four Treys.  Four Treys keeps it real.  If you're the type who prefers their dive bars not to smell like beer or to have garish neon then this isn't the place for you, but don't worry.  There are plenty of contrived faux dive bars out there where you can "slum it" without getting your hands dirty or having your tender sensibilities threatened. If you're the type who likes actual dive bars then this also isn't the place for you.  You won't find drug dealing going on here.  You won't have a toothless meth addict sitting next to you.  You won't have someone call you fag and try to pick a fight with you simply because they were across the bar from you while you were simply staring forward.  Likewise you won't have someone try to pick a fight with you because their girlfriend was sitting where you happened to be mindlessly staring.  No one breaks pool cues over people's heads here and you don't have to worry about being knifed.  You also won't get menacing stares from the regulars as you, a stranger, walk in.  The reason none of those things happen is this isn't a dive bar.Four Treys is a nice neighborhood bar with no pretensions.  There is no fancy decor and what decor there is wasn't picked to create an atmosphere or foster an image.  Everything here is formed to fit it's function.  The bar itself isn't fancy at all.  It's probably been there for decades and shows it's age naturally as opposed to faux dive bars that have new bars made to look old.  The bar is very functional.  It's there so you can rest your elbows on it and so you can set your drink on it during those moments when the drink isn't actively being drunk.  The chairs aren't fancy either.  They're styled to provide a comfortable place to sit down.  Your butt won't go numb from sitting on the chairs too long.  They're the right height so you're not towering over the bar nor is the bar towering over you.  The backs are shaped for comfort and they're padded so if you're tall like me you don't get a strip of wood digging in between your vertebrae.  They're there so you can lighten your load by sitting down and getting off your feet.  They're there so you don't have to sit on the floor where it would be impossible to rest your elbows and set your drink on the aforementioned functional bar.  This is a good old fashioned neighborhood bar which is a lot like sitting in your friend's basement in high school while his parents' are out for the night.  The staff isn't glad handed friendly, but they are sincerely friendly as are most of the patrons.  It's a wonderful place to go on a weeknight for some cheap drinks ($2.50 bottles of PBR, $3 shots of Jamisons).  Saturday is karaoke night with cheap pitchers of Bud Light and since the place is long and the karaoke is in back you can ignore the song butchers and still hear the people who should be singing.

46.description: Treys is a comfortable neighborhood bar, which just happens to be in MY neighborhood. Barkeeps are attentive and homey. They have paneling on the walls. So it feels like my childhood living room. Plus beer.

1.description: Pretty bummed about how down hill it has gone.  My friend Linny used to bartend here and it was a great little dive.  Had a grand opening party for a gym (local business owner in the neighborhood)and took everyone here afterwards.  Tell everyone how great, divey and friendly it is only to almost get into a fight with the bartender last night because he insults my wife and sister.  The guy put ice in my wife's drink (beer cocktail) when she turned around to talk to friends.  She politely asked for a new one and he got visibly upset and said some pretty rude comments.  I mean it's a drink you fool and she didn't ask for ice so why did you put it in there?  Apologize and give her a new one... Anyway kind of bummed because I have seriously been going here for years and really enjoyed how chill and friendly it was to drink here. Maybe I'll pop back but it's been going downhill with the staff for a while.The time before I stopped in the bartender was hammered and also kind of rude.  Unfortunately won't be back :(

55.description: "Chicago's best bar with carpeting."There are great times to be had at the Treys.  My roommate and I found this place about 5 years ago when living around the corner.  It was the closest place to get drunk on a cold winter's night.  That's about it.  Short on atmosphere.  Short on selection.  No food.  But Saturday nights...now I like Saturday nights.  Saturday night is Karaoke night, and my buddies and I have been coming here for years.  It's the kind of place we always seem to end up visiting after midnight when it's packed.  We'll storm in, tip the Karaoke DJ, and drink straight from our $6 pitchers until we can't feel feelings.  I don't know if they're licensed to do this, but they seem to stay open until about 3am or after.  Honestly, I can't remember if they sell beer that late, but I know I've left that late.Unfortunately, there is a drawback to drinking straight from a $6 pitcher of light beer.  Guaranteed headache on Sunday morning.Essentially, you've got a crappy bar serving crappy beer and people signing crappy songs.  The floor is carpeted (how many other bars can say that?), and the people are friendly.  I would have taken away a star for smokiness, but the State of IL took care of that problem.

9.description: Came here on Saturday night for karaoke and $8 bud light pitchers. It was a lot of fun! It was not too crowded when we got there but by 1am the place was packed with people singing and dancing along to the karaoke. We got there early enough so everyone in our group who wanted to sing got a chance to before things got crazy. This place is perfect because everyone is just out to have a good time and it's not too fussy. Many of the songs people sing at karaoke are freaking hilarious and are total throwbacks. I was a big fan of the guy in his late 20s who had an outfit and haircut that were straight out of 1996. Perfect addition to a place that feels like it is from yesteryear. I cannot say I'll be a regular at Four Treys but when people want to get loose with some karaoke on a Saturday night and get drunk for not much money at all I'll probably recommend Four Treys!

26.description: Colleen, you run a lovely establishment! Thanks for the tour! Can't wait to utilize the party room! ~ the other Colleen

25.description: Four Trey's is a friendly neighborhood bar that allows well-behaved dogs. I really enjoy the place. For the few crybabies on here who don't like dogs, stay out. The atmosphere is always enjoyable and having the chance to enjoy a cold drink with my dog means a lot to me. I fully recommend this establishment.

12.description: No karaoke on friday night, no problem, make your own.Met a friend and "local" here on Friday night. Totally our bad, we thought karaoke was Friday and Saturday (nope just Saturday) but we were here, so why not. The place wasn't particularly  full, but even if it was, I'm confident the bartender, Matt(?) Mark(?), would have continued to treat us like VIPs. He was awesome. Carried great conversation with my husband about The Grateful Dead, joked with my friends about the snacks behind the bar, and shared chocolate with us all!Great local pub with a homey vibe - almost like hanging in grandma's basement. Only negative is it's cash only.

59.description: I like the Four Treys.  I like it a lot.  It's a great place to hang out, play some darts, and drink a brew with your friends and some dogs.The bartenders are very nice, patient, and friendly.  The space leaves a little to be desired, but they've got good games, good seating, yet enough open space for pool and darts.The only reason that it gets 3 stars from me is that it has a very poor selection of beers on tap.  Compared to most of the other bars in Roscoe Village, it has a very poor tap selection.  Other than that, I really do like the place a lot.

21.description: Came here late night on a friday night. Seems like I should've been here on a saturday night, oh well.It's a normal neighborhood bar and it's cash only. There really weren't that many people here even though it was a friday night. The beer selection is as expected with some bells and sam adams. The Bell's sure was expensive though as it was $6.50 a beer. I probably should've moved onto something else, but I didn't.The bartender was cool and easy to get a hold of. Four Treys is more 2.5 stars for me and with it being right across the street from a friend's, its likely I'll be back here for a re-evaluation at some point. But, it just doesn't seem that four treys is my scene for me at least.

17.description: Did a little pre and post Retro on Roscoe partying here...didn't stay long and didn't drink much...but it has a fun, neighborhoody atmosphere. The witty chick that was tending bar when we arrived was hilarious. The downside, it was Africa hot in there later when the place filled up. No air conditioning I hear? Ugh...that's no fun. We had a table and the crowd was fun so I can't complain though. I'll be back...

10.description: Context is everything.Four Treys?If that's the case, then the other six guys in the game are holding four bedposts, four fins, four demons, four luckies, four snowmen and four cowboys, You walk into Four Treys thinking, hey, sweet, a few cold ones post-game after one of the Roscoe fests. I just pulled four of a kind. Yee-uh.And then the cards are shown, and you're holding a big time bad beat.That's the feeling you'll have upon a visit to Four Treys. Why?Because no matter how many pints o'black you've had at the fest, you're still going to walk into no AC, stale beer and vomit drenched carpet like you had in the party room back at the ol' country club in 19-, er, something and faux wood walls. Four Treys?I'm not even thinking Four Deuces.I'm just thinking a deuce. Singular. Fold.

5.description: Seriously, what is not to love about this place?! Karaoke, dive bar, cheap drinks, and feeling like you just crashed somebody's basement party in college. Staff and bartenders and friendly, and just a fun place to be. You really do feel like you're chillin in somebody's basement when you come to four treys. Love it. I'll be back.

3.description: I mean I get that it's cash only. Does that mean our service must be short and snippy as if you are an atm? I think not. 20 people does not a busy bartender make.

35.description: $4!  $4! No way!  This has got to be a joke.  Toto wake up we are finally in Kansas!  I am elated to find out that a bar in Chicago could possibly offer a deal this good!  And friendly bartenders to boot when does this dream end!  The 6 of us belly up to the bar and gradually commit to another bloody mary.  After all, this bloody is only $4.  How can you possibly go wrong?   As I entered the bar I told myself I'd switch to beer.  I had already enjoyed two heavy bloody marys at brunch and didn't think I was up for another.  After "Jeff" (sorry, I think that's correct) raved about his bloody I figured I must try it.  It was decent.  Worth all the raving?  Well, I like mine with a little more kick!  A lot more kick to be honest, but I demolished it in no time.  Unfortunately, the crowd was ready to call it quits so quit I did.  If I am back in the neighborhood I will definitely stop in!

19.description: Awesome place. Dog-friendly, affordable drinks and a killer comedy night on Tuesdays. I saw Hannibal Buress (Comedy Central, former Saturday Night Live writer, etc.) drop in at the open mic like a month ago. It was crazy! Come down and check it out!

28.description: Great staff, reasonable prices, never to crowded.  Plus, I can bring my dog?  Awesome, sold, love this bar!  Watched the hawks win here.  You can order food in from anywhere but reccomend the sushi place on Belmont.  Great jukebox, pool tables.  Karaoke Saturday's

45.description: I was stuck at about 3.5 stars for this place. It would have been 4 if I hadn't had my last experience there with a bitchy, rude waitress and when they were out of the Bud Light pitchers on special, she felt like substituting an $18 pitcher was no problem. Ugh.Some nights this place can feel a little too cliquey. We live about 200 yards away, so I wanted to love this place. Karaoke on Saturday nights is the most ghetto I've ever seen, but fun if you're with the right people. The crowds on Saturday nights also seem more fun and welcoming.Other times we've gone here and felt totally unwelcome. The owners live down the street from me and are completely awesome, so I know that it's mostly just the staff and the "regular" clientele. Still, I will continue to stop in when I want to drink someplace a little dirty.

33.description: Have been here many times for Saturday night karaoke.  It's always a guarantee that you will strike up a conversation with a fellow patron, or dance with a random group of Journey lovers.  I've never gone here and not run into someone I know, which is bizarre given that I've never lived anywhere close to Roscoe village.  It's just that kind of place.  Feels more like a party in my unfinished basement than a neighborhood bar.  The prices are right on par with this theme as well.

43.description: A great place when you are sitting around and don't want to get dressed up, but want to go out and have some drinks! it looks as if it could have been an old timers bar at one time, but now the crowd is either college, late twenties or sometimes office DB's!!! but good for a "NO where to go for a Monday bar"

2.description: 2.5.. Joint is dismal/ Strange Crowd and not much to see here!  Couple strange video games near the bar that seem popular?  Mothers Basement is the best description I believe.. Prices are average and absolutely NO WOMEN in this dump!  Just a good place to hide and tie one on... get dat did

18.description: All the comforts of your parents basement, without the curfew!  Saturday nights at Four Treys are pretty much a guaranteed good time if you're into karaoke and pitchers of bud light.  The karaoke is well done with no dead spots - not missing a beat, the dj usually plays Top 40 dance music while you're waiting for the next stumbling American Idol to take the mic.  The crowd is friendly and you'll often see the same faces as it's a neighborhood place.  Drinks are reasonable and with $8 pitchers of bud light on Saturdays it's pretty easy to know what to order.  The only Saturday I would NOT recommend going here is during the Retro on Roscoe street fest.  Then they open up this back garage part (which normally is never open) and charge big bucks for cans of bud light (no pitchers during the street fest, wah wah wah).  BOTTOM LINE: All in all, on a Saturday night it probably has the highest energy in the Roscoe Village area, making it a good spot to wrap up an evening with some sing-a-longs.

41.description: No self respecting Chicago bar charges $4-effing-.50 for a shot of Malort. and the dog thing is obnoxious too.I'm going to open a cat friendly place that has Malort on tap across the street and call it the Trey Fours. screw this place.

52.description: I don't get this place; sometime it can be one of the greatest places to go and the other time it really sucks. The bar tenders seem to only want to work just hard enough to get by. You ask one bartender for a drink and they say they do not have it, but you ask another bartender and they will tell you they do have it. I understand if you think you don't have it but the lack of effort and the fact that he was totally lying really has turned me off of this place. On the plus side Saturday nights are good and they are never really packed. And if you going during the day they let you bring your dogs in, which is cool if you are just walking around and decide you need a drink (don't lie it happens to everyone). I don't mind going here, but if I had a choice there are many other bars in the area that are worth going to a lot more.

50.description: I threw a party here last month, with the help of some other lovely ladies, and all I can say is that the owner of Four Treys and her staff are the nicest and most wonderful people to deal with.  They were accommodating and tried their best to go above and beyond the call of duty for us.  Thank you Four Treys Tavern!!

4.description: Four Treys was just the speed I was looking for on a Sunday afternoon. We had finished up brunch at nearby Black Rock and were looking to continue the drinking in a casual atmosphere. After turning down another bar down the street that was a little too in-your-face for us, we spotted Four Treys and stopped in.It's not much to look at, but you'll be greeted by the bartender and can find a decent selection of your typical bar beers. Be prepared for cash only; however, an ATM is conveniently located within the bar.Dog friendly! It didn't do me much good because we'd previously been somewhere that I couldn't bring the pooch and the weather was not nice enough to leave her in the car, but it's nice to know that if someone suggests meeting here and I'm worried about time that I can bring the pup.

6.description: I need to stop walking into this dump.The same shit-faced bartender streaming The Greatful Dead off his laptop week after week.

22.description: Four Treys is ridiculous in the best way possible.First and foremost DO NOT come here sober.  Especially on a Saturday night after 11pm.  Being at Four Treys is like partying in someone's basement.  There's carpet, which always kind of scares me, wood paneled walls, tiled ceilings and decor consisting of light-up beer signs and Christmas lights.  It's totally freaking awesome.Best discovery for sure was karaoke.  I was in on a Saturday night, so I'm not sure what happens other nights of the week, but karaoke for sure on Saturdays.  Nothing says "Summer Rules" like wailing Welcome to the Jungle at 1am to a room full of your newly closest drinking friends.Beer prices aren't staggeringly cheap, but certainly not offensive.  Plan on shelling out about $4 for domestic bottles.  Service behind the bar was friendly and speedy.Finally, it's hotter than hell in this place.  A ponytail and a tank top are your friends.Four Treys is easily one of my new fave dive bars.

15.description: The best dive in Roscoe and one of my top 3 favorite in Chicago! The best deals in town and friendly staff. A wonderful day drinking spot. I love that Four Treys is what it is. Not a boring, sterile, bar constantly trying to be hip, selling it's soul to the next Chicago trend. I aim to be as authentic and true to myself as Four Treys.... ... Wait a sec... Am I looking up to a bar as a role model? Sorry, Mom.

57.description: As much as I laugh when I walk in this bar, I can't get away from it. I come from a small town in central IL so waterholes like this feel like home to me; however, living in Chicago for the past two years, I've lost my roots for bars like this. Four Treys is dog friendly, cheap on drinks, and on Saturdays I can sing my heart out to MeatLoaf and other fun karaoke jams. One thing I was happy to see go away was smoking inside the bar due to the statewide ban. Prior to that, you could be in there for one beer, walk out, and still feel like you swam in a pool of ashes. Now if only they can fix the temperature to adapt to the weather outside, it would be grand.

20.description: went here for the first time last night. it feels like your in someones basement they have Carpet. most of the beer is Bottle beer but they have Bud light and Mangers cider on tap. they have board game you can play. if you come here During the week you can get 2.50 Pbr and 3 Dollar Jameson shots.  if you are by here i would check this place out

36.description: How have I not reviewed this place yet? One of the best neighborhood bars in Chicago. Located in Roscoe Village, the bar staff is awesome and very friendly. Owner is in the bar frequently and she's so nice. They have a great jukebox, pool table and dart boards. Locals love this place and you can always expect a good crowd when there's a Bears, Cubs or Hawks game on. The one downside...... Saturday Night is Karaoke Night. So unless you're a total pop-your-coller douche and like that sort of thing avoid this bar on Karaoke Night!

14.description: This place really belongs in Sisters Lake, MI, but I'm glad it's here. There's nothing fancy about it, but it has a lot of charm. The servers are friendly and everyone inside seems to have been friends for years. I can bring my puppy in too!

3.description: This place is AMAZING!!! I went to an EFT (tapping) group therapy on cravings and Jeanne was the instructor. She had a wonderful way of teaching tapping to the group and I truly found the therapy technique effective in "conquering a craving." She is very passionate about this technique, is extremely relatable and has a calm demeanor that is contagious (in a good way!). I enjoyed this presentation/technique so much that she came to my work to share with the rest of my department of social workers. I would highly recommend Tribe and especially recommend Jeanne. I would definitely refer others to Tribe and plan to check out all the services they have to offer!

1.description: Madge Lockwood's massage works miracles. She performed multiple modalities on my aching body. First lymph drainage: a soft relaxing massage which quickly put me to sleep. On my injured shoulder she had a special procedure to break up scar tissue. One treatment and what had been sore for years felt good as new! She's attentive and always on time. Her practice is giving your body real medicine. She is a true healer. I cannot describe in words the mental and emotional transformation that took place after a few sessions of working with her. TREMENDOUS! : ) ( :

2.description: Although it was Angie's awesome healing, wonderful massage skills that brought me here. The whole Tribe atmosphere is absolutely wonderful, warm, and tranquil. It is conveniently located for even an out of towner to find!I Highly recommend this place and Angie, as a fellow massage therapist and massage snob it is absolutely fantastic ( :

5.description: A wonderful experience here.  I like the healing approach to massage (as opposed to spa treatment).  Massage is a way to maintain one's health and at Tribe, they don't expect large tips (like spas do).  They would prefer you get regular massages for health purposes than engage in tipping.  That philosophy makes sense to me.

6.description: Highly recommended! I was hurting when I came to Tribe for my first massage with Erin. By the time I left, I felt much better and was completely healed a few days later. I've decided to schedule regular massages to keep myself healthy this winter. Erin is calm and soft-spoken, and she can give a powerful massage. The myofascial work was new to me, but seems very effective. I'm intrigued by the healing and learning philosophy at Tribe and want to explore classes there. Clean and beautiful atmosphere.

0.description: So grateful to find Jen Napoli here. She does amazing work with standard Swedish massage, as well as her specialty, shiatsu. She really cares about giving appropriate pressure and specific treatments to her clients, whichever modality she is using. She is always on time for her appointments, and she makes sure each client gets his/her full time. There are no shortcuts here, like you get with the massage chains. On top of all her therapeutic skills, she is a genuinely nice person. Seeing her is always a pleasure. Highly recommended!
