4.description: I followed my wonderful massage therapist, Jen Napoli, when she moved to Tribe.  The calm, clean and comfortable atmosphere puts one in the right mindset and Jen's shiatsu expertise left me feeling healthier and walking better.  I'll be back.

3.description: This place is just great.  I was first referred to this place by my good friend who knows what I collect.  This place if great.  If you are looking for a junk shop with cheap merchandise this place is not for you.  They feature very high quality antiques at fair prices.  There are many items you could find for less than $20.00 and if you feel like investing into something more substantial the restored antique radios are beautiful and all work.  Check this place out.  You won't be disappointed.  Also I was on public transportation and the owner packaged the antique fan I bought in a box with bubble wrap so I could get it home safe.  Thank you.

1.description: I love it when I find any place here with less than 5 reviews. And this is more of a rave for those of you who like old Zenith radios. If won the lottery, the first thing I would do (after freeing all the caged puppies ) is buy all of the restored stand-up Zenith radios at this place. They only run a couple of grand a piece! So then I would have to open up a boutique hotel and place them all in the lobby, or the bar. The jazz bar. And pump old jazz through them.They have other nice antiques here, and the brothers who run the place are very friendly and helpful. Fortunately, there are still a number of antique places in the area, which used to have more, and made a great antiquing destination. So you can still see some variety and do some damage to your budget on this stretch of Belmont. But check out this place and give yourself some time to browse on a cool autumn day.

0.description: I needed two floor lamps.  Only, I didn't want just ANY floor lamps.I wanted torchiere candelabra floor lamps, c. 1935-1945.Yeah, I'm one of those people.Anyway, a friend suggested this place may have just what I was looking for.When I walked in, I was greeted by the guy behind the counter.  I told him what I was looking for - and he said:"Well, check out what we have in the basement, there are a few on this floor, and a few more on the second floor."Good! He knew what I was talking about!  I ventured into the basement.Let me explain the basement:  It is essentially every basement in every Grandma's house in America.  There is stuff everywhere - including cob webs.  Though, this space is a treasure trove.  I found 2 lamps.  The sales guy happened to walk down while I was down there, and I asked him "How much?"  The price he gave me made me smile inside, and I didn't even counter offer.  SOLD.I did go upstairs, for "inspiration".  There they had about a half dozen fully restored and rewired lamps.  They were, sadly, out of my price range.When I came back downstairs, the sales guy had carried the lamps upstairs for me.  I rang out, and made small talk.  I was totally distracted by the dozens of AMAZING tube radios that were all restored and for sale.  I could have spent even more - but I was a man on a mission.After I rang out, I realized that I no longer drive a big orange SUV.  I know drive a tiny orange MINI.  But guess what?  Both 5" lamps fit in the car.For the past few weekends, I've been reading, stripping the paint of the lamps (one has a swirl agate base), and getting all the wiring and bulbs I needed.  This past weekend, I finished my little project.  The two lamps you see before you have been merged into one - and I found another one in a little shop in West Chicago.Hurray for Good Old Days!  I'll be back.  There are so many other things I need!

2.description: I was looking for a special gift for my boyfriend's birthday. I knew he had mentioned he wanted a globe and I was determined to find him a unique old one that would compliment the style of our home. I looked on yelp for reviews of antique stores in the area and The Good Old Days got great reviews and was close by. Within the first 5 minutes of walking in, I found the PERFECT globe. It was a great price too. The store is filled with cool things and I could have walked around for a few hours looking at everything. It has 3 levels jammed full of unique items that would be great gifts - or to add accents to a home. The guy who was working ( maybe the owner - he was a guy with a ponytail) was cool and helpful. A great place to go. I will be heading there again!

5.description: Wow... I can't believe this place doesn't have more reviews... but the fact that all of them have been 5 stars says a lot!I was "antiquing" with my visiting sister since I noticed a lot of antique stores on Belmont.  We were the type collectors groan about: we had no intention of buying, the trip was more of a museum experience with the possibility of a few small purchases. This is the best antique store on Belmont.This is the best antique store I've been to in the city.Why:The prices were reasonable.Their antique radios are rebuilt with expertise and respect.The layout... three stories, small rooms, all filled with no rhyme or reason makes antiquing extremely pleasurable.The man I talked to, presumably the father of the owner, was authentic and kind... but only as kind as he could authentically be.  All he cared about was cubs radio and the fact that his son, despite having his own house, still had his junk sitting around his dad's place.  The number one reason... the reason for 5, heck, 6 stars: an obvious dedication to Chicago history.  This place could be a Chicago history/bar memorabilia/cubs museum.  But it's not.  It's an antique store; you can actually buy, at reasonable prices, the pieces of Chicago history you, and the owner, admire.Note: I bought a (non antique) giant Fat Tire metal sign for $20.  I also bought an antique radio for about $7 (no, it wasn't one of the super fancy pretty rebuilt ones) and I've been totally satisfied with my purchases. Don't change anything, Good Old Days; you're perfect the way you are!

6.description: I know why there aren't tons of reviews...this is a great place, no one wants other shoppers to know about it!  I found great vintage Chicago pictures (building the bleachers at Wrigley) that were the perfect accent for our game room. The guys were knowledgeable and welcomed browsers.  If you see something you like, buy it because it won't be there next time, especially stuff in the basement.

7.description: GREAT stuff in here.  You must check it out.  Great prices, and lots of goodies.  Perfect for any antique lover out there.  Go, right now!

8.description: I absolutely agree with all of the other reviews of this establishment: Bruce, the owner, was great to talk to and the place holds a wealth of antiques--Chicago-specific and otherwise. The prices are definitely reasonable and the building itself is amazing--built in 1908 I believe he said. Books, furniture, pictures of music & sports celebrities, signs, SO great. What drew me in, though, were the original (and BEAUtiful) stained glass windows recovered from Bungalows, etc. I WILL purchase one of those for my new house!

9.description: Every time I am looking for a piece of furniture I go here first.  These guys run a great business.  It's a family business.  I like things that are made well and things that have a story.  I like a bit of history when I buy something.  I've bought quite a few items from these guys.  I feel good about spending my money here.  I'd rather spend it here than buy some junk that will fall apart in a few years.  Antiques hold their value.  Good Old Days has always had a good selection of items and they are priced very well.  Do yourself a favor and give these guys a visit.

10.description: Neat family-owned store with lots of antiques and bar room decor. It's a three story shop with tons of new and used neon signs, old black and white Cubs/Sox photos; pool table lights; tin signs; old radios, etc. We went looking for a neon sign for my Dad for Christmas and not only did we find the perfect one, but we were blown away by the sheer assortment of bar supplies and misc antiques. We spent nearly half an hour just looking at all the old black and white photos on the walls - it felt like a Chicago sports museum. Very highly recommended!!

4.description: I found exactly what I was looking for, however it was a bit out of my price range, but it was worth asking price (It was even more woth the negotiated price $40 lower than asking). I didn't leave empty handed, I found some great photos of The Worlds Fair. I will for sure go back! great place for stained glass, radios, antique signage and photos. Hopefully the table I wanted will still be there, and my boyfriend wont talk me out of getting it.

12.description: Love this guy! Price is great and he's a true artist.

3.description: A friend suggested I check out Goodkind Tattoo for my first piece big and I'm so glad I went. Rob is a really great guy and a fantastic artist. I had gone in with only a basic idea of what I wanted and Rob helped to take that simple idea and turn it into a work of art while keeping in mind what I wanted as a customer. He kept in mind the layout of the tattoo and gave me great suggestions for what would look good. His studio is very clean and the prices he charges are reasonable. I've been showing off my piece with pride and telling all my friends to go here if they want a really excellent tattoo.

1.description: Carolina is a rock star. This is one talented young lady. Her lines are clean, and her shading is amazing. I went in with a single photo and a general idea, and she worked with me on the sizing and the positioning and then added her own creativity to the piece. This is the second time I've been to Goodkind, but the first time working with Carolina. I intend on going back when I'm ready for more work.

2.description: I chose Rob to do my first tattoo after seeing his portfolio online. When I went for my consult, the shop was clean and he was very welcoming and willing to answer all of my questions. He took my tattoo idea, kept all the important parts, but then made it better than I had envisioned it. He always asked for my feedback at every step and  made sure I approved of the design, colors, size, etc. He also verified my price range and gave me an accurate estimate.He made the actual tattoo experience as comfortable as possible too. He was friendly and encouraged me to stay comfortable and relaxed and take breaks if I needed them. Most importantly, the end tattoo looks phenomenal, the lines, shading, and everything. It was an excellent choice for a first tattoo experience, and I couldn't recommend it more.

9.description: Nicest tattoo shop!! Showbiz did a sibling tattoo for us. He was so nice and patient. I've been to a few tattoo shops and they always come off rude and snobby. Not here, he made us feel welcome and didn't feel awkward the whole time. Clean lines, clean spot, and great customer service. This spot will be my go to spot and recommend everyone and anyone.

10.description: I cannot say enough good things about Rob and Goodkind tattoo. Super clean shop, friendly staff, the perfect tattoo parlor. Rob is the third artist I have been to and as long as he is in the business I will never go to anywhere else. His work holds up well over time and he is a master at color and shading work. I bring him an idea that's kinda fuzzy in my head and he presents me with a work of art better than my wildest dreams! Can't wait to go back in April for my next piece, I recommend  this shop to everyone and even usually keep a couple of his cards in my wallet as I am often complimented on his work.

4.description: I'm so glad I found all of these amazing yelp reviews, because they're all right. From the second Rob picked up the phone to the completion of my tatttoo, the customer service was above and beyond. (Unlike some other popular places in Chicago...) I called on Friday to see if there were any appointments available on Saturday. (When I decide I'm ready for a tattoo, I never want to wait.) Luckily for me, Rob said Carolina would be available and asked if I could pop by later that afternoon for a consultation with her. I went in and told her the quote I wanted, the placement I wanted, and that I wanted a Chicago flag  incorporated. I gave her artistic freedom to design the tattoo from there, and oh my god, did she deliver. When I came in Saturday, what she designed for me was 1,000 times better than anything I could have imagined. Her line work is impeccable, and the only way to describe her shading is bad @ss. I can't stop staring at my tattoo because I'm so in love with it. She also designed it so I can easily build off of this tattoo in the future if I want to add to it, which I do. I'll definitely be back when I'm ready for my next tattoo.

6.description: Goodkind Tattoo was the best experience I could have asked for in getting a tattoo! I went to get my second tattoo there in September 2012 (took me a freaking long time to get a Yelp account, I know) and they set the bar high for any future tattoo experiences I will have. I STILL rave about them to friends considering getting a tattoo and it's been over a year later. I have even considered going back to Chicago for any new tattoos, even though I live in New Jersey, because I trust and like them so much. Better atmosphere, talent, and prices than ANYTHING I have ever seen in NJ/NYC.I found Goodkind Tattoo because I was housesitting for my sister down the street from the shop. I knew I wanted to get a 2nd tattoo but had no idea how to find a good place. Luckily, Goodkind was already building a great reputation on Yelp and I decided to check out the shop. Rob and his assistant were so nice, they answered my questions and since I had come in with a few ideas, Rob talked with me and gave me his input. The day before my appointment he even called me to discuss the design again in a constructive way (he was not being pushy or trying to get me to change my mind at all, so no one get the wrong idea!!) and I really appreciated his feedback.The end result was breathtaking and every part of the process incredible. The after care instructions I got also seemed to speed the healing process. I fully endorse the anti-microbial soap and tattoo lotion they sell there. Also, since then I have gone back to Chicago to see my sister and stopped in to say hi at Goodkind. I just love that place and with something as permanent and personal as a tattoo, I cannot recommend a better artist or business than Goodkind Tattoo.

0.description: I found Goodkind on yelp and I liked that people said good things about the vibes here. I contacted Carolina only one week in advance, and I already had a tattoo design. I didn't expect that she would have time to help me, but she replied me right away. I showed her the draft, she told me that for the size of my tattoo, she had to simplify some lines. I told her I really liked the original design, and discussed how I wanted it to look like. She didn't get offended. She's really patient and fun. She's a real artist. I'm so grateful that because of Carolina, my first tattoo experience was amazing!!! I love my new tattoo!!

5.description: Robs work is phenomenal the last piece he did for me was finished over three sessions totaling 14 hours.  The finish product is a true piece of art and I get complements all of the time.  I will not go to anyone else for my tattoos.  I would recommend Rob to anyone looking for a tattoo.

13.description: Rob is absolutely amazing. He took my idea and FAR exceeded my expectations. The shop is clean, organized and totally bad-ass. Rob makes sure you see all of your sterilized needles and makes sure you are comfortable every step of the way. And as far as my tattoo goes...I absolutely love it! Rob has immaculate line-work and is very attentive to detail. Not to mention, Rob and his apprentice, Curtis, are super nice guys. I may be back here in the next year or so for another piece---I wouldn't want to go anywhere else! Thanks Rob!!!

11.description: Goodkind Tattoo is the kind of shop you spend months looking for.  Rob is super friendly and the workspace is INCREDIBLY clean (which is always reassuring to see when you're getting a tattoo done).  He is always willing to work meticulously with you on the artwork you want and is fun to talk to while you're sitting for hours.  It's not often you can walk into a shop without feeling intimidated by the grizzled veterans of the tattoo industry.  Rob definitely makes you feel at ease with the work being done and the time spent in the chair.  I can't say enough about how great the shop is, and could not recommend it any higher.  I plan on going back for my the rest of my tattoos.

8.description: Goodkind Tattoo is awesome!  I was looking to get my first tattoo which was to be a memorial tattoo for my grandmother who just passed away.  I shopped around to other area tattoo shops but all of the artists were cold and did not give me any artistic input.  They basically wanted to tattoo me with something that had already been done.  When I visited Goodkind, this was NOT the case.  Rob came out and introduced himself, shook my hand and listened to what I wanted to have done.  I initially was set on having a picture my grandma and I holding hands (just the hands part).  He tastefully told me "while this is a beautiful picture, anytime someone tattoos a picture of hands, the thumb ends up looking like a dick."  I definitely did not want this.  We began talking and I showed him a medallion my grandmother always wore.  He then grabbed a piece of paper and a pen and began sketching this beautiful design.  He saw exactly what I wanted and listened.  He hit every aspect I wanted to portray in my tattoo to honor my grandmother and I love it!  He also helped me avoid certain embarrassment by having a penis like look on my arm that I would forever have.Rob is a true artist and professional.  He made sure to talk me through over an over again as to what I needed to do to be sure it heals properly and that I don't get infected.  He also runs a very clean shop and ensures that you are comfortable all the time.  The price was very very reasonable too.  I would definitley recommend Goodkind Tattoo to anyone over and over again.  When I am ready for my next one, I'll be going back!!!

14.description: I have 6 tattoos that I have received from 6 different artists in 6 different cities.    Prior to deciding on this place I had looked at his website. I liked what he did with color and with flowers and because the tattoo I had in mind was going to be very vibrant and leafy, I decided to go by and check him out.    First thing I noticed is there are no tattoo designs on the wall, only the owners framed art. I liked this very much. To me, it makes a statement about the integrity of his art.    Second thing I noticed is the owners welcoming demeanor. He's not 'that creepy tattoo guy'. He made me feel comfortable to talk about what I wanted and has a way of giving his opinion and still letting you feel like your decision is the best decision. Later, as I was getting work done, I was able to witness how he treated others who walked in and it was exactly the same. Well, other than the jerk who seemed very upset that they do not do piercing in this shop.  Which again brings be back to the integrity of his art.    All in all I am very impressed. This kid is OCD clean freak. By far the cleanest I have gone to. Not that my other tatts  were done in back alleys or anything. They were all done professionally its just that this guy was noticeably cleaner.     As of now, I only have an outline. I am looking forward to completing it but I have a feeling it will end up an ongoing project for a while. I love what he has done so far and I am pretty sure that this will be my last and largest tattoo.     I really went with my gut since he is 'the new kid' and he doesn't have any reviews or anything. I am sure I made the right choice.   My husband, who has no tattoos, smiled wide when he saw Robs work on my arm when I came home. This was the best part.

7.description: Phenomenal shop! Kyle Adani has thrown down some killer pieces on me this past week. I can't rave enough about this shop.

58.description: It's a great night when you get excited when your phone beeps, only to  see that it's an email from Wingstop.  And then you immediately grow sad.  And then you try to remember why and when you signed up for the newsletter. And then you think, "If it was a good enough deal..."

56.description: WING DING DONG! WING A DING DING DONG. So I walked on the hard -mean streets of chicago looking for the best CHICKEN N GRAVY . Then I thought whoa dude what would barney fife do . Go to the krazy chicken place in chi city. WING STOP OH YEA I LIKE SPICEY. So I Grabbed my curious george rain boots and elmo umbrella and my mickey mouse gloves and walked 5 miles even though the sun was out I thought hmm maybe that rain cloud will come down on me. I finally made . the church bells rang and I was there . Chicken ,chicken cluck cluck .. I got a chicken wing n more wings sat down and licked the wings to death. Boy o boy glad i had my juice boxs with me those wings were one spicey meat a ball. 2hrs later i was still in the place licking my fingers.

29.description: I actually had to ask for a refund and leave without any food, which I definitely never do because I love food.  But after being yelled at by the cashier I just couldn't see paying $20 for my wrong order

42.description: I regularly go to the Wing Stop in Northlake and order either 15 or 25 atomic all drums. Never had a problem with them and they were always good. Last night I was driving past this wing stop and decided to stop in and get 15 atomic drums to go while on the way home. Turns out they wouldn't sell me just 15 atomic drums like every other WS was perfectly happy to do. My only option was to get the combo with the choice of a side I can't eat and a drink I didn't want. It is what it is and I asked for that. To my horror they tried to charge me close to $20 for them. I questioned the price and the owner / manager stepped in and was unbelievably rude. I walked out mid-rant and drove 30min out of my way where I asked for 15 atomic drums and paid less than $10 for them!!Not all Wing Stops are created equally and please to judge all based on this one. I love the atomics that Wing Stop sells but can't imagine what would ever make me go back to this place!!________________________________________Can't comment on a comment so this will have to do.Paul,My "facts" are in fact "straight" and I am not wrong! I stand by my comments and the accuracy of them. You may want to consider that readers of my review can check my post for accuracy. How much would a person have to pay for 15 atomic drums in your place? I would suggest that you seriously consider the possibility of opening a Wing Stop in Westmont. If it's anything like the one I went to in Chicago it won't last long. On the positive side the girl (don't know her name) behind the register was polite, helpful and friendly. My problem was with the menu and pricing.

23.description: The chicken does not taste tender. Sauce was ok.

47.description: MMM hmm mmm wings.!! I've tried wings from differents restaurants and let me tell you wingstop can't be compare. Yeah, it might be pricey but I don't mind since the quality IS there. :o) Customer Service - the young ladies are very nice and make you feel welcome. Food- Love their fries with honey mustard or ranch.Flavors to consider hot,cajun,hawaiian, and garlic parmesan. Atomic it's alright, stopped eating them for a while and now they're to spicy. In general Wingstop is awesome, I'm a loyal fan. ha.! :D

8.description: We had a pretty awful experience. First, we bought a groupon and had an ordering miscommunication. NONE of our order was covered by the groupon. So we bought the $18 groupon and then had to pay $30 for everything we ordered, which should have all been covered by the groupon. And when I ordered I told the person I talked to that we had a groupon BEFORE I started ordering and was never told that EVERYTHING I ordered wasn't covered by the groupon.So, besides the communication issue, the food was very disappointing. EVERYTHING was over seasoned and dry. We had the boneless wings, classic wings, strips, Cajun fries, and coleslaw. The boneless wings were the only thing we kind of enjoyed. Some of the wings were so over cooked and dry they were inedible. And I got a headache from all of the seasoning and salt on my lemon pepper strips and Cajun fries. And because we had to pay full price... We still have our groupon.It was not a good experience.

31.description: They always get my order right.Extra Crispy. Sauce on the side.I get the garlic parm and the honey bbq,and don't forget the fries!!My favorite wing place in chicago!

34.description: Wasn't sure what to expect given the mixed reviews but it was fine. Girl up front was friendly. Food was timely. Pretty similar to previous wing stop experiences elsewhere. Fairly close to home...will be back.

16.description: Hubby and I usually split the 15 piece wing combo for 2 with 2 flavors: he picks a spicy one and I always get the lemon pepper.  The wings are made fresh to order so be prepared to wait, but it's worth it.  The skin is crispy; the meat moist and tender.  So much better than BW3s.  The fries are nice thick cut, but have been soggy a few times we've ordered.  We sometimes opt for a side of carrots and celery instead.The staff are friendly.  Hubby was so happy when he was carded  thinking it was because he ordered a beer, but sad when it was because he used his credit card.  The cashier humored him.  We typically eat there to minimize the food getting soggy or cold.  It's a great place to  catch a game, or games running concurrently since there are several TVs.  Glad this location is just a walk away!

13.description: Decent wingstop!! Way better then the one on Pulaski and Belmont! Mellow restaurant always go with mango habanero!

11.description: Place BLOWS, be prepared to wait until you want to eat your arm off by the time this place delivers.  And they are not apologetic either... everyone waits 2 hours for food delivery right? NOT.

39.description: This location has good wings however you get less for your money than other wing stop locations. I am use to getting 10 pieces for a particular price and here you only get 8 for that same price!!!!  I felt cheated in regards to that! Also don't like paying extra for condiments that should come with wings ( blue cheese and celery)

37.description: I've always been pleased with this location. Friendly,fast service as well as great food for reasonable prices. Keep up the good job,guys!

0.description: I was craving wings, and this place came up highly rated. The service was great and friendly. They made the food fresh.I was a bit disapointed with how hot (spicy) the food was. The normal wings were just tangy, and the "Atomic" I would just call Jamaican Jerk. For the price I was disappointed.

38.description: OK Wings in a decent atmosphere...I love wings.  My wife loves wings.  My child will love wings.  WIth that said, Wingstop is not usually my first choice.  We snagged a Groupon earlier in the year and decided, why not?!  The staff was very friendly and gave us no issues using the Groupon.   The dining room was clean and had ESPN on 5 TVs...winning!We ordered 30 wings, carrots, celery, blue cheese dressing, and few sodas.   While most of our wings were Original Hot, we did try a few Cajun and Louisiana Rub.  Honestly, all three sauces were unique and quite good.  With that said, the wings are just so tiny.  One of our wings looked to have been taken by a disabled bird. Sauces good...wings eh....Overall, an OK experience.

51.description: Tried to place an online order. Now know how to start a Wingstop franchise but alas cannot actually get into your menu. Calling BWW instead for our hot wings fix, in this day and age if you want customers to order carry out, invest in maintaining a website that works!

27.description: Shitty customer service. Checked in thru Yelp and wouldn't let me redeem the 5 free boneless after the fact I just paid for a big order. Oh well.

32.description: We've had Wingstop from this location 3 times. Typically we order just the mild and we enjoy them. Last night we stopped in to order on their 60 cent wing special and we figured "Let's try some different flavors". I don't know why, but the flavors are really limited. Back in Florida the Wingstops offer 20+ flavors, but that's just a comment and I'm not taking off stars for that. We ordered the mild, hickory smoked BBQ, and Hawaiian. The order took way longer than it was supposed to, the service was lackluster, and the BBQ and Hawaiian wings were absolutely disgusting. They dumped the wings underneath the mild order so the sauces were mixing and it tasted awful. The Hawaiian (which is different from the Teriyaki) was just sour and salty. When you order a Hawaiian flavor anything you're expecting something light and fruity, sweet and instead this looked like something you left in the back of the fridge, gross. The BBQ had the same problem, it was supposed to be on the lower end of the hot range yet it was extremely spicy. It wasn't BBQ, Smoked, or Hickory tasting whatsoever. It tasted like a spicy and very slightly sweeter version of what the Hawaiian's tasted like. All in all, good deal but it's obvious you may be taking a risk if you order anything other than original or mild.

54.description: Best chicken wings in town.  Crew were the best, some remembers my name even if i go there atleast 1 visit a month.

48.description: Definitely the fast food of wings, and I only use that term with regards to the quality of the wings. Regarding the other, more positive traits of fast food -- costs and speed -- this place is definitely lacking. Here's the breakdown!Cost- Nearly $11 for 10 wings and a drink -- crazy. I'd pay that at Hooters or BWW because the quality is there, but for Wingstop? Naw, that's about $2 too high.Speed- From the order time to receiving my wings, it took probably 10 minutes. Once again, it comes down to quality -- if they were hot and tasted fresh, then 10 minutes is NBD. But they weren't. Quality- And finally, the meat-and-potatoes. Wings were of adequate size, but I've had bigger (that's what she said!). Parmesan Garlic was NOTHING like what I expected (something more akin to BWW Parmesan Garlic). WS's version was deep fried wings that were lightly coated in a "garlic" butter and sprinkled with grated parm... I mean, yeah, it was techinically "Parmesan Garlic" but maybe they should rethink the receipe. As for "Hot," I must've gotten mild by mistake, because there was barely any heat whatsoever. And the sauce was strange ... a little too thin, and as someone had alluded to previously, was a little too vinegary.There are definitely better places to go to get your wing fix.Oh, and Paul, just because Wingstop is the #1 wing place in America doesn't mean this place meets the other Wingstop standards -- nice attempt at covering your ass though!

44.description: Ok, so this is a chain restaurant, and I've only been to this particular one today, but I've been to three other Wing Stops in the past, and I'm assuming the food is pretty much the same, as it all probably comes frozen from the same vendor(s). So, I've liked WS in the past, that's why I keep ordering from here. My husband likes boneless wings, so that's what I've always ordered from them. They are great, love the sauces, love their fries, pretty decent and consistent customer service in all the WS. I like that they have an app and I can order the food with my phone then pick it up in aprox. an hour. So, tonight was Super Bowl. I really could have cared less. I needed food on my way home from work. When I tried to order on the app, they weren't accepting any further online orders due to Super Bowl. Alright, so I called them, anticipating the worst. I'm told 14 min. Ok, that's not bad at all. I get there, they are adequately staffed, and busy, but not super busy. Why couldn't I just order on the app? But whatever. The food was hot and ready when I got there, the staff was competent, and all that was appreciated.So, my husband and I are doing this whole low carb thing, so I decide to order the regular wings to cut down on the amount of breading, with a large side of coleslaw. So, now, the reason is coming that I am giving them 3-stars instead of 5. The wings were really terrible! The wings were super skinny with like barely 2 bites of meat on each little wing-ding. I've actually NEVER seen wings that small and skinny, and then frying them just shrunk them down even more and dried out a lot of the meat, making each wing mostly bone. So, I might have given it 4-stars and just said, order the boneless wings, but come on! The place is called WING STOP for goodness sake. A boneless wing is nothing more than a chicken nugget made from the breast, not even a wing. If your name says wings, your wings should be rockin'. I will continue to go there but I will ONLY order boneless wings. The saving grace, the coleslaw was super fresh and delicious. I gave my husband all the wings and sat and ate the large by myself.

24.description: The food here is ok, but I truly love most chicken wangs (wings), but the service is mediocre, not exactly rude service, but not friendly at all and they ALWAYS seem to forget something or get the order wrong. Also there should be a new french fry Togo container, a 5 minute drive from the store to the house and now you've got yourself some warm and moist potato mush. Thanks Wang Stop!

7.description: My boyfriend wanted wings so I was on a manhunt for a place that was new and that had decent reviews. Stumbled upon the wingstop. I got the boneless wings, half medium sauce, and half BBQ sauce. I also got fries with the order. My boyfriend was impressed with the BBQ boneless wings. I tried both and I thought they were really delicious. I think the prices were a little steep but then again this is Chicago and everything is expensive.The wing stop is a pretty solid joint. I am sure I will stop on by when I am in the area again!

49.description: Tiny / Small wings, over done.  a complete rip given the price..Have eaten at the one on north ave/milwaukee a lot and the quality there is MUCH better than at this one (not sure why - theyre all franchised?)

40.description: Great wings! Atomic is my favorite - super hot goodness. My wife loves the Cajun. I don't understand the negative reviews, but the food was solid and the people friendly.

53.description: Decent fill for wings

30.description: Hubby and I usually split the 15 piece wing combo for 2 with 2 flavors: he picks a spicy one and I always get the lemon pepper.  The wings are made fresh to order so be prepared to wait, but it's worth it.  The skin is crispy; the meat moist and tender.  So much better than BW3s.  The fries are nice thick cut, but have been soggy a few times we've ordered.  We sometimes opt for a side of carrots and celery instead.The staff are friendly.  Hubby was so happy when he was carded  thinking it was because he ordered a beer, but sad when it was because he used his credit card.  The cashier humored him.  We typically eat there to minimize the food getting soggy or cold.  It's a great place to  catch a game, or games running concurrently since there are several TVs.  Glad this location is just a walk away!

46.description: the best boneless wings ever!

1.description: This place was good until one snowy afternoon Dec 14, 2015 I called in for a pick up, picked it up, drove all the way home then found out, it was the complete wrong order. I had called them right away and spoke with a Manager  (don't remember his name) and he was nice and said that next visit there will be a credit for me. The manager got my info. I went in this evening Jan 17, 2016 after work and ordered a take out and told the girl that took my order, I had a credit. She got the manager,  and he looked at 2 different books and said sorry I dont see it, I can't give you a credit. I had then asked him who was the manager on the 14th of Dec? He then said I don't know....I said to him, could you look? He said no, then he said I would have to go all the way in the back to look it up... (like he didn't want to and that it was soooo far to go to the back and look) I held my tongue bc i didn't want to flip out and regret what I wanted to say out loud (the mnager looked like he was 15 years old and obviously has no customer service experience) welp, no more wing stop for me. It's a shame.

55.description: I have always wanted to try Wingstop. I am not one for restaurant chains, but who doesn't love wings? I was surprised just how clean Wingstop was and everyone there was nice and the wings came out real fast. It was an overall great experience and Wingstop is definitely a place I would go to again when I am craving some wings.I came into Wingstop early one Monday evening. I ordered the 6-Piece Wing with the Cajun seasoning, fries, ranch dipping sauce and a drink. The wings and fries came out promptly and they were hot. Temperature and seasoning. I did not expect cajun seasoning to have so much heat, but it was not overpowering. The wings were a bit small, but the chicken wings were moist and cajun spices were flavorful, but the ranch dipping sauce cooled the subtle fire in my mouth. The fries were great too. There were a lot them and they were doused in a cajun seasoning too. The overall meal was good and for the cost it was worth it too. Like I said before I don't do chain restaurants, but for Wingstop I would make an exception. Wingstop is an A-Ok place for quick and tasty wings.

9.description: The wings were burned and the fries. I bit into a boneless wing and my teeth almost fell out . They suck

26.description: I love wingstop. I just don't love this location. It almost never fails that I have an issue here with not getting something I ordered. I never do dine in because I have an infant and baby and eating wings. Meh, not so much. I either place an order and go pick it up or my husband does. I will say 9 out of 10 times they don't get us the fries we paid for or skimp us on the bones we purchased or leave out the sauces we said to include.  I always call and they tell me that their sorry and that I could come pick it up right then. Very convenient getting all the way home sitting down to eat and then having to go all the way back. I placed an order 2 weeks ago and got all the way home and no fries. I called spoke to the manager that not. He said he could offer me a 20% off my next order and that he would 'note my account'.. He didn't even offer to 'note in my account' that my next order I shouldn't pay for the fries. Since I didn't get them and PAID for them. I ordered today and went to pick up. I explained the situation and that they could look in my account to see the 20% off per the manager. They looked at me like I was crazy and looked in a book where that manager explained they logged all those issues. Surprise surprise. Wasn't in there. And after about 5 minutes of standing there he finally gave me the 20% off. I won't be back to this one anymore. Don't waste your time. Go to the one on Milwaukee.

25.description: Wings were ok. But do NOT done in. No napkins, unclean bathrooms, and less than sanitary silverware arrangement.

12.description: 6 pc. tiny tasteless wing combo was $10.58. You get better tasting crap at Taco Bell.

59.description: This is the best wing/wingstop location in all of chicago. The one in wicker park has been nothing but horrible service of 45 minutes waits with the place clear that made me never want to eat a wingstop again but this loation was my saviour. my last meal only days ago from order to eating was about 6 minute. now thats great service. Hot, delicious and plentiful, these guys know their wings

21.description: Staff at this location is slow, lazy, and rude.  Do yourself a favor and go to the location on Pulaski

17.description: The staff here looks like they did not get the right training. My order was all wrong and when I told them about it all they said was what do you me to do about it. Don't think I will ever go to that one AGAIN.

10.description: Let's talk about the fact that I just watched my entire order made by a person without gloves. Not only was he not wearing gloves, but he not once washed them. Same hands were used to touch multiple different sauce bowls that had not been cleaned In idk how long... His method of cleaning his hands you ask? By wiping them on his dirty shirt he was wearing. Of course I confronted the manager and asked how many people were certified safe to handle food. His response was 1. 1!!! In an entire shift only 1. Himself, now if you're cool with ppl who make your food and are seen seconds later with a broom in their hand then by all means this place is for you. Everyone else don't do it!

5.description: We ordered our wings online to avoid waiting at the restaurant. Wings were supposed to be ready at 8:35, it is currently 9:10 and we haven't gotten anything. What was supposed to be a 5 minute trip has been over 30 now. This is ridiculous.Update: total wait time came out to an hour past our pickup time. Order placed at 8:04, pickup time of 8:35, actually got food at 9:30.Update 2: ordered a family combo and they forgot the fries and buns. Thanks for nothing.

3.description: They've completely changed their staff and it's improved the food. Prices are getting silly though. Bummer

35.description: This was a very disappointing experience.  On June 15, 2013, they got my order wrong the very 1st time I was there.  I called to let them know and they told me they would put a note in their computer and that next time I come in I'd get the credit.  No time limitations.  I saved my receipt just in case.I stopped in today to redeem my credit.  I was told by the manager, Zachary, (or at least he said he was the manager) there was no note in the computer or in their  "books" and all he could do was give me 10% off.  I argued with him that it was not the information that I was given and I thought it was poor customer service.  I settled for the 10% because at this point my family was hungry.  When I opened my wings at home they were all dried out and burnt.  Sad that a place that's called Wingstop doesn't know how to cook wings and has bad service.This is my LAST stop at Wingstop!

19.description: They always get my order right.Extra Crispy. Sauce on the side.I get the garlic parm and the honey bbq,and don't forget the fries!!My favorite wing place in chicago!

28.description: Yeah.. Wanted to go here because of a few friends said they had good cheap wings. First of all their wings are way over priced. The chicken wing itself was small flavorless meat. You can tell they were frozen and not thawed right from the over cooked flavorless watered down meat in the middle. Whoever says this place is good.. Has obviously never had good wings before. Also the beer on tap was skunky. The people who work there were very nice though. It's not their fault their company has cheap shitty wings. You would be better off going to Buffalo Wild Wings for the better beer and atmosphere.

45.description: Really enjoyed the wings.  Cost is a little pricey but got my wings fast and was delicious.  A stop for any wing fans.

33.description: Decent wings. We stopped in here to pick some up after a decent amount of wandering around Mariano's and Unleashed (aka Petco). Their Monday special was 60 cent boneless wings, which was not too bad of a deal. We ordered the garlic parm, atomic, and BBQ. The food came out quickly. Everything was correct, and warm. I wish that they had packaged the wings in a plastic bag rather than a paper, but it wasn't that big of a deal.Then we headed back out to our "car" (aka iGo), only to have it not start. It was nice to have something to eat while we waited the two hours for the tow truck to come. The wings were crispy and tasty! I really liked the garlic parm.This Wingstop is a bit far from home, but it will definitely be a go-to place after grocery shopping. I mean, who wants to cook after all that shopping?

43.description: Owner is rude. Crappy Wing Stop..Period.

2.description: I'm a wingstop believer. Their meat is juicier and meatier than other wing competitors like BWW. Plentiful sauce options. Garlic Parmesan is my choice pick, but the bbq and hot are also really good. I haven't been failed yet, stand in ipen to trying others like their Hawaiian and mango habanero. Fries are Cajun but doused with sugar. Worth a try if you've never had 'em before, but I start opting for the rolls to pair with my wings. All other sides tend to be forgettable, but never bad. It's more a grab-n-go joint, but if you must stay, there are a few tv's (no sound), and a modest variety of bottled beer, including coors light, dos Equis, and corona. Extra plus: they're open til midnight! Honestly i mostly use the spot to make a to-go order when there's a fight to watch or something on TV, but don't want pizza

18.description: Lemon pepper!!! That is all.

41.description: After reading all the bad reviews, I was unsure about getting a groupon for this place but my friend and I used to always do wings dates, so I thought about trying some place new instead of our usual. We ordered the family pack with original hot, hawaiian, and lemon pepper, and two rolls. We were about to order some cokes when to our delight, they had beer on the menu. Yay! Suddenly the world became a brighter place.We sat down with our beers and there seemed to be nothing to complain about. Seemed clean and the service at the counter was nice. Our name got called so I went up to grab our order, even though the family behind us got their wings brought to them. Whatever- I know how to walk and carry. The napkin situation was a little off-putting because you had to tear some off a roll at the front. I know we are a napkin wasting kind of people, but it is wings, so we do want a stack of them.The buns were meh. The fries were good. Celery was crunchy and refreshing. The original hot was good- not as hot as I like- but good on flavor. The Hawaiian was not our fave- too saucy and not in a good way. Omg, lemon pepper. This is the one. This is my soul wingmate. Crispy with a zingy lemon and pepper coating, not saucy. Love it. Will be back for more of these for sure.

52.description: Wing Stop failed to deliver on fulfilling my wing needs for this weekend.  Ordering the garlic Parmesan was a mistake. The HOT wings were weak. I admittedly am a wing lightweight also. I don't understand the pool of grease in the container?? Gross.The only bright spot was the impulse buy of a couple of dinner rolls and veggies.A note for MGMT - Make your staff give out plastic bags for to go orders. Nobody wants their car to smell like garlic because the garlic grease mix leaked through a paper bag.I will not be back. BW3 is closer and better.

50.description: I hate reviewing chain restaurants, but I Iove wingstop and I haven't had any problems with this location. Just get the cajun wings, side of ranch, fries, and side of cheese. I prefer them over buffalo wild wings.

4.description: The food is good but the service SUCKS. No one knows what they r doing here. They over charged me and then lost my ticket, it took 40 minutes to get my food and I had a hungry 3 year old. The manager is clueless too. I won't come to this location ever again

6.description: Cashier had a bad attitude on the phone and when I picked up my order... Pfft BYE! Not to mention, the wing sauce leaked all over my car seat.. Way to go with the packing wingstop

22.description: The service here is atrocious. The food isn't worth dealing with the service. And where are the trash cans?

15.description: Great service! Jasmin was incredibly nice and the entire staff was very accommodating. Typically, I wouldn't write a review for a To-Go/Fast food place--but they really were that great. Plus, the food was great.Will be back!

57.description: I was recently visiting Chicago from California and stopped by this wingstop with my family and I have to say that it has been the best wingstop that I've ever gone to! I'm a huge fan of wingstop but I have to say that the service at this particular location was amazing! The employees actually looked like they enjoyed their job as they offered great service with a smile! Other wingstops that I frequent locally aren't as pleasant as this one was for me. If I could move this location to California, I would! :)

20.description: The portions are decent. The sauce is bland & way too heavy handed with the salt. WBW is still 100% better than this place!

36.description: Wingstop is overpriced greasy college food.  Overpriced wings that don't make you full and wishing you picked a different place for dinner after eating there.  Better boneless wings at the hot counter at Dominicks, haha!THIS REVIEW HAD TO BE EDITED because the owner wrote a comment saying assuming that I had something against COLLEGE STUDENTS!! Correction:  "overpriced greasy college cafeteria food". I do not have anything against college students - as I have post graduate degrees myself....so perhaps the business owner is reading this review incorrectly?  Again..."OVERPRICED GREASY COLLEGE CAFETERIA LIKE FOOD" (nothing intentional towards college students!!!).

14.description: I don't get it...I'm sick from eating this crap.  Now let me say this.  If I was 15 this would be 5 star eating.  I'm not so it's shit that hurts my gut so much so that if I could afford Bruce Rauner's insurance I would be in the emergency room in Highland Park.  So in a way if I could afford the trip this would be like Alinea in terms of price.

28.description: Come here if you like dive bars. We had driven by this gem for months before we finally stopped in and were thrilled witht the result. First, it was ~midnight on Sat/Sun night and had to knock to gain entry. We were the only ones in the bar, the waitress was generous with her pours and she politely watched us turn the joint into Dance Party USA.  Great little joint for a laidback (or otherwise) nightcap.

1.description: This is quickly becoming my favorite place.  Really attentive and friendly staff, that was nice enough to put the sound on for us for one of the March Madness play in games.  For being a small local bar, I am amazed at their large beer selection and even more impressed with all their cider options.  They even have $1.00 off all ciders on Fridays.

39.description: Quite the escape from the hustle and bustle of Ashland.  If you head just a couple of blocks west on Wellington, under the Metra tracks you find a hidden little gem called Millie's.  Now Millie's isn't for everyone, but everyone can appreciate the $2.50 domestic and $3.50 import bottles.  They have a beat up pool table and about the most jacked up Megatouch I've ever seen, but despite that the company was welcoming and the price was - well gourmet.  I don't think I'd say the same for the pizza, but hey it's a dive bar.  The juke box kicked out some pretty good tunes, and if you haven't stepped up to the 21st century they even have a pay phone - phone books too!  Stop in if you need a little back country bar fix.

9.description: Thanks for letting us in about 5 min before closing.  It was a great spot to stop in for a few minutes on a Friday evening.  Cute spot, good beer on tap and you can buy combos from behind the bar!

29.description: All the reviews below are misleading.  Millie's has recently had a new change in management.  It now has draft beer.  Also, it no longer opens at 6 or 7 AM.  Still, it has its locals. If you go in before 5 pm it is probably interesting.   At night though, the locals thin out.  It is a local non fancy watering hole.

23.description: Awesome bar! Pool, darts, pitchers, and pizza. What more could you ask for?

5.description: A dive bar in  the middle of a side street in Chicago hidden that I had not been.I made a late night  visit to this unique looking bar and was not disappointed. A small neighborhood bar in a building that has hosted bars like since 1776. Bartender was friendly and drinks seemed cheaper than in your other North side bars.

31.description: I dig it!I consider myself to be a low maintenance, low frills kind of gal and this is just my kind of place. Millie's is a non descript neighborhood joint in a quiet little corner of Roscoe Village. It's a dark little one-room bar with a pool table, internet jukebox and some video game in the corner. Drinks are cheap and they serve a little food too.If this doesn't sound like your kind of place or you like your watering hole chock full of bells and whistles - move along Millie's doesn't need you.P.S. Cash only

25.description: The quintessential dive bar.  I came here at 1 a.m. on a Sunday night, and there was an older woman bar-tending.   She was friendly, talkative, and interesting.  Turns out she was a retired nurse, who just wanted to stay working and around people.  She has been a bartendress (I love that word) at Millie's for over 16 years!  What a cool woman!  There were plenty of beers and liquors to choose from, and they also serve a variety of pizzas.  The place has a lot of character, and it's clean, so it's already ahead of most bars.  There is also some awesome Pabst Blue Ribbon art on the walls.  I want the Monster Pabst picture realllll bad.  I really liked this place and I will be coming back here again real soon.  I also broke my Schlitz cherry here, as we don't have Schlitz in CA.  I just got misty eyed.

12.description: This a neighborhood dive bar that's on a very quiet residential street.  I went to meet friends on Wednesday night, and we pretty much had the place to ourselves.  When I checked in on Yelp, there was a deal for 20% off your bill.  When I asked the bartender about it, she said the manager was trying to take it off and was weird about it.  But, then she was able to honor the discount.  Millie's is pretty nondescript.  If I was in the area, I'd stop in, but I wouldn't make a special trip just to go there.

37.description: The other reviews said it best, Millie's is definitely not for everyone.  It's somewhere between a dive and a corner neighborhood bar.  The entire place is very small, there's a couple tables up front near the Golden Tee, a decent amount of bar seats and a little round table in the back.  The floor, as expected in this kind of establishment, is worn out linoleum.  There's plenty of old brewerania about, including some things that probably out date most people reading this.  The wallpaper is the oddest thing I've ever seen, it has a fuzzy velvet design pattern on it.  The bathrooms are something straight out of the original days of this place.  All things considered, the place is very clean and well kept.The beer menu is nothing special aside from the cheap Bud tall boys and all around bargain priced menu.  I believe the tall boys at $4 are the most expensive thing on the menu.  Shots are similarly priced and the bartender will probably give you some free booze if you're nice.  The only food available are frozen pizzas and potato chips.  The pizzas are cheap and really hit the spot if tamale guy hasn't yet stopped by.  Yes, Millie's is on his route, this only adds to the validity of this tavern.For entertainment there's a pool table, old mega touch game, shiny clean Golden Tee and a really nice Internet jukebox.  And of course, plenty of great conversation all around.Millie's is one of the few surviving old taverns in this neighborhood.  If you're looking to see and be seen, you're heading to the wrong place.  If you're looking for some cheap beers and good times with friends, you can't go wrong.

21.description: Great little corner tavern tucked away in a residential area near the Metra tracks. The wife and I happen to find it when walking through the neighborhood and have been back numerous times. The owner's grandson has taken over the management and has brought in a great selection of craft beer for the type of bar and has great prices. They have also recently added larger windows in the front of the building so has added a lot more light and removed most of the dive bar feel. The patrons are a mix of blue collar workers that have been coming there for years and also more white collar people from the neighborhood. Has a coin operated pool table and free darts as well. Bartenders are willing to switch one of the three TVs to a sports game if you are looking for something specific as well.

16.description: What a dump but the beer is cheap.  Great place to drink when u only have ten bucks to your name.

17.description: The quintessential dive bar.  I came here at 1 a.m. on a Sunday night, and there was an older woman bar-tending.   She was friendly, talkative, and interesting.  Turns out she was a retired nurse, who just wanted to stay working and around people.  She has been a bartendress (I love that word) at Millie's for over 16 years!  What a cool woman!  There were plenty of beers and liquors to choose from, and they also serve a variety of pizzas.  The place has a lot of character, and it's clean, so it's already ahead of most bars.  There is also some awesome Pabst Blue Ribbon art on the walls.  I want the Monster Pabst picture realllll bad.  I really liked this place and I will be coming back here again real soon.  I also broke my Schlitz cherry here, as we don't have Schlitz in CA.  I just got misty eyed.

10.description: The quintessential dive... Can't speak for the food but they always have a great beer selection on tap and the specials are amazing. Awesome staff and cheap pool.

11.description: The quintessential Chicago corner/'hood bar with clean floors and windows. I happened past it a few days ago while walking the dog, took note of the name/location and we made our way back this past weekend to celebrate a few things...I bring  up the windows/floors only because when you think "dive bar" you don't typically think "ooo, natural light and freshly mopped floors." Actually, you also don't really think "cheap microbrews." It was absolutely everything I wanted it to be. . We rolled up 8-deep for an impromptu Saturday of day-to-night drinking foray and had an absolute blast. Comfortably settled into a table with a few locals nearby, and as the night wore on people milled in and out always contributing to the overall vibe. Never empty, never overly-crowded. One toddler, as can be expected...but they were well behaved. See, I'm telling you...everything I dreamed of! You see, this was our engagement party...decided approximately on our way to the bar with our friends. So, we put down our credit card and for about 5 hours we all drank beer, ate pizza and pretzels, played pool, darts and the jukebox...for around $200 all in with tax and tip. Not too bad, right? Ha...cheapest engagement party ever perhaps. I dig Millie's. It's not trying too hard, but its trying a little bit. A great beer selection (word on the street is they are always trying new microbrews), friendly bartenders, some drunk people snacks (the pizzas probably saved us a world of hurt), enough TVs to satisfy without being obnoxious and somehow by the grace of God, none of the Wrigleyville brohans/trixies have stumbled upon it just yet. And for that, it's a Roscoe Village win. Say what you will about this 'hood, this bar is definitely a shining star. Millie, will you marry me?

26.description: I pass by regularly when I'm heading to Jewel, and have always thought this place looked pretty sketchy. Boy was I wrong with that assumption. My roommate's and I visited on Friday night, more as a joke to go to the hole-in-the-wall bars around our apartment, and this place was an excellent find. The drinks were very well priced for Chicago, $3 for Sam Adams, Great Lakes beers, etc. It has a great selection of micro-brews, and is definitely off the beaten path.One thing is for sure here, you won't get your frat guy crowd that you find in Wrigleyville, or at some of the bars on Belmont. The crowd here is very low-key, and not crazy drunks. It's always nice to find a bar that you don't have to hear blasting music all night. We will definitely be going back in the future whenever we are looking for a cool place to hang out and not have to scream over the music to talk to one another.

27.description: I would always pass Millie's on my bike route. It's super secluded and looks kind of run down but that's like the perfect dive! I unfortunately was not able to ever enter because I was under 21. My ideal birthday bash was to chill at a dive and have a beer with a bunch of crusty old dudes, so back in August on my 21st birthday, after jamming out to some great tunes & hanging with a classy elderly gentlemen (I got the "Do you come here often?" line. Awesome!) at the Green Mill, I decided that it would be a lot of fun to drag my friends out of there and bike on over to Millie's.When we got there, my lock couldn't fit around 3 bikes so we walked into the empty bar and asked if we could keep one of the bikes inside. The bartender was totally cool with it. The drinks were dirt cheap. You get a lot of booze for little coin... and the best part about it was that the bartender was cool as shit! (Minus his taste in music. Live Kiss videos were being played the whole time.) The name of the guy escapes me, but he was fun to talk to and he was pretty funny with his lessons on "bar etiquette" for this first timer. He's also very customer service driven. Some buffoon came in and tried to start trouble with my friend and without hesitation, he told him to leave. Good to know it's not all about the money.I left drunk & happy, with money still in my pocket.I would highly suggest this place. It's fantastic. I have yet to go back but I think I will be paying a visit sometime in the near future!

35.description: This is a great place for a low key cheap night out.  As everyone else said, it isn't going to win any awards but it does its job.  Cheap drinks, jukebox, pool table and electronic bowling make it a good place to start or end the night.The pizza is really good with some of the hot sauce they bring out.

8.description: Great neighborhood dive bar.  Perfect for an afternoon happy hour - don't judge, I work from home - or great for a late night libation after a night out. What's more...when neighborhood residents are walking their dogs they can stop at Millie's for a dog treat.  Love it.

0.description: If you're looking for a low key bar in the city, Millie's definitely delivers. Millie's has a great selection of beers and also great specials every day of the week. If you love cider, stop in on Fridays for $1 off ciders! (They have a great selection) My friends and I came to Millie's on a whim on Saturday night during the Hawks game and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We were able to snag a booth for the 5 of us as soon as we walked in and order a drink right away. The bartender working was very helpful and walked me over to the fridge to help me pick out a cider she thought I would enjoy. After that, we were able to play a game of pool on their pool table where we spent the majority of the night. Other patrons from the bar challenged my friends and I to friendly games of pool and we stayed until close! It was a blast and one of the best bars I've been to since I moved to the city. Great drinks, great prices, great people and a feel-good vibe!

38.description: I agree with Josh S....not a place for everyone. I have even seen some people get turned away because they walked in a lil' too loud...ok those people were me and my friends but I would have turned us away too. When I went back it was good times. TALL BOYS OF BUD, and a jukebox that has some good music. The pool table is bumpy and the bathroom is kinda scary but for a dive it has GREAT PRICES!

20.description: The quintessential Chicago corner/'hood bar with clean floors and windows. I happened past it a few days ago while walking the dog, took note of the name/location and we made our way back this past weekend to celebrate a few things...I bring  up the windows/floors only because when you think "dive bar" you don't typically think "ooo, natural light and freshly mopped floors." Actually, you also don't really think "cheap microbrews." It was absolutely everything I wanted it to be. . We rolled up 8-deep for an impromptu Saturday of day-to-night drinking foray and had an absolute blast. Comfortably settled into a table with a few locals nearby, and as the night wore on people milled in and out always contributing to the overall vibe. Never empty, never overly-crowded. One toddler, as can be expected...but they were well behaved. See, I'm telling you...everything I dreamed of! You see, this was our engagement party...decided approximately on our way to the bar with our friends. So, we put down our credit card and for about 5 hours we all drank beer, ate pizza and pretzels, played pool, darts and the jukebox...for around $200 all in with tax and tip. Not too bad, right? Ha...cheapest engagement party ever perhaps. I dig Millie's. It's not trying too hard, but its trying a little bit. A great beer selection (word on the street is they are always trying new microbrews), friendly bartenders, some drunk people snacks (the pizzas probably saved us a world of hurt), enough TVs to satisfy without being obnoxious and somehow by the grace of God, none of the Wrigleyville brohans/trixies have stumbled upon it just yet. And for that, it's a Roscoe Village win. Say what you will about this 'hood, this bar is definitely a shining star. Millie, will you marry me?

19.description: I don't want to see Millie's lose any of its corner tavern charm, but they still deserve a nod for all their recent upgrades.  Renovations this summer saw the north all-brick side of Millie's knocked out and replaced with a window.  Once a dark haven for factory workers just off shift, Millie's has opened up in both senses.  Natural light has finally found its way inside, and it looks good.  Formerly a shot & beer joint, there are lots of craft beers available at Millie's now.  The draught selection is still limited, but there are plenty of bottles from brewery heroes both local and distant.  Millie's has long been a good off the beaten path place, and it just got better.

33.description: Millie's really shouldn't be listed on the Internet.  Not that it isn't worthy of reviews, but I think it might alter the space time continuum: Millie's is a time portal.  It exists in a place that's pre-world wide web, pre-automatic teller machines, and pre-banners that advertise $5 Michelob Ultras.  This place is the real deal. If dude from Dazed & Confused that said, "I get older, they stay the same age" went to a bar in Chicago, this would be it.24oz Budwesier cans.  A little pizza oven.  The jukebox plays Bad Company's "Feel Like Making Love."You might see a fight.  You might see someone light a cigarette even though there's a smoking ban.Great Scott!!

2.description: I love Millie's. I am on a cider kick and on Fridays ciders are $1 off.they have specials everyday of the week.I went in tonight july 4th and Kris the bartender had on the best playlist. It was my first time in Millie's and I felt like a regular. they have pool and arcade bowling.I think I found my neighborhood bar!

34.description: This is a great little place, but don't go here. The bartender is a doll, but you wouldn't like her. The beer is cheap, but not the kind you like.

32.description: The last time I walked in here, a guy started talking to me.  The term "shit-faced" would be much too kind... if I were to continue with the excrement analogy, this guy would be covered in poo.  Regardless, he was a local from around the block who told me he had been coming there for years.  He was with some streets & sans buddies.  He told me that Millie lived upstairs and watched everybody on closed-circuit TV.I attempted to make conversation for a few minutes and then sat by myself, had a couple of Budweisers and left.  In all, not really much to be said for it; it's cheaper than Cody's, but has worse selection.  If you're around and have a few friends, it could be cool to take over the pool table.

18.description: Free Darts, Pool, and a great bar. Maybe its the charm of this Roscoe Village bar, or perhaps just the fact that it is not like every other bar. It's homey feel makes you feel comfortable and at ease. The barteneders are kind and are more than happy to take your order. Their list is small and unique, but the setting is still quite alright. If you are looking for that neighborhood dive bar, look no further, Millie's is a great and high quality place to go to.

13.description: Making our way through our list of corner bars to check out in the neighborhood, my husband and I stopped in to Millie's on a Friday night and we were wondering why we hadn't visited sooner! They've recently remodeled and the bar looks great while still keeping some divey charm. Good beer selection, a pool table, TVs, jukebox, and friendly bartenders means that we'll be back!

4.description: Best neighborhood  bar ever. Friendly and gourmet. Great craft beers and cocktails.  Super friendly people in a cute, vintage atmosphere.

24.description: This place has to be the "Ultimate Hideout" !! Nestled in the middle of a Residential Area, you would never even know it's there unless you were looking for it.  This area used to me a "Factory Zone" and it once opened at 7am to cater to The People! Inside, really cool "Wallpaper" and other Rock Posters/ Old Bar/ Pool table/ Etc. Although they don't have a "List", I thought they had quite a few great beers on hand!! Lets say like 40 choices including "Olympia" and "SKA" True Blonde Cans, Love those True Blondes!  Foodwise--They Make Frozen Pizzas and have COMBOS--Enough Said.  Only drawback/ Comedy of the whole place is the "Mens Room".. it probably has never been updated and REEKS of you know what/ Including a BLUE TOILET!! Service is very attentive--Hide There! GTFJD

6.description: Nice little neighborhood bar around the block from me.  It's got a decent beer selection and enough TV's that its like my personal extended living room.  Lots of local folks come by and the occasional softball team from Hamlin Park.  They also offer a small amount of food (pizza, chips, pretzels).  Don't expect to be wowed.  If you're looking for a quiet night at a neighborhood bar, you can't go wrong.

22.description: I don't want to see Millie's lose any of its corner tavern charm, but they still deserve a nod for all their recent upgrades.  Renovations this summer saw the north all-brick side of Millie's knocked out and replaced with a window.  Once a dark haven for factory workers just off shift, Millie's has opened up in both senses.  Natural light has finally found its way inside, and it looks good.  Formerly a shot & beer joint, there are lots of craft beers available at Millie's now.  The draught selection is still limited, but there are plenty of bottles from brewery heroes both local and distant.  Millie's has long been a good off the beaten path place, and it just got better.

15.description: Love this place. It's right around the corner, it's cozy, the beer's reasonable, they have a decent pool table, and the crowd's pretty diverse. The bartenders are friendly and on top things, too, which is pretty awesome. There's definitely character here, which is a cool thing to see in a neighborhood that's turned pretty white-bread.I'd like it more if it weren't so cramped, and if the bathrooms were just a spit cleaner. I can deal with it, but those are the only things I see stopping it from being a 5-star dive. And thanks for moving the pool table! You read my mind, and I love you for it.

7.description: Great service by Val every time I go. She is hilarious and attentive to everyone here. She makes a great drink. I love the ambience of this bar! Everyone that picks music on the juke box is always spot on! If you're in the area, check out this place!

36.description: Everyone puts it right on their reviews. It is a Dive/Corner bar that is a hidden gem if you like character. This bar has everything you need: cheap drinks, a bar sized pool table, silverstrike bowling, and a jukebox. It is hit or miss for some people when the locals get a little too tanked and start becoming rowdy, but hey! its not "The Underground". If you are in walking distance and want a place to have a cheap beer or pregame before a softball game at Hamlin park this is the place! Word of Wise, they DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARDS. They have an old school retro register so bring the green.

30.description: I miss Millie's....used to live around the corner and happened to remember (after a 5 a.m. barshift and a few too many libations at home) that they open at 7 A.M. (!!!!) Mon-Sat (11 on Sundays, it's the law).  Generally nice patrons and cool bartenders, with a couple of notable exceptions, laid back atmosphere, the best '60s brocade wallpaper you'll ever see and cheap prices.  You can also get some really good, cheap bar pizza made in one of those lil ovens.  Cash only, though I think they do have an ATM now and they do have a good electronic (expensive-ish) jukebox, a pool table and they used to have a game table or two.

3.description: I am a fan of the dive bar which this is, kinda. A great corner neighbourhood bar, friendly staff and patrons.

14.description: Great neighborhood bar tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Belmont.  They have great beers on draft and a wide selection of bottles, and the best thing about the place was their $13 pitchers of Green Line every Saturday and Sunday.  Too bad they decided to get rid of that special--I told everyone I knew to come check it out specifically for that reason, and even brought people by from out of town.  I guess the new management decided to pinch pennies.But enough of the negative.  It's right in my neighborhood, has a nice mix of people, and the darts are free and real (plastic dart machines blow).  They also just got done refinishing the floors, but I hope they don't get rid of all the old timey feel that made Millie's a great bar.

58.description: I love wine, I may even have a slight addiction.  I used to live in Lincoln Park close to the mega supermarket of wine stores, Sam's.  I always found the sales people helpful there, but the experience as a whole somewhat overwhelming.  That is when I realized maybe I am more of a boutique shopper when it came to wine.  After all why should shopping for wine be any different than my preferred method of shopping for my other love, clothes?  Lush offers amazing tasting son Sundays, which are great for the obvious reasons, but what I really love about Lush is there wide selection.  While they have wines of all prices, they have a "recession proof" section where all wines are $10.  I am talking about juicy Malbecs, complex Cabernet's, refreshing Prosecos and light Roses.  Perfect if you like to entertain and keep the wine flowing.  The best part is they don't judge you for buying the cheapest bottles in the place week after week.

56.description: I really like good wine(who doesn't right?). Unfortunately I'm also poor(and cheap). That being said, I hit the $10 racks here and have never been disappointed. And the last time I was in there was a tasting going on. And let me tell you, they gave me 6 nice size tastings of some delicious Spainish/Portuguese wines. I off course didn't purchase any as they weren't on the $10 rack(but would if had the means).

29.description: Glad I came to Lush, I've walked by many times and never went in.  Great wine and beer selection, along with a few liquor/spirits as well.  The snack bar was fun- you take your wine over there and order a few things to nibble on in a really nice little cafe themed environment.  All the staff here are really, really, nice.  I will be back!

42.description: It makes any day better to stop by here.  Great selection, even for someone like me who just wants something inexpensive - they have two islands of $10 wines.  I know nothing about wine, and everything recommended to me has been fantastic.  And they keep track of what I buy so that when I really like something I can buy it again.  Fabulous!

23.description: Went here for a Pappy Van Winkle release the night before Thanksgiving 2012. There was also a Goose Island Bourbon County Stout release at the same time and only two people working the shop with about 50 patrons. Both employees (owners? managers? hobos? who knows) were totally overwhelmed and never mentioned that for the Goose Island release, you get in line, but for the Pappy, you get a ticket at the door (two different processes, not confusing at all.../sarcasm). Because there were only about 6 bottles of Pappy, the first three people that had tickets bought them up. Those three were there before me which is fair enough, but knowing the process ahead of time would have saved me waiting for an hour for nothing. Also, had they mentioned that process via their social media (which is where they announced the Pappy release in the first place), I would have gotten there much earlier to improve my chances of getting a ticket. All-in-all, a waste of my time for absolutely nothing, which could have been prevented by some basic customer service.I walked away empty-handed, went to Galleria by the Southport Brown Line and bought a cheaper bottle of Goose Island Bourbon County Stout.

47.description: Perfect

8.description: Really like this place. They have a nice selection of mid range wines (of course the more expensive stuff too if you're so inclined). I like stuff from cali and italy, and they have a good selection of cabs, rosso's, even a few brunello's good vintages and from some of the better wineries. They don't try and push the expensive stuff though, front and center they have a bunch of big bins full of table wines. They've also been very helpful everytime I've gone in, which quite often since I live around the corner.

31.description: We have been going to Lush for years to buy wine or beer and have made the recent discovery of the small lounge they now have next door.  The lounge area mainly has appetizers and small plates which go very well with the wine or beer that you can buy from the store next door (don't worry you don't have to go outside).We bought a bottle of wine which they flash chilled for us and brought it to us in the lounge area.  We ordered a couple of the small plates including the chick peas (amazing!) and the BLT (fantastic!).  The atmosphere is very casual where we just talked and drink and nibbled at our food for a couple of hours.  I can't wait to go back and find another bottle of wine and work our way further through the menu - perhaps taking a harder look at the cheese and meat plates that they offer.Highly recommend for a casual night out with wine and some great food!
