34.description: If frequenting Lush means I have a problem, then I think it's a wonderful problem to have.  Standing in front of the craft beer fridge, I get this strange tingling in my toes, a bead of sweat forms on the back of my neck, and my fingers twitch with anticipation.  What brews do I spring for this time?  It seems like Lush scores some rare and limited releases that other bottle shops only dream about.  Plus, they have an ample supply of '08 Founders Breakfast Stout that never disappoints (it's the best $6 beer you will get...ANYWHERE).  I've only purchased vino a couple times from here, each time on staff recommendations (since I don't know a Cabernet from a cabaret), and each time very happy with the selection.  The staff is super friendly, unpretentious,  and always willing to answer questions.  It can get a bit busy, but good help is worth the wait.  Some people jones for money, drugs, or sex.  I jones for Lush.

16.description: Love this place! Great $10 wine selection area, you can try a lot of the spirits and you can buy single beers and try something new without committing to a six pack. The staff is always super friendly and never pretentious.

13.description: This spot is a keeper!Sometimes you have to seek out a staff member, but everyone is nice and friendly.  The wine selection is great and the snacks are really tasty.  A great spot to buy some wine - and go ahead and open it and drink there while you're at it!

11.description: What an amazing place!!! Great atmosphere, knowledgeable staff and AMAZING snacks!  Cheese is very important to a WI native after all!  Will definitely be back again and again and again!

39.description: I was curtly told that I was not recognized as a regular customer, therefore I should NOT expect to be eligible for the "First come, first served!" CBS. I was also told that I was overly persistant. I am not responsible for the limited availability, it is uneccesary to be rude and impolite because you are experiencing stress. I did apologize for misunderstanding the post, but the interest in serving this customer was below the standard you pretend to maintain. Sorry, A thirsty and entirely disappointed with the "Attititude" former customer!

37.description: Well,I have to say this place is nice to have on a stressful Monday night. The wine Selection is extensive and the prices are decent. The staff is very nice and they keep a database of what wines you purchase and the frequency of your purchase. If you are in the area I would suggest stop by Tuesday-Friday and try their back lounge area. To put is simple I would come and have come back here often. One thing I would say they don't have is a certified wine taster like Binny's. All in all this a great neighborhood store.

0.description: Good wine nice atmosphere!!! That's all I need to say. Will go here again for the weekend night with my friends.

38.description: Best wine store ever.First, a suggestion to the reviewers who feel ignored when they enter the store.  It's true that the employees don't immediately approach everyone who enters, but all you have to do to get attention is walk towards the counter and look like you are interested in help and someone will offer to help you right away.  Same goes for the many, free wine tastings.When I have needed help, the staff is always so friendly and patient, whether I was looking for cheap wine for a bachelorette party or champagne for my husband's birthday.  When I tell them my price range, they often suggest something lower, showing me they aren't just trying to sell me the most expensive wine possible.They also have lots of interesting beer and spirits.  And, dogs are welcome in the store.  My puppy has joined me on many delicious wine tastings!I have been meaning to try the new snacks section.  One comment to the owners - please keep that menu stocked with vegetarian options (or at least non-pig for the Jews).  I've heard there are plenty of choices, but my fear of leaving hungry has kept me away so far.

51.description: FREE wine tastings on Sunday afternoons.  I was a bit skeptical at first, but it's true.  There is a new theme every week and the staff has a prepped list of descriptions for each wine that you try.  The staff is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic which adds to the experience.  They are extraordinarily helpful when selecting a wine for your taste and budget as well.  Hint:  If you go for a tasting, wear long sleeves!  They keep the store very cold.  I went on a 90 degree day so it felt amazing to me, but the staff and a few other patrons were dressed for late fall.  They frequently offer different classes and food pairings as well.  I hope to check one out in the near future!

27.description: This spot is a keeper!Sometimes you have to seek out a staff member, but everyone is nice and friendly.  The wine selection is great and the snacks are really tasty.  A great spot to buy some wine - and go ahead and open it and drink there while you're at it!

32.description: I've been back MANY times since my original review and every time has been great. The staff are very knowledgeable and super helpful. My favorite is that they have 2 shelves of featured $10 wines - half white and half red - for you to quickly look through and buy one to use for a BYOB dinner or party.This past weekend, a group of friends and I went to their Snacks lounge to celebrate my birthday. it was great! We each bought bottles of wine (they chilled the whites for us), then they brought the wine and some glasses to us in the Snacks portion of the business. We also ordered some food - a cheese platter, truffle oil popcorn, and chickpea bites - to eat while we drank and chatted the night away. We took over a large part of the lounge, and they put together two huge farmhouse tables for us so we could all sit together. The staff really are great!I highly recommend this place, either as a place to buy your booze or a place to chill with friends. I will definitely be back soon!

54.description: They do a lot of things right at this place.  Most retailers do not store the wine at a cooler temperature, but Lush does.  The layout is very elegant, and very easy to navigate.  A little section for each region, and a $10 bottle table offering some good deals.  I liked that there weren't the same old wines being sold here.  They do not make the mistake of selling stuff at a markup over what can be found at Binny's, Costco, and Whole Paycheck.  Obviously, they make a bit of effort to distinguish themselves from other retailers.  They seem to have a good following, and they are generous with offering a taste of whatever they might have open behind the counter.  I'll be sure to stop by for a bottle whenever I'm in Roscoe Village.

48.description: This place is AWESOME! They know everything about the wine in the store and can suggest something really good based on your taste.. and the first question they ask is your budget. They dont try to sell you a $50 bottle when you want a $20 bottle. Very friebdly too.. o yea.. FREE SAMPLES!  They have wine tasting nights and always have a bottle or 2 open for you to taste.  Go.. drink and be merry! :)

44.description: Oh how I love thee, let me count the ways...$10 bottle wine sections...Free wine tasting on Sundays (2p - 5p)...Wine glass chandelier...Knowledgeable staff...Fish net carrier...The huge LUSH sign with blinking lights in the window always call out my name when I pass by.  They also sell wine related trinkets and other gift-able items.  Two thumbs up on the chocolates they carry.  Street parking isn't too difficult.

24.description: Clip joint, look up the term, paid $66 for a $25 bottle of Lemoncello. Avoid.

7.description: I live in the neighborhood so I've been here a bunch of times and have always loved it. I actually had my wedding here last weekend, and it was perfect! Yup, both ceremony and reception. As a budget cautious bride, I only had about 30 guests. I'm the opposite of a bridezilla and wanted something really laid back but sophisticated at the same time. Phyllis is amazing. She is always super busy, but I put my trust in her, and she absolutely delivered! The rest of the staff was also great as usual. My guests had a great time and of course loved the booze and the food. I'm so glad I decided to have my wedding at Lush!

49.description: Fantastic selection of wines for reasonable prices!I needed a bottle of Prosecco for a friend's 30th birthday party celebration that would fit my budget and the knowledgable sales associate who helped me recommended the perfect bottle. Not only did the bottle she recommed fit my budget but I got to sample it before I bought and she even gift wrapped it for me as well.  Total score!I can't wait to go back some Sunday and try their free wine tastings and pick up a few more goodies for myself.  I gladly raise my glass to Lush Wine and Spirits!

40.description: Shortly after the American Homebrewers Association published their 50 Best Beers of America, I really wanted to track down as many of the less familiar brews on the list.One of the staff, some kind of Beer Jedi, went way out of his way to help.  He had taken the list I was carrying around with me to help me with my search.  He then proceeded to mark next to each beer whether they were seasonal, regional or attainable.  It was pretty damn impressive...he didn't miss one.  Without that insight, my local search may have never ended. Before leaving, they had found me a few of the "hard-to-finds", directed me on a more productive quest, and left me feeling better than when I arrived.

53.description: Lush has become my wife and I's go-to store when we are in need of a bottle of wine or two to take to a party or event. The bottles on their $10-racks cannot be found at any other run-of-the-mill liquor store and are generally very good bottles for the amateur wine drinker - while also on the low end dollar-wise.

30.description: Don't buy gift cards from here!!!!   I have been having the most difficult time trying to get the owner Mitch to honor the gift card I received from the Roscoe Village location.  When I first went in to redeem it the nice woman behind the counter told me that there was nothing on the card but that they have been having tons of frustrating problems with the gift cards.  Well after numerous encounters (and really unfriendly and accusatory even) with Mitch we are still unresolved.  I think he had problems with a past employee and he is unwilling to make up for his companies mistakes.  I have to say it is the worst customer service/ customer relations I have ever encountered.  I don't appreciate being accused of stealing.  So be very WARY.

46.description: So you know the 3/50 project? Where you find 3 local businesses and spend $50 a month supporting them (as opposed to a big box business or a chain that will survive without you)? All three of my local business last month were wine stores. My lips are permanently red. My eyes brilliant evermore with a champagne glimmer. LUSH has been there for me when I'm stocking up for a party, when I'm on my way to a friend's, or looking to fulfill my BYO needs. Great selection, helpful staff, and an all-around classy joint.

1.description: I love Lush! I've been here multiple times as it's so close to home! I usually drop by and pick up a bottle or two from their $11 selection. Their $11 wines are always fabulous - whether red or white!I love going to Lush in the summer when you can sit outside and watch the world go by with a good friend (or a few)!

55.description: Helpful and very friendly! Great lil place to grab a fabulous bottle of wine!

9.description: I love the whole idea and concept of this place, go in and buy an a inexpensive  bottle of wine they open and give you glasses and you can spend your evening here just as you would in a bar only less expensive!  Super cute and fantastic wine selection (and craft beers)!

26.description: Great selection of wine. They offer a $10 rack of white and red wine if you don't want to splurge on a pricier bottle. Cool event space that is open to the public as well as can be reserved for private parties. Staff is super friendly and knowledgeable.

25.description: This place is the mecca for me. We recently went to Lush in Rosco Village and had a fantastic time! This is one of the coolest concepts I know and I don't know why there aren't more of them!Oh, if you didn't know - the "concept": A liquor store and bar in one!With LUSH, gone are the awkward encounters with friends over how much to spend on a bottle of wine, or who wants to get beer, and who wants to get liquor. Just walk in and grab a bottle off the shelf and enjoy! It's really that easy, and the bartenders will help you choose some great bottles. What's more? They have a fantastic array of reds and whites for $10 - you seriously can't beat that.The snack bar has great food for you to snack on while you drink, as well. This place is great, however the Roscoe location has some specific rules, so I would call in to check and make sure that no one has rented out the bar for the night.

12.description: My husband and I rented out Lush on Roscoe for my 40th birthday.  We had about 35 people.  Pablo the manager was nice enough helping me plan, but kind of laid back and not as proactive as I hoped - I was disappointed that he didn't remind me the deadline of when I needed to put my food order in for the party, so we missed out on the beef tenderloin and lobster sandwiches. But he assured me that he'd pull what we could together for an amazing menu and night. I had no choice but to trust...Well, the night was amazing.  The food was delicious (we even had some of the tenderloin/lobster, they made it happen). The wine choices Pablo helped us select were perfect, and the service was incredible.  The staff walked around filling up our glasses and bringing out new food.  The kimchi/cheese sandwiches - incredible. Such a fantastic party. I would give Lush 5 stars but the planning had me worried. But as Pablo said, it would be great.  And it was.

59.description: Hands down, best wine shop in the city.  At least for me anyway.  The staff is great and the best part is their magical island in the center of the shop of incredible reds for $10.00.  You cannot not go wrong.  Pick anyone of them and you'll be happy.  They seem to switch them out every week as well.  The perfect wine shop in my opinion.

21.description: This place is the best!- Educated, cool, and super friendly staff! The whole atmosphere is so cool. great ambience and music. Awesome variety of wines with great price range!ANd now that the restaurant side has opened...OMG!!! I have no clue how many times Ive been! the food is unique, creative, and delicious!!Go Go Go to Lush on Roscoe!!

17.description: We took a wine class here led by the general manager, Pablo. It was fantastic!  We couldn't have asked for a better combination of great wines and interesting information. And we did some shopping afterwards - great selection at reasonable prices. The whole experience is highly recommended!

10.description: I love this place. The staff are incredible. Last night I had wine with a friend and we ordered their excellent hummus. When they packed up my leftovers they presented me with a nice fresh loaf of unbelievably good french bread to take home with it. Who does that? I am a regular customer from now now. Thanks Lush folks, for your delightful experience.

5.description: Love this place! We've lived in the neighborhood and stop in for wine all the time. My husband also threw a surprise 30th birthday for me here right after the tasting room opened and it was phenomenal. We recently went back during the week with our pup and sat outside for drinks and snacks. We bought an extremely reasonably priced bottle inside, were helped by the fantastically friendly Phyllis who fell in love with our dog, Milo, bringing him treats as we waited for our wine to chill. The service is a LITTLE slow, but this is not a restaurant and we were in no rush, so we didn't mind. I appreciated the time everyone on the staff took with us, even if it was making sure we felt like we were ordering the right cheeses. Note: the cheese and meat boards are GENEROUS. We ordered both and had to get a doggie bag. You should definitely try the chickpeas as they are addicting, too. We will absolutely be back as usual to buy wine, but this might be our new, go-to spot for awesome outdoor dining in the neighborhood.

3.description: Came here after the oyster fest was done on Saturday. Had about an hour to drink so our group of 7 bought a couple bottles of red and had a seat in the adjoining room. Such a cute place! Loved the wine glass chandeliers and overall dark and cozy feeling. There's a kitchen in there too and I could see  and smell some good stuff coming out to the other tables. Unfortunately they close at 11:00 so we had to chug the last bit of vino cause we were getting the boot (I swear we weren't rowdy) Didn't really understand why we were asked to chug when another couple in there was taking their time and still in there eating and drinking after we left....still a nice place to grab a bottle and enjoy.

35.description: Ok, after knowing I was a bit bitter after writing my last post. I decided to give the place one last try for a special Christmas present I wanted to buy. They not only reserved it for me when I called, but also wrapped for me. A+ on the Christmas helpfulness!

19.description: This place is the best!- Educated, cool, and super friendly staff! The whole atmosphere is so cool. great ambience and music. Awesome variety of wines with great price range!ANd now that the restaurant side has opened...OMG!!! I have no clue how many times Ive been! the food is unique, creative, and delicious!!Go Go Go to Lush on Roscoe!!

28.description: Fantastic wine selection with choices in all price ranges and friendly faces to help you find just what you're looking for.  Love their $10 rack for trying new reds.  If you're looking for a simple night out - head to Lush, grab a bottle or two in the shop and a table in the cafe next door.  Try the chickpeas (outstanding!), cheese tray and of course the croque monsieur...YUM!

45.description: oh oh oh oh...I can't believe I have never reviewed Lush.  This has been my go-to boutique wine shop for several years now.  I go when I want to find an extra special wine, and I go when I want a weekday dinner $10 wine--and I am never disappointed with their recommendations, their customer service, their friendliness.... in fact, I am always impressed by their consistency!  Aside from their great wine selection, their bourbon and beer selection is quite good as well.  I would advise you to go with an open mind and ask them to pour up something fun and exciting for you to taste...  yum.

33.description: I went to this place once a couple of months ago to get a bottle for a friend's birthday. When I arrived there was only one other customer there, with her dog, which I thought was kind of gross in a place that sells beverages and food. The whole place wreaked of wet dog as a result. Not a very good first impression. Two of the three employees there were talking to her (not helping, just talking, about neighborhood stuff, not even wine related), which apparently meant neither of them was able to help other customers.I wandered about for 10 or so minutes, trying and failing to figure out their system of organizing wine - by varietal? nope. by price? nope (in fact I couldn't even find prices on most of the bottles). No one asked me how I was doing, if I needed help, etc. Nothing. After I finally selected a bottle and put it on the counter, the cashier rang up the order without saying a SINGLE word to me. Not even a, hi, how are you. NOT A WORD!  When I asked for a gift bag, she huffily said, "well I already rang it up. Do you want me to void the transaction?" Oh, excuse me, I guess by not talking to your customers it just increases your efficiency! Rude! I said nevermind and got out of there as soon as possible. In summary: smelled like wet dog, and the employees ignore customers. No thanks.

43.description: Great wine and spirit store. The staff really know what they are talking about and great selection.

2.description: Overpriced by about 160%. Selection not that great. Service is fine but look elsewhere for better selection and value.

18.description: Went here for a Pappy Van Winkle release the night before Thanksgiving 2012. There was also a Goose Island Bourbon County Stout release at the same time and only two people working the shop with about 50 patrons. Both employees (owners? managers? hobos? who knows) were totally overwhelmed and never mentioned that for the Goose Island release, you get in line, but for the Pappy, you get a ticket at the door (two different processes, not confusing at all.../sarcasm). Because there were only about 6 bottles of Pappy, the first three people that had tickets bought them up. Those three were there before me which is fair enough, but knowing the process ahead of time would have saved me waiting for an hour for nothing. Also, had they mentioned that process via their social media (which is where they announced the Pappy release in the first place), I would have gotten there much earlier to improve my chances of getting a ticket. All-in-all, a waste of my time for absolutely nothing, which could have been prevented by some basic customer service.I walked away empty-handed, went to Galleria by the Southport Brown Line and bought a cheaper bottle of Goose Island Bourbon County Stout.

41.description: From one lush to another: Lush is the spot to indulge all your lushing, from beer to wine to spirits. And, with their free Sunday tastings, you can get ever-so-slightly lushed on the premises.I expected to find such a well-curated, intimate collection of craft beer (I did my research) but I wasn't expecting the shop to be so sleek and beautiful - gawd, you're gorg. And with staffers who know more than just enough to be dangerous, I was quickly smitten. I asked about the Boulevard Tank 7 Saison and mentioned how much I'd love drinking a cold pint from the tap. Right away, Mr. Know-It-All (in the best of ways) mentioned that Owen & Engine serves it on draft. Beer from this Kansas City brewery is notoriously hard to locate here in Chicago, and the mister nailed its mysterious whereabouts.Besides a fantastic selection of beer, Lush Wine delivers on their very name. Of course they serve vino justice! And not just the high-end stuff, either: There's a bottle in everyone's price range at Lush.Thanks for keeping me in my best (lushful) form. You'll certainly see this face again... and often.

52.description: This place rules!!! Excellent selection of wines for every budget.  The staff is the best, very eager to help and knowledgable!

50.description: Lush has a great beer selection as well, in addition to their impressive wine and spirits collection.  Many individual bottles of a wide variety, and style.  The staff is extremely helpful, and able to describe them perfectly.  I bought a bottle of sour Belgium beer.  It was outstanding, and unlike any other beer that I have experienced before.  They specialize in unique craft beers.  I am saving my pennies to buy the $24.50 beer in their case!  Supposedly hails from Belgium Monks, and was originally to be a liquor.  Well... it went all wrong and soured.  Have no fear, they saved it and the oak casks it aged in... and made this in to beer some how.  A little pricey for a beer... but I'm sure it is well worth it!  There are many other reasonably priced beers as well.  Go there - you will not be disappointed!

4.description: Came here after dinner down the street to have a flight of different wines. The nice things is this place has already grouped some employee choices and bottles under $12 for you. The staff was helpful and made some good suggestions. We also got the cheese plate and the popcorn to snack on. The popcorn was ok but the cheese had some great options especially the thinly peeled option. Overall a good after-dinner place to get cheaper drinks.

6.description: Totally sucked. Got suckered into buying their $10 a can sardines and tuna from Spain after seeing a guy on TV say it tastes so good. It tasted like Bumble Bee and King Oscar from Walgreens but at 6 times the cost.Check that, ZERO stars for Lush!

22.description: What a great concept.  It's a wine/ liquor store with an area you can eat and drink what you bought.  Very cute!

15.description: Oh how I love thee, let me count the ways...$10 bottle wine sections...Free wine tasting on Sundays (2p - 5p)...Wine glass chandelier...Knowledgeable staff...Fish net carrier...The huge LUSH sign with blinking lights in the window always call out my name when I pass by.  They also sell wine related trinkets and other gift-able items.  Two thumbs up on the chocolates they carry.  Street parking isn't too difficult.

57.description: I got offered to bring back my bloody mary mix that was all horseradishy for a bottle of wine. I did and the owner promptly picked out a bottle of pinot grigio for me after asking me what I liked and wrapped it up for me and apologized for the BM mix. This is how all business owners should be, what was a mediocre experience is now a rectified one and I am a happy patron and willing to go back and tell others about it too.

20.description: Lush Wine and Spirits in Roscoe Village is amazing.  The staff is very versed in wine and spirits.  Their tastings take you on a weekly journey of the wonderful varietal regions of the world.  Tuesday thru Saturday their kitchen is open.  Pick up a bottle of wine and go next door for tasty treats.  My favorite is the Caesar salad.  Lush is an awesome neighborhood go to spot.

36.description: I thought this was just a fancy wine store, so I never went inside, until my friend made me go with him.  It is really quite awesome. They carry all kinds of beer and obscure (to me) liquors.  They also have inexpensive wines.

14.description: My friend and I went here because she lives close by and wanted a cozy spot to grab a bite and have some wine.  We arrive after 6pm and we were greeted very kindly and asked if we wanted help with selecting a bottle of wine.  I advised the lady behind the counter that we are wanting to eat as well.  We were told that the "chef" is running a little late.  I'm not very concerned as this place serves mostly cheeses, charcuterie, and popcorn.  Well, an hour goes by and the "chef" is still not there.  It's 7:00pm and there's nobody there to pop popcorn and slice the meats???  We finally put our order in for food and we get our popcorn.  Over an hour later we get our sliced Iberico jamon (ham).  The "chef" felt the need to come over and tell us that he's unwrapping the Iberico ham just for us and it's very expensive.   (Um, I know.  We're paying $19 for approximately 2-3 ounces).  Nearly 30 minutes after that we finally get our fois gras croistinis.  All told, it took 90 minutes to get our food, none of which required cooking unless you count popping popcorn cooking.I don't recommend coming here for food.  Service is atrocious and the food as well as the wines are overpriced for what you get.

29.description: This is one of those reviews where I'm reluctant to say who the technicians I like to visit are, because I'm worried that they'll be too busy to see me! That being said, I like all of the technicians here, though Lilly and Tracy are my favorites. I notice a lot of reviews say that Lilly isn't friendly-- I don't think that is true at all! I think her lack of English and the fact that she isn't a naturally smiley person might make her seem not that outgoing, but she is very nice and cares about doing a good job. I'll also say that she is probably the most requested technician there, so she can be hard to get an appointment with.The salon is clean, they use great products, the ped chairs recline and massage, and the spa massage is great. That is my big recommendation-- pay the extra $10 for a spa pedicure. They use scented scrubs, do an extra long massage, exfoliate, put a clay mask on your legs, moisturize, use hot stones to then massage your legs, and then wrap in hot towels. It is fabulous and worth way more than the $10 they charge to upgrade. I've tried other salons across the city, but I keep coming back here. My no chip lasts the longest, the price is reasonable, the salon stays open late to accommodate customers, and they remember me every time I come. I certainly recommend it.

42.description: Best no-chip manicure ever! Love it won't go anywhere else.

23.description: Best deluxe pedicure!  Well done and very friendly!   I always have better luck here when I make an appointment.

47.description: This place is awful! Apparently, they are not prepared for crowds. I went there on Saturday and had to wait a ridiculous amount of time for a manicure. I received a quick manicure in which the paint bubbled over once dried. I also did not receive a receipt. I would skip this nail salon and head strait to the Wing Spot!

8.description: I got my eyebrows waxed here. Despite telling the lady several times that my brows were uneven afterwards ,  she continued to tell me that my brows were fine. I took a picture (while waiting for my nails to dry), which she told me was just taken at a strange angle. She would just not admit that she messed up! One brow is higher than the other (which she said was not possible), and much shorter (which she says is how my brows started out). My nails were fine, but the place is filthy and I won't go back.

31.description: Best Nail Place Ever! My old roommate introduced me to it when we moved in together early 2012. I just moved to the burbs and I will still go here. They always do a great job. NO CHIP MANICURES ARE THE BEST!! I've gone to a few different workers and they are all nice and good at what they do. Lisa is my favorite, she takes her time on my manicures and they always look amazing! I always get so many compliments on my nails thanks to Wonder Nails. I've been getting my nails done for 15 years and I have never found a place I like better then this. Def try it and get a no chip manicure with Lisa!

34.description: I have been going to Wonder Nails for several years- I don't know why I have never written a review.  I just got home from getting my nails done this evening and felt I should let everyone know how great this place is.  I always go to Lily and she is great.  She is funny and I am always so happy with my nails.  She remembers colors that I like and helps me decide when I am going back and forth between two choices.  All of the people who work there are very nice and when you are there, everyone smiles and says hi.  It is a very friendly atmosphere.  Pricing is great, the salon is clean, the people are fun.  Why would you go anywhere else????

16.description: This place sucks. Went last night and had maybe the worst pedicure of my life. The kid doing it, cut me at least three times with his cuticle scissors. Floor was so wet I almost fell getting out of the chair. All they do is try to upsell you on anything they can, woman clearly was annoyed when I kept saying no to her. They didn't even let me dry my toes --- they swiped my credit card and walked away. Awful awful customer service. I'm bummed because this place is super close to my new condo, so the convenience can't be beat; but I'd rather drive further to get better service. Will never go back again. Plenty of other nail places in the area.

13.description: Two stars only because my nails look good however terrible service inside. The techs were telling at each other in another language the entire time. My tech stopped and talked for almost 10 minutes about an intersection. He took 2 phone calls and rushed through my manicure. The nail salon is quite dirty and unorganized inside as well. I will be sticking to the nail salons off of roscoe and they are very clean, professional,  and always do a fantastic job.

11.description: The best nail salon I've ever been to!! I've been going there for the past 3 years and was never disappointed!! The staff is very welcoming and flexible, always ready for walk-ins, very clean and relaxing, and the best part is that they are very affordable! My favorite is Jessica, but all the other nail technicians are great!! Maher her you want a No-chip, regular manicure or Spa Pedicure, I can assure you it will come out great! I highly recommend it!!

39.description: LOVE. absolutely love love love....i've tried a handful of nail places in the city, all of which left me wanting something...more. something different...not wonder nails.my tech (which, unfortunately, i forgot his name! i'm such a jerk) was talkative, without being intrusive and annoying!i walked in and was greeted with smiling faces. they were really busy, but instead of having me wait in a chair to the side, they filled up one of the pedicure stations and let me soak for a few. which was wonderful! it's one of my favorite parts!the pedicure was extremely detailed, and he spent so much time doing everything. i've never been so happy with the way my feet looked!the manicure was just as wonderful. i always love the places that do little hand massages, and this is one of them :)and my favorite part of my visit to wonder nails: they did NOT ask, or rather PRESSURE me, about getting my eyebrows waxed. i absolutely HATE IT when i walk into a place for my nails, and they sit there and basically try to force a waxing on me. not only is it rude, it's offensive.but wonder nails doesn't do that. so win! i will be back.

37.description: I caught a fungus from here.  Tracy did my manicure and pedicure. For 2 months I was going weekly for a manicure and pedicure.  They do not serilize their tools.  Tracy pulls the tools she uses out of her pocket in her smock.  I questioned her about it and she seemed offended.  Couple days later I was in the ER.  I called the owner about it and she was so unprofessional.  This place is the worst.

0.description: Kelly is the best!  She does an amazing job on the nails and includes a wonderful massage.  The place is clean, reasonably priced, and has free parking.

38.description: Nice atmosphere, easy to walk in without an appointment. Lily is great for manicures (but doesnt do tips ) and I love the pedicures. The last 2 times I've went to get tips then to have them filled and wasn't impressed. My nails (the gel part) starting to come  off after only 2 days. I don't think I'll being going back for tips.

51.description: As a "long-time" resident of Roscoe Village, I am pretty familiar with most of the business around the area....as a woman who gets her nails done on a regular basis, I am even more familiar with the local "nail places"......Tucked "behind" the Western Ave strip mall tanning salon you will find the family operated..... Wonder Nails....Everytime I try a new nail salon.....(around my office, mostly)....I am terribly dissapointed and run (sometimes crying, sometimes bleeding) back to Wonder Nails....the service there is great....their pedicure massage chairs are wonderful (they recline)...they have a big flat screen TV....the inside is very clean.....and their prices are very reasonable....They have both male & female manicurists....and there isn't a bad one in the bunch.....everyone is gentle, accomodating and talented......(my daughter regularly gets hand painted designs that she loves...)I have also gotten my eyebrows done there and have been just as pleased.....So next time you're in the area of Roscoe & Western....and in need of a little TLC.....stop in.....sit back....and enjoy.....

27.description: Poor Service: The lady doing my nails was more concerned about watching the other women and everyone around her than doing my toes, she was constantly stopping and talking to the other women. A customer next to me dropped her phone into the water which is unfortunate but literally EVERYone stopped to help her. I'm sorry, but please focus on me during my time. Dirty: The washcloth that they wanted me to place my hands on or my manicure clearly had someone else's cut nails on it still, they do not change linens for every new customer. Kids: A woman had three kids under the age of 10 running between the waiting area and her getting her nails done for a solid 30 minutes, when not yelling or running, they were playing games on their phone with the sound so loud you couldn't hear yourself think. Management should have stepped in to tell her that kids were not welcome in a salon environment. Pedicure: My toe nails are getting snagged on my sheets just 2 days after they were done. This is reflective of a poor job.

32.description: Oh dear lord...why didn't I walk out 2 seconds after I walked in??? This place is filthy! I was so worried that I was going to get one of those crazy staph infections that you see on news stories about nasty nail salons. The guy that did my mani/pedi was rude. Really rude. He missed about an 1/8 of my left big toenail and the small toes on my right foot look like I did one of those quick slop jobs so nobody can tell that my pedi is trashed from a distance. My mani was jagged with lots of dust chunks under the polish. I asked the guy (I think his name was Benji) to fix it and he just slopped some more of their old gooey polish over it. No hand/arm massage. I was so happy to get out of that place. Ick Ick Ick!!!! Don't go there, girl!

48.description: I love Wonder Nails! I've been going here for years and every now and then have gone somewhere else closer to home but have always regretted it. They do an amazing job for both mani and pedi. They're fast, cheap and my naisl always look great!

44.description: Wonder Nails is under new management and I couldn't be happier to hear this. Everything from the decor to the employees has changed and it's all for the better. Good decision, Wonder Nails!

24.description: It was my first time here. Got a no chip French mani and was very happy with the results and service. Lisa did a great job. I'll be back! :)

7.description: I was looking for a salon that could do the most stylish nails designs! Jessica is able to recreate any picture that I bring in to show her. I'm very picky and particular about my nails and where I take my bi- weekly business. I realized very quickly that I had found my new salon! Forward one year later, Jessica is still Amazing!!      Best Regards,  Stylish Girl

49.description: I went in with low expectations, but walked out with some great nails! The women who work here are very friendly and do a good job. I even got a 5 minute hand massage that was extremely relaxing. My only complaint would be that the paint job was a little too close to my cuticles (I'm a little weird about that). I can't bring myself to use anything other than OPI, so I was very excited to see that this nail joint uses OPI products!I stopped into this place without an appointment on a Friday and they fit me right in. In fact, I was probably in and out in under 30 mins. Gotta love that! Not to mention, this place is cheap! Only 12 bucks for a mani and if you add a pedi into the mix it comes to a total of $32. Can't beat quick and cheap!

40.description: Been to a 100 nail salons and this the the one! It's tiny and you'll likely wait if you go in the evening or on a weekend but its worth it.It's very clean and not too tacky. I only get the no chip about once a month. They last that long, really they do. But I ONLY let Long do my nails. He is the BEST. I had a couple of manicures by Tracy and almost didnt go back. Now I know to just wait for Long and it'll all be perfect everytime.

30.description: This place is horrible. I get my nails done every week and I will never return. It was my first time and it was my last time. Stopped there for the first time  to take my daughter and a friend for a treat manicure because we were in the area and it was convenient. Little did I know what we were waliking into.Horrible people. From the time we walked in the door all they did was try to sell us services that we had not asked for. When we stuck to our guns and asked for what we came there for they became mean. Criticized the color my 15 year old chose. The man was actually mean. Told her she needed her eyebrows done. They gave us three horrible manicures and were mean too. To young girls. A 13 year old and a 15 year old. And we couldn't have been more polite.Shame on them. Never will we ever return and I have already told numerous people never to try the place even though we are all in the area with lots of time so spare all of the time because our kids have extracirricular activities there. Do not waste your money. Also the worst manicure I have ever had and I have one, as I said, once a week. Don't spend money to be bullied and abused. Don't go to this awful place.

46.description: Wow this place is the greatest!  They have a new manager since August of 2009, and my nails have never been better.  They take the time to do my nails the way I like, sometimes creative, sometimes a simple French style.  They work hard to do the best possible job and can be as creative as you like!Their $32 Pedi/Manicure is economical, and something everyone can afford, even in these tough times.  Very relaxing, very good clean-up, and they take good care of me.  Their decoration and soft music are so nice, and contribute to the relaxing ennvironment.  It's like a spa! I love this place and will come back again and again!

1.description: I've come here multiple times for a no chip manicure and spa pedicure and have always been pleased. Their spa pedicure is absolutely worth the extra few dollars. Every time I thought the technician was going to start painting my toenails, she would start another special treatment for the feet and legs. For real, there was like 8 different steps. You end up feeling very refreshed with super soft skin.The manicures are also good, but I will say I had 1 bad experience when I asked for a design. I showed them a photo of exactly what I was interested in which was really a basic straight line going across each nail. She then proceeded to freehand the design, and overall it did not execute as planned. The lines were really crooked. They are very accommodating to their customers though. For example, I broke a nail the day before coming in, and they were able to make it equal length to the others by adding the acrylic powder to just the tip! I had never seen that done before and was pretty surprised by how well it turned out!

9.description: I have been going to this place for the past 9 years. I initially lived in the city when I found the place but 3 1/2 years ago moved out to Park Ridge and still make the trek all the way there for their services. The no chip manicures typical last 3+ weeks. I am usually going in to have my nails redone not because they have chipped but because they have grown out too far to look good any longer. 5 stars for sure!

26.description: Best No Chip in the city!

25.description: I had decided on this nail place since it was close to home.  Originally, I thought it was great, they had a wide variety of no-chip colors.  Well after several trips, my opinion changed.  One time, the owner decided to do my nails... she left me with several cuts on my skin. OUCH!  I decided to overlook this unfortunate incident and go back one more time.... BAD IDEA.  This time, two manicurist were having an argument and yelling at each other.  I was attempting to schedule an appointment over the phone at the time and had to hang up because i could not hear the person on the phone.  Also, while they were arguing the manicurist was so upset she was griding my nails very hard and missed!  she caught skin and i pulled back... I was livid.  She then continued to yell at the other woman, while customers sat back and watched with open jaws.  Against my better judgement,  i still decided to tip the woman. She groaned at her $5 tip. Do not get your nails done here unless you would like the added entertainment of two women screaming at each other while NOT focusing on your nails.

12.description: Went here for the first time for my last acrylic fill. Lisa did a great job. My acrylics were bad around the cuticle and she clipped away all the ones that were messy or starting to lift and filed them down and filled it all. I've had them for 2 weeks now and they're all still strong, I keep my nails long too. I'll definitely be back, I'll try a pedicure as well next time. Prices are great.There's only 2 technicians that do acrylics (that I know of). They'll try to upswell you on gel polish or whatever and it's annoying, they're persistent.

21.description: LOVE!  I have been going to Wonder Nails for over 3 years and every now and again would try a new place for whatever reason and realize that no other place can really compare.I only let Long do my nails and he is wonderful.  He does the best no-chips and they last!  Every time I go to one of the other techs I get chipping or lifting within a week...  but not when he does them. DEFINITELY recommend..

17.description: Absolutely the worst manicure/pedicure I have ever had.  The nail tech cut my toe badly and poured blue liquid on it to stop the bleeding.  She touched the tip of the bottle directly to the cut and then replaced the cap, so I can only imagine that this same bottle has touched many cuts before mine and will touch many after. Disgusting.She tried several times to talk me into the more expensive pedicure or a no chip instead of a regular manicure.  Lady, you just cut me and possibly contaminated me with other people's bacteria (or your own - no gloves) - no chance you're up-selling me!  She also generally just did a bad job - nails not shaped well, she rushed through painting.  On top of all that, the place is filthy.  Will never go back.

10.description: Best no chip I've ever had! Lasts up to three weeks. The ladies at Wonder Nail are always accommodating and sweet. In three years of frequenting the salon for a manicure I've never been disappointed. I regularly walk in and only remember having to wait one time- it was particularly busy that day. Their pedicures are good too. Their friendly demeanor and great service has kept me coming back. If you only want a manicure, they get you in and out in no time and I appreciate that!

5.description: Amazing!!! Super Clean, talented women, Jenny, and Lisa are miracle workers!! Best girls day out of pampering ever!!

3.description: I have tried to this is place so mani opportunities but I just can't anymore. 1) The woman I had the last 2 times scalded my feet with the hot water in the tub. I made a comment and she was upset I asked her for colder water. My feet lady, not yours. 2) They always try to sell you something. I only want a mani/pedi. Don't ask me 6 six times about upgrading to a spa pedicure or no chip. Jeez... 3) UNEVEN... I hate to tell people how to do their job but the last 3 appointments my nails end up all sorts of shapes and sizes. I just want even nails.4) Once you're done, they're done with you. They'll move you to the drying station and you won't see them again. There is no plastic for your feet and no drying oil or spray. They seem annoyed when you ask. 5) Attitude. They've got it, get used to it. I just want a relaxing experience. Where can I go?

35.description: Ever since I  moved to Lakeview over 2 years ago, I have been going to Wonder Nail for my nails and pedicure and brow wax. It is the only place I will go for my nails, I am very loyal to them. I love the staff so much and have gotten to know them well, and I can say they really, truly care about their customers being happy with their service. I really like Lily for my pedicure and Tina or Jessica the owner for my nails. All though I highly recommend the entire staff, including Ben, Lisa and Tracy.  They are the only ones I will ever have do my nails!  They have a very wide selection of polish and no chip colors. There are also more colors "Galaxy" collection under the no chip polish display if you are looking for more colors.  Jessica the owner, is very welcoming and friendly, and always dresses nicely. I love them all. I will often bring in pictures I find of designs and Lily will do the design for me for my pedicure and Tina for my gel overlay. They work very hard to make it look very beautiful and unique. The quality of their  work is nothing short of excellent. Also love the convenience and location, there is plenty of parking since it is in a mini mall, and right next to Ultimate Exposure Tan, where I tan! Plus the salon is decorated very nicely, it's a nice and relaxing atmosphere. To address some of the earlier comments, I don't mind at all when they talk in their native language, if I want to know what they are saying I just ask them and they will tell me! It's a nail salon, the girls will talk and I enjoy seeing them every 2-3 weeks, or I will pop my head in when I go tanning to say "hi". The gel fill in lasts forever or until your nails grow for a fill, same with pedicure. All in all, Wonder Nail is my nail salon of choice, and I am a very loyal customer and really appreciate all of the time and hard work the staff has put in for me during all of my visits. 5 stars A+++++!

19.description: Worst. Pedicure. Ever. Wish I would've driven anywhere else. I decided to stop in after running errands nearby and boy do I regret that decision. When she was clipping the cuticles she hurt my big toe but made no apologies. Did it again on the other toe. I should've walked out at that point. Never had a "spa pedicure" last only 30 min, but I just wanted to get outta there. I had her fix her mistakes but still looks like I did it myself..while drunk. Do yourself a favor and never go in there. Terrible.

28.description: I finally found a nail shop that I love!! I happy to stop in because it was by my job and I saw it on Yelp.  The atmosphere was really nice and relaxing.  I got a no-chip manicure and an eyebrow wax and they had the largest selection of colors that I have ever seen.  My manicurist Jessica was really nice and thorough.  It was clean and very professional.  They were also busy and that is a good sign.  I am very pleased with my manicure, I plan on going back for a pedicure really soon.

45.description: I come here sometimes for their $22 pedicure. Under new management, the decor is nice compared to what was there before. But, I always get the same mean woman!! She is SO unfriendly. She has really bad skin (can't miss that face) and she just looks mean!  I've asked her name and I think she said "Lilly" or whatever American sounding name she tells customers is her name. Anyhow, I've asked her if she could trim the nail along the side of the big toe. I will get an ingrown toenail if it's not trimmed regularly. So, I ask - and she nods as though she knows what I am asking (have never had this issue ever at other nail salons) but doesn't do it!  Ugh. She just rolls through it, nothing special and she does the bare minimum. The worst part is after the pumice scrub on the bottom of the foot.  She takes this nail brush and very aggressively works over the top of my feet. Ow! What is the point of that?? Her leg/foot massage at the end is bad, too.  I guess I need to just pay $8 more for the $30 pedicure at 2x10 on Roscoe down the street.  All you are really getting here is rushed service, your nails trimmed and painted. No frills or kindness!

33.description: Stopped in for a mani on my lunch hour.  Not confident in the cleanliness of the place. Also, the attention to detail wasn't there with the tech who did my manicure glopping the polish on so that it wasn't even dry by EVENING!  Korean TV is NOT relaxing. $12 for a mani, so I guess you get what ya pay for.  I keep trying new places, and nothing compares to the quality I've found at Spa Nail City, up on Peterson and Pulaski.

43.description: I absolutely the OPI no chip manicure! My polish last on my natural nails for two weeks without chipping instead of one or two days. Do not let the lady in the Jade Hotei Buddha necklace do your nails. She is not as skilled as the other technicians. The OPI no-chip is a miracle product! The pedicures are just okay. I don't like how they try to give you used foam slippers, that's just gross.

2.description: Would I ever come here again? No. There's a few reasons why I would not.I got a gift certificate for Christmas and went with a friend on the Dec. 30th. She was going to leave me but I convinced her to stay with and enjoy a relaxing night of pampering. Now this is just to paint a picture for you... They tell me to pick a color, so I walk over to the wall with all the polish. I attempted to pick a color, but let's be honest here picking a color is one of the hardest decisions a woman ever has to make. After about ten minutes I could not decide (reason #1 not a very big color selection). My friend was getting a no chip and usually when I cant decide any nail shop i go to i can look at the gel colors,decide from there and then ask the tech for a similar color in regular polish. Then ask the tech if they have anything similar in a regular polish. My friend is done picking out her color so I grab the basket and start looking. One of the nail techs come from the front of the shop and specifically say(with an attitude i might add) "are  you done looking at the colors?". Now she had already been giving me side eye since i walked through the door and i told her jokingly "No i'm not". So she says "Well i need it!" Now the inner ratchetness almost emerged out of me but instead of causing a scene i rolled my eyes, said "well excuse me,here." and handed her the basket(reason #2). The pedicure was great and looked good. Now I asked for a full set of acrylic nails. One thing for sure is they are persistent with trying to up-sell you which can get pretty annoying. Now I also did notice they are not very sanitary.(reason #3) I've been to many nail salons who are much cleaner then them. Before she started I asked her "Can you clean up my cuticles like a manicure?" she completely ignored me, but kept asking if i wanted to upgrade to gel polish.(reason #4) Once She was done and i was able to inspect my nails. I asked for coffin. They were uneven and wide. The surface was lumpy. (reason #5)Then an hour after getting them done my middle finger nail breaks. Oh, i was livid! (reason #6)I go back in on the 31st which was a bad idea because they were packed. I wait for the tech to finish with her client to fix my nail and instead of taking the rest of the nail off and redoing it she uses the electric filer to file it down where it broke and just add the tip and acrylic. (reason#7)Now at this point because the same chick that gave me the attitude with the basket is still looking at me up and down sizing me up. I'm too the point where I just want to get the hell out! She then finishes the nail and tells me "don't mess it up. I'm too busy ok?!"(reason#8)Once I am waiting at the dryer for the nail to dry. I notice there is a clear line on the acrylic that indicates where she filed down and you can see where she was lazy and just added the nail tip. Then the polish was lumpy. The owner then came over and put the clear coat on it and made it a little better.(reason#9)Now I have gotten my nails done so many times where they last a long time or long enough for me to be able to get a fill in. Not even a week after that same middle finger nail broke off and at that point I am pissed off and just take all of them off.(reason #10)So NO! I will never come here again. Other then the pedicure being pretty. The polish didn't last too long. It did chip shortly after and I've never had that happen either. Everything is just terrible. That is all.

18.description: Poor Service: The lady doing my nails was more concerned about watching the other women and everyone around her than doing my toes, she was constantly stopping and talking to the other women. A customer next to me dropped her phone into the water which is unfortunate but literally EVERYone stopped to help her. I'm sorry, but please focus on me during my time. Dirty: The washcloth that they wanted me to place my hands on or my manicure clearly had someone else's cut nails on it still, they do not change linens for every new customer. Kids: A woman had three kids under the age of 10 running between the waiting area and her getting her nails done for a solid 30 minutes, when not yelling or running, they were playing games on their phone with the sound so loud you couldn't hear yourself think. Management should have stepped in to tell her that kids were not welcome in a salon environment. Pedicure: My toe nails are getting snagged on my sheets just 2 days after they were done. This is reflective of a poor job.

41.description: Very good gel nails. Excellent pedicures. I enjoy having great conversations with staff when I am getting services done. Not really an option here. It kills the time. It's not the end of the world though.

50.description: Sometimes, I get bored and put on gel nails. Now, I know that some people think that they look bad, but I feel like my hands look manly sometimes and I like to have them on. Wonder Nails is one of the best places to get them on! They are quick, efficient and there is usually no lifting! Unfortunately, the 3 stars is because the gentleman didn't make my nails short like I enjoy them and he cut me- twice. A little unacceptable. In addition, I've been here for mani's and they're definitely no frills with a sadly barely there hand massage. BUT, the color lasts long. Bottom line, Wonder Nails is a great fix, but not my #1 choice.

4.description: The no chips done by Selena are flawless each and every time! Everyone is great with pedicures!

6.description: First of all, this nail salon was kind not very sanitary.  Clipped fingernails/toenails covered the floors and I didn't see ANYTHING disinfected.  Uh, ew?As far as the mani/pedi goes, this one was the most painful one I've experienced.  The technician cut up my cuticles and I'm pretty sure I'm going to end up with an ingrown toenail :(  Also, when I put my hands under the UV lights (I got a no-chip shellac manicure) it STUNG.  The french manicure looked nice enough, and so did my pedicure.  That counts for something.  However, it was not worth the price I paid for it.  Would not recommend going there.

22.description: Went here for the first time for my last acrylic fill. Lisa did a great job. My acrylics were bad around the cuticle and she clipped away all the ones that were messy or starting to lift and filed them down and filled it all. I've had them for 2 weeks now and they're all still strong, I keep my nails long too. I'll definitely be back, I'll try a pedicure as well next time. Prices are great.There's only 2 technicians that do acrylics (that I know of). They'll try to upswell you on gel polish or whatever and it's annoying, they're persistent.

15.description: I went in here with a coworker about a week and a half and to be honest the experience was horrible. The first issue that i experience was that the lady that was doing my pedicure did not cover the side area to get off the chair of all water and i experience a horrible fall. Cause of this fall i ended up extremely bruised and sore (the whole reason for the trip to begin with was to relax ). Then the lady decided to pick two different colors when i stated i wanted matching in the first place. Then she decided that because i selected opi for my toes i had to get gelish because it was the same thing. I told her i wanted opi and she was not happy with me. She complained the whole time about opi in her dialect to a nearby coworker while she was doing my nails. Thats poor customer service when you are complaining about your customer the whole time in their face in your language, just an fyi for the owner. And to top everything off decided to charge me 72 freaking dollars. The no chip that i got from there only lasted a week and it started to chip bad after that. Waste of money, poor service and negligence of the employees is what is going to kept me away from this business.

20.description: Absolutely the worst manicure/pedicure I have ever had.  The nail tech cut my toe badly and poured blue liquid on it to stop the bleeding.  She touched the tip of the bottle directly to the cut and then replaced the cap, so I can only imagine that this same bottle has touched many cuts before mine and will touch many after. Disgusting.She tried several times to talk me into the more expensive pedicure or a no chip instead of a regular manicure.  Lady, you just cut me and possibly contaminated me with other people's bacteria (or your own - no gloves) - no chance you're up-selling me!  She also generally just did a bad job - nails not shaped well, she rushed through painting.  On top of all that, the place is filthy.  Will never go back.

36.description: I'm way over due for writing this update, but I was going through my old reviews and remembered my horrible LAST experience at Wonder Nails. I had gone to the same guy a few times in a row, and it wasn't really for anything else besides him being the only one available. I made a last minute decision to walk in and see if they had anyone open for a Shellac and pedicure. There was another guy open and got me started right away. My previous nail tech walked by, gave me a dirty look, and mumbled something about not booking my appointment with him. From that point on, the guy doing my pedi/shellac was rude and gave a horrible service. My shellac actually peeled off that very night. I'm pretty sure my pedicure lasted a total of 2 days. Needless to say, I didn't ever go back there. They do great work until you piss one of them off then all bets are off. Good luck!

14.description: I have been going to Wonder Nails for approximately ten months!! I have had my nails done by various technicians...all are great and professional!!  However Lily is the best!!!!! Jessica the owner is awesome as well!! Clean snd nicely decorated!!

58.description: Delicious, just the pick me up I needed for lunch. Casual setting with only 10 stools, its a small and cozy environment. I would recommend take out but there are two locations and this one is a little smaller than the one on Armitage.Now for the food, I ordered the Bistec De Palomilla which is a steak type item with onions, tomatoes, lettuce, some sauce, with I think plantain chips. Great for a light/medium lunch. The sandwich itself was good but a little stiff, my jaw felt like I was working it out cause I had to bite the tough bread, otherwise it went down happily.Not sure what authentic Cuban food is but this one def was tasty. Would recommend.

56.description: What can one say, the food is good, not out of this world but good.  Like a theme restaurant they try to convince you its Key West inside with a run down interior (oh, that was on purpose?) and an unpaved dining patio floor and chairs and tables that rock.But when its 20 degrees outside and there is 3 feet of snow on the sidewalks there is no way you'll believe its Key West.  So food was good, ambiance was something to be ignored.  But the waitstaff was excellent, eager and attentive it made dining there a pleasure.

29.description: Best Cuban I've ever had in my life! Better than any Cuban place I could find in Miami so that's really saying something. So do your taste buds a favor and take yourself here!! Try the coffee and Plantine Sandwhich absolute musts

42.description: In response to the owner stating dogs must be outside the sidewalk cafe on a leash, I researched the claim and its unfounded.  According to the City Of Chicago Sidewalk Cafe rules and regulations section III Operation, subsection L states that "Dogs are allowed within the Sidewalk Cafe if it is accessible from the street."cityofchicago.org/conten…

23.description: Really nice place, nice service, tasty tostones and yuca frita. So so on the pork.  Needs a little more flavor. But overall good.

47.description: I have spent a lot of time in Miami and I thought that was where I would find the best Cuban Sandwich. I was wrong!  90 Mile Cuban Cafe was outstanding. Service was equally impressive, the people were amazing. We were taking our dog to the Vet up the street and stopped for lunch after our appointment. It was so good that when we dropped our dog off this morning we actually went back for breakfast. Going back to the vet again tomorrow morning to get our dog and you guessed it, going back for another pastry and a Cuban Coffee. Seriously don't miss this place!!

8.description: I am a single middle-aged woman who often dines alone. I tried twice (January 22nd and 29th )  to have dinner At 90 Miles, and both times I went in I was ignored and not seated. I waited 12 minutes the first time and 9 minutes the second, both around 730 pm. I'll have to go down the street to Sabor  de Cuba and eat earlier for my Cuban food fix. Can't rate the food; only the service.

31.description: This is the Original 90 Miles to Cuba @ 3101 N Clybourn Avenue (hint it's actually a little further then 90 miles to Cuba). It's a really cool tiny little restaurant on a triangular corner bordered by Elston, Oakley & Barry.  The decor both on the outside & inside are reminiscent of Cuban restaurants.  The dining inside is somewhat limited with NO tables & about 10 bar stools.  The walls on the inside are wallpapered with newspaper clippings from Cuban newspapers.  There is another newer & bigger "90 Miles to Cuba" @ 2540 W Armitage, but you need to experience the original one first. I ordered the Cubano Sandwich it is delicious.  The perfect blend of ham, roasted pork, Swiss cheese, pickles & mustard toasted on a piece of toasted French bread & topped off with hot sauce.  If you like things spicy it's so much better w/the hot sauce.  This also comes with banana chips.I loved the food and the atmosphere of this restaurant and will be back to try some of the other items on the menu.  I also want to check out the other location on Armitage.

34.description: By far the best place I have eaten at in the Chicago area!!! The food has amazing flavor!!!! I will definitely return to eat here many more times A++++++

16.description: The place is small but the food is huge with flavor!  I ordered the Cubano sandwich and beef empanadas.  The sandwich was fresh with just the right amount of mustard to pickle ratio which complimented the meats perfectly.  The bread was fresh and toasted just right.The empanadas were amazing!  Perfectly crunchy on the outside and full of complex savory favors inside.The staff was busy but very cordial.  Always a smile and willing to answer a question. I will be back!

13.description: This location has all bar seats inside. On a nice day there are some tables on their patio.We ordered to go:We got the puerco rostizado...this was quite tender but didn't quite live up to our expectations....it lacked some flavor or kick. It was fine after adding a little hot sauce and salsa lizanoThe guave and cheese pastry was quite tasty. You can't go wrong. The steak sandwich was pretty awesome with the onions and chimichurri sauce. I'd probably try something different next time. it's very accessible and has a small parking by lot.

11.description: Great sandwiches and traditional Cuban dishes. Love the island feel and the friendly service...

39.description: Loved the ropa vieja and empanadas. The outdoor patio is a great place to sit in the warmer months. Byob is an added bonus.

37.description: Great food at reasonable prices. The Cuban sandwiches and garlic sauce with the yuca fries are especially tasty. The guy who helped me was very patient and helpful as I labored over the menu trying to decide what I wanted. They don't seem to have any AC though so if its a hot day, be prepared to sweat as you wait for your order...let alone eating inside!

0.description: I love Cuban food and 90 miles does not disappoint! I went there for the second time this weekend and it has to be one of my favorite spots. The empanadas are a must! The beef is my favorite but you can't go wrong with the chicken or mozzarella. We tried the chorizo/goat cheese but the goat cheese was just too overpowering. The empanadas have a perfectly flakey crust with gooey centers. Also try the snickers version for dessert. The churrasco is hands down my favorite entree. You get a huge serving of skirt steak and the flavor is incredible. I had my first yuca cob mojo here and it's delicious. Similar to potatoes but velvetier. I wanted to try something else but couldn't bring myself to pass this up. I sampled some of my friends fricase de pollo and croqueta which were both delicious but would still choose the steak =)Pros:The food- seriously everything is fantastic!BYOB- you can literally bring a bottle of whatever with no cork fee.. rum, wine, beer (think of the $$$ you save)Con:Busy- Make a reservation in advance especially the weekends

38.description: Really solid Cuban food that was super tasty without being greasy. The sweet plantains, Cuban sandwich and empanadas were all awesome. The tamale was good, a touch too sweet and didn't have much meat. A chicken dish was solid but a bit boring.  The price was a touch too high, so not a great value but if in the mood for Cuban and I'd definitely go back. An almost 2 hour wait for delivery on a Thursday is also a big detractor.

51.description: I live right around the corner from this place, so I come here often. I've tried the majority of their sandwiches and appetizers. They are all extremely delicious. I used to go classic Cuban sandwich until I discovered the other sandwiches are even better. I love the lechon sandwich, and my boyfriend loves the croquetas sandwich (which I agree is probably the best sandwich they have). We usually get the aji relleno and the wanna be cuban for appetizers. They are both awesome, but I love the wanna be cuban better (even though it's soy beef, and I am NOT a vegetarian by any  means!) The maduros are also really good. I just think the empanadas are so-so, though. I definitely wouldn't come here for those. The service is always friendly and usually quick. The only bad experience we've had was on the first nice weather day this year they were super busy, so our order took probably 25-30 minutes longer than normal. They also forgot to give us part of our order. It wasn't a big deal though since it's not normally like that, and they gave us a credit.

27.description: AWESOME Cuban food!! I was inspired to go here after watching the movie Chef (great movie btw!). This restaurant did not disappoint. The atmosphere was low key and very nice. I loved the patio seating. I had the croqueta sandwich and the bread pudding. The sandwich was melty and delightful! The bread pudding was like no bread pudding I have ever had.. but in a good way! The texture was more like flan than bread pudding. My boyfriend who dislikes bread pudding and flan helped me finish the entire thing! I highly recommend 90 Miles to Cuba. The staff is friendly and the food is great :)

32.description: Hands down the best Cuban food in the city, blew me away.  The lechon is absolutely amazing.  Empanadas are awesome.  Overall amazing experience.

54.description: This place is awesome. The staff is super friendly, it's good ambience, and the sandwich I got was delicious. Very fresh and so damn tasty. I'm officially addicted to Cubanos now. The empanadas were also really good. I didn't love the spinach one, but the others were delicious. I'll definitely be back.

48.description: This place has amazing Cuban food! Love this little mom and pops corner shop. Yuca fries to die for!

44.description: I've passed this cozy spot several times over the years, but only just recently got a chance to go into it. My mom sent me in for a cafe con leche, and I took this as an opportunity to scout the menu out, too.The decor is lovely, with old newspapers from Cuba and plenty of cultural art pieces. The space itself is small, but they do have an outdoor patio, which I imagine is nice for the summer. The staff seemed overwhelmed by everything going on, and the restaurant wasn't even very busy. Maybe they were understaffed. The counter person was responsible for taking orders, running food and also making all the drinks, which depending on what you get, could take a while. There seemed to be confusion as to where food was going, which sort of dragged things out a while. I imagine it might help if the staff asked their customers if they would be seated indoors or on the patio....I waited for 20+ minutes for two coffees and my shake. This was definitely more than I would like to wait, and I consider myself extremely patient. This time did give me the chance to look over the menu though, which was awkwardly placed next to the counter (making it hard for someone just walking in to really get to the menu BEFORE having to place the order). The food I did see looked delicious and reasonably priced.I would come back and try the food, but choose a time that's significantly less busy than a Saturday early afternoon....

24.description: Ordered takeout. Food was ready quickly, the cashier was friendly, and everything we got was tasty. Shrimp empanadas were soft and flavorful, while the ropa vieja both in sandwich and entree form was juicy and really hit the spot.

7.description: Holy grease ball batman. Super disappointed in this sandwich. The bread was soaked everything.

49.description: The Cubano sandwich never disappoints , and I love the empanadas they deserve four stars. It is Great for a quick lunch. The employees are lack luster, the outside tables wobbly and that's about it.

40.description: This location has all bar seats inside. On a nice day there are some tables on their patio.We ordered to go:We got the puerco rostizado...this was quite tender but didn't quite live up to our expectations....it lacked some flavor or kick. It was fine after adding a little hot sauce and salsa lizanoThe guave and cheese pastry was quite tasty. You can't go wrong. The steak sandwich was pretty awesome with the onions and chimichurri sauce. I'd probably try something different next time. it's very accessible and has a small parking by lot.

53.description: Absolutely DO order the Avocado Salad. It's super tasting, and filling on it's own. I also ordered the Lechon, there were some very tender and moist pieces, but I also got some very dry unappetizing pieces as well. The rice and beans were perfect -- not a fan of the sweet plantains that also come on the side. It's a small space, with just a few countertop seats, and a few tables on their patio. Bathroom is VERY odd, you have to walk to the side of the building, and make sure you lock two doors -- the one from the outside and the one from the kitchen -- and then unlock them when you are finished. Service was perfect. Food was good. I'd definitely come back, but I'd make sure it was a nice enough day so I could sit outside.

30.description: This place is super popular but it's really not THAT great. After going to the Roscoe Village location 5 times now, I realized that this place is merely popular with white people who have no idea what Cuban or Puerto Rican food is supposed to taste like . I am Puerto Rican and I lived on my island for 9 yrs. The two main ingredients in ALL the food is Sazon and Sofrito. Which this place uses neither. Its truly unbelievable to me that you can make this Caribbean food without these 2 critical ingredients which differentiate this food from any other country! Their empanadas are bland. In fact, all the food there has a blandness to it because of the lack of these two critical seasonings. The food is "pretty good" but OMG it could.be over the top delicious if they actually used the seasonings of Cuba and Puerto Rico!    Today, I got the papaya shake. They handed me a large glass of milk and sugar. Zero papaya fruit. They said it was in there but. You sure couldn't taste it. It was like a large glass of thick sweet creamer. Yuck.    In my opinion, If you're white and don't know any better you'll love this place. If you're from the Caribbean, there are tons better places.like Paladar in Logan Square!

46.description: Tried the Cuban sandwich and it was so bad. The pork and the ham had the consistency of jerky. No flavor. This place has no Cuban flavor. I pass.

1.description: Im not sure if this location(clybourn ave) has the same owners as the others but out of the three I find this one to be the least friendly (at least when there is a young woman with blondish hair serving the counter) and the one that over salts their food the most. If that wasnt enough, the ropa vieja sandwich ordered had a measly amount of meat..(im talking less than the size of my fist and Im a small girl so my fist is pretty small) and it was a sandwich yet we got the meat and bread seperate..didn't know it was a create your own sandwhich kind of deal. My bistec sandwich was super greasy. I had to blot it with a napkin and it soaked up the entire napkin. Now we all know we dont eat Cuban food for their health benefits but still I also dont expect a greasy spoon type order..The only good thing from our visit was their cafe con leche. If you have dined at their other locations, dont come here expecting the same quality or like me..you'll be in for a dissapointment.Oh yes and when I brought it to their attention, made no effort to rectify the situation.

55.description: Excellent Cuban coffee!

9.description: 90 mile is decent place. But it small portions and it's mad expensive. Plus it's packed like all the time cause hipsters love byob. I've dropped this place off my radar and started to search for that perfect Cuban joint. It's a great place of people who charge things on their credit card then report them stolen the next day. I think the proper name for those people are "scumbags". But for us common folk. No point on dropping that much coin on rice & plantains.

26.description: Great hole in the wall with excellent food! This is my old neighborhood, so I'm a little biased. Friendly people, good service, fair prices. Haven't had food Cuban steak since I lived in Miami.

25.description: This is a fabulous little spot serving the best Cuban fare around.  It's an interesting concept that fits very well into this establishment's name, 90 Miles Cuban Cafe.The lechon I had was excellent as was the Cuban sandwich on another visit. It was equally as good.  The French fries and fried plantain chips are great too!  This place can be hoping....... Improve your customer service!   ... Looks like  you have plenty of help, step out from the back counter and be a tad more accomodating to your patrons.  Maybe some colorful tablecloths outside in summer would surely draw attention and bring more people in.   Action and people bring more people!On the two occasions I was there, the food was fantastic but it was dead.  Do something positive to bring more people in. Walk outside and ask people how's it going.  Refill their drinks but step out from behind the counter.  You're not White Castle's, you have to work harder!I ll be back ... I want you to earn that 5th star!

12.description: excellent cuban sandwhiches.  bread is particularly good.  warning: not fast.  expect to wait 10-15 minutes for anything you order

59.description: Approved by my 6 year old. Loved the yucca fries and the croquetta sandwich. Yucca fries had the perfect texture, crisp on the outside and soft and moist inside.
