15.description: A small, quaint coffee shop in Roscoe Village that does not disappoint.  The cafe latte was fresh and delightful.  If you are in the mood for donuts, they also carry Glazed and Infused donuts. The maple bacon donut is amazing.  The shop is more of a morning place as the afternoon hours are limited.  They have seasonal favorites as well such as pumpkin spice and honey nut lattes.  I will definitely be back again. A local favorite!

40.description: The coffee needs improvement.  The light roast was weak.  Light roast doesn't mean that the coffee is semi-transparent.  Use more coffee or pour the water slower.  Other withdraw-the bathroom and back area.  Just a mess.  And empty fridges..... Nope.  Very nice service on the other hand.

7.description: TL;DR: Great, tiny coffee shop.This is a petite, yet powerful cafe. It seats about a dozen at best between one large table and a smattering of 2-seat tables. There are outlets to plug in, and the cafe has always had a table when I've come in outside of rush times.The coffee is always excellently prepared, be it brewed or espresso'd. They offer a handful of specialty drinks on top of a standard menu, and they are always open to creating a custom beverage. That's how I snagged a sweet Nutella latte (literally and punningly). In addition to tasty West Town Bakery baked goods, they also have savory bagel sandwiches. For the price, the lox bagel sandwich is one of the best deals in the city - they don't skimp on lox or cream cheese, and the bagels themselves are fairly tasty. This shop isn't near where I live; I stop by every time it's on the way to or from somewhere. It's worth it every time.

36.description: Great coffee and staff!  Such an awesome addition to the neighborhood

30.description: Local business with great coffee. They grind the beans for your coffee/drink on the spot -pour hot water over and let it sit. Takes maybe a few minutes longer than getting a black coffee at Starbucks but in my opinion it tastes way better . While you wait you can have a seat (one big wooden table, bar seating at the window and two two person tables) or grab a glazed and infused donut or a bagel-today they had a fig bagel with fig jam that sounded interesting! There's FREE WIFI and a cooler full of sodas, some juice and chobani yogurt. My large (16oz) coffee was 3.59 or around that. So it's pricier in that way but I do feel like it's fresh yummy coffee. They also had a honey almond nut latte I think it was called with almond milk and honey which I want to try next too! Ladies working we friendly-one a little spunky and one really sweet. Both said hi as I walked in and seemed to be well educated about their product (which I hate when the employees can't tell me about their coffee or anything) go check it out!

3.description: this is hands down my favorite local coffee shop. I'm never disappointed when I come in, especially because they carry both almond milk and soy milk and have a good choice of food for vegetarians. the staff is super chill, friendly, and have even taken to remembering their regulars. not to mention they're talented with latte art and making tasty drinks (lavender honey, chai bella, chocolate and pine, etc). and lucky enough for me, the manager is a reallyyy cute lesbian (just a personal bonus). ambiance is great, music is always different when I come in but fits. all in all thumbs up, you're my hero ;)

14.description: I stopped in to grab a quick lunch while working in the neighborhood. Ordered a Pacific Bird sandwich and a coffee. The sandwich was ON POINT. You definitely get your money's worth. Lots of turkey, bacon, chock full of perfectly ripe avocado, ripe tomato, pesto mayo, on delicious bread that wasn't too dense but still managed to contain all the deliciousness. The coffee was great too. Went with the Columbia medium roast. It's a cute little cafe with friendly and chill staff. Definitely worth the trip even if you're not in the neighborhood.

58.description: Lemongrass tofu banh mi = veggie heaven. The space is a tiny bit cramped--definitely better for takeout. I'll definitely be back.

56.description: I moved to the area a few months ago and was really excited about this place.  I love a good Bahn Mi sandwich, fresh spring rolls and Pho.  On my first visit I had a Bahn Mi sandwich with grilled beef; very tasty and a good value.  Since then, they have raised their prices and I don't visit as much.  Don't get me wrong, They do have a good Bahn Mi sandwich with pickled daikon radish and carrots, cucumber, jalapeño and cilantro with your choice of meat. As for the pho, it's pretty good.  They do serve it with bean sprouts, basil and cilantro if I remember correctly.

29.description: Banh mi has the best Vietnamese sandwiches you will find in chicago. Very flavorful and crunchy.

42.description: (Reviewing here since for some reason the new Division Ave location is not on Yelp yet.)First experience at Bahn Mi & Co, but I've eaten my fair share of these while living in New York and Asia. It only musters three stars in my book:- Bread was soft, but should be very crunchy, like a day-old baguette- Inexplicably doesn't also serve bubble tea, which is staple of similar shops, notably in NYC- Price is a bit high for what you're getting when you compare to Chipotle and the likeStill, the taste was good and service was great, so I'll probably be back if I'm in the neighborhood and want a quick sandwich.

23.description: Love the Bahn mi soup!!! Have recommended this place time and time again!! Small but even to go never disappoints

47.description: Tried the noodle salad. Noodles were hard, stale and not edible. Pho was bland and meat smelled old. Maybe sandwiches are better but I won't be back to try them. What a waste of a meal and money.

8.description: Cool Vietnamese place! The lemongrass tofu sandwich is yummy. Spring rolls to. My favorite is Black Mushroom soup with rice noodles. Cool staff. Always smiling :-)Highly recommended!

31.description: Not a bad option for a super quick, take out order!Sandwiches are on the small side, and could use a little more veg but the flavors are great and the bread is perfect. I really enjoyed the homemade taste of the chicken broth in the wonton soup, and loved the novelty of being able to order an entire bottle of sriracha for barely any markup. With 5 location throughout the city, this is a great choice for an inexpensive, light bite to eat.

34.description: I'm only writing this because it's the second time I've had a bad experience. I've never written a bad review on yelp before but I was so angry I had to. The first time I ordered from here I ordered the chicken rice bowl which is supposed to come with soy sauce. It didn't come with any. I was left with a dry, unedible meal. I decided to give it a second shot today. I ordered the chicken bowl with EXTRA sauce that I paid extra for to ensure I would not have this problem again. No sauce. My vegetarian friend ordered the pho with no meat. When she opened the box of fillings there was pulled beef in it. No lunch for her.  ON TOP OF THAT it did not come with the hoisin or sriracha. Are you kidding me? That makes it. So basically neither of us got to eat our lunch because of careless mistakes. I will never order from here again.  Get it together Bahn mi. If you're going to serve mediocre product, at least include the ingredients that can improve it.

16.description: Banh Mi & Co Roscoe Village.Banh Mi & Co. features Vietnamese sandwiches and soup. I had the Black Mushroom Vegetarian Soup: Vegetarian stock served with black mushrooms, cabbage, carrots, white and green onion topped with crispy fried onions. Your choice of rice noodles or white rice.I liked my soup well enough. If there were a Banh Mi & Co. near me I would get this again.My dining companion had the Pork Rolls Sandwich: Pork rolls and pate. Served with cucumber, pickled carrots and daikon, cilantro, jalapeno, soy sauce, black pepper and mayo on a fresh baked baguette.He gives the sandwich a 4 out 5 stars.Given the opportunity, I would dine here again. Full review: foodchickeats.blogspot.c…Chow!food chick

13.description: I've lived near by this location for a while and finally decided to give it a whirl! The combination of flavors was initially scary, but I was pleasantly surprised. I went with the BBQ pork sandwich with everything on it - delicious meat, crisp bread and a spicy mix of flavors.Also worth mentioning - the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in explaining the menu. Check it out!

11.description: My husband and I are obsessed with this place right now.  My husband always gets a sandwich and raves about the bread.  I love the vegetarian options that this place offers.  I'm not a tofu person.  But Bahn Mi offers seitan and they cook it so well.  I really like their spring rolls with the seitan.  They're delicious, but a little hard to eat because once you take a bite, everything falls out.  I also love their noodle salad with seitan.  If you're vegetarian, definitely check this place out.  If you're a bread lover, you should also definitely check this place out!

39.description: I had the BBQ pork sandwich. It was okay - they use lots of cilantro so be careful if that is something you don't like. Good spot for lunch. Not a lot of seating, so be prepared to take out if it is busy.

37.description: Horrible wonton soup, pho, and the spring rolls fell apart after the first bit. The wonton soup was super oily chicken broth, with a tiny bit of cilantro, and 6 small wontons. They also do not have any knives. Oh and they ran out of bean sprouts. The sandwiches looked good though. Skip this place for soup and spring rolls and go to the Red Line Argyle stop area for really good Vietnamese food.

0.description: So glad to have stumbled on this place. I had the BBQ Pho and it was sooo good! I ate it in under two minutes. Super cute place too. They had good root beer too which I love. Can't wait to try the soup next time!

38.description: Had the curry chicken sandwich with added bacon. The bread was unbelievably good! Ingredients were really fresh and I liked the kick that the fresh jalapeños and sriracha gave it.  Wish I would have picked up the shrimp spring rolls with it.  All in all, would definitely recommend.

51.description: I've been to Vietnam and am obsessed with Bahn Mi. If you are looking for an exact replica, this is not it. This location had Hispanic women working the counter and kitchen, so not authentic, but If you are looking for a very good sandwich made on fresh bread with delicious fresh herbs, then go get your sandwich! We tried the Classic Saigon and it was pretty good. I didn't care for the pate much, but again I wanted to compare it to the delicious sweet, creamy pate slabbed onto my Bahn Mi in Ho Chi Minh City. We also got the papaya green salad (which was one of my favorite street foods in Saigon). The salad is okay. The papaya didn't have a lot of flavor and the fish sauce didn't help, neither did the peanut sauce. I ordered the lemongrass chicken on the side to go with, and I'm glad it came on the side because although it was flavorful, it was extremely dry & needed some help. It's not a stellar Bahn Mi by any means, but it is a delicious sandwich and I would go back because it tops all those other nasty sandwich places (Potbelly, Subway, Submarines, etc...etc...etc...)

27.description: Phenomenal pho. You will not get better pho than here.

32.description: Best bread I've ever eaten. Seriously. Something must have changed recently because I remember the bread always being good, but whatever new bread they're using is AMAZING. It's so fresh and fluffy and warm but there's a crispy exterior similar to a french baguette. Highly highly highly recommended!

54.description: One of the best Vietnamese sandwiches in town - i'm glad that they are close to my home :) the ingredients are always fresh - get the pork belly, i'm not pork lover, but that sandwich is yummy...

48.description: Great Vietnamese food and one of the best green papaya salads I've ever eaten. A must!

44.description: Cool Vietnamese place! The lemongrass tofu sandwich is yummy. Spring rolls to. My favorite is Black Mushroom soup with rice noodles. Cool staff. Always smiling :-)Highly recommended!

24.description: I cannot say enough about the food and the staff at Banh Mi Baget!!! They frequent the branch that I work at up the street to get change on a daily basis and they always offer to bring over some yummy food! A few weeks ago it was terribly cold and one of the employees dropped in to get change and offered to go back to the restaurant and pick up some soup for us. What a kind, thougthful and yummy gesture! Keep up the awesome customer service and delicious food! We love you guys here at TCF!

7.description: Food was delicious! Service was fast and super friendly. The veggie bahn mi was superb and the French bread was so FRESH! My girlfriend thought the Pho should have had mint but still loved the dish. We will be returning!

49.description: Only three stars, because the young girl who works the front counter is so rude & unhelpful.  Every time I come in she's here & it really ruins my experience when I have to interact with her.  Must be the owners daughter. No way anyone would want her being the first impression of their restaurant unless they had to. Harsh, but true. Love the food though.

40.description: I've been very pleased with my visits here! The service is pleasant and efficient and the food is great. I'm a fan of the Saigon Classic and their lychee lemonade, but we were also eyeing the pho and salads we saw headed to other tables. I've eaten in and carried out - either way, great experience! The only drawback is that there are only a few tables, but turnover is relatively quick. We'll definitely be back!

53.description: First I'm going to explain why such a long review, it's because I want you to trust me on this! I'm so happy to have a place like Yelp to forewarn hungry consumers what you're in for. This place is a dreadful disappointment, I wish I could say they just must have been having a bad day, but its my second attempt at eating here, took me about 8 months to give it another try after the first disappointment. So now I'm confused by the glowing reports from other people. In honesty I'm familiar with Vietnamese food so granted I'm no novice (stepmom was French Vietnamese). Okay. So..When I stepped in at lunchtime the place was empty, and the server was grumpy looking, stupidly I thought I'll be the cheerful one and make friendly conversation and engage her, perhaps help her improve her mood. Time wasted. Yeah I shouldn't have to do that, I know. I ordered the shrimp spring roll and a soup, by the time I was long gone from the place I discovered they had given me tofu spring roll and no spoon for the soup. The place was empty, what excuse can you have? The roll was small, flimsy, and really tasteless, the tofu was hard and dry on the edges. (Nothing like that picture you see on Yelp) All bad. Three days ago I made spring rolls for the first time ever and they were knockout, on my first attempt! I poured the soup down the drain, wasn't worth eating. This is their business, I don't understand I really shouldn't be able to do better than what they make. So for an $9 lunch,(silly me gave a tip to cheer her up) I came out hungrier than when I went in. My analogy it was like eating air, nothin' there.When I called to complain the response was as limp as my spring roll.  Quote 'We hope you come back' to what another disappointment? How about a full refund? Next time I walk into an empty restaurant at lunchtime, I'm walking right back out!I want to help you save your money and tell you look for somewhere else to eat!PS I found the awesome recipe on notenoughcinnamon dot com yummy!

30.description: This place is AMAZING. The spring rolls are out of this world (lemon grass chicken). Everyone who works here is extremely nice, and I had the pleasure of meeting the owner today and he couldn't have been friendlier. This is definitely my go to spot for fast and HEALTHY food!!

46.description: OK...maybe I was too generous with my first review.  I think the reason being was because I was so hungry and homesick.  You know when you are hungry, even a piece of paper dipped in Siracha taste good to you!  We ordered carry out on a Friday night.  We had their Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) and bbq pork spring rolls.  Big FAIL.  The Pho Ga was flavorless and the noodles had a bland flavor.  The bbq pork spring rolls were too heavy on noodles and not enough protein.  I may give it another shot and try out what I ordered the first time, but my husband has insisted we never order from here again.

1.description: I appreciate healthier options in the 'hood and like having a Viet place a bit closer than Uptown. However, the food is lacking in oomph and ahhh. I've had both their chicken & beef phos and they get the job done but are nowhere near the best phos I've had. They take care in their ingredients - everything is very fresh and looks good. But the flavor? It's just lacking. The pho needs more.....something. I'm honestly not sure what is missing but it doesn't taste as good as most pho I've had. And the meat has zero seasoning to it which wouldn't be a problem at all if the broth had some good flavor.I've heard their sandwiches are pretty good, but skip the pho unless you're in a bind.

55.description: First timer to Banh, and let me tell you, Pho-nominal!  I've never had this soup before, but the broth was so good.  Very simple, yet so complex and fresh tasting.  Love the oyster sauce and peppers on the side.  Add some lime and beef, seeeee ya.  So good.    If you can afford to dish out $10 for a soup, this is the place to go.  Wow.

9.description: I didn't realize there could be so much of a difference at other locations. I usually frequent the Broadway location. I was in the Roscoe neighborhood and had such a taste for Banh Mi BaGet.  I ordered a large Wonton to eat there and one to take home . I should have cancelled my to go order. I told the woman behind the corner the won tons were terrible . She said they taste different depending who is making them . They  were mushy and slimy . I should have changed my order. When I served the soup to my daughter at home, it tasted even worse. The soup and wontons were awful. I will return to my Broadway location without hesitation.

26.description: Best place to get some banh mi and pho in roscoe village! Although, the beef pho would taste better if the beef was cut into thin slices. Very friendly staff as well!

25.description: I love how I can call ahead and by the time I get there 10 minutes later, it's all ready to go!  The soups are my go to's when I 'm sick.  When it comes to portion size, I feel it's pretty generous for the price and you get your free wonton soup when you check in and spend a reasonable amount, which really makes it worth it.

12.description: This review is solely based on the beef pho that I had. I've never paid more than 8$ for a bowl of beef pho. This was over 9. Maybe I'm being cheap. But this is a semi-take out restaurant place, it shouldn't cost that much. Especially when they are on the cheap side with the ingredients, tiny bit of beans sprout, a couple of basil leaves (literally 2 leaves). And a plastic spoon? (I like my China spoon that can hold more soup!) I have also NEVER had beef pho where the beef aren't served in slices, this place does it with shredded beef. Can't say I'm a big fan, I love my slice beef! But I have to say the taste of the soup and the beef are quite flavorful. So, would i being a friend here? Sure but can't say is my fav place.

59.description: Ah Banh Mi & Co - these Vietnamese sandwich shops are popping up in the city like cupcake craze of years past.  This location opened up a little over a year ago right after Retro on Roscoe in August.  It's a cute store that's nicely decorated.Since then, it seems the employees have been regularly turning over since I haven't really seen the same cashier consistently.  The menu has also expanded beyond Banh Mi, but also cut back much to my dismay - why did they get rid of my favorite sardine banh mi???  I usually get the 2 shrimp rolls, but one time they even ran out of shrimp (really?).  I also get either the wonton soup (so-so) or the chicken rice soup.  The soup and the spring rolls are very filling.  The Lychee lemonade is also pretty good.  The bread for the sandwiches is thick and chewy, which is not like the bread I'm used to for banh mi and also  not as good as Ba Le.

21.description: My husband and I are obsessed with this place right now.  My husband always gets a sandwich and raves about the bread.  I love the vegetarian options that this place offers.  I'm not a tofu person.  But Bahn Mi offers seitan and they cook it so well.  I really like their spring rolls with the seitan.  They're delicious, but a little hard to eat because once you take a bite, everything falls out.  I also love their noodle salad with seitan.  If you're vegetarian, definitely check this place out.  If you're a bread lover, you should also definitely check this place out!

17.description: Service was just ok, nothing outstanding. My Phó was really good. Spring rolls were alright but not wrapped tight enough and the wrapper was unusually thin.

10.description: Pho is out of this world. Go for the beef Banh Mi and lemongrass spring rolls. Quick easy delicious!

5.description: Their food continues to slip. We ordered this past weekend. Still even smaller portions of shredded beef in which I've discussed in the past. Ordered the noodle salad: nothing better that two big sticky clumps of rice noodles that don't come apart with a fork. I also ordered spring rolls which were wrapped so poorly and were 90% noodles and the pork was terrible. I basically gave them $5 so I could throw them away. What's happening over there? It used to be fantastic, now, well...

3.description: So the quality has kind of gone downhill. I have previously questioned the cleanliness in the kitchen here but kind of wrote it off.Here's why: on my last visit I got my usual and the chicken on it (pulled chicken) looked this weird grey color. I inspected further and though it didn't smell off saw a clump of pulled chicken (light and dark meat) with a long black hair intertwined. I was absolutely disgusted and threw it right into the trash. Please make the people in the kitchen wear hair nets when pulling the chicken.  I probably won't be back for a long time.  I really wish Roscoe Village could keep some good restaurants.

35.description: Bahn Mi is  the visit if you're in its surrounding area and looking for a quick easy-to-eat sandwich.  Having trekked all the way up to Arglye and Broadway from Avondale in the past for similar sandwiches, the appearance of Bahn Mi is a blessing.The menu is small, and so is the physical space, but it isn't a deterrent.  Each sandwich is delicious and Roscoe Village is great for sitting and eating outdoors.I would not go for just the Pho, however.  Continue to go North for that.

19.description: Stopped in today and was blown away!  I had the vegetarian bahn mi w/lemongrass tofu and it was absolutely fantastic! I'll definitely be back!!! :-)

28.description: Service was just ok, nothing outstanding. My Phó was really good. Spring rolls were alright but not wrapped tight enough and the wrapper was unusually thin.

45.description: We get Pho about once a week, from the various Bahn Mi's and the places on Argyle. Tonight we had the worst Pho we have ever had. The broth was actually oily and bland. We had to ADD salt to give it flavor and OIL had separated from the broth and floated on the spoon. Extremely disgusting.  There should be no oil visible in Pho. Not even sure how they would do this?? Unless they cooked their beef in the same pot That the chicken broth pho would go in?! Needless to say, never getting Bahn Mi again..with the trip up to Argyle. Stomach is doing flips. Would have taken it back but we got it to go and didn't notice until we were at home. :(

33.description: Food is good always fresh....but just found out they aren't gonna have any shrimp anymore  that sucks

43.description: one of our fave takeouts/deliveries...vegi goodness while still keeping with the ethnic flavors:  delicious veg pho (the black mushroom soup), vegi springs rolls AND seitan/tofu banhs -- ALL very tasty and filling!  the one small complaint is that the spring rolls have been a bit inconsistent - sometimes the wrapper can be very very chewy or the fillings can be sparse.  when made well, they are some of the best spring rolls i've ever had.  also, agree with other yelpers that the price hike has brought bahn mi & co down a notch or two on our "regulars" list.

2.description: Based off the saigon classic special I just finished in house, what a crap sandwich. No pate, maybe enough to clean the knife off. Really small sandwich and shitty ingredients. Banh mi fillings are already inexpensive, and you charged $7 for this? #disgrace

18.description: They leave trash on the sidewalk and now a large grease trail from their door to the dumpster.  I have had it with this place.  Dirty, poorly managed, avoid.  Too bad they started off so well.

41.description: Great sandwiches and great price.  Could use a bit more room for the busy lunch rush, but overall great experience.

52.description: I loved this place. The food was great! Definitely going back! The Waitresses are not the best. There is one waitress who I occasionally see really short hispanic girl with short hair, she's very friendly and an older woman in the mornings are kind, they are also in uniform. The other girls that always have to much make up on are rude, unhelpful and always on their phone. :( These girls kind of made my experience bad.

50.description: I am so pumped to have found a place selling Banh Mi's and am going to go back to try more! It is difficult for me to give any Bahn Mi a 5 star rating since I've had the best right outside my office in Philly but will say the lemongrass chicken BM was good not great ...may have been higher if it had a little more protein on it - thought they skimped on the chicken. A sandwich and a water was over $9 but you don't get chips or carrots or anything with your order. The key selling point to Banh Mi & Co is their variety - lots of options that all sound interesting plus they have pho, other sandwiches, and are quick for delivery or take out.

4.description: I will say that the spring rolls and seitan sandwich options are very delicious. However the frustration with ordering from here outweighs the delicious meal by far. 50% of the time I make an order I have to go back to pick up something I was forgotten or something that was not made correctly. Not my idea of a good time.

6.description: When this place popped up in my hood I was SO SO SO SO excited, I love pho. Like a crazy person I keep coming back hoping for things to get better. Here's the scoop... inconsistency. ARRGGG I want to like this place, it is just SO frustrating to get things like frozen meat; dry noodles; half of a container of soup; no bean sprouts (can't someone just run up to Mariano's?!); tiny little bags of veggies. I have to order more bags of vegetables because they are so stingy with their veggies...and then to get charged for it?!. And the price is just outrageous, 10$+ dollars for pho?!?! And then to get cold meat with it? Shame on you. It just seems like you don't care.  Lastly, the last several times I have ordered pho my total price has been different EACH time. Weird. Inconsistent. PLEASE PLEASE get your act together. The bahn mi sadly shares the same 2-star review, expensive and inconsistent.

22.description: So the quality has kind of gone downhill. I have previously questioned the cleanliness in the kitchen here but kind of wrote it off.Here's why: on my last visit I got my usual and the chicken on it (pulled chicken) looked this weird grey color. I inspected further and though it didn't smell off saw a clump of pulled chicken (light and dark meat) with a long black hair intertwined. I was absolutely disgusted and threw it right into the trash. Please make the people in the kitchen wear hair nets when pulling the chicken.  I probably won't be back for a long time.  I really wish Roscoe Village could keep some good restaurants.

15.description: Great tasting food. But their AC is always broken and the kitchen staff don't wear hats/nets over their hair. Don't be surprised if you find hair in your food. YUM!

57.description: It's a small fast food restaurant. Yep, I called it fast food because their food was mediocre.  The only nice thing about it is during the summer you can sit outside on their small patio like area as most of the surrounding restaurant offers as well. If I'm in the area I would eat somewhere else, unless you're really craving for pho and you don't have a way to a better Viet restaurant then go for it.

20.description: My friend picked up some spring rolls last week from Banh Mi Baget.  I tried the Veggie Tofu spring roll and the Lemongrass spring roll.  The lemongrass was interesting but not my cup of tea.  The veggie tofu was perfect, I will definitely be back for more!

36.description: Banh Mi & Co Roscoe Village.Banh Mi & Co. features Vietnamese sandwiches and soup. I had the Black Mushroom Vegetarian Soup: Vegetarian stock served with black mushrooms, cabbage, carrots, white and green onion topped with crispy fried onions. Your choice of rice noodles or white rice.I liked my soup well enough. If there were a Banh Mi & Co. near me I would get this again.My dining companion had the Pork Rolls Sandwich: Pork rolls and pate. Served with cucumber, pickled carrots and daikon, cilantro, jalapeno, soy sauce, black pepper and mayo on a fresh baked baguette.He gives the sandwich a 4 out 5 stars.Given the opportunity, I would dine here again. Full review: foodchickeats.blogspot.c…Chow!food chick

14.description: Very glad we stopped in here by chance without reading the reviews--this place was awesome. Generous bowls of hot pho and wonton soup were exactly what we needed. Both soups were perfect in their simplicity, and the lychee lemonade was a big hit too. The space is small but very cozy and welcoming. Will definitely be back soon.

1.description: I met Alex a few months ago and she invited me to her studio to show me how she teaches and how her studio works.  I was highly impressed.  When I first walked in I instantly felt welcome.  The entire store including the studios look so inviting and comfortable, not like other studios that kinda look and feel like a health clinic or someones basement.  I own my a small business and feel very comfortable recommending her to my clients for their music lesson needs.

0.description: This is a beautiful and welcoming place in Roscoe Village. Knowledgeable instructors that approach music lessons very differently than when I was a kid. They spend time introducing the instrument and making music and mastering and instrument seem within reach for everyone. I highly recommend it for anyone interested in having their child try their hand at an instrument. They will be hooked from their first lesson. Alex is the friendliest person you'll ever meet!

1.description: Artefill was recommended to me with no one telling me it is fiberglass and the product has been on and off the market for safety concerns.  I never would have allowed it to be injected since it's permanent.  I think you should give consumers full disclosure.

9.description: I decided to give Luxe a try since they're in my neighborhood and were participating in the Pretty in Pink $31 services for Breast Cancer support. First of all, their hours are crazy and change every day, so I had trouble even getting an appointment made. I went in for an eyebrow and bikini wax on a Saturday morning.  The woman who did the waxing was Lainie or Lonnie or something like that. I can't remember and I threw away the card after my awful experience.First of all, you have to wind your way through ugly, industrial hallways to even get to the spa section of the place. I was scared I wouldn't be able to find my way out. The room she put me in was extremely warm, and when I mentioned it, she just ignored me and told me it was just because the massage table was heated. She started with my eyebrows and told me that she likes to work quickly. I was definitely okay with that because who wants a wax to last long? Anyway, even though I told her I liked the natural looking, fuller brow, she waxed below AND above the brow line and totally thinned my brows into lines. I was angry since my brother's wedding was that weekend, but figured I could pencil them in. The bikini was was very painful, of course but seemed mostly okay. That is until two days later when I realized the hair hadn't been pulled out, but ripped off at the surface so that it was already growing back in weird patches. Gross, I know. I called to complain and left a message about my problem. (Again, weird hours, so I could hardly ever get anyone.) They didn't even bother calling me back! I tried one other time and still was ignored. Their regular prices are ridiculous for how cheap the experience and quality is, so I will NEVER be going here again. Luckily I only paid the reduced price for the bikini wax because of the Pretty in Pink promotion. Plus, if the way they treat their dissatisfied customers is an indication of the business, you should definitely turn and run!

23.description: I have been going here for years and it is wonderful! As soon as you walk in the door you are greeted with a smiling face. They provide you a robe so the little hairs don't get on your clothes which I love because you know how itchy those things can be!  They also offer you this delicious tea, which I can't describe but it is delicious!I have had my hair cut by both Jessica and Ella and both do a fantastic job. I do prefer Jessica only because I have had her cut my hair more times and recently went through a dramatic change that she walked me right through, cutting 11.5 inches of hair and coloring those oh so lovely grays. As a first time color-er I couldn't have been more pleased with my experience and being with Jessica through my shocking 11.5 inch hair loss was a pleasure. Of course she rubber banded the hair and preserved it for me to send it to Locks for Love. Jessica just really listens to what you want and gives you exactly that!The products they use, Pureology, leave your hair smelling fantastic and I never wash it the next day just so I can still smell it. Their shampoo girl is the best touch, who doesn't love getting their hair washed??!!! It is such a treat!I think after typing this up I am calling for an appointment!

12.description: I found Luxe on Pretty City. As a graduate student I don't have a huge disposable income, but want really great service. I have to say that Luxe is a really great place, especially for the money. Ella gave me the best haircut I have had in AGES and I do mean ages. She really gets working with your face and lifestyle, something a lot of stylists cannot do, they usually want you to tell them what you want and they just follow. I could not be happier. Another great thing, is the place is untpretentious, which I personally really like. I don't need to feel the salon is doing me a favor by coming there, the vibe at Luxe is warm and easygoing. I finally found someone great who is reasonable. Plus the parking is easier than going dowtown or river north.

21.description: I got my first wax here with Rachel and she was great.  She made it as fast and as least painful as possible.  She was also very friendly and makes you feel comfortable by engaging you in conversation.

16.description: I have been going here for years and it is wonderful! As soon as you walk in the door you are greeted with a smiling face. They provide you a robe so the little hairs don't get on your clothes which I love because you know how itchy those things can be!  They also offer you this delicious tea, which I can't describe but it is delicious!I have had my hair cut by both Jessica and Ella and both do a fantastic job. I do prefer Jessica only because I have had her cut my hair more times and recently went through a dramatic change that she walked me right through, cutting 11.5 inches of hair and coloring those oh so lovely grays. As a first time color-er I couldn't have been more pleased with my experience and being with Jessica through my shocking 11.5 inch hair loss was a pleasure. Of course she rubber banded the hair and preserved it for me to send it to Locks for Love. Jessica just really listens to what you want and gives you exactly that!The products they use, Pureology, leave your hair smelling fantastic and I never wash it the next day just so I can still smell it. Their shampoo girl is the best touch, who doesn't love getting their hair washed??!!! It is such a treat!I think after typing this up I am calling for an appointment!

17.description: I'm not sure who is giving all 5 stars, must be the friends of the stylists. I had an updo and my make up done and did not like either. My hair looked really simple and ugly (they braided it in the back so I felt like a 5 yr old), and the make up artist put on tinted moisturizer. HELLO! I paid like $50 for tinted moisturizer? I do that daily in my own house. The updo was also ridiculously expensive ($75!!!!), in a salon in Roscoe Village!? I pay less in my own 'hood, the Gold Coast (about $60 for an updo at a good salon on Oak St). Overall not impressed at all and paid too much.

10.description: So, I had been going to Luxe for years, had actually recommended the salon to several friends.  Unfortunately, as is the case with a lot of smaller Chicago salons, Luxe became a bit too pretentious and the service failed horribly because of it.  What used to be a great local shop where I knew that attention to detail and customer satisfaction were paramount, has now become another churning place of mediocrity.  It's really sad.

5.description: I've been a Luxe customer since it opened six?...seven? years ago and I'm sure I'll be a Luxe customer for six, seven, or even 67 more years. Honestly, I can't believe it took me this long to write this review. I followed Ella from her previous place and no one has touched my hair other than her in 10 years and I get compliments on my cut and color all the time (the credit is all Ella). I'm writing this review simply because I owe it to Luxe - they've been very good to me over the years. Elizabeth and everyone else are wonderful too. I can't vouch for them as a customer, but I have friends who go to Elizabeth and I love their haircuts as well and they are loyal customers like me. They are great if you know exactly what you want (for me...usually a trim) or if you have no idea and want something new (for me, that usually means saying...I don't know, you decide). I've never been disappointed. All in all, if anyone criticizes this place, don't listen to them. I've been to Ella every 6-8 weeks for 10 years. So that's what, 85-100 excellent haircuts? I've also sent at least five friends to Luxe and they all continue to go there, so, obviously, they're happy too. Add it up and we're talking about hundreds of happy haircuts. :-)

11.description: Spa Week presented a great opportunity to check out the spas in the city, so I had blindly signed up for a "Detox Body Wrap" at Luxe this past weekend.Truth be told, I had no idea what that entailed - just a faint knowledge that I will be lathered in some reduction, wrapped and left alone to drift away in my thoughts. That was exactly what I was given, and more! The minute we walked in, the service was great. They led us through a maze of doors and hallways into a building next door, giving us the impression that we were being taken far, far away.The rooms were dimmed with beautiful elevator music, very well-kept and a faint soothing aroma. My masseuse, Laini, was very pleasant and professional. After applying an oatmeal-like reduction rich with vitamins and minerals, she carefully wrapped me in plastic and towels and tucked me in! Then she left me alone for 15 minutes and there, I floated to bliss.The grand finale of the treatment allowed me to shower in their multi-jet stream shower and then hang out in their relaxation room while waiting for my friend's massage. She too, had a wonderful experience and we vowed to go back the next time we feel knots in our back ... which will be any day now!

22.description: I came here for the Pretty in Pink $31 deal in October, and got a haircut with Jessica.  Overall, I was impressed with the speed and precision Jessica had in cutting and styling my hair.  They also opened up a spa services next door, and their prices aren't outrageous, so I'll be back to try something else next time.

0.description: Elizabeth is amazing.  I moved to Chicago 2 years ago, and quickly went through 4 different stylists at different salons--none of them could do both great highlights and a great cut.Thankfully, Elizabeth is awesome at both.  She gets blonde.  She is blonde (which I think is important when it comes to understanding the shades, etc.).  I really trust her.  Plus, she's super quick.  I have a ton of long hair, and for full highlights/cut/blowdry/style, I am out of there in 2 hours.  Not bad.  A bit pricey, but worth it.

20.description: Spa Week presented a great opportunity to check out the spas in the city, so I had blindly signed up for a "Detox Body Wrap" at Luxe this past weekend.Truth be told, I had no idea what that entailed - just a faint knowledge that I will be lathered in some reduction, wrapped and left alone to drift away in my thoughts. That was exactly what I was given, and more! The minute we walked in, the service was great. They led us through a maze of doors and hallways into a building next door, giving us the impression that we were being taken far, far away.The rooms were dimmed with beautiful elevator music, very well-kept and a faint soothing aroma. My masseuse, Laini, was very pleasant and professional. After applying an oatmeal-like reduction rich with vitamins and minerals, she carefully wrapped me in plastic and towels and tucked me in! Then she left me alone for 15 minutes and there, I floated to bliss.The grand finale of the treatment allowed me to shower in their multi-jet stream shower and then hang out in their relaxation room while waiting for my friend's massage. She too, had a wonderful experience and we vowed to go back the next time we feel knots in our back ... which will be any day now!

19.description: I absolutely LOVE Luxe! I have been a client of Laini and Elizabeth for well over 10 years. Laini has the most amazing touch and has the ability to make you feel like a new person everytime you visit. I am constantly complimented about how amazing my skin is and no one ever knows my age. Everyone needs a special facial and waxing from Laini - it is a luxury that you won't forget.Elizabeth is the best stylist and like Laini is a true crafts'person' - I have been stopped on the street, in airports, in other countries asking where I get my hair done. She is absolutely amazing ... and makes you look amazing - definitely a great combination.You need to make an appointment - QUICK!! It is the best place ever !!

2.description: note to brides to be: FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO GET YOUR MAKEUP DONE!!i was searching for a makeup artist for my upcoming wedding, and a friend recommended luxe.  i was getting short on time, so after emailing with a receptionist back and forth, i decided to just book the appointment for my wedding day, figuring i could always cancel later.  i was quoted a price of $45 for the trial application, and $85 for the day-of makeup.  i went in for the trial with tori, who was very sweet.  she did the application in about half an hour, and it wasnt bad.  we talked about what i liked and didnt like and what i wanted to do different on the day of.  so i went to check out, and imagine my surprise when i was charged $65 instead of the $45 i was quoted.  i thought maybe i made a mistake or something, so i just paid ($80 with tip) and went on my merry way.when i got home i checked my email, and lo and behold, there was the quoted price of $45.  not only that, but there was an email from luxe stating that they were "so sorry, but we forgot to mention that for the day of, there will be a $120 travel charge."  WHAT!!!!!! not only did you overcharge me for the trial, but you "forget" to mention the astronomical $120 travel charge????? let me state that my wedding location is a mere 3 MILES from the salon. where is the makeup artist coming from? timbuktu? and is she flying in on a private jet?  i mean, i expected there to be a travel charge and i was surprised when it hadnt been mentioned previously but i figured, what the hey, maybe i got lucky? i find it completely ridiculous that the travel charge costs more than the actual makeup application. needless to say, i sent an email cancelling my day-of appointment and explained very politely how upset i was over this development.  to this day, management has not bothered contacting me to explain or apologize--pretty shabby way to treat a new client.  the only silver lining here is that i was personally contacted by one of the other receptionists, who was not even involved in the situation.  she said that when she came in to work and saw all the emails back and forth between me and the other girl, she immediately went to the manager and pleaded my case for me, saying she didnt think it was fair that i be charged, etc.  she told me that she got nowhere with the manager and was in fact disgusted with the way her boss had handled the situation, and apologized again and again.

18.description: I got my first wax here with Rachel and she was great.  She made it as fast and as least painful as possible.  She was also very friendly and makes you feel comfortable by engaging you in conversation.

13.description: After Several hair stylist that I just didnt LOVE for the money I was -paying I am so happy to back to Elizabeth! She is so great!  She is so great and fast! If your a mom you will love here because she is not messing around!  She has you in and out and I have VERY VERY curly thick hair that I blow dry straight!!    She does an awesome job and always love my haircuts and blow outs !  My sister does her color with Elizabeth also and it looks just Fab!    Cant say enough good things!

4.description: I went here for a root touch up. I explained that I had two major concerns: A) My grey hairs should be covered and match the rest of my hairB) my roots should match the rest of my hairShe seemed to understand and went to work dying my roots. I felt that something was up at the wash bowl when she started whispering to the shampoo girl. She brought me back to her station put a toner over my whole head, because I had been complaining that my all over color was looking a little washed out. Toner sat on for about 10 minutes and then wash and back to her station for styling. The lighting isnt fabulous in there, but it looked ok and she kept saying "it matches pretty well for first time". I couldn't see anything horribly wrong so I paid and left. When I returned home and looked over my hair I could tell that:A) My grey hairs were not fully covered (there is a gap of white between the last dye and this dye job)B) My grey hairs do not match the rest of my head and are much lighterC) my roots do not match the rest of my head and are darker and brown(my hair is a coppery color)I tried calling to see if they could fix my roots for 30 minutes and kept getting a machine. I know they are there because I just left.I give this place two stars because they include a blow out with the dye job, the lady seemed really nice, and the prices are middle of the road ($75). I am sure if I kept returning we could eventually get my roots to match the rest of my head and maybe get all my grey hairs covered, but I am not that impressed and I feel that I can get a comparable level of dissatisfaction for less money closer to where I live.

6.description: Finding someone to do my hair and makeup for the wedding (and for the bridesmaids) was one of the most stressful things.  Why, I am not sure.  But literally every time I found a place, they were charging a TON of money.  I was stressed, unhappy and emailing my best friends way too much about this topic.  I found Luxe just by walking in and found out that they were not open on Sundays.  Ack, I was getting married on a Sunday. However, I found out that a stylist, Michelle was able to take care of us that day.  The prices were pretty reasonable and we had the salon to ourselves.  My friends brought in yummy snacks and drinks and we were able to relax, listen to music and just have a really enjoyable experience.  Also, Michelle was FAST.  Like super fast. While it would have been nice to have been pampered a little longer on my wedding day, we were an hour ahead of schedule.  And that made such a difference.  We were able to relax and read magazines and get to the wedding venue with more than enough time.  How often does that happen on a wedding day? It was so so appreciated by me.  My hair was natural but pretty as was makeup. I dont even really ever wear a lot of makeup anyway, so I appreciated the natural look.   We had a fun relaxing time and I think that we all looked pretty.  So thank you Michelle for being there on a day the salon is opening and thank you for adding to a relaxing wedding day!

15.description: Was pleased when I first found Luxe as I had been going to a "chain salon" and my hair color needed to be corrected.  Luxe did a good job, however, the problem with the salon are the hours and the adherence of staff to keep the scheduled appointment times. One time I had called to say I was running 15 mins late and was asked to reschedule-fine. When I showed up for my rescheduled appt I was made to wait over an hour! Really? Then another time I was called and and made to reschedule because the stylist had something come up. Fine. I should have stopped going then. The last straw was when  I made my appointment 3 weeks in advance and made sure they knew I would not be able to make it in for another 3 weeks so I needed to keep this appointment. I stressed this fact as I had been canceled before. Babysitting was scheduled and all arrangements made, and of course I receieved a call the day before saying I'd have to reschedule my appointment for another day. Frustrating to say the least. I didnt reschedule and called later that day and left a message for one of the owners to see if I could been seen by someone else as I had babysitting etc in place already. I was willing to pay more. Of course, I didnt receieve a call back. Customer service does not seem to be a priority here which is a shame bc I did enjoy this salon but the frustration with scheduling trumps that. I received a recommendation for a salon near there from a friend who schedules her appointments 6 months out and has yet to have a problem. Ill be going there from now on.

7.description: I took my mom as part of the Pretty City $31 specials.  My mom had previously received a terribly bland hair cut at another salon.  I called in the morning and got lucky with an early afternoon appt with Olivia.  Once we got there, I briefly explained what my mom was looking for and Olivia confidently and quickly got the job done.  My mom was complimented by other clients waiting and walked out with a lovely hair cut.  Overall, nice/talented staff and great experience.

8.description: I like this salon, but it's not my favorite.  I haven't lived in Chicago too long, and am trying to find the perfect place.  I live close, so I decided to try it out.  I have seen Michelle twice, and she is very sweet and tries really hard to listen to exactly what I want.  My first visit was a little off-putting for a couple reasons.  First, I have short hair, and she seems to be much more in-tune with cute cuts and styles for long hair.  Also, I brought in pictures of what I wanted, but she kind of did what she felt would look best anyway.  It didn't end up looking bad, but it just wasn't me.  I went back again and was much happier the second time around.  She did a better job of listening to what I wanted, and I was very happy.  She's a great stylist too, and I would truly recommend her to ladies with long hair, but probably not short or medium.  I also LOVE the products at this place!   They are wonderful for your hair, plus they don't contain any parabens, and aren't tested on animals...so what more could you want?

3.description: I've been going to Luxe for almost nine years and have had wonderful service from Elizabeth and Lainie.  I used to live in Roscoe Village and could walk to Luxe.  Elizabeth was the first (and only) stylist that I ever trusted enough to say, "just do what looks best," and I am always happy.  She is great at listening to what my styling, lifestyle, and look needs are and then making a cut that will complement me.   I am a natural redhead and began coloring my hair a few years ago.  It was really important to me that my color look natural and as close as possible to my natural color.  Most of my family members don't even know that I color my hair.Lainie waxes and tints my brows and they always look natural and wonderful.Occasionally I feel like they've booked too many appointments in a small amount of time, but they are also very flexible about adding or subtracting services at the last minute.The salon has had a bit of turnover in their receptionists, which has led to some confusion when I make my appointments, etc., but overall, I love the service at Luxe!

14.description: what?! 5 stars?! no freakin way. i got my first ever brazilian wax here, and my nether regions have never been so abused. molly the waxer was super nice, but as she was gettin the job done, she was telling me about how people are always coming to her to get their bad wax jobs fixed. ha. i had what felt like a million ingrown hairs. strays. a crooked landing strip. hot damn. needless to say, i'm rockin it au naturel these days.

3.description: Crazy as it may sound, I've tried quite a few massage therapists in my short time on earth. You can thank my Dad, who is an avid believer in the healing powers of massage, and who kindly bankrolled my first five years of massage exploration. Which is all to say...Aline is the best masseuse I've ever had. She is incredibly strong, incredibly intelligent, and has a deep understanding of the ways most of us computer-dwelling workers use our bodies. You will not just get a great massage and stimulating conversation (she's French and has a pretty amazing life story), you will also learn achievable exercises to help you avoid seeing her again! She truly puts the client's interests at heart. I reccomend her to anyone in need of stress relief but particularly if you work at a desk all day and want to know why [insert body part] aches today. And if you're worried about price (I haven't been in a year or two so I don't know her prices), trust me, one Aline massage is worth 100 mediocre massages.

1.description: Aline is a wonderful massage therapist.  She has strong hands and knows exactly where the knots are and works them out well. She is awesome!!

2.description: I went to Aline for some working out of aches in my upper neck, back and legs.  She did her wonders and got those knots out quickly... Now I feel 2 inches taller and no soreness at all.  Very professional, will ask you where it hurts ; I walked out with a calmness all over my body - thanks !

0.description: Aline is a wonderful massage therapist. I was having pain in between my shoulder blades and after just an hour with her, I feel so much better. I am so happy I went to visit her at Tribe!

12.description: Been going to Mahoma for years!  His expertise is hair dye/highlights and of course awesome hair cuts.  I always get hair compliments.  It doesn't matter what hairstyle I get -- streaks, highlights, long, short, etc.My 12 year old daughter had a hard time adjusting to him when she was younger because she was used to a woman cutting her hair but now that she is entering the teenage years she knows that Mahoma will do a great job.  Besides ---my daughter has tons of hair (corse, dry etc) and only he can manage her hair.Only thing that he might need is a bigger team of hair-stylers.  As of today, its only him.

3.description: I've been going Maoma since 2009. I love getting my hair colored with him. He always used the best products and gives me suggestions on maintaining my hair.

1.description: This is my to go spot when it comes to eyebrows and waxing ! Maria is the wax lady  and does a great job !!

2.description: Unfortunately this is one of the worst experiences I have ever had in any kind of beauty/ hair salon ! I will start and  finish this post  with DO NOT GO TO MARiA  ! After 3 years of using Maria for body sugar waxing , always tipping her well , always being nice to her , this is what she did to a regular client who used her for pretty expensive services ! First , the salon is very modest, but that wouldn't be a problem if it didn't seem dirty at all times, I blame Maria she is the female in the salon , whatever you do ,don't go to the bathroom , instead of relaxing or neutral music they listen to Judge Judy and similar type Tv program , if you are not Spanish speaking person , Maria often works on you while she talks to the owner in Spanish , they laugh and it might be about you , but you would never know ! So I think they try only to make their Spanish speaking customers happy ! Back to how Maria treated her longtime client , she is usually late like 15-20 minutes if you come when she begins her shift , which I have gotten used to , I think she lives close by and the owner calls her when her first customer comes in. For me it was every time as I always scheduled the mid day hours , she wouldn't step in the salon before noon to safe her life , as I have asked her  to come earlier few times ! I really don't think she even wants the job , definitely does not take it serious after I came at 1.15 pm as agreed , nobody says anything , the owner cuts somebody's hair, Maria's room is closed with the little divider , she does not come out to apologize, ask me if I am ok waiting , would I like to reschedule , I can only hear her talk and giggle with customer inside, 50 minutes later , she comes out without apologizing , walks me in the room where she works, I was really upset , I told her why didn't she let me know she would be late , we got into pretty mild exchange  , no voices were raised , as she worked we both didn't say a word, I thought she wouldn't charge after being almost hour late, she did, so I didn't leave tip at all , as I was leaving she didn't say even goodbye ! I am kind of a person who is forgiving and pretty much always avoid confronting if possible , so as I was ready for new appointment I called her , told her I realize it was awkward for the both of us but we have known each other for long time, so I asked her if she has availability, she booked me, only few days later to cancel the appointment in a text less the 24 hours to the scheduled time ( she has done it before) but I should have gotten the hint unfortunately I didn't realize , as she made it sound it was emergency , I texted few days later and she explained in a text that she does not want to give me her services ! I would have never written this post if she said that in that first phone call after the incident what she said in the text ! The only question is if I didn't like her being late, her dirty work room, her Spanish speaking while working on me, why didn't I leave earlier , the answer is because she uses Alexandria sugar wax that I used to use in Europe, my skin does not react good to regular wax ! When I came to Chicago four years ago she was the only one to my knowledge to use Alexandria, good news is that there are few more salons now that use the same product ! As I was using her I never did additional research until her disrespectful behavior , so if you want late , dirty floor, dirty bathroom, questionable towels, cell phone ringing while she works on you while you hear Judge Judy in the back , use Maria ! I have to say one thing the owner seems like cool dude, he does hair  and I feel bad writing this about his salon as he shares the space with her ! Maria you are such a disappointment!!!!!!!! Nobody is gonna be ok if you are late 50 minutes and you don't even make big deal to apologize and charge for your service, I was good enough to call back as I thought you were nice person but you are spoiled person who takes the job from somebody who would really appreciate it !

9.description: Do you know what it's like to walk around with NO left eyebrow? I went in just to get an eyebrow wax she used strip wax so after she applied the canvas sheet to my eyebrow the wax must of went upward & rip there goes my eyebrow! When I got up & she gave me a mirror to look at I was said, "OMG!" She acted like nothing was wrong. I told her I came in with a left eyebrow what happened? She still acted like nothing happened & went on talking about how she also does facials. Wth? My bf was there w/me to get a haircut. They made him look like a fifth grader with a dish bowl hair cut.because we're both way too nice we were foolish enough to pay for the crap service we receive but definitely will NEVER go back! Luckily his ugly haircut grew out faster than my eyebrow which took over a month! I was getting the wtf happened look from my co-workers so annoyed from repeating the story over & over. Save yourself & your money. I wish I remembered her name. She was Hispanic, brown wavey hair, light skinned & less than 32 y/o, kinda chunky.

10.description: I gave two stars because they are friendly and I got my hair washed and styled.  I was happy with the results.  So I thought why not try a haircut there are pretty good reviews. Let's say I walked in with sweeping shoulder length hair.  I asked for a trim to give my hair some shape because I was trying to grow my hair out.   Why was the end result chin length hair??????  I left and ended up going to another salon to have my short haircut fixed.  The haircut was bad.  I think this salon's specialty may be long hair.

4.description: Capelli's is the best the absolute best! Mahoma knows his stuff. I have changed styles over the last years and I've loved every one. Plus his coloring is amazing. And he always has great tips for hair care and styling. Also can't beat the prices. For the amazing quality of work they provide here their prices are low. Maria, the lovely esthetician, is super-friendly and really takes pride in her work and it shows. She is always on point with the eyebrows, waxing isn't the funnest but she is so gentle that the process is a breeze. She's also a perfectionist which in this field I'm glad she is. Her facials have you falling asleep to her touch. Her facials are so relaxing, you'll forget where you're at. Always has answers and suggestions to skin questions. Also she can hold a great conversation, always nice not to be laying there all awkward. I definitely recommend this place.

6.description: I was so worried about going blonde for the first time but I have to say I  am so happy with the results!!! mahonia made me a gorgeous blonde and I high leu recommend him!! He's also such a nice man!!!

15.description: Julieanna is absolutely right. Mahoma is a gem!He gives me great haircuts that everyone tells me are perfect.

0.description: I've been going here for 3 years and I have not been able to find another esthetician better than Maria. Just look at my beautifully shaped eyebrows! They used to look like fat caterpillars! Lol! Besides the fact that she knows her stuff, she's the sweetest girl and keeps you entertained whilst she does the girly stuff I hate. The salon is cute and tidy. The owner always compliments me and makes small talk if he sees I'm bored.Love the chill atmosphere and the prices are great for this area! Definitely recommend

5.description: I been coming here for the past year and a half and i absolutely love the service here. I've gone to many salons and no other has given me the quality that this place has. I love that this place has reasonable prices and the owner Mahoma is such a great stylist! He always gives me the results that I want to see! He is not pushy with his products and he always gives you very helpful tips. Also the esthetician, Maria, is great!! I love all her services from the threading, waxing, facials, EVERYTHING she is good at it. She has never disappointed me or any of the people that I have recommended. She takes time to give you what you want. She is extremely nice and very professional! I encourage you to give her a try, trust me you won't regret it! Finally but not least Hector is the go to guy for hairstyles and makeup.  He is really good at that and more. He did my sisters hair and makeup for prom and she looked gorgeous! I haven't found an excuse to go with him but I have gone with Mahoma and of course he is also good. Overall I love this place! They all know what they're doing and they always put their clients first. Anybody that is doubting their work just go and try it out, I'm pretty sure you guys won't regret it.

13.description: I LOVE going here! I was always that person with curly hair in the front and wavy in the back. I went to salon after salon trying to find someone that could work with my hair and I finally did. Mahoma is a genius. My hair texture has changed for the better ever since I have been going to him.  I love my hair straight, so I always get it blowed out  and he does an amazing job. I moved to the suburbs a couple of years ago and still continue to go to him.

11.description: So I went to try Capelli's based on a review I saw from Julieanna in YELP.  It wasn't the experience of a life time, but it wasn't a scary one and I came out with my hair in a somewhat style.  I will say that Mahoma will listen to your concerns and will give tips about how to take care of your hair.  I recommend a book to him on curly hair to read "Curly Girl" by Lorraine Massey.  I hope he will take her ideas when cutting curly hair.  I love it when my hair is cut by her method.  Good luck out there to all curly heads.I would totally go back for another trim!!!

8.description: I started coming here when my old manager had really nice highlights, so I asked her where she got them from and she finally told me here. I literally had to ask her 3 times before she told me! She was apparently trying to keep this place her little secret or something, but I'm spreading the word baby! Mahoma who is the owner has done an exceptional job with my highlights every time. He is so skilled at what he does...I recently told him to do what he wants with my hair to get rid of the red. He said, "Don't worry, I will make it look very pretty." Boy oh boy, he wasn't playing! I get nothing but compliments when I leave his salon. He is the ONLY beautician that I have went to that has been able to lift my naturally black hair to golden brown with caramel highlights. For whatever reason, people have a very difficult time lifting my hair color. I highly recommend him for any dye job!I also love Hector for his hair cuts/blow dries. He will cut your hair and texturize it, then blow dry it AND flat iron your entire head before letting you leave. He is the only person that has gotten my naturally curly hair bone straight and shiny. They really make a wonderful team together. As of yesterday, I just got a keratin treatment there and I didn't even know they did them! I'm very exctied for the outcome so I will keep you posted. Oh and the best part is that their prices are very reasonable!!! Both of them can easily charge what they do at Mario Tricoci or any big name salon, but they simply don't! I highly recommend this salon and I hope you will like it as much as I do. Just an fyi, since they are a smaller team...appointments are highly recommended.

14.description: I found a wonderful stylist (Mahoma), he owns the Capelli Hair Salon at 2330 W Belmont Ave, Chicago, IL 60618 (773) 755-3822.  He is great and the best I have found for my curly hair, he doesn't try to sell you a bunch of products or services you don't need. He knows how to style so the hair isn't crispy and best....he doesn't cut your hair short just to get the curls (I like long pretty spiral curls, that are soft to the touch)!!! The prices won't break the bank, he took the time to show me how to style my hair by myself, at home and I didn't even have to sit in the salon all day! It is right on Belmont just east of Western on the North side of the street.

7.description: I've been to Maria a couple times: once for sugaring and then for eyebrow threading. I have the greatest respect for her, as she answers all my skin-related questions (acne prevention, moisturizing recommendations, etc...) and she is generous with the advice! I would also highly recommend sugaring over waxing! My skin had much fewer reactions to it and it was much less painful. Maria is careful to spend the time to make you look your best. Really though I have to reiterate that her skincare knowledge is phenomenal--I haven't been to her for a facial yet but that makes her even more kind for giving me so many helpful skincare tips! I can't imagine going anywhere else!

58.description: I had the best tuna melt today at Kitsch'n on Roscoe.They take an ordinary item and make it extraordinarily good.

56.description: Funky decor. I like it. Friendly staff. Good coffee.Go with the coconut french toast! I had the chicken and waffles. Bleh, I've had way better. I am looking forward to trying other things on the menu.

29.description: The Lobster Mac 'n Cheese is heavenly. The best I have ever had. Service is great, prices are reasonable and everything on the menu is amazing.

42.description: Items Selected:Bottomless Coffee from IntelligentsiaFried Chicken and Waffles - Two Pieces of Belgian Waffle, Golden Chicken Thighs, Mixed Fruit, Jalapeno Butter, Fried EggCoconut Crusted French Toast - Shredded Coconut Crusted Brioche, Fresh Pineapple and Strawberries, Raspberry SauceKitsch'n Twinkie TiramisuForever a member of my 'places to visit' during several trips to the Windy City it was finally on Friday that I decided to stop by Kitsch'n on Roscoe, my sister and her fiancé opting to sleep in on the day before their wedding while I went for an early morning run followed by a two-mile walk to a restaurant that more than lived up to its name.  Truly a space that is best seen to be understood with a menu of items both standard and unique it was just after the 8:30am opening that I approached the deceptively sizable space and entering through unlocked doors I immediately became confused, the quirky décor with bedazzled album covers and Tony the Tiger smiling back as The Four Tops played overhead, but not a human to be seen behind the counter or in the kitchen beyond.  Deciding to investigate further only after shouting "hello" it was onward to the back room that I progressed and again finding the space empty I was admittedly startled when a small woman emerged from the storeroom, the look on her face likely similar to mine as we both laughed at the circumstances - the cooks arriving a bit later than usual and thus requiring her to start the stoves and gather items to begin service.  At this point more than a bit amused it would be mere moments before I found a seat and with the first of several cups of Intelligentsia's House Blend poured into a bottomless cup a three-part order was placed - the opening duo arriving in expedited fashion from a kitchen who needlessly apologized more than once.  Admittedly a bit more expensive than one would expect for food that could best be described as 'fun' it was with the restaurant's signature chicken and waffles that I began and although the bird itself was a bit underwhelming the waffle and butter did an admirable job of steering the ship, though a mere half of the crunchy, golden disc seemed chintzy at best.  Improving with subsequent plates my attention soon turned to buttery brioche tossed in shreds of soft coconut and while pineapple could have stood to be sweeter the raspberry syrup helped, an overall lightness to the dish proving a stark contrast to dessert - a pair of America's favorite snack cakes infused with coffee and cocoa amidst a sea of whipped ricotta that tastes far more refined than the concept would seem.

23.description: Second time I've been here and will definitely be back for more! The Bloody Mary is one of the best I've had in the city. Lots of flavor but not overly spicy. This time I got the Coconut Crusted French Toast - to die for. The raspberry sauce on the side is sooo good, could easily use two sides. The French Toast itself is almost doughy it's so soft, but the coconut crust gives it a sweet crunch. I also ordered a side of hash browns to share - the rosemary leaves in these really did it for me, so much flavor! Service was great too. Got two meals and a side for under $35. Restaurant size is a little small, so make sure to come early because this place is always full! Great for people of all ages.

47.description: The food is delicious, albeit a bit pricey. It's a great place to bring visitors and tourists.

8.description: Neat interior, good coffee, fast service, and if you're a fan of coconut, definitely get the french toast!

31.description: Local eclectic spot in Roscoe.  We went on Saturday and were surpirsed how many people were there.  The place was actually really big in the back, they have a heated closed off patio.  Service was pretty quick and friendly.  We ordered from the brunch menu.  Food was nothing special.

34.description: This is a cool neighborhood breakfast and brunch venue. The vibe is very cute and homey. This is my second time here and I've ordered the green eggs and ham as well as the breakfast burrito. The servers are very friendly and the food is delicious. Try to sit in the back patio if you can. The green eggs and ham are a must try!

16.description: I arrived for brunch on a Sunday with the boyfriend, who recommended the place for its amazing food.  Unfortunately for me, Kitch'n was oversold.  There wasn't a wait, and we were seated somewhat promptly, but I felt as though the waitress pressed us for our order, and I tend to make poor food selections when rushed.  My meal began with a warm mimosa; the perfect compliment to those warm, pre-Summer days.  The drink was both forgettable and regrettable.I then ordered the Carnitas Tacos, which were bland, small in number, and just disappointing.  Two flour tortillas with a dollop of pork and a greasy side of those same tortillas, only deep-fried:  $9.99.  Doing the math, my Kitsch'n experience  just didn't add up to a good value or a decent meal, for that matter.  I'd like to say I'd give it another try, but there are plenty of other reviewers here who have done so and came away further convinced of the level of disappointment contained within.  Never the same fool twice.

13.description: Tucked away in Roscoe Village, this place was a recent and pleasant discovery.  A friend invited me for brunch and I loved it.  The decor is cute and homey.  The service was fast and courteous.  The food was great.  I had the green eggs and ham and it was amazing.  I'll be back again and again.

11.description: What there for the first food was terrible.I had the eggs in a basket big mistakeDon't waste your money. Over priceTaste like crap.

39.description: Walked into this place and really dug the vibe. The piped music was reggae and soul...we were feeling it. We were greeted right away and led to a table on the covered, heated patio. Nice touch. We liked the shabby, nostalgic, hipster feel of the place, and the service was pretty good as well.The food was pretty good...I had the bbq chicken omelette and the hubs had...hmmmm, I don't even remember, but it was tasty. I guess had it been rock star amazing, I would have remembered it. I'd like to have given this 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, 3 will do. Cool lil neighborhood spot.

37.description: Kitsch'n is my favorite place to nurse a hangover in Roscoe Village. Get the green eggs and ham... Or their breakfast burrito (but order it with pulled pork)! Even when they're completely full, service hasn't suffered, in our experience.

0.description: I had a magnificent time here; not only was the food delectable, the atmosphere was both comfortable and casual. I had chicken and waffles with the fruit salad.The staff was beyond kind and especially prompt with her service. I had mixed expectations with chicken and waffles, as they can come out poorly breaded or overly soggy. To my joyous relief the chicken was breaded and fried to perfection and the jalapeño butter added extra depth to the flavor palette offered by the sweet crisp flavors of the syrup, waffle, and chicken. I would highly suggest this locale to anyone in the neighborhood seeking an astounding breakfast.

38.description: Wish this was a great neighborhood spot. Been here a few times and unfortunately found the food subpar. Last time, a few people at the table actually were not feeling well if you hours after. Probably will not return despite being so close to where we live.

51.description: Went this morning with my two kids.  The staff, especially server guy, was very kind and attentive.  Food was very good.  I ordered, and ate, green eggs and ham and coffee.  Loved it.  The basil pesto is very flavorful and though the potatoes were nothing like I expected, my son and I finished them with no problem.  Kids ordered mini burgers and grilled cheese.  I assume that both were good because both disappeared.  I'd go back for sure.

27.description: Eggs in basket awesome.

32.description: Fantastic place!Came her for the New Years Day Pajama Brunch. (Gosh, what a great idea.)The bloody's really helped nurse the hangover.The food was to-die-for! I got the hangover burrito, but I kept leaning over and eating my boyfriends Mac & Cheese. Sooo good!I never knew this place existed, but was pleasantly surprised by it's comfort and odd decor. Definitely will be coming back!!! Bonus: They have good coffee!
