54.description: To read some of these reviews, you get the impression that Kitsch'n on Roscoe--seriously, a pretty terrible name for a restaurant--has been resting on its many laurels for a long stretch--if having folks like Rachael Ray blurb about your restaurant counts as a "laurel."  And for a joint that markets itself as a monument to kitsch, Kitsch'n's collection of '70s and '80s flotsam is really kind of weak and uninspiring; I'm confident that there are garage sales that have more impressive galleries of this kind of stuff merely by accident.  But the restaurant is right on the main drag of Roscoe Village with pleasant views of the street--good for watching the parade of yuppie babies and dogs--and the front room feels spacious and comfortable given if it's actually pretty small.And where Kitsch'n got high marks on the morning we were there was on food and service, which is really what counts.  We're not really brunch fans--not really into the whole eggs and breakfast dessert for lunch deal--but at breakfast time Kitsch'n seems to offer a wide range of appealing choices.  If my "Borracho Breakfast Burrito" wasn't the best or most original I've ever had, it attained more depth of flavor than many (and not really sure what "Danish" hashbrowns are, but they were rosemary-heavy and good, too), and my wife was very pleased with her "Green Eggs & Ham," i.e., with pesto.  Special nod to our server, who I think was named Liz:  We came up for a long weekend in Chicago with my developmentally-disabled brother-in-law, who isn't always the easiest to deal with when confronted with a menu like Kitsch'n's, which is rather long and unconventional.  He just wanted plain pancakes and sausage, which really isn't offered as a menu item.  She was especially helpful in putting together an order for him and handled him with genuine good humor throughout the meal.Portions are very generous, but the prices still might be a notch high.

48.description: I'm really in love with the atmosphere at Kitch'n. There's an endless amount of stuff to look at. The brunch is pretty delicious, but my most recent experience at the dinner was a little underwhelming. I liked their nachos, but the tacos were kinda plain. My mom ate about two bites of her taco salad because she thought it was so bad. Next time, I'll stick to the brunch.

44.description: My friends and I were at Retro on Roscoe and stopped in for some cocktails on their patio and had a great time. The drinks were delicious and to top it off the manager (I think) gave us fantastic black bean dip and chips. I have no idea if this is what they typically do but we loved it and he gave us a refill when we were getting empty. When I'm back in Chicago I'll definitely stop by!

24.description: Friendly staff, plenty of cool decor to look at, absolutely delicious chipotle bloody mary. Try the breakfast tacos they blew mind!

7.description: Went to Kitsch'n on Roscoe with two others for brunch on Sunday around 11:45 am. We just beat the rush as there must have been 10-12 people that piled in shortly there after (it's a pretty small place). Definitely take a look around at the decor when you go; it's one of the more eclectic diners I've ever seen!I ordered the BBQ chicken omelette while my friends got the "phat jacks" and the chicken and waffles. Everything is solid! Portion sizes are pretty good but smaller than other diners. Nothing about the food really stood out to me hence the 3 star rating. Service was really good however and the food came out fast. Not the place for a gourmet brunch but if you're looking for something quick and easy this is a good place to hit up!

49.description: Great place! Very fun hipster atmosphere. Food is unique and tastes very fresh. Loved the kitschn chilaquiles.the hashbrowns are super thin and stringy which most of my friends didn't like too much but other than that it was good!

40.description: After reading the reviews of this place we were not expecting much but a place that served tofu and meat products as I'm a vegan and my girlfriend is not.  We were very pleasantly surprised by the friendly and attentive service.  The food was very good and our waitress gave us some very useful ideas on how to spend our day after realizing we were from out of town.  Overall very good experience.

53.description: I think it's the best breakfast around the area. The biggest down fall is make sure you aren't super hungry going in because there is always a wait. I wouldn't recommend it for the other meals, just breakfast. It's a small place so be prepared to squeeze in!

30.description: Gave this place the benefit of the doubt by returning,wish we hadn't. One of the staff was really rude, talking about us out loud rather than helping out - worst service I've had in Chicago. Food is ok but really greasy. Plenty of other breakfast options around that are far better.

46.description: The good.  Place was indeed as kitschy as the name implied.  Food was tasty.The bad.  The place reeked of mildew, and they placed the empty water glasses on the surface of the table with the rim of the glass facing down.  Given how unsanitary the rags that wipe each table might be, if they're even wiped, it was a BIG gross-out and restaurant no-no.  I wound up eating outside because of the mildew smell, but if my friend didn't have her heart on going there, I would have just left before ordering my food.We both had their Spicy Crazy Eggs, also known as Huevos Locos.  The egg were, as I said, tasty, but it still bothered me that my meal was made in an environment that smelled like mildew.  My friend said it was better 10 years ago.I've been there.  I've done that.  There are other places to try.

1.description: This place has some amazing breakfast tacos among other things!  I wasn't super impressed with their biscuits and gravy but that's a tough one to perfect.  I wouldn't suggest bringing a group of more than 6 here just because the tables are smaller.  Also, the food came out SO FAST; I mean breakfast is usually served pretty quickly but I swear we ordered our food and were eating in less than 10 minutes!The decor is very cool, they have board games and some of the hanging artwork on the wall is for sale!  Definitely a fun place to check out for brunch - FYI: I have only eaten brunch/breakfast here.

55.description: Sat outside on a nice day for brunch, so that was good, though the people next to us had their dog, and I am not a fan of dogs in my eating space.  I had bacon, eggs and crispy hash browns, which were just fine.  I was very excited that they had cinnamon toast on the menu.  I love good cinnamon toast and figured if they had it on the menu it must be special. I was dreaming of toast with a buttery, crunchy cinnamon topping.  Boy, was I wrong.  I got a piece of toasted bread with a little bit of cinnamon and a little bit of powdered sugar dusted on top.  That's it.  No butter, even.  I don't think you can even call that cinnamon toast.  Boo for that, Kitsch'n!

9.description: I dream of going back to this place. A friend suggested it to our group while I was visiting for the Blues Festival. We enjoyed it so much on Saturday that our group of 5-6 unanimously voted to return on Sunday. The chilaquiles with pulled pork and salsa verde are to die for.

26.description: I'll give 2 stars strictly because it's a good location and they are kid friendly.  However, the food is terrible.  I've been several times, as it is convenient when in that hood, and I've never enjoyed.  Went again today hoping it would have gotten better and I believe it actually got worse!  My husband ordered the basil pesto omelet and said it had zero flavor and it was watery.  I ordered the eggs in a basket and it was just plain old disgusting.  How do you mess up eggs in a basket?  The bread tasted like it was cooked on a dirty griddle and the eggs were undercooked.  And the hashbrowns!!  They taste like they've been double deep fried with giant sprigs of to rosemary.  Again, great location but terrible terrible food.  It's really too bad.

25.description: I really like this place for brunch/lunch. While so many places on Southport corridor have 1.5hr wait times for brunch, at Kitsch'n we got seated right away. Brunch menu mixes it up a bit, we got breakfast tacos (divine) and tuna melt (a little bit greasy but good hangover food!). Wish they did cappuccinos, just straight coffee. Nice outdoor space for warmer weather. Prefer seating out back than infront of store

12.description: Went for the first timeHad high hopes based on reviewGot the chicken and waffles to goSuper disappointed for $14.Two small wafflesOne tiny piece of chickenWeak

59.description: A local diner feel and some creative items on the menu. I loved the hashbrowns...skinny and crispy, and I had a BLT with an egg on it that was delicious and creative.

21.description: I had the Chilaquiles and they tasted fantastic! It was the first time I've had Chilaquiles with red salsa in a long while & I thought it was great. The only thing I would change with the dish is I would prefer to have the bacon (and more than 2 slices!) chopped/mixed into it. Otherwise, it was a good choice. I added avocado to it also & that made it even better! Although, Californians like avocado on everything. I plan to come visit here again!

17.description: "Awful waffle" ....Waffles were  advertised as two waffles when in reality we were served only two quarters of a waffle, not 2 whole. Chicken was bland and even the fruits were nasty. The momosa, taste like vomit....don't waste your time or money.

10.description: Been here a few times, a fun neighborhood spot with good food at a good price. The Chilaquiles are very tasty (and great if you're trying to get over a hangover)

5.description: I got the Mac n' Cheese Deluxe, which the menu implies comes with a good amount of bacon. There were evidently bacon "crumbles" but barely had any presence in the meal. I went back and asked to which the hosts graciously offered to give me a few slices of bacon, but I am still unsure why there is an $11 Mac n Cheese if the bacon was the mere crumbles on this.I also got the Brownie Batter dessert, which came with a cookie so overcooked we literally did not eat it because it was so hard to break and also not tasty because of how overdone it was.I would probably not go back to this place.

3.description: Chill local brunch place. It's a more of 2-4 friend environment. Service was kind and got the food pretty quickly. Went there around 12pm on a Saturday and was seated immediately. Loved the awesome decor feel. For food I thought my breakfast burrito was great, but nothing too memorable. The cheese was good within the burrito. This was the first time I had hash brown in string form.

35.description: Very good.  Loved the coconut french toast.  Perfect amount of sweetness and portion size.

19.description: Kitsch'n is full of a variety of quirky kitsch - get it? This is a fun, casual spot to grab brunch in the mornings, or tacos in the evening. The past two times we have ventured to Kitsch'n, the outdoor back patio was reserved for private events, so unfortunately we couldn't sit out back in the lovely warm weather. We sat out front in their other outdoor seating area which was still nice. We ordered an assortment of tacos and some drinks, and started with the chips and guac (also served with comp black bean dip). The tacos were great - we tried the beef, chicken, and fish (the fish were my favorite, served with a mango salsa). I also tried the house margarita which was very tasty and not too sweet.

28.description: This is our favorite place in the city for brunch. We've gone over and over again. We are big weekend brunch people and have tried dozens of places throughout the city. Somehow we always end up back a Kitsch'n. The food is great, the drinks are even better. We've never had a bad experience and we've tried almost everything on the menu. Definitely stop in and give it a try.

45.description: Great Chilaquiles and Bloody Mary's! A go-to spot for me when I visit my best friend, who lives in the neighborhood.

33.description: I really liked the breakfast tacos. The ingredients were very fresh and the portions were perfect for a brunch. The Bloody Mary was pretty average but my girlfriend said the mimosa was great. Overall, both the food and the ambience are unique and comforting.

43.description: Can't say it's was bad, and can't say it was good.  Just stuck in the middle.  Service was great, food was ok, but somewhat pricey for the portion size.  Would I go back for breakfast, probably not.

2.description: We came for Pajama Day Brunch on New Years. It was pretty busy and we were seated in a semi-warm enclosed patio area. There were mounds of snow pushed to the side and tables and chairs right up on top of it.... not the coziest ambiance. But the PJ theme was fun.  I honestly was pretty disappointed with all the food that was ordered. I dont think anyone in our party of 8 loved their dish. I ordered the mac and cheese and it was missing something... couldn't quite put my finger on it. The grilled cheese, chicken and waffles, breakfast burrito, was all meh. The french toast was probably one of the better dishes but it still wasnt that great. The drinks were a little overpriced for the dive-y feel. Don't think I'll be back!

18.description: Local eclectic spot in Roscoe.  We went on Saturday and were surpirsed how many people were there.  The place was actually really big in the back, they have a heated closed off patio.  Service was pretty quick and friendly.  We ordered from the brunch menu.  Food was nothing special.

41.description: Went on a busy Saturday morning about 10:30am. No wait, a few tables were open in the main dining room in front but hadn't been bussed so the hostess showed us to a seat in the back, enclosed outdoor area. It was a bit cold and we kept our jackets on through the duration of the meal, but I'm guessing it was due to the first cold day of the year, so they hadn't kicked on the heat yet. No big deal.I was drawn to the place because I'm a vegetarian and they boasted a decent vegetarian menu. Not so much.Their main popular dish had eggs & bacon but said it was able to be changed to cater to a vegetarian. I asked the waitress how - she said they'd take out the bacon. Nah. Went with the breakfast tacos, minus egg, add avocado ($1.50.) Received two flour tortillas, each with a thin slice of avocado and some red sauce and a bit of sour cream. The dish came with a cornbread hashbrown side, which was decent, but at the entire plate costing just under $10, definitely was not worth it. The person I was with had green eggs & ham with hashbrowns. It appeared to be an egg scramble with bits of ham in it. He said it was ok. His totaled a tad over $10.I think the important thing here is to note that the place might be good for ovo-lacto vegetarians who consume eggs & dairy, but they shouldn't really boast a large vegetarian brunch menu because plenty of us don't eat eggs. In short: seemed promising but food fell a little short for the price.3 stars because service was good for the business and the place had a homey feel to it.

52.description: Kitsch'n is full of a variety of quirky kitsch - get it? This is a fun, casual spot to grab brunch in the mornings, or tacos in the evening. The past two times we have ventured to Kitsch'n, the outdoor back patio was reserved for private events, so unfortunately we couldn't sit out back in the lovely warm weather. We sat out front in their other outdoor seating area which was still nice. We ordered an assortment of tacos and some drinks, and started with the chips and guac (also served with comp black bean dip). The tacos were great - we tried the beef, chicken, and fish (the fish were my favorite, served with a mango salsa). I also tried the house margarita which was very tasty and not too sweet.

50.description: No idea if this place is actually any good because the food we ordered never showed up.  They blame the delivery guy and said someone else got my food and it will be remade and delivered in 15 minutes.  Over an hour later and there's still no food.  I called them back and they actually said "I don't know what to tell you".  Really, how about you cancel the order and give me a refund?  The best food in the world doesn't do you any good if it never shows up.  Stay away if you know what's good for you.

4.description: My favorite breakfast in the area. The green eggs and ham is a delicious blend of the pesto and the creaminess of the scrambled eggs. I also had the bbq chicken omelette which is guaranteed a winner. I can eat that everyday. The chicken and waffle portions are just right. Not too heavy with the breading and the waffle size is perfect. I liked the service and the atmosphere inside, both front and back. If you have room, try the very sugary and sweet Twinkie tiramisu.

6.description: YUM!I was going to say in this review that the way to my heart is through chilaquiles, but really, it's through salsa verde.  You should always opt for the sub of slow roasted pork with salsa verde because who wants bacon with your chilaquiles?I also was craving grapefruit juice (random) and their juice hit the spot.  Didn't have their coffee (I BYO-D from Starbucks, shame) but it smelled delicious and they had a spicy hot chocolate that I would have definitely taken part in.My fiance got what I call Boring Breakfast - you know the dish.  Eggs your way, hashbrowns, choice of meat, toast. ZZZZZZZZ.   He's usually way more adventurous, but he wanted something basic and said it was great.I didn't have room for any of that nonsense, though.  I was on a chilaquile mission and that mission was verily accomplished.  Cute atmosphere, super nice people, adorable patio.

22.description: I have been here several times, and have yet to be disappointed. The service has always been friendly and fast, the food has always been quite good, and the mimosas might be one of my fave mimosas around (it's the orange juice!). Also, as a vegetarian, I have many options to choose from (that actually taste phenomenal). Love bringing my out of town visitors here for brunch, because most places don't offer a week day brunch option.

15.description: Walked into this place and really dug the vibe. The piped music was reggae and soul...we were feeling it. We were greeted right away and led to a table on the covered, heated patio. Nice touch. We liked the shabby, nostalgic, hipster feel of the place, and the service was pretty good as well.The food was pretty good...I had the bbq chicken omelette and the hubs had...hmmmm, I don't even remember, but it was tasty. I guess had it been rock star amazing, I would have remembered it. I'd like to have given this 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, 3 will do. Cool lil neighborhood spot.

57.description: I came here with my family for Mother's Day brunch. The breakfast tacos, huevos locos and egg BLT were amazing! So good. The fresh squeezed orange juice was refreshing and the service was spectacular. Great location in RV as well. I'll be back!

20.description: I arrived for brunch on a Sunday with the boyfriend, who recommended the place for its amazing food.  Unfortunately for me, Kitch'n was oversold.  There wasn't a wait, and we were seated somewhat promptly, but I felt as though the waitress pressed us for our order, and I tend to make poor food selections when rushed.  My meal began with a warm mimosa; the perfect compliment to those warm, pre-Summer days.  The drink was both forgettable and regrettable.I then ordered the Carnitas Tacos, which were bland, small in number, and just disappointing.  Two flour tortillas with a dollop of pork and a greasy side of those same tortillas, only deep-fried:  $9.99.  Doing the math, my Kitsch'n experience  just didn't add up to a good value or a decent meal, for that matter.  I'd like to say I'd give it another try, but there are plenty of other reviewers here who have done so and came away further convinced of the level of disappointment contained within.  Never the same fool twice.

36.description: Tucked away in Roscoe Village, this place was a recent and pleasant discovery.  A friend invited me for brunch and I loved it.  The decor is cute and homey.  The service was fast and courteous.  The food was great.  I had the green eggs and ham and it was amazing.  I'll be back again and again.

14.description: Came in on a busy morning. Was seated outside under some tent. It was heated, but still a little chilly outside.. I mean it is the middle of winter. Ordered the Chilaquiles, not very good. Dry.. Could have made them at home myself. My friend ordered the Breakfast burrito in a bowl, no tortilla. Pretty reasonable request right? The waitress responded with "It's pretty busy, I'm not sure they'll make modifications" Coffee was watered down, so was the cokes. Will not return, should have went to Orange.

12.description: Getting my pink & white fill in with my favorite nail tech for over 15 years!!! There is a reason I have followed her from Gurnee to her own salon in Libertyville.  Tomi has always done such a beautiful job on my pink and white acrylic nails with a gel overlay, I get compliments daily!!! Love her and her gorgeous new salon in libertyville.  It's such an escape to come relax and visit... Leaving feeling refreshed and looking fabulous of course!

7.description: I had tried some other nail salons in the area and this is the best I've tried to date. The staff is very polite and professional. I had a French no chip manicure which has lasted 12 days so far with no chips, no peeling, and no bubbling. (I have never had a no chip manicure look so good for so many days, which I believe is due to rushing through the procedure and not taking the time required under the uv light after each layer of polish). All the work surfaces and tools were clean. My pedicure was also done meticulously-one toenail was broken (too far to cut) and the technician took the time to fix it, which turned out perfectly. I would recommend this salon.

20.description: I stopped by T Nail Spa yesterday for a mani pedi on the recommendation of a friend. The owners, Tomio and her husband, Ken, were gracious and welcoming, and I was put into a comfortable chair immediately. The salon is immaculate and pleasant, and I received one of the best mani/pedis I've ever had, and for a very reasonable price. The pedi included a leg massage, salt scrub and hot towels (so relaxing!) and the exceptional mani was done at the same time. The customers in the store were clearly long-time regulars, and after my enjoyable experience, I can understand why. I'll be back again.

19.description: Clean bright cheerful environment. All the technicians are very good. Any kind of nail art you want, you can get there.

1.description: Stopped in for a manicure, and I was not disappointed. Not only did Tyler greet me as soon as I came in the door by name, but I was also offered a glass of wine (score) and bottle of water. I haven't had my nails done in awhile, and it feels great to tap away on my keyboard with a fresh mani that's been done so well - I will certainly be back!

2.description: I guarantee if you give this salon a try you will never go anywhere else as long as you're in Chicago. Very comfy salon, sparkling clean, staff is friendly and convenient free street parking.14 days after getting gel color mani & pedi, still looks fresh no cracks, chips, still perfect. The salon uses the best quality nail products & entire staff seem to take pride in their work and takes the time to ensure the best result possible.This salon is owned by Lily who has always been probably one of the best nail techs in the business. I've followed her from various salons and she was the best at all of them. Formerly working at Wonder Nails, Lily's hard work & excellent attention to detail has earned her own high quality nail & waxing salon.Lily is very picky with whom she employs and all staff seems to follow her high expectations of quality nail service. I highly recommend this salon to anybody that loves perfect nails.

9.description: Yikes! I am surprised this place has any good reviews! The chairs are broken and jab into your back, the whole place feels grimy, their "hot towels" are old grubby cleaning rags, and the people seemed to all be in their own little world (at one point there were about 5 'workers' just hanging out at the front of the store and yet they still made a girl wait for service). The girl that did my pedicure was so rough, I nearly scalded my feet with the water 3 times! She buffed them so hard that I have bleeding sores on my feet (for real!!!); she chopped the nails off after I asked for "barely any cutting"; and then she slapped on 2 quick cotes of polish and ran off to the next appt, leaving me to just sit in the chair to dry. I really couldn't believe how terrible the experience was!

6.description: I think the lady I had wasn't used to doing French tip nails because mine ended up kinda scraggly. After she painted the white tips she didn't go over the edge with remover to make it smooth. The store also reeked of incense. Very nice workers though.

18.description: My mani-pedi was great & truly a relaxing experience. Everyone there is friendly and helpful. I personally would recommend T Nail Spa to anybody looking to relax and enjoy themselves. I give it two thumbs up.

10.description: My only problem with T Nails is that I didn't find it sooner!  It's not easy to spot- between Dunkin Donuts and Grand Appliance. Only a few technicians. Nori has done my nails 3 times and each time I've had people compliment me. I get acrylics but she makes them look natural!  Plenty of colors to choose from. The salon is clean and bright and everyone is nice. I don't give many 5 star reviews.

13.description: I have finally found my regular place. I was so happy with the job Michelle did on my nails, artificial gel fill and a no chip on top with some nail art! Lasted perfectly!  Love the fact that I can have some fun with my nails using color and art and then go back to my normal pink & whites.

16.description: I saw reviews on Yelp for this salon and saw that Michelle was the top technician. I called spoke to Michelle and she got me in. She talked to me about what I wanted, liked, etc. She and I got along great. The salon is clean, stylish and they are all very friendly. She has me as a client for life!!! Thank you Michelle.    Stacey- Libertyvlle

17.description: We saw the great reviews for this place and decided to pop in. I had a male. I was a bit disappointed with the cleanliness, be sneezed in his hand before touching my feet and then when I asked if he could used gloves he gave me attitude. He then took out a razor type tool and when declined he gave me attitude. I wasn't impressed. I likely will not visit again.

15.description: Was very excited to give this place a try since it had high reviews and is close to my house. I left rather disappointed by the service and the price. It's been over a week and my no chip is chipping?!? I've never had such experience, even when I've done the no chip at home. I would not recommend this place.

0.description: Such a friendly staff !! we got our nails done and eyebrows !! The salon was closed by the time we finished . But even though they were closed they didn't skip any of the steps in a manicure and didn't hurry the service . They took their time and our nails looked great ! and our eyebrows !! awesome staff !!!

5.description: Stopped in here while traveling for work... Friendly nail tech and solid work. Had a pedicure, acrylic fill, and gel polish. The review was for T Nails in Libertyville... Not for the new location.

11.description: Meh.  I got a no-chip manicure and a pedi.  Three of us arrived on a Sunday afternoon and were able to sit right down next to each other, which was nice.  (+) They have a lot of chairs.  (+) Michelle was very nice, clean, and did a good job.  (-) But I was disappointed that they charged extra for a salt scrub, most places include that.  (+) They had a good selection of no-chip colors, and I wasn't rushed to pick one.   (-) The finished product looked pretty good, but one of the nails had bleeding into the cuticle (I'll post a pic so you know what I mean).   This happens to me all the time when I do my own, but I expect more from a professional, especially for what I paid.  Which brings me to the main reason I deducted stars.  (-) I paid $58 without tip - too pricey!  All-in-all: meh, I'll only come back if I have a coupon.

8.description: My original review was for T Nails in Libertyville. I don't appreciate Lily Nails in Chicago taking the T Nails account a few months ago and my review and assigning them over to Lily Nails. I tried to delete my original review, and my account won't let me do so. Shame on you.

3.description: It was time to find a new manicurist and I wanted one close to home so I tried Lily for the first time last week.   What a great discovery!   Lily gave me an excellent pedicure complete with solving an ingrown toenail issue almost painlessly. My legs felt great. Then she did my nails exactly as I'd asked and all in less than an hour.   I can't say enough good about that visit. I have become her regular client after only one visit.

14.description: I had a gift card and stopped in for the first time. I made an appointment and still waited for 20 minutes. The male manager was chatty and though nice a little overbearing at times. He did a lot of checking in with the very young technicians and would watch over their shoulders for several minutes. It made me even a little uncomfortable. Two of the technicians flirted almost the entire time I was there and I felt like my mani and no chip were on the sloppy side. Probably won't go back though the prices were pretty low.

4.description: Lily is THE BEST at both nails and waxing! I'm a wardrobe stylist here in Chicago, and cannot recommend Lily and her team highly enough. The salon is clean, professional, friendly, and warm.

3.description: I really like this store. In addition to being a really well stocked liquor store, it's also a deli and convenience store with produce, dairy, and random goods you forgot you needed. When I walked into Miskas on a Sunday afternoon, I was going in to buy a bottle of water. I left with almond milk, toilet paper, ginger beer, and deodorant--DONT JUDGE! I ran out and you don't want me being all funky.The staff is super friendly and didn't laugh at me when I cam back twice within 10 minutes because I forgot the water I went in there to buy. Overall, a well stocked liquor store with friendly employees and items to help you maintain your personal hygiene.

1.description: Let me first say, this is down the street from my apartment and about the most convenient convenience store in the area.  I have been here after work, usually around 6, and every time I am, I get followed VERY closely by an older woman, whom I assume manages the shop.  Now I am all for security a d trying to reduce theft, as are most businesses, but this place is a bit over the top.  It just made me feel really uncomfortable walking around trying to get a few items.  That aside, the store has a decent variety of food and other items you might need, but has an extremely impressive beer, wine, and spirits section.  If you can't find what you're looking for, you don't really need it.  Prices are decent for the area and the "style" of mom and pop store that it is.

2.description: This is a corner grocery store to pick up a few items if you are in a hurry. They have a limited supply of food, but have quite the selection of alcohol beverages from wines and beers to liquor.  The staff seems friendly, but they watch you like a hawk as you walk around.  If you just need a quick liquor this is your place to go, but not for general merchandise.  Mariano's is not far away.

9.description: Love this place. Great selection and great prices. I bought a case of Dos Equis for the same price as it is at Jewel Osco. It's spacious and clean. The manager, Devin is knowledgeable and super nice.

10.description: HUGE store, amazing selection. It's nice that they carry other goodies in a pinch too, beyond just liquor. I don't think the prices are any sort of deal, but I'm willing to pay for the convenience.

4.description: Decent selection and convenient but cannot deal with the security "shadowing" whenever I visit here.  I feel very uncomfortable whenever I visit this place and just can't understand why they don't invest in a better camera system if they are worried about theft.

6.description: If I didn't live next door, I'd never shop at this store.Each time I go to Miskas thinking "maybe this time they will have what I need" I'm disappointed. Sometimes what I need is a little customer service and neighborhood recognition. Nada, as the stock person at Miskas with a degree in English as a second language would say. I ordered a keg a month in advance and got the run around until the 11th hour and never got the keg. I went in for olives, they were out (for weeks). I bought eggs on a pinch, they were expired. They were out of 12 packs, so I asked if I could buy two six packs for the twelves price, nope. Told them I'd make it a point to buy from Binny's as I overpaid for a 12 pack, the response was "credit or debit?". This place is mismanaged and the employee turnover is atrocious. The guy at the deli is pleasant, and other than him, to hell with the rest. One star for deli guy, one star for Roscoe Village tax revenue. I will avoid them whenever possible.

12.description: One of the more underrated Microbrew, liquor, and wine sellers in the city. Selection is great in all three phases. I often find beer and liquor that is hard to come by at other places (Three Floyd's, top shelf whisky). Prices are reasonable and they almost always have great deals on domestic beer and popular liquor. Also operates as a convenience store of sorts, having A LOT of floor space and inventory. There's also a Deli on the way.

5.description: I use this place for late night snacks. It's convenient and clean but I will admit the deli strikes me as odd but hey why not put a deli in a liquor store lol. The guys that work there are really friendly and have the patience of an angel with some of the customers I've seen in there, more than I do just being another customer. Selection for food and stuff is rather limited but the liquor selection is a good size, overall a good corner store and better than the bodegas further west on belmont

13.description: For those of us that had been there before it's no wonder it was closed down for so long.  Not anything like it's sister store 1000 Liquors on belmont/sheffield.

11.description: Since I moved I'm no longer close to my favorite discount liquor store, so that meant finding a new one.  I remembered someone telling me that Miska was a good place for deals on liquor.  Off I went to see for myself.  The store is larger than I thought, bright, clean, and well stocked.  I found everything I needed without looking like a mouse trapped in a maze.  They have some specials that are well marked, so definitely look for those.  Also, I don't believe it's advertised, but if you buy more than 6 bottles of wine they give you a 10% discount on all bottles.

8.description: HALLELUJAH!!!!!I am BEYOND happy there is a corner store in the neighborhood.  I've lived here for a few years and there was nothing even close to Miska's.  What do you want?...beer, wine, water, papertowels, tp, salsa, chips, ice-cream. They have all of it! I love stores that cater to several everyday needs and Miska's is right on the mark.  The deli isn't open yet but I'm sure it will be amazing.  The staff is super friendly and they have an ATM! Another thumbs up b/c there are few and far between in this area.

0.description: As soon as I entered this place, there was security personnel on my tail almost immediately.  I felt very safe the entire time, knowing I was being watched literally every second of my stay.  The old style Military fanfares blaring from their fully integrated P.A system was a great accompaniment to my experience.  The walls are covered in old school (i love vintage! lol) Stalin and Putin posters, military grade weaponry (not-loaded/disassembled), and giant X-ray and infrared cameras.  I have a feeling there may have been some form of insurgency or mass robbery that could have inspired such incredible security measures.  The owner is a very interesting man!  He screams a lot, and points his fingers around in an emasculating show of power over his lowly employees.  His voice was booming, and his wife, timid and understanding of the necessity to inspire his employees against the dangers of corporate espionage and theft prevention.  They have Fireball.

7.description: I like my martinis dirty. I would expect a liquor store to have olives and/or brine.  They had one jar of olives that looked like overgrown peas.  Here's the deal. If I have to get in a car to go get garnishments and, in the case of a dirty martini, essential ingredients elsewhere, I'm going to want to minimize the number of trips and Miskas isn't the go to store for that one stop liquor shop. What the hell is the toilet paper, can of mushrooms and Windex have to do with a liquor store? Nice add if you did the rest well.  The guy behind the counter told me I could go to the store down the street for decent olives.  Good suggestion.

29.description: When I was a kid I used to get so Excited about a Tripto my Local Toys R Us...Way back in the Past when I was a child Toys R Us was actuallynamed Bargain Town, right off Milwaukee Avenue near Armitage.I Loved Toys, better yet people buying me Toys! :)Well, Today My Son Nick and I went Toy Shopping for my Granddaughter Carissa..Carissa will be 2 next month and she is Finally over herBarney Phase- Thank God for that but now she has another Favorite!Elmo is now the man of the hour!So Elmo it was! Tickle me Elmo,(Really Cute but kindda hyperwhen tickled,) An Elmo Laptop Computer, Not a real Lap-top, a Toy one2 other Elmo Toys which I can't remember,personally I think I am all Elmo-ed out!Okay, Toys R Us at Riverview Plaza, layout of store is a little confusing..Kept looking for someone on the floor to help us find stuff but it took a while, but finally the Toys R Us Employee every boss would dream of having work for him came to our assistance...Forgot to get his name, I was Elmo-ed Out... But he is a Blonde headedGuy if that helps. Guy deserves a Raise for sure...He Even helped me find the Hot Toy from Last Christmas, the Electronic Mickey Mouse that does the Moonwalk and other assorted pretty cool stuff..I decided the $70.00 price tag was too much, even if he does the Moonwalk like Michael Jackson!The Store seemed well stocked and Neat and Clean...Check-Out was smooth as well.So, hopefully my Granddaughter will Love her gifts that I will bring to GreenBay for her this Sunday!Cause, I am too Old for Elmo and I don't think my Son Nick will want these toys either.. He'll be 26 soon... Special toys for my very special granddaughter..Thank You Toys R Us!P.S- Toys have gone up in price alot since I was a kid...This I do  not like.. :(

42.description: This is the staple of my childhood, (not this location). I would anticipate coming here, my eyes would get wide, my heart beat a little faster, I would become a hyper little kid. Sadly I've gotten older and expect a little more than to have that "certain" toy to be there. Clean and organized store, friendly and helpful staff and well stocked merchandise. Well I've been here on more than one occasion, several times in fact. Trying to find some thing for my niece and nephew at one point or another. The staff usually for me is fairly on the ball and happy to help a bleary eyed, confused and befuddled uncle. The store can be crazy to figure out where things are, shelves have merchandise tossed and strewn about, misplaced items. Trying to find that certain red power ranger, not the blue, and with the shield and not the power sword can be a little frustrating. I now know what I put my family through during those younger years of my life. The store can get messy, especially during any rain or snow which just doesn't help the situation. I only now try and come here when I absolutely have to. It is messy and disorganized, trying to find one toy can be a big nightmare and ulcer inducing, thank goodness for meditation.... and drinking after wards.

23.description: I got in and got out as fast as I could.  There are too many screaming kids at this location. I bought Dekor diaper disposal.  I asked a worker to help me find it and she was clueless so I ended up finding it myself. The annoying part was that I wanted to buy refills for the Dekor and they just don't carry them.  WTF??  Really??  So now I have to buy it online. I think I will just buy online for now on.  This store gave me a headache.

47.description: Went shoping here just before Christmas. Nice selection and easy to find employees.

8.description: I normally do not review chains but Yelp definitely has this location wrong, or at least that was my impression on my last visit here. I don't have kids so rarely have to shop at Babies R Us; however, baby shower season is in full gear so there I was. I ordered some items online at Babies R Us and ordered in-store pick-up here and after reading the negative Yelp reviews, I will admit I was already dreading heading over there. I was definitely pleasantly surprised. The entire transaction from the minute I walked in the door to the time I got my items and left was under 5 minutes and along the way, I encountered numerous helpful staff, even on a busy Friday evening.  I went to the Registry kiosk since I wasn't sure where to pick up the items and she kindly informed me to go up to the front customer service desk, but she initiated the pick-up from her kiosk so it would alert the front desk.Once at the front desk, they had my items already at the counter and the check-out was super fast and easy.Really fast, friendly and helpful service. Would not hesitate to do in-store pick-up in the future here!

31.description: Once a Toys R Us kid, always a Toys R Us kid. I really don't get the hate and the flame that is thrown at this Toys R Us and the only reason I came to Toys R Us was because Christmas was around the corner and it was time to hook up the little ones with fun toys without driving their parents mad.Given the limitations and given that Toys R Us was packed to the brim with carts, strollers, and an endless wave of parents and kids I really didn't find it all that bad. I had fun looking through all of the toys and seeing the latest in giant ginormojumbo Lego sets, new spins on old favorites like Star Wars, GI Joe, and Transformers. I escaped buying five Transformers, one big ass panda and a ferocious looking foam Tyrannosaurus Rex and didn't get trampled. I must admit, I was exposed to too high a dose of ghettospeak coming from all the folks inside but what's the big deal - everybody needs toys!

34.description: Wow. Where to begin? This construction zone of a store (there is not even a sign on the building at the moment, so I thought it was shut down at first) is now a Toys R Us/ Babies R Us combo. I understand construction and all, but this place was unstocked, disorganized and a complete maze. I couldn't even handle being there for more than 10 minutes. I had gone there to browse while I was killing time in the area, but it was almost just stressful being in there.. The only decent thing was that there were 5 million employees milling around there and I got asked if I needed help 4 times in that 10 minutes, so I'm sure if I'd had one item in mind, I would have gotten help.I'm almost sorry I shredded the review of one of the other Babies R Us stores that I went to recently, because that one was way out of the league of this one.

16.description: If this place only had a bigger selection, and wasn't so cramped I could easily bump it to four stars based upon the rest of my experience...Enjoy Suckas'!!!

13.description: No problem! We literally were in and out within a couple minutes. Can't complain.

11.description: I have to say the customer service at this Toys R Us really came through for me when I had a defective component part. They tracked down the manufacturer and resolved the issue in a few short days--absolutely excellent customer service and my hat is off to Jan, Sylvia, and Jennifer in particular.

39.description: I have to say I was impressed with my recent visit here. Now generally I don't go back to a place a gave a bad review to, however, we needed baby food. They have redone the store format and they have a large selection of baby products. Yippie! They carry many more baby foods than before including organics. They also have a small section of children's clothing as well. If they are under new management then I would like to say they are doing a great job with the re-vamp of the store.

37.description: OK, I got to cut the staff some slack. Working in a kids store where everything gets pulled off the shelves is not exactly my idea of fun plus shopping during the holiday season is a double whammy.  We went in knowing exactly what we wanted but could not find where the items were located.  They really do have everything under one roof (if you can find it) We spoke with 3 different associates, all who pointed us in different directions.  We finally succumbed to walking each aisle.  Prices may be be better in other stores so do your homework before hand!

0.description: I was pleasantly surprised at the attention and personal service I received at the Roscoe Village store. When I asked if they had a vehicle in stock they were happy and pleasant and quickly checked to see if they had the item. They also offered to put it together for me. I was very pleasantly surprised at the very good service . They double checked when I checked out. Very good experience. If it was better lit, and cleaner I would have given it 5 stars.

38.description: What in the world has happened to customer service?  I called to see if they had something in stock and the phone just rang and rang.  What the F!  And when I have gone in there its a mess and you cant find any help.  People spend lots on kid stuff, dont they care about return business?  What kind of business is this?   They should call it Jeroffs R US....

27.description: Terrible.  Ghetto.  Attitudes.  Have not been there since the "remodel" a few recent reviews have indicated.  This is my memory of the place from over the winter.

32.description: Got my purchases here, everything was fine until I saw the sign saying I get $5 if they don't upsell me.  They don't, and me pointing that out gets me a look from the cashier that I am a troublemaker.  But the economy is bad, and they made the promise.  I get sent to the customer service desk.That takes me 15 minutes of scanning, rescanning, and rerescanning.  I don't know why they couldn't hand me a picture of Abe Lincoln, but they REALLY wanted to put it on my card.  After all that, I only get $4.17.  I cut my losses and go, I would feel like I got too greedy, but that money doesn't make me Bernie Madoff.

44.description: Oof.  This store... Man, they need some serious help.  We stopped here on Sunday afternoon to pick up some gifts for our church Giving Tree program and while I LOVE LOVE LOVE shopping for gifts, I almost left this store miffed by the endless annoyances held within its walls.  (I say "almost" because nothing can dampen my holiday spirit!  Mwah ha!)This store is a layout nightmare--there is no clear, easy "up and down every aisle" path, which bothers me because I'm positive I missed something in that maze of toys.  Help was hard to find in the store and was pretty clueless, for the most part.  That might just be a product of holiday-hired employees, but it's still really bad.  The woman in front of us had to actually walk the check-out person to the games to prove they were on sale and THEN had to instruct the checker how to run a check through the register.  It was pretty absurd.  Of course, using checks in this modern age is sort of absurd, too, but whatev.I love kids, but sometimes I forget how noisy they can be.  I was given a not-so-subtle reminder at this Toys R Us with maaaaany screeching youngsters clamoring over the new Bratz bus and Tickle Me Elmos.  My negativity towards the loud, bratty kids was canceled out by one young boy ogling some completed Legos projects, who reverently breathed a hushed "Whoaaaaa" when he saw them.  THAT is why I like kids in toy stores.  He saved the whole experience for me.  Well, he and the $4.99 game of Memory (um, one of the best games EVER!) and the awesome Crayola art kit.

24.description: I would imagine that this is what prison fees like.  Get in, get the stuff you need for your kid, and GTFO. Otherwise, you will be sucked in by its tractor-beam of fluorescent lights and depression.

7.description: I hate this store. The staff are so unhelpful and unfriendly and that's if you can even find someone to help you. I only go to buy Earths best organics oatmeal and Ella's kitchen food pouches as nowhere else seems to stock them. Today as I was paying, the cashier completed my transaction and then went off and took a 5 minute call from a customer, while my baby kicks off crying. I asked her three times could she just give me the bag and I'll pack it myself, fell on deaf ears while my little one cried even harder. They have no customer service standards.The bit that annoys me the most is that their online prices they push through email as deals are not honored in store. Their marketing is very misleading. I've mentioned this in store and their staff even agree with me on this.Avoid if you can, Buy Buy Baby all the way where you can be guaranteed a pleasant shopping experience.

40.description: When I was a kid, I used to LOVE coming to this Toys 'R Us with my parents.  Last weekend, my sister and I dropped in to peruse the boardgame section, but first we had to walk through baby clothes, bicycles, nerf ball and arrow guns (which were pretty cool, actually), action figures, basketballs and hoops, kiddie pools, and a whole Lego land area before getting the the relatively small area cordoned off for board games.  For such a big place, they had like 15 different versions of Monopoly, Scrabble and a Yahtzee.  I was sorely dissapointed.  What about CLUE?  Or Risk?  They didn't even carry the seminal childhood hit CandyLand.Toys 'R Us, you have changed.  I just don't know you anymore.

30.description: I went here today with my kids to use there gift cards from xmas. Some of the toys didn't have prices in front of them, even though there was a spot on the shelf for them, so we would have to hunt down a scanner to find the price. The store was a mess. The babies r us side was much cleaner then the toys r us side. As for Help the only way to get help in the store is to go to the cashier and make everyone in line wait behind you while they send someone to get what it is your looking for holding up the lines. the store needs more employees that smile, and try to help customers. Instead of looking disgruntle and mad. Sorry I have worked retail and if you don't like it than find something else.

46.description: Selection: If you know what you're looking for (an eisel), then it's fantasitcEmployees: finding someone to assist you - good luck. We've been here at last once every other month of the last 2 years for an assortement of breeder needs and it's worse than the dentist. This place has the worst customer service.the -4 stars it gets for staffing and +5 for selection equals the 1 star rating.Blech

1.description: Hired a sitter so I could go here to pick up a big plastic slide for my 15 month old. Got there. Picked up the slip of paper. They called back to make sure they had it. Paid, and I was on my way with some twine so that I  could either tie down the trunk or strap it to the roof (huge box). Tied it down, made it home, and the box was missing about half the parts and there were no instructions. UNBELIEVABLE. Called the store to explain the situation and ask them to mail me one directly (it's a big enough company they should be willing to do this right away), and they said there is nobody there that can authorize that. I'd have to bring the slide back (i.e. hire sitter again, re-tie it to my roof, etc.) Never again. This is why I have Amazon Prime and I should have used it in the first place.

9.description: I ordered a train table online for Christmas.  The price was almost 50% off.  A couple weeks before Christmas they sent me  an email saying my order was cancelled.  They offered $10 for their mistake.  I was pissed.  I really wanted to get the train table for my son and could not afford the full price of $80+. A few days went by and toys r us sent me another email stating that they understand how badly they messed up and that the initial $10 email wasn't good enough.  This email they sent an additional $40 to use on top of the $10. I was super pleased.  My kids had a wonderful Christmas.  Thanks toys r us.

26.description: They should've just left this store as a Toys R Us.  The Babies R Us section is cramped and unorganized!  It was not easy to find items off of a baby registry.  The clothing section can only hold 2-3 people at a time.  They tried cramming too much into this little store.  Make it one or the other.  It doesn't work for both.

25.description: I go here for the Babies R Us Section, as we just had our first baby, but I'm sure I'll keep going for the Toy R Us part, too.The customer service here is great. The employees are friendly and helpful. Everytime I go someone makes sure I'm finding everything ok and when I need something specific, they are sure to come through for me. There is never a long wait at registers (except for Christmas, but that's a different beast) and the customer service desk handles everything quickly. My latest experience with this store was with the trade-in sale. I traded an old item in to get something that was not in stock in the store, but was available on-line and the customer service lady helped to make sure that I got my item for the sale price. She did all the computer work for me and made it easy as could be. I agree that this store can feel cramped and unorganized sometimes, but I used to work at a small local toystore and I know how easy it is for a toy store to become a total mess when you have kids (and parents) rummaging through all the fun toys. And this place is HUGE with TONS of stuff, so I cut them slack. I'm sure they keep up with it the best they can and it's never been so bad that I can't find what I'm looking for.I should also add that phone customer service is good, too, which is a bonus, since usually doing anything over the phone can be a pain.Bottom line is that it's as good as a chain toy store is going to get and the customer service is excellent.

12.description: Ok. This now has to be the WORST run toy store in the world. I dread coming here, they are rude, slow, and get upset when you ask for help. Save yourself a migraine and go somewhere else. This is supposed to be a place where a kid can be a kid. But the employees. Who are adults, act like kids. Terrible terrible place.

21.description: I went yesterday, a week before Christmas.  I was sixth in line, with only five of ten registers open.  You'd think they would have all lanes open a week before Christmas.  The couple in front of me tried to use their Groupon, which required a $20 purchase.  Their purchase was $19.97.  The clerk scanned the Groupon, which apparently immediately took the Groupon out of the system and marked it as used.  But the Groupon did not apply because the minimum purchase was not met.  The couple grabbed a pack of gum, bringing the total to an amount over $20.  But the Groupon was already marked as "used."  I waited about five minutes as a manager came over and could not solve the problem, then called the store manager who also could not solve the problem.  Their solution?  They told the couple they would have to CALL GROUPON and get the coupon re-set, then COME BACK and try again.  Are you kidding?  That was the wrong answer on so many levels.  Never once did an employee apologize to the couple.  Instead, the employees blamed the couple for not purchasing enough.  I wish I had had the energy/tolerance/gumption to stick up for the couple and help them out, but I just wanted to get out of that place.  I will not be back, even if they run another Groupon.  There's one on Touhy that might be better.

17.description: I got in and got out as fast as I could.  There are too many screaming kids at this location. I bought Dekor diaper disposal.  I asked a worker to help me find it and she was clueless so I ended up finding it myself. The annoying part was that I wanted to buy refills for the Dekor and they just don't carry them.  WTF??  Really??  So now I have to buy it online. I think I will just buy online for now on.  This store gave me a headache.

10.description: Writing This Review Because Of The Very Nice Young Man That Assisted Me Today, The Store Has A Really Good Selection Of Stuff Which Made It Understandable Why The Store Was So Busy. As I Was Looking For A Toy For My Son Not Sure Of What To Get With All The Options, This Young Man Approached Me I Believe His Name Was Omar And He Asked Me If I Needed Help So He Helped Me Out And Compared Some Toys For Me To Help Me Narrow Dwn My Pick He Was Really Nice And Super Pleasant He Also Knew His Stuff Which Made It Evn Better Rather Then Talking To Somebody Who Has No Idea BTW Its Service Like That That Will Make Me Want To Return.

5.description: Don't even try calling them for help. You will be either placed on an extremely long hold that you don't have time for, or no one will pick up. It was definitely a friendlier and helpful staff when I was a kid. Terrible service now.

3.description: I generally dislike this store and try to never come here but with a new baby and this being the only Babies R Us around, it's the only place for us to use our gift cards. Naturally my 3-month old needs to nurse while we're here meaning a trip to the mother's room. I'm here now and couldn't be more disgusted. It stinks, the diaper pail is overflowing, the furniture is broken and unclean, the floors, walls, and door are filthy. I rarely post negative reviews on Yelp but this is just so unacceptable for a place designed for feeding and changing babies in a store catering to kids and their parents' money. It's such a contrast to the clean and calm nursing room and environment at Buy Buy Baby.

35.description: I usually avoid Toy R Us like the H1N1.  However, my son really wanted to get a Lego Star Wars set he saw in an ad included with Saturday Red Eye.  Here's the short of it all the store is a HOT MESS the people that work there are incompetent to say the very least.  The customer service desk should be renamed"Returns Only" because that is all this girl could handle without incident.  This is a multi million doller company and she could not look up the item in question due to what seems  dial up speed of her computer system.  WOW ....never again.  I was able to find, order, have the said item shipped free to me and at about 8 dollers less then at TRU, on Amazon and not one dumb ass to deal with Priceless....

19.description: When I was a kid I used to get so Excited about a Tripto my Local Toys R Us...Way back in the Past when I was a child Toys R Us was actuallynamed Bargain Town, right off Milwaukee Avenue near Armitage.I Loved Toys, better yet people buying me Toys! :)Well, Today My Son Nick and I went Toy Shopping for my Granddaughter Carissa..Carissa will be 2 next month and she is Finally over herBarney Phase- Thank God for that but now she has another Favorite!Elmo is now the man of the hour!So Elmo it was! Tickle me Elmo,(Really Cute but kindda hyperwhen tickled,) An Elmo Laptop Computer, Not a real Lap-top, a Toy one2 other Elmo Toys which I can't remember,personally I think I am all Elmo-ed out!Okay, Toys R Us at Riverview Plaza, layout of store is a little confusing..Kept looking for someone on the floor to help us find stuff but it took a while, but finally the Toys R Us Employee every boss would dream of having work for him came to our assistance...Forgot to get his name, I was Elmo-ed Out... But he is a Blonde headedGuy if that helps. Guy deserves a Raise for sure...He Even helped me find the Hot Toy from Last Christmas, the Electronic Mickey Mouse that does the Moonwalk and other assorted pretty cool stuff..I decided the $70.00 price tag was too much, even if he does the Moonwalk like Michael Jackson!The Store seemed well stocked and Neat and Clean...Check-Out was smooth as well.So, hopefully my Granddaughter will Love her gifts that I will bring to GreenBay for her this Sunday!Cause, I am too Old for Elmo and I don't think my Son Nick will want these toys either.. He'll be 26 soon... Special toys for my very special granddaughter..Thank You Toys R Us!P.S- Toys have gone up in price alot since I was a kid...This I do  not like.. :(

28.description: The absolute worst customer service ever.  I ordered a glider and when it didn't come in the response I got was "My computer says it's in the store but I can't find it".  That's it.  Like this is an acceptable response!  I tried calling customer service online and got bounced around to 4 different people the last of which hung up on my while making a transfer.  No one has been able to find the glider and I'm due to give birth any day.  Seriously- go anywhere else besides this store- the savings aren't worth the hassel.

45.description: I now remember why I refuse to walk into this chain.  The staff is basically incompetent, and this doesn't just pertain to the sales people, I'm also talking about the cashiers.  I went in here to buy some gaudy necklaces for Halloween....shouldn't be a difficult task right?  WRONG.  I walked in and asked the first person I saw, she had no idea where to find the item.  So, I walked around the area and found them myself (I think I deserve one hour of pay for this).  Then I waited in line, and of course, I looked for the shortest line.  Well, I got in line only to stand there for 10 minutes before I was told to go to a new line.  Why you ask?  Oh, b/c the idiot cashier didn't know how to load more paper into the receipt machine.  Hrm, this should've been an easy 30 minute change (trust me I know!).  So, I huff and puff and go to a new line.  This new line has a cashier who doesn't seem to understand that he needs to put the items in the bag.  So, the customers stand there and stare for a good 30 secs before he realizes "DUH!".  Needless to say, it took me 20 minutes to get one item that should've been an easy in and out of the store.  But NO! The idiots of Toys R Us have developed a system to make you spend 10x the amount of time you should spend.  Bravo dummies

33.description: Came here to shop for a baby shower and it was my first time at one of their combo stores, plus....using a baby registry.  Can we say fricken confusing!! The layout of the store was really weird...who designed this place?  Please revoke their degree 'cause they failed big time! They were out of a lot of items and understaffed. We couldn't find certain items on the list and it took us 15min just to find the one person working the floor...poor lady!!! Once we found her off course, she was very nice and helpful, I believe her name was Pat.Anyway, we also walked by some of the toys and I could not believe the prices. Ok...so I haven't been in a Toys R Us in forever, but holy cow!!  Their stuffed animals were so expensive, and they weren't even the really good ones. Yeah....I don't think I would come back to this location...

43.description: I'm pretty sure that it must be pure hell to work here.  I've got a toddler myself...I can't imagine dealing with several dozen kids screaming yelling and pulling things off shelves all at once, day in and day out.We decided to go on the day that the first winter storm hit.  Brilliant, I know.  I had to buy a birthday gift for my niece's first birthday, and it was too late to order online.  I wish that I did.  I would have avoided the crowds, the screaming kids, and the pig sty that awaited me.  Nothing that I was looking for was available in the store.   I asked 3 different associates for help in locating 2 particular toys. Though they were nice enough, I suffered incredible brain freeze talking to them.  How do you work in a store and not know where things are located and not know major brand names?  And as a side note to the clerk who tried to keep my credit card,..umm I was onto you.  I've worked retail all of my working life.  My credit card does not discretely get slid under your register.  It is returned to me after I sign my credit card receipt and you hand me my store receipt.  Even though the store was a chaos, the transaction was chaos, and my toddler wanted down, I'm not that stupid, I noticed.  Don't play me for a fool.

2.description: When my kids are lethargic and lifeless and quite honestly sick of their old toys, I always head over to this Toys R US. They are usually really well stocked and the staff is usually pretty helpful. While they may be a little more expensive than Wal-mart or other big box store, they always have what I'm looking for and I'd rather pay more and not waste time or energy looking for something a store doesn't have in stock. Not much else to say about Toys R US

18.description: Got my purchases here, everything was fine until I saw the sign saying I get $5 if they don't upsell me.  They don't, and me pointing that out gets me a look from the cashier that I am a troublemaker.  But the economy is bad, and they made the promise.  I get sent to the customer service desk.That takes me 15 minutes of scanning, rescanning, and rerescanning.  I don't know why they couldn't hand me a picture of Abe Lincoln, but they REALLY wanted to put it on my card.  After all that, I only get $4.17.  I cut my losses and go, I would feel like I got too greedy, but that money doesn't make me Bernie Madoff.

41.description: Someone needs to call DCFS on this place. Every weekend I see children being dragged out of here kicking and screaming against their will.

4.description: This is the only Toys R Us location I ever really shop at and I've been shopping here since I was a little girl. I really like this location because its closest to my house and there is a Mariano's and a Chipotle right next door. One thing that does annoy me though is that there is a constant, maddening buzzing sound that comes from of the lighting over the customer service desk. They really need to get that fixed because it makes me want to run out of the store like a madwoman every time I'm there.

6.description: Yep, no response from anyone, ever, about my complaint. BIG SURPRISE for national nonsense mega-store, huh? Babies/Toys R Us sucks. Thanks.

22.description: Did a pick up in store online order.  Figured it would be a quick way to get in and out.  Got to the store 2 hrs placing the order and paying online for two video games.  The order wasn't ready.  Asked if I could just get the items off the shelf, was told "no".  Asked when it would be ready, couldn't get an answer.  Called an hour later to see if it was ready, got hung up on.  Waited a half hour and called again, still wasn't ready. Went to the store anyway, and they said it was ready, but it had to be brought up from the back.  Waited another 30 minutes, until the manager went to the back and got the order.  Never again!

15.description: This review is specifically for the babies r us portion of the store. They have plenty of options for baby food, diapers, bibs, bottles, and everything else you need for your baby.  The prices are reasonable. They have plenty of parking.

20.description: If this place only had a bigger selection, and wasn't so cramped I could easily bump it to four stars based upon the rest of my experience...Enjoy Suckas'!!!

36.description: I haven't had to come to this store in a LOOOONG time.  However, there's now children in the family, so my mom and I stopped in before Christmas to look for something.  Actually, I had stopped in about a week prior than the visit with my mom to look for something, but left just as soon as I entered because it was overwhelming and I didn't have time for the headache that would have ensued.  My mom went in, walked around, got annoyed, asked a question at the counter and left.  The people that come here are rude.  RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE.  Something tells me it wasn't solely the fact that it was the holidays, I suspect their shoppers are rude on a daily basis.  Whatever.  My mom sent me in later and I had to ask THREE employees a question before someone could manage something other than "uh....maybe?  sure.  I think."  The set up of this store is horrible.  It feels like a maze, and with aisles that aren't large, it made me sick.  The best part?  This store has not changed since I was younger.  It always felt dreary, but the holidays make me really cheerful (go figure) and I hated being in there because it was depressing.  It's dark and dirty and no one looks like they enjoy their job.  Can't say I blame them though.  There are better toy stores around with better prices.  The only time this place might be useful is if there's a special/deal/sale, and even then a lot of stores are doing "price match with ad".  Even still, I'd rather support some independent/cute toy store and pay the same/similar prices than have to come back here.

14.description: I went yesterday, a week before Christmas.  I was sixth in line, with only five of ten registers open.  You'd think they would have all lanes open a week before Christmas.  The couple in front of me tried to use their Groupon, which required a $20 purchase.  Their purchase was $19.97.  The clerk scanned the Groupon, which apparently immediately took the Groupon out of the system and marked it as used.  But the Groupon did not apply because the minimum purchase was not met.  The couple grabbed a pack of gum, bringing the total to an amount over $20.  But the Groupon was already marked as "used."  I waited about five minutes as a manager came over and could not solve the problem, then called the store manager who also could not solve the problem.  Their solution?  They told the couple they would have to CALL GROUPON and get the coupon re-set, then COME BACK and try again.  Are you kidding?  That was the wrong answer on so many levels.  Never once did an employee apologize to the couple.  Instead, the employees blamed the couple for not purchasing enough.  I wish I had had the energy/tolerance/gumption to stick up for the couple and help them out, but I just wanted to get out of that place.  I will not be back, even if they run another Groupon.  There's one on Touhy that might be better.

58.description: Twice now, my wife has gone to this store and was overcharged because the scales read the weight too high. Both times my wife had to go to customer service to get refunds for what she knew was too high a price on various items. This store needs to get its scales in order; it is a joke that the product does not weigh out correctly. My wife is the type that will fight when she is overcharged but I would imagine that there are many persons who just let it go and overpay.

56.description: I frequent this Mariano's for lunch since I work right across the street from them.  I LOVE that this place opened!The food is fresh and the prices are reasonable.   I really like that the meat department will heat up a steak or seafood that you purchase from them upon request.The staff is friendly and efficient. Their coffee/lunch bars are absolutely fantastic and there's such a HUGE variety to choose from!  The prices are very reasonable.  I've tried their hot bar and some of their pizzas and all taste delicious!  The only downside to such a huge variety of affordable lunch items to choose from is that it is always very busy there, so it is usually very crowded, but worth it!

29.description: Getting seriously annoyed with this location. Every time I come there's something I need that's out of stock and organic produce is slim pickings.  I've also bought one too many items that are already expired and don't notice until a few days later.  I don't have time to check expiration dates on every item I need to buy at the grocery store. Frustrating because this is a decently priced and convenient grocery store.

42.description: Good variety, good prices, better than the Jewell they produce is really good they also have organic produce. The employees are very nice. They always have a bunch of cashiers open so you don't have to spend a lot of time in line to check out.

23.description: Seriously! What's wrong with this location? Total chaos and mess. I went there again to get a fresh juice as they advertise in the store and the counter next to the ice cream and the, hot drinks bar. And they tell me that they do not offer fresh juices, eh? What's all that banners around about their juices and ingredients and prices to order then?! I double checked and asked many times. You sure? All the fruits and veggies hanging behind you are for nothing. She said yes, I am sure and well, I am sorry. They simply offer one pre-made juice a day. That is today you could get a watermelon, Apple something else juice made this am somewhere, hopefully in house. She wasn't sure...what a mess!!!

47.description: This review is for the Squeezd juice bar only.Outstanding!!!!! Glad Mariano's has this in their store.  The juice/smoothie options are fantastic and it's nice to have such a healthy option near my home!

8.description: Hardly anyone shopping at this 8:00 A.M. hour, I was able to get through with ease. I saw the other reviews about the store being messy or lack of food stock. I didn't see any of that, in fact the store is fully stock and clean. I don't know if this changes with later hours or weather permitting. Prices are a bit higher than what I'm use too. I was impressed with the selections they have. Unique items I can't get on the south side. If I'm in the area I will definitely be back.

31.description: This Mariano's location always seems busy--even around non-holiday days. That's not necessarily a bad thing because I found the staff still helpful as ever even when the place looks likes everyone is shopping for the apocalypse. Sometimes the produce isn't stocked as quickly when the bins get low, but I've always asked if there more of certain items and have received help and more of those items immediately.I especially like the fresh herb selection. The quality is great, they have more choices than Jewel and the prices are lower than Whole Paycheck.I've never been disappointed with their butcher section either--short ribs, lamb chops, ground beef...everything has been great quality and priced reasonable. Their layout seems a little cramped to me--or maybe it's just because this place is always busy. But I do like Mariano's and the variety of products (including local products) available.  Including my local fave--Rare Bird Passionfruit curd!

34.description: Out of rotisserie chicken at 7pm 3 days in a row.... No grill.Poorly stocked Always out of stuff around the holidays. If you like to eat exotic meat like duck and buffalo check the experation date and make sure there package is not tampered with @this store. So I walked in 3 days in a row looking for a rotisserie chicken. On the 3rd day I was so furious. Having had good luck with customer service from Marianos at other locations I asked to speak with the Manger. I explained this was my 3rd day I haven't gotten what I wanted from your store it's only 645. There was at least 5 people who asked for chicken and waited for her with me.  She quietly listens then proceeded to apologize for the inconvenience.  She did not offer to put more on the rack to cook. Instead she continued to talk about how a computer system tell her how many she can make in one day? Lady your job is gonna be controlled by a computer that will make me a friggin chicken when I want soon. So you are not a Manger that you claim to be.  I walked to Jewel they were out as well but the man behind the counter said to me "if you don't mind the wait I'll put some in" then he told me " about 45 min ". I was happy. I live on Addison, 3 min away from this store. I will avoid it at all cost. There is 3 jewel's who offer organic food as well ,a Whole Food and a Trader Joe's. Better believe that!

16.description: I love Mariano's. They have a great selection of just about everything. I have ordered cakes and treats from them. My last cake order unfortunately was made wrong, but the Store Manager gave me a refund which I asked for in a gift card because I wanted to give them my service back. I'll continue to shop here. Customer Service is GREAT!

13.description: Updated January 4, 2015:This is my email sent to their corporate website (via "Contact Us") after my visit to the Roscoe/Western store 1/4/15, plus several pictures uploaded as well. "Greetings - I have been a loyal Mariano's customer ever since you arrived in the Chicago area.  Imagine my delight when a Mariano's opened in the old Dominick's store at Western and Roscoe.  I have been a regular customer since the store opened, plus I go to the stores on Lawrence and Ashland.  These comments are specific to the Western/Roscoe store.After the first six months or so, no problems.  I was able to get high-end meats and fish.  Then the high-end meat was gone, so I started to get my meat (again) from Gene's in Lincoln Square, Paulina Meat Market, and even Jewel.Then I had two experiences with buying fish and seafood.  Two times (one time during an embarrassing dinner party at my house), I opened my purchases of seafood from Mariano's and it was bad.  I mean REALLY bad.  Both times I notified the store, to which they told me to bring in the receipt, but really didn't have any response when I asked if they were going to check the remaining scallops that were in the case.  Nothing.  I have stopped buying any fish or seafood from this store.Since then, this place has been on the decline rapidly. I just left there (Sunday January 4th, 2015).  Now I know it's a Sunday and I know it's after the holidays, but this place was a complete mess.  The shelves were a disaster, many were empty, there was hardly any chicken or milk; there wasn't even any spinach.  Seriously?  The place was filthy.  I heard other customers saying the similar things about the condition and availability (one woman saying to her friend "it's like they haven't paid their bills")...  I mentioned something to the service desk and she said, 'no one has said anything'.  Ok, but I just did.  I asked if she - or anyone working here - had walked around the store today, because it is that bad, and she said she would notify the manager.I took pictures of this mess and will be posting them on Yelp, because this store is seriously mis-managed as compared to your newer stores.  I'm wondering if they'll also be declining after the honeymoon of the first six months is over."

11.description: Seriously! What's wrong with this location? Total chaos and mess.
