I went there again to get a fresh juice as they advertise in the store and the counter next to the ice cream and the, hot drinks bar. And they tell me that they do not offer fresh juices, eh? What's all that banners around about their juices and ingredients and prices to order then?! I double checked and asked many times. You sure? All the fruits and veggies hanging behind you are for nothing. She said yes, I am sure and well, I am sorry. They simply offer one pre-made juice a day. That is today you could get a watermelon, Apple something else juice made this am somewhere, hopefully in house. She wasn't sure...what a mess!!!

39.description: To start, I'm a big fan of Metro Market in Milwaukee which is under the same company. I love their marble cake. We've gotten it a number of times for family birthdays.When it came time to plan for my son's long overdue baptism, I knew that I wanted a cake from here. Ordering the cake was super easy and straightforward. How have I never ordered a cake from the grocery store before? In addition to cake, I ordered fruit and veggie trays too. These trays were gigantic and tasty. I got the largest tray of fruit for our 20 or so guests. I could have easily ordered a size down on it. My brother took home fruit for his family and there was still plenty left over. The veggie tray was reasonable in size with fewer leftovers, but still delicious with the spinach dip. The cake and trays were easy to order and pick up. I had a great experience with their bakery and deli departments on these. I got a catering menu which had some other tasty items too.Besides the catering, I like the store in general. Their dark chocolate chip cookies are so good. They also have Goose Island soda that we looked so hard to find and finally located. Their prices are higher for sure, but if you're looking for good cuts of meat and specialty items, I would go here first. Their bakery and deli are also awesome too.

37.description: Updated January 4, 2015:This is my email sent to their corporate website (via "Contact Us") after my visit to the Roscoe/Western store 1/4/15, plus several pictures uploaded as well. "Greetings - I have been a loyal Mariano's customer ever since you arrived in the Chicago area.  Imagine my delight when a Mariano's opened in the old Dominick's store at Western and Roscoe.  I have been a regular customer since the store opened, plus I go to the stores on Lawrence and Ashland.  These comments are specific to the Western/Roscoe store.After the first six months or so, no problems.  I was able to get high-end meats and fish.  Then the high-end meat was gone, so I started to get my meat (again) from Gene's in Lincoln Square, Paulina Meat Market, and even Jewel.Then I had two experiences with buying fish and seafood.  Two times (one time during an embarrassing dinner party at my house), I opened my purchases of seafood from Mariano's and it was bad.  I mean REALLY bad.  Both times I notified the store, to which they told me to bring in the receipt, but really didn't have any response when I asked if they were going to check the remaining scallops that were in the case.  Nothing.  I have stopped buying any fish or seafood from this store.Since then, this place has been on the decline rapidly. I just left there (Sunday January 4th, 2015).  Now I know it's a Sunday and I know it's after the holidays, but this place was a complete mess.  The shelves were a disaster, many were empty, there was hardly any chicken or milk; there wasn't even any spinach.  Seriously?  The place was filthy.  I heard other customers saying the similar things about the condition and availability (one woman saying to her friend "it's like they haven't paid their bills")...  I mentioned something to the service desk and she said, 'no one has said anything'.  Ok, but I just did.  I asked if she - or anyone working here - had walked around the store today, because it is that bad, and she said she would notify the manager.I took pictures of this mess and will be posting them on Yelp, because this store is seriously mis-managed as compared to your newer stores.  I'm wondering if they'll also be declining after the honeymoon of the first six months is over."

0.description: Good ol' Mariano's on Western. They've got the biggest selection of LaCroix a girl could want. I found tangerine yesterday! Plus fresh squeezed OJ, nice floral section, good salad bar, and the list goes on.The real reason I wanted to write this review was to give a shoutout to the two employees in the produce section who were having a boisterous, heated, near-philosophical conversation about the Chicago Bulls yesterday morning. They made me smile. Props to Mariano's for hiring some real people. The only con I have about this location is the lunchtime swarm of Lane Tech kids. Go somewhere else, awkward lanky children! No one wants to hear about how mean Mrs. Oglethorpe is.

38.description: Had lunch yesterday with a bud. We were multi-tasking and she had yet to visit a Mariano's. Perfect occasion and there was an ample sitting area for patrons. After surveying the various options in the clean and well-designed food court, we decided on hot dishes. My friend thought the $10 special with sushi, seaweed salad and miso was pretty good. I had a deliciously seasoned, moist and succulent breast of barbecued chicken that blew my mind! I was beyond impressed. I also had a kale & sun-dried to salad that was pretty tasty. The one reason I would not give 5 stars in this review is that nearly the entire time we were there, the very talkative cashier entertained nearly six different girlfriends while tending the register. A "white shirt" walked by at least once and never corrected the behavior of the staff people. They cursed and spoke at a volume that was unattractive for them as both young ladies and staff persons.I'm glad Mariano's has entered the local grocery scene and raised the bar with it's standards, quality and ubiquity!

51.description: The pros are that this store is always pretty clean, well-organized, and staff are quite helpful and friendly. The cons are the irritating little things-- an unreliable produce selection, Whole Foods-esque prices for produce and a lot of other stuff, pretty weak meat department (but what else is new), or the fact that each of the three times I've been in this store the restrooms are always mysteriously closed for cleaning.

27.description: I love this place.  The staff is helpful, and mostly, friendly.  Produce, meats, cheeses, and dairy are always fresh.  The flower department is amazing!  Totce thank you for the friendly smiles and the beautiful arrangements.  Totce is always willing to give advice or make something for us using the 3 for $12 flowers.  Mostly, I love this place because of the organization and flow between departments.  To me, the store just flows in a logical order.  Everything has a place and everything is in it's place.

32.description: Mariano's used to be my go-to supermarket but I find their fresh produce, particularly their organic section, hasn't been as good of late. Perhaps it's seasonal issues but I keep finding myself disappointed.My favorite part is their bakery and fish counters. That's probably why I keep going back! Their fish counter staff are very knowledgable and happy to help.Would prefer if they had better dairy selection, especially the organics pasture raised milk. Would love if they stocked the big tubs of Wallaby yoghurt too. I usually end up going to jewell on Ashland for this.

54.description: I'm a huge fan of the Mariano's in greek town (closer to home). This one is right by my work, but just isn't as great as that one on Halsted. Main reason is how crowded it gets during lunch hours. This is due to the high school students coming here- there is never a seat available to eat your lunch at,  the checkout line can be long, and there's often stuff not restocked on the shelves. (The last two times I went they were out of plain coconut water in the grab & go area).Besides being less crowded, the one in greek town is just bigger, more open, and has a lot of extra stuff like the oyster bar, and wine bar.

48.description: Surprised of how this Mariano's looks like god there was food in the floor. Super dirty everyone's yelling, no one is so courteous and classy as the other ones. I bought a small birthday cake and it tasted like it was refrigerated too long and super dry. They didn't had that much of sweets varieties and you were limited to choose from their stand. Behind the glass. Not happy with this location! Not serviceable or nice smiles in their faces.

44.description: Great quality and price for groceries. They have a great variety of options, but I seldom notice any employees around the aisles. It is a little on the smaller side and gets a little claustrophobic, so avoid busy times. Nice ambiance though! Sometimes there is a live piano player.

24.description: I live in the neighborhood and have been coming here since it is convenient and HAD a good selection. Lately, I have noticed vegetable/fruit selection has diminished or is out of many items. It is also dirty with fruit smashed on the floor.  The bread selection WAS great, now many times virtually nothing is in the display case. Desserts, when opened it was impressive, now very little there and only a few cookie types to choose from. Soups are great, but it needs to be cleaned. Salad bar is nice, however I have seen items with a bit of crust on it. Deli case, was beautiful when they opened. Virtually everything in that case has day old "crust" and looks spoiled. I won't bother anymore. The fish initially was great, lately I have purchased a few "stinkers" which should never happen. The egg section is always littered with opened cartons. The cold soy milks are so picked over, I wish I knew when to arrive for deliveries. Finally, check out lines are long and not enough clerks, nothing like the opening.  I have been to 5 other Marianos and this is the worst. It has to be one of the highest volume stores...Bob Mariano please address this ASAP. I brought it up to a manager a month ago, nothing has improved.

7.description: I love all the Mariano's location but I especially love this one in particular . It's right by my job and by the expressway which is a plus . Today I got my shrimp grilled and put them on top of my salad .It was sooooo good the shrimp was fresh and so was my salad. Their chocolate cookies are awesome as well !!

49.description: A confusing produce setup was difficult to navigate. Seemed like they were trying to give Mariano's the quality of an old world street market with produce carts sans vendors.Note to Mariano's: elephant/ giant garlic is mild and carries little "garlic taste". You should carry at least one other kind of garlic.The piano guy was whaling away, he added to the Mariano's experience.

40.description: One of my least favorite Mariano's. It used to be an old Dominick's and still feels like a Dominick's instead of a Mariano's. Products are disheveled and misplaced. It leaves us wondering how much some things are because they're not marked and not placed where it should be. Many items were out of stock. It gets very crowded and chaotic here at times. Employees get in our way instead of helping us out. Instead of opening more regular check-out lanes, they use these 2 small checkout stations near the exit, which is very confusing.

53.description: It's cheaper than "whole foods" and "treasure island", but the selection isn't quite as good. Marianos stocks a bit of normal, processed crap you'd find at Jewel or Dominicks, so their selection isn't quite as diverse as the high-end grocers. Here's the deal: If you need niche or ethnic ingredients then go to wholefoods. If you're making basic American food and want high quality ingredients at lower prices, head to Marianos.

30.description: It is probably not the best Marianos in Chicago area but i still love how the cashiers are super fast and workers are very kind and helpful. Live piano is a good touch  :)On the other hand they need to be more organized and deli section needs more people working there because fresh produce area is generally a mess and deli line can take forever because most of the tim more than one worker help only one customer.

46.description: First time at this location since it was Dominick's. Overall, I had a pleasant experience even though I found it to be smaller than their suburban locations. What it lacks in size, it makes up in customer service. I found the employees friendly and helpful. The self serve salad bar was delicious and had a variety prepared salads as well as built your own. I really enjoyed the raspberry salad and flavored tofu cubes you can add as a topping. Overall, if your in the area and looking for a quick self serve salad bar, hot bar, deli, butcher, etc. Mariano's will definitely meet your needs at affordable prices.

1.description: This is probably the worst Mariano's location I have ever visited.  I do shop here some times, as its close, but not my favorite.  The produce is hit or miss.  The meats are okay, but over priced.  The prime steaks in the case are good and fair for a prime cut.  The seafood, okay, and again over priced.  The deli is awful!  The staff is horrible!  The are so slow and have no idea what they are doing.  They are also not very friendly, as the customer in this store is poor.  This location is also very small, not as large as most the other stores that I have visited.

55.description: Good produce selection, rivaling Harvestime's for value, and I like their salad bar and bakery. Dairy here is affordable, as are store brand processed foods, and they offer dozens of hot sides and entrees, plus cold deli items for every palate. Fresh squeezed OJ is a can't-miss at $3.50 and their floral department is pretty good for a grocery store. Lots of organic fruits and veggies, and they also stock a decent collection of import beers and wines. The only thing I'm not comfortable buying at Mariano's is meat and seafood, and that's just because I find their selection and pricing skews a bit Whole Foods or Treasure Island-ish. I'm sure this is a plus for some people, but on my budget, I'd rather get no-name piernitas from a local carniceria for 69 cents a pound. Those chickens probably didn't receive a Montessori childhood education or daily massages from Amish farmhands, but once I've prepared them nicely, they taste about the same for 1/4 of the cost. In summary, I will continue to shop at my local independents for a few items, but overall, the Mariano's on Western is an excellent market, and you can get 80% of what you came for at a very reasonable price. 4 stars!

9.description: This is a decent store, but missing many of the "treats" present in other Mariano's.  They have limited specialty stations in this store, but the kicker for me is no popcorn.  Their cheddar and caramel mix found at other stores is honestly one of the things that brings me to the store, but this location doesn't have it, nor do they have a sweets station.  Otherwise the store is large and well-stocked with a variety of items, but I was disappointed when I stopped tonight and they did not have popcorn.  I also think their ready-to-go prepared foods are more limited than other locations I've seen.

26.description: Large selection of Alçohol beverages, bakery items and other grocery items. Very nice Mariano's in the heart of roscoe village.

25.description: This place is stellar.  We used to have to go all the way to Whole Foods to get good produce...and at a much higher price.  The have it all: great meat, fresh seafood, fresh produce, and a great booze selection.

12.description: This is a review for the deli only. l like the whole concept of Marianos but even though the deli workers have always been polite, the store on Roscoe/Western has got to have the worst deli service in the city of Chicago. ESPECIALLY DO NOT COME HERE if you're going to buy Prosciutto! It's like rolling dice, for you to get someone behind the counter that knows how to slice prosciutto. Even worse if they have to open a fresh prosciutto and they have to trim it! I blame this totally on poor training and management. It's frustrating that I would have to drive an inconvenience distance just to buy prosciutto when there is such a well stocked deli half a mile from me.

59.description: Great selection!  ...fairly inexpensive.   Good customer service.  Truly is sorta like a Wholefoids ...but has more mainstream brands too.

21.description: This is the marianos close to me! Is it just me or are grocery stores beginning to step up their game lately? Anyway... never had any kind problem with this location. Great service, selection, workers etc. It seems like they will do whatever it takes to make the customer happy, which is great for me! Love all the food you can get here too. Sometimes, cooking for yourself is just not an option and with this place so close by and cheap, its not a problem. Pretty much like a super upgrade of Dominicks (rip). Yep.

17.description: This Mariano's location always seems busy--even around non-holiday days. That's not necessarily a bad thing because I found the staff still helpful as ever even when the place looks likes everyone is shopping for the apocalypse. Sometimes the produce isn't stocked as quickly when the bins get low, but I've always asked if there more of certain items and have received help and more of those items immediately.I especially like the fresh herb selection. The quality is great, they have more choices than Jewel and the prices are lower than Whole Paycheck.I've never been disappointed with their butcher section either--short ribs, lamb chops, ground beef...everything has been great quality and priced reasonable. Their layout seems a little cramped to me--or maybe it's just because this place is always busy. But I do like Mariano's and the variety of products (including local products) available.  Including my local fave--Rare Bird Passionfruit curd!

10.description: I normally love Mariano's (things are typically very fresh with a large selection and competitive prices), but this particular location is kind of terrible. The selection is smaller, the store seems more run down, and the last couple times I've stopped by, there was a very limited selection of produce and seafood (which is what I typically purchase when menu planning for the week). The last time in particular had me muttering "I hate this place" under my breath - I'm not sure if there was a plant apocalypse or what, but huge swaths of the produce section were COMPLETELY barren. It was bizarre - it reminded me of how the grocery store looked right before Y2K when everyone thought the world was ending, but WORSE. It was also jam packed with patrons who also appeared to be rather bewildered at the lack of vegetation in the produce section. Will try to avoid this Mariano's at all costs going forward. If you are a 'center of the grocery store' kinda shopper, I think this location is probably fine for you, as long as you don't mind the lines.

5.description: Not indicting all Mariano's with this review (although my issues with this place seem similar  to those Mariano's that are ex Dominick's facilities).    This particular location does not have an upscale or modern / clean vibe to it (like many other Mariano's do).  Instead this feels like the old Dominick's re-opened under a different name.   Does not have any of the perks / features that other locations have that justify the premium price that they charge for product.   There are a couple of other Mariano's within a couple of minutes driving distance of this place.  If you need to go to a Mariano's, go there.

3.description: When they opened it was great. Now it's like a ghetto Jewel. Deli counter? You wait 20 minutes no matter what with TWO people helping 20 customers. The produce sucks... totally old stuff; I cut a white onion open the DAY I bought it and it was dry? An onion!!  The meat goes bad if you don't cook it right away. They fudge the expiration dates on the bread? 2 items dated 7 days from when I bought where completely STALE! When you checkout the rollers are FILTHY! The cashiers never clean them/ WHY?? No more Bob!! PS- Lets not even talk about the "Parking Lot"; you might as well park behind The Liberty Lounge!!

35.description: So last night put me over the edge! This Mariano's is becoming an un-faced poorly managed facility that cannot keep up with its success.  From the moment you try to turn left into the parking lot from Roscoe Street to the barren shelves - no milk, no spinach, no wild rice and people are abandoning their purchases and leaving bags/carts in the aisles. Seriously this is getting out of control. Clean this store up, this is Roscoe Village!!!

19.description: I love this place.  The staff is helpful, and mostly, friendly.  Produce, meats, cheeses, and dairy are always fresh.  The flower department is amazing!  Totce thank you for the friendly smiles and the beautiful arrangements.  Totce is always willing to give advice or make something for us using the 3 for $12 flowers.  Mostly, I love this place because of the organization and flow between departments.  To me, the store just flows in a logical order.  Everything has a place and everything is in it's place.

28.description: I really don't get excited about grocery stores, but Mariano's is just the best. This location, along with every other I have been to, is well staffed, well stocked, and clean. Grocery shopping just isn't the huge pain in the neck that is usually is. I never wait in a long line to check out and there is always staff around asking if I need help and actually walking me to where a particular item is if I can't find it on my own. I almost always drive the extra distance to Mariano's now that the service at the Jewel by my house is steadily declining.The only thing I would suggest is more people working at the deli, the wait to get some sliced turkey is sometimes a little much.

45.description: I know I have already proclaimed my love for Mariano's but it is 100% necessary to give some special love to the floral department of the Roscoe Village Mariano's. So for some reason I thought it would be a reasonable idea to teach myself how to make a 10 foot floral garland for our wedding ceremony. And to do all of the table arrangements myself for our wedding reception. And to do all of the table arrangements for our rehearsal dinner. I must be crazy...Anyway, the floral ladies hooked. it. up. I had stopped in over the weekend to do a test run of the garland and they helped me pick a few different options to see what would work best. I came back that Thursday to make all the real things and they sold me all the greenery at cost (!) and helped me pick out flowers that would keep until the big day on Saturday. No one could believe the flowers were from a grocery store or that it was a DIY project. And I can't believe I was able to make a 10 foot garland for under $15 worth of greenery. I can't wait to get our pictures back from our photographer so I can bring them by the store.

33.description: The only bad experience i've had here was with the sushi (sushi was actually really delicious but the manager wouldn't replace my order that was completely wrong). Otherwise, definitely my favorite grocery store in Chicago.

43.description: Clean, fancy and organized. Pianist playing live is cool.I shopped at the deli and it has a good selection. The bakery and their goodies, all pastries I tried were too sweet, but it's a grocery store so it's not too bad. The presentation looks great, but the taste is average to me. They also have an international aisle which is where I usually get lost. Very good selection of items. Overall good experience there. Note: The Mariano's in Ravenswood just has very bad parking.

2.description: I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  The store is massive and has a bazillion varieties of everything.  It is slightly high end, but everything is still affordable. (Example- Good agave syrup is $9 here, but I have seen it for up to $13.)  There is a huge selection of everything as stated, and that includes the baked goods, but not as much fresh goods in general as other locations.  The store is a bit out of date in its interior and the layout is a bit off.  If they reorganized the place and made the flow a little better, his would make a huge difference.  Also a small side note, the customer service needs work.  I was here for about 30 minutes and only ever saw a couple of workers in the produce section.  If people need assistance it can be difficult to come by.

18.description: This review is for the Squeezd juice bar only.Outstanding!!!!! Glad Mariano's has this in their store.  The juice/smoothie options are fantastic and it's nice to have such a healthy option near my home!

41.description: I fell in love with Mariano's at first sight! I love the open layout and excellent produce selection. The cheese, deli, and meats are all great selections as well.The store is clean and staff friendly. They usually offer several great samples throughout the store. Mariano's also offers a wide selection of pre-made foods including the soups (all delicious), salad bar, bakery items (best oatmeal cookies ever), and several other meal options (entrees, sides, pizza, etc.).I do try to avoid the store during peak times (ie: Sunday afternoon and Mon-Wed rush hour), as it can get pretty busy, but lucky for me I'm usually able to manage this with my work schedule. The waits can be especially long at the deli and meat counters during these busy periods. The upside is that she store is almost always well stocked; I've had very few encounters with empty shelves since shopping here for the past 6 months. Also, even during rush times they staff the registers well and you'll see most of them open (unlike several other places I've shopped in the past). The live piano player is a nice bonus too. My only pet peeve at the moment is the recent reorganization of the aisles and inventory...hopefully I'll master the new layout soon!

52.description: This is the closest grocery store to us so we've been buying our groceries here for about 3 years.+ Positives* They have a slightly better butcher than you'd find at Jewel, but not nearly as good as you'd find at a Whole Foods or other higher-end store. Likewise for their deli and cheese departments.* Reasonably priced- Negatives* It's incredibly claustrophobic, especially if you go on Saturday or Sunday. The isles are small (because its not a very big store for the quantity of merchandise) and the place is packed. Lines are also very long.* Like I said, the butcher is better than average, but still nowhere near the level of higher-end stores. Their seafood selection is also disappointing quality for the price.* Their produce, particularly greens, are fairly poor quality. Finding a bunch of green onions that isn't wilted is pretty challenging. Whole Foods may be expensive but at least the quality is there.I have been to Mariano's locations that really are the best of both worlds: the variety and quality of a Whole Foods or Plum Market at a pricer closer to Jewel, but the Roscoe Village location isn't it, and the small size makes it a somewhat unpleasant shopping experience.

50.description: Mariano's has quickly become my favorite grocery store.  Whole Foods is absurdly expensive, Trader Joe's is too far from my home and has a limited selection, Jewel, Dominick's and Tony's... Meh.  To begin with, Mariano's sushi is surprisingly good (especially compared to any other grocery store).  I do not like rolls that use a lot of cream cheese or mayo to hide the fish.  Not a problem at Mariano's.  My favorite is the sensei roll with unagi and fresh asparagus rolled up in salmon with tobiko and cilantro on top.  There is another delicious role with slices of strawberry on top.  Ching is the sushi chef.  She is always friendly and takes enormous pride in her work.  Besides the sushi, the gelato bar and the cheese counter are wonderful.  I am in love with Kunik cheese, a soft cheese that can rarely be found at Whole Foods.  This is always available at Mariano's. The wine section has many fine options while the rest of the store provides standard fair, and the service is wonderful.

4.description: Great fresh food at all times. I have tried the coffee, salad bar, sushi bar, fresh sandwiches and I regularly buy groceries there.  Always a positive experience.

6.description: Short review - Mariano's is the best grocery store in Chicago. This location is #2 (the one on Lawrence being a bit better), but still pretty darn good - and bonus for not having a vertigo-enhancing parking garage. Good prices, great quality, nice staff, easy to navigate and double coupon Wednesdays! That saves me hundreds per year in grocery costs. The butcher counter folks are especially good and often do custom cuts for me, while I peruse the cheese monger. My heart attack is way over due from consuming so many delicious cheeses from them. I may have a Chevre blockage. Getting a coffee, and strolling through the store is a wonderful way to spend an early Saturday morning.

22.description: Love this grocery store.  Good variety of products and competitively priced.  I wish the organic produce section was a bit bigger, but they do always have a solid variety of things I need.  I also just realized they sell Thank God It's Natural products!  I love those soaps and hair care items!  No weird ingredients, all good stuff!  Try them out if you haven't had the chance yet!

15.description: this places needs a overhaul on the way they have Items set up ! it's just a mess ! the produce area mainly ! the lettuce area is so dirty and messy . Sale items should be at a easy place for customers to get them and not constantly at the top most shelf ! it's not easy for short people !

57.description: This is probably the best grocery store in Chicago. The review really could end there.But here are the specifics.The Fresh:- A wide selection of meat  that never looks like road kill.- A gelato and coffee bar lurk right beside the entrance like sirens of sweet indulgence.- Functional fruit and veg that look like rock-star versions of themselves, with (some) locally sourced veggies.- The prepared foods and salad bar are appealing and not where unsold expiring foods go to die like in other grocery stores.- The bakery is well-stocked, awash with jewel-tone sweets and crusty breads (and  perfumes the store with cookie smell OMG).- The shelves are stocked up in dry and cold goods.- Gluten free, soy-free, and allergy-alternative foods can be found in abundance here.- You've died and gone to cheese and wine heaven.- The $6-$10 meal deals are normally healthy and deliciously big portions.- The in-house Roundy's brand hasn't let me down yet in quality.- The interior is pretty, clean, and  well-lit.- Employees seem to really like what they do.- They sell, literally, 12 different kinds of bacon. I counted. It's beautiful.The Funky:- There's always a bottleneck at the deli. Expect to wait. And wait.- The produce is a little pricy. Then again, so are doctor bills, right?- Some pugilist must come in every day and takes a few swings at Mariano's lettuce section, because they always look beat-down and tore-up.- A considerable amount of that classy meat is priced like it was dipped in gold. I'm sure there are economic reasons for this stemming from the drought and increases in the cost of raising a head of cattle, but still, rabble rabble.- Sales are weirdly timed, and can be highly limited.Mariano's beats Whole Foods in price, carries a lot of the same high quality brands, and is an overall better shopping experience.Don't even get me started on how much better Mariano's is than Jewel.

20.description: I shop here over the jewel next door because the produce is so fresh, there's a great selection of cheeses and a pretty decent meat counter. My absolute favorite thing: they sell Batiste dry shampoo!!! I no longer have to make a special and usually expensive trip to ulta anymore! If they served booze like some locations then it would be a 5 star in my book. Friendly staff, good carts and very clean!

36.description: I was there for weekly shopping on Friday. No bananas, empty salad shelves, no berries!  It looks like the staff walked out or maybe they are closing. This is the second time in a month that we found the store very poorly stocked. Maybe they need a new manager. So disappointed!

14.description: I'm still a huge fan of Whole Foods, however Mariano's seems a little more "honest" than Whole Foods.  (Especially after the price raising debacle, that I witnessed first hand at Whole Foods.)  HUGE grocery store with Organic produce and foods as well as cereal and snacks that and excited to have one coming to my neighborhood!!

3.description: This used to be a great shop, and I'm hoping it will be again.  There in October 14 for new strings.  Poor job plus left my violin sitting out on the counter--on top of its case--for most of the day, I assume.  Months later I am still correcting the windings that were done.  The owner, who always did such a fabulous job, was not around.  Did the store change hands?

1.description: I took Babygirl to be measured for her violin and we had an excellent experience. "Grandma" Bobbi measured her, took the time out to get to know Babygirl and just made sure we had a very positive experience. Babygirl's pretty enthusiastic to begin violin lessons, and working with A 440 has added even more to her excitement.

2.description: I traveled from Texas to view some fine instruments at A440 that were being sold on consignment. This place is the real deal. I found Roberta/Bobbie to be very helpful, knowledgable and honest as well as delightful. She listened to what I was looking for, showed me what she had in stock, and gave me good advice. She also understood that I had a budget to adhere to and she was very respectful regarding the amount I could spend. Keep in mind that the instruments they sell are quality instruments and therefore you can expect to pay quality prices.I am looking forward to my next trip to Chicago because I will surely stop by A440. I am a very happy customer and am beyond pleased with the purchases I made at A440. Also, this is the first music/instrument store that I have been to where I was not ignored as a woman. Many female musicians can attest to the fact that often times music stores  cater to the male clientele while ignoring female customers, guitar shops often being the worst offenders. At A440, the vibe was completely different. There were male and female customers at the time I was there and as far as I could tell, all of us were being treated with the same amount of respect and all of us were acknowledged as fellow musicians. I felt very much at home at A440 and it was a thrill to shop among so many beautiful instruments, strings being the main focus of this store. If you are looking for something specific (i.e. hammered dulcimer, recorder, viola da gamba) give A440 a call because they might just have what you need on consignment.P.S. How honest are they? The instruments I happened to be interested in were on consignment from a religious order of Catholic sisters. If the sisters do business with A440, that's a pretty strong recommendation regarding the integrity of A440s business practices.

9.description: My daughter is taking orchestra in high school this year, and has decided upon the cello. Since I've only played the piano and a couple of wind instruments, I know next to nothing about the needs of string instrument players. However, it was clear from the first day she brought her cello home to practice that we needed something to keep it from slipping on our hardwood floor. So, my daughter found out that there's a gadget called a pin holder that does just that. The problem was: where to buy it on a Saturday afternoon? I knew that finding supplies for an orchestral sting instrument from a brick and mortar store might be tough. I called the Old Town School of Folk Music, since I have come to rely on their helpful advice in so many instrument-related situations, and though they didn't have what I was looking for, they pointed me to A 440.A 440 is a small music shop that caters to the needs of string instrument musicians and students. I called and they knew exactly what it was I needed, and told me they carried a variety of them. Fantastic! Within an hour, I had the object that will make my daughter's cello practice time less slippery. On the package, it's called the "Best-Way Non-Skid Rubber End Pin Holder" and it also says, "Relax While You Play".Thanks, A 440, for being not downtown or in the suburbs and open on a Saturday afternoon. My daughter will let her classmates know that they can get their string instrument supplies from you!

10.description: Just when i finally signed up for a cello class at Old Town they (old town) stopped renting cellos. So i found A440 which happened to be in my neighborhood so great! I went in and rented a cello with insurance, a bow, case and all that. They seemed nice enough but still a bit intimidating for a newbie like me.Flash forward a few weeks into class and to my horror i notice a small hole bashed into the side of my cello as i was taking it out in class. I have absolutely no idea how that happened as i tried to be very careful with the instrument but oh well accidents happen and thankgod i got insurance. Well when i took it back the guy said insurance wouldn't cover it and would cost me an extra $100. WTF is insurance for then?! I left the cello with them to be fixed (with no replacement, so i was behind on practice!) and was disappointed enough to cancel my class and not use up the rest of my rental time. i just wanted it over. And i never played the cello again. :p

4.description: I have rented violins twice for this location for my son and I will always go back.  The service is great and they are affordable compared to other rental places.  Insurance comes with your rental and they are very nice about repairs.  They will automatically charge my credit card, so I never have to worry about the payment.People are friendly and welcoming!!

6.description: This place is a total SCAM.  Do not go here.  They sell fakes.  They give you a verbal guarantee that you can return your purchase and either get your money back or more because of appreciation. This is not true.  I have shown my violin to multiple professionals who all agreed that I was sold a fake.  If I could, I would give them 0 stars.  They also have made relationships with some teachers in the Chicagoland area who refer unsuspecting students here.  Please think twice and be aware before you make a purchase.

11.description: As a professional, I've found A440 to be a great resource for my needs.  I've bought a fine bass, bow and many sets of strings from them and have had a good experience each time.  I've also recommended them to my students, and Mike went so far as to bring instruments out to one student's house for trial.  I haven't used their bass repairman myself, but he gets good reviews from other area pros.

5.description: (I'm officially going to feel old with this next intro. However, I--like time--must march on. . . )When I was younger, there were lots of shops like this. Back in the day, I would take my fiddle to a local guy named Lazlo Pinter (R.I.P.) he was old, eccentric, and he had a lovely shop. His cat used to curl up in my violin case while he did minor repairs while I waited, and I think that speaks volumes about the vibe of his shop. He died more than a few years ago, and I recently decided to get my fiddle seriously tuned up. While there is no shop cat there is every bit of charm in this store. The owner; Ms. Roberta Guastafeste is charming, 82 years old, and routinely goes hiking to places like Patagonia and the Andes. Which more than makes up for the lack of a cat in my view. After all, good chit chat and reparté--like the craft of violin making--needs appropriate conservation if you ask me. As for the service, I had a major overhaul done on my 100 year old fiddle here and I was blown away by the quality of the service. Their in-house luthier; Mr. Koo Young Chung got the action and intonation of my fiddle dialed in perfectly. Additionally, he's crotchety and has a wonderful sense of humor. Musicians and luthiers tend to be eccentric by inclination (default?) and it's nice to see that there are still places in Chicago where the people stay true to this fundamental part of the scene. In the end, this is a wonderful shop, with a top notch luthier, excellent customer service, and a staff that's as good to chat with as they are to shop with. Brava!

7.description: My daughter has broken the scroll on her viola and I was looking for a place for repair however  we were only in Chicago for a short vacation.  Luckily, we found Michael through Yelp.  Thanks for his speedy, reliable, and reasonable service.  We will definitely return when my daughter needs an upgrade or service.

8.description: Yes, those student violins are pretty shabby. Agreed. Then again, student violins = kids who probably aren't really serious so spending a lot of money early on is pointless. I think it would be nice to say it's my violin that sounds like garbage vs. my technique. Anyway, the staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. You can try out whatever they have, even if they know you can't afford it hah. Not a lot of bells and whistles, but it's definitely not a corporate business either. It's a woman's house I believe, and she's really nice. I definitely recommend this place.

0.description: EXCELLENT.Professional, attentive, fair, and informative service by Andrew M. I enjoy this quaint shop. They take a non pressure approach and give you enough time to try out the instruments so you select what is best for you.Thanks y'all.

3.description: the new counter is gonna be awesome.

1.description: I can't tell you how excited I am to be the first person to review the infamous Clybourn Market... I first went there several years ago to visit the Maxwell Street Bus Stop (a makeshift shack that served polish sausages and pork chop sandwiches on the street). It was around midnight, and I sat on the curb in front of the Clybourn Market to enjoy my late night fare. A presumed homeless woman told me, "white boy shouldn't be here less you lookin' fo' crack." I've since referred to the Clybourn Market as "Crackhead Corner." The area has changed a lot since then. Big brick yuppie condos and an increased police presence has made this area slightly safer. Very little has changed at Crackhead Corner though, and it's awesome. A fine selection of 40, 32 and 24 oz. beer/malt liquor beverages that are priced "out-the-door" (tax included). They used to sell frozen pizzas, hot pockets and even had a meat counter, but have recently downsized their inventory. Great prices on liquor, wine and beer make this the perfect party store. They also sell blunt wraps and single condoms.

2.description: No more butcher! :(

0.description: Yes, the average clientele at Clybourn Market is... well... about what you would expect from a convenience store located directly adjacent to housing projects. However, in my 100+ visits to this corner shop, I have never been worried for my safety. The surrounding neighborhood has gentrified significantly in the past 3 or 4 years, and the guys that work there know everyone in the neighborhood (from both sides of the proverbial 'tracks'). The beer prices are comparable to Dominick's, only without the lines, so this is usually where I pick up a 12-pack of bud light for $8.99. I think a 12-pack of bud light at Dominick's usually runs about $9.99, so (at least as far as beer goes) this place has competitive prices.Take some time to chat with the guys that work there. They are incredibly friendly and welcoming, and make this place worth visiting... despite its proximity to the projects.

1.description: My daughter and I went to this Chipotle because we were STARVING. We couldn't wait to order one of their famous burrito bowls. As the young lady was making the bowls we noticed how very little she was putting in the bowl. We all know chipotle is known for having their bowls overflowing with food. Well, not this particular Chipotle. There was hardly any rice, veggies or meat. We could still see the bottom of the bowl! Where they do that at? Needless to say, we didn't buy the bowls. We left still hungry.

9.description: This is the best Chipotle in town.  Positive employees and super clean store.  Chips are a little saltier than at other locations, but overall the food at this location tastes fresh and hits the spot.

23.description: I have eaten many, many burritos from Chipotle, so this is not really a negative review... However, I ate there last night (6/29/13) and have had terrible food poisoning all day. I'm trying to track the source and I'm pretty sure it was from the veggie burrito I had but wanted to see if anyone else was feeling ill today after eating there last night. Their food is usually very tasty and this has been the only time I've gotten sick after eating there in over 10 years

5.description: Like others have stated, they skimp on quantity and you have to ask for more with every ingredient.  Order guac on the side because if you get it included, you hardly get any!  The location nearby on N Elston is way better.  I'm not coming back to this one.

25.description: Best chipotle in chicago

12.description: Glad this Chipotle popped up across Western from our home!!New crew is getting the ropes. They were open and honest when they weren't sure about something. Good people working to make great food. Thanks!

21.description: It has been a long time since I have been to Chipotle until my visit here. I have forgotten how much how much I enjoy Chipotle. My meal was tasty and they got it ready quickly. It was rather busy for an early weeknight and they moved the line through quickly and they were super-friendly.I tip my hat to the staff here for doing an excellent job with my meal. I haoping to be back to visit soon!

16.description: Very stingy on giving food I ordered a burrito and the filling I received of meat and rice could of barely filled a taco shell.never going back

17.description: Been going to Chipotle for years and love it! Always fresh, hot, and consistent. We just recently moved to the area and this is THE only Chipotle we've been to and experienced such AWFUL service and experience. The portions were a joke, food was COLD, employees were incompetent. I took a few bites and actually brought it back to the counter letting them know it's cold. Never would do this, especially at a Chipotle but it was THAT cold, I felt it was ridiculous. They made me stand in line and watched them test out the temperature gage and taste test the food in front of me to "prove me wrong." They said "it's actually pretty warm to me." Instead of just offering to remake it OR even throw it on the grill to heat it up...they did anything BUT make the customer happy. Unbelievable. Never will be back to this location. The owners of this location better check in.

10.description: Tasty as always but it was the smallest burrito I have ever received from a Chipotle. Also, they ran out of rootbeer.

11.description: If you go during the day it's 5 stars! During the evening its 1 star. They are awful. They are closing everything down at least a half hour before close, including leaving the doors in the entrance clipped open while it is freezing outside. The manager was just joking around with the employees and having conversation with them while serving customers. I would definitely be back during the day but not at night.

26.description: This is a good one for me.  I can cut behind Devry, take a right onto the service road for the building that house Chipotle, avoid the Mariano's traffic, park, stand in the assembly line, order, pay, eat, digest and get back into my car in under twenty minutes.  That is what it's about, efficiency.  Food is good too.  I hate to say it but i like places that serve food with plastic utensils.

27.description: the girl had to remake my burrito, she packed it too big and the food spilled out. I assumed she is a new hire so I let it go, I wasn't upset. then she left the burrito and walked away. I was waiting at the cash register for 5 minutes while one girl was watching me stand there as she wipes trays, she called some co workers name, another employee saw me too and continued folding cups and another girl coming out of the kitchen passed me by. I was like " no one on the staff knows how to use the cash register, there has to be a designated person who's nowhere to be found??" I can't belive the staff stood around while a customer waited. then a girl was passing by the cash register and I ask her if someone can ring me out, she did. this staff has no professional training, they cant make burritos or use cash registers. they all look like teenagers and they goof around and talk to eachother while customers wait for some service, wow! its a mess!by the way, I paid about 12 dollars for 1 burrito and one drink. chapotle in general is way over priced for what they offer!

0.description: I almost always get a bowl, with chicken veggies rice and beans. It's usually more than I need which is great bc leftovers are a thing I appreciate.We ordered today, a group of 4 and all got bowls. When we went to get utensils we couldn't find forks, so we asked and the cashier said "oh we're out". They are out, of forks. Forks. Not even a "sorry about that".  I do like chipotle but try and eat what is basically a taco salad with a spoon.... :\ Idk not having utensils just seems like something you would tell a customer when they ordered, so they had the option to change their mind. Instead I had to pay and then be stuck with whatever I got and eat like a caveman.

20.description: Talk about a great staff! I walked in and was immediately greeted by 6 smiling faces. Each person was nice, enthusiastic, and genuine. Keep up the great work!

19.description: I keep going here because the service is excellent, the food is fresh, clean and well prepared and the costs is less than $7 for a huge bowl of yummy Mexican food.

2.description: Something is wrong with people if they give it 4 or five stars. But hey it's their opinion. It's over priced, not the best quality. I'm never eating at cheatpotle ever again. Yes cheatpotle!! they cheat you out of your money and doesn't taste good.

18.description: This is a good one for me.  I can cut behind Devry, take a right onto the service road for the building that house Chipotle, avoid the Mariano's traffic, park, stand in the assembly line, order, pay, eat, digest and get back into my car in under twenty minutes.  That is what it's about, efficiency.  Food is good too.  I hate to say it but i like places that serve food with plastic utensils.

13.description: I just visited this place for the first time and was not pleased with how I was rushed to make my order and if the customer in front of me hadn't ordered the 3 tacos I wouldn't have known you get 3 for that huge price of 7$!! Then what made me yelp was the burrito was cold, they didn't ask if I wanted it heated or better yet you don't melt the cheese!!  So for lunch I had a COLD one and I don't mean beer!  Oh yeah it was ok but it would have been one of my FAV 5! Because the burrito did have a good taste.

4.description: Work walking distance from here and we all know that chipotle is ADDICTING. Seriously, I'm convinced there is crack in this stuff. Anyways- quality is always top notch, and this location is always clean. Service always friendly and fast. I'm here at least once a week. For a healthier option- go with the salad bowl. It's no rice, and comes with a great dressing!

24.description: I keep going here because the service is excellent, the food is fresh, clean and well prepared and the costs is less than $7 for a huge bowl of yummy Mexican food.

6.description: It's totally unacceptable for the workers to tell us after we paid that they were OUT OF FORKS! Really? It's got inventory! Order Order Order!!! I have an account with OfficeMax I'd be thrilled to order you some; for free food in return! Oh oh also out of half the Coke products from the drink dispenser!!!!! WTF? Pathetic!

22.description: meh. it sure ain't the Chipotle at Kedzie and Addison (every one of those employees is present; not half-assed about it all.). i know it's a newer place, but there's like a dead energy. and when i ordered my crispy tacos as veggie tonight... i specifically had them put just a little sour cream and cheese, to leave room for guac. i said "alot of guac" and the girl put about half a teaspoon in each! there was like NOTHING in the tacos! i asked if she could put some more in, and she just gave me a look and did it as if she was annoyed. i pay almost 14. for two orders. there better be more than a few pieces of lettuce and rice in them. and once again, if you hate your job or something, it's really better to quit or not work with customers up front.

15.description: 2nd time at this location and second time out of stuff. Forks?  Really?  This place really isnt that complex. Get it together.

7.description: Do you seriously think it's ok to not be taking cash? Pull that burrito out of your brain and think it thru.

8.description: I'd suggest getting sour cream, salsa, etc on the side. My request for "just a little bit" fell on deaf ears as the girl just plopped on the usual amount. I now understand why others ask for their condiments on the side. The workers simply don't listen to basic requests. I wish I was able to just make it myself.

3.description: Worst experience ever. How does a restaurant run out of forks, spoons, Diet Coke and Coke Zero. Absolutely horrible experience. Customers don't come first here. Make customers aware they won't be able to eat their food unless they use a knife. Management has room for improvement at this location.

14.description: Chipotle is good for a quick meal with the kids in tow.  I will not give it 5 stars until they make good on their promise to go gmo-free.  THEN I will give them 5 stars!

12.description: This is the home for the best night cap after a night on the town. The Liberty Lounge is one of my favorite dive bars in the city. The main reson I go to this spot is the super nice staff and the friendly neighborhood folks that go there. They also have a great beer selection and they pour there drinks nice and strong. The pool table is a big plus for me.All around super cool bar.

7.description: "Are you guys freaking kidding me?"That phrase I said when I realized that my friends actually came here. WHY? Do I really want to hang out with the hil-jack locals? Do I want to chat with the local drunk guy who everyone laughs at when he makes obscene comments instead of throwing him out? HELL NO. No thanks. The parking area looks super shady and is a perfect placed to get mugged.The pool table seriously needs to be leveled. There is no room to even shoot without having your stick bang into the narrow walls. I dont even think that this "bar" is even a full bar. They don't serve food, the location sucks, the employees are rude. Word to the wise....STAY THE FAWK OUTTA HERE!ps. I think the reviews prior to mine...are fake...and done by the business to boost thier crappy "bar"

19.description: Certainly not a bad place to have a drink by your lonesome.  Not that I'd know or anything.  Some sort of drink special most nights, Boba Fett's spaceship at one point hung upside down from the ceiling, and for some mysterious reason it's easy to play a pretty decent game of pool on their pool table, despite having little to no skill at pool.  Magic.

1.description: One of the few old school neighborhood places left...love this place!

2.description: Parking...horrbile like others thought I would get mugged. Also while outside smoking by the back door there was a dog above my head..didn't get pissed on but was waiting for it lol.Bar...Reminded me of a small town bar, which I like being from one. Loved that I could play the music I wanted to and not have to worry about others bitching. Pool table was well...a pool table! Beers seemed to be well priced..I didn't pay my husband did but he wasn't bitching.Overall I think if we lived closer we would be there all the time...probably a good thing we don't.

9.description: The Liberty Lounge is a great little dive off of Western Ave in Roscoe Village. It is a great place to grab a beer and a shot after a long day of work and mingle with the locals that flock this bar. The bar is old school with both Star Wars and Star Trek memorabilia hanging from the ceiling. The bartenders know their drinks and serve them with a smile. The jukebox has every song you could dream of hearing and the bathrooms are decently clean too.The prices are great, the beer choices are sparse, but there are great options. Hacker-Pschorr and Delirium Tremens to Miller Lite and Mike's Hard Lemonade the selection is quite diverse. The shelves are filled with every kind of liquor you can imagine and there are even pork rinds to help with that late night hunger pangs.As you can see The Liberty Lounge is nothing too fancy, it's just a straight up dive where you can drown your sorrows after a long rough day at work.

6.description: I live right down the street and Liberty Lounge is a perfectly small dive that has become my neighborhood bar, filled with friendly folks and reasonably-priced drinks.On any given night you'll find a blue collar grandpa next to a disillusioned hipster both sipping whiskey that the bartender probably comped them for. You'll also find a good pool table, juke box and -- oh yeah -- loads of Star Wars memorabilia hanging from the ceiling. Pretty darn cool.Not sure what the fears are over a "shady parking lot" business is. You live in Chicago, it's called Western Avenue. The POLICE STATION and a TOYS R US are across the street. Also, you should venture elsewhere if you don't like hanging out with regular folks from the neighborhood.

18.description: i can see why you might not immediately pull your car into the lot of the liberty as you drive down western...i can see why you might not call all your friends and say "hey check out this hotspot"...i can even see why you might stroll right past on your way to underbar...but if you manage make the turn and walk in on a sunday you'll find free pool, $3 bloody marys and a phenomenal jukebox.  while liberty does have that dive-y feel to it, don't be fooled...you don't have to order coors light, they've got grey goose. and while they do have some snacky foods - nuts and pizza etc, they'll also be just as happy to let you order in, and can even tell you which places deliver fastest. and the only thing that stops me from adding that fifth star...i'm afraid i'll lose my parking spot!

10.description: Great beer selection and prices for a hole-in-the-wall type bar. I think most people drive past this place their whole lives and never notice it because it's hidden by the viaduct.The bartender is awesome and super friendly. They got a pool table and also a back porch. Drinks are poured nice and stiff here and I like my drinks stiff!

13.description: It is not really a dive bar-I do like me some dives-fun experiences can be had at them, with all the varying characters in them.  I did expect it from the outside and from the sketchy parking lot, but once inside I realized what it really was: a facade.  Oh and by the way you can drink something besides a MGD or PBR and still be cool.

16.description: After living in the neighborhood for three years, and walking past this place many times, we finally went inside last night.  It's really cute for a dive bar.  All kinds of bizarre collectibles on the shelves, starwars toys hanging by the door, etc.  The bartender was super friendly, and when we started singing along to "the devil went down to Georgia" regulars in the bar smiled at us.  The drinks were fairly reasonably priced - nothing outrageous for Chicago.  We left around 11pm and there were only about 6 other people in there, but it seemed like the late night crowed was just starting to file in.  We would definitely go back.

17.description: this has become my home away from home. everyone is super friendly and the drinks are cheap! i have won (and lost) many a game on their pool table. the parking is the best. they have an awesome beer selection. 3 kinds of leines, arcadia witsun ale, dogfish head (the 60 and the 90), delirium tremens to name just a few.  its def a hillbilly spot by day, watch out for the moonshine and they'll kick your butt in pool. but at night its just a fun, chill place to go with friends.and just as a p.s. - "tell me when to go" IS on the jukebox and has actually become the last call anthem!

15.description: This is a hole in the wall bar. It is really small and has limited beer selections where you can find elsewhere. A very tiny bar that is easy to miss over on Western Avenue.

0.description: Great local bar.  Bartender was awsome...  drinks were fast and cold.... plus free pool!    Great place

5.description: Good neighborhood bar where you have the good usual suspects. Beer, small Craft Beer selection, liquor, pool table, jukebox, snacks, and good bar tenders. Good people watching with locals and people from all sides of the city coming in here for a beer or two any given day or night.

11.description: I'm probably taking some street-cred from Liberty Lounge just by reviewing it here (or you can probably call it 'Da El-El -- if you don't already call it that you should start calling it that). I believe this is the essence of the faux-dive establishment.It's a dingy little joint with a pool table and a bunch 'a chairs and a bar. It wasn't very hoppin' until a few of us came over from another place -- we stayed 'til last call and the bar tender was super-nice, chatting everyone up and being really friendly-like.Apparently you can get little pizzas there -- I saw someone eating one but unfortunately I can't taste with my eyes so I don't know how it tastes.  8 bux for a large: smelled good.Anyway, I really liked this place. I'll go back next time I am in Roscoe and I feel like ending the night in a chill fashion.Minus one star only because we couldn't find the fabulous "Tell Me When to Go" by the stellar E-40 on the jukebox. BUT...PRO TIP: At first it looks like there are no good songs on the jukebox, but if you touch "Super Song Selection", it takes you to a screen where you can retrieve a song by pretty much any group you want.

8.description: I absolutely adore this place! The bartenders are fun, personable, and awesome! (especially Sterrin) I heard from a friend for awhile this was the place to go. I'm from a small town and hate big Wrigleyville type clubs. So, on a whim a friend and I stopped in and we had so much fun we ended up staying til close. Sterrin was such a fantastic bartender she even made up a drink for me, then invited me to her wedding reception! What other bar makes you feel so at home and welcome that you are invited to an actual life event? Check out the Liberty Lounge and you'll see, besides the drinks are so cheap you won't even have to pre-game before going ;-)

3.description: Pretty amazing.  I love dives and this hidden gem fit the bill.  The staff was super friendly, they've got a great jukebox, and the prices are hard to beat.  Brooklyn Lager for $3?  Yes, please!  Their pizzas also make for a great late night snack!  Love Liberty, we'll definitely be back for more!

14.description: I thought this place was a great little bar. The bartender walked up and introduced herself and chatted us up. I like this place and ill be coming back soon

4.description: Wow--What a cast of characters in this Joint is about all I have to say!! Standard DIVE complete with a plastic plant in the front window as well as Star Wars shit hanging from above the bar. It's Cheap/Patrons are shady/bartenders are hilarious!! Definitely something to witness, that's for sure!! LOUD JUKEBOX!! GTFJD

12.description: I have shopped here multiple times. As another reviewer said, it is a bit creepy. I think it was a former grocery store... dingy, spartan.. but really great values! I love this place! quintessential Chicago!

3.description: We stumbled upon Krasny & Co. while trying to locate a cheap brew kettle for homebrewing.  The guy who greeted us was super helpful and knew right away what we were looking for based on the description.  The kettle he showed us was crazy expensive but very high quality.  We decided not to purchase it, but this place definitely can cater to your restaurant supply needs.

1.description: While most people have more traditional New Year's resolutions like losing weight, saving money, volunteering, blah, blah, blah, mine tend be something food-related, like trying a new restaurant every week or learning a new recipe. Those are resolutions I actually look forward to keeping! So this year, I challenged myself to learn to make a new cocktail every week, and with that, I'm also trying to use the proper glassware. I've been searching around for a classic coupe glass ( which also doubles as an old-school champagne glass) that wasn't inappropriately large, but the only ones I found were either way too big or were over $10 apiece. I didn't need anything fancy, just one to serve its purpose. Apparently this is a difficult thing to find. Why does anyone need a cocktail glass that holds 7 oz. of liquor? Three sips in and your drink is too warm. Ah, yes, it's the old "bigger is better" mentality.My hunt led me to Krasny. I'd always been curious about this place but due to its prohibitively inconvenient hours (M-F, 9-5), I could never make it in. I was taking the day off yesterday anyway, so I was finally able to put my curiosity to rest and check it out.Victory was mine! They carried three different sizes of coupe glasses (not to mention any other type of glass you could ever want) as well as other cooking tools, gadgets and assorted restaurant wares. As I feared, I could only purchase the glasses in multiples of a dozen. But at less than $40, I went for it. They're nothing fancy (just regular old Libbey brand), but they're exactly what I needed to start making all those fancy drinks.  And naturally while I was there, I stocked up on other kitchen tools and doodads. This stuff is utilitarian. They're not carrying plates that Alinea serves food on;  It's restaurant- grade, and meant for heavy use. The place itself is bare bones, wonderfully dingy, and retro in that old mom-and-pop-store kind of way. The owner is super helpful and knows everything about what he sells.What a great source. As I expand my cocktail-making repertoire, I will definitely be returning to procure the correct glassware and such.

2.description: I cannot rave about this place enough. They are so helpful every time I come in. They are able to look up my previous orders so they can help me find my products easily. And I just learned today that they do drop offs/deliveries for orders too. I have talked to some of the employees that work there and one guys has been there for 25 years! That says something about a company. I stumbled upon this place one day when I dropped off my dry cleaning next door. Once I stepped in, I knew I would never go to Restaurant Depot again. This was closer to my house and in regards to kitchen and dining room supplies, they have it all. Prices are very competitive too. If you own a restaurant/bar/catering business on the north side of town. Do yourself a favor and check out this place. You will not regret it.

9.description: One of my favorite stores in town. Over the years have hooked up with fabulous deals for DIY wedding reception, equipping new home, hosting house parties, supplies for baking hobby, just everything. I'm a loyal customer.

10.description: Having Thanksgiving at your place this year?  Or maybe just a big birthday bash?If you're frettin' about serving pans, paper plates, plastic glasses, or even toothpicks with the fancy twirls on top, just head over to Krasny & Co., Inc., restaurant and bar suppliers, and one of the fella's will put you right at ease.  With over 6,000 products these guys can literally take you from 'soup to nuts.'The shop is basically a warehouse but the prices are posted (all quite reasonable) and you can purchase both large and small quantities.I've been going to this place for years and many a party has run all the more smoothly thanks to Krasny & Co.

4.description: I agree with the other reviewers who love this place.  Because Krasny sells mainly to businesses that buy in bulk, some items are not available in small quantities for the home cook.  I couldn't buy 10 microwaveable containers--they are only sold by the case.  Still, 5 stars.

6.description: Score!  Nice and cheap cookware only blocks away from my apartment!  Sure this store is no-frills, but it's a treat just to find a restaurant supply company that's open to the public.I was in the pursuit of bread pans and being a loyal follower of the gospel of Alton Brown, I had to seek out a place like this to get a sane price on stuff like this.  They have a myriad of equipment for both front and back of house side of things.  They had nice big containers of your staple spices too that I'm considering trying out next time I run out of something and also the perfect minimalist dish set that unfortunately only caught my eye on the way out.I'll be recommending this place to my fellow amateur chef's in the near future.

0.description: If you've ever been in a bar or restaurant and saw a product they have and thought, "I could sure use that at home," get yourself to Krasny & Co.  This is where bars and restaurants come for everything they need and it is open to the public as well.I used them for a bar upgrade as I needed a dispenser for my demerara (I take my cocktails very seriously).  Other cheap items they had included bar spoons and strainers (which for some reason at places like Crate & Barrel are ridiculously overpriced) and a huge amount of different beer glasses, again for very cheap.It's restaurant grade, so don't come here looking for that wine glass you had at Alinea.  Instead, come here to stock up on the basics at great prices.338/365

5.description: If you're in need of barware, glassware, or pans, you'd do well to make a stop here before dropping hundreds of dollars at Williams Sonoma or Crate & Barrel.  Bars and restaurants shop here, and you should, too.  I was directed to Krasny by the lovely Melani of The Green Lady on Lincoln.  I was looking for tulip glasses for beer, and Melani mentioned that Krasny happened to carry very nice tulip glasses.  Krasny happened to be sold out of the tulip glasses on my initial visit, but the friendly gent working the counter put in an order and promised to hold them for me.  This gave me a chance to browse some of their other items.  Krasny is a great resource for anyone whose kitchen or bar needs a bit of an upgrade.  I picked up a few jiggers, a bar spoon, a cocktail strainger, and an olive oil bottle with a detachable spout, all for very cheap.  The quality of such items won't blow you away,  but at wholesale prices, it's very much worth a look.  Unless your tastes are very high end, you owe yourself a visit here.  Per the owner, 97% of their business goes to bars and restaurants.  However, they're happy to cater to individuals.  The only knock would be on their hours.  It's a 9-5 place (again, they almost solely to bars and restaurants), so you might have to slip away from work to manage a visit here.

13.description: i live near this place for 24 years when i need supplies for a event this is the place to go today i went here to buy some takeout trays  i got a good deal for a stack of 200 this place is AWESOME! i tell everyone i know about Krasny it's the place to go .

11.description: krasny has all of your needs whether you are a restauranteur or a domestic god or goddess. if you are expecting a lot of hand holding, forget about it. you will also have bragging rights when your friends see the industrial strength of your purchases. 1. survey the store shelves before you start asking questions.2. measure your oven before you purchase any pans to make sure they will fit.3. purchase the rolls of parchment to protect your cooking trays etc. the clean up will be a snap.3. be prepared to pay way under retail price and get quality beyond sur le table or williams sonoma. 4. enjoy for years to come, this stuff is made to last!

8.description: Dear friends were getting married. Matthew bakes really well. So, they asked me to bake their wedding cake. Of course I accepted. Then I realized, I didn't have pans big enough to accomplish this grand task... a cake big enough to feed 175 guests! I was pointed to Krasny & Co. by the owner of A Taste of Heaven. I followed the directions they gave me over the phone, and found myself parked behind, what looked like, an abandoned warehouse. I was scared, imagining what it would be like if I was touched inappropriately by a strange, foreign speaking, sweaty, tall, muscular man in the parking lot...right on the hood of my car. What if he touched the side of my face, and I felt strangely compelled to return his lusty emotions - what if he tore my shirt open and carressed my heaving, smooth chest....Oh, wait. I think of that all the time. Nevermind. I went inside.... It was a virtual smorgasbord of baking supplies!! Hurray! Cake pans, cake stands, icing spatulas, and cake decorating tips. They had lots of other fantastic things too, but I was focused on cake baking equipment. Everything in the store is laid out in rows - its hard to get confused. I couldn't find the cake stand I wanted, and they were able to help me quickly. The merchandise is quality restaurant grade stuff. I still have everything I bought. I return when I need to get something on the cheap for a dinner party - or party supplies. Does a restaurant need it? They have it. And the staff was friendly. It still feels a bit Mom & Pop...which I love. I totally suggest checking this place out for all your baking needs...and more!

14.description: Went here to buy a roasting pan for Thanksgiving. They didn't have one big enough. If you want cookie sheets, go for it. It was dingy and kinda creepy. The guy never even acknowledged I was there.

7.description: This place is old school. It's absolutely not a beautiful place. The employees are helpful but not pushy. Everything seemed to be reasonably priced, but I wish they carried eco-friendly options. They have everything from bulk spices and dry goods, to brooms, ketchup bottles, non slip floor mats, specials chalkboards, aprons, pots and pans, utensils... AHHH! I could go on for days. The selection was good.I will be back though, and soon!

0.description: THE BEST jewelry boutique in Chicago!  I have bought jewelry as well as clothing at this  "jewel" of  a shop.  The owner is personable and very knowledgeable about the merchandise.  She knows each piece because she travels far & wide to buy them!  Everyone should check out this Belmont Avenue "Gem".

58.description: Went to see a couple bands play and the space is really good, and the sound is just fine for the type of music I saw. (Rock/Reggae vibe). The main bar area is very normal bar BUT a pretty good beer selection! The back room is where the bands play, lots of space - they also "sold out" which means they regulate the number of sweaty bodies into the venue, which is a good thing on those hot months in the summer! Staff was friendly, and drinking outside on sidewalk/porch was nice, no complaints in this department. Overall, I will be back for various shows, I imagine the crowd will make the experience but what the venue offers is solid. Good people means a good time!

56.description: Best bar in Chicago.

29.description: I was wonderfully surprised with this place!I did realize that this was the same place I'd been nearly a year ago to see a band. The venue isn't huge, but the sound is really good. When I was there, it was a five piece band, great sound, lights everywhere and the crowd - who didn't seem to know the band - was a blast. So on that front, I will definitely be coming back for more music. When I go to a music venue I'm really not expecting great food. I got what I expected with the beer - a good selection and really fun bartenders. I really didn't expect their veggie quesedillas to be that good! It's like they roast the veggies in garlic before they make the quesedillas SO good!Be really careful with the hot sauce though. It's really not messing around with the heat.

42.description: Seeing a concert here was awesome. Ron Pope killed it. For concerts its standing room only and can get kinda tight but if its an amazing band, well worth it. Haven't tried the food but the bartender service was superb!

23.description: Overall it was okay. We were disappointed in the waitress and the length of time the food came. The waitress could have been more attentive to filling drinks. Also, we didn't order anything special besides pizzas and sandwiches,  but we ended up having to take the food to go since we had thought we had plenty of time to eat there. My pizza was mediocre.

47.description: Visited Beat Kitchen last night. Was very surprised at how diverse the crowd was -  I guess it was because they had a live music show on. We got there early at around 6:30pm (thankfully!) and tried the Beat Salad and Thai Pizza. Both were AMAZING! The beat salad for some reason we thought was made of Beets but upon reading the menu again we saw that it was their specialty house salad and "The Beat" and in fact contained no beets!The pizza was homemade goodness on a thin crust and went down well with the pear ciders.I would say the only downside were;- hard to get service once the crowds started moving in for the show- very small downstairs with little seating- CASH ONLY establishment - once the line built up and people were rushing to get in, it was difficult to get outside through the door!Apart from these few minor things the food was amazing - I recommend going early if you are planning on having a sit down meal and want to be able to chat.

8.description: Where it's at is right here. I've come here for shows and comedy several times and it's always a great time. It's nice having the separation between show and eats here, however, I wish they would have the little bar in the stage area open more often. It can get super crowded here on a Saturday night and sometimes you have to elbow your way to the bar...and the wait staff (understandably) will give you the squinty eye when you stand in the waiter's station. The waiters up front tend to get swamped when it's busy so I've had to wait a while before getting things and/or cashing out. Aside from that, it's a good deal. Watch out for 'dem bathroom steps though. Especially at the end of the night. :D

31.description: The guacamole and pizza were delicious! We came for a show and grabbed a table and ate before hand. Service was great and the food and drinks were very reasonably priced. The venue is simple but cool. I'd definitely come back. We had the bacon spinach pizza and it was some of the best pizza I've had in a long time.
