34.description: So disappointing! We were walking around after our cake decorating class looking for food, and this place looked interesting so we stopped in. Right away, this place screamed chaos. There were kids running around everywhere (apparently there was a kids show in the back on Sunday morning). We couldn't tell who worked there and who didn't (the guy who sat us was carrying a baby on his back....?). The atmosphere was very divey - it seemed like more of a bar atmosphere than a restaurant. We waited a while to be seated. Finally when we were seated, we waited....and waited....and waited. No one ever came to the table! The menu had a few things that looked different/interesting (like their mango chimichurri breakfast potatoes), but nothing worth waiting around for.When we asked another couple if the food was good there, they said "it's ok". Our patience ran out, so we left. Totally unnoticed. Wow.

16.description: The venue part of the bar was awesome. Nice sounding room. But the door guy was rude the entire night to its paying customers making unfriendly remarks on multiple occasions. Maybe they will learn he is the first and last impression on new patrons and replace him with someone with a friendlier disposition.  will likely not return due to his behavior.

13.description: Great spot with live music every night.  The pizza is what to get.  It's pretty dark inside with good vibes and a big beer menu.  The music is in the back larger room.  Service was less than personable, but I'll be back anyways.

11.description: You would be Surprised about how good the food is here. Very interesting menu options so it's not your typical pub grub. The staff is even better. Everyone is super nice and welcomes every newcomer as if they've been a regular for years. Truly a hidden gem in Chicago.

39.description: Great bar/music venue.  Great craft beers, well priced specials, and shows are usually quite good.  Sorry it's not a more interesting review.  The cheap beer makes my memory a bit hazy, but I know I had a good time.

37.description: Went to see a show last night. I like that the live music has a separate space.  Drinks are moderately priced, service is attentive, and acoustics are pretty decent. Reminds me of Schubas. I'll be back.

0.description: Your standard Chicago alternative dive bar.Drinks were weak... Boo! Food is cheap and large portions... Yay! My boyfriend enjoyed his grilled cheese and I felt okay with my empanadas... Next time I will order something else. Tater tots were also a bore, bring in fries! Service was quick and friendly, but getting the bill paid could've been faster.I liked the decor and the ambiance, it's fun and alternative and minimally decorated. We came here on Tuesday for open mic comedy and ehhh... It was a great fun date experience, a couple stand out comedians from like 12; but I just didn't get some of the comedians.

38.description: This place has become my hushand Billy and I's living room! Yummy food, good vibes, awesome selection on beer, staff is always super nice and always friendly!

51.description: Small venue, decent sound, and a fine bar area, but nothing that would ever bring me back to see a show. Maybe next time I'll stick around for a bite to eat, and hope that changes my feelings towards this place.Nothing great-Nothing awful....Enjoy Suckas'!!!

27.description: I have been in and out of this place for years, rented a room a couple of years ago for a party.  I will not go there again.  Today was Burger fest and my date and I went to sit and have a few beers.  We are in our 50s and look it.  Was carded by cop wanna be bouncer.  As I was pulling out my ID i muttered that I shouldnt have to be carded in my 50s, dumb rule.  Bouncer said I could move along as he did not like my attitude.  I was sober, did not raise my voice and was getting my ID out when for whatever reason this dick decided he didn't need my business.  Be careful if you choose to go there, he could decide he doesnt like your type and turn you away too.

32.description: This place is awesome. Great atmosphere, food, music...what's not to like. I've  been here so many times and it has always been a good time. Here's the best part. I was behind Rosie S. On 3/28/14 and she is out of her mind. ROSIE S. your license was EXPIRED! I couldn't believe I was reading her review bashing the security at the door. What's not to get about the concept of security at the door. He was doing his job. My friend and I remember this because Rosie S was oddly upset. In my opinion more door security should be half as on top of their games as Beat Kitchens door security is. Three cheers for you Beat Kitchen on hiring good staff. We will keep coming back, and good thing Rosie S. Won't.   Ps you told the waitstaff they weren't needed because you took care of yourself. That's why they didn't come back. You really need to review what you wrote.

54.description: This place earns a third star from be because their craft beer and whiskey selection is really nice, which I appreciate. My review may be poorly biased because I just was brought here for dinner and I did not like the burger I ate. It was just bland and nothing special at all. Especially with all the great places to eat in the area, this is not a good place to eat. Maybe I will come back an check out music or enjoy the atmosphere more and change my review? Time will tell

48.description: I am a fan of this place solely for their comedy nights. They have the funniest comics I've seen in Chicago! Their food is absolutely terrible so I would not plan to eat there. But other than that it's really good place to get your laugh on, and entry for comedy show is only $5

44.description: This review is for my experience using their upstairs space.I was looking to throw a birthday party for about 50 guests when I stumbled across this place. It was at a great location and very reasonable price. Christina kept in touch about booking the room and was good at answering any questions. They are able to setup for any occasion. We wanted some dancing and had a cake, so they did both standing tables and sitting. We also had a DJ (Chicago Movers and Shakers-go check them out!) and they were able to accommodate their needs. There's a small bar in the room, AC, and bathrooms. It's a great space. Matt, the bartender, was great! He was kind and helpful, and generally an all-around awesome person. I would definitely use this space again.

24.description: Nikki Lane! Talented, hilarious, beautiful and did I mention talented?She was in town and with her band, performing a great set. If you get the chance, you should come here. The setting is informal and small- so you do have intimate proximity to the performers. To have a conversation with a musician so admired? C'mon, don't act shy now, even if you have nothing to say these are professionals with a quip waiting. Also, no one bats an eye when fan in the audience passes a beer to a band member- kinda nice. It's hard to get away with that in a bigger spot, so go see your favorite right now before they pack arenas.

7.description: I really like Beat Kitchen as a small music venue. It's never been too crowded for a show I've been to and they usually have some pretty good bands come through. This bar usually attracts a good crowd - not too drunk and rowdy. But I usually only go for weeknight shows, so it could be different on the weekends.Just as a bar, Beat Kitchen is fine. It's got a good drink selection but all of it is a bit overpriced in my opinion. I haven't tried the food but it looks good! People always interact with me when I'm around the bar here which is nice. It's definitely a friendly environment but if you want something more private then the booths are pretty nice too. The last time I was here there were these two older ladies (in their 70s, I believe) sitting at the bar. Apparently they are regulars and they are very funny and love telling stories so if you see them you should talk to them!4 stars because I always have a nice time here.

49.description: A little bit of a small place, but some rockin bands come here!There isnt any easy L access unless you bus xfer (takes a while). But honestly its worth checking out if the band is good! They have a nice front bar area with some seating and then a separate back room venue. So if you get sick of the jammin beats you can come out front to relax. On the night I went they had some amazing fish tacos and they were on special $6 for 3 (was a Sunday). Cheap beer too!

40.description: Darwin Deez, 9/9/13: Last minute switch from close-to-el-stop-Lincoln-Hall to must-now-drive Beat Kitchen. Arrive at beat kitchen to be told that a brownout has temporarily canceled the show. Sit down outside because inside is UNBEARABLY hot and humid. (no AC) Wait 10 minutes for overworked and now slammed solo patio waitress to come by. Order a few beers and a delicious salad, which arrives just in time to listen to the manager tell the audience that the show is now canceled. Finish salad, Catch a glimpse of Darwin on the sidewalk, drive home. I'm not totally mad a Beat Kitchen- brownouts happen, but I am secretly glad the show was canceled- I hope this venue normally has AC, because I would have been a puddle of sweat within 2 minutes of this show. Imagine the stench of 100+ hipsters packed into a small venue with no AC and its 85+ degrees out? Thank you no, So, to recap: kind of a waste of a Monday night- spent money I didn't need to while waiting for a show to happen which didn't, in a venue with climate-control issues. What an awesome night out. Boo.

53.description: I only make it to Beat Kitchen a couple of times a year, but I need to increase that quotient, stat. This is a really great place to see a show. The stage is huge, the bartenders are friendly; the lights and sound are top notch. They bring a good roster of local and touring bands.In the front bar, they have tater tots. And Rolling Rock and Blatz in cans (for $3 and $2 respectively).After playing here, I'm even more charmed: the sound on the stage is without question, the best I've encountered anywhere in Chicago; the sound guy was excellent; and the people in charge were personable and friendly. Overall, BK gives the bands a uniformly fun and positive experience.

30.description: The Beat Kitchen is the kind of funky venue I used to dream of frequenting as a teen. I'm jealous of the people who get to visit regularly! The people working the door were friendly and answered all the (probably stupid) questions I had about catching a cab in the area. I couldn't make my way to the front of the crowded bar to get a drink, but that was probably for the best since minutes later I was nodding off while sitting in a heavily graffitied booth. Whoever nudged me awake was really sweet about it, focusing more on me not missing the headliner instead of being rude or impatient. I even liked the teeny tiny bathroom (hey, it was clean!). My only complaint is that the sound system was particularly wonky that night. WOOF, I've seen the band in question on three other occasions, and not being able to make out the vocals is not a normal occurrence with them. Whatever, I still dig the place!

46.description: Came for a Sunday night show. The bands were awesome but enough with them, how about the venue.. I thought parking was a breeze. I looked up public transit but there didn't seem to be an easy solution for me so i drove. I didn't eat here. I drank beer which was good. I thought the music venue was very cool. It's a smaller venue, long and narrow. Not a bad place to stand in the place. Unless it's behind me because I'm a tall son of a gun. I really enjoyed my experience here and I'll come back.

1.description: This place is a hipster paradise..and today (Sunday) when I came for dinner, wow, the people here are having fun.  Lots of young hipsters drinking and having fun, and also some middle age folks, trying to relive their youth...quite funny.  Menus are unique in that they are albums with the menu in the center.  This is a cool concept, but pretty fitting for a bar in the area.  Waitress, was sporadic and took about 10 minutes to get a menu, but other than the initial slowness, not bad for service. She wasn't the warmest, but efficient nonetheless.  Order the pizza.  Lots of cheese and little toppings.  Tasted a little like a frozen pizza, even though I know it isn't.  Next time I'll try something else. As I stated, could have been better, but could have been worse.

55.description: Review for musicians who gig:Beat Kitchen is a staple for top shelf local bands that gig a lot, and they're one of the few venues that still book twee-ish indie bands, which I love. They'll even do the occasional all ages show, which is odd, to be honest... they rope off a section for the under-age crowd.Load in through the side door on Hoyne. Shouldn't have a problem pulling up or double parking, although navigating this hood and parking can be a pain. Lots of one way streets, permit parking only locations (watch out for these, you'll get a ticket, and Chicago is serious about their parking tickets), and plenty of cars already on street can make it difficult to find a home for your vehicle. I've circled around for ages, and had to walk blocks to get here.The front of the house is a bar and restaurant and the back is the music venue. You load right in to the venue and easily get your gear on stage for sound check. Sound guys (where are the sound girls? Never a sound girl) have always been good here. Backline your gear or it gets stored in the wings of the stage. The stage is not big, but big enough for 3 bands, easily. Share gear if you can.The green room is upstairs, door is near the main entrance next to the bar. It's a really nice space upstairs, stocked with tubs of beer and plenty of space to hang out. Honestly, I haven't spent much time up here, I prefer watching the bands or hanging out at the bar. Got a nice outdoor seating area too. The bar and restaurant offers a good mix of craft beers and solid food.Merch is set up inside the music room along the east wall, next to the sound booth.A solid place to play and a good place to catch a band.

9.description: My second try with this place and I just wonder one thing,why do the employees treat you like you're a piece of shit. I feel like an inconvenience for spending money at your bar. It's not "cool". Please, lighten up. Kthanks

26.description: Had an awesome time here. Went early for a show, had really great beer and food (veg burger and tots!), and then had a great time at the show, which was run like clockwork. Staff was totally friendly, talking us through everything on tap and giving us samples.

25.description: My friend and I went to see the Harvard Sailing Team (a sketch group) here last night. It was our first time at the venue, and disappointingly, when we got into the event space ~10 mins before show start, there wasn't anywhere to sit. We ended up having to stand behind the guys doing the sound and lighting for the duration of the ~1.5 hr show, which wasn't what you would call comfortable. Before the start of the show, we asked the bartender if there are any more chairs and he said we'd have to ask the waitress. We tried to stop the waitress (who seemed to be the only one having to tend to the entire event space) to ask about more seating, but she just flew by us barely looking at us long enough to say, "I'll be back". Spoiler alert: she never came back. To make matters worse, it was pretty much blazing hot in the venue the entirety of the show. They have maybe three ceiling fans in the event space, which - you guessed it - are above all the people who got lucky enough to have seats. They have A/C outlets, but it sure seemed like there wasn't anything coming out of them. In short, it was an uncomfortable experience not made better by the aloofness of the staff. If somebody is performing here you really need to see, go early and don't expect to be charmed by the staff.

12.description: A fantastic, intimate bar and live music venue!Recently came here to see my very favorite band perform and I couldn't have been happier with the size of the venue/stage. Intimate settings like this are perfect for experiencing your favorite music live.I cannot speak for the food menu, but the barkeeps were great and there's tons of free street parking!Would love to return!

59.description: I went there last night with a friend. I have pasted this place many times put never went in. The place was fairly busy. My review is about the food. I ordered the steak skewers and Cobb salad. My friend ordered the Crostini and tacos. Everything was bland. I had to put salt and pepper on the steak skewers to make the eatable. The sauce that came with it had no flavor. The chicken on the Cobb salad was super dry. The Crostini and the tacos were tasteless too. Maybe we came in on the night the chef that does not taste or season the food was working, but I can't recommend this place for food.I see most of the reviews here are about the music and atmosphere. Just don't waste your time on the fare.

21.description: Great venue for brunch and kids concerts. Been here multiple time and, while it gets busy and is covered with concert posters,  its been fantastic every time. I recommend the bloody Mary, burgers and kids pizza.

17.description: I recommend the house made veggie burger. The pizza is delectable. Live music in the back room always sounds great, or you can get away from the noise in the front bar or outside patio.

10.description: Never had a bad time here.  Good food, good beer selection and comedy shows are great

5.description: This place is super gross.. Met my BF here with his friend and it was nothing but a liquored up frat party.. Bouncers didn't care about me or my friend's DePaul freshman ID.. But seriously; I didn't know what to do with myself after like the 5th blacked out dude with dreadlocks came up to me and offered drugs. I guess that's what Hopefully it's not what I get to look forward to during the rest of my time here. Definitely avoid this place unless you're into underage DePaul girls and super heady spunions

3.description: This place is so fun! So I came here only because my husband's friend has a bluegrass band and he was playing here. My husband hadn't seen him in a long time so we decided to come.So this isn't exactly my husband and my type of crowd (no offense hipsters of Chicago, still got mad love for ya). We kind of stuck out like sore thumbs. However, we still had a blast. The only thing I can say that I agree with about this place, that I also see other people have noticed as well, is that the bar tenders tend to be a little lackluster. The night that we came our bar tender in the front reminded me very much April from the show Parks and Recreation. She was super cute but everything that came out of her mouth was very weird and kinda mono toned. I'm a very hyper and happy person. I'm not sure me and her mix well. But whateverThe stage area is nice! They had this little battle of the bands at the end of the night where the members of the various bands would split up and make new bands and played bluegrass songs they created in 10 minutes. Very neat! Had a lot of fun. Made some hipster friends. Date nice success. Oh yea before I forget, the cover at the door was $13!!! I don't think I've ever paid that much to get into a bar ever. So I take a star away for that. Pretty steep for $26 for two people before I even start drinking....

35.description: This place has a lot going on. A bar, a back room with live music and an interesting (and quite good) food menu. Not sure if it wants to be a bar, restaurant or music club. I guess it can be all three?Saw Moon play here on Friday night and so to the back we went. There is a bar back there but it doesn't seemed to be staffed. So in between sets or bands the front bar can get nutty with everyone coming out at the same time to get a drink.Music room in the back is decent enough. A bit small but the types of acts they get there maybe aren't packing the place so it's a good place to see a show.  A small bummer is you have to leave the music room and go downstairs to use the restrooms. Again - time your drinking and peeing wisely...Here was the real surprise. The food. Had a quesadilla and pizza with chicken, almonds and tomato which were both really quite good! Beer selection is the weak link at this place. They have the requisite microbrews but it seems like they picked all the weak ones in the lineup. Every draft I had was just eh. Stick to bottled beers and what you know you like. Overall not the best place and not the worst.  Bonus points for being on Belmont right near a bus stop and plenty of taxis.

19.description: Pulled pork sandwich! Incredibly friendly staff. An excellent venue for music. The music, service, and food are always a safe bet. Great venue/bar/restaurants. Easy 5 stars.

28.description: I can't say a lot about Beat Kitchen--I didn't try the food and I stuck with my regular beer, but as a venue, I thought it was pretty good and I would go back if invited.Beat Kitchen is not a place my boyfriend and I would normally try just because it's a little bit out of the way. However, one of the kids I used to babysit was in the School of Rock program and was playing at the Beat Kitchen so we decided to go see what he could do (he was brilliant, for those interested). We didn't do any research on the place and walked in expecting it to be a family restaurant with a little stage area with a middle school talent show quality show happening on it. This place WAY exceeded our expectations. There was a cover for the show and we got wristbands for alcohol. The bar was nice and, well, pretty big with booths along the back wall for those getting food. It was a small space and I wondered where they were going to play. Downstairs by the restrooms?Then I was led into the back room. It was loud--as a concert should be--but you couldn't really hear anything up front. I thought that was a really nice element to the bar. The back room is a legitimate sized space. It's perfect for a small crowd and an intimate show. I would love to come back to see a professional band perform. (Not that I was disappointed by the School of Rock kids--they were legit. LEGIT--like, back to back Muse then The Clash then Van Halen--everyone knew every song and it was a GREAT show). The crowd cleared out really quickly after everyone was done playing (I think a lot of the kids lived in the suburbs and it was a mixture of bed times and dinner calling to them). My boyfriend and I hung around a little bit to finish our beers and just sit. WE went back to the front area where service was really friendly, but not at all overbearing. The bathrooms were pretty clean, also.If I lived closer, I think I'd be here all the time.

45.description: I've never been to a show here but have had food and drinks on a few occasions. I'm right in the neighborhood so whenever I'm in the mood for a good chicken sandwich this is without a doubt my first choice. Their southwestern grilled chicken sandwich is easily one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had, plus its HUGE (something I appreciate as I am a big guy with a large appetite). With that said, the good beer and great food will keep me coming back. Also excited that the outdoor seating has opened up now that the weather is getting better (finally).

33.description: This place is awesome. I've been going here to drink, eat, see and play shows. It is one of my favorite places to go. The food is quite tasty and they have a great beer and liquor selection. The bar tenders and servers are very attentive and personable.

43.description: I am a Roscoe Village resident and glad to have the Beat Kitchen in the neighborhood because of the great offerings it has when it comes to live music and drinks. I've always been one for live music entertainment and this place rocks.The crowd is lively and the bands that play here are awesome. I've been coming here for the past year and it just gets better. Almost every day of the week you get good live shows and there is a good roster of local and touring bands. It's a small to mid size venue that caters for any crowd and the service is excellent though slightly overwhelmed when the place gets packed.You can also have your own party here and they can set up for any occasion and despite not having a wide array of offerings on the menu, the food is great. I would recommend to anyone who loves loud live music.

2.description: I've always loved this place. From the days when there was still smoking allowed in bars, this place never felt smoky. To last week when I saw WALRUS ATTACK (check them OUT!) on stage. Great acoustics, great room. A lot of history here.And the food! The beer and drink selection has always been tops. Now I'm a fan of their GIANT Cobb salad, that is really enough for two. Keep on rocking, Beat Kitchen!!

18.description: The thai chicken pizza and the mac and cheese were amazing. Can't wait togo back.

41.description: Went here for the first time for Teenage Bottlerocket and Reaganomics.  The show was very fun.  The place is small and awesome for what seems to go on there.  I'd love to go back for the food or to just drink.

52.description: A nice, small venue with a great beer list and fantastic sound, I wish more bands would book here!

50.description: I have been to the beat kitchen 4 times; all if which were disappointing due to the beat kitchen/their staff. The pros: fairly priced tickets without outrageous fees when bought online, and the bands I have been able to see.Unfortunately, the staff is painfully rude and intimidating. I am a 5'0'', 100 lb female and have been shoved multiple times by large staff members for not moving quickly enough to the back room from the bathroom -- I am under 21, so apparently being in the bar area (where those under 21 are completely banned from, thus not being able to eat food) for 15 seconds is unacceptable. I was almost denied entry because of a pill case -- that is a legitimate grandma-style pill case -- that I keep my anti-epileptic medications in. The doorman at first suggested i let him throw it out to gain entry...Another time, I drove most of the equipment for a band my boyfriend filled in with. They would not let me in -- while they were loading & setting up, I had to wait alone in the cold for 40 min until "doors officially open"Often, the music they play in between sets is just as loud as the bands, which I find a bit bothersome.Overall, the staff is unreasonable. What has brought me here is the bands. If I like a band enough, I'll go, but the venue itself is a serious deterrent.

4.description: This is a perfect place for music and affordable, but tasty food. I've been going for at least 6 years now and I don't have one complaint. The music venue is a good mid-sized room, with a decent sound system and professional sound tech's. They even have "School of Rock"shows on occasional weekend afternoons, to support the future rockers of Chicago. Overall, this is a good local bar that supports local and touring bands. They have good prices, good food, and top shelf employees!

6.description: Admittedly, my first visit to Beat Kitchen was for a private party, so my review is related to that.We visited last weekend for a party in the upstairs.  Unlike other parties I've been to at bars where there's mass confusion at the door, this was easy... 'we're here for the party' and then we got a wristband - super!Upstairs, there are bathrooms (nice, so you don't have to go through the bar), coat racks and a nice open space.  There's also a bar.  I don't know exactly how the party worked in terms of food/drinks, but the setup was great - food along one wall in an open space and then some high and low tables (but still plenty of room to walk) in the front area.  The bar also had seats and a very friendly bartender who was busy since the party was crowded but didn't seem stressed out.I think the space was pretty and it had a good layout with windows to give some light and view outside but plenty of space to walk around and chat.  Bathrooms were clean and easily accessible.  Very friendly staff really made it as well.Definitely a great spot for a party!!!

22.description: Saw The Drowners here last weekend. Staff was friendly, beer list was ok, and the place has a huge outdoor seating area. As a venue, the size is perfect; not a bad place to stand, though some seats would be nice. The sound was solid. Maybe a little loud... or maybe I'm just showing my age. I look forward to more shows here.

15.description: Nikki Lane! Talented, hilarious, beautiful and did I mention talented?She was in town and with her band, performing a great set. If you get the chance, you should come here. The setting is informal and small- so you do have intimate proximity to the performers. To have a conversation with a musician so admired? C'mon, don't act shy now, even if you have nothing to say these are professionals with a quip waiting. Also, no one bats an eye when fan in the audience passes a beer to a band member- kinda nice. It's hard to get away with that in a bigger spot, so go see your favorite right now before they pack arenas.

57.description: Food in the front.Party in the back.Beat Kitchen is a split bar, with great beer and food in the front (with limited seating if you don't count a summer patio), and music in the back. I'm a musician, so I hate split rooms at music bars. Why not just charge everyone a smaller cover and be done with it? I digress- musicians- it's still a good place to play.It has a funky vibe, the back room is dark, it's pretty loud- but you're up close and personal, and sometimes they get some great bands!They really do have good food and great beer- on my last visit I ordered Lakefront Brewery's "New Grist", which I've never seen elsewhere. It's not always my first thought when looking for music in Chicago, but pretty solid choice for food, drinks and music.

20.description: Admittedly, my first visit to Beat Kitchen was for a private party, so my review is related to that.We visited last weekend for a party in the upstairs.  Unlike other parties I've been to at bars where there's mass confusion at the door, this was easy... 'we're here for the party' and then we got a wristband - super!Upstairs, there are bathrooms (nice, so you don't have to go through the bar), coat racks and a nice open space.  There's also a bar.  I don't know exactly how the party worked in terms of food/drinks, but the setup was great - food along one wall in an open space and then some high and low tables (but still plenty of room to walk) in the front area.  The bar also had seats and a very friendly bartender who was busy since the party was crowded but didn't seem stressed out.I think the space was pretty and it had a good layout with windows to give some light and view outside but plenty of space to walk around and chat.  Bathrooms were clean and easily accessible.  Very friendly staff really made it as well.Definitely a great spot for a party!!!

36.description: Do not ignore the food menu as I have the past many years of coming to play shows here. I only recently discovered the Chorizo/Goat Cheese pizza, and it is one of the greatest things I have ever tasted. I was so obsessed with it, I ordered it 2 days in a row.

14.description: So disappointing! We were walking around after our cake decorating class looking for food, and this place looked interesting so we stopped in. Right away, this place screamed chaos. There were kids running around everywhere (apparently there was a kids show in the back on Sunday morning). We couldn't tell who worked there and who didn't (the guy who sat us was carrying a baby on his back....?). The atmosphere was very divey - it seemed like more of a bar atmosphere than a restaurant. We waited a while to be seated. Finally when we were seated, we waited....and waited....and waited. No one ever came to the table! The menu had a few things that looked different/interesting (like their mango chimichurri breakfast potatoes), but nothing worth waiting around for.When we asked another couple if the food was good there, they said "it's ok". Our patience ran out, so we left. Totally unnoticed. Wow.

58.description: First time here, will certainly not be the last.  Cold lemon water awaits to help refresh diners.   We ordered the Chicken Shawerma plate and Godfather pizza.  The chicken was savory and succulent; salad and hummus very fresh and tasty; the falafel and rice were both delicious.  Pita these elements together with one of their 3 sauces (prefer the spicier red and tzatziki pairing).  Phenomenal!  The pizza was very good, but I think next time we'll try a more singular pizza.  I only say this because I don't think wood-fired pizzas needs a lot of traffic on top.  The Margarita or White Cheddar as cheese pizzas, or possibly a single meat topping will be next.  The also have a slew of panini's and solid lunch specials.  Super friendly, high quality service

56.description: Most every meal we've had there has been spectacular. A few weeks ago our order wasn't up to their usual standards and they have gone above and beyond to make right!! They KNOW service and FOOD!!!  Check them out. You'll be happy you did!!

29.description: I always pass this plaza and now I finally have a reason to come back and back again! Beginning... The server explained the restaurants concept and was very polite and concise. The food is all fresh and prepared to order!I ordered the Mediterranean ZA and the curry chicken plate. Both were amazing, but I did enjoy the plate of food better. The three sauces were all unique and complimented the meal greatly. All in all we had enough pizza leftovers for dinner. The meal for two people without drinks was only $24!

42.description: Awesome food and friendly service. The food was so fresh and prepared to order. Definitely recommend the toubule. Will definitely be back!

23.description: The service here is truly some of the best I've ever had. In addition, the food is super tasty and cheap. It is a blessing and curse to live near here, because I have to limit my visits. One of my favorite spots in Chicago.

47.description: Best takeout food in Roscoe Village.The staff and owner are great. Always up for a conversation and very accommodating to your meal. They offer a number of sauces/olives--- try the yellow curry- its great. Go to place everyweek when I can't decide what I want for dinner. Always get the chicken swarma, chicken curry, med salad. Wife loves the hummus- its made fresh daily and beats out anyone's in the city. Panini's are great too and good price. Overall, great experience.

8.description: If I could give 6 stars for service, I would. Food: 5 stars.The Mediterranian pizza will blow your mind. A wood-oven from Napoli heats to 800 degrees and creates a heavenly soft yet crunchy dough base. Topped with in house tomato sauce, shwarma, basil, and other fresh spices, it was probably the third best pizza I've had in my life. It was such a flavorful, masterful combination of tender, juicy shwarma and sweet sauce and fresh, tongue-livening spices that I was surprised the restaurant had only been around a year.4: The chicken chipotle shwarma was by no means a slouch, it was delicious and had extremely fresh salad. But it was overshadowed by the perfect pizza. 6 stars for the service. Fares was an absolutely gracious and warm host, and we felt as if we were dining in his home. We talked about life, our experience in the Middle East, our love for food, amongst others. He threw in free dolmas which were so fresh and grape-leafy, and went well with the tzatziki yogurt sauce. He also gave us free baclavas which were just as good if not better than that found in the Middle East. I was blown away.Go go go go go there now.

31.description: We have eaten here twice now it was Oh So GOOD! The wood fire grilled metterainan pizza was stellar and beyond belief, we added extra garlic to it, we heard from someone there were vampires in the area. The Dolmas were heaven wrapped in a grape leaf. Baklava was amazing as well not too sweet, just right.Would go back again in a heart beat, service was excellent as well!

34.description: The best. Always stop here when we come to Costco. Great service, and delicious food. Get all the sauces!

16.description: Even if the food wasn't good (but trust me, it was), I would give this place 5 stars because of the service. I walked in alone to order dinner, and the man taking my order was just so nice. No better way to put it. I assume he was an owner or manager, but at the end of my meal he even personally thanked me for coming in and made sure I had enjoyed everything. Super sweet.I ordered the veggie plate (they let me sub the baba ghanoush for rice) and it was a good amount for the price and delicious. The falafel and pita were really good. Make sure to ask for tzatziki on the side!

13.description: So my boyfriend and I decided to try this place out. We walk in, place was full but we mentioned that we were both new and have some questions. Our server was extremely helpful and attentive. He sat us down and answered all questions and gave us amazing recommendations. We ordered the pepperoni Pi and the chicken combo plate (recommended by our server) and let me tell you, IT WAS DELICIOUS! We also each order their homemade strawberry lemonade and the regular homemade lemonade. Also GREAT. All Ingredients are fresh and the service is great. If you haven't been here, GO! YOU WON'T REGRET IT!

11.description: Amazing food! I had the Chicken Shawarma plate and would definitely get it again. The falafels are fresh and a must have. The dine in area is small so if you have a large party, greater than 4 people, it might be easier to do take out.

39.description: Solid pizza from a brick oven stove in this small little cafe across from Lane Tech. Each pizza is pretty much a personal small size pizza and taste wonderful. Lunch specials are super cheap as well! Good job guys! I just wish this place was open later at night past 9pm.

37.description: Unstoppable Mediterranean pizza! I can taste the freshness of meat. Everything is incomparable. The price is super affordable. Salute to the owner of this restaurant very passionate and super humble.

0.description: Omg omg omgIt is worth the speeding ticket you will inevitably get whilst on Western to get these folks' wood fired pizza. They say they only have personal pizzas, but it's really like a small. We ordered three for two toddlers and four adults and heisersingh some left over. My kids are major olive aficionados, so their house made pickled green olives were a huge hit.

38.description: If I could give 6 stars for service, I would. Food: 5 stars.The Mediterranian pizza will blow your mind. A wood-oven from Napoli heats to 800 degrees and creates a heavenly soft yet crunchy dough base. Topped with in house tomato sauce, shwarma, basil, and other fresh spices, it was probably the third best pizza I've had in my life. It was such a flavorful, masterful combination of tender, juicy shwarma and sweet sauce and fresh, tongue-livening spices that I was surprised the restaurant had only been around a year.4: The chicken chipotle shwarma was by no means a slouch, it was delicious and had extremely fresh salad. But it was overshadowed by the perfect pizza. 6 stars for the service. Fares was an absolutely gracious and warm host, and we felt as if we were dining in his home. We talked about life, our experience in the Middle East, our love for food, amongst others. He threw in free dolmas which were so fresh and grape-leafy, and went well with the tzatziki yogurt sauce. He also gave us free baclavas which were just as good if not better than that found in the Middle East. I was blown away.Go go go go go there now.

51.description: The food here is delicious.  Granted I've only had the pizza and the Mediterranean Plate but, the service is great, and it's clean and tidy, and this food is great. The place is a bit small, and it's across from Lane Tech so it'd probably hard to get a seat when school's out, other than that it's all great. We'll be back.

27.description: Surprisingly good food!  Got the chicken schwarma, beef kefta, and veggie platter.  Lots of good food, all arrived nicely and on time at our house.  Meats were excellent, hummus very good, baba ghanoush OK (bit too smoky for me).  Definitely will order again.

32.description: Great food, great people to talk and did I say very great food!!!!

54.description: Amazing food, really clean and fantastic service. Love this place and they deliver! Fire-grilled, you can't beat it. Loved the panini sandwiches. Pizza is supposed to be incredible. Trying that next visit.

48.description: Absolutely delicious food here. One of the best falafel sandwiches I've ever had. My boyfriend wouldn't shut up about how good his avocado panini was. We ordered delivery on a weeknight, and the food got here quickly. Bonus was the incredibly nice delivery driver! Would recommend this place to anyone looking for good Mediterranean food in the city.

44.description: So the owners didn't come up with the greatest name for a restaurant but they are dedicated to providing tasty, healthy wood-fired pizzas and Mediterranean fare with the freshest ingredients. Try the homemade falafel! The core clientele are Lane Tech students who are, according to the owners, very health conscious. Not much of a sit-down area but customers get prompt service. Itching to try a lot more menu items. Very affordable - especially with daily specials.

24.description: Even if the food wasn't good (but trust me, it was), I would give this place 5 stars because of the service. I walked in alone to order dinner, and the man taking my order was just so nice. No better way to put it. I assume he was an owner or manager, but at the end of my meal he even personally thanked me for coming in and made sure I had enjoyed everything. Super sweet.I ordered the veggie plate (they let me sub the baba ghanoush for rice) and it was a good amount for the price and delicious. The falafel and pita were really good. Make sure to ask for tzatziki on the side!

7.description: My friend says I give way too many five stars (what can I say -- I have good taste and know where to go...) However, when I brought him to try the Mediterranean Pizza and the Spicy Chicken Shwarma plate, he was amazed. He would give this place a five star too. I think I saw his eyes roll to the back of his head because the food is so good. The Mediterranean Pizza probably ranks as one of the best five pizzas I've ever had in my life. The wood fire makes all the difference. The dough is delicious, the meat is fresh and succulent, the sauce is slightly sweet, and the basil adds another level of freshness. I also enjoyed the chicken plate but not as much as the pizza because it was THAT good. I also enjoyed the falafal as well. The owner is also super humble, very wise, and very passionate about his business. He gave us dolmas and baklava and the baklava BLEW me away. There's something so different about his baklava compared to the usually very, very sweet baklava that I usually have eaten.Anyways, come and support this business! It's a fairly new one but definitely worth the trek from wherever you are. ORDER THE MEDITERRANEAN!

49.description: Found this place and decided to try it. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to help up make our lunch choices, my wife got the Beef Shawarma and I got the roasted red pepper panini and a side of hummus. We were absolutely satisfied, I usually don't like hummus but this stuff was perfect. Perfect small place with good prices, if we are ever back in Chicago This place will definitely be on the list to visit again.

40.description: One of our absolute favorite places! The food is always amazing and so is the service. My favorite is the Mediterranean salad with chicken schwarma. My boyfriend gets the chicken combo plate. Our little girl loves their baklava. The falafel is also very good. Stuffed grape leaves are amazingly creamy inside and like unlike anything you'll find anywhere else - best I've ever tasted.I love the food but I also love that it's a small business with an owner who lives in the neighborhood and invests in the good of our community. The owner is hands on, friendly, offers samples of their specialties such as homemade olives, homemade tahini sauces or their homemade drinks or soups. He even tries his best to remember his regular customer's names. They have some nights throughout the school year where they donate certain percent of the proceeds to the various area schools.When I had a large catering order for a work event, they provided a ton of great food at much less than I expected to pay and delivered to an area way outside of where I would expect them to deliver during peak lunch hour. (I did give plenty of pre-order notice though.) Everyone at the event raved about the food. People who had never tried stuffed grape leaves loved them so much that several of them took some to their desk to have again later. I'd love to cater another large event with them whenever I can. Definitely worth trying when you are in the area. It's a very small place so I'd suggest take out of you go during peak hours and you have a large group.

53.description: I was in their parking lot going to the bank when I noticed their restaurant . I yelped it and said I have to go in and check it out. I felt like I was a old friend of the staff and owner. They couldn't be nicer or more helpful . The food was great. What a find will be back.

30.description: The smoothies there are absolutely ridiculous. All fruit smoothies, can't go wrong...panini's are also legendary. Simple yet delicious, paired with cheese fries and your mind will be blown...Honestly passed this place 200 times never tried it cause how it looks from the outside. But once you step in you'll see that it's  a quaint well put together lil shop. Clean, new, fresh, and friendly. Dude behind the counter is a boss.Don't be fooled by the location or appearance...it's actually great. Try the mango madness or the strawberry express smoothies...they're a must...

46.description: Pi Hi Cafe is phenomenal. Everything is top-notch. The service, the food, the prices. I can't say enough about this place and how great a job that Faris is doing here. My family has tried many of the items on the menu and literally every single one is amazing. Thank you for bring high quality, homemade, healthy, fair-priced food to our neighborhood, Try the chicken kabob plate. You will be hooked immediately. Dave

1.description: HALAL PEPPERONI. HALAL SAUSAGE. Right. Now that we have that out of the way- if you want some halal pepperoni (beef, obvs) pizza and you don't want to trek out to Devon (ugh), try Pi-Hi. Honestly, I have driven past here a million times but never realized it was food... doh. I think I saw the sign which has flame design on it, and the word "Hi" and assumed it was a vape cafe or something? Whoops.The pepperoni is delish (sujuk, for those of you who know what that is) and the sausage they use is crumbled kefte kabab and it is delicious. Like I kept picking pieces off, eating it, and exclaiming "Mmmmmmm!!!" (I should have probably ordered it to go, for obvious reasons...)Next time I'd ask for extra toppings (I just wanted MORE MORE MORE), and, I'd probably order a second pizza, but that's just me. My husband and I polished off one pizza in no time flat, but we also like to eat, so two normal people can probably get by with one :)Super nice staff. Menu looked tasty. And according to (I think he was) the owner, everything but the turkey is halal for those of you who care.See you soon, Pi-Hi!

55.description: Great oven cooked pizza. Great schwarma. Big servings. Great service. Old fashioned home made taste and feel. Best bang for the buck!

9.description: You can drive right by without noticing Pi-Hi, which is in a small strip on Western Ave.  Very unassuming front with signage denoting a fiery flame, but this camoflauges the name, especially at night. We wanted to check out the only Chicago restaurant that made the Yelp top 100 in the US!  Ultimately, good food on a budget, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.  The owner couldn't be friendlier, which I believe encourages the glowing reviews.  The meat in the beef shawarma is fine cut so every bite is flavorful.  The plate is an excellent value and comes with rice, salad, falafel, hummus and pita bread.  I loved the beef shawarma and falafel, but the hummus and pita were lacking something.  The hummus tasted plain and the pita wasn't the freshest.A good wood-oven pizza has an incredible crunchy crust but their version was doughy.  The margharita pizza was covered with basil, and the herb overwhelmed the flavors.  The sauce was also on the sweet side.  I would return for the schwarma but not the pizza.

26.description: There is a reason this place is so highly rated; it is great! Went to try the pizza based on its ranking in Chicago magazine. The pizza did not disappoint, and their sauce and seasoning blend is delicious! The owner was very welcoming and friendly, taking the time to talk to us when we picked up our order. When we opened our order at home, I realized the two falafels I ordered where missing but dismissed it because it only cost $1 and we were already enjoying the pizza. I was so surprised when the owner called me to apologize for missing that in the order, and offered to have his delivery driver drop it off!! A special delivery for two falafels?! Very impressive! Not to mention when the driver came a few minutes later, they included a piece of baklava as an apology. Seriously impressed with the food and customer service of this place. Will definitely be back!

25.description: Tonight was my first experience and I loved it.  There were so many ways to go regarding the menu, but I went with the chicken shawarma, fries and a couple falafel.  The shawarma was excellent.  The pita was so fresh.  The meat was very thinly cut so easy to eat and had great flavor.  The fries were some of the best I've had.  I definitely wasn't expecting that...because fries are fries in my mind, but these were pretty damn good.  I enjoyed the falafel as well.  I will definitely be back!  This restaurant is right out my back door.  I'm new to the 'hood and am so happy to have found this place.  I think my next try from the menu will be the pizza.  From the other reviews here, that sounds like a good choice to go with my next time around.  There's lots of stuff on the menu I plan to try!  I'm definitely a fan.

12.description: The service here is truly some of the best I've ever had. In addition, the food is super tasty and cheap. It is a blessing and curse to live near here, because I have to limit my visits. One of my favorite spots in Chicago.

59.description: After church we were starving and wanted something quick and tasty. Boy did we get that and more! Chris has some of the best customer service I've ever had. The bathrooms, which I count in my reviews, was immaculate, and everyone at the table was beyond pleased with their food. We had chicken schwarma and the beef combo. The beef was better than the chicken, and I'll be ordering that the next time we go. $30 for 3 people isn't too bad either!!!!

21.description: great food

17.description: After church we were starving and wanted something quick and tasty. Boy did we get that and more! Chris has some of the best customer service I've ever had. The bathrooms, which I count in my reviews, was immaculate, and everyone at the table was beyond pleased with their food. We had chicken schwarma and the beef combo. The beef was better than the chicken, and I'll be ordering that the next time we go. $30 for 3 people isn't too bad either!!!!

10.description: It's really convenient for me to stop by Pi-Hi to grab food and since I love Mediterranean, I'm happy that it's so close by. The chicken shwarmma is fairly good so I tend to get a plate of that or sometimes the combo chicken which also comes with kebobs. The hummus is delicious and since most Mediterranean places don't include hummus in their meals, it's a really good bonus! On the other hand, the rice is rather plain though - it's missing some spices that could take it to another level. Also, the garlic sauce that I opted for on the side did not taste like garlic at all! Falafels - does not compare to Pita Inn...I am a strict believer that Pita Inn has the best falafels in the world so I was dying to try the falafels here given that some reviews have noted that the two are similar. Nope! Sorry, but Pita Inn still trumps all. It's not bad here but it's just not comparable. Sweet potato fries - Hm...what to say. Definitely not the best sweet potato fries I've had. It could be a bit crispier and less burnt on the edges though with more flavoring that actually sticks to the fries. Dolma - fairly cheap. You get 6 small ones for $2. I wish there was more stuffing to fill out the grape leaves.Pi-Hi didn't live up to its amazing reviews for me in terms of their Mediterranean food but I do plan on trying their pizzas and paninis later.

5.description: Alright, this review is way overdue as I've probably put someone's kid through college with all the food I order from this place.  Truth is I can't say enough good things about this establishment.First of all, the food.  If you want, super fresh, delicious Mediterranean food, you've found your spot.  I love the Chicken Combo plate here.  The chicken is succulent with a bit of char, the salad is tangy and delicious, the hummus is fresh and light.  And if that's not enough to get you in the door, TRY THE DAMN PIZZA!  Seriously, in a city of amazing pizzas, Pi-Hi makes theirs unique enough to stand out on its own.  It's light and fresh, cooked in a wood oven and the flavor profile is unlike most of your standard pizzas out here.  The pita and spice give it a middle eastern flair that have me ordering from this place again and again.And if that wasn't enough, the owner is one of the nicest guys around town.  Customer service is fantastic here.  These are the kind of people who get to know you by name and always appreciate your business.  These guys take pride in their establishment and it shows from the high quality of the food they make to the phenomenal customer experience they provide.It's always a pleasure ordering from here.  Keep up the good work guys!

3.description: Holy Mollee!My friend's apartment had a gas leak, we were starved in dire need of sustenance.  What did we do?  We listened to fellow co-workers and top men, who gave us satisfactory food reconnaissance.  We departed to Pi-Hi and were delightfully served in the face with the upmost quality of Mediterranean cuisine.  I enjoyed the falafel plate which I devoured and literally cleaned my plate with the pita they made from their brick oven, while my cohort established dominance over his chicken combo.  The falafel was not too dry or greasy but just right and the chicken was savory and moist decadent to say the least.  For this achievement in food service I salute you Pi-Hi you have created a regular.

35.description: We got the chipotle chicken panini, bbq chicken wood fired oven pizza, and also baklava! :) The panini was really good and so was the baklava. The problem with the pizza was that the crust was burnt and it was a bit overwhelming with the bbq sauce. It kind of tasted like CPK according to my girl. This place is more of a take-out kind of setting, but the service was pretty awesome. In all, we would come back and try their other pizzas and panini.

19.description: My absolute favorite place. Absolutely great food. Very friendly people. You can choose anything from the menu and you can't go wrong. Healthy. Affordable. Most importantly, delicious.

28.description: I wish I could give Pi-Hi 10 stars! I cannot say enough of the amazing food and service at this little gem on Western. My husband and I tried the place a few weeks ago and immediately fell in love with the place. The chicken curry is to die for. And their eggplant is out of this world. Their hummus is some magical concoction of creamy, chickpea goodness that tastes better than any other hummus I've ever had. The owner, Fares, is just a delight. He greeted us the first time we went in and made sure to make us feel at home. He made suggestions from the menu and checked in on us frequently, but not obtrusively. We felt right at home. We liked Pi-Hi so much we decided to have them cater an event we were hosting for work. Fares himself delivered the food for about 15 people and set everything up. I swear we had enough for 30. All of our guests raved about the food. Everything was served up fresh, warm, and expertly seasoned. Pi-Hi takes care to use the freshest ingredients each time. The owner and all the other employees are extremely professional and always treat customers with the utmost respect. You will leave Pi-Hi satisfied and counting the days until you get to come back! P.S. Try their baklava. It is divine.

45.description: Average place until you taste their meat... It is prepared with wood fuel which gives it an earthy wood charcoal flavor... Simply crazy good. The staff are very nice and down to earth. Will go there again and try other stuff.. I give them five based on the grill side of the meal and the service. The falafel can be better, they might be undercooked or I could be wrong and it is a matter of taste. The hummus seems to be hand made and felt fresh. Will give another update after my next visit.

33.description: Unbelievable service. These guys are the real deal! You have to eat here. We randomly stopped in because we were getting our phone fixed down the block and were so happy we did. We're def coming back. Thank you so much for explaining how you do things in the restaurant !

43.description: Food really good and staff is nice but I wish they would stop using plastic and Styrofoam containers/utensils (especially when you eat your food in house)

2.description: Sorry but I don't really think they know how to make a falafel sandwich.. or if they've ever had one. The cucumber salad was just dry leaf lettuce with 2 slices of cucumber with a dab of hummus. We ordered online and picked it up. Everything was dry. My friends had paninis which weren't impressive at all. We asked for cheese fries with the cheese on the side but they put it on the fries anyway.Everyone agreed everything was just ok. Especially for the price, not ordering from here again.

18.description: So first the customer service when I placed my order was awesome. Friendly and enthusiastic are the two words to best describe it. I ordered my food delivery and it came under the said time. The food was hot and so tasty. I ordered the beef kabob plate and dolmas. I will definitely be back here probably tomorrow! 5 stars definitely deserved! The only thing I was left wanting was more falafel and sour cream sauce!

41.description: My friend says I give way too many five stars (what can I say -- I have good taste and know where to go...) However, when I brought him to try the Mediterranean Pizza and the Spicy Chicken Shwarma plate, he was amazed. He would give this place a five star too. I think I saw his eyes roll to the back of his head because the food is so good. The Mediterranean Pizza probably ranks as one of the best five pizzas I've ever had in my life. The wood fire makes all the difference. The dough is delicious, the meat is fresh and succulent, the sauce is slightly sweet, and the basil adds another level of freshness. I also enjoyed the chicken plate but not as much as the pizza because it was THAT good. I also enjoyed the falafal as well. The owner is also super humble, very wise, and very passionate about his business. He gave us dolmas and baklava and the baklava BLEW me away. There's something so different about his baklava compared to the usually very, very sweet baklava that I usually have eaten.Anyways, come and support this business! It's a fairly new one but definitely worth the trek from wherever you are. ORDER THE MEDITERRANEAN!

52.description: You can't go wrong, order everything.

50.description: Very friendly and welcoming. They're a small place but very accommodating if you have a slightly larger group. Inexpensive good portion size for the price.  Parking available in front.  Excellent taste. Great choice if you're in Chicago and don't want to fight for parking down town.  Was so good we returned the next day for more.  Will definitely return next time we're in Chicago.  Wish they were in Hawaii.

4.description: Our first time here, we got the chicken shawarma plate and a veggie pi. I can't express the yumminess of this meal. The chicken shawarma was so fresh and tender. The falafel on the side was legit! I try falafel everywhere I can, and most places are dry and gross. Falafel here is perfect, crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful on the inside. The one I tried was so good that I had to order some to go! The pizza.... Oh the pizza... I will be having dreams about this pi with perfectly crisp crust from their wood burning oven. The only thing that pisses me off is that I didn't come here sooner. I guarantee this will become a regular spot for me.

6.description: My go to in the city. I get the chipotle chicken shawerma every time and I try to stop in as often as possible.

22.description: Slow, slow, slow! When I arrived, there was one other table. I told the worker that we were in a big hurry and asked if it would be relatively fast. He said yes. I asked for our food to be brought out as  it was ready, as opposed to all at once. I had ordered soup and hummus, thinking it would be quite fast. We waited and waited. Finally I went up and asked about it and it was sitting there ready but hadn't been brought out. About 20 minutes later, the sandwiches the rest of our group had ordered were brought out. The food was pretty good, but the frustration of how long it took outweighed that.

15.description: Had the falafel sandwich and the GODFATHER PIZZA, very good! my wife had the Mediterranean Pizza, she was happy ;) which makes me happy, which makes everything happy! ;) EXCELLENT! Try it, you will go home happy!

57.description: I've had middle eastern food and when made properly it is delicious.. Unfortunately my chicken kabob plate was very underwhelming. Flavorless hummus/rice/chicken ... The "homemade hot sauce" ....shouldn't be called hot at all. It wasn't even mild. I really liked the guy who took my order, I'm assuming he was the owner. Customer service was wonderful. Very nice guy. But as far as the food.. If you want middle eastern food, without that "middle eastern" flavor then this is the place.

20.description: The first time my husband and I came here, we arrived about five minutes before closing.  I really hate going anywhere that soon before closing but we had just gotten back from a long trip to the burbs and had no food in the house.  It was a stormy night and you could tell the employees were ready to pack it in.  I expected to get a bad attitude from everyone inside.  Instead, they welcomed us in, told us to take our time looking at the menu and even gave us some free drinks.  Score!That was our first of many visits here and each time we have enjoyed not only tremendous service but also delicious food.  I have tried the falafel, the chicken combination plate and the beef plate.  They have all been wonderful.  Also, the portions are great and the prices are too.  I haven't tried the pizza yet but that's going to be my next adventure here.  Hope to see you there!

36.description: I've passed this place soooo many times. Now I just imagine how many great meals I've missed by not trying it sooner. This place is awesome. I had the chicken kabob sandwich, and it was phenomenal. The staff was very friendly and I was impressed with the amount of choices on the menu. It's right across the street from late tech, has a lot of parking, and will be my go to spot from now on.

14.description: There is a reason this place is so highly rated; it is great! Went to try the pizza based on its ranking in Chicago magazine. The pizza did not disappoint, and their sauce and seasoning blend is delicious! The owner was very welcoming and friendly, taking the time to talk to us when we picked up our order. When we opened our order at home, I realized the two falafels I ordered where missing but dismissed it because it only cost $1 and we were already enjoying the pizza. I was so surprised when the owner called me to apologize for missing that in the order, and offered to have his delivery driver drop it off!! A special delivery for two falafels?! Very impressive! Not to mention when the driver came a few minutes later, they included a piece of baklava as an apology. Seriously impressed with the food and customer service of this place. Will definitely be back!

58.description: It's OK...not GREAT, not BAD, just OK.  Not worth the trip, but still OK.

56.description: I'm not a huge fan of late night bars in general - I'd rather sit and enjoy a quality beverage with my friends than worry about seeing and being seen.  That said, this place is great (and relatively hipster-free) before the late hours of the night.  They have a surprisingly good beer selection, and the prices are reasonable.   Friendly bartenders and easy parking make it just that much better.

29.description: Let's start by comparing this to the other decent 4am bars in the area. What other decent 4am bars? You mean the Bluelight or Cristina's? You're joking... right? This isn't exactly a quiet bar, but it has its own chill aesthetic to it. The bartenders hook up their own iPods, so the playlist can vary from the Detroit Cobras to the Misfits. The beer and booze selection is decent, and  it's easy to hail a cab after the seven hour drinking binge when the night commences. My favorite aspect of this bar is that it's a big industry joint for the nearby bartenders and waitresses. I constantly see staff in Underbar from Delilah's and Kumas (eventually I'll learn them all by name). Why is this a big plus? One: Most of them are still sober at 2 am. Two: they tip well, which always puts the bartenders in a good/generous mood. My favorite night to head over is Sunday when Mike is behind the bar. He's a good guy, and a better bartender.

42.description: I love this place and Will was awesome. W-I-L-L. Triple word score. After an awesome game of Scrabble, my friend and I are grinning ear to ear. Will was the bartender tonight and he totally made our night. He recommended an awesome beer and even let me try it before I bought it. Where else do you get awesome service like that? And, 20minutes in my friend was raving about the awesome jukebox, only to find out it was Will's Ipod. Awesome bartender and good taste in music...wow. We had a great night. He even recommended a good pizza place. Ians? Heard of it? I haven't but I am totally gonna check it out. Macaroni pizza? I'm all over it.  Suffice to say, I had a great time. 5 stars Underbar!

23.description: Just the highlights that instantly come to mind:1. Great beer list.2. Classics on vinyl that just sound better than CD/MP3.3. Dim lights and classy vibe.If at least two out of these three things are your cup of tea, stop on by and fall in love. Discovered when it was an in-between spot when I was in Lincoln Square and my buddy was in Humboldt Park; now I live further away, but still make a point of returning as often as I can.

47.description: Checked out the late-night scene at Underbar this weekend and was pleasantly surprised. As one would imagine (since it was, after all, 3 in the morning) there were some unsavory characters...but there were also some really nice people just hanging out, enjoying their beers. I like being able to go to a bar and having the option of striking up a conversation with a stranger without feeling uncomfortable. So that was a plus! And they have Gumballhead on tap! Yes yes yes!

8.description: For the area it's got a good beer selection. So, say if you started down the street at Western & Fullerton, you would have stopped at Owen Engine, had some beers and shots and then headed to Underbar.  You could stop into Blue light as well, but the vibes are completely different.  Don't feel as though having tattoos are necessary here, its not Kumas.  They are cool with you either way, heck its a dive.  Was that a jab.. oh yea!

31.description: I had not been in Underbar since smoking was still allowed in bars. Those days Underbar was stacked to the brim so tightly with so many people smoking that even the most seasoned smoker would feel nauseous from the billows of smoke that used to fill the air. These days smoking is NOT allowed in Underbar and everyone is all the better for it!On a Saturday night, we rolled in only 4 deep as the night was into sudden death overtime. Fortunately for us, the bar was not a clustermuck with shoulder to shoulder wandering. In fact, I found my friend sitting by the window with plenty of stools around to sit on and a good enough position to look out for cops and people watch as they passed by, rolled in, and smoked cigarettes.I always forget that the beer selection over at Underbar is deep and the price is right especially at 4am. While I am still on Lenten abstinence from the alcohol, my friends did not mind downing some Bud heavies while we formulated our next plan.

34.description: Honestly, you say "five a.m. bar" to me, my face goes into uncontrollable contortions of disgust and horror at the image of hammered, desperate idiots delaying the end of their evenings. Um, sorry about that Underbar, I had you mostly all wrong.Great beer selection and very affordable. Really cool bartenders, and just dark enough to hide if you want to. Since they got rid of the parking under the Western bridge, parking in the area can be quite tricky but considering there's not much else around there but the Blue Light (shudder) I say go for it. At the very least, get there early and beat the post-2am crowd. Also, if you're in the industry, you'll find some sympathetic ears after midnight.

16.description: This is perfect "Late Night" Bar with no drama... Un-like that joint a few doors down! Dark Inside and very clean, they don't try to blow you out with the music, which is a good thing! Very nice beer selection and they don't rip you off like said venue 3 doors down. GTFJD

13.description: I had not been in Underbar since smoking was still allowed in bars. Those days Underbar was stacked to the brim so tightly with so many people smoking that even the most seasoned smoker would feel nauseous from the billows of smoke that used to fill the air. These days smoking is NOT allowed in Underbar and everyone is all the better for it!On a Saturday night, we rolled in only 4 deep as the night was into sudden death overtime. Fortunately for us, the bar was not a clustermuck with shoulder to shoulder wandering. In fact, I found my friend sitting by the window with plenty of stools around to sit on and a good enough position to look out for cops and people watch as they passed by, rolled in, and smoked cigarettes.I always forget that the beer selection over at Underbar is deep and the price is right especially at 4am. While I am still on Lenten abstinence from the alcohol, my friends did not mind downing some Bud heavies while we formulated our next plan.

11.description: We were looking for a late night bar, and the cab driver suggested this one...ummm, ok, take us there! Who know a cab driver would have such a great suggestion?? It was dark, and intimate, and we sat at the bar and talked for hours. It was a great way to end the night! I would definitely recommend this bar to anyone in the area.

39.description: Open til 5 am??! How I wish I could forever erase the memory of my thrilled little alcoholic eyes scanning that notice (posted like a dare) on the door, as nothing healthy or productive can ever come from me having read it. Bars in New York aren't even open that late, and self congratulatory Manhattanites think THEIR city never sleeps! "Ha!" I say to them!  I love that the second city is really geared toward people who like to drink in earnest. Not just weekenders, bachleorette parties, and sports-fans (((shudder))). A lone tumbleweed blew past as I walked in around nine (the confused bartender gave up his book and turned on the music, I'm assuming they're not used to an early crowd, if "I" constitute a crowd) and had the place to myself and a rapidly depleted bottle of gin until around ten thirty. By midnight it was crawling with sauced revelers. A half hour later when I fled, people were already starting to nod off in corners... This place could become a bad habit.

37.description: Surprisingly they have a great beer selection. I had a Lagunitas A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale and it sure was sumpin. Seriously, really good. The music was good and the people were interesting. The only problem is there's a $30 minimum on credit cards which seems a little outrageous...

0.description: Have been to this bar only once before, received 5 star service then. Then returned again tonight, and they remembered us! 5 star service again! Love this bar! We'll be coming more often in the future!!! Ask for Carlos!!! :-D

38.description: Not bad, not great.Service was fine, music fine, yeah I don't know I just wasn't really liking it for some reason.

51.description: If you go here early (meaning before midnight), chances are good you can talk the bartender into borrowing a game of Scrabble from behind the bar.  The drinks are good at decent prices and the bartenders are very nice.  One even plays whole obscure Depeche Mode albums, which ranks up there in my book.

27.description: Went for a friends birthday and our group pretty much accounted for the entire crowd at the bar, aside from 3 or 4 other people.  So I can't speak to the after hours crowdedness.  I don't think I really got the full experience of this bar because I was there well before 2 a.m.  Still, I liked it a lot.  The overall ambiance was nice.  There's plenty of open space (though it's not a huge bar), the staff was nice,  I really liked the lights (even if I can't remember what they looked like now), the beer selection was fantastic with a wide range of prices to match every budget.  The bartender let us sample beers before committing to a full glass, which I totally appreciated. I'm glad I read reviews before I went because there was no way I was going to make a $30 credit card minimum on cheap beer, so I had stopped for cash on the way.The bartender was playing his personal iPod...and when I tried to compliment him and tell him I was impressed with his wide selection, he kinda blew me off.  Maybe he thought I was hitting on him and thought I was a troll or just didn't give a shit about my taste in music, I'm not sure, but he was nice the rest of the night.I'd go back, late night, if I happened to be in the area.

32.description: $30 minimum on credit card?  Fuuuuuuuuuuckkkk you!

54.description: A solid 4am bar. In fact it's the one I tend to go to most often now that the smoking ban is in effect and you don't have to wait in line to get in (or out for a cigarette). The clientle seems to veer between rockers and college kids, so sometimes they sort of rub each other the wrong way so interparty  socializing isn't huge, but if you're just into a late-night bar to spend with some friends or the pal you just met before last call at another bar, this is a good place to head towards.

48.description: Wow, we must have hit this place on an off night.  We came in around 7:30 on a Tuesday and the place was totally dead.  This would have been fine.  What was NOT fine was the bartender and three of her friends practicing their go-go dancing routine in the middle of the bar floor starting at about 7:45 and ending....well we were chased away before they stopped.  Actually, even that might have been okay if they didn't play a Neil Diamond song and the theme from the Partridge Family (I couldn't make this stuff up) over and over to practice.  Seriously, I realize there were only two paying patrons there, but this is a bar, not a dance studio.  They also went ahead and played their music loud enough that we couldn't hear each other no matter where in the bar we sat.The dance hall days and the $30 minimum charge on credit cards ensures I'll likely not be going back.

44.description: I believe I'm the first to give the Underbar the 1 star.  I was very excited to find out about this late night spot as I live only a few blocks away and the reviews were good.  I've been on a couple occasions and won't ever be going back.Let's get straight to the point.  The last couple trips I've dealt w/ pretty shitty service.  It seems like the bartenders, different ones on different nights are very pretentious.  And having to deal with this when my friends and I are the only ones in the bar is a bit crazy.  You would think that the bartenders would be down for light conversation or could recommend a beer or two, but I guess not.  Oh and don't discuss their music selections because their music is too good for you to discuss with them.  Fair warning.  On a lighter note, the beer choices are pricey and only caters to regional area microbreweries. Generally that's ok, but there are no cheap options here or any of my staple favorites.The point is you have to be an elitist to fit into this bar's crowd and I find that rather comical because you're in Roscoe Village.  So stop trying to get all WP or LP on us.      Anyhoo, I hope the regulars keep coming here in hopes they stay away from my secret gems in the city.

24.description: Hey Underbar owners, if you bother to read any of this stuff, you lost a long-standing Underbar customer who spent a lot of money there because of really shitty treatment at Green Eye:yelp.com/biz/green-eye-l…You probably don't care, but whatever, I work hard for my money and I don't like being treated like shit by dumbass rude bartenders.

7.description: If you must go to a 4 am bar, I understand it can't be helped sometimes, this is the one to visit. It's quieter, cleaner and not as crowded as the rest of them. The drinks are strong. Happy hangover!

49.description: like the continental only smells more like a restroom.  only thing going for it is the 4 am license and the "diverse" crowd so one never realizes she is technically in lakeview. people are druuuhhhhnk here.despite its location *under* the western avenue overpass (clever-clever), one seems to always be able to hail a cab.  i think the assy cabbies know to line up and take advantage of the 4am'ers.  (um we a**bags deserve it no doubt.)

40.description: I don't know if I understand the appeal of this place, other than it's hours, but I suppose one could start the review of most 4am bars with that statement. They have decent music and serve decent beer at decent prices. Not a bad neighborhood spot, but I don't really see it as a destination on its own. Any given Saturday you can put six drunks together and one will always suggest going to Underbar as if it were the single greatest idea in Modern History. Well, it's usually not the worst.

53.description: I seem to have wound up here after going to other bars, twice. I had no idea this place even existed!It's a cute place, and usually the bartenders have the ipod playing some decent tunes.
