The bartenders are great and the drinks tasty and reasonably priced.Being a 4am bar, it's not so crowded until 2 am, which is great if you want to sit and have a good conversation. After 2 am, the rush hits and it gets noisy and crowded. The crowd is a little stand offish to newcomers, so be prepared. However, everyone has been nice when encountered.I could see being there a lot if I lived in the hood. Give it a try!

30.description: I used to live a couple of blocks away. Always passed here and never stopped in.  Decent priced drinks, Love the mirrors hanging on the walls. Definitely would stop in again.

46.description: I dig it. I live two blocks away & for a small little joint, they've got an impressive beer selection. If you're into crowds, go late.. that's when all the clubbin' hipsters show up.. like midnight or later. If you want to sit down & enjoy a beer, go early.. that's when the locals are sitting around sipping a chilly! it's dead & wonderful.

1.description: New management is great. Never gave two craps about this bar until the people from Sub T took over. Carlos is great and always takes care of his regulars. Becky is the bomb.  Environment is chill, non violent, and everyone is just there to have a blast. Wish i still lived close  because i miss being here after hours every night. Visit often and tip generously!

55.description: What a strange little place.  Yes, I am a Bluelight refugee. I used to love that old dive.  It had a comfortable, welcoming ambience.  The new Bluelight - not so much but that's whole other review.I, like many others, used to always walk past this place without ever walking in.  The other night, desperate to get my final smoke in before the ban took effect, I decided to go Hungry Brain.  But Hungry Brain was way too packed.  Everybody was thinking the same thing.  So in desperation I decided to go to the Bluelight. But I didn't want to go to the Bluelight!  I peaked through the window of the Underbar and made an executive decision: We were going to try the Underbar.We walked in around 11pm on a Saturday night. Incense was burning. It was nice but a little strange to smell incense in a bar. I was surprised, it wasn't that packed but then I remembered this is a 4 am bar.  The crowd that was present was very diverse. Hipsters, locals, working people, some yuppies.  Service was fast.  Bartender was polite. On tap selection is small - only four choices. But they do have a wide selection of bottled beer. Pretty nice. This is a basically a nice, clean 4 am bar.  I might actually make it a special trip to the place early in the evening if I felt like a quiet bar.  I'm sure this place can get pretty packed in the evening.  Only reason I subtract a star: There are not a lot of tables. I suspect it becomes standing room only pretty quickly when it fills up. Also, somebody was playing rap music all night. Yuck.

9.description: i like this joint...and now thats its more easily accessible for me to get to i have a feeling ill be seein the inside more oftenits small clean n cozy...bartenders are pleasant and quick on their feet...drink deals make it affordable and the extra 2hrs that theyre open when other places have closed is a definite drawsee ya soon ub...hopefully next time ur patrons will be more willing to mingle...i like making new friends :)

26.description: I LOVE this place.  I always go here after Chicago Outfit Roller Derby at the Fieldhouse.  I have also been here at other times and It's always low-key.  Great beer list, knowledgeable bartenders, and the guy with the Harry Carray glasses that works Saturdays plays great underground hip hop from is ipod.  I hear it gets crowded late, but I'll keep justifying them being open early.

25.description: If the pickings are slim in Lincoln Park or Wrigleyville on a Saturday night, this is my favorite place to go if I'm still up for catching a lady for the night.  The bartenders are great, the place gets crowded and there's just so many ladies to choose from!  They should get 4AM bar of the year!!

12.description: I was here late night after a show last week.  I realize that a lot of people at late night bars are pretty drunk, but I was not.  I was also wearing a Halloween costume that included 6" platform shoes.  I had been standing in these shoes since 9pm.  My feet hurt.  These are relevant points to my review.My friend was sitting at the bar, and I tried to sit down at a chair next to him.  A girl nearby informed me that someone was sitting there.  Oh okay, no big deal.  When the same chair was unoccupied 20 minutes later, after being empty for at least a further 20 before that, I tried to sit in it again because I felt like my feet were going to crumble away beneath me.  Out of nowhere, the door guy swooped in and told me again that someone was sitting there.  I sort of grumbled under my breath that maybe the person should actually, you know, sit there. Instead of leaving me alone, he decided to pick a fight with me.  He told me that the girl had gone to the bathroom and then had a cigarette.  I was not in the mood, grumpy because my feet hurt.  I told him that that was pretty interesting, because I had also gone to the bathroom, had a cigarette, mediated an argument between two friends, and gotten a drink -- this seat had been empty the whole time.  Without warning or provocation, he said "GET OUT."  I responded, essentially, "NO.  I didn't do anything wrong, aside from disagree with you."  I wasn't drunk or disorderly, I wasn't throwing up on the bar, I wasn't even sitting down in his imaginary friend's chair.  I just was expressing my displeasure that it is apparently possible to have a seat reserved for you here at all times as long as the door guy is trying to hook up with you, even during late night on a fairly crowded Saturday night.I probably should have made him carry me out, but I just slammed my beer and left because he kept whining "GET OUT" in my ear as I was trying to ignore him.  What a douche.  Will not ever be back.

59.description: Ooooh, Underbar.  You're cute!  And you have Three Floyd's Beer.  I just want to pinch your cheeks!Although Underbar is a little out of my way I am glad I swung by for a beer Saturday night.  It totally reminds me of Lemmings minus the pool room in the back.  The place was d-to-the-dead around 9:30 PM.  Around 10, things picked up a tad when a few sets of couples strolled in.  After reading other reviews, this place appears to start bumpin' late night so I will have to come back when I'm in my "I'll stay out all night, I don't care cuz I'm a ROCKSTAR" mode.

21.description: I've been coming here for years. The staff is great and the booze is fine. Always a fun late night stop.

17.description: I'm not really sure how I've gone so long without updating my original review of Underbar (or as I like to call it, "Ünderbar" - with the umlaut, of course).What sets this place apart from ANY other 4AM bar in Chicago is the clientel.  Folks coming in here anytime after 2AM are generally fellow industry workers (bartenders, waitstaff, barbacks, doorguys) who are looking to get their kicks after a night of work (which makes me wonder - where do the 4AM bar workers go? Golden Nugget?). If the people there aren't bar workers, they're regulars, friends of industry, or just plain stinkin' drunk.  If they're the latter, they won't last long (or even make it in) at Underbar. The ambiance in the bar is relatively low key, considering it's a late night place.  The music may be loud at times, but there are plenty of stools at the bar and tables for one to sit down and have a nice conversation.The staff here is top-notch.  Each and every one of them are friendly, knowledgeable and most importantly, fast - something important when racing the clock before last call.So the next time you're looking to sit down with friends and extend your night just a bit longer and not feel like you're surrounded by desparate singles, make a trip over to Underbar.

10.description: Cool bar, cool bartender and nice laid back vibe. Plays a good set of music usually 60's pop before 2am, after 2am it gets better with some smooth laid back electronic indie grooves. Board games and most of all cheap drinks and nice specials. We don't mind starting out here and ending here because the music isn't blasting and its not super crowded so you can carry a conversation with your homies.. Not pretentious, good mix of people but it is pretty dead until after 2am but if you are the only group like we were you feel pretty VIP y mas chingon

5.description: Underbar....the only bar I was ever banned from.  Aaaah, good times, good times.  I recently realized which bars are the "sister bars" and I was shocked.  Well, not entirely.  It makes sense, but I wish it didn't because this bar sucks in comparison.  I'm not holding a grudge, I swear!  (Getting banned from here left me with a funny story which has gotten me free drinks, and who doesn't like free drinks?)  I think it's better than some 4am bars, but really, I always kind of hated it.  I'm no longer banned, and the staff has definitely improved, but, I still can't stand the crowd.  I'm actually really nice at bars.  My friends are sometimes shocked at how patient and nice I am, but the crowd here always has and most likely always will test my patience.

3.description: Underbar----- A charade of douchebags behind a bar.  I have been to this bar 1 to many times, and every time I leave thinking "that was a waste of money and time."  Did someone forget to tell the bartenders that they will make more money if they are nice to their customers.  I have concluded that everyone that works there is a trust fund baby and doesn't need my money.

35.description: I really like the atmosphere, music and crowd at this cool 4 am bar.  They have a expansive selection of quality beers and the friendly barstaff seems very knowledgeable about them.I wish it was closer to my place (Chicago & Ashland area) but it's a great spot to end up at when I am in the neighborhood.

19.description: Just the highlights that instantly come to mind:1. Great beer list.2. Classics on vinyl that just sound better than CD/MP3.3. Dim lights and classy vibe.If at least two out of these three things are your cup of tea, stop on by and fall in love. Discovered when it was an in-between spot when I was in Lincoln Square and my buddy was in Humboldt Park; now I live further away, but still make a point of returning as often as I can.

28.description: Me: "Hey bartender, can you recommend 2 fun drinks for my wife and friend who've been drinking wine all night and want something to sip on?"Bartender: (Blank look and 3 second pause back at me) No.Really dude? It's not like I was asking for a miracle. Any idiot can sit behind a bar and pour beer and shots. And it was empty in there at 1am.  I wonder why?

45.description: go now. go early. go often

33.description: Just went again; I arrived just in time (a little before 2), that is, before the big rush.  Mike the bartender was awesome: friendly, funny and quick.  Patrons were friendly, in generalI love that UB offers an almost dizzying array of beers, from $2 Old Milwaukee cans to some higher-end ($12-15) drafts (which I can't name, as I can't afford to drink those!).  The aforementioned seating/layout problems have been addressed: some smaller, more useful tables have been added.  The bathroom was a little nasty, they seem to have a drainage problem (as water is going down the sink, it's coming up the floor drain in the stall), but nothing outrageous (it's the men's room at a 4:00 bar, I can deal).  One other thing that sucks: there is NO parking under the Western Avenue viaduct any more (which was their primary parking), but that's not the bar's fault; just don't go expecting easy street parking.

43.description: I happened into here with some people that I met at Delilah's.  The first thing I noticed when I walked into the bar was that Aphex Twin was playing.  This immediately put me in an awesome mood, as Aphex Twin has been my favorite electronic artist for as long as I can remember.The staff was slightly rude, however I think that they just wanted the night to be over with and were overwhelmed with the crowd.  The drink selection was pretty good, however the ATM was functioning and there were no ATM's anywhere around.  Also, there is a $30 minimum for credit cards, so I had to stop after a couple drinks exhausted my funds.Anyways, I dig the atmosphere there and will most likely be back, especially if I can talk the bartender into some more Aphex Twin next time.

2.description: As this bar is under new ownership from the good guys that brought you Sub-T and Beat Kitchen. Nothing but good things will come. The music will get better and the beer selection will be top of the line. Beyond happy that this place re-opened.

18.description: Well the plan was to go to blue light but there was a fight there and didn't want all that drama. Then I went to underbar the serves was great I don't know who the bartender was but he keep up with everything and always had a smile I can wait to go back

41.description: This place is great! So, I'm always drunk when I come here after leaving 2am bars- but it is always a pleasant experience. Mostly because it is full of interesting & genuine people, plus good lighting/warmth and enjoyable tunes. There's really not much more I can say that hasn't been said, but I'm tellin' ya: this place is the best! Esp. if you like to meet nice people! Perfect safe spot for a crazy extrovert like myself. Cheers!

52.description: By far, the best after hours bar in the area! I used to go to Estelle's and found myself not liking it there anymore - way too crowded & creepy guys just like most after hours bars. Underbar, however is the tops! It hasn't been overcrowded any of the times I've been there and they carry a good selection of beers (La Fin Du Monde). The crowd, atmosphere, & music is a little more rock 'n roll which is just the way I like it!

50.description: If this were as cheap as the Hungry Brain it would be the perfect bar. It's small but not gross, not too loud, and good selection. Celebrity sighting: Brendan Kelly of the Lawrence Arms, while wasted, told my friends and I that we should all do tequila shots. He then told us he didn't have any money. What an asshole.

4.description: This is one of the best late night bars in the city. Great staff, great beer, great clientele. Go here

6.description: A no frills place to grab a drink and converse. I found that it had a relaxed atmosphere for a late Friday night after 2AM and the drinks were cheap.  It wasn't all that crowded and we found a table right away.  Basically, it's a dive bar at the Western and Belmont overpass, but it's worth checking out if you want to keep the drinks going late into the night.  I'm going to avoid the nearby Blue Light bar as when we pulled up to Underbar, the sidewalk outside of Blue Light was covered with bros (awkward stares and vibes had by all).

22.description: I'm not really sure how I've gone so long without updating my original review of Underbar (or as I like to call it, "Ünderbar" - with the umlaut, of course).What sets this place apart from ANY other 4AM bar in Chicago is the clientel.  Folks coming in here anytime after 2AM are generally fellow industry workers (bartenders, waitstaff, barbacks, doorguys) who are looking to get their kicks after a night of work (which makes me wonder - where do the 4AM bar workers go? Golden Nugget?). If the people there aren't bar workers, they're regulars, friends of industry, or just plain stinkin' drunk.  If they're the latter, they won't last long (or even make it in) at Underbar. The ambiance in the bar is relatively low key, considering it's a late night place.  The music may be loud at times, but there are plenty of stools at the bar and tables for one to sit down and have a nice conversation.The staff here is top-notch.  Each and every one of them are friendly, knowledgeable and most importantly, fast - something important when racing the clock before last call.So the next time you're looking to sit down with friends and extend your night just a bit longer and not feel like you're surrounded by desparate singles, make a trip over to Underbar.

15.description: I used to live a couple of blocks away. Always passed here and never stopped in.  Decent priced drinks, Love the mirrors hanging on the walls. Definitely would stop in again.

57.description: This place is located sort of equally inconveniently from the "big three" Chicago northside neighborhoods (WP/Bucktown, Lincoln Park, and Lakeview) but honestly that's one of its charms.  You get a crowd of folks who are fairly determined to be there, even if they don't get there until 2 AM (I keep my street cred by arriving promptly at 1:55).  Makes for a good, fuzzy-brained dynamic for a nightcap, but the real reason I like this place is because they have a way above-average beer selection.

20.description: The door guy was awesome, but between the too cool for school skinny jean wearing hipsters and the retro scooter crew I found the bar dull and boring

36.description: 4AM & great beer on tap.

14.description: Hey Bar #5 of our First Night in Chicago Impromptu Bar CrawlSo, here we are, two LA girls who hadn't eaten all day but had a massive dinner at the Publican. We tried three bars to various success (mostly failure, though) and then landed at a classy joint, the Matchbox. There we learned from our friendly barkeep to head to Underbar.Oh wow, this is dive city. I parked myself at the bar and concentrated on the whiskey selection which was fair. I also saw they had some cool gin as well. There was a lot of noise going on around me (friend getting hit on), wild shenanigans on stage and me trying to push it past my bed time. I started singing along to the songs which was probably only amusing to my friend. Hey, we're having a good time!I decided I liked this bar but the travel and whiskey was catching up to me. I vowed to come back some other night. We need some of these 4 a.m. bars in LA.

3.description: I have hard to handle and style, very fine hair.  Rudy is the only stylist EVER that has managed to thrill me walking out of his salon.  It's just a one man show and I love the attention I receive from him.  A great stylist and a great conversationalist too.  Love him!!

1.description: This was by far my least favorite hair cut... He basically made fun of my previous hair cut and said he would "transform me"... Turns out to him that means A LOT of nasty feather layers and the Rachel look from friends. I asked for a long bob and he said I needed movement so he cut a bunch of layers that don't blend at all. Very arrogant vibe from him and not at all a positive experience. I didn't hate the highlights he did but not absolutely crazy about them either. Ooooo and my bangs! They look like the original American girl dolls bangs. Awful!

2.description: I just had my hair colored and cut at Alfaros Hair Design.  I was very pleased with the results.  I was impressed with the personalized service Irecieved.  Rudy took the time to discuss my concerns and gave me the cut I have been wanting for a long time.  The salon is not about having a snobby attitude or unreasonable fees for services.  It has a warm and relaxing atmosphere. Rudy is friendly and down to earth, he knows how to treat his clients.  I would recommend Alfaro Hair Design to all of you who are looking for a great salon.

0.description: I have been going to Rudy Alfaro for 15 years for my cut and color. And I stuck with him even when his location moved and wasn't quite as convenient for me - worth it to stay when you find somebody who gets it right. We always discuss approach every time I am in for an appointment. He makes recommendations on how to adjust my color, and always listens to what I want.  I almost always love my color. The very few times over 15 years that something wasn't quite right, he works with me to fix it. It would be difficult for me to go to anybody else at this point!!

4.description: It seems like there are one million and one hair salons within a 10 block radius on Belmont.  I've been to several of them.  My favorite, however, is Alfaro Hair Design.  It's totally unpretentious and very reasonably priced.  That being said, Rudy, (the owner and master stylist) could charge a lot more.  He's truly awesome.  This guy knows how to cut and color hair.  He has done a far better job on me and my family/friends than the other more "luxurious" salons.  Not only is he a gifted stylist, but he's excellent in the customer service department.  (Something that many of these other salons lack.)I have sent at least 8 people to him, and every one of them is thrilled.

29.description: Ducked into this Starbuck's while Retro on Roscoe was trying to get itself started. Despite the fact that it was after starting time, there wasn't a beverage or any kind of food to be had. I was starving and thirsty, so glad to find that this Starbucks wasn't crowded. It's a spacious one, well designed and pleasant to be in. More and more, Starbucks are starting to feel my indy and not so institutionally.I changed my order and the server was really gracious about it. I loved the egg feta wrap I had for breakfast. Just the right amount of food and quite tasty.I'll be back, for sure. Next time I'm in the area.

42.description: This is the only SB within walking distance to my home, that alone would only give it 3 stars. That fact that it is H-U-G-E tips it to 4, they have booths. Booths. In a Starbucks. Add to that the staff is super nice and makes my nephew half cocoa /half milk tips it to 5 stars.

23.description: Walked in to a line of 6 people, with 10 min before an appointment in the area... it seemed to be moving quickly, so I stuck it out.Less than 4 minutes later, I'm walking out with my soy latte! Hooray! This place is efficient!

8.description: I stop in to this location probably twice a week when I am down the street visiting my local chiropractor. The scary or nice thing is even though I only go there twice a week a few of the baristas/employees already remember my name and my drink. That's always a nice thing or is that a sad thing that I spend so much cash on coffee. Who cares as a shareholder I am only adding to the bottom line.  The space is always clean although I find the brick wall  and pillar in the center of the space awkward to get around to get into line to order. Parking is street and is usually very easy to find when they are not doing construction.

31.description: Their staff is usually very nice, except they tend to screw up drinks. This locations is beautiful, and the booths are great. It is really hard to find a seat though on busy afternoons. They parking situation kind of sucks too! There is also A LOT of great art on the walls.

34.description: Love it! Service is awesome and friendly, not to mention they really whip up those drinks quite fast. This is one of three that I can walk to and I always prefer this one. Good job Starbucks staff :)

16.description: This is a really nice Starbucks. I love the brick, seating setup, and the local art on the walls. Staff was nice, good coffee.

13.description: It's Starbuck's.If you don't know what a Starbuck's is like, then you probably don't know what Yelp is, so I don't know how you are reading this.Anyway, this is a Starbuck's, nothing fancy, somewhat small, but with decent seating.  The staff is really great.  Also coincidentally good for dog watching.  People are almost always walking some small dog outside.  I think it's because the small dogs need a Mocha Latte to keep their quivering up.

11.description: I try not to review big chains but just gotta say this was surprisingly pleasant. There's a lot of space for a city Starbucks and a variety of different kinds of seating. I enjoyed my time here. It's close to a toddlers class I take my nephew to so I'll be back :)

39.description: They came by the pricinct to drop off free coffee for the election judges and for all during election day.  That is above and beyond what I expect from a coffee chain by my book.  The coffee got me through the long and hectic day. My local coffee joint, big comfy booths, friendly staff and to go above and beyond......  Thanks for caring about us.

37.description: I'm in love with Starbucks.Every morning I buy a green tea latte, which is the best tea latte I ever had.It's so addictive plus the pumpkin spice latte, only for the season is great! They used to have pumpkin pie, but perhaps they shall add it later during the season! ITS GREAT!Can't live without it!

0.description: This is the Starbucks closest to my house and if I were ever to move from my current location I would still go here!Friendliest staff I've ever encountered! Memorize my order! Always clean!I wish more starbucks were similar to this one

38.description: Me? Reviewing a Starbucks? There must be something amiss. But no, this Starbucks is worth reviewing. It is the nicest Starbucks I've ever been to. It's clean, peaceful with the several people studying, yet roomy enough to have a nice conversation around those keeping quiet. It's decor has personality such as a marble bar with swivel stools, big and cushy booths, plush over sized chairs, and local art. And, the green tea latte I ordered was the best green tea latte I've ever had.

27.description: A good Starbucks, in fact one of the best I've been to.  I like the layout, fireplace and cushy seating. I especially like that there are nice big booths to spread out and get some work done.  People come to this location for 1 of 2 reasons.  The first is to get some work done, many people stay for hours studying/working.  The second reason is a mom destination.  There are tons of babies and toddlers here, but I haven't seen any out of control or disruptive kids so I don't mind all the kids.The employees are not very friendly or talkative which is fine because they are good at getting through a long line quickly.Oh and this is a busy Starbucks, sometimes it's difficult finding seating.

32.description: So, here is the deal.  I live in Old Irving Park and my closest Starbucks is a 5 minute walk.   THIS is not my closest Starbucks.  However, this is MY Starbucks.  I drive to this location at least once a week and sit in their comfy booths and work for hours.  I love to watch the various people walk in and out of the door and I love how spacious this place is.  The staff is friendly and they are always having a lot of fun.  MY Starbucks actually made me want to know about Roscoe Village.  Maybe one day MY Starbucks will be a 5 minute walk...you never know.

44.description: Not a coffee person or a Starbucks person, but the staff here are really awesome. I just finished a good five hours of Village thrifting next door when it started to rain. I had three huge bags and didn't feel like walking in the rain to the bus stop, so I sat here for a good 40 minutes waiting for a ride. I find it rude not to buy anything so I bought a bottle of water and some tea. Staff was really cool and didn't mind that all 100 lbs of me and 3 bags totaling 50 lbs took up an entire corner.

24.description: good plACE FOR COFIIE:)

7.description: Friendly staff, free wifi, and awesome little outdoor patio to do some work in when it's nice out!

40.description: It might be just a Starbucks, but this is a really nice Starbucks.It's like two separate storefronts connected together by  a walkway and the counter.  On one side there are booths to sit in, like cooshy diner booths, and a coffee demonstration type bar area that one of the workers there told me has never actually been used lol.  There's also a random, old-timey red telephone booth just up in there.The other side is all comfy with stuffed chairs and couches and a really cozy fireplace that I've taken at least one wonderful nap in front of - that is a super prized spot in the wintertime, and it is amusing to see some fancified people all ready to shank each other over prime seating.  I'm in no danger of shanking though, because if I'm sleeping in a big stuffed chair there, I am probably exhausted and more likely than not look like a hobo.  And they aren't maybe so used to hobos on Roscoe? I don't know, but I've gotten no grief from either staff or other customers - and the staff is always really nice here.A word of warning - This place on a Saturday afternoon is like the fucking county fair - everyone but a fucking goat and a prized pig is in there forming giant Soviet era like bread lines - avoid, unless there is a serious Frappuccino emergency or something.  Of course, there are like 50 other Starbucks within a 5 minute drive of here - at least.  And, last but not least - They have local art on the walls here!  Like from local artists from the city of Chicago! On their walls!  At a Starbucks!  Lord, please let that become a trend.Of course this isn't as good as all coffeehouses get, but it is as good as Starbucks gets.

30.description: This Starbucks was once a diner (confirmed by Winter from starbuckseverywhere.net).  This location has all the great elements that you could want: booths, oversided chairs, a fireplace, exposed brick, tables/workspaces, and a fairly friendly staff (check out my posted pictures).  The 3 times that I've been there the employees were friendly and after my drink was made engaged in small talk with me.This store is one of the most unique in terms of design space and elements. Well worth the trip and the metered parking.

1.description: One of the okay Starbucks that I know. Been visiting this place for a while now and it seems very good compared to the other branches.Latte was okay, i was expecting that in the first place because this is not my first time coming here.Staff is very friendly.

9.description: Came into the area for a PAWS adoption event.  They were giving free coffee to shelter workers.  I needed change to leave a nice tip because I appreciated the gesture of the free coffee.  My $2.19 bottle of water netted me $15 in change for a $20. It's like they built in their own tip.  They did the same thing to another volunteer in my organization.

26.description: I hate saying this, but it has to be done.  On weekends I can barely move through this place without needing ear plugs from the high shrill sounds of kids voices and protective gear from getting rear ended by giant strollers.  I have begun to travel a little further to other coffee joints on weekend mornings, which is unfortunate considering this is the closest place to my house.  I'm not even a kid hater! I love kids! But not when I want a quiet place to read and relax.  I know its a neighborhood filled to the gills with new moms and I realize moms need coffee too...but there is actually a place JUST for this demographic right up the street called Family Grounds. They even have an enclosed play area!  Go there!

25.description: I wanted to be selfish and give this 1 star to keep this Sbux gem all to myself. But I just can't do it b/c it's awesome! I love local, independent coffee shops, but Starbucks are like Corollas---there's one on every block and they never let you down. I'm a proud Gold Card member at Starbucks, and frequently get pumpkin lattes, peppermint mochas, hazelnut lattes--um basically the entire menu. *I like THIS Starbucks in particular b/c it truly has a neighborhood feel unlike many of the other Sbuxes. A good amount of seating, ranging from booths, to study tables, to cozy chairs. A wonderful place to study. Friendly employees and free wi-fi as well. I highly recommend this Starbucks--just don't go telling too many of your friends! =P

12.description: Though oddly busy at times, this is a nice Starbucks with friendly staff and good coffee.  Don't expect to rush in and out during busy times, but otherwise, this is almost like a neighborhood coffee spot vs feeling too much like Starbucks.

21.description: clean friendly starbucks with lots of seats!

17.description: Starbucks' are all serving you the same stuff so it really comes down to the staff. These guys are good.The rest of the review will be written in hopes of one person reading it: The ******  that likes to get a coffee around 630 am with the company of his loud rapid-fire barking dog that he ties up outside.I'm trying to sleep dude, your dog clearly cannot be taken on this trip without barking loudly for 15 minutes straight. Whatever happiness you get from the company of that dog pales in comparison to the urge to step on said dog I have every morning.Firstly - go F yourself for not realizing that this is annoying. Secondly, kindly leave the dog anywhere else and have a lovely day with your fresh coffee.

10.description: I get coffee at this location multiple times a week because of its great service and atmosphere. This is my #1 study spot and everyone is just so so nice. Great staff. Thanks!

5.description: Maybe this is just the highlight of the parents' in the neighborhood's week to come here with screaming children in what I consider to be an adult meeting space/workspace.  I just can't really come here without getting highly irritated at the blatant disregard for others and the hot drinks that are around.  Children should not be allowed to run around in here like I constantly see them doing.Please someone open up another coffee shop on Roscoe.

35.description: What better way to get to review #100 than to review a Starbucks in a city I'd never been to? Yeah, you can find a Starbucks practically everywhere on Earth these days, and I apologize for not seeking out a cool local Chicago coffeehouse, but sometimes you're in the area, you spot the green siren, and you just have to go in for your fix. In this case, we were in the area and had about a half-hour to kill. This is a pretty cool Starbucks - I don't think any within a 200 mile radius of my home are decked out with brick, nor do I think any of those feature a big old-school telephone booth functioning as a community board. There's a lot of seating, and the windows offer a good view of the street. Even with all the large tables, the place was jammed - everyone had a laptop out, doing whatever. This location would definitely be a good one for serving as your "branch office." Service was competent, a refreshing change from some of the dull high-school kids and hood rats that the 'Bucks at home seems increasingly predisposed to hiring. I'd have to say that in the realm of chain coffeehouses, this is about as good as it gets. Hence this is me dropping yet another 5-star review. I'm beginning to think I'm an easy touch.

19.description: This Starbucks was once a diner (confirmed by Winter from starbuckseverywhere.net).  This location has all the great elements that you could want: booths, oversided chairs, a fireplace, exposed brick, tables/workspaces, and a fairly friendly staff (check out my posted pictures).  The 3 times that I've been there the employees were friendly and after my drink was made engaged in small talk with me.This store is one of the most unique in terms of design space and elements. Well worth the trip and the metered parking.

28.description: I know. 5 stars. Starbucks. But this isn't any old Starbucks. It's the Roscoe Starbucks, and it holds a special place in my heart. It's the perfect little sanctuary: local art adorns the walls, there's plenty of seating, and a variety of seating options including booths, comfy chairs, regular tables and long communal tables. Lots of outlets and just the right amount of noise to get work done without feeling like you're furious typing is too loud. The employees are friendly, there's free wi-fi and free water for when you're cracked out and dehydrated from all the coffee. Plus, there's usually plenty of free parking around the corner if you look for it. It's rare that I would say this about the crazy empire that is Starbucks but this one in particular has become a home away from home.

3.description: This is your typical Starbucks with a Harry Potter twist. The brick wall always reminds me of platform 9 & 3/4! This is a good spot to cozy up with a HP book. The staff are always friendly, quick and efficient.

33.description: Starbucks is great. Though some of my friends say that Starbucks lack a bit aroma, I still love it. Soy milk Latte is my favorite drink when I need to warm up in winter, Vanilla bean frappuccino is my favorite drink on a hot summer day. Even when i need energy before a long day at work I get a cup of coffee here. You can get here many different coffee related goods. From cups, mugs and souvenirs, everything smells like coffee here.Moreover, sometimes they surprise you with a free gift card! This happened to me some time ago, I received a gift card with $15 so I was all set with coffee for next couple of days!

43.description: This particular Starbucks isn't very close to where I live or work - yet I keep coming back.  I simply love this place.  The people who work here are exceptional.  I've probably been to a dozen or so other Starbucks in Chicago.  This is the only one that I'm inspired to come back to.  I particularly enjoy their comfortable booths and the tables by the window.  Tables by the window are great for people watching - especially in the summertime.  I should probably point out that I'm not one of those people whose life revolves around Starbucks or coffee.  I come here probably once a week on average.  But when I do come here - I really enjoy it.  There are probably five or six Starbuck that are closer to my home than this one.  You won't find me at any of them.

2.description: Went in here on Sunday morning to do some work (and to avoid the office setting) and this place was great.  The only downside (which I'll put first) is the service isn't overly friendly, but that could have been because it was 9am too.  The service was quick and efficient and got the orders in and out..which can sometimes be a hit and miss in Chicago Starbucks.  They are often understaffed and slow, but this one had four people working, which was great.  The atmosphere was great.  Brick walls, great art, and a cool, vintage phone booth in one corner.  The tables also had tabletop chargers that work for any device (Apple, Samsung, Lenovo, etc).  It's great for working with a couple of devices at once so you can get work done without so many wires all over.  Great Starbucks..if only all of them were like this.

18.description: all you want out of starbucks nowadays is reliable drinks, correct orders, efficient service, and a place to sit and relax if needed. I believe this starbucks is one of the best at doing all of the above. Happy to find such a quality place in my neighborhood.

41.description: This Starbucks rocks!  I live close to it and stop by almost daily.  The staff are great and super fun and friendly.

4.description: I have always had a great experience at this Starbucks location. Coffee is always fresh and delicious. I love the layout of the interior with the exposed brick walls and the red telephone booth. Great ambience for a coffee shop. Pastries are delicious with a warm latte of your choose.

6.description: They do coffee, and they do it good. Since this is a chain, and there's reasonable expectation that its very similar, I won't expand much. It's Starbucks coffee, happy, polite baristas, and good coffee. Are you a member of their loyalty program? You should. Every 12th cup is free!

22.description: nice staff that make drinks quickly

15.description: I wanted to be selfish and give this 1 star to keep this Sbux gem all to myself. But I just can't do it b/c it's awesome! I love local, independent coffee shops, but Starbucks are like Corollas---there's one on every block and they never let you down. I'm a proud Gold Card member at Starbucks, and frequently get pumpkin lattes, peppermint mochas, hazelnut lattes--um basically the entire menu. *I like THIS Starbucks in particular b/c it truly has a neighborhood feel unlike many of the other Sbuxes. A good amount of seating, ranging from booths, to study tables, to cozy chairs. A wonderful place to study. Friendly employees and free wi-fi as well. I highly recommend this Starbucks--just don't go telling too many of your friends! =P

20.description: I like there friendly personal. Coffee is right away. Only issue maybe parking.

36.description: One of the bigger Starbucks in area, totally remodeled like 3 months ago. Fireplace, Booths, Exposed Brick, and a very nice staff...

14.description: What better way to get to review #100 than to review a Starbucks in a city I'd never been to? Yeah, you can find a Starbucks practically everywhere on Earth these days, and I apologize for not seeking out a cool local Chicago coffeehouse, but sometimes you're in the area, you spot the green siren, and you just have to go in for your fix. In this case, we were in the area and had about a half-hour to kill. This is a pretty cool Starbucks - I don't think any within a 200 mile radius of my home are decked out with brick, nor do I think any of those feature a big old-school telephone booth functioning as a community board. There's a lot of seating, and the windows offer a good view of the street. Even with all the large tables, the place was jammed - everyone had a laptop out, doing whatever. This location would definitely be a good one for serving as your "branch office." Service was competent, a refreshing change from some of the dull high-school kids and hood rats that the 'Bucks at home seems increasingly predisposed to hiring. I'd have to say that in the realm of chain coffeehouses, this is about as good as it gets. Hence this is me dropping yet another 5-star review. I'm beginning to think I'm an easy touch.

3.description: Today i was surprised to find à new massage spa around my neighhood. I'm glad that i walked in.THE first thing grabbed my attention was their Japanese theme, including these pretty Japanese dolls, wood benches, and lamps. Moreover, the people in THE front desk was Nice and talkative. They even gave me à special offer because I lived in this neighhood. What à sweet business owner! Then I tried the deep tissue massage since I always has sore, tight muscle on my shoulders. THE room was clean and neat with aroma candle. THE massage was great- she was experienced. THE whole process was relax, cozy. My therapist spent more time on my shoulders as I asked.As à lady, I pay more attention on details, and I was happy with this new experience!I strongly recommend this place to THE people who are looking for à great massage.

1.description: I had the same experience as Meghan. Additionally another issue:  I told the front desk j had a groupon and she redeemed it.  she put me in a room and the therapist started with full body instead of reflexology.  I figured that was fine. What I didn't expect however and will never forget is that the front desk lady banged on the door and walked in during my massage to talk to me about the service and what the new price would be if i continued.  Like Meghan said,  there was no sheet so I felt exposed.  It was insane.  The massage was very good.  The business side of things on the other hand, pretty bad.   It's a shame.

2.description: worst experience in the history of reflex.  Went with a friend yesterday. there was only 1 practitioner there. The woman at the desk tried to pretend she was a practitioner also but it was ridiculous. All she did was rub my calf and foot for 20 minutes...this is not reflexology. I literally had to sit up and tell her, "enough, go to other foot". I was hoping it would get better because it was my friend's first time and I didn't want to spoil it for her. If the treatment wasn't bad enough, the "woman-pseudo-practitioner" kept leaving me to answer phone and door!! It was beyond ridiculous. She was rude in general. She should've just told me there was only 1 there.  I'd never go back. Already emailed Groupon to complain and demand a refund. They seriously need to go to FitFoot or Relax-a-foot or Foot Smile or VIP Feet to see how it's done.

5.description: I came here on a Groupon.  When I scheduled the appointment I was clear that I had one and what service I was requesting.  When I arrived, they had me down for a different service and I had to wait over 20 minutes for a therapist.  I was perplexed because I didn't see a single person in the place.  Overall a nice service but I'll stick with either Fit Foot or Relax Feet.

6.description: It's a very sophisticated place, the massage room was perfect and cozy. I had an amazing experience! Definitely going back again :)

0.description: I just got a massage here because of a Groupon deal. The place is really nice inside. My biggest issue was the bed. Every place I have gotten a massage at has a cloth cover that completely covers the face hole. This place had a wash cloth folded as a strip just sitting on it. So my face was actually touching the face thing which is kind of gross. Every place I have ever gotten a massage at has a sheet and blanket on the bed that you climb under and they just uncover a specific body part as they go along. This place had a bath towel on me, so most of my body was exposed the entire time I was laying there. I was cold. The massage was good other than the punching of the soles of my feet which hurt. The guy did offer me the groupon price whenever I go back which is cool, but I like the last massage place that I went to more.

4.description: I came here with a Groupon for $27 one hour reflexology foot massage.  Their regular price is $40 for same service but right now they are offering the same deal of $27 to walk ins.  I was thrilled with my service.  The place is very clean and comfortable.  I found free street parking easily on Belmont less than 1 block away.  I got about 10 mins of scalp, neck, arm, and back massage and the rest of the time was spent on my feet.  My feet feel wonderful and I am going to try to get the same service once a month.  I did not wait even a minute and my visit was on a  Saturday.  I highly recommend this place!

28.description: I'm in love with my new buffet. The delivery guys were very kind and took extra care when bringing it up my staircase. They took extra time to make sure the wood floors and antique wallpaper in my hallway were not damaged. Very professional. You can tell they really care about their work.  All around a great experience with Megmade!

1.description: Overall I had a positive experience with Meg Made. I was looking for something custom and stumbled upon this place online. I came in to see Meg in person who was very nice. We talked about exactly what I wanted done with my dresser and we agreed upon an approximate time for delivery. I also said I really wanted a few extra days for the piece to sit out so that it doesn't have any kind of fumes of paint smells. Upon the time of arrival, the dresser I ordered looked nice but it came with a few imperfections and the hardware gold color wasn't exactly what I wanted but here's what Meg did right away to make things right. Everyone makes mistakes, no one is perfect, but she made things right and perfect. She had her delivery guys take the piece back and had a much better product delivered a few days later. It looks stunning, just what i had envisioned in my head, I don't mind at all that it wasn't perfect the first time around. What I like is their business approach that if something isn't quite right or perfect, she will make it perfect.I only do wish they didn't rush it the second time as it did have a little bit of a paint smell that I'm not fond of but it may not bother most people as I'm just very sensitive to smells. What's also nice is that if you share whatever piece you order with Meg, she will send you a gift card for $25 to use as a thank you for giving her business.I do plan on working with Meg in the future as I like that she acknowledges when she makes a mistake and makes things right. In this day and age when there are so many businesses out there, I really want to work with people, not who are perfect, but ones who work to make things perfect and understand what you are looking for. My dresser is standing, although a little smelly still from the paint, but it's beautiful and looks very elegant in our master bedroom. Thank you to the MegMade team!

9.description: Very happy with the pieces, delivery and service. Removed some drawers from dresser to create opening for electronics. See photo -Very happy with result.

29.description: Thanks so much MegMade for my beautiful dresser! Quality work on a vintage piece - I love it!Service was stupendous and the delivery personnel was courteous and respectful.Thank you MegMade!

23.description: So sad. I ordered two pieces. The first was a bed table that came out perfect, exactly what I wanted. The second piece was a dresser/buffet. I ordered both a few weeks before Xmas and they were adamant about getting them to me before the 25th. Hey, I wasn't gonna say no. The pieces arrived on a Saturday and I was very excited by the bold color the sale's lady chose for me. Shortly after the delivery men left, I noticed several scratches on my hardwood floors. Ugh! On Monday I spoke to one of the owners and he asked me to text him photos of the damage. I did. He text me that they would discuss and me in contact. They never got back to me. Later, I noticed that the buffet piece was poorly finished. It looked like it needed another coat of paint. It was darker in some areas and lighter in others. They were so nice to work with in the store.However, I  feel like they rushed my pieces to get them out before Xmas. So I end up with a wonky buffet, scratched floors, a nice bed table, but they're moving on up to a bigger and better store? Maybe that's why they never called me back?

5.description: I loooove Megmade sooooo much.I keep inventing reasons to go there.I had bought 3 pieces of furniture which Meg and team have now revived to absolute furniture porn perfection.I'm the type of customer who can be annoying, as I like to get involved in the creative process.Meg has always managed my expectations ( let's not say demands) super well!Customising colours,adding  new hardware,even adding polka dots for my daughter to a piece they had on the floor.I'm now dreaming up ideas for a vanity unit for my daughter and guess what? I'm going to go back to Megmade.Etsy eat your heart out...we have Meg and she's got it made xoxo

31.description: MegMade offers a stunning selection of refurbished antique furniture and and ready-to-be-customized antiques. I love my dresser! I went in on a day that the warehouse was open and was able to choose a mid-century dresser and specify a perfect paint color. It was delivered to 3rd floor apartment at a time that worked for me by a nice person.  This piece is so unique but it fits the decor of my space like a glove. I paid about half the price of a new Crate and Barrel dresser.

25.description: I just received my new buffet, dresser/changing table and couldn't be any happier with my experience at MegMade! Joe, Meg, and Amanda were super friendly and helpful in picking out pieces that fit my needs and style to a tee. Pricing is reasonable. Robert and Kevin delivered and assisted with painting my pieces and were very professional, enthusiastic and gave me lots of useful tips and advice for the care of my new furniture.  I highly recommend this store for anyone, regardless of style type!!

12.description: So sad. I ordered two pieces. The first was a bed table that came out perfect, exactly what I wanted. The second piece was a dresser/buffet. I ordered both a few weeks before Xmas and they were adamant about getting them to me before the 25th. Hey, I wasn't gonna say no. The pieces arrived on a Saturday and I was very excited by the bold color the sale's lady chose for me. Shortly after the delivery men left, I noticed several scratches on my hardwood floors. Ugh! On Monday I spoke to one of the owners and he asked me to text him photos of the damage. I did. He text me that they would discuss and me in contact. They never got back to me. Later, I noticed that the buffet piece was poorly finished. It looked like it needed another coat of paint. It was darker in some areas and lighter in others. They were so nice to work with in the store.However, I  feel like they rushed my pieces to get them out before Xmas. So I end up with a wonky buffet, scratched floors, a nice bed table, but they're moving on up to a bigger and better store? Maybe that's why they never called me back?

21.description: What a disappointment.  The owners, Meg and Joe, were very pleasant and upbeat upon meeting them in their store.  When we made our first purchase, I was extremely happy to be supporting a local, woman owned business.  However, more than two months later, I am still missing pieces to the hutch that I purchased, rendering it useless. Despite my repeated attempts to contact the shop as well as Meg directly, I was offered absolutely no recourse with the exception of a discount for a future purchase which I find quite offensive.Don't be lured into making a purchase from MegMade based on their lovely marketing tactics.  Meg's lack of communication and unwillingness to acknowledge and correct an error when it occurs is disheartening.  Particularly since I will now be stuck with this furniture in my home that will serve as a constant reminder of my regret in making this purchase.

16.description: Just had a beautiful Campaign Dresser delivered that we had custom stained in a dark walnut/espresso color for our bedroom. It looks amazing! We happened to walk into MegMade a few weeks ago, as we were in the neighborhood and couldn't believe the selection of vintage furniture they had for custom finishing in their warehouse. Both Meg and her husband Joe are very passionate about the pieces they have and restore. Will be back for sure!

17.description: I have searched high and low from Etsy to Craigslist to other shops for quality reclaimed furniture. I have a blend of higher end new pieces and vintage pieces in my home but particularly like supporting small businesses and finding furniture that has character! This place is my favorite by far! The owners, Meg and Joe, are so passionate about their work and it shows in their beautiful pieces. I have also been impressed by their customer service. I am NOT someone who can imagine what something will look like before it is made. Meg and Joe do that. They listen really well and know how to translate loose ideas into beautiful work. IMO, it is worth the out of state delivery to work with these guys.

10.description: We've purchased two great vintage pieces from MegMade in the last year (the latest one earlier this month from their new showroom), and I would recommend working with them. Our first piece was a vintage walnut and white lacquer buffet - a custom job Meg did for us at a discount after a piece we found on Etsy turned out to be already sold. Our latest piece is a great little mid-century dresser finished in bright blue with gold hardware. After recently visiting their showroom, I can also say they've upped their game on finishes, which tended to be a bit inconsistent the first time I saw their work last summer. If you like quality solid wood furniture and are looking for something unique at a great price, definitely take a look and keep looking if you don't see what you want the first time around. They have new inventory constantly and a new warehouse full of great stuff ready for refinishing. I will say that we had minor customer service snafus with both experiences, but the team was incredibly gracious and responsive in resolving any issues (and was definitely concerned with our satisfaction). Just keep in mind that you're working with a small local team, not a large national retailer.

11.description: We went to MegMade after someone suggested it to us when we moved to a new apartment. We picked out a great dresser and mirror out of the great selection. Meg even made some slight adjustments to them so they would match each other and the rest of the furniture in our room. After we got our new pieces (delivered easily and on time), we decided we wanted our bookshelves to match the dresser and mirror. So Meg mixed us up a can of the paint she used on the pieces and gave us some pointers for how to best paint our shelves. Highly recommend MegMade. The selection is great and they're very helpful with picking out what you want. There's a huge supply of finished and unfinished ones so you can easily find something that fits your style and space.

26.description: Thank you for the beautiful dresser!!! What a gem of a store!  My husband and I were looking for new bedroom furniture and found the most beautiful dresser! We even had it delivered same day! The delivery men out the icing on the cake! They were so nice and complimented our new piece! I highly recommend Megmade!!!!

27.description: We had a terrific experience from start to finish with MegMade.  We knew from perusing MegMade's site and FB page that we could definitely find something that suited us and our taste.  My wife emailed Meg's team to have them be on the lookout for a piece with specific measurements and Amanda sent us pics of pieces that could work.  When we went to the warehouse, Amanda, who is friendly and knowledgeable, helped us find something great.  She walked us through the various finish options and my wife was able to have a specific custom color special ordered.  Exactly one week later, our piece was delivered to our home, where it looks fantastic.  Robert and Kevin very carefully delivered our buffet and painstakingly moved it to its final resting place.  They were great, very friendly and upbeat.  Kevin himself painted it; it's a smooth, professional lacquer finish.  The "thank you" package included a container of touch-up paint and brush.  We'll definitely be recommending MegMade to friends in the market for upcycled and refinished vintage furniture.

0.description: It's rare to find solid wood furniture that doesn't cost a fortune but MegMade delivers! I had gone to crate and barrel, pottery barn and west elm and everything was just so cookie cutter and most was particle board. I want a home that's a little different and MegMade is making that happen. I recently bought a gorgeous buffet and hutch that is mid century modern in style, the price was more than reasonable and the refinish job was amazing. I go back to MegMade every few weeks (or every week! ) because they always have new stuff that's been brought in or refinished. I've still got a lot of furniture to buy and MegMade is my number 1 destination to find unique, high quality, fun furniture that no one else on the block will have!The other reason I go back.... the big jar of starbursts. I never leave without eating a few ;)

20.description: I was given a beautiful desk for my birthday from meg made. This is a great local business to support. The pieces they start with are high quality and they paint and refinish them to a high standard. I'd definitely shop here again, or bring them an item to customize.

19.description: I just received my new buffet, dresser/changing table and couldn't be any happier with my experience at MegMade! Joe, Meg, and Amanda were super friendly and helpful in picking out pieces that fit my needs and style to a tee. Pricing is reasonable. Robert and Kevin delivered and assisted with painting my pieces and were very professional, enthusiastic and gave me lots of useful tips and advice for the care of my new furniture.  I highly recommend this store for anyone, regardless of style type!!

33.description: Absolutely fantastic experience! Associate in the retail store was extremely helpful and got in touch with Meg as soon as we had specific questions. We were brought to the warehouse where there was so many more pieces to choose from that were not completed yet (this meant they could be customized). We stayed in the warehouse for about an hour and a half and we're treated so well and professionally the entire time! Delivery was about 36 hours afterwards and the delivery man was not only on time, but very well mannered, polite, and more importantly, careful with the furniture. Great people, great service, great product, can't beat MegMade!

2.description: A wonderful up cycling place with beautiful finishes...go see for yourself and check out their one of a kind pieces from yesteryear

32.description: I am a local Interior Stylist and I LOVE MEGMADE.  Can't say enough about Meg, Joe and the whole Megmade team! Great prices, fabulous quality, and complete eye for detail. My clients are always so pleased with their one of kind pieces. If you are looking for curated vintage style, superior quality and perfectly priced pieces for your home. LOOK NO FURTHER!

18.description: Not a positive experience here. Was recommended by a friend and I had a piece that needed refinishing. My first visit wasn't that impressive but my friends enthusiasm kept me to pursue my piece getting done, they had it for 3 weeks and after going to pick it up myself on my drive home I realized only half of one shelf had been refinished. I drove it immediately back only to break away the plastic wrap to find many more parts of my piece not finished. Really what bothered me more than the unfinished botched work was Meg's demeaning/ patronizing attitude like it was no big deal, she had multiple excuses. Weeks went by, no phone calls- nothing. I emailed asking if my piece was done yet- after a second email I received a phone call from Shelby to set up free delivery, my piece was delivered another week later. The delivery guy upon walking into my house was very kind and said that he was told to tell me a gift card was being mailed to me for the inconvenience. It's been another two weeks and no gift card, no apology, no follow-up, nothing. It's been nearly 2 months since this all began. Meg was happy to take my money, but that's where her service ended.

13.description: Meg and her team are actual miracle workers you guys, they are pure MAGIC!  I have a lovely vintage dresser that's been with me for 6+ years and when I recently moved into my new condo it finally hit me that it was decidedly much more shabby than chic...so I sent it off to Meg's magical workshop to be given a facelift!  The initial pictures I sent didn't quite convey the state that it was in (layers and layers of paint, there was duct tape on nearly every drawer, and there were several chunks of wood missing, and that was just on the outside) so I took trip up to their store front/warehouse (which by the way is amazing!) and met with Meg to talk about our options...after explaining the story behind the dresser and the emotions I have attached to it, and discovering our Kansas City roots connection (KCMO represent!!), she said they would work their hardest to make the dresser look good again......and boy did she deliver on that promise(!!!), and then some...I was absolutely blown away when the dresser was delivered last week!!!  I would have been happy with just a new coat of paint to be honest, but Meg and her elves, er, I mean her team, stripped that baby down, filled holes, took off tape, added trim where it was missing, to make a long story short they worked their magic because it looks brand, spankin' new, it's a total showstopper!!!I could not be happier with the end result and would definitely, 100%, no doubt about it recommend MegMade and will be a customer again!!!  Thanks again:)

4.description: This place is awesome!  There are beautiful pieces of furniture to choose from that you can have painted or stained to your liking.  They are very helpful in assisting you in choosing a piece that matches your style.  My order was ready much faster than I anticipated.  Delivery was swift and efficient.  I will definitely be back for more pieces!

24.description: Oh MegMade, how I adore thee! Seriously. MegMade is an absolute gem! I stumbled upon this place one day while searching for vintage furniture on the Internet. I called them and asked if I could stop by their warehouse to look for a dresser that I had spotted online. They were super kind and allowed me to browse forever. I immediately purchased the dresser and a nightstand because well, it was a Drexel and absolutely gorgeous! It's so hard to find nice, refinished furniture these days.A few days later I stopped back in a purchased another dresser with the intention of making it into an entertainment stand. They were so kind to customize the color for me and gut the middle of it so that I could place my cable box, etc in it. Lastly Meg is awesome. She had a a amazing eye for design and is incredibly helpful when you are picking out pieces. They can even find you pieces if you give them an idea of what you are looking for. I plan on buying another mirror, headboard and coffee table from them. I'm always impressed with their work and the furniture.Oh and they do delivery for a decent price and the guys who deliver are awesome! :) I highly recommend checking out MegMade!

6.description: I. Love. This. Place. There is hardly more to say, but I will say more! I was thrilled to be introduced to MegMade in November and now I'm completely addicted even though I don't need additional furniture after buying a bureau for my master bedroom and dining room set. All mid-century.I met Meg but mostly worked with Shelby who is a delight. I loved how I was able to wander through the items that had yet to be refinished to find the pieces that were right for my home. I snatched up a dining room set just after they had posted it online. Lucky me that I was there at the right time!The pieces were delivered yesterday and they are GORGEOUS! I'm tickled to have pieces that are custom for me and my personality, including a hot pink interior in my beautiful bedroom bureau. In addition, they sent a lovely flower arrangement with a hand-written note with my pieces. You'll never find these kind of pieces or get that kind of service in a big-box store.I'm going to think hard of another reason to bring another MegMade piece into my new home!

22.description: Best kept secret in Chicago. Found MegMade first on Etsy as my husband and I bought our first condo in the city and were looking to buy a few new furniture pieces. I had been saving money from an inheritance from my grandmother to buy a very special piece that we will have forever. I started looking into a china cabinet/hutch and I found the perfect piece online and we went to see it in person and bought it that day. They had delivery set-up already and we were able to choose from a variety of days/times they could deliver so it would fit in our schedules. I am excited to continue to visit MegMade and will definitely buy furniture from there in the future! Thanks, MegMade!

15.description: I had visited the shop and found a dresser that I liked, but went home to think about it.   By the time I went to purchase it, it had already sold.  However, the staff worked with me to find another unfinished piece in their inventory.  They finished it in the same colors, and I like it even better than the first one. The delivery guys were great as well

7.description: Shopping is not my "happy place", but we were in need of a new piece to update our look.   Just walking in the door, I knew I was in the right place.  Ideas everywhere, great colors and designs at every corner, smiling faces, good listeners, creative ideas, honest feedback, amazing quality at a very good price, service beyond my expectations..... it's my new go-to place.

8.description: Oh MegMade, how I adore thee! Seriously. MegMade is an absolute gem! I stumbled upon this place one day while searching for vintage furniture on the Internet. I called them and asked if I could stop by their warehouse to look for a dresser that I had spotted online. They were super kind and allowed me to browse forever. I immediately purchased the dresser and a nightstand because well, it was a Drexel and absolutely gorgeous! It's so hard to find nice, refinished furniture these days.A few days later I stopped back in a purchased another dresser with the intention of making it into an entertainment stand. They were so kind to customize the color for me and gut the middle of it so that I could place my cable box, etc in it. Lastly Meg is awesome. She had a a amazing eye for design and is incredibly helpful when you are picking out pieces. They can even find you pieces if you give them an idea of what you are looking for. I plan on buying another mirror, headboard and coffee table from them. I'm always impressed with their work and the furniture.Oh and they do delivery for a decent price and the guys who deliver are awesome! :) I highly recommend checking out MegMade!

30.description: Just had our first MegMade piece delivered today! We originally found a piece on Craigslist and went to the showroom to check it out. It didn't work out for aesthetic reasons, but luckily Meg pointed us in the direction of MegMade's warehouse, just a few blocks away (it's walkable). There, we picked out a completely new piece and were able to guide the custom design process ourselves, free of charge. Less than two weeks later the piece is now in our dining room. We can't say enough. Delivery was fast and easy. Already looking forward to shopping for our next MegMade piece.

3.description: My wife and I have 4 pieces from MegMade, and they are all great. One of them was a piece of her grandmothers that we brought in to have refinished, and they did a fantastic job and turned it around faster than they originally said they would. They are very collaborative in helping you decide how to redo a piece of furniture, offering advice while also listening to your ideas. Their delivery people have been great too - very careful but also very quick. Will definitely be back for more.

14.description: i am thrilled with this piece. The paint job is perfect, hardware sturdy--beautiful to look at and very functional. The price cannot be beat. Delivery was prompt and friendly. I am thinking of sending an old dresser to be MegMade. Thank you!

28.description: This place is new, but I'm loving it!  I love the prices.  Manicure for $12 or $11 if you pay cash.  $25 pedis- less if you pay cash.  I'm so used to paying so much for more these kinds of services.  The employees are also very friendly.  On Sundays, they all wear football jerseys.  The place is very clean and the decor is super cute.  I would definitely recommend.  Such a great value!

1.description: The way to describe the service here is: condescending. There is no way they spend more than 2 seconds for you to explain what you would like and how you would like it. They know better. They are extremely quick and sloppy; like a "get out of my way, I have better things to do" attitude. Also, they speak all the time with each other in their common language (not sure what it is). So, you find yourself surrounded by 5-7 people speaking, laughing, telling each other stories, etc. out loud! for all I know they could be giving each other food recipes. The thing is, you have no idea what's happening! It's plain rude. I think this is a business not their living rooms. I tend to believe the employees here are very bad paid, if paid. Sometimes I feel this is a family business with all the cousins, sisters, mothers in law, aunts, etc. working here. I think because they are inexpensive people will keep coming back regardless of all the above.

9.description: So after going here for several months, this is my combined review. I guess it matters on the tech, but my last non chip lasted 4 days. Sloppy work, top coat covering my fingers. It was awful. I went back for a redo. The woman working asked who did my nails. And said that person was not working today and Id have to come back. Like I have nothing better to do with my time then drive around from nail salon to nail salon several times a week. She just painted over my chipping nails, with attitude. Sorry nail loft, I won't be coming back. Their service is condescending and spotty.

29.description: Best nail salon in the city- hands down!  The sweet and talented ladies that own this salon will take great care of you.  Every color option you could imagine and the service is friendly.  The place is clean and charming and the prices are totally reasonable.

23.description: Best manicure I have ever had.  It lasted 10 days without a chip...unheard of for a regular mani!  They are incredibly nice, the space is clean...best nail salon I've been to after 15 years of regular mani/pedis!  ps the price can't be beat.

5.description: Thanks to the Nail Loft!  I had been eagerly anticipating this opening as I've passed by a few times during their renovation and it looked so cute.  And cute it is - really clean and a total turn around from what was in the space before.  It's very bright and cheery with chandeliers and other cute touches.  The staff was super nice.  I was running by and totally sweaty and popped my head in to see if they were indeed open.  They were!  So, I let them know that I would be back in the afternoon to get a manicure.  They were so accommodating - even though I was sweaty and had no money or wallet on me, they told me to come on in and that I could come back later and pay.  WHAT?! Wow!  I said no, but didn't need much prodding.  So, I had a very relaxing manicure.  I sat for a bit afterwards to dry them, but then went home to grab some money so that I could go back and pay!  They seemed a smidge surprised that I returned (either so fast or at all!), but I did return.  Really great deal - $11 manicure if you pay with cash ($12 otherwise).  No neck/back massage (which I love typically), but really relaxing and friendly.  Clean and neat and a great spot!

25.description: After an amazing first trip here and a rough work week I decided to treat myself with a manicure. Everything was fine until one employee tried to move a chair and dropped the nail dryer on my freshly painted nails (destroying them) and another employee kept unplugging the dryer I was trying to use to salvage my nails. Apparently just another average nail salon in the area.

12.description: Best nail salon in the city- hands down!  The sweet and talented ladies that own this salon will take great care of you.  Every color option you could imagine and the service is friendly.  The place is clean and charming and the prices are totally reasonable.

21.description: Like the atmosphere but quality can vary.  Unfortunately, the technician cut my cuticle and didn't seem concerned even though I was bleeding and needed a second bandaid. The rest of the staff was helpful but still...

16.description: This is one of my favorite nail salons in the city! Everyone is super friendly and detail oriented. Love the cash specials and they're BYOB! Highly recommend!

17.description: I'm a fan. The Nail loft is so clean and inviting. There's always music playing, there's never clutter, and it always smells good. You don't walk in and feel like you're choking on nail polish remover.The staff is wonderful. Not only are they quick and very talented but they are very nice and happy to talk to you. I learned all about where the woman who did my nails is from. It's super refreshing to be spoken to and not just worked on like a car. They offer so many services and have extensive colors for you to pick from. They're also so reasonable with their prices. Highly recommend!

10.description: Aboslutely love The Nail Loft! It's such a great addition to the main drag in Roscoe Village. The interior decor is very clean/fresh and modern. The women working there do a wonderful job - I can't say I have ever been disappointed with a manicure or pedicure there. The color selection is awesome (both regular and no chip). I also love that you can pay via square on their ipad, including tip, which a lot of other local nail shops seem to require you pay in cash for tip. This place is a gem!

11.description: Such a great nail salon! Really sweet and detail oriented staff. And the interiors are really clean, tasteful and relaxing.

26.description: Having just moved into the neighborhood, I was looking for a new nail/wax salon. Their sister salon, Salon Yves, is where I got my wax done, and it was great! As a walk-in, I appreciated not needing an appointment.Anyway, I stopped in for a mani/pedi with Jackie yesterday, and something I love about both salons is how friendly everyone is but also how beautiful the salons are. I feel like I'm in a Pinterest pin when I step into the salon, and it's oddly calming. Jackie gave me a great mani/pedi, and was very calm when I accidentally wrecked three nails before leaving the salon. :)

27.description: Really love this place. Have been 2x and both times gotten a great wax & mani. They're also so sweet & friendly. Feel like I could just hang out there! So happy they're in the neighborhood!

0.description: It doesn't get better then a BYOB nail salon! - The service is great -The staff is outgoing and welcoming. -The place is chic -BYOB I really look forward to coming here on Fridays after work to relax. I would pick this nail salon over any in the area. So far thee best salon I have been to.

20.description: Such a great nail salon! Really sweet and detail oriented staff. And the interiors are really clean, tasteful and relaxing.

19.description: This place is new, but I'm loving it!  I love the prices.  Manicure for $12 or $11 if you pay cash.  $25 pedis- less if you pay cash.  I'm so used to paying so much for more these kinds of services.  The employees are also very friendly.  On Sundays, they all wear football jerseys.  The place is very clean and the decor is super cute.  I would definitely recommend.  Such a great value!

2.description: If only we could give no stars.  What a bad customer service experience.  We have been pretty loyal customers, and my daughter and wife to be have all gotten pedicures together. We are getting married August 22nd and we scheduled an appointment to get pedicures again. We got there today and we were told that they can't honor our appointment as they are too busy.  Why have appointments at all?  I understand waiting a minute or two, but to not let us in as they are too busy is not good.  A few days before our wedding and the bride is crushed.  Please stay away from this mess and tell your friends. A reasonable response would have been acceptable, but to flat out tell us we are out was very rude.  Oh and they own another nail salon on Roscoe.  Not 2X10, but the other one.  Don't give your money to these businesses.  Yes I am a mad groom.Woody SiddallBell School Parent

18.description: I love this place! I've been coming here for 6 months now. I love Tiffany and her daughters for starters. But they always do an awesome job! Every time I'm there they are so welcoming and make me laugh. And my nails look amazing every single time! They are perfectionists. I highly recommend this place!

13.description: My new local nail salon! It's clean, special cash deals, BYOB, excellent waxing services and everyone speaks English (I've read horrible things about nail salons and the treatment of employees) and you can tell that the employees work there because they want to. I was getting a manicure and talking with the lady (co-owner) and her sister is a videography and is now doing the videography for my wedding!! I absolutely love this space, great color options.
